comment: Nehra to Mandeep, FOUR, first boundary for Mandeep and RCB. Full and on the pads, needed to be put away and Mandeep did just that, picked it up and dispatched it over mid-wicket, couple of bounces and into the fence

Nehra to Mandeep, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries to end the first over. Again, Nehra is a tad short in his length, Mandeep had the width to cut and he didn't try to hit it hard, just placed it behind point and Bhuvi at third man gave up the chase pretty quickly

Henriques to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, hit straight back at Henriques and he was late to get his hand up. Once more the off-cutter which almost fooled Jadhav, who shimmied down and checked his drive, middled it alright to beat the mid-off fielder
Nehra to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, another full toss, it's Jadhav this time and he picks his spot into the deep mid-wicket fence. Not great bowling from Nehra. He's missing the yorker by quite a bit

Nehra to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, four more. Jadhav starting to really find his timing now and he's looking dangerous. This is smart batting rather than just throwing his bat at everything. He knows that fine leg is up and so he waits for the back of a length delivery to come to him before pulling it over the fielder. Nehra under pressure

Henriques to Kedar Jadhav, out Kedar Jadhav Run Out!! 1 run completed. Cutting has conjured a wicket out of nowhere. That's a sensational throw from the deep. My goodness. He's absolutely nailed the stump from long leg and Jadhav is out of here. This is a huge moment in the context of the match, especially as Jadhav was looking so good. Even this shot which he played was extraordinary. It was a length ball outside off, Jadhav sat on his back knee and scooped it over short fine leg. He was a little slow to decide on the second run, maybe a little hesitant and boy did Cutting make him pay! More than a couple of feet short, even with a dive. Kedar Jadhav run out (Cutting) 31(16) [4s-4 6s-1]
Rashid Khan to Head, FOUR, goes down and smashes the full toss over the deep mid-wicket ropes. Some nerves maybe from the Afghanistan leggie and Head pounced all over them with a mighty slog-sweep

Rashid Khan to Head, out Caught by Yuvraj!! Rashid strikes back! That might have been the googly. Yeah, it seems so. Head went for another slog-sweep, but due to the variation, Rashid managed to generate some extra-bounce which took more of a thick top-edge and lobbed up towards long-on. It still came really close to clearing the boundary though. Yuvraj keeps his cool and takes it smartly. Head c Yuvraj b Rashid Khan 30(22) [4s-3]

Bipul Sharma to Sachin Baby, out Caught by Henriques!! Straight up off a leading edge, taken! SRH taking control. There's no turn on the ball as Bipul fires it on leg-stump from round the wicket, Baby swings across the line and is undone by the sliding delivery. Good catch from Henriques too. He pedalled backwards from mid-wicket and made it much easier than it should have been. Sachin Baby c Henriques b Bipul Sharma 1(3)
Rashid Khan to Watson, SIX, Rashid finishes with a long hop. To be fair, it's not abysmally short, but Watson is so good on the back foot. Rocks back quickly and hammers the pull over long-on
Cutting to Binny, SIX, slower ball again but this time Binny hacks it over deep mid-wicket. It was slightly closer to off-stump and was given a fair tonk
Cutting to Watson, FOUR, plants his foot down and absolutely drills the ball wide of a diving extra-cover. Overpitched from Cutting, Watson blasts him away

Bhuvneshwar to Binny, 1 run, dropped! Naman Ojha, with the gloves on, puts one down. The ball went high up and was swirling awkwardly all the way through. But at this level, it should be taken. Binny was completely duped by the slower leg-cutter. Such good bowling from Bhuvi to keep it wide of off and out of reach

Bhuvneshwar to Binny, out Caught by Yuvraj!! Gone this time. Yuvraj makes no mistake at backward point. What a top over this has been from Bhuvneshwar. It may now be a mountain too high for the RCB to climb. Binny backs away to slash a back of a length delivery over point. But this is a leg-cutter which bounces spongily and he slices it up to the fielder. Binny c Yuvraj b Bhuvneshwar 11(10) [6s-1]

Nehra to Watson, out Caught by Henriques!! That's the end of Watson, and of RCB. The little bit of reverse-swing which Nehra uses to curl the ball away from Watson does his undoing. Despite it being another full toss, Watson slices it straight up off the outside half of his bat. Simple catch at extra-cover. Watson c Henriques b Nehra 22(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Nehra to Aravind, out Bowled!! Terrific yorker from Nehra; a perfect way to seal wicket no. 100 in the IPL for the veteran pacer. The ball tails back in, zips through Aravind before his bat could come down and plants leg-stump into its grave. Nehra on a hat-trick. Aravind b Nehra 0(2)
Bhuvneshwar to Tymal Mills, SIX, full and wide, Mills has a proper dash at it and he's flayed it away over the point boundary. Magnificent hit. Bhuvneshwar won't enjoy that

Bhuvneshwar to Tymal Mills, out Caught by Warner!! Good lord, that's got air miles on it. Way up into the night sky, Warner settles under it at long-on and takes it. Bhuvneshwar had slowed the pace down on the delivery, causing Mills to go through with the hoick too early. Right off the toe-end of the bat. Tymal Mills c Warner b Bhuvneshwar 6(3) [6s-1]
Cutting to Aniket Choudhary, SIX, first ball Choudhary faces in the IPL, he smashes it over long leg. A short ball from Cutting, Choudhary swings into an instinctive pull and gets enough on it

Cutting to Aniket Choudhary, out Chahal Run Out!! Direct-hit and that's it! SRH with a comprehensive win in the IPL 10 opener. Another pull shot from Choudhary, this one's straight to mid-wicket. Chahal comes running down only to be sent back and he had given up. Jordan with the bull's eye. Chahal run out (Jordan) 3(7)
Nehra to Gayle, FOUR, Nehra goes back to the shorter length, Gayle seems a tad comfortable with that, hops on one leg and uses Nehra's pace to guide it past the diving short fine leg fielder

Nehra to Mandeep, FOUR, might have been the slower one and Mandeep picked the bones out of that one. He cleared his front leg to give him more options and then slots the loft over mid-on, one bounce and over the rope

Nehra to Gayle, SIX, that ball hung in the night sky for eternity. Never looked like coming down. For what it's worth Gayle gets the maximum result. Length delivery right in the swinging zone and Gayle did not hold back, went full-monty and heaved it over deep mid-wicket. Six number one for Gayle in IPL 10

Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, SIX, Gayle is in the mood. Mind you, he's not been in the best of forms, but IPL is his cup of tea. Bhuvneshwar dishes a full length delivery and hopes to get away with it, Gayle doesn't allow him to, carves it over long-on for his second maximum

Bhuvneshwar to Mandeep, FOUR, Mandeep is playing the perfect foil to Gayle. Warner already worried. Full on middle and leg, whipped through mid-wicket and mid-on. Hit uppishly but placed it expertly in the gap

Cutting to Gayle, FOUR, not convincing, but Gayle will take that. A very good over from Cutting. Just misses the length this ball, goes full and that allows Gayle to get underneath and hoick it over mid-wicket. Not off the middle but enough to clear the fielder

Rashid Khan to Mandeep, FOUR, Rashid throws it up once more and this time Mandeep threads the crowded off-side field. Overpitched and Mandeep went full-throttle on the drive, raced to the sweeper fence

Rashid Khan to Mandeep, out Bowled!! He strikes! The customary celebration follows. One hand up and the finger pointing skywards. The most delighted man in the dugout was his fellow countryman - Mohammad Nabi. He too had his finger up in celebration. The quicker wrong 'un and Mandeep clearly did not pick it, went back for the cut and gets cramped for room, only manages a chop onto the stumps. Mandeep b Rashid Khan 24(16) [4s-5]

Deepak Hooda to Gayle, SIX, a gift from Hooda and Gayle thumps it over the rope. A full toss outside off, Gayle takes a step out and slots it straight back over the bowler's head. Went miles back into the crowd

Deepak Hooda to Gayle, out Caught by Warner!! It was an experiment from Warner and it has paid off. Completes the catch, turns towards the crowd and does a fist pump. RCB have lost two in quick succession. Both set batsmen gone. Slows it up as Gayle gives the charge, he goes through with the loft even though he isn't to pitch of the ball, miscues it towards long-off and Warner ain't dropping those. Gayle c Warner b Deepak Hooda 32(21) [4s-2 6s-3]

Rashid Khan to Head, FOUR, lots of flighted and lands as a half volley, Head gets a good stride forward and drives it past Henriques at extra cover, the timing was superb as long-off had no chance of cutting that off

Rashid Khan to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, ordinary delivery from Rashid and Jadhav is all over it. The young man is shaking his head while taking his cap from the umpire. Half tracker which sat up nicely for Jadhav, who pulls it between deep mid-wicket and long-on

Cutting to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, that looked like a half-hearted shot from Jadhav and it has travelled the distance. Picked the back of a length delivery and pulled it to the vacant deep mid-wicket region, just cleared the rope

Henriques to Head, FOUR, Head does the most of the full length delivery, stays deep in the crease and opens himself up to free his arms, smashes it straight down the ground and even a quick Warner could not reach that from long-on

Tymal Mills to Warner, FOUR, lovely shot, sublime timing on that one from Warner, it wasn't anything more than a back-foot punch. This was a back of a length delivery outside off, he got on top of the bounce and placed it in the gap past point
Aniket Choudhary to Warner, FOUR, smashed, width on offer from Choudhary, Warner gets forward and thumps it over mid-off, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Aniket Choudhary to Warner, SIX, .. and Warner makes the most of the free-hit. Another pretty poor ball from Choudhary, short and just outside off, Warner rocks back and pulls it high and over mid-wicket, went sailing into the stands for the first six of IPL 10

Aniket Choudhary to Warner, out Caught by Mandeep!! The night has changed completely for the 27-year old RCB debutant. Warner has been dismissed for less than fifty for the first time against RCB - when he's playing for SRH. On a good length and well outside off, it was there to be smacked, Warner didn't go through with the shot completely, he was just looking to clear the infield. Mandeep times his jump to perfection at point and completes a good two-handed catch. Warner c Mandeep b Aniket Choudhary 14(8) [4s-2 6s-1]

Binny to Dhawan, FOUR, oh boy. He's toying around with the bowling out here. Binny looks to go wide outside off with the shortened length as well. But Dhawan in all his confidence walks across, crouches and half-pulls, half-sweeps it past the reach of the man at 45-degrees behind square

Binny to Dhawan, out Caught by Sachin Baby!! This was coming. It really was. Tactical aggression here from SD with his dance down the track looking to smoke some into the clouds. Does everything in getting right to the pitch of this fuller one as well, swings mighty too, just that he skews it off the toe end. All the altitude and into the safe palms of Baby at long-on. Dhawan c Sachin Baby b Binny 40(31) [4s-5]

Aravind to Yuvraj, FOUR, here's the pick up. Vintage Yuvraj. Helped by an allying half volley on the pads at gentle pace and all he does with it is lovingly lofts his flick. All the timing and a bounce into the mid-wicket fence

Aniket Choudhary to Yuvraj, FOUR, streaky. But the runs keeps leaking. Does it really matter how. Wide, half way down the track and Yuvraj anticipates the ball to fizz up in flat batting it across. There's barely any climb, and all he gets is the inside edge to impart the direction in guiding it just past the sticks

Aniket Choudhary to Yuvraj, SIX, whoa. This is getting back in the 2007 zone. Choudhary without a clue as to where to bowl goes full and wide. The mind-reader gets the front leg out and unleashes a full bat swing showing the maker's name in tonking it right on the extra cover ropes

Aniket Choudhary to Yuvraj, FOUR, and it keeps getting better. Rocks back, stands tall, waits for the short drag down to sit up and swats in his swivel. All the crunch in the timing to reintroduce it back into the fence

Aniket Choudhary to Yuvraj, 1 run, oh Aravind. You really do not grant a life. Certainly not to this guy. Another compulsive pull here from Yuvraj but with the ball gaining in height, only manages the top-edge. Right into the hands of fine leg, who slides and makes an absolute mess

Watson to Yuvraj, FOUR, back to the usual. Is this a surprise anymore. This time the skipper decides to test him with a short one, one that neither has the pace nor the bounce. And obliged with a swat. As flat as you'd want

Aravind to Henriques, FOUR, on the charge. And the slap. The combo bags yet another fence hunter. Walks down, intercepts the length and gets on top of the bounce of this back of a length delivery in flaying it in front of square
Aravind to Yuvraj, SIX, into the first tier. And a standing admire from Yuvraj. Aravind serves a pie with the short sitter and heaved away. So very typical. Equally friendly bowling here as well

Aravind to Henriques, SIX, now Henriques joins the act. Wants to ive his partner a run for his money. A run for some crowd catchers. Keeps banging it in short with the pitch sucking away all the momentum. Another mow across to give the crowd some work. Brings up his fifty. In some style

Chahal to Henriques, out Caught by Sachin Baby!! Some normalcy restored. And as always is the case, it is spin that gets on that duty. Chahal doesn't mind giving it some air inviting the big swing. And gets just that. A full-blooded tonk down and skewed away. Almost teases Baby at the long-off fence with this one threatening to fly over, before the bucket hands facing upwards come to the rescue in plucking it out. They're checking the foot's behaviour - just inside the permissable limits. Henriques c Sachin Baby b Chahal 52(37) [4s-3 6s-2]

Chahal to Yuvraj, 1 run, is that a bird? Is that a plane? Oh it is Mandeep Singh on his flying ways. Yuvraj goes through with yet another ones of his delightful airy drives. Is in the process of admiration just as Mandy runs across at the long-off fence, leaps and pulls it back into the field of play. Almost plucked it out while landing down too. Oof

Tymal Mills to Yuvraj, FOUR, head on. The battle continues. With Mills keen on cramping him up with the short pepper gets it barely up to the ribs. Just when he spots the bat going flat and the face pointing upwards in hooking it away. Behind square it flies

Aniket Choudhary to Deepak Hooda, SIX, the march to the double ton gets another gear. And some help from Chahal in tipping it over the fence. Hooda opens up and uses his entire height to good effect in his tall pull. Mid-wicket takes another one in its kitty

Aniket Choudhary to Yuvraj, FOUR, a salute in celebration. Takes the bat to his head in holding it up to his team mates inside. Covers all his sticks with a shuffle and after getting bored of the wides throws the kitchen sink at it and slaps it over point. #HisFastestIPLFifty

Tymal Mills to Yuvraj, FOUR, full, down leg. Nothing right with that. Certainly not if fine leg is inside. Certainly not if that man is Chris Gayle. All Yuvraj has to do is get the bat down in giving it some tickle. And places it wide and into the ropes

Tymal Mills to Yuvraj, SIX, the murder continues. Mass murder. Another spirit buries itself inside this pitch. Overcompensates going short, going quick but the response is quicker. Is brutal too. Back to his high backlifted pulls. Gravity too cannot pull it down

Tymal Mills to Yuvraj, out Bowled!! The zings light up. The crowd refuses to believe and keep searching for the ball. Nope, that's the end of the fun in store folks. Mills for a change aims for the stumps, going slower as well. Nicely off the back of the hand and foxes him with the seam position. A swat across the line is missed eventually and the top of leg takes the brunt. This has been some serious clock roll back here. Makes me feel 10 years younger. Yuvraj b Tymal Mills 62(27) [4s-7 6s-3]

Watson to Cutting, SIX, the yorkers too cannot stop the bleeding. Cutting rocks way inside, crouches, gets underneath the supposed yorker and carries on from the finals a year ago in tonking the drive

Aniket Choudhary to Henriques, FOUR, eventful first over from Choudhary, a wicket and 16 runs. Another freebie to end his over, short and wide outside off, Henriques was all over it as he cracked it square past point, beats the inner ring and rolls away to the fence

Watson to Cutting, SIX, a dramatic photo finish. Watson tries another short one but this time Cutting ain't surprised. Stands up, uses his entire height to good effect and smokes it away. Admiring it as he does so. As flat as the bat motion could get

Chahal to Henriques, 1 run, a direct hit at the bowler's end and Henriques was struggling. He was coming back for the second run, Dhawan didn't respond one bit. Aravind was the man with the throw and he sent it to the keeper. Kedar Jadhav still had time to effect the run-out, but his shy is way off-target. Henriques scrambles home with a dive. Coming to the ball, it was flat and wide of off, punched to the left of long-off
Aravind to Henriques, FOUR, too short from Aravind, can't bowl those at his pace. Henriques swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
Watson to Dhawan, FOUR, gentle loosener from Watson, short and on Dhawan's hips, he swivels across, uses the pace on the ball and helps it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Watson to Dhawan, FOUR, lovely shot, Dhawan is getting into his groove now. Comes down the track, doesn't get close to the ball, that allows him to free his arms and drill it back past the umpire, no need to run for those

Watson to Dhawan, FOUR, juicy full-toss and Dhawan has put it away, turning out to be an expensive start from Watson. Dhawan leans into the shot and finds the gap wide of mid-off, no need to run for those

Watson to Dhawan, FOUR, make that four fours of the over, banged in short and on the stumps, Dhawan swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it behind square on the on-side. Watson was expensive in the final of IPL 2016, he has started badly here once again

Head to Henriques, SIX, massive, Henriques shimmies down the track, makes room as he did so and goes high and over long-on, went a long way into the stands. Watches in admiration as the ball kept going and going
Dinda to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, thank you Dinda says Parthiv Patel as he clips a leg-side dross fine to claim his first boundary
Chahar to Buttler, FOUR, length ball outside off and Buttler is away. Swats it across the line and gets it wide of mid-on
Chahar to Buttler, FOUR, shuffles across and flicks a ball from middle stump, easily done. With fine leg inside the ring that was always asking for trouble, Buttler obliged
Zampa to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Zampa not getting the googly right. Again down leg and this time Rana gets a bit of bat/glove on that. The ball races away fine beating the short fine fielder

R Bhatia to Rayudu, out Caught&Bowled!! Thank You! A typical Bhatia wicket. Foxes the batsman with a 116kph delivery and Rayudu is found checking his drive, spoons a straightforward chance and Bhatia accepts the dolly. Once again the Delhi man showing his variety and the key to his success has been the length. It was on a good length and Rayudu thought it was there for the drive. Not to be. Rayudu c and b R Bhatia 10(12)

Stokes to Nitish Rana, SIX, Stokes would be proud of that shot. Banged in halfway down and the line was around off, Rana is quick to transfer his weight onto the back foot and nails the pull over deep square leg. Third six that Stokes has conceded

R Bhatia to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Dhoni!! First Tahir and now Bhatia. The slow bowlers are doing it for RPS. Bhatia lets out a roar as soon as MS completes the catch. He's been exceptional with his variations. This offie was bowled at 96kph, Pandya just didn't have the pace to slog it across the line, the top-edge skies up and Dhoni calls for it. Takes it in his own unique way, one leg up in the air. Krunal Pandya c Dhoni b R Bhatia 3(5)

Tahir to Pollard, FOUR, Pollard welcomes him with a thumping drive. Bit of air and Pollard plants his front foot forward, smashed it straight back over the bowler's head. Didn't bother to run, he knew he had middled it

Zampa to Pollard, FOUR, Pollard goes downtown once more and gets the desired result. Zampa goes fuller with the tossed up delivery and Pollard drills it straight back at Zampa, who is slow to get down and stop it

Zampa to Nitish Rana, out Caught by R Bhatia!! Bhatia has made amends. Put a sitter down early in the innings, this time keeps his eyes on the ball and ends Rana's knock. It was the googly which was drifting away from the southpaw, Rana went down and slog swept it flat, Bhatia didn't have to move at deep mid-wicket to pouch that. Nitish Rana c R Bhatia b Zampa 34(28) [4s-1 6s-2]

Tahir to Pollard, SIX, Tahir shouted "catch it" and there was no way anyone could have caught that. The South African goes a tad fuller in his length and that enables Pollard to get underneath it, slams it flat and over long-off for a maximum

Dinda to Pollard, no run, was that a drop? Need another look. Wide yorker outside off, Pollard bends down to squeeze it out, the ball takes the under-edge and goes low to Dhoni's right. The former skipper goes with one hand and spills it. Tough one for Dhoni and Dinda's unlucky day continues, second drop off his bowling

Dinda to Pollard, FOUR, unlucky and Dinda have been synonyms today. Full and outside off, Pollard throws everything he's got at that and the outside edge flies away fine and Dinda just stands there in his teapot position

Stokes to Pollard, out Caught by Mayank Agarwal!! Stokes gets the better of the West Indian. But credit has to go to Mayank Agarwal, he's pulled off a stunner. Length delivery and Pollard miscued his loft, came more off the base of the bat. It was dropping in front of long-on before Mayank dived full length and grasped it inches from the ground. He didn't allow it to pop out even as he hit the ground. Pollard c Mayank Agarwal b Stokes 27(17) [4s-3 6s-1]

Stokes to Southee, SIX, Southee nails this. He should have tried this shot on the previous ball. Once again gets his front leg out of the way to give him a free swing, Stokes makes his job easier by bowling a length delivery, tonked straight back over Stokes for a maximum

Dinda to Hardik Pandya, SIX, consecutive sixes for MI. Dinda missed his yorker by a few inches and is launched into the crowd. Low full toss outside off, Pandya keeps a firm base and carves it over point. Went a long way back into the stands

Dinda to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Dinda attains normal services. Three sixes in a row. Pandya getting into the thick of things. Length delivery and Pandya dismisses it over long-off. Just stood there and dispatched it with disdain

Dinda to Hardik Pandya, SIX, make it four in a row. Dinda and death overs are not the best of mates. He goes full and misses the yorker by a couple of inches, Pandya had enough to get under that and smack it over long-on

Dinda to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, four more. Already 22 off the over. A game-changing over this. Fifty up for Dinda. Full and wide outside off, Pandya throws the kitchen sink at that and the outside edge flies wide of Dhoni

Dinda to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Smith has a worried look as Pandya sends another one crashing over the rope. Switched to back of a length and the result remained the same, Pandya went back and nailed it over wide long-on. Pinged the ad hoarding on the full
Dinda to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, sat up on a perfect length to be smashed, Parthiv Patel rocks back and nails the pull over mid-wicket. Take four!
Dinda to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, this pitch is a belter, 180 is a must. Half-volley outside off, Parthiv Patel stands tall and slams it straight of mid-off who dives in vain

Dinda to Hardik Pandya, wide, out Southee Run Out!! Where was Southee going? He might have thought that it was the last ball of the innings, but Pandya was sure that it was a wide and there would be an extra delivery. Dinda fires it outside off, Pandya can't reach it and Southee was at the other end by the time Pandya could react. Dhoni lobbed it to Dinda, who took care of the rest. The third umpire checks if the batsmen had crossed, Pandya got his back foot in before Southee could reach the crease. It's touch and go, but Pandya will cling on to the strike. Southee run out (Dhoni/Dinda) 7(3) [6s-1]

Dinda to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, dropped by Bhatia. A straightforward chance. Parthiv Patel doesn't get control of the cut and he slices it straight to third man, Bhatia didn't even need to move an inch. It was going arrow straight towards his chest. Straight in and straight out. Oops!
Stokes to Buttler, SIX, for the first time this over, he pitches it up and Buttler goes bam! Gets underneath it and launches it for a maximum over long-on

Stokes to Buttler, SIX, Stokes turns back and smiles. That's all he could do. Ridiculous T20 batting on display. Buttler shuffles and scoops a pacy length ball over the keeper's head, lands just over the advertising triangles. Back to back sixes for Buttler
Tahir to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, floated full on leg-stump, Parthiv Patel sits up and brooms it away with sheer disdain, rocketed away behind square

Tahir to Parthiv Patel, out Bowled!! Knocked him over. Tahir is off with his marathon sprint. The crowd go bonkers. It was a slider, just skids on and slaps Parthiv Patel's leg peg as he fails to connect with the slog sweep. Got too greedy and paid the price. Parthiv Patel b Tahir 19(14) [4s-4]

Chahar to Buttler, FOUR, gives himself a lot of room as he skates down the pitch, pierces the gap between extra cover and mid-off to perfection. Fast hands, full flow of the willow. Jos-outrageously-talented-Buttler
Chahar to Buttler, SIX, that's gone flying into the stands. Greyhounds out of his crease, picks the bones out of it, a Tennis-esque flat-batted smite over wide long-off

Tahir to Rohit, out Bowled!! And again, Imran Tahir is on fire. He's just unstoppable at the moment. A canny skidder this, just keeps going with the angle and clatters Rohit's stumps. He may have got a bit of inside edge there. He wasn't fully forward, neither backward. Poor feet movement. Rohit b Tahir 3(7)

Tahir to Buttler, out Lbw!! Inside-edge onto pad, but doesn't matter, the umpire has his finger up. No turn, just goes flat and on the stumps, Buttler is stuck inside the crease, tries to block off the front foot and ekes a big edge onto his pad. In real time though it appeared as if it had gone straight towards his pad. Wasn't to be. Big moment in the game? Buttler lbw b Tahir 38(19) [4s-3 6s-3]

Stokes to Rayudu, 1 run, direct hit and Rayudu was gone! Smith was the fielder, curses himself after he missed the target. A casual knock down the wicket from Rayudu, goes straight to mid-off, Smithy had ample time to target all three at the non-striker's end. A big miss
Zampa to Nitish Rana, SIX, half-tracker and gone! Lovely swivel-pull from Nitish Rana, lands Zampa over the mid-wicket fence, brute power!

Southee to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, edged and four, streaky but Mayank will take those. There wasn't a first slip, Buttler dived to his left from second, but can't get to the ball. On a good length and holding its line outside off, Agarwal just hung his bat at that, the edge bisected the keeper and second slip to perfection

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, he's peirced the gap to perfection, just a tiny gap between the fielder at point and cover-point and Rahane found it. Played with an open face, allowed the ball to come onto him and gets it in the gap past point

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, edged and four, on a good length and in that channel outside off, drew Rahane into the drive, he went with hard hands and gets a thick edge past the lone slip, rolls away to the fence in a hurry

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, lovely shot, on a good length and well outside off, Rahane gets a big stride forward and lifts it over the head of the man at mid-off, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Southee to Rahane, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! A slight misjudgement from Rana in the deep but he's recovered really well here. The umpires want to have a second look. But I think the catch was clean enough. Soft signal is out, and we will stay with out. A back of a length delivery, Rahane slogs it across the line and hits it flat and straight towards deep square leg. Rana is slightly guilty of sleeping on it. He doesn't really move from his position, expecting it to carry comfortably, and has to dive forward in the end. Snatches it right off the turf. Southee has struck first ball of a new spell. MI needed that. Rahane c Nitish Rana b Southee 60(34) [4s-6 6s-3]

Bumrah to Stokes, FOUR, heaves the pull away over mid-wicket. He was quickly in position for that. Short of length from Bumrah and the ball just sits up. Stokes drags it from outside off with a lot of muscle
McClenaghan to Smith, FOUR, plants his back foot at least a couple of feet outside off, rocks back, and mows the pull through square leg. The footwork had Smith written all over it
McClenaghan to Smith, FOUR, that will run away. McClenaghan strays in line and bowls it on leg-stump. Smith simply had to glance it away past the fielder at short fine leg. Neat wrists

McClenaghan to Smith, 1 run, dropped! It's Nitish Rana in the deep. The ball flew towards his left and he was on the move but he got there with both hands. Exquisite timing on the short-arm pull from Smith. It's precisely that which gets him in trouble. Rana provides the reprieve. The ball actually hit him flush on the shoulders. That's quite an error. Huge moment
Pollard to Smith, FOUR, oh poor ball. A short of length delivery which sits up around the waist and Smith drags it away past short fine leg. Big decision to get Pollard in here

Pollard to Smith, SIX, it's not working. Smith is just too good for Pollard. His slower balls do work sometimes but this is just different class. Smith picks it up, waits on it and swipes it over deep mid-wicket

Southee to Stokes, FOUR, he's absolutely crashed this through extra-cover. A full, wide ball with mid-off up. Not sure what the thinking is. Whatever it is, the execution of it is way off target. Misses the yorker by a long way and Stokes pummels the drive

Southee to Smith, 2 runs, fifty for Smith. This guy, huh, unbelievable. He comes off a 499-run series in Tests and now belts a half-century in his first IPL X innings. Clips a short of length off-cutter from outside off and rushes back for two

Hardik Pandya to Stokes, FOUR, rare error in the field from Pollard. It would actually be harsh in calling that an error for most fielders, but this is Pollard we're talking about. A mistimed slog from Stokes. However, he still places it to the left of long-on where Pollard sprints and dives across trying to flick the ball in, but fails to get a hand

Hardik Pandya to Stokes, out Caught by Southee!! Another miscue, this time it goes straight to hand. Was it an off-cutter from Pandya? Might have been. It was there on a length though but Stokes doesn't get hold of it and holes out at deep mid-wicket. The crowd erupts with "Dhoni, Dhoni" chants. Stokes c Southee b Hardik Pandya 21(14) [4s-3]
Bumrah to Smith, FOUR, how good is he! Susses out the plan from Bumrah based on the line he's been bowling in this over so far, waits on the ball and just slices it past short third man

McClenaghan to Smith, FOUR, that's been dragged all the way to the wide long-on fence. Pure despair for McClenaghan. He's bowled this so wide of off and to see the ball being swatted into the on-side is downright demoralizing
Bumrah to Dhoni, FOUR, there we go. Dhoni isn't to be denied for too long. A bit shorter than the previous couple of deliveries, and Dhoni pulls it away to the fine leg boundary. One bounce and over

Bumrah to Dhoni, 1 run, dropped! An absolute sitter put down by Southee. Oh boy. They've already dropped Smith earlier. That hasn't quite gone well. Now another one. Dhoni miscues the full toss to deep mid-wicket where Southee doesn't have to move. Dear me
Pollard to Smith, SIX, going, going, gone... Is there anything he can't do? It's a slower ball from Pollard, Smith swipes across the line and muscles it over wide long-on

Pollard to Smith, SIX, he's done it. A couple of sixes to finish the game off just when it was getting away from them. What a player! A full ball on leg stump, Smith whips it away with unbelievable timing over the deep mid-wicket boundary. Pune clinch the game with a ball to spare

Southee to Rahane, SIX, Rahane is looking in good touch, this was banged in short and on the stumps, Rahane swivels across, doesn't bother to keep it down. He didn't look in complete control - but has enough to send it sailing over the head of the man at long leg

Southee to Rahane, FOUR, cracking shot, on a good length and just outside off, Rahane leans forward on the drive, seemed to have checked his shot at the lst moment. It went in the air and past Southee, beat mid-off's sprawling dive to his right and rolls away to the fence

McClenaghan to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Rohit!! Soft dimissal for Mayank. A daft little shot - to be precise. This was a back of a length delivery outside off, the width was there to cut, instead, he attempted something of a forehand jab, doesn't keep it down and hits it straight into the hands of Rohit at mid-off. Not the start Mayank wanted in his new franchise. Mayank Agarwal c Rohit b McClenaghan 6(5) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Smith, FOUR, clubbed, made a great noise as the bat connected with the ball. Length delivery outside off, Smith shuffles across and heaves it over wide mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

McClenaghan to Rahane, SIX, that's easy pickings for Rahane, width on offer from McClenaghan. He stays in his crease, uses his hands to good effect, makes the most of McClenaghan's pace and helps it high and over third man for a maximum

McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, lovely, this is exquisite cricket from Rahane, back of a length and well outside off, he waits on it, opens the face of the bat and steers it to the left of wide slip, beats the man getting across from the deep
Krunal Pandya to Smith, FOUR, cracking shot, short and wide from Krunal, Smith doesn't need a second invitation, hangs back and cuts it square on the off-side, beats the fielder in the deep with ease

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, fifty for Rahane. This was banged in short by Hardik, Rahane took his eyes off the ball, still went through with the pull, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes. Hardik looks amused, that ball didn't deserve a boundary

Krunal Pandya to Rahane, SIX, stunning bit of timing from Rahane and he gets just enough to beat Pollard's leap at long-on. At first instance, it looked like a simple dolly to long-on, the ball kept going and going. Pollard arched back one-handed, got a finger-tip, but the ball was always beating him

Boult to Roy, FOUR, cracking shot, Roy is off and running in his IPL career. On a good length and just outside off, he leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and drives it back past the non-striker, no need to run for those

Boult to Roy, FOUR, nicely played by Roy, width on offer from Boult. He leans into the shot, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and steers it behind square on the on-side, gets it past backward point and into the fence
Chawla to Roy, FOUR, lovely, the reverse sweep in full flow from Roy, gets down low and gets it into the gap behind square on the off-side. It was picked up from the middle-stump line as well

Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Second wicket for Kuldeep. One shot too many from Finch. It was the wrong 'un which was on a fuller length, Finch gives himself room to go inside out, the bat turns on impact and the ball skews towards long-off. Suryakumar runs around the circumference and pouches it cleanly. Finch c Suryakumar Yadav b Kuldeep Yadav 15(8) [6s-2]

Boult to Raina, FOUR, a well-controlled pull shot from Raina. Boult did not get height on the short of length delivery, just above the waist and Raina got on top of that nicely, rolled his wrists and struck it behind square, beating deep square leg with ease

Narine to Karthik, FOUR, Pandey tried his best, but the ball still found a way to reach the fence. Width offered outside off, Karthik maintains a low base and drills it in front of square, Pandey runs across from sweeper cover, dives and flicks it in but the ball backspins and touches the rope

Chawla to Raina, 2 runs, in no man's land. The googly and Raina takes it on without reading, he charges down and goes across the line, the leading edge balloons up and drops in front of the incoming long-off fielder

Narine to Karthik, FOUR, for the umpteenth time today Narine has landed it on a shortish length, sat up nicely for Karthik, who cut it away fiercely square of the wicket. Timed it superbly as it beat the sweeper cover comfortably

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 2 runs, comedy of errors. First Raina gets away with yet another leading edge, goes on the bounce to long-on. He was never wanted the second and Karthik was almost near the bowler's end before Raina decided to go, Karthik makes it in and Kuldeep for some unknown reason doesn't throw it to Uthappa and Raina also survives. He's living a charmed life

Chawla to Raina, 1 run, fifty for Raina. 29th in IPL. Not one of his best. Quicker delivery on the stumps, clocked at 113kph, that's the pace of Bhatia. Raina is hurried into the flick and sends it along the ground to deep mid-wicket

Chawla to Raina, 1 run, dropped! Would you believe it? I have lost count of the number of chances Raina has got today. Flighted delivery on the stumps, Raina kneels down and sweeps to deep backward square, went straight to Yusuf and he split it. He was on the move a bit and that put him off. He's been whisked away from that position by a stoic GG

Chawla to Karthik, SIX, ends the over with a maximum. A much needed one for GL. Bit of air on this and a fuller length meant Karthik was able to get underneath that, he heaves it high and over the cow corner fence
Boult to Raina, 1 run, Raina backs away and Boult follows him with a yorker, squeezed to backward point

Boult to Raina, FOUR, it is all going Raina's way. He might walk on water today if he wants and get away with it. A well-directed yorker, Raina brings his bat down and squirts it off the inside edge to the fine leg fence. Not far away from the leg-pole

Boult to Karthik, FOUR, Boult misses the yorker and Karthik is in no mood to let him off, doesn't bother to get his front leg in line with the delivery, just goes through the line and smacks it straight down the ground

Woakes to Raina, 1 run, Raina and Woakes collide. Short and slow outside off, Raina cuts it on the bounce to backward point. Both were ball watching and Raina dashed into the bowler, Woakes is down on the ground and Raina makes his crease. The GL skipper goes back to check on Woakes and the Englishman is fine

Woakes to Karthik, SIX, Karthik picked the bones out of that. Length delivery right in the slot and it was a clean swing of the bat from Karthik, lofted it with a straight bat and cleared long-on with ease

Woakes to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik is playing a blinder here. Woakes goes short and outside off, it was the off-speed delivery and Karthik spotted it early, carves it up and over backward point. No need to run for those

Woakes to Raina, FOUR, 16 runs off the over and not the best of outings for Woakes on IPL debut. He finishes with 3-0-35-0. Once more the slower delivery is on the shortish length, Raina waits and cuts it behind square, splitting backward point and short third man to perfection

Boult to Karthik, FOUR, off-pace delivery and once more Karthik read it early, he waited in his crease and stayed leg-side of the ball, lofts it handsomely over the extra cover fielder. All timing there from the Tamil Nadu man

Boult to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik does a ABD. The reverse sccop. Full delivery and close to the yorker length, Karthik switches his stances and sends it over the short third man fielder, almost went the distance

Boult to Karthik, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! A fine knock ends. He provided the much needed impetus to the innings. Deserved a fifty, but that's cricket. Short delivery that caught Karthik by a bit of surprise, pulled it towards long-on and Suryakumar takes the easiest of catches. Raina pats him on the back as he trudges off. Karthik c Suryakumar Yadav b Boult 47(25) [4s-6 6s-2]

Narine to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's a shocker from Kuldeep and he concedes four runs. This was dropped short and wide of off, McCullum backed away and cut it straight to backward point. Kuldeep dived over the ball and ends up conceding a boundary

Boult to Raina, FOUR, Raina finishes off in style. Very full and outside off, Raina crouches low, opens the bat face and drives it square on the off-side, the field was up and that was played beautifully

Chawla to Roy, out Caught by Y Pathan!! Roy falls and KKR have struck early. A nothing shot from the England opener. This was another long hop from Chawla, Roy rocked back on the pull, didn't go through with the shot completely - was perhaps just looking to help it on its way, gets a fat top-edge, high and over mid-wicket. Yusuf ran back and completed an easy catch. Roy looks gutted as he walks off. Roy c Y Pathan b Chawla 14(12) [4s-3]
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, SIX, massive, tossed up nicely by Chawla, fell right into McCullum's hitting zone, he gets forward and clubs it high and over mid-wicket, went a long way over the ropes
Narine to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, cracking shot, poor ball from Narine, drops this one short and wide of off, McCullum makes room and cracks it over cover, couple of bounces and over the ropes
Narine to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, Narine has been too short today, drags his length down once again. McCullum rocks back and pulls him past the square leg umpire

Woakes to Raina, FOUR, nicely played! Fraction fuller and on the stumps, Raina leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and punches it back at the bowler. Woakes got a hand onto it, but it still beats mid-off to the fence

Woakes to Raina, FOUR, this is excellent cricket from Raina, made room as he came down the track. Woakes spotted it and followed him - Raina is good enough to tuck it past square leg, the man in the deep is very square and has no chance

Woakes to Raina, 2 runs, that will go down as a chance, but Kuldeep did very well to get to the ball, got both hands and lost control as he fell down. Would have been a stunner had he held on. This was short and on the stumps, Raina was making room for the pull, gets slightly cramped on the shot, hits it high and over mid-on. Kuldeep ran a long way back, stretched as he got both hands to the ball - but can't complete the finishing act
Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, Kuldeep can't afford to drop short on this pitch. McCullum rocks back and pulls it through mid-wicket, bisects the two men in the deep to a nicety

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, SIX, McCullum is in some form alright, comes down the track, doesn't get too close to the ball, allows him a free swing and he deposits it high and into the sightscreen. Another expensive over for the Knight Riders
Woakes to Raina, FOUR, that ruins the over for Woakes, leg-stump half-volley, all Raina had to do was get some bat on that. Once he did - fine-leg, who was inside the ring had no chance

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, out Lbw!! Kuldeep has his man. This was tossed up on the leg-stump line, McCullum was looking to turn it towards the on-side, the ball straightened and went past his inside edge, struck him low and in front of leg-stump, would have been crashing into the stumps. Easy call for the umpire and it's also time for the strategic break. Brendon McCullum lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 35(24) [4s-4 6s-2]

Y Pathan to Finch, SIX, Finch gets going with a massive hit, Yusuf tosses one on the stumps, Finch gets a big stride forward, lifts it with the spin and sends it high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum
Y Pathan to Finch, SIX, back-to-back sixes from Finch, flighted delivery on the stumps, Finch gets forward and thumps it high and way over the fence at deep mid-wicket

P Kumar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, just goes through with a wild slog across the line, no timing whatsoever. All power. To Lynn's delight, it went in the gap behind the square leg umpire. First boundary for KKR
D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, SIX, that's the Chris Lynn we saw in BBL. Full-blooded swing, clears his front leg, picks the length early and goes bang over mid-wicket
D Kulkarni to Gambhir, FOUR, stand and deliver! Half-volley in the slot, Gambhir won't miss out, watches the ball closely and dismisses it out of his sight
Shadab Jakati to Gambhir, 1 run, advances and compiles a well-deserved fifty with a ease to long-on

Gony to Gambhir, FOUR, both of them have just played themselves in such good form here. Full ball outside off, Gambhir clears his front leg and crashes it inside-out to send it to the wide long-off fence. Superb hand-eye co-ordination
Gony to Gambhir, FOUR, really ordinary bowling. It's a gentle short of length delivery on off-stump, the ball sits up for Gambhir who bludgeons it through mid-wicket

Gony to Gambhir, FOUR, awful from Gony. He bangs it in very short but the speedometer just shows 128kph. The ball was actually on its way down when Gambhir slashed it over backward point. GL being clobbered out there

Shadab Jakati to Gambhir, FOUR, down the track in a flash, right to the pitch of the ball, and driven so beautifully over the covers. The trick in the shot was that he delayed the charge and came out only when the ball was released
P Kumar to Gambhir, 1 run, bowls it short from round the wicket, Gambhir pulls it away to deep square leg. 150 of the partnership comes up
Shivil to Chris Lynn, SIX, way too many half-trackers from Shivil today. Just can't get away with it at this level. Lynn rocks back and blooters it over long-on

D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, SIX, that about sums their night up. McCullum makes a blunder in the deep and palms the ball over the ropes. A miscue from Lynn off a full toss, should have been taken at long-off

D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, FOUR, short of length, probably an off-cutter, Lynn mows the ball in front of long-leg who comes running forward for the catch. But the ball drops well short and then bounces over him
D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, SIX, flat, strong, six! Kulkarni misses his mark, bowls it in the slot and is walloped over long-on. Lynn can do no wrong
Gony to Gambhir, FOUR, that's spanked! The open stance helps him figure the line and length quickly, uses all his might to smash it straight down the ground

Gony to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Chris Lynn and his golf hits I tellya. This isn't off the middle, but that bottom hand power and the baseball swing takes it the distance, just one bounce and over the long-on ropes
Gony to Chris Lynn, SIX, boy, has he nailed it! You bet. 95-metre smite. Gony serves length and gets smoked for a maximum over long-off
Shivil to Gambhir, FOUR, rank long hop, Gambhir says thank you. Short, down leg, Gambhir swivels and nails the pull behind square
Shivil to Chris Lynn, FOUR, too much width gestures Raina as soon as he saw the ball flying over backward point. Tad short and Lynn pounced on the width on offer, slices the cut and gets four
D Kulkarni to Gambhir, FOUR, 50-partnership. Clears his front leg and goes bam over mid-on. Right out of the screws

Shivil to Gambhir, FOUR, Shivil Koushik isn't learning. Keeps landing it short and gets smacked. Gambhir rocks onto his back foot and all he needed to do was get it over the fielder, did it with sheer ease
Shivil to Gambhir, byes, FOUR, keeps low and nutmegs DK, Gambhir didn't pick it, neither did the keeper, runs are runs
Shivil to Gambhir, FOUR, sits on one knee and chips the slog-sweep over mid-wicket, excellent batting this from GG
Shivil to Gambhir, FOUR, outside edge and four! Opens the bat face to steer, the edge flies to the right of Kulkarni who dives belatdely
Shivil to Gambhir, FOUR, make that 20 off the over. Gambhir has raced off to 40 in no-time. A real dart on the pads, Gambhir milks it off his pads. Easy peasy

Dwayne Smith to Chris Lynn, SIX, if that ball had voice, it would have pleaded: "Chris please take me for a journey". Lynn heard that and obliged, rubbish length ball outside off and the next thing Smith sees is the ball flying over deep mid-wicket
Dwayne Smith to Chris Lynn, FOUR, stands tall in the crease and flat-bats a shortish delivery straight down the ground
Dwayne Smith to Chris Lynn, SIX, in his zone and Lynn doesn't have any second thoughts. Marmalizes it with utter disdain, Roy came in the way to interrupt, he was never going to catch that. Never
Dwayne Smith to Chris Lynn, SIX, the onslaught continues... Full ball, don't even look back Mr Smith, the ball has gone to Brisbane. Period
Dwayne Smith to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slower length ball outside off, Lynn drills it through cover and brings up a sparkling fifty
Shadab Jakati to Gambhir, 2 runs, short ball on middle, Gambhir jumps on the back foot and lifts the pull over mid-wicket. 4th fastest team 100 in the history of IPL, gee!
Shivil to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Shivil Koushik's night keeps getting worse. Fires it short and wide, Lynn gets a feather of an edge on the attempted cut, the edge runs past DK's gloves

Dinda to Amla, FOUR, edged and four! Streaky way to get off the mark, but Amla won't mind. Seam-up delivery that shapes away a tad, Amla chases it with a slash and gets a fat outside edge. The ball flies between slip and short third man. First boundary of the innings
Christian to Vohra, FOUR, shot! Uses the width outside off and bounce and elevates it over backward point to collect his first boundary
Rahul Chahar to Axar, SIX, goes for the big whammy and succeeds. That was short and has been flat batted over long-on for a huge maximum. Pressure on the youngster

Rahul Chahar to Amla, out Caught by Stokes!! The young man gets the big fish! A luring delivery tossed up outside off and the batsman looking to thwack it down the ground, finds the able hands of Stokes at long-off. That brings the game back in the balance. Amla was struggling to get the runs and pays the penalty trying to up the ante. Amla c Stokes b Rahul Chahar 28(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

Tahir to Axar, out Caught&Bowled!! Looks to go for the slog sweep, the googly undoes him and he manages a big fat top-edge. The high ball comes down for the bowler to pouch that. The trademark celebration from Tahir follows. That was a disastrous strike for KXIP as they had lost Amla a couple of balls earlier. The promotion didn't really yield the desired results. Axar c and b Tahir 24(22) [4s-1 6s-1]
Rahul Chahar to Maxwell, SIX, MAAMMAAAMIAAAHH! The Big Show has arrived. The showman lays the bat on that and crunches that over the man at long-on. That scaled many a light years before coming down
R Bhatia to Maxwell, FOUR, backs away and then the sledge hammer does the rest. Just like a warrior, wields his weapon to axe the ball past the man at cover

R Bhatia to Miller, SIX, slower ball, doesn't matter. That was a dead meat of a delivery and the batsman has picked the bones out of that. It's that time of the season folks - In the arc, it's out of the park. If it's in the V, it's into the trees. Remember the carnage from 2013 against RCB?
Stokes to Maxwell, FOUR, PHHUUUUFFFFF! Such power. He bulldozes that one through the off-side and the man at cover had no chance as there was a lot of room on it

Stokes to Maxwell, SIX, backs away by clearing his legs and then sees the ball like a football to have a clear swing at it. The ball soars over the long-off region for a maximum. Maxwell is taking it away

Tahir to Maxwell, SIX, 50 for the combo! That was a short ball, never got enough wood on it but enough on it to send it packing just over the man at mid-wicket. There were shouts of catch it but that region was unmanned
Tahir to Maxwell, SIX, the most powerful delivery boy is here. He has sent it packing over the cow corner region. Brutal sinews into that pull and the ball flies away into oblivion

Dinda to Miller, SIX, has that gone all the way? An overpitched delivery and the batsman checked his drive with power on his bottom hand to hit it flat and just past the diving Christian at long-on. The ball landed on the cushion and the third umpire signalled it as a half-a-dozen
Stokes to Miller, FOUR, short ball and the swivelled pull. Picks up the length quickly and pivots on his back foot to send it speeding towards the backward square region for a four
Christian to Amla, FOUR, 13 off the over after bowling a brilliant first ball. Length ball down leg, Amla gets inside the line and flicks it well past the short fine leg fielder. Easy runs
Dinda to Vohra, SIX, that has been slapped! Short of a length delivery, Vohra dances down and wallops it over the bowler's head. Muscled it. Way past the boundary rope

Dinda to Vohra, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! First wicket down! Dinda sees the batsman charge down and bangs it short. Vohra is cramped for room, but still persists with his pull shot. Doesn't middle it and the ball balloons up on the leg-side. Tiwary, who had a good stint with the bat, runs to his left from deep mid-wicket and gobbles it up. Vohra c Manoj Tiwary b Dinda 14(9) [4s-1 6s-1]
Christian to Saha, FOUR, nicely done! Shortish delivery outside off, Saha hops, gets on top of the bounce and forces it wide of point. The ball races away into the fence
Christian to Amla, SIX, Amla is turning it on here now! He walks down and lifts this shortish ball over mid-off. The ball has enough wings to go into the stands

Stokes to Saha, 1 run, a very tough chance goes down! Saha prods forward and drills the cover drive. Dan Christian, at cover leaps to his right and gets a hand to it. Those are the ones that need to stick. Wasn't the case this time
Stokes to Saha, FOUR, Saha has come out with a positive intent and that is paying dividends. Finds the gap beautifully on his cover drive. No need to run for shots like that
Stokes to Saha, FOUR, four more! Safest shot to play is hit it down the ground. Sees the length on a fuller side and lofts it down the ground, left of the bowler and right of mid-on. Safe shot

Tahir to Saha, out Bowled!! Tahir strikes! And he is off! His customary celebratory run. He bamboozles Saha with a googly. It tweaked in at pace as well. Saha doesn't pick the wrong 'un and is also late to bring his bat down. The ball cannons onto the stumps. Through the gap between the bat and the pad. Saha b Tahir 14(9) [4s-3]

Tahir to Axar, FOUR, sloppy from Rajat Bhatia at short fine! He was put off by the appeal for lbw from the keeper and Tahir. It was the slider which was very full. Axar just about brings his bat down and gets a bit of wood on it. Bhatia over-runs to his left and allows the ball to go past him

Sandeep Sharma to Mayank Agarwal, out Bowled!! Cleaned him up!! That was the ferocious inswinger and the batsman without covering the line of the ball looks to play across the line and misses. The sticks go cartwheeling and the bowler takes off with a hand in the air. He does it so often, does Sandeep Sharma. Superb bit of attacking bowling as he got the ball to land on the sticks and put the batsman on a tight leash. Mayank Agarwal b Sandeep Sharma 0(4)
Swapnil Singh to Stokes, SIX, good end to the over. A massive end actually. In the arc of the southpaw and the batsman comes up with an explosive response to tonk the ball over the cow corner region

Stoinis to Stokes, FOUR, imparts his powers of guiding the edge where he wants. Is happy to stay away from the line, giving his long levers some breathing space and just slashes at a slanter. An obvious outside edge and an even more obvious empty cordon for some free runs here

Swapnil Singh to Dhoni, out Caught&Bowled!! A tame dismissal. Quite typical of Dhoni's defences in the early part of his innings. One of those famed stabby defences, just that he cannot keep this one down. But Swapnil decides to help him to an extent, getting his palms and almost grassing it. A three-time juggle before he earns himself a story for a lifetime. The replays show it to be much slower, yeah Dhoni was made to check his defence causing the ball-lob. Dhoni c and b Swapnil Singh 5(11)

T Natarajan to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, pure timing. And grace. With a sink down on a knee, Tiwary decides to free his arms at a wide overpitched delivery outside off in the form of a slice. Such is the meat on this that he doesn't even bother keeping it down. Almost all the way

Axar to Stokes, FOUR, gets a long hop. A rank one. And all he has to do is decide where to deposit this one. Decides mid-wicket it is again to take the brunt. Ensures that he doesn't get up early and once again puts his spinning back foot to use in whisking it into the fence
Axar to Stokes, SIX, and now he lets the off-side take the brunt. Patel in his response fires one out flat and wide. The mind-reader that Stokes is, sinks and tonks it through the line

T Natarajan to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, the wide yorkers. Prove to be the undoing of Natarajan here. Makes Tiwary reach out making him stretch every cell of his body in getting there. Boy o boy he does. And how. Slices it imparting all the momentum in lofting it over backward point. These tiny boundaries I tell you
Stoinis to Stokes, SIX, he's smoking them in. With a gallop down, gets the ball sitting up in his arc and keeps swinging his bat. We are firmly into the baseball zone. Over cow corner

Stoinis to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, they're turning it on. Tiwary joins the act now. Is mighty helped by a horror line always drifting down leg. Has to ensure that he gets some wood on it and he does it with aplomb. Gets enough to muscle it heave behind square and beat the lone man perched out there
Mohit Sharma to Stokes, 1 run, clears his front leg and shovels it down the ground. The yorkers keeping him quiet(er). Nevertheless, the half-ton comes up

Axar to Stokes, out Caught&Bowled!! A smash back. And the perish. Patel smartly keeps denying Stokes the opportunity to go through the on-side by firing it wide outside off. Gets the bat up flat on the slap down the ground. Too early once again and all he manages is the cue end that flies back to the upward palms of Patel. So the change in bats not quite what the side wanted at this point. Stokes c and b Axar 50(32) [4s-2 6s-3]

Mohit Sharma to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, in the arc, and out of the park. You cannot expect the bowler getting away bowling length at this stage. And Tiwary keeps up with the tradition of dishing out the punishments. Sits up and swings it through the line in tonking it over long-on

Mohit Sharma to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, a real drag down. The Mohit slower back hander but half way down the ground. All the time for the adjustment and Tiwary does it in executing his crouched pull. Axar did get a hand in his stretch at the fence, the power imparted was enough to burst through a wall though

Sandeep Sharma to Christian, FOUR, oh dear. Spots Christian running inside and fires one way down leg. Christian with his stalking eyes always on the ball gets his bat out on the horizontal swiping mode and scoops it away

Sandeep Sharma to Christian, FOUR, more of the same. The ploy here from Sandeep refuses to change and Christian too refuses to stand up on his feet against this length. Does all he can to get under the ball and keeps his bat on the scoop. This time right over the keeper

Sandeep Sharma to Christian, SIX, a switch to over the wicket makes no difference. Pounds it short, pounds it wide and Christian unleashes the mighty forehand smash. The concrete on the stands taking a real beating here

Sandeep Sharma to Christian, out Caught by Maxwell!! Shovels it to his doom. Only after having done his job to perfection. Sandeep gets the yorker right and Christian gets his bat down off a massive backlift in shovelling it out. Not quite the elevation this time with the ball flying down to long-on. Christian c Maxwell b Sandeep Sharma 17(8) [4s-2 6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Rahane, 1 run, DROPPED!! The man at cover - Vohra had enough time to settle down under it by going back but he makes a meal of it. That was a nothing shot to a length ball and the ball scooped high up in the air and never scaled any distance. Vohra was put off by Natarajan at mid-off who was just beside him. The former could see the fast bowler from the corner of his eye and that was enough
Mohit Sharma to Rahane, SIX, OLLLLAALLLAAAA! That was some response from Rahane to a short ball. He loved the aroma on the perfume ball and accepted it with glee. That drop might well be costly
Mohit Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, opens the face of the blade on impact and runs it down to third man for a four. Cheeky from Rahane as used the pace of the bowler and knew his angles to perfection
Sandeep Sharma to Smith, FOUR, gets the room to free his arms and creams the ball away into the covers. No one moved as the ball sped away into the off-side

Sandeep Sharma to Smith, FOUR, creates room by going leg-sidish, got the room to expand his arms and then threads the ball away between cover and extra cover for back-to-back fours. Innovation and Smith go hand in hand

T Natarajan to Rahane, out Caught by Stoinis!! There you go! The young man strikes. Whatta moment for him. A length delivery slanting away, Rahane looks to drive on the up, hits it uppishly and finds the safe hands of Stoinis in the sweeper region on the off-side. The fielder was looking into the sun, so he steadied himself, got a hand up to create a better vision and then gobbled it up. Rahane c Stoinis b T Natarajan 19(15) [4s-1 6s-1]

T Natarajan to Smith, FOUR, shot of the day? Shot of the tourney so far? Pardon the exaggeration but that was serene from the skipper. That was a slower delivery and the batsman just leant his weight forward on it with a straight face of the bat touching the ball. The man at mid-on and at long-off dived over the ball to allow a deserving four to the skipper

Stoinis to Smith, out Caught by Vohra!! HUGEEEEE WICKKKETTTT for KXIP. That was a leading edge as the ball held onto the surface for the batsman to not control the whippy pull. The man in the deep - Vohra, this time settles down and takes a smart catch at the edge of the boundary. It almost carried all the way. Pune in trouble now. Smith c Vohra b Stoinis 26(27) [4s-3]

Stanlake to Billings, FOUR, loose delivery. It's drifting onto the pads and all Billings has to do is help it on its way. RCB can ill afford these errors, especially when they're defending a sub-par score

Stanlake to Samson, FOUR, that's quite the blooper from Mills at third man. He might have taken his eyes off and the ball sneaks through him and over the ropes. Nice little glide from Samson, shouldn't have been anything more than a single

Stanlake to Samson, out Caught by Binny!! Stanlake rushes Samson and gets rid of him. Really tame dismissal actually. He's pulling on the front foot, the ball is onto him quicker than expected and it hits him right on the splice. It spoons up for an easy catch to long-on. Bangalore keep hitting back, they keep fighting. Samson c Binny b Stanlake 13(12) [4s-1]

Watson to Pant, SIX, that's a really good short ball from Watson. Pant is unable to control the pull as he tries to fetch it over his head and nearly holes out. But these are short boundaries. The ball lobs up to the left of Binny at deep square leg, who runs backwards and leaps across but can only palm it over the ropes

I Abdulla to Pant, FOUR, yeah, Abdulla is in a fix here. He doesn't want to be bowling in Abdulla's arc, but there is no one out in the deep to protect the cut either. He ends up straying wide of off and Pant slaps it through point

I Abdulla to Pant, SIX, now he gets closer to off, Pant goes down on one knee and wallops it over wide long-on. This is superb batting from the 19-year old. He's putting Abdulla under tremendous pressure

I Abdulla to Chris Morris, out Lbw!! The ball slides on with the arm, clips both the pads and up goes the finger. Morris was caught in the crease there to a flat ball from round the wicket, and then he made the mistake of playing across the line. That would have hit leg-stump. So Bangalore have struck back as soon as Delhi threatened to surge ahead. It's been that kind of chase. Chris Morris lbw b I Abdulla 4(5)

Chahal to Brathwaite, out Bowled!! Chahal's got him the very next ball and he is absolutely pumped. This is serious drama in Bangalore. A beautifully flighted leg-break which drifts in on leg, the ball dips on Brathwaite, lands away from him as he slogs and sneaks under him. Brathwaite b Chahal 1(5)

Tymal Mills to Pant, FOUR, Pant keeps stroking them beautifully at the other end. He clearly holds the fate of his team now. It's a full ball on off and Pant has timed the pants of it as he flicks it through mid-wicket. The placement is brilliant too

Watson to Pat Cummins, FOUR, Watson has erred big-time with the leg-cutter and Cummins gets him away. It's well down the leg-side and Cummins whips it over short fine leg for four. It was so close to clearing the boundary

Watson to Pat Cummins, out Bowled!! It swings one way, and then the other. Watson hits back with a vengeance. A good length delivery which is in the slot for the slog, but the ball nips in just a touch to cause the error from Cummins. He chops it back on off an inside edge. The crowd is right in this. Pat Cummins b Watson 6(6) [4s-1]

Tymal Mills to Pant, 1 run, beautiful slower ball, it's all the more effective with Mills bowling it. Pant is deceived by the lack of pace and he has to reach out as a result. He skews it right off the toe-end to mid-on. It's fifty for Pant. Superb knock, but he has to go all the way

Tymal Mills to Pant, SIX, Rishabh Pant, you beauty! This is some stunning cricket we're witnessing here. He takes on the short ball, and pulls it away over the fine leg boundary. It was a thick top-edge there actually but with Mills's pace, it travelled

Negi to Pant, out Bowled!! Negi has done it. That is surely the game for the RCB. Pant moves across towards off, Negi may or may not have seen that but he fires it on leg-stump and uproots it. A real valiant effort from Pant comes to an end. He's dragging himself off. Got to feel for him. Pant b Negi 57(36) [4s-3 6s-4]

Negi to Nadeem, out Caught&Bowled!! Negi tosses this up and lands it far enough from Nadeem to make him reach out for the slog. The ball turns, takes a thick leading edge and lobs up. Negi doesn't leave it for anyone else, he runs backwards and grabs it so well. Made it look easy there. Nadeem c and b Negi 0(2)

Stanlake to Tare, FOUR, picked away into the leg-side again. Stanlake searching for swing, pitching it right up, but the ball goes on with the angle and ends up on the pads. He has to adjust his line. Too many freebies

Stanlake to Tare, FOUR, oh well, put the mockers on him there. But again, as soon as he tries to pitch the ball up expecting it to swing, he ends up on the pads. Whipped away gloriously from Tare over square leg

I Abdulla to Tare, FOUR, that's flown between keeper and slip. Gayle, standing at slip, didn't even have time to react. It was too close to cut. Tare made some room and slashed at it off the stumps. Lucky to get away. Not just get away, he's gotten four

Tymal Mills to Tare, out Bowled!! Mills has struck. A fierce short of length delivery which skids on, keeps a bit low and nips back in from round the wicket. Tare makes room once more and has a slash at it but he's played over the ball by six inches at least. It pummels the off-stump. Tare b Tymal Mills 18(17) [4s-3]
Tymal Mills to Nair, FOUR, climbs from a back of a length, finds the outside edge pretty high up on the bat and runs away to the third man boundary. Nair was driving on the up there. Highly ambitious

Stanlake to Nair, out Bowled!! It's game on here at the Chinnaswamy! Nair has played completely down the wrong line of a full ball and is castled comprehensively. The crowd erupts. Rusty footwork from Nair as he presses forward to drive, the ball didn't seem to do a great deal. Might have held its line a touch if anything. Nair played way inside the line of it, maybe anticipating it to come back. The off and middle stumps are clobbered. Nair b Stanlake 4(3) [4s-1]

Chahal to Billings, SIX, oh my days! This is thrilling cricket. Billings goes down low and wallops the reverse-sweep for six. He's known for this. It was right in the slot too after Chahal flighted it up

I Abdulla to Billings, out Caught by Stanlake!! Billings has been completely outsmarted. What clever bowling from Abdulla. He enticingly tosses this on up and ensures to keep it very wide of off. Seeing the flight, Billings is lured into having a go at it but he's not quite to the pitch of the ball and has to reach out for it. The ball turns away further, lobs up off a thick edge and is taken by Stanlake at backward point. Bangalore are making good inroads. Billings c Stanlake b I Abdulla 25(19) [4s-1 6s-1]

I Abdulla to Pant, SIX, holy smokes, the nerves these guys have got! First ball, Pant sashays down the track and wallops the ball over deep mid-wicket. He was playing with the turn, so not a bad option. But to do that first ball is something else. This is a roller-coster, this match

Tymal Mills to Pant, FOUR, short of length into the body, Pant swivels across on the back foot and helps the pull behind square. He's placed it in the gap perfectly. Fine leg and deep square leg have no chance. Pant taking Mills on

Zaheer to Watson, FOUR, cracking shot, nice way to get going, that should give Watson plenty of confidence, length delivery on his pads, he prods across and clips it in front of square on the on-side, beats the infield and rolls away to the fence

Zaheer to Watson, FOUR, Watson is at his best in the opening slot and he has started well for RCB. On a good length and well outside off, he leans forward, plays with an open face and drives it on the up, beats cover and rolls away to the fence

Chris Morris to Watson, FOUR, Cummins makes a mess of a simple stop and concedes a boundary. On a good length and holding its line outside off, Watson went for the big drive, gets a thick edge over backward point. Cummins did all the running, slid and stopped the ball, but it hit his legs and rolled onto the ropes
Chris Morris to Gayle, FOUR, creamed, low full-toss from Morris, Gayle waits on it, leans forward and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover-point and rolls away to the fence

Pat Cummins to Binny, FOUR, much needed boundary for RCB, on a good length and angling back into the right-hander, he uses the pace on the bat, opens up slightly and shovels it wide of mid-wicket. Mishra put in the dive - but in vain

Mishra to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, massive, Kedar breaks the shackles, this was well tossed up on off, right into the swinging zone of Kedar, he gets forward and sends it high and into the second tier - over long-on
Mishra to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, pushed through flatter and wider of off, Kedar makes room and flat-bats the slap - beats Mishra and races away to the fence in a jiffy

Mishra to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, cracking shot, tossed up on the stumps, Kedar shimmies down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it back over the bowler's head, almost went all the way, one bounce and over the ropes

Mishra to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, 24 from the over. RCB needed something and Mishra has gifted them a perfect launching pad. Kedar is in some form alright. This was tossed up slower and wider outside off, Kedar bends down his knees and clubs it high and over long-on, went a long way over the ropes

Brathwaite to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, cracking shot, that's Kedar's own version of MSD's helicopter shot. This was full and on the stumps, Kedar was deep inside the crease as he whipped it wide of mid-wicket, no chance for the man running across from long-on
Brathwaite to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, freaky, this is sensational from Kedar, length delivery on off, he makes room by backing away and goes inside out over cover, went all the way over the ropes

Brathwaite to Kedar Jadhav, 2 runs, fifty for Kedar, this has been a superb innings, short and just outside off, he backed away and cut it to the left of point. Billings put in the dive, made the stop and fired in a throw at the striker's end, concedes another run

Zaheer to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, mistimed shots are finding the gaps now, this was short and on the stumps, Kedar was late on the pull, gets a top-edge - the fielder at square leg was inside the ring and Kedar has managed to get it over his head

Zaheer to Binny, out Caught by Billings!! Lovely shot - but Binny has found deep mid-wicket to perfection. This was full and on his pads, Binny gets forward and whips it beautifully - but unfortunately for him, the placement wasn't right. Straight into the hands of Billings and he doesn't drop those. A small contribution from Binny - but a big wicket under the circumstances for the Daredevils. Binny c Billings b Zaheer 16(18) [4s-1]
Brathwaite to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, smashed, length delivery on the stumps, Kedar backs away and thumps it back over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the ropes

Brathwaite to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, cracking shot, he's in some devastating form at the moment - Kedar. Length delivery from Brathwaite, that's a cardinal sin for any bowler. Kedar gets his left leg out of the way and drills it back over the bowler's head, went high and into the top tier of the Chinnaswamy

Zaheer to Vishnu Vinod, SIX, he's done it several times for Kerala - he's showing why RCB picked him up as KL's replacement. Runs down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it over long-on for a maximum

Zaheer to Vishnu Vinod, out Vishnu Vinod Run Out!! That was completely unnecessary from Vishnu Vinod and it has cost him his wicket. This was a floaty delivery outside off, Vinod got underneath it and drilled it towards extra-cover. Almost a catch to Nadeem, he doesn't go for it though, instead, stops it on the half-volley, the return to the bowler is good and Zaheer whips the bails off - with Vishnu Vinod miles out of the crease. Vishnu Vinod run out (Nadeem/Zaheer) 9(5) [6s-1]

Zaheer to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Chris Morris!! That's another huge wicket and RCB are losing their way towards the end. Lovely piece of deception from Zaheer. He followed the slower short ball with another slower ball, rolled his fingers across the seam. Kedar was backing away on the lofted drive, gets it right off the bottom of the bat, plenty of height but not the distance. Morris settles under it and holds on at mid-off. Kedar Jadhav c Chris Morris b Zaheer 69(37) [4s-5 6s-5]
Chris Morris to Negi, SIX, Negi connects one finally! This was the slower full-toss from Morris, Negi backed away, got underneath the delivery and sends it soaring over long-off for a maximum

Chris Morris to Negi, out Bowled!! Morris gets his yorker right and Negi's stumps go for a walk. This was fast, this was full and this was on the middle-stump line. Negi backs away on the drive, misses and simply walks back to the pavilion. Negi b Chris Morris 10(8) [6s-1]

Chris Morris to Tymal Mills, out Bowled!! Morris gets another wicket with a juicy full-toss. RCB finish with just 157 on the board. Mills made room on the drive, missed and the off-stump goes for a walk. Tymal Mills b Chris Morris 0(3)

Pat Cummins to Watson, FOUR, lovely, just a hint of width outside off, Watson made it look bad by arching back slightly, frees his arms and sends the cut scorching behind square on the off-side, beats third man - running to his right

Chris Morris to Gayle, out Caught by Samson!! A high full-toss has got rid of the big Jamaican. Gayle looked surprised, was looking to blast it over the top, can't get on top of the ball, it hit him high on the bat and lobbed over Samson at mid-off. He ran back, kept his eyes on the ball even as it landed beyond his shoulder, dives and clutches it with both hands. Chinnaswamy has been stunned into silence as the big man departs. Gayle c Samson b Chris Morris 6(8) [4s-1]
Chris Morris to Mandeep, FOUR, that ruins the over for Morris, another full-toss, but this time on Mandeep's pads, he gets inside the line and helps it on its way. Nice way to get going

Pat Cummins to Mandeep, FOUR, cracking shot, back of a length and well outside off, Mandeep rides with the bounce and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover and rolls away to the fence

Pat Cummins to Mandeep, FOUR, lovely, this is even better, on a good length and just outside off, Singh presses forward, drives it on the up and splits the gap between cover and mid-off. Good early signs for Mandeep

Pat Cummins to Mandeep, out Bowled!! Mandeep has chopped on for the second straight time in this tournament. On a length and just outside off, Mandeep saw the width, manufactured a bit more by backing away slightly, went with hard hands on the cut, gets an inside edge that bounces back onto the middle-stump. He was looking very good, but it means nothing now. Another promising start, but nothing more for Mandeep. Mandeep b Pat Cummins 12(10) [4s-3]

Mishra to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, beautifully played, what made the shot even more special was that he didn't get to the pitch of the ball. It only allowed him to free his arms and lift it inside out over cover, went sailing all the way

Nadeem to Watson, out Stumped!! Nadeem has deceived Watson completely in the air. Anticipated that Watson was getting itchy and was looking to dominate him, shortened his length and beats Watson in the air, the extra bounce did the trick. Watson was completely flummoxed on the lofted drive and Pant is quick to whip the bails off. RCB are in a spot of bother now. Watson st Pant b Nadeem 24(24) [4s-4]

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, cracking shot, that should release some pressure off Roy, comes down the track, flat-bats the short of a length delivery and lifts it back over Bhuvneshwar's head, a few bounces and over the ropes
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Roy, makes room to a length delivery on the stumps and swipes it over the infield, clears cover-point and rolls away to the fence

Cutting to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, wow. That sped off the bat. Smith breaks the shackles, stands tall and extends his hands into fierce punch, right off the middle and pistols away to the fence beating the sweeper cover fielder

Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, edged and four! Would've been swallowed by the first slip fielder, if there was ever one. Lovely flight from Rashid, drew Karthik forward and takes the outside edge which runs away through the invisible first slip region
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, short ball and punished. Smith picks it up early and nails the pull in front of square
