Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, two fours in a row for Smith. This was a poor ball from Henriques, drifts one on the pads, all Smith had to do was to get some wood on it, which he did and it races away to the fine leg fence

Nehra to Dwayne Smith, no run, brilliant work from Henriques. A direct-hit would've been interesting. A fuller length delivery on the stumps, Smith pushes it meekly towards extra cover, Moises dives to his right and throws at the non-striker, all in one motion. DK was backing up for a single and had to turn back and dive full-length to make his ground

Nehra to Dwayne Smith, SIX, Smith is finding his bearings now. Nehra errs in length and dishes out a full ball right in the hitting zone, Smith frees his arms and launches it straight down the ground, pings the sightscreen on the full

Cutting to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, that's an awful ball from Cutting. Offers width, by bowling it well outside off, Smith goes deep in his crease and carves it over point. 50-run stand comes up between the two

Bhuvneshwar to Dwayne Smith, out Caught by (sub)Vijay Shankar!! Kumar strikes! Half the GL side are back in the hut now. Smith runs out of patience, decides to take on Bhuvi. It was a slower delivery and the West Indian didn't pick it. Was early into the shot and went through it, skews it off the toe-end and slices it towards deep mid-wicket. Vijay Shankar, the sub, runs to his left and pouched it safely. Dwayne Smith c (sub)Vijay Shankar b Bhuvneshwar 37(27) [4s-4 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, no run, oh nearly.. A communication breakdown between both the batsmen almost resulted in a run-out. A short of length delivery outside off, Karthik slashed it straight to point, Kulkarni set off for a single, DK was ball-watching and sends him back. Yuvi, the fielder, was slow to react and fires a throw at the non-strikers end, misses the target and Kulkarni survives

Nehra to D Kulkarni, 1 run, wristed into the on-side, takes off for a quick single before being sent back. Rashid fires at the bowler's end and misses. The duo run on the overthrow. Karthik was in trouble had that hit

Nehra to Karthik, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Two wickets in two overs and GL are losing gas towards the end. A short ball from Nehra, Karthik went across his sticks and tried to lap/scoop it over short fine, doesn't succeed as he gets a faint nick and Ojha takes a simple catch. Karthik c Naman Ojha b Nehra 30(32) [4s-2]

Nehra to D Kulkarni, out D Kulkarni Run Out!! Third umpire woken up for a run-out check. Kulkarni is struggling and has to take the long walk back to the pavilion. GL are committing hara-kiri. Another one bites the dust. Kulkarni worked it towards mid-wicket and took off blindly for a single, his partner was never interested and sends him back. Rashid Khan, the fielder, swoops down on the ball, takes the aim and fires a direct-hit at the striker's end to catch Kulkarni short of his crease. Rashid Khan's dream day continues. D Kulkarni run out (Rashid Khan) 1(2)

Cutting to P Kumar, 1 run, silly running from the GL batsmen. Could've lost another one. A short of length delivery outside off, Kumar toe-ends the drive to extra cover, takes off for a single. The fielder collects the ball and fires a throw but misses the target. PK had given up
Cutting to Basil Thampi, SIX, this will do. Sinks low, gets under this slower ball and tonks it over the long-on fence for a maximum
Bipul Sharma to Roy, FOUR, lovely shot, fraction too short from Bipul , Roy is quick to rock back and pulls it through mid-wicket, no need to run for those
Bipul Sharma to Roy, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries once again from Roy, comes down the track, covered for the spin and lifts it over the head of mid-on, a couple of bounces and over the ropes
Nehra to Roy, FOUR, lovely shot, banged in short and on the stumps, it sat up to be smacked, Roy makes room and pulls it over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

Rashid Khan to Brendon McCullum, out Lbw!! Rashid has struck gold in his first over! This was pushed through flatter and quicker, the wrong 'un from Rashid. McCullum was down on his knees as he went for the sweep and missed, struck pretty adjacent to the stumps and it's an easy call for the umpire. The impact was in front of middle, would have been going on and hitting the stumps. Brendon McCullum lbw b Rashid Khan 5(10)

Rashid Khan to Raina, no run, edged and dropped, that was a chance and Warner at first slip has missed it. It was a tough opportunity though, Raina went with hard hands, the edge was flying and to the right of the captain, he went with hard hands and shells it. Coming to the ball, it was tossed up invitingly outside off, another wrong 'un from Rashid, lured Raina into the mistake - but Raina survives

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, out Caught by Dhawan!! Dhawan has claimed a catch. Roy isn't going anywhere. The third umpire will have a look, the soft call is OUT. He has caught it cleanly, but has the ball touched the ground or did Dhawan get his fingers underneath it? The zoomer has been called for, it looks tricky, but the soft signal is OUT. If there's no conclusive evidence, it will stay with the on-field call. The third umpire is taking numerous looks at it. B2$ is the call. GL have lost two of their overseas batting stars now. Coming to the ball, it was banged short and just outside off, Roy was rocking back on the pull, went low of the bat and looped towards mid-wicket. The ball was dying in front of him, but Dhawan does well to dive forward and holds onto it. Roy c Dhawan b Bhuvneshwar 31(21) [4s-5]

Rashid Khan to Finch, out Lbw!! Rashid is leaving the Lions flummoxed. This was the wrong 'un, pitched just outside off and spun back into the right-hander, Finch didn't read it one bit, played for the straighter one, beaten on the inside edge and struck bang in front of middle. The height wasn't an issue, the ball would have been crashing into the leg-stump. Easy call for the umpire and Gujarat Lions slip into further trouble. Finch lbw b Rashid Khan 3(5)
Nehra to Karthik, FOUR, cracking shot, a floaty half-volley from Nehra, Karthik leans forward, closes the face of the bat and drives it back past the non-striker, no chance for the man at mid-off

Rashid Khan to Raina, out Lbw!! Rashid is running through Gujarat Lions. This was the leg-break and Raina had no idea about it. This was tossed up on the off-stump line and spun back in slightly, Raina didn't read it, was playing for the straighter one, gets beaten on the inside edge and is rapped on the pads. The impact was in front of middle, would have been going on and hitting the top of middle. Rashid is on a roll and so are his team. The umpire has called for a strategic break. Raina lbw b Rashid Khan 5(8)

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, cracking shot, that should release some pressure off Roy, comes down the track, flat-bats the short of a length delivery and lifts it back over Bhuvneshwar's head, a few bounces and over the ropes
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Roy, makes room to a length delivery on the stumps and swipes it over the infield, clears cover-point and rolls away to the fence

Cutting to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, wow. That sped off the bat. Smith breaks the shackles, stands tall and extends his hands into fierce punch, right off the middle and pistols away to the fence beating the sweeper cover fielder

Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, edged and four! Would've been swallowed by the first slip fielder, if there was ever one. Lovely flight from Rashid, drew Karthik forward and takes the outside edge which runs away through the invisible first slip region
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, short ball and punished. Smith picks it up early and nails the pull in front of square

Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, two fours in a row for Smith. This was a poor ball from Henriques, drifts one on the pads, all Smith had to do was to get some wood on it, which he did and it races away to the fine leg fence

Nehra to Dwayne Smith, no run, brilliant work from Henriques. A direct-hit would've been interesting. A fuller length delivery on the stumps, Smith pushes it meekly towards extra cover, Moises dives to his right and throws at the non-striker, all in one motion. DK was backing up for a single and had to turn back and dive full-length to make his ground

Nehra to Dwayne Smith, SIX, Smith is finding his bearings now. Nehra errs in length and dishes out a full ball right in the hitting zone, Smith frees his arms and launches it straight down the ground, pings the sightscreen on the full

Cutting to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, that's an awful ball from Cutting. Offers width, by bowling it well outside off, Smith goes deep in his crease and carves it over point. 50-run stand comes up between the two

Bhuvneshwar to Dwayne Smith, out Caught by (sub)Vijay Shankar!! Kumar strikes! Half the GL side are back in the hut now. Smith runs out of patience, decides to take on Bhuvi. It was a slower delivery and the West Indian didn't pick it. Was early into the shot and went through it, skews it off the toe-end and slices it towards deep mid-wicket. Vijay Shankar, the sub, runs to his left and pouched it safely. Dwayne Smith c (sub)Vijay Shankar b Bhuvneshwar 37(27) [4s-4 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, no run, oh nearly.. A communication breakdown between both the batsmen almost resulted in a run-out. A short of length delivery outside off, Karthik slashed it straight to point, Kulkarni set off for a single, DK was ball-watching and sends him back. Yuvi, the fielder, was slow to react and fires a throw at the non-strikers end, misses the target and Kulkarni survives

Nehra to D Kulkarni, 1 run, wristed into the on-side, takes off for a quick single before being sent back. Rashid fires at the bowler's end and misses. The duo run on the overthrow. Karthik was in trouble had that hit

Nehra to Karthik, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Two wickets in two overs and GL are losing gas towards the end. A short ball from Nehra, Karthik went across his sticks and tried to lap/scoop it over short fine, doesn't succeed as he gets a faint nick and Ojha takes a simple catch. Karthik c Naman Ojha b Nehra 30(32) [4s-2]

Nehra to D Kulkarni, out D Kulkarni Run Out!! Third umpire woken up for a run-out check. Kulkarni is struggling and has to take the long walk back to the pavilion. GL are committing hara-kiri. Another one bites the dust. Kulkarni worked it towards mid-wicket and took off blindly for a single, his partner was never interested and sends him back. Rashid Khan, the fielder, swoops down on the ball, takes the aim and fires a direct-hit at the striker's end to catch Kulkarni short of his crease. Rashid Khan's dream day continues. D Kulkarni run out (Rashid Khan) 1(2)

Cutting to P Kumar, 1 run, silly running from the GL batsmen. Could've lost another one. A short of length delivery outside off, Kumar toe-ends the drive to extra cover, takes off for a single. The fielder collects the ball and fires a throw but misses the target. PK had given up
Cutting to Basil Thampi, SIX, this will do. Sinks low, gets under this slower ball and tonks it over the long-on fence for a maximum
Bipul Sharma to Roy, FOUR, lovely shot, fraction too short from Bipul , Roy is quick to rock back and pulls it through mid-wicket, no need to run for those
Bipul Sharma to Roy, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries once again from Roy, comes down the track, covered for the spin and lifts it over the head of mid-on, a couple of bounces and over the ropes
Nehra to Roy, FOUR, lovely shot, banged in short and on the stumps, it sat up to be smacked, Roy makes room and pulls it over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

Rashid Khan to Brendon McCullum, out Lbw!! Rashid has struck gold in his first over! This was pushed through flatter and quicker, the wrong 'un from Rashid. McCullum was down on his knees as he went for the sweep and missed, struck pretty adjacent to the stumps and it's an easy call for the umpire. The impact was in front of middle, would have been going on and hitting the stumps. Brendon McCullum lbw b Rashid Khan 5(10)

Rashid Khan to Raina, no run, edged and dropped, that was a chance and Warner at first slip has missed it. It was a tough opportunity though, Raina went with hard hands, the edge was flying and to the right of the captain, he went with hard hands and shells it. Coming to the ball, it was tossed up invitingly outside off, another wrong 'un from Rashid, lured Raina into the mistake - but Raina survives

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, out Caught by Dhawan!! Dhawan has claimed a catch. Roy isn't going anywhere. The third umpire will have a look, the soft call is OUT. He has caught it cleanly, but has the ball touched the ground or did Dhawan get his fingers underneath it? The zoomer has been called for, it looks tricky, but the soft signal is OUT. If there's no conclusive evidence, it will stay with the on-field call. The third umpire is taking numerous looks at it. B2$ is the call. GL have lost two of their overseas batting stars now. Coming to the ball, it was banged short and just outside off, Roy was rocking back on the pull, went low of the bat and looped towards mid-wicket. The ball was dying in front of him, but Dhawan does well to dive forward and holds onto it. Roy c Dhawan b Bhuvneshwar 31(21) [4s-5]

Rashid Khan to Finch, out Lbw!! Rashid is leaving the Lions flummoxed. This was the wrong 'un, pitched just outside off and spun back into the right-hander, Finch didn't read it one bit, played for the straighter one, beaten on the inside edge and struck bang in front of middle. The height wasn't an issue, the ball would have been crashing into the leg-stump. Easy call for the umpire and Gujarat Lions slip into further trouble. Finch lbw b Rashid Khan 3(5)
Nehra to Karthik, FOUR, cracking shot, a floaty half-volley from Nehra, Karthik leans forward, closes the face of the bat and drives it back past the non-striker, no chance for the man at mid-off

Rashid Khan to Raina, out Lbw!! Rashid is running through Gujarat Lions. This was the leg-break and Raina had no idea about it. This was tossed up on the off-stump line and spun back in slightly, Raina didn't read it, was playing for the straighter one, gets beaten on the inside edge and is rapped on the pads. The impact was in front of middle, would have been going on and hitting the top of middle. Rashid is on a roll and so are his team. The umpire has called for a strategic break. Raina lbw b Rashid Khan 5(8)
Malinga to Chris Lynn, FOUR, errs in length and pays the price. Lynn is too good to not miss out on these. Takes a giant step forward, uses all his power to muscle it down the ground
McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, poor ball. Short and down leg, too easy for Lynn. Swivels across and helps it on its way past the man at 45

Krunal Pandya to M Pandey, FOUR, another edge. Pandey is living a struggle here in reading the amounts of turn. Not quite the control but ultimately manages to get some wood on it in directing the edge through the keeper

Krunal Pandya to Y Pathan, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Another dismissal all in the household. In fact it doesn't leave Baroda either. Pathan in his quest to get on with the scoring jumps down the track, barely gets close but cannot pull out of his hoick. Swings hard, miscues big time and Hardik at long-off stretches vertically in plucking it out. Y Pathan c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 6(11)
Harbhajan to M Pandey, FOUR, so deft. The cheek these days. Shapes up for the cut, or so we assumed but at the very last moment opens the bat upwards in a dab past the outstretched Parthiv leg

McClenaghan to M Pandey, SIX, this was coming. With McClenaghan keeping it short and wide and Pandey's orthodox cuts failing, he decides to arch back with a toe-rise and ramps his bat upwards in teasing the man at third man over the ropes
Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, just the hint of width. Enough for Yadav to sniff a boundary out of it. Throws the kitchen sink at it with a crack through the off-side

Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, the width is back. And so is the allied length that starts off from half way down. A wristy chop quite off the outside half of the bat. Hurries away through third man

Bumrah to M Pandey, SIX, oh boy. Smoked one down. For a change he stays put in his crease without moving around and bends low in plundering what should have been a yorker. A vicious bat swing in tonking it into the black screen

Bumrah to M Pandey, FOUR, and now he toys around further. Bumrah responds with a length delivery outside off and Pandey after threatening to muscle another one out, stays composed and guides it behind point

Malinga to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Pollard!! The sucker ball. On the umpteenth occasion a set batsman perishes after the team passes on a strategy in the break. Can't blame Yadav for anticipating the toe-crushing yorker. He gets one just that there is no pace at all on this one. Swings through his shot, gets one hand off the handle and eventually watches the ball pick out Pollard to perfection at long-on. Suryakumar Yadav c Pollard b Malinga 17(15) [4s-2]

Bumrah to M Pandey, 1 run, here's his half-ton. Playing a vital hand here. Gets there with a flat batted agricultural heave. Then watches all his effort neutralized by the ball finding deep mid-wicket on the bounce

Malinga to Woakes, out Caught by Pollard!! The wheels falling off here. Looks for his favoured flat batted pull through cow corner. Does get it right but neither manages the elevation nor does he keep it down. Yet another batsman picks out Pollard at the fence. The ploy of keeping it short and slow doing the trick out here. Woakes c Pollard b Malinga 9(8)

Malinga to M Pandey, SIX, a sink, a swing and a crowd deposit. Picks out the predictable off-spinner and waits for the ball to get into his arc. Unleashes a full bat swing and goes through with it in holding the pose as he drills one several rows into the cow corner stands

McClenaghan to M Pandey, SIX, the sitting up length. Right where he wanted to and with all the pace on it as well for it to be dealt with severity. A full-blooded pull and just the sound ensures the maximum

McClenaghan to M Pandey, SIX, misses the mark yet again. A yorker attempted only to be missed by a cool few centimeters. Ample time for Pandey to settle himself under it as he hammers it over long-on. Just cannot keep it down

McClenaghan to M Pandey, no ball, FOUR, he oversteps and then bowls it in the arc as well. More of the sunken bat swings in intercepting the two men at the leg-side fence. Pandey with help here from the bowler giving KKR the final catapult. Free hit coming up
McClenaghan to M Pandey, FOUR, a full toss now. Nothing coming out right here. Tailing away and Pandey is more than glad to use the width in just tickling it past the keeper
McClenaghan to Gambhir, FOUR, offers some width to Gambhir, who will not miss out on these. Reaches out and bullies it with serene timing through cover
Bumrah to Gambhir, FOUR, yes he can! Bumrah is not learning, doles out a friendly full toss on off, Gambhir opens the bat face and slices it behind point

McClenaghan to Narine, out Lbw!! Dead straight. Just that it goes onto the pad after smashing the bat. A yorker on the stumps, quite where he should have been right from the start. Narine tries hard in getting his bat down in digging it out. Almost does well in the end, gets right off the toe-end to ricochet onto his boot. Too quick for the umpire to spot it as well. Never mind. KKR finish with 178. Narine lbw b McClenaghan 1(2)

Bumrah to Gambhir, FOUR, two in a row for Gambhir. This was streaky but the KKR captain won't mind. Pitched up full outside off, Gambhir went hard on the drive, gets an outside edge that races away to the third man fence. The fielder was squarer and had no chance
Malinga to Chris Lynn, SIX, there he goes! Loads up big, gets under this short ball and dismisses it into the deep mid-wicket stands. Into the top-tier

Krunal Pandya to Gambhir, out Caught by McClenaghan!! Gambhir combusts. The ploy of bringing in a spinner early in the innings has paid rich dividends for Mumbai. Gambhir, in an attempt to go big, miscues one and hits it straight to square leg. McClenaghan times his jump to perfection, leaps and takes a smart catch. Pandya exults in delight.Gambhir c McClenaghan b Krunal Pandya 19(13) [4s-3]

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, FOUR, this was quite intentional from Robbie. Plants his front foot forward, looking to defend. The ball came in with the angle, takes the outer half of his willow and runs away to the third man fence

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Two wickets in the over. Uthappa falls cheaply. This was floated up much fuller from KP, tempting Uthappa to go for the big shot. The Karnataka batsman went after it, albeit didn't find the sweet spot in his willow. Skies it as far as deep mid-wicket, where his brother Hardik swallows it up with ease. Pandya roars in joy and sprints up to his brother and leaps onto him. What a start for Mumbai. Uthappa c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 4(3) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, oh boy! McClenaghan has been Lynn-ed here. If there is ever a term like that. Just stands still, unleashes a strong bottom-hand to slap it through extra cover. Bulleted away to the fence

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, out Lbw!! Boom! Bumrah strikes. Its the dangerous Lynn who has to walk back to the hut. The crowd find their voices back. Lynn makes a blunder by walking across his sticks, Bumrah kept it simple, bowled full and raps him low on the pad. Was beaten for pace and was struck right in front of middle. Lynn is disappointed. Big wicket for the home team. Chris Lynn lbw b Bumrah 32(24) [4s-3 6s-1]

Boult to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, poor delivery from Boult to follow-up. Short, wide and Parthiv is right on top of it, cracks the cut behind square and third man was only picking it up from the rope. MI are off and running
Boult to Buttler, FOUR, inswinger which is slightly off target and Buttler puts it away with ease. Full and swinging into the pads, flicked through mid-wicket to open his account. Not a muscle moved
Rajpoot to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, this time Krunal is in position much quicker, the line is different too - more around off and middle - and he's able to muscle the pull away through mid-wicket

Rajpoot to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, consecutive fours to finish the over. MI desperately need some momentum here. I think Rajpoot is getting a bit carried away. Bowls it full on the pads and Krunal whips him over mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Nitish Rana, FOUR, a little bit of air from Kuldeep, Rana quickly bends his knees and swipes it to the wide long-on boundary. The length was a bit too full from Kuldeep there

Kuldeep Yadav to Nitish Rana, SIX, oh what a shot! 23 off the last two overs now. A good little burst from these two. Kuldeep still flights the ball up, the line is outside off and Rana goes through the line to cream it beautifully over extra-cover. What timing on that. Way into the stands

Rajpoot to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Uthappa!! Rajpoot has strangled him down leg. What a lucky breakthrough to end a fledgling partnership. Back of a length on leg-stump, Krunal tries to help it along into the fine leg boundary but the deflection is only a small one. A faint little tickle off the inside edge straight to the keeper. Krunal Pandya c Uthappa b Rajpoot 11(6) [4s-2]

Rajpoot to Pollard, SIX, all the way. If you're going short to Pollard, it better be nice and high. This one sits up around his chest and he dismisses it from his presence over the mid-wicket boundary

Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, uh oh! A bad mix-up there with Pollard being sent back from the middle of the pitch. But he makes it home. The throw isn't a great one from Pathan either. Rana called him initially but then backtracked as Pollard steered it to point. These are nervy times

Woakes to Pollard, FOUR, Woakes bowls short first up to surprise him, but Pollard is quickly into position. He's able to swivel outside the line of the ball which is on leg-stump and helps the pull to the fine leg boundary. It's rocketed through

Woakes to Pollard, out Caught by (sub)Rishi Dhawan!! What a huge wicket right after the break. The major threat of Pollard is gone, and KKR will really back themselves now to seal this. Not sure if this was the plan, or Woakes just executed it incorrectly. He bowls it short and wide, Pollard throws his bat at and the top-edge flies down for a comfortable catch to third man. Massive moment. Pollard c (sub)Rishi Dhawan b Woakes 17(17) [4s-1 6s-1]
Woakes to Nitish Rana, FOUR, moves away from the line of the short of length off-cutter, creates some room and flays it away over extra-cover. Rana keeping Mumbai afloat

Woakes to Nitish Rana, 1 run, Woakes botches a run-out opportunity! He just had to collect the ball cleanly. Rana was well short. Rana couldn't find any elevation as he tried to flat-bat the back of length delivery and he hit it straight to mid-off. Never a run there, but the non-striker had come a long way down so Rana obliged. Would have been gone
Woakes to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, that's been absolutely spanked through extra-cover. The ball has left a vapour trail. Short and wide from Woakes, Pandya smokes it while backing away
Boult to Nitish Rana, FOUR, brilliant timing! Low full toss wide of off, Rana reaches out and slices it past backward point. It skimmed off the bat

Boult to Nitish Rana, SIX, 10 off 2 balls. This game isn't over yet. Not while Rana is there. Boult is struggling to execute the yorker. He delivered a low full toss last ball, now a proper full toss at the stumps. Rana picks it away effortless over long leg

Boult to Hardik Pandya, SIX, length from Boult and it disappears way back over mid-wicket. The MI dugout is on its feet. What a blow from Pandya. But this is ordinary death bowling. Seam-up and good length, right there in the slot
Rajpoot to Nitish Rana, SIX, lapped over the keeper for six! Thrilling stuff. Rana has stooped across and picked this full toss from middle-stump. It came right off the middle

Rajpoot to Nitish Rana, FOUR, full toss again and this time he lofts it over extra-cover. Although the timing isn't quite there, he just had to clear the fielder in the circle. No chance for the fielder running across from sweeper cover. It's fifty for Rana too. The crowd going bonkers

Rajpoot to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Narine!! That roar from Rajpoot drowned the whole of Wankhede by itself. Rana backs away to a low full toss on middle and spears it straight to point. He had timed the pants off it but couldn't have found the fielder any better. His stunning innings comes to an end. Oh what a game! Nitish Rana c Narine b Rajpoot 50(29) [4s-5 6s-3]
Rajpoot to Hardik Pandya, SIX, low full toss again and Hardik flogs it over square leg. He is 18 off 5. What a blinder!

Boult to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, that is probably the blunder which will cost KKR the match. It shouldn't have been any more than a single. A low full toss which Hardik can't find any elevation with. He smacks it down to long-on, where Surya attacks the ball nicely but he misfields and the ball sneaks through

Boult to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, this is very, very ordinary from KKR in the field. The substitute Rishi Dhawan is the culprit this time. He drops a skier. Another brilliant short ball, rushes Hardik on the pull and takes a thick top-edge to deep square leg. Dhawan looks nervous under the ball, slips a bit and then has to dive to his left after the misjudgement. Makes a hash of it
Boult to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, full on the pads, and Hardik has done it! He whips it away past a diving Rajpoot at the fine leg boundary before running down and cutting a pose for the camera

Boult to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, a shot that should make him feel better. Boult errs in his length slight and that is enough for Parthiv to punish him, driven beautifully wide of mid-off and the ball raced away to the fence

Woakes to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, direct hit and Parthiv was running back. Finally he connects with one of his heaves, not middled though and finds Yusuf at mid-wicket. The shy is at the bowler's end and it is way off target

Woakes to Buttler, SIX, Buttler clearly has the wood on his England team mates. Stokes in the first game and now Woakes. A little shuffle and a crouch down to scoop this length delivery over short fine. The connection was such that it travelled the distance
Narine to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, rank long hop to start Narine's spell, Parthiv picked the bones out of the pull shot, rocks back and nails it wide of the mid-wicket fielder. No need to run for those
Narine to Buttler, 2 runs, the new opening combo for MI has registered a 50-run stand in only their second game together. Buttler works it away with the spin wide of long-on and the second was on

Narine to Buttler, SIX, Buttler surely picked that from Narine. It was the off-spinner and he played it with the turn, plants his foot across and whips it over the cow corner fence for a maximum. This was more timing than power from the Englishman

Kuldeep Yadav to Parthiv Patel, SIX, finally Parthiv connects with one and sends it into the crowd. Floated up just outside off, Parthiv sinks to one knee and slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket. GG certainly didn't like it

Kuldeep Yadav to Parthiv Patel, out Lbw!! Kuldeep can't be kept quiet for too long these days. He provides the first breakthrough for KKR and ends Parthiv's hit-and-miss innings. It was the wrong 'un and Parthiv shuffled across to sweep, missed and is rapped on the pads. The question was whether the impact was in-line, umpire Nandan thought so and raised his finger. Parthiv Patel lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 30(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Nitish Rana, FOUR, a freebie from Kuldeep to welcome Rana. Googly which is short and down leg, Rana went for the big pull and under edge it fine. The man in the deep was square and had no chance

Rajpoot to Buttler, out Lbw!! Two wickets in two overs. The bowling change has worked for KKR and GG. The UP lad gets rid of the dangerous Buttler, who makes a start and gets out, again. A full toss that tailed back in, Buttler was beaten for pace as he missed the flick. The ball struck him in front of leg-stump. Not sure if it would have gone on to hit the sticks. But the finger was raised and he walks back. Buttler lbw b Rajpoot 28(22) [4s-1 6s-2]

Narine to Rohit, out Lbw!! Rohit is not walking. He's not pleased with the decision. Has some choice words to say to umpire Nandan. "That's an absolute shocker," says KP on air and he's right. Massive inside edge onto the pad. Two poor decisions in two overs might have just cost MI the game. The off-break which turns back in and cramps Rohit for room, he hurriedly brings his bat down and smashes it into his pads. The umpire didn't spot it and gave it out after a thought. Rohit was fuming after the decision. Even showed his bat to the umpire gesturing he hit it. But you can't overturn an onfield decision unless you have the DRS and that is not available in the IPL. This wicket has to be the game changing moment. Rohit lbw b Narine 2(6)

Stanlake to Amla, FOUR, Amla is off and running. Stanlake loses his radar and sprays it on the pads, Amla will not miss out on those. Just nonchalantly whips it past square leg. The ball raced away to the fence at MACH 3

I Abdulla to Amla, FOUR, fabulous shot from Amla. Don't offer him width, not even half a foot. If you give him half a foot, he will take it into a mile. Just extends his hands and lifts it effortlessly over extra cover
Chahal to Amla, SIX, that has gone flying into the third tier. Just slid on with the arm, Amla picked the bones out of it, thumping it high and handsome into the long-on stands

Watson to Maxwell, 1 run, dropped by backward point, a real sitter, RCB fans can't believe it! Full and wide, Maxi slices the drive sitting deep inside his crease, it went flat and straight to Mandeep Singh. He was a tad slow to react, straight in and straight out

Watson to Amla, FOUR, it's down the leg side and Amla tickles it away for four! The man at fine leg had no chance. A fine fifty from the South African. This knock has ensured that KXIP are chasing this down without much of a problem
Watson to Maxwell, FOUR, plenty of width on offer and Maxwell takes full toll of it, stands tall in his crease and smacks the leather over extra cover. Take four!
Negi to Maxwell, FOUR, that's fodder! Maxi wants to finish it off ASAP. Uses the strong bottom hand to whip it in the air over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

Stanlake to Maxwell, SIX, this could be over pretty soon. Maxwell is surely relishing captaincy, Australia are you watching? Clears his front leg and smites the heck off a short delivery, backs away and makes a clean connection, goes seething over a helpless third man

Stanlake to Maxwell, SIX, brute! That's massacred! Maxi is in some form. Watches the ball like a hoop, once he picked the length (short) it was all about connection; that was marmalized, flat and flying over backward point

Chahal to Maxwell, SIX, #KXIP make a mockery of RCB's 148, ABD's 46-ball 89, win by 8 wickets with 33 balls to spare. Maxi is blasting it all around the park, puts the finishing touches with a brutalizing maximum over long-off. Got underneath a flat delivery and killed it...Watto smiles as he shakes hands with his dear friend. Lo! That's all he can do at the moment

Stanlake to Vohra, SIX, you will see those often especially when Stanlake is bowling at such pace. Vohra is not afraid, goes for a pull off the front foot, gets a fat top-edge that flies over the third man fence. Blades these days! I tell you..

Watson to Vohra, FOUR, in the airrr and just over a leaping Negi. Vohra would've had his heart in his mouth for a moment. A short of length delivery outside off, there was width on offer so Vohra went after for a rasping cut. Didn't bother to keep it down but luckily for him it flies over the point fielder
Watson to Vohra, FOUR, almost.. Watson overcorrects his length, bowls fuller this time. Vohra flexes his arms and lifts it over mid-off. Just clears the fielders and runs away to the fence

Watson to Vohra, FOUR, third boundary of the over. Watson is not learning. This was much straighter, he is looking for some swing which is non existent at the moment. Full on the pads, Vohra gets inside the line and tickles it away to the fine leg fence. The fielder was inside the ring and Watson shouldn't have bowled it there

Stanlake to Amla, FOUR, threads the gap this time. Pure class from Amla. Stands still and lets his hands do the talking. Punches a back of a length delivery crisply through cover-point, beats the packed off-side field
Stanlake to Vohra, 1 run, goes wide of the crease and angles one on the pads, clipped away sweetly to deep square leg. 50-up for Punjab

Tymal Mills to Amla, SIX, in the airrrr and dropped. Mills is furious. Stanlake is the culprit. Don't even look at the bowler. A short ball down leg, Amla swivels across and pulls, hits it straight to fine leg. Stanlake prances to his right, goes reverse-cupped but makes a royal mess of it. The ball bursts through his fingers and what's worse is, it carries over the fence

Tymal Mills to Vohra, FOUR, wow. Elegance written all over it. Shot of the day so far. Mills bowls a half-volley on the stumps, Vohra leans forward, presents a full bat face and drives it smoothly down the ground, beats mid-on

Tymal Mills to Vohra, out Lbw!! Number one down. A premature end to Vohra's innings. Mills is chuffed to bits, lets out a huge roar. It was full and straight, the back of the hand slower ball from Mills. Vohra misjudged it completely. Shuffled across his sticks and plays down the wrong line. Misses it and is struck low on the pad. Looked pretty adjacent and umpire Anil Chaudhary raises his dreaded finger. Vohra lbw b Tymal Mills 34(21) [4s-4 6s-1]

I Abdulla to Axar, SIX, this one goes horribly wrong for Abdulla. Tries the chinaman, but drops it on a shortish length, Patel spots it. He pivots back and muscles the pull into the deep mid-wicket stands

Chahal to Axar, out Bowled!! Chahal strikes. The experiment of sending Patel up the order fails. It was the googly from Chahal, wasn't quite short. Patel went for the encore, not the ideal length. He misses and the ball rattles the stumps. Chahal exults! Axar b Chahal 9(6) [6s-1]
Chahal to Amla, SIX, in the slot and out of the park. Pitched up just outside off, Amla was waiting for it, plonks his front foot forward and lifts it over long-off

Tymal Mills to Maxwell, FOUR, you cannot keep Maxwell quiet for long. He gets into business, full at 146kph, Maxwell clears his front leg and bludgeons it back over the bowler's head. Brutal from Maxi!
Tymal Mills to Maxwell, SIX, wow! What a strike. Full and outside off, Maxwell engineers room and slices it with an open bat over extra cover. Such is the power that it carries all the way

Axar to Watson, out Bowled!! And that's a beautiful delivery to get rid of Watson. He beat him in the air. Lovely change of pace from Axar. The previous ball came at 100kph, this was nicely floated up, Watson was early into the cut, didn't turn much, anyway was too close to cut and he chops it back onto the sticks off an inside edge. So the ploy to open with Axar works wonders. Disappointment for the RCB skipper. Watson b Axar 1(4)

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, that was a poor piece of fielding from the man at third man. So de Villiers is off the mark straightaway in this IPL. Sandeep Sharma bowled a decent length ball outside off stump, just shaped away from the right-hander, de Villiers guided that with an angled bat past point and eventually managed to get a boundary

Aaron to Mandeep, out Caught by Saha!! Can a wicket keeper take a wicket? He sure can. Catches like those should be awarded to the keeper. Short delivery, got big on the batsman, he went for the pull and managed a big plump edge. The ball skied upwards and stayed there till eternity till Saha circled under it after running back and then despite misjudging it, threw himself in the air to take it out of thin air. Superb take from the mitts-man. Mandeep c Saha b Aaron 28(34) [4s-1 6s-1]

Aaron to de Villiers, SIX, MAAMMAAMIAAAHHH! That has sailed over the long-off region. Out of nowhere, Mr. 360 decides to pepper the area down the ground and he got the length to smack it down the ground. Length to ABD is blasphemous

Stoinis to de Villiers, SIX, good length is synonymous to death in the death overs. Length ball and the batsman hacked the pull shot away to send it packing into the cow corner region. That was out of the top draw from the comeback man!

Stoinis to de Villiers, SIX, Mr. 360 is back with a bang! Short delivery, it was a dead meat of a delivery for the batsman who was on the back foot, he picked the bones out of that. Pivots on the back foot and then hammers the pull on the on-side for a maximum and with that his fifty.

Mohit Sharma to Binny, SIX, length ball and it disappears. That has been hoicked away into the on-side and that has landed many-a-miles into the deep mid region. He picked it up like he was picking roses in a garden

Mohit Sharma to Binny, FOUR, goes inside-out and cannons the ball over cover for a boundary. That was a full ball outside off and the batsman thwacks the ball over the fielder to get another boundary. Even Binny joins in the act

Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, cheers says ABD as he accepts the freebie from the bowler. That was a friendly full toss on the sticks and the batsman went across the line to smack the blow flat between long-on and mid-wicket for a maximum

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, FIFTY for the combo! This man can do anything and everything with the willow. The pied piper of RCB treated the bowler as if he hails from Hamelin. That was full outside off and the batsman just steered the ball over the man at point

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, PHHUUUUUU!! 97 metres hit after he sank down on his knee to clobber the ball away towards the deep mid-wicket region. That was a low full toss and the batsman got under it to send it into oblivion

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, full toss, you don't want to know what happened to the bowler. That again forced the batsman to crouch low and trample the ball away into the on-side. That ball almost scaled the moon before it came down

Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, his body lost balance. He was done in by the length, which was full, done in by the lack of pace but he reached out for it. He still managed to drag the ball away over long-off and a six it is

Mohit Sharma to Vishnu Vinod, FOUR, in the airrrrrr and just over the leaping Maxwell at mid-on. Vinod is known for his audacious stroke-play. He won't mind playing his shots in any situation. Shortish delivery from Mohit Sharma, Vinod smacks that from the crease, didn't get hold of it, more a sort of a pull shot it was, the ball just evaded the Punjab skipper

Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, on the sticks, he goes down onto his knees and then the biggest of the night is unleashed as the ball scales some other orbit and disappears out of the stadium. Sensational hitting from ABD and RCB have something to fight with

Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, oh my! That's a de Villiers special. How did he manage to time it so well? Looked like he was initially cramped for room, just moved his legs to the leg-side for a wee bit, somehow managed to get under that ball and loft it inside-out over wide long-off. Right then, he's moved on to 10 off 5. Good start you would say

Sandeep Sharma to Vishnu Vinod, no run, yes-no and the last thing RCB want is for Vinod to run AB out. Thankfully no damage done. He defends this back of a length delivery towards cover-point and blindly sets off, AB rightly sends him back and Stoinis' throw wasn't accurate at the striker's end

Sandeep Sharma to Vishnu Vinod, out Caught by Maxwell!! Good captaincy from Maxi. Vishnu Vinod hit a boundary that went aerial over mid-on in the previous over. Now he's placed himself in the deep and swallowed an easy catch. Disastrous start for RCB after opting to bat. Credit to Sandeep Sharma as well for dropping it short and cramping the batsman for room on seeing the batsman advance, Vinod wasn't in the best of positions to play, yet he went through with the hoick, totally mistimed it in the end. Vishnu Vinod c Maxwell b Sandeep Sharma 7(12) [4s-1]

Aaron to Kedar Jadhav, out Lbw!! "Aaaaah, aaaaah," goes Aaron and the finger goes up. "Definitely going over," says Pup on air, but quickly corrects himself to add, "maybe umpire's call." Body blow for RCB. Kedar was their hero in Bengaluru, he's out for a 4-ball 1 in Indore. Was that going over the top? Should the benefit of doubt been given to Kedar? This was the nip-backer from Aaron, Kedar was on the hop, impact was just around the off stump and hawk-eye shows the ball missing the stumps. Another poor call from the umpire. We've had a few thus far in the series. Ask Mumbai Indians! Kedar Jadhav lbw b Aaron 1(4)

Aaron to de Villiers, FOUR, Aaron missed the yorker by a yard or so and that was just what de Villiers wanted with the line being middle and leg. He waited for the ball to come and flicked it past the diving mid-wicket fielder

Mohit Sharma to Mandeep, no run, another yes-no and Mandeep escapes. A direct-hit would have seen him walk back. He wanted to drive this short of length delivery through cover, got an inside edge to Amla at mid-wicket, AB shouts and sends him back, the throw was wide of the stumps

T Natarajan to Mandeep, SIX, now then, now then! That's hit the roof of the stadium over the square leg stand. What a shot! How effortless was that? This short ball didn't rise much, Mandeep stood tall, swivelled and muscled the pull shot all the way

T Natarajan to Mandeep, FOUR, and he gets lucky with an outside edge that runs away for four! No one at slip and third man can't cut that off. Natarajan bowled full and outside off stump, Mandeep reached out to meet the ball, the ball escaped off the edge

Chahar to Tare, out Caught by Dhoni!! Look at him go. Surely he's inspired by a certain South African in his team - Imran Tahir. As soon as he sees Dhoni complete the catch, Chahar is off on a celebratory run. Runs past almost all his mates. Good length ball in the channel around off, Tare has a needless poke at that, the hint of away movement takes the edge and Dhoni does the rest behind the stumps. Tare does not trouble the scorers and RPS have an early wicket. Tare c Dhoni b Chahar 0(5)

Chahar to Samson, FOUR, classy stuff from Samson. Nothing much wrong with the delivery. Good length ball around off, Samson allowed it to do its bit before opening the bat face and directing it past the backward point fielder. Used the pace on the ball and timed it beautifully

Chahar to Samson, FOUR, consecutive boundaries for Samson. That should calm the nerves. Overpitched and Chahar is punished, Samson strides forward and creams the square drive through the packed off-side field. No need to run for that
Zampa to Pant, FOUR, tosses it up slow on middle and leg. Overpitched as well. Pant waits for the ball and drills it down the track. No chance for the long-on fielder

R Bhatia to Pant, SIX, hits it and poses for the photographs does Pant. That's Instagrammable. Full delivery with no pace behind it. He clubbers it over the bowler's head and the ball sails over the sightscreen. First maximum of the day

R Bhatia to Pant, SIX, second six of the over and Pant is turning the heat on here. Very similar to the first six. Full and slow from Bhatia. Once again, Pant thumps it down the ground and the ball lands wide of the sightscreen

Stokes to Samson, 1 run, just short of the long-on fielder and Samson reaches his fifty! Pitched up delivery, Samson lofted it over mid-on and falls in front of the diving long-on fielder. Samson collects a single to get to his milestone

Zampa to Samson, SIX, that's a pressure-releaser! Brings up the 50-run stand in style! Zampa overpitches and Samson takes full toll of it. Leans forward and sends it sailing over long-off for a gigantic six

Stokes to Pant, out Pant Run Out!! That's brilliant stuff from Mayank Agarwal. The excellence cuts short Pant's innings. To start with, Stokes bowled a wide yorker. Pant squeezes it out, finds Mayank at point and sets off. Mayank finds the target directly and Pant is well short of his ground. Pant run out (Mayank Agarwal) 31(22) [4s-1 6s-2]
Stokes to Samson, FOUR, nice looking shot! Short ball, Samson has ample time to move across and pull it behind square on the leg-side. Well wide of the fine leg fielder. One bounce over the rope
Tahir to Samson, SIX, that's a monster! Fired in on the legs of Samson and Samson deposits it into the mid-wicket stands with a heave. That cleared the boundary rope by a long way
Dinda to Samson, SIX, welcome to your new spell says Samson! Length ball wide of off allowing Samson to free his arms. He is balanced in the crease and elevates it straight over long-off for a six

Dinda to Samson, SIX, that's a stunning shot! Samson moved leg-side and Dinda follows him with a bumper. Samson has no problems whatsoever as he hooks it over square leg. No fielder there and Samson collects another maximum
Dinda to Samson, FOUR, highest score in this season! Cheeky from Samson! Low full toss outside off, Samson picks it and laps it well wide of short fine and the ball dribbles away into the fence
Zampa to Samson, SIX, what a stunning way to get to your maiden T20 century! Zampa bowls it quick, full and on the stumps, Samson moves slightly to his right and lofts it down the ground. MUSCLED

Zampa to Samson, out Bowled!! Zampa gets his man and Samson walks back raising his bat. Gets a standing ovation from his team mates in the dug-out. It was a flipper that did the trick. Samson looked to pull it through the on-side and failed to make connection. The ball cannons onto the stumps. Samson b Zampa 102(63) [4s-8 6s-5]
Zampa to Chris Morris, FOUR, that's one helluva way to open your account! Leg-break outside off, Morris lofts it inside-out and gets off the mark with a boundary

Zampa to Chris Morris, SIX, that's a gigantic hit. For a moment, I thought it might go on and land onto the Pune-Mumbai Expressway. Fullish length, Morris moves to his right and wallops it over long-on. That went miles in the air and cleared the fence by a long way as well. High and handsome

Zampa to Chris Morris, FOUR, the gamble hasn't paid off. A wicket was scalped, but the overall result - 22 runs off the 19th over. Flipper outside off, Morris crouches and lifts it inside out. No chance for long-off
Stokes to Chris Morris, FOUR, that's a gross delivery! Short of a good length delivery with no pace behind it. Morris moves across and helps it away well wide of short fine. Runs away into the fence

Stokes to Chris Morris, FOUR, that's a brilliant stroke! Stokes can't believe that. He didn't do much wrong there. It was bowled in the blockhole wide of off and Morris opens his bat face and drills the squeeze wide of point
Stokes to Chris Morris, SIX, wow! Bowls length and gets punished. On the pads and just a flick of the wrists. The ball has more than enough wings to clear the square leg fence

Dinda to Samson, FOUR, Samson has come out firing. Picked the length early on the short of length delivery, got his front leg up and nailed the pull in front of square. That came smack bang off the middle

Dinda to Samson, FOUR, fourth boundary in five balls for Samson. The start is getting better for DD. Dinda overcompensates and goes full outside off, Samson is up for it and cracks the drive past the diving cover-point fielder. Sped away to the fence

Dinda to Billings, FOUR, third boundary of the over and Dinda leaking runs here. Short and wide outside off, Billings throws the kitchen sink at that and the ball flies off the outside edge, over Faf at slip and into the third man fence

Stokes to Chris Morris, SIX, fittingly Morris finishes the innings with a six. What a cameo this was from him. Stokes bowls it short and Morris easily muscles the pull over deep mid-wicket. The man in the deep is just a spectator. Well that has been the story for the last few overs
Chahar to Samson, FOUR, excellent batting. On a length and just outside off, Samson goes up and over cover, once he got it through the infield the result was going to be in his favour

Stokes to Samson, FOUR, Stokes too meted out with the same treatment. Good length ball outside off, Samson leans into the drive and places it square. It is a crowded off-side field and he's threaded that to perfection
Chahar to Billings, FOUR, not a boundary ball but that's T20. Back of length around off, Billings crouches a bit and swats it away wide of mid-on, not off the middle but he had enough wood on that

Chahar to Billings, FOUR, last over of the powerplay and Billings has decided to cash in. Advances and gets cramped for room, swings with all his might and drags it off the inner part of the bat to the left of short fine, Dinda can only escort the ball to the fence

Chahar to Billings, FOUR, poor delivery this and Chahar is made to pay. Sprays it down leg and that is easy pickings for any batsman, Billings stays inside the line and whips it fine. No chance for Dinda this time around

Tahir to Billings, out Bowled!! And off he goes. Gets the crowd going as well. Billings is cursing himself off the field. It is yet another start for the Englishman that is not converted. It's always dangerous to shimmy down the wicket for a bowler like Tahir, who generally skids the ball through, and that is what happened. Billings came down the wicket and Tahir pushed it through, by the time the Kent batsman could get his bat down, the ball was past him and crashed into off-stump. The partnership has been broken and just the opening RPS needed. Billings b Tahir 24(17) [4s-4]

Nadeem to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, first boundary of the innings. Sweetly timed by Agarwal. Saw the ball dropped on a shortish length, pivoted back and flayed it through cover. This is a mickey-mouse outfield and it zooms away to the fence
Corey Anderson to R Bhatia, SIX, take that! Says Bhatia. Gets under this short ball and smokes it over deep mid-wicket. Crunching sound of the willow

Nadeem to Dhoni, SIX, lovely shot, Pune need more of those, Dhoni skips down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it high and over long-on for a maximum. Chants of MS, MS from the crowd.. Can he make a big score here?

Mishra to Dhoni, out Caught by Nair!! When things go wrong, they go hopelessly wrong. Even his favourite helicopter shot has gone wrong tonight, that should snuff out whatever little hopes Pune might have had. This was tossed up invitingly by Mishra, Dhoni cleared his left leg and whipped it off his toes - flat and hard, but straight to Karun Nair at deep mid-wicket. He didn't have to move an inch, accepts the catch gleefully. MS walks off, so do half the Pune crowd. Dhoni c Nair b Mishra 11(14) [6s-1]

Pat Cummins to Chahar, SIX, mistimed but six, Chahar just got enough to clear the leaping Billings at wide mid-wicket, got underneath the length delivery, gets plenty of height and just about enough distance

Pat Cummins to Chahar, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Chahar, Cummins shortened his length outside off, Chahar backs away, makes room and slaps it over cover. The timing is good and the ball sails over the ropes for another maximum

Mishra to R Bhatia, out Caught by Chris Morris!! Another wicket for Mishra, he's having a better night. This was a floaty leg-break, went wider of off. Bhatia had to fetch that as he played the slog-sweep, went off the toe of the bat and it's a simple catch to Morris at long-on. Bhatia has a look at his bat and walks away. Mishra is on a hat-trick now. R Bhatia c Chris Morris b Mishra 16(17) [6s-1]
Mishra to Zampa, FOUR, lovely shot, Mishra tosses one wider of off, Zampa gets a big stride forward and drills it through extra-cover, beats the man getting across to his left from long-off

Zaheer to Chahar, out Caught by Pant!! Third wicket for Khan, he's having a ball tonight. Saw Chahar giving him the charge, banged it short and on the stumps, Chahar swung across in hope, gets a thick top-edge - simple catch to Pant. Zaheer has a few words to say as Chahar walks away. The end is nigh for Pune. Chahar c Pant b Zaheer 14(6) [6s-2]

Zaheer to Dinda, no run, has Karun plucked a one-handed stunner? The third umpire is called for, the soft call is OUT. Looked like a good catch on first view. Has the ball touched the ground, has he got his fingers underneath? The third umpire is having a look at different angles, this will be a tricky call. NOT OUT it is. Fair call, looked like the ball might just have touched the ground as Karun plucked it. Coming to the ball, it was full and shaping away, squared up Dinda as he was looking to work it towards the on-side, the edge flew to the left of first slip. Karun stuck his left hand out and claimed the catch
Zaheer to Dinda, FOUR, Dinda wants to have some fun, length delivery outside off, he gets forward and thumps it over extra-cover for a boundary

Mishra to Zampa, out Caught by Samson!! Another catch for Samson and another wicket for Mishra. This was another leg-break, bowled slower and on the middle-stump line. Zampa swung across in hope, he had to manufacture all the power himself, doesn't get the elevation either. Samson moves across to his right at deep mid-wicket and takes the offering. The umpire has called for a strategic break with just one wicket remaining. Not sure what the two teams will talk about over the next 150 seconds. Zampa c Samson b Mishra 5(7) [4s-1]

Pat Cummins to Dinda, out Caught by Mishra!! The Daredevils have opened their tally and it's Cummins who has the final wicket. On a good length and on the stumps, Dinda was backing away on the drive, doesn't get hold of the shot and chips it tamely towards cover. Mishra runs forward, dives and completes the catch. A 97-run mauling at home for Pune, they would love to forget today's display as soon as possible. Dinda c Mishra b Pat Cummins 7(7) [4s-1]

Zaheer to Rahane, out Caught by Samson!! Zak attack strikes! Glum faces in the crowd. Rahane falls early in the innings, big wicket for DD. It was on a fuller length around off, it was the off-cutter from Zak. Rahane perhaps went hard at it, the ball seemed to have stopped on the pitch and that must've foiled Rahane's attempt there. Skewed off the toe-end and lobs a sitter to Samson at mid-off, who backtracks and pouches it safely. So, Zak gets the better of his counterpart. Rahane c Samson b Zaheer 10(9)

Chris Morris to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, wow. Delicate stuff from Agarwal. Opens the bat face to this length ball and runs it towards third man, Sanju had to cover some ground, sprinted to his left but couldn't stop the ball from reaching the ropes

Zaheer to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Chris Morris!! The old warhorse gets his second wicket. Agarwal's poor form continues. He was scarced for runs, wanted to throw caution to the winds but doesn't succeed. Went for a on-the-up drive to a good length delivery that probably kicked up a touch. It was the slower ball from Zaheer that did the trick. He slices it straight to extra-cover, who took a couple of steps back and held onto it. Mayank Agarwal c Chris Morris b Zaheer 20(18) [4s-2]
Zaheer to du Plessis, FOUR, fabulous shot from du Plessis. Sets up a solid base and caresses it past long-off
Chris Morris to Tripathi, FOUR, what a way to get off the mark in IPL for Tripathi. Leans across to a full ball and blasts it through extra cover

Chris Morris to Tripathi, FOUR, edged and four. Morris is not happy. Throws a wild stare at the batsman. On a length and just outside off, Tripathi went hard at it, gets an outside edge that races away to the third man fence

Chris Morris to Tripathi, out Caught by Nadeem!! Short ball consumes Tripathi. Morris picks up his first wicket. A lifter angled at the batsman, Tripathi went for the pull. The ball got big on him and he manages a fat top-edge that went up in the air. Nadeem from fine leg darted in and snaffled it with ease. Tripathi c Nadeem b Chris Morris 10(5) [4s-2]

Nadeem to du Plessis, out Caught by Pant!! "Ahhhh, ahhhhh" goes Pant and S Ravi raises his finger. A big blow for Pune. Stunned silence in the crowd. du Plessis tried to be too cheeky, went low to play the scoop over the keeper's head. Gets a faint tickle and Pant nestles it into the gloves. du Plessis c Pant b Nadeem 8(7) [4s-1]

Pat Cummins to Stokes, out Caught by Pant!! Gone! Three wickets in three overs and Pune are in trouble now. Stokes bites the dirt. Cummins reaps reward for his tidy bowling. Again slants it wide of off, Stokes went for a pull. Wasn't too short and all he could manage was an under-edge that was gobbled up by Pant. Smart catch, must say as it was dying. He bent forward and took it cleanly. Stokes c Pant b Pat Cummins 2(5)

Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, FOUR, slightly straighter from Bhuvneshwar and the batsman clips the ball away between mid-wicket and mid-on for a four. Hardly touched it and the ball sped away after he shuffled a tad across his sticks

Nehra to Buttler, FOUR, looks to defend and the ball trims the inside edge to run past the sticks. Cruel it is for the bowlers. The ball lifted up after landing on a length forcing the batsman to jab at it but the ball clipped the inner edge to run past the timbers and the keeper for a four

Nehra to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, serene! The format might demand slam bang wham. But a back foot cover drive with a lean into the shot and hitting it on top of the bounce is welcomed all day long. He trampled back to stroke it off the back foot

Deepak Hooda to Nitish Rana, SIX, BOY O BOY! Clatters the ball out of the park after dropping down on one knee. The moment it hit the bat, it was heading one way - into the oblivion! That was again flattish and the batsman wasted no time in sending it away aerially
Nehra to Nitish Rana, FOUR, he's sprayed it around a bit today, has Nehra. Short and wide and gives away the boundary to finish the over. Slashed over backward point by Rana

Mustafizur to Pollard, SIX, wow! Just a flick of the wrists from Pollard and away she goes. That's scintillating timing. It was a fullish off-cutter on middle stump and Pollard whipped it comfortably over deep mid-wicket

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, out Caught by Dhawan!! He's whipped a pull straight to square leg. It was an innocuous short of length delivery into the body, not very high, and Pollard usually is pretty adept at dealing with those. But this time it seemed as if he didn't go through with the shot. It's straight down the throat of Dhawan. Can SRH still turn things around? Pollard c Dhawan b Bhuvneshwar 11(11) [6s-1]
Rashid Khan to Krunal Pandya, SIX, oh that's a full bunger on leg stump, the dew causing the ball to slip out of Rashid's hand. So difficult. Krunal Pandya swings it away over square leg
Nehra to Krunal Pandya, SIX, just clears long-on! He didn't get all of it, having to fetch it from outside off, but there was enough power in those shoulders
Nehra to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, 10 off 2 balls. Nehra continues to be expensive. Strays just a touch in line, bowls it on middle and leg, and Krunal Pandya glances it away past short fine leg
Cutting to Krunal Pandya, SIX, he's mowed that over deep mid-wicket. Back of a length, maybe a cutter, and it sits up to be whacked. Flat six
Cutting to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, very wide outside off and Krunal Pandya somehow reaches out and then generates enough power to carve it over extra-cover. He's in a hurry now

Cutting to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, off the top-edge or the glove, the ball lobs over Naman Ojha and runs away to the boundary. Krunal Pandya was rushed on the pull on this occasion. The line from Cutting cramped him up too. But he still gets the boundary

Bhuvneshwar to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Cutting!! He's holed out off a full toss. He swings hard but gets it right off the toe-end. It still goes pretty far and is caught just 5 yards inside the deep mid-wicket boundary. Cutting takes a smart catch running backwards and to his right. Krunal Pandya c Cutting b Bhuvneshwar 37(20) [4s-3 6s-3]

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, lofted over mid-off! He picks the slower ball, the length was pretty full outside off and Rana's focus is purely on timing. Doesn't go very hard at it. Brilliant batting

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, out Bowled!! Bhuvneshwar knocks over Rana's off-bail. It hit nothing else but the bail. Third wicket for Bhuvneshwar. He's been fantastic again today. A little bit of nip from a good length, Rana was backing away looking to create a shot out of nothing and missed it by a long way in the end. He's played a fine knock though. Nitish Rana b Bhuvneshwar 45(36) [4s-3 6s-2]

Nehra to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, repeats the gait of the previous ball and gets an outside edge to run it down towards third man. He got wood on it and got it fine after just using the pace of the bowler. 15 off the over!

Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, FOUR, errs in length, which is short, errs in line, which is wide. Enough said. The batsman cashes into the blank cheque of a delivery with the flay of the arms and stroked it beautifully through the heavily manned off-side

Nehra to Buttler, out Bowled!! The batsman preempts by dancing down the track but he lost his dancing shoes in the process as the slower ball doled out deceives him. The wily old Nehra rolled his fingers over the ball and the batsman trying for a cross batted swipe completely missed the ball due to the lack of pace on it. SRH get the first blood. Buttler b Nehra 14(11) [4s-3]

Nehra to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, nicely done as he wristily whips the ball in the air over the man at mid-on. A few bounces and into the fence. A length ball it was and the batsman did it with nonchalance

Nehra to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, targets the mid-riff with another short delivery but the pint-sized dynamite is onto it in a flash! The short arm jab on the pull and the ball screeches away into the backward square region on the on-side for a four

Rashid Khan to Rohit, out Lbw!! The wrong 'un and the MI skipper seems to be at the wrong end of it again. First game: Tahir, Now: Rashid. The ball decked in after landing and the meek prodded attempt from Rohit plots his own misery. The impact might have been around off even as Rohit lunged forward on the defensive push. The teen sensation continues to bamboozle the men. Rohit lbw b Rashid Khan 4(4)

Mustafizur to Nitish Rana, SIX, banged in short, the batsman plays an awkward shot to pull the ball away fine on the on-side for a maximum. He had eyes away from the ball and then the evasive action with the bat coming down on it made good enough contact

Mustafizur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that was a chocolate brownie of a delivery and the batsman puts the icing on it with the help of an eyes-scream of a shot. Cut away easily past the man at point making the man at third man look like a statue
Mustafizur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, the ramp now! He is pulling out all the tricks from his hat. Short ball bumped in well outside off and the batsman helped it on his way towards third man
Mustafizur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, poor delivery on the pads and third in a row as the batsman clips the ball away over the man at short fine leg
Deepak Hooda to Nitish Rana, FOUR, attempted slog sweep, is not really well timed but is well placed to send it away into the vacant backward square region for a much needed four

Deepak Hooda to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Length ball tossed up and he has chipped it straight to the man at long-on who dives forward and takes a good catch. He gave the impression to us that it might have stuck onto the wicket a bit. But it was a bizzare shot as he just lofted it without any particular intent on the shot. End of a good knock from Parthiv Patel. Parthiv Patel c Bhuvneshwar b Deepak Hooda 39(24) [4s-7]

Harbhajan to Warner, SIX, bring it on! Make a GIF of that shot. Warner swapped his hands and belted it with switch hit over third man, that's some hitting I tellya. Got behind it and gave it a full whack, bam!

Harbhajan to Warner, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Not again! Warner tries for another switch hit and this time it doesn't come off, ends up playing it off the back of the bat as the ball slid onto him and then the heroics of PP. He anticipated the shot, moved quickly to his left and dived full length before nestling it inches above the turf. Stunning catch that. Warner c Parthiv Patel b Harbhajan 49(34) [4s-7 6s-2]
McClenaghan to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, don't worry about that! Healthy width on offer, Hooda throws the kitchen sink and gets his christmas gift
Krunal Pandya to Dhawan, FOUR, right in the sweeping zone for SD. He gets inside the line and thrashes it away behind square

Harbhajan to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by Pollard!! Harbhajan's doosra does the trick, and boy is he happy! Does a cradle like celebration for his daughter, who is in attendance today. That was fired around off and middle, Hooda knelt down on knee and miscued the slog, was trying to clear long-on, but didn't get the distance. Pollard sets himself at long-on and consumes with ease. Deepak Hooda c Pollard b Harbhajan 9(9) [4s-1]
Harbhajan to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan's getting better with each passing delivery, he steps out, takes Harbhajan on and lofts him inside-out over extra cover

McClenaghan to Dhawan, out Bowled!! No fifties for the openers. Warner misses it by a run and SD by two. It was a loopy full toss which dips under Dhawan's cross-bat hoick to crash into his stumps. Easily done. McClenaghan has a wicket, been expensive thus far but this wicket should sooth his nerves. Dhawan b McClenaghan 48(43) [4s-5 6s-1]

McClenaghan to Cutting, FOUR, no fuss from Cutting! Arrives and gets a boundary, with utmost ease. A friendly full toss outside off, Cutting shows the full face of the bat, McClenaghan's pace takes care of the rest. Raced past mid-off

Hardik Pandya to Yuvraj, FOUR, a fielding blip from Buttler and that's a boundary. Yuvi knew what was coming with the field set, stayed on the back foot and unveiled the cut with a glitter of left-hander's elegance. Jos runs to his right from cover and dives, the ball slids through his fingers to add agony to a grumpy-looking Rohit Sharma

Hardik Pandya to Yuvraj, out Bowled!! Dragged on! Lands on the seam and gets the ball to angle away from Yuvi; making him fetch that far from his reach. Yuvi with his laden-feet went through with the pull and chopped it back onto his stumps, off the thick inside edge firing off the PUMA sticker. Yuvraj b Hardik Pandya 5(7) [4s-1]
Malinga to Cutting, FOUR, the gangly Cutting makes his intentions clear. He wants to have a piece of slinga Malinga. Waits deep inside the crease and bludgeons a full ball back over the bowler's head
Malinga to Cutting, FOUR, that's a wood chopper! Takes on a full half-volley and slices the whacky-drive over a leaping exra cover. Bhajji was the fielder and he may have got a fingertip on that
Bumrah to Cutting, FOUR, slower ball alright, but serves too much of width. Ends up as a full toss, Cutting chips it over extra cover, easy peasy

Bumrah to Cutting, out Bowled!! The Bumrah special, Cutting can't do much, just drops his head and walks off. Goes a touch wide of the crease and lands a perfect yorker, right at the base of middle stump. By the time Cutting got his bat down, his stumps were already shattered. Phewf! Cutting b Bumrah 20(10) [4s-4]

Malinga to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Way too early through his shot, played the shot on Monday, and the ball...Um! It arrives on Wednesday. Looking to flick, a healthy leading edge pops up to Rana at backward point. Simple catch. Vijay Shankar c Nitish Rana b Malinga 1(2)

Bumrah to Naman Ojha, out Caught by Pollard!! The wickets keep tumbling. Slower ball, in right-hander's swinging arc, Ojha got under it but he didn't give it a full whack. Relies on timing and chips it high into the night sky, Pollard is safe as a house at long-on. Naman Ojha c Pollard b Bumrah 9(9)

Bumrah to Rashid Khan, out Caught&Bowled!! Bumrah says "It's mine" and he makes no mistake. Charges out of his crease and clatters it, nowhere off the middle, it hung in the air for long and Bumrah had it covered. Caught it around the cover region. Rashid Khan c and b Bumrah 2(4)
Harbhajan to Warner, FOUR, lovely shot, poor ball from Harbhajan, dropped it short and wide of off, Warner backed away, plays with the turn and cuts it over cover, one bounce and over the ropes

Harbhajan to Warner, FOUR, this is even better. This was not all that short but Warner made room for himself, stayed back and went inside out over cover, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Malinga to Warner, FOUR, nicely played by Warner, it was the slower ball from Malinga, rolled his fingers across the seam. Warner watched it all along, played with an open face and guides it in the gap behind square on the off-side, beats backward point and rolls away to the fence

Malinga to Warner, FOUR, poor ball from Malinga, too straight and on Warner's pads, he allows it to come onto it, closes the face of the bat and glances it fine, beats the keeper and rolls away to the fence

Bumrah to Warner, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Bumrah, Warner waits on it, gets on top of the bounce, uses Bumrah's pace and steers it to the right of backward point. No chance for the fielder running across to his left from third man

McClenaghan to Dhawan, FOUR, streaky and four, on a good length and on the stumps, Dhawan heaves across the line, gets a thick inside edge past square leg. The pace of this outfield is so good that it rolls away to the fence

McClenaghan to Dhawan, SIX, cracking shot, length delivery on the stumps, right in the hitting arc for Dhawan, he gets forward and thumps it high and over mid-wicket, went sailing into the stands for a maximum

McClenaghan to Dhawan, FOUR, cracking shot, on a good length and just outside off, Dhawan does a little shimmy, gets close to the ball and drills it wide of mid-off. No need to run for those. 15 from the over
Hardik Pandya to Warner, leg byes, 1 run, short of a good length and on Warner's hips, he was looking to nudge and missed, rolled away off his pads towards square leg

McClenaghan to Warner, FOUR, that's a bad fumble from Rana and he has cost his team two runs. Full and on his pads, flicked away behind square on the on-side. Rana did the hard yards, got to the ball and slips it through his hands

McClenaghan to Warner, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries and it has turned out to be another expensive over from McClenaghan. He got too predictable with the slower ones, Warner was waiting for it, cuts it hard and beats the fielder at point to his left

Hardik Pandya to Dhawan, FOUR, inside edge and four, on a good length and holding its line outside off, Dhawan walked across on the swipe, gets a thick inside edge - past the off-stump and past the diving Parthiv. A hat-trick of boundaries for SRH

Hardik Pandya to Warner, SIX, beautifully played, banged in short and angling across the left-hander, Warner backs away,uses the pace of Hardik and helps it on its way, no one in the deep and the ball sails over the ropes
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, slapped, short of a length and shaping away from outside off, Narine plays with the angle and carves it behind square on the off-side, one bounce and over the ropes

Ishant to Gambhir, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Ishant, Gambhir gets on top of the bounce and cuts it in front of square on the off-side, beats the man in the ring and rolls away to the fence

Ishant to Gambhir, FOUR, edged and four, a third slip would have gobbled it up. Short of a good length and angling across Gambhir, opened him up as he looked to defend, the edge flew past the diving Maxwell at second slip, third man can't get across - despite the dive

Axar to Uthappa, out Bowled!! Uthappa attempts a cheeky lap sweep and ends up self-destructing himself. His captain doesn't look too pleased with it. This was tossed up on the leg-stump line, Uthappa went a long way across his stumps, bent down and was looking to lap it past the keeper, misses and the ball hits the top of leg-stump. Hushed silence at the Eden Gardens as Uthappa walks away. Uthappa b Axar 26(16) [4s-3 6s-1]

Axar to Gambhir, 1 run, 33rd IPL fifty for GG. Equals Warner's record for the most number of fifties. Waves his bat around to acknowledge the Eden Garden crowd. Reaches the milestone with a wristy flick through mid-wicket

Mohit Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, off-pace delivery and Gambhir spotted it early. The length was short and with his open stance, it was always going to be trouble for Mohit, punched off the back foot in front of square and Axar at sweeper gave up the chase very soon

Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, what was Ishant doing? Gambhir backed away to the leg-side, Axar followed him with a short and quick delivery, Gambhir adjusted and ramped it fine. Ishant at short third man stood like a statue

Axar to M Pandey, FOUR, top shot! Just a caress and off she went racing to the boundary cushion. Axar tosses it up outside off and draws Pandey into the drive, the Karnataka batsman drives it handsomely through extra cover and beat a quick David Miller at sweeper cover

Mohit Sharma to M Pandey, FOUR, slower short ball and Pandey had all the time in the world to dismiss it from his presence, delays the pull and sends it along the turf behind square, well wide of the deep square leg fielder

Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, that's bread and butter for Gambhir. Short, wide and he cracks it away. Went back in his crease and unleashed the cut shot behind square, beating backward point and third man quite comfortably

Stoinis to M Pandey, SIX, KKR complete a stunning 8-wicket win. Their eighth win on the trot against KXIP. Pandey brings up the winning runs in style, picks the slower delivery and swipes it flat over long-on. The fielder there was a mere spectator

Sandeep Sharma to Narine, SIX, lovely, Narine was sent in to do some pinch-hitting and he's doing exactly that. Length delivery outside off, Narine gets forward, drives it through the line and sends it high and over the fence at long-off

Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, cracking shot, hint of width outside off, the length was on the shorter side as well, Gambhir gets on top of the bounce and cuts it in front of square on the off-side, beats the fielder at point and rolls away to the fence

Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, this is turning out to be an excellent start from KKR. Sandeep overcompensates and bowls one full and wide of off, Gambhir shimmies down the track, gets down on one knee and drills it past extra-cover

Ishant to Gambhir, FOUR, poor ball from Ishant, short and wide of off, Gambhir gets on top of the bounce and cracks it behind square on the off-side. Beats backward point to his right and the man getting across in the deep
Maxwell to Gambhir, FOUR, this is a super quick outfield, flatter and on Gambhir's pads, nudged away behind square on the on-side. Two men gave chase, but the ball kept going away from their reach
Maxwell to Narine, FOUR, lovely shot, pushed through flatter and quicker, Narine shuffles down the track, makes room as he did so and drives it wide of mid-off, no need to run for those
Maxwell to Narine, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Narine, Maxwell drags his length back, drops it short and on Narine's pads, pulled away over square leg for another boundary

Maxwell to Gambhir, FOUR, 18 runs from the over, poor ball from Maxwell, fired it flatter and on Gambhir's pads, he goes back and clips it past square leg. The man in the ring was pretty square, gives the chase, but it's in vain
Aaron to Narine, SIX, lovely shot, Narine is hurting KXIP here, length delivery on the stumps, he presses forward and thumps it over mid-on, has enough power to pop over the fence on the full

Aaron to Narine, SIX, back-to-back sixes, this is Narine's highest ever T20 score. Aaron isn't learning here, another length delivery on the stumps, Narine backs away and lifts it high and over long-on, went a long way over the ropes at long-on

Aaron to Narine, FOUR, cracking shot, awful start from Aaron, fine leg was inside the ring and he looks to bounce out Narine. There's not much bounce on this one, Narine swivels across and helps it over short fine-leg, one bounce and over the ropes

Aaron to Narine, out Caught by Axar!! Narine's fun is over, but has he taken this match away from KXIP's grasp? This was banged in short and on the stumps, Narine swivels across and pulls it hard and flat - was struck pretty well but went straight into the hands of Axar at deep mid-wicket. He doesn't drop those and Narine walks off to a nice round of applause. Even his captain enjoyed it, gives a good send-off to his partner. Narine c Axar b Aaron 37(18) [4s-4 6s-3]

Mohit Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, the short-ball attack isn't working and KXIP aren't learning either. Banged in short and down the leg-side, Gambhir gets inside the line, swivels across and pulls it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Mohit Sharma to Uthappa, SIX, stylishly done, just a pick-up swivel from Uthappa and he sends it into the stands at wide long-on. Was quick to read the length, stayed on the front-foot and launched it into the stands
