Axar to Uthappa, FOUR, deft touch from Uthappa, Axar dropped one short and wide of off, Uthappa makes room, waits on it, uses the pace on the ball and dabs it late, beats Sandeep at short third man and rolls away to the fence

Stoinis to Uthappa, FOUR, that's easy pickings for Uthappa, he's looking in good form tonight. Short and on the stumps, he gets inside the line and helps it on its way, one bounce and over the fence at backward square leg
Axar to Uthappa, FOUR, poor ball from Axar, dropped it short and wide of off, Uthappa makes room and cuts it behind square on the off-side. Miller was caught wrong-footed and has no chance to recover

Boult to Amla, FOUR, shoddy from Piyush Chawla, running around from fine leg. He's too stiff while bending and the ball slips underneath him. Swinging in on middle and leg, Amla clips it behind square leg and it shouldn't have been more than a couple
Boult to Amla, FOUR, the swing from Boult takes him on the pads once more, Amla stays in the crease and whips a glance down to the fine leg boundary. Brisk start from the Kings XI

U Yadav to Vohra, SIX, that's been dispatched with disdain. Blistering pull shot. Short of length, around chest high, Vohra is still on the front foot but he transfers his weight quickly and smashes it in front of square. Hits the boundary cushions on the full

de Grandhomme to Amla, out Caught by Gambhir!! Maiden IPL wicket for de Grandhomme. Amla's painful innings is over. The frustration was creeping in, he walked across and tried to nudge it into the on-side, it was an off-pace delivery and Amla was fooled there. Gets a fat leading edge that goes up in the air. The skipper takes a simple catch at cover and the crowd roars in delight. Amla c Gambhir b de Grandhomme 25(27) [4s-4]

U Yadav to Maxwell, out Caught by Uthappa!! Mad max Maxi is gone. This is a body blow for Punjab. Two wickets in two overs and the pendulum swings back in favour of KKR now. It was a pacy back of a length delivery, Maxwell backed away towards the leg-side, perhaps was undone by the bounce there. He is tucked up for room, ends up having a slash at it. Gets a feather and Uthappa makes no mistake behind the stumps. First time Maxi has been dismissed in this IPL. Maxwell c Uthappa b U Yadav 25(14) [4s-3 6s-1]
U Yadav to Saha, FOUR, flashed and flashed hard. Umesh provides width for Saha, he throws his bat and ekes out a thick outside edge that flies past first slip
de Grandhomme to Miller, FOUR, this is a bit streaky but Miller won't mind. Bangs it short, Miller went for the pull, gets a top-edge that flies over the keeper

de Grandhomme to Miller, no ball, SIX, thumpy thump! What a sin. de Grandhomme has overstepped again and one more free-hit for Miller. Hurls one full outside off, Miller plants his front foot across and smashes it flat and hard over extra cover. Such is the power that it carries all the way
Chawla to Saha, SIX, Saha gets into the act. He's had enough. Uses his feet, reaches near the pitch and tonks it over long-off. An 84-meter strike
Chawla to Saha, SIX, fabulous shot. He has picked this googly alright, shimmies out, meets the pitch and lofts it inside-out over extra cover. Sweet timing and it sails over the rope

Boult to Saha, FOUR, that is an awful effort from Narine. Makes a royal mess of this one. Boult wears a cheeky smile on his face. It was a short ball outside off, Saha gets a top-edge as he tried to elevate it over third man. The ball lobs in the air and drops in front of Narine at third man, he fails to get his body behind the line of the ball and lets it go through making him look absolute silly
U Yadav to Miller, SIX, that's gone a long way into the stands! Miller sets up a solid base on the leg-stump, lets his hands take over and smokes it miles into the deep square leg stands
U Yadav to Miller, FOUR, attempted yorker gone wrong for Umesh. Ends up offering a high full toss on off, Miller gets hit high on the willow but he manages it skew it past mid-off

U Yadav to Miller, out Caught by M Pandey!! There is a notion that full tosses are a bad ball but not on this occasion. Some respite for Umesh and KKR. Slips in a friendly full toss on the stumps, Miller went for a whack across the line, again squirts it high on the bat. Pops it high towards deep mid-wicket. Pandey ran forward, covered good ground and snaffled a good running catch. The umpires checked for a possible no-ball (both crease and height), but it was fine. KKR anthem blares in the background. Miller c M Pandey b U Yadav 28(19) [4s-2 6s-2]

U Yadav to Saha, out Caught by Woakes!! Two in two for Umesh. What an over this is turning out to be for KKR. Umesh is on hat-trick now. A fuller ball on off, Saha sort of checked his shot, ended up hitting it uppishly to mid-off, Woakes dived forward and held onto a smart catch. He ensured that it didn't pop out of his hands when his elbows hit the ground. Saha c Woakes b U Yadav 25(17) [4s-2 6s-2]

U Yadav to Axar, out Caught by Narine!! Three wickets in the over and Punjab are falling apart here. Umesh is on a roll. Spears it on a fuller length on off, straightened a wee bit. Patel was early into his shot, skims a leading edge that balloons straight into the hands of Narine at extra cover, who finally holds onto one today. Axar c Narine b U Yadav 0(1)
Boult to Mohit Sharma, FOUR, he's timed that well. Gets on top of the bounce, opens the bat face nicely and steers it past point. No chance for the third man fielder

Woakes to Mohit Sharma, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Another one bites the dust. Against the run of play, Punjab lose another one. It was a short ball slanted at the body, Mohit went after it, gets it high on the bat and skews it to long-on where Suryakumar Yadav pouches it safely. Mohit Sharma c Suryakumar Yadav b Woakes 10(8) [4s-1]

Boult to Vohra, FOUR, ravishing cover drive from Vohra. This looks a belter of a pitch. This is no half-volley, but the ball is coming on so beautifully that Vohra just leans across and caresses it on the up. Awesome timing
Boult to Vohra, FOUR, third boundary today that Boult has conceded off the pads. Just straying a touch with the swing. Curling in on leg, Vohra shuffles across and just tickles it through

Boult to Vohra, 1 run, Narine has shelled a sitter at third man. Oh dear. Boult just turns around in despair. A short of length delivery, Vohra tries to pull off the front foot and sends a top-edge flying down to third man. They don't come easier than that

Woakes to Aaron, out Caught by Gambhir!! Oh goodness! Gambhir nearly made a meal of this catch. He somehow clasps onto it. A full ball outside off, Aaron threw his bat, gets a top-edge that goes high in the air towards extra cover. Gambhir set himself under it, the ball was swirling in the air. The ball popped out of his hand, after juggling with it, he manages to gobble it up. Aaron c Gambhir b Woakes 4(5)
Woakes to Amla, FOUR, deliberately goes up and over point. Ordinary delivery. Short of length with width on offer, Amla opens his wrists up as he slashes it away to lift it over the infield

Woakes to Vohra, FOUR, the boundaries keep coming as the bowlers keep erring in line. Full ball on the pads, fine leg is inside the ring, so Vohra effortlessly whips it over him and into the fence. KXIP off to a flying start
Woakes to Vohra, FOUR, that's a risky shot but Vohra backs himself to ramp a short of length delivery into the third man boundary. He got it fine enough of the fielder. One bounce and over the ropes
Narine to Vohra, 5 wides, an inswinger from Narine. But this one goes a long way in the air, falls away down the leg-side and beats Uthappa completely. There's no stopping those runs

Chawla to Vohra, out Bowled!! Much needed breakthrough for the hosts. Chawla comes on and strikes first ball. Not a big turner of the ball, this bloke, and that skiddiness through the surface accounts for Vohra. May have been the googly. Pushed through the air, lands it on a length, and the ball zips through the gate as Vohra tries to loft it on the up. He was aiming for the inside-out shot with the turn. But the ball goes straight on and knocks over middle and off. Vohra b Chawla 28(19) [4s-4 6s-1]
Chawla to Stoinis, FOUR, only slightly short, the ball slides in on leg, and Stoinis is quick to go back in the crease. He effortlessly whips a pull over square leg and beats long leg to his left
Narine to Amla, 1 run, fires them in, 103kph, Amla punches it to the right of point and quickly goes through to the other end

Narine to Stoinis, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Stoinis doesn't pick this one. He expects the ball to go away to aid his cut shot, but it turns in slightly to cramp him up. A thick under-edge into the pitch before bouncing up to knock over the top of leg stump. Stoinis b Narine 9(12) [4s-1]

Woakes to Maxwell, FOUR, picked off his hips for six, is it? No, one bounce. So stylishly done. Loose from Woakes again, he bowls back of a length and bowls leg-stump. Maxwell languidly swivels outside the line and helps it on its way. Lovely wrists

Woakes to Maxwell, 1 run, dropped by Uthappa! Definitely two noises there. Back of length, cutting in and takes the inside edge. The ball deflects off Maxwell's thigh as well. Uthappa dives to his left with one hand but the ball hits him hard on the glove
Woakes to Amla, FOUR, short of length into the body, Amla wallops a pull through backward square leg. That's rocketed to the fence. Really poor from Woakes. He's been consistently short so far

Chawla to Maxwell, SIX, he's in some form in this tournament. A flighted leg-break from Chawla, it's right in the slot. Maxwell is close enough to the pitch, knows that Chawla doesn't turn it a great deal and just swings through the line over long-on
Chawla to Maxwell, FOUR, four more. Flatter outside off but it's full again, and Maxwell smokes a flat-batted drive wide of long-off
Chawla to Maxwell, FOUR, Chawla under serious pressure. This is scintillating batting. He goes wide of off again, and is carted over extra-cover again. An unabridged swing of the bat

Binny to Buttler, out Caught by Gayle!! Binny tears off the wrapping paper and presents RCB with a gift in his first over. Early strike from the home team. Binny was being under used in the last three matches. Makes amends immediately today with a prized scalp of Buttler. It was a fuller length delivery jagging in on leg-stump line, seemed to have stopped on Buttler. He flicks it meekly straight to mid-wicket. Gayle won't drop those. Buttler c Gayle b Binny 2(5)
Chahal to Krunal Pandya, SIX, in the slot and Pandya connects one. Scooches low and smacks one over long-off

Tymal Mills to Pollard, FOUR, in the blockhole, the ball chirps the toe-end of the bat and bisects the gap between the keeper and the slip fielder to race away to the fence. That was really full and was just outside off to force the batsman to jam his bat down on that
Binny to Pollard, FOUR, length ball outside off and the batsman flogs the ball away with the meaty bottom-hand coming into play. The gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket was easily pierced

Negi to Pollard, SIX, backs away and clears the man at deep extra cover. He went inside out and got enough meat on it to send it packing over the cover fielder's head. Any doubts on Pollard's powerful delivering skills were quelled down. He didn't time it at all. The batter got it off the outer part of the bat and still enough sinew in it to send it over the ropes

Tymal Mills to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, fifty for the combo! He waited on that slower delivery and then dismissed it out of his sight with disdain. Got the room as well to free his arms and then got the ball speeding between cover and mid-off for a four

Tymal Mills to Pollard, FOUR, full ball targetting the sticks and the batsman got enough wood on it to clip it away. The man from deep square who was Binny came running in to make the save but despite getting a hand on it, couldn't bend down enough to stop that. Second four of the over

Negi to Pollard, SIX, flat hit! That was a flatter delivery and the batsman spanks it down the ground and over the bowler's head to give himself a wonderful fifty! This has been a top-class knock from the Trinidadian
Negi to Pollard, SIX, go fetch that! That has gone out of this orbit. That was flat again from Negi and the batsman shot a firecracker into the night sky to the delight of the MI fans

Aravind to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, poor from Mills! That was dabbed away with soft hands and the fielder at short third man does the London Bridge and dives over it to open the floodgates for RCB. The momentum has again changed hands
Chahal to Pollard, SIX, succeeds this time! He reaches out for the dragged slog and then biffs the ball down the ground to send it rocketing 20 rows into the stands

Chahal to Pollard, out Caught by de Villiers!! The gamble has worked for Kohli. Gives the ball to Chahal, who tosses it up, the batsman takes the aerial route but gets more elevation than distance and ends up being caught at long-off. That again went very high but ABD was all calm under the ball and cupped it without any fuss. Pollard c de Villiers b Chahal 70(47) [4s-3 6s-5]

Tymal Mills to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, short ball, pulled away and no man in the deep mid-wicket region allows the ball to race away into the fence. Chahal from deep square ran across and the ball sandwiches between him and the ground to ensure that he is in some pain. Hope he is OK as he has a grimacing expression on his face

Tymal Mills to Hardik Pandya, SIX, slower delivery, Hardik Pandya picks that up and dismantles the ball over the cow corner region for a maximum. That is it. MI have got themselves out of jail here after self-imprisoning themselves with a dreadful start. They were 7 for 4 but Pollard-Pandya have done it for them. 3rd win for MI!

Badree to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Gayle!! Two in two for RCB. Chinnaswamy breaks the sound barrier. RCB are right back in this contest. Both openers back in the hut now. Badree looped it full outside off, it was the sucker ball and Patel fell into the trap. Drove it on the rise straight to Gayle at short extra cover. The West Indian shows quick reflexes as he pouches an excellent catch. He was alert enough and his natural instincts took over there. Parthiv Patel c Gayle b Badree 3(8)

Badree to McClenaghan, out Caught by Mandeep!! "Mumbai Indians are committing hara-kiri" screams Ravi Shaz on air. Can't disagree. McClenaghan has been promoted up the order and what does he do first ball? Gets underneath a full toss and smacks it straight into the bucket hands of Mandeep at long-on. McClenaghan c Mandeep b Badree 0(1)

Badree to Rohit, out Bowled!! The scoreline reads 7/4. This is surreal from RCB. What an over from Badree. Badree takes a hat-trick. Rohit's woeful form continues. He fails to pick this googly from Badree. The crowd go bonkers. It came back in as Rohit prodded forward to defend, leaves a gap between his bat-pad. Enough for the ball to sneak through to rattle the stumps. Rohit b Badree 0(2)
Tymal Mills to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Rana is the man in form. Poor ball from Mills, slides one down leg, Rana gets across and whips it crisply behind square. No chance for the fine leg fielder

Chahal to Pollard, SIX, greets him to the crease with a maximum. Tosses it up, a floppy-hat Pollard plants his front foot forward and launches it over long-off. A blow so meaty that it deserved some extra cheese and french fries to add to it

Badree to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Aravind!! What a dream spell from Badree. Finishes it with a wicket. His fourth of the evening. Rana bites the dirt. Was itching to smack this quicker delivery, it was wider of off. The width was there and Rana went after it with a flashy cut. He forgets to keep it down and hits it straight to point. Aravind dives forward and takes a fine low catch. MI sink further into the mire. Nitish Rana c Aravind b Badree 11(16) [4s-1]

Krunal Pandya to de Villiers, 1 run, dropped! Buttler went backwards at deep-midwicket, then circled under it and drops it in the end. That was a mistimed slog-sweep and the ball stayed in the sky for a long long time. Buttler messed it up by never really judging it

Krunal Pandya to de Villiers, byes, FOUR, byes signalled! The ball kept terribly low as de Villiers backed away to thwack it. The ball rolled down to beat the keeper through his legs and run away into the fence. Bumrah giving it a chase comes up with a comical effort - tried to flick it back and ended up lobbing the ball outside the boundary edge

Bumrah to de Villiers, SIX, that's a six and a half! That ball is gone into the sea of reds in the cow corner region. That was a slower delivery and de Villiers spotted it like dead meat after giving the charge and picked the bones out of that

Bumrah to Kohli, SIX, full toss and the ball has been banged down the ground! Over the man at long-off and fifty for the skipper in his comeback game! He can do no wrong in this league. That was effortlessly done
Bumrah to Kohli, FOUR, cheeky from the skipper as he opens the face of the blade and runs it past the diving keeper for a four
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, looks to slog sweep, the ball chalks the outer thin edge and runs past the keeper for a four. Lucky and streaky

McClenaghan to Kohli, out Caught by Buttler!! The Buttler serves this one up for his team by pouching the big man on the juggle. That was wide and on a length, the batsman threw his hands at that and managed to trample it straight down the throat of the man at deep cover. Buttler came in a few paces, juggled it once as the ball came at chest height to him and then on the juggle managed to grab hold of it. Kohli c Buttler b McClenaghan 62(47) [4s-5 6s-2]

Krunal Pandya to de Villiers, out Caught by Rohit!! The Hit Man does it for the MI side. He flies to his left and flings his left hand to pick that out of thin air. That was chipped away uppishly sans any control from ABD and the ball was picked up inches from the ground as Rohit decided to showcase his wings at extra cover. Third time Krunal has accounted for ABD in the IPL. de Villiers c Rohit b Krunal Pandya 19(21) [6s-1]

Bumrah to Negi, out Kedar Jadhav Run Out!! The yorker blocked back, the bowler picks it up with one hand to his left and then has the mind to strike the sticks down at the bowler's end. That was harakiri from Kedar Jadhav as he was backing up so far on a free-hit delivery. That will hurt RCB but credit to Bumrah as he had the brain to take the opportunity. Kedar Jadhav run out (Bumrah) 9(8)

McClenaghan to Mandeep, out Bowled!! Gone first ball. The length ball, batsman looks to go for the big monty and ends up dragging the ball onto his sticks. He had to throw caution to the winds but manages only a thick inside edge. McClenaghan is finally getting amongst the wickets in this season after a disastrous start to his campaign. Mandeep b McClenaghan 0(1)

Southee to Kohli, SIX, first maximum for Kohli. Finds his bearing right this time. Sees a full ball on off, just stands motionless, in fact took a step forward and thumps it over long-on. Doesn't bother to look at the ball at all. He knows it went a long way
Southee to Kohli, FOUR, awful start this has been for Southee. Overbakes and bangs it short, sits up nicely for Kohli, who skips back and muscles the pull in front of square on the on-side

Southee to Kohli, FOUR, two fours in a row. "He is looking ominous here," says Ravi Shaz on air. This was a half-volley on fifth stump line, Kohli brings those quicksilver wrists of his into play. Just gets inside the line and whips it past mid-on. Goes to the fence like a 'famous bullet phrase' to the fence

Harbhajan to Gayle, FOUR, the chat has worked. Virat offered some advice to Gayle and next ball the big man slaps one to the fence. A quicker delivery outside off, Gayle goes back and flays the cut, through point. Zooms away to the fence.
McClenaghan to Gayle, FOUR, stand and deliver stuff from Gayle. Just flexes his arms and times the pants off this length ball. Races away through cover and no need to run for those

Harbhajan to Gayle, SIX, Gayle flies out of the blocks! He runs out of patience and shows Michael Jackson footwork. Reaches the pitch this time and lifts it high up in the air. Didn't get it off the middle but enough to clear the man at long-on
Harbhajan to Kohli, FOUR, buffet ball, as Geoff Boycott would say. Short and offers enough width, Kohli skips back and knives with a solid punch, the timing was brutal and it beats extra cover

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Gone! Pandya has struck in his first over. As often is the case, lapse in concentration for Gayle. Hits the deck on a shortish length outside off, Gayle wanted to pull it, he had to fetch it from outside off. He came down a step and wanted to smack the leather off it. All he could do was manifest a faint nick to the keeper. PP went up straightaway and Hardik joined him late. Hushed silence in the crowd. The umpires checked for a possible no-ball but his foot was way behind the crease. Gayle c Parthiv Patel b Hardik Pandya 22(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

Ankit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, that's a thick inside edge is what it is. Smith just plants his foot down looking to loft it down the ground without being anywhere close to the pitch. It slides in, spoons up off the edge and beats square leg before running away

Ankit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, SIX, he's got proper hold of that. Good lord. That's gone way back. Not much different than the first delivery as Smith lunges at a length ball but this time he muscles it right off the middle. Welcome back as an opener
Ankit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, now Ankit fires it short and Smith goes back to punch it through the covers. What a blistering start for GL! 16 off the over
Lockie Ferguson to Brendon McCullum, SIX, bangs it in short but it's a leg-cutter and it just sits up. McCullum makes room and spanks a flat-batted shot over extra-cover. Woof!

Rahul Chahar to Brendon McCullum, out Stumped!! The junior Chahar continues to impress. Some of the fantasy fanatics are cursing_____ you know who! Baz follows his instincts, shimmies down and looks to bash the young man over long-on. Was nowhere near the pitch of the delivery, beaten by length and done in the drift and dip. MS slaps the bails in flash. Brendon McCullum st Dhoni b Rahul Chahar 49(32) [4s-5 6s-3]

Tahir to Karthik, out Bowled!! Tahir strikes and the customary celebrations follow! DK had a great domestic season, looked decent thus far in this IPL, but not today. He was shaping up to cut, perhaps didn't expect Imran Tahir to fire in a googly. Result? He ends up chopping it back onto his stumps, off the inside edge obviously. Karthik b Tahir 3(5)
Rahul Chahar to Finch, FOUR, paddle-scoops a leg-drifter to the fine leg fence, good placement
Rahul Chahar to Raina, SIX, this is Raina at his best. He does this so often against spinners. Dances down, gets to the pitch of the delivery and takes Rahul Chahar for a journey over cow corner
Stokes to Raina, FOUR, first poor delivery from Stokes. Half-volley outside off, Raina lofts him inside-out over extra cover. Smith running in from long-off gave up a little too early

Stokes to Raina, FOUR, that's timed to perfection! Save your legs. It rose just enough from a fullish length, Raina shows the full face of the bat as he spanks it through cover. No chance for the man in the deep
Tahir to Finch, FOUR, plenty of flight on that one and Finch takes full toll of it. Watches it closely and nails the drive wide of extra cover
Tahir to Raina, FOUR, Raina is having a ball out there. Middling almost everything. On one knee, gets underneath a flighted delivery and loft-drives Tahir over extra cover
Tahir to Raina, FOUR, on the pads, Raina says thank you and brooms him away into the deep backward square fence. 13 off the over

Lockie Ferguson to Finch, FOUR, a night to forget for Imran Tahir as he puts one down. Pick-up flick shot from Finch, Tahir at fine leg was late to anticipate as he tries to reach the ball with a lackadaisical dive, through his fingers
Lockie Ferguson to Finch, SIX, that's a Finch special. He loves pace, doesn't he? Stamps a 145ks delivery with a 80-metre maximum over square leg. Pure power!
Lockie Ferguson to Finch, SIX, that's it. Gujarat Lions win their first game of the season. Finch goes deep inside the crease, expects pace and envelops it over long-on

Lockie Ferguson to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, bludgeoned! A short of length delivery outside off which Smith smokes through mid-wicket. To hit that well in front of square against someone like Ferguson, especially after having to fetch it from wide of off, it's a special shot
SN Thakur to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, you don't bowl short to this guy, not unless you're express. Such fast hands as he dispatches a pull through mid-wicket. The man in the deep is too square

SN Thakur to Brendon McCullum, no run, hit straight back at Thakur who puts it down. Half a chance here. McCullum had timed that beautifully and the ball was travelling. But it came at a nice height in the followthrough. Thakur parries it towards mid-off

Lockie Ferguson to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, 147kph on that length ball and Smith uses all of it to slice the ball over backward point. Or maybe I'm giving him too much credit and it's just a thick outside edge. In either case, he went hard and the ball flew
Lockie Ferguson to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, a proper half-volley at the stumps, beautifully whipped away wide of mid-on. Excellent wrists from Smith. GL off to a flier

Tahir to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, lunges out at the ball and lofts it over mid-off. Interesting that he's gone after Tahir first ball. The ball was full enough to execute the shot and he took his opportunity
Tahir to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, now McCullum skips out of the crease, takes it on the full and drills it through extra-cover. Back to back boundaries
Tahir to Brendon McCullum, SIX, a little shimmy down the track, reaches out to the pitch of the ball and wallops it over long-on. Tahir under pressure, probably for the first time in this IPL
Rahul Chahar to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, too close to cut, but Smith has played it well! Picked the length early, rocked back and slapped it from around off-stump backwards of point
Rahul Chahar to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, that's pleading to be pummeled. Short and slides down, Smith with a brazen-looking pull shot puts it away into the vacant mid-wicket area
Tahir to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, kneels down and sweeps Tahir between long-on and deep mid-wicket. Gee! This is some exhibition
Tahir to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, a repeat of the previous delivery. This time though he had to fetch it from well outside off and beats Stokes's dive to his right at long-on
Tahir to Brendon McCullum, SIX, skips out of his crease and smokes a dart high into the night sky, straight back over the bowler's head
Tahir to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, full floater on middle and leg, Smith drills it to the right of a diving Imran Tahir. Long-on can't get there

SN Thakur to Dwayne Smith, out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! Flays one straight down the throat of third man. Dwayne Smith is disappointed, but he has done his job. Was lured by the width on offer and went chasing, makes a mess of the connection though, it slices the thick outside edge and drops as a dolly into the hands of junior Chahar. Dwayne Smith c Rahul Chahar b SN Thakur 47(30) [4s-8 6s-1]

P Kumar to Rahane, out Caught by Raina!! What a way to start your 150th IPL game. First, won the toss and now pulls off a blinder. Even he can't believe that he has plucked that out. A blob for Rahane and early trouble for Pune. This one jagged back in from a shortish length, Rahane thought it would be shaping away and went for a flashy cut, the outside edge flies towards the cordon. Raina, standing at wide slip, reacts quickly and grabs it with his left hand. He caught it when the ball had almost passed him. Rahane c Raina b P Kumar 0(3)

P Kumar to Smith, FOUR, class written all over it. Tells us what kind of form Smith is in. Ball is darting around and he just presents the full face of the bat and drives it straight past the bowler, the timing and placement was exquisite from the skipper

Basil Thampi to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi is off the mark with a fine shot. Thampi wanted to start with a yorker, misses it by a good distance, the full toss is thumped down the ground, past the diving mid-on fielder
Raina to Stokes, FOUR, edged and four. Stokes won't mind that. Quicker and the ball straightens a touch, Stokes goes hard on the drive and the outside edge runs away fine. A welcome boundary for RPS
Dwayne Smith to Stokes, FOUR, hit-me delivery from Smith. Short and down leg, Stokes swivels and helps it over the short fine leg fielder. He's keeping the scoreboard moving swiftly

Andrew Tye to Stokes, out Bowled!! The aeroplane takes off. Second wicket for Tye and what a selection he's been for GL. Another biggie for the home side. A set Ben Stokes departs. It was the knuckle ball from Tye, Stokes did not pick it and was early into his drive, the ball catches the inside edge and deflects off the pads onto the stumps. RPS in a spot of bother now. Stokes b Andrew Tye 25(18) [4s-2 6s-1]
Shadab Jakati to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, that's a half-tracker wide of off. Tiwary fetches it and shovels it wide of long-on. Jakati under pressure straightaway after an ordinary first over

Jadeja to Dhoni, out Lbw!! Dhoni's poor run of form continues. He's hit on the back leg as Jadeja slides one on with the arm and the ball would have clipped leg-stump at least. Dhoni wanted to cut loose here and unwinds a hefty swing looking to go downtown but was beaten on the inside edge by the slider. A good phase for Gujarat this. Dhoni lbw b Jadeja 5(8)

Jadeja to Ankit Sharma, FOUR, nicely done. He's played this so late and so delicately, using all the pace that Jadeja has to offer. Darted in on a back of a length just outside off, Ankit leans back and dabs it fine of short third man
Basil Thampi to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, brilliant timing. The ball races away past point. Back of a length outside off, Tiwary eases onto the back foot and punches it firmly. Good start to the over

Basil Thampi to Ankit Sharma, 2 runs, back of a length slower ball on middle and leg, Ankit makes room and chops it into the pitch. He's ambling across for a single as Thampi appeared to be lazy in getting to the ball, but that's only a smokescreen. Thampi quickly pounces, turns and throws and would have caught Ankit short had he hit the stumps direct. Instead, concedes an extra run

Jadeja to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, hammered back at the bowler and that's not really a chance. Props to Jadeja for getting his hands in position quick enough and attempt a catch but he can't hold on. It was hit powerfully. Saved a boundary really
Jadeja to Ankit Sharma, FOUR, this time Jadeja can do nothing about it. Full in the slot, Ankit drills it straight down the ground and beats long-on to the right

Jadeja to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, goes down on one knee and tonks the ball straight back down the ground. Finishes a good over for GL. 14 off it. Jadeja fires it full again, maybe aiming for the blockhole, but misses it by a fair distance and Tiwary is all over him
P Kumar to Ankit Sharma, SIX, length and into the batsman, right in Ankit's arc to heave it over cow corner. It might have been a slower ball but Ankit picked it all right

Andrew Tye to Ankit Sharma, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! That's been skied up .. and McCullum takes a really good catch around 5 yards inside the ropes. It was there to be slogged from a length, but Ankit went through it too early and lobbed a leading edge up which surprisingly travelled quite a fair bit. McCullum skirts to his right from long-on, runs backwards and grabs it with both hands while tumbling over. Ankit Sharma c Brendon McCullum b Andrew Tye 25(15) [4s-2 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Manoj Tiwary, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Two in two. Tye has four. Slower ball at the stumps, Tiwary swings it in the air and is caught at the backward square leg boundary. Lovely deception from Tye. Manoj Tiwary c Ishan Kishan b Andrew Tye 31(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to SN Thakur, out Bowled!! Two hat-tricks in a day. The IPL has gone mental. Thakur has absolutely no clue as Tye dips a knuckle ball into the blockhole and he ends up playing all around it. The ball sneaks through to knock leg-stump. Tye is absolutely pumped. It's a five-for as well! SN Thakur b Andrew Tye 0(1)

Basil Thampi to Smith, FOUR, wow! Does this man have wrists? Even the sub-continent players will be proud of this shot. Full delivery around off, Smith with his slight shuffle brings those wrists into play as he flicks it over mid-wicket. Couple of bounces and into the fence

P Kumar to Tripathi, FOUR, lovely shot! Nothing too fancy from Tripathi. Waited for the ball to do its bit - move away and used the width on offer to his advantage, carved it past the diving cover-point fielder and it raced across the turf

Andrew Tye to Rahul Chahar, 2 runs, that could have, and should have, been four in the over for Tye. Another knuckle ball, Chahar is early into the slog and miscues it to Jadeja of all people at deep mid-wicket. He puts down a simple enough chance

Shadab Jakati to Smith, FOUR, greets Jakati with a whippy flick. Flatter and just outside off, Smith brings his bat down at an angle and whips it past mid-on. No chance for the deep mid-wicket fielder

Shadab Jakati to Smith, SIX, glorious. Uses his feet and gets right to the pitch of the flighted delivery, once he did that the rest was easy, lofts it handsomely over the long-on fence for the first six of the game
P Kumar to Tripathi, SIX, well, Tripathi showing why he's been sent out to open. One, two and bang. Advances to the length delivery and swings through the line. Hit flat and over deep mid-wicket

P Kumar to Tripathi, SIX, the result though does not change. Good length ball around off, Tripathi lofts through the line, nice free flowing of the bat and off it went over the long-off fence. Back-to-back sixes for Tripathi

P Kumar to Tripathi, FOUR, the 50-run partnership is up. Rahane's wicket seems a long time ago. Pitched up and right in the slot, Tripathi has no half measures in his armoury, lofts it over the infield on the off-side and collects four more

P Kumar to Smith, FOUR.. and it is usual business from Smith at the other end. Sees the delivery in his arc and lofts it straight back over the bowler's head. Once again the full face of the bat was the key to the shot

P Kumar to Smith, FOUR, poor bowling this from PK. Searches for the yorker, low full toss down leg, Smith just helps it along the way, flicked behind square and there's no one in the deep to stop that. Expensive over from PK, 25 off it and RPS are off to a flier

Andrew Tye to Tripathi, out Caught by Finch!! A breezy innings comes to an end. One shot too many from Tripathi. Should have tried to bat a bit longer, especially with Smith at the other end. Full delivery on off, Tripathi makes a bit of room and lofts it to mid-off. The idea was to go over the fielder, but with the ball being too close to his bat, he did not get the elevation. Finch reverse cups it right on the edge of the circle. Tripathi c Finch b Andrew Tye 33(17) [4s-3 6s-2]

Jadeja to Smith, FOUR, errs in line and Smith is too good a player to miss out. Drifts onto the pads, Smith stays on leg-stump and glances it fine. PK at short fine dives just to please the captain, the ball had gone past him

Jadeja to Stokes, SIX, just a pick up shot and cleared the rope by quite some distance. Bit of air on this delivery, Stokes uses his long reach to get under that and sends it sailing over deep mid-wicket. Jaddu under the pump

Dwayne Smith to Smith, out Caught by Finch!! Break followed by a wicket. The bowling change has worked for GL. This is a huge wicket. Smith was looking in ominous touch. Short of length delivery just outside off, Smith went for the pull and top edged it towards long-off. Finch had plenty of time to settle under that and he pouches it safely. Just what GL needed after the time-out and not what RPS required. Steven Smith was gutted with himself, smacks the bat onto his glove as he walks back. Smith c Finch b Dwayne Smith 43(28) [4s-6 6s-1]
Nehra to Narine, FOUR, stands tall in his crease and rockets the flat-bat smack back over the bowler, wasn't in complete control, but it had enough power to go all the way

Henriques to Uthappa, SIX, a nice way to nail your form back. And he exhibits it with some toying around. Just crouches, takes on the line off a length sliding in and swats it flat batted. Such is the timing that it flies all the way too

Rashid Khan to Uthappa, FOUR, too much of a risk. But when the luck flows for you, you'd better be milking it. And Uthappa does it with aplomb. Sinks and without quite picking the wrong 'un slogs it hard and high. Through the hands of a diving Dhawan at the mid-wicket fence

Nehra to Uthappa, FOUR, leans forward, takes on the short pepper head-on and mows it across the line. Not the timing but once again the placement in finding the gap to bounce it into the cow corner fence

Nehra to Uthappa, FOUR, now he's back to his caresses. More like the Uthappa we know. Moves away, exposes his stumps and Nehra tries his best to evade the reach with a wide yorker. Gets under it and shows the full bat face in lofting it over extra cover
Nehra to M Pandey, FOUR, make it 14 off the over. A length angler with the width pounced on by a backing away Pandey as he imparts all the timing in spanking his punch through the covers.

Rashid Khan to Uthappa, FOUR, irritating runs these. Uthappa's edges are back to deal. Rashid gets some extra bounce on his top-spinner but all that comes in handy with Uthappa looking to sit and slog. The top-edge runs past the keeper

Cutting to Uthappa, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! The luck runs out. But it's done the damage. On the shorter side, with the pace taken off the ball as well. Uthappa looks to go ahead with his front-footed pulls but wears it high on the bat with the face swaying upwards as well. For a change, the airy ride finds its destination in the hands of Rashid at mid-wicket. Uthappa c Rashid Khan b Cutting 68(39) [4s-5 6s-4]

Cutting to M Pandey, FOUR, goes full pace. Only to watch the edge bag a boundary against his name. On the back of a length and outside off as well tempting Pandey to go after it. He flashes hard and the outside tickle takes it through the cordon where no one is

Bipul Sharma to M Pandey, SIX, the feet are on the skipping mode. Sharma does the cardinal sin of darting it in Pandey's arc and the shimmy down with the full bat swing unleashed tonks it high and mighty

Bipul Sharma to Y Pathan, FOUR, a tossed up invite. And Pathan cannot refuse. With a massive stride in getting right up to the pitch of the delivery, he nails the broom. Whistles away in front of square

Cutting to M Pandey, SIX, a yorker missed by the slightest of margins. And Pandey punishes it to the fullest. Gets moving inwards, gets right under what ended up as a half volley and smashes it down the ground

Cutting to M Pandey, FOUR, cheeky now. Cutting persists with his yorkers. gets it right too this time. And wide as well to prevent the earlier misery. Pandey however has his bat ramped up with a crouch and guides it using all the pace on offer. Wide of backward point

Bhuvneshwar to M Pandey, out Caught by Warner!! A strike. In the form of Bhuvneshwar. A slower float here outside off and Pandey pretty compulsively reaches out in looking to deposit it out of the park. Is quite early on his slice and the balloon off the cue end goes high but just not long enough. A running in Warner from long-off will not put these down. Not even if he is distracted by Bipul Sharma running back from cover to take it. M Pandey c Warner b Bhuvneshwar 46(35) [4s-3 6s-2]

Nehra to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, misses the blockhole. Just the shot Yadav needed to help himself to his first runs. A low full toss on the pads and whipped away with those enviable wrists. The deep square boundary takes the impact

Nehra to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! The umpire spots an edge. And is happy to raise the finger. Sorry, not quite the time to be mean. Nehra bends his back in banging it short, and cramps Yadav all ends up for any room. Despite the shuffle coming in, the swivelling pull only gets the ping on the glove to a diving Ojha to his left. Suryakumar Yadav c Naman Ojha b Nehra 4(3) [4s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Y Pathan, SIX, spoiling his figures. A perfect sitting up length delivery right in the slot and Pathan is in his beast mode unleashing the entire bat curve bringing it down off a massive backlift and spanks it high and mighty

Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, out Bowled!! A mess of the stumps. The pin-point yorker comes out at full pace and Grandhomme without bothering to move his feet just jams his bat down. No connection at all. The off-pole is uprooted. Kolkata just not getting the move-on they'd aspired. de Grandhomme b Bhuvneshwar 0(2)

Bhuvneshwar to Narine, out Bowled!! The off-stump goes flying. Bhuvi has had a fantastic bowling record over KKR and it only gets better. It swings in the air, lands on the seam and shapes just enough to uproot Narine's off-pole. The slash-flash batsman had no clue about that one. By the time the ball dipped in, Narine opened himself up completely and embarassed himself. Narine b Bhuvneshwar 6(9) [4s-1]
Nehra to Gambhir, FOUR, plenty of room on offer and Gambhir has nailed the cover-drive to perfection, pierced the gap between cover and extra-cover
Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, drifting into the pads, Uthappa shuffles a fraction before helping it to the fine leg fence. Easy!
Cutting to Gambhir, FOUR, stands deep inside his crease and exerts all his power on the punchy-drive, gets it past a diving mid-off to his right
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, SIX, gets underneath this one and lauches it over long-on, picked the length early and was helped with some width on offer
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, 1 run, flicks to square leg and rushes for a non-existent single. Dhawan aims at the bowler's end and misses, had that hit Uthappa was a goner. He is living dangerously here

Rashid Khan to Gambhir, out Bowled!! Got him! Rashid Khan does it again, he has taken wicket off the first over in every game he played. That's some record. Gambhir exposes all his stumps looking to cut it square, the quicker one skids on and pings the bails in a flash. Gambhir slaps his bat onto his pad as he walks back in disgust. Gambhir b Rashid Khan 15(16) [4s-2]
Henriques to Uthappa, SIX, stand and deliver! Uses those Popeye-esque arms to smash a pull off the front foot, sheer power! It has gone flying into the mid-wicket stands
Bipul Sharma to Uthappa, SIX, sits back and smites a half-tracker over wide long-on, he is making the most of his luck today

Boult to Dhawan, FOUR, width on offer outside off. Dhawan chases it with a slash and gets a fat outside edge. The ball flies past the slip fielder and races away past the ropes. Hits the laptop in the SRH dugout. Probably, the one that of the statsman
Woakes to Henriques, FOUR, delicacy from Henriques! It was a off-cutter which sat up on the pitch, he uses the width and sends it open-bat faced into the vacant third man region

Woakes to Henriques, out Caught&Bowled!! Things looking bleak for SRH. 3 of their main batsmen are back in the hut now. No change of pace this time around, he spears it in at 136ks on a good length, Henriques checks his drive and chips it back to the bowler. Easily done. He was perhaps expecting the slower one. It came right off the cue end of the bat. Henriques c and b Woakes 13(10) [4s-2]
Woakes to Yuvraj, FOUR, stands tall on his back foot and delivers a perfect pull does Yuvi, picked the right spot to place it too. No-one at deep mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes
Kuldeep Yadav to Deepak Hooda, SIX, advances, gets right to the pitch of the delivery and hacks him over wide long-on. Nailed!

U Yadav to Yuvraj, SIX, I hate to do commentary on balls like these. Coz, all you want to do is stand, admire and applaud the class of Yuvi. Wowza! Holds the pose for the cameras as he powers a mere extension of the arms on this 141ks pace cranker
U Yadav to Yuvraj, FOUR, effortlessly done. Short and down leg, he half-swivels and puts it over short fine with a twirl of his wrists
U Yadav to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, backs away to manufacture the desired room, cuts the length ball in the gap behind point. Smart cricket

Narine to Deepak Hooda, out Stumped!! Nah, not again! Looks to fancy his chances against the wily Narine. Not to the pitch and was caught miles short. 83ks, lands on the seam and moves the other way round and beats Deepak Hooda neck and crop. Uthappa does the rest. He was looking to go over long-on/mid-wicket. Booming bat swing, but no dice. Deepak Hooda st Uthappa b Narine 13(7) [4s-1 6s-1]

Woakes to Yuvraj, SIX. That's dismissive. Precise, mathematic middle of the bat. No feet, allows his wrists to take over. The gift of timing. Flat-footed, takes on the short and wide ball, thumps it flat over extra cover. Fetch that!
Woakes to Cutting, FOUR, Cutting likes the short stuff, he likes pace too. No wonder he's from Brisbane. Rocks a touch back and then smashes the pull through mid-wicket, raced away...

Woakes to Yuvraj, out Caught by (sub)Rishi Dhawan!! And look what that extra delivery has done, it has fetched KKR the much-needed wicket. Yuvi walks back disappointed and has been asked to wait by the umpires. Oh hang on! What's the wait for? Just a little confusion out there and Yuvi continues his march. It was a slower short ball, Yuvi was through the shot way too early, didn't get hold of the pull and holes out to long-on. Good running catch from the sub fielder. Yuvraj c (sub)Rishi Dhawan b Woakes 26(16) [4s-2 6s-2]
Woakes to Cutting, SIX, that's in his half and Cutting has clubbed that straight back over the bowler. Clears his front leg, gets underneath and goes bam!

Boult to Cutting, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! The Kiwi combination does the trick. The ever-smiling Boult can smile a little more now. Cutting shuffles a long way across his stumps, premeditates the slog straight down the ground and makes a mess of the connection. Outcome? He tumbles after the half-hearted execution and it goes flat and straight to the man at long-off. Cutting c de Grandhomme b Boult 15(10) [4s-1 6s-1]
Woakes to Bipul Sharma, SIX, quick-feeted this time, does just enough to pick the length and marmalize it over KKR's dugout at the long-off area
Boult to Bipul Sharma, FOUR, takes his eyes off and pulls a short ball. Top-edge flies over the keeper's head, all these runs count
Boult to Bipul Sharma, FOUR, full and angled in, Bipul stays leg-side of the delivery and biffs it straight, long-on and long-off can't cut it off. Too good

Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, catch it is the cry, but Woakes can't hold onto it. That came in at a rapid pace. Once again, Dhawan gives the charge and this time he slashes it off the middle of the bat. The Englishman at cover-point dived to his right and half-stopped it. Saved three runs there
U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, stand and deliver. Dhawan stays in his crease, sees the shortish ball come to him and lifts it over mid-on. He stood there and admired his shot

U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, not off the middle , but Dhawan won't mind. A length ball on middle and leg, Dhawan moves across and swishes it away. Finds the gap on the on-side and the ball races away into the mid-wicket fence
Boult to Dhawan, FOUR, that's not the greatest of deliveries from Boult! Short ball that sits up nicely for Dhawan to pull it firmly behind square on the on-side

Boult to Warner, FOUR, first boundary for Warner! That was a good ball from Boult. He bowled a sharp bouncer attacking the head of the batsman. Warner, who almost took his eye off it, wasn't afraid to go with his hook shot. Came right off the middle of the middle in the end. One bounce into the fence

Boult to Warner, FOUR, four more! Boult pitches it up this time. Warner presses forward and checks his drive. The ball falls wide and short of GG at covers and the ball rolls into the extra cover fence
Narine to Warner, FOUR, easy to put away. Drifting down leg, all Warner had to do was get a tickle, which he did. No chance for the man at 45 to stop that
Kuldeep Yadav to Warner, FOUR, shot! Typical Warner! Reverses his stance and wallops the sweep over backward point. With both the deep fielders on the on-side, that's an excellent shot

Y Pathan to Dhawan, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! That's a soft dismissal. The ploy of giving Pathan the ball has worked. That ball didn't deserve a wicket to be honest. It was floated outside off, Dhawan waltzes down, moving slightly leg-side and chips it towards de Grandhomme at long-off, who runs forward and pouches it. There was no intent there from the southpaw there. Dhawan c de Grandhomme b Y Pathan 23(22) [4s-4]
Kuldeep Yadav to Henriques, FOUR, tossed up delivery outside off, not much of spin there and Henriques latches onto it. He smacks the cut behind square on the off-side. The sweeper can't get there

Kuldeep Yadav to Warner, out Caught by Woakes!! This was coming. Warner was struggling against the spinners and perishes trying to play the big shot. A tossed up delivery that pitched outside off and turned further away. Warner got low and wanted to clear long-off. Doesn't get enough power behind it and a straightforward catch from Woakes at long-off. Lots of revs on that delivery. Warner c Woakes b Kuldeep Yadav 26(30) [4s-4]

Sandeep Sharma to Samson, FOUR, no, no. Wrong line Sandeep, searches for that banana swing. In the process, sprays it on the pads, the fine leg was inside the ring and easy put away for Samson. Just nurdles it past the man at 45
Sandeep Sharma to Samson, FOUR, candyfloss. Cracking shot from Samson. Leans forward and caresses it through the packed off-side field. Eventful start for DD

Mohit Sharma to Billings, FOUR, not where he exactly intended but he will earn a boundary. Billings gets off the mark with a boundary. Mohit bangs it short, Billings was committed to the pull, was hustled by pace, manages to get it off the higher part of his bat and skews it over mid-on
Mohit Sharma to Billings, FOUR, make that two in a row. Mohit goes shorter again, Billings is bred on English soil. Too easy for him, pulls it wide of mid-on. No need to run for those

Mohit Sharma to Billings, FOUR, with mid-wicket inside the ring, the pull is a safe shot. That is if you get it right. Billings was almost cramped for room, but got the pull high on the bat and placed it to the left of mid-wicket. No chance for long-on to cut it off

Mohit Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Eoin Morgan!! Catching practice for Morgan. Another partnership that had started to flourish is nipped in the bud. Not the greatest of shots from Iyer. It was a length delivery alright and he wanted to loft it over the long-on fence, the bat turned on impact and the ball went up towards long-on. Second catch for the England ODI skipper. Shreyas Iyer c Eoin Morgan b Mohit Sharma 22(17) [4s-3]

Mohit Sharma to Billings, 1 run, fifty for Billings. Raises his bat and acknowledges the applause from the home crowd. Still a long way to go for him. The pitch has started to get slower and run making is not going to be easy. With him being set, DD would want him to carry on. Coming to the ball: Plays the slower delivery with soft hands into the off-side ring and jogs across to the other end

Axar to Billings, FOUR, Axar almost deceived his man. Saw the batsman advance and pushed it wider, Billings reached out and lofted it inside out, not off the meat of the bat but had enough to collect a boundary

Axar to Billings, out Caught by Miller!! The small little things that you do produce the bigger things. That Vohra stop kept Billings on strike and what happens next? The Kent man miscues a loft to long-on. Takes a couple of steps down, not close to the ball but still goes through with the loft. Right off the toe-end and almost had enough to clear Miller, who set himself up right on the edge of the circle and clasped it. Billings c Miller b Axar 55(40) [4s-9]

Maxwell to Pant, FOUR, long-off had around 10 yards to cover and he couldn't get there. That is the power of Pant. Races down the wicket and gets to the pitch of the ball, lofts it hard and over extra cover, one bounce and into the fence

Cariappa to Corey Anderson, no run, almost thumped it back to Cariappa. Flatter offie around, Anderson hangs back and punches it straight down the wicket, did not keep it down the ground, Cariappa is late to react, the ball hits his upper part of his hand and goes to ground. Tough chance but should have been taken

Cariappa to Pant, FOUR, wow! Width offered and Pant is all over it. There was a deep cover fielder and he beat him to his right. Short as well and Pant slaps it in front of square, raced away to the fence

Cariappa to Pant, FOUR, even the mishits are going to the fence, thanks to some sloppy work by Morgan. Short and turning away, Pant pulls and the bottom hand comes off the handle, the ball goes to wide long-on, where Morgan allows it to escape

Aaron to Pant, out Caught by Eoin Morgan!! Done in for pace. An important wicket for KXIP. Pant was looking to get on with proceedings. Short and angled across off, pulling against the angle is always dangerous, Pant takes it on and splices it towards mid-off. Morgan might be having a rough day with his ground fielding, but not with his catching. Accepts the dolly with ease. Pant c Eoin Morgan b Aaron 15(9) [4s-3]

Aaron to Chris Morris, FOUR, lovely! No fancy shots from Morris. He uses Aaron's extra pace to his advantage, stays leg-side of the short of length delivery, opens the bat face and directs it behind square on the off-side, split backward point and short third man expertly

Aaron to Corey Anderson, FOUR, Anderson reminding everyone that he has the second fastest ODI hundred. The extra delivery costing Aaron four runs. Length delivery right in the slot, Anderson slams it straight down the ground. Almost knocked the umpire off

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, SIX, that's how you cash in. Something for Billings to learn. 95kph slower delivery and Morris picked the bones out of that one, delayed his shot and that allowed it him to send it sailing over long-on. That gets the crowd going as well

Sandeep Sharma to Corey Anderson, FOUR, round the wicket and dishes in a full toss, the idea was to nail the yorker, missed and Anderson slices it over the infield on the off-side. The fielder was at deep cover and even though the ball plugged in the outfield, he couldn't get there

Sandeep Sharma to Chris Morris, out Caught by Mohit Sharma!! Huge wicket this, especially at this stage of the innings. Morris blasted a 9-ball 38 in the previous game against RPS, coming in at this stage. Short of a length delivery and Morris pulls, he does not bother to keep it down, was planning to clear the fielder. But since it was off the bottom of the bat, it has no wings to fly over Mohit at deep square. Chris Morris c Mohit Sharma b Sandeep Sharma 16(8) [4s-1 6s-1]

Axar to Corey Anderson, SIX, Axar became predictable there. He was targeting Anderson's pads, missed his length and the Kiwi got underneath that, swung it over the long leg fence and the short Kotla boundaries took care of the rest

Axar to Corey Anderson, SIX, it was a gamble and it didn't pay off. Darted in on a shortish length, Anderson sets himself up with the front leg cleared, muscles it towards long-on. Maxwell leaps as high as possible, but couldn't even get a finger on it

Sandeep Sharma to Pat Cummins, FOUR, handy runs these for DD. Not a bad delivery by any means. The wide yorker outside off, Cummins crouches low, opens the bat face and steers it past the diving backward point fielder

Sandeep Sharma to Pat Cummins, FOUR, yorker followed by a slow short of length delivery, Cummins was waiting for that, he stayed on the back foot and pulled it in front of square, bisected deep mid-wicket and long-on to perfection

Sandeep Sharma to Corey Anderson, FOUR, switches to round the wicket for Anderson, misses the yorker by a few inches, Anderson smashes the low full toss straight down the ground. No chance for long-on or long-off

Sandeep Sharma to Billings, FOUR, you don't often see a batsman play sweep shot to a fast bowler. Let's call this Billings special. Buries on one knee and sweeps it fiercely behind square. Races away to the fence in a jiffy

Sandeep Sharma to Corey Anderson, SIX, Anderson ends the innings in style. Slower short of length delivery, sat up nicely for Anderson, who waits for it and pulls it to deep square leg. The ball teased the fielder, but he could only palm it over the rope
Aaron to Billings, FOUR, wow. That was hammered ferociously. Billings charges down the track and smacks it down the ground
Aaron to Billings, FOUR, Billings is teeing off like a golfer. Uses his feet again, stays a bit leg sidish this time. Fetches the heave from off and directs it through mid-wicket

Aaron to Billings, FOUR, three in a row. Problems aplenty for Aaron. Just not getting his line right. Slants it on the pads, fine leg was inside the ring and Billings will put it away seven days a week and twenty four hours a day. Flicks it past short fine
Mohit Sharma to Samson, SIX, caps off the over with a stinker. Short ball sat up nicely for Samson, he gets on top of it and nails the pull over wide long-on. Just about clears the fence
Cariappa to Billings, 1 run, rushes it through outside off, Billings goes deep in his crease and pats it softly to cover

Cariappa to Samson, out Caught by Eoin Morgan!! First wicket for Cariappa in IPL 2017. Has struck in his first over. Tosses it up this time, the ball dips in a touch. Samson plays down the wrong line, gets a leading edge that ballons up straight to long-off. Morgan ain't dropping those.Samson c Eoin Morgan b Cariappa 19(18) [4s-2 6s-1]

Aaron to Nair, out Caught by Saha!! That's an excellent catch from Saha. Credit to Varun, kept persisting it with short pitch stuff and it pays off. After conceding 13 runs in his first over, he shows great courage and picks up a wicket. It was short and drifting down leg, Nair, in a bid to tickle it fine, gloves it to the left of Saha. He flings and settles under it. Nair c Saha b Aaron 0(3)

Aaron to Billings, FOUR, streaky but he won't mind. Aaron sees the batsman back away and hurls it full outside off, Billings throws his bat and gets a thickish outside edge that flies through the vacant slip region

Cariappa to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, top shot from Iyer. Sees the leg-break early, lunges across, opens the bat face and steers it past point. The fielder in the deep gets across and puts in a dive but in vain
Aaron to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, easy-peasy for Iyer. Vrooming down leg, Iyer gets inside the line and tickles it fine

Aaron to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, brilliant placement from Iyer. Bisects two men in the deep to perfection. Showing a piece of geometry that would put Euclid to shame. Aaron strays it on the pads again, Iyer gets right behind it and clips it behind square

Nadeem to Vohra, out Lbw!! Shahbaz Nadeem strikes in his very first over. He's having a wonderful season. The umpire took his time before raising the dreaded finger. Did that pitch in line? Yes, it did and spun away. Vohra gets down on one knee and in his attempt to lap it fine, misses it completely. He is pinged on the thigh pad in front of middle and leg. HawkEye confirms that would have hit the leg-pole. Good decision from the umpire. Vohra lbw b Nadeem 3(6)

Pat Cummins to Eoin Morgan, out Caught by Nair!! He's cut that straight to backward point this time. That's a big blow. Morgan was starting to find some fluency but he now finds the fielder. Short and wide from Cummins, Morgan goes hard but fails to keep it down and it's straight to Karun Nair. Eoin Morgan c Nair b Pat Cummins 22(20) [4s-3]

Mishra to Maxwell, out Caught by Billings!! Is that the game for DD? The in-form Maxwell is gone for a duck. Too much pressure really. He had to tee off from the word go with the required rate touching 13, and Mishra isn't the most straightforward bloke to take on first up. He cleverly bowls it a little wide of off forcing Maxwell to reach out for his slog-sweep and it comes right off the bottom. It's a top-edge too. Simple catch for Billings at deep mid-wicket. Maxwell c Billings b Mishra 0(2)

Mishra to Axar, SIX, gosh, that's big from Patel. Way back into the stands. Mishra turns one into him this time, Patel goes down quickly and picks the bones out of the slog-sweep. Elevation as well as the distance

Corey Anderson to Miller, FOUR, his first boundary today and it's come off a thick inside edge past short fine. Anderson bowls this in the blockhole just outside off, Miller jams down on it and squirts it away past leg-stump

Corey Anderson to Miller, 1 run, is that a dropped catch? It looks like it. Another very full ball, Miller crashes it to the right of cover where Zaheer goes across low with both hands but fails to hold on

Corey Anderson to Miller, out Lbw!! Miller's painful stay at the crease has ended through a full toss. Anderson gets some tail on the delivery and swirls it in on middle, and Miller plays all around it. His head fell over too. The ball crashes into the back leg on the full. Just one of those days for Miller. Never found any timing whatsoever. Miller lbw b Corey Anderson 24(28) [4s-1]

Zaheer to Axar, 2 runs, Zaheer only had to gather that and Mohit was gone. But the throw landed very close to him making it difficult. Knuckle ball outside off, Patel punches it through backward point and calls his partner back for two despite the fielder swooping in quickly
Zaheer to Axar, FOUR, short and wide, Patel slashes and slashes hard. The edge flies away through to the third man boundary

Zaheer to Mohit Sharma, FOUR, he's unwittingly sliced that over short third man. A knuckle ball outside off, Mohit throws his hands at it, the bat-face opens on impact and the ball beautifully lobs over the infield. A bit of a helicopter from Mohit too

Corey Anderson to Axar, SIX, drills this straight back down the ground. Anderson misses out on the blockhole by a few inches and is hammered by Patel. He's playing a good little knock here. But this chase is beyond his powers
Zaheer to Axar, SIX, another slower ball perhaps? Patel picks it up and nails it over long-on. He's been hitting them really well today
Pat Cummins to Axar, 1 run, dabs a short of length off-cutter straight to short third man. They impetuously run across for a non-existent single. Mohit had given up. No direct hit though

Pat Cummins to Mohit Sharma, out Bowled!! Off the pads and into leg-stump. Cummins followed Mohit with a full ball as he backed away a touch. The delivery is too quick for Mohit. He misses his swipe through mid-wicket and the ball deflects off the pad to knock over the timber. Mohit Sharma b Pat Cummins 13(14) [4s-1]

Chris Morris to Cariappa, out Bowled!! Similar technique from Cariappa - backing away to swish through off. But Morris does him with a yorker. It's too quick for Cariappa. The ball bursts through to crash into the base of middle. Cariappa b Chris Morris 1(2)

Zaheer to Amla, FOUR, in the air and that's the first boundary of the innings! The knuckle ball on a shortish length, Amla walks down the track and pulls it over mid-wicket. There is no one in the deep and the ball races away

Chris Morris to Axar, out Bowled!! The leg-bail flies off its groove and that's the game for Delhi. Massive win. Morris causes Patel to go through with the slog too early as he holds it back in pace and the deception is good enough to fetch him his third for the night. Axar b Chris Morris 44(29) [4s-1 6s-3]
Zaheer to Amla, FOUR, shot! Perhaps, a safe shot. Stands tall, waits for the ball to come to him and launches this short of a good length delivery over mid-off. One bounce and into the fence
Nadeem to Saha, FOUR, flat and slightly short, Saha backs away and carves it over point. Two fielders chase, but can't chase it down

Nadeem to Saha, out Caught by Zaheer!! Zaheer takes a catch and claims it. The umpires decide to go up and the soft signal is out. It was darted in on off, Saha danced down, moved leg-side and went for the inside-out shot. Couldn't get enough elevation on that and finds Zak at extra cover. The ball was dipping when it approached him, but Zaheer had both his hands underneath the ball. Second wicket for Shahbaz Nadeem. Now, it's all down to the four foreign recruits for KXIP to make a match out of this. Saha c Zaheer b Nadeem 7(5) [4s-1]

Nadeem to Amla, FOUR, beautiful shot! See the ball, hit the ball, is the mantra. A round-armish delivery from Nadeem, Amla who has taken leg-stump guard, has enough room to free his arms. Strokes it over and wide of mid-off to collect his third boundary

Chris Morris to Amla, FOUR, wow! Elegant. Amla shuffles across a long way and flicks this full ball around off very fine. No chance for the man at short fine leg. The ball reached the fence in a hurry

Chris Morris to Amla, out Caught by Billings!! Would you believe that? Amla perishes to a full toss. There was one fielder in the deep on the leg-side and Amla finds him perfectly. A low full toss on the pads, Amla with a slight shuffle, flicks it in the air and hits it straight down the throat of Billings at long leg. Punjab in a spot of bother. Amla c Billings b Chris Morris 19(12) [4s-4]

Chris Morris to Miller, 1 run, ah! A direct hit there at the striker's end would have been curtains to Eoin Morgan! Miller taps this length ball to covers with soft hands and sets off. Billings chases it down and fires in a throw quickly. Misses the target just by a few inches
Pat Cummins to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, shot! Shortish ball that sits up nicely for Morgan to thwack the pull from outside off. Found the gap between mid-on and mid-wicket and the result was a boundary

Pat Cummins to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, a boundary for KXIP after 24 balls. Morgan clears the front leg and spears a full ball through extra-cover. Mid-off was up in the ring and he just had to find the gap
Pat Cummins to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, Morgan again. This time it's short and wide and Morgan slaps it hard through point. It beats the diving fielder inside the ring as well as the one at the boundary

McClenaghan to Dwayne Smith, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! The dangerous one is gone and the crowd go wild. McClenaghan is delighted. Smith sees the width outside off on this short of length delivery and slashes hard. Doesn't get enough elevation and finds Nitish Rana at backward point, who jumps and takes a good catch. Smith departs without troubling the scorers. Dwayne Smith c Nitish Rana b McClenaghan 0(2)

Malinga to Raina, FOUR, and Raina takes full toll of the free-hit. Bends his back knee and crunches the cover drive wide of the diving extra cover fielder. Once it cleared him, there was none stopping that

Malinga to Raina, no ball, FOUR, Malinga oversteps and bowls a length ball on middle and leg. Raina shuffles across and tucks it very fine. The short fine leg fielder is pretty fine as well. Free-hit coming up

Krunal Pandya to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, fifty for McCullum. A very unlike McCullum innings this. Waves his bat around and is congratulated by his skipper. Looked scratchy to start off and has slowly found his bearings. GL would want him to continue. Flatter and on off, worked to deep square leg

Krunal Pandya to Raina, 1 run, direct hit and McCullum would have been on his bike. Raina punched this towards extra cover, where Suchith got a good bounce and it was to his strong hand as well. Fires a throw at the striker's end and fails to hit the stumps. McCullum was stretching and would have been touch and go

Harbhajan to Raina, out Caught by Rohit!! This was on the cards. Raina kept charging down to the spinners without much success, but he didn't stop trying. Shimmies down and Harbhajan being a clever bowler, tosses it up well outside off, Raina has to reach out for the inside out loft, all he could manage was a slice towards cover-point. Rohit tracks back and takes it over his head while tumbling. Good take that by the MI skipper. Raina c Rohit b Harbhajan 28(29) [4s-2]
Bumrah to Brendon McCullum, SIX, a gift which McCullum accepts with pleasure. Full toss just below the waist, McCullum maintains a low base and helps it along the way, over long leg for a maximum

Malinga to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, McCullum has had the wood over Malinga in this innings. Continues to collect runs off the Sri Lankan. Full and down leg, McCullum tickles it very fine. No chance for Bumrah in the deep

Malinga to Brendon McCullum, out Bowled!! That roar and fist pump says it all. Just takes one delivery for Malinga to change the tide. A fine knock from McCullum comes to an end. Battled hard and has built a platform for his lower-order. Straight delivery, McCullum plays all round it, the ball sneaks through bat and pad to hit middle stump. Two set batsmen gone and MI keeping the lid over GL. Brendon McCullum b Malinga 64(44) [4s-6 6s-3]

Hardik Pandya to Karthik, SIX, 200th six this edition. And we are just into the 11th day. Improvisation at its best. Karthik moves across his stumps and gets underneath the back of a length delivery, uses the pace of Hardik and scoops it over the fine leg fence

Bumrah to Karthik, no ball, FOUR, poor from Bumrah. First, he oversteps and the yorker is way outside off, Karthik stays low and drives it square on the off-side. No chance for the sweeper this time around

Bumrah to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, Bumrah has not get his radar right on his yorkers. A low full toss down leg, Kishan is almost down on his knee and swipes it behind square. McClenaghan at fine leg had no chance to cut that off

Bumrah to Karthik, FOUR, this is an ordinary over from Bumrah. 19 runs off it and he like Malinga has been expensive today. Full toss on the pads, Karthik says thank you very much and flicks it behind square leg. The man was up inside the ring and the ball was well away from him

McClenaghan to Karthik, SIX, he is a small man but when he hits them, he certainly packs a punch. Short of length delivery angled across off, Karthik goes deep inside the crease and pulls it over deep mid-wicket. Flat and all the way. 50-run stand and 150 up for GL

McClenaghan to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Something for the 18000 kids to cheer about. McClenaghan has provided the breakthrough. Kishan has been asked to wait by Ravi. The front leg is fine. Legal delivery that and Ravi raises his finger. The back of the hand slower ball dug in short, Kishan takes it on and top edges it to deep square leg. Krunal misjudged it for a second, but recovered well to pouch it. Ishan Kishan c Krunal Pandya b McClenaghan 11(14) [4s-1]

Malinga to Roy, SIX, why was Roy held back? Can someone tell me? Such power and timing he possesses. This was more power and the ball cleared Pollard with ease. Malinga misses the yorker length and Roy gets under that, though a miscue the ball still goes over long-on with ease. A rare off-day for Malinga, finishes with: 4-0-51-1

Bumrah to Roy, FOUR, low full toss and Roy thumps it down the ground. Goes deep and leg-side to free his arms, with mid-off in the ring, he just had to place it wide of him, which he does and collects four

McClenaghan to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, short ball and McCullum latches onto it! No pace behind that delivery to trouble. He waits this slower delivery to come to him and pulls it away wide of the man at 45

Bumrah to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, trademark McCullum shot! Dances down to a fast bowler and thwacks this length ball down the ground. No chance for the bowler and the ball reaches the fence in a hurry

Malinga to Brendon McCullum, SIX, wow! He made that look easy. McCullum waltzes down and Malinga shortens his length. But there was enough width outside off for McCullum his free his arms. He expertly elevates over the point region and it has enough wings to go all the way

Malinga to Brendon McCullum, SIX, shot! It's the slower ball from Malinga and McCullum picks the bones out of it. Waits for it to come to him and muscles it over mid-wicket. Second maximum of the over
Harbhajan to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, another flighted delivery, not much of turn and McCullum brooms it away through mid-wicket. The man in the deep couldn't get there
Krunal Pandya to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, ends the over with a poor ball. Darts it short, McCullum rockets back and pulls it fiercely through the mid-wicket region
Harbhajan to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, one bounce into the fence! Gets down on one leg and middles the slog sweep. Found the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket to perfection

P Kumar to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Roy!! Parthiv goes for a blob. Praveen Kumar is effective with the new ball and once again he gets the breakthrough. Good seam presentation on this good length delivery. It pitches on middle and jags away off the track. Parthiv gets a leading edge looking to work it through the on-side and finds point. Jason Roy collects it in his third attempt. Parthiv Patel c Roy b P Kumar 0(2)

P Kumar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, top shot to get off the mark! Of course, he was helped by Praveen. Drifting down leg, Rana dances down and flicks it over short fine and the ball bullets away into the fence
Basil Thampi to Nitish Rana, FOUR, stand and deliver! No need to run for shots like that. Length ball that sits up nicely for Rana stand tall and drill it wide of the bowler. No chance for mid-on

Basil Thampi to Nitish Rana, 1 run, dropped! Jason Roy has put down a dolly. The pacy short ball catches Rana by surprise. He still persists with his pull shot and gets it off the top part of the willow. The ball balloons up on the leg-side. Roy, at mid-wicket, runs back, settles under it and makes a mess of it. Thampi can't believe it. He has to wait for his first IPL wicket

Munaf Patel to Buttler, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! First IPL game after three years and Munaf has his first wicket. And it is a vital breakthrough. Another start and another stutter for Buttler. His rope is coming to an end, especially with Simmons waiting in the wings. Short of a length delivery, Buttler pulls and gets it high on the bat, straight down McCullum's throat at long-on. Replays show that it was a slower ball - the leg-cutter and Buttler had to manufacture all the pace, which he couldn't. Buttler c Brendon McCullum b Munaf Patel 26(24) [4s-1 6s-2]

Munaf Patel to Rohit, FOUR, that should get him going. First boundary for Rohit this edition. Short and wide delivery, Rohit hangs back and relies on placing the ball, cuts it between backward point and short third man

Munaf Patel to Rohit, FOUR, Munaf is not a happy man. Short and wide outside off, Rohit cuts it over backward point, where the fielder did not make any effort to catch the ball. He might have lost it in the background. Jadeja was the fielder and he simply stood his ground
Munaf Patel to Pollard, SIX, 120kph slower short of length delivery, sat up nicely for Pollard, who pulls it off the front foot, struck it flat and over the wide long-on fence

Dwayne Smith to Pollard, SIX, just a lift and off it goes over the long-on fence. For the first time in the over Smith pitches it up, Pollard nonchalantly puts it over long-on. Just an extension of the arm and the ball flew away

Dwayne Smith to Pollard, FOUR, goes back to the shortish length and takes the pace off as well, Pollard pulls and is a touch early into the shot, the bottom hand comes off but the ball is in the gap, wide of deep mid-wicket and four more

Jadeja to Rohit, SIX, lovely shot! This is Rohit Sharma we all know. Flighted on off, he makes a bit of room to go inside out and connects handsomely, the ball crosses the boundary cushion by a metre or so
Andrew Tye to Rohit, 1 run, as expected starts with a slower delivery outside off, Rohit drives to sweeper cover

Andrew Tye to Pollard, SIX, just over a leaping McCullum at long-off. Short of length delivery outside off, Pollard flat-bats it straight back over Tye, McCullum standing at straightish long-off, jumps up and couldn't even get a finger

Andrew Tye to Pollard, FOUR, a pick up shot and that has almost gone the distance. Angled in on off and middle, Pollard flicks it away powerfully. Roy like McCullum was straight at long-on, he can only pick the ball up from the boundary rope

Basil Thampi to Pollard, 1 run, run-out chance and Kishan hits the stump mic instead of the stumps. Pollard was a goner. Thampi nails the wide yorker, Pollard digs it to point and sets off for the single, no response from Rohit and he had to turn back, well short with a direct hit. No one backing up and the duo eventually get the single

Andrew Tye to Pollard, out Caught by Jadeja!! Not over, yet. Still need 17 runs off 11 balls. Credit must go to Thampi for bowling a tight 18th over. Pollard had to take the risk and he perishes while doing so. Full and slow, on middle and leg, since there was no pace, Pollard could not gather momentum on the flick, skies it towards deep mid-wicket, Jadeja won't drop those. Pollard c Jadeja b Andrew Tye 39(23) [4s-2 6s-3]

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, streaky, but MI won't mind. The knuckle ball on a fuller length, Hardik had the width to free his arms, throws everything he's got and squirts it off the outside edge behind point, right between backward point and short third man

P Kumar to Rohit, FOUR, that must surely do it. Praveen looks befuddled. He comes round the wicket and bowls a low full toss on the stumps, Rohit moves across, crouches low, almost on one knee and paddles it fine. With the fielder inside the ring, that was a smart shot

Munaf Patel to Buttler, FOUR, much needed boundary for MI! Length ball on middle and leg, Buttler moves across and flicks it effortlessly backward of square on the on-side and collects his first boundary

Basil Thampi to Buttler, SIX, wow! That's a Buttler special. Easily done. Short of a good length delivery on off, Buttler moves across, still has the eyes on the ball and scoops it over the keeper's head. Improvisation at its best

Basil Thampi to Nitish Rana, SIX, shot! That's Raina-esque. Slower ball outside off. Overpitched as well, Rana crouches low and creams the lofted cover drive over extra cover. It came right off the sweet portion of the bat and the ball goes the distance
Andrew Tye to Nitish Rana, SIX, one of the best shots of the day! Short ball at a decent pace, Rana has no trouble in pulling it over square leg for a maximum. He absolutely middled it
Munaf Patel to Nitish Rana, FOUR, wow! That went like a bullet into the fence. Short and wide outside off, Rana jumps and flashes it hard. The ball flies through the point region and races away
Jadeja to Nitish Rana, FOUR, what a way to get to yout fifty! Second half-century this season. He cuts the shortish ball outside off and pierces the gap between backward point and short third man
Jadeja to Buttler, SIX, wow! 15 runs off the over and MI are surely ahead at this stage. Right in the slot for Buttler to swing his bat. He prods forward and thumps it over long-on for a huge six

Andrew Tye to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Karthik!! Nitish Rana has done his job here. End of a fine knock. The knuckle ball from Tye does the trick.
