Rana wanted to cut hard and all he managed was a faint tickle. The man with the mitts gobbles it up and the umpire spotted the feather. Nitish Rana c Karthik b Andrew Tye 53(36) [4s-4 6s-2]

Unadkat to Kohli, SIX, my word, how well has he timed that! Unadkat appeared to have deceived Kohli with a cutter and Kohli had to really reach out for it. But his wristwork is a work of genius. He somehow manages to whip the ball away over the deep square leg boundary. Fantastic shot

SN Thakur to Kohli, FOUR, he's checked this shot down the ground but it still races away off the middle. Back of a length and wide of off, Kohli thinks about a cut but changes his mind midway and just jabs it back. The ball was in the air but Thakur can't get down quick enough because it absolutely raced away

SN Thakur to Kohli, no run, Tiwary drops Kohli. Oh you can't do that. Thakur hits the pitch hard on a back of a length outside off, Kohli dangles a horizontal bat and edges it for a simple catch to first slip where Tiwary makes a meal of it

SN Thakur to Mandeep, out Caught by Dhoni!! Another chance, and this time there's no mistake. But it's Mandeep, and not Kohli. Not too dissimilar from that Kohli chance actually. It's a bit short, a bit wide, Mandeep has a swish at it but he's done in by extra bounce. Simple catch. Mandeep c Dhoni b SN Thakur 0(3)

Tahir to de Villiers, out Stumped!! Oh what a ball. What a ball. He tosses this on off, gets it to dip on AB to draw him out of the crease and then turns it right across him for the stumping. This is a brilliant piece of leg-spin bowling. AB was ambitiously trying to flick this through mid-wicket but he's beaten in flight and length. Dhoni, quick as ever, hardly takes any time to whip those bails off. That's lightning glovework. This is on. de Villiers st Dhoni b Tahir 29(30) [4s-1 6s-2]

Unadkat to Kedar Jadhav, out Bowled!! Jadhav's dragged on. Time was running away and he had to do something, so he gallops down the pitch with an almighty swing but the ball takes a long time to arrive. He's forced to reach out for it outside off, gets a thick inside edge and plays it onto leg-stump. Kedar Jadhav b Unadkat 18(22)

Stokes to Binny, FOUR, pace on the ball from Stokes and he's been put away. That's not how Thakur and Unadkat were bowling. It skids on nicely from a back of a length for Binny and he flays it through backward point

Stokes to Watson, FOUR, it took 39 balls for RCB to get a boundary. And now they've got two in three. Slower ball banged into the pitch outside off, this time Watson gets stuck into it and slashes it into the extra-cover boundary

Stokes to Watson, out Bowled!! Got him. And that's the big one. It's the slower ball again which does the trick. RPS have read this pitch like a book. Stokes takes the pace off, bangs it on a back of a length and the ball dips underneath Watson as he tries to heave it away. The middle stump is floored. Watson b Stokes 14(18) [4s-1]

Christian to Binny, SIX, Binny nails this one into the crowd. The slower ball from Christian drifted into his hips, sat up to be put away, and Binny flogged it a long way over long leg. Don't think we're getting the ball back. Someone's taking it home. Ball change required
Christian to Binny, FOUR, normal pace short ball, Binny swings into a pull and it takes a thick top-edge to fly over the wicketkeeper. RCB just about stay in it

SN Thakur to Negi, SIX, well, well .. don't go anywhere. This partnership has raced away to 22 off 9. Thakur deviates from the slower ball strategy, bowls it full and wide of off and Negi spanks him over mid-off. That's gone all the way. Flat six

SN Thakur to Negi, out Caught by Tripathi!! That's gone straight up. Who wants it? Tripathi is the one settling under it at deep mid-wicket, and he takes it neatly. A real skier. Slower ball which extracts spongy bounce and takes a thick top-edge as Negi slogs. Second for Thakur. Negi c Tripathi b SN Thakur 10(7) [6s-1]

SN Thakur to Binny, 1 run, what an effort from Stokes. This is stunning fielding. He's actually caught the ball and has control over it, but he doesn't have control over his weight which is causing him to fall over the ropes. So he has to flick it back in - does so incredibly, through his legs. Lots of height from Binny on the slog, fair amount of distance too. Stokes's foot is stationed just a foot inside the ropes at wide long-on, he takes it overhead, and flicks it in. They just take a single

SN Thakur to Binny, out Bowled!! The middle stump has been planted into its grave. That might be it as far as RCB's hopes go. Binny moves a mile to the off-side and Thakur keeps it full and straight and fast. Binny b SN Thakur 18(8) [4s-2 6s-1]
Unadkat to Milne, 1 run, slower back of a length delivery on middle, Milne glances it to short fine leg. Badree was struggling had Thakur hit direct

Unadkat to Badree, out Bowled!! Floors middle stump yet again. Has he stepped up today or what?! Exceptional from Unadkat, and even Shardul. He's slowed this up beautifully and Badree is through his slog too early. Badree b Unadkat 0(1)

Stokes to Milne, out Bowled!! Bang on top of off-stump. These bowlers are helping themselves to some good wickets here. Three for Stokes now. Cuts his fingers across the ball while bowling it into the pitch, it doesn't bounce as much as Milne wants. Right under his swipe. Milne b Stokes 2(3)
SN Thakur to de Villiers, FOUR, what a start from AB! He smokes this off the back foot past backward point. Short and wide from Thakur, and a player of AB's class won't miss out

Unadkat to de Villiers, SIX, he's hit that straight into the stage where a display car is kept. He sat on that slower ball. It was a touch on the shorter side, AB is quick to rock back before mowing it over wide long-on

SN Thakur to Kohli, FOUR, the edge just eludes a flying Stokes at backward point. Nice and full from Thakur, drawing Kohli across into a drive. The ball holds its line slightly to take a thick outside edge. Such a good effort from Stokes. Can't get a hand though

SN Thakur to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli walks at Thakur who bowls a slower ball on middle and leg. That's Kohli's bread and butter shot. A beautiful wristy flick through mid-wicket fetches him another boundary

Stokes to Kohli, out Caught by Rahane!! Stokes has Kohli. That's a really sharp short ball. Kohli was on the move down the pitch, Stokes bangs it in and gets it around head high. Kohli still doesn't back down. He has a big swish at it and probably caught it right off the bottom of the bat. It slices up in the air for a simple catch to Rahane at sweeper cover. Another wicket, especially of AB, and things will get really interesting. Kohli c Rahane b Stokes 28(19) [4s-3 6s-1]

Tahir to de Villiers, SIX, Tahir flights it up and AB immediately clatters him over long-off. Just got the length wrong there. It was a bit too full outside off. Still, it's a superb shot as AB had to reach out
Badree to Rahane, FOUR, a full toss. First up. Dictates terms right away does Rahane with a lean forward in whipping it through the on-side. Quite a warm up this
Badree to Smith, FOUR, decides to take matters into the leg-side. Reaches out to the pitch of the delivery and forces it with a dragging slog bisecting the men guarding cow corner

Chahal to Dhoni, SIX, whoa. The beast mode is out. And the ball has been tonked into one of the metros going around. Dhoni is back to his earlier avatar of galloping down to spinners and just swings the bat keeping it as straight as possible. Laced over long-on. Has to be the biggest of this season
Aravind to Smith, FOUR, a wasted delivery. Well down leg and all Smith has to do with these is get some wood. And he gets a whole chunk on it. Flicks it away off his pads

Watson to Smith, FOUR, a real sitter. Quite a nothing delivery this from Watson. Neither full nor short enough. Gives Smith all the time to open himself up and spot the area to place this angry pull of his. Decides it would be cow corner to take the brunt

Watson to Dhoni, FOUR, the edges spoil the over. The scrambled leg-cutter this from Watto with a hint of width as well. Dhoni gets his drive around 90-degrees finer than he had planned. Off the outside edge and through the vacant cordon

Watson to Dhoni, out Bowled!! Plays it on. And it is the age-old trick of firing in the yorkers that does the trick. Dhoni loads himself up for a version of his helicopter. But the ball is just wide enough to kiss the inside edge and ricochet to make a real mess of the timber. A much needed pull back into the contest for RCB - a contest that could well have gone outside the park. Dhoni b Watson 28(25) [4s-3 6s-1]

Aravind to Smith, out Bowled!! Two in a row. And is both the batsmen who'd done all the hard work in setting themselves up for the final slog. Aravind comes back with an off-cutter and keeps the aim up and right on the money. Stays much lower as well. Through the defences and under the early pull to light up the zing bails once again. Smith b Aravind 27(24) [4s-3]

Aravind to Christian, out Caught by Mandeep!! They are falling apart. Three wickets in the span of six balls. All the momentum that seemed to have drifted Pune's way has surely been redirected via the national highway to Bangalore. A fullish delivery this and full-paced as well for a change. Christian executes the clip but fails to keep it down. Doesn't get it high enough either. The middle path treaded takes the lob into the safe palms of deep square leg. Christian c Mandeep b Aravind 1(3)

Milne to Stokes, out Bowled!! The stumps just keep flying. The heart of Pune being ripped apart here. And so is this innings. A length delivery assumed to be in the slot for the slog here from Stokes. He lines up neatly and does everything right in swinging his ba putting all forearms to good use. Just that there is hardly any bounce here to sit up for the timing to come out right. Scoots under the flat bat and sends the off-pole on a cartwheel. Stokes b Milne 2(3)

Milne to SN Thakur, out Caught by de Villiers!! Oh dear. This is a collapse of enormous magnitudes. Faster than some of the vehicles that line up in the evenings on the Bangalore roads. Goes for the slower one on a length outside off. Thakur looks to check his drive but the sticker on the pitch makes him check his shot. He does so and chips it to a flying AB at cover. SN Thakur c de Villiers b Milne 0(1)

Watson to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, a juicy full toss, with generous width dished out as well. Smoked off the middle of the bat sinking onto the front knee as well making it one for the cameras. Pune need a lot more of these

Watson to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, pitched up. Right in the slot to be spanked. And Tiwary doesn't disappoint. Once again leans onto his front knee and just swings his bat through the line. A lot straighter this time

Watson to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, some runs scrapped here. In style rather. Those wrists employed in executing the lofted drive over extra cover. Finding the gap to perfection. Watson for some reason doesn't believe in not dishing out half volleys at this stage of the game

Watson to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, even better. The gorgeousness of the shots increases in an arithmatic progression. Much straighter this from Watson but once again off a generous half volley length. A seam up and dispatched into the sight screen with a full flowing drive

Milne to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, up and dispatched. Gives his side something to bowl at on this graveyard. Milne after bowling an eviable yorker misses the next. A cool few inches short and enough time for Tiwary to get under it in whipping it over the top. Behind square and into the stands

Milne to Tripathi, FOUR, right off the screws. A charge down the track in perpendiculars moving down and away in the same motion. All the breathing space for his arms in slicing it with all the power through the covers
Milne to Tripathi, leg byes, FOUR, down leg. And dealt with a nurdle off the thighs. Going past the glance and runs away into the long leg ropes

Milne to Rahane, FOUR, whoa. Take that for timing. All of it employed here on duty tonight. Leans onto the front leg and shows the full bat face in spanking a lofted drive over the bowler's head. Holds the pose to make it all the more elegant

Milne to Manoj Tiwary, out Manoj Tiwary Run Out!! 1 run completed. Surrenders in the quest fo an extra run. But he's done his job. Squeezes out a fullish one, almost whipping it in the process to long-on. A charge in and a good throw at the keeper's end ensures that Tiwary's desperate diving attempt to get back in for the second is futile. So, 161 is what Pune manage. Manoj Tiwary run out (Kohli/Kedar Jadhav) 27(11) [4s-3 6s-2]
Milne to Rahane, FOUR, make that 17 off the over. After the polite timing, Rahane gets out his violent streak now. Crashes the cut ferociously. Square like a tracer

Aravind to Tripathi, SIX, nothing streaky this time. Aravind looks for another one to fox the batsman getting too predictable in the process. A mighty swing taking the ball into the clouds before getting it to settle over long-on. Jee, this target setting is getting scary
Aravind to Tripathi, FOUR, width now. Nothing going Bangalore's way. The length isn't either. A friendly sit up and smashed away with a flaying cut. Reintroduced into the fence

Watson to Rahane, FOUR, deft. Delicate. Cheeky. The wide slip tactic not quite making much sense now. With Rahane using his surgical precision in bisecting the man out there and the keeper with his delayed steer

Watson to Rahane, FOUR, they're racing through. Brings up the half-ton stand as well. Watto decides to get defensive with a wide dart. Not quite the case with Rahane already stooping low and reaching out in drilling it behind point

Badree to Rahane, out Bowled!! The break does the trick. In the form of the strategy to introduce spin back. As has been a trend all through the tourney, the leg-spinners's wrong 'uns keep getting the rewards. Floats it up inviting Rahane to get forward on the drive. And then gets the ball to dip in sharply going through the tiny gap between the bat and pad to light up the timber. Much needed slow down this for Bangalore. Rahane b Badree 30(25) [4s-5]

Badree to Tripathi, FOUR, bursts through the hands. Badree's. Was a polite drill down this squeezing out the fuller one from Tripathi as he smashes it back. The bowler, slow to get low has a boundary against his name

Negi to Tripathi, out Caught by Kohli!! All the timing. All the power. All the elegance. Just that there is a certain Kohli in the way. Clears his front leg, gets his eyeline right on the ball and looks to go for the inside-out slap through the covers. Intercepted and a dive to his left plucks this one out of thin air. Diving low as well in the process. A real stunner. Tripathi c Kohli b Negi 31(23) [4s-3 6s-1]

Badree to Dhoni, FOUR, threatens to come down. Charge down in fact. All he does in the process is fool Badree into thinking the same and fire one wide. Adjusts and reaches out in slapping it behind point. A confidence boosting boundary
Badree to Dhoni, FOUR, the punches are out. A wide, short combo this and dealt with a certain degree of aplomb. Shows the leather the full face of the blade and crashes it through backward point
Coulter-Nile to Samson, FOUR, wow! What a shot to get off the mark. Length ball right in the slot for Samson to swing his bat. Stands tall and lofts the on-drive
Coulter-Nile to Samson, FOUR, four more! Samson isn't afraid to play his strokes. Sees the width outside off and throws the kitchen sink. Gets it well wide of backward point. No chance for third man

Woakes to Samson, FOUR, that's timing and placement! "That's class," calls Sunny G on air. Just a hint of width outside off on this back of a length dlivery and Samson just taps it on the off-side. Pierces the gap between backward point and cover-point. The quick outfield does the rest

de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, beautiful shot. With mid-off up inside the circle, de Grandhomme pitches it up outside off. Iyer spots it and caresses the drive. It was uppish, but in the gap. 12 runs off the tenth over

Kuldeep Yadav to Nair, FOUR, placed to perfection. Flighted on middle, Nair sinks down to one knee and sweeps, not quite off the middle, but got it in the gap at deep square leg. The fielder tries to flick the ball in play, but in vain
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that ruins the over. Like Nair, Iyer also moved to leg, but he kept his options open and didn't committ to one shot, waited for the short ball and cut it behind point

Narine to Shreyas Iyer, out Shreyas Iyer Run Out!! 1 run completed. It was a risky second and Iyer pays the price. It was his call and he was running to the danger end, took on de Grandhomme and came second. The knuckle ball on middle, nudged softly into the mid-wicket region. The Kiwi charged in from the rope and fired a flat throw right next to the stumps to Uthappa, who did the rest. Even a dive from Iyer was not enough to save him. Another start for Iyer that he doesn't convert. Shreyas Iyer run out (de Grandhomme/Uthappa) 26(17) [4s-4]

Narine to Nair, no run, dropped! The penalty you pay for fielding a part-time wicket-keeper. The flatter knuckle ball around off, Nair moved away to the leg-side and tried to force it off the back foot, the outside edge goes straight in and straight out of Uthappa's gloves. That would have been two set batsmen removed in one over

Coulter-Nile to Nair, out Bowled!! This was coming. Nair was struggling against Coulter-Nile and he perishes looking to play a wild stroke. NCN darted it full and on the stumps. Nair clears his front leg and wants to heave it over the on-side. Doesn't bring the bat anywhere close to the ball and the it strikes the base of middle. Nair b Coulter-Nile 21(27) [4s-1]
Kuldeep Yadav to Pant, SIX, wow! Floated up outside off, Pant had the width to free his arms and he made no mistake, lofts it high and over the long-off fence. Almost nailed the electronic scoreboard
U Yadav to Pant, SIX, the yorker gone wrong. Low full toss just outside off, Pant brings that strong bottom hand into play, gets underneath it and sends it sailing over the long-on fence. What a hit!
U Yadav to Pant, FOUR, short and outside off, Pant cuts up and over backward point. Used the pace of Umesh and never thought about keeping it down the ground, one bounce and into the fence
U Yadav to Pant, SIX, 16 off three balls. That is what he can do. Length delivery on the pads, Pant crouches low and plays the pick-up shot to perfection, sent it packing over backward square leg

U Yadav to Pant, SIX, wasn't Umesh the best pacer for India in the Test season? He's been taken to the cleaners by the youngster. Third six in the over and already 22 off the over. KKR will be hurting by this onslaught. Fuller and around off, Pant clears his front leg and dispatched it over wide long-on

U Yadav to Pant, FOUR, geez! He hits them hard. 26 runs off the over and Umesh has taken a pasting. From 1/27 he ends with 1/53. Very full and outside off, Pant drills the drive past the diving extra cover fielder. The ball rocketed to the fence

Narine to Mathews, out Bowled!! This is not what you expect from an experienced campaigner. With Pant going brilliantly, Mathews just needed to give the strike to the youngster. Instead he advances and fails to pick the offie, the ball breaks back in and hits the top of leg-stump. Mathews b Narine 1(4)

Narine to Chris Morris, FOUR, you need confidence to play that shot, especially against Narine. The off-break turning in, Morris reverse sweeps it over backward point. Not off the middle, but once it cleared the infield it was going to be four

Coulter-Nile to Pant, out Caught by Gambhir!! GG exults. But the damage might have been done. Third wicket for NCN and he's been an inspired selection today. Low full toss outside off, Pant had to reach out for that, slices it low to backward point, where GG clings on. A fine knock from the youngster that. Gave DD the momentum going into the final overs. Pant c Gambhir b Coulter-Nile 38(16) [4s-2 6s-4]

Coulter-Nile to Chris Morris, 1 run, dropped! Tough chance, but when you get two hands, you have to catch it. Short delivery and Morris is hurried into the pull, spliced towards long-on. Umesh runs forward and across, overruns and the ball comes near his waist while he was diving forward, hits his hands and pops out. GG is not happy with the effort

Coulter-Nile to Chris Morris, 1 run, Morris living a charmed life. Now, GG puts one down. What do you say now skipper? Umesh might be asking. It was a straightforward chance unlike his. Slower delivery and Morris is early into the drive, toe-ends it towards extra cover. It was going in slow motion and GG lost it in the background. The ball hit his fingers and went to ground
Woakes to Chris Morris, FOUR, short delivery on middle and leg, that is easy pickings for a South African, Morris swivels and pulls it towards long leg. Bounced just before the ad cushions
Woakes to Chris Morris, FOUR, streaky but DD won't mind. The slower delivery but had the space for Morris to throw the kitchen sink, the outside edge flies fine and down to the third man fence

Woakes to Chris Morris, out Caught by U Yadav!! Clever bowling from Woakes. Dug in the slower short ball, Morris delayed his shot after reading it off the surface, the idea was to ramp it over short third man, since there was no pace the ball balloons to Umesh, who makes no mistake this time. Chris Morris c U Yadav b Woakes 16(9) [4s-3]

U Yadav to Billings, FOUR, starts with a leg-stump half-volley and gets the treatment it deserves. Billings leans forward and whips it through mid-wicket and the ball bullets away. No need to run for shots like that

U Yadav to Samson, FOUR, wow! He strokes and stands still on the crease, posing for the photographs. Length ball just outside off, Samson presses forward and caresses the cover drive. Finds the gap superbly

U Yadav to Samson, FOUR, four more! This time he uses the pace and bounce to good effect. 141kph short ball outside off, Samson opens his bat face at the last instant and runs it wide of the keeper. Third man gave it a chase, but in vain

U Yadav to Samson, FOUR, exquisite. He's seeing the cricket ball like a football. All timing. He is not trying to hit the leather hard. Pitched up delivery, Samson leans onto it and drives it between mid-off and extra cover. Umesh Yadav leaks 17 runs off his opening over
Kuldeep Yadav to Billings, FOUR, starts with a full toss on leg. Easy-peasy for Billings. He clips it in front of square on the on-side
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, 2 runs, to long on, 50-run stand in the fifth over. A gentle nudge into the leg-side, followed by a quick double

Coulter-Nile to Billings, out Caught by Uthappa!! The umpire took ages to raise his finger. Perhaps, it looked like he had a look at his partner before making the decision. The partnership is broken, courtesy short ball down leg. Billings would have smacked that past the ropes nine times out of ten. But, not today. He attempted the pull and all he managed was a glove onto it. Uthappa moves to his left and pouches it. Billings c Uthappa b Coulter-Nile 21(17) [4s-2]

Coulter-Nile to Samson, FOUR, cheeky, delicate and effective. Uses the slightest of width on this short ball outside off and sends it wide of the keeper by opening his bat face. It was an off-pace delivery as well. He waited for the ball till the last moment before making contact

U Yadav to Samson, out Caught by Uthappa!! Umesh Yadav strikes and removes the big fish. He bowled much better compared to his first spell and earns himself a wicket. It was a pacy Test match line and length. Short of a good length delivery on fourth-fifth stump line. Samson gets a faint outside tickle looking to run it down towards third man. Settles into the safe mitts of Uthappa. Samson c Uthappa b U Yadav 39(25) [4s-7]

Woakes to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that's harsh on the bowler. That didn't deserve to go to the boundary. It was banged in short and Woakes bent his back there. Iyer is surprised by the pace and bounce on that delivery. He jumps and just sticks his bat out hoping that it doesn't hit him. The ball flies past the keeper off his shoulder and dribbles away into the third man fence. The umpire thinks it came off the bat and gives four runs

de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, welcome to Delhi says Iyer. Shortish and wide outside off, Iyer treks back and fiercely cuts it behind square on the off-side. Gets it well out of the reach of backward point

Zaheer to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Billings!! Zak attack strikes. Trap set and trap sprung. So, de Grandhomme's promotion fails. Lasted for just two balls. It was a fuller length delivery on off-stump line, de Grandhomme went for a half-hearted flick. It appeared that the ball might have stopped on the wicket. Nonetheless, he was early into the shot and it was the slower ball from Zaheer that fooled the batsman there. Skies it towards deep square leg. Billings sprawls in forward and pouches it with ease. Zaheer roars in delight. de Grandhomme c Billings b Zaheer 1(2)
Pat Cummins to Gambhir, FOUR, that's a gift and Gambhir accepts it gleefully. Half-volley on off-stump, Gambhir takes it from there and flicks it fiercely past mid-on. Rockets away to the fence
Pat Cummins to Gambhir, FOUR, too full and too easy. Wafted full outside off, Gambhir leans forward, presents a nice high elbow and creams it past mid-off
Pat Cummins to Uthappa, FOUR, Uthappa gets off the mark with a boundary. Pivots back to this short ball and nails the pull in front of square on the on-side
Shami to M Pandey, FOUR, this is intentional stuff from Pandey. Waits in his crease till the last instant, opens the bat face and runs it through the vacant slip region

Mathews to M Pandey, SIX, that's a pressure-releaser. Jogs down the track and uses his wrists to good effect. Flicks it handsomely over square leg. there were two men in the deep. All they could do was watch it sail over the rope

Zaheer to Y Pathan, SIX, can't get away with this full toss! Pathan brings up his fifty in style. He clears his front leg and swings his bat hard. Finds the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket and has enough power to go all the way as well

Zaheer to Y Pathan, 3 runs, 100-run stand between the duo. Another low full toss, Pathan gets underneath the delivery and drills it down the ground. Morris from long-off dives full length to his right and flicks the ball back in play. The other fielder (Nair) from long-on fires in a throw, but he can't stop the duo from taking the third. Excellent running

Zaheer to M Pandey, FOUR, 15 off the over and Zaheer isn't happy. Probably with himself. After serving all those full tosses, he drifts one down leg. Pandey moves across and gets a faint tickle. No chance for Pant who put in a desperate dive. The ball dribbles away into the fence
Chris Morris to Y Pathan, FOUR, this is a gift and Pathan collects it with both hands. Full toss down leg, Pathan gets enough wood on his wild bat-swing and gets it very fine

Chris Morris to Y Pathan, out Caught&Bowled!! Much needed breakthrough for the home team. The short ploy does the trick. Morris bangs it in short at a good pace. Pathan is hurried on his pull and the ball lobs up off the top-edge. Morris calls for it moving to his left and takes a safe catch. Y Pathan c and b Chris Morris 59(39) [4s-6 6s-2]

Chris Morris to M Pandey, FOUR, cheeky shot! Full and on off, Pandey opens his bat face at the last instant and steers it between the keeper and short third man. 10 runs off the wicket, in spite of Pathan's wicket
Pat Cummins to M Pandey, 1 run, a fore-handed stroke to send this short ball to long-on. Manish Pandey notches up his fifty with that single

Pat Cummins to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Zaheer!! Is there a twist here? With mid-off inside the circle, it was worth taking the gamble. But, Yadav didn't get the desired result. The pace off the ball did the trick here. Yadav moved leg-side and mishit the lofted-off drive straight to mid-off. The bat turned at the point of impact. Suryakumar Yadav c Zaheer b Pat Cummins 7(9)

Mishra to Woakes, out Stumped!! Delhi is going Mishy, Mishy, Mishy. A dot followed by a wicket. He completely foxes Woakes with this tossed up leg-break. Woakes's weight takes him forward, who wanted to deposit it away with a slog sweep. The back leg is well in front of the crease. Pant whips off the bails in a flash. The only doubt in the third umpire's mind was if Pant gathered it behind the stumps. It's touch and go. The benefit of doubt goes to the keeper. OUT flashed on the giant screen. Woakes st Pant b Mishra 3(5)

Mishra to M Pandey, SIX, wow! Six and KKR need just 2 now. It was darted outside off. Pandey does a Dhoni! He moves slightly across and thumps it over long-on. Cummins was coming forward and I reckon he misjudged it there. Had he held his ground, he might have had a better chance

Pat Cummins to Uthappa, out Caught by Pant!! Uthappa combusts. No tryst with destiny for Uthappa today. Top nut from Cummins, overcorrects his length and hurls in the sucker ball outside off. Uthappa goes for a booming drive sans any feet movement. This was the away curler, he doesn't account for the swing. Ekes out an outside edge that flies to Pant, who dives to his right and completes a fine catch. Uthappa c Pant b Pat Cummins 4(2) [4s-1]

Zaheer to Gambhir, out Caught by Mathews!! Zaheer is on a roll. One more down. What is happening to KKR? The skipper departs. The frustration was conspicuous, he wanted to break the shackles. Zaheer is clever, he bowls one full and gets it to veer away a touch. Gambhir slogs wildly across the line, gets a leading edge that balloons in the air towards cover. He gave the charge there. Doesn't matter anyway. Mathews takes a couple of steps backwards and hangs onto it safely. Gambhir c Mathews b Zaheer 14(12) [4s-2]
Zaheer to M Pandey, no run, rib-tickler this time, tucked straight to short fine. Wanted a single but wisely sent back by his partner. A direct-hit from Morris would've been close

Chris Morris to Y Pathan, FOUR, elegance written all over it. So flowy and effortless from Pathan. Like a liquid. A fuller length delivery in the slot, Pathan stands motionless and lifts it straight over the bowler's head. Holds the pose for the cameras after playing the shot
Zaheer to Y Pathan, FOUR, that's a stinker and gets punished. Shortens his length but sprays it on leg-stump line. Pathan rolls his wrists and directs it past the man at 45

Pat Cummins to Y Pathan, FOUR, wow. That's a ripper from Cummins. Came out of nowwhere. Bangs it short, rears up viciously. Pathan is startled by the bounce, went for a pull and gets a top-edge onto his helmet. Flies over the keeper's head for a one bounce boundary
Pat Cummins to Y Pathan, FOUR, no half measures this time. Rocks back and butchers it over mid-on. Couple of bounces and into the fence
Pat Cummins to M Pandey, FOUR, the short ball isn't working for Cummins. Pandey backs away and unleashes the pull in front of square on the on-side

Shami to Y Pathan, SIX, how on earth did it go over the ropes? Shami looks flabbergasted. Almost did in with this off-pace delivery, Pathan was months early into the shot, ends up mistiming it but such is his power that it went all the way for a maximum over deep mid-wicket. Pathan ended up hitting that with the use of one hand as the bottom hand came off
Mishra to M Pandey, SIX, fabulous shot. Uses his feet, reaches the pitch and tonks one over long-on. Went sailing into the stands
Mishra to M Pandey, 1 run, flays this flatter ball through cover. 50-stand up

Mishra to Y Pathan, FOUR, didn't get it where he intended but still earns himself a boundary. Mishra drops it shorter again, Pathan went for a muscular blow across the line, the ball takes the top-half of the blade and loops over Mishra's head. Races away to the fence

Bhuvneshwar to Amla, out Lbw!! That's plumb. Out. Gone. Dead. Amla has played right across a full one and missed it. The ball hurries on to hit low on his pad in front of middle and that's crashing into the stumps. Not a great deal of movement, just a hint of inswing but Amla falters by opting to play across the line first up. Amla lbw b Bhuvneshwar 0(1)

Bhuvneshwar to Maxwell, FOUR, four first ball for Maxwell who has promoted himself to No. 3. Full on leg-stump, the ball is ducking in sharply and Maxwell just about gets some bat on it to help it along while yanking his leg away

Barinder to Vohra, FOUR, lots of width from Sran and Vohra lashes him over cover-point. He had no intentions of keeping it along the ground, which is the way to go when you're going hard at it. Even if an edge is found, it will fly

Barinder to Maxwell, FOUR, right up under Maxwell's bat and he punches it fiercely over mid-on. A full ball on leg-stump, Maxwell opens his stance up, gets his front leg out of the way and times it nicely

Rashid Khan to Saha, out Bowled!! Done him with the googly. Actually, Saha picks this one but he anticipates the ball to come back in a lot more than it does, so he ends up playing inside the line of it. It goes past his outside edge and knocks over off-stump. What a comeback from Rashid Khan after being hammered in his first over. Saha b Rashid Khan 0(2)
Nabi to Axar, no run, spills a return catch. Axar hits it straight back at him but it's not coming too fast and the height is pretty comfortable too. He should have taken it
Nabi to Vohra, FOUR, too many deliveries on the shorter side in this over and Vohra finally gets hold of one. He rocks back and pulls it away wide of long-on
Nabi to Vohra, FOUR, almost an action replay of the previous shot. An ordinary over from Nabi to complete what has been a fine spell. Short again, Vohra belts it in the same place on the field

Henriques to Axar, out Caught by Dhawan!! Full and wide, Axar throws his hands at it to carve it over extra-cover. The bat turns in his hands and he eventually slices it straight to deep point. KXIP are in tatters now. No real firepower to come. Axar c Dhawan b Henriques 7(12)

Henriques to Vohra, 2 runs, more than a dropped catch, that's two runs saved. A fine stretch from Nabi at short third man to get fingertips to the ball. Vohra wanted to ramp this back of length delivery above him, and was so nearly successful

Barinder to Mohit Sharma, SIX, Mohit Sharma, what a strike! Never mind my comment that they have no real firepower to come. This has been caned over point. Full and wide from Sran, Mohit clatters it away
Barinder to Vohra, SIX, two sixes in three balls. The required rate is back under 12. Handsome strike from Vohra, crunching the full ball over long-on to bring up his half-century

Barinder to Vohra, FOUR, what an over this is turning out to be! 18 already with 2 balls to go. He errs in line with this slower ball, gets it full on middle and leg and Vohra whips it wide of deep mid-wicket. The ball sneaks through the fielder as he slides across. Warner isn't happy

Rashid Khan to Vohra, FOUR, the bowler is under pressure too here. Even someone as confident as Rashid. He drops it short, allows Vohra to rock back and he belts it over square leg. Bounces just inside the ropes
Rashid Khan to Vohra, SIX, short again, this time it's all the way. It might have been a googly, but it's way too short. Vohra nails the pull over long leg

Rashid Khan to Vohra, SIX, what a stunning hit over long-on. Vohra is playing an absolute blinder here to spring the game back to life. A flighted leg-break on off, Vohra doesn't bother using his feet. Just a stride forward to smash it through the line
Rashid Khan to Vohra, FOUR, massive over. 21 off it. Rashid errs down leg, sits up for Vohra on the hips and he whips it away past short fine leg. He beats deep backward square too

Bhuvneshwar to Mohit Sharma, out Caught by Dhawan!! Bhuvneshwar to the rescue for SRH again. He has easily been the bowler of the tournament so far and he has executed under pressure once more. A back of a length leg-cutter which is wide of off, makes Mohit reach out and he slices it up straight to sweeper cover. Mohit Sharma c Dhawan b Bhuvneshwar 10(5) [6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Vohra, FOUR, Vohra keeps going. He's batting on another planet out there. The timing off his bat, magnificent. This is a full toss in all fairness, Vohra is deep in the crease, he uses the pace and slices it away through point

Bhuvneshwar to Vohra, 1 run, put down, put down! Dhawan seemed to have grabbed that for a split second, but no, it's down. Back of a length outside off, Vohra carves it off the back foot but he's hit it very close to sweeper cover. The ball was travelling though and Dhawan can't hang onto it as he was on the move

S Kaul to Vohra, SIX, he's not mis-hit one delivery, not that I can remember. What we're watching is something very special. A length ball wide of off, this is actually a pretty decent delivery. But Vohra's arc has widened so humongously tonight that he's able to fetch it over long-on. Just over the fielder

Bhuvneshwar to Cariappa, out Bowled!! Leg-stump out of the ground. They're checking the front foot, but Bhuvneshwar's fine. That's insanely good execution of the yorker under pressure. Cariappa gives the charge looking to smack it down the ground but he's really not playing the odds. The ball fizzes under him. Cariappa b Bhuvneshwar 1(5)

Bhuvneshwar to Vohra, out Lbw!! Low full toss, and flush on the back pad. Oh what a shame that is for Vohra. He's been absolutely phenomenal on the night, but falls just short of the finishing line. That's absolutely plumb, no question. On the flip side, how good has Bhuvneshwar been?! It's a five-for for him. Vohra lbw b Bhuvneshwar 95(50) [4s-9 6s-5]

S Kaul to Ishant, out Bowled!! Siddarth Kaul has done it. He has produced the perfect delivery, a delivery which he'll remember for the rest of his life. A ripping yorker which goes right through Ishant and hammers the base of off-stump. Ecstasy for SRH, agony for KXIP. Ishant b S Kaul 2(5)

Bhuvneshwar to Maxwell, out Caught by Warner!! Bhuvi has done him with the leg-cutter. This is a huge breakthrough for the home side. Really smart bowling. He knows Maxwell's after him so the line is a bit wide of off, the leg-cutter means that there is extra bounce too. Hence, instead of sitting up for Maxwell's heave over mid-on, the ball slices up in the air towards long-off where Warner has no problems in gobbling it up. The skipper's pumped. Maxwell c Warner b Bhuvneshwar 10(12) [4s-2]
Nabi to Eoin Morgan, SIX, bowls it short first ball and Morgan is quick to pump him over long-on. Swiftly jumps onto the back foot and thumps a flat pull over the ropes

Rashid Khan to Vohra, FOUR, spots the googly out of the hand and lofts it over mid-off. The line was a bit too wide of off which was a giveaway too. A good forward stride from Vohra before hitting through the line

Rashid Khan to Vohra, SIX, oh my goodness, the sound that made! Wow. Rashid flights the leg-break up around off, Vohra quickly goes down on the back knee and belts a slog-sweep into the second tier over mid-wicket

Rashid Khan to Vohra, FOUR, he's nailed that extra-cover drive too. Rashid under the pump for the first time this season. A little shimmy down the pitch to get close to the pitch and drills it with the turn

Nabi to Eoin Morgan, out Bowled!! Snuck through him. Nabi slides one on from round the wicket and completely cramps Morgan. Morgan may have initially wanted to cut it away but the ball just skids on rapidly and cleans up middle and leg. Poor shot against someone like Nabi who doesn't turn the ball a great deal. Eoin Morgan b Nabi 13(17) [6s-1]

Rashid Khan to Miller, out Bowled!! What a horrible shot that is. It's a leg-break pitching on middle and leg, and Miller is still trying to manufacture a cut through point. The zip from Rashid fizzes the ball right through him and knocks over the top of leg-stump. Really poor shot selection. Miller b Rashid Khan 1(6)

Cariappa to Naman Ojha, FOUR, sinks on the sweep. Barely gets himself in control of it. The stride doesn't even get close enough to the pitch of the delivery as he top-edges it in the end. Has a boundary to his name with the man charging in from fine leg sacrificing some runs in the quest of looking to take the catch
Cariappa to Warner, FOUR, the usual trick. But conventional this time. Sweeps with all his muscle and his big bat has it in it to almost take it all the way over

Cariappa to Warner, 2 runs, a calm looking pat through mid-wicket. And pulls his partner back for the second. Makes the dive as well as Maxwell charges in from the mid-wicket fence and misses with the direct hit. Had he hit, Ojha would've been gone

Axar to Naman Ojha, FOUR, the line-looser. Ends up with a freebie going down leg and all he does it get some of his swat on it to take it past the keeper. That's all he had to do. A graceful acceptance
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, FOUR, cheeky. Deft too in equal proportion. Moves away, manufactures room and opens his bat face ever so late in guiding it very fine

Axar to Naman Ojha, SIX, whoa. Take that. A gallop down the track, inherits the ball right in the slot and just swings the bat all along. A massive swing and lofts it over deep mid-wicket. Several rows inside

Ishant to Warner, FOUR, a juicy full toss. Had to be dispatched. It sure was. But almost laterally opposite to where he was looking for. Tries punching it through the covers, gets it a lot more of the edge than he would have liked and gets it through the cordon. The half-ton of the stand comes up

Cariappa to Naman Ojha, out Stumped!! Too greedy. Dances down the track in looking to deposit another one of those crowd catchers. Cariappa smartly fires in the leg-break and darts it wide too. Wide enough for the ball to sneak under the bat on the move. Foxed by the wide angle starting from the corner of the crease. Saha doesn't mind some more work. Naman Ojha st Saha b Cariappa 34(20) [4s-2 6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Warner, FOUR, the loss of radar. Five consecutive half-centuries for Warner against Punjab. Has to be the most difficult one. Certainly the slowest. Gets there with a tuck off his hips in ensuring that it is fine enough for fine leg to cut it off

Axar to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, clears the front leg, adopts the line and then reintroduces the ball into the fence. After quite some time. Much needed this for the crowd to find their lost voice back. Sinks and lofts the drive through the line

Mohit Sharma to Warner, FOUR, moves all around in his crease. Then sits. And turns right handed. Mohit meanwhile fires in a low full toss. Only to watch it be slogged through the tiny gap in the cover fortress

Mohit Sharma to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by Sandeep Sharma!! A compulsive pull brings about the downfall. The ball right at the neck and Hooda cannot resist not throwing his bat at it. Takes his eyes off though and trusts his instincts in executing the hook. The instincts only manage a top edge, a balloon that gains enough elevation but into the palms of Sandeep behind square. Deepak Hooda c Sandeep Sharma b Mohit Sharma 12(10) [4s-1]
Mohit Sharma to Warner, FOUR, a hang on the front foot and keeps his mace flat as he forearms a smash back past the bowler. So typically Warner

Sandeep Sharma to Nabi, out Caught by Miller!! Another short ball. Another top-edge. Another catch. The tried and tested ploy of snaring wickets all day fetches another. Sandeep persist bending his back and banging it in. More of the kick up on this occasion. Gets too big for Nabi in the end as he throws his bat up in the air and just swishes it cross faced. Off the cue end to deep mid-wicket. Nabi c Miller b Sandeep Sharma 2(3)

Sandeep Sharma to Warner, SIX, bursts through the hands. Oh Morgan. Such has been the standard set these days that you expect these to be picked out. A low full toss here and Warner reaches out on a knee, almost rolls over in the process too. But imparts the final few breaths of energy in him to loft it over long-off, where Morgan gets his hands up but in the quest of keeping himself inside the rope lets the ball sneak through

Sandeep Sharma to Dhawan, FOUR, just the ideal sitting up length. Bangs it in but the pitch just doesn't allow the ball to do anything cheeky. Right in the slot and swatted away flat batted through backward square

Sandeep Sharma to Rashid Khan, SIX, that's how it is done. A banged in sitter and Rashid just stands tall and slogs. Connects right with the middle of his sweet spot and in the only ball he faces gets the ball into the crowds. Over long-on. 159 is what the Sunrisers manage

Mohit Sharma to Dhawan, out Caught by Saha!! A troubled stay this. And Mohit saves him further problems. The peppery bouncer comes out right, half way down the pitch and gaining in altitude even on this sluggish track. Dhawan meanwhile looks to take it on with his swivelling turn in hooking it away. All he manages in the end it a kiss off the glove for a smart Saha to pouch it behind with his fingers venturing upwards. Dhawan c Saha b Mohit Sharma 15(15) [4s-1]
Cariappa to Warner, FOUR, nails the reverse. Switches grips, turns around, sits down and creams the broom behind square. A whistler this

Cariappa to Warner, SIX, the usual suspect. To deal with the mystery spin. Warner pre-plans his switch. Gets quickly the other way and fetches this off the middle stick to slog-sweep it away over point

Axar to Henriques, out Stumped!! The familiar ploy. The ploy of taking the time-out to get yourself a wicket. Plays itself out yet again tonight. Patel floats it up generously and Henriques looks to unsettle the new man with a charge down and an aimless slog. Misses the line completely and is undone by the sharp turn on offer as well. Saha ain't missing out on these bail-whips. Henriques st Saha b Axar 9(16)

Axar to Yuvraj, out Caught by Saha!! Saha yells. Gets no response. Keeps yelling. And the umpire relents. A massive wicket this, and Axar gets himself two in two. Slightly wider this and Yuvraj looks to search for the turn playing a push away from his body. A faint tickle in the end and has the guilty look in his eyes of looking back. Yuvraj c Saha b Axar 0(1)

Chahal to Dwayne Smith, out Caught by Mandeep!! Something always coming. A big shot. A big heave. A big miscue. Sees the shortened length for a change does Smith and looks to post it into the night sky. Just that gravity gets hold of the skier that initially was a mistimed pull with a swivel and finds the lone man at the square leg fence to pouch it. Dwayne Smith c Mandeep b Chahal 1(4)

Aravind to Karthik, out Caught by Kohli!! Guess who's pumped. Looked at who caught this. This was actually too short a ball to be lofted downtown. Karthik still goes for it, his bat ending up slicing the ball to long-on. Had to impart more power onto the shot if he was to put this away. Couldn't. Kohli's there, and as much as the shoulders might be on struts, he won't drop these. Not when RCB sense a win here. Karthik c Kohli b Aravind 1(4)

Milne to Jadeja, FOUR, what's those feet for? Stays put, just lumbers up and uses the width on this short ball to slice the cut uppishly through backward point. Placed it delicately behind the fielder

Milne to Brendon McCullum, SIX, Milne is letting it through like a sieve here. Very full ball. Too full, Milne. And McCullum makes room and hedgehops him flat over his head. 39 off Milne's 3 overs so far

Watson to Jadeja, FOUR, the line was quite similar again. Angled across tight on off-stump but Jadeja goes for the pull this time. Was prepared on the back foot and swatted it away round the corner, with a deliciously awkward swivel

Watson to Brendon McCullum, SIX, here's it, again. A big front foot stride that somehow opens the leg-side for this man. Hacks the ball across and popped it away over square leg. Scratch that. Not popped, but bruted

Chahal to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by Milne!! Chahal, Chahal, Chahal! And he gets McCullum on a day he had blown his side away ten years back. Had bowled a similar full ball earlier in the over to McCullum, but the batsman had resisted then. Not this time. It's McCullum. Gujarat need 77 off 33, so he takes this on. Tries the slog-sweep, fails to get under the ball and offers a steepler to deep mid-wicket. Milne there, who catches it, doing a much better job than he did with the ball earlier. Brendon McCullum c Milne b Chahal 72(44) [4s-2 6s-7]

Aravind to Ishan Kishan, SIX, uh oh. I will. I have. Kishan gets a six here. Wanted to do this since the first ball of this over but gets the desired length and pace on this ball. Outside off, just short enough and he's slogged this over deep mid-wicket
Head to Ishan Kishan, SIX, I-am-from-McCullum's-team slog sweep. Sits low, gets under this hospitably full ball and punishes it. Admonishes it

Head to Jadeja, out Jadeja Run Out!! 1 run completed. A run out so bad that they are checking which batsman is out. Both are at the same end and the umpires have to decide who's made it back in. Jadeja drags it down to long-on, gets to the other end and chaos takes over then. Ishan runs back for the second, Jadeja was unsure about it. Intended. Then not. Then again. But hey, Ishan is at your end. You better get back in. But he's ball-watching and Ishan edge-crosses him at the bowler's end, getting past the marker line quicker. Keeper Kedar Jadhav takes the bails off. Had so much time there, with both the batsman fighting it out at the other end. Jadeja run out (Negi/Kedar Jadhav) 23(22) [4s-2]

Head to Andrew Tye, 2 runs, dropped at long-on. Miscues it high and over but it's been dropped there. Fairly simple chance after Kohli runs across and gets the ball on his stuck out palm as well. Only for it to pop out

Aravind to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, Kohli drops a tough chance here, now, now, he better not hurt his shoulder here. That right one is still sore, we all know. Miscues to deep mid-wicket, Virat Kohli hops back to take it, jumps just in time but tips the ball through. Umpires check if it has touched the ropes as VK looks to recover the ball, and he had
Aravind to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, he has to hit them out now. Sees the width and slashes it through backward point.
Aravind to Ishan Kishan, SIX, eish! This guy! It's a full toss alright but look at that bat swing. Brutal. Swings this full toss over deep mid-wicket. Way over. 32 off 8 needed..

Aravind to Ishan Kishan, SIX, 26 needed off the last over now. I'm not calling this, yet. Another slower delivery on the shorter side, Kishan ducks but only to get under it and hoicks it up and over backward square leg

Milne to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Chahal!! Umm, who's surprised. 23 off 3 needed, why not hit a few sixes. Throws his bat at a wide back of a length delivery but slices it up in the air, for extra cover to grab hold of it on the edge of the ring. Kohli flashes a thumbs up. Why not. Ishan Kishan c Chahal b Milne 39(16) [4s-2 6s-4]
Aravind to Raina, SIX, hoisted. And with sheer timing. A slider this from Aravind onto the pads further amplified by a shuffling across Raina, who picks and posts it over the long leg ropes

Aravind to Raina, SIX, just when we assumed the earlier flick was good, this one gets even better. Plonks his front leg forward to a pitched up delivery right in the slot and keeps the bat face full in lofting it with all the elegance. Down the ground

Aravind to Raina, FOUR, he's turning it on. Makes it 19 off the over courtesy a walk down and a clip off his legs. Another loss in the radar here from Aravind darting it down leg. Raina's ain't complaining though. Just strolls and piles on the misery with a wristy airy flick in front of square

Chahal to Brendon McCullum, SIX, the slog mode is on. Oh it better be. Is quickly on a knee with the bat turning into a slogging monster as he swings across the line and goes high and mighty into the cow corner stands

Chahal to Raina, FOUR, the slogs continue. This time off Raina's bat. Walks himself into the line, sees the defensive trajectory on the pads and just whips it off an angled blade. A bounce into the fence behind square

Chahal to Raina, out Caught by Watson!! The momentum lets him down. In the quest of continuing with the scoring, he gallops down the track. Chahal meanwhile bangs it in half way down the track and gets it to turn in sharply as well. A compulsive heave this off the body gets the inside half of the bat and finds short fine leg. A breeze of a knock clipped. Raina c Watson b Chahal 23(8) [4s-2 6s-2]
Negi to Brendon McCullum, SIX, moves well across the stumps. And is down on a knee. To execute some more of his slogs. An angry sweep in the air and a dispatch into the stands behind square
Negi to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, a nothing length this. Too short. Sitting up nicely on the bat. And plundered back into the mid-wicket fence with a flat batted opened up pull

Chahal to Finch, SIX, brings the hoick out. The defence was meant only for the first delivery. Spots the googly and decides to let the mid-wicket ropes take the brunt of the hammer once again. Tantalizingly over the fingers of a leaping man right at the fence

Milne to Finch, FOUR, a real sitter. Tries the surprise slower one dishing this one out at 117kph and just a tickle off the bottom of Finch's wood on the pull is enough to take it into the gap behind square and past the reach of the man running across

Watson to Brendon McCullum, SIX, oh the bats. And the muscles. Helped by Watson's want to bowl length and he just gives himself some room in swinging his bat as he lofts it high and mighty down the ground
Milne to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, a full toss now. With all the men inside the circle at mid-off, even a miscue catching the toe-end of the bat in the extravagant drive means a boundary

Milne to Brendon McCullum, SIX, nothing mistimed about this one. Hands with a speed greater than 3 x 10^8 as he unleashes a ferocious cut to a short one in slapping it over extra cover. All the way as well

Milne to Finch, FOUR, the leakage goes up to 17. Milne keeps digging it short, the pitch doesn't get it up and Finch keeps raking in the boundaries. Is as usual away on the charge, and the bat transforms into a sword as he stabs it in the air. Over point and guess where it goes

Negi to Brendon McCullum, SIX, 10 years down. And McCullum puts up another show. Against the very same opponents. A real drag down and pulls out the agricultural heave in pocketing a half-century with a max over his favoured square leg

Negi to Finch, out Stumped!! This is what flight can do to you. Negi realizes it after being tonked around for a few. Slows it up, gives it a lot of air and invites Finch to take it on. Finch in his tentative reach outs looks to search for a feel of the turn. Only for the ball to drift away, bounce and go away past the outside edge for the keeper to do his bit. Yep, the back leg is way out. Finch st Kedar Jadhav b Negi 19(15) [4s-2 6s-1]

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, was that intentional from Kohli? I don't think so. Where's the slip. In that nagging line outside off where Kohli is susceptible early in his innings. Kohli looks to dab it towards third man and gets an outside edge that flies past the diving keeper

Basil Thampi to Kohli, FOUR, 143kph sharp bouncer that hurries onto the batsman. Kohli persists with his pull shot and gets a top edge that goes over the short fine leg fielder's head. Unfair for the bowler
Dwayne Smith to Gayle, SIX, he eats, sleeps and churns out sixes like a mill. Right in the slot for Gayle, he won't spare those. Just muscles it flat-batted over long-on
Dwayne Smith to Gayle, SIX, what a strike. Full and in the slot for Gayle, he flexes his muscles and smokes it a long way into the long-on stands

D Kulkarni to Gayle, FOUR, streaky but Gayle won't mind one bit. Throws his bat at this off-pace delivery, gets a thickish outside edge that flies past a diving short third man. Ishan Kishan was the fielder who dived to his right but to no avail
D Kulkarni to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle is putting on a show here. Shows finesse this time, opens the bat face to this off-cutter outside off and steers it past point. Races away to the fence

Basil Thampi to Gayle, out Lbw!! Finally, finally. The show is over. Thampi plays the anti-cupid's role. Totally deserves this wicket. From round the wicket, bowls it full and gets it to curl back in sharply, just an inch short of an yorker. Gayle was late to bring his bat down there. Misses it and is pinged on the boot. Right in front of middle and looked dead straightaway. Thampi is chuffed. Gayle lbw b Basil Thampi 77(38) [4s-5 6s-7]

Jadeja to Kohli, FOUR, abandons the niceties of 1s and 2s and unfurls his strong bottom hand here. Leans forward, extends his hands and cracks the drive through extra cover. Fielder in the deep gave a chase but in vain. Sublime!
Shivil to Kohli, 2 runs, 28th IPL fifty for Kohli. Whips it wide of long-on and reaches the landmark
Shivil to Kohli, SIX, there he goes. High percentage shot. Picked the gap and used his wrists to good effect. Generated enough power to send it over the long-on fence
Shivil to Head, SIX, Koushik is being taken to the dry cleaners today. Head joins into the act. Gets underneath this one and dumps it over cow corner

D Kulkarni to Kohli, out Caught by Dwayne Smith!! The slower ball does the trick. Kulkarni gets his first wicket and prises out the big fish. Robs off all pace and hurls it on off, Kohli swung hard but had to generate some power to clear the fence. In the end, he sends it as far as deep mid-wicket, where Smith was waiting to snaffle that. Easy peasy for the West Indian. Kohli c Dwayne Smith b D Kulkarni 64(50) [4s-7 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, how cheeky from Jadhav? Sees the full ball outside off, waits in his crease and lets his hands take over. Opens his bat face and dinks it in the pocket between short third man and point

Basil Thampi to Head, FOUR, too predictable. The slower ones, I meant. This was on shortish length outside off, Head deals it with alacrity, fetches the pull from outside off and nails it in front of square
Basil Thampi to Head, FOUR, Head is cutting loose here. Gets under this full ball outside off and thumps it over extra cover
Andrew Tye to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, the pocket-rocket launches his missile. Saw what was coming maybe, picks the knuckle ball by advancing down the track and deposits over long-on
Andrew Tye to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, 10 off first two. fabulous shot. Sets up a solid base, extends his arms and lifts it over extra cover
Andrew Tye to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, drops it short and pays the price. Jadhav takes a step forward, takes on this short ball and short-arm pulls it over square leg. One bounce and over the fence

Andrew Tye to Kedar Jadhav, 2 runs, dropped. Hard chance though since he was in his followthrough. Looked like the knuckle ball, Jadhav played it too early, gets a leading edge that popped back to Tye, who leapt with both hands outstretched. Can't cling onto the offering. Parries it towards long-off and they will steal a brace
Jadeja to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, 200-up for RCB. Magnificent shot from Jadhav. Engineers room by backing away to leg and lifts it over cover-point. The ball has enough legs to reach the fence
Jadeja to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, oh dear! Jadeja fails to get his landing right and bowls it in the arc for Jadhav. Gets dumped over long-on, effortless from Jadhav
Jadeja to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, goes the round-armish way but dishes out it outside off, Jadhav lunges across and lofts it over cover. Sort of played a short-arm jab there
D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, shot! This should amplify his confidence. Steps out of his crease and swishes it away through mid-wicket
D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, four more! You don't bowl to this guy on his pads. He will keep punishing you. A wristy clip through square leg. Off the middle of the bat and the ball races away
D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, all timing! A gentle push-drive down the ground. Gets it between the bowler and the mid-off fielder. No chance for either of them

Basil Thampi to Gayle, 1 run, 10,000 runs in T20 cricket for Gayle! Full, pacy delivery outside off, Gayle throws his horizontal blade at it and the ball runs down to third man off the outside part of the bat

Basil Thampi to Gayle, SIX, first six of the evening. Gayle is underway. A high full toss served to him and Gayle just about manages to put it away. He lofts it over mid-off. Didn't get it off the middle, but doesn't matter as it had enough wings to hit the boundary rope on the full

Jadeja to Gayle, FOUR, fired in quick outside off, lots of width on offer. Gayle treks back and punishes it with a punch. The mid-off fielder dived and got a hand to it. But the power off Gayle's bat ensured it crossed the rope

Shivil to Gayle, SIX, there you go! Overpitched and Gayle latches onto it. Presses forward and dispatches it over long-off for a huge six. Just an extension of his off-drive. Brings up the 50-run stand as well
Jadeja to Gayle, FOUR, now he finds the gap. Similar delivery, Gayle thumps it between the bowler and Kohli. The ball bullets away
Jadeja to Gayle, FOUR, four more. Jadeja darts it outside off, Gayle crouches low and bludgeons it over extra cover. No chance for the men in the deep
Jadeja to Gayle, SIX, oh hello! The best of the lot. Gets down on one knee and slog sweeps this firing in fullish ball into the deep mid-wicket stands

Jadeja to Gayle, SIX, Jadeja gets his man. But, this wicket should belong to McCullum. Hang on! It was a low full toss outside off. Gayle stays in his crease and doesn't get hold of his lofted drive over extra cover. B-Mac at long-off runs to his right and takes a flying one-handed catch. The Lions are confident. The umpires want to go upstairs. Soft signal is Out. Oh wait, did his floppy hat make contact with the rope? Oh, yeah. What a shame! Baz's brim of the hat saves Chris Gayle. The southpaw has a big smile on his face as he comes back. He gets six runs as well. Even, Kohli came and shook hands with the SUPERMAN to applaud his effort. Credit to McCullum for he immediately gestured that his hat may have touched the hoarding. Felt the touching motion

Andrew Tye to Kohli, FOUR, RCB are going well here. Kohli talked about intent after their loss against RPS. He and Gayle are showing it. Bouncer, Kohli walks across and pulls it very fine. The fine leg fielder was very fine and he had no chance there

Shivil to Gayle, SIX, stand and deliver. That's a 104 meter six! Gets to his fifty in a grand style. Right in the slot for Gayle to swing his bat. Sees the width outside off, comes forward and blasts it over long-on. The ball is out of the stadium. New balls please. He takes some piece of the sand from the turf and pours it on his bat

Siraj to Billings, FOUR, leading edge for four. The ball just eluded Yuvraj's reach at backward point as he dived to his left. There was just enough nibble for Siraj as Billings closed his bat-face too early. But he timed the edge wonderfully, if that's a thing

Siraj to Billings, FOUR, oh spanked! Pressure on the debutant straightaway. Two fours out of two. He goes short this time and Billings absolutely slaughters him on the front foot. Rockets away through mid-wicket
Siraj to Billings, FOUR, whipped away. Poor ball on leg-stump and Billings times his flick beautifully through mid-wicket. It was hit uppishly but he found the gap pretty well

Siraj to Billings, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Uppish flick again, and taken. It was almost the exact same ball like the previous one and was there for Billings to dispatch to the boundary. But he finds the fielder at mid-wicket this time. He's gutted with himself. More importantly, a big confidence booster for Siraj. Billings c Deepak Hooda b Siraj 13(9) [4s-3]
Henriques to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, 138ks, Iyer thanks him for the pace. Bowled short and in the zone to be ramping it away with an open bat face, times it ever so sweetly does Shreyas Iyer

Siraj to Samson, out Caught by Henriques!! And they lose a wicket first ball, good running catch from Henriques at extra cover. Robs the pace does Mohammed Siraj and dishes it wide of off, asking Samson to fetch. He fell for the trap looking to clear the ring, slices the stroke off the bottom half, the bat face turns on impact too. Henriques doesn't drop many, does he? Samson c Henriques b Siraj 42(33) [4s-3 6s-2]

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, exposes all his stumps as he backs away, standing far outside leg-stump. Siraj follows him but doesn't bowl it as close as he would have liked, Iyer cashes on the width and flays it away over point for a once-bounce four
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, advances, right to the pitch of the ball and he smokes it for a maximum over long-off

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, down the pitch again, just a clean swing of the willow. Might have read the wrong 'un early, and then used all his might to get the distance, into the stands over mid-wicket
Henriques to Mathews, FOUR, saw the field and preempted the scoopy flick over short fine, got good connection and posted it in the gap. Deep backward square can't get there

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, innovative and effective from Iyer. Crouches as he stands outside leg-stump, Bhuvi does well to follow him, but Iyer uses the pace to slice the cut over short third man. Just that subtle adjustment of the bat face...
S Kaul to Mathews, FOUR, right in the crash-bang-wallop zone, Mathews clears his front leg and takes him for a tour over mid-wicket. Once bounce and over the ropes
S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, full toss on the pads, Iyer helps it away to the left of fine leg. Dhawan tried his best running a few yards across the boundary triangles, but that was timed too well

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, brilliant from Iyer. That shot has been nipped out from Kohli's locker. Stands deep inside the crease and just opens the bat face to send the yorker between backward point and short third man
S Kaul to Mathews, SIX, can't get away this time. Another full toss in the swinging zone, Mathews clears his front leg and smites it over wide long-on

S Kaul to Mathews, out Caught by (sub)Jordan!! Takes on a slower short ball, pulls...no timing. Straight down the throat of Chris Jordan at wide long-on. Mathews c (sub)Jordan b S Kaul 31(23) [4s-2 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Nair, FOUR, back of a length delivery outside off, Nair firmly punches it through point. Lovely balance at the crease there. Didn't try to do something fancy. Just a proper cricket shot
Bhuvneshwar to Nair, FOUR, oh lovely shot. What hand-eye coordination! His feet didn't move a great deal as he creamed the length ball on the up through cover-point
S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, a tame flat-drive through cover to get to his fifty, but that won't help. 4/4 wins for SRH at home, yet again their bowling comes to the rescue. Superb death bowling
S Kaul to Samson, SIX, lofts him into the stands. What a way to get off the mark. Right in the slot from Kaul, and Samson goes through with an uninhibited swing over long-on

Siraj to Samson, SIX, another nonchalant strike over long-on! He makes it look ridiculously easy. The key is that Samson's head is so still while hitting through the line. Once the ball is full, he simply gets a small stride in, keeps his balance, and plays an extension of the on-drive

Siraj to Nair, FOUR, squeezes it through the ring. Full and wide ball, Nair plants his foot across and unfurls a drive through the covers. It didn't look like he get all of the timing, but on this outfield it's enough
Siraj to Nair, FOUR, top-edged over short fine leg. Unlucky Siraj. He's rushed Nair on the pull again and he's not in any control whatsoever
Rashid Khan to Samson, FOUR, drifts it in on leg, it's half-edged, half-deliberate. Samson played slightly outside the line expecting the ball to turn a bit too more but it skids on

Rashid Khan to Nair, FOUR, that's a shot which can eliminate the hassle of picking the turn. As soon as Rashid drifts it close to the stumps, Nair is down on the crease for the sweep and he slaps this nicely through mid-wicket

Henriques to Samson, FOUR, that will run away. Slightly straight from Henriques and Samson has picked him away so easily. The faintest of tickles to get it past the wicketkeeper. He's looking good again

Henriques to Nair, SIX, brilliant shot on the move. He's walking down the pitch, Henriques does him in length with an off-cutter but Nair is still able to loft him through the line over mid-off. He not only clears the infield, but the timing ensures that he clears the boundary too

Yuvraj to Samson, FOUR, what an interesting choice of bowler at this stage. Yuvraj for the first time in this tournament, and he's been spanked off the first ball. Short outside off, Samson slaps him hard through point

Yuvraj to Samson, out Nair Run Out!! 1 run completed. That's such an unfortunate way for this partnership to end. A run out. But what a timely breakthrough for the home team. The ball is nudged into the vacant mid-wicket region from Samson who wants two. They're both running hard from the get-go, so there's not any hesitation there. But what an effort from Vijay Shankar running in from the boundary. He swoops in quickly and fires a brilliant throw on the bounce right beside the stumps. Nair run out (Vijay Shankar/Yuvraj) 33(23) [4s-5 6s-1]

Yuvraj to Pant, out Caught by Warner!! Yuvraj gets Pant. Oh that's such a big wicket. Pant was striking them brilliantly in the last game, and to get him first ball is massive. Should he have taken a bit more time rather than going for the slog first ball? You could argue. But that's how he's been playing so far. Yuvraj does well to get it slightly wide of off and Pant has to reach out for the slog-sweep. He wants to drag this over mid-wicket, but ends up miscuing to long-on. Pant c Warner b Yuvraj 0(1)

Jayant Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, swings hard and gets a boundary. Poor delivery as well from Yadav. A short ball, Dhawan slightly crouches and swishes it through mid-wicket. There is no protection there and Dhawan is away

Chris Morris to Warner, 1 run, direct hit would have made things interesting. Pitched up delivery outside off, Warner pushes to mid-off and sets off. He puts in a dive. But had Jayant Yadav found the target, Warner would have been a goner

Chris Morris to Warner, out Caught by Mishra!! Big wicket for DD. How many times have we seen Warner get out like this? He was dismissed at least thrice in this manner in the previous Ashes. Short ball at a good pace - close to 145kph. Warner is caught in two minds - to go hard on his pull or just tap it on the on-side. In the end, he brings his bat down a bit late and the ball lobs up off the leading edge. Mishra, from short fine leg, runs forward and gobbles it up. Warner c Mishra b Chris Morris 4(7)

Pat Cummins to Williamson, SIX, fine shot! Short delivery around off, Williamson was on the front foot, but quickly transfered his weight back and pulled it behind square. There was a fielder in the deep, but placed it well wide of him

Mishra to Williamson, 2 runs, fifty for Williamson. First game and he's already making an impact. Whichever format it is just pleasing to watch KW bat. Moves away to the leg-side, reads the googly off the surface and works it in the gap in front of square on the leg-side, sprints back for the second and raises his bat to acknowledge the applause

Pat Cummins to Williamson, FOUR, up and over Cummins. Quicker the delivery and Williamson is so much more comfortable. Low full toss outside off, Williamson walks across and tonks it over the bowler. No chance for long-on or long-off

Mishra to Dhawan, FOUR, rubbish from Mishra and Dhawan deals with it. Darted full and down leg, Dhawan crouches low and helps it along the way past short fine. 100-run stand comes up with that boundary

Mishra to Williamson, SIX, even the tallest man in the team can't get a finger on that. Tossed up around off, Williamson makes room and drags the loft towards long-on. Morris was a few yards inside the rope and the ball sailed over his leap. If he had been on the edge, who knows

Mishra to Williamson, SIX, how is he not playing every game? He's turning it on here for SRH. Just a bit of air from Mishra, Williamson kneels down and nails the slog sweep to perfection, flat and over cow corner. BTW, it is his fifth six of the evening

Zaheer to Williamson, FOUR, buckle up folks this is going to be some contest. Zak with his funky fields and Williamson trying to bisect them. Full and on off, almost a yorker length, Williamson moves across and whips it over backward square. The fielder was inside the ring and he was nowhere near the ball

Zaheer to Dhawan, 1 run, fifty for Dhawan. His first of the season. After a couple of 40s, he finally has a half-century to his name. That should bring back the confidence in him. Williamson walks up and congratulates him on the milestone. The knuckle ball which is short in length, Dhawan is early into the pull and lobs it off the edge to fine leg

Mathews to Williamson, FOUR, this is batting of the highest order. The cross-seamer on a fuller length outside off, Williamson takes a step across and lofts it inside out through extra cover. Iyer at sweeper had no chance. The placement was equisite

Mathews to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson has certainly enjoyed batting against Mathews. Slower short ball, Williamson makes room and slaps the pull in front of square, bisecting deep mid-wicket and long-on

Chris Morris to Williamson, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Needed something special to get rid of Williamson and Iyer has pulled off a stunner. Dhawan pats the Kiwi on the back as he trudges off. It has been a high quality innings from Williamson. First opportunity and he's grabbed it with both hands. Good length ball on off, Williamson maintains a low base to hoick it into the leg-side, gets more of a leading edge towards deep mid-wicket. Iyer from deep square leg covers good ground, dives full length and clings on. Made it look easy did the Mumbaikar. Williamson c Shreyas Iyer b Chris Morris 89(51) [4s-6 6s-5]
Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan takes over the mantle. Short of a length delivery, Dhawan swivels and pulls it over the leaping backward square fielder. Just about eluded Mathews there

Chris Morris to Dhawan, no run, direct hit and Yuvraj would have had a diamond duck to his name. Very full and on leg-stump, Dhawan misses the flick and is rapped on the pads, the ball rolls to the left of Morris and Yuvraj was backing up for the run. Dhawan sends him back and Morris fires a throw which is off-target

Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, streaky and Dhawan won't mind. Morris looks down in frustration. Deceived Dhawan with a slower delivery and the opener just threw his hands at that, the outside edge evades the outstretched left hand of Pant

Mathews to Dhawan, SIX, geez! That ball hardly left the surface. A flat six from Dhawan. Mathews missed the yorker by a good couple of inches, Dhawan got underneath it and heaved it over deep mid-wicket. Mathews leaking plenty

Chris Morris to Dhawan, out Caught by Mathews!! Third wicket for Morris. Not his best of deliveries, but he wouldn't mind as it takes his wicket tally into double digits. Short of length and on leg-stump, Dhawan premeditated and got inside the line, he gets the pull off the cue-end and Mathews at deep backward square made no mistake. Dhawan c Mathews b Chris Morris 70(50) [4s-7 6s-1]

Chris Morris to Yuvraj, out Bowled!! Top nut! Morris doing the damage for SRH in the death overs. This is a big wicket, with couple of overs to go, Yuvraj would have unleashed himself. A yorker aimed for the base of leg-stump, Yuvraj attempts to flick, gets his legs inside the line and allows the ball to slip past him, crashes into the leg-pole. He's on a hat-trick as well. Yuvraj b Chris Morris 3(4)

Zaheer to Deepak Hooda, SIX, crack! That was the sound when ball made contact with the bat. A gift from Zaheer and Hooda takes full toll, full toss on the pads, Hooda swings hard and dispatches it over deep square leg
Zaheer to Henriques, FOUR, charges down and even though Zaheer digs it in short, Henriques pulls with a full pivot of the front leg, split deep mid-wicket and deep square leg to perfection
Zaheer to Henriques, FOUR, Zaheer wanted the yorker, but instead offers a full delivery, Henriques lofts it straight back down the ground, no chance for the man at long-off to cut that off

Chris Morris to Williamson, FOUR, class written all over that shot. Seam-up delivery from a short of length. Width on offer as well. Williamson waits for the ball on the back foot and cuts it behind backward point. No chance for third man

Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, Morris is trying too much here. Bangs it in short and offers ample width outside off for Dhawan to free his arms. Dhawan jumps and elevates it over point. It came right off the middle of the bat

Pat Cummins to Dhawan, FOUR, shot! That was bowled at 143kph. Short of a good length delivery outside off, Dhawan gets on top of it and caresses it between mid-off and extra cover. No need to run for shots like that
Mathews to Williamson, SIX, length ball at 123kph. Williamson trusts the bounce, gets into a good position and dispatches it over mid-wicket. Off the sweet spot of the bat

Mathews to Williamson, SIX, even better! Williamson is looking in fine touch here. Shimmies down the ground and lofts it over long-off. Exquisite timing. He didn't try to hit the ball hard. Relied on timing

Pat Cummins to Dhawan, FOUR, Cummins comes round the wicket and bangs it in short. Dhawan slightly moves across and goes with his pull shot. He wasn't under control, but got enough wood on it to send it wide of the keeper. The boundary also brings up the 50-run stand

Zaheer to Williamson, FOUR, cheeky and effective! Williamson anticipated where Zaheer would bowl and moved across the crease well before the ball was released. Uses the pace on this delivery and laps it over short fine leg. A couple of bounces into the fence

Hardik Pandya to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, and Marsh is off the mark with a boundary. Poor delivery from Pandya, maybe he was trying to bowl the inswinger from just outside off stump but lost control and delivered a ball that was short and wide, easy cut shot through cover-point

McClenaghan to Amla, FOUR, was that another chance? Looked like Nitish Rana got a fingertip to it and would be called a dropped chance. Fullish and angled across outside off stump, Amla squre-drives on the rise, the man at backward point moved to his left and tried to reverse-cup the ball but couldn't hold on

Krunal Pandya to Amla, SIX, why is Pollard not at long-on? The only man who could have had a chance, but this would have cleared him as well. Currently, it is Nitish Rana who is patrolling the fence. Flatter delivery on the leg stump, Amla lofts over the top and clears the long-on boundary

Krunal Pandya to Saha, out Bowled!! Saha never looked comfortable against Krunal Pandya. Looks to loft over long-on, Pandya spots his intentions and held his length back slightly, it drifts in slowly with great amount of dip to slide and slip into the leg peg. Brilliant work. Saha b Krunal Pandya 11(15)
Malinga to Amla, FOUR, slower ball, Amla shows his class. Shuffles forward and towards the delivery and opens the bat face to slice it behind point. Pure timing
