Malinga to Amla, FOUR, just a mere extension of the punch. Played it with leaden-feet and timed it to perfection, waited for the full ball to dip and graced it with touch of elegance. Back over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four
Malinga to Amla, 1 run, slower and wider, Amla had to fetch, pings a single to cover to celebrate his fifty. Job half-done, his team-mates are a happy bunch in the dugout
Krunal Pandya to Amla, FOUR, cuts and cuts well does Hashim Amla. Stays deep inside the crease and rotates his wrists through a fierce cut, beating a diving backward point to his right
Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, pacy bouncer and Maxwell isn't holding back this time. Wields his willow through a fiery pull and top-edges it over the keeper's head

Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, that's brutalized behind square on the off-side. That bouncer might have just woken him up. Clears his front leg, waits for the length ball to arrive and smashes it with the amount of power only MAXI can generate. Those Popeye arms..woof!

McClenaghan to Maxwell, SIX, Maxi has arrived. "The juices are flowing for Glenn Maxwell," Mike Hussey on air is all excited. Gets underneath a full delivery and sends it soaring into the stands over long-on
McClenaghan to Maxwell, SIX, D-I-S-M-I-S-S-I-V-E! No change of length, in the slot and Maxwell whangs it like a fire-cracker over long-off

McClenaghan to Maxwell, FOUR, emergency, emergency! The bowlers are being thrashed, someone send an ambulance. Maxi is putting up a clinic. This is some batting. McClenaghan bowls it straight, marmalized wide of long-on
McClenaghan to Maxwell, SIX, full toss again, you gotta be kidding me. Maxwell uses every ounce of his muscular stamina to whip-loft it into mars. Bam!
McClenaghan to Maxwell, no ball, FOUR, front foot no-ball and bang! Maxwell whups a full toss with over a leaping backward point

Malinga to Amla, SIX, that has gone out of the stadium. Things that T20 cricket do, Hashim Amla can hit the long ball. What's more amazing is the power he generated behind the shot, Amla picks the change of pace and spank-banged it over the top-tier over long-off with a bat velocity of 135KPH
Malinga to Amla, SIX, 72 metres maximum square on the off-side. Well, well! Amla is nailing it. He is treating Malinga like a club bowler, hammers him with a throw of the kitch sink on the off-side
Malinga to Amla, FOUR, bludgeoned straight down the ground, don't bother looking back Mr Slinga-Malinga
Malinga to Amla, FOUR, full toss on leg-stump, Amla helps it on its way with a flick of his wrists. So easily done. 50 runs from the last 2 overs

Bumrah to Maxwell, out Bowled!! My fingers became numb, so did the atmosphere around the office and in Indore too. Lack of pace foxes Maxwell. He picked it late and was through the shot early, the ball cut back in before deflecting off his pads onto the stumps. An absolute gem of a knock from the BigShow. Maxwell b Bumrah 40(18) [4s-4 6s-3]

McClenaghan to Stoinis, out Caught by Pollard!! Slower ball again and Stoinis holes out to long-on. Clears his front leg and looks to tonk it into the stands, doesn't get the distance, off the cue end of the bat and straight into the ever-safe hands of KP. Stoinis c Pollard b McClenaghan 1(3)

McClenaghan to Amla, FOUR, room on offer and Amla uses it to great effect. Carves the short ball over point giving no chance for sweeper cover to cut it off. Amla on fire, just 17 away from the triple treat

Bumrah to Amla, FOUR, across his stumps and way she goes into the fine leg fence. Sweetly timed, Bumrah has no clue. Amla walked a long way across and helped the full delivery with a real tap of the bat. Flew!
Malinga to Amla, SIX, short ball, Amla clatters the pull off the top-edge, over the keeper's head but who cares? It's a six
Malinga to Amla, SIX. First T20 hundred for Hashim Amla. What.A.Player. He posts a leg-side rubbish into the fine leg stands with a clean wallop. Sigh!

Hardik Pandya to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, that's an excellent shot from Marsh. Shortish and rising high, Marsh stood tall and cut it away over point, didn't bother to keep the ball down and it raced to the fence in no time

Hardik Pandya to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, this time he cuts along the ground, the length wasn't all that shorter compared to the previous ball, Marsh timed that shot sweetly as well and pierced the gap between cover-point and cover

Harbhajan to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, that's asking for trouble. Short and way outside off stump, the arm-ball gone wrong, maybe the newish ball slipped out of his hands, Marsh had to reach out and he cut that fiercely past point

Malinga to Amla, SIX, wowww! It's always interesting to see Amla play aggressive cricket. This was an authoritative hit. Malinga seemed surprise by that approach. He bowled a normal back of a length delivery, but Amla had made up his mind to go big, went back in the crease and launched it over long-on for the first maximum of the day

McClenaghan to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, the slower ball doesn't stick on the surface and sits up nicely for Marsh to thrash that away for four with a pull shot. Hit with some power and the man in the deep had no chance

McClenaghan to Shaun Marsh, out Caught by Pollard!! Oopsy! Marsh is out against the run of play. Certainly not a great delivery, could have been easily put away, but as luck would have it, the bat turned in Marsh's hands and brought about his downfall. Number one down for Punjab after a brisk 46-run opening stand. This was a full ball, Marsh wanted the flick again having missed out off the third bal of the over, but he totally mistimed it and offered a simple catch to Pollard at mid-wicket. Shaun Marsh c Pollard b McClenaghan 26(21) [4s-5]

Sandeep Sharma to Buttler, SIX, easy as! That's just a flick off the wrists and the ball has flown away over mid-wicket. A little shimmy down the pitch from Buttler to get close to the ball, picks it away with sumptuous timing. He's been lukewarm so far in the IPL. Can tonight be the night?

Ishant to Buttler, FOUR, steers the ball through point for four. Good length ball outside off, Buttler's feet don't move a lot as he opens the bat-face and guides the ball in the gap. The timing stands out again

Ishant to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, stand and admire! That's a scorching drive. Wow. That's not a half-volley, not even close. But Parthiv still manages to blaze it away on the up. He hit that uppishly but found the gap
Ishant to Nitish Rana, SIX, we're into the mode of having fun now. A wide yorker gone wrong. Shortened by a few inches and Rana just leans low, crouches and whacks it down the ground

Ishant to Buttler, 1 run, 140kph, and sliced away even faster. Keeps it wide making Buttler stretch every cell of his body in getting close. Does with a square stab. Brings up the 50 between the duo as well

Swapnil Singh to Nitish Rana, SIX, right in the slot. Talk of the pressure of a chase. Mumbai do not seem to understand though. Sinks, buries and slogs it into the night sky. Rows into the cow corner stands

Swapnil Singh to Nitish Rana, SIX, the misery is piled on. This time with the length getting even more horrific. In the form of a rank drag down. A rock back, a swivel and a dispatch off a flat batted mow into the mid-wicket stands

Sandeep Sharma to Buttler, SIX, whoa. Brute. Angry. These bottom hands. These big bats. All in one. Clears his front leg getting it out of the way does Buttler, gets under the friendly length delivery and just jabs it over long-off. The flattest you'd have seen

Sandeep Sharma to Buttler, SIX, a miscue? Does it matter? It continues to fly. More of the sitters from Sandeep enabling Buttler to get on top of the bounce and he just clobbers it over cow corner. The required run-rate is a mockery now

Mohit Sharma to Buttler, out Caught by Maxwell!! The misery closes. The carnage is over. Looks for another tonk down the ground in looking to finish this off in a hurry. Just that the bat handle rolls in his palms for a change and the ball doesn't get the distance. A miscued slice flies high up and falls into the palms of mid-off. A knock for the centuries nevertheless. Buttler c Maxwell b Mohit Sharma 77(37) [4s-7 6s-5]

Ishant to Nitish Rana, SIX, 180-degrees on the other side from the one he'd intended to go over. But the maximums only keep coming. Gets the ball to climb up awkwardly does Ishant getting it up on the ribs and Rana just swings his bat looking to go over cow corner again with the familiar hits. Gets the familiar result though with the top-edge flying over the cordon. And his third half-century of this season too
Ishant to Hardik Pandya, SIX, another bat. Another rocket launcher. The angry flat bat face is up and so is the usage in whacking it. Boom. Back into the third stand. Over mid-wicket

Ishant to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, a low full toss. Ishant well and truly on his way to some unwanted bowling figures tonight. Pandya meanwhile just about clears his front leg and slices it past a tired extra cover at the fence. Spare a thought

Ishant to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, and again. Ishant has 58 against his name. A full delivery hoping to veer into the blockhole and Pandya digs it out with the bat gaining all the momentum to be imparted with a smash past the bowler. Long-off doesn't even want to take the effort in chasing this. Futile I tell you

Mohit Sharma to Nitish Rana, SIX, that's that. A real mockery this. A target of almost 200 and Mumbai do it with time to spare to go after another. Mohit meanwhile bends his back in banging it half way down the track and Rana just swivels as he hooks it into the second floor. Over long leg

Sandeep Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, with the keeper up, Buttler doesn't give the charge. What he does is back away to make room and laces a drive off the stumps through extra-cover. Sandeep had overpitched there and gets drilled to the boundary

Sandeep Sharma to Buttler, SIX, oh my! KXIP won't be liking this. They don't want to run into Buttler on the wrong night. And so far, the signs are ominous. Buttler exposes his stumps again, backs away, and smokes a low full toss over extra-cover. Flat six
Ishant to Parthiv Patel, SIX, good length ball on leg stump, Parthiv whips it gloriously into the fine leg stands. What a pick up! The runs are flowing for Mumbai

Ishant to Buttler, FOUR, oh dear, is Miller okay? That burst through his hands and hit him on the head. Luckily, it looks like just a glancing blow. The good length ball was hit ferociously by Buttler and it flew towards extra-cover. Would have taken some catching but Miller would normally back himself
Ishant to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, wrong lines from Ishant, and Parthiv will pick him away from there all day everday. Fullish on the pads, he's been flicked away behind square
Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, there's no stopping the boundaries. Mohit bangs it in first ball and he's been ramped over the keeper's head. What a start for Mumbai. They're absolutely flying

Mohit Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, picks the slower ball and thumps it through extra-cover. Carnage in Indore. It was a back of length off-cutter and somehow Buttler managed to infuse enough power on the drive off the back foot
Mohit Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, drifts into the pads, and with fine leg up, that's asking for punishment. Buttler duly puts him away to the boundary. Good wristwork

Mohit Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, 17 off the first over from Mohit. I think Maxwell will have to turn to spin. His pacers are disappearing. Slower ball outside off, it's full and in the slot, and Buttler nails him through extra-cover again

Stoinis to Parthiv Patel, SIX, backs away, Stoinis bangs it in, and Parthiv spanks him off the front foot well in front of square. That's gone all the way. It's just flying off their bats. Amazing timing
Stoinis to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's a sizzler! He's absolutely scythed that through point. A little bit of width from Stoinis, Parthiv adds to it by making some room and slashes it away

Stoinis to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Maxwell!! Pace off the ball gets Parthiv. It's an off-cutter bowled on a back of length outside off, Parthiv tries to flat-bat it down the ground but he's not in control of the shot and slices it up in the air to mid-off. Relief for Punjab. Parthiv Patel c Maxwell b Stoinis 37(18) [4s-4 6s-2]

Stoinis to Nitish Rana, SIX, any confirmation needed about what form Rana has been in? Have a look at this. He's pulled that into the stands, making it look so easy. Short of length over leg-stump, that's usually a very awkward line. But Rana's so quick to get outside the line of it and then helps it on its way over fine leg

Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR, sliced in the air, the bat turned on impact there. But Buttler will still get four. He can't do much wrong tonight. Backs away a touch to what was probably a slower ball and is able to place it wide of long-off, the ball turning away from the fielder further after bouncing
Axar to Buttler, 1 run, slid in from round the wicket, Buttler jabs it to the right of long-on and brings up his half-century. Mumbai will hope that this knock gets his season going

Axar to Nitish Rana, SIX, Axar fires this well outside off and would have hoped that he's got this out of Rana's reach. But Rana is still able to fetch the slog-sweep comfortably over wide long-on. Amazing shot

Axar to Buttler, SIX, that's almost a seam-up delivery from Axar, but he's landed it way too short and Buttler parks him into the crowd. He uses the depth of the crease well and pulls it over mid-wicket

Shakib to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, McCullum is underway! Shakib fires it in full on middle, McCullum drills it down the ground. The umpire has to duck under it to evade that. The ball races away into the fence
Shakib to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, offers bit of width outside off and McCullum latches onto it. Treks back in his crease and fiercely cuts through covers. Good start for GL
Narine to Finch, FOUR, shot! Trademark Finch shot. Seam-up delivery wide of off, Finch manufactures more room by backing away. Lifts it inside-out over the cover region

Narine to Finch, SIX, wow! The intention is clear from both batsmen. Slightly overpitched, Finch gets low and smacks the slog sweep over deep mid-wicket. There was a man in the deep, but he couldn't do anything
Narine to Raina, FOUR, gets into a picturesque position as he loft-drives Narine over extra cover. On one knee mind you, sweetly timed and in the gap as well
Narine to Raina, FOUR, is quick to jummp onto the back foot, gets inside the line of the flatter delivery and thumps it with a clean swing of the willow. A boundary behind square on the leg-side

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, FOUR, deft! Raina camps deep inside the crease and steers the ball with softest of touches as he opens the bat face at the right moment. Needed a dive from Narine at short third man, he is just lazing around

Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by U Yadav!! And this is what [Most] players do when they don't have a clue of which way the ball is turning. Ishan Kishan belongs to the same genre, or at least, looked like so. Crouches and looks to break the shackles with a slog-sweep, poor connection, Umesh Yadav takes a well-judged catch at deep backward square. Ishan Kishan c U Yadav b Kuldeep Yadav 4(11)
Kuldeep Yadav to Dwayne Smith, FOUR. No sighters. Walk in and get a boundary. As simple as that. Slog-sweeps from outside off and boy! The ball flies away

U Yadav to Dwayne Smith, out Bowled!! Makes a mess of Dwayne Smith's stumps does Umesh Yadav. Sheer pace. Steams in and bowls it at full throttle, it was pitched on a fuller length and snapped back in slightly, Smith was late to get his bat down. It grazes a chunk of bottom edge before crashing into the stumps. TIMBAHHHH! Dwayne Smith b U Yadav 5(4) [4s-1]
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, FOUR, just a slice of inside edge and through. It skids straight on and nicks the edge before racing past the leg-stump. Tough for Robbie to pick
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 1 run, drives to the right of a diving bowler and marks his fifty
U Yadav to Raina, SIX, picks the slower ball and deposits into the crowd. An off-cutter from Yadav, Raina backs away and nails the slog sweep from a length. Sailing over mid-wicket
U Yadav to Raina, FOUR, there's the width which Raina has been eyeing. It's on the shorter side too, and Raina is able to lash it away past backward point. Beats third man to the boundary

Narine to Jadeja, SIX, top-edged .. and taken by Surya at long-on. But he's stepped on the boundary cushion. Straightaway signals a six, making it easy for the umpire. A desperate move from Jadeja after three dot balls, he nearly falters but somehow the top-edge flies right at the edge of the boundary, where Surya does really well having stationed himself just inside the ropes. But his weight is leaning back as he stretches overhead and the momentum takes him over
Coulter-Nile to Raina, FOUR, length ball outside off, Raina moves leg-side and slaps it straight back past the bowler. Mid-off was up inside the ring, and Raina is able to slot it to his left

Coulter-Nile to Raina, FOUR, he's winning it for his team. Makes some room and nearly slices this overpitched delivery from off-stump. The placement is spot on, so is the timing as he nails this past backward point

Coulter-Nile to Raina, SIX, slower ball this time, and all the way. He's tearing into Coulter-Nile here. Picks up the change of pace right off the hand and whips the ball off middle and leg into the deep mid-wicket stands
Kuldeep Yadav to Jadeja, 1 run, generously tossed up on off, overpitches, and Jadeja drills it down to long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, SIX, quickly onto his back knee to smoke a slog-sweep over mid-wicket. He sees the ball drifting into leg, it's in the slot and Raina gets under it beautifully. Just 8 needed now

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, out Caught by M Pandey!! Raina perishes just short of the finish line. It's a flat leg-break outside off, Raina wants to cut but the ball turns away sharply and takes a thick top-edge. It loops up to the left of Pandey at point who takes a really sharp catch diving across. End of a fine knock, and surely a match-winning one. Raina c M Pandey b Kuldeep Yadav 84(46) [4s-9 6s-4]

Coulter-Nile to Jadeja, FOUR, Jadeja seals it with a boundary! Short from Coulter-Nile, enough width for Jadeja to slap it past backward point. Superb chase from the Gujarat Lions to hopefully provide a boost to their turbulent campaign
Narine to Finch, FOUR, 16 off the over. Short, seam-up delivery outside off, cracking cut well in front of square on the off-side
Shakib to Finch, FOUR, wow! He has muscled it. With mid-on inside the cirlce, that's a safe shot. Backs away a tad and tonks this fullish delivery over mid-on
Shakib to Finch, FOUR, this is brilliant batting from the Victorian. Sees it in his slot and lifts it handsomely over mid-on
Shakib to Finch, SIX, second six for Finch and GL are off to a flier. Waits for this slingy ball to come to him and dispatches it into the long-on stands. 15 runs off the over

Coulter-Nile to Finch, out Caught by M Pandey!! Gone! Coulter-Nile gets his man. After bowling a slower bouncer, Coulter-Nile opts for the quicker one this time. Finch is slightly late on his pull as he is hurried by the pace. Gets it off the top portion of the bat. Pandey at deep square leg, settles under it and takes it calmly. Finch c M Pandey b Coulter-Nile 31(15) [4s-4 6s-2]

Coulter-Nile to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that came right off the middle of the bat. Angling in short of length delivery, McCullum jogs down and leg-side-ish to cut it behind a diving backward point. No chance whatsoever for third man

Coulter-Nile to Brendon McCullum, SIX, 50 up for GL in 23 balls! Head-high bouncer, McCullum isn't perplexed by that. He is on the front foot to pummel the pull well in front of square on the leg-side. The deep mid-wicket fielder is just a spectator

Coulter-Nile to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, 16 off the fourth over. Superb adjustment. Seeing McCullum jogging down, Coulter-Nile darts it outside off, McCullum spots it slices it backward of point. One bounce into the fence

Narine to Raina, no run, dropped! The odds of this happening are high when you field a non-regular keeper. Raina pokes at a turning off-break and gets an outside edge. Uthappa fails to gobble it up. How costly is that going to be?
Shakib to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, shot! McCullum moves leg-side and Shakib follows him and darts it in. McCullum crouches low and smacks it with a sweep through backward square leg

Woakes to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by M Pandey!! Would you believe it? B-Mac has carved one straight down the throat of sweeper cover, Manish Pandey, the man. Didn't even had to move an inch. Gives himself a lot of room and takes on a 140ks full delivery, smacked it off the meat and for a fleeting moment I thought it was a maximum. Not to be. Brendon McCullum c M Pandey b Woakes 33(17) [4s-5 6s-1]
Woakes to Raina, FOUR, room on offer and Raina makes the most of it. Adjusted well as he rose high to flay it past a diving backward point

Coulter-Nile to Karthik, out Caught by Gambhir!! Nathan Coulter-Nile continues to pick wickets. DK reveals his cards a touch too early, seeks to flick into the on-side and sends a leading edge into the off-side. Gambhir lurking at cover anticipates and takes a good catch diving to his left. The ball popped up off his palm, but he hung onto it while falling parallel to the ground. Karthik c Gambhir b Coulter-Nile 3(3)

Woakes to Raina, FOUR, quintessential Suresh Raina inside-out loft over extra cover. Anyone surprised? He does this so often and that too off the first ball of the over. Makes room and goes bang off the middle

Woakes to Raina, SIX, just grazes Pathan's fingertips at fine leg. Hooks a short ball and wasn't quite in control of it, it loops up and goes flat to the right of fine leg who sprints with his right hand stretched to the maximum. Just can't get there

P Kumar to Narine, FOUR, that's Daren Sammy alike from Sunil Narine. The former is very good with his whip without moving his feet much and Narine has emulated him. The line is straight on the stumps from PK, Narine stands and flicks stylishly over backward square leg and beats the man at fine leg

P Kumar to Narine, FOUR, now that's some response from Narine. He knows that the outswinger is troubling him, steps down the pitch and forces the bowler to drop it short, which will not allow the ball to swing, and then he goes back over the bowler's head for a boundary

P Kumar to Narine, FOUR, he's doing it nicely, Sunil Narine! Just what Gambhir and Co. wanted with the promotion. PK bowls short of length and just outside off stump, Narine waits for the ball to come and hits through the line over mid-on

Faulkner to Narine, FOUR, Faulkner sports an "Ooohhhh," with a wry smile on his face. This wasn't a bad delivery. Full and swinging away outside off stump, Narine drives without moving his feet, sends it to the right of mid-off and it races away
Faulkner to Narine, FOUR, that's edged and no one at slip. Faulkner delivers one outside off stump, Narine goes hard at it and gets a thick edge that escapes past the keeper

Faulkner to Narine, FOUR, off the back foot and over mid-off. This is great exhibition of batting from the West Indian. Short of a length just outside off stump, Narine lofts nicely from the middle of the bat and collects his sixth boundary

D Kulkarni to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa is the best front foot puller. Picks the back of a length delivery early, just plonks his foot forward and short-arm jabs the pull over cow corner. Flat and all the way

D Kulkarni to Uthappa, FOUR, deft, delicate and effective. The off-cutter outside off, Uthappa waited for the ball to arrive, cut it late and pierced short third man and backward point to perfection. He couldn't have played that better

Faulkner to Uthappa, FOUR, the idea was to steer it to third man, but Uthappa got it finer than he would have liked. Slower delivery angled across the batsman, Uthappa gets an edge that eludes Karthik to his right. Should he have gone for the catch? Tough one to call

Faulkner to Gambhir, out Caught by Raina!! The partnership has been broken. If you wanted someone from the GL team to be under this skier, it would be Raina. Short of a length and on off, Gambhir went for the pull and the top-edge goes straight up, keeps swirling and almost kisses the night sky before coming down, Raina from mid-wicket, called for it, removed his cap to get a good sighter and then reverse cupped it safely. Gambhir c Raina b Faulkner 33(28) [4s-1 6s-1]

Faulkner to M Pandey, FOUR, that was just a nudge and the lightning fast Kolkata outfield does the rest. Short of length and on the batsman's hips, Pandey backed away and twirled his wrists to place it wide of short fine leg, once in the gap it was a boundary
Jadeja to Uthappa, FOUR, uses the pace of Jadeja and collects a boundary. Pushed through just outside off, Uthappa waits and steers it fine. Once past the 30-yard circle, there's no stopping that

Jadeja to Uthappa, FOUR, fifty for Uthappa. Second for him this season. Gets there with a cheeky little scoop. Expects Jadeja to target the stumps, shuffles across and gets low, then laps it over Karthik to bring up the milestone

Basil Thampi to Uthappa, FOUR, that might be the commentators curse. Thampi missed the yorker by a few yards, low full toss on middle, Uthappa flicks it to the fine leg fence. The fast outfield on display again

Basil Thampi to Uthappa, FOUR, the ball hits the turf and zips off. McCullum had a few yards to cover and he couldn't get there. Very full and just outside off, Uthappa lofts it wide of long-off, one bounce four

Basil Thampi to Uthappa, SIX, 10 off the first two balls. The back of the hand slower one does not come out right for Thampi, ends up as a nice juicy full toss for Uthappa, who heaves it into the crowd at deep mid-wicket

P Kumar to Uthappa, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! A fine knock comes to an end. He had to go and could only manage a miscue to long-on. Might have been the slower one from Pk, the speedgun shows it as 119kph, Uthappa wanted to hit it straight back over him, got it nowhere close to the middle and McCullum running across from long-on takes it with ease. Uthappa c Brendon McCullum b P Kumar 72(48) [4s-8 6s-2]

P Kumar to Y Pathan, FOUR, top shot! PK missed his yorker by a couple of inches and that was enough for Pathan, he opened the bat face on the loft and placed it wide of long-off. The opening of the bat was important to get the placement right

P Kumar to Y Pathan, FOUR, last two balls ruins the over for PK. It was turning out to be a good over until then. Full toss on middle and leg, Pathan whips it square and there's no protection in the deep, 12 off the over
Basil Thampi to M Pandey, FOUR, full toss and Pandey cashes in. He stands deep in the crease and slices the drive square on the off-side, sweeper had no chance of cutting that off

Basil Thampi to M Pandey, out Bowled!! Thampi deserved that wicket. Has his arms aloft and roars in delight as well. A yorker that swirls back in, Pandey clears his front leg to have a clear swing of the arms, missed and the ball deflected off the pads, crashed into middle stump. Pandey never looked at ease in his stay. M Pandey b Basil Thampi 24(21) [4s-2]

Basil Thampi to Y Pathan, out Suryakumar Yadav Run Out!! 1 run completed. What was Pathan doing? Suryakumar wanted to give him the strike and Pathan didn't budge. Very full delivery around off, Pathan squeezes the drive to long-off. Baz gets across to the ball quickly and fires a wide throw to the striker's end. Karthik collects and throws the ball on to the stumps. Suryakumar was sent back and he couldn't get back in time. Caught well short of the crease. Suryakumar Yadav run out (Brendon McCullum/Karthik) 1(1)

Faulkner to Narine, FOUR, he's only dealing in boundaries. Faulkner tried the change of pace to fox the batsman, but it went too full and landed right in the slot for Narine to drive, credit to Narine for delaying the shot to get the timing right and hit it well wide of the man at long-off

Basil Thampi to Narine, FOUR, this is almost predictable. Basil Thampi has the pace to trouble Narine, so one could see the bouncer coming. Narine was already backing away before the bowler delivered the ball and easily managed to pull it over mid-on

Basil Thampi to Narine, FOUR, the idea was right from Basil Thampi - to opt for a fuller one as follow up for the bumper - the execution was poor. It's a full toss and Narine slices the drive over cover-point

Basil Thampi to Narine, SIX, gee, this is the shot of the match so far. Could well be the shot of the day. Highest score for Narine in T20s. Thampi bowls a length delivery on the leg stump, Narine goes leg-side and lofts the drive easily over mid-off and holds the pose for the cameras

Raina to Narine, out Caught by Faulkner!! In the airrrr, the timing is not there and mid-on back-pedals to take a good catch. The Narine cameo ends, but he's done a great job for his side. Raina bowls flat and on the leg stump cramping the batsman for room, Narine was on the back foot and couldn't time the pull shot well enough to collect another boundary. Totally mistimed it and holed out to mid-on. Narine c Faulkner b Raina 42(17) [4s-9 6s-1]

D Kulkarni to Uthappa, FOUR, that's a gift from Kulkarni. Short of a length delivery down the leg-side, Uthappa flicks, the outfield is fast, the ball races through backward square leg and fine leg had no chance
D Kulkarni to Gambhir, FOUR, that's too wide and Gambhir is a very good off-side player. Reaches out to meet the ball, was on a fuller length, creamed through cover from the middle of the bat

Raina to Uthappa, 1 run, uppish, catchable but Finch lets it slip. A tough chance though. Maybe a swifter fielder would have easily had that. Shortish delivery on the stumps, Uthappa mistimes the pull, Finch didn't move quickly to his right from long-on, tried to grab the ball with his right hand but couldn't
Raina to Uthappa, FOUR, very straight, Uthappa kneels down and pulls it along the ground through square leg, no protection in the deep. Looked like the ball came off the inside half of the bat

Jadeja to Gambhir, SIX, that's easy pickings for Gambhir. Full and outside off stump, the ball is turning back in, so the mid-wicket area is a favourite zone for a left-hander, Gambhir swings with the spin and sends this all the way - the first six for him this season

Dwayne Smith to Gambhir, 4 runs, oh dear, Jadeja misses the stumps and it's gone for four overthrows. A direct-hit would have seen Gambhir walk back though. It looked very interesting when he chose the striker's end, despite Uthappa being halfway down the pitch. Should have been a dot ball, but it's four runs now. Gambhir tapped this to point and thought about a run, took a couple of steps out of the crease, his partner was charging towards the other end, but Gambhir sent him back. All well in the end for KKR
Dwayne Smith to Gambhir, 1 run, steered away to third man

Rashid Khan to Smith, out Bowled!! Rashid has broken through. Look at him go. He's thrilled with the wicket of the Pune captain. It's that googly again. Snakes it back in from outside off and cramps Smith up as he lines up a cut. Not sure if he picked it. The ball takes a thick under-edge, goes onto back pad and clips the outside of off stump. Big wicket at this stage. Smith furious with himself. Smith b Rashid Khan 27(21) [4s-1 6s-2]
Siraj to Dhoni, FOUR, he's helicopter-slashed it through backward point. Not a great delivery. It's short and wide from Siraj, just the kind of ball Dhoni needs to break his shackles

Siraj to Dhoni, 1 run, Tripathi had given up there. But backward point has just one stump to aim at and Vijay Shankar, who is on as a substitute, misses. Even wider than the previous ball and Dhoni has to really reach out for the cut. He mistimes it to the left of the fielder who turns around quickly after collecting and fires it in. Not great judgement from these two batsmen

Rashid Khan to Dhoni, out Tripathi Run Out!! That's superb from Rashid Khan, but equally horrendous running. Never a run there. Rashid sees Dhoni coming down and spears it into his pads. The ball rolls away beside the pitch and they decide to go through for a single. Dhoni had a headstart there which may have swayed his thinking. Tripathi was never going to get there. Rashid swoops across, picks up the ball and fires the stump with Tripathi two-three feet short. Tripathi run out (Rashid Khan) 59(41) [4s-6 6s-3]

S Kaul to Dhoni, SIX, that's as flat a six as they come. Never got over 10 feet above the ground. Lots of power in the bottom hand as Dhoni swipes an overpitched delivery over wide long-on. Not easy to get under those

S Kaul to Stokes, FOUR, carves it beautifully over extra-cover. Kaul slanted it away outside off and Stokes used the angle to his advantage. It looked like he got it close to the bottom of the bat but it still flies away

Bhuvneshwar to Stokes, out Caught by (sub)Vijay Shankar!! Full at the stumps, Stokes whips it away and it's gone straight to deep mid-wicket. Bhuvneshwar can do no wrong at the death these days. Despite missing the blockhole, he's still able to keep it full enough to ensure that Stokes's wrists can't power it over the boundary. You don't want to get near Stokes right now. He slams his bat into the ground after crossing the boundary. There's smoke coming out there. Stokes c (sub)Vijay Shankar b Bhuvneshwar 10(9) [4s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, questions are bound to be raised over Tiwary's batting position. To my mind at least, he's been in stunning form of late. Such brilliant timing as he whips a full ball from outside off through mid-wicket. RPS needed that finish to what had been a quiet over

Siraj to Dhoni, 1 run, just about carries to Bhuvneshwar but he cannot hold on. Pops out of his fingertips. A low full toss which is very wide of off and Dhoni squirts it right off the toe-end as he reaches out
Siraj to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, walks across towards off and effortlessly picks it away over backward square leg. Brilliantly timed yet again. Fine leg was up inside the ring and Tiwary picked his spot

Siraj to Dhoni, SIX, he's muscled that over the long-on boundary. Nothing but brute power. It's a decent ball from Siraj: a leg-cutter wide of off. But Dhoni swings his hips, pumps his arms and flat-bats it away

Siraj to Dhoni, FOUR, he's getting into his stride now. An upper-cut over backward point for four. Siraj goes short outside off, it's not a very safe delivery with third man up. It's not a safe delivery at all. Dhoni keeps his shape, doesn't go very hard and just glides it over the fielder

Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, FOUR, gets it between his own legs and gets it for four. So unfortunate for Bhuvneshwar. It's a cracking delivery this. Almost a yorker at the stumps, Dhoni tries to whip it away but nutmegs himself off a thick inside edge and splits square leg and short fine
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, FOUR, full and very wide outside off, Dhoni reaches out and slices it over backward point. Dhoni is turning the tables now

Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, SIX, hit hard, hit flat, six! Dhoni, you have been missed. That's sensational ball-striking. It's very full from Bhuvneshwar, most players won't be able to get under it but Dhoni's wrists and the power he generates are something else. A Dhoni special

S Kaul to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, that's been dropped right at the edge of the boundary. A swirling swipe from Tiwary, the ball gets caught up in the wind and presents the opportunity to Rashid at deep mid-wicket. The ropes would have been on his mind all the time as he's treading a thin line. And he spills the catch
S Kaul to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, good length delivery outside off, Tiwary mistimes the drive to extra-cover

Bhuvneshwar to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi breaks the shackles! Runs down the track, looked like he lost his shape on the shot, ends up slapping it through extra-cover, beats the infield and rolls away to the fence

Bhuvneshwar to Tripathi, FOUR, edged and four, perfect length from Bhuvneshwar, fraction fuller and a hint of shape away from off, brought Tripathi forward into the defensive push, he nibbled at that, gets a thick edge and the ball races away past the keeper and into the fence
S Kaul to Dhoni, FOUR, MS Dhoni is back! He's back to what he does best. Kaul misses his mark, bowls it full in the slot and Dhoni spears him through extra-cover for the boundary

Bipul Sharma to Rahane, out Caught by S Kaul!! Bipul has got his man! He slowed down the pace, the length made Rahane come down the track, there was no pace on the ball. Rahane had to manufacture all the power behind the shot, he was playing against the wind, ends up chipping a dolly - down to the throat of mid-on. Kaul ran across to his right and accepted the offering. Rahane c S Kaul b Bipul Sharma 2(7)
Bipul Sharma to Tripathi, FOUR, tossed up outside leg, Tripathi was looking to play the sweep, gets a fat top-edge, fine leg was inside the ring and the ball lobs him, into the fence

Bipul Sharma to Smith, FOUR, lovely shot, Smith comes down the track, gets to the ball on the half-volley and lifts it back over the bowler's head, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Siraj to Tripathi, 2 runs, Bipul has made a meal of a skier, he never settled himself under the ball, only manages to get his fingertips and lets the ball pop out. This was banged in short and on the stumps, Tripathi was looking to pull, gets a fat top-edge, high and behind square on the on-side. Bipul called for the catch, it kept swirling around, so did he and wasn't in any position in the end
Siraj to Tripathi, SIX, cracking shot, banged in short and on the stumps, Tripathi was waiting on it, swivels across and pulls it high and over square leg, no need to run for those

Siraj to Tripathi, FOUR, this is even better, length delivery outside off, Tripathi comes down the track, makes room as he did so and cracks it square on the off-side, hit on the up and in the gap past point

S Kaul to Tripathi, SIX, beautifully played, Tripathi is making SRH suffer for dropping him, runs down the track, driven on the up - played with the full face of the bat, a high elbow and deep into the stands at long-on
S Kaul to Tripathi, FOUR, .. and he repeats the dose .. once again on the up after shimmying down the track, hits it in the air and in the gap between cover and mid-off, no need to run for those

S Kaul to Tripathi, SIX, for a moment, it looked like it went straight up in the air.. but Tripathi has managed to clear the fielder at deep point. This was full and wide of off, he lost his grip on the hand as he went chasing after it, ended up slicing it high and over cover. The fielder in the deep thought he had a chance, but ended watching it sail over his head. It was the slower ball from Kaul, thought he had done the batsman in by his clever change of pace
Rashid Khan to Tripathi, 1 run, maiden IPL fifty for Tripathi, pushed through outside off, Tripathi hangs back and works it wide of cover
Rashid Khan to Tripathi, FOUR, lovely shot, tad too short from Rashid, allows Tripathi to rock back and pull it wide of mid-wicket, no need to run for those
Bipul Sharma to Smith, SIX, massive, that ruins the over for Bipul, too full and just outside off, Smith bends down low and slogs it high and over mid-wicket, went sailing into the crowd

Bipul Sharma to Smith, SIX, Smith is ruining Bipul's figures here, slower and just outside off, Smith gets forward and thumps it high and wide of long-on, has the power to sail over the ropes, back-to-back sixes for Smith

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, down the track to ram the ball down the ground. He didn't quite get to the pitch of it as Unadkat saw him coming, but went through the line regardless. Beats mid-on comfortably

Stokes to Warner, no run, dropped, it's the Australian captain who has dropped his vice-captain. An Englishman looks aghast. Length delivery outside off, Warner got a big stride forward and drilled it straight to Smith at mid-off, in and out, that was a sitter

Stokes to Williamson, SIX, top-edge and six, no luck for Stokes today. Banged in short and on the stumps, Williamson was late on the pull, gets a fat top-edge that sails high and into the stands at long leg

Stokes to Williamson, FOUR, cracking shot, expensive over from Stokes, short and on the stumps, Williamson swivels across, rolls his wrists and bisects the two men in the deep on the on-side, rolls away to the fence in a hurry

Christian to Williamson, out Lbw!! Big wicket for Pune, but was the ball sliding down the leg-side? Williamson was done in for the lack of pace from Christian, he rolled his fingers across this slower ball and drifted it back into the right-hander, Williamson was shuffling across on the flick and missed, struck in front of middle and leg, but was the angle taking it down the leg-side? Need to see more replays, but Pune will not care one bit. Williamson lbw b Christian 21(14) [4s-1 6s-1]
SN Thakur to Henriques, FOUR, too short from Thakur, can't bowl that length with his pace. Henriques is quick to rock back and clears mid-wicket with the pull, a few bounces and over the ropes
SN Thakur to Henriques, FOUR, lovely, back-to-back boundaries for Henriques, runs down the track, gets close to the ball and drives it past the diving fielder at mid-off

Tahir to Warner, no ball, SIX, that should break the shackles for SRH and Warner, this was a high full-toss from Tahir, Warner was already pre-meditating the reverse sweep, ends up playing the switch hit and sends it high and over deep point for a maximum

Christian to Warner, FOUR, that's a poor ball from Christian, third man was inside the ring and he went full and wide outside off, Warner reached out for the slice, gets a thick outside edge that cleared the man in the ring
Unadkat to Henriques, SIX, SRH need many more of these, length delivery outside off, that's right in his hitting zone, clears his left leg and clouts it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum

Unadkat to Warner, out Bowled!! Warner tries to be too funky and instead loses his wicket. This was a length delivery on the stumps, Warner was setting himself up for the switch-hit, the length was a bit too full, he then decides to pull it away, gets the angles all wrong and misses the ball completely. It goes on and crashes into the top of off-stump. Warner falls after a rather subdued innings. Warner b Unadkat 43(40) [4s-3 6s-1]

Unadkat to Henriques, FOUR, beautifully played, Henriques is playing a fine hand here, short and wide from Unadkat, Henriques waits on it, uses the pace on the ball and cuts it behind square on the off-side, beats backward point and rolls away to the fence
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, edged and four, SRH will take these runs, length delivery outside off, Hooda swung across the line, gets a big edge that flies through the vacant first slip region

SN Thakur to Henriques, FOUR, nicely played by Henriques, he's playing a gem of a cameo here. Fraction short and wide of off, Henriques backs away, waits on the ball and cuts it in front of square on the off-side, beats point to his right this time and rolls away to the fence

Unadkat to Deepak Hooda, SIX, massive, Unadkat misses his mark, offers a length delivery on the stumps, Hooda gets underneath it and sends it high and over long-on, hits the roof of the second tier and bounces back into the ground

Unadkat to Henriques, SIX, cracking shot, this was the slower short ball from Unadkat, Henriques spotted it early, waited on it and slaps it high and over deep mid-wicket, went a long way into the stands. SRH are finishing well here

SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, cheeky and four, this was slower bouncer from Thakur. Hooda waits on it and ramps it over Dhoni's head, third man was inside the ring and the ball rolls away to the fence

SN Thakur to Henriques, FOUR, nicely bowled but even better played by Henriques, raises his fifty as well. Thakur saw Henriques backing away, followed him with a full ball. Henriques makes room, plays with an open face and drives it through cover, no need to run for those

SN Thakur to Henriques, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Henriques, this was full and on the stumps, Henriques was backing away, plays with an open face and finds the gap behind square on the off-side, no one moved

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, presses forward causing the bowler to shorten his length, quickly transfers his weight onto the back foot and spanks the pull through mid-wicket. Unadkat didn't get a lot of height with that and it sat up

Washington Sundar to Dhawan, FOUR, this time he goes fuller, and a little bit wider outside off, and allows Dhawan the room to free his arms. He's quickly onto the back knee to sweep it away through mid-wicket

Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan seems to have gained tremendously from his fifty the other day. He's playing with a good amount of confidence and fluency. Back of a length outside off, he punches it away with flair past backward point

SN Thakur to Warner, FOUR, doesn't nail the timing again but he's hit it with enough power to beat mid-on to his right. A full ball slanted in on off, Warner shovels it away down the ground with a lot of bottom hand

SN Thakur to Warner, FOUR, rather than using a horizontal bat this time, he just steers this past short third man and into the boundary. It was a slower ball from Thakur so wasn't a lot of pace to work with. But the timing is exquisite from Warner

Washington Sundar to Dhawan, FOUR, that's such a good shot and so difficult to do against Sundar. He's able to gallop down to the pitch of the ball to lift it back over the bowler's head. Really well played

Tahir to Dhawan, out Caught by Tripathi!! Tahir strikes first ball. It's not his best delivery, but he isn't complaining. Slightly on the shorter side at the stumps, Dhawan quickly jumps back to pull it away but he skies it off a thick top-edge. Easily taken by Tripathi coming in from deep mid-wicket. Dhawan c Tripathi b Tahir 30(29) [4s-5]

Johnson to Tare, out Tare Run Out!! This was very similar to the Buttler dismissal, the fielding aspect. Tare's horror run this season continues. His scores: 18, 0 and 0. Back of a length and close to off, Tare knocks it towards cover and sets off on a suicidal run, Hardik runs across, gets a good bounce and under-arms a throw onto the sticks at the bowler's end. Tare was diving to make his ground, but was still short. Tare run out (Hardik Pandya) 0(1)
Johnson to Samson, FOUR, crunched! Johnson pounds it short of length around off, Samson stands tall and punches it through the crowded off-side field, the ball races away to the fence

Johnson to Samson, FOUR, consecutive boundaries to finish an eventful first over. Too straight, on middle and leg, Samson flicks it off his pads past the square leg umpire, the quick outfield does the rest

McClenaghan to Samson, out Caught by Rohit!! What's happening DD? This game ain't over. It has in fact come alive. The in-form Samson departs. Two early wickets for MI and just the started they needed. Good length ball around off, might have stopped on Samson, who checked his front foot push and spooned a dolly to mid-off. Full marks for Rohit, he had placed himself close in. If he was on the edge, it wouldn't have carried. McClenaghan is pumped up. Samson c Rohit b McClenaghan 9(6) [4s-2]
McClenaghan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, poor delivery and Iyer is off the mark. Slips it onto the legs, just needed a tickle and Iyer got plenty of wood on that, the ball raced away to the fine leg fence

Bumrah to Rabada, FOUR, chipped up. Was a serious miscue. But pockets a boundary for his efforts. With no one at the fence, thanks to all the wickets falling around, Rabada lofts it uppishly off the cue end over mid-off. That's all he had to do

Bumrah to Rabada, FOUR, the French cut now. Rabada keeping the flag fluttering up there. Gets himself too close for the cut but swishes through. Chops it off the under edge past the keeper. So very French
Johnson to Chris Morris, FOUR, brings up the 50 of the stand. A real fightback this. And gets there in some style as well with a lovely looking square cut. Guess what, there is no one out there

Krunal Pandya to Chris Morris, FOUR, brilliance to end in some sloppiness. A punishing drive this from Morris through the covers and the other KP runs around, swoops and dives to cut off what was meant to be a certain boundary. But in his attempt to get up and throw has his back leg spike brush the boundary cushions. Oh dear, the misery gets worse

McClenaghan to Rabada, 1 run, shuffles well across. Almost a set of stumps away and flicks it away to short fine. Again, a shy at the stumps at the non-striker's end..a direct hit would have meant curtains
McClenaghan to Chris Morris, FOUR, here comes the streak. Morris gives it his all, just throws his bat out at a short, wide pepper. Only manages a top-edge. More than enough to fly through the cordon
McClenaghan to Chris Morris, SIX, much needed. Courtesy Morris. Walks across, stands tall and gives the sitting up short one a real spank in getting it to fly over mid-wicket

Bumrah to Rabada, out Bowled!! The zing bails light up the night sky again. Bumrah gets out the screwdriver in tightening the coffin. The coffin that had brought Delhi out of the dead. On the base of leg and nothing Rabada could do with it. Swings hard but the ball dips in sharply to scoot under the flashy blade. What a welcome Rabada's had to the IPL nevertheless. Rabada b Bumrah 44(39) [4s-4 6s-1]
Hardik Pandya to Chris Morris, FOUR, keeps them in the hunt. Gets low on a knee and throws the bat out in carving it square. In the gap too. 19 needed off 4

Hardik Pandya to Chris Morris, 2 runs, more of the same. Pandya persists with the line way outside off and Morris responds with another square drive. Uppish, whistling away off the turf. Just that this time Krunal is present in putting in the dive to keep it down to a couple. Meanwhile Morris has his fifty to boast of. He doesn't know. He doesn't care

McClenaghan to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Iyer has been strangled down the leg-side. The hometown lad doesn't cause much damage. Short and down leg, would have been a wide had Iyer let it pass, instead he sees a run-scoring opportunity, gets inside the line and gloves it to Parthiv. This time he had the bowler and umpire on his side. Third wicket down and DD are in deep trouble. This was a nothing delivery from McClenaghan and it still produced a wicket. Tells you that the rub of the green is with MI. Shreyas Iyer c Parthiv Patel b McClenaghan 6(7) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Corey Anderson, out Lbw!! Anderson is gone for nought. McClenaghan is running riot. The extra delivery brings MI a wicket. Fourth wicket down and things look bleak for DD. They need something special to get out of this. Good length delivery with a bit of inward movement, Anderson is caught in the crease, beaten on the inside edge and the ball hits the back pad right in front of middle. Umpire Ravi had his finger up in a flash. McClenaghan's current figures: 2-0-7-3. Corey Anderson lbw b McClenaghan 0(3)

Bumrah to Pant, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Another batsman goes without troubling the scorers. Bumrah has both has his hands up in a gesture which says, that was easy. Back of a length delivery angled across off, Pant hangs his bat away from the body, the ball takes a healthy edge and flies to the lone slipper, Harbhajan clings on comfortably. Five down and things going down very quickly for DD. Pant c Harbhajan b Bumrah 0(3)

Hardik Pandya to Nair, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Hardik is into the act now. Six down and just the 24 on the board. Nair becomes the sixth batsmen to record a single-digit score. This is getting embarrassing for DD. Short of a length and just outside off, Nair goes half-hearted on the cut shot, the inside edge crashes into the stumps. No respite for the crowd, they keep going bonkers each over. Nair b Hardik Pandya 5(15)

Harbhajan to Rabada, FOUR, almost another. Rabada after getting squared up thanks to the nagging angle being created out here just throws his bat up looking to cut the ball away. Races away off the top-edge and flies through the hands of slip. Rohit the man out there. Too quick for the classification to come under a drop

Hardik Pandya to Rabada, FOUR, oh glorious. As clean as it could get. A pitched up delivery in the arc and Rabada gives his top order a facepalm moment with a full bat face presentation. Whizzes past the bowler
Harbhajan to Chris Morris, FOUR, would need many more of these. A wide liner this from Bhajji and Morris capitalizes with a reverse as he brooms it past the lone man perched at point
Harbhajan to Rabada, SIX, a dance and a dispatch. Right up, close and personal to a friendly tosser up and excutes the lofted drive. Clears the tallest man on operation at long-off

Chris Morris to Buttler, SIX. Bouncer. Top-edge. Six! Are you surprised? Oh! The bats these days. Big chunk of edge as Morris drops his head in disappointment. Went for the pull did Jos Buttler and Morris' pace took care of the rest
Chris Morris to Buttler, FOUR. Edged. One-bounce. Four. The fluke pays off. Buttler comes dancing down the track and slices the flash-drive off the outside edge. Raced away!
Zaheer to Krunal Pandya, FOUR. No pace. Krunal Pandya picked the bones out it. Shuffles towards the line of the ball and smears it in the gap between mid-off and extra cover

Mishra to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Pant!! Two for Mishra-gee! Googly again. Krunal Pandya hides his bat between his legs after running it off the face of the bat. But, the umpire isn't fooled by any of his tactics. Pings his index finger straight up acknowleding the appeal from the keeper. It twirls away from a good length and massages the edge en route to Rishabh Pant. Krunal Pandya c Pant b Mishra 17(16) [4s-1]

Zaheer to Pollard, FOUR, fine delivery that didn't deserve a boundary. Short delivery right under the batsman's throat, Pollard was backing away and was hurried on the pull, the top-edge flies away fine, one bounce and into the fence

Zaheer to Pollard, FOUR, second boundary of the over for Pollard. He holds the key for MI. Zaheer goes full and Pollard says thank you very much, drilled down the ground past mid-off. That ends Zaheer's spell, 4-0-36-0. He's still searching for his 100th IPL wicket

Mishra to Pollard, FOUR, smashed! The crowd are slowly finding their voices again. Flighted just outside off, Pollard drives it down the ground. How hard did he strike that? He didn't bother to run, that sums it up

Pat Cummins to Pollard, FOUR, would you believe it? Morris allows the ball to escape past him. Has his hands up to apologise to Cummins. Short delivery and Pollard pulls it without much timing. Morris was reluctant to come for the catch. Tries to take it on the bounce, but the side spins beats him

Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, SIX, for a second the ball seemed to be heading out of Wankhede. But just clears the rope. Slower delivery on middle and leg, Pandya clears his front leg and heaves it to deep mid-wicket. Not off the middle and hence didn't go a long way

Pat Cummins to Pollard, out Caught by Samson!! Huge, huge wicket. With 18 balls to go, Pollard could have produced a match-defining innings. Clever cricket from Cummins though, rolled his fingers across the ball at the last instant, Pollard had made room to go for a big heave-ho, went through even though there was no pace on the ball. The ball went high up and the cool, calm Samson was under it at long-on. Taken comfortably. Pollard c Samson b Pat Cummins 26(29) [4s-4]

Rabada to Hardik Pandya, SIX, smoked! Back of a length delivery, Pandya was almost cramped for space, but got a decent connection on the short-arm pull, the ball travels to second tier at the deep mid-wicket fence. Head right on top of the ball was the key there

Rabada to Hardik Pandya, out Harbhajan Run Out!! School boy stuff from Harbhajan. He doesn't slide the bat in and hence pays the price. Rabada does not offer any width to Pandya, spears it in the blockhole, an inside edge hits the pad and drops on the pitch. Harbhajan calls for the run and he forgets to slide the ball. Good footballing skills from Rabada, runs forward and kicks the ball onto the stumps. If he had slid his bat in, Harbhajan might have survived. Harbhajan run out (Rabada) 2(2)

Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, out Hardik Pandya Run Out!! 1 run completed. Pandya had to go for it. He was the man who could cause more damage. Squeezes out the yorker to mid-wicket. Nair had a long way to run in and the batsmen thought the second was on. Nair gets there quickly and fires a flat throw to Pant, who does the rest. Even a full stretch from Pandya is not enough to save him. Hardik Pandya run out (Nair/Pant) 24(23) [6s-2]

Chris Morris to Johnson, FOUR, streaky! But Johnson won't mind. He's off the mark in this IPL with a boundary. Very full and on leg-stump, Johnson slogs and the inside edge evades the leg-stump, runs away to the fine leg fence

Chris Morris to Buttler, no run, dropped by Rishabh Pant! Buttler went too far across his off-stump and tried the scoop, he may have played that stroke a touch too early. Spoons it straight to the keeper who was late to pick the ball as the ball swirled around him to distract his attention. Oh, boy!

Zaheer to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, pure timing. Just put bat to ball and the timing will take care of the rest. The thing that coaches tell you. PP did just that to a leg-side dart, dances away to the mid-wicket fence beating a desperate dive from one of the fielders
Rabada to Buttler, SIX, you don't bowl length to this lad. Not when he's in form. Clears his front leg and smokes it with superb ease over mid-wicket

Rabada to Parthiv Patel, out Bowled!! Welcome to IPL, Kagiso Rabada. Spears a 145ks tail-smashing yorker in the blockhole, opens PP up and thrashes his leg-stump. World class fast bowling. Nothing much PP could do about it. Too hot to handle. Rabada is all pumped up, why not? Parthiv Patel b Rabada 8(11) [4s-1]
Zaheer to Buttler, FOUR. Help-me please. Leg-side fodder, Buttler tickles it fine
Zaheer to Nitish Rana, 1 run, subtle change of pace. Rana plays it late as he tucks it to short fine. A good throw from the fielder would have had Rana struggling at the non-striker's end
Zaheer to Buttler, FOUR. Right into his plate. Sits up perfectly for Buttler, he lifts it with lovely extension of the arms over extra cover

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, out Buttler Run Out!! Rana slams his bat in disgust. Error in judgement and he ends up selling his partner. Just taps the ball to cover and sets off, Samson runs forward, picks it up clean and smashes the stumps. Buttler was nowhere to be seen in the frame. There was no single there, Buttler looked ominous, gee! Buttler run out (Samson) 28(18) [4s-3 6s-2]
Mishra to Nitish Rana, FOUR, picks the length and reverse-sweeps Amit Mishra through backward point. There was a slip in place, but he got the timing right. Risky, but worth it

Pat Cummins to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Corey Anderson!! Corey Anderson didn't have to move an inch. Straight as a dolly. 140ks short ball. Rana, with the kind of form he is in, looks to tonk it over deep square with a pull. He might have timed that well, but with 140ks thudding your bat, you can't clear the fence every day. Deep square plucks it reverse-cupped. Replays show it came off the toe end. Nitish Rana c Corey Anderson b Pat Cummins 8(9) [4s-1]

Mishra to Rohit, out Caught by Pat Cummins!! Rohit Sharma has been googlied again. Legspinners are having him for dinner this IPL. Big, big wicket this. Not sure if he read the wrong 'un, was on his knees looking to clear deep square with a slog sweep. Miscued, big time. Cummins gobbles it up at the edge of the boundary. Rohit c Pat Cummins b Mishra 5(9)

Sandeep Sharma to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, McCullum is off and running. No sighters needed. Short of length around off, McCullum hops a bit and directs the cut square on the off-side. There was a man at sweeper but he couldn't get there, such was the timing

Sandeep Sharma to Brendon McCullum, out Lbw!! Sandeep has the early wicket. That was dead in front. One of the easiest decisions Erasmus would have made. McCullum has missed out on a full toss, he closes the bat face tad too early on the flick, beaten on the inside edge and the ball crashed into the back pad. It would have crashed into middle stump. Brendon McCullum lbw b Sandeep Sharma 6(6) [4s-1]
Mohit Sharma to Raina, FOUR, easy peasy. Can't bowl on the legs of any batsman. Raina shuffles across to get inside the line, helps it along the way past the man at 45. Off the mark with a boundary
Axar to Jadeja, FOUR, the boundary that they will need in every over from now has come. Was a bit short, Jadeja went back and thrashed past the man at cover

Cariappa to Jadeja, out Caught&Bowled!! What a catch by Cariappa on his followthrough, pranced forward in time to snaffle that inches off the ground. Jadeja was early on the shot, was trying to work into the on-side and ended up spooning it back to the bowler, who was ready for the opportunity. Jadeja c and b Cariappa 9(7) [4s-1]

Axar to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, not the kind of fielding effort you need. Dwayne Smith got on his knee and helped this flatter ball with a half-sweep. The man from deep backward square leg ran to his right, got to it but fumbled when it mattered the most

Axar to Dwayne Smith, out Caught by Stoinis!! He's hit this one well. Oh, hold on. Not quite. Does not bother to step down, just goes with the swing, ends up miscuing it and holes out to long-off. Two quick wickets and Gujarat's chase is in danger of going awry. Dwayne Smith c Stoinis b Axar 4(4) [4s-1]

Cariappa to Akshdeep Nath, out Lbw!! Wow. What moment for Punjab. Third wicket for them in no time. Two in two for Cariappa. Floats it on the stumps and the new man tries to work across the line. Is beaten in the air and closes the bat face too early. The ball evades the willow and thuds him low on the pad. The umpire obliges the appeal to sink Gujarat's hopes further. Hat-trick ball coming up. Akshdeep Nath lbw b Cariappa 0(1)
Axar to Andrew Tye, SIX, they need more of these! Andrew Tye goes across the line, the ball did not turn and came in with the arm, helping Andrew Tye's swing. Goes well over the cow corner
Axar to Andrew Tye, FOUR, gets low and across to use the inward angle from Axar, helps past the man at short fine leg. Welcome boundary

Sandeep Sharma to Karthik, FOUR, the length is great on this one but the line is awful. On the legs of Karthik and he whips it through backward of square leg. Now they have got the four, need to make it count

Sandeep Sharma to Andrew Tye, FOUR, short ball, comes late to Andrew Tye - that is what the shot suggested. Andrew Tye is early on the pull and slices off the outer edge, over the head of the keeper and into the fine leg fence

Sandeep Sharma to Andrew Tye, out Bowled!! Yorker! The good old yorker. Sandeep Sharma had been hit for two boundaries already and had to fall back upon to his main weapon. Bowls it right at the base of the middle stump. Andrew Tye's swing does not meet the ball and the furniture gets disturbed. What can Karthik do from the other end. He has run out of partners now. Andrew Tye b Sandeep Sharma 22(12) [4s-2 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Karthik, FOUR, there's risk involved but he has to take all that is on offer. Karthik reverse sweeps this full ball to place it between short third man and backward point. This is his first fifty of the seaons. Will it be in a winning cause?
Sandeep Sharma to Basil Thampi, FOUR, aims for the blockhole and does well. Basil Thampi inside edges the drive past the keeper into the fine leg fence

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, when Raina is in form, he plays some audacious shots. This was not a bad ball by any means, length ball around off, Raina swats it over mid-wicket and wide of mid-on. That was dealt with disdain

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, top shot! Sandeep switches to round the wicket, fires in a low full toss around off, Raina stays low, opens the bat face and threads it behind point, right between short third man and backward point

T Natarajan to Finch, SIX, that spoils the over for Natarajan. It was good until then, but ends up conceding 11. Good length ball just outside off, Finch extends those big forearms and smashes it over long-off

Cariappa to Raina, FOUR, two fielders dived and both could not stop the ball. Trifle short and Raina is quick to go back and whip it, first beats the dive of mid-on and then deep mid-wicket's. Placed to perfection

Mohit Sharma to Finch, out Caught by Stoinis!! Second wicket for KXIP in the powerplay. Not many times they have achieved that this season. It is a big one of Finch. Mohit saw the batsman back away to the leg-side, fired it full and outside off, Finch was made to reach, was down on his back knee to drive, couldn't control it and spooned it towards extra cover. Stoinis right on the edge of the circle, dives forward and takes it millimeters from the ground. Finch c Stoinis b Mohit Sharma 13(12) [6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Karthik, FOUR, a gift first up for Karthik. Short delivery at 128kph, sat up nicely for the in form keeper, who swivels across and pulls it neatly behind square, well away from the short fine leg fielder
Cariappa to Karthik, FOUR, half tracker and Karthik pounces on it. It was the carrom ball and turning away, Karthik rocked back and slapped it in front of square, no chance for the man sweeping
Axar to Karthik, FOUR, rubbish to start off from Axar. Long hop asking to be punished, Karthik obliges, rocks back and pulls it in front of square on the leg-side, one bounce and into the fence

Axar to Raina, out Caught by Maxwell!! Massive wicket. 50th IPL wicket for Axar. And there comes the wicket after the break. Not a wicket taking delivery but credit to Maxwell for clinging on. The dangerous Raina is back in the hut. Another half tracker from Axar, Raina pulled and he wanted to clear Maxwell at deep mid-wicket, couldn't get enough power as he was arching back, the KXIP skipper timed his jumped to perfection and took it inches before the rope. After landing he ensured that he doesn't fall over. Raina c Maxwell b Axar 32(24) [4s-4]

Stoinis to Karthik, FOUR, the little things in cricket cost you so much. Karthik should have never been on strike, but thanks to Maxwell he was and he collects a boundary. Slower short delivery and Karthik swiveled to pull it behind square, good connection as the ball bounced only once before reaching the fence
Shubham Agarwal to Amla, FOUR, and he is away, in style. Gets a tossed up delivery just outside off. Stays leg-side and drives past cover, in the gap
Shubham Agarwal to Amla, FOUR, poor ball to finish the over. And Amla won't let those go. It's short and wide.. well not that wide but wide enough for Amla to stay back and crack the cut past point

Nathu Singh to Vohra, out Caught by Karthik!! And he is gone. First IPL match for Nathu Singh and gets rewarded on the second ball. Karthik who takes a decent catch behind the stumps now becomes the first wicket-keeper in the IPL to register 100 dismissals. Here's what happened on this ball: just short of a good length that came in and might have left a bit off the deck to compel Vohra to have a feel for it. Enough to get the edge and fly to the right of Karthik. Vohra c Karthik b Nathu Singh 2(4)

Nathu Singh to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, not off the meat of the bat. But still runs away to the fence. Was angled across around off and Shaun Marsh drove from the crease; toe-ended but had enough to get it past the fielders near the cover region
Andrew Tye to Amla, FOUR, clips it fine after getting across. Fetches a four to the fine leg fence to bring up his fifty

Basil Thampi to Maxwell, SIX, Maxwell is much better off playing conventional cricket shots. Short delivery and at Thampi's pace it sat up for the Australian, who dismisses it with a pull over deep mid-wicket

Basil Thampi to Amla, FOUR, shoddy from McCullum. You rarely associate that word with him. Full delivery on off, Amla jams the drive into the pitch and bounces over Thampi, McCullum from mid-off runs across and lets it through. No one to cover him and that's four more to Amla

Jadeja to Amla, FOUR, Amla's fast hands on display. Quicker and just outside off, Amla stays leg-side of the ball and brings his hands down on the ball, lofted inside out over extra cover, one bounce four

Shubham Agarwal to Maxwell, SIX, mammoth! Agarwal is brave enough to toss it up to Maxwell, who plonks his front foot forward and muscles the loft over the bowler's head. Cleared the sightscreen with ease. All bottom hand!

Shubham Agarwal to Maxwell, SIX, this is buffet for Maxwell. Couple of steps down and takes it on the full, then heaves it a long way over the cow corner fence. Second six of the over and Agarwal is under pressure

Shubham Agarwal to Amla, out Caught&Bowled!! Maiden IPL wicket for Shubham Agarwal. It's the big one. A well-set Amla departs soon after the strategic break. I guess it should be renamed to wicket-taking-break. Second time today that GL have got a wicket after the time-out. Flatter and on the stumps, Amla makes room and slaps it straight back, it was traveling quickly and Agarwal did well to bend down and pouch that. Made it look easy did the youngster. Amla c and b Shubham Agarwal 65(40) [4s-9 6s-2]
Jadeja to Maxwell, FOUR, Maxwell toys with Jadeja. Plants his front leg across the stumps and hoicks it behind square. Maintained a low base to get underneath the ball and that was the key

Jadeja to Maxwell, out Lbw!! Back-to-back wickets for GL. Once more Maxwell has thrown away a start. He did that against MI as well and he's team suffered a big loss. Today as well after Amla's wicket, he needed to stay there and bat till the end. Instead he tries an ambitious reverse sweep against Jadeja, who always attacks the stumps, struck in-line with middle and the slow dreaded finger of umpire Anil Chaudhary went up. Maxwell lbw b Jadeja 31(18) [4s-1 6s-3]

Andrew Tye to Axar, FOUR, shot! Stand and deliver stuff from Axar. It was the normal speed delivery and right in the slot, Axar didn't have to move much, extends his arms and lofts it straight back over Tye. A much needed boundary for KXIP

Basil Thampi to Axar, FOUR, bang! Axar strikes them really hard. Thampi missed the yorker length by a good couple of inches, Axar pumps the drive straight down the ground. Rocketed to the fence and beat long-off with ease

Andrew Tye to Stoinis, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! The dreaded slower delivery from Tye does the trick. He might have got 90% of his wickets with it. Stoinis thought it was in his arc and can for the loft over long-off, but since there was no pace on the ball, it lobbed to McCullum, who takes the dolly. Stoinis c Brendon McCullum b Andrew Tye 7(9)
Dwayne Smith to Axar, SIX, first ball and it is out of the park. Length delivery right in the slot, Axar crouches a bit and tonks it over deep mid-wicket. Plenty of height and the required distance

Dwayne Smith to Axar, FOUR, streaky! Angled across the left-hander, Axar throws everything he's got at it, the outside edge flies away fine to the third man fence. The man was inside the ring and he had no chance

Dwayne Smith to Axar, SIX, Doctor Smith changes to round the wicket but there is no respite for him. Proving to be a costly injury that to Nathu Singh. Another length ball and Axar nonchalantly puts it into the crowd at cow corner. 16 off the first three balls

Dwayne Smith to Axar, out Caught by Finch!! And Smith has a wicket. Axar had to keep going. This time he picks out the fielder. Or rather Finch got to the ball. Dug in short and there was not much pace on the ball, Axar pulls it in front of square, Finch runs a long way from long-on to his left, keeps his eyes on the ball and takes it with both hands while on the move. Excellent catch that. A handy knock from Axar ends. Axar c Finch b Dwayne Smith 34(17) [4s-3 6s-2]

Basil Thampi to Saha, SIX, this time Thampi does not get away with a full toss. There's the big hit Saha was looking for, heaves it towards cow corner and has made a decent connection for the ball to carry over the fence
Raina to Amla, FOUR, and again. Raina is shortish again and on seeing that Amla retreats, opens the face of the bat on the punch and cracks it through cover

Basil Thampi to Saha, out Saha Run Out!! Top nut to end the innings. Yorker aimed right at the base of off-stump, Saha jams it back to the bowler and Mohit was going for the run as it was the last ball of the innings, Saha responds but always knew he would not make it. Thampi collects the ball, runs back and takes the bails off. Saha run out (Basil Thampi) 10(5) [6s-1]

Basil Thampi to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, cross-batted heave from Shaun Marsh. The angle was taking it across him but he took his chance, did not get it off the middle. But had enough to beat the man running from deep square leg to his right

Basil Thampi to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, that just about spoils the over for Thampi. Ended up giving room to Shaun Marsh just outside off. Enough for the latter to camp back and pierce the gap through point with a cut

Andrew Tye to Amla, FOUR, Punjab have got boundaries but not all of them have been well timed ones. This one too is not. Amla makes room, tries to go flat-bat on this short ball. Mistimes but does well to get it just over the fielder at mid-off
Andrew Tye to Amla, FOUR, too full a ball on off. Cannot be termed a poor ball but the brilliance of Amla. Opens the bat-face at the last moment and squeezes it square on the off-side

Andrew Tye to Amla, SIX, as long as they fetch runs - mistimed swing again. Gets over the man at long-on; made a bit of room to this length ball and threw whatever he had. Will be happy with the end result for sure
Shubham Agarwal to Shaun Marsh, SIX, mishit. Again. Won't use that famous thing..everytime. Yeah. Shaun Marsh skips down the track and lofts over the man at long-off. Eventually it has enough on it

Shubham Agarwal to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, dances down the track again. Shubham Agarwal smartly bowls it wide but does not get away. Shaun Marsh manages to reach on the drive and cracks it to the deep cover fence
Jadeja to Amla, SIX, there's no reason for Jadeja to flight and be full. Because one time he tries this, he gets lofted over deep extra cover.. inside out. Goes all the way
Jadeja to Amla, FOUR, flatter this time. This is a result of what happened on the previous ball. Ends up on the legs of Amla, who helps it to the fine leg fence with a little sweet tuck

Andrew Tye to Shaun Marsh, out Caught by Raina!! Time-out and wickets. The love-story world does not care about! Slower ball around off and middle. Shaun Marsh gets early on the push and the bat turns in his hand, making the ball to pop up towards captain Raina at mid-wicket. What a soft dismissal that is and that too against the run of play. Shaun Marsh c Raina b Andrew Tye 30(24) [4s-4 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Maxwell, 1 run, confusion but Amla survives. Nathu Singh from short fine leg failed to hit the target at the striker's end. Maxwell got across to flick this one straight to him. He got the ball, the batsmen in the meantime were staring dead into each other's eyes - standing in the middle of the pitch. Eventually decided to go for the run. And as luck would have it. Amla stayed
Badree to Narine, FOUR, cracking shot, that's a shot of a batsman, Narine comes down the track, gets close to the ball and drills it through extra-cover
Badree to Narine, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Narine, shimmies down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it back over the bowler's head, a couple of bounces and over the fence
Badree to Narine, FOUR, three in a row for Narine, comes down the track to a well flighted delivery and lifts it over Gayle at short extra-cover. This is a smashing start from KKR
Badree to Narine, SIX, lovely, Narine's toying with Badree, comes down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it high and over long-on, 18 runs already from the over

Tymal Mills to Gambhir, SIX, excellent cricket from Gambhir, banged in short and well outside off, Gambhir got on top of the bounce, used Mills' pace and helps it over the lone slip, went all the way for a maximum

Badree to M Pandey, FOUR, lovely shot, width on offer from Badree, it was short as well. Manish plays with an open face and carves it behind square on the off-side, beats the man at backward point and rolls away to the fence

Chahal to M Pandey, out Caught by Badree!! That's a soft soft dismissal and Manish is livid with himself. RCB are well on top now, this was a low full-toss from Chahal, Manish could have hit it anywhere. Perhaps, the late dip undid him, ends up whipping it into Badree's hands at mid-wicket. He's a safe catcher and doesn't drop those. KKR's depth with the bat will be tested tonight. M Pandey c Badree b Chahal 15(16) [4s-1]

Chahal to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Kohli!! Chahal is on a roll! This was a lovely leg-break from Chahal, teased de Grandhomme into coming down the track, he doesn't get to the pitch of the ball, looks to force it away through cover and ends up getting a thick edge to Kohli at first slip. The RCB captain swallows it and KKR fall further into trouble. de Grandhomme c Kohli b Chahal 0(2)

Negi to Woakes, FOUR, risky but four, pushed through flatter and on the stumps, Woakes backed away, exposed his stumps and gets a thick edge on the cut, rolls away past Kohli at slip and into the fence

Negi to Woakes, FOUR, takes on the tease, takes on the invite and gets himself a pressure releiving boundary. Clears his front leg, steps aside as well in the process and goes inside-out with his lofted drive

Aravind to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, a sweep off a seamer. A major punch on the ego for sure. 127kph, on the sitting up length in the slot and Yadav strolls well across, sits on a knee and unleashes a flat bat to place it to perfection behind square

Tymal Mills to Woakes, FOUR, length balls at this stage. Woakes keeps up with the tradition of putting them away. Gets right iunder it with a burial and just swings his bat through the line. All the timing in spanking it through extra cover

Tymal Mills to Woakes, out Caught by Mandeep!! Another time-out. Another wicket. A sure shot strategy uncovered when things seem to be going the way of the batsmen. A perfectly disguised 107kph back of the hand stuff and Woakes after being made to wait swings his bat going for the uppish flick. Miscues and the ball doesn't even have the pace to go all the way. Picks out the lone man at deep mid-wicket to perfection. Woakes c Mandeep b Tymal Mills 18(21) [4s-3]

Negi to Coulter-Nile, out Caught by de Villiers!! Oh AB. Takes a rocket launched in his direction and makes it look like just another day in office. As clean as it could get. Started off with the ball in the arc for Coulter-Nile to smash down. And he obliges. Sinking and spanking it over mid-off. Only for AB at the fence to put his hands up, grab it and avoid the overbalancing. Nothing more. Coulter-Nile c de Villiers b Negi 2(3)

Negi to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Tymal Mills!! The hole gets deeper. The collapse gets more dramatic and KKR lose their last known hope of stealing a few more.
