A rank drag down this to start off from Negi, Yadav meanwhile opens himself up, shapes up for the pull and outside edges it. Thanks to the sticker on the pitch. Ballons in and out and then back into the palms of short third. Oh Mills. Almost a comical end. Suryakumar Yadav c Tymal Mills b Negi 15(19) [4s-1]

Aravind to Kuldeep Yadav, out Bowled!! A failure to last the duration. A massively long banana peel here that Kolkata just couldn't get rid of. And the innings ends with the light up of the zing bails. Kuldeep exposes his stumps, gallops away and whips angrily. To connect with nothing but thin air. The full slower ball meanwhile makes a real mess of the furniture. Kuldeep Yadav b Aravind 4(7)

Aravind to Gambhir, FOUR, edged and four, it was deliberate from Gambhir, but was too close for comfort. Short of a good length and well outside off, Gambhir played with an open face and dabs it past Gayle at slip, rolls away to the fence
Aravind to Narine, FOUR, Narine continues to make merry, back of a length and just outside off, Narine prods across and pulls it back over the bowler's head, a few bounces and over the ropes

Aravind to Narine, FOUR, this will hurt RCB! Nothing wrong with the ball, just a fraction short and wide of off, Narine makes room and punches it in front of square on the off-side, splits the gap past cover and rolls away to the fence. KKR are off to a flier once again

Tymal Mills to Gambhir, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Much needed wicket for RCB. Nicely bowled by Mills, he was troubling Gambhir with his extra pace and bounce. This one angled across the left-hander, Gambhir was looking to defend with an open face, the extra bounce surprised him, flicked his thumb and carried nicely into Kedar's gloves. The strong stand has been broken. Gambhir c Kedar Jadhav b Tymal Mills 14(11) [4s-1 6s-1]

Tymal Mills to Uthappa, FOUR, lovely shot, fraction overpitched and just outside off, Uthappa leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and drives it back past the bowler. AB dives but can't stop it, neither does the other diving fielder at mid-on

Binny to Uthappa, FOUR, sublime timing from Uthappa, length delivery on the stumps, Uthappa leans across and clips it towards mid-wicket, it was in the air but well wide of the fielder, races away to the fence in a hurry
Binny to Narine, FOUR, fuller length delivery outside off, the width was there and Narine threw his bat at that, ended up slicing it over backward point and into the fence

Binny to Narine, out Caught by Chahal!! The Narine show is over! This looked like a certain six, but the timing wasn't spot on, Chahal - at deep square leg, watches it all along and makes sure that he didn't step onto the ropes. A big wicket for RCB. Nicely bowled by Binny as well, shortened the length, rolled his fingers across the seam and made Narine manufacture all the power. He did so, but was just short enough to clear the ropes. That's also the 50th T20 wicket for Binny. Narine c Chahal b Binny 34(17) [4s-6 6s-1]

Badree to Uthappa, out Lbw!! Badree strikes and RCB are fighting back into the contest. This was the straighter one from the leg-break bowler, pitched on leg and slid through, Uthappa was looking to work it towards the on-side, ended up playing right across the line and missed, would have been going on and hitting a good chunk of middle and leg stump. The umpire takes his time and lifts the dreaded finger. Uthappa lbw b Badree 11(9) [4s-2]

Chahal to Y Pathan, wide, out Stumped!! A wide but Chahal has completely flummoxed Yusuf here. Big, big wicket for RCB and Kohli is thrilled to bits. He guessed Yusuf was going to come down the track, fired it faster and down the leg-side, Yusuf was in no position to lay bat on that. Kedar was quick to move to his left, collects the ball and whips the bails off. Yusuf doesn't even attempt to get back. Y Pathan st Kedar Jadhav b Chahal 8(8)

Coulter-Nile to Kohli, out Caught by M Pandey!! An England 2014 dismissal. Plays around with his ego here does Coulter-Nile darting it wide outside off. Kohli couldn't resist, throws his bat out stalking it with the drive, way away from his body. Just enough nip under the lights for the ball to grope the thick outside edge and fly away to second slip. Sharp astute captaincy. Kohli c M Pandey b Coulter-Nile 0(1)

U Yadav to Mandeep, out Caught by M Pandey!! Kolkata errupt. Oh they've switched loyalties, once again coming back home. An innocuous wide ball here from Umesh. Short as well. Asking to be slapped and obliged by stabbing it right into the hands of cover-point. The ball just stopping a touch on the turf to grab the outside half. Mandeep c M Pandey b U Yadav 1(3)

U Yadav to de Villiers, FOUR, away in style. Umesh tries the surprise full ball coming back in. Just that his opponent is a master of these tricks. Out-thinks him with a shuffle to clip it away through mid-wicket. Off and running, with some timing

Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, FOUR, a wasted delivery. Not quite the line to bowl to the best bat in these situations. Straying down leg hoping to swing it away and clips it behind square. Not quite the ideal one with a 7-2 field

Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, out Caught by Uthappa!! The wickets tumble. And so does the RCB line-up. What on earth is going on? The banana peel that KKR were subject to seems to have slipped into the RCB territory. A 147kph bolt here. Bang on the money, short, climbing up and too quick on the pull. The compulsive AB pull. Goes sky high with the top edge and Uthappa almost makes a meal of the grab behind the stumps. Moves all around and settles just about under it. de Villiers c Uthappa b Coulter-Nile 8(6) [4s-2]

Coulter-Nile to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, the streaky edge comes into play. Doesn't matter, it is the free hit. Throws his bat out at a wide delivery and takes the edge to ensure that it flies past second slip
Coulter-Nile to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, oh glorious. In the midst of the madness of wickets tumbling, we have another spanking drive unleashed. Full, wide and carves it away with a square slap

Coulter-Nile to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Woakes!! The Gardens explode. The Garden city self-implodes. The sticker on the track consumes another. Jadhav looks to fetch one from off as he attempts whipping it away. The ball meanwhile takes an eternity in getting onto the bat taking the leading edge on the early flick to balloon to mid-on. Don't forget, Chris Gayle is stuck at the other end. Kedar Jadhav c Woakes b Coulter-Nile 9(7) [4s-2]
Coulter-Nile to Binny, FOUR, a release. Full, wide and squeezes it out with a ferocious square drive. Over point and ensures that it keeps wide of third man

U Yadav to Gayle, FOUR, his first boundary. Off a top edge. He wouldn't complain though. Another well-directed short bouncer squares Gayle completely after getting him opened up and. He responds with a slash of the horizontal bat and the streaky edge flies almost into the third man ropes
U Yadav to Binny, FOUR, width. Asking for the slap, gets the slap. But finds it just wide of Pandey;s full stretched dive at point. Rushes away `

Woakes to Gayle, out Caught by Coulter-Nile!! Is that the game already? The big man has been given a proper working over, and now he succumbs. Short of length, skidding on off the deck, and hurries onto Gayle as he tries to heave it over wide mid-on. The ball slices up off the outside half and presents a simple opportunity to NCN moving to his right from mid-off. Gayle c Coulter-Nile b Woakes 7(17) [4s-1]

Woakes to Binny, out Caught by Uthappa!! Wonderful delivery. This time it has taken the edge, has it? Yes. These might well be familiar conditions for Woakes, given the freshness in the wicket and the way it's zipping through the surface. He's found his rhythm from the get-go. Short of length, nips away a touch and squares Binny up to take a feather through to the keeper. KKR routing RCB pretty bad. Binny c Uthappa b Woakes 8(9) [4s-2]

de Grandhomme to Negi, out Lbw!! Oh that's out. What beautiful shape from de Grandhomme. Floats it up, curls it back in and hits Negi on the pad as he plays right across the line. That's plumb in front of middle. He set him up beautifully with the previous delivery angled across. The crowds are shouting their throats hoarse. Electrifying at the Eden Gardens. Negi lbw b de Grandhomme 2(3)

Woakes to Badree, out Lbw!! Trapped in the crease and plumb again! This is just unbelievable. Some of the RCB fans, however minimal their number, are shellshocked. Woakes pitches this up, gets some movement off the pitch again and the ball cuts back in with Badree caught in the crease. It hits him right in front of middle, the height not a problem. Badree lbw b Woakes 0(3)
Woakes to Aravind, FOUR, he checks the drive as the ball stops on him from a length, but the timing is splendid. It flies away over extra-cover for a boundary

de Grandhomme to Tymal Mills, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! That's miscued .. and a really good running catch from Kuldeep. Mills tries to swing a ball into the on-side, gets a thick top-edge which lobs in front of long-off. Kuldeep has to cover good ground and it's not easy to stabilize yourself against the momentum. But Kuldeep does really well. Tymal Mills c Kuldeep Yadav b de Grandhomme 2(5)

de Grandhomme to Chahal, out Caught by M Pandey!! It's all over. RCB have capitulated for the lowest IPL score ever. This time de Grandhomme's outswinger finds the edge as Chahal prods forward. The ball goes right between second and first slip. Both dive for it. But Pandey, at second slip, pouches it well. Chahal c M Pandey b de Grandhomme 0(2)

SN Thakur to Buttler, FOUR, third man is up and Buttler squirts it right off the toe-edge to squeeze this through the gap. A poor delivery from Thakur. This is way too short and wide and although Buttler almost failed to reach out, it deserved the punishment that it got

SN Thakur to Buttler, FOUR, he's tickled that off middle and leg stump. Buttler walks right across, gets a full ball on the pads and just about gets his bat down in time. Would have been plumb had he missed
Unadkat to Rohit, FOUR, walks across. Sits down. Gets under the fuller delivery and scoops it over the keeper. Almost off the toe end but with the field behind square up in the circle it seems safe

Tahir to Karn Sharma, no run, oh Tiwary. He puts down another. This time it goes right in, only to pop out. A fierce slap this from Karn finding extra cover to perfection. Just that the catch cannot stick in his palms tonight
Tahir to Karn Sharma, SIX, and he piles it on with a salt rub. Gets a ball in the slot at a good length and just swings his bat out. Tonking it down the ground

Stokes to Karn Sharma, out Bowled!! He is yet to give a run. But has a couple in the wickets column against his name. Karn looks to stay true to his pinch hitting role with a violent swish of the bat. But just doesn't bother moving his feet while looking to deal with this tight length delivery. Swings, gets the inside edge and watches his bails light up. A big time loss of shape. Karn Sharma b Stokes 11(10) [6s-1]
Stokes to Pollard, FOUR, here's the brute. A short one here that refuses to get up. A bare 123kph and Pollard spanks it with utter disdain. Pulls the leather off it to mid-wicket

Stokes to Pollard, 1 run, oh a mix-up. Could have been a lot more. But for these missed aims. A polite knock to mid-wicket from Pollard and he just charges out to get away. Rohit meanwhile stands half way down the pitch hoping his partner would return. None of that happening though. And the Wankhede doesn't let sound travel, even across the pitch. Rohit has to thank a wayward throw

Tahir to Rohit, FOUR, a beastly slog. Opens and picks out the top-spinner half way down the track with a swivel to dispatch it just past the reach of a diving Rahane at mid-wicket. Takes his finger tips along as well

Tahir to Rohit, SIX, well if there is someone catching this it is in the crowds. That's into the railway line. Into one of the Virar locals perhaps. Another variation, in the form of a googly this time and picked out right off the palm as he slogs it while sweeping
Stokes to Rohit, FOUR, take that. You bowl length at your own peril. Stokes learns it the harsh way. A mighty swing of the bat and a punishing drill through the covers

SN Thakur to Rohit, SIX, Rohit and his front footed pulls. Ah, sublime. Thakur looks to pepper it with banging it half way down and watches it being deposited with a flat bat into the first floor over deep square leg

Tahir to Pollard, out Caught by Smith!! Another wicket to the break. And all Pollard needed to lose his concentration were the 150 seconds. Sees a toss up delivery and compulsively swings his bat looking to downtown with his lofted drives. Enough turn away to take the miscue. Meanwhile Smith sprints from long-off, and juggles before pouching. Tahir too is off on a celebratory run. Pollard c Smith b Tahir 9(9) [4s-1]
Unadkat to Rohit, 1 run, fifty #30. Gets there with a standing dab wide of point. All so nonchalant
Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, he doesn't believe in gentle nudges. Gets a back of a length sitter in the arc and flat bats it with all his might over extra cover

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, ruins it further. Hangs back patiently on the back foot toying around with the bowler's mind in waiting for the short-slower combo to get to him. When he does, he heaves and posts it bisecting the two men converging at cow corner

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Stokes!! Oh Stokesy. If not with the bat, he changes the game with the ball. If not with the ball he does it with his diving arounds. Pandya slaps this fullish ball hard. And doesn't bother keeping it down as well. Only for Stokes to run across from the extra cover boundary and dive to pluck it inches off the turf. Is that the game? They've crossed over mind you. Hardik Pandya c Stokes b Unadkat 13(11) [4s-2]

Unadkat to Rohit, SIX, it only gets another twist. Spoke too soon. Converts a wide length ball into one in the arc with a run across his stumps. And then it is his swing that takes over. Hacks it across the line and despite the top-edge the big bats ensure it flies into the stands over mid-wicket

Unadkat to Rohit, out Caught&Bowled!! Oh he's lost it. An argument with the umpire for the want of a wide has consumed his focus. Another walk across and he goes for an almighty slog swing. A top edge is all he manages with the ball flying high and mighty into the hands of the bowler itself. Did not even leave the pitch. And Unadkat bangs his head down in the process of almost messing up the catch. Rohit c and b Unadkat 58(39) [4s-6 6s-3]

Unadkat to Harbhajan, out McClenaghan Run Out!! 1 run completed. All over. Gets low on his haunches and carves out the extravagant drive to extra cover. But the quest of wanting a non-existent second consumes another. A flat rocket arm throw from the deep, courtesy Stokes at the non-striker's end catches McClenaghan well short of his ground. McClenaghan run out (Stokes/Unadkat) 0(0)

Washington Sundar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, just over mid-on. He was itching to break free. It's slightly fuller from Sundar, but Parthiv isn't quite to the pitch of it. But he goes through with the loft. Enough on that to clear the infield
Washington Sundar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's what he was looking for all this time. Width on offer. Parthiv lashes it away through backward point
Washington Sundar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, third boundary of the over as Sundar drops it short again and this time, Parthiv pulls him away to the deep mid-wicket boundary

Unadkat to Harbhajan, SIX, he finishes it with a swat. In style. But it is Pune who'll be celebrating. They've breached the fortress. A lovely strike on the ball with Harbhajan clearing his front leg and slogs it out of the park. Through his favourite area - mid-wicket

Unadkat to Buttler, FOUR, that's unfortunate for Unadkat. He's deceived Buttler for lack of pace while also bowling it wide of off with Buttler swinging leg-side. The cutter grips a touch, takes a thick edge and flies fine of short third man

Stokes to Buttler, out Caught by Washington Sundar!! The slower ball has worked. Buttler drags it straight to long-on. He backed away looking for the big hit, maybe over mid-off, and Stokes followed him with a leg-cutter to deny him the room. The lack of pace on the ball meant that it didn't come on as well as Buttler wanted and he ended up dragging it off the inside half. Simple catch for Sundar running in. Buttler c Washington Sundar b Stokes 17(13) [4s-3]

Stokes to Nitish Rana, no run, did that carry to Tiwary? Oh what a big wicket that would have been. Round the wicket, slanting the ball in on a back of length and getting it to straighten a touch. Rana fences it to slip. Oh, this is close. It might have just fallen short. Centimetres

SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, poor from Thakur. He strays in line again. That's not what Pune want at this stage as they strive to crank up the pressure. Parthiv picks it off his hips and glances it past short fine leg

Christian to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Unadkat!! Short of length, Rana heaves into the on-side but he's in no control of it whatsoever. The ball has flown off the top-edge. He's gone. Pune making a match of this. Christian might have cut his fingers across the ball. Rana wants to heave it away off the front foot but it's onto him much quicker than he thinks. Essentially, it was a break-free short after having been kept quiet. Third man runs in and holds on. Nitish Rana c Unadkat b Christian 3(9)
Christian to Rohit, FOUR, wow. That's been driven on the up and over mid-on. Powerfully struck from Rohit. Maybe he's decided that's the way he wants to go today

Washington Sundar to Parthiv Patel, out Bowled!! Maiden IPL wicket for Sundar. He's slid that right through Parthiv. Risky shot to play really. Darted in and skidding on from round the wicket, Parthiv wants to cut it off the stumps but the ball hurries onto him. He doesn't have much room to work with either. Cleaned up. Parthiv Patel b Washington Sundar 33(27) [4s-4]
Tahir to Rohit, FOUR, that's beautifully done from Rohit. He was initially beaten by the turn on this leg-break, but he didn't commit so he was able to open the bat-face and steer it past slip
Tahir to Rohit, FOUR, that's a magnificent shot against the turn. But because it was so full, he really didn't have to worry about it. Drifting in on middle, Rohit whips it away over mid-wicket

Johnson to Rahane, SIX, what a wonderful shot! Shows the nature of the track. An away-slanter from a good length, Rahane squats, reaches for it and slaps it over cover. Off the middle and the ball has enough wings to go all the way

McClenaghan to Tripathi, FOUR, almost a maximum. Dances down the track and elevates this shortish ball over point with a fierce cut. He played it uppishly and almost got the distance. One bounce and into the fence

McClenaghan to Tripathi, 1 run, direct hit at the striker's end and Rahane is in. The TV umpire was called for assistance. Easy one for him. Short of a good length delivery wide of off, Tripathi taps it towards backward point and responds to a quick call from Rahane. Pollard finds the target, but Rahane was easily home

Karn Sharma to Smith, FOUR, Smith will use his feet against the spinners. Is quick to get out of the box and gets to the pitch of the flighted delivery, thumps it past the bowler. Karn had no chance to even get a fingertip on that

Karn Sharma to Tripathi, out Caught by Pollard!! Pollard under a high-ball, you expect only one result. A fine hand from Tripathi ends. Deserved a fifty. Smart bowling from Karn, his second and making the most of the opportunity. He saw the batsman advance and threw it wide outside off, Tripathi had to reach out for the loft and he miscues it towards long-off. Tripathi c Pollard b Karn Sharma 45(31) [4s-3 6s-2]

Karn Sharma to Smith, 2 runs, dropped! Harbhajan spills a sitter. That would have been a huge moment in the game. Tossed up on off, Smith not completely down on his knee to sweep, hence the ball lobs towards deep square leg. Harbhajan runs across to his left and goes with both hands, but manages to grass it. He was on the move and that made it difficult for him to control the ball. Karn is disappointed, he should have had his third

Karn Sharma to Smith, FOUR, that's adding salt to the wound. Karn drags the length back and Smith is all over it, uses the depth of the crease to hammer the pull past the diving mid-wicket fielder, no one in the deep to stop that

Harbhajan to Smith, out Bowled!! 200th T20 wicket. He dropped him last over and now has removed the dangerous Smith. Not much harm done. Look at Harbhajan go. He's letting all his frustration out. Shouting and roaring at the top of his voice. Slows it up and drops it short, Smith is early into the pull, the ball takes its time to beat the bat and hit the top of off-stump. Wicket off his final ball and Harbhajan ends with: 4-0-20-1. Smith b Harbhajan 17(12) [4s-2]

Johnson to Stokes, FOUR, gift first up for Stokes and he says thank you very much. Fired full and down leg, might have been the attempted yorker, Stokes helps it away fine and the pace of Johnson takes care of the rest

McClenaghan to Stokes, FOUR, streaky! Not where he intended but will take the final result. Steps out and aims for a nudge into the on-side, the inside edge nutmegs him and runs away to the fine leg fence

Johnson to Stokes, out Bowled!! Cleaned 'im up. It was right in the slot for Stokes and he misses it altogether. Johnson came round the wicket and pounded it on a length ball on leg-stump, Stokes clears his front leg and heaves, but failed to connect with the ball. Crashed into leg-stump and Johnson has his first wicket of the game. Big wicket at this stage. Stokes b Johnson 17(12) [4s-2]

Johnson to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, in the air and just short of Hardik at mid-off. Johnson stays round the wicket, the cross-seamer outside off, Tiwary checks his drive and the ball lobs towards mid-off, dips in front of Hardik and runs away to the fence

Johnson to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries. Follows up the full delivery with a short one, Tiwary is on one leg to pull it away behind square leg. The man was inside the ring and there was no one stopping that

Bumrah to Dhoni, out Bowled!! Dragged on. No heroics from Dhoni today. MI are chipping away at the wickets. Five down and Bumrah has his name on wicket's list. The umpire checks for a no-ball and Bumrah has some part of his foot behind the stumps. Good length ball around off, Dhoni goes for the pull and the ball does not bounce as much as he anticipated, the inside edge crashes into the stumps. Dhoni b Bumrah 7(11)

McClenaghan to Christian, FOUR, cracking shot! Brings up the 150. Half volley and not many batsmen miss out. Christian clears his front leg and pumps the drive through extra cover. No one at sweeper cover to stop it
Bumrah to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, dug in short and Tiwary fetched the pull from outside off, not off the meat but the key thing was he got it in the gap, between deep mid-wicket and long-on

Bumrah to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, Bumrah misses the yorker and Tiwary thrashes it away. He gets underneath the ball and smashes it towards the cow corner fence, one bounce and into the fence. Good start to the over

Bumrah to Manoj Tiwary, out Lbw!! The apprentice is doing the job for MI. Second wicket for him and both have come in the death overs. The off-cutter and deceived Tiwary completely, he didn't pick it and shuffled across to nudge it to the on-side, missed and is struck in front of middle stump. HawkEye shows it to be clipping leg-stump. Manoj Tiwary lbw b Bumrah 22(13) [4s-4]

McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, good looking shot. McClenaghan pitches it up and Rahane meets it with a straight-batted drive. The bowler can't stop it and the mid-on fielder can't get there with a dive. Races away into the fence

Johnson to Rahane, FOUR, wow! Just a mere push and the ball dribbles away into the fence. Johnson comes round the wicket and darts it in full just outside off, Rahane prods forward and middles the straight drive/push. Gets it well wide of mid-off and the quick outfield does the rest

Bumrah to Rahane, FOUR, nice shot! There wasn't room there for Rahane to free his arms. He goes deep in his crease and manufactures his own to cut it through covers. A teasing chase for the cover fielder. Escorts the ball till the fence

Karn Sharma to Tripathi, SIX, that's a monster! Dhoni-esque. Flat, quick and overpitched, right in the slot for Tripathi to swing his bat. Clears his front leg and tonks it over long-on for a gigantic six

Karn Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, nice shot to end the powerplay.Eleven runs off the over. Karn Sharma slightly tosses it up, Rahane hangs back and flicks it wide of mid-on. Once it cleared the fielder, there was none to stop that

Harbhajan to Tripathi, 3 runs, Tripathi uses the extra bounce outside off and late-cuts it wide of the keeper. Mitch McClenaghan, runs, slides and flicks the ball back into play. Saved a run for his team there. 50-run stand between the duo as well
McClenaghan to Tripathi, FOUR, McClenaghan drops it short and Tripathi stays in his crease and cuts it over backward point

McClenaghan to Tripathi, FOUR, McClenaghan shortens his length seeing Tripathi come down. He looks to cut and gets it off the toe end. The ball evades the keeper and runs away into the third man fence
McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, short of a good length delivery, Rahane nails the pull well in front of square on the leg-side. This is turning out to be an expensive over

Karn Sharma to Rahane, out Caught&Bowled!! First wicket for Karn Sharma in Mumbai colors. Rahane was undone by that top-spinner. He was looking to cut as he thought it was a leg-break. The extra bounce hits the top portion of the bat and lobs up in the air. The bowler calls for it and takes a straightforward catch. Rahane c and b Karn Sharma 38(32) [4s-5 6s-1]

Karn Sharma to Tripathi, SIX, good effort from the man in the deep, but he couldn't stop it from going into the fence. A 68-metre six. A leg-break, Tripathi gets down and slog sweeps. Doesn't quite get it off the middle of the bat. Nitish Rana at deep mid-wicket waits for it at the edge of the rope. But, the ball had just about enough elevation to go over him
Unadkat to Narine, FOUR, easy. Don't bother. When you have such good hands, just put bat to ball. Short of a length, sat up wide of off-stump, Narine flays it over point. Period.
SN Thakur to Narine, FOUR. Well placed. Needles the gap between mid-off and extra cover with a firm drive. Lot of bottom hand power on that
SN Thakur to Narine, FOUR, throws his bat at a wide delivery and gets four. Thick edge and it races away past the cordon
Unadkat to Gambhir, FOUR, up and over! Rises on his toes and lifts a wide ball with a flat bat, over cover and into the fence
Christian to Uthappa, 1 run, a dazzling fifty for Robbie! That was short and he was quick to swat the pull away for a single. Soaks in the applause as the KKR camp is happy and so is the skipper

Christian to Gambhir, 1 run, slower short ball, the ball climbs onto the batsman. Gambhir gets a top-edge and the man running in from the short fine leg region - Sundar drops it. The ball popped out as his elbows thudded onto the ground. Another dropped chance, another charmed life
Christian to Uthappa, SIX, some salt into the open wounds being garnished in by Uthappa. The ball was short but Uthappa was tall enough to smack the pull away over cow corner. He wants a quick finish

Tripathi to Uthappa, FOUR, slower, much slower short ball. Uthappa has all the time in the world to place the pull behind square on the on-side to tease the man from deep square to give it a valiant chase

Tripathi to Gambhir, FOUR, ton for the combo!! That was deft, cute, earns a four with the help of an open face of the bat. The dive from the man at short third man spelt agony for Pune. The match continues to slip away
Tahir to Gambhir, SIX, looked like a mishit but that has gone for a half-a-dozen. The ball was in his zone and the batsman played the cross batted swipe to tonk the ball away over deep mid-wicket

Tahir to Gambhir, 2 runs, third umpire was called in but Gambhir has made it. Fifty for skipper. Yet another valuable knock from the skippy. His 100th game for KKR, all as skipper and he has again stepped up in a crucial game. The ball was cut away into the off-side and the throw came in at the striker's end to which Dhoni flicked it back onto the sticks. GG had made it easily
Christian to Gambhir, FOUR, ramps the ball over the man at point and that will run away for another four. This is turning out to be a canter for KKR
Tahir to Uthappa, SIX, onto one knee! The story after that is scripted. The author - Uthappa just looks into the stands. The ball has disappeared into the stands at the cow corner region

Tahir to Uthappa, SIX, this one is a sequel to the previous six. Meatier and bigger. He knelt down and clobbered the slog sweep deep into the stands. That should be six and a half, Danny would agree for sure

Unadkat to Uthappa, out Caught by Tripathi!! Uthappa tries to do it with a glory shot but the slower short ball has done him in. Not before he has taken them to the doorsteps of a fine win. The slower ball hung onto the surface, the batsman was early into the slapped pull and managed to get a huge top-edge. The man at long-off back-pedalled and took it close to his chest. Uthappa c Tripathi b Unadkat 87(47) [4s-7 6s-6]

Christian to Gambhir, out Caught by SN Thakur!! The short ball does it again. The batsman late on it as the ball bounced a tad bit more. In the end, the spliced up parabola was taken at mid-on. Gambhir departs after yet another wonderful knock. Gambhir c SN Thakur b Christian 62(46) [4s-6 6s-1]

SN Thakur to Darren Bravo, FOUR, crunches the drive through the covers and that is it! KKR win!! They will spring to the top of the points table thanks to this mauling. The target of 183 never ever looked enough. Going back to the final ball: in the zone and Darren Bravo threaded the ball into the gap with a lot of muscle power

Washington Sundar to Gambhir, out Narine Run Out!! Narine is horrible when it comes to running between the wickets. Just pathetic I must say. Gambhir should have been aware of it. Just tickles the ball to short fine and rushes for a quick single. Narine had to respond. Thakur underarms the throw and then the MS special. Good game awareness. Just deflects the ball onto the stumps with sheer ease. Narine run out (SN Thakur/Dhoni) 16(11) [4s-3]
SN Thakur to Uthappa, FOUR. Just stand and deposit. Stays firm and picks the length early to lash a one-bounce four over mid-on, just an extension of the drive
Washington Sundar to Gambhir, FOUR, he does this time. Rocks back and nails the cut square on the off-side. No-one moved
Washington Sundar to Gambhir, FOUR, half-volley. Errs in length and Gambhir makes full use of...Times the pants of a drive through extra cover
Christian to Uthappa, FOUR, street-smart cricket. Saw third man was inside the ring, just opens the bat face and runs it fine of him. Lovely

Tahir to Uthappa, FOUR, dropped by Unadkat. He has made a habit of hurting his head this lad. A complete mistimed cross bat swing from Robbie, swirls high and looks to be setting safe into the hands of deep mid-wicket. Unadkat keeps swirling with the ball, lands awkwardly on his back as he bumps his head onto the ground. To make matters worse, it dribbles away to the boundary triangles
Tahir to Gambhir, FOUR, advances, gets to the pitch of the delivery and nails the straight drive. Take four
Washington Sundar to Uthappa, FOUR. Deft. Uses the crease to make subtle adjustments and glides a slider with a silk touch down to third man
Washington Sundar to Uthappa, SIX, on one knee and spank! Right towards the pitch of the delivery and he goes kaboom over wide long-off
Washington Sundar to Uthappa, SIX, make that two in a row. Over long-on this time. Good hand-eye coordination as he smears the ball with a clean swing of the willow
Tahir to Uthappa, SIX, had a good piece of that did Robin Uthappa. Got underneath and marmalized a floater over long-on for a 83-metre maximum over long-on
Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, gorgeous. So pleasing to the eye. Watches the ball bull-eyed and extends his arms over the loft over mid-off. Pure timing

Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, vintage Uthappa. Shuffles outside his off-stump and hacks one into the deep backward square area. The key was he watched the ball till the last minute and ensured he dropped the stroke in no-man's land

U Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, edged and four, that will go down as a chance, but it climbed over Uthappa, he had no chance of taking it. Short of a length and shaping away from outside off, Tripathi was rooted to his crease as he frailed at that, got a thin edge that flew over the keeper's outstretched gloves

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, loosener from Kuldeep. Rank long hop on off, Rahane had all the time in the world to go deep in the crease and pull it in front of square, wide of deep mid-wicket and Rahane is getting a move on

Chawla to Rahane, FOUR, beautiful! Such a good cricketing shot. Rahane backs away to go inside out, Chawla fires it on the stumps, enough room to loft it handsomely over extra cover. One bounce and into the fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Smith, FOUR, precise placement from captain Smith. Floaty chinaman turning in around off, Smith stays low and plays the half sweep/pull, in the air and bisecting the two fielders in front of square on the leg-side
Narine to Smith, FOUR, streaky! Short and turning in, Smith goes with all his might on the cut, the ball takes the top-edge and flies away fine. No chance for Yusuf to haul that in

Narine to Rahane, out Stumped!! Is this match being played in Pune? Then why are they cheering for the fall of their own? That is because the wicket brings MS Dhoni to the middle. The carrom ball which is short in length, Rahane just took a step out and tried to carve it into the off-side, beaten and Uthappa was quick this time. The back foot was initially on the line, Rahane lifted it to get back in and Uthappa took that opportunity to light up the bails. Rahane st Uthappa b Narine 46(41) [4s-4 6s-1]

Chawla to Dhoni, FOUR, more sloppiness. This time Yusuf lets one through the legs. Dhoni comes down the track and flicks it to mid-wicket, straightforward stop and Yusuf makes a mess of it. Right through him and Dhoni is underway

Chawla to Dhoni, SIX, you put fielders close to me, I will hit the ball out of the park. Dhoni is taking the aggressive option. This time gets right under the ball after dancing down, smokes it straight back over Chawla for a maximum

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, chants of "Dhoni, Dhoni". He's looking in ominous touch here. Not all that short from Kuldeep, Dhoni went deep in the crease and might have top edged the pull, looked mistiemd at first, but the ball kept gathering momentum as it flew over the deep mid-wicket fence

Narine to Smith, FOUR, second time Smith has got a streaky boundary off Narine. Short and wide outside off, he throws the bat on the cut, right off the cue-end and the ball runs away fine to the third man fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, out Stumped!! Huge wicket this. Full marks for GG as well. Bowling a spinner in the 18th over, you don't see that often. The youngster has outfoxed the master finisher. The googly which is short in length, Dhoni runs down the wicket and is beaten by the turn, does not get the body behind the line, Uthappa whips the bails off in a flash. Kuldeep loved that wicket. Jumps and follows it with a fist pump. Dhoni st Uthappa b Kuldeep Yadav 23(11) [4s-1 6s-2]

Kuldeep Yadav to Manoj Tiwary, out Stumped!! Take a bow Gautam Gambhir. It was a brave move to bowl Kuldeep and he is now reaping the rewards. Two wickets in the over. One of Dhoni and the other of the in-form Tiwary. The wrong 'un keeps bamboozling the batsmen, Tiwary like others does not pick, lunges forward to work it into the leg-side, missed and beaten comprehensively. Uthappa takes his time to remove the bails, but does so in the nick of time. Tiwary's back leg was on the line and he didn't even attempt to get it back in. Manoj Tiwary st Uthappa b Kuldeep Yadav 1(2)

Woakes to Christian, SIX, super shot! Woakes was a bit predictable there. Full and wide outside off, Christian lined up for the loft over extra cover and nailed it to perfection. All the way and a much needed one for RPS

Woakes to Christian, SIX, back-to-back sixes and now we know why GG was relcutant to bowl the spinners at the death. Length delivery right in the swinging arc, Christian is known for his big-hittin and he thumps this over the cow corner fence

U Yadav to Smith, SIX, 16 balls without a boundary or a six, now RPS have three on the trot. This is a top shot. A difficult one to play. Wide yorker outside off, Smith opens the bat face and carves it over point. Nice connection and pinged the ad boardings

U Yadav to Smith, 1 run, fifty for Smith. This was a long time coming. He got a few starts in the previous games but hadn't converted them. This time he does. Another wide yorker and Smith squeezes it to backward point

Woakes to Rahane, FOUR, cracking shot, long half-volley on Rahane's pads, that's easy pickings for him, prods across and clips it in front of square on the on-side. The man in the deep is square and has no chance

U Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, lovely, much better from Tripathi, should make him feel much better. This was a back of a length delivery outside off, he stands tall, gets on top of the bounce and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover and rolls away to the fence

U Yadav to Christian, out Caught by M Pandey!! Wicket off the final ball. Full toss and Christian smacks it straight down the throat of deep mid-wicket. He backed away slightly and didn't have the space to free his arms, mistimed it and Pandey gobbled that up with ease. Christian c M Pandey b U Yadav 16(6) [6s-2]
U Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, beautifully played, just a little shimmy down the track, Tripathi made room as he did so, drives it on the up and beats cover-point to his right, no need to run for those

Woakes to Rahane, SIX, Rahane breaks the shackles, at first look - he didn't looked to have timed it, but it kept soaring high and into the stands at long-on. Just short of a good length and outside off, Rahane swung through the line and collects his first maximum
Woakes to Tripathi, FOUR, smashed, length delivery outside off, Tripathi comes down the track, takes it on a half-volley length and drills it back past the bowler, no need to run for those
Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, nicely played by Tripathi, makes rom to a well flighted delivery, gets down on his knee and goes inside out over cover-point, a few bounces and over the ropes

Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi isn't afraid of the mystery bowler, gets down low, uses his reach to good effect and sweeps it to the right of square leg, beats the diving fielder and rolls away to the fence

Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Tripathi, almost an action replay of the previous shot, gets down low to a well flighted delivery and sweeps it in front of square on the on-side, the fielder at square dives to his left and can't stop it, ends the powerplay in style

de Grandhomme to Tripathi, 1 run, Yusuf has made a mess of a simple chance, ran back from mid-wicket, got to the ball, went with both hands and shells it. Looks bad on replays. Coming to the ball, it was short and just outside off, Tripathi swung across the line, got a fat top-edge - high and towards mid-on

Chawla to Tripathi, out Bowled!! Piyush has broken through the dangerous opening stand, Tripathi falls after a fine hand. This was the wrong 'un from Piyush, Tripathi didn't read it, backed away on the cut, the ball kept spinning back into him, cramped him for space, gets the under-edge and the ball goes on to crash into the leg-stump. Piyush gives him a send-off, but Tripathi has done his job. Tripathi b Chawla 38(23) [4s-7]

de Grandhomme to Smith, FOUR, lovely shot, friendly full-toss from de Grandhomme and Smith takes full toll of it, shuffles across and shovels it in front of square on the on-side, beats the man getting across from the deep

Chawla to Rahane, FOUR, cracking shot, tossed up just outside off, Rahane bends down low, gets on top of the bounce, rolls his wrists over and sweeps it in front of square on the on-side. de Grandhomme has no chance - getting across to his right from deep mid-wicket

Badree to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, goes with the spin and gives it a full whack. Quick to rock back, pulls as hard as he can, Mandeep Singh from long-on does well to make a diving stop, but he seems to have made contact with the boundary triangles, the boot to be precise

Badree to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, looks as if Ishan Kishan has been given the license to express himself. Six balls, six whacks. Stamps his weight on the back foot and powers a biff-drive past a diving mid-off
Aravind to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, superb stroke! Punched off the middle, don't move! Uses the crease to adjust his feet movements as he unveils it in the gap between cover and point

Negi to Finch, SIX, that's been launched! Full in the slot for Finch and he isn't standing on ceremony there. He certainly isn't. Lots of flight from Negi, Finch's eyes lit up. Huge six down the ground
Negi to Finch, SIX, that's a smaller six but perhaps a better shot as he had to drag it from outside off. So much power in the bottom hand as he swipes a flat six over wide long-on
Chahal to Raina, FOUR, flighted on middle, there's no one at square leg and Raina is quickly down on his knees to sweep him to the boundary
Chahal to Finch, FOUR, he's just toying with them. It's his day today. Chahal tosses this leg-break up outside off and Finch swats the reverse-sweep away very fine. All intentional, all in control

Negi to Finch, out Caught by de Villiers!! Gone. Finch's knock comes to an end. Flat from Negi, following Finch as he backs away, cramps him up a touch and he miscues the pull straight to long-on. But what a knock it's been. He's blown RCB away. Finch c de Villiers b Negi 72(34) [4s-5 6s-6]
Negi to Raina, SIX, races to the pitch of the ball and lofts it over wide long-on. Raina may have the net run-rate at the corner of his eye

Head to Raina, FOUR, that's a really good shot. It's inside-out but it's off the back foot which is not easy to do at all. Flat from Head and sliding in, Raina stays in the crease and somehow finds the power to lift it over extra-cover and take it to the boundary
Head to Raina, FOUR, another one. He's timed this even better. Up and over extra-cover, the fielder dives in the deep but the ball sneaks through
Badree to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, short, inviting. Ishan Kishan clears his front leg and pulls it in the gap behind square square, there's no-one there and that will be an easy boundary

Badree to Ishan Kishan, out Lbw!! Badree's go-to delivery, the skidder. He may have anticipated a slog-sweep from Ishan Kishan and fired it straight on the stumps. Also the length was the key, neither full; nor short. Enough to defeat the batsman's instincts and strike him dead in front. Ishan Kishan was way too early on the shot. Ishan Kishan lbw b Badree 16(11) [4s-4]

Badree to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by de Villiers!! Game on! Both openers are back in the hut and it's that man, Samuel Badree, again. Shimmies out to loft the bowler over long-on, wasn't to the pitch, hits it right of the cue and holes out to the safest fielder on the planet. A-B-D. Clever from Badree as he followed B-Mac and fired it too close for his liking. Brendon McCullum c de Villiers b Badree 3(6)
Badree to Finch, SIX, why use the feet when you have such beautiful hands. What power, woof! Gets underneath this venom-less slider and smacks it onto the roof at deep mid-wicket
Badree to Finch, SIX. Kaboom. Make that two in a row. Finch wants to take the attack to the opposition. This time he fetches the ball from leg stump and goes spank over wide long-on. Madness...
Aravind to Finch, FOUR, plenty of width, Finch throws the bat and gets a thick edge which races away to the third man fence
Aravind to Finch, FOUR, makes room while clearing his front leg and bludgeons Sreenath Aravind straight down the ground. Can't slot fielders for that kind of a shot

Chahal to Finch, SIX, down the wicket and bam! Was nowhere near the pitch of the delivery, but fast hands and power of Finch takes care of everything. No half-measures. Swung it as hard as he can and got it over mid-wicket

Aniket Choudhary to Finch, FOUR, mistimed, but worth it. He saw there was no-one at deep mid-wicket, takes on the short ball and despite the ball getting big on him, he pulls full-throttle. Excellent batting
Aniket Choudhary to Finch, FOUR, he is picking the gaps to perfection tonight. Covers for the line and lofts gorgeously over extra cover. He is turning it on...

Aniket Choudhary to Finch, SIX, how does it matter? He is smashing the ball into the crowds. A half-volley on the pads, he whups it for a 97-metre maximum over mid-wicket. Just compare Raina's score with Finchy. Tells you that he's in some mood

Aniket Choudhary to Finch, 2 runs, fastest fifty by a GL player in the history of IPL, off 22 balls. Pitched up, Finch looks to drive firmly, it takes a big chunk of bottom half before dancing down towards the third man fence. A diving stop keeps it down to two, but cannot stop Finch from reaching fifty
Chahal to Raina, FOUR, slides this way too wide outside off and Raina reaches out to dab it away for his first boundary. Hasn't been himself today, maybe this will get him going
Basil Thampi to Kohli, SIX, there goes the riposte from the RCB skipper. He planted his feet leg-sidish and created enough room for a whip of the hands. The ball soared into the stands

Jadeja to Negi, FOUR, not where he intended, but RCB will take any run now. They have become like golddust. Quicker around off, Negi goes for the steer and chops it off the under edge, nutmegs Karthik and runs away to the boundary

Jadeja to Negi, FOUR, again. Once more Jadeja fires it across the left-hander, Negi still does not get the connection right on the dab, races away fine off the under edge and no chance for short third man

Faulkner to Negi, FOUR, Negi welcomes Faulkner with a superb drive. He makes a bit of room to open up the off-side field, Faulkner helps his cause by dishing it full, pumped through extra cover and wide of long-off
Faulkner to Mandeep, leg byes, FOUR, back of a length on off, Mandeep is early into the pull. The ball kisses the back thigh and escapes past Karthik, he dived over the ball there. Bonus runs for RCB
Ankit Soni to Negi, SIX, a much needed six. Soni is brave enough to toss it up, Negi kneels down and fetches the slog sweep from outside off, smacks it over long-on and has the crowd going again

Ankit Soni to Negi, SIX, Soni is trying too many things. First ball - leggie. Second - googly. Third - the front of the hand slider, Negi flat-bats it over extra cover. Just about has enough wings to clear the rope

Ankit Soni to Negi, out Caught by Basil Thampi!! Maiden IPL wicket for Soni. Negi wanted to smack another one out of the park. What was the need? You have to ask him. It was quicker and on off, Negi could not quite get underneath that, but still went through with the swipe, Thampi at deep mid-wicket didn't have to move an inch to pouch that. Another set batsmen throws it away for RCB. Negi c Basil Thampi b Ankit Soni 32(19) [4s-3 6s-2]

Jadeja to Badree, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! GL can do no wrong today. While RCB cannot find a way to stop the slump. What was Badree thinking playing that shot? Quicker and on the stumps, Badree goes for the heave into the leg-side, skies it towards deep mid-wicket. The ball hung in the air for a long time. Kishan had a fair distance to cover, he reaches there and slides across to cling on. Super take from the youngster. Badree c Ishan Kishan b Jadeja 3(3)

Andrew Tye to Mandeep, out Caught by Jadeja!! There goes RCB's last hope to post a decent total. Mandeep 's horror IPL continues. For the third or fourth time this season he has got playing the cut shot. Short and wide, it was there to be smacked, Mandeep cracks the cut straight to Jadeja at backward point. Third wicket for Tye and he takes his tally to 12. Mandeep c Jadeja b Andrew Tye 8(14)

Basil Thampi to Aniket Choudhary, FOUR, finally a boundary after 30 balls. Gets the crowd and cheerleaders going. They have been quiet all evening. Low full toss and Choudhary drives it uppishly wide of extra cover, Finch at long-off gave up the chase very early

Faulkner to Aravind, 1 run, they are running for everything. The back of the hand delivery and Aravind is early into the drive, the inside edge rolls to the right of Karthik, he shies and misses. Choudhary survives

Faulkner to Aravind, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! Easy peasy. McCullum makes it look so easy. The slower delivery right in the slot, Aravind spotted it and went on one knee to smash it out of the ground, did not get the elevation and hits it to long-on. McCullum first reverse cups it, but the momentum was taking him over, tosses the ball up, comes back in and completes the formalities. Aravind c Brendon McCullum b Faulkner 9(16)

Faulkner to Chahal, out Chahal Run Out!! 1 run completed. RCB have been bowled out. Another back of the hand slower one from Faulkner, Chahal drills the drive to long-off and Choudhary calls him for the second. McCullum gets to the ball and releases it quickly to Karthik, who does the rest. For the first time in IPL, RCB have been bowled out in consecutive matches. Chahal run out (Brendon McCullum/Karthik) 1(2)

Nathu Singh to Gayle, FOUR, slashes at that, the ball creams the outer part of the bat and goes between short third man and backward point for a four. It was full and well outside off. The bait was there and Gayle didn't back off

Basil Thampi to Kohli, out Caught by Finch!! Kohli has a smile, a frustrating one as he departs. That was short, at his body and Kohli closes the face of the bat on the pull but finds the man at short fine leg to perfection. He doesn't believe his luck. He timed it well but placement deserted him. The fielder - Finch gobbles it up somehow as the ball threatened to pop out. Massive strike from Basil Thampi who has both hands up in the air and soaks in the moment. He has scalped one of the best in the business. Kohli c Finch b Basil Thampi 10(13) [6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Gayle, out Caught by Karthik!! The ball nips away and takes the edge. First Kohli, now Gayle. RCB are under heavy weather. Gayle has a lame poke at it without any feet and manages to edge it. Karthik behind the stumps has one of the easiest bargains. GL have started off on a roaring note. Gayle c Karthik b Andrew Tye 8(11) [4s-1]

Andrew Tye to Head, out Caught by Raina!! The ball rears up, the batsman fails to get his hands out of the way and manages to edge it for Raina to take it at first slip. Good captaincy as he had himself there for this ball. All going GL's way. Head has a look of disbelief as he stares at the wicket. He had no clue as to how the ball sprung up from that length. On a hat-trick is Tye. Head c Raina b Andrew Tye 0(1)

Basil Thampi to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, short delivery and the batsman is quick to latch on it. The short deliveries were getting predictable and the batsman rocked back to slaughter that. The man in the deep - Tye, dives but fails to pull it back
Basil Thampi to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, strays on the fuller side with length, on the pads with the line, flicked nonchalantly over the man at short fine leg for a four. Kedar is away!

Basil Thampi to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, up and over screams Danny. Short ball zoning into the batsman, Kedar Jadhav archs his body back and uppercuts the ball away over the man at point for a four. Hat-trick of fours and RCB try to break the shackles

Jadeja to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, uncocks the wrists on impact and goes inside out to get a four over cover. One bounce into the fence. Shot of the day so far. The execution looked serene despite not a lot of followthrough with the bat. Just a suplex of the wrists

Ankit Soni to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, drops down on one knee and sends the ball skywards. That was a maximum, the moment it left the bat. He pumelled that with all his might and the ball landed well into the crowds in the cow corner region

Jadeja to Kedar Jadhav, out Bowled!! Poor shot!! Tries to be cheeky and loses his woodwork. That was flat and at the sticks, the batsman tried to open the face of the bat and run it down but misread the trajectory and the length to be clean bowled. GL break the momentum and get the huge scalp against the run of play. Kedar Jadhav b Jadeja 31(18) [4s-4 6s-1]

Ankit Soni to Mandeep, out de Villiers Run Out!! Miscommunication personified. The two men were clueless, stranded almost midway on the 22 yards and the end result is a calamitous one. ABD is gone. That was pushed away into the off-side with the outer half of the bat and then the mix-up followed. Yes-no, yes-no, ABD somehow moved past Mandeep and the direct hit at the striker's end meant the end for him. ABD did make the initial call though. de Villiers run out (Jadeja) 5(11)

Coulter-Nile to Nair, FOUR, first boundary of the match, short and angling into Karun's hips, he gets inside the line and tucks it behind square on the on-side. Fine leg was inside the ring and the ball rolls away to the fence

U Yadav to Samson, FOUR, nicely played by Samson, short of a length and on the stumps, he leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and flicks it over mid-wicket, beats the infield and rolls away to the fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, SIX, well tossed up delivery and the batsman slog sweeps it out of the park. That brings fifty for Samson! This has been a fine knock from the keeper-batsman. This might as well break the shackles
de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, dragged down short delivery and down onto the leg-side, the batsman swivels on the pull and gets it fine past the man at short fine leg for a four
de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, fifty of the combo comes up! That was on the pads and clipped away uppishly for the man at deep mid-wicket
de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, short delivery, sans any pace and the batsman hammers the pull away over the man at deep mid-wicket for a sixer. Iyer has changed gears as well

de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, pushes it away into the off-side for a quick single and a direct hit at the bowler's end would have seen the back of Shreyas Iyer but he survives as there was no direct hit and in the end, gets an extra run on the overthrow

U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Looks to heave the ball away, the ball trims the leading edge and soars up for the man at third man to make a meal of that. The ball bounced up after landing in front of the man at third man - Pathan, who tipped the ball over the bar
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, poor ball, tickled away past the man at short fine leg and back-to-back boundaries get Delhi off a to a good start in this over

U Yadav to Samson, SIX, Bang!! Boom!! Short ball and the batsman transfers his weight ever so slightly to thwack the ball over the on-side towards cow corner region for a huge six. That was almost lost in the clouds

U Yadav to Samson, out Lbw!! The ball tails in and raps the batsman in front of the sticks. The ump had no hesitation in raising his finger. The batsman was trying to walk into the clip but lost his balance in doing so and missed the full, straight ball. End of another good knock from Samson, he continues to have a good season with the bat. Samson lbw b U Yadav 60(38) [4s-4 6s-3]
Narine to Pant, FOUR, drops it short does Narine and the batsman scooters back to pounce on it. Munches the cut past the man at backward point to send the ball racing into the fence

Coulter-Nile to Pant, out Lbw!! That was full and straight from round the wicket and the batsman misses it to be out LBW. That was going down is what I feel. But the ball tailed in a touch and the batsman was falling over a bit to give the impression to the umpire that the ball struck the batter adjacent to the wickets. A lucky one for KKR there. Pant lbw b Coulter-Nile 6(4) [4s-1]
Coulter-Nile to Chris Morris, FOUR, short, wide, room, batsman cashes in. Opens the face of the blade and gets a four. Just used the pace of the bowler

Coulter-Nile to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that was an explosive drive from Shreyas Iyer. Full and wide, the batsman threw the kitchen sink piled with utensils to spear that between cover and mid-off. Iyer is getting a move-on

Coulter-Nile to Shreyas Iyer, out Lbw!! The full swinging in delivery does it again. A hint of reverse and the batsman again misses trying to play across the line of the sticks. He was as dead a as a dodo. That delivery was quick as well and didn't allow the batsman to bring his bat down in time. NCN vindicates his skipper's decision to bring him back. Shreyas Iyer lbw b Coulter-Nile 47(34) [4s-4 6s-1]
Kuldeep Yadav to Corey Anderson, no run, lucky is Corey Anderson! That was scooped back to the bowler who lets it pop out. Dolly of a catch it was as the batsman pushed it back on the clipped drive

Kuldeep Yadav to Corey Anderson, 1 run, shot back like a bullet by Corey Anderson and the bowler spills another one. This was a tough one and almost burst through the hands of the bowler. It was a flighted ball and the batsman found it in his radar and slapped it back with ferocity for it to be fluffed

Narine to Corey Anderson, out Corey Anderson Run Out!! Corey Anderson finally runs out of luck and commits harakiri. Pushed the ball away with soft hands into the off-side and then yes-no, yes-no in the middle ensured both men were stranded mid-way. In the end, the ball was flicked up to the batter's end and the keeper did the rest to find Corey Anderson well short. Corey Anderson run out (Gambhir/Jackson) 2(5)

Coulter-Nile to Bawne, FOUR, full on the sticks, the batsman winds up for the heave and picks the delivery away into the on-side for a four. There was no one square on the on-side and a four to start the over

Coulter-Nile to Chris Morris, out Caught by Woakes!! Full delivery sliced away and Woakes in the deep came charging in and takes a great catch diving forward. That was full and again some tailing movement accompanied the ball. The batsman despite getting a meaty part of the bat on it failed to clear the man in the deep. In this sapping heat, Woakes putting in an effort like that speaks volumes of his fitness. Chris Morris c Woakes b Coulter-Nile 11(10) [4s-1]

U Yadav to Samson, SIX, cracking shot, fraction too short from Umesh, Samson is quick to swivel across, uses the pace on the ball and helps it on its way, went sailing over the ropes at backward square leg

Coulter-Nile to Nair, FOUR, too straight from Coulter-Nile, ends up drifting onto Karun's pads, he uses the pace on the ball and flicks it behind square on the on-side. The man in the deep was very square and has no chance

Coulter-Nile to Nair, FOUR, lovely, no wonder - the Daredevils are backing him despite poor form. This is a top shot, 'exquisite - a proper cricket shot', gushes KP on air. Nothing wrong with the ball, on a good length and just outside off, Karun leans forward, drives it on the up and splits the gap past cover-point, no need to run for those

Coulter-Nile to Samson, FOUR, nicely played by Samson, back of a length and just outside off, he waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and taps it past the lone slip, beats the man getting across from third man

Woakes to Samson, FOUR, beautifully played, on a good length and just outside off, Samson leans forward, drives it on the up and splits the gap between cover and cover-point, rolls away to the fence in a hurry

Woakes to Samson, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Samson, this is some supreme batting from the two Daredevils openers. Cross seasm delivery from Woakes, but it's short and wide of off, Samson waits on it and cuts it behind square on the off-side, beats the inner ring and rolls away to the fence

Narine to Nair, out Lbw!! Narine has got past the dangerous opening partnership. Karun was looking solid, but gets too ambitious and pays the ultimate penalty. This was tossed up on the off-stump line, Karun went down on his knees as he looked to play the slog sweep, missed it completely and was struck on the back thigh-pad. Was the impact outside off? Need to have a look at the replays, but it was certainly hitting the stumps, the umpire doesn't think a lot, up goes the dreaded finger. Replays prove he was just about right, both impact and hitting the stumps remained with the umpire's call. Nair lbw b Narine 15(17) [4s-3]

Zaheer to Narine, FOUR, there's the width and there's the first boundary for Narine. No feet movement at all from the spinner, stands his ground and slashes it off the outer half to third man, the fielder was inside the ring and it turned out to be a safe shot

Rabada to Narine, out Bowled!! Thank you for coming. One ball is all Rabada needed to send the dangerous Narine back to the hut. Full, fast and straight - the mantra to get Narine out. Rabada angled across the left-hander, Narine's feet went nowhere with the prod forward, the ball beats the outside edge and clatters into the off-stump. Early wicket for DD. Narine b Rabada 4(4) [4s-1]

Rabada to Uthappa, FOUR, Iyer helps Uthappa to get off the mark with a boundary. Full and drifting onto the pads, Uthappa with the kind of form he's in, clips it through mid-wicket. Iyer did the hard work of getting to the ball, but slipped while gathering it

Rabada to Uthappa, byes, FOUR, Pant had no chance. 147kph bumper that kept climbing, Uthappa ducked under it and evaded it with ease, but unfortunately Pant couldn't glove it even with a full stretch upwards

Mishra to Uthappa, SIX, picks the bones out of this googly from Mishra. It was tossed up generously and as soon as Uthappa picked it, he decided it was going in the stands. Heaves it way over long-on. It was right in the slot too
Corey Anderson to Gambhir, FOUR, this is gentle pace from Anderson. At 127kph, he has tried to bang it in short. The ball sits up for Gambhir and he pulls it off the waist through mid-wicket

Corey Anderson to Gambhir, out Uthappa Run Out!! Nair has one stump to aim at from point, and he nails it. Uthappa is gone here. He looks surprised as OUT flashes on the big screen. Thought he was in. But he's a yard short at least. Nair is really swift to get onto the ball as Gambhir chops it to his left. Quick gather, quick release and a rocket throw. But the magic in the field has come 10 overs too late. Uthappa punches gloves with Gambhir as he walks off. Uthappa run out (Nair) 59(33) [4s-5 6s-4]

Corey Anderson to Gambhir, FOUR, so much time for Gambhir against someone of Anderson's pace. The ball is short and wide, Gambhir plants his back foot a foot outside the off-stump to get to the ball and then slices it away past backward point into the boundary. Brings up two milestones with this one shot. Another fifty for him, as well as 6000 T20 runs
Mishra to Gambhir, FOUR, really poor delivery from Mishra. He strays in line, tosses it up on leg stump and all Gambhir does is paddle him away fine into the boundary

Mishra to Gambhir, FOUR, that's a tired dive from Zaheer at backward point. He's struggling with his hamstring too, so can't really blame him. But Mishra is just seething. He turns around in disgust. But this is awful bowling to begin with. Bowls it short and wide again, and Gambhir slices it neatly to the left of Zaheer. A younger fielder would have stopped that
Mishra to Gambhir, 1 run, pushes a single down to long-off
Mishra to M Pandey, FOUR, drops it short again and Pandey swats him to the right of long-on to finish a truly horrendous over from Mishra. 13 off it

Rabada to M Pandey, out Bowled!! Absolutely shatters middle and leg-stump. Pandey doesn't have a clue. A pacy, full ball at 146kph which bursts right through bat and pad. His feet aren't moving, he is playing across the line, he is beaten for pace. Poor technique from Pandey. Rabada exposes it and how. M Pandey b Rabada 5(4) [4s-1]
Chris Morris to Jackson, FOUR, that's more of a steer than a cut. Width on offer from Morris as he starts a new spell, Jackson times it beautifully as he guides it past backward point

Chris Morris to Gambhir, FOUR, DD are just waiting for this to get over. The field is well up. Morris bowls it full just outside off and Gambhir just has to get his placement right as he drives through extra-cover

Chris Morris to Jackson, FOUR, a good little cameo this from Jackson. He's handling himself really well. Short of length into the body, he swivels nicely and pulls it away through backward square. Uppish but in the gap
Rabada to Gambhir, FOUR, flicked away to the mid-wicket boundary. No one bothers to move. Huge open space in the field. Poor from DD. Not at all mindful of the net run rate
Corey Anderson to Gambhir, FOUR, first ball from Anderson and it is smashed for four. Short, wide and Gambhir had the width to free his arms, slaps it behind point and third man had no chance

Pat Cummins to Gambhir, FOUR, errs in line and that is enough for Gambhir to collect a boundary. On leg-stump, Gambhir gets inside the line and uses Cummins's pace to glance it past the diving short fine fielder
Rabada to Uthappa, leg byes, FOUR, sprays it down leg, Uthappa can't meet with the tickle, but the ball brushes the pad to beat Pant to his left. Poor ball that from Rabada

Rabada to Uthappa, FOUR, in the air and just over the leaping mid-on fielder. Uthappa is early into the pick up shot, more of a leading edge and the ball balloons over a backtracking mid-on fielder. The practice wickets take care of the rest

Mishra to Gambhir, FOUR, greeted with a dance down the wicket, gets right to the pitch of the flighted delivery and lofts it with the turn over mid-wicket, one bounce and into the fence. He's one of the best players of spin

Mishra to Uthappa, FOUR, now Uthappa uses the pace of Mishra to pick up a boundary. He waits and waits for the ball to arrive, then at the last second opens the bat face and runs it past the slip fielder

Mishra to Gambhir, FOUR, lovely shot! Another 50+ stand for the duo. Continuing from where they had left off in Pune. Loopy leg-break on the stumps, Gambhir makes just a bit of room and chips it beautifully inside out. The onus was on timing rather than power. Long-off dived in vain to stop that
Chris Morris to Uthappa, SIX, sharp short delivery and Uthappa is up for the challenge. He gets into position quickly and nails the pull behind square, flat and all the way. Good start to the over
Chris Morris to Uthappa, FOUR, full on off and middle, Uthappa flicks it uppishly over the mid-wicket fielder. Not timed well enough but has enough fuel to collect himself a boundary

Chris Morris to Uthappa, SIX, 16 runs off the first three balls. This is the best of the lot. Good length ball on the pads, Uthappa just picks it up nonchalantly and places it into the stands at deep mid-wicket

Pat Cummins to Uthappa, SIX, he promised some fireworks this year and he's keeping up his words. Anticipated the length to be short, got quickly into position and smashed the pull over the deep mid-wicket fence

Pat Cummins to Uthappa, FOUR, in the air and over the fielder. Cummins pitches it up and Uthappa does not need a second invitation, drives in the air and over Mishra at mid-off. Even a full length jump from Mishy wasn't enough

Corey Anderson to Uthappa, 1 run, fifty for Uthappa. It is his fourth this season. Waves the bat around, walks towards his skipper and shakes hands. Got it in 26 balls against RPS, today has taken two balls less. Back of a length and on the hips, tucked square on the leg-side

Corey Anderson to Gambhir, FOUR, the runs keep flowing. The 100 is up for KKR. The equation is down to a run-a-ball. This should be a cake walk. Banged in halfway down the wicket, Gambhir swats the pull over mid-wicket. He had to really reach out and did well to avoid the fielder

Bhuvneshwar to Guptill, FOUR, guess it was against Pakistan in 2016 World T20 Guptill played a superb knock. He knows the conditions well here. Doesn't move much, gets inside the line of a fullish delivery and lifts the drive over extra cover
Bhuvneshwar to Guptill, FOUR, inswinger, Guptill exposes all his stumps and spanks it straight down the ground. Sheer power
Nehra to Guptill, SIX, short ball at 131ks, angled into the body. Bring it on says Guptill as he swivel-pulls a 77 metre maximum over square leg.
Nehra to Guptill, FOUR. Whang! Guptill is making full use of the opportunity. Clears his front leg and smokes a full ball over mid-on. There's Warner at long-on, but he can't get there in time
Henriques to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, drops a dolly short for the batsman to slap the ball away through the covers for a four. Eoin Morgan is away

Henriques to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, action replay of the previous ball and that has been powered away through the covers. The man at sweeper cover despite not having to cover a lot to his right, ends up being a spectator

Rashid Khan to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, the partnership between Shaun Marsh and Eoin Morgan is now 50. Short ball, flatter in trajectory and the batsman stays back to cut it away between short third man and point
Henriques to Eoin Morgan, SIX, fetches the length ball and then thwacks the ball over long-on. Length in the later part of the innings spells doom for the bowlers

Henriques to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, length ball at the sticks and the batsman slashes the ball away across the line and threads it between long-on and deep mid-wicket. Fifty for Marsh! Another valuable knock from the run-machine from Punjab
Henriques to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, BOOM! Flat bats the short ball and Warner at long-on had no chance to grab that. Even the FEDEX would have been proud of that forehand smash

Henriques to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, Hooda was hoodoo-ed there! Drops a skier at deep mid-wicket. The short ball it was, Shaun Marsh took on the bait and managed a huge top-edge. The fielder in the deep made a meal of it as it went through his hands and to make matters worse, the ball bobbled away into the fence

Rashid Khan to Eoin Morgan, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! The slog sweep comes out wrong. The extra bit of flight induces the big fat top-edge on the slog sweep and Hooda this time doesn't err. He runs across to his right and takes it with both hands. There was no turn on that ball but the batsman was expecting some. Eoin Morgan c Deepak Hooda b Rashid Khan 26(21) [4s-2 6s-1]

Rashid Khan to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, jumps out, takes the ball on the half-volley and then goes straight down the ground. On a bounce and into the fence goes the ball. The use of the feet ensured Shaun Marsh got an important four against the leggie
S Kaul to Saha, 1 run, dabs the ball to point and allowed Yuvraj, standing at point to have a shy at the batting end. A direct hit and Shaun Marsh would have been miles short of his ground

S Kaul to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, short delivery and slightly wide as well. The batsman opens his arms and cuts it away. Hooda in the deep puts in the slide but the ball goes away from him to hit the cushion

S Kaul to Shaun Marsh, SIX, WOOAAAAHHHHHH! That was out of the top draw! A length ball it was and the batsman cracked it over covers for a maximum. That should have been awarded a dozen runs just for the execution of it

S Kaul to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, another chance for Shaun Marsh! This time Warner at deep mid-wicket allows the ball to burst through his fingers. Warner came in and then missed it. That was walloped though. The ball lands into a puddle

S Kaul to Saha, out Bowled!! A length ball, Saha looks to pull and manages an inside edge for the ball to canon onto the sticks. That was a nothing shot from him. Kaul gets away with a length ball but the good thing was he kept it closer to the sticks. The ball might have hurried onto the batsman after it hit the deck. Saha b S Kaul 2(4)

Bhuvneshwar to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, Marsh cooking up some great momentum now. Flurry of boundaries. Low full toss from Bhuvneshwar as he misses the wide yorker. Marsh uses the pace and steers it to split short third man and backward point

Bhuvneshwar to Shaun Marsh, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Hooda under the skier again, and he takes it this time. Makes amends. But massive props to Bhuvneshwar, stepping up to answer his captain's call once more. He's done it time and again this season. Uses the knuckle ball to deceive Marsh who is early into the heave. The ball is launched into the night sky, Hooda comes in from deep mid-wicket, settles under it and overcomes a slight bobble to grab hold of it. That should seal it. Shaun Marsh c Deepak Hooda b Bhuvneshwar 84(50) [4s-14 6s-2]
Nehra to Axar, FOUR, right off the toe-end of the bat as Axar chases a very wide ball from Nehra, squirts it away past the keeper into the third man boundary. Went very fine
Nehra to Axar, FOUR, overpitched outside off and Axar crashes it through extra-cover. Blistering shot. He's in some good hitting form, carrying on from the last match

S Kaul to Axar, 2 runs, he's miscued that, but manages to place it to perfection in between long-on and long-off. Actually, Williamson got there from long-on with a one-handed effort but hardly managed to get fingers on the ball. A length ball which Axar wants to tonk down the ground, just couldn't get hold of it. Back for two

S Kaul to Axar, out Caught by Warner!! Another miscue, this time he won't get away. It's Warner under it, and Warner takes it. Clever slower ball from Kaul keeping the line well outside off and the ball cuts away further to ensure that Axar slices it in the air. Warner moves to his left and takes it comfortably. Axar c Warner b S Kaul 16(9) [4s-2]
S Kaul to Anureet Singh, FOUR, dipping slower full toss, 113kph, Anureet swings it away to the square leg boundary. Kaul disgusted with himself

Bhuvneshwar to Anureet Singh, FOUR, Anureet has unintentionally played the perfect slice to split short third man and backward point. He just swings hard at this length ball, wanting it carve it over extra-cover. The bat face opens beautifully on impact and the ball pops perfectly into the gap

Nehra to Mohit Sharma, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Third catch for Hooda after the drop. The ball is full and angling across off, Mohit slices it in the air after throwing his bat at it. Simple catch at sweeper cover. Mohit Sharma c Deepak Hooda b Nehra 2(4)

Nehra to Ishant, FOUR, Nehra not impressed, either by the effort from the keeper, or by Ishant's attempt at a pull. Ishant is rushed by this short of length ball and sends an outside edge past the diving Ojha into the third man boundary

Nehra to Guptill, FOUR, mid-on chases...chases...chases and the ball wins the race. Not quite off the middle, but Guptill will take it. Slogs a length ball across the line to the right of mid-on where Siddarth Kaul comes second in the race

Bhuvneshwar to Guptill, out Caught by Henriques!! Big, big wicket this. The knuckle ball. Front of the hand slower ball, Guptill was way too early into the shot, looks to flay it over the infield, but instead slices it off the bottom half. It keeps sailing and soaring high, Henriques at cover runs back and plucks it with minimum fuss. Guptill c Henriques b Bhuvneshwar 23(11) [4s-4 6s-1]

Nehra to Anureet Singh, out Caught by Williamson!! That's it. Nehra bags a third as Anureet hits a full toss straight down the throat of long-off. Sunrisers bag their first away win this season. Anureet Singh c Williamson b Nehra 15(12) [4s-2]
Nehra to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, lovely, lovely shot! Pitched up outside off, Marsh drives on the up and gets it in the gap between cover and extra cover
Nehra to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, waits on the slower ball and cuts it at the last possible second. Bhuvi at third man runs to his right and puts in a dive, couldn't quite get his body behind the ball

Nehra to Vohra, out Caught by S Kaul!! The slower ball works...Nehra persists with the same tactic, he fires it around off and middle denying all the room Vohra wanted. He lifts the stroke off the upper half and chips it straight to Kaul mid-on. Simple catch. Vohra c S Kaul b Nehra 3(6)
S Kaul to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, short ball, angling away outside off, Marsh gets a thick top-edge on the pull which sails over the keeper for a one-bounce four

S Kaul to Maxwell, out Caught by Nehra!! Remember Kohli's dismissal yesterday? This was more or less the same. Maxi couldn't have picked the fielder any better. It was a length ball drifting into the pads, Maxwell looked to have timed the flick perfectly but little did he knew that the ball would go straight to short fine. Nehra gee ain't dropping that. Maxwell c Nehra b S Kaul 0(2)
Deepak Hooda to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, poor first ball from Hooda, dropped it short and wide of off, Marsh makes room and crunches it wide of point, no need to run for those

Deepak Hooda to Shaun Marsh, SIX, cracking shot, just a little shimmy down the track, Marsh gets close to the pitch of the ball, extends his elbows and lifts it high and over long-off, went a long way into the stands

Deepak Hooda to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, another boundary and Marsh is piling it on. Hooda overcompensates and drops one short and wide of off, Marsh makes room and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats mid-off and rolls away to the fence

Henriques to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, Marsh is looking in sublime touch! Width on offer from Henriques, a gentle loosener to start, he leans back and cuts it square on the off-side, beats the fielder in the ring and rolls away to the fence

Anureet Singh to Dhawan, FOUR, first boundary for SRH. It was marginally short and Dhawan is on it in a flash. Quickly transfers his weight and pulls it to deep mid-wicket. The fielder there had no chance of cutting that

Anureet Singh to Dhawan, FOUR, this is poor from Anureet Singh. Sprays it down the leg side, all Dhawan had to do was to get some wood. He gets plenty of it and the ball races down to the fine leg fence in a jiffy

Maxwell to Warner, out Bowled!! Big, big wicket for Maxwell. Warner makes room and exposes all three stumps. Misses the slog sweep and the ball rattles the middle stump. Punjab will be delighted with this as Warner would have taken the game further away from Punjab. Warner b Maxwell 51(27) [4s-4 6s-4]

Axar to Williamson, 1 run, gently knocks a flatter delivery to the right of Axar and runs for a risky single. Axar slides and aims, misses by a whisker, had that hit Williamson would have been in trouble
Axar to Williamson, SIX, touch short and spanked! Williamson is quick on his wheels as he jumps back to thump Axar over mid-wicket. Mighty!
Cariappa to Dhawan, FOUR, in his half and he smashes it for a one-bounce four over mid-wicket. Good, clean swing of the bat
Mohit Sharma to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan seems to be in mood today. Shuffles across his stumps and dispatches a slower ball with a thumping flick wide of short fine

Mohit Sharma to Dhawan, out Caught by Maxwell!! Maxi you bewdy! What.A.Catch. Misjudged it for a fleeting moment at deep mid-wicket, but timed his leap to perfection to grab it over his head mid-air.
