Christian to Finch, 1 run, Stokes misses a direct hit here. Certain run out opportunity. Firstly, Finch is duped by a slower ball. Pops it up towards short point, where Stokes comes sprinting in and attacks the ball. Picks the right end too, with Finch having given up, but misses

Christian to Brendon McCullum, SIX, and look at how McCullum celebrates Stokes no-bullseye last ball. Gets the right length to smack his bat right across to, and does so effectively. Hedgehopped over deep mid-wicket

Tahir to Finch, SIX, what can a bowler do. Bowl, they say. Perfectly good ball from Tahir here. Wrong 'un on off stump but Finch has his front leg out, smacking it over deep mid-wicket with the turn. What have you got, Tahir?

Tahir to Finch, out Caught&Bowled!! Two overs, two wickets. Tahir is the late-bloomer we all want to be. He was driven on the up last ball, so drags the length back this time. Just a bit. Finch was looking to nudge a single to mid-wicket at best, but is early into the shot. Perhaps the ball held up and the leading edge was devoured by Tahir. And the celebrations followed. Finch c and b Tahir 13(6) [4s-1 6s-1]
Sangwan to Rahane, FOUR, drifts on the pads of Rahane, who does not have to do much. Gets on his toes and tickles it into the fine leg fence to get things going

Sangwan to Rahane, out Lbw!! Appeal and umpire Marais Erasmus raises his finger. Oh, the replays suggest it pitched marginally outside leg. But too tough to spot that in real time. Rahane was on the back foot to keep that out. The ball came in off the deck. Sangwan has that extra pace and which is why he was able to evade the bat of Rahane. Was hit around the knee-roll and Gujarat have got the start they wanted. Rahane lbw b Sangwan 4(4) [4s-1]
Sangwan to Smith, FOUR, the bait that Smith throws to the bowler - shuffles across to this inswinging ball and flicks through mid-wicket to get off the mark with a boundary

Sangwan to Smith, out Caught by Ankit Soni!! Sangwan's pace has devoured another one. Good pacy bumper that kept climbing on to Smith, who wanted to hook this one. Was hit on the splice and hence no power behind the shot. The man at short fine leg has to move a few yards to his right to make things a little tricky for Pune. Smith c Ankit Soni b Sangwan 4(2) [4s-1]

Basil Thampi to Manoj Tiwary, out Lbw!! What is happening there. Manoj Tiwary is gone. Stephen Fleming in the dug-out has a sorry look on his face. Manoj Tiwary goes on the back foot to play a full ball. It is a reminiscence of what happened in Australia close to a decade ago. Thampi is not as quick as Brett Lee but has enough venom to catch him in front. The ball would have crashed on to the leg-stump. Manoj Tiwary lbw b Basil Thampi 0(2)
Dwayne Smith to Stokes, 1 run, 50 for Stokes. Second one in the IPL. Pune need him tonight. Pulls a short ball to deep mid-wicket to get to the milestone

Dwayne Smith to Stokes, FOUR, Stokes leaves his crease too early. Dwayne Smith sees that and throws it pretty wide but that does not help him get away. Stokes manages to put some bat and squeezes it to the deep backward point fence
Faulkner to Dhoni, SIX, this shot is all about the sound it made. Goes back and across to this short ball and hammers the pull over the deep mid-wicket fence

Dwayne Smith to Stokes, SIX, that could have taken a couple of them down in the crowd. Stokes swings. Why not. Length ball, sits up there and Stokes just swings across. "The big Ben," the screen displays
Dwayne Smith to Stokes, FOUR, now makes room to a ball that was always going to be fuller, and slaps it through covers. Top shot as a follow up to that brute of a ball

Basil Thampi to Dhoni, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! From the lanes of Kerala to outwitting Dhoni on the grandest of stages. A slower ball, and the funny bit is that Dhoni did read it. Was wide outside off, so waited before letting out a forehanded slap. Dhoni waits, and then some, and hits but couldn't impart the power that he should have. Straight to McCullum at long-off. Pune might be done here.. but hey, Stokes here. Dhoni c Brendon McCullum b Basil Thampi 26(33) [4s-1 6s-1]
Basil Thampi to Stokes, FOUR, that's a I-don't-want-you-to-be-a-bowler hit. Takes his front leg out of the way and flat-bats Thampi over his head. Disparaging hit. Utterly disdainful
Sangwan to Christian, FOUR, past Faulkner at backward point. Dives sideways with outstretched right hand but can't stop this brutal cut from Christian. Saw the width and just laid into it

Basil Thampi to Stokes, SIX, oh dear, that simplifies things. A 79-meter six. 19 needed off 11 now. A full toss and that has been bruted over long-on. A full-blooded bat swat and boom, it's outta here

Basil Thampi to Stokes, SIX, for a moment, I thought it's headed to long-off. But Finch was there, and the ball would have cleared Finch on Finch's shoulders there. Long, big hit. Made room, as he's been doing, and clouts it over the fielder. Way over him, as I have made amply clear

Faulkner to Stokes, FOUR, no more an IPL virgin. Pune goes loud and berserk as Stokes hits a century here. His first in the Indian Premier League. His first ever in Twenty20s. Backs away and slaps a drive through extra cover. What a gorgeous shot. Raises his bat after a fist-pump and screeches, in cramps and joy, err.. He's almost taken Pune home here

Faulkner to Christian, SIX, Dhoni and Smith half-hug in the dug out, Pune's crowd cheers its lungs out. Supergiant beat Gujarat for the first time ever in IPL. Christian gets a ball sitting up and scythes the ball over square leg. Way over it. With that, it's goodbye RCB from IPL 2017

Sangwan to Stokes, FOUR, keeping things simple and straight is Stokes there. There was a hint of movement on this full ball. Stokes did well to not try something fancy, presented the full blade and bisected the gap between the bowler and mid-on

Basil Thampi to Stokes, FOUR, Stokes was on the charge for a moment but saw the length early. It was a bit shortish outside off and Stokes fetched the pull from there, hit it all along the ground to the deep mid-wicket fence
Sangwan to Stokes, SIX, short ball and Stokes seems to have got his eye in. Goes back in no time and times the pull well over the deep backward square leg fence. Goes deep into the stands
Sangwan to Tripathi, FOUR, wow shot from Tripathi. Pure timing from Tripathi. Stands tall to this short ball and cuts past the man at backward point

Faulkner to Stokes, FOUR, slower ball that is too wide, makes things easy for Stokes. He stays back in the crease and thumps past the man at cover. Once he has got that out of the ring, it is always racing away

Faulkner to Stokes, out Tripathi Run Out!! 1 run completed. That is farcical from Tripathi. What was he thinking? Called for the second run and then stops mid-way to spoil things for himself because Stokes had committed for the run. Stokes thuds this on-drive down the ground towards long-on. Finch has some distance to cover and Tripathi senses the second run. Withdraws late and digs his grave as Finch hits the target at the bowler's end. Stokes looked angry there. No fault of his though. Tripathi run out (Finch) 6(7) [4s-1]

Jadeja to Dhoni, FOUR, those trunk-like forearms take over. Jadeja tosses outside off and Dhoni drives with the turn. Places it wide of sweeper whose dive makes contact with the ball but fails to keep that in. First boundary for Dhoni
Jadeja to Stokes, SIX, when 11 deliveries have been dot out of 12, you do such things. Like going across the line and sending it well over cow corner for a maxium
Jadeja to Stokes, SIX, and when the bowler dares to flight, you - on the back of confidence - try it again. This time, Stokes clubs it well over the long-on fence. Too big a hit

Siraj to Samson, SIX, that's a glorious shot! Siraj bangs it short without any venom behind it. Samson stands tall and launches it over long-off. See the ball and hit the ball. He hit that and stood for the photographs

Siraj to Nair, FOUR, that's a cracking shot to get off the mark! That was a gift from Siraj. Short and wide outside off, Nair backs away, clears the front leg and slaps it hard over covers. One bounce and over the fence
Henriques to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that's one of the best shots of the game. A slight move across and offers a straight bat to send it between long-on and deep mid-wicket
Siraj to Pant, SIX, this guy and his timing. Reads this short ball early and waits on the back foot. Pulls from there into the deep square leg fence

Siraj to Pant, out Bowled!! Wow! What a reply from Siraj. He did not like the six for sure. Comes back with a peach of a yorker and as Mr Gavaskar informs us this was around 27.4kph quicker than the previous ball - 115kph. A yorker on the legs, too tough to negotiate. Pant's bat comes down late and he deflects it off his leg to the off-pole. Siraj is delighted. Pant b Siraj 34(20) [4s-4 6s-1]

Yuvraj to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, another loose ball around off. Shreyas Iyer swings across the line and for a moment it seems he is in danger of skying this one. But he is not, sends over the long-on fence. Mighty hit
Yuvraj to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, and again! Unlike Corey Anderson, Shreyas Iyer does not miss out on this short ball. Camps back in time and thunders the pull deep into the stands over deep mid-wicket

S Kaul to Corey Anderson, SIX, after a barrage of mistimed swipes and pulls finally Corey Anderson gets one off the middle of the willow. And when he gets those off the meat, no ground is big enough. A length ball served with gentle pace. What else does he need? Swings and swings well to clear the man at long-on

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Henriques over-trusts his legs and spoils a catch that could have been 'the one' for Dhawan who ran from sweeper towards this skier. Shreyas Iyer had thrown his bat at a wide ball and sliced off the outer half. If not for his luck and Henriques ambitions, Shreyas Iyer would have been walking back

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Siraj!! Slower ball on off, on the shorter side as well. Shreyas Iyer has already given himself some room. That's like committing without knowing what is in store. Cannot retreat, it is late for him. Tries to ramp but there is no pace or the bounce to ease things for him. Ends up guiding it into the hands of Siraj at short third man. This is far from over. Delhi have not chased well and because they have not, they will need some extra effort to go past the line here. Time-out in the meantime. Shreyas Iyer c Siraj b Bhuvneshwar 33(25) [4s-1 6s-2]

Siraj to Corey Anderson, SIX, bye bye ball. Slips on the legs of Corey Anderson. Was a slower ball and Corey Anderson whipped it from there, skies it high but gets the distance as well. Manages to clear Dhawan at deep square leg

Siraj to Chris Morris, FOUR, placed! Well placed! This is what Delhi were lacking. It is a short ball and Chris Morris rolls his wrists on the pull to bisect the fielders converging from deep backward square leg and deep mid-wicket

Bhuvneshwar to Corey Anderson, FOUR, there is a thing called luck. But there is nothing called like a bowler's luck. He is always at the receiving end of things. It is a yorker, almost fells Corey Anderson down. Cannot get his bat down in time but manages to put some willow on it. That is enough to deflect this to the fine leg fence

Bhuvneshwar to Corey Anderson, SIX, if not for the stands this would have travelled more. Might have got the metro from Pragati Maidan. Fuller length and Corey Anderson cleared his front leg, cracked it hard and hit flat over the long-on fence

S Kaul to Chris Morris, SIX, at the outset this one did not seem to have come off the middle. But he had timed it well. Has that power to clear the fence. A short ball and Chris Morris pulls well over the deep mid-wicket fielder

Henriques to Corey Anderson, FOUR, Short ball. Corey Anderson pulls and mid-off is in the ring, this will be a four, giving Delhi a much-needed win. Has this been given as four or is it only a single? Yes it is a four. Delhi win by 6-wickets

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, nothing wrong this time. Right off the middle. Kumar offers width wide of off on this short of length delivery and Samson takes advantage of it. He punches it and bisects cover and cover-point. Races away

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, a very unlike Bhuvi over. He was all over the place this over. Shortish delivery outside off, you don't offer width to this guy. Flays the bat hard at it and lifts it over the infield on the off-side. Bullets into the cover fence

S Kaul to Nair, SIX, third man in business? Nope, over him. Cheeky shot from the Karnataka batsman. It was banged in short outside off, Nair waits for it and periscopes it over the non-existent slip. Has enough power to go over third man, who thought he might have a chance there

S Kaul to Nair, FOUR, 2 runs off the first four balls, and then leaks 10 runs off the next two. DD are off to a flier. Kaul pitches it up and Nair drills it down the ground with a shimmy down. All along the carpet, into the fence

Siraj to Samson, out Caught by Dhawan!! First breakthrough for SRH totally against the run of play. Once again the familiar culprit doing the trick - the slower ball. It was on a good length and wide of off. Samson is early into his stroke - the slash. In the end, slices it straight into the bucket hands of Dhawan at cover-point. Samson c Dhawan b Siraj 24(19) [4s-2 6s-1]

Siraj to Nair, FOUR, nowhere near the middle of the bat, but Nair won't mind a bit. Nair backs away and wanted to loft it inside-out over covers. Since the ball was a slower one, he ends up slicing it over covers. The quick outfield does the rest

Siraj to Nair, 1 run, dropped! Bhuvi, the culprit. Nair, trying to be too cheeky, almost gifted his wicket. Moves across a long way and attempted the scoop shot. Got decent amount of wood, but there wasn't enough elevation there. It went at catchable height to Bhuvi at short fine. He makes a mess of it

Henriques to Nair, FOUR, this time well over short fine. The keeper is up and Henriques bowls a full length delivery just outside off, Nair shuffles across and nicely scoops it away over Bhuvi and the ball races away
Henriques to Nair, SIX, Nair is on a roll here! Straight, length ball, Nair moves leg-side and launches it straight over the bowler's head. The ball sails over the sightscreen for a maximum

Henriques to Nair, FOUR, four more! The runs are coming thick and fast for DD. Not the greatest of deliveries from Henriques. Short and drifting down leg, Nair gets inside the line and pulls it fine, beating the diving fine leg fielder
Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, welcome to Delhi says Rishabh Pant. A loosener from Rashid Khan. Quick delivery well down leg, Pant is quick to get low and smack the sweep well wide of short fine

S Kaul to Nair, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! In the air and taken! The knuckle ball from Kaul does the trick. Nair waltzes down by backing away. Goes through with his crouched slap. Gets reasonable amount of timber on that. He hit it flat and that led to his downfall. Bhuvi at long-off, moves to his left and times his mini-jump to perfection and gobbles it up. A big wicket! Nair c Bhuvneshwar b S Kaul 39(20) [4s-5 6s-2]
Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, poor ball and Pant takes full toll of it. Low full toss, Pant sinks low and smacks the sweep through square leg. Off the sweet spot of the bat
Henriques to Pant, FOUR, that's a gross delivery. Short and wide outside off, Pant waits for it and lifts it over extra cover for four runs

Henriques to Pant, FOUR, four more! Henriques isn't learning here. He is continuously offfering width outside off. Pant spots it and pummels it in front of square on the off-side. No chance for Dhawan in the deep
Jayant Yadav to Warner, FOUR, and he's away in a flash. Shortish and just outside off stump, Warner rocks back and cuts fiercely through cover-point
Rabada to Dhawan, FOUR, not the ideal start for Rabada. Fullish and swinging into the left-hander, Dhawan flicks, fine leg is inside the ring and he had no chance. Off the mark in a flash

Rabada to Warner, FOUR, oh this goes at a catchable height but there is no one at extra-cover. Would have been a straightforward chance. Warner is certainly having trouble facing Rabada's angle, chips gently, was a poor shot and he'd say that he deliberately played that with that gap on the off-side. Didn't look convincing though
Mishra to Williamson, FOUR, delicate. The googly just outside off, Williamson waited for it to arrive, opened the bat face and steers it past the diving short third man

Shami to Williamson, out Caught by Chris Morris!! Second wicket for Shami. He's got two big ones - Warner and now Williamson. Slower short delivery, kept climbing on the Kiwi, who went for the pull and only managed a fat top edge towards deep square leg. He was never going to in control of the shot as the ball got big on him. Smart bowling from Shami as well, rolled his fingers across at the last moment. DD have pulled things back nicely after the powerplay. Just 26 runs scored and two wickets taken. Williamson c Chris Morris b Shami 24(24) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shami to Yuvraj, FOUR, oh gosh! That was vintage Yuvraj. Full delivery on the stumps, Yuvraj does not bother to get his front leg behind the line, short-arm jabs the loft over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the ad hoardings

Mishra to Yuvraj, FOUR, anything in his zone and Yuvraj is willing to take it on. The googly which is a bit full in length, Yuvraj's back leg is in the air as he lofts it over Mishra. Almost similar to the one he played in the last over
Shami to Yuvraj, FOUR, he's not gonna miss out twice in two balls. Shami drifts another one on the pads, Yuvraj gets the faintest of touches on the ball and it races away to the fine leg fence

Shami to Yuvraj, FOUR, brilliant stop from Mathews. But did he touch the cushions? The third umpire has a look and spots something in contact with the triangles. Short delivery and Yuvraj pulls in front of square, Mathews ran in from deep square, dived and stopped the ball, but it was spinning back towards the rope and he flicked it in and that's when he was in touch

Rabada to Henriques, FOUR, boundary to start the 18th. The slower delivery that drifts onto the batsman's hips, Henriques does not do anything fancy, tickles it round the corner and allows the outfield to do the rest

Rabada to Yuvraj, FOUR, unlucky! Yuvraj is hurried by the short delivery, but at this stage of the innings the batsmen tend to throw their bat at everything, the top edge flies over short fine and lands just in front of the rope

Rabada to Yuvraj, SIX, not off the middle, but it doesn't have to be when it is Yuvraj Singh. The cross-seamer on off, Yuvraj clears his front leg to heave it into the on-side, off the base of the bat and over the man patrolling the deep mid-wicket fence

Rabada to Henriques, FOUR, big over for SRH. 20 off it and Rabada has been put under pressure. Fuller and width on offer, Henriques square drives and the placement is superb, well wide of the man sweeping on the off-side

Chris Morris to Yuvraj, FOUR, Morris is shaking his head, but there is very little he can do about that. The yorker just outside off, Yuvraj waited and went low, opened the bat face and dug it to the right of short third man, who dived just as an afterthought

Chris Morris to Yuvraj, FOUR, fifty for Yuvraj. Even though it is Delhi, the crowd are up on their feet to applaud the knock. Yuvraj acknowledges it with a wave of the bat. The slower length delivery, heaved in front of square, bisecting the two men in the deep

Rabada to Yuvraj, no ball, FOUR, horrendous start. He oversteps and dishes out a full delivery, Yuvraj's hands take over, he drives it past extra cover and the ball raced away to the fence. No chance for the sweeper

Rabada to Yuvraj, FOUR, too full and missed the yorker by a couple of inches, Yuvraj doesn't miss though, whipped it square and past the man at square leg. Boundaries flowing in the final part of the innings

Rabada to Yuvraj, FOUR, sloppy! The low full toss outside off, Yuvraj was trying to slice it behind point, got it finer than he would have liked. Jayant at third man makes a meal of that. Allows it to escape past him

Jayant Yadav to Warner, SIX, this is the advantage of having the ability to play the switch-hit. You can't set fields for such shots. A good flighted delivery on the stumps, nothing wrong with the delivery, Warner makes decent connection, although it was a top edge and it cleared the rope over backward point

Rabada to Yuvraj, FOUR, finishes the innings on a positive note. 19 runs off the over. Rabada went for 39 in his final two overs. You have to get the yorker spot on against Yuvraj. Slightly off and he puts it away, the bat comes down like an axe and he lofts it over Rabada, one bounce and into the fence

Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, similar delivery to the previous one and this time Morris pays the price, Dhawan is looking good today. The shots have been timed well. This time he's executed the cover-drive to perfection

Chris Morris to Dhawan, SIX, he's so good with that pick up shot. Plays it in his own way. Stylish! Morris once again bowls the perfect length to lift over the top, the full ball was on the leg as well and Dhawan used his lovely wrists to whip it away over the mid-wicket boundary

Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, now the bowler overcompensates by bowling short. There wasn't much of width on this one, but hopped and backed away slightly to create a bit of room and cut it away to the right of backward point
Rabada to Warner, FOUR, Warner knew that a slower ball was coming, backed away nicely to free the arms and slapped it hard over extra-cover for four. Easy pickings those

Shami to Warner, FOUR, slower ball, heaved away, no timing but it escapes for four. Another great start from this lovely SRH opening pair. Fifty comes up in 5.1 overs. This one was in the air, but wide of the man at mid-wicket

Shami to Warner, out Bowled!! Missed a few games? No problem. I know how to nail the yorkers. This is such a difficult art for bowlers, but look at Shami, this is just the second ball of his spell and he's bowled one at 141kph to knock Warner's off pole out. The SRH captain didn't look comfortable at all and DD will be delighted with that wicket. Warner was never willing to cover the line against the right-handed pacers, was always looking to back away and open up the off-side. Shami spotted that and outfoxed the batsman with a brilliant yorker. Warner b Shami 30(21) [4s-4 6s-1]
Shami to Williamson, leg byes, FOUR, that's down the leg-side, Williamson misses the flick, the ball beats the keeper off the thigh pad and goes for four
Shami to Dhawan, FOUR, Shami tries the slower ball bouncer, Dhawan does well to roll his wrists and control the hook shot, sends it past short fine leg

Jayant Yadav to Williamson, SIX, oh dear! That's released all the pressure. He'd beaten Williamson twice and then follows it up with a filthy delivery in the form of trying a variation. He suggests that he wanted to bowl the carrom ball, but it slipped down the leg-side and Williamson helped himself to a six with a pull over backward square leg

Mishra to Dhawan, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The moment he tosses one up, he gets a wicket. I was surprised by that first delivery when he chose to bowl flat. Enough in the pitch for a spinner to enjoy his outing. A gentle fist pump from the local lad. This was the googly, Dhawan went for the sweep, went with hard hands, got a top edge and Iyer came forward from deep backward square leg and took a good catch. Big wicket for DD. Dhawan was well set and he needed to carry on. Dhawan c Shreyas Iyer b Mishra 28(17) [4s-4 6s-1]

Unadkat to Narine, out Caught&Bowled!! Wicket-maiden! This over exemplies how a bowler sets up a batsman. After varying stuffs for 5 deliveries, he keeps this one short around off. There is almost no pace off the track and Narine, who is waiting to slap off the back foot, makes a mess of the timing. Chipping it back off the lower half of the bat to the bowler. Unadkat almost grabs it in a hurry. What a start for Pune. Narine c and b Unadkat 0(6)

SN Thakur to M Pandey, FOUR, whip of the wrists and off she went, one bounce four. Thakur is into his third over on the trot, full and angled into the pads, Pandey picks it over the mid-wicket fielder

SN Thakur to M Pandey, FOUR, third boundary of the over. Might be one over too many for Thakur. Short slower delivery and it sat up nicely for the swat from Pandey, he tonks it over mid-wicket and no one in the deep to stop that

Tahir to de Grandhomme, SIX, "that's Colin de Grandhomme," goes Doully on air. He spots the googly, kneels down and slog sweeps it with the spin over cow corner. He's a big man and that ball sailed a long way into the crowd

Tahir to de Grandhomme, SIX, consecutive sixes for de Grandhomme. Should have been caught. Once more goes with the turn, lofts the leggie towards long-off. Got height more than the distance, Christian moves across to his left and parries it over the fence. He misjudged the rope behind him. There was enough space to go a foot back
Christian to M Pandey, FOUR, this time manages to elude the short third man fielder. Waits for the back of a length delivery to arrive, opens the bat face and delicately places it wide of Sundar

Stokes to de Grandhomme, FOUR, the initial call from de Grandhomme was "two". Even he didn't know how well he had timed it. Full toss just outside off, which is caressed through extra cover. Rahane at sweeper had given up the chase quite early

Christian to M Pandey, out Caught by Rahane!! Rahane has the safest pair of hands in India. He ain't dropping these skiers. An important breakthrough for RPS as the partnership was slowly taking the game away from them. Pandey backed away and Christian followed him with a slower delivery, the batsman still goes through with the pick up shot, no pace on the ball meant he picked out deep mid-wicket. M Pandey c Rahane b Christian 37(32) [4s-3 6s-1]

Christian to de Grandhomme, FOUR, Christian has his hands on his head. He shouted "catch it," but it was nowhere close to the fielder. Slower back of a length delivery, de Grandhomme punched it on the up and in the air, wide of extra cover and sweeper though

Tahir to de Grandhomme, FOUR, not where he intended, but the final result is what he was looking for. Floated up outside off, de Grandhomme wanted to go over long-off, sliced over backward point and Sundar saw the ball balloon over him

Unadkat to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Washington Sundar!! Break and a wicket. How many times have we heard that? Even Pathan perished first ball after the first time-out and now it is de Grandhomme. Once more Unadkat resorts to the slower delivery, the Kiwi is completely deceived as he closes the bat face and the leading edge pops up to backward point. de Grandhomme c Washington Sundar b Unadkat 36(19) [4s-3 6s-2]

Christian to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, is it Suryakumar's night? Has been quiet in the tournament and has been in-and-out of the side as well. Picked the back of a length slower delivery, pivoted on his front leg and pulled it over deep square leg

Christian to Suryakumar Yadav, out Woakes Run Out!! 1 run completed. Dangerous thing to take on Smith and Woakes pays the price. Suryakumar bunts the length delivery to long-on, Smith was quick to swoop down on the ball and released it even quicker. The throw was right on top of the stumps, Christian had got back, collected the throw and light up the stumps. Even a full stretch from Woakes was not enough. Woakes run out (Smith/Christian) 1(3)
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, sweep shot off a pacer. You don't see that often. The slower delivery and Suryakumar spotted it very early, went across his stumps and broomed it over short fine

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely shot! The off-pace delivery and Suryakumar is playing with Unadkat, makes room and lofts it inside out over extra cover, no chance for the long-off fielder to cut that

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, 14 off the first three balls. Unadkat is predictable and Suryakumar is toying with him, plants his front foot across the stumps, laps it over backward square, a better connection meant maximum result

Unadkat to Coulter-Nile, SIX, Collision between Smith and Stokes. The latter straightaway calls for the physio. After crashing into Stokes, Smith goes bang into the ad boardings. Head first and it bounced off. Smith gets up and has a word with the physio. Seems to be fine. That looked brutal. Slower delivery from Unadkat and Coulter-Nile swung across the line towards deep mid-wicket. Stokes ran to his left and Smith ran to his right from long-on. Both were watching the ball and not each other. It was the Englishman who caught the ball, but once he dashed into Smith the flick back didn't go where he intended

Stokes to Coulter-Nile, out Caught by Washington Sundar!! Stokes has his name in the wicket column. Short of length delivery following Coulter-Nile, who had made room to smash one into the on-side, the ball kept cramping him for room and once the bat face was closed, the leading edge lobbed to backward point. Sundar accepts the dolly there. Coulter-Nile c Washington Sundar b Stokes 6(5) [6s-1]
Unadkat to Jackson, FOUR, makes room and does well by not going completely berserk with the shot. Had his eyes on the ball and slapped it past the man at backward point

Washington Sundar to Jackson, FOUR, Jackson skips down and does well with the loft. Did not appear to have given it everything. The focus was on the timing after he met the pitch of the ball. Lifted it pretty straight and fetched a four to the long-on fence

Washington Sundar to Jackson, out Hit Wkt!! That is why you should not use the depth this much. Goes back to tuck and after making the connection steps on the stumps. Dhoni realizes and appeals but Jackson is already walking before the customary check sent upstairs confirms the wicket. What a soft dismissal indeed. Jackson hit wkt b Washington Sundar 10(9) [4s-2]
Stokes to Gambhir, FOUR, the way he had been caged, this was coming! Clears the front leg and swipes across the line, finding the gap through mid-wicket
Stokes to Gambhir, FOUR, consecutive fours for the skipper and this one is more classic. Goes back to this ball and tucks it fine after a hop in the crease. The ball races to the fine leg fence
Washington Sundar to Gambhir, FOUR, that's so pleasing to watch. Moves aside to open up a bit and then goes inside out over cover. Races away
Washington Sundar to Gambhir, SIX, wow! This is brutal! Dances down the track and goes big with the swing. Sends well over the long-on fence

Washington Sundar to Gambhir, out Caught by Rahane!! And again! Hold on, he is caught in the deep. Sundar tossed up again, as if challenging Gambhir to go after it again. The latter took the offer and slogged across the line. It seemed he had made a good connection but there was a speed-breaker at the deep mid-wicket fence. Rahane timed his jump to perfection and plucked it from above his head. The captain goes and KKR are now in a spot of bother. Gambhir c Rahane b Washington Sundar 24(19) [4s-3 6s-1]

Tahir to M Pandey, 1 run, guides with the turn to short third man and calls for the run. Pathan has to hurry as Dhoni does that blind trick to hit the stumps at the striker's end. Yeah, that thing where he flicks the ball back on to the stumps even as he keeps his eyes on the thrower

Tahir to M Pandey, SIX, he goes against the turn, I assume! And then takes the biggest part of the ground to hit this one. But Pandey has got this one right off the middle of the bat to leave the fielder at the fence as a mere spectator

Tahir to Y Pathan, out Lbw!! And he has done it. Pune wanted one of these. They had Tahir and he has managed to get rid of Pathan. Skids this straighter ball. Quicker than what Pathan expected it to be. Though, cannot be justified for playing this one off the back foot. Once he misses, the ball catches his leg right in front. The big appeal, followed by the raise of finger from the umpire and then that famous sprint from the bowler. Y Pathan lbw b Tahir 4(9)
Coulter-Nile to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane is away. Sees the width and throws his bat, gets an outside edge that flies past first slip. Would've been gobbled up by second slip, if there was ever one
U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, that's a quality shot from Rahane. A short of length delivery outside off, Rahane gets on top of it and thumps it over the infield on the off-side

U Yadav to Rahane, out Caught by Jackson!! Eden roars. Rahane has been given the pink slip. What a ball from Umesh, strikes gold in his first over. Cramps him with this short of length delivery that nipped back in a fraction, Rahane was caught in a state of dilemma. Tried to ride the bounce, was too late and ends up feathering it to the keeper. Early strike for KKR. Rahane c Jackson b U Yadav 11(9) [4s-2]
Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, slog-swept! Shabby fielding effort from Woakes at deep mid-wicket. Dives to his left, but doesn't stretch enough to flick the ball back

Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, how well has he hit that? Boy! He is having some fun out there. Skates out of his crease, wasn't quite to the pitch, but why bother? He swung it handsomely over mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, another one! Bam bam! He reaches his highest T20 score and does it in some style. Greyhounds down the pitch and takes Kuldeep Yadav for a journey over mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, my word! Don't drop it there to this lad. On seeing the loop, he gets down on his knees and bludgeons it barrel straight over the bowler's head. Runs raining at KKR's E-DEN

Narine to Stokes, out Caught&Bowled!! Excellent catch by Narine, considering his fielding standards mind you! He is one of the slowest, languid among the KKR fielders, but not on this occasion. Gets the ball to grip as he cuts as much pace as possible, Stokes went for the pull, but was way too early into the shot. A thick top-edge balloons around the mid-wicket area, Narine calls for it, runs around and grabs it. Stokes c and b Narine 14(15) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, out Caught by Jackson!! TWO IN TWO. Dhoni walks. Kuldeep Yadav has dismissed MS both times KKR played RPS this season. The googly, lands it fuller and draws Dhoni forward, he fiddles while striding forward a long way, thin edge through to the keeper. Dhoni c Jackson b Kuldeep Yadav 5(9)
Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, on one knee and launched! Tripathi into the 90s. Wanted to have a piece of Kuldeep Yadav once more, got down and thwacked him with a slog-sweep over mid-wicket

Woakes to Tripathi, out Caught by (sub)Rovman Powell!! Feel for this fella! He deserved a 100 or at least needed to be there till the end. Similar emotions from Smithy as he tweaks his hair in disappointment. Takes on the short ball this time and pulls to the right of short mid-wicket, there's Rovman Powell fielding there? He is from the Caribbean, won't drop catches. Dives full length and takes a blinder. Tripathi c (sub)Rovman Powell b Woakes 93(52) [4s-9 6s-7]

de Grandhomme to Christian, SIX. All over! Some glum faces among the crowd. Three back to back wins for RPS. A right-handed version of Ben Stokes, Christian waits for the short ball, once it arrives, he murders the pull flat over mid-wicket
Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, FOUR, fabulous shot from Tripathi. Rides the bounce and cracks a solid punch that breaches the crowded off-side field. Races away to the fence

Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, SIX, this must be demoralising for Coulter-Nile. Telegrams his intentions and shimmies out to meet the pitch, converts it into a full ball and blasts it over extra cover. Enough to carry it all the way

Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, FOUR, NCN overcorrects and dishes out a full toss, Tripathi sets up a solid base and drills it past mid-on. Didn't get it off the middle but manages it thread it past the fielder

Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, FOUR, 19 runs off the over. An expensive one for KKR. A short ball that sits up nicely for Tripathi, he spindles across and pulls it behind square. Goes all the way for a maximum

U Yadav to Smith, byes, FOUR, ooh, almost did him there. Smith gives the charge to this back of a length delivery that shaped back in, aiming to open the up the off-side field. In the process, gets an inside edge that eludes a diving Jackson. The umpire fails to spot it and gives it as byes

U Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, imperious. What a strike from Tripathi. Isn't intimidated by this short ball, takes it from over his head and deposits it over the long-leg fence. He got into the position early and hooked it off the meat off the bat
U Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi is cutting loose here. Reads this leg-cutter early, flashes it hard and gets it over backward-point.

Woakes to Smith, SIX, wow. Gorgeuous from Smith. Brings up the fastest fifty for RPS in IPL. Stands motionless and lets his hands do the talking. Extends his arms and lifts it handsomely into the long-on stands
Woakes to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi takes a cue from his skipper and plays a fabulous shot. Gets under this full ball and almost checks his shot past mid-on

Woakes to Smith, out Bowled!! Woakes has the final laugh. One shot too many for Smith. Just sticks to his basics and targets the stumps, Smith exposed his stumps aiming for a flashy punch through cover. The ball striaghtened a bit and the RPS skipper misses it completely. The ball kisses the top of off. Talk about basics, Laxman Sivaramakrishnan will be a proud man. Smith b Woakes 9(9) [6s-1]
Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, SIX, terrific striking from Tripathi. Gets right back to this short ball and muscles it away over the cow corner fence for a maximum
Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, FOUR, magnificent. Shimmies out to meet the pitch and bullies it through extra cover

Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi is putting on a show here. He is 47 off just 18 balls. The short ball ain't working against him. Coulter-Nile isn't learing, peppers it short without any purpose. Tripathi is committed onto the front foot and flat-bats it over mid-on

Narine to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, Narine is greeted to the crease with a boundary. Deft from Tiwary, waits to the last moment and late cuts it to the third man fence. Almost fetched it from the keeper's gloves

Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi reaches fifty in style. Fastest individual fifty for RPS. Walks across his sticks, goes low and scoops it to the fine leg fence. Raises his bat and Tiwary embraces him

Woakes to Manoj Tiwary, out Bowled!! Gone. Woakes gets his second wicket. A nothing shot from Tiwary, a good length delivery that vaults back in a touch, Tiwary has a feel for it sans any feet. Gets an inside edge that crashes back onto the stumps. The off-stump goes for a cardio training. RPS lose their third. Manoj Tiwary b Woakes 8(9) [4s-1]
Narine to Stokes, FOUR, audacious from Stokes. Changes his stance and employs the reverse-hit. Directs it behind square on the off-side

Sangwan to Nair, FOUR, Nair is off and running. Gets into business straightaway after having a sighter. Backs away to create some room, Sangwan kept it on middle and subsidized with width. Nair brings his bottom hand into play. Just extends his arms and steers it past the crowded off-side field
Sangwan to Nair, FOUR, such minimal effort from Nair. Waits in his crease for this short of length delivery to arrive, uses his magical wrists and effortlessly pulls it over mid-wicket

Faulkner to Pant, FOUR, oh dear. Ishan Kishan has defied the laws of living and walked through a ball at long leg. Or so it looked. Whipped off the pads, shipped away using the bottom hand and Kishan was charging in, and ran through

Faulkner to Pant, SIX, he was undone by the lack of pace there. Early into the shot but made sure that he swung hard at this. Bruted it. And as much as it lacked the timing, it made up with its power, this shot. Clouted over deep mid-wicket, despite coming off the bottom half of the bat
Faulkner to Pant, leg byes, 1 run, now he manages a leg bye this this. Early into his swat, Pant deflects it off his pads.. and runs
Faulkner to Pant, SIX, what do you do to a slow bouncer? You bully it. Despite being in a tangle with your footwork. Had the weight back and could pull the bejeezus out of it. Brilliant shot

Faulkner to Pant, SIX, *jumps into a well* This is turning out to be a ridiculously good innings. Unicorns are real, and so are DD chases. Gets a pitched up delivery and slogs it over long-on. No half measures. None at all. Pick the length and swing. Has been so successful so far
Jadeja to Samson, SIX, umm. This looked effortless and it's gone into the crowd. Just a length ball, turning away and Samson has swatted it over long-on. Clocked 99 meters as if it's body temperature
Jadeja to Samson, SIX, wide and slotted over covers. And it wasn't a bad ball from Jadeja, drifting it wide and making Samson reach out. But erred in the length and paid by six runs. That's it
Dwayne Smith to Pant, FOUR, as if the choice of bowling Smith wasn't enough, the bowlers chooses a full ball to bowl. Clattered over mid-wicket with a disparaging whip. Enough. No one in the deep

Dwayne Smith to Pant, FOUR, he's wound himself up brilliantly there. So brilliantly that he's taken a full ball on the stumps and whipped it over backward square leg, cleverly opening that side of the field by shuffling across early and getting into position. 44 off 42 and I see the unicorn already. Well, almost

Jadeja to Samson, out Caught by Faulkner!! End of a good, good innings. They are checking for the no-ball but Jadeja ushers us to "ooooohhh" and then the back foot somehow manages to be halfway behind the line. Anyway, coming to the wicket, the ball sat up to be hit there. Samson just decided to go across the line, the ball may have spun, and the Samson ended up slicing the slog to towards wide long-off, where Faulkner's present. "Oh he'll drop it". "Gujarat are having a bad day, so this should go down". But it doesn't. Faulkner slides in front and takes a good catch. Samson c Faulkner b Jadeja 61(31) [6s-7]
Jadeja to Pant, SIX, brilliant. A slog sweep that's been nailed into the stands, again. Nothing more I can add. He's just seeing the length so early tonight and readying himself for the hits

Jadeja to Pant, FOUR, now this is a back foot punch over covers. You have to see it to believe it. Jadeja is from over the wicket to the left hander here. Just a touch short, Pant is so early there to get back and punch it up and over. Graceful, if it's ever been any more brutal

Basil Thampi to Pant, out Caught by Karthik!! There's an appeal but the umpire has been stunned by this kid. Even the umpire. Thampi appeals, and after eliciting an obvious edge, and appeals again and then gets his man. Rishabh Pant doesn't fall short of a century here; he makes 97. Brutes them. Enthralling innings. Thampi angled this full and across, Pant drives and ekes out an outside edge, that's been nicely taken by Karthik behind. Erred in not using his feet there, and Thampi is quick. But he was in that sort of a mood. He was hitting everything outta here, so can't blame him. Not after 97 runs, can we? Pant c Karthik b Basil Thampi 97(43) [4s-6 6s-9]

Sangwan to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, oh just a touch overpitched. And so overpitched that the change of pace doesn't matter much. And to make things worse, Iyer had read it. So waits a little longer and dumps the ball over long-off. More timing than anything else. Connected the ball at the right time and boom, you can hit it with a spoon too. Well, not really. 20 off 24 needed
Basil Thampi to Corey Anderson, SIX, another six. Length ball, around off and Anderson has swung it over deep square leg. It's that sort of a day. 18 sixes already
Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, here's another. Shuffled across early, and was able to open up the long leg region. Picked the ball up and bottom-handed it over the ropes there. Just 4 needed
Faulkner to Corey Anderson, SIX, Delhi have their highest ever run-chase. Anderson gets a full ball and pumps it over long-on to seal what was an easy win in the end

Sangwan to Samson, SIX, wow. This is from Samson's refrigarator of awesomeness. Pure class. Drops it a tad short, does Sangwan. Samson is ready for it. Handsomely hacks it behind square, such is the power that it carries all the way for a maximum

Sangwan to Nair, out Caught by Karthik!! Number one down. Kotla goes silent. Nair's failure continues. What was he trying to do there? Awful really. Redemption for Sangwan. Banged it short and it shooted up awkwardly at Nair. He was caught in two minds there. Initially, wanted to leave but then sees it as a scoring opportunity. Arches his back belatedly and tries it periscope it over the keeper. Too late. The ball catches a faint edge and carries to the keeper. Nair c Karthik b Sangwan 12(11) [4s-2]
Basil Thampi to Pant, SIX, quality from Pant. Thampi bowls it short and compliments it with width, Pant reaches out and spanks it over cover
Basil Thampi to Samson, SIX, you cannot afford to spray it on Samson's pads. Thampi just does that and gets punished. He gets inside the line and whips it nonchalantly behind square. Half a dozen!
Sangwan to Pant, SIX, Pant joins into the act. High percentage shot this. Hauls his back leg in the air and elegantly swipes it into the deep square leg stands

Sangwan to Pant, SIX, "Three sixes in a row for Delhi" screams Scott Styris on air. Finesse followed by violence. Loads up big time, gets under this full ball and smashes it over long-on. Soars a long way into the stands
Sangwan to Pant, FOUR, 16 off first 3 balls. Pant is on fire. Protracts his hands to this widish ball and cleverly guides it past short third man. Kotla breaks the sound barrier
Raina to Samson, SIX, in the slot and out of the park. 500th six of the tournament. Loops it up in the arc for Samson, no turn. Samson lowers his stance and launches it over cow corner
Ankit Soni to Samson, 1 run, hunches forward and sweetly drives it to long-off. 50-stand up between the two

Ankit Soni to Pant, SIX, what a shot. The googly from Soni, but pitches it up fuller outside off. Pant isn't sparing those. Flexes his arms and murders it straight over the bowler's head for a maximum

Raina to Pant, FOUR, clumsy from Smithy. Makes a royal mess of this one. Pant blasts it hard off the back foot through extra cover. Smithy gets across, slides near the ropes but lets it through his boot laces. Into the fence

Raina to Pant, SIX, fifty for Pant. Reaches the landmark in style. A rank long hop from Raina, Pant is onto it in a flash. Skips back and smokes it away into the deep mid-wicket stands. 14 runs off the over
Ankit Soni to Samson, SIX, ugly from Soni. Perhaps, took a cue from his skipper. Half-tracker, sits up nicely for Samson. He gets under it and clubs it over deep mid-wicket

Ankit Soni to Samson, SIX, brilliant. Soni floats it up full, Samson is ready for it. Unleashes his muscles and dumps it over the bowler's head for a maximum. Raina walks up immediately and consoles the bowler

Nadeem to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, turn straightaway for Nadeem and he finds the outside edge. Smith was on the front foot to defend, the turn took the thick outside edge of the bat and it flew past the man at slip. The Lions are off the mark

Nadeem to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, that's swept away over backward square leg and it's four more. Turns out to be a good start for Smith and Gujarat. This was a delivery down the leg-side, Smith sweeps, gets a bit of top edge but he swung hard to send it over the infield

Rabada to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by Pant!! A peach from Rabada. He recorded the worst bowling figures of the season the other night (4-0-59-0), but he's started with a lovely nut tonight. The hard-hitting Baz McCullum is walking back with just a solitary run to his name. Rabada angled this short of length delivery into the right-hander from wide of the crease, the ball moved away late, just enough movement to take the outside edge of McCullum's bat as he was looking to defend away from the body. Pant dives to his right and takes a good catch. Brendon McCullum c Pant b Rabada 1(3)

Rabada to Raina, out Dwayne Smith Run Out!! This is disaster for Gujarat Lions. Both the openers gone in successive balls. Who is to be blamed here? Raina took a couple of steps out of his crease after playing this ball gently to mid-wicket, Smith thought the skipper was keen on a run, but was shocked when Raina stopped suddenly. The West Indian tried to rush back but a bullet throw from Nadeem meant his bat was on the line when the stumps were disturbed. Dwayne Smith run out (Nadeem) 9(4) [4s-2]

Samuels to Raina, SIX, no sir! Don't bowl there, he'll thrash you even in his sleep. When it's full and that front leg is out of the way, he hardly misses out on the slog. He was down on one knee and smashed this over mid-wicket

Samuels to Raina, SIX, once again Samuels errs on the fuller side and Raina is not afraid to hit the ball in the air. Hits it very straight and ensures that long-off and long-on were not in the picture

Nadeem to Karthik, SIX, every time the spinners have dropped it short, Karthik has done very well to rock back, make excellent use of the crease and pull it handsomely over mid-wicket. This had a lot of hang time on it

Nadeem to Karthik, SIX, wowww! The shot of the day for me! The greatest thing about this shot was Karthik didn't manage to get close to the pitch of the ball after jumping down the pitch, yet went through the lofted inside-out drive and sent it over the cover boundary

Nadeem to Raina, FOUR, the slog-sweep, in the air, but Raina has split the fielders in the deep. Deep mid-wicket and deep backward square leg thought they were in the business for a moment. Raina got down low on his knees and timed it well enough
Corey Anderson to Karthik, SIX, Karthik is turning the heat on. Not off the middle, but Karthik won't mind as he got enough wood on his hook against this short ball that sails over the long leg fence
Corey Anderson to Karthik, 1 run, uses his wrists and directs this short of length delivery on the pads through mid-wicket for a single which brings up his 14th IPL fifty!

Shami to Karthik, FOUR, magnificent shot to start the over! Shami serves width outside off, Karthik leans forward and biffs the drive over Karun Nair at extra cover. Once it cleared him, there was none stopping that

Shami to Karthik, out Raina Run Out!! Direct hit and the skipper has to walk back. Shami bowls one in the blockhole just outside off, Karthik squirts it out to backward point. Raina wanted a quick single and is halfway down. That's when he saw his partner who wasn't interested in the run. Rabada finds the target direct and Raina is well short. The 133-run partnership has been broken. Raina run out (Rabada) 77(43) [4s-5 6s-4]
Shami to Karthik, FOUR, shot! On the pads to any sub-continent batsman, he won't spare you. He moves slightly across and middles the leg-glance. The quick Delhi outfield does the rest

Shami to Karthik, SIX, wow! Brilliantly played. It was short and wide outside off, Karthik waits for it and slashes it. Didn't bother to keep it down and up she goes. Over backward point and the ball sails over the boundary rope
Shami to Finch, FOUR, 19 runs off the over! Finch is underway in a grand style. It was bowled on the stumps, but overpitched. Finch blasts the straight drive. The ball bullets away into the fence

Pat Cummins to Karthik, out Caught by Corey Anderson!! That's a screamer! Corey Anderson has taken the catch of the tournament. DK has to go. Cummins darts a scrambled seam delivery on a fullish length just outside off. With mid-off inside the circle, the lofted off-drive shot was on. Karthik goes for it, but couldn't quite get the required timing. His bat turns at the point of impact. The Kiwi all-rounder at mid-off, times his jump to perfection and plucks it with his left hand. The ball had almost gone past him. Karthik c Corey Anderson b Pat Cummins 65(34) [4s-5 6s-5]

Rabada to Finch, FOUR, ah! Got to feel for the bowler. Finch was in no control of that shot, still gets a boundary. Quick short ball that keeps following Finch, who moved leg-side. The ball gets big on him. The batsman, with his eyes closed, goes for the pull. The ball pops up and flies wide of short fine and runs away into the fence

Pat Cummins to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The scratchy knock from the youngster comes to an end. He never looked comfortable in his brief stay. Kishan doesn't spot the off-cutter and is early to swipe it across the line. The top edge balloons up high in the air. Sheyas Iyer, from long-on, runs forward and takes a good skier. Ishan Kishan c Shreyas Iyer b Pat Cummins 4(6)
Pat Cummins to Finch, FOUR, that's a good shot! The batsman seemed to have been deceived by the short ball. He adjusted well, jumped and pulled fiercely through mid-wicket
Rabada to Finch, FOUR, trademark Finch shot! Backs away and reaches for this fullish ball outside off. Carves it inside out over extra cover. Mid-off is up and there is none to stop that

Rabada to Finch, out Caught by Pant!! Finch is gone! Excellent catch by Pant. Finch moves leg-side and Rabada follows him with a sharp bouncer. He isn't in the greatest of positions, but still persists with his pull shot and gets a top edge. The ball lobs up very high. The keeper runs back and calls for it. Nadeem was also approaching towards him from short fine leg. The ball swirls around as it drops down. Pant holds his nerve and dives full-stretched and gobbles it cleanly. Finch c Pant b Rabada 27(19) [4s-4]

Corey Anderson to Faulkner, out Caught by (sub)Brathwaite!! Gone! Trying to play the big shot, Faulkner perishes. It was a slow short ball on the stumps. Faulkner spots it and pulls it. He went at it hard and ended up hitting it flat. Brathwaite at deep square leg, stoops low and catches it safely with both hands. Faulkner c (sub)Brathwaite b Corey Anderson 1(2)
Corey Anderson to Jadeja, SIX, that's a monster! Full and right in the slot for Jadeja to swing his bat hard. Jaddu stands tall and biffs it over long-on for a gigantic six

Rabada to Raina, 1 run, it's dropped this time. Gee, this is a crazy over. Two wickets, one just escaped the fielder and then one was put down. This time Rabada does what most fast bowlers with pace do to Raina. Bowl that bouncer and have him jumping around in the crease. It was down the leg-side, Raina could back away or duck, tried to pull, the ball went off the back of the bat, a lob it was to first slip. Easiest of chances, but Shreyas Iyer spills it. Rabada is very disappointed

Pat Cummins to Raina, FOUR, uppish, but not convincing. Short of a length delivery on the leg stump, Raina chips it over the infield, more towards square leg, luckily for the visitors, the ball went in the gap

Corey Anderson to Jadeja, SIX, highest ever total for Gujarat Lions! Jadeja finishes the innings in style. That's Dhoni-esque. Slower shortish ball. Jadeja waits and waits for it to come to him and smacks the pull over deep mid-wicket. 17 runs off the final over

Shami to Raina, SIX, why on earth did they remove Rabada after that brilliant over? Raina was never comfortable against him. This Delhi team does strange things! Shami serves up a length ball on the leg stump, Raina is good when he connects those slogs and he has done decently well this time, flew over wide mid-on
Shami to Raina, FOUR, the short ball but Raina backed away early to free his arms. Slashed at it with an open bat face to deliberately hit over the top through point for four

Shami to Raina, FOUR, this man is great with his inside-out lofted drives over the cover region. Can't really say that this is a bad ball from the bowler. Middle and leg line on a good length, Raina moved leg-side and played that easily over extra-cover

Rabada to Raina, SIX, no problems with connecting this one from the middle of the bat. Length ball right in the slot and he's in the mood to swing at everything, lofts down the ground, goes over mid-on and goes all the way. Somehow, Raina has raced to 33 off 17 balls

Pat Cummins to Karthik, FOUR, that's a lovely piece of timing from Karthik. Should get him going. Not easy to jump down the pitch to a pacy bowler. In fact this came down at 148kph, Karthik made it into a fuller length by using his feet and played an excellent off-drive, the dive goes in vain from mid-off

Pat Cummins to Raina, FOUR, stylish from Raina. So after a terribly scratchy start, Raina has managed to settle nicely. Poor full delivery on the pads, deserved to be put away, Raina moved across the sticks just a touch to open up the backward square leg boundary and he placed the flick shot wide of the man at short fine to sign off the over in style

Shami to Raina, 2 runs, dropped. This is turning out to be the kind of knock he played against KKR very early in the tournament. This was in the slot for the batsman, Raina teed off with a slog, went at a catchable height to mid-wicket, although it was hit with power, Samules tried to grab it above his head but it popped out

Mishra to Karthik, FOUR, gee, what placement! Deliberately swung hard at it with an open bat face to send it through point. This was the googly from Mishra, making it a risky shot against the incoming ball, but the fact that it was too full made his life easy.

Mishra to Karthik, SIX, the googly again, but it's way too short. Karthik jumps on the back foot, times the pull well enough to send it high in the air and over the mid-wicket boundary. A poor over that from Mishra, bowled well to Raina, but was very poor with his length to Karthik
Samuels to Raina, 2 runs, worked away off the back foot into the vacant mid-wicket region and that's a fifty for Raina, his 31st in the IPL. Pressure clearly back on Delhi, despite a dream start

Mishra to Karthik, FOUR, and Mishy continues to struggle against the right-hander, very strange through. He is so unwilling to toss the ball up and has hardly made Karthik play off the front foot. It's a short delivery that turns away, Karthik cuts well through point and beats the sweeper's dive on the boundary

Aniket Choudhary to Amla, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Clear nick, no appeal from the bowler, even the keeper didn't hear the edge, but Amla walks. Well done sir! It's been short of length from Aniket all over, this time he bowls it slightly wide outside off stump than the previous ones, Amla throws his hands at it to cut it away for four but gets a faint edge. Not sure if the umpire heard that nick too. Would have been interesting if Amla had not walked. Just the start KXIP didn't want in a crunch game. Amla c Kedar Jadhav b Aniket Choudhary 1(3)

Aravind to Guptill, FOUR, this is one ground that he can make it big if he gets his eye in. The boundaries are short and even mishits can go all the way. Aravind bowled a fuller length and just outside off stump, Guptill lofted it over cover, didn't come from the middle of the bat, but good enough for a one-bounce four

Aravind to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, wow! Lovely piece of timing. Aravind bowls full in search of swing, it did swing away a touch, but Marsh was nicely forward to cream the cover drive from the middle of the bat

Chahal to Vohra, out Caught by de Villiers!! Something had to give and it is a wicket. The sea of red flags flutter around the Chinnaswamy. Another set batsmen doesn't bat through the innings. Nice loop on this leggie, Vohra's eyes lit up and he went to send it into the second tier, cleared his front leg to heave and mistimed it towards long-on. The ball hung in the air for a long time before AB reverse cupped it calmly. Vohra c de Villiers b Chahal 25(28) [4s-1 6s-1]

Negi to Maxwell, FOUR, was that a drop? Negi is not a happy man. The reverse sweep from Maxi and he almost picked out backward point. Aniket is a tall man and he did get a fingertip on it. It was struck fiercely and Aniket did not have much time to react

Chahal to Maxwell, byes, FOUR, what was Kedar Jadhav doing? Maxwell was beaten all ends up, tees off for a big mow to the leg-side, the ball goes on straight to beat him on the inside edge. Jadhav didn't even try to get his gloves behind the ball

Chahal to Maxwell, byes, FOUR, Kedar Jadhav is having a torrid time behind the wicket. Flighted just outside off, Maxwell drives and misses, he was undone by the lack of bounce and Jadhav is nutmegged. He should have had his legs together

Chahal to Maxwell, out Caught by Badree!! Oh no! Maxwell has been caught but the umpire is checking for a no-ball. It is touch and go. GO it is for Maxwell. Looked really close and the benefit of doubt has gone to the bowler on this occasion. Nicely tossed up delivery and Maxwell brings out the switch-hit. The top edge skies towards short third man, it was a tough one and the experienced Samuel Badree pouches it and puffs his cheeks. He knew it was a steepler and needed to his eyes on the ball till the last second. Maxwell c Badree b Chahal 6(11) [4s-1]
Chahal to Axar, SIX, floated up on a fuller length and Axar says thank you very much. A much needed six for KXIP. Axar plonks his front foot forward and hammers the loft with the turn over long-on
Chahal to Axar, FOUR, good batting from Axar. A no risk shot this. Waited for the ball to arrive, used whatever pace was available and steered it fine, Badree had no chance at short third man

Aniket Choudhary to Saha, FOUR, Gayle at backward point and Badree at third man, you don't expect them to chase a ball down. Slower delivery and Saha relied on placing it behind point rather than knocking the cover off the ball. No chance for both the fielders

Watson to Saha, out Bowled!! Third batsman out in the 20s. Watson has a wicket and has his finger up in delight. Wicket-to-wicket stuff from Watto, Saha made room to glide it behind point, was beaten for pace and the ball kissed the off-pole. Crucial wicket for the home side as Saha was looking to get on with proceedings. The off-cutter that skidded off the surface. Saha b Watson 21(25) [4s-1]

Watson to Mohit Sharma, FOUR, bad delivery and deserved the treatment. Short and wide, Mohit threw the whole kitchen sink at that, sliced it off the outside edge to third man, got it fine enough and beat Aravind to the fence

Aniket Choudhary to Mohit Sharma, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! This time Kedar Jadhav appealed and so did Aniket, the umpire obliges to their plea. Nothing but a short of length delivery angled across the right-hander, Mohit pulled and got an under edge to the keeper. Mohit Sharma c Kedar Jadhav b Aniket Choudhary 6(4) [4s-1]

Watson to Axar, SIX, massive hit! Makes a dent on the ad hoardings on the roof. Right in the arc - length delivery and outside off, Axar clears his front leg and heaves it all the way over long-on. Needs to play all the six balls

Watson to Axar, FOUR, Axar seems to be having no problems on a surface where others have struggled. Short delivery on leg-stump, Axar pivots on his front leg and pulls it backward of square, couple of bounces and into the fence. 12 off the first three balls

Watson to Axar, FOUR, turning out to be just the over KXIP needed. Kohli is furious at long-off. Kicks the ball back onto the ad boardings. Pitched up and Axar slams it straight down the ground. No chance for Kohli at long-off

Aravind to Guptill, out Caught by Negi!! This was coming. All Kohli needed to do was have a man at sweeper cover. It's very difficult for a right-handed batsman to middle the ball against the away-going ball from a left-handed bowler on a slowish pitch when he is trying to loft on the off-side. Guptill wanted to go over mid-off, but lack of pace on the ball meant the bat turned in his hands on impact with the ball. Ended up slicing it and it's a simple grab for Negi. Credit to Aravind for bowling the slower ball. This is a very sluggish start from KXIP. 18/2 and we are into the fourth over. Guptill c Negi b Aravind 9(10) [4s-1]
Watson to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, gee, how quickly did that reach the fence? Watson bowls a gentle full ball outside off stump, Marsh crashes it through cover and picks up a boundary

Watson to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, that's lovely placement. No one at third man, he was actually inside the ring, so any width from the bowler is going to be easy, Marsh opened the bat face and nicely guided it past the man at 45

Badree to Vohra, FOUR, oh this one kept low and it's very unlucky for the bowler that the ball has gone for four despite taking the inside edge of the bat. This was the slider on the shorter side, Vohra went back to pull, the ball didn't rise, went off the inner part and split short fine leg and backward square leg to perfection

Negi to Shaun Marsh, out Caught by Mandeep!! Negi has got a big wicket and KXIP's team owner Preity Zinta is not happy in the stands. On a slowish pitch, a set batsman has to carry on, but in trying to up the ante and with the thought of taking on the left-arm spinner, Marsh has holed out. It's 39 for 3 and the visitors are in deep trouble. Clever bowling from Negi. He knew that anything full and on the stumps would make it easy for Marsh to target mid-wicket, he bowled this full and wide outside off stump, forced Marsh to fetch and it's a mistimed hit to long-off. Shaun Marsh c Mandeep b Negi 20(17) [4s-3]

Negi to Vohra, SIX, he's a good striker of the cricket ball and Negi erred in his length. Too full and allowed the batsman to get under the ball, Vohra was down on one knee to smash it over the leaping long-on fielder

Sandeep Sharma to Gayle, out Caught by Guptill!! Had to happen. If you read the last delivery's description, you would know. Didn't use his feet to a fullish ball, so he shimmies out this time to compensate. The length's been nicely shortened by Sharma, and also gets it to move away. The result: Gayle is down the track and slices an outside edge to gully -- yes, there was one, for Gayle. Comeback done and dusted. Gayle c Guptill b Sandeep Sharma 0(2)

Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, FOUR, first ball. Shuffles and kills the inswing with a whippy clip, embarrassing us for all the bottom hand strength we don't have. Plays it real fine behind the wicket and gets a first-ball boundary to get off the mark

T Natarajan to Mandeep, SIX, gosh, no! A short ball down leg and Mandeep had helped the pull over fine leg with utter nonchalance. And given how slow this pitch is, bouncers aren't exactly themselves. They are friends
T Natarajan to Mandeep, FOUR, this was half a cut at best. Jabbed the ball through covers. Natarajan angles this away, Singh stays put and caresses it away

T Natarajan to Mandeep, FOUR, inside edge runs away. Had to shuffle here to get behind this ball angled away. Instead stays there and looks to fetch it, getting an inside edge much to keeper's left in the process

Axar to Watson, out Caught by Saha!! This is the fifth time Axar Patel has dismissed Watto in IPL, the most he has dismissed any batsman. Just wow! A quicker flatter dart outside off, from Jaddu's book you would think. Watson goes deep inside the crease to flay it square, feeds the faintest of nicks to the keeper. Watson c Saha b Axar 3(6)

Maxwell to Mandeep, out Bowled!! Maxi roars. RCB fans are absolutely shattered. One guy has ran out of expressions, he just tweaks his hair while giving THAT WHAT.THE.____ expression! Oh boy! Things going bad to worse for RCB. No real turn, just stump-to-stump channel and fired it flat, Mandeep rocks back to pull, a big swish across the line. Misses by a long way and the middle pole takes the pasting. Mandeep b Maxwell 46(40) [4s-5 6s-2]
Aaron to Negi, FOUR, skates down the pitch, stays leg-side of the delivery and carves Varun Aaron over extra cover. The batsman in Negi speaks...

Maxwell to Aravind, out Lbw!! Maxi is having fun out there. He is picking wickets like the way he knocks the switch-hits. 7 down now. Aravind crouches and looks to sweep Maxi through square leg, doesn't pick the line, neither the length. Strikes him low around off and that's smashing into middle. Aravind lbw b Maxwell 4(6)
Aaron to Negi, FOUR, full and wide, Negi twitches his back knee and throws the kitchen sink, a big-blooded edge flies away to the third man fence

Aaron to Negi, leg byes, FOUR, the rib-tickler. With fine leg inside the ring, not sure if that's a great idea. Negi hops and misses the tickle, the slow-low nature of the pitch means it shoots a bit low to take the thigh pad en route to fine leg fancy boards

Axar to Negi, out Caught by Saha!! Three fielders converge for the catch and Saha pouches it safely. Not before a bit of collision though. Natarajan aborted himself at the last second and evaded the dash, but Aaron and Saha didn't. In the end, Saha accepts while gliding into Varun Aaron who was running from backward point. It was a pull that never took off, off the splice of the bat. And then all the drama Negi c Saha b Axar 21(23) [4s-2]
Axar to Badree, out Bowled!! Knocked him over! Down on one knee looking to thump Axar into MG Road. You miss I hit. Knocks the head of off peg. Badree b Axar 8(9)

Mohit Sharma to Aniket Choudhary, out Caught by Guptill!! That's the final nail in the coffin. This is the lowest ever total defended at this venue. KXIP needed to win this badly and they did so with great ease. Fast bowler to fast bolwer. Result? He slaps hard and picks out Guptill at mid-off. Had only so much power. Alas! Aniket Choudhary c Guptill b Mohit Sharma 4(6)

Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, out Bowled!! Go Sandeep, make a GIF out of this and retire. Virat Kohli's been done. Sees Kohli shimmy out and still keeps it straight at the stumps. Kohli overruns, letting the ball sneak through and timbah. The trick was that Sharma stuck to a normal pace delivery. Kohli would have connected had it been a slower one. Wasn't and bam, Kohli is gone. Kohli b Sandeep Sharma 6(6) [4s-1]

Aaron to Mandeep, FOUR, hence proven: Guptill has spring in his shoes. Hey ICC, are you watching? Cut but it's more off the edge, thanks to the bounce, and Guptill has almost gotten to it at backward point. Well almost. My commentary has been adulterated by my fanboyism, so maybe. But he really jumped there, and tumbling as he fell on the ground. Good to watch but Mandeep gets four runs here

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, goes full this ball and that's been smacked delightly, delicately through the other side of the wicket -- Sandeep is from over the wicket to AB here. Takes the ball on the up and disparages it away

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, umm, you aren't a cricket binge-watcher if you didn't see this coming. Dropped short, and AB has smacked it into the oblivion. Over deep mid-wicket. You would envy how early AB sees things, cricket lengths here. Got into the position beautifully and swatted it away

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, out Caught by Saha!! Sandeep Sharma has Chris Gayle, Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers off consecutive overs. Now that's something to roast others about, in your white picket-fenced villa that you buy from your IPL contract. So, coming back to reality, AB was shimmying out of his crease, high on confidence of bullying the last ball for a six. What Sandeep does is to keep it full but just about adjusts the line to something further outside off. AB gets an edge on the charge and the keeper does so well to anticipate it all and move to his right to pouch that. Big wicket, RCB stuttering. de Villiers c Saha b Sandeep Sharma 10(6) [4s-1 6s-1]
Aaron to Mandeep, FOUR, good shot. Sees the length short and pulls it up and over the infield. Clears it easily for a boundary
Aaron to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, what he's done here is ruled out Guptill at backward point. Hit it over him, and wide of him. Short and wide, talls up and cuts it ferociously. Powerplay done: 46 for 3

Mohit Sharma to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Axar!! That's just Mohit playing with the length. And his knuckles, maybe. Clocks 134ks but gets the ball to hold in the pitch, as Kedar charges out in ambition. Tries to check his shot but ends up slicing it off the splice to short cover. Kedar wanted to go leg-side, and go big, but was hoaxed by the ball never arriving at all. Where are we headed? More importantly, where are RCB? Kedar Jadhav c Axar b Mohit Sharma 6(6) [4s-1]
Mohit Sharma to Mandeep, FOUR, to be a cutter or to not be a cutter, that isn't the question. This was wide, and it's been cut away through backward point. Life's simple
Mohit Sharma to Mandeep, SIX, clobbered over mid-wicket. Stays put, and waits for the ball to arrive, before laying into a delicate bat-swing over cow corner

Nehra to Tripathi, out Tripathi Run Out!! A waste. A sheer waste. A nothing line this from Nehra, down leg and Tripathi helps it out to short fine courtesy his clip. Nothing wrong with that. Just that he wants the single desperately after that - something Rahane declines making him return from his adventures half way down the track. A direct hit and you do not need to disturb the third umpire for these. Had given up. Oh what a waste of form. Tripathi run out (Bipul Sharma) 1(4)
Bipul Sharma to Stokes, SIX, Stokes has seen enough. Decides to up the ante and succeeds. Lowers his stance to reach the ball, unleashes his strong muscles and thumps it over deep mid-wicket

Bipul Sharma to Stokes, SIX, two in two! Left-arm spin against Stokes? Not a good idea. He takes a step forward this time, wasn't quite to the pitch but he extends his long levers to butcher it into the deep mid-wicket stands
Bipul Sharma to Stokes, SIX, Stokes is teeing off. Third six off Bipul. Spots the shorter ball early, skips back and flat-bats it over long-on
S Kaul to Stokes, 2 runs, common-sense cricket from Stokes. Knocks it away into the leg-side and comes back for the second without breaking a sweat

S Kaul to Stokes, FOUR, oh my word! You don't often see a batsman play the reverse-hit to a fast bowler. But Stokes does the unthinkable. Sees the short of length delivery early, changes his grip and swats it over point. Outrageous!

Rashid Khan to Stokes, out Bowled!! Got him. Rashid takes matter on his own hands and castles Stokes. Flatter ball, extracted just a bit of turn back in, Stokes sanked down for a blindfold slog, misses and sees his stumps rattled. Much needed breakthrough for SRH. Stokes b Rashid Khan 39(25) [4s-1 6s-3]

S Kaul to Smith, out Caught by Bipul Sharma!! Bipul Sharma has resurrected his karma charts. This should've happened much earlier. He dropped Smith earlier off the same bowler but washes off all the sins now. A very full ball outside off, Smith tried to be smart, opened the bat face and looked to flay it in the pocket between point and short third man. But fails in his endeavour. Picks out Bipul, who settles under it and roars in delight. Smith c Bipul Sharma b S Kaul 34(39)

S Kaul to Christian, FOUR, Christian is off the mark with a boundary. Would you believe it? This is only the second boundary of the innings. A juicy half volley outside off, Christian leans forward and creams it through extra cover

S Kaul to Christian, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Two wickets in three balls for SRH. What a turnaround. One shot too many for Christian. It was swerving in on off, Christian wanted to go over long-on but messes up his timing. Skews it off the splice and sends it high towards long-on. Rashid Khan runs in and pouches it safely. Too easy for him. Christian c Rashid Khan b S Kaul 4(2) [4s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, a boundary to cap off the over. A short of length delivery outside off, Tiwary reaches out and places it behind point. No chance for the third man fielder
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, FOUR, bad idea Kumar. Arrows it on leg-stump line, Dhoni swivels 360 and hacks it over square leg

Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, SIX, Dhoni has found his elements. A short ball without any purpose, sits up nicely for Dhoni. He rocks back and muscles the pull over deep mid-wicket. The crowd aren't willing to return the ball. So, the fourth umpire has arrived with a set of replacements

Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, SIX, you miss the length, you will get punished. The idea was good from Kumar, but the execution was horrible. Fullish outside off, Dhoni throws his weight across and bullies it over extra cover. A flat six

Bhuvneshwar to Manoj Tiwary, out Manoj Tiwary Run Out!! 1 run completed. Horrible mix-up and Tiwary has to depart. A total communication breakdown between Tiwary and Dhoni. A fuller length delivery on the stumps, Tiwary pushes it towards long-off and set off for the second. Dhoni showed signs of interest but on seeing the fielder rush onto the ball, he sent back Tiwary and sold him down the river. The Bengal batsman had no chance of returning back once he took off. Manoj Tiwary run out (Warner/Bhuvneshwar) 9(5) [4s-1]
S Kaul to Dhoni, FOUR, such a calculative shot from Dhoni. Kaul angled this slower ball outside off, Dhoni throws his bat to his fullest and gets it over point. Not off the middle but he won't mind

S Kaul to Dhoni, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! End of Dhoni blitz. But he has done the damage. Very full ball on the stumps, Dhoni swung hard at that, fails to find the sweet spot. Some curl in the air must've done him. Edges it behind and Ojha makes no mistake. Dhoni c Naman Ojha b S Kaul 31(21) [4s-2 6s-2]

S Kaul to SN Thakur, out Caught by Warner!! Safe as houses. If Davy Warner is in the vicinity, you can tuck your arms and walk off. You will rarely see him put a catch down. Two in two for Kaul and he is on a hat-trick. Looked like the slower ball, hurled it wide of off, Thakur meekly chipped it down the ground. Finds long-off and the SRH skipper calmly gobbles it up. SN Thakur c Warner b S Kaul 0(1)

S Kaul to Smith, 1 run, put down. Oh Bipul Sharma. Neutralizes all the work he did with Tripathi's dismissal with a horrific piece of catching. At the same position - short fine. Smith fetches it off his pads and fails to keep the glance down finding the man at 45 behind square to perfection. Gets both hands to it over his eyeline and watches it fluff out

Henriques to Rahane, SIX, piles on his luck. Unleashes the first boundary of the day clearing his front leg, walking into the line and down in executing the full bat swing as he clinically dispatches it with a tonk over long-on. All timing

Bipul Sharma to Rahane, out Caught by Yuvraj!! Sweeps and sweeps his way to his doom. Bipul has some sort of a revenge. Keeps flighting it up inviting the aggression. Gets it in the form of an uncontrolled sweep. Rahane doesn't really reach out, takes one hand off the handle as well as he top-edges it to a running in Yuvi from the square leg fence. The second time Bipul has Rahane's number this season. Rahane c Yuvraj b Bipul Sharma 22(20) [6s-1]

Henriques to Smith, 1 run, another life. At short fine leg again. This time it is Bhuvi Kumar playing godfather. Smith seems keen on his walking flicks, once again doesn't keep it down and gives Bhuvi a chance with a dive to his left. In the palms and popping out

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, lovely shot, poor ball from Unadkat, short and wide of off, Dhawan reached out and cracks it in front of square on the off-side. Rahane moved across to his left, put in the dive, but the ball was always wide of him

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan has come out aggressively. Someone might have told him that the Indian team for Champions Trophy might be selected tomorrow.
