Unadkat shortened the length as he spotted Dhawan running down the track, makes room and slaps it over cover. Rahane has no chance in the deep

Christian to Warner, FOUR, calculated risk from Warner. First ball from a new bowler, mid-off inside the ring and Warner was walking down the pitch, extends his arms and lifts it over the fielder, couple of bounces and into the fence

Stokes to Warner, out Caught by SN Thakur!! And that's why he was brought back. Huge moment in the game. Third wicket for RPS and all three have been from Stokes. Nothing special about this delivery. Short and outside off, Warner was on the hop trying to play the cut, does not bother to keep it down and picks out the sweeper to perfection. He was aiming to go over point and got it a lot squarer than he would have liked. Warner c SN Thakur b Stokes 40(34) [4s-4 6s-1]

Stokes to Yuvraj, 2 runs, direct hit and Yuvraj was struggling. Stokes sprays one down the leg-side from round the wicket, Yuvraj wanted to play his favourite pick-up shot over backward square, right off the cue-end and to deep mid-wicket, Unadkat get the angle and released the ball quickly. Dhoni also failed to collect the ball. Had he even deflected it onto the stumps, Yuvraj was a goner

Stokes to Yuvraj, SIX, class! Everything right about this shot. Just a pleasing sight to see Yuvraj smack a six straight back over the bowler. Fuller and on the stumps, the full face of the bat comes to the fore and then the extension of the arms to send it sailing over the rope

Tahir to Henriques, out Bowled!! Tahir is off. Game on! The wrong 'un from Tahir, Henriques certainly did not pick it as he went back to play the cut shot, the ball spun back in and got the under edge, deflected onto the stumps. Tahir is off on his sprint. Almost ends up near deep square leg. Two wickets in succession and the game is back in balance. Henriques b Tahir 4(6)

Tahir to Yuvraj, FOUR, that is cricket. A chance off the last ball followed by a boundary. Flighted delivery on a fullish length, righth in the arc for Yuvraj, who heaves it to the deep mid-wicket fence. Placed it expertly

Christian to Yuvraj, SIX, much needed hit for SRH. Short delivery and not much pace to trouble Yuvraj, was bowled at 120kph and sat up nicely, Yuvraj pulls it off the front foot into the deep square leg stand

Unadkat to Yuvraj, out Caught by Tripathi!! Wow! Is that the game? Unadkat certainly thinks so. Pumps his fist in excitement. The off-cutter on a shortish length. They have been bowling that all evening. Yuvraj goes for the cut and like Warner does not have the power to get it over the man sweeping. Tripathi runs to his right and takes a well-judged catch. Yuvraj has some advice for the incoming Bipul Sharma. Yuvraj c Tripathi b Unadkat 47(43) [4s-4 6s-2]

Unadkat to Naman Ojha, SIX, Ojha can strike the ball. So, SRH fans, hang in there. Unadkat switches to round the wicket and dishes out a slower delivery on a length, Ojha swings as hard as possible and sends it over long-on. Got plenty of height and for a second might have thought he was in trouble, but Christian was reduced to a spectator

Unadkat to Naman Ojha, out Caught by Stokes!! You just can't keep Stokes out of the action. Second wicket in the over for Unadkat and he might have just won RPS the game. Another one of his cutters outside off, Ojha went for the loft over long-off, since the ball gripped the surface it took the outer half of the bat and skied towards sweeper cover. Stokes made no mistake. Bit of silence around the ground now. Naman Ojha c Stokes b Unadkat 9(9) [6s-1]

Unadkat to Bipul Sharma, out Caught by Stokes!! Dot followed by a wicket. Stokes with another catch. He's been everywhere today. The slower delivery and Bipul picked it early this time around, went with the angle towards deep square leg. Made a decent connection as well but the big side boundaries don't fetch him a six. Stokes steadies himself near deep square leg and pouches it with ease. Unadkat has a smile on his face. Bipul Sharma c Stokes b Unadkat 8(7)

Unadkat to Rashid Khan, out Caught&Bowled!! Fourth wicket for Unadkat. He's on a hat-trick. Another batsman falls prey to the slower delivery. The key with the off-pace delivery is that you have to hit the right length and Unadkat has managed to do that, Rashid went for the loft and only managed to cue-end beside the pitch. Unadkat runs across and reverse cups it. Rashid Khan c and b Unadkat 3(4)

Unadkat to Bhuvneshwar, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! There it is. Third hat-trick of the season. He is chuffed to bits. Is almost on his knees celebrating the occasion. Also, reaches 100 wickets in T20s. Once more the off-speed delivery on back of a length, Bhuvneshwar stayed leg-side and tried to flat-bat it, spliced it towards extra cover and Tiwary made no mistake. He's been terrifich with his slower balls. Bhuvneshwar c Manoj Tiwary b Unadkat 0(1)
Unadkat to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan is looking in good touch, length delivery outside off, he was quick to shuffle across, gets into a good position and heaves it over the mid-wicket fence

Stokes to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Stokes strikes first ball, did the ball stay a bit low? Stokes wouldn't complain though. He came from round the wicket and angled one back into the left-hander, Dhawan was lazy in getting forward, his bat came down way too late - but by that time the ball had gone past him and pegged the off-stump back. Stokes exults in delight, Dhawan was looking in good touch, but it's only a cameo from him today. Dhawan b Stokes 19(12) [4s-2 6s-1]

Stokes to Williamson, FOUR, edged and four, a juicy full-toss from Stokes, might have slipped out of his hands. Williamson was startled as he pushed at that, gets a thick edge that rolls away past the keeper and into the fence. An immediate apology from Stokes, but that wasn't dangerous

Stokes to Williamson, out Caught by Dhoni!! Stokes is pulling his team back into the contest once again. He did with the bat earlier, he now has two in an over. This is a huge wicket, KW was the man who could have anchored the chase on this pitch, he's been done in by some extra bounce. Was late in getting forward on the drive, the ball seamed just enough to catch the shoulder of the bat - a bit of glove as well and MS doesn't drop those. Williamson c Dhoni b Stokes 4(2) [4s-1]

Stokes to Yuvraj, FOUR, a gift and Yuvraj gleefully accepts! Short and wide from Stokes, Yuvraj climbs into the cut and deposits it over cover, a couple of bounces and the ball rolls into the ad hoarding
Washington Sundar to Warner, FOUR, that's a good comeback from Warner, tossed up on the stumps, he gets down low and sweeps it over square leg, no need to run for those

Washington Sundar to Warner, FOUR, lovely, Warner is getting into the act now, slower and just outside off, he gets forward, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and finds the gap past extra-cover, beats mid-off and rolls away to the fence

Washington Sundar to Warner, FOUR, cracking shot, this is good batting from Warner, he's beginning to read Sundar now, tossed up on the stumps, he gets well forward and lifts it back over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the ropes

Tahir to Warner, SIX, cracking shot, this was the leg-break, but the line was too full, allowed Warner to get underneath the ball and lift it back over his head, went all the way for the first maximum of the chase, for Warner

Tahir to Yuvraj, 1 run, was that a chance? Yes, it was - a tough chance but you need to grab those when you are defending a low score. This was dropped short by Tahir, Yuvraj swivelled across on the pull, didn't bothered to keep it down. It was travelling and to his left, Sundar went with both hands, got to the ball but can't hold on. On the second viewing, it was closer to him, should take those at this level

SN Thakur to Yuvraj, FOUR, edged and four, more luck for Yuvraj, full and wide of off from Shardul. Yuvraj saw the width and threw his hands at that, gets a thick edge that flies past Dhoni and into the fence

SN Thakur to Yuvraj, FOUR, creamed, width on offer from Shardul, Yuvraj leans into the shot and drives it to the left of extra-cover. It was in the air but was perfectly placed as well, no chance for the fielder at mid-off

McClenaghan to Samson, out Caught by Simmons!! This is not how you climb a Mt Everest. This is not the start you dream of. A fuller ball and Samson swings across the line. Wants to dominate with ball one. The bat turns a bit in the hands, taking the power off the shot. Carries to the man at deep square leg. The fielder moves a bit to his right and grabs that with ease. Samson c Simmons b McClenaghan 0(1)

Malinga to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Not for once in this innings did he look at ease and eventually hands a dolly to Harbhajan at mid-wicket. Short ball, Shreyas Iyer is clearly done in by the pace. Is late on the pull, the ball hits the splice and skies. Second one down for Delhi. They are not helping their cause. The move to send him up the order falls on its face. 150 wickets in the IPL for the great Sri Lankan. Shreyas Iyer c Harbhajan b Malinga 3(6)
Harbhajan to Shami, SIX, that is a good hit! Slogs with the turn and hits it well over the long-on fence. 91 metre hit that

Harbhajan to Shami, out Caught by Pollard!! Goes with the turn again. No, not really. It is the attempted doosra from Bhajji. Does not turn much but does the trick, Shami miscues the big loft. Pollard gets under it at long-on and pushes Delhi closer to embarrassment. Shami c Pollard b Harbhajan 7(4) [6s-1]

Karn Sharma to Zaheer, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Delhi lose by 146 runs and it's an IPL record. Zaheer tries to clear the straight boundary but mistimes in the air for Nitish Rana to run across from long-on and catch it. Juggled a few times but managed to hold on. Zaheer c Nitish Rana b Karn Sharma 2(11)
McClenaghan to Nair, FOUR, cheeky and effective. Makes a bit of room to this shortish ball that was going across him, guides it over the slip fielder, who is fairly wide. Third man too is in the ring

McClenaghan to Nair, FOUR, the swipe that Delhi batsmen have been attempting to no avail. But this time he has got a bit of bat on it. The delivery was slower than usual, might have helped his cause. Hits over mid-wicket and fetches a four

McClenaghan to Nair, SIX, sound! Often that is an indication of the timing. Nair clubs the length ball over mid-wicket. Looked a bit early on the shot but manages to put more than enough behind the shot to power it over the lurking fielder at the boundary

Bumrah to Pant, out Caught by Simmons!! You got to look at Pant. He cannot believe it. Looks dejected. As if has been robbed of hope. The scoreboard pressure gets the better of him. A shortish ball that he tries to help with the pull, does not quite manoeuvre it well. Ends up hitting in the air at deep mid-wicket. The fielder onrushes a few yards and accepts the offer. Pant c Simmons b Bumrah 0(3)
Bumrah to Nair, FOUR, wickets are tumbling at one end but Nair continues to impress. Arches back to this short ball and ramps it over the keeper. A couple of bounces and into the fence

Harbhajan to Corey Anderson, FOUR, starts round the wicket and gets it to turn a bit around off. Corey Anderson goes back to cut, the ball keeps a bit low and takes the under edge. Goes between the legs of Parthiv. Bumrah, from short fine leg, gives the chase for a while before the ball beats him to the fence

Harbhajan to Nair, out Caught by Rohit!! Now Nair departs. Wheels coming off the chase. Nair, like the previous occasion, stepped down again. This time Harbhajan is smart enough to shorten the length. However, that does not deter Nair who goes with the shot, whips it well but does not get the elevation. Rohit Sharma at mid-wicket leaps a bit and plucks it. Nair c Rohit b Harbhajan 21(15) [4s-3 6s-1]
Malinga to Corey Anderson, FOUR, drags the mighty heave from around off. For a moment he seemed to have found mid-wicket. But it was in the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on

Malinga to Corey Anderson, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! Short ball and it devours Corey Anderson. He was trying to make some room but saw that the line was pretty close to his body. Decided to go for the pull, but the ball skid on. Could not get enough power behind the shot and found long-on to his left. Corey Anderson c Karn Sharma b Malinga 10(8) [4s-2]S

Karn Sharma to Samuels, out Caught by Rohit!! Where did this come from? Rohit Sharma has taken a catch that for me qualifies as the grab of the tournament, at least so far. Samuels goes back to cut this leg-break, outside edges that flies to right of Rohit at slip. He spots it, not sure what was the reaction time, and plucks it one-handed when it has almost gone past him. Blinder from the Mumbai skipper. Samuels c Rohit b Karn Sharma 1(5)
Harbhajan to Pat Cummins, SIX, he goes and goes big. What helps him the sensible approach - that is to go with the turn. Clubs over cow corner for a maximum

Harbhajan to Pat Cummins, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Mumbai are running through Delhi. Pat Cummins stays back to defend, plays for the extra turn. There is not much, takes the edge and settles into the gloves of the keeper. Pat Cummins c Parthiv Patel b Harbhajan 10(10) [6s-1]

Karn Sharma to Rabada, out Caught by Rohit!! Nothing shot from Rabada. Goes back to cut a googly that is not short by any stretch of imagination. Gets a thick edge and Rohit Sharma is catching everything tonight. How can he drop something destined to go into his lap!? Rabada c Rohit b Karn Sharma 0(5)
Mishra to Simmons, 1 run, tossed up outside off, driven down towards long-off for a single, brings up another IPL fifty
Mishra to Pollard, SIX, massive, nicely tossed up on off, Pollard gets his left leg out of the way and swings through the line, plenty of height and way into the stands, long-off was a mere spectator

Mishra to Pollard, SIX, the short straight boundaries has worked against Mishra here. He can't believe it - for a moment, long-off thought it was an easy chance, but he kept watching it soar over his head. Coming to the ball, it was another lovely leg-break, Pollard was completely done in by it, mistimes it badly and still gets a maximum. Who wants to be a bowler in T20s?

Pat Cummins to Simmons, SIX, massive, once again the batsman seemed to be done in by the length, but Simmons has still managed to send this one way into the stands at wide long-on. On a good length and on the stumps, Simmons was backing away on the slog, had to drag it in the end and still gets plenty of bat on it
Corey Anderson to Simmons, SIX, cracking shot, slower short ball from Anderson, Simmons walks across the stumps and pulls it high and over mid-wicket, went a long way into the stands

Corey Anderson to Simmons, out Caught by Samuels!! Catching practice for Samuels and Simmons falls after a fine knock. Relief on the faces of the Daredevils fielders, this was short and on the stumps - asking to be smacked. Simmons shuffled inside the line and was looking to help it fine, went off the middle and straight into the pouch of Samuels - at short fine leg. He doesn't drop those, juggles and takes it on the second attempt. Simmons walks off to a good ovation. Simmons c Samuels b Corey Anderson 66(43) [4s-5 6s-4]

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, beautifully played! This was a back of a length delivery outside off, Rohit waits on it, uses the pace on the ball and dabbed it behind square on the off-side. Backward point dived to his left, short third man to his right - but both can't stop the ball
Mishra to Pollard, SIX, sheer power from Pollard, Mishra helped his cause with a long hop, Pollard rocks back and flat-bats it back over the bowler, deep into the stands at long-off

Mishra to Pollard, SIX, another biggie and Pollard has deposited this one into the top tier of Kotla. Mishra gave this one plenty of air, Pollard gets a big stride forward and dismisses it high and over long-on. He's looking extremely dangerous

Zaheer to Pollard, FOUR, Pollard gets way with another slice of luck. He came down the track, set himself up for the lap sweep, Zaheer spotted it and went wider, finds the outside edge and it loops past Pant. Can't do much as a bowler in this format of the game

Rabada to Pollard, FOUR, full marks for effort from Iyer, but he could not stop the boundary. Length delivery on off, Pollard heaved and the inside edge squirted towards fine leg. Iyer ran across from deep square and dived, but the ball won the race

Rabada to Rohit, out Caught by Mishra!! That's the pace of Rabada. Rohit is one of the finest pullers in India and still he's undone by the South African's speed. Dug in short and gets a nice lift on this, Rohit goes for the pull tad too late, the top-edge pops towards short fine leg and Mishra completes the formalities. Big wicket for DD at this stage of the game. They need few more to take control. Rohit c Mishra b Rabada 10(6) [4s-1]

Pat Cummins to Pollard, FOUR, fifty for Pollard. The move has paid off. He raises his bat and acknowledges the applause from his team mates. He shouldn't have been on strike for this ball. The basics in cricket I tell you. Low full toss and Pollard drills it past mid-off. No stopping that

Corey Anderson to Hardik Pandya, SIX, the ball hits the ad cushions on the full. Slanted across the right-hander, Pandya stands his ground and smokes it over extra cover. Two men in front of square riding the boundary and he split them to perfection

Corey Anderson to Pollard, FOUR, good finish to the over. Anderson misses the yorker by a couple of inches and that is enough for Pollard to tonk it back over him, one bounce and evades the long-on fielder

Rabada to Hardik Pandya, 3 runs, dropped! First, Iyer spills one and then takes ages to release the ball. Allowing the duo to scamper back for the third. Short of length and Hardik is hurried on the flat-batted pull, spliced towards mid-off. Iyer rans back and tries to take it over his left shoulder, got both hands but the ball pops out

Pat Cummins to Pollard, FOUR, lovely batting. Low full toss outside off, not far from the yorker, Pollard is deep in the crease, opens the bat face and drives through extra cover. No chance for the sweeper

Pat Cummins to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, this was not the area Hardik was targeting. He was looking to go over extra cover, but the bat turned on impact and the length delivery was sliced over backward point

Pat Cummins to Hardik Pandya, SIX, brings up the 200 and the 50-run stand in style. The cross-seam full delivery, Hardik stays right back in his crease and lifts it over mid-off, the 146kph delivery sailed over the rope

Pat Cummins to Hardik Pandya, SIX, they have recovered from that tidy last over. Back of a length delivery and Hardik short-arm pulls it over deep mid-wicket, the short boundaries taking care of the rest
Zaheer to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's a poor ball, spoils the over for Zaheer. Down the leg-side, the cutter gone wrong. Parthiv Patel helps the pull past the man in the ring at short fine leg

Rabada to Simmons, SIX, reminds of that night in Mumbai. Flat-batted pull on this back of a length delivery. Does not go high in the air, almost goes flat to the deep mid-wicket fence. So much power behind this one
Rabada to Simmons, FOUR, now he is playing with the mind of Rabada. It's a short ball, gives himself some room and slaps over cover-point

Zaheer to Simmons, SIX, that is not the longest part at Kotla - the area behind square on the on-side. And to make things easy, it is a short ball down the leg-side. Simmons waits and thunders the pull well over the fence. Simmons is turning it on. Does not take much time to change the entire context
Pat Cummins to Simmons, FOUR, that's as Caribbean as anything. Clears the left-leg and slaps this length ball over cover

Pat Cummins to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, how far has that gone. Far enough but bounces just inside the ropes. Parthiv Patel took on the short ball and went for the hook, hitting it high and almost handsome. One bounce over the ropes at deep backwars square leg fence
Pat Cummins to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Parthiv Patel is giving it all. Backs away to this fuller ball and slices it past the ring, races to the third man fence

Pat Cummins to Parthiv Patel, leg byes, FOUR, Cummins switches to round the wicket to finish the over. Does not bring about a change in fortunes, drifts down the leg and Parthiv Patel helps it past the keeper. In fact between the keeper and the man at short fine leg with a whippish pull. That is what I saw, the umpire saw things differently and correctly. Given as leg-byes, must have come off thigh or something else
Shami to Simmons, FOUR, shortish ball. Bad ball to start off the over. Might have been warming up. Simmons makes full use of it, cuts past the man at backward point
Shami to Simmons, FOUR, he is cracking those off the back foot. And the length from Shami is not helping the cause of Delhi. Bit of width, Simmons creates some more and cuts it past the man at point

Shami to Parthiv Patel, no run, direct hit at the striker's end and Parthiv Patel was gone. But as luck would have it, Cummins missed the target. It was again a short ball and Parthiv Patel went for the pre-meditated hook, could not get behind the shot and ended up deflecting off the face of the bat toward mid-wicket. Was blinded through the motion and did not spot where the ball went. Heard the call late but was back in time

Mishra to Parthiv Patel, out Stumped!! This was coming. Parthiv Patel was not quite able to find the fence despite his regular attempts. This time curmudgeonly steps down to go down town. The googly was always going across him. Once he did not meet the pitch of the ball, the doom was waiting. Pant did not do anything silly, collected the ball and whipped the bails. Parthiv Patel st Pant b Mishra 25(22) [4s-3]
Shami to Simmons, FOUR, he is not going to budge, this man who beats jetlags. Clears the front leg and hits it flat over mid-off, one bounce and over the ropes

Aniket Choudhary to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Lynn is off. Sheer timing fetches him his first boundary. Fuller and just outside off, Lynn drives through the line and the timing take care of the rest. There was a fielder in the deep and he had no chance
Aniket Choudhary to Chris Lynn, FOUR, drilled. Aniket pitches it up and is dispatched with disdain. Lynn does not bother to move his feet and hammers the drive past a hapless AB at mid-off

Aniket Choudhary to Chris Lynn, SIX, two fours followed by a six, Lynnsanity is back ladies and gentlemen. Nothing but a back of a length delivery and the golf like swing comes to the fore, slapped over the wide long-on fence

Badree to Narine, FOUR, in the air and over short third. Narine shimmies down and Badree pushed it wide, the outside edge flies towards Aniket, who misjudged it slightly by moving in and by the time he tracked back, the ball was over him
Badree to de Grandhomme, SIX, he's got hold of that. You bet he has. Badree skids it through from a length on middle, de Grandhomme takes a shimmy down and launches it over deep mid-wicket

Negi to de Grandhomme, FOUR, shortish outside off, and it's been slapped to the point boundary. What's Mandeep done to himself here? He charged across from sweeper cover and put in the dive. Valiant but futile effort. Looks in some pain. He's fine

Head to de Grandhomme, SIX, that's a six and a half! Into the top tier. Head floats it up right into the slot outside off, and that's all the swinging room which de Grandhomme needs as he sinks on his knees and destroys it over wide long-on

Negi to de Grandhomme, out Stumped!! Oh beautifully bowled. That's wonderful deception in flight. He slows it down, gives it some air to lure de Grandhomme out of his crease and then gets it to dip and turn past him. de Grandhomme runs past the ball. Lovely. Easy stumping for Jadhav. de Grandhomme st Kedar Jadhav b Negi 31(28) [4s-1 6s-2]

Chahal to Gambhir, out Caught by Negi!! Another wicket. It's brought a smile on a couple of faces for RCB. Chahal drifts this wide of off, Gambhir chases it for the drive wanting to smash it through the covers but because it's so wide, he gets it close to the bottom of the bat which spoils his timing. Skews it to short cover. Gambhir c Negi b Chahal 14(16)

Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that length is not going to trouble Lynn or for that matter any batsman. Short and on off, Lynn makes a bit of room and cracks it in front of square, raced away to the fence

Chahal to Chris Lynn, SIX, good use of the feet. Chahal floats it up on leg-stump, Lynn dances down and lofts it straight back over Chahal. The key was to play it with a straight bat and he did it with utter ease. Almost sent it into the press box
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, excellent batting. He is intimidating the bowlers here. Chahal is not tossing them up now, Lynn stays on the back foot and thumps it past the diving extra cover fielder

Badree to Narine, SIX, Narine had the better off Badree in the reverse fixture and nothing has changed. Tossed up outside off, Narine goes through the line and the loft travels all the way over long-off
Badree to Narine, SIX, same. Badree keeps flighting them up and Narine keeps sending them into the stands. A clean swing of the bat and the ball sails over the long-off fence. Back-to-back sixes

Badree to Narine, SIX, hat-trick of sixes. Badree is being taken to the cleaners by his mate. A repeat of the previous two shots, Badree needs to change things up, he ends up bowling in Narine's half and the big hit clears long-off with ease
Badree to Narine, FOUR, now this is rubbish. Rank long hop and down leg as well, Narine helps it along the way with a pull over short fine, this is just brilliant batting from the duo

Aravind to Narine, FOUR, wow! This is some hitting. Fullish and outside off, Narine nonchalantly lofts it inside out over extra cover, the ball almost carried the distance. One bounce and into the fence

Aravind to Narine, FOUR, the runs seem to be coming thick and fast. KKR want to finish this early so we can start the second game on time. Back of a length and outside off, Narine slaps it past mid-off. Not where he intended but the end result is what matters

Aravind to Narine, FOUR, full toss, come on you have to do better than that. Narine stands his ground and heaves it over mid-wicket, no one in the deep to stop that. Can he record the fastest fifty this season?

Aravind to Narine, SIX, there's the fastest IPL fifty. Sunil Narine is the proud owner of that record. If someone had told me that he would be the holder of that record, I would be laughing my guts out, but here he is proving almost everyone wrong. Short of length and Narine goes on his toes and lofts it over long-on. That is a very difficult shot to play and even the best of batsman find it hard, but Narine does it with ease. The KKR dugout are on their feet and GG is leading the applause. For once he has a smile on his face
Aravind to Narine, FOUR, fullish and outside off, Narine slices it over the infield. The carnage continues. Aravind just doesn't know where to bowl to Narine and he concedes 26 runs in the over

Chahal to Chris Lynn, SIX, the explosion does not seem to stop. KKR keep steamrolling. Lynn uses his feet to the flighted delivery and lofts it beautifully over the long-off. Who said he can't play spin?
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, short and outside off, Lynn slaps it over the off-side ring. No need to run for those when you keep striking them like that. This is simply brilliant batting from the duo

Chahal to Chris Lynn, SIX, it is now the highest team total in the powerplay. RCB have found new ways to create records. Chahal keeps tossing them up and Lynn sinks to one knee to slog sweep it into the deep mid-wicket fence

Aniket Choudhary to Narine, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Wicket after the break. It will not matter for KKR. Narine has done the job he was sent out to do. In fact might have done more than they would have expected. Quick short delivery and Narine takes it on, feathers an edge and Jadhav had to jump up to glove that. Some respite for RCB from all the madness. Narine c Kedar Jadhav b Aniket Choudhary 54(17) [4s-6 6s-4]
Negi to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slow on off, Lynn pats it with the turn into the off-side to bring up his half-century. It's come off 21 balls, at a snail's pace

Negi to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Got him. That's scooted through to shatter the stumps as Lynn lines up a pull. Darted in short, Lynn expects the ball to get up so he can pummel it into the stands. Not quite. RCB can chew the leftovers of their carcass. Chris Lynn b Negi 50(22) [4s-5 6s-4]

U Yadav to Gayle, out Caught by Gambhir!! Oh dear! Back-to-back ducks for Gayle, he is OUT first ball in his 100th IPL match. On a good length and a hint of shape back into the left-hander, Gayle was looking to work it towards the on-side. Did the ball stop on him, he closed the bat face early, the leading edge popped in the air and Gambhir raced in from cover to gobble it up. Worst possible start for RCB as Gayle walks away. Gayle c Gambhir b U Yadav 0(1)

Woakes to Mandeep, FOUR, nice way to get going, banged in short and just outside off, Mandeep backs away, comes down the track and slaps it high and behind square on the off-side. Almost went all the way, one bounce and over the ropes

Rajpoot to Head, FOUR, that ruins the over for Rajpoot, much needed boundary for RCB. Too short and on Head's hips, he gets inside the line and helps it on its way. Fine-leg was inside the ring and once it beat him, there was no way it could be stopped
de Grandhomme to Head, 1 run, on a good length and angling across the left-hander, Head was early into the drive once again - ends up dragging it down towards long-on for a single

Narine to Head, SIX, Head has a reputation of a clean-hitter, but we haven't seen any of that this season. Picks the right ball this time to play the slog sweep, flighted delivery on off and middle, Head went through with the shot and gained maximum result
de Grandhomme to Mandeep, FOUR, good shot! Just used the pace of de Grandhomme and guided it behind point, opened the bat face at the right moment and bisected the two fielders to perfection

de Grandhomme to Mandeep, 2 runs, fifty for Mandeep. First of the season and he's repaid the faith shown in him. Raises his bat and soakes in the applause from the crowd. Nurdled in front of square leg and races back for the second. The running has been excellent from these two

Narine to Mandeep, out Caught by U Yadav!! If the rain break didn't bring about a wicket, the strategic break did. Mandeep does not kick-on. Perishes while trying to up the ante. The off-break from Narine, Mandeep makes a bit of room, sits down and slog sweeps, made a decent enough connection, at least I thought with the sound when ball made contact with the bat, but it towards deep square leg. Umesh judged the boundary rope to perfection and hung on. Mandeep c U Yadav b Narine 52(43) [4s-4 6s-1]

Woakes to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, Jadhav is too good with those pick ups. Sees the back of a length delivery around the hip region, Jadhav maintains a strong base and swats it behind square on the leg-side, no chance for deep square leg

Rajpoot to Head, SIX, finishes the over with a maximum. Walks down the wicket to get close to the pitch of the ball and then hoicks it over the cow corner fence. Gets the crowd going as well. Good day for Rajpoot in the office, 4-0-25-0

Woakes to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by U Yadav!! And Jadhav mistimes one. The trap had been set from Woakes. The full wide delivery outside off, Jadhav was up for it, moved across to get close to the swinging range, the loft comes off the toe-end and skies up to long-off. Umesh jogs to his left and takes it comfortably. Kedar Jadhav c U Yadav b Woakes 8(9) [4s-1]

Woakes to Head, 2 runs, fifty for Head. It is his maiden IPL fifty for him. Good time to get it. The dugout are up on their feet applauding. Very full delivery outside off, Head squeezes the drive to long-off and Negi is quick to get back for the second

Woakes to Head, SIX, Woakes misses the length and pays the price. Lands it right in the swinging arc and Head ain't missing out, clears his front leg to get and strikes it cleanly over the long-off fence

U Yadav to Negi, FOUR, wow! Was that the outfield or the power of Negi? Bit of both I reckon. Too full and outside off, Negi reaches out for the drive and almost jammed it through extra cover. The ball kept going away from the long-off fielder

U Yadav to Negi, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! Third wicket for Umesh. Negi had no other option than to go for it. The off-pace delivery and Negi went for big hit down the ground, got it right off the base of the bat and sent it a long way into the sky. Lynn from extra cover called for it and made the catch look utterly easy. Negi c Chris Lynn b U Yadav 5(3) [4s-1]

U Yadav to Head, SIX, caught, in the crowd. 109 meters. That's a monster. The slower delivery on a fuller length, Head shuffled across slightly, bent his front knee and smashed it over long-on. For a second, it seemed to be heading to Cubbon Park, but dropped inside the ground

U Yadav to Head, SIX, consecutive sixes. Umesh is dishing out length and Head is feasting on it. Outside off and Head set himself up nicely for the loft, slots it over the long-off fence. Flat and all the way
Woakes to Mandeep, SIX, lovely shot, on a good length and on the stumps, Mandeep makes room, swings through the line and clears mid-on with ease, has enough power to send it soaring over the ropes

U Yadav to Mandeep, FOUR, cracking shot, Mandeep is finally showing the form that made him a possible India selection a couple of seasons ago. Picked up the short ball from Umesh, swiveled across, rolled his wrists over and pulls it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

U Yadav to Kohli, out Lbw!! Piyush can be relieved now, yet another failure for Kohli. Superbly bowled by Umesh, this was the back of the hand slower ball, Kohli didn't pick it up at all, swung across the line and missed it completely. Rapped on the pads (back thigh) and it's a simple call for the umpire. Umesh exults in delight, RCB are struggling early once again. Kohli lbw b U Yadav 5(9)

U Yadav to Head, FOUR, ends the innings on a high. The slowest of slower balls from Umesh. Took a while getting to Head, he waited for a long time before pulling it over the square leg umpire. Since there was no pace, the ball didn't travel the distance

Woakes to de Villiers, FOUR, cracking shot, AB gets going, Woakes shortened his length as he saw AB's charge. Quick hands does the trick for the Protean superstar, swivels across, rolls his wrists over and pulls it in front of square on the on-side, beats the man getting across from the deep

Narine to de Villiers, FOUR, classy, that's why he's the best in the business, Narine dropped his length short and wide outside off, AB was shuffling across, adjusts well and slaps it over cover, one bounce and over the ropes

Narine to de Villiers, out Bowled!! This has been the story of the season for RCB, says Sanjay Manjrekar on air - can't be wrong. This was tossed up on the stumps, AB was once again shuffling across, as a result - he left his leg-stump exposed, the ball drifted in, went past his attempted sweep and crashed into the leg-stump. A stunned AB has to walk back to the hut. de Villiers b Narine 10(8) [4s-2]
U Yadav to Head, FOUR, lovely shot, leg-stump half-volley from Umesh, Head shuffles across and whips it in front of square on the on-side. The man in the deep is very square and has no chance
Narine to Mandeep, FOUR, lovely shot, Narine drops one short and wide of off, Mandeep waits on it and cuts it late, beats backward point to his right and rolls away to the fence
Sandeep Sharma to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, swinging into the pads, no real threat, Ishan Kishan puts it away with a flick of the wrists. No-one at fine leg
Mohit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, leg-side dross. Smith won't spare. He clips it behind square, so far that the man at deep square couldn't reach
Mohit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, slower half-volley outside off, Smith gets to the pitch of it and thrashes it away between mid-off and extra cover. Simple
T Natarajan to Raina, FOUR, full toss on legs. Raina helps it to the deep backward square leg fence. Horrible ball, overheard in the comm room
Aaron to Raina, FOUR, Raina makes room, gets followed by a short ball but does not flinch. Goes with the pull - tennis-like heave - and sends it to the deep mid-wicket fence on the bounce
Aaron to Raina, FOUR, and gets this one fine. Shuffled across to a short ball and tucked in the air, but fine leg was not in the ring. Managed to fetch a four in the end

Maxwell to Dwayne Smith, SIX, the captain did not listen to what the keeper had to say a couple of overs ago. Yes, he pitches it up and then sees himself get muscled over the fence, straight down the ground

Maxwell to Dwayne Smith, out Caught by Guptill!! Drags the length and gets rewarded. Dwayne Smith goes for the slog on this flatter ball, fails to generate enough momentum. Finds one of the tallest members on field stationed at deep mid-wicket boundary. Dwayne Smith c Guptill b Maxwell 74(39) [4s-8 6s-4]
T Natarajan to Raina, FOUR, steps down does Raina this time. Natarajan wants to out-think him with a slower short ball. Fails. Raina cuts him to the deep point fence

Mohit Sharma to Raina, SIX, blame the willow, if you are a bowling fan. Or call it a beautiful display of timing, if you support the batters. A gentle chip on this shortish ball where Raina looked deceived for a while. But manages to clear the long-on fence

Aaron to Raina, 2 runs, that kind of a day it has been for Punjab. Gurkeerat misjudges this mistimed loft from Raina. Goes back, comes forward but is late by then, fails to get underneath the ball despite the dive from long-off. Got fingers to that, so will go down as a drop chance

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, out Caught by Gurkeerat Singh!! Mann is the man for Punjab, finally. Takes one at deep mid-wicket. Raina went for the glory shot, the bat turned in his hand as he attemped the swing on this fuller ball. Skied it high and Mann, who was not having a great day before this catch of course, manages to reverse-cup it. Relieved, that was the look on his face. Raina c Gurkeerat Singh b Sandeep Sharma 39(25) [4s-4 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Finch, out Caught by Saha!! Sandeep is behind what happened earlier in the day and he is trying his best to change things on his own. Short ball that kicked off and beat the pull of Finch, took the top edge en route to the keeper. Two wickets in the over and Punjab might feel resurrected after this. Finch c Saha b Sandeep Sharma 2(2)

Aaron to Karthik, SIX, had it gone a few inches higher, it would have gone past the reach of earth's gravity. Short ball and Karthik gets late on the pull, top edges it over the keeper's head. Goes deep into the stands as well
Aaron to Karthik, FOUR, Aaron don't look at Maxi. Short and slow outside off. Karthik cuts past backward point and releases the pressure
T Natarajan to Karthik, FOUR, slower ball and Karthik lofts over extra cover. No one in the deep and it just about trickles down to the fence. All over. GL win by 6 wickets
Sandeep Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, trying too much? I guess so. Looks for swing again, there's none. Sat up from a short length, Smith punches sweetly through the covers. Save your legs!
Aaron to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, shortens the length and takes the pace off, Smith had the width to free his arms and he delays the cut shot, that helped him place in the gap on the off-side ring

Aaron to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, looks to tuck a length ball in the air over mid-wicket, gets a thick leading edge which lobs up and rolls towards third man. Sandeep Sharma tried his best, but he ended up parrying the ball into the boundary boards
Sandeep Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, too full, Smith bludgeons it back over the bowler's head. There's no stopping that
Sandeep Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, right where Smith likes it. Wide of off-stump, he uses his wrist power to smash a drive wide of extra cover. High elbow and all that...
Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, pokes the ball into the off-side to bring up the 50-run opening stand
Mohit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, they are just feeding to his strengths. Full ball on the pads, Smith picks it up and kills it over mid-wicket

Mohit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, 1 run. David Miller drops a dolly. It hung in the air for an eternity, Smith cursed himself and almost started walking to the pavilion, but luck seemed to have smiled on him. Smith looks to go straight with a loft, doesn't locate the middle. It goes up in the air towards mid-off, Miller comes in sets himself and looks to take it reverse cupped, it just doesn't stick. Hits him on the side of the palm and drops to the ground
Axar to Dwayne Smith, SIX, fifty for Dwayne Smith. Dwayne Smith gets a fuller ball this time. Something that was missing so far in this over. Clubs it straight over Axar's head. Goes a long way
Maxwell to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, nothing seems to be working. Starts with a short ball, Ishan Kishan camps back and pulls through mid-wicket

Maxwell to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, how good a shot that is. Look at the placement. Ishan Kishan charges on the front foot, sees the length and shapes back, cuts and beats the man at point and then sweeper who ran to his right

Maxwell to Dwayne Smith, 1 run, Dwayne Smith drank elixir today! Gets another life. Short ball and he pulls it to long-on, who dives forward but fails to get underneath the ball. Got hands to it so will go down as a chance
Axar to Dwayne Smith, SIX, just about clears the man at long-on. An almost tossed up ball. Dwayne Smith goes with the swing and muscles it over the fence

T Natarajan to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by (sub)Miller!! Finally the catch has been taken. Ishan Kishan goes for the heave again, was on the move a bit and hence no transfer of weight to impart enough power on the shot. Ends up hitting it low towards the man patrolling the fence at mid-wicket. Was a slower ball and that might have made things a touch different for the youngster. Ishan Kishan c (sub)Miller b T Natarajan 29(24) [4s-3]
T Natarajan to Dwayne Smith, SIX, anything up and he decimates it. Fuller ball on the middle and leg. Dwayne Smith keeps the willow straight and beats a leaping long-on

Sangwan to Guptill, out Caught by Basil Thampi!! This was coming. The approach to the pitch when he came out to bat wasn't that positive. He got a friendly ball on the pads first up, only managed to flick it behind square without power, then mistimed a hat-trick of balls before this one and Sangwan has got him with a bumper. Guptill wasn't expecting this from the pacer. Was looking to come forward, surprised by the bouncer, tries to pull off the back foot, Sangwan has a man at deep mid-wicket precisely for the top-edge and the man in the deep made no mistake as it came off the outside half of the bat. Guptill c Basil Thampi b Sangwan 2(5)
Faulkner to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, full and down the leg-side, Marsh easily glances it past short fine leg, Ishan Kishan runs to his left in the deep and dives but the ball wins the race

Faulkner to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, 112kph slower ball, but you can't offer width with both backward point and third man inside the ring. Marsh delays the late cut and guides it nicely between the two fielders

Ankit Soni to Amla, 1 run, fifty for Hash. The century stand is raised as well. Flighted delivery on the stumps, Amla mistimes the lofted on-drive to long-on. This has been a fine innings from the South African batsman. It's been a good mix of aggressive hits with gentle nudges
Ankit Soni to Amla, SIX, this time he connects well. Flighted delivery outside off stump, not as wide as the previous one. Amla goes straight down the ground and clears the fence
D Kulkarni to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, slower delivery outside off stump, Marsh pushes it towards point and raises his bat for a fifty. Another sensible innings from the Aussie

Basil Thampi to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, that's Marsh's strength. He is so good with the cut shots. Just can't keep him calm by bowling it wide of off, plants his back foot deep and thumps it away past backward point

D Kulkarni to Shaun Marsh, out Caught by Finch!! High into the night sky and straight into the bucket hands of Finch at long-on. Perfect length from Kulkarni, didn't let Marsh plan his swing, just held it back a touch and ensured he messed up the timing. Marsh lofted it straight, no distance, regulation catch. Shaun Marsh c Finch b D Kulkarni 58(43) [4s-6]

D Kulkarni to Amla, SIX, don't worry about this one though. Amla is nailing it off the middle, backs away a touch and fires a full ball over long-on. Got complete hold of it and his bat swing took care of the rest
Basil Thampi to Amla, SIX, Amla knows what's coming. A slower delivery, he transfers all his weight onto the back foot and bullies the ball over cow-corner. All power!

Basil Thampi to Amla, FOUR, oh Amla! You bewdy! He was shaping up to scoop over the keeper, on seeing the yorker dip he stays still and slaps it off the face over short third, all wrists you know. He might have borrowed VVS' wrists. Seriously! Never seen someone scoring so many runs at ease with pure wristwork
Basil Thampi to Amla, FOUR, width on offer, Amla charges himself for another flay, goes deep and carves it away over point
Faulkner to Amla, FOUR, low full toss, straight at the stumps, Amla lifts it barrel straight, no-one's stopping that!
Sangwan to Maxwell, SIX, short and in the swinging arc, Maxwell loads up and hacks it away over deep mid-wicket

Sangwan to Maxwell, SIX, mishit? Who cares? It has gone for a six. Maxi, you beast! What power! He looked to have mistimed this full delivery, went for the loft, but the only thing that could have taken that over the long-on fence is his power
Basil Thampi to Amla, FOUR, low full toss and Amla smashes it away over extra cover. Just a hit away now

Basil Thampi to Amla, SIX, second hundred this season, mighty Hash has done it on the big stage! Gets a handshake and a hug from his skipper. Cross-seam full delivery wide of off, Amla goes inside-out over extra cover. Crunnnnched off the meat

Basil Thampi to Amla, out Lbw!! Some respite, finally. A yorker that tails in a bit around middle and leg, Amla with his back leg deep inside, looking to swing over mid-wicket. Misses due to the dip and is caught plumb in front. Raina walks up to him to congratulate what has been a tremendous ton from one of the modern greats. Amla lbw b Basil Thampi 104(60) [4s-8 6s-5]

Sangwan to Amla, FOUR, that's class for you. The off-side is packed and Amla nonchalantly walks across the stumps, tempts the bowler to bowl at the stumps, Sangwan delivers a slower ball, Amla had ample time to flick along the ground, made sure he placed it well wide of deep square leg
Sangwan to Amla, FOUR, this time he clears the off-side field. Slower delivery outside off stump, Amla leans forward, delays his punch and hits it along the ground through cover

Basil Thampi to Amla, 1 run, dropped. Jaddu it is! Went to his right - not his natural side. Got both hands to it and he's livid with himself for putting it down. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Amla punches it uppishly, hit very well, backward point flew to his right, there was a dive but the ball popped out

Basil Thampi to Amla, FOUR, now that is a top shot! The change of pace, but Amla has great eyes. Picked that from the bowler's hand, delayed his shot, opened up the front leg and used his wrists so well to lift it inside-out over cover

Faulkner to Amla, SIX, Amla welcomes Faulkner with a lovely off-driven six. Length delivery just outside off stump, Amla waits and lofts it easily over the top. Faulkner was surprised how Amla managed to time it so well despite there being no wild swing of the bat

Faulkner to Amla, FOUR, that is pure wrist power. This was the slower ball, but it went too full, meaning that the batsman had a bit of extra time to react, Amla flicked nicely along the ground through mid-wicket

Jadeja to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, and again. As soon as Marsh comes on strike, Jadeja forgets words like "flight, air-time, tossing." MS Dhoni has to be behind the stumps to give him advice when he is under pressure. This is a big outfield and maybe he need not be afraid to toss a ball up. It's flat, quick, short, Marsh pulls it nicely past the deep mid-wicket fielder

Ankit Soni to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, it's a full toss, the idea was there to give the ball a bit more air, but the execution wasn't great. Marsh doesn't try to over-hit the ball, places the flick between long-on and deep mid-wicket
Jadeja to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, Jadeja continues to bowl quick, errs in line once again. Down the leg-side, Marsh glances it fine past the man at 45

Nabi to Simmons, out Bowled!! This was coming. He wanted to target the offie right from the word go. But Nabi a clever operator and out goes the middle pole. The key to this dismissal was once again Nabi opting to bowl a flatter trajectory, knowing that the batsman was targetting the on-side boundary. Simmons was nowhere close to this ball, a wild swing it was, ended up playing outside the line and made a mess of the stumps. Simmons b Nabi 1(5)

Rashid Khan to Rohit, SIX, good shot to end the over which will spoil a good over from Rashid Khan. Slightly overpitched, Rohit crouches low and launches it downtown over the bowler's head for a maximum

S Kaul to Hardik Pandya, no run, a direct-hit would have been curtains for Rohit. Pandya stands tall and punches it straight to cover. Henriques, there, makes a sharp stop and has a shy at the stumps at the bowler's end. Rohit was nowhere in the frame

Bhuvneshwar to Rohit, FOUR, this time he gets a boundary! Shortish and wide outside off, Rohit throws the kitchen sink, gets a fat outside edge that flies through the gap between backward point and short third man. There is no one to stop that

Henriques to Rohit, FOUR, wow! Stupendous shot. Henriques starts with an 117kph half-volley outside off, Rohit spots it like a hawk, waits for it and drills it through the covers. There was a man in the deep, all he could do was watch it go past the boundary rope
Henriques to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, wide of off again from Henriques, Pandya scythes it in front of square on the off-side. The single brings up the 50-run stand

Henriques to Rohit, FOUR, this is turning out to be an expensive over. Length ball outside off, Rohit doesn't go hard on his drive. Gets it wide of extra cover and the long-off fielder can't cut it off either

Henriques to Rohit, FOUR, four more, third boundary in this over. Deft touch from the MI skipper. Waits for the ball to arrive to him and cheekily opens the bat face at the last instance to guide it well wide of the short third man fielder. The ball dribbles away into the fence

Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Henriques!! There you go! Rashid Khan strikes and breaks the partnership. Hardik Pandya was never comfortable against Rashid. Doesn't pick the wrong 'un that doesn't spin much and goes for a wild slog sweep. The bat turns at the point of impact and he ends up slicing it high in the air. Henriques at extra cover calls fot it and catches it calmly. Hardik Pandya c Henriques b Rashid Khan 15(24)

Siraj to Rohit, 1 run, fifty for Rohit Sharma! A captain's knock. Pushes a fuller length delivery down the ground, that evades the fingers of the bowler. The ball hits the stumps and deflects towards long-on
Siraj to Rohit, FOUR, cheeky and effective. Short ball aimed at the body of Rohit. The batsman waited for it, slightly bends backward and periscopes it over the keeper's head for a boundary
Bhuvneshwar to Rohit, SIX, highest score for Rohit Sharma this season. He spots the slower ball that is on a short of length and smacks it away over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

S Kaul to Rohit, out Bowled!! The slower ball does the trick. It was an off-pace short ball well outside off, Rohit is early into his pull shot. He gets an inside edge and it also came off the bottom portion of the bat. Hits his boot and cannons onto the stumps. He could have gone with a stroke through the off-side. Anyway, end of a fine knock. Rohit b S Kaul 67(45) [4s-6 6s-2]

S Kaul to Karn Sharma, FOUR, ah! Boundary to finish the over. Still, just six off it. Attempts the yorker and ends up being a low full toss, Karn Sharma backs away and manages to squirt it away behind square on the off-side off the outside part of the bat

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! Seam-up full toss that tailed into the right-hander. Pollard goes for his favourite shot - the slog over mid-wicket. Goes hard and ends up mistiming it. Finds the man at deep mid-wicket to perfection. Shankar didn't have to move an inch. Pollard c Vijay Shankar b Bhuvneshwar 5(9)

Bhuvneshwar to Karn Sharma, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Had he let that go it would have been deemded as a wide. Seeing the batsman back away, Bhuvneshwar darts one well outside off from a good length. Sharma has to reach out for it with a stretched arms. In the end, nicks it into the mitts of Naman Ojha who collects it with ease. Karn Sharma c Naman Ojha b Bhuvneshwar 5(5) [4s-1]

Siraj to Parthiv Patel, SIX, that's a cracking cut shot from the little man. Siraj bowls a 135kph short ball, Parthiv is an excellent player of the cut shot, he deliberately cuts hard with an open face and hits over backward point, it's good enough to go all the way

Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, now then, now then, how about that for placement? What confidence to play such a shot when he has not even scored a run. Third man was inside the ring, Rana spotted that, as soon as he saw room on the ball, Rana guided it late and split short third man and backward point to perfection
Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, overpitched from Siraj, the over-correction from the bowler, Rana leans forward and plays a lovely off-drive to the left of mid-off

S Kaul to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! There you go, the pressure telling on the Mumbai batsmen and the youngster succumbs. He wanted to take the attack to the new bowler, in the process, he has played a false shot. This was a short of a length delivery outside off stump, it was never there to be pulled away, had to fetch it, an off-side shot would have been ideal, in the end slices it high in the air - the bat turned in his hands on impact - and only goes as far as mid-off. Nitish Rana c Bhuvneshwar b S Kaul 9(11) [4s-2]

S Kaul to Parthiv Patel, 2 runs, dropped! Vijay Shankar the culprit. Could have been three down. Short and wide outside off stump, Parthiv cuts, doesn't bother to keep it down, went to backward point, the fielder jumped and got both hands to it, easily catchable but it burst through the hands

Nabi to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, this is a brave hit and well executed too. Flighted delivery wide outside off stump, Parthiv was down on one knee and he had to fetch that shot, extended his arms and slog-swept it nicely into the deep mid-wicket boundary

S Kaul to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Warner!! Look at that fist pump from Davey Warner. Why not! He's taken an excellent catch and Mumbai aren't getting a hang of things here. Kaul gets his second wicket, it was the slower delivery, looked like the knuckle ball, Parthiv flicked uppishly, was beaten by the change of pace, hence couldn't control the shot, the ball wasn't comfortably carrying to the fielder. Warner ran forward and timed his dive to perfection to take a good low catch. Parthiv Patel c Warner b S Kaul 23(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Rashid Khan to Rohit, FOUR, deft touch from the skipper. Quicker delivery outside off stump, Rohit allows the ball to come, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and sends it to the left of short third man
Harbhajan to Warner, FOUR, short and wide outside off stump, Warner delayed the cut shot as the ball came slowly, hit that really hard through cover-point. He wants to make the most of the new ball

McClenaghan to Warner, out Lbw!! And he strikes first ball! What a great asset he has been for Mumbai Indians this season. This is a big, big wicket and a wicket that Mumbai needed badly. Warner was on the back foot expecting some short stuff, wasn't to be. McClenaghan spears in a full one that keeps tailing in to hit Warner on the back pad. Dead in front. Warner was looking to play straight...oh wait! Snicko shows that he seem to have got a faint inside edge on that. Warner lbw b McClenaghan 6(6) [4s-1]
Malinga to Henriques, FOUR, a full toss now. Henriques rides his luck with a dish out of some elegant timing. Executes a short arm jab to whip it in the air through mid-wicket

Malinga to Henriques, FOUR, and the mid-wicket fence is disturbed again. This time courtesy a standing up pull. Overcompensates the full toss with a pepper and Henriques - just what Henriques was waiting for. Rides the bounce with a toe-rise and dispatches

Harbhajan to Henriques, no run, put down. Oh Harbhajan. Gets the ball to stick on the surface making Henriques stand back and check his push. Chips it meekly in the end off a straight batted defence, straight to the bowler. Doesn't quite anticipate the sharp dip on this does Bhajji as he barely stoops low. An out-popper

Bumrah to Henriques, out Caught by Rohit!! Here comes the leading edge. The Bumrah slower one on this sticky wicket finally consumes a wicket for Mumbai - too late in the day one would reckon. After a few checked defences, Henriques looks to pile on the angle coming in off a fullish length as he turns his bat looking to flick it away. A balloon to extra cover, who snatches it from the hands of mid-off. Henriques c Rohit b Bumrah 44(35) [4s-6]
McClenaghan to Yuvraj, FOUR, breaks the shackles. Gets a short one on the ribs and an angry swivelling pull comes out in spanking it into the square leg fence. Hides his pain under some runs

Malinga to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, celebrates his selection into the Indian squad with a half-ton. And he's taking his team home. Gets a nothing delivery on the pads and puts it away with a glance to fine leg

Malinga to Dhawan, 1 run, keeps up with his leg-liners. This time darting it a lot fuller. Flicked away in front of square. Okay, this is his half-ton. ctrl C + ctrl V the description from a few balls earlier

Malinga to Yuvraj, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Now go and ice those fingers. Malinga keeps up with the slower ones, this time changing the line to one angling outside off. Yuvraj swings his bat through the line, realizes he is way too early and has to settle for a chipped loft. Miscued. Pandya at sweeper cover meanwhile runs in and settles to cause some jitters. Yuvraj c Hardik Pandya b Malinga 9(11) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, that's that. A juicy length delivery right in the slot and Shankar swings it over mid-on. Trickling away into the fence with the field brought up. Applies the finishing touches in style. SRH plant their flag again to reclaim the fortress
Malinga to Dhawan, FOUR, full ball in the slot, Dhawan feasts on it. Thumps the drive through extra cover with lovely balance, stand and admire stuff!
Bumrah to Henriques, FOUR, eye-pleasing! Back of a length wide of off, Henriques gets into to perfect position as he punches the ball on the up through the covers, blazed away...

Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR. The Gabbar is so good with the pull shot. Picks the length early and slots it all along the carpet through mid-wicket, too much to do for deep square, he couldn't get there in time
McClenaghan to Henriques, FOUR, that's too much width and can't expect to get away by bowling such fodder. Henriques uses McClenaghan's pace to slash it away through backward point
Karn Sharma to Dhawan, SIX, right to the pitch after putting his dancing shoes on, wallops Karn Sharma into the long-on stands. Easy!
Hardik Pandya to Henriques, FOUR, smash-me delivery. No real intent on that delivery. It just kept arrowing down the leg-side, Henriques helps it to the fine leg fence with a real muscular pull
Hardik Pandya to Henriques, FOUR, width on the off-side to the right hander this time, Henriques has no second thoughts, he stays his ground and cuts fiercely square on the off-side
Karn Sharma to Dhawan, FOUR, down on one knee and he goes boom on the sweep. Gets inside the line and picks his gap through backward square, timed well too

Karn Sharma to Dhawan, SIX, isn't to pitch, but boy! Look at that bat swing. The Gabbar seems to be in full flow. Fetches it from outside off and takes Karn Sharma for a journey over long-on. The crowd are excited, why not!

Harbhajan to Dhawan, FOUR, precision at its very best! Call it luck or placement, but Dhawan and SRH won't mind. Attempts the reverse sweep and for a fleeting moment he seemed to have mistimed it, but such is the luck, it flies in the gap between short third and backward point
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, and that is an usual sight. Sandeep Sharma throws it full outside off, might have swung a bit. But how does it matter, Narine flays the drive uppishly through cover

Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, back to back now! Another fuller ball and Narine this time lofts the drive, not much of followthrough. Just an extension of elbow and off she goes, one bounce over the ropes at extra cover
Sandeep Sharma to Chris Lynn, FOUR, swings a bit outside off. Chris Lynn takes that into account, clears the leg and cracks the drive over cover

Matt Henry to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Henry might have had a wicket off the first ball this season. But the wicket-keeper and the slip fielder both are undecided. Nobody went for it. Length delivery and Chris Lynn goes hard at it, outside edges that flies between the two men behind the stumps

Matt Henry to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Henry's pacy puts Chris Lynn in tangle once again but there is no one at fine leg. The man is in the ring. Chris Lynn was hurried by the bumper and top edged the pull. And because he throws his bat so hard, these edges fly over the ring

Swapnil Singh to Chris Lynn, SIX, boom, there you go. Slightly short outside off, and even though it's turning away, Lynn has the room to smack it over long-on. And then the gymnasium and those arms take over. Give the ball wings. Sails over
Rahul Tewatia to M Pandey, FOUR, geez, I have jinxed it, haven't I? Has the readymade room made and mows it off the front foot, right between long-on and deep mid-wicket
Axar to Chris Lynn, SIX, gosh. Nothing to add. Makes room to a length that has been slightly shortened and Nadals it over long-off. And he says he's not 100 percent..

Mohit Sharma to Chris Lynn, FOUR, the partnership between Chris Lynn and M Pandey is now 50+. Mohit caps the over with a poor, poor ball. Overpitches at his normal pace - must have been about 135kmph - and Lynn flays him back over his head. The shot was on. Andcredit to Lynn for reading the change of pace, for Sharma was on the slower side for all the over but this. 37 off the last 3

Matt Henry to M Pandey, out Caught by Axar!! This is big. What hoodwinked Pandey was the length - full and on leg-stump. Guess he had read the slower ball, for he was waiting with his stance open but the length was such that he couldn't get right under it. So ends up scooping it high in the air. So high that Axar could sprint to his left at deep mid-wicket and station himself into a simple catch. M Pandey c Axar b Matt Henry 18(23) [4s-1]

Matt Henry to Chris Lynn, out Chris Lynn Run Out!! 1 run completed. Korbo - yes. Lorbo - just there. Jeetbo - iffy, now. This is a death blow, or feels like it. Lynn had the room made, swats at a back of a length delivery and hacks it to deep mid-wicket. And then coaxes de Grandhomme into a second. Is running back to the danger end. Axar darts a throw back to Saha; he's having that kinda day. He's having a field. On the bounce to Saha, who takes the bails off and Lynn is just short. Wow. Just the wicket KXIP needed. Chris Lynn run out (Axar/Saha) 84(52) [4s-8 6s-3]

Matt Henry to de Grandhomme, FOUR, slightly slower in the early 130s and de Grandhomme has picked him. Slices it square on the off-side and manages to place it wide of the deep point fielder. 29 off the last two

Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, out Caught by Maxwell!! Chuck the '13 Reasons Why' on Netflix -- here's one reason why Mohit Sharma is so good. Pathan takes on the pacer.. like he would a spinner. And pays the penalty. Pathan uses his feet, goes for the big wind-up but this is a slower ball, needed more biceps. Pathan doesn't have it. Holes out to long-on. Perfection. Auction Mohit's knuckles in the next auction, will you? Y Pathan c Maxwell b Mohit Sharma 2(3)
Mohit Sharma to Woakes, SIX, back of a length delivery, slower again and Woakes is out of his crease, weighed on front foot to whack this out. And he does. Over deep mid-wicket. 22 off 8

Sandeep Sharma to Chris Lynn, FOUR, there's a long on this time but it has gone too straight. Sandeep Sharma once again teases his luck with a fuller ball. Chris Lynn, who was backing away, on-drives this one with a loft. Finds the fence with ease
Mohit Sharma to Narine, FOUR, slower ball but Narine waits, as if he knew what was coming, and drives uppishly over extra cover. Not off the middle but does the job for him

Mohit Sharma to Narine, FOUR, the best we have seen so far? Maybe! Is making room to this length ball, the length is just short of a length and hence decides to play a straight-bat punch. Times it well to beat mid-off to his right

Mohit Sharma to Narine, out Bowled!! Round the wicket slower ball. Narine knows what is coming, waits and decides to swing across the line. Is still early on the shot and misses it completely. The stumps get shattered off this off-cutter. Punjab get a window and the breather they needed desperately. Narine b Mohit Sharma 18(10) [4s-4]
Axar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Axar throws it wide outside off. Chris Lynn keeps his front leg out of the equation and drives to the deep cover fence
Axar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, has to wait a bit as the length is a touch shorter. Cuts and finds the gap past a diving extra cover, another four

Matt Henry to Chris Lynn, FOUR, only with a man of steel-forearms can do it. Short ball outside off, Chris Lynn is committed on the pull but the ball does not quite come with pace. He does not flinch, goes with the pull and fetches it from outside off, almost clears the fence at deep mid-wicket
Matt Henry to Chris Lynn, SIX, and now a full toss to cap off the misery. Swings across the line and sends it over the deep square leg fence. Went high and handsome
Rahul Tewatia to Chris Lynn, 1 run, tossed up ball around off, Chris Lynn drives to deep extra cover to bring up his third IPL fifty

Rahul Tewatia to Gambhir, out Caught by Shaun Marsh!! And he is gone. Wrong 'un does the trick. It is a little bemusing to see why did Gambhir go for the big hit instead of Chris Lynn! The boundaries were not coming for a while now and Gambhir departs trying to up the ante. Slogs and gets the height on it. Not quite the distance he wanted. Marsh settles under it at deep mid-wicket. Gambhir c Shaun Marsh b Rahul Tewatia 8(18)

Rahul Tewatia to Uthappa, out Caught by Axar!! Axar takes a beauty diving to his right at deep mid-wicket. Googly and Uthappa goes with the turn. But this is the first ball he is facing. Not sure what was he thinking. Does not quite time it and hits in the air towards the right of the man in the deep. Axar attacks the ball and dives in time to get his fingers underneath the ball. Uthappa c Axar b Rahul Tewatia 0(1)
U Yadav to Guptill, FOUR, first boundary of the evening. A loose ball down leg, Guptill moves across slightly and nudges it very fine into the fine leg fence
de Grandhomme to Maxwell, SIX, right in the slot. And Maxwell goes into the beast mode. Swings, hard and mighty. Muscles it over long-on
de Grandhomme to Maxwell, SIX, more of the freebies. A sitter up on the hips and Maxwell couldn't be happier in swishing it around the corner. With all the meat in the timing

Rajpoot to Saha, FOUR, the edges too come in. Ah, unfair. Rajpoot bumps it in, gets it at the perfect nagging height and Saha's compulsive pull gets the top edge flying over the keeper. You cannot stop these

Rajpoot to Maxwell, FOUR, piles it on. With the width not enough to force matters in the off-side, Maxwell takes it into the other side of the pitch. Another back of a length this from Rajpoot looking to cramp him up for room and responded with a flat bat this time. Barely bothers to keep it down either, gets it in front of the man looking to cut it off at mid-wicket
Narine to Saha, 1 run, the off-break. A room creating punch down to long-off. Brings up the 50-run between the duo
Narine to Saha, FOUR, too short. Too wide. Further amplified by Saha backing away violently. Waits on the ball to get close and slaps it through the covers

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, SIX, into the clouds. Too good for the multi-pixel cameras to pick this one from the clouds as well. Too short this from Yadav, all the time for Maxwell to rock back, inherit the line and plunder it away. Hacked away to clear the deep mid-wicket fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, SIX, even longer. Maxwell turning it on here. A scarred ball this - flat, dragged down and real quick. Just the pace required to go for another muscling swat into the favoured cow corner region

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, out Caught by Woakes!! The greed. Oh it really is. Brings about his downfall. Tossed up wide, floating googly and inviting Maxwell to take matters into the off-side. And he cannot resist it. Throws his hands out, with a lean and a reach out as he lofts it. Off the toe end and some clean diving at the fence seem to be enough to send him back. Maxwell c Woakes b Kuldeep Yadav 44(25) [4s-1 6s-4]

Kuldeep Yadav to Saha, SIX, gets the slog right. Invites him with an airy googly does Kuldeep and Saha throws everything he has into it. Slices it up, slices it high and slices the projectile long enough to take it over long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Saha, wide, out Stumped!! The teaser. And teases Saha back into the pavilion. Keeps up with his wrong 'uns, drifting them wide and slow. Saha obviously with his show of aggression was down and away once again, just that this time even the stretch out to reach the line of the ball turns futile. Robin takes over. The best extra leaked - ever. Saha st Uthappa b Kuldeep Yadav 38(33) [4s-2 6s-1]

Woakes to Swapnil Singh, out Bowled!! Drags it on. Bends his back does Woakes in bumping it in. And it skids on to stay a touch low for the anticipated lined up pull from Swapnil to come out right. Too high in the end and takes the inside edge to light up the night sky with some red again. Punjab falling apart in search of their catapult at the end. Swapnil Singh b Woakes 2(2)
Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, for some reason switches to a half volley. Tewatia, waits, buries and meets it with a full-blooded lofted drive through extra cover

Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, spots the slower off-cutter. And ensures to dispatch it away. Tries to fox him with the loopy bouncer here does Woakes but a walk across to pull it past the man at short fine does the job
Rajpoot to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, hunts the fence. Much needed this for the Punjabis. Takes it off the pads and brings out the broom as he sweeps it this away
Narine to Vohra, FOUR, doesn't get away this time. Seam up delivery from a shortish length, Vohra punches it handsomely through the covers. Finds the gap and the ball races away
Narine to Vohra, FOUR, cheeky and effective. Uses the slightest of widths outside off and opens his bat face to guide it wide of the keeper into the third man fence
U Yadav to Vohra, FOUR, slower delivery and Vohra takes full toll of it. The attemped leg-break ends up right in the slot for Vohra. The batsman jogs down and heaves it over mid-wicket for a boundary
U Yadav to Vohra, FOUR, wow! Superb shot. Vohra spots the slower delivery well outside off and carves it over point. There is none stopping that

U Yadav to Vohra, out Caught by Uthappa!! Umesh Yadav persists with the short ball stuff and that pays dividends for him. Removes the dangerous Vohra with a 139kph bouncer on leg. Vohra didn't go whole-heartedly against it on his hook shot. He shuffled across a bit and ended up giving a simple catch to Uthappa. It came off the glove. Vohra c Uthappa b U Yadav 25(16) [4s-4]

Narine to Guptill, out Lbw!! A vociferous appeal for lbw and up goes the finger. Guptill isn't happy with the decision. The impact outside off maybe? No. Guptill got low on one knee to play the sweep shot and missed a straight ball. He is struck adjacent to the off-stump. That's crashing onto the stumps. Good call from the umpire. Guptill lbw b Narine 12(16) [4s-1]

de Grandhomme to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, ah! Streaky, Marsh won't mind though. Seam-up delivery on a short of length, probably kept a tad low. Marsh wanted to work it through the on-side and gets an inside edge that eludes the leg pole and dribbles away into the fine leg fence
de Grandhomme to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, that's textbook stuff from Shaun Marsh. Half-volley just outside off, Marsh leans forward and middles the straight-drive. That's Instagrammable

Woakes to Shaun Marsh, out Bowled!! Shaun Marsh is clean bowled. Seam-up delivery from Woakes from a goodish length that snakes in a tad. Marsh doesn't account for it and attempts the drive. The ball sneaks in beating his inside edge and cannons onto the stumps. Shaun Marsh b Woakes 11(10) [4s-2]

D Kulkarni to Samson, FOUR, that's as minimal footwork as you'd get, and the ball has sped to the boundary at the rate of knots. What timing. What a start. Shows you how good a pitch this is as well. Back of a length from Kulkarni, curling away a touch outside off, and Samson just caresses it from the crease through the covers
Sangwan to Samson, FOUR, full again, but too much width on this occasion and Samson roundhouses it to the cover boundary. Just lashed at the ball and got it away through the ring

Sangwan to Samson, out Bowled!! He's played on. Big blow for Delhi up front. Short of length from Sangwan, hits the pitch hard and rushes Samson on the pull. It was there to be put away, the height didn't seem an inconvenience, but I think what unraveled Samson was the skid on the ball. He's late on the shot and under-edges it into the furniture. Middle stump floored. Samson b Sangwan 10(7) [4s-2]

Sangwan to Pant, FOUR, first ball and he's away. We've seen that before from Pant this season. Isn't shy to take the bowler on, even as early as his first ball. Picks length quickly, and swats it through mid-wicket off the front foot. Dismissive

Sangwan to Pant, out Pant Run Out!! Waste, a complete waste. Pant has had a brainfade. He's completely caught up in the LBW call, so much so that he forgets to plonk his bat inside the crease. Excellent comeback from Sangwan, spearing it full on leg, Pant plays across the line and it appears to hit him on the back leg. Maybe an inside edge, maybe going down leg, whatever it is, it isn't out. Meanwhile, Pant is anxious about the decision, wanders out of the crease and Raina capitalizes from slip. Pant run out (Raina) 4(2) [4s-1]

Faulkner to Shreyas Iyer, out Samuels Run Out!! Slower ball from Faulkner, Iyer taps it towards backward point again, a little bit in front of the fielder this time and they decide to go through for the single. Turns out, it's not a good decision after all. The man they are taking on is Ravindra Jadeja, one of the best fielders in this tournament, and if he hits, more often than not his arm will catch you short. Samuels is a yard out. Samuels run out (Jadeja) 1(4)
Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, flat and wide outside off, Iyer waits for it on the back foot and cuts it behind square on the off-side. Runs away to the fence and that brings up his fifty

Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, another risky run. The running between the wickets hasn't been good all through this innings. Iyer taps a length ball straight to cover and calls his partner through for a quick single. Kishan fires in an underarm throw and misses the target at the striker's end. A direct hit would have been curtains for Corey Anderson
Basil Thampi to Corey Anderson, FOUR, that should ease his nerves. Slightest of widths outside off and Anderson opens his bat face at the point of impact and punches it through square on the off-side

Basil Thampi to Corey Anderson, out Corey Anderson Run Out!! Third run out of the innings. Once again it's the rocket from Rajkot. Why do you take a chance against him? He is so good there. Coming to the ball, it was a short of length delivery just outside off, Anderson chops the cut to backward point and wanders out of his crease for a non-existent single. He is sent back by his partner. By the time he turns back and tries to return, Jaddu does the thing he often does. Finding the target direct at the striker's end. Corey Anderson run out (Jadeja) 6(6) [4s-1]

Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Thampi throws it wide outside off, Iyer forces it behind square on the off-side and the ball races away towards the fence. The man in the deep isn't sharp to stop that
Jadeja to Brathwaite, FOUR, wow! Easily done! Brathwaite gets low on one knee and laps it away into the fine leg fence

Jadeja to Brathwaite, FOUR, was there bat involved? The ump thinks so. The premeditated shot fetches Brathwaite a boundary. It was fired outside off, Brathwaite reverses his stance and tries to play the reverse sweep. Probably, there was a bit of wood on it. DK can't stop it and there no one else to stop that from reaching the fence

D Kulkarni to Brathwaite, out Caught&Bowled!! Carlos Brathwaite has been bounced out by the Mumbai seamer. Brathwaite underestimates the pace of Kulkarni and is late to play the pull shot against this back of a length delivery that kept following him. The ball lobs off the outside part of the bat. The bowler calls for it, moves to his left and takes it with ease. Brathwaite c and b D Kulkarni 11(10) [4s-2]

Sangwan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, four to start the over. Iyer backs away, creates room and hammers this length ball from round the wicket through the covers. Thampi, in the deep, dives and makes a mess of it
Sangwan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, four more! Once again, Iyer moves leg-side, opens up the off-side and cuts it fiercely behind square on the off-side
Sangwan to Pat Cummins, FOUR, good shot to open your account. He relied more on power than timing. Clears the front leg and hammers a length ball through extra cover
Sangwan to Pat Cummins, FOUR, wow! DD are still in this game. Sangwan angles it on a length, Cummins moves slightly leg-side and flat-bats it down the ground
D Kulkarni to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, third boundary in a row. Full ball around off, Iyer waits for the ball and carves it between mid-off and extra cover

D Kulkarni to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, make that four! This is excellent batting. A mini shuffle across from Iyer and is helped by a low full toss on middle and leg. Helped away through backward square leg
D Kulkarni to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, and another one! Kulkarni is feeling the heat. Drifts one on the pads of Iyer. Tickled away fine into the fine leg fence

Faulkner to Pat Cummins, SIX, in the air and out she goes! It was an off-pace delivery wide of off at 129kph, Cummins clears his front leg and launches it into the cow corner fence. It came off the sweet spot
