Faulkner to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, highest IPL score for Shreyas Iyer! For a moment, it looked like he would hole out to long-off. Length ball, Iyer walks down the track and lifts it over long-off. It came off the bottom part of the bat, but had enough wings to clear the rope by a long way

Faulkner to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, with mid-off up, you don't bowl full. That's exactly what Faulkner did and got punished. Iyer drills the drive wide of a diving mid-off fielder. 21 off the over and DD need just 23 with three overs to go

Faulkner to Pat Cummins, out Caught by Dwayne Smith!! Cummins departs looking to play the full shot. It was in the slot for Cummins to slog it over long-on. He cleared his front leg, but unfortunately mistimed the tonk. Straight into the bucket hands of Smith at long-on. Pat Cummins c Dwayne Smith b Faulkner 24(13) [4s-2 6s-1]

Faulkner to Shami, FOUR, oh Soni! What have you done? Slower ball, was a full toss as well. Shami backs away and throws the kitchen sink. Manages an outside edge, that goes to the left of short third man. Soni, there, initially went to his right and hence couldn't stop that as it spun away from his dive. That could well be the turning point

Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, leg byes, 2 runs, a direct hit and Iyer would have been a goner. Very full pacy delivery down leg, Iyer misses the flick, strikes his pad and runs towards fine leg. The throw is decent at the striker's end, but there is no one near the stumps. Iyer gets a couple. Raina is animated as he wanted the bowler to be at the stumps. Had Thampi been there, would've had the chance to run Iyer out. Thampi was just standing and watching - poor!

Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, out Bowled!! Gone! This man from Ernakulam is too good at this stage of the innings. Full and tailing in, hint of reverse swing. Iyer walks across in his crease and looks to clip it through the on-side. Gets an inside edge that cannons onto the stumps. Shreyas Iyer b Basil Thampi 96(57) [4s-15 6s-2]

Basil Thampi to Mishra, FOUR, 3 off 3 now! What a shot! Dhoni-esque. Dances down the track and elegantly flicks it through mid-wicket after converting it into a full toss. Wristily played and it raced away off the bat. Jaddu gives up in the deep

Basil Thampi to Mishra, FOUR, Mishra has done it! He was the villain against RCB early in the tournament, not giving strike to Pant. Not today. With seven needed off four balls, he comes in and hits two boundaries. Cheeky shot. Back of the hand slower ball, was a full toss as well. Mishra moved across, waited for a long time and helped it away wide of the keeper. Akshdeep Nath at fine leg, tried his best, but couldn't stop the ball from going past the rope. DD win by 2 wickets

D Kulkarni to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, back of a length just outside off, Iyer pats it to the left of Jadeja at backward point. They go through for a single. Jadeja shies at the stumps and concedes an overthrow. Replays show that Iyer had given up and had Jadeja hit, Iyer would've been gone

D Kulkarni to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, beautifully done. The ball is coming on so well that you need not go hard at it. All timing. Back of a length outside off, Iyer punches it through point with a firm bottom hand
Sangwan to Nair, FOUR, the bat-face opens as Nair tries to loft a drive over mid-off but he's got enough behind it to skew it over the infield. Gets it away into the extra-cover boundary

Sangwan to Nair, 1 run, poor running once again. There's never a run there but both batsmen just decide to go through on instinct and never take a chance to process their decision. Nair steers this back of length ball with impeccable timing but Raina's dive at backward point parries it to the fielder beside him. A direct-hit would have consumed Nair
Sangwan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, pounces on the width and flashes it up and over backward point. Poor delivery. Iyer up and running with a nice couple of boundaries

Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, overpitches and Iyer puts him away. It's a juicy delivery on middle, with Thampi perhaps missing a yorker. Nice roll of the wrists from Iyer to flick it through mid-wicket. The man in the deep is too square
Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Thampi gets too straight and too full again and he's been whipped away. Iyer not missing out on any freebies he gets. Beats short fine leg to his right
Basil Thampi to Nair, SIX, all the way. That's a consequence of going through with his shot. Didn't hold back at all. Fullish around off, Nair has the swinging room he desires and launches into it
Dwayne Smith to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, now here's a surprise. Dwayne Smith bowling in the powerplay. He drops it short and wide first ball and is crashed to the boundary. DD building some good momentum
Dwayne Smith to Nair, FOUR, treating Smith with utter disdain. That's dismissive. Good length ball, Nair muscles it with a lot of bottom hand over mid-on. Nearly carried all the way

Dwayne Smith to Nair, FOUR, he's decided that Smith has to go. Really good tactics from Nair. These are gentle medium pace deliveries and he's backing himself to clear the infield. Goes over mid-on again. One bounce and over
Dwayne Smith to Nair, FOUR, oh shocker. Very short and very wide. With third man up, all Nair has to do is make some connection, especially with him going so hard. Upper-cuts it over short third man
Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, fired in fuller, Iyer prods it away into the point region
Jadeja to Nair, FOUR, goes down low, reverses his stance and scoops the reverse-sweep over short third man. Nair rattling along. 30 off 13 balls now

Faulkner to Nair, out Caught by Dwayne Smith!! Faulkner's done him with lack of pace. Really canny bowling. Cuts his fingers across, the ball holds up on Nair as he tries to loft inside out and ends up slicing it in the air. Smith backpedals at least 10-15 yards from extra-cover, eyes on the ball all the time, and grabs it. Nair c Dwayne Smith b Faulkner 30(15) [4s-5 6s-1]

Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's miscued .. and six. He didn't get that like he wanted at all. A big mow from Iyer, the ball grips and catches him on the outside half of the bat and it goes all the way. Ridiculous. Finch, at long on, is left bemused

Faulkner to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, this is what he was trying to do the previous ball. Gets it spot on this time. Waits on the back of length delivery, allows it to pass him and then taps it just beside the keeper to have it racing into the third man boundary
Faulkner to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, and again. Such a deft touch. Normal pace from Faulkner and Iyer utilizes all of it and steers it cheekily. Karthik dives, third man dives, but to no avail

Zaheer to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, the outfield here is so quick. Cutter on the pads of Dwayne Smith and he tucks it past the square leg umpire. The man behind square on the on-side did not have much to cover, yet the ball beat him to the fence
Shami to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, precision at its best. A normal seam-up delivery around off and Ishan Kishan drives on the up, opens the face of the bat a bit to place it between cover and point

Corey Anderson to Karthik, FOUR, top shot! Short of length, Karthik rides the bounce and punches it beautifully through extra cover, the fielder at mid-off was a touch too straight and had no chance of stopping that

Corey Anderson to Finch, FOUR, not where he intended, but that should relieve some pressure. The cross-seam back of a length delivery delivery, Finch heaves and the inside edge goes behind square on the leg-side, Shami had no chance in the deep

Corey Anderson to Karthik, FOUR, poor delivery and Anderson pays for it. 9 runs off the first three balls. The off-pace delivery is on the pads, Karthik glances it fine and picks up the second boundary of the over

Shami to Karthik, SIX, fabulous shot! Just the extension of the arms and off she went. Good length ball just outside off, Karthik maintains a good base and lofts it straight back over the bowler's head. All the way
Brathwaite to Finch, FOUR, GL picking up the run rate. Six followed by a four. Rubbish from Brathwaite, sprays it down leg, Finch helps it along the way and beats a squarish fine leg

Zaheer to Finch, leg byes, FOUR, appeal for LBW and umpire Anil Chaudhary has got it spot on. Right off the back boot. Low full toss and Finch wanted to sweep it, missed and the ball runs away off the right boot. The ball had pitched outside leg and hence a good decision from the umpire

Zaheer to Finch, SIX, just over a leaping Samson. The famous Zaheer knuckle ball on a shortish length, not sure if Finch spotted it early, went for the pull and the short boundaries helped his cause, over deep square leg for a maximum

Brathwaite to Karthik, out Caught by Corey Anderson!! Wicket right after the break and it is Anderson, who has pulled another terrific catch. Full and on the stumps, bit too full for Karthik to get underneath that, but he still goes through with it and spoons it towards long-on. The ball was dying in front of an onrushing Anderson, but he gets there with a dive. Takes it inches from the ground. The umpires send it upstairs and it is an easy one for the TV ump. Karthik c Corey Anderson b Brathwaite 40(28) [4s-4 6s-1]

Brathwaite to Finch, SIX, fifty for Finch. He's blown hot and cold this season. Still getting used to the new batting position. Almost a similar delivery that got DK out, but Finch was able to get under that and tonk it over the long-on fence

Brathwaite to Jadeja, FOUR, some charity from Brathwaite. A nice juicy full toss outside off for the new batsman, Jadeja had ample time to pick his spot and he slices it behind point, away from the deep point fielder

Brathwaite to Finch, FOUR, now the finesse from the Australian. Had the width to play whatever shot he needed, he chooses to back cut it behind square on the off-side, splitting backward point and short third man to perfection

Pat Cummins to Finch, FOUR, that is straight in Finch's alley. Full and outside off, and he is too good with the inside out shots, stays leg-side of the ball and goes over the fielder, couple of bounces and into the fence

Pat Cummins to Finch, FOUR, wow! What wristwork. He backed away and Cummins follows him, almost cramped for room is Finch, but still manages to whip it wide of long-on. The strong wrists come into play to execute that shot

Shami to Jadeja, FOUR, Shami's turn for some charity work. Second full toss Jadeja has got this innings and he has put that away, heaved wide of mid-wicket, got it high on the bat but more importantly had found the gap

Shami to Finch, out Bowled!! Shami makes a mess of the stumps. The off and middle are uprooted completely. But Finch has done his job. A quickfire 69 has set GL up for a strong finish. This was a full delivery and had Finch not given himself room, he would have been in a position to put it away, not to be and the ball crashed into the stumps after beating the swinging willow. Finch b Shami 69(39) [4s-6 6s-4]
Zaheer to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, shaping in this time. But Zaheer has gone too full, making things easier for Ishan Kishan. Whips it past mid-wicket. Timed it beautifully

Pat Cummins to Faulkner, FOUR, streaky, but GL will take it. It was a good over from Cummins. Full, fast and slanting into the batsman, Faulkner heaves across the line and the inside edge eludes a diving Sanju Samson

Shami to Dwayne Smith, out Dwayne Smith Run Out!! Is Dwayne Smith short there at the bowler's end? Yes he is. He was a sloth there, has to pay in the end. Got hurried on the short ball and mistimed the pull to short fine leg. Ishan Kishan wanted the single and set off. Dwayne Smith reacted late and despite Shami not being in a good position to collect the throw, he could not make it in the end. Did not even attempt the dive there. Might have lost his bat as well. Will confirm soon. Dwayne Smith run out (Mishra/Shami) 8(8) [4s-1]
Shami to Ishan Kishan, SIX, finally he gets one where he wanted. Down the leg-side and full, Ishan Kishan whips over the fine leg fence. Only just clears the fence

Shami to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, that's his area - behind square on the on-side and Shami is playing into his court by bowling it short. Now that Ishan Kishan has got the idea of the pace off the pitch, he is picking them well. Pulled this one over the man at fine leg, who is inside the ring
Zaheer to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, so lucky Ishan Kishan is there. Tries to drive a full ball from off and almost chops it on. The ball misses the stumps and rolls to the fine leg boundary
Pat Cummins to Raina, FOUR, Raina makes room and gets a short ball to his liking. Cuts over cover, a couple of bounces and into the fence

Pat Cummins to Raina, out Bowled!! Raina has been cleaned up. Makes room again but the length is much fuller and laced with pace (146kph). Raina's bat is late to come down on the inside-out drive, loses his stumps. Big wicket in the context of the game. Raina b Pat Cummins 6(5) [4s-1]
Pat Cummins to Karthik, FOUR, races off the bat of Karthik. Did not try to hit that hard. Just timing and made sure that he placed it well. Driven on the up past cover, what a way to get off the mark
Mishra to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, bad ball. Down the leg-side, Ishan Kishan does not have to do much, sweeps it well to the fine leg fence. Was trying a googly there

Mishra to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Zaheer!! One shot too many for Ishan Kishan. Another googly but it has a lot of flight. Ishan Kishan goes for the sweep again and top edges to Zaheer at short fine leg. Mishra has struck soon and once he gets a wicket early in the spell he can be lethal, especially on these kind of tracks. Ishan Kishan c Zaheer b Mishra 34(25) [4s-5 6s-1]
Mishra to Karthik, FOUR, slides down the leg-side. Karthik helps it fine off the inside part of the willow. Races to the fence
Brathwaite to Finch, FOUR, what timing from Finch there. Gets on his toes and accomodates the bounce and angle from Brathwaite, tucks through backward square leg
Mishra to Finch, SIX, touch short and Finch sees it early. Camps back and dispatches it to the deep mid-wicket fence. 89 metre hit this

Mishra to Finch, SIX, and now Mishra flights. Overdoes it and gives some room as well. Finch cracks it over the long-off fence. Mishra's wrist looked as if he attempted the googly but it went away from Finch there
Hardik Pandya to Guptill, FOUR, swing for Hardik, but it's full and way outside off. Guptill leans into the drive and hits it over the man at cover-point, a few bounces and over the ropes

Hardik Pandya to Guptill, FOUR, edged and four, Harbhajan leaped at first slip, might have got a finger-tip on that, but there was no way he was catching it. Guptill came down the track to a floaty outswinger, gets a thick edge as he slapped, the edge just about cleared the leaping first slip fielder
Hardik Pandya to Saha, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Hardik, it was short as well. Saha leans into the free-flowing drive and finds the gap past cover-point, no need to run for those

McClenaghan to Saha, FOUR, nicely played by Saha, hint of width outside off. Saha waits on it, opens the face of the bat and guides it past the slip cordon, no one in the deep and the ball rolls away to the fence

McClenaghan to Saha, FOUR, beautifully played, length delivery on the stumps, Saha gets forward, uses his wrists to good effect and flicks it over mid-on, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes
Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, intentional! Maxwell waits for this seam-up delivery and opens the face of the bat at the last moment to get this one past the keeper to his right, races away

Bumrah to Maxwell, out Bowled!! Look at Bumrah. He is hardly this pumped. Knows he's got the big man. Maxwell makes room, tries to cut, but the ball is not that short. On top of that it's a seam up ball that skids through and uproots the off-stump. Crowd goes mental. Little window that Mumbai needed, have they got that? We shall see. Maxwell b Bumrah 47(21) [4s-2 6s-5]
Harbhajan to Saha, SIX, 'what a way to bring up the fifty,' shouts D Morrison on air. Saha skips down and lofts Harbhajan with the turn over long-on for a maximum

Harbhajan to Saha, FOUR, Saha is deceived for a while, in the flight. But does well to go with the shot and hits it well enough to beat the dive from long-off to his right. Eventually timed it really well
Harbhajan to Shaun Marsh, SIX, Shaun Marsh skips a bit, dos not need to dance down. Gets a fullish ball and goes with the swing to dispatch it over the long-on fence. Big hit this one
Malinga to Saha, SIX, Saha is justifying the move to send him up the order. How quickly did he read the slower ball from Malinga and lofted it over long-off. Goes the distance
McClenaghan to Shaun Marsh, 2 runs, full toss but Shaun Marsh, in his bid to go too hard on the shot, mistimes it towards long-on. Is still wide of the fielder and fetches him a couple

McClenaghan to Shaun Marsh, no ball, SIX, these cute Aussie-Kiwi battles. McClenaghan oversteps and then bowls a slower ball, which gets read by Shaun Marsh. Clears the front leg and sends it soaring over the deep mid-wicket fence

McClenaghan to Shaun Marsh, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! A bowler always has the last laugh. One of those things. Shaun Marsh is gone. McClenaghan gets him, not sure how big that one will be. But at least it's a dot ball and a wicket. Another off-pace ball that is going across Shaun Marsh. He tries the cross-batted swing, slices it in the air. Parthiv Patel runs forward towards his left. Has to stretch a bit to snaffle this one. Shaun Marsh c Parthiv Patel b McClenaghan 25(16) [6s-2]
McClenaghan to Saha, FOUR, slower balls lose their venom when banged in short. Like this time. Saha has all the time in the world, waits and pulls to the left of the man at deep square leg
Bumrah to Saha, FOUR, such awareness from Saha, sees the mid-off is inside the ring, makes room and lofts over him so nonchalantly. A couple of bounces and into the fence
Hardik Pandya to Saha, SIX, full toss. Saha loves that. Clears the front leg and muscles it over the deep square leg fence

McClenaghan to Saha, no ball, FOUR, lovely shot from Saha, he's looking in good touch already. A no-ball as well as McClenaghan flicked the bails during his delivery stride. Turns out to be a low full-toss, Saha presents a straight bat and punches it back past the non-striker
Hardik Pandya to Axar, SIX, full toss in Axar's arc and out of the park. Takes his right leg out of the line and sends it over the long-on fence

Malinga to Guptill, no ball, SIX, that's a big bonus for KXIP, it's a maximum and it's a big no-ball as well. On a good length and just outside off, Guptill takes a step forward and carves it high and over cover, went a long way into the stand

Malinga to Saha, FOUR, expensive start from Malinga, it was the slower ball, but it gave Saha plenty of time to spot it. He makes room and carves it inside out over cover, a couple of bounces and over the ropes

Malinga to Saha, FOUR, this is turning out to be a very expensive over from Malinga, short and on the stumps, Saha swivels across and pulls it behind square on the on-side, back-to-back boundaries for Saha
Bumrah to Guptill, FOUR, drilled, Bumrah kept it full and on the stumps, Guptill backs away, makes room and drives it through the gap at extra-cover, no need to run for those
Karn Sharma to Guptill, FOUR, tossed up on the stumps, Guptill was setting himself up for the big slog sweep, gets a thick inside edge and beats the fielder at square leg, rolls away to the fence
Karn Sharma to Guptill, FOUR, lovely, tossed up nicely by Karn, right in the zone for Guptill, he clears his left leg and drills it back over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the ropes

Karn Sharma to Guptill, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Guptill gets greedy and throws his wicket away! Lovely ball from Karn, slowed down the pace on this leg-break, Guptill was setting himself up for the slog sweep, gets a fat top-edge, high and towards long-on. Hardik kept back-pedalling, didn't lose sight over the ball and completes a fine two-handed overhead catch. Much needed wicket for MI, the two openers were threatening to take this game away. Guptill c Hardik Pandya b Karn Sharma 36(18) [4s-5 6s-1]

McClenaghan to Saha, FOUR, cheeky and four, leg-stump half-volley from McClenaghan, Saha bends down low, uses McClenaghan's pace and laps it past the keeper, no need to run for those with fine-leg inside the ring

McClenaghan to Maxwell, FOUR, nicely played by Maxwell, back of a length and on the stumps, he waits on it, opens the face of the bat and runs it past the keeper. The pace of McClenaghan does the rest

McClenaghan to Saha, FOUR, this is excellent batting from Saha, McClenaghan went short and wide of off as Saha backed away, he waits on it, uses the pace of the bowler and taps it on its head, splits the gap between backward point and short third man to perfection
Karn Sharma to Maxwell, SIX, lovely shot, tossed up invitingly by Karn, Maxwell gets a big stride forward and lifts it through the line, long-on is just a spectator

Karn Sharma to Maxwell, SIX, Maxwell is in a beastly mood tonight, lovely leg-break from Karn, slower and wider outside off, nearly did Maxwell in with the length. He had to lean forward, goes inside out and carves it over extra-cover, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum
Harbhajan to Maxwell, SIX, Harbhajan is greeted with a maximum, dropped it short and on the stumps, Maxwell rocks back and pulls it over square leg, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum

Harbhajan to Maxwell, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Maxwell, pushed through flatter and just outside off, Maxwell gets forward and thumps it flat and hard over mid-wicket, went sailing over the ropes for another maximum
Harbhajan to Maxwell, SIX, third six of the over, this was tossed up wider of off, Maxwell gets forward and thumps it high and way over long-on for a maximum
Sandeep Sharma to Simmons, FOUR, and Mumbai take off with Punjab's momentum. Gets a delivery nipping onto the pads and tickles it away fine enough to go all the way

Matt Henry to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, pouncing on the pace. Pouncing on the bounce. 142kays of it and Parthiv throws everything at it as he hacks it. And even a mistime is enough on this carpet to race it away into the fence - the mid-wicket one
Matt Henry to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, more of the pace offered. This time Parthiv forces it through the line. 142kays again and a front footed smear through the covers. Ah, elegance all over it

Matt Henry to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, make that three. Parthiv on a carnage. Pitched up further, more of the width and an invite to get back to the business of dispatching these away. Done with another full flowing cover drive

Ishant to Nitish Rana, FOUR, time for cliches, "Fortune favours the brave" chirps Laxman Sivaramakrishnan on air. Also, french cricket from Rana, goes for the almighty pull, the ball shapes in a touch, takes the inside edge and beats a diving Saha, who sprawled to his right. Runs away to the fence in a jiffy

Ishant to Rohit, 3 runs, Comedy. Chaos. Everything happening out there. Rohit tucks it away towards mid-wicket and sets off for a second run. The fielder quickly gets to the ball, collects it and fires a throw at the non striker's end. There was an opportunity for a run-out had Ishant taken it cleanly. He fumbles and Rana gets back in. They also sneak in an extra run as there was no proper backing up

Rahul Tewatia to Rohit, out Caught by Guptill!! Punjab are fighting back into this contest. A big, big wicket in the context of the game. Hold on! They are checking for a possible no-ball but he's fine and Rohit has to continue the long walk back to the pavilion. The Mumbai skipper's destiny doesn't last long. Totally fails to connect this flatter delivery and ended up hitting it straight to Guptill at long-on. Too easy for him and he ain't dropping those. Stunned silence in the crowd. Rohit c Guptill b Rahul Tewatia 5(7)

Axar to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Guptill!! Gone! Another one bites the dust. Rana hasn't been in the best of touch lately and he departs cheaply today. Axar pushed it through quicker, perhaps Rana was hustled for pace. Went back and looked to clear deep mid-wicket but messes up with his timing. Skies it straight to Guptill near the rope and he gobbles it up nicely. Nitish Rana c Guptill b Axar 12(12) [4s-2]
Rahul Tewatia to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Pandya doesn't bother wasting any time. Sees a tossed up delivery in his arc, flexes his muscle and tonks it straight over the bowler's head
Rahul Tewatia to Pollard, SIX, Pollard joins into the act. Tewatia drifted it wide of off but Pollard managed to reach with his long levers and launches it straight down the ground

Axar to Hardik Pandya, SIX, spoils the over by conceding a six off the last ball. Lands it full in the arc for Pandya, he clears his front leg and smacks it over long-on. The fielder seemed in business for a while but it sailed over his head for a maximum

Matt Henry to Pollard, SIX, this has gone some 10 rows back. Such is his power. Full and just outside off, Pollard stands motionless and wallops it over long-on. Not off the middle but still soars over the ropes
Matt Henry to Pollard, SIX, two in a row. Henry goes short, Pollard is upto it in a flash. Spindles back and pulls it behind square. Goes all the way for a maximum

Matt Henry to Hardik Pandya, SIX, a behemoth, gosh. Third six off the over. Henry bowls it full and outside off, Pandya bends his knee and lofts it handsomely over extra cover. All grace, elegance and class. Go watch a smooth wave caress the shore, this is that
Matt Henry to Hardik Pandya, SIX, shambles, follows up with a full toss, Pandya ain't sparing those. Gets under it and murders it over long-on

Sandeep Sharma to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Saha!! Has that been taken? It has. Up goes the umpire's finger. End of Pandya's cameo. Again bowled it full and outside off, Pandya threw his bat at it, gets an outside edge and flew to Saha. He flung to his right and pulled off a blinder. Is this the spark that can lighten Punjab back into this game? Hardik Pandya c Saha b Sandeep Sharma 30(13) [6s-4]

Sandeep Sharma to Pollard, FOUR, it's a summer sale. Pollard is making a joke of these boundaries. Sandeep misses his yorker, serves it up on a fuller length, Pollard brings his bottom hand into effect, dumps it straight down the ground
Sandeep Sharma to Pollard, SIX, what a shot. If you miss your length, Pollard will make you pay. Full and zooming on the stumps, Pollard gets underneath it and blasts it over long-on

Sandeep Sharma to Karn Sharma, FOUR, another massive over for Mumbai. Again, Sandeep offers a full toss, Karn frees his shoulders and clouts it wide of long-on, Maxi runs to his left and tries to keep the ball back in play but in vain

Mohit Sharma to Karn Sharma, SIX, what a clanger. Maxwell, what have you done? Knuckle ball from Mohit, on a fuller length outside off, Karn tonks it straight down the ground, Maxwell prances to his left from long-off, gets both hands but palms it over the ropes. Clumsy!
Mohit Sharma to Karn Sharma, FOUR, this match ain't over folks. To rub salt into the wounds and other jazz. Mohit goes wider of off, Karn protracts his hands and lifts it over cover-point
Mohit Sharma to Karn Sharma, FOUR, this is getting better and better for Mumbai. Full toss and outside off, Karn throws the kitchen sink and gets an outside edge that runs past short third man

Mohit Sharma to Karn Sharma, out Bowled!! Bowled him. Just when Mumbai keep belting boundaries, Punjab manage to strike back with plucking wickets. Let's call it a nomenclature, Mohit's back-of-the-hand slower ball, aiming at the stumps. Karn swung at it wildy, misses and is castled. Mohit roars in joy. Karn Sharma b Mohit Sharma 19(6) [4s-3 6s-1]
Mohit Sharma to Pollard, SIX, wow. Pollard is still keeping Mumbai in the hunt. Pivots back and swats this short ball over deep mid-wicket

Ishant to Simmons, FOUR, oh my. That's a punch, a ramp and an upper cut all in one. Ishant looks to climb onto his neck. A typical Caribbean back footed stride and an open batted punch to race it through the cordon
Mohit Sharma to Pollard, 1 run, Mohit seals the deal for his team. Punjab win by 7 runs. Again, fires it in the blockhole, Pollard just about gets his bat down and digs it out

Sandeep Sharma to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, has switched to the yorkers. Bang on the sticks. A dance away and down in the same motion to half-drill, half-squeeze it down to mid-off. A direct hit and you never know. Because there isn't one
Sandeep Sharma to Simmons, FOUR, a wasted line. Ruins what was well on the course of turning out to be a top over. Down leg and helped along getting it past the man at short fine

Ishant to Simmons, FOUR, all timing. And glory. Nicely pitched up, very friendly. The reply isn't am afraid. A perfect approach to the pitch of the delivery and a smear to time the pants off it. Through the covers
Ishant to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, okay now a few runs for the luck brigade. Nicely snaking up and a desperate/compulsive pull takes the top edge and flies in no man's land. Over the keeper's head

Ishant to Simmons, FOUR, pile on the misery. Ishant slips, tumbles, falls down and then gets up to see the ball hitting the fence. A slip onto the hips and nurdled away fine enough. Mumbai well on course
Mohit Sharma to Simmons, SIX, another Sharma. Another dispatch. Right in the slot. A shimmy across from Simmons to top it up with a full-blooded tonk. Several rows into the long-on stands
Mohit Sharma to Simmons, SIX, he's toying around here. The mind-reader reads the slower one and the fullish length on the stumps. Deals with a backing away and a sinking lofted power over the covers

Axar to Simmons, 1 run, the time-out almost brings a wicket with it. Smashed down, doesn't bother keeping it down and pops in and out the man at long-off lined up. Ah the dew. And the drop. Mohit Sharma the man

Axar to Simmons, SIX, there are some ways to bring up a half-century and there is this way. A gallop down the track, right forward and swings his bat massively to deposit this well into the stands down the ground. His #11 I'm told
Axar to Simmons, SIX, and he celebrates with some more. More of the charges down, more of the swings through the line. The zone of having fun here
Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, oh the cheek. The deft. Attempts the scoop and nails it. Off the middle of the blade, nothing streaky about this one as he guides it past the keeper

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, now conventional. But keeps thudding the fence. Forces it full, forces it wide and amplified further with Parthiv backing away and smacking the drice off a knee. Sliced over a leaping Ishant at short third

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, short. Down leg. But Parthiv refuses to relent. Keeps the dancing shoes on. Gets inside the line and pulls it away past the lurking short fine. This is murder. Call 100

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Vohra!! That's the end of the fun. Continues moving away, but for a change Mohit learns his bit following him with a pacy length stuff. Gets too big on him as he tries powering it away once again with a loft. Miscues it all ends up and the balloon in the air is taken. Finally. At cover. Something's arrested. Parthiv Patel c Vohra b Mohit Sharma 38(23) [4s-7]

Mohit Sharma to Nitish Rana, FOUR, a new man, the same old line down leg and the same old response. Doesn't matter that it is only the first ball he's facing. Whips it away with enough chunk of wood on it to take it behind square

Maxwell to Simmons, out Caught by Guptill!! A bird, a plane. Oh no. That's Martin Guptill. What in every world could only have been a smoke down the ground with Simmons in his mood dancing and tonking sucked out by the only man who could have taken this. And he does it with a jump, a one-handed raise and taking it as cleanly as it could. Forget the boundary run-ins and throw outs. This is sheer timing. Simmons c Guptill b Maxwell 59(32) [4s-5 6s-4]

Unadkat to Nair, out Samson Run Out!! Poor running. Absolutely poor. Nair steers it to the left of backward point. The ball goes at a good bounce for Stokes to pick it up and hit the stumps direct. Sanju Samson was nowhere in the frame and Ananthapadmanabhan has his finger up. Sanju Samson walks back disappointed and an end of a good first over. Samson run out (Stokes) 2(4)

SN Thakur to Samuels, SIX, top-edge and six, too predictable from Shardul, banged in short and well outside off, Samuels was swiveling across on the pull - was in no control, the top-edge went high and behind square on the on-side, just has enough to clear Unadkat at deep backward square leg

SN Thakur to Samuels, SIX, cracking shot, much better from Samuels, length delivery from Shardul, Samuels backs away, opens up his arms and lofts it high and into the sight-screen. DD are off and running once again

Christian to Samuels, FOUR, lovely shot, width on offer from Christian, Samuels backs away and slaps it square on the off-side. Tripathi got across to his left from deep point, puts in the slide and drags the ball back in - but the ball slowly rolls back onto the ropes

Christian to Samuels, out Caught by Dhoni!! 101st dismissal for MS and he took it as cool as a cucumber. He's still one of the best keepers in the game - and this catch shows why. This was another slower short ball from Christian, Samuels made room outside leg and was looking to flay it through mid-wicket, played the shot a tad too early, got a fat top-edge. For a moment he seemed to be safe, but there was that man. MS ran backwards, kept his eyes on the ball, timed his leap well and completed a one-handed catch - with his right glove. Christian clenches his fists in delight - as much as a keeper's wicket as it was for the bowler there. Samuels c Dhoni b Christian 27(21) [4s-1 6s-2]

Washington Sundar to Corey Anderson, out Stumped!! Dhoni is confident about a stumping. When he's confident, it means he's got his man. Looks like Anderson's foot is in the air, he did well to drag back in, but couldn't get his feet down. OUT is the call. Excellent work from MS, quick hands did the trick, but that was very well bowled by Sundar as well. He slowed down the pace, dragged Anderson forward on the drive and did him in with the turn. Anderson was a long way out of the crease, he did try to drag his foot back in - but comes second best to the Indian keeper. Corey Anderson st Dhoni b Washington Sundar 3(5)
Washington Sundar to Nair, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, nudged away behind square on the on-side, raises his 8th IPL fifty, his first this season

Stokes to Pat Cummins, 2 runs, a direct hit and even Cummins' dive wouldn't have saved him. MS let the ball go and Cummins was sprawling all over the place. Coming to the ball, on a good length and just outside off, eased away backward of square on the off-side
Stokes to Pat Cummins, SIX, much needed for the Daredevils, length ball on offer from Stokes, Cummins backs away and clubs it over mid-wicket, went sailing over the ropes at mid-wicket for a maximum

Stokes to Pat Cummins, out Bowled!! That's a terrific comeback from the England star all-rounder, he slips in the leg-stump yorker - bowled at pace as well. Cummins was making room for the shot, has to jam his bat down - too late and the leg-pole goes for a walk, first wicket of the night for Stokes and Pune continue to chip away. Pat Cummins b Stokes 11(6) [6s-1]

Unadkat to Nair, FOUR, lovely shot, width on offer from Unadkat, Karun arches back, waits on the ball and cuts it late - gets it into the gap behind point and beats the fielder getting across to his left from deep point

Unadkat to Mishra, SIX, cracking shot, back of a length and just outside off, Mishra was prodding forward, uses the bottom hand and smashes it high and over long-off, has enough to clear the ropes on the full

Unadkat to Nair, FOUR, expensive over from Unadkat, topo short and at his pace it's easy pickings for the batsman. Karun waits on it and pulls it in front of square on the on-side. Long-on has no chance of cutting it off

Stokes to Nair, out Caught by Unadkat!! Excellent catch from Unadkat - he seemed to have lost it under the lights, puts in the full-stretch dive and just about holds on. Second wicket for Stokes and Pune are finishing strong. It was a length ball from Stokes, Nair backed away on the heave, ended up getting a fat top-edge that spiralled in the air and behind Dhoni. Unadkat ran across to his left from short third man, called for the catch, seemed to have misjudged it - but held on with a dive. Nair c Unadkat b Stokes 64(45) [4s-9]

Unadkat to Shami, 2 runs, that's a chance and Sundar has dropped it, very similar to that of Unadkat's catch, this was another top-edge that went high and behind the keeper. Sundar ran across, got to the ball, seemed to have slipped at the last moment and drops it

Unadkat to Shami, out Caught by Stokes!! That's a superb catch from Stokes - he hasn't just saved a six, but he has got Unadkat a wicket as well. Watches the ball all the way at the deep mid-wicket boundary, lunges behind, holds onto the overhead catch - realises that he was going over the ropes, chucks the ball back into play, crosses the ropes, comes back in and takes the catch. Coming to the ball, it was a length delivery on the stumps, Shami backed away and swung hard - looked like he had got plenty behind it - only for Stokes to spoil his party. Shami c Stokes b Unadkat 2(4)

Unadkat to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Dhoni!! Second wicket goes down and Delhi are in trouble early on. Poor shot selection from Shreyas Iyer. Flashes away from the body with no feet movement to a back of a length delivery outside off and gets a thick outside edge through to Dhoni, who won't drop those. Unadkat has his hands up in joy. Shreyas Iyer c Dhoni b Unadkat 3(4)
Washington Sundar to Nair, FOUR, this is excellent improvisation from Nair. Gets well outside the line and sweeps it over short fine leg for a boundary

Washington Sundar to Nair, FOUR, good batting that from Nair. His eyes lit up for the tossed up delivery outside off and a perfect execution of the slog sweep. Finds the cow corner fence on the bounce

Washington Sundar to Pant, SIX, phew! That's been nailed for six. Short delivery from round the wicket. Pant rocks on the back foot quicker and dispatches it with a pull over deep square leg fence. Pure power that from Pant
Stokes to Nair, FOUR, Nair showing his class now. Sees the width outside off and helps it wide of short third man. With the field inside the circle on the off-side, this shot was always on the cards

Stokes to Nair, FOUR, Nair is in the zone today. He is seeing the ball well and has the awareness of the field. Makes room to this short delivery and pulls it well over the infield. The ball bounces just once before crashing into the ad boards

Stokes to Nair, FOUR, Stokes tries to attack the pads of Nair. He backs away and chips it over mid-wicket. Fielder from deep square leg tries to get across, but fails to stop the ball from rolling over
SN Thakur to Pant, FOUR, Pant gets into the act now. Full and straight, Pant goes through the line and drills it straight down the ground. Smith had no chance of stopping that at mid-on
SN Thakur to Pant, FOUR, nicely done. Thakur slips one down the leg. Pant goes low and helps it down to fine leg. Fine leg was inside the circle and the ball raced away to the fence in no time

SN Thakur to Pant, FOUR, Thakur is struggling with his line. Left-right combination is making it much difficult for him to stick to one line. Now he slips onw down the legs of Pant, who helps it down to fine leg with a flick

Zampa to Nair, FOUR, 50-run stand comes up for the duo with a top shot from Nair. Wasn't all that short, Nair quickly jumps on the back foot and cuts it square of the wicket. The fielder in the deep was too square and had no chance of stopping that

Christian to Nair, FOUR, exactly what he could have done with the third ball this over. Short and wide again, Nair gets his back foot across and slaps it past backward point. The ball rockets to the fence
Zampa to Pant, FOUR, rank long hop from Zampa. Gets what it deserves. Pant rocks on the back foot and pulls it hard along the ground. Splits deep backward square leg and deep mid-wicket to perfection
Zampa to Pant, SIX, wrong 'un from Zampa and how well did Pant read that. Goes on his knee and slog sweeps it to send it deep into the mid-wicket stands. That's a huge hit

Zampa to Pant, out Caught by Christian!! Pant tries it again and loses his wicket. He will be disappointed with that after being batting so well for his 36. Tries to get under the ball and slog sweep. Wasn't to be. The ball came right of the toe end for Christian to settle under it wide of long-on. Pant c Christian b Zampa 36(22) [4s-4 6s-2]

Zaheer to Rahane, out Bowled!! What a ball. Cleans up Rahane. Has this man retired, Zaheer? Wowed I am. Pitches up and swings it in to find the gap between Rahane's pad and bat. For all that peach from Zaheer, Rahane too is slightly responsible there. Went for the drive and pushed the defence a bit, leaving the space for the ball to sneak in. What a start for DD! Rahane b Zaheer 0(1)
Zaheer to Smith, FOUR, this one does not swing. And hence there is no exaggerated shuffle from Smith. Stands his ground and flays the drive through cover. Races away
Zaheer to Tripathi, FOUR, Tripathi shows how to tackle the inswinger from Zaheer. Steps down and clips with the swing to bisect the field between mid-on and mid-wicket

Shami to Smith, FOUR, slower ball. Smith does not bother getting closer to the ball. All hands from him as he drives through extra cover. Zaheer has his hands on Shami's shoulder. Must be some words of wisdom

Pat Cummins to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, another iffy slog which results in a miscue, but Tiwary gets enough on it this time to drag the ball over wide mid-on and into the boundary. That's precisely why he was targeting this shot. Mid-on is inside the ring, and with a little bit of fortune, he's able to muscle it over him

Mishra to Stokes, FOUR, that's brilliantly bowled, and Mishra is so unlucky here. Having not given anything by way of flight all through the over, he tosses up a googly and dangles it wide of off to reap the pay-off for his pressure. Stokes bites, has an almighty swish at it but he is trying to drag the ball into the on-side against the turn, a ball which is very wide in the first place. The edge is found but it zooms over the man at slip

Pat Cummins to Stokes, FOUR, hoho, fierce! Absolutely fierce from Stokes. He's just showed Cummins who's the boss. He gives charge, and accordingly Cummins bangs it in short. But Stokes isn't backing down. He thumps the ball wide of long-on into the boundary

Samuels to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, that could have been a sensational catch, but Samson cannot cling on! Samuels begins with a half-tracker which should have been deposited in the stands, but Tiwary doesn't go through with the pull. He checks his shot, might have stopped on him. It travels low and quick in front of Samson at deep mid-wicket. He runs in full throttle, dives forward nearly plucks it off

Samuels to Stokes, SIX, he's starting to turn it on now. That's not in the slot, let me tell you. And he hasn't used his feet either. Just plants the front foot down with authority and swings through the line over long-on. Brutal batting

Samuels to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, smart from Tiwary. Samuels generally bowls it quicker through the air, so Tiwary smartly stoops across on the back knee, uses the pace and paddles it round the corner. His placement is spot on, splitting the dives from short fine and long leg

Zaheer to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, dropped by Nair! Oh dear. This, right here, could be game defining, considering how this partnership is starting to flourish. Tiwary wants to take on a cutter from Zaheer, but the wily old veteran has angled it so wide that Tiwary has to really reach out. The cut on the ball catches a thick top-edge and lobs up to the right of point. Nair never really looked settled under the ball, was still on the move as it came down and makes a mess of it
Shami to Stokes, SIX, he has flogged it off his pads for a six over mid-wicket. All muscle from Stokes. I don't think he's got that in the middle at all, but it still clears the boundary comfortably

Shami to Stokes, out Caught by Corey Anderson!! Shami misses the blockhole and delivers a full toss, Stokes advances and converts it into a slightly higher full toss than he would have liked. It takes him by surprise a bit. He swings hard, it hits him high on the bat and he ends up slicing it straight down to long-off. Had he stayed his ground, would have been a much simpler ball to hit. Stokes c Corey Anderson b Shami 33(25) [4s-3 6s-2]

Pat Cummins to Dhoni, out Dhoni Run Out!! That's a very, very rare occurence. MS Dhoni caught napping is not something which happens very often. It doesn't happen at all. The slower ball deflects off Dhoni's thigh towards short fine leg, and Dhoni is just ambling across not expecting Shami to go at his end. Once Dhoni realizes the danger, he motors through and even puts in a dive, but he's caught short by a few inches or so as Shami rockets the stumps down. Big wicket. Dhoni run out (Shami) 5(5)

Shami to Christian, out Lbw!! Christian looks surprised by the decision, but that's absolutely dead in front. That's crashing into the middle of middle. Full and straight from Shami, Christian tries to lap it fine but misses and the ball crashes into his pad. Gone! Christian lbw b Shami 3(3)

Pat Cummins to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, they needed that. They definitely needed that. A nothing ball from Cummins, gaining no height on the short of length delivery. It sits up for Tiwary and he pulls it away into the stands backward of square

Pat Cummins to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, oh boy, do we have something special on tonight?! Back to back sixes. This one is a sizzler over extra-cover. Another poor delivery from Cummins, bowling it full in the slot around off. Tiwary clears his front leg and smokes a stunning drive inside out

Pat Cummins to Manoj Tiwary, leg byes, FOUR, away to the boundary, but that's not enough. What irony. The one ball which Cummins has nailed into the blockhole has gone to the ropes. Tiwary is beaten by it, the ball hits his boot, misses leg-stump by a whisker and leaves the keeper wrong-footed. But it's game over with eight needed off one

Pat Cummins to Manoj Tiwary, out Bowled!! That's it. Bang into middle stump. Cummins seals it and can afford a smile. Those two sixes cranked up the pressure but the young Aussie recovered well. Manoj Tiwary b Pat Cummins 60(45) [4s-5 6s-3]

Zaheer to Smith, 1 run, we will have to wait to ascertain what happened there? Shreyas Iyer has done a commendable job to save a six. Could not control the momentum and threw the ball away, else he could have come back to catch that one - like Stokes did earlier in the day. Short ball and Smith pulls off the back foot. Looks good to clear the fence but Iyer runs to his right from deep square leg, leaps and parries it back into play
Nadeem to Smith, FOUR, steps down and almost loses the balance but does well to slap it past point. How often does he do he something like that? Pretty often
Nadeem to Smith, SIX, tossed up ball and Smith makes full use of that. Skips down and goes with the loft. Never intended to hit that hard, clears the long-off fence with ease
Nadeem to Smith, FOUR, and now Nadeem drops it short. Smith uses the depth of the crease and cuts past point

Zaheer to Tripathi, out Caught by Pant!! Loud appeal for caught behind from the keeper, given. Zaheer did not look interested at first but joined later seeing the men from behind yell their throats out. Was a back of a length delivery that went across Tripathi, who wanted to cut closer to his body. Top edges to the keeper. Tripathi c Pant b Zaheer 7(6) [4s-1]
Shami to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, what a shot. Lets the ball shape away and then goes back to punch through cover. Found the gap with ease
Shami to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, just a little push but the sound it made was a proof of superb timing. Manoj Tiwary got on the front foot and then beat the man at cover

Mishra to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, too much risk involved for a single. Oh, wait. Shami at fine leg has made sure that Manoj Tiwary is rewarded well for the risk, Tiwary had taken his front foot long way across to fetch the sweep from off and middle. Was lucky to have connected
Mishra to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, against the turn and run of play. Leg-spinner and Manoj Tiwary steps down, keeps himself away from the pitch of the ball, swings hard and sends it over cow corner

Nadeem to Smith, out Lbw!! Smith is dejected. Cannot believe his luck. Was there some edge? It definitely hit him high on leg there. But he was on the back foot having missed this skidder from Nadeem, who pumps his fist as soon as the umpire acknowledges the lbw appeal. What a wicket. Was there a time-out before this ball? Never mind. Smith lbw b Nadeem 38(32) [4s-4 6s-1]
Nadeem to Stokes, FOUR, fuller ball on the legs of Stokes, who gets the toe-edge while trying to flick. The ball races to the third man fence
Bhuvneshwar to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, first four of the innings. Beats the five men on the off-side with a cracking cut. The width was there and he pounced on that beating a diving cover-point

Bhuvneshwar to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, the slip was there for Ishan Kishan's first ball. But he was taken off for this one and guess what the ball goes right through that gaping hole. Good delivery from Bhuvneshwar, hitting a length and getting bounce, the edge was found but there was no-one to catch and it runs away to the third man fence

Siraj to Ishan Kishan, SIX, picks the slower delivery and deposits the pull over the deep backward square leg fielder. Not that short, but with a half-swivel Ishan Kishan pulled that meatily and got himself a biggie
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, 1 run, 50 for Dwayne Smith now. Cracked through cover
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, mowed from outside off and beats long-on to his right. Knelt down and hit it, not with great timing but good enough to get it in the gap and four more

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, out Lbw!! Gone. The Nelson has struck. A fast skidding delivery that rushes past Dwayne Smith's pull and strikes him bang in front of middle. Too quick for Smith's shot. Easy decision for the umpire. Dwayne Smith lbw b Rashid Khan 54(33) [4s-7 6s-2]

Bhuvneshwar to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, very sloppy from Dhawan. Attacked the ball in trying to prevent the second and gives away two more. Thrashed to him and in running to his left from sweeper, he lets it go through his hands. A slight bobble before the ball came to him, but still should've been stopped

Siraj to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Two down. The slower delivery and Ishan Kishan can only slog it high up in the air, a fat top edge, Naman Ojha calls for it and takes it with ease. Ishan Kishan c Naman Ojha b Siraj 61(40) [4s-5 6s-4]

Siraj to Raina, out Caught by Dhawan!! What a wicket that is. Two in the over for Siraj. A game-changing over? Will only know once the match is done. But certainly SRH now get a chance to come back into the game. Wasn't a great delivery, off-pace and down leg, but Raina found Dhawan at deep backward square. After taking the catch, he puts a finger to his lip and points to the crowd suggesting to keep quiet. Typical Dhawan. Raina c Dhawan b Siraj 2(5)

Rashid Khan to Karthik, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Wow. Wow. Three wickets in quick time and suddenly the score isn't looking that great. High full toss, was meant to be hit for six but Karthik mistimed that and looked like it was falling in front of the fielder, but Hooda came in and snaffled that low and diving forward. Rashid Khan can't contain his smile. Can't believe his luck either. DK just puts his head down in disappointment, unable to believe the shot he played. Karthik c Deepak Hooda b Rashid Khan 0(1)

Rashid Khan to Finch, out Bowled!! Atrocious batting from Finch. Utterly and truly hopeless. His side have lost three wickets inside two overs and him being so experienced, is expected to bat till the 20th over. But what does he do? Swings across the line, without picking the googly. Past his shot and into the stumps. Rashid Khan goes off on his trademark celebration. Some collapse this is. Finch b Rashid Khan 2(3)
Rashid Khan to Jadeja, FOUR, smashed. Too full and Jadeja used his levers to bullet it past the umpire. Who did well to get out of the way
Siraj to Faulkner, FOUR, low full toss and sliding down, helped past backward square leg. Easy delivery to get and Faulkner doesn't miss out

Siraj to Faulkner, out Bowled!! Cleaned up. Full and straight, with a late tail back in. Faulkner swings to leg and can't connect. The ball clips the leg stump and Siraj punches the air in delight. Faulkner b Siraj 8(10) [4s-1]

Siraj to Sangwan, out Bowled!! Two in two. Before this ball, Siraj was talking to Bhuvi as he set the field. Whatever he spoke, he executed to perfection. Inswinger, lands on a length and goes through the bat and pad gap of Sangwan. Too big a gap and the ball finds its way through to the stumps. Siraj ends with a four-fer. What a story he has been this IPL. The whole of Old City in Hyderabad will be tucking into their biriyanis watching this. Certainly made his folks proud. Sangwan b Siraj 0(1)

Bhuvneshwar to Jadeja, FOUR, awkwardly for Warner and he can't stop it. A high full toss, swung away by Jadeja, bounces just in front of his body and he can't even get a hand on that. Slips away from his grasp

S Kaul to Ankit Soni, out Bowled!! Brilliant yorker from Kaul. Late swing back in, Ankit Soni tried to squeeze it out, but the ball escaped past the bat, may have even kissed it, not too sure about that and then hit the off stump. Too good for a tailender. Ankit Soni b S Kaul 0(6)

Bhuvneshwar to P Kumar, out Bowled!! Exceptional from Bhuvneshwar. Jadeja is on his haunches at the other end. Looking disappointed. Full and swinging back in, through the attempted whip of Praveen Kumar. Rushed past the bat. I predict a first baller for Munaf too. LBW or bowled. P Kumar b Bhuvneshwar 1(2)

Bhuvneshwar to Munaf Patel, out Bowled!! You don't need to be a genius at this. Anyone can see that Munaf Patel has no chance against the swinging and pacy Bhuvneshwar. Especially at the death. Munaf Patel doesn't get in line, just stands outside leg and wafts his bat through the line. The late reverse swing takes the leg stump out and sends it out of its groove. That's clinical execution at the death. Perhaps the best exponent with the ball when bowling at the end in the world. Munaf Patel b Bhuvneshwar 0(1)

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, SIX, "he is a puller" says the great Sanjay M on air. I have to agree with that. Anything near his range and he instinctively goes for the pull, a top edge on this but it went all the way and even if there was a fielder, it was going over his head. On the swivel and then got it away

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, four more. Again the pull. Can't bowl into his strengths. Into his range. This short ball sits up for him and he unleashes the Brian Lara-esque one-legged short arm-jabbed pull. Beats short fine to his right and races away
Siraj to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Ishan Kishan rolled his wrists on the cut and got it down, beats extra cover and gets another boundary
Siraj to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, too full this time from Siraj and Ishan Kishan lofts over mid-off. Siraj is bleeding here and Ishan has raced to 31 off 13
Siraj to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, smashed past the stumps at the other end. Too full and Dwayne Smith has drilled that in a flash. Rocketed away
Nabi to Dwayne Smith, 1 run, fired in on the stumps, Dwayne Smith drives and gets a single to long-on

Nabi to Dwayne Smith, SIX, slightly slower and on the stumps, Dwayne Smith plays his favorite slog to leg, connects cleanly and it goes all the way over mid-wicket. Can't give him the room to swing his arms

Nabi to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, and now four more. Nabi fired that fuller and faster on the stumps, a powerful drive and Warner at mid-off is slightly wide, so can't get there and once he did, didn't dive. Smith is hurting SRH

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, SIX, given as six. Just landed on the ad-cushions. A top edge on the short-arm jab and Dhawan was running towards it with his left-hand stretched, attempting to catch it. But it went away from him and landed flush on the cushion

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, SIX, maiden fifty for Ishan Kishan. Raina stands and applauds. Picks the wrong-un and pulls, it was catchable for Nabi at the deep mid-wicket fence, but he was mindful of the ropes behind him, goes reverse-cup and can't catch it. Can't push it back either. Rashid Khan doesn't like that effort from his countryman
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, SIX, that is the flattest hit for six. Rocks back and muscles the pull, over mid-wicket, picked the shortish delivery and was onto it in a flash. Sailed into the crowd

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, cute little paddle now. The line is down leg and with short fine inside that's not the way to go, Dwayne Smith gets sufficient bat on that and beats the man inside the ring
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, Dwayne Smith is a monster when he gets going that is. Stands on the crease and butchers this slowish off-cutter that sits up, beats extra cover with ease
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, 2 runs, punched to sweeper's left and Dwayne Smith takes on Vijay to come back for the second. Good running
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, everything going GL's way. A genuine outside edge and it has flown to the third man fence. Flashed at a length delivery outside off and got a thick edge
Bhuvneshwar to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, first four of the innings. Beats the five men on the off-side with a cracking cut. The width was there and he pounced on that beating a diving cover-point

Bhuvneshwar to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, the slip was there for Ishan Kishan's first ball. But he was taken off for this one and guess what the ball goes right through that gaping hole. Good delivery from Bhuvneshwar, hitting a length and getting bounce, the edge was found but there was no-one to catch and it runs away to the third man fence

Siraj to Ishan Kishan, SIX, picks the slower delivery and deposits the pull over the deep backward square leg fielder. Not that short, but with a half-swivel Ishan Kishan pulled that meatily and got himself a biggie
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, 1 run, 50 for Dwayne Smith now. Cracked through cover
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, mowed from outside off and beats long-on to his right. Knelt down and hit it, not with great timing but good enough to get it in the gap and four more

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, out Lbw!! Gone. The Nelson has struck. A fast skidding delivery that rushes past Dwayne Smith's pull and strikes him bang in front of middle. Too quick for Smith's shot. Easy decision for the umpire. Dwayne Smith lbw b Rashid Khan 54(33) [4s-7 6s-2]

Thrashed to him and in running to his left from sweeper, he lets it go through his hands. A slight bobble before the ball came to him, but still should've been stopped

Bhuvneshwar to P Kumar, out Bowled!! Exceptional from Bhuvneshwar. Jadeja is on his haunches at the other end. Looking disappointed. Full and swinging back in, through the attempted whip of Praveen Kumar. Rushed past the bat. I predict a first baller for Munaf too. LBW or bowled. P Kumar b Bhuvneshwar 1(2)
