Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, SIX, that is the flattest hit for six. Rocks back and muscles the pull, over mid-wicket, picked the shortish delivery and was onto it in a flash. Sailed into the crowd

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, cute little paddle now. The line is down leg and with short fine inside that's not the way to go, Dwayne Smith gets sufficient bat on that and beats the man inside the ring
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, Dwayne Smith is a monster when he gets going that is. Stands on the crease and butchers this slowish off-cutter that sits up, beats extra cover with ease
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, 2 runs, punched to sweeper's left and Dwayne Smith takes on Vijay to come back for the second. Good running
Henriques to Dwayne Smith, FOUR, everything going GL's way. A genuine outside edge and it has flown to the third man fence. Flashed at a length delivery outside off and got a thick edge

Southee to Narine, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! End of Narine and it is for a duck. Backed away to lift this shortish ball, which was rising, could only loft it straight up and Hardik moved to his left at extra cover to grab the skier. Not the sort of shot to be trying in the first over when the ball is bouncing. But that's how Narine plays. Mid-off left it for Hardik and that was a good pressure catch. Narine c Hardik Pandya b Southee 0(4)
Johnson to Gambhir, FOUR, good shot. Not all that and he latches on to it, rocks back and pulls hard wide of mid-on. Races away
Vinay Kumar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, fine late cut. Waited for the rising back of a length delivery outside off and then played it late, eluded backward point and gave third man no chance

Vinay Kumar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, to the left of third man. This is an edge. Tried to force that through backward point, the ball got big on him and he couldn't control it. But it raced away through the vacant gully region

Vinay Kumar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, now Rohit is angry. Must be at Vinay Kumar. He brought the third man up and Vinay Kumar hasn't bowled to his field. A slower delivery outside off, de Grandhomme plays it late and directs it in the gap between backward point and short third. That's three fours in the over

Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, FOUR, third four in that area between backward point and short third. Delicately steering it in the gap, beating the dive of backward point. Simmons did his best but couldn't stop it. Raced away

Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, SIX, pulls and pulls well. With a swivel, picks the slowish short ball and hammers it hard and high into the deep backward square stands. Sheldon Jackson in the dugout loved that

Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, out Bowled!! Knocked him over and Gambhir shakes his head. Hardik Pandya is over the moon. Nipped in off the surface, de Grandhomme was late in getting his bat down and the inside edge rattled back on. That turns the game again. de Grandhomme b Hardik Pandya 29(16) [4s-4 6s-1]
Southee to M Pandey, FOUR, good start after the break. Sliding into the hips, elegantly flicked away, past short fine inside the ring and deep square can't get across. Stylishly put away too

Southee to M Pandey, 1 run, dropped by Suchith! The sub on for someone. A flat pull from Pandey and the sub running forward at deep mid-wicket can't cling on. That could be the game then and there. Wasn't a difficult take too
Southee to Kuldeep Yadav, FOUR, cute from Kuldeep Yadav. On a length and outside off, Kuldeep Yadav opens the face of the bat and runs it down, beats third man. Raced away. Southee isn't happy at all

Hardik Pandya to M Pandey, out Caught by (sub)J Suchith!! Huge sigh of relief. From Suchith. He flashes a smile. Is happy that he has caught this mistimed pull at deep mid-wicket. Hardik Pandya angling the short ball into Pandey and cramping the batsman for room. Replays show that he almost dropped this one as well. Just about hung on. M Pandey c (sub)J Suchith b Hardik Pandya 33(33) [4s-2]

Southee to Kuldeep Yadav, FOUR, what is Johnson doing? A regulation stop and he lets it go through his legs. Rohit looks at him in surprise. Kuldeep Yadav moved across and helped the low full toss to fine leg's right. What was at best two became four

Southee to Kuldeep Yadav, out Caught by Rayudu!! Rayudu almost threatened the umpire into raising the finger with his loud shrieks for a caught behind appeal. Poor Nand Kishore had no other option but to agree. But a clear edge on that. So well done. UltraEdge shows nothing though. But the seam changed direction after passing the bat which is an indicator. Kuldeep Yadav backed away to squeeze it out and looked like there was a clear deflection. We will never know the truth. Kuldeep Yadav c Rayudu b Southee 16(15) [4s-2]

Johnson to Gambhir, FOUR, Johnson flashes a wry smile. After conceding a boundary. Short into the body, but not that high to cause any trouble, Gambhir swivels and pulls, beats deep backward square running to his left. So after the wicket maiden, 11 have come off the second over
Southee to Chris Lynn, SIX, Lynnsanity has started! Stand and deliver from the Queenslander. Right in the swinging arc for him and he lofts cleanly, high and over long-on

Southee to Chris Lynn, SIX, No.2 for Chris Lynn. Picks the slower delivery and out comes the big blade, not a big six, but this will do. No-one at cow corner and he finds the fence. Suddenly Southee is under pressure

Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, and he shows us here that it is not all brawn about him. There is a smart brain to go with it as well. This is down leg and with short fine inside the ring, he whips it over the man's head. 19 off the over and Chris Lynn is turning it on
Karn Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, Gambhir comes down the track and then plays his favorite lofted hit. Over a leaping extra cover. Just managed to clear the man and that will be good in the powerplay

Johnson to Gambhir, SIX, Gambhir's balance was shot when he lofted that. His head was falling away to the off-side, but the followthrough of the bat and the timing on that was special. Went all the way over long-on. Just cleared the fence. Gambhir picked the off-pace delivery well

Johnson to Gambhir, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! You can only see the Aussies and the Kiwis hugging in the IPL. Big wicket and Rohit pumps his fist in joy. A fat top edge on the pull as Gambhir was hurried by the back of a length delivery, went miles up in the air, looked a tough catch, Karn at short fine though judged it beautifully and took it the conventional way. He didn't go for the reverse cup. Johnson did Gambhir for pace. Gambhir c Karn Sharma b Johnson 21(16) [4s-3 6s-1]

Johnson to Chris Lynn, FOUR, inhuman this fella is. Really. How hard and flat has he hit that. To a short rising delivery into the body. He just has smashed the leather off the ball and gave deep square no chance. Muscled that with sheer force
Johnson to Chris Lynn, FOUR, and now gets inside the line of this and helps the pull wide of short fine. Back to back boundaries and what was looking like a good over has been spoiled

Karn Sharma to Uthappa, out Caught by Rohit!! Don't know what to say about this from Uthappa. I'm speechless. Last ball of the powerplay and he has gifted his wicket away. Didn't try to take advantage early in the over, decides to do off the last ball and pays the price. Backed away to smash it over cover, just horribly mistimed it to extra cover. That's another big blow to KKR. Uthappa c Rohit b Karn Sharma 2(4)

Vinay Kumar to Chris Lynn, out Caught by (sub)J Suchith!! You don't take on the legend of Vinay Kumar and hope to get away with it. Not even if you are Chris Lynn. What a wicket that is. Could be match winning and a record ending one as well. Look at Vinay Kumar's reaction - he raises both arms in triumph and lets out a roar. Slightly short and coming in, pulled straight to deep mid-wicket. Lynn didn't get any power behind that. Chris Lynn c (sub)J Suchith b Vinay Kumar 26(14) [4s-3 6s-2]

Vinay Kumar to Y Pathan, SIX, almost two in two for Vinay Kumar. First ball for Yusuf and he slogs, without even looking. A big top edge and Mitch Johnson running around at third man tried his best - went with both hands on the leap, but the ball had enough to evade him. Vinay Kumar can't believe that
Karn Sharma to M Pandey, FOUR, rocks back and tries to pull into the deep mid-wicket stands. But doesn't get that much power, into the gap and a four

Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, SIX, look at Pathan chew on his gum. Would've made Sir Viv proud. It was a tossed up leggie on the stumps, Pathan used his long levers to heave that to the deep mid-wicket fence. Then came the swagger with a chat to his partner to accompany it

Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, SIX, he has decided to play his shots. No matter what. This is bowled wide of off, but Pathan uses his reach and smashes it flat back over the bowler's head. Consecutive sixes and Karn Sharma is left feeling a bit sorry

Vinay Kumar to Y Pathan, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! The fun doesn't last long for Pathan. Gambhir wears a desolate expression on his face. Pathan was going to play only one way tonight and that's to go after everything. Huge risk associated with that strategy and this match it doesn't come off. Right off the bottom of the bat and an easy take at long-on. KKR are self-destructing at the Garden. Y Pathan c Hardik Pandya b Vinay Kumar 20(7) [6s-3]

de Grandhomme to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, Tiwary is off and running with a boundary, on a good length and just outside off, Tiwary gets across and punches it on the up, beats the laboured dive from Pathan at cover-point and rolls away to the fence

de Grandhomme to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, easy pickings for Tiwary, can't bowl short and wide - when you have third man inside the ring. Tiwary went hard on the cut, gets a thick top-edge that cleared the inner ring, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Rajpoot to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, unleashes the anger. In the slot, the juicy length and Tiwary smacks it through the line. Doesn't hold a muscle back in his bat swing as he forehands it over the bowler's head
Narine to Rayudu, FOUR, brings out the broom. Spots the length, the friendly one and without bothering to read the turn this time sweeps it powerfully through square leg
U Yadav to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, delicious width. Gobbled up with glee. Gets the chance to free his arms and uses all of Umesh's pace as he slaps it hard. Over point

Narine to Rayudu, FOUR, gets another drag down. And the off-cutter. Opens up his front leg, lines up and has all the time to unleash a power through mid-wicket. A much needed fence hit for Mumbai - and Rayudu. Only his second

Narine to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, too short. And pays the price. Some pressure off his shoulders with a rock back deep inside the crease and a pull into the cow corner fence. Piercing the gap to perfection

Narine to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, follows up the muscle display with some elegance. Walks into the line, to the pitch of the delivery and shows the maker's name in tonking it down the ground. Into the fence on the bounce. Brings up his half-ton as well. In the first chance he is given
U Yadav to Rayudu, 1 run, keeps walking and nurdles it away off the hips down to fine leg
U Yadav to Rayudu, FOUR, right off the screws. He's losing his radar here is Umesh, darting it wide and Rayudu slices it over point
U Yadav to Rayudu, SIX, the sound. The crunch. Could only mean one thing. Too shrot, angling in and pulls it off one leg. Into the fence over square leg she flies

U Yadav to Rayudu, out Saurabh Tiwary Run Out!! Tiwary and his run-out saga. Slips into this season as well. Just a drop off the toe end on the pull from Rayudu around the corner and he wants to pinch the single. Tiwary meanwhile takes a couple of steps and freezes. Umesh meanwhile runs, collects the ball and sprints away to the striker's sticks. Tiwary gives up, succumbs and walks back. Not the worst result for Mumbai though. Saurabh Tiwary run out (U Yadav) 52(43) [4s-9]
Narine to Rayudu, FOUR, in the middle of all the power here comes the deft touches. Opens up his bat very late and uses up the iota of width in running it through the cordon
Boult to Rayudu, FOUR, on the up. And a dispatch. the strike rate is back to normalcy now. Stands up on the bounce, shows the full bat face and flays it through extra cover

Boult to Rayudu, SIX, some way to get to a half-ton. A pitched up freebie on the pads and Rayudu waits on it to swish across the line. Doesn't even bother keeping it down. Flies into long leg. All very nonchalantly

Boult to Pollard, SIX, a mistime. That's what it was. And it is a crowd catch. The brute that this man is. Gets a pounder on a back of a length climbing up much more than Pollard would have liked but he doesn't bother adjusting. Mows across the line, gets it high on the bat and it the cow corner fence takes the brunt
Kuldeep Yadav to Rayudu, FOUR, he's into the toying around zone now. Dances down, inherits the ball in his slot and lofts it over the bowler. Effortless. The new bat I tell you

Kuldeep Yadav to Rayudu, SIX, another charge, another bat swing, another boundary. Gets really close this time and has it in him to go straight down again. All in the air this time. All the way this time too

Kuldeep Yadav to Rayudu, out Stumped!! The bait does its bit. Rayudu stays true to his gallops down the ground, goes mighty with another bat swing. Just that Kuldeep this time has spotted this and has fired this wide. Very wide. In the form of the wrong 'un as well. Rayudu cannot connect - despite his best attempts to stretch out - and Robbie does the rest. Rayudu st Uthappa b Kuldeep Yadav 63(37) [4s-6 6s-3]

Boult to Pollard, out Caught by Y Pathan!! Brings about his end. In the quest of going hard after everything. Another low dipping full toss this and Pollard swings, hard abut has to do with just a toe end. Only the height, not the distance. As far as a back-pedalling cover at the edge of the circle. Not quite the assualt from Pollard tonight. Pollard c Y Pathan b Boult 13(11) [6s-1]

Boult to Simmons, out Caught by Narine!! Simmons' misery is over, never got going on this spicy pitch. This was pitched up and angled across the right-hander, Simmons was looking to go over the top, doesn't get anywhere near the middle of the bat and it's a simple grab for his West Indies teammate - Narine holds onto the dolly at mid-off and MI have lost an early wicket. Simmons c Narine b Boult 0(5)
Boult to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, lovely shot, on a good length and just outside off, Tiwary leans forward, drives it on the up and clears Lynn at short extra-cover, no need to run for those

U Yadav to Rohit, leg byes, FOUR, poor ball from Umesh and not the greatest of keeping by Uthappa either, this was full and on Rohit's pads, he was looking to flick and missed. Uthappa went down slowly and only manages his fingertips on that, not enough and the ball rolls away to the fence
U Yadav to Rohit, FOUR, cracking shot, length ball on Rohit's pads, he leans forward, uses his wrists to good effect and clips it past mid-wicket, beats the fielder and rolls away to the fence

U Yadav to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, this is turning out to be an expensive over from Umesh, on a good length and just outside off, Tiwary leans forward, drives it on the up and finds the gap to the left of mid-off, rolls away to the fence in a hurry

Narine to Rohit, FOUR, the two men behind square on the on-side are in the ring and hence Rohit goes for the sweep. This is what he tried on the first ball as well, this time connects and fetches a four to the deep backward square leg fence
U Yadav to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, thick edge! Shortish ball outside off. Saurabh Tiwary goes for the cut and gets late, the ball is quick enough to beat the third man fielder, who ran to his right
U Yadav to Rohit, SIX, that envious swing of blade from Rohit. Once he picks the length, no ground is big enough. Saw the length ball and clubbed it over the long-on fence
de Grandhomme to Rohit, FOUR, nicely done. Did not try to overhit it. Let the short ball come to him and swiveled well to beat short fine leg's dive to his left
Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, FOUR, goes with the turn does Rohit and which is why this slog looks elegant. On top of that, has found the gap too. One bounce and over the ropes at the deep square leg fence
Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, leg byes, FOUR, wrong 'un. Rohit tries the sweep, without reading the turn on it. The ball turns away to beat the bat, ricochets off the outer part of his torso

Rajpoot to Rohit, out Lbw!! That's the curtains for Rohit and his affair with the Eden. A brave call this - quite a few doubts on the first impression but boy o boy, ump Ravi has turned around his form from the earlier goof up. A sharp in-cutter from Rajpoot, at nippy pace as well. Jags back in from a length to just about go past the bat searching for the defence and take the front pad. On top of middle shows HawkEye. Rohit lbw b Rajpoot 27(21) [4s-4 6s-1]

Unadkat to Guptill, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! Disastrous start from KXIP. Dream start for RPS. A gentle floater first-up from Unadkat, on a good length and well wide of off, Guptill went for the drive, can't keep it down and it's a simple catch for Tiwary - at short extra-cover. Delight amongst the crowd, despair for the KXIP supporters. Guptill c Manoj Tiwary b Unadkat 0(1)

Unadkat to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, almost another! On a good length and well wide of off, Marsh was leaning on the drive, the ball held up slightly and hits him high on the bat - went in the air and just wide of Tiwary at extra-cover, beats mid-off and rolls away to the fence

SN Thakur to Shaun Marsh, FOUR, cracking shot, leg-stump half-volley from Shardul, Marsh waits on it, leans into the on-drive and finds the gap wide of mid-wicket - should get plenty of confidence with that blow

Christian to Axar, out Caught by Dhoni!! Very loose. Just not what you'd expect at this stage. Teases him with a wide fuller length delivery does Christian enticing the drive. Axar cannot resist. Throws his hands out and chases it with a drive. Gets a fat outside edge in the process and this time Dhoni doesn't even have to dive. Pune are tired of their celebrations as well. Just smiles around. The 100th dismissal for Dhoni this. Axar c Dhoni b Christian 22(20) [4s-1 6s-1]

Unadkat to Swapnil Singh, out Caught by Dhoni!! Relay stuff. Executed to perfection. Dhoni adds a few more to his tally. For the first time in this over, Unadkat goes full and gives Swapnil the opportunity to swing his arms. And he cannot resist. Throws his hands out, toe ends it and Dan, at first slip reverse cups of some sort and the pop out is plucked out by the keeper. Ah, kind. Swapnil Singh c Dhoni b Unadkat 10(17)

Zampa to Ishant, out Caught by Smith!! All too easy. All too familiar. The tried and tested ploy to a tail-ender and for the umpteenth time in history, it pays off. Zampa lets out one of the floatiest of leg-breaks tossing it very wide outside the sticks. Ishant sinks on a knee, slogs it big time. It grows big on him, takes the outside half of the bat and all it finds is cover. Ishant c Smith b Zampa 1(5)

Zampa to Mohit Sharma, out Caught by Christian!! That's curtains. Mohit doesn't believe in knocking the ball around and playing out his quota of overs. Apparently. Buries down with a stoop looking to slog it out of the park. Done in the flight and the agricultural hoick manages only a miscue off the under edge to tonk high in the air. Only towards extra cover. Mohit Sharma c Christian b Zampa 6(12)

Unadkat to Saha, 1 run, edged and dropped, MS is the culprit, went late for the catch, got his fingertips and the ball pops out. This was full and wide of off, Saha went for the drive, played away from his body, gets a thick edge that went right in the middle of the keeper and Christian at first slip. He didn't budge, MS went for it as an afterthought and fumbled

Unadkat to Saha, SIX, cracking shot, length ball on Saha's pads, he picked up the length and swung through the line, got plenty of height and for a moment - Tripathi at deep square leg was an interested party. But the wind comes into Saha's aid and the ball kept going - clears him by a distance

SN Thakur to Shaun Marsh, out Caught by Smith!! That's a dolly and Smith has gobbled up his Australian teammate. On a good length and angling across the left-hander, Shardul bowled this one with a scrambled seam. The ball once again looked like it stopped on the batsman - Marsh was committed on the drive, couldn't keep it down, went off the splice of the bat and spoons a simple catch to Smith at mid-off. Shaun Marsh c Smith b SN Thakur 10(13) [4s-2]

SN Thakur to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Shardul, Morgan gets on top of the bounce and cracks it square on the off-side, beats the fielder at point and rolls away to the fence

Stokes to Eoin Morgan, out Eoin Morgan Run Out!! Brilliant work from Unadkat and KXIP have lost their third wicket. Exceptional piece of fielding from the Pune pacer, attacked the ball after Morgan had pushed it in front of mid-on. It was Morgan's call and he comes second best as Unadkat is quick on the ball and makes a direct hit - even as he was sliding onto the ground. Eoin Morgan run out (Unadkat) 4(4) [4s-1]

Stokes to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, lovely shot, fraction overpitched and wide of off, Tewatia is quick to get forward and creams it into the wide gap at cover-point, no need to run for those and Tewatia is off and running in style

SN Thakur to Rahul Tewatia, out Caught by Unadkat!! Unadkat is having a dream day in the field - follows up the direct hit with an acrobatic catch at short fine leg. KXIP are in doldrums now and the move to promote Tewatia up the order has failed. This was banged in short and on his body, Tewatia was late on the pull, the ball ballooned off the top-edge and lobbed behind the keeper. On another day it could have dropped down in no man's land - but not today. Unadkat moves across to his left, goes with both hands and completes a fine diving catch. Rahul Tewatia c Unadkat b SN Thakur 4(3) [4s-1]

SN Thakur to Maxwell, out Caught by Rahane!! It is going from bad to worse for KXIP, Maxwell clips one in the air and finds Rahane to perfection at deep backward square leg. Out for a duck and KXIP have lost half their side now. A nothing ball from Shardul, leg-stump half-volley, Maxwell got inside the line and clipped it firmly - he didn't bother to keep it down and found Rahane to perfection in the deep. He can't believe it as he trudges off. Maxwell c Rahane b SN Thakur 0(3)

SN Thakur to Axar, FOUR, edged and four, nearly a fourth wicket for Shardul. This was a floaty delivery outside off, Axar saw the width and went with hard hands on the drive, gets a thick edge that perfectly bisects the keeper and Christain at wide slip
Zampa to Axar, SIX, poor ball from Zampa, drops one short and on the stumps, Axar rocks back and pulls it high and over mid-wicket, has just enough to clear the ropes on the full

Christian to Saha, out Caught by Dhoni!! KXIP slump into further trouble, Christian strikes in his first over. This was full and wide of off, Saha was lunging forward - he was looking to dab it down towards third man - gets a thick edge, to the right of MS. Dhoni doesn't drop it this time around, dives to his right and clutches it safely. Six wickets down and KXIP are pretty much done and dusted at the moment. Saha c Dhoni b Christian 13(17) [6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Tripathi, FOUR, 'I am not going to change! That's how I play, that's how I will today as well...' Not my words but this shot from Tripathi suggests that. Steps down and cracks the drive past cover, gave himself a bit of room to help with the flow of the bat
Maxwell to Rahane, SIX, Rahane skips down and chips over the wide long-on fence. It is all over! Pune are through, winning by 9 wickets. Rahane gets some runs, finally

Sandeep Sharma to Tripathi, FOUR, although he shows his cards too early, he has managed to get what he wanted. Some card he had. Stepped down and was followed by a short ball that did not have enough pace. Flat-pulled it along the ground to the deep square leg fence

Ishant to Tripathi, FOUR, off the toe of the willow but enough to beat third man to his right. Width on offer outside off and Tripathi stays his ground before cutting it past the man at backward point
Ishant to Tripathi, FOUR, too straight and with Ishant's inward angle it becomes all the more easy. Easily deflected to the fine leg fence, the man in that region is in the ring

Rahul Tewatia to Tripathi, SIX, bye, bye ball. Margin of error against this man is so less. Rahul Tewatia dares to flight a bit and gets slogged over the deep mid-wicket fence. Well into the crowd with the wind
Axar to Rahane, FOUR, shortish. Rahane sees early and shapes back to cut, beats the dive from the fielder at cover

Axar to Tripathi, out Bowled!! Tripathi has to go. Outrageous attempt from him. Got a long way across to help the sweep over the infield on the on-side. Missed it completely and the ball crashed the bails. Tripathi b Axar 28(20) [4s-4 6s-1]
Rahul Tewatia to Rahane, 1 run, Rahane slogs and is in danger there. Guptill has it covered with a reverse cup at deep mid-wicket. Hold on, he is not having a good day and so, he drops it

Avesh Khan to Samson, out Caught by Kohli!! Wicket of the second ball for Avesh Khan. Another short of length delivery that cramps Samson for room. He tries to take him on with a pull. The ball gets big on him and he splices it straight to mid-on. Kohli takes a dolly. Samson c Kohli b Avesh Khan 0(2)
Chahal to Nair, FOUR, top shot from Nair. Gets outside the line and sweeps controls the sweep wide of short fine leg for a boundary. The first one of the DD innings
Chahal to Nair, byes, FOUR, what happened there? Nair was loose with his shot. Drives away from the body and the ball spun a mile to beat the outside edge. Keeper too fails to glove that
Watson to Pant, FOUR, short of a good length ball on the middle and leg. Pant pulls well behind square on the on-side. Races away to the fence

Harshal Patel to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Watson!! The plan has worked. The plan to bowl short and slow to these two. Once again Shreyas Iyer fails to get the timing right. Backs away a touch to slap past cover. That's actually not a bad shot, but ends up hitting it straight to the fielder at extra cover. So straight that the man there did not have to move an inch. Shreyas Iyer c Watson b Harshal Patel 32(30) [4s-2 6s-1]

Harshal Patel to Samuels, out Bowled!! Back to back wickets for Harshal Patel. What did Samuels do there? Perhaps was not expecting the slower ball first up. But gets one, is committed on the defence and by the time tries to adjust by slightly taking the bottom hand of the handle, it is late. Crashes the off-stump. If Bangalore were looking for a window to seal things, this is the one. AAAR CEE BEE is back here. Hat-trick ball coming up. Samuels b Harshal Patel 0(1)
Harshal Patel to Pant, FOUR, such a sweet, sensible shot from the young man. Sees the short ball, that is slow too. Waits, dabs between short third man and backward point

Head to Corey Anderson, out Stumped!! This is reckless from Corey Anderson. Just treks down to heave it across. Has no clue about where it has pitched. The ball scoots under his bat and the keeper does not have buttery gloves.. so that is the end of Anderson's IPL this year. Corey Anderson st Vishnu Vinod b Head 3(9)
Head to Pat Cummins, SIX, floated slightly and Pat Cummins slogs across the line. Connects well and sends over the deep mid-wicket fence

Head to Pat Cummins, out Caught by Kohli!! That is a case of not realizing the importance of the wicket and attempting to send everything out of the park. Is a flighted delivery outside off and Pat Cummins tries to loft over long-off. Gets off the bottom part of the bat and the RCB captain does not have to move much at the fence. Pat Cummins c Kohli b Head 7(3) [6s-1]

Harshal Patel to Pant, SIX, he is running out of partners but that does not bother him. Finally a delivery that is 141kph and on a length. Pant gets across slightly to cover the angle as it was bowled round the wicket. Whips the pull over the square leg fence

Harshal Patel to Pant, out Bowled!! Harshal Patel has got the wicket that might just seal things for RCB tonight. The crowd goes mum. Slower ball on off, Pant launches into the heave. Swings the bat too early and the ball scoots under to uproot the off-stump. Harshal Patel roars and alongside him roar the millions of RCB fans who finally have a reason to celebrate. Pant b Harshal Patel 45(34) [4s-3 6s-2]
Harshal Patel to Shami, FOUR, not a bad shot to get off the mark. Moves across to this short ball and helps the pull to the fine leg fence
Harshal Patel to Shami, FOUR, full around off. Shami has nothing to lose, no tailender has! Crunches the drive to the deep extra cover fence
Negi to Mishra, SIX, he won Delhi the last game by cracking back to back fours. Steps down this time and lofts with a straight bat to clear the long-on fence

Negi to Mishra, out Bowled!! Mishra won't do it for Delhi tonight. Cannot resist his tailender skills and attempts one shot too many. Steps down and makes room, only a littl though, and misses the lofted drive and the ball clatters his stumps. Mishra b Negi 7(4) [6s-1]

Avesh Khan to Shami, SIX, Shami has not given up, not just yet. A pitched up ball around off, clears the front leg and and cracks hard. Kohli at long-on gets fingertips to that. Not good enough to parry it back. Avesh Khan is down again. But wants to continue after having a word with the skipper
Avesh Khan to Shami, FOUR, 13 they will need off the last over, DD. Another short ball and Shami slices the pull over the keeper's head. A couple of bounces and into the fence

Negi to Shami, out Stumped!! Stumping appeal, this looks close. Has he stepped out? Front foot is fine. His back foot is out but has he got it back in time? Zoomer comes in. Looks out to me, not sure about the man upstairs. He wants to check all the angles. Might just be in the air. Out that is and the roar tells me Kotla has shifted to Bangalore. Shami wanted to swing this one out of the park after stepping down, Negi's darter was too good to be meted with that kind of a treatment. Shami st Vishnu Vinod b Negi 21(9) [4s-3 6s-1][/b]
Negi to Nadeem, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Slogs across the line and finds the man at deep square leg. Bangalore end their 2017 IPL campaign with a 10-run win. Nadeem c Kedar Jadhav b Negi 2(6)
Avesh Khan to Nair, FOUR, that a top shot from Nair. Stands tall and admires the punch through covers. The fielder had no chance of stopping those. 6runs off 2overs from Avesh Khan
Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, Chahal gives it little more air this time. Shreyas Iyer jumps out of his crease quickly and thumbs it over long-on for a maximum. First one of the innings

Harshal Patel to Nair, FOUR, poor start from Harshal Patel. With third man and point inside the circle, he gives batsman the room outside off. Nair waits for the ball and cuts it late to pick the gap perfectly
Harshal Patel to Nair, FOUR, cheeky from Nair. Walks inside the line of the ball and scoops it over short fine leg for his second boundary of the over
Harshal Patel to Nair, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Nair. It was short and wide outside off, Nair gets in position early and slaps it past point. The ball races away to the fence

Watson to Nair, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Nair perishes. One shot too many. Shane Watson digs it in short. The ball didn't get up as much as he wanted it to. Hurries onto Nair's pull and all he manages to do is to miscue it to mid-wicket. An easy catch for Kedar Jadhav. Nair c Kedar Jadhav b Watson 26(22) [4s-5]
Head to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, this time Shreyas Iyer splits the gap in the deep perfectly. Thumps it towards cow corner and the ball bounces a couple of times before hitting the ad boards
Head to Pant, SIX, Pant gets into the act now. Goes inside out over cover. Gets a good connection and the ball has enough legs to sail over the leaping long-off fielder for a maximum
Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Shreyas Iyer makes full use of the free-hit. A quicker delivery on the pads, Shreyas Iyer flicks it wide of short fine leg for a boundary

Zaheer to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle is off and running, no hat-trick of ducks for the big man. Too straight from Zaheer, ends up drifting onto Gayle's pads, he gets inside the line and helps it on its way, beats short fine leg and rolls away to the fence

Zaheer to Gayle, FOUR, lovely shot, overpitched and on Gayle's pads, that's easy pickings for him, gets inside the line and clips it in front of square on the on-side, beats the fielder getting across from the deep

Shami to Gayle, SIX, Gayle will play freely tonight, this was full and wide of off, Gayle threw the kitchen sink at that, gets a thick outside edge that went high and over third man, first six of the night

Mishra to Gayle, SIX, a Gayle special. Mishra darts the quicker front of the hand stuff. And he darts it half way down the pitch as well. All the time for Gayle to rock back and swat him away. High and mighty

Mishra to Kohli, SIX, more of the juicy Mishraji half-trackers. More of the dispatches. This time it is off Kohli. Stays behind with the weight going backwards and a short arm jab in the air. Into his favoured cow corner region
Mishra to Kohli, FOUR, the dart again. But this time Kohli takes matters all along the turf. Making it look all the more elegant. Clears his front leg and whips it powerfully through mid-on

Nadeem to Gayle, out Caught by Zaheer!! Yes, the break does its job. The leg-spinner from Nadeem, spinning the other way and Gayle's committed slog-sweep has him holing out. The air on this one makes him lose his timing as well with the ball only managing the toe-end as he swings it down the throat of mid-wicket. Delhi needed this big time, pouching Gayle just when he was about to explode. Gayle c Zaheer b Nadeem 48(38) [4s-3 6s-3]

Zaheer to Kohli, out Head Run Out!! 1 run completed. Matters taken upstairs. Some confusion while wanting the second run and Head sacrifices his head for his skipper. Is forced to run back and even a wide throw gives Zaheer enough time to grab and catch him short. RCB lose another. Was a walking flick through mid-wicket and Kohli always wanted the second. The only problem - there never was two there. Head bears the brunt. Head run out (Shreyas Iyer/Zaheer) 2(2)
Zaheer to Kohli, 1 run, here's the half-ton. Kotla acknowledges. A leaning drive off an opened bat face through sweeper gets him there. The fourth of the season

Zaheer to Kohli, no run, just doesn't stick. Zak has to give himself the stare here. Lets off the big man after inducing him into a false stroke. Misreads the slower one here does Kohli and is way early into a whack. Chips it back to the bowler, who in his followthrough gets both palms to it. Just doesn't stick
Zaheer to Kohli, SIX, a clear case of a missed yorker. Ends up becoming a juicy full toss and Kohli stands and swishes across the line. Several rows into his favoured mid-wicket stands

Zaheer to Kohli, out Caught by Nadeem!! Holes out before the final finish as well. That's the end with the bat for Kohli this season. After a favour of a full toss from Zak, he decides to return the favour. Another slower one on the driving length and the lofted drive through the off-side has the bat turning in his palms as he balloons it to long-off. Kohli is angry, no he is furious. Takes out the anger on himself slapping his legs with his bat. Kohli c Nadeem b Zaheer 58(45) [4s-3 6s-3]
Zaheer to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, Jadhav joins the act. Gets one right in the slot and he isn't in a mood to spare these. Swings his bat down and plunders it down the ground. A crowd catch

Shami to Kedar Jadhav, out Kedar Jadhav Run Out!! Freaky. Oh absolutely. When Shami doesn't get a wicket off a pin-point accurate yorker, the Gods align themselves to get a run-out. Right on the base of middle and Jadhav just about digs it away somehow to short third man. Cummins out there, gathers and catches Jadhav in a lazy mood to finish the run. Has a shy at the bowler's end and Shami mid-way gets his hands out of the way. Not before giving it a faint tickle and directing it onto the stumps. Kedar Jadhav run out (Pat Cummins) 12(9) [6s-1]

Shami to Sachin Baby, FOUR, misses the length. Dishes out a full toss and Baby piles on. Ensures that he bisects the two men in the off-side at the fence and gets it wide enough with his murderous drive

Pat Cummins to Sachin Baby, FOUR, intercepting the gap. Again. Dead straight with his drills down the ground. Banging it into the turf and it flies over the umpire and teases the two men converging. To beat them both

Pat Cummins to Sachin Baby, out Caught by Corey Anderson!! A miscue. Plucked just inside the ropes. Gets a length delivery and unleashes a violent swing of the blade. Slices it high but not beyond the reach of Corey, who positions himself right at the edge of the ropes at long-on, and collects it without breaking into a sweat. Reverse cupped too. Talk of swagger. Sachin Baby c Corey Anderson b Pat Cummins 12(8) [4s-2]

Corey Anderson to Negi, FOUR, width. Throws his hands out. Without holding anything back in the process. Skews off the outside half of the blade in the process. Not bad with third man inside the circle

Corey Anderson to Negi, FOUR, he does it again. Pierces the gap between the keeper and short third. Again with the outside edge. Crashes a bat throw at a wide delivery, just doesn't reach out fully but meaty enough with the outside carve flying away
Corey Anderson to Negi, FOUR, follows the edges with one off the meat. A half volley and sends it on a leather hunt with a spank through the covers. Bangalore touch 160

Shami to Gayle, SIX, massive, too short from Shami and Gayle often doesn't let them go unpunished. This was the slower short ball from Shami, Gayle spotted it early, stayed back and pulled it over mid-wicket, went a long way into the stands

Pat Cummins to Vishnu Vinod, out Bowled!! Cummins has made a mess of Vinod's stumps. This was pitched on a good length and held its line outside off, Vinod was in no position on the pull - went through with the shot and looked real ugly on replays, gets an inside edge and the ball clatters into the middle-stump. RCB have lost an early wicket once again. Vishnu Vinod b Pat Cummins 3(9)

Shami to Gayle, FOUR, cracking shot, attempted yorker from Shami turns out into a low full-toss. Gayle presents the full face of the bat and punches it back past the non-striker, beats mid-on and rolls away to the fence
Mishra to Kohli, FOUR, cracking shot, flatter and on the stumps, Kohli rocks back and pulls it wide of long-on, the fielder gets across, puts in the slide and can't haul the ball back in

Corey Anderson to Kohli, SIX, lovely shot, a simple extension of his arms and Kohli has sent it sailing over extra-cover. One of the shots of the tourney, on a good length and just outside off, Kohli leans forward, plays a check-push and sends the ball soaring over the infield
Nadeem to Kohli, FOUR, nicely played, Nadeem drifts this one on Kohli's pads, he gets inside the line and helps it fine, beats Mishra at short fine and rolls away to the fence

Washington Sundar to Parthiv Patel, SIX, there's a man at deep square, but he is just left ball-watching. Floated up into the pads, PP uses those lovely wrists to send the flick aerial over square leg. Sheer timing. Nothing else

Lockie Ferguson to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Christian!! Look at Lockie Ferguson chuckle. He thinks it's too easy. Goes wide of the crease and angles a ball in, enticing Hardik Pandya into a punch. And one he plays, just that he does it uppishly, and early, with this 139ks ball sticking in the pitch. Straight to long-on, who reverse-cups it. And now you know why Lockie Ferguson was smiling. Hardik Pandya c Christian b Lockie Ferguson 14(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

SN Thakur to McClenaghan, out Caught by Unadkat!! Cutting away, this slower full ball, and lobs off the cue-end to short third man. McClenaghan wanted to go big downtown but hey, this is Mumbai, with its pace all sold off to neighbouring pitches, you feel. McClenaghan c Unadkat b SN Thakur 12(11) [6s-1]
Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, SIX, PP starting from where he left off. Short ball, angled into the body, his head stays still as he pulls this handsomely into the crowd. Sight to watch

SN Thakur to Malinga, SIX, Dhoni carves a final spot for Pune in IPL 2017. What a 'Sundar' performance. It means beautiful in Hindi.. Anyway, assuming you have let that pass, let's get back to cricket: Malinga finishes by swatting a six over deep mid-wicket, where the fielder almost has it but then dives over the ropes. Nothing matters. Cricket doesn't allow 27 runs to be scored off one ball. Sane cricket, so to say

Lockie Ferguson to Parthiv Patel, SIX, the pocket rocket of Mumbai Indians is trying to squeeze maximum off the powerplay. No hanging back. Swivels into a perfect position as he pulls a leg-side filth flat into the stands
SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, the pitch is slow? What are you talking! PP evokes those emotions now. He chips a gorgeous drive over extra cover

SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, out Simmons Run Out!! Oh, unlucky! Knuckle ball straight at the stumps, PP hits it back the bowler who manages to get some finger after stretching his right hand, it bounces and knocks the bails before crashing into the stumps. Simmons was backing up too far and was caught napping. Wasn't even in the frame. Simmons run out (SN Thakur) 5(13)
SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, PP continues on his merry ways

Washington Sundar to Rohit, out Lbw!! Ah! Rohit Sharma and his struggles against spinners this season. Oh wait! There seems to have a big inside edge. Yes there is. Gets down low to sweep Washington Sundar past square leg, edged and onto the pads. Looked close to the naked eye, just that the umpire didn't pick the edge. Rohit Sharma walks back disappointed. Rohit lbw b Washington Sundar 1(2)

Washington Sundar to Rayudu, out Caught by Smith!! Gone without scoring. No heroics from Rayudu tonight. He takes on a short ball, but doesn't get his timing right on the pull, hits the top-half and Smithy takes a sharp catch diving forward at short mid-wicket. Rayudu c Smith b Washington Sundar 0(3)

Lockie Ferguson to Pollard, FOUR, driven past the diving mid-off this time. The key is he didn't force the shot, just allowed his instincts to take over, full and wide, all he needed was to locate the middle of the willow. Tiiiiimed!

Washington Sundar to Pollard, out Caught by Smith!! That's a poor shot, real horror of a shot. Very very lazy from KP. Steve Smith Stationed himself at short mid-wicket lurking for an opportunity, he was waiting for that brain-fade moment from the big man. And it didn't take long. A languid flick, no real intent on the shot, just playing it in more of hope. It went flat and low to the right of Smudge who had it covered with his bucket hands. Pollard c Smith b Washington Sundar 7(10) [4s-1]
SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, latches on the width on offer and flays it away past backward point, a real thrashing that
SN Thakur to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, short and slipping down leg, Hardik Pandya helps it to the fine leg boundary boards with a perfect swivel pull
Zampa to Hardik Pandya, SIX, that's the way he plays. Swagger. Saw the revs and lined himself up for the biggie, clean connection and bam it goes over long-off

McClenaghan to Tripathi, out Bowled!! The full swinging in delivery does the trick. That was pitched up and the batsman trying to play across the line of the ball, misses and is cleaned up. Tripathi is gone for a blob and Mumbai have jolted RPS early. McClenaghan takes off as his joy knows no bounds. Tripathi b McClenaghan 0(2)
Malinga to Smith, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Malinga strikes now. Smith c Hardik Pandya b Malinga 1(2)
Malinga to Rahane, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Rahane latches onto it. The Mumbaikar hangs back and cuts it fiercely to the left of a diving backward point fielder. The ball raced away

Krunal Pandya to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, in the air and in the gap. Tiwary gets down on one knee and plays against the turn. His slog sweep finds the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket. One bounce and into the fence

Krunal Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, ah! That should have been a single. A fierceful - let's make words! - sweep shot from Rahane that goes through square leg. The Big Mitch in the deep can't stop it as the ball spin away from him. He didn't anticipate that and wen the wrong way
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, another sweep shot through mid-wicket. The single brings up Rahane's fifty. He should up the ante now

Karn Sharma to Rahane, out Lbw!! The partnership is broken and Rahane is dismissed. It's the googly from Karn Sharma. Rahane looks to work it through the on-side, but fails to make connection as the ball sneaked past the inside edge. Pitched outside off, impact on off, hitting off and middle, confirms HawkEye. Loud cheers, not for the wicket. MS is walking in. Rahane lbw b Karn Sharma 56(43) [4s-5 6s-1]

Karn Sharma to Dhoni, SIX, Mahendra Singh Dhoni is underway. Probably the slider down leg, Dhoni waltzes down, gets to the pitch and wallops it wide and over the long-on rope for a maximum. Tremendous bottom hand power

Bumrah to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, ah! That should have been either a single or a couple. Length ball outside off, Tiwary swung across the line and makes good connection. Simmons at long leg, slides across and makes contact with the rope while he had the ball in his hand

McClenaghan to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, Tiwary takes full toll of the free hit. Length ball right in the slot for Tiwary to clear his front leg and tonk it over long-on. If Pollard can't do anything about it, there's nothing anyone else could have done. Good start to the over for RPS

McClenaghan to Manoj Tiwary, no ball, FOUR, that's a horror delivery. Did that slip out of his hand? That should have been the case. A very high full toss on leg, Tiwary gets inside the line and swings his bat hard. Gets it fine of the fine leg fielder. No ball signalled
McClenaghan to Dhoni, SIX, brings up the 50-run stand in style. Helped by a mediocre delivery of course. You don't bowl length to this guy. Dhoni waits on the back foot and biffs it high and over

McClenaghan to Dhoni, SIX, it's high and it is handsome as well. Not quite off the middle but Dhoni will collect another six. 26 runs off the over. Third time this season, McClenaghan has given more than 20 runs. Fullish ball outside off, Dhoni goes hard on his lofted off-drive. Rohit tried his best at long-off, but can't do much. He falls outside the boundary rope
Bumrah to Dhoni, SIX, that's a special shot! Back of a length delivery, Dhoni opened up the off-side by backing away. He generates massive power and biffs it over cover for a maximum

Bumrah to Dhoni, SIX, wow! Just wow! You can't do much when Dhoni is in such mood. Seam-up delivery from a goodish length, Dhoni decides to go downtown. Moves slightly off-side and bludgeons it over long-off for a gigantic hit
McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, the Mumbai boy decides to take matters into his own hands and lays down the old traditional mow to send it away into the deep mid fence. One bounce and away she went
McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, highish elbow, weight into the shot and a Test-matchesque shot gets the batsman a serene four. That was pitched up and the rest was done by Rahane

Bumrah to Dhoni, out Manoj Tiwary Run Out!! Two dot balls to end the over. Still 15 off it. Another pinpoint yorker, Dhoni squirts it out to the bowler. Manoj Tiwary is a long way down backing up. Bumrah easily removes the bails. Manoj Tiwary run out (Bumrah) 58(48) [4s-4 6s-2]
Karn Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, backs away and drives! That was again uppish, but the dive from the man at cover was never in contention to take that. It was close though!

Karn Sharma to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, comes down the track and lofts the ball over long-on. That is a much needed tonic to this innings which was starting to go nowhere. A slight movement down the ground and then the smacking hit
Hardik Pandya to Rahane, SIX, Rahane comes down on it like a house on fire and dismantles the ball over long-off for a maximum
Hardik Pandya to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, looks to push at it, the ball nips in from the surface and tickles the inside edge
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, FIFTY for the combo! A reverse attempted by Rahane and he manages to locate the man at short third man
U Yadav to Warner, FOUR, up on his toes and off she goes! Backs away and creates all the room he wanted, flays Umesh Yadav up and over cover, no-one in the deep. Take four!
Narine to Warner, SIX, that's a massive shot! No doubt, it's Warner. Slightly short, Warner sees it and is quick to jump back in his crease. Pummels the pull into the deep mid-wicket stands
Coulter-Nile to Warner, 1 run, once again, no room on offer for Warner. It was a low full toss to Warner who was backing away. Mistimed drill to cover. Brings up the 50-run stand

Coulter-Nile to Williamson, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! The ploy to bring in NCN has worked. He has been superb at the death, but GG needed a wicket here. Fullish length delivery outside off, Williamson doesn't get underneath it and goes hard on his lofted extra drive. Finds extra cover to perfection. Williamson c Suryakumar Yadav b Coulter-Nile 24(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chawla to Warner, out Bowled!! Two big wickets within a span of three balls. This will hurt the defending champions. Piyush Chawla gets the big fish. Warner probably misjudged the length. Did that keep low? Not sure. It was a slider from a good length, Warner went back to pull it away. Misses it by a long way and the ball crashes the middle stump. Gauti is animated in his celebration. Warner b Chawla 37(35) [4s-2 6s-2]

Chawla to Yuvraj, FOUR, why do you bowl that? Easy runs on offer for Yuvraj and he gets off the mark with a delightful stroke. Quicker and overpitched outside off, Yuvi plants his front leg forward and middles the drive. No chance for long-off

Narine to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, bit like Guptill. Slogs across the line and the head is tilted downards. Slowish offie on middle and leg, Shankar swings across the line and gets good wood behind it. One bounce and into the fence. The man in the deep probably didn't pick it up

Chawla to Yuvraj, FOUR, Vijay Shankar isn't donning a helmet. I reckon, he should. Overpitched outside off, Yuvraj smacks it down the ground. Shankar did well to evade that by ducking under. That went like a bullet

Chawla to Vijay Shankar, SIX, this guy can hit it a long way. Yep, Vijay Shankar is turning it on here at the Chinnaswamy. Once again, too full from Piyush Chawla, Shankar clears his left leg and deposits it over long-on with a mighty lofted on-drive

U Yadav to Yuvraj, out Caught by Chawla!! In the air and taken. Yuvraj has to depart. The short ball does the trick. Goes for the pull shot, doesn't time it as well as he would have liked it to. Finds deep square leg, who gobbles it up. Umesh Yadav is delighted. Yuvraj c Chawla b U Yadav 9(9) [4s-2]
Boult to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, much needed boundary for SRH. A walk down the track from Shankar to on-drive the short of length delivery to the right of Boult. No chance for long-on. High elbow

Boult to Naman Ojha, SIX, he was clueless against Narine. This is a confidence booster for Ojha. Slower ball right in the slot for Ojha to swing his bat hard. Moves slightly off-side and lifts it handsomely over long-on

Coulter-Nile to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Wicket off the first ball of the over and Shankar has to take the long walk back. Shortish ball from NCN, Shankar comes forward and looks to go downtown. Ends up slicing it miles up in the air. Yadav, at long-on takes it calmly. Vijay Shankar c Suryakumar Yadav b Coulter-Nile 22(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Coulter-Nile to Jordan, out Caught&Bowled!! Another one bites the dust. Three wickets in four balls for Coulter-Nile. The ball stuck a bit on the surface. It was a shortish delivery, Jordan is a bit early to close his bat face. The leading edge flies to the left of the bowler, who times his dive to his left to perfection. A terrific catch in his followthrough. Jordan c and b Coulter-Nile 0(1)
Boult to Warner, FOUR, 140ks, short and wide. What does Warner do? No feet, just uses the leeway and forehand smacks it dead straight, over the umpire and into the fence

U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, got complete hold of it this time. Umesh Yadav looks to bring the fine leg fielder into play. Tries the short ball again, but this one had no venom, right in the zone for Dhawan who hacks it away with blazing swing of the bat

Boult to Naman Ojha, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! The off-pace delivery from a goodish length, Ojha wants to hoick it across the line, gets a fat outside edge that goes straight into the palms of Lynn at short third man. Naman Ojha c Chris Lynn b Boult 16(16) [6s-1]

U Yadav to Dhawan, out Caught by Uthappa!! There you go. I have called it. Umesh Yadav has good memories the last time he played here. Got a 3-fer I reckon. Hits the deck hard and gets good bounce which keeps rising en route to Dhawan, he looks to loft high over the infield, but he has mistimed it big time. Uthappa calls for it, steadies himself with a forward dive to complete the catch. Dhawan c Uthappa b U Yadav 11(13) [4s-1]

Y Pathan to Williamson, FOUR, class written all over it. Gives himself room outside leg and lofts Yusuf Pathan inside out over extra cover. Can't set field for that kind of a shot when you are gonna pitch around middle and leg, sheer brilliance from KW!
Chawla to Warner, SIX, Warner has mixed all his frustration and power on that shot. Attempted googly, lands too short for Warner's liking, he rocks back and fires it into the stands over mid-wicket
Coulter-Nile to Williamson, FOUR, why worry when you can play shots like these? Walks well across his stumps and meets the ball with greatest of ease, chips the punchy on-drive over mid-wicket
Coulter-Nile to Williamson, SIX, sure that time-out has helped KW. Settling into his groove now. Gets into position early and dispatches a short ball flat into the backward square stands
U Yadav to Warner, FOUR, up on his toes and off she goes! Backs away and creates all the room he wanted, flays Umesh Yadav up and over cover, no-one in the deep. Take four!
Narine to Warner, SIX, that's a massive shot! No doubt, it's Warner. Slightly short, Warner sees it and is quick to jump back in his crease. Pummels the pull into the deep mid-wicket stands
Coulter-Nile to Warner, 1 run, once again, no room on offer for Warner. It was a low full toss to Warner who was backing away. Mistimed drill to cover. Brings up the 50-run stand

Coulter-Nile to Williamson, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! The ploy to bring in NCN has worked. He has been superb at the death, but GG needed a wicket here. Fullish length delivery outside off, Williamson doesn't get underneath it and goes hard on his lofted extra drive. Finds extra cover to perfection. Williamson c Suryakumar Yadav b Coulter-Nile 24(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chawla to Warner, out Bowled!! Two big wickets within a span of three balls. This will hurt the defending champions. Piyush Chawla gets the big fish. Warner probably misjudged the length. Did that keep low? Not sure. It was a slider from a good length, Warner went back to pull it away. Misses it by a long way and the ball crashes the middle stump. Gauti is animated in his celebration. Warner b Chawla 37(35) [4s-2 6s-2]

Chawla to Yuvraj, FOUR, why do you bowl that? Easy runs on offer for Yuvraj and he gets off the mark with a delightful stroke. Quicker and overpitched outside off, Yuvi plants his front leg forward and middles the drive. No chance for long-off

Narine to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, bit like Guptill. Slogs across the line and the head is tilted downards. Slowish offie on middle and leg, Shankar swings across the line and gets good wood behind it. One bounce and into the fence. The man in the deep probably didn't pick it up

Chawla to Yuvraj, FOUR, Vijay Shankar isn't donning a helmet. I reckon, he should. Overpitched outside off, Yuvraj smacks it down the ground. Shankar did well to evade that by ducking under. That went like a bullet

Chawla to Vijay Shankar, SIX, this guy can hit it a long way. Yep, Vijay Shankar is turning it on here at the Chinnaswamy. Once again, too full from Piyush Chawla, Shankar clears his left leg and deposits it over long-on with a mighty lofted on-drive

U Yadav to Yuvraj, out Caught by Chawla!! In the air and taken. Yuvraj has to depart. The short ball does the trick. Goes for the pull shot, doesn't time it as well as he would have liked it to. Finds deep square leg, who gobbles it up. Umesh Yadav is delighted. Yuvraj c Chawla b U Yadav 9(9) [4s-2]
Boult to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, much needed boundary for SRH. A walk down the track from Shankar to on-drive the short of length delivery to the right of Boult. No chance for long-on. High elbow

Boult to Naman Ojha, SIX, he was clueless against Narine. This is a confidence booster for Ojha. Slower ball right in the slot for Ojha to swing his bat hard. Moves slightly off-side and lifts it handsomely over long-on

Coulter-Nile to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Wicket off the first ball of the over and Shankar has to take the long walk back. Shortish ball from NCN, Shankar comes forward and looks to go downtown. Ends up slicing it miles up in the air. Yadav, at long-on takes it calmly. Vijay Shankar c Suryakumar Yadav b Coulter-Nile 22(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Coulter-Nile to Jordan, out Caught&Bowled!! Another one bites the dust. Three wickets in four balls for Coulter-Nile. The ball stuck a bit on the surface. It was a shortish delivery, Jordan is a bit early to close his bat face. The leading edge flies to the left of the bowler, who times his dive to his left to perfection. A terrific catch in his followthrough. Jordan c and b Coulter-Nile 0(1)
Boult to Warner, FOUR, 140ks, short and wide. What does Warner do? No feet, just uses the leeway and forehand smacks it dead straight, over the umpire and into the fence

U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, got complete hold of it this time. Umesh Yadav looks to bring the fine leg fielder into play. Tries the short ball again, but this one had no venom, right in the zone for Dhawan who hacks it away with blazing swing of the bat

Boult to Naman Ojha, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! The off-pace delivery from a goodish length, Ojha wants to hoick it across the line, gets a fat outside edge that goes straight into the palms of Lynn at short third man. Naman Ojha c Chris Lynn b Boult 16(16) [6s-1]

U Yadav to Dhawan, out Caught by Uthappa!! There you go. I have called it. Umesh Yadav has good memories the last time he played here. Got a 3-fer I reckon. Hits the deck hard and gets good bounce which keeps rising en route to Dhawan, he looks to loft high over the infield, but he has mistimed it big time. Uthappa calls for it, steadies himself with a forward dive to complete the catch. Dhawan c Uthappa b U Yadav 11(13) [4s-1]

Y Pathan to Williamson, FOUR, class written all over it. Gives himself room outside leg and lofts Yusuf Pathan inside out over extra cover. Can't set field for that kind of a shot when you are gonna pitch around middle and leg, sheer brilliance from KW!
Chawla to Warner, SIX, Warner has mixed all his frustration and power on that shot. Attempted googly, lands too short for Warner's liking, he rocks back and fires it into the stands over mid-wicket
Coulter-Nile to Williamson, FOUR, why worry when you can play shots like these? Walks well across his stumps and meets the ball with greatest of ease, chips the punchy on-drive over mid-wicket
Coulter-Nile to Williamson, SIX, sure that time-out has helped KW. Settling into his groove now. Gets into position early and dispatches a short ball flat into the backward square stands

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Pollard!! This is a big wicket -- make no mistake about it. Bumrah was bowling from over the wicket, angles this in to cut the room on this preempted hoick over mid-wicket from Lynn. There's no arm-swinging space in front, the ball skids on to make it worse and Lynn holes out to the fielder at long-on, something Kevin Pietersen is ecstatic about on air. Chris Lynn c Pollard b Bumrah 4(8)

Krunal Pandya to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, here's the start. On the pedal. A wrong radar stuff this..down leg. Compounds the misery further with he front leg planted inside the line and then it is business as usual. The flattest of airy-sweeps you'd ever come across

Johnson to Jaggi, FOUR, the gallops are out. Jumps down, goes away, frees his arms and rubs the pressure inducing salts on the comeback. A half volley to help himself and throws everything his hands have on it to carve it through the covers

Krunal Pandya to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, the sweet sweeps. More of them. Gets one right in the slot and the premeditation does the rest. Brooms it in front of square..and well past the hopes of those perched out there

Krunal Pandya to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, now through the other side. A floater up on off, takes matters with the turn does Yadav, with a full-blooded inside-out drive. Doesn't even bother keeping it down
Malinga to Jaggi, FOUR, picks the bones out of this disguise. The literacy means that he reads the slower one, waits on it and mows it through mid-wicket. A serious move on this

Malinga to Jaggi, FOUR, a ground version of the helicopter. Not only does he share the same state, he shares the same shots too with the big man. The slower yorker, takes an eternity to dip down. Enough for the adjustment and a chopper to be unleashed. Talk about the precision in the placement too. Surgical in bisecting the two men at the fence

Karn Sharma to Jaggi, out Caught by Johnson!! The end of the rebuilding. Courtesy a stunner in the deep. And some greedy batting to go with it. Karn after a few carters doesn't really mind floating it up and he does it again. Entices Jaggi into some feet dancing. Is obliged with the same. Just that in the process he gets too close to the pitch of the delivery and the tonk-slog attempted grabs only the toe-end of the blade to fly towards long-on. A jump, an arm raise and a reverse cup - as clean as a whistle executed by the man who claims to be 35. The best Karn Sharma figures in the IPL. A time-out with that. Jaggi c Johnson b Karn Sharma 28(31) [4s-3]

Johnson to Chawla, out Caught by Rayudu!! Ends a troubled stay. Without getting his timing right, Chawla tries an uppish loft. Doesn't bother moving his feet though. Doesn't bother reaching out as well. Doesn't even bother to read the slower one. Stands, swings, toe-ends and mid-off does the rest. Kolkata innings falling apart. More to their own self-ignition. Chawla c Rayudu b Johnson 2(6)

Johnson to Coulter-Nile, SIX, here's the first of his dispatches. Where were you hiding Coulter-Nile? Gets a friendly length ball - yes. But times the leather off it with a swivelling hack. Right off the screws and right into the crowd over mid-wicket

Johnson to Coulter-Nile, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Howrah bridge is falling down. Without repair. After the softening blow, Johnson goes for his ideal sucker delivery. Full, slowed up and Coulter-Nile once again looks to use the pace with his lofted slog. Nope, none of it coming this time. Flies off the cue-end down the throat of deep mid-wicket. Coulter-Nile c Hardik Pandya b Johnson 6(4) [6s-1]

Bumrah to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Malinga!! Talk of dreamy bowling figures. 3 wickets, 2 runs. This is a T20 mind you. And a qualifier too. Bumrah helps himself to a few free ones. Bangs it in short, Yadav wants to pull it into the river. The sluggish pitch makes him wait and then spits the ball up too. Just the top edge but Malinga swirls all under it at long leg, almost messes it up and then dives to bring about a massive smile on his face. Suryakumar Yadav c Malinga b Bumrah 31(25) [4s-2 6s-1]

Bumrah to Rajpoot, FOUR, the perfect yorker. Right in the blockhole. Deserved nothing lesser than respect. Gets the boundary to its name instead. Rajpoot just about jams his bat down in the way, gets the inside edge and then banks on his luck to take it past the stumps

Malinga to Rajpoot, out Bowled!! Three slower death rattles - Rajpoot hoodwinks the first two. But the third one lights up Chinnaswamy. Whoa, talk of the ball dipping. Gets it straight on the stumps this time does Malinga, gets it slow and right on the base. Nothing that can be done with it but play all around it and Kolkata come to a grinding halt. Rajpoot b Malinga 4(7) [4s-1]
Johnson to Gambhir, FOUR, so he gets a pitched up delivery from Johnson and drives a boundary away. Why not. Room outside off, half a stride to middle it and off she goes through covers!
Malinga to Narine, SIX, there you go. Picks it off his pads and just hoicks it away with disdain. Waits in the crease and swings his bat at the right time, poppin' the ball over deep square leg

Karn Sharma to Narine, out Stumped!! Hoodwinked by the wrong 'un. No heroics from Narine then, who stormed to IPL's fastest fifty at this very ground in the league stage. Shimmies out ambitiously but Karn Sharma's bowling in the powerplay for a reason. Sees him doing that, bowls a tossed-up googly and gets him stumped. Easy take for the keeper and a disparaging flick of the bails. Narine st Parthiv Patel b Karn Sharma 10(10) [6s-1]

Bumrah to Uthappa, out Lbw!! 144ks inducker nails him in front. Gets the ball to skid on after bowling the last ball a tad slower, and hurries him into a surprise. Nipped back in and rapped the pad above the knee-roll, but since Uthappa was caught so deep in the crease - having read neither the line, length or the pace - he looks plumb. Umpire thinks for a few seconds and raises his finger. Ball tracking: shows it clipping the top of leg-stump. Uthappa lbw b Bumrah 1(3)
Karn Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, inside-out over covers. Perhaps only Raina matches him there. Reads the flight early, drags himself inside the line and then goes over covers. Boundary

Karn Sharma to Gambhir, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Now he's set him up beautifully. Fired the last one flatter and quicker, and bowls this loopier. Gambhir, to his credit, looked to have middled it - well, it sounded like that - but he finds the deep mid-wicket fielder like how you would when things aren't going your way. A struggle of an innings, coming on the day KKR least required it. Where from here for KKR? Gambhir c Hardik Pandya b Karn Sharma 12(15) [4s-2]

Karn Sharma to de Grandhomme, out Lbw!! This is anticlimactically entertaining. Didn't read the googly at all. Was bowled flat and straight on off, the ball cut in and pinned de Grandhomme in front. He had no clue. Was making room and the ball skid on to pin the back pad. What a good selection he's turning out to be. Big game, so there was every temptation to go for Harbhajan but Rohit persisted with him and see what he's done. Third wicket for just 8 runs. And he has two overs left for goodness sake. de Grandhomme lbw b Karn Sharma 0(1)

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Pollard!! This is a big wicket -- make no mistake about it. Bumrah was bowling from over the wicket, angles this in to cut the room on this preempted hoick over mid-wicket from Lynn. There's no arm-swinging space in front, the ball skids on to make it worse and Lynn holes out to the fielder at long-on, something Kevin Pietersen is ecstatic about on air. Chris Lynn c Pollard b Bumrah 4(8)

Chawla c Rayudu b Johnson 2(6)

Coulter-Nile c Hardik Pandya b Johnson 6(4) [6s-1]

Gets it straight on the stumps this time does Malinga, gets it slow and right on the base. Nothing that can be done with it but play all around it and Kolkata come to a grinding halt. Rajpoot b Malinga 4(7) [4s-1]

Shimmies out ambitiously but Karn Sharma's bowling in the powerplay for a reason. Sees him doing that, bowls a tossed-up googly and gets him stumped. Easy take for the keeper and a disparaging flick of the bails. Narine st Parthiv Patel b Karn Sharma 10(10) [6s-1]

Nipped back in and rapped the pad above the knee-roll, but since Uthappa was caught so deep in the crease - having read neither the line, length or the pace - he looks plumb. Umpire thinks for a few seconds and raises his finger. Ball tracking: shows it clipping the top of leg-stump. Uthappa lbw b Bumrah 1(3)
Karn Sharma to Gambhir, FOUR, inside-out over covers. Perhaps only Raina matches him there. Reads the flight early, drags himself inside the line and then goes over covers. Boundary

Karn Sharma to Gambhir, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Now he's set him up beautifully. Fired the last one flatter and quicker, and bowls this loopier. Gambhir, to his credit, looked to have middled it - well, it sounded like that - but he finds the deep mid-wicket fielder like how you would when things aren't going your way. A struggle of an innings, coming on the day KKR least required it. Where from here for KKR? Gambhir c Hardik Pandya b Karn Sharma 12(15) [4s-2]

Karn Sharma to de Grandhomme, out Lbw!! This is anticlimactically entertaining. Didn't read the googly at all. Was bowled flat and straight on off, the ball cut in and pinned de Grandhomme in front. He had no clue. Was making room and the ball skid on to pin the back pad. What a good selection he's turning out to be. Big game, so there was every temptation to go for Harbhajan but Rohit persisted with him and see what he's done. Third wicket for just 8 runs. And he has two overs left for goodness sake. de Grandhomme lbw b Karn Sharma 0(1)

Washington Sundar to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, in the airrrr, in the gap and a poor effort from Dan Christian meant the ball escaped for four. He had to dive, thought about it, but took a long while to react. Sundar bowls full and outside off stump, Krunal lofts the drive inside-out, could have been cut off by the man running from long-off

Zampa to Rohit, out Caught by SN Thakur!! What a moment in the game. Look at the celebrations in the RPS camp. They reckon they've pocketed the game. Rohit is livid with himself. Swings his bat hard in disappointment. He knows that he's hit a long hop to the fielder. Short and on the stumps, Rohit went back, lost balance while playing the pull shot, didn't middle it, Thakur jumped at deep mid-wicket and took the catch. The momentum was taking him back, took a couple of steps back, just managed to stay away from the rope and the third impire was convinced he didn't touch the boundary. Rohit c SN Thakur b Zampa 24(22) [4s-4]

Zampa to Pollard, SIX, wowww! What a start. This is the very venue where Pollard grabbed eyeballs during a champions league T20 game against New South Wales back in 2009. Looks like he's going to counterattack. Flighted delivery outside off stump, Pollard muscles it high over long-off

Zampa to Pollard, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! Is there MS Dhoni's mind behind this dismissal? CSK fans would know. In 2010, he had a straightish mid-off to dismiss the dangerous Pollard in the final. Now RPS got a very straight long-off - a field placement you normally don't see in cricket - and Pollard hits it straight to him. This was full and in the slot from Zampa, Pollard was in the mood to murder the ball, he went hard, hit it flat and hard, but little did he know that he fell in the trap. It's 65 for 5 now. Pollard c Manoj Tiwary b Zampa 7(3) [6s-1]

Zampa to Hardik Pandya, SIX, what a hit from the younger Pandya. Flighted delivery outside off stump, Hardik doesn't try to over-hit the ball, just lofts inside out over long-off and timed it sweetly enough to clear the rope

Christian to Hardik Pandya, out Lbw!! People were talking about slower balls, spinners doing the damage, but this bloke has run in, bowled fast and found reverse swing to trap Hardik plumb in front. A great choice of delivery with Hardik walking across the stumps. Credit to the bowler if it was a deliberate ploy to opt for the full pace delivery. This was on a good length, tailed back in, batsman played across the line and the impact was right in front of middle stump. Would have at least clipped the top of middle and off. Hardik Pandya lbw b Christian 10(9) [6s-1]

SN Thakur to Karn Sharma, out Karn Sharma Run Out!! Dropped, but Karn Sharma is run-out. An absolute pandemonium out there. Who would have thought that a team that played so well and topped the league stage would find themselves at 79 for 7 in the 15th over of the final. And that too after opting to bat first. Rohit Sharma can't watch from the sidelines. Coming to the delivery, this one swung away from the left-hander, Karn got a thick outside edge which went low to Christian's left at first slip. He couldn't hold on, meanwhile Karn thought of stealing a run, his partner wasn't sure and in the end he was stranded in the middle of the pitch. Great presence of mind from the bowler to run towards the striker's end and effect the run-out. Karn Sharma run out (Christian/SN Thakur) 1(5)

Christian to Johnson, SIX, that has been flat-batted with a lot of sinewy power! The short ball angled across and Johnson thwarted it down the ground despite not connecting it with the meat of the bat

Christian to Johnson, byes, 1 run, looks for the deft upper cut and misses. The ball lands on a couple of bounces to the keeper, who fumbles to allow the single. The man at short third man mopped it up and had a shy at the bowler's end. Had there been a direct hit, it would have been another casualty
Christian to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, length ball, no room, Krunal Pandya opens his arms and carves it away past point. The man at sweeper cover dived to make the tackle but in vain

Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, SIX, the slower ball disappears now! He held his stroke back a bit, the ball chalked the toe-end of the bat and landed well over the cow-corner for a towering, welcoming six for MI

Christian to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, full on the sticks, nothing really wrong with the ball. But Krunal Pandya moved across his line and slogged the ball away to the deep mid region for a four. Krunal is getting some momentum for MI

Christian to Krunal Pandya, SIX, Krunal Pandya is tonking them big now. That was a length ball, full and wide, Krunal Pandya smacks it down the ground with one knee on the ground. That sailed over long-on pretty easily
Christian to Johnson, 1 run, the partnership between Johnson and Krunal Pandya is now 50!! Short ball, pulled away and the ball lands on the bounce to be picked up by Rahane at deep mid

Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by SN Thakur!! The early pressure has resulted in the fall of Parthiv. This was a back of a length delivery on the stumps, it was the slower one as well. Parthiv was in no position on the pull, went high off the bat and lobbed towards Shardul at mid-on. He runs forward and accepts the catch gleefully. Just the start RPS wanted - they have been on the dot and created the pressure on the batsmen. Parthiv Patel c SN Thakur b Unadkat 4(6)

Unadkat to Simmons, out Caught&Bowled!! 'Phenomenal catch', says Matthew Hayden on air. That's a catch that might well tilt this final towards RPS. Unadkat is having a ball at the moment, this was another slower ball, he rolled his fingers across the seam. Simmons was looking to nudge it towards the on-side, was through with the shot even before it arrived, gets a thick leading edge that popped back towards the bowler. Unadkat was on his followthrough, pushes his left hand across - it was dropping down on him, he bends down really low and completes a fine one-handed catch. The momentum was always going across him, but he held on - even as his elbow hit the ground. Mobbed by his mates, rightly so. Simmons c and b Unadkat 3(8)

Christian to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Rahane!! No such luck for Pandya. The short ball is banged in slow. The batsman tried to fetch it from outside off and only manages to sky it up in the air. The man from deep mid - Rahane charges in and takes it easily. Pune need 130 to win! Krunal Pandya c Rahane b Christian 47(38) [4s-3 6s-2]

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, first boundary of the final, Ferguson offers a freebie, it was a half-volley outside off. Rohit waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and squeezes it behind square on the off-side, beats backward point and rolls away to the fence

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, Ferguson is relieving some pressure off Rohit and MI. Length ball on his pads, Rohit gleefully puts it away behind square on the on-side. It went in the air - but well wide of Unadkat at short fine

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, edged and four, streaky but Rohit will take it. On a good length and holding its line outside off, Rohit was looking to drive, the late wobble takes the edge and rolls away through the vacant slip region

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, classy, shot of ther final so far - on a good length and well wide of off. Rohit stands tall and drives it on the up - splits the gap between cover and cover-point, no need to run for those. 16 from the over and Ravi Shastri notes that MI have doubled their score
Zampa to Rayudu, FOUR, poor ball from Zampa, dropped it short and wide of off, Rayudu waits on it and cuts it hard, beats backward point to his left and rolls away to the fence

Lockie Ferguson to Rayudu, out Rayudu Run Out!! Excellent cricket from the RPS captain and MI have lost their third wicket. Coming to the ball, it was full and just outside off, Rayudu came down the track, made room and drove it towards mid-off. There was a single there - at least Rayudu thought as he called for a quick single. Smith moved across to his left, turned around and broke the stumps at the bowler's end - all in one motion. Rayudu was scrambling across, but falls well short. Rayudu run out (Smith) 12(15) [4s-1]

Washington Sundar to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, in the airrrr, in the gap and a poor effort from Dan Christian meant the ball escaped for four. He had to dive, thought about it, but took a long while to react. Sundar bowls full and outside off stump, Krunal lofts the drive inside-out, could have been cut off by the man running from long-off

Rohit c SN Thakur b Zampa 24(22) [4s-4]

Pollard c Manoj Tiwary b Zampa 7(3) [6s-1]

Hardik Pandya lbw b Christian 10(9) [6s-1]

Rohit Sharma can't watch from the sidelines. Coming to the delivery, this one swung away from the left-hander, Karn got a thick outside edge which went low to Christian's left at first slip. He couldn't hold on, meanwhile Karn thought of stealing a run, his partner wasn't sure and in the end he was stranded in the middle of the pitch. Great presence of mind from the bowler to run towards the striker's end and effect the run-out. Karn Sharma run out (Christian/SN Thakur) 1(5)

Christian to Johnson, SIX, that has been flat-batted with a lot of sinewy power! The short ball angled across and Johnson thwarted it down the ground despite not connecting it with the meat of the bat

Christian to Johnson, byes, 1 run, looks for the deft upper cut and misses. The ball lands on a couple of bounces to the keeper, who fumbles to allow the single. The man at short third man mopped it up and had a shy at the bowler's end. Had there been a direct hit, it would have been another casualty
