Christian to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, length ball, no room, Krunal Pandya opens his arms and carves it away past point. The man at sweeper cover dived to make the tackle but in vain

Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, SIX, the slower ball disappears now! He held his stroke back a bit, the ball chalked the toe-end of the bat and landed well over the cow-corner for a towering, welcoming six for MI

Christian to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, full on the sticks, nothing really wrong with the ball. But Krunal Pandya moved across his line and slogged the ball away to the deep mid region for a four. Krunal is getting some momentum for MI

Christian to Krunal Pandya, SIX, Krunal Pandya is tonking them big now. That was a length ball, full and wide, Krunal Pandya smacks it down the ground with one knee on the ground. That sailed over long-on pretty easily
Christian to Johnson, 1 run, the partnership between Johnson and Krunal Pandya is now 50!! Short ball, pulled away and the ball lands on the bounce to be picked up by Rahane at deep mid

Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by SN Thakur!! The early pressure has resulted in the fall of Parthiv. This was a back of a length delivery on the stumps, it was the slower one as well. Parthiv was in no position on the pull, went high off the bat and lobbed towards Shardul at mid-on. He runs forward and accepts the catch gleefully. Just the start RPS wanted - they have been on the dot and created the pressure on the batsmen. Parthiv Patel c SN Thakur b Unadkat 4(6)

Unadkat to Simmons, out Caught&Bowled!! 'Phenomenal catch', says Matthew Hayden on air. That's a catch that might well tilt this final towards RPS. Unadkat is having a ball at the moment, this was another slower ball, he rolled his fingers across the seam. Simmons was looking to nudge it towards the on-side, was through with the shot even before it arrived, gets a thick leading edge that popped back towards the bowler. Unadkat was on his followthrough, pushes his left hand across - it was dropping down on him, he bends down really low and completes a fine one-handed catch. The momentum was always going across him, but he held on - even as his elbow hit the ground. Mobbed by his mates, rightly so. Simmons c and b Unadkat 3(8)

Christian to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Rahane!! No such luck for Pandya. The short ball is banged in slow. The batsman tried to fetch it from outside off and only manages to sky it up in the air. The man from deep mid - Rahane charges in and takes it easily. Pune need 130 to win! Krunal Pandya c Rahane b Christian 47(38) [4s-3 6s-2]

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, first boundary of the final, Ferguson offers a freebie, it was a half-volley outside off. Rohit waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and squeezes it behind square on the off-side, beats backward point and rolls away to the fence

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, Ferguson is relieving some pressure off Rohit and MI. Length ball on his pads, Rohit gleefully puts it away behind square on the on-side. It went in the air - but well wide of Unadkat at short fine

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, edged and four, streaky but Rohit will take it. On a good length and holding its line outside off, Rohit was looking to drive, the late wobble takes the edge and rolls away through the vacant slip region

Lockie Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, classy, shot of ther final so far - on a good length and well wide of off. Rohit stands tall and drives it on the up - splits the gap between cover and cover-point, no need to run for those. 16 from the over and Ravi Shastri notes that MI have doubled their score
Zampa to Rayudu, FOUR, poor ball from Zampa, dropped it short and wide of off, Rayudu waits on it and cuts it hard, beats backward point to his left and rolls away to the fence

Lockie Ferguson to Rayudu, out Rayudu Run Out!! Excellent cricket from the RPS captain and MI have lost their third wicket. Coming to the ball, it was full and just outside off, Rayudu came down the track, made room and drove it towards mid-off. There was a single there - at least Rayudu thought as he called for a quick single. Smith moved across to his left, turned around and broke the stumps at the bowler's end - all in one motion. Rayudu was scrambling across, but falls well short. Rayudu run out (Smith) 12(15) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Rayudu, FOUR, cracking shot! First boundary of the innings. Rayudu walks down the track and in the process moves leg-side, which allows him to free his arms. The length was on the shorter side and Rayudu slapped it away over wide mid-off

Mustafizur to Watson, FOUR, in the air, over the 30-yard circle and goes for a boundary. Angled across on a fuller length and Watson is bending forward to hammer the drive. Slices over the cover region off the outside half and the quick outfield does the rest. Not a pacy ball
Markande to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, has he got enough on it? Jusssst. Shimmied down and swung hard, got it close to the bottom of the bat but the muscle behind it was good enough
Mustafizur to Jadeja, FOUR, half-volley from Mustafizur, duly hammered back through mid-off. CSK need a flurry of these to bring some life back in this contest

Mustafizur to Jadeja, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Mustafizur is too clever for Jadeja here. He saw him coming down and bowled this cutter pretty wide. Jadeja still throws his bat at it, only managing to lob it off the toe-end. No troubles for Surya at mid-off. You never say never, but it would take something sensational for CSK to turn this around. Jadeja c Suryakumar Yadav b Mustafizur 12(13) [4s-1]

Markande to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, good start this from Bravo. He picked the previous two deliveries and now he gets his dancing shoes on to get to the pitch of the ball. It's followed by his trademark flourish to launch it over long-on

Markande to Chahar, out Stumped!! Oh dear. It's easy to be critical of players sometimes, but what was Chahar thinking here. First ball against a bowler who's bowling so well, he comes galloping down for an ugly slog. Completely done in by the length as this googly slips through the inside edge for an easy stumping. Chahar st Ishan Kishan b Markande 0(1)
Mustafizur to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, stuck in the crease while flashing a drive away from the body, runs away off the edge for four. Third man was up in the ring

Mustafizur to Harbhajan, FOUR, McClenaghan has let this sneak right through him. Poor from the fast bowler. Mustafizur turns around in disgust. Good length ball slanted outside off, squirted off a thick edge and should have only been a single down to third man

McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, Bravo keeps fighting. He charges down the track while making enough room for himself to carve this short ball over cover. It was more of a slice, but he's still able to beat sweeper cover to his right

McClenaghan to Harbhajan, out Caught by Bumrah!! Strange shot from Harbhajan, almost waving this short ball down to third man. Probably he got a bit too cramped for room, so he couldn't go through with this upper cut. Nothing shot in the end, just gliding it down the fielder's throat. Bravo has started well at the other end, but he's now in danger of running out of partners. Harbhajan c Bumrah b McClenaghan 8(5) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, stunning shot over extra-cover from Bravo. For once, Bumrah offers a length which the batsman can get under, and Bravo - leaning back - smokes it inside-out. How did he manage to generate that power! Hits flush on the cushions

Hardik Pandya to Mark Wood, out Caught by Mustafizur!! Oh boy, how lucky is Pandya! Filthy drag-down on leg-stump, but instead of hitting it into Churchgate station, Wood hits it straight down fine leg's throat. Pandya is struggling though as he immediately bends over in evident pain. Absolutely no joy on his face for the wicket. Mark Wood c Mustafizur b Hardik Pandya 1(3)
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, full ball on middle, Bravo gets his front leg out of the way and belts it over long-off. Not a clean contact, but this isn't the biggest ground
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, back-to-back sixes! Sublime wrists from Bravo as he whips it off the pads and sends it sailing into the deep mid-wicket stands
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, bangs it in short seeing Bravo advance, but is still spanked away into the boundary. He's got himself in that kind of zone, where most things are disappearing

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, this is awesome. This is so awesome. Bumrah - one of best T20 bowlers going around - has been effortlessly creamed into the long-off stands. Fifty off just 25 balls for Bravo. Now this should set the cat among the pigeons

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, Hardik Pandya slaps the seat in frustration as he sits in the dugout. Another six. This game has come alive out of nowhere. Bumrah goes round the wicket, bowls a full toss on the pads and is whipped over mid-wicket
Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, Wankhede is coming unglued here. The stadium is rocking for Bravo. Low full toss, he's heaved it over deep mid-wicket, just over the fielder

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Rohit!! A 20-run over from Bumrah has been redeemed right at the end. Bravo's gone. But has the damage been done? Short ball, Bravo swings hard but slices it up to extra-cover. Seven needed from six. Get ready to lose your mind. Dwayne Bravo c Rohit b Bumrah 68(30) [4s-3 6s-7]

Mustafizur to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, he's scooped this for six, he's scooped this for six. Kedar Jadhav.... Oh my. Imran Tahir drops his bat and runs across to hug Jadhav. There's another run to go, but he doesn't care. Good length cutter angled across off, Jadhav bends over - bad hamstring and all - and finds the leverage to lift it over short fine leg. Chennai players are clapping violently

Mustafizur to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, he has done it! Make way for the men in yellow, for there are plenty of them who are storming to the middle to jump over Jadhav. Careful of that hamstring though. Oh forget about it, no one cares anymore. Full ball from Mustafizur, drilled through the covers. What a finish. Unbelievable
Mustafizur to Rayudu, FOUR, nine off the over! Fuller length delivery attacking the stumps, Rayudu stays leg-side of the ball and creams the drive through vacant extra cover

Hardik Pandya to Watson, SIX, glorious shot! And that's gone all the way. Wow. Fuller ball and Pandya got it swing away in the air. Doesn't bother Watson, who walked forward, crouched low and elevated it over extra cover. Off the meat of the bat

Hardik Pandya to Watson, out Caught by Lewis!! Watson holes out in the deep. The slower ball does the trick. It was bowled at 120kph and Watson didn't pick that. Covered the line and moved across to flick. Plays a touch too early and that leads to his downfall. Off the lower protion of the bat. The ball settles straight into the hands of Lewis at long leg. Straightforward catch. Mumbai have the breakthrough! Watson c Lewis b Hardik Pandya 16(14) [4s-1 6s-1]
Hardik Pandya to Rayudu, FOUR, a wicket and 12 runs off the over! Pandya slightly overpitches and Rayudu took full toll of it. Bent forward and laced the drive wide of mid-off

McClenaghan to Rayudu, FOUR, nice batting! Moved slightly towards leg-side as the bowler was running to deliver the ball. That allowed him to free his arms. Shortish ball and Rayudu cracked it over cover-point. Powerfully hit and in the gap as well

Hardik Pandya to Rayudu, 1 run, direct hit would have made things interesting. Another slower ball, the knuckle ball this time. Rayudu gets squared up and defends off the outside part to backward point. The fielder has a shy at the stumps, misses by a long way and Raina is hit on his wrists. A direct hit would have been curtains for the southpaw

Hardik Pandya to Raina, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! The Pandya brothers have scalped Raina here. Normal-paced hit-the-deck-hard back of a length delivery from Hardik. Raina backwed away and wanted to go over the in-field, with this being the last ball of the powerplay. Mistimes it off the top poetion of the bat and finds mid-on. Krunal takes a step back and grabs it over his head. Raina c Krunal Pandya b Hardik Pandya 4(6)

Markande to Rayudu, out Lbw!! Two dots and Rayudu is trapped lbw. He has a chat with his partner and takes the right call - doesn't review. What a start for Mayank Markande! After two leg-breaks, he bowls a googly and gets a wicket off the third ball in his IPL career. A premeditated shot attempted by Rayudu. Got down on his knee and tried to play the booming sweep shot. Missed and got hit on the back thigh in front of middle. That's plumb. Rayudu lbw b Markande 22(19) [4s-4]

Markande to Dhoni, out Lbw!! Dhoni doesn't spot the googly and pinned in front of middle. Chris Gaffaney shakes his head in denial. That looked plumb. Mumbai Indians review. Fair delivery. Nothing on the UltraEdge. Three reds and Dhoni is gone for a single digit score. Markande is having a ball here at the Wankhede. Second wicket for him with the wrong 'un. Should have been three. The quickish googly and Dhoni wasn't commited - either on the front foot or on the back foot. Didn't pick it at all and got beaten on the inside edge by a fair margin. The impact was on the back leg adjacent to off and middle. Can't get more plumb than that. Dhoni lbw b Markande 5(5)

Chahar to Rohit, FOUR, first boundary of IPL 2018, first runs of the tournament as well, on a good length and well outside off, Rohit's feet went nowhere as he extended his arms on the drive, hits it in the air and through the gap at extra-cover, no one moved

Tahir to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, not an ideal start for Imran Tahir in this IPL. Too full outside off, Ishan Kishan slammed it straight of long-off where DJ Bravo fumbles after putting a desperate dive to his left
Tahir to Ishan Kishan, SIX, clears his front leg and whacks Tahir over long-on. The fielder there seemed interested for a fleeting moment, but Ishan Kishan got a decent piece of it

Tahir to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, boom! Tahir is spraying it full, Ishan Kishan pouncing on it like a famished tiger. Uses his bottom hand power to biff it straight down the ground, whistles past the non-striker

Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, they are going for the shots now. Short ball, arrives lazily...gives Suryakumar Yadav ample time to pick his spot, he bludgeons the pull over mid-wicket with disdain

Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, through Jaddu's fingers at mid-off. Length ball outside off, Suryakumar Yadav stays leg-side of the ball and carves it flirtingly past the fieldsman at mid-off. Jaddu leapt full length, but the execution from Yadav was too good

Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, showing his range now Suryakumar Yadav. Doesn't shy away from staying good few inches outside the crease and thumps the ball over a helpless mid-off this time. Gee, this is some clean striking

Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Second wicket for Watto and a much-needed one for CSK. Watson doesn't deviate from his tried and tested ploy which is to dig it short at a subtle, slower pace, Suryakumar Yadav falls into the trap and mistimes the pull into the mitts of Bhajji at long leg. A set trap this and Suryakumar Yadav departs after an entertaining knock. Suryakumar Yadav c Harbhajan b Watson 43(29) [4s-6 6s-1]
Mark Wood to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, easily done. Short ball angling into the body, Pandya half-ducks and swats, the ball grazes the top edge and runs away...

Mark Wood to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, can't stop Hardik Pandya, not when he gets short balls. Mark Wood went wide of the crease and sprayed this in to cramp Pandya up for room, but what does Pandya do? Just arches back nonchalantly and ramps the ball cleanly with an open bat face via third man

Tahir to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Mark Wood!! Aimless swing at the ball and the result? Caught at short third man. Walks across, gets down on one knee and swings hard at a googly, always a risk playing against the turn and thus, the top-edge lands as a dolly in the hands of the Durham lad. Ishan Kishan c Mark Wood b Tahir 40(29) [4s-4 6s-1]

Tahir to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, the big brother is taking no sighters. He wants a move-on rightaway. Gets a half-volley outside off and Krunal Pandya slam-bangs it through covers. Don't bother running..
Mark Wood to Krunal Pandya, SIX, Krunal Pandya second guessed Mark Wood there. Waits for the slower short ball and marmalizes it into the mid-wicket stands with zero tolerance...

Mark Wood to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, pace can be your enemy sometimes, like on this occasion when you lose your radar. Short and slipping down leg, Krunal Pandya gets inside the line and tickles it away past a diving short fine to his left

Mark Wood to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, what do you do when your big brother plays shots like that. Just stand and admire at the other end. Hardik Pandya restricted to a spectator role this over and rightly so. Half-volley from Mark Wood, deserved to be punished, Krunal Pandya lashes it through covers making life difficult for the fielders inside the ring
Mark Wood to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, pitched up outside off, Krunal Pandya clears his front leg and hammers it straight past the non-striker. No-one's stopping that

Mark Wood to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, an action replay of the previous delivery, only difference? Krunal Pandya hit this dead straight. Overpitched, sent racing into the fence with a absolute thwack of the willow

Mark Wood to Krunal Pandya, SIX, a poor outing for Mark Wood on his IPL debut. Was too predictable on most occasions. Krunal Pandya prepares himself for a short delivery and swings the pull with full flow into the square leg stands

Dwayne Bravo to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, off-pace, on a good length outside off, Hardik Pandya stands outside off-stump and pumps it down to long-on. Krunal Pandya forced his brother for the second and they make it easily in the end

Chahar to Lewis, out Lbw!! A duck on his IPL debut for Lewis, but he wants a review. It's for a LBW call, umpire Gaffaney was quick to raise his finger, it's a fair delivery, the ball swung back in and thudded into Lewis's pads, he fell over on the flick and missed. Ultraedge confirms that there's no bat. Hawk-Eye in and it's umpire's call on hitting. Stays with the original decision and Lewis is OUT. A piece of history created in the IPL, Lewis becomes the first player to use DRS. This was full and swung back into the left-hander, Lewis fell across on the flick and missed, Chahar was on all fours as he turned back in appeal, the impact was in front of middle and leg, the ball was skimming the outer half of leg-stump. Good enough for the decision to stand. Lewis lbw b Chahar 0(2)

Watson to Rohit, SIX, lovely, this should give plenty of confidence for Rohit, on a good length and well wide of off, Rohit reaches out, plays with an open face and slices it high and over cover, has enough to clear the ropes on the full

Watson to Rohit, out Caught by Rayudu!! This was coming, Rohit never looked at home and he's sent packing, huge blow for the Mumbai Indians, they have been rocked early in their fortress. On a good length and a hint of shape away from the right-hander, Rohit was looking to clout it over mid-wicket, doesn't cover for the movement, gets a thick top-edge, high and towards backward point. Rayudu - his partner until last season, calls for the high catch, keeps his cool and holds onto it. Dream start for the Super KIngs on their return from wilderness. Rohit c Rayudu b Watson 15(18) [4s-1 6s-1]

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cracking shot, the shot of the day so far, fraction short and just wide of off, Suryakumar stands tall and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover and rolls away to the fence

Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely, Suryakumar is looking attractive, back of a length and just outside off, Suryakumar stays back, gets on top of the bounce and punches it into the gap past cover, no need to run for those

Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, beautifully played, too full and too straight from Watson, ends up drifting onto Suryakumar's pads, he prods across, picks up the length and flicks it stylishly over mid-wicket, has enough to clear the ropes on the full

Jadeja to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, nicely played by Kishan, fraction too full and wide of off, Kishan lunges across and then plays a cross-batted swipe past cover, the fielder in the deep at long-off is very square and has no chance

Jadeja to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, nicely played by Kishan, this was dropped short and well wide of off, Kishan waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and then dabs it past MS's gloves, RJ has his hands on his head, but that was supremely well played
Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cracking shot, too short and too wide of off, Suryakumar makes room and clatters it past cover, no chance for the man in the deep

Mohit Sharma to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Axar!! In the air.....gone! Went miles up in the air but unfortunately for Shankar, he hasn't got the distance on this one. It was banged in short by Mohit and Shankar went for the pull. Struck him high on the blade and flew towards deep mid-wicket where Axar settled under the skier. Easy catch. Shankar was trying to force the pace a bit but just couldn't execute the stroke well. Vijay Shankar c Axar b Mohit Sharma 13(13)

Mohit Sharma to Pant, FOUR, crunched away! Too full from Mohit and Pant lays into the drive, smashes it towards wide long-off where Karun put in a desperate slide. Got a hand on it but couldn't stop it cleanly. First boundary for Pant
Ashwin to Gambhir, 1 run, very full and outside off, drilled down the ground to long-off, 36th IPL fifty for Gambhir! What a way to start the season! He's looked ominous right from the word go today

Andrew Tye to Pant, FOUR, not entirely in control but gets the result. Another slower ball variation from Tye and Pant is early into the slog. Skies it high towards deep mid-wicket but it's in the gap. Finds the fence

Andrew Tye to Pant, SIX, oh ho ho! Middles this like a dream! That sound off the blade, wow! Back of a length, sits up nicely for Pant who smokes it deep into the stands at mid-wicket. It was just a bit of a short arm jab, such power from the young man

Andrew Tye to Pant, FOUR, Pant has switched onto top gear! We could be in for some real carnage if he bats for a while. Attempted slower bouncer but Pant gets inside the line in a flash and pulls it easily over short fine leg. Proactive batting and Tye is under serious pressure here

Mujeeb to Pant, FOUR, such strong bottom hand! Wow! This kid certainly packs a punch, doesn't he? Fired fuller by Mujeeb and Pant was on the charge, adjusts to drill it powerfully past the bowler. Long-on had no chance

Mujeeb to Pant, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! Mujeeb has his revenge! Must say this was an ugly stroke from Pant, lost his shape completely on the slog after using his feet. It was looped up nicely and was the one that spun across him, too much to do for the southpaw and all he managed to do was slice it high towards extra cover. What about the catch though? Tye had to backtrack with his back to the ball but judged it beautifully and timed the slide really well. Massive wicket for KXIP. Pant was looking deadly. Pant c Andrew Tye b Mujeeb 28(13) [4s-4 6s-1]

Mujeeb to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, what a shot to start! Gee, Tewatia has come out with a mission. Doesn't bother to have a look at Mujeeb's variation and opts for the reverse sweep straight away. It was the same shot that got Munro but Tewatia connects well to send it soaring over backward point

Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, out Gambhir Run Out!! Brilliance from Mujeeb! Direct hits are always dangerous and it's proven this time. Slower ball on leg, Tye got away with this delivery as fine leg was up in the ring. Mujeeb was quick to attack the ball and threw down the stumps at the keeper's end in a flash. Initially seemed like Gambhir made it but he was just short. These direct hits I tell you. This Afghan lad is a champion, isn't he? What a debut! Gambhir run out (Mujeeb) 55(42) [4s-5 6s-1]

Ashwin to Rahul Tewatia, out Lbw!! Another reverse sweep dismissal! Tewatia started his innings with a similar one but this time, like Munro earlier in the afternoon, misses it to be trapped LBW. Tewatia tries to repeat the stroke but ends up losing his balance and is all over the place as he gets pinged before the stumps. Looked dead plumb. Probably didn't pick the leg break at all. KXIP chipping away at the wickets here at the back end. DD need a strong finish. Rahul Tewatia lbw b Ashwin 9(7) [4s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, SIX, H-U-G-E! When this man connects well, the ball is going to fly deep into the stands. Slower ball on a good length, Morris preempted the charge down the track and had a clean golf-like swing. Way into the crowd at long-on. Much-needed one for DD

Andrew Tye to Christian, SIX, smacked away! Takes full toll of the extra delivery, does Christian. Full and in the slot for him, he just hacks it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. DD needed that badly, they certainly did

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, FOUR, just wide of Tye's outstretched hands running to his left from deep mid-wicket. Had a lot of work to do but was never really going to get to it. Slower ball on a shortish length and Morris went for the forehand smash. Mistimed it but luckily, got it in the gap. Or nearly in the gap. Doesn't matter how they come as long as they do

Mujeeb to Munro, out Lbw!! There's that early wicket that Mujeeb is so used to. Takes three balls to take his first wicket in IPL. Munro preempts the reverse-sweep but loses his balance altogether in doing so. Mujeeb ripped the ball a little extra with his index finger, meaning the ball was drifting in and gaining pace off the deck. Skids on and pins Munro on the thigh. Munro lbw b Mujeeb 4(6)

Mohit Sharma to Christian, out Bowled!! Kaboom! Who says the yorker has gone out of fashion? It never has and it never will. Lovely yorker from Mohit, on the base of off stump and Christian was making room to slam it through cover. Too good a nut for him and he fails to get his bat down in time. Timber it is! DD finish on 166/7. Is it enough? Christian b Mohit Sharma 13(13) [6s-1]
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, quintessentially Gambhir. Axar was from round the wicket to the left-hander, Gambhir charges down whilst making some room and lofts it through extra cover. Superb hit
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, now a one-kneed stylish slog-whip over deep square leg. Axar fired it in and sees it flying round the corner

Axar to Gambhir, SIX, wow. Just wow. This is sheer timing. Also shows you how good the pitch is. Makes some early room down leg and just chips it. Carries well over the long-off boundary. See it to believe it
Mujeeb to Gambhir, FOUR, lovely shot again. Makes room as he charges out and clouts it inside-out over extra cover. He'll keep doing that all day

Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, no run, a review for LBW. Looks high to the naked eye but gee that's hit Shreyas Iyer on the back pad, above the knee roll. Carrom ball I think, which skids on instead of turning away. Beats the batsman for pace and goes through Iyer, who's standing on his back foot to meet that. Ball-tracking is in and it's umpire's call on height, as suspected

Andrew Tye to Gambhir, FOUR, cracks away a pull shot. Who said he's not good with the short balls. Rises in sync with the height on this short delivery and pumps it through square leg. Another great shot today from the master
Axar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's a shot with wings. Lands deep into the crowd. Time for Shreyas Iyer to use his feet. Ingests the flight and burps out an 85-meter six over Axar's head

Axar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Rahul!! Gone. Hit a six earlier in the over and now perishes in trying to drive along the ground. That's modern cricket in a nutshell. A bit of drift away from the batsman, which is why Shreyas Iyer stretched his front foot right across, but a bit of spin did him in. Something that you didn't expect out of Axar but he's produced it. Shreyas Iyer c Rahul b Axar 11(11) [6s-1]
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, top-edge through fine leg. A delivery going down leg from over the wicket, the left-hander is in no shape to sweep that. Goes for it and gets lucky

Mohit Sharma to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Axar!! In the air.....gone! Went miles up in the air but unfortunately for Shankar, he hasn't got the distance on this one. It was banged in short by Mohit and Shankar went for the pull. Struck him high on the blade and flew towards deep mid-wicket where Axar settled under the skier. Easy catch. Shankar was trying to force the pace a bit but just couldn't execute the stroke well. Vijay Shankar c Axar b Mohit Sharma 13(13)

Mohit Sharma to Pant, FOUR, crunched away! Too full from Mohit and Pant lays into the drive, smashes it towards wide long-off where Karun put in a desperate slide. Got a hand on it but couldn't stop it cleanly. First boundary for Pant
Ashwin to Gambhir, 1 run, very full and outside off, drilled down the ground to long-off, 36th IPL fifty for Gambhir! What a way to start the season! He's looked ominous right from the word go today

Andrew Tye to Pant, FOUR, not entirely in control but gets the result. Another slower ball variation from Tye and Pant is early into the slog. Skies it high towards deep mid-wicket but it's in the gap. Finds the fence

Andrew Tye to Pant, SIX, oh ho ho! Middles this like a dream! That sound off the blade, wow! Back of a length, sits up nicely for Pant who smokes it deep into the stands at mid-wicket. It was just a bit of a short arm jab, such power from the young man

Andrew Tye to Pant, FOUR, Pant has switched onto top gear! We could be in for some real carnage if he bats for a while. Attempted slower bouncer but Pant gets inside the line in a flash and pulls it easily over short fine leg. Proactive batting and Tye is under serious pressure here

Mujeeb to Pant, FOUR, such strong bottom hand! Wow! This kid certainly packs a punch, doesn't he? Fired fuller by Mujeeb and Pant was on the charge, adjusts to drill it powerfully past the bowler. Long-on had no chance

Mujeeb to Pant, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! Mujeeb has his revenge! Must say this was an ugly stroke from Pant, lost his shape completely on the slog after using his feet. It was looped up nicely and was the one that spun across him, too much to do for the southpaw and all he managed to do was slice it high towards extra cover. What about the catch though? Tye had to backtrack with his back to the ball but judged it beautifully and timed the slide really well. Massive wicket for KXIP. Pant was looking deadly. Pant c Andrew Tye b Mujeeb 28(13) [4s-4 6s-1]

Mujeeb to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, what a shot to start! Gee, Tewatia has come out with a mission. Doesn't bother to have a look at Mujeeb's variation and opts for the reverse sweep straight away. It was the same shot that got Munro but Tewatia connects well to send it soaring over backward point

Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, out Gambhir Run Out!! Brilliance from Mujeeb! Direct hits are always dangerous and it's proven this time. Slower ball on leg, Tye got away with this delivery as fine leg was up in the ring. Mujeeb was quick to attack the ball and threw down the stumps at the keeper's end in a flash. Initially seemed like Gambhir made it but he was just short. These direct hits I tell you. This Afghan lad is a champion, isn't he? What a debut! Gambhir run out (Mujeeb) 55(42) [4s-5 6s-1]

Ashwin to Rahul Tewatia, out Lbw!! Another reverse sweep dismissal! Tewatia started his innings with a similar one but this time, like Munro earlier in the afternoon, misses it to be trapped LBW. Tewatia tries to repeat the stroke but ends up losing his balance and is all over the place as he gets pinged before the stumps. Looked dead plumb. Probably didn't pick the leg break at all. KXIP chipping away at the wickets here at the back end. DD need a strong finish. Rahul Tewatia lbw b Ashwin 9(7) [4s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, SIX, H-U-G-E! When this man connects well, the ball is going to fly deep into the stands. Slower ball on a good length, Morris preempted the charge down the track and had a clean golf-like swing. Way into the crowd at long-on. Much-needed one for DD

Andrew Tye to Christian, SIX, smacked away! Takes full toll of the extra delivery, does Christian. Full and in the slot for him, he just hacks it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. DD needed that badly, they certainly did

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, FOUR, just wide of Tye's outstretched hands running to his left from deep mid-wicket. Had a lot of work to do but was never really going to get to it. Slower ball on a shortish length and Morris went for the forehand smash. Mistimed it but luckily, got it in the gap. Or nearly in the gap. Doesn't matter how they come as long as they do

Mujeeb to Munro, out Lbw!! There's that early wicket that Mujeeb is so used to. Takes three balls to take his first wicket in IPL. Munro preempts the reverse-sweep but loses his balance altogether in doing so. Mujeeb ripped the ball a little extra with his index finger, meaning the ball was drifting in and gaining pace off the deck. Skids on and pins Munro on the thigh. Munro lbw b Mujeeb 4(6)

Mohit Sharma to Christian, out Bowled!! Kaboom! Who says the yorker has gone out of fashion? It never has and it never will. Lovely yorker from Mohit, on the base of off stump and Christian was making room to slam it through cover. Too good a nut for him and he fails to get his bat down in time. Timber it is! DD finish on 166/7. Is it enough? Christian b Mohit Sharma 13(13) [6s-1]
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, quintessentially Gambhir. Axar was from round the wicket to the left-hander, Gambhir charges down whilst making some room and lofts it through extra cover. Superb hit
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, now a one-kneed stylish slog-whip over deep square leg. Axar fired it in and sees it flying round the corner

Axar to Gambhir, SIX, wow. Just wow. This is sheer timing. Also shows you how good the pitch is. Makes some early room down leg and just chips it. Carries well over the long-off boundary. See it to believe it
Mujeeb to Gambhir, FOUR, lovely shot again. Makes room as he charges out and clouts it inside-out over extra cover. He'll keep doing that all day

Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, no run, a review for LBW. Looks high to the naked eye but gee that's hit Shreyas Iyer on the back pad, above the knee roll. Carrom ball I think, which skids on instead of turning away. Beats the batsman for pace and goes through Iyer, who's standing on his back foot to meet that. Ball-tracking is in and it's umpire's call on height, as suspected

Andrew Tye to Gambhir, FOUR, cracks away a pull shot. Who said he's not good with the short balls. Rises in sync with the height on this short delivery and pumps it through square leg. Another great shot today from the master
Axar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's a shot with wings. Lands deep into the crowd. Time for Shreyas Iyer to use his feet. Ingests the flight and burps out an 85-meter six over Axar's head

Axar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Rahul!! Gone. Hit a six earlier in the over and now perishes in trying to drive along the ground. That's modern cricket in a nutshell. A bit of drift away from the batsman, which is why Shreyas Iyer stretched his front foot right across, but a bit of spin did him in. Something that you didn't expect out of Axar but he's produced it. Shreyas Iyer c Rahul b Axar 11(11) [6s-1]
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, top-edge through fine leg. A delivery going down leg from over the wicket, the left-hander is in no shape to sweep that. Goes for it and gets lucky
Chahal to Narine, FOUR, here he is! Not wasting any time. He's at it. It's a tossed up delivery around off, Narine grounds his knee and pummels it dead straight over the bowler's head. Four runs!

Chahal to Narine, SIX, a maximum! Even better than the first one. Loopy delivery around off, Narine goes down and slogs it over mid-wicket. Half a dozen more as it just clears the fence. Was a flat one!

Woakes to Chris Lynn, FOUR, first boundary for Lynn. Lucky to be still out there though. This was a full length delivery around off, Lynn swings hard at it and gets an inside edge, past the stumps and beats the fielder at short fine leg

Woakes to Chris Lynn, out Caught by de Villiers!! This was always coming. Lynn never looked in tonight. Struggled a tad initially and throws his wicket away eventually. It's a slower delivery, shortish in length too. The big man goes after it with a single handed shot and gets no sort of connection. Miscues it over mid-off where de Villiers sprints to his left and gulps it down. Chris Lynn c de Villiers b Woakes 5(8) [4s-1]
Washington Sundar to Karthik, FOUR, you don't bowl full tosses to DK. Not when he's in such form. DK leans forward a touch and belts the leather through covers, blazed away...
Chahal to Karthik, FOUR, 'please hit-me,' will you? Short and wide delivery, DK rocks back and murders the cut in the gap between backward point and cover-point. See ya later...
Chahal to Karthik, FOUR, overcorrects and floats one up under DK's eyes, he thumps the drive through extra cover, wowza! What bat speed..
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, SIX, Nitish Rana, gee he is some talent! Shimmies down, gets to the pitch of the ball and sends the cherry soaring straight over the sightscreen. Thwackkk

Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, out Lbw!! Nitish Rana has been given out lbw. He reviews after a brief contemplation with his skipper. Legal delivery. Nothing on the UltraEdge which means no bat involved. Waiting for ball-tracking... Nitish Rana though isn't waiting for anyone. He keeps walking back to the pavilion and rightly so. Umpire's call on hitting clubbed with a couple of reds. KKR won't lose the review, but they lose Nitish Rana. Cleverly bowled by Sundar there. Went wide of the crease and bowled the slider on a goodish length, beat Rana on the sweep and pinged him in line with middle stump. Looked rather close to the naked eye, but technology always finds ways to surprise us. Just brushing the top of leg peg according to HawkEye. Nitish Rana lbw b Washington Sundar 34(25) [4s-2 6s-2]

Woakes to Rinku Singh, FOUR, pressure? What's the spelling of that word? This guy seems to have exactly that sort of attitude. Gallops down the pitch, doesn't matter who's bowling, stamps his authority with a rollicking thump over mid-on. Came off the cue end, but he's got it under control with strong bottom hand power

Woakes to Rinku Singh, out Caught by de Kock!! RCB review: Rinku Singh pulled and seemed to have missed it IMO, but the opinion that matters is that of the TV umpire. So, let's wait and go through the process. Legal delivery. QDK wasn't excited after grabbing the ball. Virat Kohli and a couple of ring fielders got excited and the RCB skipper wasted no time in posing a T-sign to the onfield umpire, and he is absolutely right in doing so. A spike on the UltraEdge and Rinku Singh is gone. A very faint one that and hard to spot amidst the fuzzy environment. The decision has been reversed. OUT. This is a classic case of both batsman and bowler refusing to alter their plans. Woakes dished out a short ball and made life difficult for Rinku Singh by cutting it across him, the angle was always going against him. He ran down the pitch and fed a faint nick on the pull. Rinku Singh c de Kock b Woakes 6(6) [4s-1]
U Yadav to A Russell, FOUR, length ball in the slot, goodbye! Russell clears his front leg and swats him over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

U Yadav to A Russell, FOUR, goes full and goes for a journey! There's no-one at deep extra cover, so what does Russell do? Manufactures ample room and lifts Umesh Yadav over extra cover, the timing on the shot takes care of the rest
U Yadav to A Russell, SIX, conceded 12 runs in his first 3 overs and now 15. T20 things! A candyfloss on middle and leg-stump, Russell muscles it many-a-mile over wide long-on for a maximum

Woakes to A Russell, out Caught by de Villiers!! Terrific catch from AB running back. Avoided a massive collison with B-Mac there. It was bowled full and wide, asking Russell to fetch from that far, he goes after it and clubs it high into the night sky. AB from extra cover runs back, keeps his eyes on the ball and completes a splendid catch running back. B-Mac was charging from long-on, but he did well to stay low and dive to avoid bombarding into AB. A Russell c de Villiers b Woakes 15(11) [4s-2 6s-1]
Woakes to Karthik, FOUR, errs in line this time, short and angling into the body, DK rolls his wrists and nails the pull through mid-wicket

Kulwant Khejroliya to Vinay Kumar, 1 run, dropped! Washington Sundar at deep cover. VK slapped this length ball over cover, Sundar came running in and seemed to have judged well to snaffle the ball under his throat, but just as he rolled over to avoid the tumble, the ball slipped out of his grasp. Unlucky!

Kulwant Khejroliya to Vinay Kumar, FOUR, clears his front leg and lays the finishing marker on the game. AB at mid-on slides to his left, but realizes that's too far to fetch. So, Dinesh Karthik and KKR start off their campaign in style, a morale-boosting 4-wicket win over RCB. A typical slog from Vinay Kumar, all he needed to do was clear mid-off and boy did he hit that hard! Comfortably past mid-on

Washington Sundar to Uthappa, SIX, excellent shot to end the over. He can do this, doesn't matter if Lynn is back to the pavilion. Gets sight of the loopy delivery, sets under it and smokes it right over the bowler's head. In fact a tad to his left, but it's a clean strike. Long-on is a mere spectator

Woakes to Narine, SIX, raining sixes already, we are already in the fourth over. This is the third six of the innings. It's a slower delivery by Woakes, Narine waits for it calmly and bludgeons it right over long-on. Off to a flier is Sunil
Woakes to Narine, FOUR, no stopping him, it seems. Short of a length and outside off, Narine slaps hard and evades the fielder at cover-point. He's in the zone folks!

Woakes to Narine, FOUR, beats the chasing RCB skipper this time around. It's a lightning quick outfield, just look at it. Even the fast moving feet of Kohli can't stop this. Fullish in length around off and Narine creams it through covers. The ball's lost, somewhere under the covers.

Woakes to Narine, SIX, 20 runs off the over! This is boom boom Sunil Narine. Gets hold of the slower delivery yet again, it's slower in pace too. Plenty of time for the entertainer to camp back and clobber it over mid-wicket. The crowd has gone berserk

Washington Sundar to Narine, FOUR, he's taking down RCB single handedly, is he? Remember he scored the fastest IPL fifty against the same opposition last year (a record that was broken by a manic Rahul earlier today). Comes down the wicket and slaughters this one past mid-off

Washington Sundar to Narine, SIX, toying with the bowler, toying with his lines, toying with his lengths. This is a full toss and Narine simply dances down the wicket and wallops it over long-off. Six more! Can't hear anything, the crowd is loving it and so is Narine

Washington Sundar to Narine, SIX, that's caught, but the fielder has touched the fence in the momentum. Narine whipped this gift to mid-wicket where Mandeep caught it but at the same time was in contact with the cushions. Needs only one more to complete a fifty

Washington Sundar to Narine, 1 run, 50 off 17 balls! Can you believe it? He has done it again. He's making a habit of it. Charges down the wicket and whips the floated delivery to deep mid-wicket. Reaches the milestone and raises the bat, acknowledges the crowd!

U Yadav to Narine, out Bowled!! Umesh Yadav strikes. It's the ex-Knight Rider who gets his former team mate. Bowls a low full toss outside off and that's enough for Umesh to get him a wicket. Narine goes ahead with his drive and ends up getting an inside edge on to the sticks. Entertaining knock, neverthess. Some breather for the Challengers! Narine b U Yadav 50(19) [4s-4 6s-5]

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nitish Rana, SIX, crack made the sound, there! Shortish in length, Rana has had enough of those. Rocks back and pulls this nicely into the night sky, high and handsome, over mid-wicket for a biggie
Kulwant Khejroliya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Rana plays this one with only one hand, it came off as he threw his hand at it, ends up slicing it past third man to find the fence

U Yadav to Uthappa, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! Umesh is making a huge impact on this game. Has got two big wickets so far and is looking good to get a few more, believe me. Bowls a short and quick delivery around off, Uthappa who was committed into the shot goes ahead with it. Slaps it horizontally and gets a top-edge. McCullum at point has all the time in the world to settle under the skier and take it. Uthappa c Brendon McCullum b U Yadav 13(12) [6s-1]

U Yadav to Nitish Rana, FOUR, that was timed to perfection. Short of a length around off, Rana stands tall and chips this over mid-on. High elbows and poses for the camera. Not to forget the effort by AB though, sprinted back, kept his eyes on the ball and almost pulled it off

Vinay Kumar to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's not the start Karthik would have wanted from a senior pro. A classic case of nerves from the opening bowler because it is not all that easy to control the new ball immediately. Bowls a freebie length ball down the leg-side and McCullum gleefully flicks the ball behind square past the man at 45

Vinay Kumar to Brendon McCullum, SIX, top edgeeee, but fine leg is inside the ring. Wouldn't have mattered though because it cleared the rope. Shortish from Vinay Kumar, McCullum goes for the pull and gets a thick edge, the bat swing is hard enough for the ball to have enough legs

Vinay Kumar to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, turns out to be a really poor over from Vinay Kumar, didn't bowl to the field. He bowls another one down the leg-side and you can't do that with fine leg inside the line. McCullum calmly waits and flicks the ball through square leg. Great start for RCB, 14 off the over

Chawla to de Kock, FOUR, that's a friendly flighted delivery full and outside off stump, de Kock leans forward and doesn't over-hit the ball, drives nicely along the ground and hits the gap at cover. The ball escapes past the diving fielder

Chawla to de Kock, out Caught by Vinay Kumar!! That's a soft dismissal and Chawla blows a kiss to the batsman on his way to the dressing room. In trying to fetch another boundary, de Kock goes for the fancy looking reverse sweep and completely mistimes it. Get a top edge and it flies slowly to short third man. A great opportunity wasted by de Kock. de Kock c Vinay Kumar b Chawla 4(4) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to de Villiers, SIX, dances down the pitch and threatens the cameraman on one of those tiers. Flighted delivery on the stumps, de Villiers got to the pitch of the ball and launches that over long-on. AB de Villiers has nicely warmed up

Narine to de Villiers, SIX, this is what he does so well. Those small movements in the crease before the bowler delivers and that puts many bowlers off. This time he backed away and Narine followed him, de Villiers swept that high in the air and all the way over deep backward square leg
Narine to Kohli, FOUR, he's so good with those cover-drives. Full delivery outside off stump, Kohli waits and lofts the drive over the infield and the timing was great

Johnson to de Villiers, no run, appeal for caught behind and he's been given. AB reviews immediately. He checks with the umpire about what the decision was for. The umpire informs him he's given him caught behind. There was a noise as the ball passed the bat, but clearly the ball just touched the flap of the pad and was nowhere close to the bat or glove. It was a short of length delivery outside off stump, de Villiers tried to guide that to third man and missed. DRS saves de Villiers
Johnson to de Villiers, FOUR, dismissed to the boundary by AB. Short of length, bounces only as high as the chest and the pull shot is swatted away backward of square
Johnson to de Villiers, SIX, launcheddddd! AB in this form... wow. Fullish off-cutter outside off, de Villiers sizes it up and biffs it over mid-off. Sails into the stands

Chawla to Kohli, SIX, those wrists have carried this all the way for six. Magnificent timing. He wasn't to the pitch of it even after stepping out, but still went through with the flick over mid-wicket. Plenty of height on it, and enough distance too
Nitish Rana to de Villiers, SIX, oh don't do that. Never do that. A half-tracker to de Villiers who chews it up and spits it over mid-wicket

Nitish Rana to de Villiers, out Caught by Johnson!! What do you know, he's bowled another short ball and has got the dangerous AB. Massive break for the KKR. Probably it wasn't as short as AB thought. He went back to pull and ended up skying it off a thick top-edge. Johnson takes it nonchalantly at deep mid-wicket. de Villiers c Johnson b Nitish Rana 44(23) [4s-1 6s-5]

Nitish Rana to Kohli, out Bowled!! The part-timer gets AB de Villiers and Virat Kohli in consecutive balls. Floats a seam-up yorker which slips under Kohli's bat and rattles the stumps. Rana is pumped as he punches the air in delight. He'll be telling his grandchildren about this. Kohli b Nitish Rana 31(33) [4s-1 6s-1]
Nitish Rana to Mandeep, FOUR, shuffles across, bends on one knee and gets the sweep away fine. Races away once it beats the man
Narine to Mandeep, FOUR, poor from Narine. Drops it very short, and then turns it into leg-stump. Mandeep is able to free his arms on the pull as he whacks it to the long leg boundary
Narine to Mandeep, 1 run, fires this carrom ball on a back of length outside off, Mandeep pats it wide of cover. He was struggling on the single there, would have been gone with a direct-hit

Narine to Mandeep, FOUR, the two off-breaks he's bowled in this over have both drifted down leg. Unlike the previous one though, Mandeep just helps this on its away and gets it fine enough to beat short fine leg

Johnson to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Rinku Singh!! Sarfaraz looks to break free, but holes out at long-on. He was getting stuck out there, so wanted to release the pressure with a big shot. It was a full ball, probably a cutter, but Sarfaraz's bat twists in his hands as he swings down the ground. He miscues it off the inside half straight to long-on, who catches it at the edge of the ropes. Sarfaraz Khan c Rinku Singh b Johnson 6(10)
Johnson to Woakes, FOUR, full ball outside off, Woakes flings his hands at it and carves it through backward point. It goes to the fence like a bullet
Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, SIX, full in the slot, Mandeep gets in position by clearing his front leg and then wallops it over wide long-on with a clean swing. Ordinary delivery from Vinay
Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, FOUR, now a full toss on the pads, whipped away over backward square leg. He's missed his lengths with the first two balls, and at his pace, he will disappear - as he has

Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, SIX, six more. 16 off the first 3 balls. Mandeep is taking serious toll of what is some very ordinary death bowling. Short of length delivery, neither here nor there. Mandeep camps back and bludgeons the pull away

Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! Better plans from Vinay Kumar with these last couple of deliveries. He's gone back to round the wicket and bowled this pretty wide outside off. Mandeep has to stretch out to reach it, and as he does, the timing is not the same. He slices this up into the accepting hands of sweeper cover. Mandeep c Kuldeep Yadav b Vinay Kumar 37(18) [4s-4 6s-2]

Vinay Kumar to Woakes, out Caught by A Russell!! This has gone high, not long. Russell pedals back from extra-cover, and takes a really good catch falling backwards. Good finish to the over from Kumar. Another full and wide delivery which is skied off the toe-end by Woakes. Woakes c A Russell b Vinay Kumar 5(5) [4s-1]
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, this time he cuts well and gets it in the gap between cover-point and backward point. The length was just short enough for McCullum to rock back and execute the shot

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's completely mistimed, yet McCullum will get a boundary, this game is so cruel for the bowlers. Flighted googly outside off stump, McCullum wanted to loft that over long-on, but got it on the outside half of the bat, cleared mid-off and it ran away for four
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, SIX, advances and lofts the ball, the timing is good enough and the ball clears the long-on fence quite comfortably. It was the googly from Chawla but McCullum read it

Johnson to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, oh he's bludgeoned this very hard. Full and outside off stump, McCullum slices the ball hard and gets it in the gap at cover-point, the fielder in the deep had no chance

Johnson to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, the slower ball but it's been whacked by McCullum. This is a true surface in terms of bounce, so you can hit through the line, McCullum hits that over wide mid-off and it runs away for four

Narine to Brendon McCullum, out Bowled!! It's turned and gone through the gate. Came slower than McCullum expected and he was through his pull shot early. Short and turning back in, McCullum targeted the mid-wicket boundary, but lost his sticks. Anyway, has done his job as an opener in his first outing for RCB. Brendon McCullum b Narine 43(27) [4s-6 6s-2]

Kuldeep Yadav to de Villiers, SIX, that's not a bad ball at all from Kuldeep Yadav. Not easy to time the away spinning ball. So Kuldeep Yadav bowls one full googly outside off stump, de Villiers goes for the loft over cover, slices it but the timing it good enough to clear the fence
Bhuvneshwar to D Arcy Short, FOUR, half-volley on middle and leg, D Arcy Short eases it away with a nonchalant whip off the pads in front of deep square leg for four. Blazes away...

Bhuvneshwar to D Arcy Short, out D Arcy Short Run Out!! Oh, that looks out! They've gone up to the third umpire, but I think he's as dead as a dodo. A fullish one outside off, push-driven to mid-off where the cat-like Williamson runs in and scores a direct-hit at the non-striker's end. Short nods at Rahane, but not in a reassuring way. Nope, the other thing. Death knell for D'Arcy. And that's Williamson for you, after a few blinders in whites a few weeks ago. The aggression comes from within. D Arcy Short run out (Williamson) 4(4) [4s-1]

Rashid Khan to Tripathi, FOUR, lovely, Tripathi picked this one though, the attempted wrong'un, Tripathi gets a big stride forward, gets close to the ball and lifts it over cover, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Rashid Khan to Tripathi, FOUR, nicely played by Tripathi, fraction short and just outside off, the leg-break from Rashid, Tripathi waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and dabs it past KW at first slip, rolls away to the fence in a hurry

S Kaul to Tripathi, 1 run, appeal for LBW and SRH want a review. Kaul was convinced and he forced his captain to go for it. It's a fair delivery, it's pad first, but I reckon that the impact was outside off, at best it could be umpire's call. Hawk-Eye in and the impact is well outside off, NOT OUT is the call. SRH lose their review, on a good length and shaping back in, Tripathi got across his stumps as he defended, the ball clipped the flap oif the bat before deflecting towards mid-off

Shakib to Tripathi, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! That's a soft dismissal, the pressure of getting quick runs does Tripathi in. He came down the track to a floater outside off, perhaps would have served him better had he gone down the ground, instead, he was looking to drag it wide of long-on, hits it a lot straighter and down the throat of Manish, who ran in from long-on. Tripathi c Manish Pandey b Shakib 17(15) [4s-2]

Shakib to Samson, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! The wheels are falling off, both the set batsmen have been dismissed, this is a smart catch from Rashid at deep cover, runs in, slides forward and takes a good catch - right in front of his chest. Nice bit of bowling from Shakib, threw this one slower and wider of off, Samson jumped down the track, was looking to go over extra-cover, ended up chipping it high and towards deep cover. Rashid does the rest and RR have lost half their side. Samson c Rashid Khan b Shakib 49(42) [4s-5]

S Kaul to Gowtham, out Caught by Saha!! The Royals are falling away in Uppal. Exceptional bowling from Kaul, banged in short and at Gowtham, he had nowhere to go as he fended rather awkwardly. The ball ballooned off his gloves, popped straight up and it's an easy catch for Saha. The umpire wants to check for the front-foot no-ball, but Kaul is just about fine on that count. A duck on his IPL debut for Gowtham. Gowtham c Saha b S Kaul 0(2)

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, lovely shot, Gopal is a top all-rounder for Karnataka and this shot just certifies it, read the leg-break, opens the face of the bat, used the pace on the ball and ran it past the lone slip

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, crunched, lovely cricket from Gopal, on a good length and just outside off, Gopal wasn't fully forward as he drove, the timing is sweet and the ball beats the fielder in the deep at cover

Rashid Khan to Buttler, out Bowled!! That's that for Buttler, he was very circumscept, but the finishing touches never came. The leg-break from Rashid, skids through after pitching, Buttler was cramped for room on the pull, went through with the shot, the ball grazed the inside edge and the off-stump is on the floor. The Royals have never got going tonight, the Sunrisers have been all over them. Buttler b Rashid Khan 6(9)

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, out Caught by Y Pathan!! The extra ball gets Bhuvneshwar a wicket. This was a slower knuckle ball, Gopal had to go for runs, looks to tonk it over long-on, doesn't get anywhere near the middle of the bat and it's a simple catch for Yusuf - right in front of the ropes at long-on. Shreyas Gopal c Y Pathan b Bhuvneshwar 18(18) [4s-2]

S Kaul to Unadkat, out Unadkat Run Out!! 1 run completed. Saha has demolished all the three stumps and I reckon Unadkat is short of his ground. OUT by a long way. Terrific keeping from Saha, on a good length and well wide of off, Unadkat sliced the drive behind square on the off-side. He was always coming for the second run, but was too slow in doing so. Pathan was quick on the ball and although his throw was well wide, Saha does well to gather it, turns across and throws down all the three stumps. Unadkat run out (Y Pathan/Saha) 1(2)
Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, a bit of outswing on a good length outside off, a hint of seam away, but Samson just check-drives it through the line to sweeper cover for four

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, slower one, possibly knuckle, on a length outside off, Samson just picks the perfect moment in time to let leather meet willow with that authoritative whip away to deep mid-wicket for four
Shakib to Rahane, FOUR, shortens his length as Rahane comes down the track, and Rahane just adjusts his shot to flat-bat it through deep extra cover for four
Stanlake to Rahane, FOUR, short, no width, Rahane arches back into a semi-limbo and scythes that away to the deep backward point fence for four. Expertly done

Stanlake to Samson, FOUR, length delivery just outside off, straightening a little, and taking the leading edge of the closed bat-face to deep backward point. It was in the air for a while, but through the vacant region for four

Shakib to Samson, FOUR, angled in, was that armer, towards leg-stump, Samson came down the wicket, realized he wasn't to the pitch of it, but still went through with the shot Through deep mid-wicket for four

S Kaul to Rahane, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Excellent catch! Fuller one outside off, Rahane gets across and VVSes a lofted whip towards deep mid-wicket where Rashid runs across and takes a commendable sliding catch. He seems surprised that he took that! Rahane departs for a run-a-ball 13. Rahane c Rashid Khan b S Kaul 13(13) [4s-2]

S Kaul to Samson, FOUR, short of length delivery in the channel outside off, Samson tries to open the bat-face and steer it away to third man, gets a thick edge past the keeper, to the long stop fence for four. Oh, if only we had the Saha of the Australia Test series last year...

Stanlake to Stokes, out Caught by Williamson!! Length ball outside off, Stokes drags a lofted drive through the line towards long-on where Williamson, for a fleeting moment, nearly fluffs it and you can see the look of pure terror in his eyes. But his cat-like reflexes make sure he latches on during his second attempt. He - is - pumped! Stokes c Williamson b Stanlake 5(8)

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, edged and dropped. "One of the safest fielders in the slips has dropped a catch" is the comment from Sanjay Manjrekar on air. Huge moment in the game. Guess who's the culprit? It's skipper Ajinkya Rahane. A simple regulation take - length delivery angled across outside off. Dhawan aiming to break the dots slashes hard and outside-edges it straight to first slip. Jinks gets both hands but shells it. Kulkarni is in disbelief
Unadkat to Saha, FOUR, adding salt into the wounds for the Royals. Unadkat begins with a tripe delivery down leg. Easy pickings for Saha, gets across and whacks it over square leg

Unadkat to Saha, out Caught by Laughlin!! And Unadkat strikes. So, Saha's promotion doesn't work for SRH. Fuller and slanted well outside off, Saha in quest to clear the in-field on the off-side - slices it tamely off the outer half and skies it to mid-off. Safe as houses is Laughlin. One of SRH's supporters has his hands on his mouth. Just the start RR wanted. Saha c Laughlin b Unadkat 5(5) [4s-1]

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, edged and flies over first slip. Dhawan throws the kitchen sink - comes down the track, gets an outside edge and fortunately for him, it loops over a leaping first slip fielder

Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, not sure what prompted Rahane to take the review. Always seemed like pitching outside leg and the replays confirm it. Loopy and full around leg, Dhawan missed the sweep and was rapped on the pad. Never looked close at all. Desperation perhaps. The batsmen crossed during the appeal

Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, FOUR, kaboooooom! That's been smashed to pulp and it's Williamson who has done it. Things that an IPL season does. Even the gracious batsmen look for power. Uses his feet and smacks it hard over the bowler's head. Gopal may have thought about a return catch but there was no time at all to react, chose to wisely save himself

Laughlin to Dhawan, FOUR, what a sound off the blade! Gee, he just nailed that one, did Dhawan. Back of a length and plenty of width outside off, Dhawan just leant into it and slap-punched on the up. Gets it past a diving mid-off fielder and it speeds away. Considering the form he has been of late and the way he has played today, he is bound to light this IPL up
D Arcy Short to Dhawan, FOUR, that's a freebie from D Arcy Short and Dhawan isn't going to miss out. Not in this carnage mode of his. Stays back and pulls it hard to the deep mid-wicket fence

D Arcy Short to Dhawan, byes, FOUR, that's beaten everyone! For a moment, I thought it was a genuine edge but it wasn't. D Arcy Short gets this to spin away from a fuller length and the drastic turn beats Dhawan's attempted drive. Buttler also fails to react in time and with no slip in place, free runs it is

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, crunchy blow to end the game! Shortish and sits up nicely for Dhawan who rocks back to slam the pull over mid-wicket. Blazed away to the fence and with that, the Sunrisers have stormed to a win in their season opener
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, Kulkarni goes short and offers width again, Dhawan will not miss out on these. Goes deep and bashes it with ferocity through covers

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan has not been at his best so far today, but this is a shot of highest class. Kulkarni pounds it short for the nth time - well outside off. Dhawan hops across and upper-cuts. Gets enough bat to send it sailing over the third man fielder

Unadkat to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson finds the gap this time. Off the mark with a boundary. Unadkat keeps it short, just a hint of width and Williamson takes toll. Waits back and punches it through cover-point
Unadkat to Williamson, SIX, wow. Dispatched with authority. Supreme pull shot from the Kiwi skipper. Spots the short ball early, camps back and pulls it witheringly into the deep square leg stands
Gowtham to Dhawan, FOUR, quality from Dhawan. No misjudging of the length this time, picks the long hop early and hacks it over square leg. Kind of short-arm jabbed it
Gowtham to Dhawan, FOUR, back to back fours for Dhawan. Gowtham goes quick and flat outside off, Dhawan reaches out and slaps it through cover
Laughlin to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan is riding his luck. Banged in short on leg-stump, Dhawan swivels to pull and ends up gloving it over the keeper. Fine leg is squarer and had no chance there
Laughlin to Williamson, FOUR, 50-stand comes up between the duo. Short and width are like oxygen to Williamson. Gets on top of the bounce and caresses it through cover-point
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, FOUR, horror start for Gopal. Drags it short first up, ample time for Dhawan to rock back and pick his spot. Chooses cow corner and dismisses from his sight
Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, no respect whatsoever for Stokes. Is greeted with a boundary. Short with no real venom, Dhawan goes back and muscles the pull over mid-wicket
Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, consecutive fours for Dhawan. Stokes sprays it down leg, Dhawan just gets a tickle on it and sends it very fine. Races away to the fine leg fence

Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, cracker of a shot! Dhawan is in top gear and brings up his 29th IPL fifty in some style. Short and wide, he stands tall and spanks it through backward point. Power, timing and placement all in unison

Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, oh boy, that's top quality stuff! Slower ball from Stokes but Dhawan is in such a mood that he is picking everything. Waits for it and there was width on offer, so just reached out to hammer it through the covers. Rocketed away

Vinay Kumar to Watson, FOUR, not where he intended to hit that but he'll take it. Another short delivery around off, Watson takes his eyes off the ball and pulls, ends up getting an inside edge past the fielder at short fine leg and finds the fence
Vinay Kumar to Watson, SIX, this is a fine shot! In the slot on middle and leg, a length delivery and Watson stays put and towers it over long-on for half a dozen, first biggie of the innings

Vinay Kumar to Watson, FOUR, fine end to the over! Make that 16 runs off the opening over. Vinay Kumar conceded 14 runs in the previous match off the first over, concedes two extra in this one. It's a back of a length delivery outside off and all Watson does is simply punch it through the gap at cover-point. Into the gap and away to the fence she goes. Just the ideal start for CSK in this mammoth run chase
Chawla to Watson, SIX, Watto is in the house fellas! Gets down on his knee and clubs the floater over mid-wicket, clean as a whistle and it's a maximum

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 1 run, dropped! Tom Curran did a remarkable job of getting to the ball. So, tough to call it a drop. Flighted outside off, Raina sans footwork went for the inside out loft, nowhere near the middle and the ball skied towards deep extra cover. Curran ran forward, dived full length and got fingertips to it

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, SIX, that's what he was trying at the start of the over. Raina remains the key to this chase. Floated up outside off, Raina with a stride forward lofts it handsomely inside out over extra cover, just about manages to clear the rope

Narine to Dhoni, no run, Narine is a smart operator and he will mix it up. Important to read him from the hand rather the surface. Dhoni did not pick the off-break and lunged forward to nudge it into the on-side, beaten on the inside edge and struck around the kneeroll. The big press forward helped him there as ball-tracking showed it to be going over

Narine to Raina, out Caught by Vinay Kumar!! The cramp derailed him of the momentum. He was really struggling. Limps off to a quiet stadium. The delivery was short alright and Raina picked the length early, but his feet could not make the adjustment to rock back and the pull was off the top-edge, Vinay ran across to his left from long-on and completed a straightforward catch. Might be a good thing for CSK as Raina was not able to run as well and we know that Dhoni needs someone to sprint along with him. Raina c Vinay Kumar b Narine 14(12) [6s-1]

Chawla to Billings, FOUR, wow! Just a flick of the wrists and Rinku Singh, one of the quick movers, could not get around to stop it. Dances down and gets to the pitch, whipped against the turn to wide long-on, the timing was exquisite

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, FOUR, murdered! That might get him going. Need a boundary off the middle and he's got it. Shimmies down and gets close to the flighted delivery then drills it straight down the ground, went at the rate of knots

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, outta here! This is what the Chepauk crowd have been waiting for more than two years - Dhoni at his best. Tossed up on leg-stump, Dhoni cleared his front leg to give himself a free swing of the arms, sends the ball sailing over the deep mid-wicket fence

Tom Curran to Billings, 2 runs, dropped! That should have been taken. Uthappa the culprit. Full and on the stumps, Billings makes room to go over mid-off, does not get the elevation and Uthappa does not time his jump near the edge of the circle. Parries it behind him and Rinku Singh from long-on tidies up

Tom Curran to Billings, SIX, fabulous shot! To get such power behind that shot is incredible. Curran missed his yorker length by an inch or so, Billings stayed on leg-stump and went through with the inside out loft, cleared the fence quite comfortably. Nice hands!

Tom Curran to Billings, SIX, and he ends it with a maximum. Another big over for CSK, 17 off it. Curran fires in a full toss around the hip, Billings was moving around in the crease, stands still at the point of contact and heaves it flat over deep backward square

Narine to Billings, 2 runs, and Billings nudges one into the on-side ring, Dhoni was off in a flash and wanted two, he was cruising for the second when he saw the throw come to his end and decide to charge. Got it comfortably

Chawla to Dhoni, out Caught by Karthik!! Dhoni walks. Pin drop silence at Chepauk. Is that the match? Well, there is still Bravo - last game's match-winner. Dhoni waits as the umpire checks for a front foot no-ball, Chawla is fine and Dhoni continues walking. Clever bowling from Chawla, slowed it up a touch and kept it outside off, Dhoni was down on his knee to play the sweep, through the shot early and the under edge is found. Karthik has a juggle before completing the catch. Dhoni didn't even wait for the umpire. Started walking as soon as he saw the catch taken. Dhoni c Karthik b Chawla 25(28) [4s-1 6s-1]

Chawla to Billings, FOUR, much needed boundary for CSK. It had been a quiet over so far. Billings didn't connect it properly but struck it in the gap, front leg out of the way and a swing of the arms, couple of bounces and into the cow corner fence

A Russell to Billings, SIX, geez! Some skill that. He waited and waited, moved right across his stumps when Russell was about to deliver, crouched low and scooped the low full toss all the way over fine leg. The crowd find their voice again

A Russell to Billings, SIX, this is spectacular. It was the off-cutter on back of a length, Billings had moved away to the leg-side and was almost cramped for room, extended his arms and lofted it over long-on. It was more of a punch from the Englishman. Reminded me of the Kohli shot against Chris Woakes

Tom Curran to Billings, 1 run, fifty for Billings. CSK needed someone to take over the baton after Raina's wicket and the Kent batsman has taken the onus on himself to keep the chase going. Raises the bat and gets the applause from the yellow faithfuls. Walked across his stumps and Curran fired it in the blockhole, the sweep comes off the under edge and bobbles away to fine leg

Tom Curran to Billings, SIX, Billings is playing a gem here. He is getting the big hit at the right moment. The slower delivery and Billings was waiting for it with a crouched stance, gets underneath it and nails the pull over deep square leg

Tom Curran to Billings, out Caught by Uthappa!! Uthappa pumps his fists. KKR find a lifeline once again. Full delivery and right in the slot, had Billings stayed put without moving to the leg-side, he could have connected with the loft better, instead he had to reach out and managed only a toe-end to long-off. Uthappa ran across to his left to pouch that. Nevertheless, Billings has given CSK a chance to pull this off and Chepauk might have found a new hero in him. Billings c Uthappa b Tom Curran 56(23) [4s-2 6s-5]

Vinay Kumar to Dwayne Bravo, no ball, SIX, terrible terrible start from Vinay Kumar. KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan affords a smile. A high full toss well above the waist, Bravo somehow managed to swing it away off the top-edge and over fine leg. What a start to the over!

Vinay Kumar to Jadeja, SIX, the roof has come down at Chepauk. Jadeja seals the win with a mighty six. Did I say he's not connecting 'em well? He's just nailed this one. The slower delivery, off-cutter from Vinay, right in the arc for Jadeja, who waits before teeing off, full swing of the arms and the ball sails over the long-on fence
A Russell to Rayudu, FOUR, poor delivery by Dre Russ. Gifts a full toss to Rayudu who clips it nonchalantly past the fielder at short fine leg, easy pickings for the batsman there

Chawla to Rayudu, SIX, excellent use of the feet by Rayudu. Tossed up delivery on middle and Rayudu shimmies down the wicket to pump it over the bowler's head for a biggie, that came right off the meat and met the sightscreen on the full

Chawla to Rayudu, SIX, carnage continues! The crowd is loving this. Flighted delivery around off, Rayudu stands tall and chips it with ease right over covers, half a dozen more. These two are looking unstoppable

Chawla to Rayudu, FOUR, 50 up for CSK! CSK, CSK are the chants at the stadium. Short of a length outside off, Rayudu camps back and cuts it past the diving fielder at cover-point to add four more to the tally
A Russell to Rayudu, FOUR, cheeky there. Short of a length outside off, Rayudu arches back and guides it smartly towards third man, very fine and you can't keep a fielder there

Tom Curran to Watson, FOUR, the newbie to IPL is welcomed in style by Watson. It's short again and looking at the kind of touch Watson is in he won't spare you. Pulls it nicely over mid-wicket, one bounce and into the fence she goes
Tom Curran to Watson, SIX, this is entertainment. Full length delivery around off, Watson keeps his head still and powers it over long-off for six more, the bowler is under pressure, straightaway

Tom Curran to Watson, out Caught by Rinku Singh!! Maiden wicket for Tom Curran in IPL. A breather for KKR there. Short of a length delivery around off and Watson pulls it hard again. But there's a fielder in the deep, it's Rinku Singh out there. He moves to his left and grabs it eventually to bring an end to Watson's blitzkrieg. CSK couldn't have asked for a better start from the Aussie all-rounder. Wait on.. the crowd at Chepauk welcomes Raina with a loud cheer. The highest run scorer for CSK in history of IPL is at the crease. Watson c Rinku Singh b Tom Curran 42(19) [4s-3 6s-3]

Kuldeep Yadav to Rayudu, out Caught by (sub)Shivam Mavi!! Both the set openers are back in the hut now. That was bowled outside off and was spinning away from the batsman, Rayudu goes ahead with his chip shot and times it straight to the subsitute fielder who comes running in and takes it. Are KKR getting back in this match? With two new batsmen at the crease getting those odd boundaries might get a bit difficult. Rayudu c (sub)Shivam Mavi b Kuldeep Yadav 39(26) [4s-3 6s-2]

Chahar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Chris Lynn is underway! Typical Lynn. Shortish ball with width on offer, he'll punish you everytime. Stands tall and slashes it over point. Raced away and there's pin drop silence

Chahar to Narine, SIX, Narine is off the mark with a six. I'm not surprised. Swings his bat hard and takes on the man at long-on. The fielder is made to look like a spectator. It was a length ball, Narine stood tall and thumped it well over the fielder. Hello Chennai

Chahar to Narine, SIX, wow! Six more and that's 18 off the opening over. Slightly fuller and got it to swing in a tad did Chahar. But, that doesn't bother Narine. He slightly backs away and clobbers it over cow corner

Harbhajan to Narine, out Caught by Raina!! The ploy to bring the spinner has worked straightaway. So, Narine is gone! A dot, six, six and OUT. Good ball that from Harbhajan. A nicely tossed up delivery above the eyeline of the batsman wide of off. Narine looks to slog it over mid-wicket from there and all he manages is a top-edge, that goes miles up in the air. Raina sprinted to his left from cover and took a sharp running catch. Tumbles on the ground, but ensured that the ball didn't pop out of his hand. Narine c Raina b Harbhajan 12(4) [6s-2]

Harbhajan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, flat and shortish ball, Lynn stays deep in his crease and pulls it powerfully. He would have thought that a boundary was there for the taking. But, there was Chahar at square leg, who flew full length to his left and could only get a hand on it. It will be too harsh to call that as a drop, he got both hands though, perhaps had a chance to cling on

SN Thakur to Rinku Singh, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! There's the jig from DJ. CSK fans will start practicing that. KKR lose their fifth wicket, with 10 overs still left. It was hurled fuller outside off and Rinku Singh goes hard on the drive. The bat turned at the point of impact and he ended up slicing it to backward point off the bottom part of the bat. Bravo won't drop those. Rinku Singh c Dwayne Bravo b SN Thakur 2(4)
Tahir to Karthik, FOUR, KKR will remain positive, Karthik brings out the reverse sweep with a slip in place, doesn't get hold of the shot, but has enough to get it past the fielder
Watson to A Russell, FOUR, lovely shot, a long half-volley from Watson, full and just outside off, Russell stays in his crease and drills it through extra-cover, no need to run for those

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, clubbed, length ball from Bravo and Russell sends it into the long-on stands. Gets a big stride forward, didn't get hold of the shot, but his power takes the ball miles over the man at long-on

SN Thakur to A Russell, SIX, that's a bad mishit and it has still gone deep into the stands at long-off. On a good length and well outside off, this was the kuckle ball from Thakur, Russell was looking to smash it over long-on, ended up slicing it high and way over long-off for a maximum

SN Thakur to A Russell, SIX, back-to-back sixes, Russell is on a roll now, low full-toss from Thakur, he missed out on the yorker, but Russell didn't, clears his left leg and clouts it high and over long-on
