Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, massive and that has gone out of Chepauk. This ball will not come back, Bravo missed his yorker by an inch, turned out to be a perfect length ball, Russell cleared his left leg and swings it high and over long-on. 105m is the distance

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, this is turning out to be a serious hammering from Russell, this was a slower full-toss, Russell bends down low and then heaves it high and over wide long-on for another maximum

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, SIX, cracking shot, huge over for KKR, this was another slower ball and DK picked the bones off it. Gets well forward, uses his wrists to good effect and whips it high and wide of long-on. More problems for MS and CSK

Watson to A Russell, SIX, just over Rayudu at deep cover and that's fifty for Russell, could Rayudu been further back, would have had a better chance at catching it. This was full and well outside off, Russell got down on one knee and sliced it powerfully over cover. Rayudu ran across from the deep, puts in the leap and only palmed it over the ropes

Watson to Karthik, out Lbw!! Karthik has been given OUT LBW. He talks with Russell and reviews it. Was it slipping down the leg-side? Don't think there's any bat on that, struck DK in front of leg-stump, but he's so back that the ball didn't have far to travel. Umpire's call on Hawk-Eye and Karthik is OUT. A handy knock from Karthik comes to an end, lovely yorker from Watson, followed Karthik slightly and struck him bang in front of leg-stump, it was the back-pad as well. The impact was in front of leg and would have been clipping the stumps. Karthik lbw b Watson 26(25) [4s-2 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, the sixes keep flowing from the bat of Russell, length ball on his pads, he was backing away and flicks it nonchalantly over mid-wicket, sails over the head of the man in the deep

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, back-to-back sixes, Bravo is getting a real pasting in Chepauk. This was the slower ball and Russell spotted it early, gets down low and smashes it high and way over long-on, gets to his highest score in IPL
Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, a hat-trick of sixes for Russell, length ball on the stumps, Russell backs away, clears his front leg and heaves it high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

SN Thakur to A Russell, SIX, Russell is having a party at the Chepauk, on a good length and well wide of off, he bends down low and drills it high and over cover for another maximum, his 10th six of the innings
Watson to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's been thrashed through extra cover. A fuller length ball, stand-and-deliver stuff from Lynn. Stood tall and hammered the drive between extra cover and mid-off
Watson to Uthappa, FOUR, easy pickings for Uthappa! Full and straying on the pads, a lean across followed by a nonchalant flick over backward square leg. One bounce and into the fence

Watson to Uthappa, FOUR, steered and just wide of the Raina at wide slip. A short of length delivery with width on offer, Uthappa opens his bat-face at the last moment and guided it to Raina's right, who dived full length. Trickles away to the fence

SN Thakur to A Russell, SIX, smacked, 11th six for Russell and KKR finish with 202 on the board. A slower length ball outside off, Russell bends down low and smashes it high and over long-off for a maximum

Tahir to Chris Lynn, FOUR, 'catch it' cries Tahir, but Lynn has got enough wood on that. Tahir saw the batter back away and fired on following him. Lynn toe-ends the drill over and wide of mid-off. Uppish, but safe

Tahir to Uthappa, SIX, that's a wonderful shot! Was darted in by Tahir, Uthappa spotted it quickly. Got down on a knee and slogged it over deep mid-wicket with a sweep shot. Off she goes into the stands and thereby silencing the crowd

Jadeja to Chris Lynn, FOUR, another quick delivery, but errs in line, Lynn moves across, crouches and helps it along its way. Manages to beat short fine leg and there's no one to stop that. Not to forget, a poor effort from Harbhajan who dived over the ball at short fine

Jadeja to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! You miss, I hit! CSK needed this and Chepauk finds its voice. Flat ball lasered in on the stumps at 92kph, Lynn comes down the track and is beaten in the trajectory. Looked to hack across the line and the ball just sneaked through the gap between bat and pad. Crashes into the leg pole. Chris Lynn b Jadeja 22(16) [4s-4]
Jadeja to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa is in good touch! Not much flight on this ball, Uthappa spots it, gets underneath it and lofts it over wide long-on. Right off the meet of the bat

Jadeja to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa is turning it on here. This was bowled slightly outside off, doesn't matter to Uthappa. He crouches slightly low and clouts it over long-on. He's timing it brilliantly. Time to target him with pace?

Harbhajan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, superbly played! Trifle short and Rana was quick to go on the back foot and pounce on it. Waited for the ball and scythed it through backward point. The man in the deep gives a chase, but to no avail

SN Thakur to Nitish Rana, FOUR, "that's not how you follow it up," says Ian Bishop on air. After bowling a good bumper, Thakur now bowls a fullish ball, Rana stays in his crease and hit it through the line. Lofted over wide mid-off and there is no one to stop that

Watson to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Dhoni!! Dhoni pouches, up goes the umpire's finger and there's the roar from the Chepauk crowd. A soft dismissal. An innocuous short of length delivery on middle and leg, Rana moved across to help it along its way. Gets a faint under-edge onto his thigh and the ball lobs up in the air. MS moves to his right to snaffle that. A straightforward catch for the captain. Nitish Rana c Dhoni b Watson 16(14) [4s-2]

Watson to Uthappa, out Uthappa Run Out!! KKR have gifted away a wicket here. Bad communication between two senior members. Length ball around off and Uthappa punched it towards cover from the crease. Raina stopped it with a dive with his left hand, picks the ball and hits the bullseye at the bowler's end. Uthappa was ball-watching and Karthik was halfway down. One had to go at the danger's end, and Uthappa went for it. This is a big wicket. Raina has his arms aloft. Uthappa run out (Raina) 29(16) [4s-2 6s-3]

Watson to Karthik, FOUR, cracking shot. Should settle Karthik's nerves, if any. Shortish ball wide of off, Karthik gets on top of it and cuts it fiercely through the off-side, beating the man at backward point

Gowtham to Maxwell, out Munro Run Out!! The shortish ball skidded on and the batsman trying to pull, gets hit on the pads for the ball to roll away into the on-side. Munro wanted a steal but was sent back. The keeper ran to his left, picked it up and threw it to the bowler, who whipped off the bails. Dreadful start for Delhi. Munro run out (Buttler/Gowtham) 0(0)
Gowtham to Pant, FOUR, spanked! Murdered! Four.. That was a little shimmy and a powerful blade smacking it down the ground

Gowtham to Pant, FOUR, kneels down and punishes it away. Gets it past the man at short fine leg and the ball races away between square leg and short fine leg for a four. Very well done. He preempted the angle and got it away
Unadkat to Maxwell, FOUR, lucky, Maxwell ain't complaining. The batsman goes for the big wild swing. The ball trims the outer half of the bat and flies over the man at short third man for a four

Unadkat to Maxwell, SIX, finally, oh, finally, the wait is over. Here is the BIG SHOW!! The ball was in the zone and the batsman stayed his crease to use the long handle. The batsman again dragged the ball away and this time well over long-on

Unadkat to Maxwell, FOUR, that is sworded away! Full and wide, throws his bat at the leather whilst losing his balance and smears the ball over point for a four. That will do for DD. 14 of the over and that is exactly what they need in each of the rest three overs

Laughlin to Maxwell, out Caught by Buttler!! Looks to swing hard and is gone. He was never in today. The bowler cut his fingers over the ball and that tricked the batsman, who was early into his stroke. A thick edge and the keeper did the rest. Maxwell was again trying to drag it away into the on-side and lost shape completely trying to strike it hard. DD looking down the barrell. Maxwell c Buttler b Laughlin 17(12) [4s-2 6s-1]

Unadkat to Chris Morris, FOUR, full, little wide, the batsman opens the face of the blade and beats the man at deepish point. Much needed four but they need more. Good, intelligent batting from Chris Morris. 30 off 10 balls
Unadkat to Pant, FOUR, length slower delivery and the batsman pulls the ball away. Did not time it but gave it some good air miles. Once it landed, there was no one and it went into the fence

Unadkat to Pant, out Caught by Gowtham!! The fielder takes a good one behind square on the leg-side. It's a full ball and the batsman never got really under it. Got more altitude than distance -- as Pant has today on more than one occasion -- and Gowtham charged in from the deep to take it. Good catch actually, flinging his body in front and plucking it above the ground. More importantly it is a dot ball. That might well have been another delivery where Unadkat ran his fingers on the ball. Pant c Gowtham b Unadkat 20(14) [4s-3]

Laughlin to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Stokes!! Another skier, another good take. The fielder at long-on came in running in and took it. The length ball was another swirler. The ball sliced up from the outer half of the blade and the fielder did the rest. Vijay Shankar c Stokes b Laughlin 3(3)
Laughlin to Chris Morris, FOUR, throws his hands at it and slices it flat-footed over covers. It's all but over....

Laughlin to Chris Morris, SIX, A six to finish. Does not matter. 9th successive win for RR in Jaipur and 7th successive win against DD. The rains might have done them a favour. That was full and the batsman clobbered it down the ground by holding his shape nicely to send it over long-on. RR win this 10 runs
Nadeem to D Arcy Short, FOUR, poor ball to start! Drags it short and it's the slider as well, width on offer for Short who smacks the back foot punch through the covers. Easy pickings

Nadeem to D Arcy Short, out D Arcy Short Run Out!! 1 run completed. Mix up and D Arcy Short is run out yet again! Holy Molly, what's with the running between these two? Waste of a wicket really but the Daredevils won't mind it at all. It was a drifter into middle and leg, Short nudged it towards deep mid-wicket and took the first run with ease. Crazy mix up on the second run and he went for it eventually but Vijay Shankar was alert. The direct hit at the keeper's end caught the southpaw well short. D Arcy Short run out (Vijay Shankar) 6(3) [4s-1]

Nadeem to Samson, out Bowled!! Oh no! Unfortunate! Tossed up temptingly on middle, angling in from round the wicket, Samson gets forward and tries to go through with the slog-sweep to negate the spin, ends up getting an inside edge onto his thigh, which then ricochets onto the off-stump. On another night, it might have missed the wickets, but the stars up above aren't aligned for him tonight. Samson b Nadeem 37(22) [4s-2 6s-2]
Rahul Tewatia to Buttler, FOUR, master of manipulating the field. There's a leg slip now instead of silly point, and the tossed up one on off is reverse-lapped to third man for four
Shami to Rahane, FOUR, that flat-batted swipe coming down the track to a length ball. Made room, slapped it inside out to deep extra cover for four past a diving cover. He's absolutely leathered that

Shami to Rahane, FOUR, short outside off, Rahane drags it towards the on-side with a clouted pull to deep mid-wicket for four. Boult made a lot of room, running across a few yards and diving in front, and nearly pulled off a screamer but the ball flicks his thumb and ricochets away into the fence

Nadeem to Rahane, out Caught by Chris Morris!! No no no! What are you doing Jinx? Not too short, no turn, but a little too quick and skiddy. Rahane is stuck between and pull and a flick with a bit of a swat and gets a leading edge towards Morris at point to hand him a mango dolly. Rahane c Chris Morris b Nadeem 45(40) [4s-5]

Chris Morris to Tripathi, SIX, length ball angling into middle, Tripathi lays into that slog-sweep on the up and sends that into the deep mid-wicket orbit for six! Boult takes a phenomenal catch there -- leaping and reverse-cupped -- but the momentum has him going over the ropes

Chris Morris to Buttler, SIX, length delivery outside off, Buttler puts his body-weight behind it and lofts that into the night sky, Maxwell at long-on tries to take that. Jumps sideways -- in an awkward enough shape already -- and ends up dropping it into the boundary. Think that was a six even if he had taken it; Maxwell was air-borne and well beyond the ropes. Unfortunate, because that was a good effort, but that's another six
Chris Morris to Buttler, FOUR, short-ish and wide, Buttler slashes and slashes hard, as that blazes away in front of third man for four. The spin on that shows you how hard he sliced that...

Shami to Buttler, SIX, fuller one on off, Buttler gets low, makes room and throws his hands at that to loft that over long-off for six. Massive hit. Great start to the over for Buttler. A bit of a slice, but with these kalyug bats, the meat is much bigger

Shami to Buttler, out Bowled!! Off-cutter/yorker combo, not an easy one to get right, especially under duress, on middle, Buttler gets across to lap/ramp it away towards fine leg, misses it completely as the bails light up - and so do Shami's eyes. Brilliant delivery under pressure. Buttler b Shami 29(18) [4s-2 6s-2]

Boult to Stokes, FOUR, whackkkkkkkkkk! Stokes has had enough of proding around. Charges down the track and makes room before blasting this wide of the man at mid-off. Races away to the fence in no time

Chris Morris to Stokes, SIX, kaboooooom! He's got this off the meat, that's for sure. Fractionally short from Morris and Stokes doesn't even bother to go on the back foot. Was on the initial forward trigger and picks up the pull with ease. Into the shorter boundary at deep square leg for a biggie

Boult to Stokes, out Caught by Pant!! What a ripper! The decision to persist with Boult has paid dividends for Gambhir. Good aggressive captaincy. But what a ball though! Phew! One of those jaffas that you get in Test cricket generally and Stokes must be wondering where it came from. Angled into him from a good length and shaped away with a spit of extra bounce. Unplayable by any means and it flies off the outside edge. Pant reacted sharply too and flung himself to his left to take a good diving catch. What a huge wicket this is! RR are jolted early. Stokes was looking to up the ante, has to depart. Stokes c Pant b Boult 16(12) [4s-1 6s-1]

Boult to Samson, FOUR, sheer class! Samson had some runs in the last game and hence, is in a good space mentally. Gets a full ball that's not all that wide but Samson got a nice stride forward and eased the square drive through point. The timing was fab

Boult to Samson, SIX, cracking shot! Samson isn't wasting any time to get going and is happy to target the red-hot Boult who is breathing fire. Short ball that's not high enough, sits up nicely for Samson who dismisses it over mid-wicket with a forehand smash sort of pull. Beautifully done

Boult to Rahane, FOUR, just short of backward square leg! For a moment, the fielder in the ring thought he had a chance but it bounced in front of him and sneaked through. Once it got past him, the outfield did the rest. Short of a length ball that Rahane pulled without bothering to keep it down. Fortunate that it didn't go to hand

Shami to Rahane, FOUR, freebie to start from Shami and Rahane puts it away in style. Half-tracker and it's asking for trouble on this easy-paced surface. Rahane swivels on the back foot and controls the pull with elan through backward square leg
Nadeem to Samson, SIX, half-tracker and goodbye! Cannot bowl such stuff on this pitch, easy for Samson who rocks back in a flash and deposits it into the stands at deep mid-wicket. Huge hit!

Nadeem to Samson, FOUR, deft touch! If the previous shot showcased his power, this is all about finesse. Slower and around off, not all that short but Samson waits for it on the back foot before essaying the late cut. Gets it very fine and just past the keeper as it races to the fence. He is in the zone, is Samson
Rahul Tewatia to Samson, 1 run, tight single but they get it in the end with ease. Slower and outside off, Samson stays back and pats it into the gap at cover. 50-run stand is up!
Rahul Tewatia to Rahane, FOUR, rubbish ball and Rahane will feast on these all day. Gets a drag on around middle and leg, sits on the back foot and nails the pull through square leg. Found the gap

Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, 1 run, chance and Hooda has dropped it. That's a massive let-off for Rohit, no calling at all, Hooda ran back from mid-wicket, it was perhaps Rashid's catch as he came in from deep mid-wicket. Short of a length and on the stumps, Rohit was in no control over the pull, got a fat top-edge that went high and over mid-wicket. Hooda back-pedalled, wasn't in control as he went for the catch, the ball hit his palms and burst out.

Stanlake to Rohit, SIX, lovely shot, Rohit was in complete control over this pull, banged in short and well outside off, Rohit swivelled across and pulled it high and over square leg, went a long way over the ropes

Stanlake to Rohit, FOUR, lovely from Rohit, tad fuller and wider of off, Rohit leans forward, drives it on the up and finds the gap past cover-point, the timing is sweet and the ball rolls away to the fence

Rashid Khan to Pollard, FOUR, that is Pollard's riposte. The wrong 'un on a fullish and Pollard used his reach to good effect, pressed forward and struck it straight back over the bowler, couple of bounces and into the fence

S Kaul to Pollard, FOUR, needless. Kaul brought third man up and Pollard sends the ball there. Should have followed the mantra off the first five deliveries. On a length outside off, Pollard dabbed it late and beat short third man with ease

Shakib to Pollard, SIX, into the second tier. Mumbai need to step on the pedal. Bit of air as Shakib tossed it wide of off, Pollard charged down and had the room to free his arms, smashed it over extra cover for a biggie

Stanlake to Pollard, SIX, wow! That was just an extension of the arms and the ball flies over the fence. For a change Stanlake goes full, right in Pollard's arc, he stays rooted to the crease and presents the full bat face to loft it straight back over the bowler. Held his pose for the shutterbugs

Stanlake to Pollard, FOUR, for the second time Pollard uses the pace of Stanlake to pocket a boundary. Fraction short and outside off, Pollard waits in the crease and steers it behind point, Kaul at third man should have done a better job of stopping that. He got there and allowed it to escape past him

Stanlake to Pollard, out Caught by Dhawan!! What was that? Pollard puts his hand up in an apologetic manner towards Yadav, I guess. Back of a length delivery, clocked at 143kph, Pollard stays back in the crease and is through the shot even before the ball arrived, the ball takes the cue-end and skies to sweeper cover. Dhawan completes the catch and does his thigh slap. Pollard was so much early that his bottom hand came off the bat handle as he made contact with the ball. Timely wicket for Hyderabad and not for Mumbai as Pollard was looking in ominous form. Pollard c Dhawan b Stanlake 28(23) [4s-3 6s-2]

Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, he remains the key for Mumbai. Flighted on off, Yadav backs away by moving to leg, give himself the opportunity to free his arms and lofted it inside out handsomely over extra cover. Cleared the rope comfortably

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely shot! Kaul might have been a bit too predictable with his length, Yadav moved to the leg-side and waited for the short delivery, swatted the pull backward of square leg and ended the over with a much needed boundary
Rashid Khan to Cutting, FOUR, that is cheeky. Pushed it through did Rashid and Cutting used the pace on that, shuffled across with bent knee and scooped it fine, giving short fine leg no chance

Rashid Khan to Cutting, out Bowled!! Just too good. It is hard enough for a proper batsman to pick Rashid, imagine how hard it would be for an Australian all-rounder. Cutting shimmies down the wicket without knowing what delivery it is, the wrong 'un spins in and sneaks past the swinging blade before crashing into the stumps. A well-deserved wicket for Rashid, who has bowled brilliantly without any luck. Cutting b Rashid Khan 9(9) [4s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! And another one gone. This knuckle ball epidemic is getting to every Indian pacer. Sharma the latest to show it off. Lands it on a length and Yadav thinking it was a normal length delivery, goes through the line with the loft, miscues it completely and Hooda runs forward from long-on to pouch that. Yadav was the key and even he is sent back. Suryakumar Yadav c Deepak Hooda b Sandeep Sharma 28(31) [4s-2 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Sangwan, out Lbw!! You can't get more plumb LBW decisions than that. Umpire Nandan messed it up. The knuckle ball once again from Sharma, Sangwan is through his slog early and is struck on the back leg, yes back leg. The ball was crashing into middle stump as per ball-tracking and for some reason Nandan didn't give that out. Sharma was quick to ask KW to take the review and the skipper obliged. Sangwan lbw b Sandeep Sharma 0(4)

Stanlake to Rohit, out Caught by Shakib!! Smart catch from Shakib and Hooda can breathe easy. On a good length and angling into Rohit's pads, he was looking to tuck it towards the on-side, perhaps played a tad too early, the ball looped in the air and was dropping in front of short square leg. Shakib was alert though, dives forward, got both hands underneath and scooped the catch. Rohit falls cheaply once again and MI have lost an early wicket. Rohit c Shakib b Stanlake 11(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, SIX, Lewis gets going in some style, his first runs of IPL and it's a huge six, length ball on his pads, he swivelled across and helped it on its way, deep into the second tier at long leg

Sandeep Sharma to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, streaky and four, Kishan gets lucky and gets a boundary as well, comes down the track, doesn't get anywhere close to the ball, swings through the line, the big inside edge races away past the leg-stump and into the fence

S Kaul to Markande, FOUR, cheeky! Markande decides to do something about the length Kaul was bowling, moving across the stumps and laps the length delivery over short fine leg, enough legs on that to reach the fence

Sandeep Sharma to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, edged and four, more runs for Kishan, more frustration for Sandeep. This the slower ball on off, Kishan was perhaps looking to play with an open face, he didn't look to get it that fine though, past the keeper and third man was inside the ring
Stanlake to Lewis, FOUR, short of a good length and well outside off, Lewis stands tall and punches with a straight bat, finds the gap past cover-point and the ball rolls away to the fence

Stanlake to Lewis, FOUR, that's his answer to Stanlake, short of a length and angling across the left-hander, Lewis was backing away, has to reach out and carves it over cover, a few bounces and into the fence

Stanlake to Lewis, SIX, magnificent shot, pacy length ball on the stumps, Lewis makes room by backing away, swings hard and sends it sailing over extra-cover for a maximum, flat and hard - that's what made MI shell big bucks to buy him in the auctions

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, leg byes, FOUR, appeal for LBW, but I reckon it might have pitched outside leg. Kishan was setting himself up for a reverse sweep, lost his poise in doing so, ended up with a reverse hack, the ball clipped the pads and beat the slip fielder to the fence

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, chance and dropped, Kishan was looking clueless against Rashid, but the bowler has been let-down by his fielder. He didn't spot the wrong 'un as he gave the charge, doesn't get anywhere close to the ball, gets a thick top-edge over cover, Sandeep back pedalled, looked certain to take the catch and then makes a mess of it

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Y Pathan!! Oh dear! This is terrible cricket from Kishan, another blind swing and this time, he isn't reprieved. Yusuf was the fielder in the deep and he takes a good low catch. Coming to the ball, on a good length and angling across the left-hander, Kishan was eyeing the mid-wicket boundary as he hacked across the line, gets a thick edge that flew towards third man. Yusuf was perhaps unsighted by the floodlights, but does well to bend forward and takes it inches off the turf. Ishan Kishan c Y Pathan b S Kaul 9(9) [4s-2]
S Kaul to Lewis, FOUR, smashed, half-volley outside off, Lewis gets forward and drills it past the non-striker, the fielder at mid-off was a mere spectator

S Kaul to Lewis, out Bowled!! Kaul has two in the over and he's chuffed to bits. He's running all around the ground in jubilation, three wickets in the powerplay for SRH and all those dropped chances will be forgotten. This was the slower knuckle ball, pitched on middle and shaped across the left-hander, Lewis didn't spot it, went for the big heave over mid-wicket, he missed and heard the sound of clatter. Lewis b S Kaul 29(17) [4s-3 6s-2]

Shakib to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, beautifully played, too full and too wide of off, Krunal gets close to the ball, that allows him to play against the turn, beats extra-cover with the drive and rolls away to the fence

Shakib to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, cheeky and four, tossed up well outside off, Krunal bends down low, reverses his stance, uses the pace on the ball and laps it very fine, beats short third man and it's back-to-back boundaries for Krunal

Shakib to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Williamson!! Shakib has his man and MI find themselves in further trouble. This was tossed up and held its line just outside off, Krunal was looking to play with the turn, closed the bat-face early and pops a leading edge, straight to KW at cover. It's a dolly and the SRH captain doesn't need a second invitation. Krunal Pandya c Williamson b Shakib 15(10) [4s-2]

Stanlake to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cracking shot, too short and well outside off, Suryakumar swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it in front of square, beats mid-wicket and rolls away to the fence

Sangwan to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan is underway! That's bread and butter for Gabbar. Too wide and he'll punish you all day. The length was on the shorter side as well - the recipe to get hit. Dhawan flashes his bat at it and slaps it through extra cover. Off the mark with a boundary

Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, second boundary for Dhawan. didn't try to over-hit, timed it well and the placement was good. The line is too straight from Bumrah - strayed on the pads and Dhawan used his wrists to glance it away in front of square on the leg-side. The man inside the 30-yard circle gives a chase, but can only escort the ball to the fence

Markande to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rohit!! Almost a horrible bit of miscommunication between Markande and Rohit, but the Mumbai skipper just about takes it in the end. He can see the funny side now, won't have been so funny had it gone down. But what a horrible shot from Pandey. All SRH need to do here is knock Markande around, the rate is under control. But Pandey charges out for a big hit. He's done in by the flight, and skies it up off a leading edge. It was Markande's catch, but the youngster leaves it to the skipper without any indication. At the very last moment, Rohit sinks low and snaffles it off the turf. Phew. The 20-year old is inspiring the visitors and keeping them in it. Manish Pandey c Rohit b Markande 11(8) [4s-1]
Markande to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, charges out to the pitch of the ball and smokes it down the ground. What a way to start from Hooda. Wow

Mustafizur to Shakib, FOUR, poor delivery from Mustafizur, can't afford to release the pressure this way. MI don't have much to play with. Short and wide, Shakib sizes it up early and slaps it through point

Markande to Shakib, out Bowled!! What a soft, soft dismissal. He had so much time on the back foot, how did he even edge it! Shortish googly from Markande, sits up outside off. Shakib is back in the crease to tamely pat it away through point, but all he does is chop it back onto the stumps. What a spell from Markande to give Mumbai hope from a pretty hopeless situation. He's done though, will the others rise? Shakib b Markande 12(12) [4s-1]

Cutting to Y Pathan, FOUR, pivots on the back leg and whip-pulls this delivery to the left of fine leg. Ordinary short of length delivery from Cutting, sitting up comfortably around Pathan's chest to be dispatched

Cutting to Y Pathan, FOUR, this has been a really sensible partnership for the most part, and here comes the reward. Cutting sprays on the pads, allowing Pathan an easy release of pressure as he glances it away past short fine leg

Bumrah to Y Pathan, out Caught by Pollard!! SRH are close, but this is still not over. Bumrah rushes Pathan with this short of length delivery which hurries onto his attempted pull shot. He was caught on the swivel as it spooned up off the splice, before nestling into the bucket hands of Pollard at mid-wicket. Y Pathan c Pollard b Bumrah 14(14) [4s-2]

Bumrah to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Oh my, what do we have here! Bumrah has ripped the game open once more with two in two. Pacy full ball outside off, the punchy fellow that Rashid is, he goes for an ambitious cover drive but can only nick it to the keeper. Hat-trick ball coming up. Rashid Khan c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 0(1)

Mustafizur to S Kaul, out Caught&Bowled!! Taken one-handed. The Mumbai supporters in the crowd erupt. Kaul was probably surprised by the line from Mustafizur here - it was full at the stumps after the previous two which were wide of him. He chips the off-cutter straight back, where Mustafizur sticks a hand out and the ball sticks. This will be some comeback from MI if they pull it off. S Kaul c and b Mustafizur 0(4)

Mustafizur to Sandeep Sharma, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Sandeep does in fact look for the boundary. He walks across, bends his back knee and tries for the same scoop that Kedar Jadhav hit for six a few nights back against Mustafizur. But what Sandeep achieves is very different. He doesn't get it anywhere near the middle, and spoons it up to short fine leg. Mustafizur raises his arms as the MI fans go wild. Sandeep Sharma c Krunal Pandya b Mustafizur 0(2)

Cutting to Deepak Hooda, SIX, he has clubbed this for six! What a start to the over. Low full toss wide of off from round the wicket, Hooda shuffles across a bit, bends his back knee and frees his arms. Muscles it over long-off

Sangwan to Dhawan, FOUR, how good are those wrists? Must have learnt a bit from VVS. Wasn't a bad ball at all from Sangwan. On a good length and on middle and leg, Dhawan stayed in his crease and flicked it nonchalantly over and wide of mid-on

Sangwan to Saha, FOUR, dropped! Cutting is the culprit. An ugly hoick attempted from Saha and he mistimed it horribly. Cutting, at mid-on, went back and got to the ball, but couldn't hold onto it. What's worse? He allows it go for a boundary. It was a good length ball and Saha was slightly late into his shot

Sangwan to Saha, FOUR, the top-edge goes over the keeper's head and runs away for another boundary. No luck lor Sangwan, who banged one short and the bal got big on the batsman. Saha, despite not being in a good position, went with the pull shot. He will be happy with the result though

Cutting to Saha, FOUR, Cutting hurls one fuller and Saha decides to go after it. It was bowled wide of off, Saha comes down for a walk and muscles it over the bowler's head to collect his third boundary

Krunal Pandya to Saha, no run, was that a chance? Saha backed away and Pandya followed him. Got a bit of turn and Saha missed the cut. The keeper failed to catch it cleanly. Not sure if there was any bat involved
Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, Bumrah overpitches and Dhawan takes heavy toll of it. The back leg is bent, to the pitch and then creamed the cover drive. The placement was spot on too
Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, 50 up for SRH! In a quick time. This was a pacy good length ball on middle and leg, Dhawan helps it along its way to fine leg. Runs coming thick and fast for the hosts

Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, edged, missed the stumps and races away to the fence. 14 runs off the over. It was a skiddy length ball from round the wicket and Dhawan checked his cross-batted stroke. The ball trimmed the inside edge, missed the sticks and evaded the keeper to the fine leg fence

Markande to Dhawan, FOUR, crashed away! The googly from Markande, but it's short and wide outside off. Dhawan trks back and muscles the cut through extra cover. Lewis sprints across and dives to his left, in vain

Markande to Saha, out Lbw!! An appeal for lbw against Saha and umpire Nigel Llong shakes his head in denial. Well, MI have decided to review. Fair delivery. It was the quicker googly and Saha was way out of his crease and the impact is above the knee-roll. What does the ball-tracker say? Three reds and Saha has to go. Llong can't belive it and so can't I. Brilliant review from Mumbai. Saha misses the clip as he didn't the pick the wrong 'un and was also late to bring his bat down. HawkEye showed it be hitting the leg stump. There's the breakthrough and it's the 20-year-old who does the job for the visitors. Saha lbw b Markande 22(20) [4s-3]

Mustafizur to Dhawan, FOUR, bangs one short does Mustafizur and there's no venom. Dhawan fetches it from well outside off and swivel-pulls it in front of square on the leg-side. He was in total control of the shot
Mustafizur to Williamson, FOUR, fullish ball outside off, Williamson opens the bat-face at the very last moment and runs it down to third man. Got it very fine

Mustafizur to Williamson, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Another review from MI. This time against KW for caught behind. Fair delivery. There's a sound. We'll have Ultraedge in a short while to confirm. There's a little spike. Is that enough for the on-field call to be reversed? I wouldn't want to be the third umpire. Well, the call has been made. Overturned! Two overs, two reviews and two wickets. Mumbai are coming back. It was the cutter from Mustafizur and Williamson tried to run it down to third man. Gets a faint outside edge and Ishan Kishan pouched it with ease. The keeper and the bowler heard it. Williamson c Ishan Kishan b Mustafizur 6(4) [4s-1]

Markande to Dhawan, out Caught by Bumrah!! In 35 balls that he has bowled in IPL, Mayank Markande has dismissed Dhoni and Dhawan. His CV will look good, for sure. So, Dhawan plays a high-risk shot and perishes. Was a quick and flattish leg-break, Dhawan goes down for the big slog sweep and top-edges straight to the man at long leg. Bumrah, the man in the deep, held his ground and took a calm catch. He was inches in front of the boundary rope. Went a couple of steps back, but looked back to find himself just in. Dhawan c Bumrah b Markande 45(28) [4s-8]
Markande to Manish Pandey, FOUR, shot! Too short, Pandey stays back and cuts it square of the wicket. Powerfully hit

Woakes to Rahul, SIX, excellent shot to get off the mark. He's in sublime touch, has carried his form into this match too. On a length outside off, stands tall and pumps that over covers for half a dozen. Flat and over the fence

Woakes to Rahul, SIX, beautiful flick that. Very less margin for error on this wicket. Full on middle and leg, Rahul keeps his eyes on the ball and flicks it over mid-wicket with nonchalance. Made that shot look effortless

Woakes to Rahul, FOUR, 16 runs off the opening over. Couldn't have asked for a better start. On the pads again and all Rahul does is clips it past the fielder at short fine leg, he dives there but the ball is too quick for him

U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, off the mark in style, Agarwal too. Picks the length early, it's short on middle and Agarwal gets in position early to flick it over square leg, fine leg is too square and the ball wins the race

U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, textbook straight drive! Presenting full face of the bat and high elbows. Fullish in length around off, Agarwal backs away, drives it straight past the bowler and gathers a boundary more
Chahal to Nair, 2 runs, the leg-break from Chahal, Nair reaches out and sweeps it in front of square on the on-side, comes back for the second run

Chahal to Nair, FOUR, Chahal's over is ruined once again off the last ball, this was tossed up nicely outside off, Nair bent half-forward, reverses his stance and helps it on its way to the long leg fence, make it off the fifth ball

Washington Sundar to Rahul, out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! Oh dear! That's a horror shot from KL, he was looking so good and now plays an atrocious heave, pushed through quicker and wider of off, KL was looking to mow it over the mid-wicket fence, doesn't get anywhere near the pitch of the ball, the fat top-edge loops towards short third man where Sarfaraz takes it with glee. End of a handy knock from the KXIP opener. Rahul c Sarfaraz Khan b Washington Sundar 47(30) [4s-2 6s-4]

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, out Bowled!! Khejroliya has his first IPL wicket and that's a big one as well. Nair was looking in good touch, decides to up the ante and instead has to walk back to the hut. Short of a length and on the stumps, wasn't short enough for the pull, Nair went through with the shot, connected with thin air and the ball clattered into the top of middle. RCB are beginning to boss this match now, can KXIP find an answer? Nair b Kulwant Khejroliya 29(26) [4s-3]

Washington Sundar to Stoinis, leg byes, 1 run, loud shout for LBW and RCB want a review. Kohli looked very keen to challenge the call. It's a fair delivery from Sundar, it has pitched in line, but is it spinning down leg? There's no bat and Ultraedge confirms it. I don't think it straightened enough, Hawk-Eye in and it's missing the leg-stump. RCB have lost their review. This was tossed up on middle and was spinning into the right-hander, Stoinis swept and missed, was struck on the pads, in front of leg and the angle was traking it down the leg-stump. The ball rolls away towards the off-side, the fielder has a shy at the bowler's end and concedes an overthrow

Washington Sundar to Stoinis, SIX, pushed through just outside off, Stoinis comes down the track, doesn't get close to the ball, went through with the swing and sends it sailing over long-off for a maximum

Washington Sundar to Stoinis, out Stumped!! This is poor cricket from KXIP, they are losing wickets in clusters. Another unnecessary shot from Stoinis and he's stranded way outside the crease, gave away his intentions way too early, stepped down the track, allows Sundar to shorten his length. He still didn't accept defeat, swung recklessly across the line and missed, an easy stumping for de Kock. Stoinis st de Kock b Washington Sundar 11(9) [6s-1]

Kulwant Khejroliya to Ashwin, FOUR, cracking shot, short and on the stumps, Ashwin swivels across, rolls his wrists and helps it on its way, the man in the deep is square and the ball beats him to the fence
Kulwant Khejroliya to Ashwin, FOUR, beautifully played, length delivery outside off, Ashwin leans forward, drives it on the up and beats the diving fielder at cover, no need to run for those

Kulwant Khejroliya to Axar, out Lbw!! Axar has been given OUT LBW and he wants a review. This looked adjacent to the naked eye. It's a fair delivery and there's no bat as well. The impact seems to be in front of middle, the height isn't an issue. No edge, says Ultraedge. Hawk-Eye in, three reds and Axar is OUT. Simple call for umpire Ravi and Khejroliya has struck with his last ball. This was full and came back with the angle, Axar shuffled a long way across on the flick, once he missed, it was curtains, decided to take a chance as he reviewed, but to no avail. Axar lbw b Kulwant Khejroliya 2(3)

Woakes to Ashwin, FOUR, lovely shot, this is turning out to be a fine cameo from Ashwin, comes down the track, uses his reach to good effect and clears cover with the lofted off-drive, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Woakes to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Kohli!! This was always coming! Tye was looking to slog everything out of the park, on a good length and just outside off, might have been the slower ball, Tye swung through the line, went off the toe-end of the bat, got plenty of height but not the distance. Kohli ran across to his left from long-on and held on to a simple catch. Andrew Tye c Kohli b Woakes 7(7)

Chahal to Ashwin, SIX, cracking shot - made it even more special as he was done in completely by the flight. Chahal saw his coming, slowed down the pace, dragged it wide of off, Ashwin reached out and slaps it back over the bowler's head, all the way for a maximum

Chahal to Ashwin, out Stumped!! Has Ashwin been stumped? de Kock certainly seems confident. It's a fair delivery, the bat is in the air, Ashwin is way short as well and he's OUT. That's the end of a mighty fine cameo from the KXIP captain, will it be the clinching factor in this match? Smart bowling from Chahal, sensed that Ashwin was coming down the track, threw in a loopy leg-break, Ashwin came down the track, doesn't get anywhere near the ball, swung across the line in hope and missed, de Kock did the rest. Ashwin st de Kock b Chahal 33(21) [4s-3 6s-1]

Woakes to Mujeeb, out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! KXIP have been bowled out for 155. RCB will feel they have done a good job with the ball. This was short and at the stumps, Rahman was backing away on the pull, the ball was just too quick for him, gets a top-edge that lobs behind square on the off-side. de Kock went for the catch, but Sarfaraz called for it and holds on safely. Mujeeb c Sarfaraz Khan b Woakes 0(2)

Kulwant Khejroliya to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, errs in line after a good start. This is a shortish one on leg and Agarwal doesn't miss out on the chance. Swivels and drags it down to the fine leg fence, can't keep a fielder there

U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by de Kock!! Stunning catch by de Kock behind the wicket. Full length delivery in the zone around off, Agarwal goes for it, swings hard at it and ends up getting a healthy edge. de Kock flies to his right and pulls off a beauty. So just like always, Agarwal departs after getting off to a flier. Good entertaining cameo! Mayank Agarwal c de Kock b U Yadav 15(11) [4s-3]

U Yadav to Finch, out Lbw!! Golden duck for Finch! Umesh is on a hat-trick as the umpire's call stays. It was a length delivery around middle and Finch who tried to flick it off his toes missed it and got struck on the pads. Pitching in line, impact in line and clipping - umpire's call. Can he bag the hat-trick now? Finch lbw b U Yadav 0(1)

U Yadav to Yuvraj, FOUR, what was the fielder doing there? He should have been back near the fence. Could have been a straight forward catch there. Short of a length delivery around off, Yuvraj swivels and pulls it over the leaping fielder at deep square leg, guess it was Sarfaraz Khan

U Yadav to Yuvraj, out Bowled!! Third wicket of the over. Umesh Yadav is on fire! Cleans up Yuvraj with a beautiful delivery. Comes from round the wicket and fires in a length delivery from wide off the crease. Yuvraj who looks to fend it, misses it altogether and the middle-stump is out of here. Look at Umesh's celebration, he's absolutely delighted. Just look at him. Fist pump and all! Yuvraj b U Yadav 4(4) [4s-1]

Kulwant Khejroliya to Rahul, SIX, Rahul continues to march on. Wickets falling at one end won't make him a difference. This one is a short delivery on leg, Rahul keeps his calm and pulls it over fine leg, off his hips and over the fence

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, FOUR, Rahul, Agarwal and now Nair. All Karnataka boys have got off the mark with a boundary or six tonight. Full length delivery around off, Nair keeps his head still and drills it past the fielder at mid-off, no chance to stop that

Chahal to Rahul, SIX, flat and over the fielder at deep square leg. Short and quick on leg, Rahul waits for it and drags it powerfully over the man in the deep, that went like a rocket, lot of bottom hand on that blow by Rahul

Woakes to Nair, FOUR, class apart. It's a short delivery around off, Nair arches back and guides it to perfection over the empty cordon, third man sprints to his left but it's one bounce and over the fence

Chahal to Rahul, FOUR, no... he doesn't! How often have we seen the last delivery of the over to be the spoiler! Darts it on leg and Rahul gets down on his knee to paddle it away and a chase by the fielder is not enough to stop this as the ball races away

End of a handy knock from the KXIP opener. Rahul c Sarfaraz Khan b Washington Sundar 47(30) [4s-2 6s-4]

Axar lbw b Kulwant Khejroliya 2(3)

Kohli ran across to his left from long-on and held on to a simple catch. Andrew Tye c Kohli b Woakes 7(7)

Ashwin st de Kock b Chahal 33(21) [4s-3 6s-1]

Mujeeb c Sarfaraz Khan b Woakes 0(2)

Full length delivery in the zone around off, Agarwal goes for it, swings hard at it and ends up getting a healthy edge. de Kock flies to his right and pulls off a beauty. So just like always, Agarwal departs after getting off to a flier. Good entertaining cameo! Mayank Agarwal c de Kock b U Yadav 15(11) [4s-3]

It was a length delivery around middle and Finch who tried to flick it off his toes missed it and got struck on the pads. Pitching in line, impact in line and clipping - umpire's call. Can he bag the hat-trick now? Finch lbw b U Yadav 0(1)

U Yadav to Yuvraj, FOUR, what was the fielder doing there? He should have been back near the fence. Could have been a straight forward catch there. Short of a length delivery around off, Yuvraj swivels and pulls it over the leaping fielder at deep square leg, guess it was Sarfaraz Khan

U Yadav to Yuvraj, out Bowled!! Third wicket of the over. Umesh Yadav is on fire! Cleans up Yuvraj with a beautiful delivery. Comes from round the wicket and fires in a length delivery from wide off the crease. Yuvraj who looks to fend it, misses it altogether and the middle-stump is out of here. Look at Umesh's celebration, he's absolutely delighted. Just look at him. Fist pump and all! Yuvraj b U Yadav 4(4) [4s-1]

Kulwant Khejroliya to Rahul, SIX, Rahul continues to march on. Wickets falling at one end won't make him a difference. This one is a short delivery on leg, Rahul keeps his calm and pulls it over fine leg, off his hips and over the fence

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, FOUR, Rahul, Agarwal and now Nair. All Karnataka boys have got off the mark with a boundary or six tonight. Full length delivery around off, Nair keeps his head still and drills it past the fielder at mid-off, no chance to stop that

Chahal to Rahul, SIX, flat and over the fielder at deep square leg. Short and quick on leg, Rahul waits for it and drags it powerfully over the man in the deep, that went like a rocket, lot of bottom hand on that blow by Rahul

Woakes to Nair, FOUR, class apart. It's a short delivery around off, Nair arches back and guides it to perfection over the empty cordon, third man sprints to his left but it's one bounce and over the fence

Chahal to Rahul, FOUR, no... he doesn't! How often have we seen the last delivery of the over to be the spoiler! Darts it on leg and Rahul gets down on his knee to paddle it away and a chase by the fielder is not enough to stop this as the ball races away
Hardik Pandya to Roy, FOUR, that came right off the meat. On a length outside off, Roy stays put and punches this sweetly through the gap at covers, sweeper kept it place right after that shot

Hardik Pandya to Gambhir, FOUR, Pandya doesn't like it. He's not happy with himself. Bowls a shortish delivery on leg and Gambhir simply puts it away to the square leg fence with a nonchalant clip off his hips, 11 runs off the opening over

Dananjaya to Roy, SIX, that's huge! Akila concedes his first six of IPL and that's only his second delivery. Nothing much he could have done about it. Flighted one around middle and leg, Roy shimmies down the wicket and smokes it for a 95 metre six over mid-wicket. Welcome to the IPL, chirps Nasser Hussain on air

Dananjaya to Roy, FOUR, the spinner put under pressure right away by Jason. Picks the length early on this short delivery, camps back and hammers it past the fielder at wide long-on, no chance of the stopping that

Bumrah to Roy, 2 runs, oh no! Poor fielding, but it's fifty for Jason Roy, great effort. True pitch, lovely stroke-maker, you got to expect him to come good and boy, he's done well in a stiff chase. Very full and outside off stump, Roy squeezes it out, straight to backward point and it goes right through him

Bumrah to Roy, FOUR, in the airrr and if Pollard can't get there with that trampoline jump of his, nobody can. Gee these batsmen have no mercy, not even for Jas Bumrah! Well, this was a freebie ball though, full and in the slot, Roy muscles it hard over mid-off and looks like Pollard has hurt himself coming down hard on the ground

Krunal Pandya to Pant, FOUR, welcome into the attack Mr. Krunal! Pant will love this - left-armer turning it back into him. Leg-side is going to be busy. This was actually bowled pretty well, very slow although full, Pant delays the lofted drive and manages to hit it straight over the bowler to split long-off and long-on

Krunal Pandya to Pant, out Caught by Pollard!! That's Pollard for you. Freak on the field. And Krunal roars in delight. Dangerous 69-run stand broken. This was a flighted delivery wide outside off stump, something that left-arm spinners do against left-handed batsmen to take the leg-side out of play, Pant tries to muscle the ball hard through the off-side, wanted to hit towards cover, but he hit straight and Pollard ran quickly to his left, dived and took it air-borne. Pant misses a deserved fifty by three runs. Pant c Pollard b Krunal Pandya 47(25) [4s-6 6s-2]

Markande to Maxwell, FOUR, the invitation there from the bowler with the flighted delivery, you can't blame him because he's going for wickets. But just that he's bowled this too full for the batsman to be troubled and Maxwell smashes it straight over the non-striker's head to take long-on out of the equation

Markande to Maxwell, SIX, another tossed up one and Maxi slog-sweeps it all the way over backward square leg. It's on the stumps and Maxi won't miss those. Markande's having an of day. Tip for you Markande: If you are bowling to Maxwell, bowl the away-spinning ones wide outside off stump, hope for Maxwell to slog and slice one up in the air

Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Oh that's a stunning grab from brother Hardik. Unbelievable. The catch of the tournament so far. This is exactly what Markande should have done in the previous over. Turn it away outside off stump like Krunal did this time. Maxwell tries to go for a big hit, but the bat turns in his hands on impact with the ball and it's a slice that flies more towards deep extra-cover. But Hardik put his skating boots on, got there and flew full length to his left and took it with both hands horizontal to the ground. Just amazing! Krunal has given a lot of hope for MI with 2 wickets in 8 balls. Maxwell c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 13(6) [4s-1 6s-1]

Dananjaya to Roy, 2 runs, that's almost another catch. Delhi are going really hard and the opportunity for a wicket is always there. Need a bit of calmness out there. 50 odd 35 balls isn't that tough, especially at the Wankhede. Very full delivery, Roy slogs, connects well, luckily it dipped on SKY who was diving forward
Dananjaya to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, oh what a shot! The quicker delivery from Dananjaya, Iyer slogs really well and the timing is exceptional, sails into the second tier over the mid-wicket boundary

Krunal Pandya to Roy, SIX, this game is so unkind to the bowlers. Krunal Pandya has actually deceived the batsman in flight and with length, Roy, who was jumping out of the crease was nowhere close to the pitch of the ball, but he's gifted with timing and has a great willow in his hands and that combo is good enough for him to back himself and go through with the lofted hit over the bowler's head

Krunal Pandya to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that should have been stopped by Rahul Chahar at deep point. Short and wide outside off stump, Iyer cuts, Chahar got there running to his left from sweeper, but he fumbled

Bumrah to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, dropped, tough chance though! Fizz the man there at short third man. Slower delivery wide outside off stump, Iyer checks the dab, gets a leading edge that flies to the left of short third, Fizz moved to his left and dived, but couldn't hold on. Massive moment in the game

Bumrah to Roy, FOUR, a dropped catch and then the MI's best bowler has been carted away for four next ball. Five runs off 2 balls and the asking rate is only around 9. Short of a length delivery on the stumps, Roy pulls powerfully and there's no one at deep square leg to stop the boundary

Bumrah to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, slower ball alright, but this is way outside off stump, Iyer delays the cut shot, puts it past backward point and the man sweeping the off-side boundary could not cut it off as well

Bumrah to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, another catch put down and it's Fizz again. You don't deserve to win if you are going to field like that. That stare from Rohit Sharma tells it all. Silence all around the Wankhede. Good length delivery outside off stump, Iyer backs away and slices it, went to the right of short third man, easy catch and he spills it

Mustafizur to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, there is deep square leg, there is deep mid-wicket but Shreyas Iyer has expertly split them both with a well timed pull shot. Mustafizur went normal pace on this short ball and it didn't rise high enough for Iyer to be troubled

Mustafizur to Roy, FOUR, that's a quality hit from Roy but hang on, why on earth did you bowl normal pace Mustafizur? Full and wide outside off stump, Roy drills the drive over cover and there's no one in the deep. Great start to the over for DD

Mustafizur to Roy, SIX, uppish and all the way. Scores level! What a hit under pressure. With a boundary through the off-side previous ball and a field set for the leg-side, Roy knows that the bowler isn't going to bowl outside off stump, so he moves across and flicks this short of length delivery with a strong bottom hand grip to send it clear of the man at fine leg

Mustafizur to Roy, no run, a hat-trick of dots, you are kidding me! Slower delivery again that spins across, Roy pokes at it and misses. MI review just like that, obviously no edge on that. Gee this is unbelievable stuff

Hardik Pandya to Gambhir, FOUR, one bounce and into the cushions. That'll release a bit of pressure off Gambhir. Picks the length early, rocks back and pulls the shortish delivery over square leg, one bounce and into the fence
Hardik Pandya to Roy, SIX, in the arc out of the park. Full length delivery, a knuckle ball and Roy with a lot of authority picks it up over wide long-on, would have been a six on any ground

Hardik Pandya to Roy, SIX, ahh, that was even better than the previous six. Short delivery again, Roy transfers his weight on to the back foot and murders it over square leg with a pull, 96 metre biggie that one, this is why he's in the team

Hardik Pandya to Roy, FOUR, he's looking unstoppable, just like the MI openers were earlier in the day. Pandya dishes a full length delivery around off, Roy stays put and pummels it right over the bowler's head

Mustafizur to Gambhir, out Caught by Rohit!! The Fizz strikes, gets the DD skipper. Gambhir was struggling and his struggle finally comes to an end. Short of a length around off and the opener goes ahead with the pull. As there's a bit extra bounce on the delivery, it catches the top edge and Rohit Sharma at short mid-wicket does the rest. Should have given the strike to Roy who's striking the ball so well. This wicket might affect Roy's mindset now! Gambhir c Rohit b Mustafizur 15(16) [4s-2]

Markande to Pant, FOUR, first one of the innings for Pant. This was short and wide outside off and was meant to be put away. Pant doesn't miss out, reaches for it and thrashes it away, beats sweeper cover quite comfortably

Markande to Pant, FOUR, strong bottom hand on that. Flatter delivery around off and it's short too, Pant drags it away with a firm pull and beats the man at deep mid-wicket this time around, this was a powerful blow by the pocket-sized dynamite
Markande to Pant, FOUR, reverse swept! Shortish delivery around off, Pant does well to reverse sweep that over short third man, gets four more

Markande to Roy, SIX, so much power on that. Was a tossed up delivery around off, Roy went down on his knee and smoked it flat over long-off, even a leaping Pollard near the fence couldn't take the catch

Markande to Pant, FOUR, Markande is not having a good day with the ball. 10 runs in the first over, already 16 off this. Went down on his knee and swept that flighted delivery over square leg nicely, two boundaries and a six in this over
Dananjaya to Pant, SIX, Pant pumps it! Shimmies down the wicket and towers the flighted delivery right over the bowler's head for six more, straight as an arrow that was
Dananjaya to Pant, FOUR, and the boundaries continue to flow. Follows it up with a sweet sweep. Loopy delivery around off, Pant goes down and sweeps it firmly towards the long leg fence

Dananjaya to Pant, SIX, the partnership between Pant and Roy is more than 50! Tossed up delivery around off, Pant puts on his dancing shoes and slaugters it over long-on to bring up Delhi's 100 in style
Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, mid-off a touch squarer and this full length delivery finds a way. Driven with a straight bat. Always on with the ball nicely pitched up in your half
Boult to Lewis, FOUR, just a trifle short that and Lewis swivels with the incoming angle. Blasts it one-legged in front of the square leg umpire

Boult to Lewis, leg byes, FOUR, leg byes given but looked like there was some bat. Hung over from the last boundary, Boult tries to cramp Lewis for room and overdoes it with a gimme down leg. Glanced away for four runs. Who cares if it's off the bat or not..
Nadeem to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, misfielded by Maxwell at mid-on. Flat from Nadeem, Suryakumar Yadav wrists it away and basks in the glory of someone else's plight

Rahul Tewatia to Suryakumar Yadav, out Lbw!! Big, big appeal from the keeper more so than anyone else. Given. Now then, Suryakumar deliberates with his partner for a reasonable amount of time, before taking the review. Did the ball straighten enough, or was it sliding down? It's clipping leg-stump according to ball-tracking. So the umpire's call will stay. What a precious spell this has been from Rahul Tewatia, standing out amid the carnage to remove both the opening batsmen. Suryakumar was quickly down on his knees to sweep this hard, but failed to connect. It didn't grip the pitch much after drifting in, but gripped just enough to be clipping the stump. Suryakumar Yadav lbw b Rahul Tewatia 53(32) [4s-7 6s-1]

Maxwell to Rohit, FOUR, this is beautifully done from Rohit. So deft. Perfectly good delivery from Maxwell, turning in from a length towards off. Rohit's intentions are highly concealed all the way through, but just when the ball is about to pass him, he lays the softest of touches to deflect it past the keeper's glove into the third man boundary
Maxwell to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, oh poor delivery. He's fired this well down leg, Kishan sees the opportunity early and paddle-swats it to the fine leg boundary
Rahul Tewatia to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, he's bowled pretty short to Kishan so far, and unlike before, this time he's punished for it. Kishan rocks back and thumps his pull over mid-wicket

Rahul Tewatia to Ishan Kishan, SIX, oh my, he's brought out the reverse-sweep and it's gone for six. Completely switched his legs around, got blessed with a full toss and walloped it over backward point

Rahul Tewatia to Ishan Kishan, SIX, six more to finish the over, ruins the figures of Tewatia. Puts his dancing shoes on, and despite not getting to the pitch of it, he's able to drag it away over the wide long-on boundary. The key was that he went through with it

Christian to Rohit, FOUR, goes for the slower short ball again, but gets it down leg. With fine leg up, Rohit only has to help his pull past the fielder in the circle, which he comfortably does after swivelling into the shot
Shami to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, 124kph, short of length delivery just outside off, Kishan cheekily dabs it fine of short third man

Shami to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, these are weird tactics. Both fine leg and third man are up, so you'd expect the length to be full. But Shami's gone short more often than not. Now agreed, this one rushes Kishan on the pull as he's taken by surprise. But he swings into it and the top-edge balloons past the keeper. Always a risk with this field
Christian to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, short of length delivery angled in on middle, 116kph, thwacked through square leg on the front foot. They amble back for two
Christian to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, just over extra-cover! 117kph, length ball wide of off, Kishan had to reach out for it but he throws everything and is able to smear it over the fielder

Christian to Ishan Kishan, out Bowled!! Switches his legs, looks for the reverse-sweep again but completely misses this full toss. It rams into middle and leg stump from round the wicket. He was doing a decent job of hitting straight, probably didn't need to do that. But a superb knock nevertheless. Ishan Kishan b Christian 44(23) [4s-5 6s-2]

Christian to Pollard, out Bowled!! Would you believe it, Christian now has two in two. Pollard walks out to him first ball, tries to work this length ball round the corner but misses it. The ball gets stuck in his thigh pad and dips behind to knock over off-stump. These are crucial strikes as Delhi hope to reign things back. Pollard b Christian 0(1)
Shami to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, off-cutter from Shami, but it's right in the slot for Krunal to hammer it over mid-off

Boult to Rohit, out Caught by Roy!! Sliced up in the air, Roy lumbers across from long-off and takes it comfortably. Lovely bowling from Boult. He slanted this off-cutter away from Rohit's swiping zone, and it gripped further away from him after pitching. Despite that, Rohit doesn't quite smarten up. He swings cross-batted and slices it off the outside half. Rohit c Roy b Boult 18(15) [4s-2]

Shami to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! What is happening? It's been lapped straight into the hands of short fine leg, but the umpire has gone upstairs for some reason. Oh wait, his decision was not out, and so Delhi reviewed it immediately. Bizarre. It looked like it came straight off the bat-face. Krunal walks across for the scoop, gets a thick inside edge onto thigh pad and it spoons up to Tewatia. So the decision will be overturned. Krunal Pandya c Rahul Tewatia b Shami 11(10) [4s-1]

Boult to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Another one falls. An off-cutter from Boult, Hardik mistimes the slog off the inside half and holes out. Iyer, it seemed like, had lost it in the sun initially. But he picked it up in time and then sunk low for the grab. Hardik Pandya c Shreyas Iyer b Boult 2(3)

Nadeem to Lewis, 2 runs, dropped by Trent Boult but geez that was a good attempt. Top-edge on the slog-sweep -- told ya that Nadeem was bowling slower in this over -- Boult runs back from backward square leg, doesn't get beneath the ball but doesn't stay put there. Rushes in front and stops the boundary. Top class athlete with a short term memory loss for good
Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, nicely done. He's not giving up. Pitched it right up there again, desperately hoping for some swing, but is driven handsomely down the ground

Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's box-office chic and very good thinking. Short ball angled across, Suryakumar Yadav's ducking initially, then sees that the height isn't much and ramps that over to the third man fence with utter style
Boult to Lewis, SIX, early signs: good pitch against the new ball. Length ball right in Lewis's arc and he goes for it. Will go, 10 out of 10 times. Swings it over long-on
Nadeem to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's dropped a touch short, so even though it's turning the ball's hittable. Suryakumar Yadav rocks back and slaps that disparagingly wide of mid-off

Nadeem to Lewis, SIX, that's been hit to the ESA kids in the stands. Brings up Mumbai's fastest fifty in IPL. Dragged down from round the wicket, left-handed Lewis goes back and clouts it over deep mid-wicket. It was a pull but more casually ruthless
Shami to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, Shami does this. Drops it harmlessly on a back of a length on leg-stump, and Suryakumar Yadav's been served a pie. Helps it over fine leg with a good arm swing

Shami to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, now this is a fine, fine yorker.. and look what happens. Suryakumar Yadav squeezes it out with an open bat face and has that scooting to the third man fence. Who says cricket's for egalitarians?!

Shami to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, let's say Shami's gotten obsessed with bowling yorkers. More yorkers. Better yorkers. He wants redemption for that boundary that Suryakumar Yadav hit earlier in the over. Goes for one again, bowls a low full toss on leg-stump instead -- how? why? what? -- and is flicked round the corner
Christian to Lewis, FOUR, from over the wicket and that's been pitched full. Right there to be hit. Lewis doesn't even bother about the footwork. Stays put and slamns that through wide mid-off
Christian to Lewis, FOUR, about time we saw a half-volley. All he had to do was stay leg-side of the ball and deflect it with an open bat face. Does so, and it's a boundary through cover-point

Christian to Lewis, FOUR, another. Keep 'em counting. Another half-volley, and this one's been scorched through covers with an elegant bat flow. The deliveries remain the same, only Lewis's shots are evolving into something more telegenic

Christian to Lewis, SIX, this is unreal unravelling of Christian, and Delhi Daredevils. Slower on a length say, Lewis clears his front leg and sends it romping over long-off. More timing than anything else
Rahul Tewatia to Lewis, SIX, it's a slower googly from Rahul Tewatia, which allows Lewis to come down the track and lever it over straightish long-on

Rahul Tewatia to Lewis, out Caught by Roy!! Looked like a googly but replays show it's a quick slider, angling across from over the wicket, which gets the wicket. Lewis shimmies down the track, isn't quite to the pitch of the ball and ends up slicing it to long-off, where Jason Roy runs in and takes the catch reverse-cupped. Lewis c Roy b Rahul Tewatia 48(28) [4s-4 6s-4]

Maxwell to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, now he's hanging the ball flat in the air. Full, worked to long-on and that's a half-century for Suryakumar Yadav off 29 balls. Second of his career. Wankhede crowd go berserk with the flags. Quite blue.

Stanlake to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's a cracking shot. Width on offer and Lynn makes the most of it. Short and wide outside off, throws his bat at it and crunches it past the fielder at point, races away to the fence in no time

Stanlake to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Williamson pulls off a blinder, almost. Good length delivery around off, Lynn goes ahead with his lofted shot and miscues it over mid-off, Williamson goes back running, extends his right arm but can't take the catch, the ball crawls away to the long-off boundary
Shakib to Narine, FOUR, throws his hands at another ball drifting away and shoots an outside edge over the two fielders behind square on the off-side

Shakib to Narine, out Caught by Williamson!! This is just a culmination of what was brewing. Shakib's getting the ball to drift away, Narine's throwing his bat and getting lucky. Not this time. Off the toe-end, there's Williamson at wide long-on, having covered some ground from mid-wicket and tumbling behind to take this one. Lovely catch. He's on fire in the field, is Williamson, this IPL. Narine c Williamson b Shakib 9(10) [4s-1]

Shakib to Chris Lynn, out Caught&Bowled!! Shakib's stretched into double his height with this sideways dive and taken this left-handed inches above the ground. A bit of replays there to ascertain the dismissal but that's out. Kolkata crowd knows it. Arm-ball again that sticks a bit in the pitch, Chris Lynn's making room down leg and can only tamely pop it back down the pitch. And then Shakib takes over. Chris Lynn c and b Shakib 49(34) [4s-7 6s-1]

Stanlake to A Russell, SIX, Hooda's flown in the air, caught it reverse-cupped and strewn that back in the playing field. Or has he? Nah, the left foot just hits the deep point ropes. Russell throws his arms at the width, with weight still on the front foot. Just throwing his arms..

Stanlake to A Russell, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Manish Pandey, that's some catch. But what's Russell upto? Another one that he totally wanted to hit into the stands. Stays leg-side of the ball and wafts, and ends up slicing it. Into the night sky, Manish Pandey runs back from backward point, with his back to the ball, and leaps in front to take that. There was third man in the vicinity too but he just leaves it to Manish, and for the right reasons. A Russell c Manish Pandey b Stanlake 9(5) [6s-1]
S Kaul to Karthik, FOUR, back of a length delivery, punched exquisitely behind point

Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Shakib!! Bhuvneshwar is too good for a debutant. Takes the pace off again with his knuckles and gets the ball to dart away. And Shubman Gill, overcommitted on the front foot, reaches out, only to slice that over to extra cover. Shubman Gill c Shakib b Bhuvneshwar 3(9)
Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, another leg break, Karthik waits and waits before dabbing that just wide of the keeper. Boundary through third man

Rashid Khan to Shivam Mavi, 2 runs, Rashid thinks he has Shivam Mavi LBW and Williamson reviews.. Missed his sweep there, deflecting the ball to short fine leg. And guess what, he hasn't missed it. It's taken the under-side of the glove and gone to short fine leg, who with a wide throw at the bowler's end allowed the second
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, SIX, what a price to pay. Slower ball again, Karthik picks it up and mauls the free-hit ball over long-off

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, out Caught by Saha!! These knuckle balls are sticking in the pitch and darting away. Karthik gets a top-edge on his attempted flat-batted swish, for the keeper to take a good catch few paces to his right. Karthik c Saha b Bhuvneshwar 29(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, the power of Lynn on that shot will take that away to the fence. Slower delivery, the knuckle ball by Bhuvi, Lynn backs away and goes through with his horizontal slap, beats the man at mid-on and finds the fence. Wasn't middled properly but those muscles help him

Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, out Caught by Saha!! Uthappa thought that he would get away with it but DRS comes to Sunrisers' rescue. Short delivery outside off, Robin tries to run that down to third man but ends up getting a slight edge to that. UltraEdge confirms the same and the ploy to open with Uthappa has back fired. Uthappa c Saha b Bhuvneshwar 3(8)

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, crunched away! Good length delivery angled away from the batsman, Rana rocks back and slams that through the gap at point, lightning speed on that as the batsman gets his first boundary, on the first ball. Positive start for the southpaw

S Kaul to Shivam Mavi, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Imagine Bhuvneshwar escaping a collision with Stanlake.. he offers a smile but I think it's for more than just pulling off this catch. It's relief personified. Another knuckle ball this from Kaul, Shivam Mavi reaches out and pops it behind off the toe-end. It's Bhuvi's catch at short fine leg but there's Stanlake, rushing past the keeper to attempt to take this. Just about evades his teammate to my relief. Shivam Mavi c Bhuvneshwar b S Kaul 7(8)
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, slapped away! Knuckle delivery, fraction short and outside off, Lynn frees his arms and goes aerial, evades cover-point with a cut and manages to get four runs

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, lucky favoring Lynn tonight. This is a slower delivery again, full in length around off, the big man swings hard at it and manages to get an inside edge, past the stumps, past the man at short fine leg and into the fence

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, glorious! He's off to a flier, like always. This is a full length ball and well outside off, Lynn doesn't miss out and drills it through covers, right into the gap, Kaul greeted with 14 runs, quite expensive.
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, SIX, that's massive. Such sweetly it was timed. Picks the googly early, gets down on his knee and slog sweeps it over mid-wicket, high and handsome that was
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, ends the over with a cracking boundary. This was short and width was there, enough for the batsman to go ahead with his square cut and find the fence

Stanlake to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Excellent grab by Manish that, fumbles on the first attempt but manages to hold on as he's about to hit the ground. Was short and wide outside off, Rana cut that hard to point where a rather sharp Manish pulled off a screamer. Replays confirm that the catch was taken and SRH strike right aftter the break. Stanlake is absolutely loving this, bounce and pace has helped him put the pressure on Rana as he gets his scalp. Nitish Rana c Manish Pandey b Stanlake 18(16) [4s-2 6s-1]

Shakib to Narine, 1 run, Manish Pandey is on fire in the field tonight, as he almost pulls off yet another stunner. Leaps up in the air near the boundary, takes the catch and parries it away as he's about to hit the ground. Narine walked down the track and lofted that to long-on where Pandey plucked it, parried it and tried to take it on the second attempt with a desperate dive, but hard luck. Could have been six on any other day.

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, SIX, that's high, miles up in the air... Was the knuckle ball and Lynn went hard at it, towers it up towards long-off where Rashid settles underneath but goes for it only with his left hand, gets a bit on that and eventually parries it over the fence. Was a very tough chance that, difficult to spot those in the night sky
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, another inside edge and Lynn survives. Fullish around off, Lynn swings hard at it and gets an inside edge past the leg-stump, moves on to 46* with that boundary
Johnson to Saha, FOUR, first runs off the bat from Saha and SRH. It was on the stumps, Saha gets in the position quickly and whips it wide of the fine leg fielder for a four
A Russell to Saha, FOUR, just over of the square leg fielder. It was on a good length and outside off, Saha pulls it off the front root, manages to clear the fielder and ball races for a four

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, another short of length delivery, Dhawan gets into position quickly and pulls it in front of square for a four. He doesn't time it as well as he would have liked but the placement is good enough
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson puts this away. Much needed release of pressure. Short googly from Yadav, the SRH captain sits back and pumps it through mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, four more. Two short balls in a row from Yadav. He'll be disappointed by this. Googly on leg-stump, Williamson picks length early, gets down low and swats it through backward square
A Russell to Shakib, FOUR, Shakib swivels into the pull but is clearly hurried by this short of length delivery. He's lucky that the top-edge has flown over the keeper's head
A Russell to Shakib, FOUR, now goes over mid-off! He was actually done in by the slower ball, as evidenced by his bottom hand coming off, but more importantly, he went through with it

A Russell to Shakib, SIX, woah, the ball has gone skimming over the third man boundary. Boy he hit this hard. Short and wide, a ferocious slash from Shakib. Gets all of it. Massive over in the context of the game - 16 off it. SRH back in control

Shivam Mavi to Williamson, SIX, Williamson uses the pace of Mavi, all 140kph of it, and whips the pull away over long leg. What a brilliant shot. He swivelled across, remained on the front foot while pushing his weight back and used his wrists gloriously

Chawla to Shakib, out Bowled!! Through him. Flat through the air from Chawla, zoots it through Shakib who's on the prowl down the pitch. Never allowed him to get anywhere close to the ball, cramped him up and it deflected off his pad onto middle stump. Do KKR still have hope here? Shakib b Chawla 27(21) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chawla to Deepak Hooda, no run, now then, there's a review from KKR for leg-before. Hooda didn't pick a googly from Chawla and was hit on the back pad. But in real time, it looked like the impact may have been outside off. Oh wait, there's an inside edge too. So that's that

Narine to Williamson, 1 run, another out-swinger on a good length, punched down to long-off. Brings up the fifty for Williamson. He has to finish this off for his team, lest the follow the route they took against Mumbai

Johnson to Williamson, out Caught by A Russell!! Williamson flicks this straight into the hands of square leg, what a soft dismissal! He immediately throws his head back, not able to believe what he's just done. Good length ball on leg-stump, and this is a loose shot from the captain. Just so lacklustre. This could get interesting. Williamson c A Russell b Johnson 50(44) [4s-4 6s-1]
Johnson to Y Pathan, FOUR, Pathan kills the crowd's enthusiasm, crashes this full ball through extra cover. What a hit. He nailed this drive to the fence

A Russell to Y Pathan, FOUR, hoists this over extra-cover. Pathan's stepping up to the occasion against his former franchise. Back of length delivery outside off, he gets it close to the bottom of the bat but there's enough on the drive to clear cover
A Russell to Y Pathan, SIX, that will be it. The SRH dugout rises as Pathan pulls this short ball into the stands. SRH pull off their first win at the Eden Gardens
Johnson to Saha, FOUR, Johnson is becoming predictable here with his length. It was on a short of length again, Saha holds his shape and pulls it over square leg for another four.
Johnson to Saha, FOUR, another slower ball outside off from Johnson. Saha reads the change in pace and drives it through the off-side for a four

Johnson to Saha, FOUR, cracking shot! It was touch fuller of good length, Saha lofts it wide of the mid-on fielder for a four. he played that shot with a straight bat and that made it even better. Minimum risk and effective result!

Narine to Saha, out Caught by Karthik!! KKR gets the much needed breakthrough. Saha doesn't even wait for the finger to go up as he walks back. It was an off-spinner down the leg-side, Saha gets a faint tickle to it and Karthik behind the stumps makes no mistake. Saha c Karthik b Narine 24(15) [4s-5]
Chawla to Williamson, FOUR, beautiful use of the feet from Williamson. He comes down the track and drives it wide of the mid-off fielder for a four
