Chawla to Williamson, FOUR, goes on the back foot in a flash and drives it through cover for another four. Stellar timing from the skipper

Narine to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Narine is on fire! His second wicket in that many overs. He is ensuring that KKR remains in the game. It was an off-spinner and Dhawan was late onto it, trying to play across the line. Ball hits his pads and goes onto hit the stumps. Dhawan will be gutted with this shot. Dhawan b Narine 7(7) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Manish Pandey, out Lbw!! Pandey was chatting with Williamson regarding the review but umpire says time is up and Manish Pandey will have to depart. It was a flighted delivery which turned in after pitching, Manish Pandey's bat was behind the pads and ball raps him on the pads. It looked adjacent, the only question was whether it was going down the leg-side. Umpire thinks it wasn't and he raises his finger slowly in a stylish manner. Manish Pandey lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 4(11)

Gowtham to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, McCullum is off the mark and so is RCB, that too in style. Short and wide outside off, Brendon punches it hard towards cover and a misfield by Samson results in a boundary. He has scored 91* but can't take fielding lightly

Gowtham to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by Stokes!! Whatta catch that! Eye-candy that take was. Was a short delivery around off, McCullum rocked back and pulled it hard to deep mid-wicket where Stokes timed his jump and he was in the air as he reverse cupped it. Probably one of the best catches of the season. Brendon McCullum c Stokes b Gowtham 4(4) [4s-1]

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, elegance personified there. Full length delivery outside off, Kohli walks down the track and creams his drive, through the gap at cover and there's no stopping that, such was the precision in the placement

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, Chinnaswamy erupts as Kohli smokes one. Backs away, reaches for it and slams the length delivery over covers, one bounce and into the fence. Was middled to perfection, sweet sound of the willow too

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, another impressive shot. After two shots on the off-side, Kohli gets one through the on side. Moves towards the pitch of the delivery, keeps his eyes on the ball and flicks it over mid-wicket. Three boundaries already in the over. This is going to be an exciting run chase if Kohli keeps playing like this

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, out Caught by D Arcy Short!! He's got him, he's got him. Shreyas Gopal is running around with an arm raised. Pretty much a half-tracker which Kohli pulls in the vicinity of deep mid-wicket. It's D'Arcy Short there, who leaps across for an excellent take. Oh what a game-changer this. Kohli c D Arcy Short b Shreyas Gopal 57(30) [4s-6 6s-2]

Unadkat to de Villiers, FOUR, slower back of length ball again, this time there's a little bit of width which allows AB to carve it away between backward point and short third man. It was uppish, but the placement was spot on

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, out Caught by Unadkat!! Shreyas Gopal has turned this game right on its head. First Kohli, and now de Villiers. RR should really back themselves from here. Another half-tracker really, but de Villiers doesn't get hold of his pull and hits it straight towards long leg. Unadkat seemed to have misjudged it initially, but he's able to make amends by taking an excellent low catch. Wry smile on de Villiers's face. He could have hit this anywhere. Just not his day. de Villiers c Unadkat b Shreyas Gopal 20(18) [4s-1 6s-1]
Gowtham to Mandeep, SIX, nailed over long-on. Gentle off-break from Gowtham which is right in the slot. Mandeep grounds his back knee and wallops it through the line

Laughlin to Negi, out Caught by Buttler!! Done in by the off-cutter. Negi tries flicking it through mid-wicket, but there was enough cut on the ball to take a thick outside edge. Good take from Buttler diving forward, should help his bruised confidence. Negi c Buttler b Laughlin 3(4)
Laughlin to Mandeep, FOUR, normal pace from Laughlin this time, Mandeep uses those extra 10kph and slices it away through backward point. Nicely done
Unadkat to Washington Sundar, SIX, punishes the slower ball this time. He set himself up for it and launched it over wide long-on

Unadkat to Mandeep, FOUR, short of length delivery outside off, Mandeep slices the cut away through backward point. The ball spun away from sweeper cover who dived too early and fell at least 3 feet short of getting to it
Unadkat to Mandeep, FOUR, Unadkat not having a great time here. Bowls this full and wide outside off, Mandeep stretches across and slices it for another boundary, this time wide of third man

Laughlin to Washington Sundar, SIX, parried over the ropes for six! Gowtham was standing around 5 yards inside the boundary, stretched his arm out while back-pedaling but never looked like taking it. May have been a different story had he been all the way back. Slower short of length delivery, sits up for Sundar who thwacks it down the ground

Stokes to Washington Sundar, FOUR, these are all useful runs to reduce the margin of defeat. Surely they can't win this can they? Stokes misses his yorker by a couple of inches and is sliced away over backward point

Stokes to Washington Sundar, SIX, now carves this slower ball inside-out for six. Wow. Clean strike from Washington Sundar who picked the variation early and smoked it into the crowd. Brings the crowd to life

Stokes to Washington Sundar, out Bowled!! How unlucky is this for Sundar. He's lapped this full toss right off the bat-face onto middle stump. Walked across, got down low, and set himself up perfectly. But just couldn't get under it unfortunately to gain the elevation needed. Washington Sundar b Stokes 35(19) [4s-1 6s-3]

Laughlin to Mandeep, FOUR, gets inside this short of length delivery and helps the pull over short fine leg. It was really well done because this was a slower ball and there really wasn't a lot of pace to work with
Laughlin to Mandeep, FOUR, slower ball which swings away from Mandeep. He gets down low, uses the swing and slices it past short third man. Wonderful batting
Laughlin to Mandeep, FOUR, just short of the yorker mark, and Mandeep takes toll by hammering it down the ground for four. Really good showing from him, even though in a losing cause
Gowtham to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli continues to deal in boundaries. Rocks back, picks the length early and punches it through the gap at covers again, away she goes, into the fence

Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR, first one of the innings for de Kock. He has joined the skipper now. Flatter in trajectory and outside off, de Kock doesn't miss out on it and slaps it through the gap at covers, he needs to play along with Kohli if RCB want to make a match out of it. Can't be chased alone this target
Unadkat to de Kock, FOUR, beautiful! Pitches it on middle and leg, de Kock makes sure to send it to the long-on fence with a fine on-drive, RCB... RCB... are the chants all across the stadium
Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR, there's no stopping these two. Tossed up delivery around off, de Kock reaches for it with a shimmy and times his chip over long-off, quality shot

Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR, another one! The bowlers have no answers to this brilliance by the RCB pair. The left hand - right hand combination is make it difficult for the bowlers. This was floated on middle and de Kock went down on his knee to sweep it through square leg
Stokes to Kohli, FOUR, "welcome into the attack Mr Stokes," says Kohli. Picks the length on that short one early and makes sure to pummel it over mid-wicket, he's in the zone guys.
Stokes to Kohli, 1 run, 50-run stand up with that single as Kohli drags it away to deep mid-wicket, the crowd thought it was in the gap, but it wasn't

Stokes to Kohli, FOUR, can't bowl such freebies to a batsman of this class. It's a juicy full toss outside off, Kohli brings his bat down in time and angles it past the fielder at point, he's toying with the field here, finding those gaps with ease
Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, FOUR, right into the gap there! Shortish delivery on middle and leg, Kohli goes back and pulls it with authority beating the man at deep mid-wicket

D Arcy Short to Kohli, SIX, smoked it! Kohli's one hand came off but then too he manages to get a six. One hand or two hands, doesn't matter. Was a floated delivery around off and Kohli towered it over long-on

D Arcy Short to de Kock, out Caught by Unadkat!! Failed with the bat earlier today but makes up for it with this huge wicket. Bowls a shortish delivery on the pads and de Kock who looks to put it away with a pull finds the fielder in the deep, it's Unadkat who grabs it. Wait on... it's AB who walks out to bat in next. Get ready for some more fireworks! de Kock c Unadkat b D Arcy Short 26(19) [4s-4]
batsman: D Arcy Short to de Kock

comment: Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, 1 run, 31st IPL fifty for Kohli! RCB want him to get a big one tonight, he's not done yet. Was a loopy delivery that was driven down to long-on

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, SIX, insult to injury! Missed on a wicket on the last ball and goes for a six on the very next ball. Shortish delivery, a half-tracker and Kohli pummels it over wide long-on for a towering six, that was huge again
Laughlin to de Villiers, SIX, only one hand on that. Full length delivery outside off, de Villiers goes for it with full swing and manages to clear covers
Woakes to Rahane, FOUR, juicy. He's in some weird mood, happy to go horizontally right away, gets that length that sits up, hoping to be smacked. Obliged. Airy over mid-wicket
U Yadav to Stokes, FOUR, that sitting up length. On the tummy, quite Stokes' staple. He stays up, lets it get in his arc and heaves. Those muscles .. through mid-wicket

Washington Sundar to Samson, SIX, blimey, what a blow! Some momentum into the RR innings now. This was fired fuller around middle and leg, Samson held his shape and swung through the line. Sent it soaring over long-on for a biggie

Khejroliya to Stokes, FOUR, high quality shot! Why move around the in the crease and swipe when you can play shots like this. This was full and quite wide as well, Stokes played the square drive late to bisect short third man and backward point with precision. Top stuff!!
Khejroliya to Stokes, SIX, ahhhh, this is vintage Stokes! Back of a length around middle and leg, easy for him as he swivels just a touch before drop kicking this over deep fine leg. Easy pickings

Chahal to Stokes, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Massive strike from Chahal, just like he did in his previous over. The leg spinner to a left-hander is always a double-edged sword, this wicket proves it. Slows this down and drags it wider outside off, Stokes wanted to fetch it with a slog sweep but only managed a thick under edge that clattered onto the woodwork. Just when this partnership was gearing up to go up another level, it was been halted. Stokes b Chahal 27(21) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chahal to Buttler, FOUR, signature Buttler start! Wastes no time to get going. Brings out the reverse sweep and takes this on the full, makes enough connection to beat a diving backward point. Finds the fence

Chahal to Buttler, byes, FOUR, geee, that's beaten everyone! Comedy of errors really. Buttler went for premeditated paddle, de Kock anticipated and was en route to his left already but guess what, the stroke didn't connect and the ball went through the yawning gap between first slip and the keeper
Negi to Samson, SIX, hammered away! Samson is on the rampage now. Of course, half-trackers like these help as well. Was on the back foot in a jiffy and smashed the pull over deep mid-wicket

Negi to Buttler, FOUR, edged but no slip! You don't expect one at this stage of a T20 inning either for most bowlers. Lovely piece of bowling from Negi, floated up nicely to invite the drive from Buttler and forced the edge as well. Too hard for de Kock and it raced past him to the fence
U Yadav to Samson, SIX, gobbles up the Free Hit! Umesh is having a horror day. This is a full toss on leg, Samson just shuffles a touch and mows it over deep mid-wicket. Deep into the crowd

Woakes to Samson, SIX, just over deep mid-wicket! Slower and a fraction short from Woakes, Samson sits on the back foot and went through with the pull shot. Didn't quite middle this as much as he would have wanted, still got it over McCullum who tried with all his might

Woakes to Samson, 1 run, another excellent yorker, it's been a top over from Woakes thus far. Samson squeezes it out towards point to get to his 8th IPL fifty! Is this the breakthrough season he wanted? Has definitely started that way

Woakes to Buttler, SIX, deep into the crowd! Buttler has activated the beast mode, danger signs for RCB if they don't get him quickly. Back of a length around middle and off, Buttler sat on the back foot and smoked it way over deep mid-wicket. Huge biggie

Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, what a beautiful shot! Jeepers, this kid is such a delight to watch when on song. Such class! Full and outside off, his bat face did turn in his hands but he got it dead straight even then. Cleared long-off easily

Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, Samsonnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn! What quality strokeplay! Fullish ball around middle and leg, Samson makes room by backing away lot and just goes through with the extension of the loft down the ground. Such timing and over long-off again it is, deeper this time. 16 off the over!

Woakes to Buttler, out Caught by Kohli!! Soft dismissal! Woakes tried the yorker but ended up delivering a pacy low full toss. Buttler just tried to check the lofted stroke, perhaps got a touch late on it and ended up chipping it straight to mid-off where the RCB skipper swallowed it up. He's wearing an animated look on his face as well. Vital wicket this for RCB, Buttler could easily have a made a difference of about 10 runs. Buttler c Kohli b Woakes 23(14) [4s-2 6s-1]

Woakes to Samson, SIX, hammered into long-on! Samson's merry ways continue. He is batting on another level now. Slower ball on a shortish length, he just waits for it and slaps through the line. No real effort there, at least not visible but gee the timing, ever so perfect! Another biggie

Woakes to Samson, FOUR, gets it away very, very fine! Didn't intend to get it that fine perhaps but he won't mind, will he? The perfect yorker from Woakes but Samson digs it out with an open bat face. Manages to slice itwell past a diving de Kock to the fence. When it's your day, it's just your day!

Woakes to Samson, FOUR, didn't I tell you that this is his day? Samson survives once more. Fuller ball and he goes for the lofted stroke over cover. For a moment, the man at sweeper cover thought he had a chance but was late I guess. Put in a late dive and it bounced before him, then sped through to the fence

U Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, H-U-G-E! For a change, it's not Samson who hits a biggie. The young Tripathi joins in the fun now and boy, he has clubbed this almost into the top tier of the ground. Slower and fuller, tries to follow the batsman but Tripathi is equal to the task. Makes room and clubs it easily over long-on. The crowd had to take cover there
U Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, bleeding runs! Slower and short, the leg stump line doesn't help and Tripathi swivels to pull it easily over square leg. Another boundary
U Yadav to Samson, SIX, no stopping Samson here! As if he needed a Free Hit to hit them big. Very full from Yadav and Samson gets under it with ease, clubbed comfortably over long-off. Ho ho ho!!

U Yadav to Samson, SIX, this time over deep extra cover! Incredible stuff from Samson, it's been an exhibition from him this afternoon. Full and wide outside off, he just makes room to lift it over the sweeper cover fence for a boundary. Unstoppable!
Washington Sundar to Rahane, FOUR, thank the injury. When you can't run, you slog. Rahane sits, uses the line already down leg to sweep. Hard. Behind square. One-bounced
Washington Sundar to Rahane, SIX, now downtown. Sundar overcorrects going fuller, Rahane steps away, gives his hands room. And they swing, into the sightscreen
U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, backs away in the crease, converts it into one in his slot and goes all bottom-handed in lofting into cow corner. One way of avoiding run-outs
U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, hoick. Mid-wicket. Again. It's getting familiar. Another friendly length for Rahane to get under and smoke it down

Chahal to Rahane, FOUR, on the sweep. Never mind the top-edge, the powerplay is his ally. His stride doesn't quite get him to the pitch of it, the spin's big too. But these big bats allow him to clear square leg, and that's enough
Chahal to D Arcy Short, FOUR, oh these nice float-ups. Short ain't getting foxed, lets it dip. Loads up. Might swing. And flat down the ground

Woakes to Rahane, FOUR, he's toying around. May his leg never recover. Makes Woakes bowl straight, threatening a move around. But sways inside the line, flat-batted and hammers it round the corner. Pile on the powerplay

Woakes to Rahane, out Caught by U Yadav!! There's the miscue. It was coming. This entire stay was so un-Rahane. Slogging, but with good reason. So he gets a fuller-slower one now, he's camping on his back foot, goes to smoke it straight over. Doesn't time, gets it off the bottom half, flies high. And down mid-on's backtracking reverse cup. Rahane c U Yadav b Woakes 36(20) [4s-6 6s-1]

Chahal to D Arcy Short, out Caught by de Kock!! Oh dear. A teasing half-tracker, with generous width, asking to be slapped. Short does the needful, gets deep in the crease, lines up and throws his bat out in looking to cut it away. There's a hint of spit up, enough to grope a fat chunk on the top-edge. And Quinton's ever-so-sharp. D Arcy Short c de Kock b Chahal 11(17) [4s-1]
Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, spots the length. It's that in-between one, and Samson makes it look worse. Swivels, pulls and heaves without bothering to keep it down. All brute
Mohit Sharma to Watson, FOUR, throws his hands out. He's already given himself width with his exposed stance. Swings, uppish and slices it with ease over point. Never mind the mistime

Mohit Sharma to Watson, FOUR, 137.7kph. Turns cheeky. Mohit tries to correct, getting the channel close to off, but Watson's not getting foxed. He stays back, arches and ramps it ever so late, teasing the man at short third
Andrew Tye to Rayudu, FOUR, short ball, this time Yuvraj does not have time to react. The ball races away towards his right and into the fence
Ashwin to Dhoni, 1 run, fullish and outside off stump, Dhoni guides it towards point

Barinder to Rayudu, SIX, finally a maximum! The asking rate is up high, the runs weren't flowing and Rayudu gets a much needed six. Read the slower ball very early, moved across the stumps and waited for the short ball to come and smashed the ball into the backward square leg fence

Barinder to Rayudu, out Rayudu Run Out!! Mix-up and the captain fires a direct-hit from extra-cover. Look at him roar. CSK's best batsman on show thus far has been sent back. Massive setback. Rayudu drove this full ball straight to Ashwin at extra-cover and set off, Dhoni said no straightaway - probably because of the niggle on the lower back. But Rayudu had already covered a lot of distance and Ashwin's throw was spot on. Rayudu run out (Ashwin) 49(35) [4s-5 6s-1]

Ashwin to Dhoni, SIX, that's why he eats those dots. He knows he can make up for it big time. Flighted delivery on the leg stump, Dhoni gets down on one knee and slog-sweeps it from the middle of the bat over square leg

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, FOUR, he's muscled that! Look at that ball go so flat and one bounce into the wide long-off fence. Slower delivery outside off stump, Dhoni steps out and the ball sat up nicely for Dhoni to free his arms and smash

Andrew Tye to Jadeja, FOUR, oh that's a timely hit! Slower ball on the shorter side, Jadeja made room, lost balance but managed to cut that nicely over cover-point and there's no protection in the deep. 12 off the over, 55 more needed

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, FOUR, in the airrr, could be out, oh the fielder makes a mess of it. Low full toss, Dhoni slogs, should have been held at deep mid-wicket, Dagar the sub wasn't quick enough to move forward, he dived but let it pass. He's immediately moved out of that position

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, SIX, oh that's gone a loooong way into the stands. Stand and deliver stuff! Full and in the slot, Mohit Sharma goes for the yorker, misses the yorker by some mark and Dhoni gets under it to send it over deep mid-wicket

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, 1 run, that was a wide ball but Dhoni chose to have a swing at it, mistimed with one hand to long-off and that's fifty for the captain. No celebrations but he gets a big applause from everyone

Mohit Sharma to Jadeja, SIX, he's smoked that away, Jaddu! This is the second time he's hit a big shot despite being off balance. Slower delivery from Mohit Sharma, Jadeja somehow connects and gets enough power to clear long-on
Andrew Tye to Dhoni, 1 run, oh he's missed a big hit here. Full and outside off stump, better of going over cover but knowing Dhoni, he believes in muscling the ball rather than lofting over cover

Andrew Tye to Jadeja, out Caught by Ashwin!! That's mistimed and only goes as far as cover. Normal seam-up delivery, full again for a big hit, Jadeja wanted to go over long-off, sliced it high in the air and the KXIP makes no mistake. Important thing is Dhoni has crossed over and will be on strike now. Jadeja c Ashwin b Andrew Tye 19(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, SIX, smashedddd! Why are you not bowling slower balls Andrew Tye? Strange! Length ball, goodbye! You are asking for trouble. Dhoni actially felt some pain after launching this over deep mid-wicket

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, FOUR, talk about presence of mind and there's Dhoni with a bit of deftness. Short ball with third man inside the ring, unbelievable from the bowler. Dhoni spots the field, just guides the ball over the infield to the third man fence. Sehwag smiles from the dug out

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, SIX, can you believe it? An injured MS Dhoni has hit a six with one hand. Take a bow sir! Low full toss, no one at deep square, Dhoni backs himself, has an excellent willow in his hand and swings across the line and over the boundary line

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, FOUR, he's squeezed this in the gap. There were three fielders behind square on the off-side - point, backward point and short third man, yet Dhoni finds the gap. Can't blame the bowler for bowling a wide yorker, he bowled to the field

Mohit Sharma to Watson, out Caught by Barinder!! Too cute, and that's never ideal. Mohit gets his line wrong, slipping into the legs, but he's neatly disguised this slower back-hander. Watson's fooled as he loads up and commits to swipe it, knowing there's nobody at fine leg. Goes through early, gets a fat splice and short fine pockets the balloon. Watson c Barinder b Mohit Sharma 11(9) [4s-2]
Barinder to Rayudu, FOUR, all timing. Back, lining himself behind and drills it to mid-off's right. Ashwin isn't the quickest, manages a palm. The outfield isn't Punjab's ally either

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, SIX, he's hit this all the way but it won't matter - full ball outside off stump, Dhoni lofts it to over long-off. KXIP have escaped home by 4 runs. Oh these CSK games and run chases. They get so deep. You got to admire this man - MS Dhoni. Injured very early in the innings, takes some treatment, takes it upon himself and almost takes his side home.
Barinder to Vijay, SIX, roll back the clock - it's that Vijay of the old. Sran goes short, eventually sitting up and Vijay smokes, flat-batting it big into cow corner
Mohit Sharma to Rayudu, FOUR, on the charge, converts the length into his arc and on-tonks. Not the legs, but nobody's cutting this off with nobody in the vicinity of long-on

Andrew Tye to Vijay, out Caught by Barinder!! So damn ungainly. Vijay sheds his grace, well you have to when you are chasing 200, ends up one-handed. So it was the knuckle ball, Tye's staple, Vijay gets down the track in trying to dispatch it into long-off. Loses shape, loses timing, and Sran's there at mid-off, waiting to gobble up the skier. Vijay c Barinder b Andrew Tye 12(10) [6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Rayudu, FOUR, too straight. Never an ideal follow up delivery, never an ideal any delivery. Rayudu's quick to pounce, shuffles inwards and tucks, splitting the gap between the keeper and short fine

Mujeeb to Billings, FOUR, a heap of runs. A half-tracker, then the googly starting from middle and spinning well down leg. Billings isn't happy pocketing a wide, he reaches leg-sided, connects and heaves it into fine leg

Ashwin to Billings, out Lbw!! Ashwin runs to appeal. He wants an LBW. But the umpire's given runs. When you are the skipper and the bowler, you don't consult anybody. We're upstairs. It started with Billings shuffling, exposing his stumps and sweeping. Ashwin smartly slips in the quicker one, bang in line with the stumps. UltraEdge shows no edge. And HawkEye shows it to crash into off. Massive review. Massive moment. Billings lbw b Ashwin 9(8) [4s-1]
Yuvraj to Dhoni, FOUR, drags the length down. Very defensively. Dhoni doesn't have time to pat things back tonight. He chases, hard, and powers it behind point
Ashwin to Rayudu, FOUR, doesn't matter what spinner this is - it's a full toss, down leg. Rayudu's on a knee, sweeping, slogging, everything
Ashwin to Dhoni, FOUR, oh the deft. Some width, Dhoni's surgical, waiting on it, shedding that brutal muscle, putting some nerves to use, dabbing it between point and short third
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, breaks the barrier of respect and drives it on the up, uppishly. Over cover and into the fence. The ball was in the zone and the batsman did not hold back to smack it away

Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, ho ho ho!! That was creamed away. Length ball, dangling away and the batsman eases the cover drive away into the gap. The ball speeds away into the fence. Again the ball curved away but the neat footwork towards the line of the ball ensured the batsman had it covered. Action-packed start

Harbhajan to Gayle, FOUR, leaning drive! Classical touch play with a big stride forward and the ball screams past cover for a four. Slightly flatter it might have been and the batsman got it away. That would help

Watson to Mayank Agarwal, SIX, hit through the line and off she goes into the stands. Seam-up, half-volley on the stumps, Agarwal bends his back knee and smokes it over long-on. Off the meat of the bat

Watson to Gayle, out Caught by Tahir!! Watto strikes! Removes his former RCB teammate. It was banged short by the Australian and the line was on leg. Gayle went for the pull half-heartedly as he was slightly cramped form room and all he could manage was a top-edge that lobs straight to short fine leg. A dolly for Tahir. Watson has his arms aloft. End of a superb knock from 'Universe Boss'. Gayle c Tahir b Watson 63(33) [4s-7 6s-4]

Tahir to Yuvraj, SIX, there's the trademark Yuvraj shot! Flighted wide of off, Yuvi, with a huge back-lift, lofts it handsomely straight down the ground. The long-on fielder moves to his right, can only watch the ball sail over his head
Dwayne Bravo to Yuvraj, FOUR, picked the gap beautifully did Yuvraj. Short ball at 123.6kph, Yuvraj picked the length early. Stood tall and pummeled the pull between long-on and deep mid-wicket

Dwayne Bravo to Yuvraj, FOUR, follows the bumper with a yorker and Yuvraj brings his bat down at the right time. Manages to get some wood off the cue end and the ball goes fine of the man at short third man. Bravo is appealing! For what? Bat before the wicket? Was clearly off the bat

Tahir to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Jadeja!! Agarwal holes out! A mistimed loft and he finds one of the safest pairs in the world. The leg-break on the stumps and Agarwal moved leg-side to go downtown. The bat face turned at the point of impact and hence lost his timing. Goes miles up in the air, but straight to RJ at long-on. Mayank Agarwal c Jadeja b Tahir 30(19) [4s-1 6s-2]

Tahir to Finch, out Lbw!! Aaron Finch is given OUT lbw. Back-to-back golden ducks for him. He has reviewed. That looked plumb. Let's see. Fair delivery. No bat. Three reds and he is outta here. Here's the comeback from CSK. It was the quick googly from Tahir and Finch definitely didn't pick that. Presses forward to block and got rapped on the front leg in front of off. That's plumb. Tahir is pumped. Runs with the arms aloft and slaps the CSK symbol with on his shirt. That's the passion with which he plays. Finch lbw b Tahir 0(1)
Tahir to Nair, FOUR, good shot to get off the mark. In-drifter, slightly errs in line. Too straight and Nair's wrists does the rest. Flicks it through mid-wicket

SN Thakur to Yuvraj, out Caught by Dhoni!! The CSKians go up, Yuvraj starts to walk. Doesn't wait for the umpire's decision. The cross-seamed short ball from Shardul Thakur and that's the reason for the extra bounce. Yuvraj read the length and line, but couldn't account for that tad extra bounce. Looked to ramp it towards third man and got a feather on it. MS won't drop those. Yuvraj c Dhoni b SN Thakur 20(13) [4s-2 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, SIX, RJ runs across and palms it over the boundary rope. Hit his thumb - his bowling hand as well. Hope it's not serious. It was a full toss and Nair hacked it over mid-wicket. Jaddu covered a lot of distance and the momentum was taking him futher across. Stuck his left hand out, couldn't hold on, despite a jump
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, FOUR, bad ball and Nair takes full toll of it. Length ball on the pads, tickled away fine to fine leg

SN Thakur to Ashwin, SIX, Vijay was waiting for the ball, but it goes over his head. A 62m six! Slightly wayward from Thakur. Short of a good length straying down leg, Ashwin stays deep and moves towards off to help it along its way. A superb pick-up shot over fine leg

SN Thakur to Ashwin, out Caught by Dhoni!! Dhoni catches and Ashwin has to walk back to the dressing room. That's not something we are used to. A shortish ball, slightly off-paced and Ashwin was back and across to pull it away. Top-edges and MS runs towards the square leg region to snaffle that. Ashwin c Dhoni b SN Thakur 14(11) [6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, out Caught by Jadeja!! Dwayne Bravo is good. He is too good, specially at the death. It's the slower back of a length delivery from Bravo. Nair knew that was coming, still couldn't put it away. Went deep in his crease and went too hard on the pull. Mistimed to deep mid-wicket. Straightforward catch for RJ. Nair c Jadeja b Dwayne Bravo 29(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, short ball, bad ball and put away. The batsman was waiting for it and swats the pull away fine on the on-side for a four. Crisply timed and it ran away. Rahul has run into a massive purple patch
Harbhajan to Gayle, FOUR, drops the ball short and that is a sin! The huge bat of Gayle comes down on it and swords the ball away past cover point for a four
Harbhajan to Gayle, SIX, drop-kicked! Gone for a sixer. The batsman goes with the turn and muscles the ball over long-off for a maximum. Gayle is up and away!!
Harbhajan to Rahul, FOUR, did I sanity? Pardon me. Gayle's partner-in-crime joins the act and creams the full toss outside off away into the covers. The ball raced away into the fence

Harbhajan to Rahul, FOUR, if it is power from one end, it is all grace from the other. The batsman leans into the drive and threads the ball away like a seasoned tailor. The man at mid-off had no chance even with the dive to his left. Superb bit of batting

SN Thakur to Gayle, FOUR, edged and gone! Gone for a four. Dhoni does not go for it to his left. Should be classified as a chance even if it might have been touch and go. The slip was wide and the ball goes between the keeper and the slip for a four. That is a huge reprieve for Gayle
SN Thakur to Rahul, FOUR, CSK have not done their homework. That was short again and the batsman stays back to pull the ball away with a lot of control. The man at deep fine had no chance
SN Thakur to Gayle, FOUR, short ball again, the batsman does not time the pull away. But he gets enough meat on it and sends it past mid-on for a four. Fifty up for KXIP. All carnage at Mohali

Chahar to Gayle, SIX, that is into a parallel universe from the universe boss. Length ball was like a dead meat and Gayle picks the bones out of it. Over cow corner for a mighty six. That was poor bowling

Chahar to Gayle, FOUR, crafty and controlled. The short ball, the batsman gets on top of it and guides it past short fine leg for a four. The man at short fine leg and deep square leg tried to cut it off but in vain
Chahar to Gayle, FOUR, punched and K.O! That was actually a pile driver down the ground. Picks the short of length delivery and punishes it down the ground, uppishly, for a four past mid-off

Chahar to Gayle, SIX, where are the seat belts? The Gayle show is here. Full ball and the batsman hammers the ball over long-off for a huge six. This man has made a statement. A big one. 46 off 19 balls!
Tahir to Rahul, FOUR, full toss on the pads and Rahul adds four to his tally. That was clipped away and the slide from the man at deep mid is not good enough

Tahir to Gayle, FOUR, fifty on KXIP debut! The big boss is owning the evening. That was in the zone, too full and the batsman thumped it down the ground for a four. One bounce and it escapes into the fence. And look at the big man, he does the cradle act with both his arms. He is thrilled to bits
Tahir to Gayle, SIX, unfurl the noise now! Slammed down the ground over long-off. Well flighted ball and the batsman spanks it over the fence. He ain't holding back. KXIP are unstoppable

Harbhajan to Rahul, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! That is a steal. Full toss outside off and the batsman chips the drive to cover. DJ Bravo takes it and breaks into a jig. For a moment he has forgotten about the damage done. That was a poor delivery but Rahul got carried away and lifted the ball aerially for the man at cover, who was on the edge of the circle, to take it. CSK have a small ray of hope. Rahul c Dwayne Bravo b Harbhajan 37(22) [4s-7]
Harbhajan to Mayank Agarwal, SIX, comes down the track and lifts the ball away over long-on. The big hitting has spread like an epidemic. The intentions and the application was superb and in sync
Harbhajan to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, sliced away! No respect for the veteran spinner and the ball races away into the fence. Man at sweeper cover had no chance

Chawla to Roy, wide, out Stumped!! Smart stumping from Karthik and the last match hero falls cheaply. Nicely bowled by Chawla as well, he pre-empted that Roy was coming down the track and slid this one down the leg-side, Roy stepped forward, the momentum took him further ahead, he turned around in panic, but Karthik had by then removed one of the stumps. A cheap dismissal for Roy and Delhi have lost an early wicket. Roy st Karthik b Chawla 1(3)
A Russell to Gambhir, FOUR, cracking shot, overpitched and well outside off, Gambhir leans forward and places it into the gap past cover-point, beat the man in the ring and rolled away to the fence
A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, short, wide and four, Shreyas Iyer's eyes lit up as he saw the width, got on top of the bounce and cracked it square past point, no need to run for those

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! The Daredevils have been rocked early, excellent ball from Russell, hit the deck hard and got the ball to deviate away from outside off, drew Shreyas Iyer into a limp poke, the edge was found and it was travelling quickly. Rana dived across to his left at first slip, went with both hands and holds on. Shreyas Iyer c Nitish Rana b A Russell 4(3) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, SIX, that's been palmed over the ropes! Mavi, the fielder. Was a slow, flighted delivery. Slightly too full, Maxwell goes hard on the lofted on-drive and doesn't time it too well. Mavi moved to his right and probably didn't time his jump well. Gets a hand, but that's been parried away. SIX
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, SIX, back-to-back sixes. Quicker delivery, too straight as well, that's been bludgeoned over deep mid-wicket with a mighty swing of the bat

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, out Caught by Uthappa!! Tries to go for the third maximum on the trot and perishes. Hey bowlers, need a wicket? Bowl half-trackers. That's what Kuldeep did. He's bowled two and has two wickets. Was the short leg-break from the left-arm spinner, Maxwell spotted it and went deep in his crease. Pull too hard and loses his shape. Miscued and picked Uthappa at deep mid-wicket. A big wicket, this. Maxwell c Uthappa b Kuldeep Yadav 47(22) [4s-3 6s-4]

Narine to Chris Morris, out Bowled!! 100 IPL wickets for Sunil Narine! No reaction from the Caribbean; as usual. The off-break from Narine doesn't spin much. Goes straight and crashes into the off-pole. And what was Morris doing? He backed away a long way to loft it over covers. Missed it by a mile. Beaten on the outside edge. Seven down. Chris Morris b Narine 2(3)

Narine to Vijay Shankar, out Lbw!! Vijay Shankar is given out lbw and he reviews. Fair delivery. No bat involved. The impact was just above the kneeroll in front of off. What does the ball-tracker say? Three reds and Shankar goes off taking the only review with him. DD are falling apart here, without a fight. Turns in from a short of length and beats Shankar's clip/flick. He wasn't forward as well. The umpire raised the finger quickly. Vijay Shankar lbw b Narine 2(4)
Kuldeep Yadav to Shami, FOUR, more flight on this ball and Shami eyes the mid-wicket region. Swings hard and gets a fat outside edge that goes over the slip fielder. Runs away to the third man fence

Narine to Shami, out Caught by A Russell!! Shami departs. This was on the cards. He slogged from ball one and perishes. Chips down the track to smash the offie over deep mid-wicket. No timing whatsoever - courtesy the bat turned at the point of impact. Russell runs to his left from mid-wicket and pouches it with ease. Shami c A Russell b Narine 7(6) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Boult, out Caught&Bowled!! It's over. Flighted delivery attacking the stumps, Boult chips it straight back to the bowler. Kuldeep Yadav gobbles it just above his head. Kolkata Knight Riders win by 71 runs. Boult c and b Kuldeep Yadav 0(2)

Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR, change of pace from Mavi, but Pant spotted it well, waited on the short ball, rolled his wrists and helped it behind square on the on-side, beat short fine and raced away to the fence

Shivam Mavi to Gambhir, out Bowled!! First IPL wicket for Mavi and he's chuffed to bits. Short of a length and angling across the left-hander, Gambhir was cramped for room as he went for the cut, gets an inside edge and the ball clatters into the stumps. Mavi is pumped and so are KKR. DD in dire straits now. Gambhir b Shivam Mavi 8(7) [4s-1]
A Russell to Pant, FOUR, much better from Pant, full and just outside off, Pant brings his bat down and drills it back past the non-striker. Mid-off is very wide and has no chance

A Russell to Pant, FOUR, Pant has been lucky in this innings so far, pitched up and well wide of off, he saw the width and threw his hands at that, slices it high and over cover, couple of bounces and over the ropes

A Russell to Maxwell, FOUR, just over cover and the small Eden Gardens outfield means it's a boundary for Maxwell. He backed away to a short and wide ball, had to reach out for the slap, didn't get it off the middle, but has enough to clear the infield
Shivam Mavi to Maxwell, FOUR, short, wide and four, no one moved after Maxwell flashed it behind square on the off-side, a poor ball and Maxwell took full toll of it

Narine to Pant, FOUR, much needed for DD, very full and around off, Pant gets his left leg out of the way, brings his bottom-hand into play and drills it wide of mid-on, beats the fielder in the ring and rolls away to the fence
Narine to Pant, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Pant, gets down low to a well flighted delivery outside leg, rolls his wrists and sweeps it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Chawla to Pant, SIX, lovely, tossed up well outside off, Pant gets a good stride forward, picks the wrong 'un, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and sends it soaring over extra-cover for a maximum

Chawla to Pant, FOUR, this is excellent batting from Pant, Chawla dropped this one short and just outside off, Pant makes room, lets the ball go past him and then cuts it square behind point for a boundary
Tom Curran to Pant, FOUR, cracking shot, full and well outside off, right in the slot for Pant as he drives it past cover, the fielder in the deep has no chance
Tom Curran to Pant, 1 run, Curran shortens his length outside off, steered to the left of cover-point. Pant waits for the ball to pass the fielder and then jogs across for a single
Tom Curran to Maxwell, SIX, easy pickings for Maxwell, short and at his body, he gets inside the line, uses the pace on the ball and helps it way over the ropes at long leg

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, FOUR, reverse sweep and four, flighted delivery outside off, Maxwell bends down half-way and then gets it past the keeper, no chance for short third man and the ball rolls away to the fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Pant, out Caught by Chawla!! Oh dear! We saw this yesterday for RCB, now Pant falls to a long hop. Dropped short and on the stumps, begging to be smacked, Pant swivelled across and nailed the pull, hard and flat - straight into the hands of Chawla at deep mid-wicket. The Eden Gardens finds its voice once again, Pant falls after an impressive knock. Pant c Chawla b Kuldeep Yadav 43(26) [4s-7 6s-1]
Tom Curran to Maxwell, SIX, smashed, the back of the hand slower short ball from Curran, but it sat up to be smacked. Maxwell swivels across and pulls it high and way into the stands at long leg

Tom Curran to Rahul Tewatia, out Caught by A Russell!! That's a tame dismissal for Tewatia and the Daredevils have lost half their side. This was full and this was wide of off, Tewatia saw the opportunity for a few runs, got his left leg out of the way and was looking to smash it over cover. He went so hard that he lost all the poise and flow, ended up slicing it straight to Russell at short extra-cover. As easy as it comes. Rahul Tewatia c A Russell b Tom Curran 1(2)

Chris Morris to Chris Lynn, SIX, off the mark with a six. That's what he can do. Can recover momentum and up the rate so quickly. This was a full delivery on the stumps, Chris Lynn connected well and sent the ball over wide long-on, he needed that for his own confidence and for the team's sake

Nadeem to Nitish Rana, no run, Nadeem is jumping for an lbw appeal. Does not get it and Gambhir takes it. To the naked eye, looked like an under edge. Need UltraEdge to confirm. No bat. So we move on. Impact? Outside the line and that is such a poor review and DD burn their only review. Was very full to be sweeping, Nitish Rana went for it and managed to get himself outside the line

Shami to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Roy!! Good catch by Roy at long-on and another set KKR batsman departs. Got under the full delivery too much - that's why couldn't get the elevation he wanted. It was the knuckle ball as well - something Shami has developed recently, it swings away too, coming to the catch, Roy made it look easy - that's because he judged it to a nicety and took it with both hands without breaking a sweat. Chris Lynn c Roy b Shami 31(29) [4s-4 6s-1]

Vijay Shankar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, right in between deep mid-wicket and deep backward square. The short ball sits up for Nitish Rana, who swivels on the back foot and though he pulls in the air, he hits the gap

Vijay Shankar to Karthik, SIX, DK knows all about Vijay Shankar. Both play together for Tamil Nadu, a step towards the ball and then swung it from his hips over deep backward square, was a back of a length delivery but such is the form that DK is in, he has hit it for six

Shami to Karthik, no run, DK has been given out lbw. By umpire Nand Kishore. Looks a dodgy decision. That's why the KKR skipper went for the review straight away. UltraEdge shows a big spike and the crowd cheer. Huge inside edge onto the pads. How did Nand Kishore miss that? Shami was pumped, but all that celebration now turns sour! Was a length delivery cutting back in, raps Karthik above the kneeroll, but there was an edge before that
Chris Morris to Karthik, FOUR, this is classy. Effortless batting by DK. Length delivery angling in to middle and leg, Karthik flicks over mid-wicket and leaves deep mid a spectator

Chris Morris to Karthik, FOUR, an action replay of the previous delivery. Chris Morris just stares in despair. At DK who has flicked him again over mid-wicket. Sheer timing and nearly went all the way, one bounce over the ropes. What form he is in at the moment

Chris Morris to Karthik, out Caught by Boult!! That is so poor from DK. No game awareness at all. Switched off at the wrong moment and didn't spot the change in field. Flicks and holes out to deep mid. Went for the same shot that got him two boundaries, but found the fielder. Chris Morris raises his arms in delight and sports a big smile on his face. Had his man finally. Karthik c Boult b Chris Morris 19(10) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, SIX, length delivery outside off and Nitish Rana launches it over long-on. Clean bat-swing and the ball sails over the fielder's head. The wicket of his skipper hasn't put Nitish Rana off at all

Shami to A Russell, SIX, that is a magnificent shot. For a moment he was cramped by the short of length delivery into the body, but he adjusted at the last moment and slashed it into his team's dugout at the third man fence. Needed to get it fine and did so

Shami to A Russell, 2 runs, fantastic work by Roy from long-on, but he can't get to the ball, in fact gets a fingertip on that on the dive forward. A horrible miscue from Russell as he swipes at a slower delivery, got lucky as Roy had too much to do after sprinting forward. Isn't happy with that shot, slaps his thigh after completing the second

Shami to A Russell, SIX, holds the pose. Take that Shami seems to say Russell. Overpitched and right in teeing off zone for Russell, who lofts ever so cleanly and sees the ball till the last moment as his eyes and the bat are transfixed at the target. It lands in the long-off stands. Someone take a pic of that, frame it and present it to Russell

Shami to A Russell, SIX, he is unreal. When it comes to hitting a cricket ball. The predictable short delivery arrives, with no pace or height, brutalised over mid-wicket. The Kolkatans have gone mental at the Eden

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, SIX, now Nitish Rana gets into the act. Short ball and Nitish Rana pulls handsomely over deep mid. Looked like he was waiting on the back foot for that one and when it came, didn't miss out
Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, FOUR, went for the short delivery again, but took the pace off it, sits up for Nitish Rana who slashes over point and beats sweeper cover running across

Shami to A Russell, SIX, that is the flattest square-driven six you'll ever see. Trust me on that. Unbelievable stuff from Russell. Sees the slower delivery outside off and gets low to carve it over deep point. The ball never took off from a height after it left the bat

Shami to A Russell, SIX, my word. There's so little margin of error against this beast from Jamaica. A man-mountain. Shami errs by slowing the pace down, lands right in the swinging range of Russell who sends it high into the deep mid stands. Such clean striking!

Shami to A Russell, SIX, straight up in the air, can someone get under this one. What! It has landed over long-off's head. What does he have everyday? Just pass that to all those who want to put on weight. This is jaw-dropping stuff from Russell. Looked like he had pulled the short ball straight up in the air, but such is the power he possesses that it has landed beyond the boundary. What more can I say?
Boult to Nitish Rana, 1 run, full on off, Nitish Rana looks to flick and the leading edge dribbles to backward point. 50 for Nitish Rana and it's his first one in KKR colors

Boult to A Russell, out Bowled!! Gone now. If anyone needed a sample of how to get Russell out, just watch this from Boult. No fuss or drama. The old-fashioned yorker - still gets you wickets even today. Will do so after 100 years as well. Just that you have to get it right. Boult did, slipped it under A Russell's swinging bat and it clipped middle and leg. Superb bowling and that wicket could mean a difference of 20 at least to the eventual score. No big celebrations from Boult, just a fist pump. Replays show that it was delivered cross-seam as well. A Russell b Boult 41(12) [6s-6]
Boult to Shubman Gill, FOUR, goes short and Shubman Gill gets off the mark with four. On the body, pulled hard through mid-wicket and Gill finds the gap

Boult to Nitish Rana, FOUR, this guy has talent. Make no mistake about it. Turns a near yorker into a boundary. Special skill when you can do that. Backed away a tad and directed it with an open face, just wide of short third, who didn't get across. Should've done better

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, FOUR, how good is he with those cuts and carves on the off-side. Sits deep in his crease, waits for the full delivery and then at the last moment opens the face of the bat to drive in the air, there's a fielder placed exactly for that shot, but the ball bounces wide of him and speeds to the fence

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Gambhir!! Deception from Chris Morris and he dismisses Nitish Rana. The slower delivery just outside off, Nitish Rana this time scooped it straight up in the air and Gambhir tracked back from cover to settle under that. Nitish Rana c Gambhir b Chris Morris 59(35) [4s-5 6s-4]

Chris Morris to Shubman Gill, leg byes, FOUR, poor delivery and deserved four. High full-toss sliding down leg, brushes the thigh pad of Shubman Gill and beats Pant's dive to his left. Runs away fast to the fine leg fence. Chris Morris has been disappointing with the ball tonight

Rahul Tewatia to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Chris Morris!! "Catch it buddy" shouted someone and it has been caught at point. All too simple really. Short and wide outside off, Shubman Gill fails to keep the cut down and gives Morris an easy opportunity inside the ring. Shubman Gill c Chris Morris b Rahul Tewatia 6(5) [4s-1]

Rahul Tewatia to Chawla, out Caught by Pant!! Chawla comes and goes. Without scoring. Cleverly bowled by Rahul Tewatia, saw Chawla charging out, pulled his length back, Chawla skies the lofted hit straight up and Pant calls for it to take it. Chawla c Pant b Rahul Tewatia 0(3)

Boult to Narine, out Caught by Maxwell!! Tag-team work and Narine is gone. They are checking the height on this. But Boult is fine on that count. Narine didn't get bat on the last delivery, this one he gets a thick edge on the slash and Pant tipped it over the bar, but great anticipation from Maxi at slip who tracked back and pouched it. Alert mind and good cricketing nous from the Australian. Deserved wicket for Boult. Narine c Maxwell b Boult 1(4)

Rahul Tewatia to Tom Curran, out Caught by Maxwell!! Rahul Tewatia is pumping his fist and punching the air. Three wickets in that over and just one run off it. Fantastic effort from the leggie. Tom Curran too like Chawla charges the bowler and can only find long-on. Tom Curran c Maxwell b Rahul Tewatia 2(3)
Boult to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that is smashed. Belted by Chris Lynn as he saw the short of length delivery outside off and didn't hold back. Went aerial over cover-point and gets four

Nadeem to Chris Lynn, FOUR, he wants to go only one way - through the off-side. This is a good shot, hammers it hard and wide of extra-cover, who didn't dive. It was a quicker one and on the stumps, but Chris Lynn found the gap

Boult to Uthappa, FOUR, shot. Slightly fuller than a good length on the stumps, Uthappa just biffed it over the bowler's head. Not a very good connection, but good enough to clear everyone. Breaks the shackles a bit

Boult to Chris Lynn, FOUR, clobbered by Chris Lynn. Boult went round the wicket to cramp up the batsman, but provided the ideal length for the Aussie to hit, brutalised past the stumps at the other end. The ball was gone before Boult could stick his boot in

Boult to Chris Lynn, FOUR, nearly holed out. But gets four thanks to Morris' fumble. At long-on. He went for the catch, but the ball bounced in front of him and since he didn't get his body behind the line of the ball, it runs away. Was a full-toss and Chris Lynn biffed that in the air
Nadeem to Uthappa, SIX, heaved over deep mid. Sliding on, on the middle and leg line, Uthappa sunk under that and clouted it high and over mid-wicket

Nadeem to Uthappa, SIX, sheer power. That's all made in the gym. What a shot this is. Must be contending for one of the shots of the tournament so far. This is a length ball on off, Uthappa went back and used his forearm power to great effect as he flat-batted it dead straight back over the bowler. A flat six. Nadeem shouldn't feel too disheartened with that hit, it wasn't a bad ball by any stretch of the imagination

Nadeem to Uthappa, FOUR, drags it short, the arm-ball went wrong. Fired it outside off, Uthappa cuts that hard and eludes a diving cover-point to his left. As soon as he got it past the fielder, it was four
Rahul Tewatia to Uthappa, SIX, slog-swept by Uthappa and six over deep square. Went down quickly and sheer timing on the shot sees the ball sail into the crowd

Nadeem to Uthappa, out Caught&Bowled!! That is Nadeem's wicket. Full marks for slowing it down and getting purchase from the wicket, which brought about Uthappa's downfall. He had swept Nadeem last over for a big six over mid-wicket, but this turns slightly and the top edge goes straight up. This time into the hands of Nadeem. Just when Uthappa was looking dangerous he gets out. Has been the story of his life. Uthappa c and b Nadeem 35(19) [4s-2 6s-3]
Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, SIX, the slog-sweep from Nitish Rana and he has sent it over Morris' head at deep mid. Right in the range for that shot and Rana sent it into the stands
Nadeem to Nitish Rana, SIX, comes down the track and launches into the lofted hit, gets good height and the desired elevation over deep mid. Clears the fielder

Nadeem to Nitish Rana, FOUR, now shows his intelligence by sweeping wide of short fine leg. Knows deep square is too square and won't get there, got outside the line and knelt down to play the sweep well

U Yadav to Suryakumar Yadav, out Bowled!! What a cracker to start! It's a golden duck for Suryakumar Yadav. A beaut from Umesh to begin, gets this to nip in a touch from a straightish off stump line. It was full and drew Suryakumar forward but he didn't anticipate the late movement. As a result, ended up playing around it and missed it completely. The woodwork is disturbed and up go the RCB players in jubilation. Umesh is absolutely pumped. Suryakumar Yadav b U Yadav 0(1)

U Yadav to Ishan Kishan, out Bowled!! Got himmmmm, yess goneeee! Umesh is breathing fire I tell you. If the first one was a good nut, talk about this one! What a corker! Goes full and it's almost the ideal inswinger that lands around off, Kishan plays around it, quite like Suryakumar did and sees the off stump go for a walk. Fab sight for any fast bowler and Umesh is on a hat-trick now, folks! RCB have started this game with a bang. Pressure mounting on the hosts. Ishan Kishan b U Yadav 0(1)

Woakes to Rohit, FOUR, classy shot! He has been out of form but strokes like these should set Rohit up nicely. Half-volley and not all that wide, but he leans nicely to caress the drive through the covers. Raced away to the fence in no time

Woakes to Lewis, SIX, dumped over deep backward square leg! Doesn't take long for Lewis to launch. Gets one that's fractionally short and he is on the back foot in a jiffy. Swivels to absolutely clobber the pull. Went deep into the stands

Chahal to Lewis, SIX, he's done waiting for something deft. He's down, running, Chahal's gone slower as well for some reason. Swings, big time, and it's more a miscue .. never mind when you've got hands like these. Way over long-off
Chahal to Lewis, SIX, typically dragged down. Lewis' smart, he sits, gets it in his slot and heave-sweeps. Checks the railway tracks behind square leg..the ball's there

Corey Anderson to Lewis, out Caught by de Kock!! And the twist comes from a stress-fractured off-cutter. They've realized there's no point in bowling your best ball, and Anderson smartly floats up a slower change up. Lewis can't wait, he commits to a lofted slice, loses timing, has the ball grab the upper half of his bat and fly. Fly higher. Over Quinton, who's already messed up a few. He runs behind, under the swirl, comes back and collects. Lewis c de Kock b Corey Anderson 65(42) [4s-6 6s-5]
Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, rubbing insult. A nothing half tracker, drifting down leg and Rohit loads up on the back foot, swivelling as he swats it powerfully behind square. One-bounced

Chahal to Krunal Pandya, SIX, connects. Cleanly at last. And then it's going only one way. Chahal tries a flipper, but Krunal with his shuffle gets under, sits under and dispatches it into long-on. Nothing subtle
U Yadav to Rohit, SIX, raw meat. That length, you are obliged to smack. Rohit smokes, swinging flat-batted, into the first tier over square leg

U Yadav to Rohit, FOUR, now compensated with width too. The length stays short and friendly. Rohit carves, doesn't even bother keeping it down, given how fine third man is. And yes, it's a fifty .. his first of this season
U Yadav to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, and now feeds the pads for some reason. Umesh's dealing in binaries here. Whipped away, typically bottom-handed, teasing fine leg

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, angling wide across. Rohit in some form, he leans, frees up his hands, taking it head-on in hammering it square. Oh the way he opens up the face in slicing,check the leather!

Corey Anderson to Rohit, out Krunal Pandya Run Out!! 1 run completed. More running troubles. Anderson standing in the way and Krunal has to take a step away to ensure he doesn't collide again. Can't afford getting injured. Well the tournament can't afford anyone else getting injured, the replacements aren't leaving their Counties. Right, Rohit smashed it down the ground, wants the strike. Pandya has to sacrifice. Hesitated for the second, stopped and takes the longer route. Alas, the dive is too late. Krunal Pandya run out (Woakes/Corey Anderson) 15(12) [4s-1 6s-1]

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, that short-wide combo. And Rohit has no shortage of time on anything. Gets in line, angry bat, angry hands on the revenge from the run-out he's caused. And into deep point

U Yadav to Rohit, SIX, oh my. As if the half trackers weren't enough, the hospitality has stretched out to dishing out full tosses on the hips. All Rohit has to do is impart direction and that's swiping it into fine leg. A railway tragedy wouldn't be far

Siraj to Rohit, SIX, wow. Okay Google - search for descriptions. Siraj errs for a change, letting the length sit up in Rohit arc .. and that arc's ever-expanding. Flat-bats, high and into long-on. Save your faces

Woakes to Pollard, out Caught by de Villiers!! Smart slower stuff. Pollard never comfortable when he has to slog without getting set. Today's no different. Doesn't quite get his power right on the cutter that Woakes digs into the pitch on length. Tries whacking it over long-on, but AB's there. And he's good to take it reverse-cupped. Pollard c de Villiers b Woakes 5(7)

Woakes to Hardik Pandya, no run, a peach. Oh it doesn't get better. And to imagine it coming in the death in the midst of an onslaught. Oh and amidst all this noise, the umpire's heard a tickle. He's given him caught behind. But Pandya isn't amused, he goes up instantly. Why bother consulting your partner with 10 balls to go in the day. And UltraEdge is a murmur all through, but when it passes the bat it gets a little bigger. The sound's deaf. Oh and forget the spikes, the third umpire overturns
Woakes to Hardik Pandya, SIX, feeds him a revenge gift. Short, on the body, and Pandya swivels, almost base-balling it into the second floor. Where else, but behind square
Woakes to Hardik Pandya, SIX, and now length. The cardinal length. Pandya rubbing it in and how. Holds his pose, lets the ball get close and clears long-off with his lofted shovel
Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, clears his front leg. Goes conventional. Full meat, over the bolwer, and trickling further in. Deadly death batting this

Corey Anderson to Rohit, SIX, makes him bowl a full toss. Misses the yorker, the dew isn't helping him either. And Rohit doesn't need these, really. You don't have to be this kind. Carved away, deep extra cover
Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, another juicy full toss. Oh dear. Oh dear. Flat-batted, heaving it downtown. Oh the bleeding, it's getting painful to watch

Corey Anderson to Rohit, out Caught by Woakes!! Real quick. Talk about timing even when you are getting out. Rohit backs away, smacks it down long-on's throat. And it's so flat that Pandya can't even cross over. Rohit c Woakes b Corey Anderson 94(52) [4s-10 6s-5]

U Yadav to Lewis, FOUR, wrong line and is duly punished. Short of a length and is down leg as well, cannot do that with fine leg in the ring. Lewis swivels across for the pull and although it came off the inner half, was always a percentage shot. Beats the fielder in the ring comfortably and races away
Corey Anderson to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, finishing touches. Make it 21 off the over -- and Pandya's done it with a flash straight down. 213 it will be ..

Washington Sundar to Rohit, FOUR, doesn't start well and on this pitch, there is little margin for error. Slightly short and a bit of width as well, Rohit sits back and crunches it through the covers. Found the gap and the outfield did the rest

Washington Sundar to Lewis, FOUR, super shot! Sundar is being put under pressure here. Flatter and a touch short outside off, Lewis waits on the back foot and punches this through the gap at backward point. Lovely stuff! Even Kohli cannot help but applaud the stroke

Washington Sundar to Lewis, FOUR, this is getting disastrous for the young off spinner but he has only himself to blame. Another fuller ball down leg, this time Lewis doesn't fail to connect. Sweeps it very fine down the leg-side and past the fielder who was in the ring

Washington Sundar to Lewis, 1 run, close shave for Lewis! Didn't put in the dive and trusted his long reach to bail him through. The direct hit at the bowler's end did test him to be frank but the West Indian got through in the end, only just though. It was a nicely floated off break to start with, gripped a touch and forced a leading edge towards backward point. There was a slight stutter in the running before they eventually decided to go ahead with it. No harm done in the end

Siraj to Lewis, SIX, welcome to the attack Mr.Siraj! Lewis is absolutely nonchalant as he dispatches this rubbish short ball way into the stands at deep backward square leg. At his pace, Siraj needs to be careful about the lengths he bowls, especially in the Powerplay

Siraj to Lewis, FOUR, bleeding runs here! This is a fab counterattack from these two and the RCB bowlers are wilting under the onslaught. Slower but short with a lot of width, allows Lewis to chance his arms with a slap cut through backward point

Siraj to Lewis, 5 wides, poor from Siraj and nothing much de Kock can do about the bad bounce. Tries the variation and it slips outside off, could say that the wide call was marginal but the uneven bounce means that de Kock couldn't get down in time. Races away to the fence

Woakes to Lewis, FOUR, raining boundaries! Cannot understand this ploy though, back of a length outside off with third man in the ring. Lewis stays back and glides it, just had to beat that man in the 30-yard circle and he does it with ease

Washington Sundar to Rohit, SIX, down the pitch and bang! The MI skipper has decided to up the ante a little. Shimmies down the track on seeing the flight and the leg-stump line helped as well, launched into the stands at deep mid-wicket. Super shot

Washington Sundar to Lewis, FOUR, not Sundar's night at all. Another drag-on, leg-stumpish and these are easy pickings for Lewis. Sits back and swivels across to clatter the pull to the deep mid-wicket fence. The offie has been unusually erratic so far

Chahal to Lewis, SIX, that's hugeeeeeeeeeeeee! Lewis continues on his merry ways. Picks the top spinner quickly and brings out the imperious slog sweep. Huge maximum over deep backward square leg. Brings up his 50! He is looking deadly tonight

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, how hard has he hit this one! Boy, that's some power from Rohit. Charges down the track and makes room to create width. The length wasn't all that short but he clobbered it over cover. Rocketed away

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, does it again! Rohit is determined not to let his former MI teammate settle. Stays in the crease this time and just gets leg-side of the ball a touch before launching it inside out over extra cover. Delicious strokeplay!

Corey Anderson to Rohit, 1 run, direct hit would have been close! Lewis was certainly in double but Mandeep's throw at the keeper's end misses by a whisker. Was a goner if it had hit. Wide yorker that was squeezed by Rohit towards backward point

Bumrah to Kohli, FOUR, what a shot. Bumrah overdoes, overpitches and that's too easy for Kohli. Gets forward, with a full face of the bat and creams it past mid-on. That boundary will ruin a decent over by Bumrah

Krunal Pandya to de Kock, FOUR, is greeted to the crease with a boundary. Flighted on the stumps, de Kock gets and sweeps. Gets it more off the top-edge but it sails over behind square. No-one there and they'll collect a boundary

Krunal Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, uppish and through Pollard's hands at short mid-wicket. Trademark Kohli whip. Clears his front leg and swats it off his pads. Pollard leaps but in vain. Races away to the boundary at deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, this is tripe. Gift packed and delivered to Kohli. Flat and short outside off, Kohli goes back and thrashes it through cover
Markande to Washington Sundar, FOUR, lovely hit inside-out by Washi! The googly from Markande, seemed to have picked that from the hand, got a stride forward and lofted that beautifully over cover

Krunal Pandya to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! He got smashed in the first over, but he's got three wickets now. The widish delivery across the left-hander, Sundar mistimes the lofted drive over cover, hits it high and straight to long-off. Celebration time for Krunal Pandya. Washington Sundar c Suryakumar Yadav b Krunal Pandya 7(8) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, he's guided this in the gap past backward point and it's running away for four. It was the slower delivery outside off stump, Sarfaraz gets the placement right by opening the bat face at the last moment

Markande to Kohli, SIX, that's classic Virat Kohli for you! Flighted delivery just outside off stump, Kohli lofts the inside-out drive from the middle of the bat, hits the rope on the full. Stand and deliver stuff

Markande to Sarfaraz Khan, out Stumped!! Blind swinging from Sarfaraz Khan. Advances and goes for an almighty swing, but Markande is clever enough to bowl this wide outside off stump and force the batsman to reach out, completely missed and Tare, the sub keeper, does the rest. Sarfaraz Khan st (sub)Tare b Markande 5(6) [4s-1]
Hardik Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, fifty for VK, but he won't celebrate. Doesn't even raise the bat. Just nudges this length ball into the on-side and gets to the milestone
Mustafizur to Kohli, FOUR, he's middled this alright, doesn't bother running! The off-cutter, Kohli launches it over the bowler's head and beats long-on
Mustafizur to Woakes, SIX, that's a lovely hit! Hit on the rise, the bat made a good sound as it made contact with the ball. Slower delivery again and Woakes went straight towards the sightscreen
McClenaghan to Kohli, SIX, take that! Short of a length delivery on the off stump, Kohli shows no respect and pulls the ball handsomely over mid-wicket. Brilliant hit

Bumrah to Woakes, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Soft dismissal. Slower delivery outside off stump, Woakes plays early and slices it straight to short third man. Bumrah gets his name into the wickets column to please himself and the ones who have taken him in their fantasy teams. By the way, that was Bumrah's 50th IPL wicket. Woakes c Krunal Pandya b Bumrah 11(11) [6s-1]

Bumrah to U Yadav, out Caught by Rohit!! Another one. Catching practice. They are checking for the no-ball. Oh no! More than half of his foot is inside the line. Why check that? It was a shortish delivery, Umesh slices the slog and skies it to cover. Hang on, the replay looks like it's not the wicket taking delivery. Umesh is at the non-striker's end. U Yadav c Rohit b Bumrah 1(2)
Mustafizur to Kohli, SIX, cracking sound. Full and in the slot, Kohli muscles that way back over the long-on fence

Mustafizur to Siraj, SIX, oh he's connected this brilliantly! Give him a promotion next match! Slower delivery sat up nicely, Siraj hangs back and pulls powerfully over deep mid-wicket and easily clears the fence. Will this make Kohli smile?

Bumrah to Kohli, FOUR, outside edge and third man is inside the ring, the ball flies over him as Kohli goes hard on the attempted lofted drive. Can he get a hundred? 14 to get, 4 more deliveries to go
Bumrah to Kohli, SIX, down the one knee and smashed! Back in the crease with a step and then he picked the bones out of this slower delivery and sent it over long-on

McClenaghan to Kohli, FOUR, su-sweet. Ends the over with a boundary. Juicy half-volley from McClenaghan, well outside off. Kohli isn't sparing those. Leans across, plants his front foot towards the ball and slashes it through extra cover. Beats a crowed off-side field

Mustafizur to de Kock, FOUR, this wasn't timed as he would've liked, but de Kock will still earn a boundary. The slower delivery from Fizz, de Kock didn't pick it as he was through the shot early. Still managed to get enough wood to place it over mid-on. There's no stopping that

Mustafizur to de Kock, SIX, de Kock has found his bearings. Rahman errs, bowls it full on QDK's strong zone. Just bent forward and lifted it through the line. Ah, all timing as it sails over the ropes over mid-on

McClenaghan to de Kock, out Bowled!! And call it the text commentator's curse. McClenaghan snuffs out de Kock and Wankhede erupts. Nothing shot from de Kock. It was full and a semblance of tail back in. The batsman stepped forward and swung, completely down the wrong line and enough gap for the ball to sneak through to knock the off-stump. RCB lose their first wicket. de Kock b McClenaghan 19(12) [4s-2 6s-1]

McClenaghan to de Villiers, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! de Villiers perishes. Huge blow for RCB. Two wickets in the over and McClenaghan is turning it on here. Seemed like a certain ploy and de Villiers fell into the trap. Dug in short and there was a fielder positioned at deep mid-wicket. AB forgets, goes for the pull, doesn't bother to keep it down either. Flat and straight to Hardik, who cupped it. Straight down the gullet, didn't even had to move there. MI on top. de Villiers c Hardik Pandya b McClenaghan 1(2)

Mustafizur to Kohli, FOUR, edgy but looked like it was intentional from Kohli. The slower ball from Rahman, ends up as a wide yorker. Kohli digs with an open bat face, runs it more off the outer half and it beats short third man

Mustafizur to Mandeep, FOUR, cracked. Rohit isn't happy, asks Rahman to bowl towards the stumps. Fizz overpitches and offers it outside off, minimal effort from Mandeep. Shifts his weight forward and caresses the drive that beats extra cover

Krunal Pandya to Mandeep, 1 run, fired it in quick on off, Mandeep pushes it to the right of Rohit at extra cover, who swiftly moves across and releases the throw in one motion. Hits the target but Mandeep's makes it in by dragging his bat

Krunal Pandya to Corey Anderson, out Caught by (sub)Duminy!! Anderson departs for a blob. Not a sweet IPL 2018 debut for the Kiwi all-rounder. Pandya gets two in two. Slowish and lured Anderson into a big shot. The batsmen went low and slogged, no timing whatsoever and he ended up hitting it straight to deep mid-wicket. Pandya is chuffed, so are rest of his team-mates. RCB digging a hole for themselves here. Corey Anderson c (sub)Duminy b Krunal Pandya 0(1)

Krunal Pandya to Mandeep, wide, out Stumped!! Once bitten twice shy. No mistake whatsoever from Ishan Kishan this time. Mandeep has been hokey-pokeyed for the second time and no repreive on this occasion. Very smart from Krunal; Mandeep announced his intent of stepping out early. Krunal sees it and lasers it wide of off. Very similar to the last over, Ishan Kishan doesn't panic, grabs it cleanly and whips the bails off. RCB lose their third wicket. Mandeep st Ishan Kishan b Krunal Pandya 16(14) [4s-1]

Gowtham to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Duck for Chris Lynn! Couldn't have been a better start for the Royals, this. Lynn not having a great time, dropped a catch earlier and departs without troubling the scorers. It's a short delivery and with a bit of off-spin, Lynn goes back to cut and gets undone due to the lack of bounce and spin on that. No Lynn special tonight and the crowd at Jaipur erupts. Chris Lynn b Gowtham 0(2)

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, edged but safe! A short delivery around off, too close to cut and Narine goes ahead with the shot. Gets a top edge that eludes the leaping keeper and finds the fence. Lucky to be still out there, but this is how he plays
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, FOUR, low full toss outside off, Rana puts bat to ball and it skims away through the covers. Didn't go too hard on the drive, just focused on timing which was spot on
Gowtham to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Gowtham darting them in real quick - 95kph this one. Rana goes back, uses the pace of it and tickles it nice and fine. Bit too straight this one from round the wicket

Gowtham to Uthappa, out Caught by Stokes!! Superb catch at the boundary from Stokes, showing great awareness here. It was drilled back hard by Uthappa, and Stokes had plenty to do at long-on. Initially, he had to take a brilliant overhead catch while making sure that he times his jump nicely. And then he had to toss the ball back in as his feet were going to encroach the cushions. He judges the situation to a nicety and the execution is spot on. Uthappa c Stokes b Gowtham 48(36) [4s-6 6s-2]

Gowtham to Karthik, FOUR, oh lovely. He's already showing some excellent touch out there. 102kph delivery from Gowtham, Karthik stays back to it and then dabs it out of the keeper's gloves. So so late and really really fine

Unadkat to Nitish Rana, no run, slower length ball on off, Rana defends back towards the bowler and sets off for a single. Ridiculous judgement. Karthik obviously sends him back, but even a dive wouldn't have saved him if Unadkat had hit the stumps direct. Michael Clarke calls it the worst attempted single in the history of cricket

Unadkat to Karthik, SIX, oh what a freebie, and what a time for it. Any pressure that had built on KKR has evaporated. Slower short ball on leg-stump, Karthik whip-pulls it witheringly over the long leg boundary

Unadkat to Nitish Rana, SIX, pretty full from Unadkat, and this is brilliant use of the crease from Rana. He takes a step back which allows him to get under the ball. Mid-off was up in the ring, so the idea was to just loft it over him. And despite the bat turning in his hands, it still clears the ropes
Stokes to Karthik, FOUR, full toss outside off, 144kph, Karthik carves it away through backward point. Rocketed off his bat
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, an inswinging slower ball on middle and leg, Rana clears his front leg and drives to the right of long-off
Laughlin to Karthik, SIX, hoisted over long-on to wrap up a clinical win for KKR. Set himself up for this length ball and launched it into the night sky, falls way back into the stands
Gowtham to Uthappa, FOUR, showed glimpses of form in the previous game too. This is short around off, Uthappa camps back and punches it well past the fielder at mid-off, placement was bang on there

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, finally manages to get a boundary. Was trying it since a while. This was a tad on the slower side but short enough for Narine to thrash it, goes aerial over covers and finds the boundary, his first convincing shot of the day

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, this was even better than the previous one. No fielders moved, just mere spectators. Short of a length outside off, Narine throws his hands at it and times his drive through the gap there, that came right from the meat

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries. Kulkarni put under pressure by Narine. Picks the length early on that short one, transfers his weight on to the back foot and pummels it through mid-wicket, the fielder there was too square to cut this off
Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, pulled away! Short of a length on middle and leg, Uthappa picks the length on it and pulls it neatly over mid-wicket, on a bounce and over the fence there
Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, slower delivery and that's been put away to the fence again. Just outside off and on a length, Uthappa stands tall and pumps it right over the bowler's head

Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, cheeky. That's Uthappa's experience for you. Shortish in length around off, Uthappa simply guides it down to third man and finds the fence again, can't keep a fielder so fine

Laughlin to Uthappa, FOUR, poor line! Can't bowl such freebies when a batsman is in good touch. This was a shortish delivery on the thigh and all Uthappa wanted to do is get it past the fielder at short fine leg, manages to do so. Drags it past the fielder and gets another boundary

Laughlin to Narine, SIX, 50-run stand up between Narine and Uthappa! Short of a length around off, Narine clears his front leg and pulls it over mid-wicket to end the powerplay with a maximum. Good recovery by KKR after the loss of Lynn in the first over of the innings
Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, SIX, short and punished! Gopal drops it short on off, Uthappa camps back and times his pull over mid-wicket, an impressive blow

Stokes to Narine, FOUR, another edge, another boundary. On a length around off, Narine goes hard at it and gets an outside edge that makes it fly past the keeper. Even a dive by Buttler wouldn't have helped his cause

Shreyas Gopal to Narine, out Narine Run Out!! Poor piece of running there. First of all he tried to reverse sweep it and as it went off the pads to short third man. Narine wanted the run but Uthappa sent him back. There was no chance that Uthappa would have completed the run. Unadkat is the man who throws it at the keeper's end to catch Narine well short of his crease. Narine run out (Unadkat/Buttler) 35(25) [4s-5 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, SIX, a biggie to end the over! Excellent timing on that. Full and floated on middle, Uthappa doesn't miss out on the chance to slog it over mid-wicket, a meaty blow that was. That'll spoil the over for the bowler
