Stokes to Uthappa, FOUR, misfield by Unadkat and Stokes isn't pleased by that. Was a back of a length delivery outside off, Uthappa went for it with hard hands, threw his bat at it and got an outside edge. Unadkat slips at square third man and misfields as the ball goes through him

Tom Curran to D Arcy Short, FOUR, well-timed and four. Sliding down and D Arcy Short didn't miss out. Short fine was inside the ring and deep square back, he beat the latter with a beautiful flick off the hips. That should hopefully get him going
batsman: Tom Curran to D Arcy Short

comment: Narine to D Arcy Short, FOUR, this is another short-arm jab, one bounce over the ropes at deep square. Way too short by Narine, on middle and leg, D Arcy Short picked him off easily, bisected the two men either side on the leg-side
Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, this is so unlike Narine. He hasn't looked himself tonight. Another drag-down, Tripathi controls the pull and beats Mavi to his left at deep mid. 10 off that over

Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, SIX, what a blow that is. This is what D Arcy Short can do. Backs away and Shivam Mavi follows him with a back of a length delivery, but D Arcy Short clobbers the pull miles into the deep square stands. At one point looked like clearing the crowd and going out of the stadium
batsman: Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short

comment: Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, FOUR, he can do finesse too. Not only raw power. Used the pace of Shivam Mavi to full effect. Watched the back of a length delivery onto his bat and steered it to the right of the diving backward point, beats him and gives third man no chance
batsman: Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short

comment: Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short, out Bowled!! D Arcy Short's painful innings comes to an end. A fist pump from Nitish Rana. Bowled the slider and it rushed past the cross-batted hoick of D Arcy Short. Clipped off and credit to DK for getting Nitish Rana back on. The bowler has justified that move with another wicket. D Arcy Short b Nitish Rana 44(43) [4s-5 6s-1]
batsman: Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short

comment: Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, this is a proper pull. Dragged down by Kuldeep Yadav and Tripathi was onto the back foot in a flash, pulled it between wide long-on and deep mid. Found the gap to perfection. Hit hard as well

Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, out Caught by A Russell!! Good catch by Russell at short cover. Leapt at the right time to catch. Tripathi went inside out but couldn't keep the in-to-out shot down, bit more elevation and he would've got a couple at least. Tripathi c A Russell b Kuldeep Yadav 15(11) [4s-2]
Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, SIX, as soon as he saw the tossed up delivery, a chinaman, Stokes goes downtown. Kneels down and then slogs it miles back into the long-on stands. That's what Stokes can do

Chawla to Stokes, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Chawla has bowled very well tonight and gets the dangerous Stokes out. To the left-hander he has been bowling mainly googlies and this one is the same as well. Stokes was charging Chawla and it kept on going away from him. Sliced it high up in the air and Rana backtracking from cover takes a good catch. Not easy to judge that in the lights. Stokes c Nitish Rana b Chawla 14(11) [6s-1]

Narine to Gowtham, SIX, can Gill get there? He can but can only parry it over the ropes. Good effort from him running to his left at long-off. Not easy at all as Gowtham lofted it superbly after using his feet. Had enough to get it over the left-hand of the diving fielder
Narine to Buttler, FOUR, brutal. Fraction short and that's enough for Buttler, who marmalises the back foot forcing shot. Long-off wasn't even in the picture. A rare off night for Narine

Tom Curran to Gowtham, out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Easy for backward point. Back of the hand slower delivery, Tom Curran bowls that well. He is so confident with that delivery that he regularly and surprisingly bowled it in the Ashes Test. To not great effect it must be said. But here he gets Gowtham slicing it off a thick outside edge and grabs a wicket. Gowtham c Shivam Mavi b Tom Curran 12(7) [6s-1]

Tom Curran to Shreyas Gopal, out Bowled!! Both Karnataka men gone in consecutive balls. To Tom Curran. He takes off his aeroplane and Mitch Johnson is seen clapping from the dugout. Pacy length delivery, on off, Shreyas Gopal was late on the defence and it knocked the stump out of the ground. Played a bit inside the line and had no footwork to deal with that sharp delivery. Tom Curran is now on a hat-trick. Shreyas Gopal b Tom Curran 0(1)
Tom Curran to Buttler, FOUR, slightly off-line and four. Can't err in any way to Buttler. Low full-toss and swung to the left of long-on, one bounce over the ropes
Shivam Mavi to D Kulkarni, 1 run, Lynn at backward point drops a simple catch. Kulkarni sliced it and Lynn drops it. What's more it brings Buttler on strike too

Shivam Mavi to Buttler, out D Kulkarni Run Out!! 1 run completed. Almost a royal mess-up. But Shivam Mavi recovers to run Kulkarni out. Driven to long-off. No way the second was on, not with Kulkarni running like that. Shivam Mavi fumbled the throw but recovered to run Kulkarni out, who couldn't make it. But importantly Buttler will be on strike. D Kulkarni run out (Shubman Gill/Shivam Mavi) 3(3)
Narine to Rahane, FOUR, first ball from Narine and Rahane takes the seam-up delivery and sweeps it through backward square leg, hit well and found the gap too
Narine to Rahane, FOUR, lovely batting. Down the track and to the pitch before slamming it in the air, but wide of the diving Russell at mid-off. Consecutive boundaries
Narine to Rahane, FOUR, three in a row. Too short outside off, Rahane has played around with Narine's mind. Takes full toll of this, by cutting this wide of point and cover-point

Narine to Rahane, FOUR, four more. This is brilliant batting. Without any risk too. That's 16 runs off the over. The last two balls have been short, even though this bounced from a back of a length, Rahane was back and across, cuts again and does so well, to find the gap between point and cover-point. An injection of momentum, so badly needed by RR

Shivam Mavi to Rahane, SIX, smashed. That's some way to treat a bloke who's bowling at over 140 clicks. Down the track and flat-batted the short of length delivery straight back over the bowler's head. Had enough on it to go all the way
Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, FOUR, first one he has timed tonight. Picks the slower delivery from a length and swings cleanly over mid-off's head
batsman: Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short

comment: Chawla to Rahane, FOUR, magnificent cover drive. When Rahane is on song, there are few better timers of the ball in India. This is overpitched and he leans forward to caress the drive wide of cover and extra cover. Threaded the needle there
Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short, FOUR, sliding down, just needed bat on that and D Arcy Short gets the glance going. Fine leg is too square and he had no chance
batsman: Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short

comment: Nitish Rana to Rahane, out Stumped!! Brilliant from DK but felt that Rahane gave up all too easily. Could've put pressure on DK by attempting to dive, none of that and he goes. Was down the track looking to flick, richocheted off the pad and went in front of DK who calmly collects the ball and then backflicks to hit direct. One glove was off quickly and that made it easier for DK. Can't understand why it has been changed to stumped. According to the laws of the game, when a batsman is attempting a run - Rahane surely was - it should be declared run-out. Weird! Rahane st Karthik b Rana 36(19) [4s-5 6s-1]

Shivam Mavi to Samson, FOUR, he attempted that off the first ball and missed. Not now. Uses the pace of Shivam Mavi to great effect. Steers late and with an open face, right off the middle of the bat and Uthappa running around from third man can only watch it run away

Shivam Mavi to Samson, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! Gone now. As soon as he hit that, Samson knew he had made a mistake. Good short of length delivery on the hips, rising, Samson cannot keep the short-arm jab pull down and picks out deep square to perfection. Kuldeep didn't move a muscle there. Samson c Kuldeep Yadav b Shivam Mavi 7(8) [4s-1]

Jordan to Gayle, leg byes, FOUR, bonus runs! Gayle checks his back a bit as that had struck him above the thigh pad. Back of a length around leg, he missed the flick off the back foot and it sped past a diving Saha to the fence

S Kaul to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Such a soft dismissal! Often been the story with Agarwal, gets a good looking start and then weirdly, throws it away. Slower ball from Kaul and it was a bit short, Agarwal was in two minds whether to go hard at it or just use his touch. In the end, all he managed was to spoon it straight to Hooda at backward point. A dolly that is and once again, SRH get a wicket at just about the right time. Mayank Agarwal c Deepak Hooda b S Kaul 18(9) [4s-2 6s-1]

Shakib to Nair, SIX, "Will he catch it? Yes, he will! No, he won't!", yelps Mbangwa on-air! Good effort by long-off but too difficult in the end. Pandey was the man there, leapt to take it one-handed but the momentum was taking him past the ropes and in the effort to throw it back into play, fails to do so. Floated ball and was lofted down the ground by Karun, gets a maximum

Shakib to Gayle, SIX, he has got under this one, oh yes! Shakib was trying to steer clear of Gayle's arc but misses it for once. Full and on middle and off, the big West Indian just clears his front leg and launches it over long-on for yet another six

Jordan to Gayle, 1 run, slower and very full on the pads, nudged towards the big spaces at mid-wicket. Jordan has to chase it himself and that allows the single. 23rd IPL fifty for Gayle, second on the trot to start a new season. The Jamaican is making a statement, that's for sure

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, not off the middle really but who cares? He has enough power! The googly and Gayle decided to go with the turn, sliced it away over long-off and easily cleared the fence! Whoa!

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, this is off the middle alright! Gayle storm alert! The shorter length and Gayle sits on the back foot to flat bat it straight down the ground. As straight as an arrow and well over the ropes

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, 3 in a row! Has Rashid ever been hammered like this? I cannot remember at all but this is what Gayle does. He can destroy the best of bowlers. Fuller length once more and he just lifts it straight down the ground. Into the sight-screen! He is in the savage mode

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, it keeps coming! It keeps coming! 4 out of 4 for Gayle! Floated up on middle and off, he gets across on one leg and clobbers the slog sweep over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. Oh boy, this is some exhibition!
S Kaul to Nair, 2 runs, mistimed but clears mid-wicket with ease! Short of a length around middle and leg, drags this flick off the inner half and clears the infield
S Kaul to Nair, FOUR, up and over! Good batting from Karun, saw mid-off up in the ring and decided to go over the man. Succeeded easily. Fuller ball outside off,

S Kaul to Nair, FOUR, does it again! This time, Jordan at mid-off thought he had a chance and leapt full length but the ball sailed over him. Short of a length outside off, Karun flat-batted it with all the power and although he didn't keep it down, didn't matter at all. Runs bleeding at the moment

Jordan to Gayle, SIX, Jordan doesn't get the landing rights in Mohali. The slower delivery, bowls it half-way down the pitch. Seemed as though Gayle was waiting for it. Rocks back and bulldozed it into the deep square leg stands. "Catching practise for the crowd," says Pommie Mbangwa on air. 14th maximum for the universe boss

Jordan to Nair, FOUR, mid-off inside the ring and Jordan bowls it right in the arc for Nair. He just gets under it and tonks it with a straight bat and clean swing over mid-off. Beautiful hands from Nair. Ah, poses for the paparazzis as well

Bhuvneshwar to Nair, out Caught by Dhawan!! Nair targets the longest boundary and holes out. Bhuvneshwar gets his man, finally. Length delivery just outside off, Nair moved across and whiplashed it. Needed to generate more power to clear the ropes. Fails and hits it straight to Dhawan at deep mid-wicket, who grabs it and does the thigh-five celebration. Nair c Dhawan b Bhuvneshwar 31(21) [4s-3 6s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, SIX, Gayle moves to 99. Spoils a good over by Bhuvneshwar. Pitched up just outside off, Gayle spots it early and smokes it disdainfully over long-off. High and handsome

S Kaul to Gayle, 1 run, put your hands together for the universe boss! Christopher Henry Gayle brings up his 6th IPL hundred. Off comes the helmet, raises his bat to soak in the applause from the Mohali crowd and unleashes the 'Baby in the arms' celebration. Reached the landmark with a squeezy drive to point

S Kaul to Gayle, 1 run, oh this was nearly a run out! A highish full toss miscued to extra cover, who with a direct hit could have gotten Gayle. Throw is right on cue to Kaul but he's not in a position to under-arm the ball onto the stumps. Chance missed, Gayle makes it back in...
Rashid Khan to Finch, FOUR, Finch gets into the act. Backs away, makes room and Rashid helped him by slanting it on the stumps. Golf-swung over cow corner
Rashid Khan to Finch, SIX, Rashid has been taken to the dry cleaners today. Proper pasting. Went too full this time does Rashid, Finch was waiting for it. Muscles it straight down the ground

Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, FOUR, elegant shot! The flourish of the bat was a sight to behold. Knuckle ball from Bhuvneshwar but too full and also too straight as well, Rahul shuffles a touch to flick it away sweetly. Bisected mid-on and mid-wicket with ease. Yusuf gave a chase but was never going to stop it even with the slide

Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, no run, good use of the technology by Rahul! He was very sure that he had hit it and UltraEdge confirms the inside edge. He was stuck on the crease to this inswinger and got pinged on the back leg. Cannot fault the umpire for raising his finger because if not for the edge, it was dead plumb

Jordan to Gayle, SIX, crunched! The big man kicks off the six-hitting for the night. Expected the short ball and was ready on the back foot, swatted the pull over mid-wicket. Made a cracking sound off the blade

Jordan to Gayle, FOUR, on the off-side now! Fuller ball on middle and off, Gayle is sensing the lengths early and backs away for the loft over cover. Carved it away over the infield with ease. He is getting into the groove

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, hammered into the stands! That's a bad ball to most players, let alone Gayle. Juicy full toss and he just blasts it away over deep square leg for a mammoth biggie. Clean strike

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, smashed over long-on! Huge test this for Rashid, Gayle is in the mood to destroy him tonight. Loopy leg break and it's too full, launched down the ground for another huge biggie

S Kaul to Rahul, FOUR, shot of the night so far! This guy makes batting look really simple, doesn't he? Fuller ball and Rahul got the stride forward nicely before absolutely creaming the drive. On the up and what stood out was the precision in placement, bisected extra cover and mid-off with such ease

S Kaul to Rahul, FOUR, over the infield this time! Rahul also joins in the fun. Another half volley from Kaul and this is lofted straight over mid-off. Comfortably over the fielder and away she goes to the fence
Deepak Hooda to Gayle, 1 run, saw Gayle giving the charge and smartly shortened the length around middle and leg, eased away down to long-on. 50 up for KXIP

Rashid Khan to Rahul, out Lbw!! Rashid draws first blood! SRH needed this and not surprisingly, it's their star spinner who does the job. The slider that shoots through a touch low, Rahul wasn't anticipating the lack of bounce and went through with a pull. Got pinged on the pad and that's as plumb as it gets. End of a smooth opening stand but KXIP haven't really been allowed to get away. Rahul lbw b Rashid Khan 18(21) [4s-3]
Deepak Hooda to Gayle, SIX, booooooom! Cannot bowl it in his arc when he is in this mood. Full and in the slot on off, he just lofts it down the ground effortlessly. Crashes into the sightscreen

Deepak Hooda to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, almost carried to backward point! Reprieve for Agarwal, he went after this flighted delivery on seeing the width but couldn't connect the drive well. Sliced it in the air and it just fell short of the diving fielder. Sneaked past him eventually and sped to the fence

Shakib to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, beautiful placement! Tossed up generously from Shakib but it's too wide and Agarwal executes the inside out lofted stroke with finesse. There was a man at long-off but he's got this well wide of that man

Shakib to Mayank Agarwal, SIX, clobbered away! Agarwal is wasting no time in switching to top gear. Floated up around off, he just clears his front leg and deposits this over the long-on fielder for a maximum. Good proactive batting

Barinder to Saha, no run, Punjab have gone for a review. My naked eyes tell me this is high and it might be going down the leg side. Saha is jumping in the crease when ball strikes him on the back pad. It is clipping the stumps -- the top of middle and leg -- but just clipping so it is umpire's call and Punjab retain their review. Good inward shape from Barinder on that back of a length ball

Mohit Sharma to Williamson, FOUR, we have seen brute power from gayle earlier but this is total touch play from Williamson. It was a good length delivery outside off, Williamson gets in a good position and drives it on the up, ball beats the mid-off fielder for a four
Mohit Sharma to Saha, FOUR, picks up the slower ball early but doesn't time it as well as he would have liked, but he gets enough bat onto it to get a four to fine leg

Mohit Sharma to Saha, out Bowled!! Saha wasn't timing it at all and this was always on the cards. It was a good length delivery at the stumps, Saha wanted to play it across the line, his willow misses it totally and ball disturbs the furniture. Punjab are off to a dream start here. The ball just brushes the off stick. Saha b Mohit Sharma 6(7) [4s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, FOUR, 50-run stand up. Goes for the yorker but he's bowled a nice little full toss here -- something that Manish Pandey uses to hit his first boundary. Scythed round the corner, that full toss
Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, FOUR, room offered outside off and Manish Pandey's sliced it without fuss to the third man boundary. That will do
Ashwin to Williamson, SIX, some turn on this leg break but Williamson stays put and swipes this over deep mid-wicket. Just a little short, which allowed Williamson to go against the spin there
Ashwin to Williamson, 1 run, back to off breaks, is Ashwin. Williamson slaps it to sweeper cover to hoist a fifty
Andrew Tye to Williamson, FOUR, 129ks on a back of a length, and veering down, there's only one way the ball's going. To the boundary. Pulled behind square

Andrew Tye to Williamson, out Caught by Finch!! Williamson will now know that this is a big, big ground. Steps out to a slower delivery -- knuckle ball, actually -- but can you blame him? Mistimes this attempted loft and there's long-off waiting, secretly thanking the big dimensions that this ground entails. Williamson c Finch b Andrew Tye 54(41) [4s-3 6s-2]
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, FOUR, deftly played. Googly but it's wide, and Manish Pandey waits and glides it just wide of the keeper

Andrew Tye to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by (sub)Manoj Tiwary!! That's been hit high but SRH here are unravelling, surrendering to Mohali's big dimensions. Knuckle ball, another one yeah, and Deepak Hooda finds long-on with this big loft. Manoj Tiwary there, who takes it and then kicks the ball away in celebration... Deepak Hooda c (sub)Manoj Tiwary b Andrew Tye 5(5)
Barinder to Shakib, no ball, FOUR, that's above the waist, and hence a no-ball. Shakib nicely arches away before realizing that he can get some bat on this. Glides it uppishly through third man

Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, SIX, a 37-ball fifty for Pandey. 40 from 10 needed now, which means literally every ball has to be a boundary. A bottom-handed loft from Manish Pandey that, getting under that full ball and launching it over long-on
Ashwin to Shakib, SIX, switches to the off break and Shakib launches him over deep mid-wicket. Just the length you can swing across
Ashwin to Shakib, SIX, another one pretty much there. A bit slower you'd think, and Shakib goes straighter here

Ashwin to Shakib, 1 run, dropped by Mujeeb at deep mid-wicket. Ashwin actually did well by spinning it into Shakib but Shakib's in that mood. Carved across the line, only to be let off. That's the long side of the boundary and that should have been taken

Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, FOUR, Ashwin mistimes the jump and ball goes over him at mid-off for a four. It was fuller length ball at the stumps, Pathan lofts it over mid-off, just gets enough blade on the ball to clear mid-off

Barinder to Y Pathan, 1 run, what are you doing Yuvi! He drops a sitter. This is as easy as they come. Pathan mistimes the cut shot and he hits it straight to cover point where Yuvi makes a mess of it. Reacted very late as he went reverse-cup style and it popped out
Andrew Tye to Y Pathan, FOUR, slower delivery at the stumps, it was fuller in length and Pathan picks up the slower ball early. He gets in a good position and hits it over mid-wicket for a four
Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, FOUR, no one moved on that ball. It was a good length delivery outside off, Pathan swats it wide of the mid-off fielder for a four. Power and placement from Pathan

Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, out Bowled!! Chops it back onto the stumps. This is a back of the hand slower ball from Mohit Sharma and Pathan was completely foxed by it. He wanted to drive it through the off-side but gets a thick inside edge and ball comes back in the direction of the stumps. Clever variation in pace from Mohit Sharma, he is having a good night thus far. Y Pathan b Mohit Sharma 19(13) [4s-3]

Ashwin to Williamson, FOUR, gorgeous shot! Pure class from Williamson. It was a leg-spinner from Ashwin, Williamson comes down the track and lofts it with the turn over cover for a four. One of the toughest shots to play but he reached the pitch of the ball and made it easier for himself

Ashwin to Williamson, SIX, Williamson sends it into the crowd. It was an off-spinner from Ashwin, Williamson comes down the track, reaches the pitch of the ball and lofts it over the long-off for a maximum. Clean connection!

Mujeeb to Williamson, no run, Punjab have gone for a review. Williamson is a long way down the ground. Ultra edge shows no edge and DRS shows ball is just hitting the leg stump. Punjab retains the review again. Williamson comes down the track on the ball and misses the bat totally, ball hits his pads
Binny to Watson, FOUR, he won't miss out on that, will Watson! Waits for the slower delivery, rocks back and pumps it right over the bowler's head to get off the mark in style

Binny to Watson, FOUR, that's bread and butter for Watto. Back of a length delivery outside off, Watson camps back, transfers his weight on the back foot and crunches this through the gap at covers, no fielder moved there

Binny to Watson, 1 run, edged and dropped! Rahul Tripathi the culprit on that occasion. Puts down a sitter. Was a full length delivery outside off, Watson goes for a drive and the away swing induces an outside edge. However, Tripathi - the lone slipper makes a mess out of it

Binny to Rayudu, FOUR, who would want to be a bowler in this format? Dropped catch just on the previous ball and this one has been belted away. Full in length outside off, Rayudu advances down the wicket and smokes it over cover for a boundary
Gowtham to Watson, SIX, first maximum of the match! Loopy delivery around off, Watson backs away, makes room and towers it cleanly over long-off for his first big one of the night

Unadkat to Raina, FOUR, these runs are hurting Royals, really bad. Both batsmen are looking unstoppable. Shortish delivery on leg, Raina swivels his pull past the fielder at short fine and ends the over with a boundary again. How often has that happened tonight!

Laughlin to Raina, FOUR, the boundaries continue to flow.. Room to leg and that opens up the off-side field nicely for him, even though it is back of a length, Raina thumps it on the up over extra cover. No chance for the sweeper

Laughlin to Watson, SIX, flat six! That barely left the ground. Banged in and at Laughlin's pace it sat up for Watto, who was quick to rock back and nail the pull in front of square, right between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket

Shreyas Gopal to Raina, FOUR, streaky! But that's how Raina plays. No half measures. Darted in outside off and Raina threw his bat at that, sliced the drive over backward point and started another over with a boundary

Shreyas Gopal to Raina, FOUR, fabulous shot! It was the wrong 'un and Raina picked it right out of the hand. Got into position to play the inside out shot and struck it handsomely over extra cover. The timing was exquisite

Shreyas Gopal to Raina, out Caught by Gowtham!! Stunner! Needed something like this to break this partnership and the two Karnataka lads combine to send Raina back. Another wrong 'un from Gopal and Raina once more spotted it early, sat down on his knee to play the slog and sweep, struck it powerfully and flat towards deep mid-wicket, the ball was dying in front of Gowtham, who covered good ground, dived full length and took it inches from the ground. Raina c Gowtham b Shreyas Gopal 46(29) [4s-9]

Binny to Watson, FOUR, easy pickings! Back of a length on middle and leg, Watson waits and gently tickles it fine, the man is inside the ring at 45 and it was well wide of him, raced across the lightning outfield

Binny to Watson, FOUR, consecutive boundaries and this was not a poor delivery. Fab shot from Watto. Spotted third man inside the ring, waited for the back of a length delivery on off and dabbed it past a diving backward point, the quick outfield takes care of the rest

Binny to Watson, FOUR, third boundary of the over. Binny is going for plenty. Short delivery and at 132 clicks it is not going to trouble Watson, who pulls it along the ground in front of square, the placement was perfect
Binny to Dhoni, FOUR, 19 runs off the over. Raina's wicket has done nothing to slow down the scoring rate. Off-cutter on a length, Dhoni just guides it past backward point and short third man

Shreyas Gopal to Dhoni, out Caught by Gowtham!! Juggled and taken. Gowtham must be a relieved man. For a second it seemed like he parried it over. Dhoni shimmies down and gets close to the wrong 'un, smokes it flat and hard towards long-on, Gowtham times his jump and goes reverse cup, but the ball bursts out and luckily for him goes straight up, he gathers himself and completes the catch. Dhoni c Gowtham b Shreyas Gopal 5(3) [4s-1]

Unadkat to Watson, FOUR, edged and four! Not where he intended, but when luck is on your side, everything goes your way. Unadkat comes round the wicket and cramps Watson for room, he attempts a cut shot and the outside edge runs away to the right of Buttler

Shreyas Gopal to Billings, out Caught by Stokes!! Third for Gopal. He's been exceptional today. Standout bowler by far for Royals. It was the sort of half-tracker that got Kohli and de Villiers couple of matches ago, Billings went deep in the crease to play the pull and hit it straight to deep mid-wicket. The big England all-rounder ain't dropping that. RR fighting back with a couple of wickets. Billings c Stokes b Shreyas Gopal 3(7)

Laughlin to Watson, FOUR, Watson needs to keep going for CSK. The runs have dried up a bit in the last few overs. Trifle short and outside off and Watson waits before playing the cut shot past the diving backward point fielder

Laughlin to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, delicate! Slower back of a length delivery, Bravo walked across his stumps to get inside the line and then glances it off the hips past the short fine fielder, just a roll of the wrists to pocket a boundary

Unadkat to Watson, 1 run, hundred for Watson. Two in two days in this IPL. Gayle yesterday and Watson today. The helmet comes off and the bat is up in the air to acknowledge the applause of the traveling fans. There was also a little fist pump as soon as he placed it in the gap. He scored a hundred for Royals while playing against CSK and now he's done the vice versa - the first player to do that. Coming to the ball: Back of a length around off, Watson knocks it wide of point and reaches the milestone

Unadkat to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, offers room on this slower delivery and Bravo is quick to capitalize, he waits before unleashing the cut shot over backward point, no one in the deep to stop that. Much needed boundary for Bravo

Unadkat to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, dropped! Samson the man who puts it down. Bravo tried to repeat the previous shot, but does not get the elevation on the cut shot, Samson jumps up at backward point and parries it over him. Should have done a better job there. RR have not had a good day in the field

Stokes to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, one-handed pull from Bravo. He was deceived by the slower delivery and the bottom hand comes off the bat handle, but the placement is behind square and a desperate dive from Klaasen is not enough to stop the boundary

Stokes to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, ends the over well. Made room while dancing down, the width on offer made him free his arms and send the ball sailing over the extra cover fielder. Rocketed away to the fence

Laughlin to Watson, out Caught by Buttler!! Edged and taken. Some of the RR players run up to Watto and congratulate him. He was one of them for eight years and walks off to a standing ovation from the yellow army. Fine innings from the Australian. Fuller and outside off, Watson with his typical bent knee looks to smoke it over long-off, only manages an outside edge to Buttler. Watson c Buttler b Laughlin 106(57) [4s-9 6s-6]

Gowtham to Watson, 1 run, dropped! Short and wide outside off, Watson cuts it firmly to point but a diving effort by Tripathi saves a certain boundary. In fact it was a chance, Tripathi got his hand to it but couldn't take it

Unadkat to Watson, SIX, Watto is off to a flier. Although he has been dropped twice, he's continuing to take on the bowlers. This was a length delivery around off, Watson stood tall and clobbered it over the extra cover fence for half a dozen more

Unadkat to Watson, SIX, last ball of the over fetches six more. Unadkat wouldn't like this. He's the most expensive buy of this IPL among Indian players. Short of a length around off, Watson camps back and hammers it over mid-wicket for a flat six
Stokes to Rayudu, FOUR, boundaries continue to flow. Short and slow on middle and leg, Rayudu swivels and pulls it past the fielder at short fine leg, does well to get it past him

Stokes to Watson, FOUR, all bowlers are proving to be expensive. CSK openers are making the most of the powerplay. Again this was a gift of a delivery. Fullish and on the pads as Watson flicks it nonchalantly away to the fine leg region
Laughlin to Watson, 1 run, 50-run stand up with that single! Short of a length on middle and leg, Watson nudges it away to short mid and scurries across to the other end

Laughlin to Rayudu, out Caught by Buttler!! Laughlin strikes in his first over and sends Rayudu back to the hut. It was a length delivery outside off, too close to the body and Rayudu attempted a cut, he got an edge to it. Buttler behind the wickets makes sure to hold on to it. The batsman was in two minds there, whether to guide it to third man or play a cut shot. The dilemma resulted in his downfall. Rayudu c Buttler b Laughlin 12(8) [4s-2]
Stokes to Raina, FOUR, typical Raina there. Full length delivery around off, gets down on his knee and sweetly times his inside out shot over covers, looked pleasing to the eye that shot
Stokes to Raina, FOUR, short one on the thigh and Raina drags it down to the fine leg fence. Stokes has struggled with his lines so far. Bowled a few looseners in his first over too

Stokes to Raina, FOUR, commits the same mistake again. Fires in a low full toss on the pads and Raina makes sure to get some bat on that. Tickles it away to the fine leg fence and gets four more, that's the third boundary of the over

Stokes to Raina, FOUR, brilliant! That's Raina's experience for you. This was a length delivery angled away from him and Raina played it late in order to guide it down to third man, the fielder was too square to cut it off. 16 runs of the over, all in boundaries!

Gowtham to Raina, 1 run, a risky single! What was Raina thinking here? Knocks the flatter delivery to the left of the bowler and takes a single. Gowtham had the time in the world to parry it to Rahane but he decides to go for a direct hit and misses out on a run out opportunity. Raina had given up

Gowtham to Watson, SIX, gets to his fifty in style! It's a short delivery and Watson camps back and slaughters it over Stokes at long-on. Reaches the milestone and raises his bat, acknowledges the crowd
Gowtham to Watson, FOUR, there's no stopping him tonight. This is short again outside off, Watson goes back in his crease and slams it through the gap at covers
Gowtham to Watson, SIX, smoked it! Tossed up delivery around off, Watson slogs this over mid-wicket for half a dozen
Unadkat to Raina, FOUR, that's the second 50-run partnership of the match. Short and wide outside off, Raina beautifully cuts it over point and adds four to his tally

Chahar to Klaasen, no run, dropped! Deja vu! Watto was dropped in the first over at first slip and he does the same now. A beautiful delivery from Chahar. Seam-up delivery on a good-ish length that decks away a tad and Klaasen dangled his bat out. The thick outside edge carries to Watson, but that's been put down. Klaasen survives. The centurion wasn't quite ready - was late to react

Chahar to Rahane, SIX, shot! One of best shots played today. The RR skipper gives the charge by coming down the track and then offers a straight bat to thump this length ball over long-on. Off the middle and off she goes into the stands. Poses for the photographs too

Chahar to Rahane, FOUR, edged and four. 14 off the opening over. Streaky, but Rahane wouldn't mind much. The ball came in with the angle and Rahane got an inside edge on his push, runs away to the fine leg fence

SN Thakur to Klaasen, FOUR, through the gates! That won't please the bowler, nor the captain. A fullish ball on middle and leg, Klaasen flicks it superbly, but was straight to the man at mid-wicket. Karn Sharma there allows it to go through his legs. First boundary in IPL for Klaasen

SN Thakur to Klaasen, out Bowled!! Gone! Shardul Thakur strikes. A nothing shot from the South African. No feet movement either. A cross-seamed length ball attacking the stumps, Klaasen stays leg-side of the ball and plays down the wrong line. The stumps get shattered. CSK have an early breakthrough. Klaasen b SN Thakur 7(7) [4s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, out Caught by Tahir!! Bravo is on his way with those celebrations, shaking it real nice. Completely deceived Buttler with this slower ball. It was a short of length delivery well wide of off, Buttler was looking to drag it away through the on-side. But by the time it arrived, he had completely lost his shape. The top-edge balloons towards short third man where Tahir moves a few yards back and settles under it comfortably. Buttler c Tahir b Dwayne Bravo 22(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Tahir to Stokes, FOUR, drilled straight back, goes right through Tahir and then sneaks through Rayudu as well. Clumsy sliding effort at long-on there, but considering his bruised knee, we'll cut him some slack

Dwayne Bravo to R Tripathi, out Caught by Billings!! Goes down on the back knee, wanting to unleash a big slog-sweep against this slower ball, but he's miscued it off a thick top-edge. He'll be taken at deep mid-wicket. Yes. So Bravo has his second, and there's more moves from him. R Tripathi c Billings b Dwayne Bravo 5(5)
Dwayne Bravo to Binny, FOUR, he's somehow glanced this yorker into the fine leg boundary. Really well done from Binny. The line - which was on leg-stump - helped his cause
Tahir to Stokes, SIX, stretches out to reach this googly and then flat-bats it over long-off. Brute power

Tahir to Stokes, out Caught by Billings!! Stokes's head dropped as soon as this left his bat. Knew he hadn't got it off the middle. Flighted leg-break from Tahir, it comes off a thick top-edge as Stokes looks to slog-sweep and it's calmly taken at the mid-wicket boundary. Stokes c Billings b Tahir 45(37) [4s-3 6s-1]

Watson to Gowtham, out Caught by Dhoni!! Slower short ball, Gowtham swings into a pull but all he manages is a top-edge through to Dhoni. The Royals sinking rapidly now. Hardly any celebrations from CSK. Dhoni just throws the ball back and waves his players to their respective positions. Gowtham c Dhoni b Watson 1(2)

SN Thakur to Binny, out Caught&Bowled!! This is a brilliant one-handed return catch from Thakur, who is absolutely fired up. He rushed Binny with the short ball, and then rushed forward in his followthrough before diving and taking it with his right hand. It was flapped up off the splice by Binny, after getting severely cramped. Binny c and b SN Thakur 10(8) [4s-1]
SN Thakur to Unadkat, FOUR, oh shot. Nailed this pull shot through mid-wicket. Solid response after the previous ball
Karn Sharma to Unadkat, FOUR, the width on this delivery spelled it out for Unadkat's inside-out loft. He frees his arms to cream it wide of long-off
Karn Sharma to Unadkat, FOUR, quickly onto the back knee to swat this leg-break through mid-wicket. Plenty of muscle from Unadkat as he swishes it to the boundary

Karn Sharma to Unadkat, out Bowled!! Clatters the stumps with a googly. Unadkat has had his fun, no more. Tries for another slog-sweep but probably didn't pick the variation. Unadkat b Karn Sharma 16(10) [4s-3]

Karn Sharma to Laughlin, out Caught by Dhoni!! Faint tickle from Laughlin, and that's it. RR bowled out with nine balls to go. Flat leg-break, Laughlin makes room to drive off the back foot but it climbs on him due to the overspin imparted. Dhoni takes care of the edge. Laughlin c Dhoni b Karn Sharma 0(1)

Chahar to Rahane, no run. Another appeal for lbw and this time CSK decide to review. Fair delivery. The knuckle ball and Rahane didn't pick it. Was early into the shot and got struck on the back thigh. Was there any bat involved? A light spike on the UltraEdge. An inside edge. CSK lose their only review. It was on a length and Rahane walked forward to work it through the on-side. Didn't pick it, on that occasion did Rahane

Chahar to Samson, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! Two down! Samson is distraught as he walks off. He has picked the man in the deep perfectly. Short of a length delivery on the body and Samson went aerial on the heave. Got it off the top portion of the bat and found Karn Sharma at deep backward square leg. As he walks off, mocks the pull shot (to be played along the ground). Too late! Samson c Karn Sharma b Chahar 2(3)

Chahar to Rahane, out Bowled!! Another knuckle ball, another wicket. Simple, right! Rajasthan are now in deep trouble. Chahar changed the position of the ball in his hand at the last moment and Rahane had no clue about it. Waltzed down the track and wanted to pull it away. Early to swing the bat and the ball scoots under the blade. 32/3! Rahane b Chahar 16(11) [4s-1 6s-1]
Tahir to Buttler, FOUR, hit hard! Buttler uses his feet to good effect. Dances down the ground to convert it into a half-volley and drills it down the ground. Long-on had no chance to mop that up

Tahir to Buttler, SIX, 14 off the over! Buttler has ensured that Tahir is not settled. For the third time in as many balls, he comes down the track. It was the googly from Tahir, but Buttler made it into a half-volley and bludgeoned it over the bowler's head. A gigantic hit

Watson to Stokes, FOUR, poor delivery and that's been put away. First boundary for Stokes! With fine leg inside the circle, he bowls a short ball down the leg-side. Stokes gets a glove on the pull and the ball goes fine of the fielder at 45
Tahir to Stokes, FOUR, cracking shot! Stokes backed away even before the ball was delivered and that allowed him to free his arms. It was darted outside off and Stokes crashed it through extra cover

Mujeeb to Narine, out Caught by Nair!! No Narine show today. Falls cheaply and it's the youngster from Afghanistan, who has struck in his first over. Full credit to Ashwin, perfectly set a trap and Narine has fallen into it. It was the googly from Rahman, Narine cleared his front leg and whacked across the line, forgets there is a fielder in the deep. Nair nearly made a hash of it as he misjudged it initially. Recovers in time by diving head first at deep mid-wicket and pouched it superbly. Narine c Nair b Mujeeb 1(4)
Mujeeb to Chris Lynn, FOUR, loosener from Rahman and Lynn puts it away with ease. Stand and deliver stuff. Short, wide and outside off, Lynn says thank you very much and bashes it through cover

Ashwin to Karthik, FOUR, nicely played by DK, this was flighted well outside off, Karthik went down low, rolled his wrists over and slog sweeps it past mid-wicket, beats the fielder getting across from deep mid-wicket

Ashwin to Karthik, FOUR, lovely, has to be the shot of the day so far. Even Ashwin looks perplexed, this was tossed up nicely outside off, Karthik leant forward, played with the turn and drove it wide of mid-wicket, split the two men in the deep to perfection
Yuvraj to Karthik, FOUR, cheeky and four, slower and wider of off, Karthik waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and runs it past short third man, no need to run for those
Yuvraj to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's powerfully struck! Yuvraj dropped this one short and just outside off, Lynn backs away and bludgeons past the bowler, the fielder at long-off had no chance

Yuvraj to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, 4th IPL half-century for Lynn, he gets a big applause from the crowd, the dug out seem relaxed as well. This was pushed through flatter and quicker, Lynn had to reach out as he hacked it wide of long-off, hurries back for the second run

Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, SIX, smashed, length delivery and Lynn is all over it like a rash. Lynn was waiting on it, plays with the angle and sends it high and deep into the stands at long-on, 103 m hit - the second longest of IPL 2018
Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, FOUR, cracking shot, Tye is running out of ideas, back of a length and well wide of off, Lynn gets on top of the bounce and clatters it over cover-point

Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, chance and Sran has dropped it. He did all the hard work, ran across to his left from deep cover, got both hands as he slid across, but fails to hold on. A life for Lynn, how costly will it prove to be? This was short of a good length and well outside off, Lynn threw his hands at that and carved it over cover, no real timing on the shot and it should have been gobbled up

Mujeeb to Karthik, FOUR, the boundaries are flowing for KKR, fraction short and sliding down the leg-side, Karthik went half-way down and pulled it behind square on the on-side, the man in the deep was square and has no chance
Mujeeb to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, slower and wider of off, Lynn went hard on the drive once again and mistimed it wide of long-off, that actually allowed the batsmen to come back for the second run

Ashwin to Chris Lynn, FOUR, dropped short and wide of off, Lynn makes room and cuts it square past point. Sran has a lot of distance to cover, he slides and pulls the ball back in. The third umpire has several looks and reckons that his boot was touching the ropes as he pushed it back into play, given as a boundary

Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Rahul!! Edged and caught! A pre-meditated slog from Lynn as he shuffled right across the stumps, Tye saw it coming and fired it wide of off, Lynn was aiming for the mid-wicket fence, gets a thick and audible edge through, KL doesn't drop those and it's a much needed wicket for KXIP. They have got rid of one dangerman, but here comes the bigger danger - it's Andre Russell. Chris Lynn c Rahul b Andrew Tye 74(41) [4s-6 6s-4]

Barinder to A Russell, FOUR, easy pickings for Russell, Barinder misses the yorker by an inch, turns out to be a swinging full-toss, Russell cleared his left leg, got his bat down and punched it back past the non-striker

Barinder to A Russell, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Russell, the slower short ball from Sran, but it was short and way down the leg-side, Russell swivels across and pulls it over backward square leg, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Barinder to A Russell, out Caught by Nair!! That's a big wicket for KXIP! That might turn out to be a difference of 20-30 runs. This was another yorker from Sran, he missed his length by a bit, Russell brought his bat down like a sledge-hammer and heaved it back over the bowler's head. Only the timing wasn't as great as it normally is. Good captaincy from Ashwin to have long-off fine as well, straight down the throat of Karun and KKR have lost their fifth wicket. A Russell c Nair b Barinder 10(7) [4s-2]
Barinder to Shubman Gill, FOUR, cracking shot, short and wide of off, Gill gets on top of the bounce and cuts it square past point, beat the diving fielder and raced away to the fence in a hurry
Rajpoot to Karthik, FOUR, that's a poor start from Rajpoot, short and wide of off, Karthik waited on that, played with an open face and beat Mujeeb's dive at short third man
Rajpoot to Karthik, FOUR, cheeky and four, this is excellent cricket from Karthik, fraction too short and wide of off, Karthik waits on it, opens the face of the bat and runs it past the keeper

Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, FOUR, beautifully played, too much of width on offer and Gill doesn't let it go. Prods across and crashes it square past cover, the man in the deep has no chance. 17 runs from the over, a terrible one from Rajpoot

Barinder to Karthik, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! KKR are not finishing on a high! Karthik falls after a fine cameo, this was a slower length ball from Sran, Karthik was deep in the crease as he shovelled it towards the on-side, went off the inner half of the bat and straight to Tye at deep backward square leg. He takes it reverse cupped and KXIP continue to chip away at the wickets. Karthik c Andrew Tye b Barinder 43(28) [4s-6]

Andrew Tye to Tom Curran, out Caught by Rajpoot!! KKR are losing some momentum towards the end. Tye has another wicket to his name, this was a yorker length delivery outside off, Curran jammed his bat down hard, gets a thick outside edge and the ball loops to Rajpoot at short third man. Some other day, it might have gone either to his left or right, but not today. Tom Curran c Rajpoot b Andrew Tye 1(3)

Andrew Tye to Chawla, 1 run, chance and Mujeeb has dropped a dolly, short and just outside off, Chawla backed away and dabbed it in the air towards short third man. Mujeeb didn't spot it early, the ball was dying in front of him, he bends down low and can't hold on. He then has a shy at the striker's end as the batsmen sneak in a single and misses, but Shubman Gill was always in

Rajpoot to Uthappa, FOUR, edged but just eludes Gayle's outstretched right-hand. Rajpoot gains trampoline bounce outside off with this back of a length delivery, Uthappa pokes with hard hands and outside-edges it towards Gayle, who was at a widish slip. Gingerly stretched his right hand but it escaped away to the fence

Rajpoot to Chris Lynn, SIX, third short ball in a row and Lynn punishes it with ease. No venom on this occasion, Lynn gets under it and hacked it comfortably into the fine leg stands. First maximum of the innings

Mujeeb to Uthappa, FOUR, adventure from Uthappa. Deals another flatter ball by bringing out the reverse sweep. Picked the length early and broomed it away to the third man fence. Key was he rolled his wrists there

Mujeeb to Uthappa, FOUR, two fours in a row for Uthappa. Sliding down leg as Rahman corrects his line. Uthappa drags the sweep, more of the bottom. But it beats short fine leg and races away to the fence

Mujeeb to Uthappa, FOUR, this was more streaky and Uthappa won't mind. Hat-trick of fours. Quick and skidded through, Uthappa was stuck on the back foot, looked to work it to the leg-side. Ends up squirting it more off the inner half and it eludes short fine leg, who's chase is vain in the end

Barinder to Chris Lynn, FOUR, the slower version of Sran's slower ball, Lynn didn't read it as he was early into the shot. But got it off the meat as he went for the pull and sent it behind square on the leg-side. No-one there and he'll collect a boundary

Andrew Tye to Uthappa, FOUR, this was out of the top draw. The slower delivery from Tye, on a short of length around middle and leg. Knuckle ball to be precise. Uthappa picked it early, with a roundhouse and helped it over short fine leg. Easy-peasy

Barinder to Uthappa, SIX, bosh! Shot. Never bowl short to Uthappa, Sran finds out why. Short ball aimed at the torso, Uthappa was ready for it. Picked the bones out of it and muscled it way back into the deep square leg stands

Barinder to Chris Lynn, FOUR, brute force from Lynn. Such quicksilver hands. Was a decent delivery as Sran saw Lynn back away to leg and fired it wider of off. But the Australian threw the kitchen sink and managed to stroke it over extra cover

Barinder to Chris Lynn, SIX, woah! Has he launched this one into the moon or what? What a shot. 97-metre hit. Length ball in the slot for Lynn, Lynn set himself and whacked it with ferocity, behind square on the leg-side and into the crowd
Barinder to Chris Lynn, SIX, 23 runs to cap off the over. Back of the hand slower ball goes awry for Sran. Lynn bent low to free his arms and launched this over deep square leg once again

Ashwin to Uthappa, out Caught by Nair!! Straight down the gullet of Nair. The time-out has broken Uthappa's concentration. Was looking so good and has thrown it away. Flat and shorter from Ashwin, Uthappa rocked back and hammered it off the sweet spot. Hit it flat and didn't have enough wings to clear the ropes. Nair didn't have to move an inch at deep mid-wicket as he cupped it. Eden Gardens has been muted. The half-trackers working well for the spinners throughout this tournament so far. Uthappa c Nair b Ashwin 34(23) [4s-5 6s-1]

Mujeeb to Nitish Rana, out Nitish Rana Run Out!! Oh, what happened there? KKR have gifted a wicket away to the visitors. Hare-brained running from the duo. Complete break in communication results in a run-out. Flatter outside off, Rana went back and laced the cut to backward point. Rana set off without even looking at his partner. Lynn wasn't interested and sends him back. Both were ball-watching and Rana had no chance of returning there. Rajpoot gathers it and fires a neat throw to the keeper, who does the rest. Rana, the man in form for KKR has to depart. Punjab clawing back here. Nitish Rana run out (Rajpoot/Rahul) 3(5)

Shivam Mavi to Rahul, FOUR, oh almost chopped on and what a good first ball that was Shivam Mavi the young Shivam Mavi. Pacy, good length, seam pretty straight and just tailing back in and it seriously tests Rahul. He wanted to go for the drive, the feet weren't fully forward, lucky that the edge escaped past the off stick. Troubled by the movement in to him on that occasion

Shivam Mavi to Rahul, FOUR, now that's brilliant placement from Rahul. Third man up, so Rahul uses the width on offer on this good length delivery, allows the ball to come and guides it to the left of backward point and it came from the middle of the bat as well

A Russell to Rahul, FOUR, this is the thing about classy batsmen. They have this silken touch. Rahul hardly had a real go at this length delivery, just came forward and went through with an extended forward push, but found the middle of the bat or close to it and got it wide of the man at cover

A Russell to Rahul, FOUR, this is unfair on the bowler. He's actually surprised Rahul with extra bounce on this short of length delivery, but Rahul managed to play with an angled bat at the last moment, third man was inside the ring again and there was no protection in the deep

A Russell to Gayle, FOUR, Dre Russ vs Gayle and Gayle hits a four first ball. Russell missed the yorker there, bowled a juicy full ball and Gayle just placed the square-drive to the left of point, didn't try to hit that hard and this outfield is quick enough

Tom Curran to Gayle, SIX, that's in the airrr, mistimed, the fielder jumps and it just escapes him. So that's the game for KXIP. They top the points table. Fittingly Gayle hits the winning shot. Length ball, Gayle went for the loft straight, long-on ran to his right and jumped but couldn't get a hand on it

Shivam Mavi to Gayle, FOUR, a boundary but this was hardly middled by Gayle. The bowler actually won a mini battle there, tried the outswinger, but that didn't swing much, the angle away troubled Gayle, who wanted to smash this over long-off, the ball hits the outside half of the bat and flies over cover-point

Shivam Mavi to Gayle, FOUR, that's sloppy from Narine, should have been stopped. Again Gayle fails to time the ball, this was a good length delivery that rushed, the ball took the inside edge of the bat and escaped wide of mid-wicket

Shivam Mavi to Rahul, SIX, that's inexperience for you from the bowler. He was troubling Rahul with the inswingers, this is the final ball of his second over, he may not be given the third, so now he tries something different from what was working and gets smashed. Short and rising, Rahul nonchalantly pulls over square leg. How good a shot was that?
A Russell to Gayle, SIX, nope! Please don't bowl there Russ! You know it's all too easy if you bowl full against a power-hitter. Gayle easily gets under this ball and launches it wide of long-on

A Russell to Gayle, FOUR, look at the frustration on Russell's face. He thought of outsmarting Gayle by taking pace off the ball, but Gayle cleverly delayed the shot. He moved leg-side early, but held the pose for a bit and then cut it between point and cover-point. Expertly done

A Russell to Gayle, SIX, the upper cut and it's gone all the way. This guy averages around 50 in T20s at this venue I guess! Oh Dre Russ is down on the floor after delivering that ball. Looks like he's done a hammie here. Anyway, this was a short ball that came at pace and Gayle's leg-side movement gave him the space to free the arms and slice the ball over third man. The connection was spot on

Narine to Gayle, FOUR, that's the over spoiled, tried the offie again but sprayed it down the leg-side, fine leg was inside the ring and Gayle happily helps it on its way over short fine leg. Gee he's looking ominous

Chawla to Rahul, FOUR, hey Sunil! Gotta move buddy! Rahul went back and pulled this short ball fine, Narine was at short fine leg, he hardly moved, should have tried at least, instead he put his arm out to the man in the deep, who clearly had no chance

Chawla to Rahul, FOUR, this guy is striking them at 264 and bits but doesn't play rash shots. That's the feature of his batting. Spots the field, fine leg is inside, so he allows the ball to come, the line was down the leg-side and he just helped it away fine past the keeper

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, absolutely no mercy from Rahul. Well, a rank long hop doesn't deserve respect anyway. Rahul quickly rocks back and pulls powerfully, splits long-on and deep mid-wicket quite easily

Kuldeep Yadav to Gayle, SIX, got to feel for the bowlers who are forced to bowl a defensive line with these big bats and small boundaries. Can cricket be kind on them please? Kuldeep Yadav did the right thing by spinning the ball away from Gayle and bowling wide outside off stump, but he bowled too full and the big man got under it to smash it over long-on

Chawla to Gayle, SIX, that ball stayed up for an eternity. The fielder at long-on thought he was in with a chance, but it is Chris Gayle who is batting and even a miscue from him will clear the rope. Went after the wrong 'un and cue-ended the loft, just about managed to clear the field

Chawla to Gayle, SIX, full toss and smashed. A hat-trick of fifties for Gayle and this is a bloke who went unsold originally and was picked last minute at base price. He hits this straight and does the "baby celebration" of his. Gets a great round of applause from the crowd

Narine to Rahul, SIX, crunched! A 24-ball fifty for KL Rahul. How well has he played thus far in the tournament! Shortish delivery from Narine, Rahul pulls off the back foot, hit flat and hit over the mid-wicket boundary

Narine to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul wants to finish this off early. Bravely races down the pitch and forces Narine to shorten the length, it was well outside off stump, but Rahul reached out and cut it away past cover
Narine to Rahul, FOUR, cut away fiercely past point and a big roar from the crowd! Who are they supporting? Quicker delivery outside off stump, Rahul goes back and cuts really hard

Narine to Rahul, out Caught by Tom Curran!! He's mistimed this high in the air and deep mid-wicket takes it. Short ball, Rahul went for the pull, came off the bottom of the bat as the ball came slowly onto him. Walks off to a great applause, raises the bat to the crowd. He really wanted to end this game in a hurry. What a top knock though. It was so good to watch him score quick runs with proper cricketing shots. Rahul c Tom Curran b Narine 60(27) [4s-9 6s-2]

Woakes to Pant, FOUR, that four evens out the over. Once more Woakes goes for the fuller length and with mid-off inside the ring he was taking a risk, Pant hammers the drive straight of mid-off and collects the boundary
Siraj to Pant, 1 run, short of length around off, Pant back cuts it to third man. The 50-run stand comes up and the rebuilding work is done, now they need to kick-on and to get a par total

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, top shot! Full delivery at 146kph, but Iyer had made some room to open up the off-side field, lofts it without much footwork over extra cover and pocketed a much needed boundary

Siraj to Pant, SIX, good over for DD, 12 runs off it. They need plenty more of it. Slower delivery and Pant picked the bones out of that one, delayed his loft and smashed it straight back over, pinged the ad boardings on the full

Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, massive! For a second it seemed to be traveling out of Chinnaswamy. Sundar changes his line of attack - comes round the wicket and slants it right in the slot, Iyer clears his front leg and heaves it deep into the mid-wicket stand

Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, fifty for Iyer. Gets there in style. First for him in this IPL. Needs to keep going though. Fetched it from well outside off, might have been a wide had he let go, but he doesn't and swipes it across the line flat over cow corner

Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Siraj!! Soft soft dismissal. And the sea of red is alive again. The momentum is broken and Iyer has himself to blame. That would have been a wide had he let go, instead reaches out for the full delivery and slices it to short third man. There was no need for him to play that. Could have picked up a wide and then made use of the extra delivery. Instead he loses his wicket. RCB needed that wicket as the partnership had started to flourish and was looking dangerous. Shreyas Iyer c Siraj b Washington Sundar 52(31) [4s-4 6s-3]

Siraj to Pant, no run, Siraj appeals for LBW. But that ball had clearly pitched outside leg. Pant winds up for a big mow by clearing his front leg, was beaten for pace as he missed the heave to the leg-side, pinged on the back thigh where there is no protection. He is down on the ground grimacing in pain. Meanwhile, RCB take the review and waste it. Not sure who prompted them to challenge the decision as it had pitched miles outside leg. Nonetheless, the good thing for DD is Pant is back on his feet and is ready to resume..

Chahal to Maxwell, out Caught by Siraj!! Chahal has his bunny. He has made it a habit of removing the Aussie. Had the better of him during the ODI and T20 leg in 2017. Now also was held back by Kohli specifically for this. Flighted leg-break on off and middle, Maxwell tries the fancy reverse sweep and is undone by the extra bounce, the top-edge balloons towards short third man, Siraj runs to his right, dives full length and manages to cling on. Maxwell c Siraj b Chahal 4(6)

Chahal to Pant, SIX, fabulous shot! It was the wrong 'un and Pant seemed to have picked it from the hand, didn't try to go across the line, went straight and the boy packs a punch, cleared long-off with ease

Chahal to Pant, SIX, back to back sixes and this was superb. The reverse sweep that goes all the way. Chahal pushed it through after being hit over his head, Pant spotted that and used his pace to broom him away over the third man fence

Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, edged and four. Third man is square and Tewatia got it fine enough to beat him. Just a good length delivery angled across the left-hander, Tewatia went hard on the drive and the outside edge went away quickly to the fence

Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, just over. A mistimed shot that clears the backtracking mid-off fielder. Slanted across off, Tewatia made a bit of room and sliced the drive over Siraj, who put in a desperate dive and still couldn't get there

Woakes to Pant, FOUR, fifty for Pant. Mighty fine innings from the youngster. But with three overs to go he needs to keep going. Short of length delivery and Pant was early into his swivel-pull, off the toe-end and past the man at 45

Siraj to Pant, SIX, flat six! That was just a flick of the wrists and Woakes had no chance. Siraj missed the yorker and the low full toss was right in the arc for Pant, who crouched a bit and whipped it over deep square leg

Siraj to Pant, SIX, wow! What power. It was the slower delivery and Pant had to manufacture all the power, he waited and waited before standing tall and smoking it over long-off, cleared the rope comfortably as well

Woakes to Pant, SIX, raining sixes at the moment. Good length ball outside off, Pant had the space to work with and he accepted the width gleefully, smashed the inside out loft over extra cover for a maximum

Woakes to Pant, leg byes, FOUR, does not matter how they come as long as the runs keep coming for DD. The back of a length delivery on middle and leg, Pant swivels to play the pull, misses and the ball lobs off thigh pad over de Kock

Woakes to Pant, FOUR, geez! AB would be proud of that shot. The reverse scoop. Yes, he has played a reverse scoop off a fast bowler. Woakes went full and wide outside off, Pant kept his balance and spooned it over short third man. Even Kohli seemed impressed with that shot

Woakes to Pant, FOUR, another costly death over for RCB, 18 off it. The off-pace short of length delivery, Pant spotted it early, shuffled across to get inside the line and pulled it over short fine, once it cleared the fielder there was no stopping that

Corey Anderson to Pant, SIX, smoked! Pant is smashing them to all parts. Small shimmy to convert it into a length delivery, once he did that the rest was easy, went through with the shot and pummeled it over long-on for half a dozen

Corey Anderson to Pant, out Caught by de Villiers!! AB clings on to the skier and a fine knock comes to an end. He has put his team in the ascendancy here. The cross seamer from Anderson, seemed to have held up on the surface, Pant went for the loft back over the bowler, skewed it off the base of the bat to long-on. AB ain't dropping those. Tewatia also pats his partner on the back as he walks off. Pant c de Villiers b Corey Anderson 85(48) [4s-6 6s-7]

Corey Anderson to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, premeditation from Tewatia. Walked across his stumps even before Anderson bowled the ball, it was outside off and he still managed to lap it over short fine. Umesh gives chase and can only escort it to the fence

U Yadav to Gambhir, out Caught by Chahal!! This was bound to happen. Gambhir was struggling to get going and finally throws it away. Probably the pressure of the dot balls created by the pacers. This was short in length and hurried on to the batsman, and although Gambhir picked the length early he couldn't middle the pull. Gets it off the splice towards short mid-wicket where Chahal completes an easy catch. Gambhir c Chahal b U Yadav 3(10)
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, first one of the night! Short one on middle and leg, Iyer drags it away to deep square leg to score the first boundary of the match
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, back of a length well outside off, Iyer reaches for it and slams it through the gap at covers, that's his second boundary, and Delhi's second boundary too

Chahal to Roy, out Bowled!! Knocked him over. Gambhir departed early and it's Roy who departs now. That was a flat and quick delivery on leg, Roy goes back in his crease to drag it away but gets undone due to the lack of bounce. The ball skids on and takes down his leg-stump. Fine display of bowling by RCB this has been so far. Both DD openers are back in the pavilion now. Onus on the middle order batsmen to get them out of trouble. Roy b Chahal 5(16)

Chahal to Pant, FOUR, slammed away! Rishabh Pant announces his arrival at the crease in style. Picks the length early, camps back and punches it firmly through the gap at cover to get off the mark with a boundary

Washington Sundar to Pant, FOUR, reverse swept! Flighted one around off, Pant goes down on his knee and reverse sweeps it past the man at backward point to score a boundary, did well to connect his shot and past the fielder

U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, width on offer and that's been put away. Short and wide outside off, Iyer goes back in the crease and cuts it nicely through point. Sweeper cover sprints across in order to save it but fails in his quest

U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that six will spoil Umesh Yadav's figures. He had conceded only 13 runs off his 3 overs, ends with figures of 4-0-27-1. Was a full length ball on leg as Iyer nonchalantly flicked it over the mid-wicket fence, was timed to perfection by the youngster

Boult to de Kock, FOUR, that's sweet from de Kock. Exquisite timing. Good length ball curling away from off, de Kock caresses it on the up through the covers. Just had to find the gap there, races away on this outfield
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, 137kph on the pads. And it doesn't even pitch. Oh my. de Villiers's swipes, heaving it into square leg, flat

Harshal Patel to Kohli, out Caught by Boult!! Just the worst of full tosses. No forget that. It's never going to be remembered. Boult has clinched that 10 lakh cheque for the end of the season. It's a catch for the ages. A viral catch. So Kohli quite obviously whips the innocuous, without bothering to keep it down. Over square leg. Boult comes out of nowhere, sticks his right hand up. And it sticks. With him eventually falling in a millimeter in front of the FBB prismic sponsor on the rope. Nobody can seem to believe. Yeah, muggles, it's true. Kohli c Boult b Harshal Patel 30(26) [4s-2 6s-1]
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, SIX, continues his fun tirade. Keeps getting nothings on the pads, sitting up to be smacked. Obliged. Fiercely swatting into deep mid-wicket

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, gets well across, wanting to go over mid-wicket. And typically changes his mind, like only he can. Ruins a wide yorker, slicing it through extra cover all of a sudden. Just sublime. And yes, a fifty .. he's killing the contest
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, SIX, there's his arc. You genius. Reads the fuller sucker that's to follow, sits, shuffles and it's behind square. In less than a second. Oh the nerve!

Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, SIX, spectator down - into her jaw. Now who's missing Gayle when AB can break jaws as well. Back on a knee, under the swinging tonk, and into the second tier at cow corner

Chris Morris to de Villiers, SIX, the second tier tonks have become boring. So AB goes into the third. Once that front leg goes out of the way, it's always into the orbit. And then the ball's on the meaty length too. Whacked, straight down
Chris Morris to de Villiers, FOUR, the carnage. Morris loses it down leg, the last hit has mentally scarred him. And is mowed away, fine
Boult to Corey Anderson, SIX, nobody's getting it right. Boult returns with a full toss, nice and high, and Anderson's reversing roles. Smokes it into cow corner

Boult to Corey Anderson, out Bowled!! Another twist. That ideal ball in the times of misery. Full, straight, bang in the blockhole. Anderson backs away, gives himself some room to go downtown. Misses. Big time. And the ball sneaks under to make a mess of the timber. And they take the time-out. The only strategy RCb need now is to find ways of giving AB his strike. And his century. Corey Anderson b Boult 15(13) [6s-1]

Chris Morris to Mandeep, SIX, these massive bats. So Mandeep's done in with the lack of pace, he swings across the line, gets the back of the bat. And it finds a way to fly high and into the fence behind the keeper

Chris Morris to Mandeep, FOUR, blame Mandeep for stealing AB's century. A fullish length and he throws every ounce of his muscle to cart it straight down. Roy chases, dives, and has probably cut himself on the rope. Yeah, none of it could stop the boundary though
Boult to de Villiers, FOUR, beautifully played, fraction short and just outside off, AB arches back and then ramps over third man, couple of bounces and over the ropes
Boult to de Villiers, FOUR, it's it. Lays into a half volley, screeching it through the covers, beating the leather off it. And RCB begin their move up

Maxwell to Vohra, out Caught by Roy!! Roy almost makes a mess of this at long leg, but he's recovered fantastically to take a superb low catch diving forward. They've referred it upstairs, but there's nothing wrong with it. Clean catch. His fingers are underneath it. The Englishman initially misjudged this top-edged sweep from Vohra, stalled in his position when he should have been moving forward. But makes up with a dive. Vohra c Roy b Maxwell 2(5)

Maxwell to de Kock, SIX, swept all the way over short fine. Shuffled across slightly to get inside the line of this off-break, Maxwell drifted it in on leg to aid the batsman further, and gets swatted into the stands with a powerful sweep shot

Nadeem to Kohli, FOUR, massive moment in the game. Tentative defence from Kohli, the ball turns away from him to take the edge which goes between keeper and slip. Was Morris standing too wide? He barely had time to move before it went through. Nadeem doesn't know what to do

Nadeem to Kohli, out de Kock Run Out!! De Kock is gone by a mile. Dreadful running. There's a tremendous mix-up between the two batsmen and de Kock ends up around halfway down the pitch before the bails are taken off. The ball was patted towards backward point, Kohli started running, stuttered to look at his partner, and then ran through. But de Kock never really took off. de Kock run out (Vijay Shankar/Pant) 18(16) [4s-1 6s-1]
Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, there he goes. De Villiers is underway. Walks across the stumps, gets down low and wallops the sweep through square leg

Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, now clears his front leg and lofts it inside-out over the covers. The off-side field is up and Nadeem has bowled to his field by drifting it in on middle, but AB is just too good

Chris Morris to Kohli, SIX, just over the fielder. Length ball around off, Kohli whips it away and he had the whole of Chinnaswamy concerned for a bit. But they shouldn't have been. Not with those wrists
Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, swept away for four. De Villiers has started off brilliantly. Nadeem lands it on a length for him and is dispatched

Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, my word, how's this gone for four! Crazy. Unbelievable power with the bottom hand. He seemed to be cramped on the back foot but is somehow able to whip it between long-on and deep mid-wicket

Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, hat-trick of fours! Nadeem is clueless against AB at the moment. He tosses this up wide - the best thing he can think off - but AB still walks across and powers the sweep through square leg. Crowd going wild
Chris Morris to Kohli, FOUR, now Kohli joins in the fun. Not great from Morris actually. Can't feed him on the pads with a length ball, gets flicked away in a flash to the boundary

Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, SIX, smashes the roof of Chinnaswamy! Rank long-hop from Tewatia, just the ball which got rid of Kohli and de Villiers in their previous home game. But de Villiers is having none of that today. Rocks back and hoists it away over mid-wicket

Stanlake to du Plessis, 1 run, was it a chance? Hooda was the fielder, think the ball bounced just in front of him, nice start from Stanlake, full and well outside off, du Plessis went hard on the drive, gets a thick edge to the right of first slip, Hooda dived to his right and got a hand onto it, saved three runs for his team

Bhuvneshwar to Raina, FOUR, beautifully played, will this help Raina break the shackles? Comes down the track, makes room as he did so and goes inside out over cover, one bounce and over the ropes. 13 came from the over

Deepak Hooda to Rayudu, FOUR, CSK gaining some momentum and it is the local boy - Rayudu who is leading the charge, flighted delivery around off, Rayudu reverse sweeps it backward of point and starts the over with a boundary

Rashid Khan to Raina, SIX, lovely shot! Superb use of the feet from the southpaw, sashays down and gets close to the pitch of the delivery, then uses his bottom hand to whip it over the cow corner fence

Rashid Khan to Raina, SIX, just the over Raina needed to get some impetus to his innings. This is a good old fashion slog sweep, Rashid errs by giving it some air and Raina kneels to get underneath it, struck powerfully enough to clear the fielder in the deep
Shakib to Raina, 1 run, pushed it through and more importantly cramped Raina for room, knocked to long-on

Shakib to Rayudu, no run, Saha completed the catch and went up immediately. Shakib joined him as well. Williamson trusting his players challenged the decision, but it remains with the onfield call. Rayudu steps out and is tucked by the drifter, misses the nudge into the on-side and the ball lobs off the pad to the left of Saha. He moves across to catch that

Shakib to Rayudu, FOUR, smashed! Flighted delivery and the idea from Shakib was to land it full enough to the blockhole, Rayudu had made room and that allowed him to open up his arms and strike it inside out over extra cover, no chance for the sweeper to stop that

Stanlake to Rayudu, FOUR, cracking shot! Once again the shuffle across aiding him. It is Stanlake's favourite length but he offers width on this occasion, Rayudu capitalizes and unleashes a powerful cut shot behind point, raced away to the fence

Stanlake to Rayudu, FOUR, edged and four. That is what pace does. Short and outside off, Rayudu made room this time and threw this kitchen sink at it, the thickish outside edge runs away fine beating the fielder in the deep

Stanlake to Rayudu, SIX, he is playing a gem here. The slower delivery from Stanlake and he picked the bones out of that, set himself on leg-stump and swung through the line, the fielder at long-on was a mere spectator

Stanlake to Rayudu, FOUR, massive over for CSK, 19 runs off it. It is another edge and another boundary for Rayudu. He runs down the wicket and looks to force the back of a length delivery through the off-side, the outside edge runs away quickly to the third man fence

Shakib to Rayudu, 1 run, fifty for Rayudu. On a surface where all the other batsmen have struggled, he has stroked a flawless half century. The whole team in the dugout stand up to applaud. Tossed up on off, Rayudu wrists it to long-on and reaches the milestone

Shakib to Rayudu, SIX, hammered! He is toying with the bowling. Shakib is clearly rattled, bowls a juicy full toss as Rayudu dances down the wicket, easy pickings for the batsman as he slots it into the crowd at long-on

Shakib to Rayudu, FOUR, now he is playing with the field. Walked across his stumps to the flighted delivery, sat down and broomed it backward of square leg, struck it fine enough to beat the man in the deep

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, wrong 'un is dragged down and Rayudu was waiting for it in the crease, cleared his front leg and pulled it in front of square, bisecting the two fielders in the deep comfortably

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, SIX, Rashid is being taken to the cleaners. Tosses the googly up and Rayudu picked it out of his hand, he went down on his knee and slog swept it with the spin over cow corner. Got plenty of height and the required distance

Rashid Khan to Raina, FOUR, Raina does not want to be left out. He hangs back to this wrong 'un and since the ball is turning it away, it offers him the room to slap it past the diving extra cover fielder. Long-off can only pick the ball up from the fence

S Kaul to Rayudu, FOUR, wow! We saw Rishabh Pant play the reverse paddle yesterday, today it is Rayudu. This is more deft than Pant's powerful strike. Knuckle ball and Rayudu just bent down, reverse lapped it fine to the third man fence

S Kaul to Rayudu, out Rayudu Run Out!! 1 run completed. What just happened there? "One of the very best from Rayudu," says Sanjay Manjrekar on air and I couldn't agree more. He lifts the back of a length delivery on the bounce to long-off, settles with a single as Pandey lobs the ball back to Kaul, who fumbles and Rayudu thought there was a chance to steal a second. Raina stands his ground and by the time Rayudu turns back, Kaul gets to the ball and throws it to KW to remove the bails. There was never a second and Rayudu knew that, he walks up to Raina with a smile on his face, hugs him and trudges off to a standing ovation. Rayudu run out (S Kaul/Williamson) 79(37) [4s-9 6s-4]

Rashid Khan to Dhoni, FOUR, almost cleaned up Raina at the other end. The leg-break is right in the slot for him, small step forward and murders the ball straight back, Raina was ducking for cover and the fielder at long-on didn't even try to chase that

Rashid Khan to Raina, FOUR, poor bowling from Rashid. Very rarely does that happen. But he has had two off days back to back. Went for 55 against KXIP and today ends with 1/49. Short and down leg, all Raina had to do was help it past the fielder at short fine, he does so with utter ease

S Kaul to Dhoni, FOUR, top-edge and four. Not where he intended but Dhoni starts the over with a boundary. He was rushed by a short delivery and the pull is late, the edge goes away fine and he asks the umpire whether it is one for the over, the square leg umpire nods in approval

S Kaul to Raina, FOUR, fifty for Raina. A very unlike Raina innings. He bided his time before he got going. Now is well set to take CSK past the 180-mark. The knuckle ball with width on offer, Raina just laces the cut square on the off-side. The sweeper is straighter than usual and he doesn't get there in time

S Kaul to Dhoni, FOUR, Kaul has his hands on his hip. Not much he can do there. Just the class of Dhoni. A low full toss outside off, Dhoni opens the bat face and carves it past the diving short third man fielder
