Stanlake to Dhoni, SIX, easy peasy! Just a short-arm jab and the ball clears the rope. Stanlake rolls his fingers across the ball and bowls it on a length, Dhoni smokes it over deep mid-wicket nonchalantly

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, SIX, cracking shot, rare bad ball from Bhuvneshwar, back of a length and on the stumps, Watson swivels across and pulls it high and over square leg, went a long way over the ropes for a maximum

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Bhuvneshwar has his man now! That's a big wicket for the Sunrisers, this was the knuckle ball and Watson didn't pick it, he was done in by the change of pace as well, went through with the flick far too early, the ball lobbed off the splice of the bat and it's a simple low catch for Hooda - at short mid-wicket. The crowd finds its voice, no heroics from Watson today. Watson c Deepak Hooda b Bhuvneshwar 9(15) [6s-1]

Stanlake to Raina, FOUR, risky but four, Raina backed away a long way, Stanlake followed him with a full ball, but Raina has enough room to free his arms and drives it square behind point, beats third man getting across for his first boundary

S Kaul to du Plessis, FOUR, on a length and well outside off, du Plessis comes down the track, doesn't get anywhere close to the pitch - but has enough to clear cover with the lofted drive, the timing wasn't great, but the ball has enough to beat the chasing pack

Rashid Khan to du Plessis, out Stumped!! .. and Rashid strikes with his first ball. A different day and some different results already. du Plessis was struggling to get a move, doesn't spot the leg-break, lunged forward on the sweep and missed, to make things worse - he slipped as he tried to get back into the crease. Saha whipped the bails off with du Plessis well outside the crease, Anil Chaudhary doesn't need the help of the third umpire, off he goes, a poor start for du Plessis in IPL 2018. du Plessis st Saha b Rashid Khan 11(13) [4s-1]

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, that's brave from Rayudu, but he knew what he was doing, fetches this well tossed up delivery from well and slogs it over mid-wicket, there's no one in the deep and Rayudu gets going with a boundary

S Kaul to Rayudu, 1 run, a direct hit and Rayudu might have been in trouble, he drove one to the right of point and had a stuttered start. Raina was always coming and that forces Rayudu to accelerate. Bhuvi was quick on the ball and has a shy at the bowler's end. He misses with Rayudu well short of making his ground. Rayudu seemed upset with his partner at the calling, turned around towards Raina after completing the single
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, SIX, massive, length delivery outside off, Rayudu bends down on one-knee, picks up the length and swipes it high and way over wide long-on for a humongous hit

Chahar to Bhui, out Caught by Watson!! Edged and taken! Watson put one down in the previous contest but makes sure to take one today. It's a full length delivery outside off, Bhui pokes at it and gets a thick outside edge to Watson at first slip. The youngster walks back to the hut without troubling the scorers. Excellent start for CSK and Chahar. Bhui c Watson b Chahar 0(5)

SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, first boundary of the innings! Williamson makes the most of the provided width. It's a short of a length delivery outside off, Williamson reaches for it and slams it through the gap at cover-point to gather his first boundary of the innings

Karn Sharma to Shakib, out Caught by Raina!! Gets him with the googly. 100th T20 wicket for Karn Sharma. It was flighted up on leg-stump, once Shakib saw that line he knelt down to sweep. But there was a bit of extra bounce with this delivery which produced the top-edge. Raina accepts the dolly at short fine leg. Shakib c Raina b Karn Sharma 24(19) [4s-2 6s-1]
Karn Sharma to Williamson, 1 run, shimmying down to the pitch of this flighted leg-break, pushes it down to long-off. It's fifty for the SRH captain, but has he given up on this chase?

Jadeja to Williamson, SIX, doesn't look comfortable doing this, but he's somehow muscled it over wide long-off. Length ball just outside off, Williamson had set himself up by clearing his front leg. Opens his body up and carves it inside out

Karn Sharma to Williamson, SIX, this time Williamson goes leg-side, and collects six. He planted his back foot outside off, got a delivery which landed right in the slot, and shovelled it over wide long-on
Karn Sharma to Williamson, SIX, woah, that's massive. Williamson! He sat on his back knee and whacked this slog-sweep way back into the square leg stands. Do we have a match on here?

Karn Sharma to Williamson, SIX, lays into it again, and it's six more. This is some lovely batting from the SRH captain. He didn't overhit the ball this time, just an extension of the off-drive, and it sails over long-off
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, SIX, deep into the crease to be able to get under the ball, and get under the ball he does. Pathan has launched this over long-off. Boy have SRH come roaring back
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, SIX, bludgeoned! He gets absolutely stuck into this slower ball and mows it over cow corner. Wow. Bravo goes for 14 in his first over
SN Thakur to Y Pathan, SIX, free-hit or not, Pathan doesn't care. He smokes this full toss over long-on. He is starting to middle these now, nice and clean

Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, FOUR, very wide on the crease goes Bravo, but he loses his line. He strays this short of length delivery right into Pathan's chest. There's no fine leg in place, or if there is, it's not fine. Pathan helps this pull into the ropes

Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, out Caught by Jadeja!! Taken. Taken, taken, taken. It's a brilliant catch from Jadeja, sprinting forward from long-on and diving in front with two hands. Oh Williamson. He's done in by this slower ball. Back of length from Bravo, the ball stops on Williamson who miscues his flat-batted swipe off the splice. Bravo shows off with his dance moves. CSK will back themselves from here. Williamson c Jadeja b Dwayne Bravo 84(51) [4s-5 6s-5]
SN Thakur to Y Pathan, SIX, oh what a horrible delivery. Delicious full toss on off stump, Pathan gobbles it up as he whiplashes it over the mid-wicket boundary. Keeps SRH afloat

SN Thakur to Y Pathan, out Caught by Raina!! Sliced up in the air, and that should be it. Raina isn't dropping that at extra cover. It's the knuckle ball in action again, Pathan swings hard at this length delivery but it comes right off the outside half. He immediately hangs his head. SRH running out of gas. Y Pathan c Raina b SN Thakur 45(27) [4s-1 6s-4]

SN Thakur to Rashid Khan, SIX, whacked down the ground for six. First ball Rashid faces, he leans back and pummels the slower ball. Brings the equation down to 19 needed off the final over. The way this game has gone, don't rule it out

Dwayne Bravo to Rashid Khan, SIX, this is a length ball and it has disappeared. Drama. Two sixes in two balls from Rashid. He's striking it at 600. Swivels across and heaves it away over deep backward square
Dwayne Bravo to Rashid Khan, FOUR, they're still in this. Quite unbelievable. Full length ball outside off, Rashid swings for the rafters and sends a thick edge flying past short third man

SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, classic shot by Kane. Another short delivery well outside off, looking the class of Williamson he won't miss out. Plays a perfect square cut and pierces the gap at cover-point to end the over

Chahar to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! That's the second duck of this innings. First it was Bhui and now it's Manish. Was a full length delivery outside off and swinging away from the batsman, Manish went ahead with his shot and ended up slicing it to the man at third man. Surprising to see that it carried all the way to third man. Probably there was a bit of extra bounce on that. Manish Pandey c Karn Sharma b Chahar 0(2)

SN Thakur to Williamson, 1 run, that's a brilliant display of fielding by Karn Sharma in the deep. Times his jump to perfection, plucks his right arm out and grabs it before he parries it into play near the third man fence. Was short and wide outside off as Williamson upper cut it towards third man and Sharma saves five runs for his team with this valiant effort
SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, pulled away! Short of a length around off, Williamson camps back and pulls it nicely through the gap at mid-wicket, was timed sweetly by the skipper

SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, boundary to end the over. Just the over Sunrisers were looking for. Thakur drops it short again and has to pay the price for it as Williamson rocks back in order to pull it over mid-wicket, yet again...

Chahar to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by Jadeja!! Third wicket for Chahar. He's steaming in here. Bowls a full length delivery around off with not much pace in it, Hooda is a tad early in his flick as the ball hits the back of the willow before it spoons up towards wide mid-off. Jadeja won't miss those. SRH in trouble. They're feeling the absence of Dhawan already. Deepak Hooda c Jadeja b Chahar 1(7)

Chahar to Williamson, SIX, is he a playing a skipper's knock? Reminds me of the knock that Kohli played against Mumbai Indians a few days back. This is a short delivery on middle and leg, Williamson is onto it in a flash as he middles his pull to perfection. Right over the square leg fence for a flat six

Watson to Shakib, FOUR, off the mark with a boundary. That's not enough though. Needs a few more of them and get going. Picks the length early on this short one and pulls it in front of deep square leg who's too square in order to cut it off
Watson to Shakib, SIX, pulled away! Was a short delivery on leg and Shakib had plenty of time to heave it over the fine leg fence. The crowd is slowly getting its voice back

Chahar to Shakib, FOUR, he's bowled 17 dot balls so it's okay if he concedes a boundary or two. Has been an excellent spell by Chahar this. Short of a length around off, Shakib jumps in his crease and cuts it away to the third man fence, beat the man in the deep quite comfortably
Jadeja to Williamson, FOUR, fine square cut by Williamson again. Was short and wide outside off and the Sunrisers skipper did well to time his cut as he beat sweeper cover with ease

D Kulkarni to Lewis, out Bowled!! This is what swing up front will bring you. Such a blunder it was from RR to bench Dhawal against CSK on a wicket that had a bit of grass. Lovely inswinger outside off stump, Lewis is not a keen mover of the front foot, just throws his bat at it to thrash the ball through cover, only manages an inside edge that shatters the sticks. Dream start from Dhawal Kulkarni. Lewis b D Kulkarni 0(1)
Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, SIX, he's upping the strike-rate as well. Flighted delivery down the leg-side, Ishan gets to the pitch of the ball by advancing and slogs over wide long-on

Stokes to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he's been superb with the pick-up shots today. Anything on the pads, SKY has dispatched it disdainfully. Here's another instance. Full down leg, Suryakumar gets across and whips it cleanly behind square. In the gap and zooms away to the fence

Stokes to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, oh, what a clanger. Krishnappa Gowtham, what have you done? Spills a straightforward catch at long-on. This is going to hurt RR, for sure. A slower ball from Stokes, Suryakumar took it on and miscued it completely. Gets it off the top half of the bat towards long-on. Gowtham had to move across a bit, went with both hands but it pops out of his hands. Tried grabbing it on the second attempt, in vain
Stokes to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, smashed away wide of long-on, they scamper back for the second

Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Yadav shows off his cheekiness. Manufactured room out of nowhere. Pushed through quicker outside off, Suryakumar went deep and sliced it in the gap between short third man and backward point. Threaded the gap beautifully

Jofra Archer to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, wonderful from Kishan. "Such a dynamic player he is" is the comment from Isa Guha on air. Greets Archer to the crease by chipping down the track, takes it on the full and lofted it with a clean swing of the arms over mid-off

Jofra Archer to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, 143.3kph, low full toss on leg. Kishan with a full face of the bat wrists it to mid-wicket, where Stokes dives across and intercepts it. And that will be a half-century for Kishan. His second IPL fifty. So both batsmen who were dismissed for a first-ball duck in the previous match has made it count today. Raise of the bat from the youngster to soak in the applause from the dug-out

Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, more clumsy effort from RR in the field. Gopal, the guilty culprit this time, who lets it through. Kishan moved across on this occasion and helped this short of length delivery to short fine leg. Gopal was lazy to bend low and didn't get his body behind the line of the ball. Sneaked through his legs and off to the fence

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Buttler!! Oh my word, unnecessary cheekiness from Kishan doesn't come off well. Tried to emulate Rishabh Pant's reverse scoop and fails miserably. Nonetheless, brilliant innings from him comes to an end. Second wicket for Kulkarni. Went full and wide, turned out to be a low full toss. Kishan was ready to scoop it over short fine, but messes it up and spoons it up in the air. Easy-peasy for Buttler. Ishan Kishan c Buttler b D Kulkarni 58(42) [4s-4 6s-3]

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Buttler!! RR are pegging back MI here. Suryakumar Yadav has looked out of sorts since a last couple of overs and finally, he decides to throw his wicket away to Unadkat. Again the off-cutter, slanted around off. Suryakumar Yadav in a bid to step up the pedal, miscues it totally. Top-edges it into the night sky, was swirling in the air. Buttler called for it, moved across to his left and safely grabbed it. Suryakumar Yadav c Buttler b Unadkat 72(47) [4s-6 6s-3]

Unadkat to Rohit, out Rohit Run Out!! Now, now. Two wickets in a span of three balls and this is a prized scalp for Rajasthan. Rohit is livid with himself, punches his bat in anger. It was his call and he has to pay the price. You just cannot underestimate Rahane in the field. A meeky tap to the right of Rahane. He moved across in a flash, picked it up with one-hand and released the throw in one-motion to break the stumps. Only one stump to aim at and bingo! Rohit wasn't even in the frame. Goner! Rohit run out (Rahane) 0(1)

Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, excellent from the senior Pandya. How late he played that? Didn't have any room there at all to free his arms. So, he stayed back, opened his bat face and glided it in the gap between short third man and backward point
Unadkat to Pollard, SIX, pure muscle from Pollard. Finally, gets going. Cutter slanted wide of off, Pollard waited and waited before butchering it over long-on. Flat-batted powerfully!

Jofra Archer to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Klaasen!! Maiden IPL wicket for Archer. Archer will be chuffed to bits. Krunal loses shape as he winds up for a slog. Archer slips in a knuckle ball that holds up a touch on the pitch. Krunal went for the longer boundary - the deep mid-wicket area. Lacked timing and power, straight to Klaasen. Look at Archer, he breaks into a jig. Krunal Pandya c Klaasen b Jofra Archer 7(6) [4s-1]

Jofra Archer to Pollard, 1 run, oh, almost had two in two here. Archer drops a tough chance. Fuller ball at 145.1kph just outside off, Pollard smacked it straight back at him, Archer got both hands but it slipped out

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, ouch. Take cover Rod Tucker, Hardik knocked off his head nearly. Very full on off, the slower ball at 123.1 kph, Hardik gets under it and hammered it straight down the ground ferociously. Tucker take evasive action and is on the floor

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, out Bowled!! Jofra has his revenge. Sweet. Rip roaring yorker, angling on leg. Hardik is beaten for sheer pace (145.6kph). Couldn't get his bat down in time, the ball slams his pad and deflected back onto the stumps to clatter the middle stump. MI losing steam towards the end. Hardik Pandya b Jofra Archer 4(2) [4s-1]

Jofra Archer to McClenaghan, out Bowled!! Wow. Wow. 149.2 thunderbolt from Archer. Demolishes the stumps. What an over this is turning out to be. Two wickets in two balls and he's on a hat-trick now. Harpooned it full and at the stumps, McClenaghan had no clue and failed to negate it. Straight through him to shatter the stumps. McClenaghan b Jofra Archer 0(1)
Stokes to Pollard, FOUR, Stokes is not happy with the effort by Gowtham. Should've stopped definitely. Pollard whacked it wide of long-on, Gowtham gets across, puts in the dive but doesn't stop it

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, Suryakumar is a free-flowing player, tough to keep him calm and Kulkarni, in trying to search for swing, bowls a touch fuller and disappears. The outswinger doesn't swing, Suryakumar gets under it and lofts it easily over long-on, hit on the rise to an extent

Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 144.5kph, that's nicely picked away off the hips by Suryakumar Yadav. Another pacy short of length delivery, actually on the stumps, but Suryakumar got inside the line and helped it away past the man at 45

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, SIX, has he hit that alright? Oh yes he has! Been trying a few shots, but he's bravely raced down to a bowler who's kept him calm, the best part about it was he picked this slower ball, got into great position and absolutely smashed that over long-on. First six of the night for Ishan

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, unbelievable hit! Suryakumar Yadav is very, very good with that pick up shot of his. He's moved across a touch to this fullish delivery on the stumps and whipped away with his lovely wrists with great timing, all the way over the long-leg boundary

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, looked like it was going to either short third man or backward point for a moment, but Ishan Kishan has managed to split them with this uppish cut. Poor delivery from Kulkarni, gave too much width. Mumbai have picked up pace

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, massive space for sale beyond mid-wicket and Suryakumar Yadav, who is not afraid to walk across the stumps, meets this length ball with a flick to the right of mid-wicket and greets Unadkat with a boundary first up

Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, this time he connects with the sweep, he actually played this with one hand. This line is a little more straighter than the previos one, Suryakumar hits the big gap at deep backward square leg

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Archer dives but fails to stop the ball at deep mid-wicket. Short delivery on the stumps, Suryakumar pulls, deep mid-wicket runs to his left, actually got there but made a mess of it

Stokes to Ishan Kishan, SIX, oh shot! Hit on one leg. Stokes tried a similar ball to the previous one, Ishan connects with the pull this time despite being cramped for room and it hits the backward square leg rope on the full
Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, Ishan knows he's going to bowl short, it's down the leg side and he helps himself to a boundary with a pull shot behind square on the on-side

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, whata a way to bring up the fifty - off 29 balls. Flighted delivery outside off stump, Suryakumar leans forward and lofts the drive inside-out handsomely over cover. Gentle raise of the bat to the team and the crowd
McClenaghan to R Tripathi, FOUR, there's a short fine leg in place but this leg-stump delivery deserves nothing less than a boundary. Tripathi crouches and glances it wide of the fielder at 45

McClenaghan to Stokes, SIX, all the innocous-ity. 92kph, dug in half way into the pitch, turning into him down leg too. Stokes waits. And waits. And swivels, rejecting the wide to pull it into fine leg

McClenaghan to Stokes, FOUR, now the overcook. McClenaghan tries sneaking in a quiet one, wide, full. Can't. Stokes' up there smart, reaching out and drilling it through extra cover. Here's the move on .. 16 runs in it
Krunal Pandya to Samson, 2 runs, drifting into middle. Whipped down the ground, and long-on's sloppy
Mustafizur to Stokes, FOUR, sits up perfectly. Stokes up there tall, already given himself loads of room and carts it over the covers. Nothing streaky here

Hardik Pandya to Stokes, out Bowled!! It's in the blockhole. Stokes has been walking all across, but has been getting down in time to dig things out. Until this one. It's full, it's into the base of leg, and Stokes' walked across, freezing in front of the stumps as he tries using the angle to swipe it behind square. Done in for pace. Done in for dip. This is exactly where Rajasthan need to avoid doing a Mumbai. Stokes b Hardik Pandya 40(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Samson, FOUR, latches on. It's that sitting up length, and Samson goes flat-batted, riding the bounce and timing the leather off it through cow corner, splitting the two men converging. In the hope of converging
Krunal Pandya to Samson, 2 runs, grips on a length, turning away slowly. Samson merely defends, and its into the vast mid-off gaps to pinch a couple. And a ninth IPL fifty

Bumrah to Samson, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! It was all timing till it lasted. The moment it deserts him, he falls. It was Bumrah's famed slower gripper, Samson tries hoicking it into cow corner. Gropes only the toe-end, spoons high and Hardik runs in. Nah, he ain't messing these up. Samson c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 52(39) [4s-4]

Bumrah to Buttler, out Bowled!! Perfect peach. And Rajasthan are well and truly doing a death over Mumbai. Bumrah's the Jofra in the remake. Nothing slow here, full paced, 144kph, hitting the good length, seaming in sharply and staying low to go through the bat and pad on Buttler's meek prod forward. Buttler b Bumrah 6(8)

Mustafizur to Klaasen, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! The bridge is falling. The fortess is falling in dramatic fashion. Klaasen gets himself a golden duck on his home debut. Fizz comes up with his go-to ball - a cutter slanting across. Klaasen with flat feet looks to drive away from his body, gets the customary edge and Ishan's diving low to his right to collect. Yes his black eye doesn't stop him from judging these perfectly. Klaasen c Ishan Kishan b Mustafizur 0(1)
Mustafizur to Gowtham, SIX, rocks back, deep in the crease, getting that front leg out once again. And targets the smallest part of the ground - cow corner. And swings. Smoking

Mustafizur to Gowtham, FOUR, edge. And the Royals have a massive edge of life. 15 off this one and all of a sudden there's oxygen still there in this one. A low full toss, across Gowtham, who throws his bat out in an attempt to slice. He'll make his peace with the edge, running past the keeper

Bumrah to Jofra Archer, FOUR, very, very Caribbean. Okay former Caribbean. Archer transfer back, lets the ball get on par and waits on his drive, opening it to pierce the gap behind point. And that gap is huge
Bumrah to Gowtham, FOUR, utter disdain. Take that .. width, pace and it is back in that point zone. Thumped hard. How things turn

Bumrah to Gowtham, FOUR, goes pulling. And goes into the gap. Doesn't get enough meat, and thank heavens for that. It goes a lot finer, beating square leg in the ring. It's 10 off the final over. And you thought this was over, twice

Hardik Pandya to Jofra Archer, out Caught&Bowled!! Another twist. Agatha Christie would be so damn proud. Pandya lets out the bouncer, neatly directed into the head, and Archer's pulls in desperation, top-edging it high. Pandya takes matters into his own hands. Calls and holds his nerve. Jofra Archer c and b Hardik Pandya 8(9) [4s-1]
Hardik Pandya to Gowtham, FOUR, top thinking. He's spotted third man inside the ring, and ramps his bat out to shove it over. Wrong line, wrong length

Hardik Pandya to Gowtham, SIX, it's in the orbit. It's into the car park. And Gowtham turns hero - coming right at the climax, scoring at a strike rate of 300. Gets a juicy back of a length ball, in the slot and flat-bats it across the line. Into the clouds. And then cow corner

Krunal Pandya to R Tripathi, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Even Krunal Pandya cannot believe it. Gets that rainbow-from-this-palm-to-other pose dead right. A bit of loop after that first ball, and Tripathi middles this straight to mid-on. Straight to him. Would have wanted to go over the fielder but times it right into his hands. Well, this debut at the top doesn't go so well.. R Tripathi c Suryakumar Yadav b Krunal Pandya 9(8) [4s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Samson, FOUR, now what do I call that.. Will be an outside edge to the naive but this has been cleverly played late and just wide of the keeper. Bat face opens at the last minute and Krunal Pandya's grounded. Sort of. We'll see

Mustafizur to Samson, FOUR, full and wide, and the long-limbed Samson is not going to miss out. Reaches out, with footwork into a snooze, but who cares. It's all hands. Creams the drive through covers. Bullets it. Surgeons it. Whatever. It's Samson, okay? We're allowed to drool this season

Krunal Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, proper Rahane. Early to load onto the front foot and then drills it away through covers. Nothing Krunal Pandya could have done, except maybe pitching it a bit shorter. But then Rahane might have come up with something else

McClenaghan to Rahane, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! McClenaghan had pared down Rajasthan with pace, or the lack of it. Three slower deliveries in a row and that was it for Rahane. Takes it on with a flat-batted swat and all he manages is a toe-end to mid-wicket. Krunal's tall and leaps a little to take this screamer. It's a pun alright, because you should have seen Krunal screaming. Rahane c Krunal Pandya b McClenaghan 14(17) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Samson, FOUR, that's why you can't not like him. McClenaghan strategy is pretty obvious: Bowl it slow and angle it across, because there's third man and backward point waiting to cut the runs off. And Samson here has found the tiniest of gaps between the fielders. Beautifully done, opening the bat face just enough to cleave the fielders
Markande to Stokes, FOUR, this spins more, so this is the googly from back fo the hand. Stokes gets into a shape to sweep nicely and brooms it away through mid-wicket

Mustafizur to Stokes, no run, Mustafizur is excited but that looks high. Traps Stokes on the shuffle with this delivery. Oh they've gone for the review. It's hit the knee-roll bang in front of off-stump, so the impact is alright. But as we doubted, the bounce in this Jaipur deck is taking the ball over the stumps -- the ball-tracking confirms. So not out it'll be and Mumbai lose their review

Rajpoot to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, pumped over mid-off for first IPL runs. It wasn't as close as you want to hear it was. Chipped the loft over Ashwin, who's tall enough. Good use of the length ball and the slight width that Prithvi Shaw used to use his arms into effect

Rajpoot to Gambhir, no run, Ashwin reviews. Makes sure first with the keeper that it was straight enough and then goes for it. Last ball from Rajpoot was the one that shaped away and beat Gambhir, and this straightened and slithered on to rap Gambhir's front pad's flap. But tell you what, this is just a bit naff, this review. Pitches almost a foot outside leg-stump, and it's not out -- just as the on-field umpire thought
Barinder to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, throws his hands at this wide ball that's been angled across by Barinder from over the wicket. And gets away. Backspins and beats the keeper to his left

Barinder to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, wow, get the thesaurus out. That's been cracked away with utter disdain. Short and wide yeah, but look at the sound the bat makes. Pinches the slightest gap at point and lasers it away

Barinder to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's a bit ambitious.. and he's gotten some lucky runs here. Stays back and wants a stylish and uppish back foot punch through covers. Not in control of the bounce and the outside edge flies over the lone slipper in place

Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, off-spin was working alright against Shreyas Iyer in the previous over for Ashwin and he gets whacked trying to bowl leg-spin. Short and wide, Shreyas absolutely nails it off the back foot wide of cover

Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, out Christian Run Out!! 1 run completed. Ashwin was confident after whipping the bails off and he was spot on. Shortish from Ashwin, Shreyas flicks it wide of long-on, Mayank rushed to the ball and fired in a perfect through on the bounce and adjacent to the sticks. Ashwin shatters the stumps. The second run was on and Christian should have been a touch more quicker. TV umpire has a look and catches Christian a few inches short. Christian run out (Mayank Agarwal/Ashwin) 6(11)

Barinder to Shreyas Iyer, no run, the appeal was so loud and confident that the umpire was under a lot of pressure, fair on KXIP's part because they thought it was a genuine edge, but the fact that Shreyas Iyer immediately smiled and reviewed clearly suggested he didn't hit this. Maybe the ump should have originally given the benefit of doubt to the batsman, because the bat also hit the ground. Wide yorker, Shreyas Iyer tried to squeeze, missed it completely and there's no spike on UltraEdge. Review saves Shreyas Iyer
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, overpitched and Shreyas drills it straight down the ground between the sticks and the non-striker, long-on and long-off had no chance

Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, that's a brilliant hit under pressure. Barinder, why did you run in and bowl a full ball in the slot? He followed Rahul Tewatia who was backing away, but landed perfectly for Tewatia to tee off over long-off

Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, what a timely hit! He's moved across the stumps, got down on his knees and paddled the fast bowler around the corner through backward square leg. Brave hit! Barinder missed the yorker again and offered a full ball on the stumps

Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, out Caught by Rahul!! Got to be a slower into the pitch and it's done the trick. Maybe Andrew Tye won't mind about bowling the extra ball now with the wide call earlier. This was cleverly angled across the left-hander on a good length, Tewatia goes for a big slog and gets an edge that goes slowly to Rahul. Rahul Tewatia c Rahul b Andrew Tye 24(21) [4s-1 6s-1]

Barinder to Plunkett, out Caught by Nair!! And what does he do first ball? Advances and connects well, but finds the fielder at deep backward square leg. It was a short slower ball, Plunkett wanted to flick that in the gap wide of deep mid-wicket, but hit it too square and too well. Plunkett c Nair b Barinder 0(1)
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, smashed, short and outside off stump, Shreyas flat-bats the loft over long-off. Fifty up for Shreyas Iyer, good knock but he needs to connect them well from here on

Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, inside edgeeee and it's past the dive at short fine leg. Lucky boundary and it's down to 5 runs off the last ball. Shreyas races down the pitch and slogs, gets a thick edge

Rajpoot to Prithvi Shaw, out Bowled!! That's not a bad debut at all. Dropped a catch in the first innings but walked in to bat in all his elements. Was a bit overamibtious here, you could say, and Rajpoot has beaten him with a 134ks delivery. Shaw tried a hack across the line, missed the seam-up delivery and lost the top of his off-stump. Prithvi Shaw b Rajpoot 22(10) [4s-4]

Rajpoot to Maxwell, FOUR, timing isn't something Maxwell has made a name out of, but if these continue, we'll need a rethink. Archaism, I tell you. Gets a delivery on the pads and times the hell out of it through mid-wicket

Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Finch!! In the air, hasn't hit this well and Finch runs around to his left from long-off to take the catch. What a squeeze this is from KXIP. Shreyas Iyer is distraught and he looks towards the sky. The flatter delivery outside off stump, Shreyas slices the loft high in the air as the ball spun away from him. He wanted to go over long-off. Shreyas Iyer c Finch b Mujeeb 57(45) [4s-5 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Maxwell, SIX, that's flown away like it belongs to the stands. Full pace at 136ks and steaming into the pads, and Maxwell's just flunked it over backward square leg with a bat swing. Sounds easy, right?

Rajpoot to Maxwell, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! They're checking Rajpoot's front foot but he's fine. A bit of a sudden rush of blood from Maxwell, but he bats like that, doesn't he? Didn't read the cutter that was pitched on a back of a length, went for the mightly hack across the line and sliced it off the toe-end to deep mid-wicket. There were two other fielders running back from inside the ring but that was Tye's catch all the way. Maxwell c Andrew Tye b Rajpoot 12(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Gambhir, out Caught by Finch!! They all want to go home. Gambhir is a bit early into tucking this seam-up delivery on a back of a length, and pops a leading edge to mid-off. Sticky Kotla? Certainly for Delhi, now. Gambhir c Finch b Andrew Tye 4(13)
Rajpoot to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, short ball sitting up, and Shreyas Iyer pulls it with authority through deep mid-wicket

Rajpoot to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, beautifully sliced wide of backward point's leap and that's been let through by Mujeeb, who's running across from third man. Covers the ground, slides but can't stop the ball. Was almost in control but then wasn't

Mujeeb to Pant, out Bowled!! Through 'im! Carrom ball from round the wicket this, and it spins in to cleave Pant into two. He's trying to clip it through mid-wicket, doesn't have his head around this variation (or Mujeeb's stock ball?) and succumbs. Pant b Mujeeb 4(7)

Avesh Khan to Finch, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Huge wicket! Just like Rahul, Finch is also beaten for pace in his first ball against Avesh and the young lad has knocked the Aussie off. Superb stuff and he is pumped up. Back of a length outside off, clocked 148.7kph and it did seem really fast off the surface as well. Finch too didn't help his cause as he just tried to use his hands to lift this away down the ground. Wasn't there for that shot, not with this kind of pace and he was late as well. Popped an easy catch towards extra cover. Finch c Shreyas Iyer b Avesh Khan 2(4)
Avesh Khan to Nair, FOUR, inside-out. That's some welcome. A wobbly seam off a length, looking to follow Nair as he backs away. But he goes uppish, lofting up a drive over extra cover

Avesh Khan to Yuvraj, FOUR, 141kph. And an inside edge allows Yuvraj the move on. He tries going against the line, pulling, without judging the length not being short enough .. inside half, and Pant diving behind deflects it into fine leg

Avesh Khan to Yuvraj, out Caught by Pant!! The inside-edge luck runs out. And eventually the inside-edge takes him to his doom. Blame it on his feet refusing to move, yet again. Avesh keeps it on a back of a length, Yuvraj loads up again to flat-bat across the line. Inside-tickle, and no matter how loud Kotla is, the nick is louder. Yuvraj c Pant b Avesh Khan 14(17) [4s-1]

Rahul Tewatia to Miller, 1 run, put down. Maxwell of all people. Miller decides to go onto his back foot, slaps, uppishly without control and extra-cover couldn't have been found any better. Maxwell's surprised too, and the surprise means there's nobody backing up his throw as well

Mishra to Miller, no run, now Prithvi. Oh these catches keep going down -- the simplest of them. Miller is foxed by the wrong 'un, again, as he goes deep in the crease to some-sort-cut. Chipped up, straight to extra cover in the ring. Shaw gets both hands, perhaps closing them a little too early. Debut nerves
Mishra to Miller, SIX, downtown. Talk about rubbing it in. Two lives, and a celebration with a hoick straight down. All muscle, perbably denting the sightscreen

Mishra to Nair, FOUR, another one in anger. Oh Mishra, typically after a catch being put down takes his frustration out by going fast, on the pads and Nair cashes in with a sweep, drilling it perfectly to split the two fielders behind square

Plunkett to Nair, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The time-out syndrome. Nair had to kick on, and he decides to do it with a lofted whip. The ball just doesn't come on, sticks, grabs the inside half of his bat and for a change somebody can catch. But Iyer almost keeps up with the trend - running across from long-on and juggling. Just. Nair c Shreyas Iyer b Plunkett 34(32) [4s-4]

Christian to Miller, FOUR, to third man, splits the slips. One slower ball too many, Miller's already standing exposing his stumps, swings in desperation and the fat edge is enough to run through the cordon. Who'll plug these in the 18th over ..

Christian to Miller, out Caught by Plunkett!! Add another to his repertoire. When he doesn't have the ball in hand, the ball will follow him in the field. A full floater from Christian, inviting an away from the body drive. Sliced uppishly, flat and Plunkett at deep sweeper dives forward. The catches can be taken again. Miller c Plunkett b Christian 26(19) [4s-1 6s-1]
Christian to Andrew Tye, leg byes, FOUR, slower in on the pads. Tye can't connect, flicking well before it gets there, rebounds and runs very fine, under Pant's late dive

Boult to Ashwin, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Wide yorker, well in the allowed-zone this time. Ashwin stretches, and he knows there's nobody square of the wicket in the deep. All he has to do is clear point. Tries squeezing his steer, but ends up spooning it out to backward point, where Tewatia times his jump superbly, reverse cupping. Ashwin c Rahul Tewatia b Boult 6(7)

Avesh Khan to Rahul, FOUR, streaky runs! Terrific end to what has been a sensational over from Avesh. On a good length just outside off, 143.7kph and Rahul was late on the forward push. Got a thick inside edge that just flew past leg stump and with fine leg really square, bonus runs for KXIP
Boult to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, crashed away! Short of a length angling across Mayank, a bit of width and he stands tall to flay the cut through point. Cracking stroke!

Boult to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, delicious, absolutely delicious stroke! More width and the length is shorter as well, Mayank doesn't go hard at it, instead relies purely on timing and boy, didn't he time this or what? Stays back and guides it past the left of the backward point fielder and it raced away. Third man had no chance at all

Boult to Rahul, FOUR, would have been a wide if Rahul left this but he chooses to go after it. Didn't time it well enough, still clears the infield on the off-side comfortably. Shorter length slower ball that was lifted over cover

Boult to Andrew Tye, out Bowled!! Dragged on. Boult goes back to his trusted full-wide yorker. Tye loads up for yet-another-hoick, giving it his all in his swing. Gets some bat for a change, it's the inside-edge and it's chopped onto off. A four-run-wicket final over, you really can't get greedier. Andrew Tye b Boult 3(9)

Avesh Khan to Rahul, SIX, terrific stroke! Rahul is in some serious form and we've seen it already this season. Dug in short and angling into the body, he just shuffles across to get inside the line and uses the pace to control the pull. Easily over fine leg for a biggie

Avesh Khan to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, kabooom! Mayank is off the blocks in a flash once more. Short of a length outside off, he just backs away a bit and hammers it on the up through the covers. Found the gap well and nobody really budged

Plunkett to Rahul, FOUR, up and over! Cannot bowl this length in the Powerplay, not on a true surface like this one. Half-volley and Rahul lifts it straight over the bowler's head. Perhaps not middled as much as he would have liked but still got enough on it

Plunkett to Rahul, out Caught by Avesh Khan!! Excellent catch! It's the young man Avesh Khan, you cannot keep him out of the action and this is a massive wicket for DD. The dangerous Rahul needs to depart. Clever from Plunkett, the slower ball on a shorter length and I don't think that Rahul picked this variation. Went across on the back foot for the short arm jab but got no pace to work with at all. Mistimed it badly and Avesh at short fine leg judged it brilliantly with a dive forward. Plucked it inches above the ground. Brilliant! Rahul c Avesh Khan b Plunkett 23(15) [4s-3 6s-1]

Avesh Khan to Nair, FOUR, glorious! Top quality stuff from Nair! Half volley from Avesh but look at the execution. Textbook front foot cover drive on the up. Brilliantly timed and picked the gap as well

Christian to Nair, FOUR, smart from Christian but Karun is smarter. Slower and short outside off, probably foxed the batsman initially but he adjusted well in the end. Stood tall and waited before guiding it past short third man. Mishra was probably a bit slow as well to come down on the slide and Christian clearly wasn't happy with the effort

Plunkett to Mayank Agarwal, out Bowled!! The off pole has gone for a walk! What a sight for any fast bowler and Plunkett is thrilled! Horror stroke from Mayank though and he has wasted another start. Slightly short of a good length around off, this was just above 145kph and that's what probably foxed Mayank who was expecting the slower ball. No excuse for the shot though, a wild slog across the line and misses it completely. Ruffled his pad before crashing into the stumps. DD are right on top here. Mayank Agarwal b Plunkett 21(16) [4s-3]
Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, poor delivery to start off. Short and wide outside off, Suryakumar Yadav reaches for it and punches it firmly through the gap at cover

Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, dropped? Just grazes his fingertips. Fizzes in the quicker one on a fuller length, SKY got forward and got sucked into the drive, he miscued it off the cue end and the ball just evaded Rashid in his followthrough. He did well to bend low, but just couldn't lock his wrists
Rashid Khan to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, short and wide, Krunal takes full toll of it, rocks back and nails the cut behind square

Rashid Khan to Krunal Pandya, out Lbw!! Much-needed wicket for SRH. Never looked close to the naked eye, but technology - as ever - always finds a way to surprise us. That quick release off the wrists from Rashid Khan, that canny variations off the front of the hand... Krunal Pandya unfortuantely didn't read it well. Was playing for the ball spinning into him and was a tad late in bringing his bat down. The ball zoomed back in at a rapid pace to catch him close for a lbw call. Not a confident appeal, but SRH make full use of the DRS system. Krunal Pandya lbw b Rashid Khan 24(20) [4s-4]
Shakib to Pollard, SIX, full and right in KP's arc, he has no second thoughts. Just dismisses it out of his presence by using those long levers to full effect, sent into the galaxy. Over long-on

Rashid Khan to Pollard, out Caught by Dhawan!! Reminiscent of Sarfaraz Khan's dismissal against KXIP. Neatly guided down to lone slip. KP hung back to this legbreak and was wanting to glide the ball past the slip, the ball arrives much quicker and lobs low off the splice off the bat. Five down MI. Well judged catch from SD considering the pace and height on that. Pollard c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 9(6) [6s-1]

Basil Thampi to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Huge wicket in the context of the game. Back of a length, angling into the hip, SKY's eyes lit up on seeing the short ball in that channel and he fell back onto his favourite shot in the cricket dictionary - the whip pull. Hit it too good and looped up in the air for deep square to take a straightforward catch. Suryakumar Yadav c Rashid Khan b Basil Thampi 34(38) [4s-4]

S Kaul to McClenaghan, out Lbw!! Nowhere near the line of the delivery, played all around it and was a dead duck. Siddarth Kaul got the ball to hold its line around middle stump and the ball didn't rise as much, McClenaghan was searching for it but couldn't prevent the ball from smashing his pads. Plumb. Just below the knee roll. Umpire S Ravi's finger went up instantly and in the meantime the duo looked to steal a non-existent single. McClenaghan was sent back and had to put in a dive. McClenaghan lbw b S Kaul 0(2)

S Kaul to Markande, out Lbw!! Can't get more plumb than that. Easier one for the umpire too. Full and straight from Siddarth Kaul, Markande went for the cross bat shot and missed the line completely. Gets hit low on the pad and looked guilty straightaway. No reviews left for MI. Siddarth Kaul is pumped up and so is the entire SRH team. Markande lbw b S Kaul 1(2)

S Kaul to Bumrah, 1 run, half-a-chance. Seam-up delivery, gets great bounce outside off, Bumrah runs it off the splice of the bat and it evades Dhawan to his right, he dived full length but could only manage a fingertip on that

S Kaul to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Basil Thampi!! Caught at third man. That's the end of Hardik Pandya and most probably the game for MI? Sid Kaul, you bewdy. Look at him go. Oh, give him a machine or else he might end up digging the pitch with his fists. Nice change of pace from him, bowls it far from off-stump of Hardik Pandya asking him to fetch from there. Pandya slogs and could only lob it as far as third man. Good running catch from Thampi. Hardik Pandya c Basil Thampi b S Kaul 3(19)
S Kaul to Bumrah, FOUR, angled in, all Bumrah needed to do was help the ball finds its direction, he swivels and manages decent contact on the pull to slam the ball backwards of square leg

Basil Thampi to Mustafizur, out Caught by (sub)Deepak Hooda!! Sunrisers have pulled this off miraculously. Fifth loss for MI. Second lowest ever total defended in IPL history. What.A.Thriller. Final wicket razzmatazz: Short ball angled in, Mustafizur top-edged the pull before mid-wicket swallowed the swirling ball. Easy as you like. Mustafizur c (sub)Deepak Hooda b Basil Thampi 1(3)

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, FOUR, timed to perfection that was. Short of a length delivery angled away with a bit of away swing too, Lewis sits back in his crease and punches it through the gap at cover. Was in the air for a while but the placement was pretty good

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! That's a well deserved wicket for Sandeep. Lewis never looked comfortable against him. This was another full length delivery with away swing written on it, as Lewis tried to flick it away, he got a leading edge to the man at point. Manish wouldn't miss out on that. Another failure for Lewis in his maiden IPL season, second on the trot. Lewis c Manish Pandey b Sandeep Sharma 5(9) [4s-1]

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, shot, good shot! Picks the length early on that. Was a shortish delivery outside off, Suryakumar doesn't miss out on it and slaps it towards mid-off. Thampi who's manning that position slips as the ball beats him and goes through. That won't please the bowler

Nabi to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by (sub)Deepak Hooda!! Duck for Kishan! This is why Nabi is in the team. There are many left handed batsmen in Mumbai's batting line-up, gets one of them. Tosses it up nicely and invites the batsman to come down the track. Kishan does so, goes for it and ends up spooning it up to long-off where the sub calls for it and hangs on to it. These wickets are making the match interesting. So far, so good. Ishan Kishan c (sub)Deepak Hooda b Nabi 0(3)

Shakib to Rohit, out Caught by Dhawan!! Edged and taken! Shakib likes that, claps hard after getting the MI skipper. A flighted delivery outside off, Rohit looks to go big, tries to loft it over the in-field but as the ball turns away, it catches his outside edge and flies straight to the lone fielder in the slip. Dhawan makes no mistake and takes it. Mumbai Indians need a Pollard special tonight, it seems. Rohit c Dhawan b Shakib 2(6)

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he's been playing so well since he has been promoted. This was played very late by Suryakumar. Was a quicker delivery outside off, he went back in his crease and guided it sweetly past the man at short third man. No chance of stopping that

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for the opener. Picks the length early on the shortish delivery, rocks back and slams it into the gap at cover. Sweeper cover is too square to cut it off as the ball wins the race

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, beautiful. What a cracking cover-drive that was. Full length delivery around off, Pandya transfers his weight on his right knee and creams it through cover. Right into the gap and the fielders could do nothing but admire the timing and placement on it
S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, good competition between bat and ball, this. Short of a length around off, Pandya does well to pummel it past the man at mid-on and get a four more

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, poor delivery to end the over. Tries for a yorker and ends up bowling a full toss. Pandya doesn't miss out on the gift and drills it past the diving Williamson to gather the third boundary of the over. Expensive over by Kaul and Mumbai fans get their voice back

Bumrah to Williamson, FOUR, magnificent shot. What a way to get off the mark. Wasn't a bad ball at all. On a back of a length and outside off, with extra bounce too, Williamson plays a top square cut, getting on top of the bounce and hitting the gap wide of cover-point

Bumrah to Williamson, FOUR, beauty! Williamson is in some form. Bumrah goes full and outside off, gets a hint of outswing too, Williamson though is almost on one knee as he bent forward and then opened the bat-face at the last moment to essay a square drive that left cover-point as a spectator. Not much Bumrah can do when he gets to see two world-class shots like that. Credit to Williamson

McClenaghan to Dhawan, FOUR, where's third man? No-one there. On a length and outside off, Dhawan throws the bat at that and the edge flies away to the unmanned third man fence, Dhawan gets a boundary to get himself going

McClenaghan to Dhawan, out Bowled!! End of Dhawan's painful innings. No feet and he is bowled off a thick inside edge onto pad and then falls on the off-stump. McClenaghan is absolutely thrilled to bits. Shouting and screaming in delight. Length delivery on off-stump, Dhawan gets forward to drive, is late on the shot and the rest is history. Dhawan b McClenaghan 5(6) [4s-1]

Markande to Y Pathan, no run, that is a very ambitious appeal for lbw. Pathan is a huge man and with that big stride of his, always will get his front foot outside the line, this one is the leggie and the impact looks outside off and what's more it is spinning away. Hang on - MI have taken the review. Could well lose it. Replays show that the impact is outside off and that's MI's review gone down the gutter

Markande to Nabi, out Bowled!! Nabi doesn't want to go. But he has to. He has been bowled here. He can't believe that the ball has hit the stumps. Superb googly, tossed up and invited Nabi to play the big shot. An almighty hoick to leg but only after the ball has missed the inside edge and clipped the top of middle and leg. Top-class bowling. Nabi b Markande 14(10) [4s-2]
Krunal Pandya to Y Pathan, FOUR, poor delivery and cut away. Short and wide outside off, Pathan had to miss backward point and he did that. Races away once it moved past that fielder

Bumrah to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Gone. Bumrah jumps up and down in delight. Angled in on a short of length on off, Rashid Khan was trying to run it down between the keeper and the wide slip. But finds Ishan Kishan who hangs on. He is catching all the snicks tonight, apart from those, his keeping has been shoddy. Rashid Khan c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 6(9)

Markande to Basil Thampi, out Bowled!! Looks like Basil Thampi has only one shot in his arsenal. The cut. Very risky against a promising Markande. The leg-spinner fizzes off the deck and beats the late-cut, knocks the off-stump back. Not a very wise shot when he should be looking to give the strike to Pathan. Basil Thampi b Markande 3(6)

Mustafizur to S Kaul, out S Kaul Run Out!! Confusion. Chaos. Gone. Long way out too. Finally Kaul gets bat on ball, driven to backward point where there's a slight fumble, Kaul is desperate to get to the other end, Pathan sends him back but Pandya has all the time to direct his throw back to Ishan Kishan who does the rest, even as he almost lost the ball while attempting the run-out. After he flicked the bails off, the ball slipped out. The third umpire completes the formalities. S Kaul run out (Hardik Pandya/Ishan Kishan) 2(9)

Mustafizur to Y Pathan, SIX, a smile from KW after that big hit. On a length and around off, too predictable these cutters from Mustafizur, Pathan stays back and lofts cleanly miles into the stands at long-on

Mustafizur to Y Pathan, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Good catch and that's the end of the innings. Pathan really smashed the pull but Rohit has kept all his athletic fielders on the fence. Hardik at deep mid judges it to a nicety as he takes it reverse-cup over his head. A smile breaks out after he completes the catch. Pathan can't believe that he hasn't cleared the fielder. Y Pathan c Hardik Pandya b Mustafizur 29(33) [4s-2 6s-1]

McClenaghan to Saha, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Saha walks. And Mumbai erupt. No need for the review as well. Similar to the last delivery, but a bit wide, Saha again reached out with his hands with the feet stuck, all he managed was an edge to the keeper. Ishan Kishan makes no mistake and the ploy to send Saha at 3 has backfired badly. Saha c Ishan Kishan b McClenaghan 0(2)

Bumrah to Manish Pandey, FOUR, a big confidence-booster for Manish Pandey. He wants runs and this is a fine shot. On the front foot and when he saw the back of a length delivery outside off, just knifed it on the rise. Through the vacant cover-point region for a boundary

McClenaghan to Manish Pandey, FOUR, when it is pitched up, Manish Pandey looks to go over the top. Has come out with an aggressive intent. This was full outside off, he lofted it cleanly and wide of mid-on

McClenaghan to Manish Pandey, FOUR, clean and over mid-off. The same delivery that got Saha, but Manish Pandey is in and seeing it well tonight by the looks of it. Goes over mid-off with a full bat-swing and clears the fielder comfortably

Hardik Pandya to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson gets lucky. Very lucky. A thick inside edge that on another day would've gone onto the stumps, misses them and runs away wide of short fine leg. The fielder didn't dive as well. Good length and on off, Williamson was late on the attempted dab

Hardik Pandya to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rohit!! "Story of Manish Pandey" is the comment from Sanjay M on air. Apt. Finds cover. Down the track and right off the toe of the bat, can only find the MI skipper there. Clever from Hardik Pandya, may have seen the batsman coming and bowled it just a bit wide from his reach. An innings which promised so much has been nipped in the bud. Manish Pandey c Rohit b Hardik Pandya 16(11) [4s-3]

McClenaghan to Williamson, out Shakib Run Out!! Williamson has sold Shakib down the river here. Williamson turned this to the short mid area and said an yes, Shakib too responded and then the SRH skipper belted out a loud no. By then Shakib was almost halfway down and Surya took his time, aimed and hit direct. What a waste of a wicket. Shakib is too disappointed to say anything. Just walks off. Shakib run out (Suryakumar Yadav) 2(4)

McClenaghan to Y Pathan, byes, FOUR, short, Pathan ducks under that and lets it go. Ishan Kishan is having a bad day in the office tonight. Leaps but can only parry it over and the ball runs away for four byes. Again off McClenaghan
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, FOUR, brilliant back-cut. As late as possible. Williamson cutting the ball behind him and the pace on the ball beats the chasing and diving McClenaghan. Top shot that one

Mustafizur to Williamson, FOUR, comical from KW. He hasn't realised that the ball has crossed the fence. Keeps running and then belatedly realises. But what a good pull shot that is. Rocketed off the bat, harmless short ball around waist height, Williamson murdered that and bisected the two men on the fence. Even a dive wasn't enough to stop the ball

Hardik Pandya to Williamson, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Williamson walks. Clear inside edge and the umpire's finger is up too. Nipped in a tad, from a good length, Williamson had his bat face open to play the dab to third man, but it kissed the inside edge and went to the keeper. That's a wicket SRH ill-afforded to lose. Massive blow. Williamson c Ishan Kishan b Hardik Pandya 29(21) [4s-5]

Hardik Pandya to Nabi, FOUR, can't seem to string 6 good balls in an over. Overpitched and Nabi doesn't miss out. Gets forward and strokes it wide of cover. Sweeper had no chance at all. Right off the middle of the bat
Markande to Nabi, FOUR, too short and begging to be hit. Nabi rocks back and finds the gap between long-on and deep mid with a hard pull. Right into the gap

Markande to Y Pathan, FOUR, googly but wrongly directed, starts from middle and goes down, Pathan helps the sweep with one hand off the bat handle, good enough though to take the ball away from the man at deep backward square

Negi to Watson, SIX, that's Watson at his best. Too full and too straight, Watson sits down and then heaves with all his might, good connection to get it all the way over long-on. Gets the crowd going

Negi to Watson, out Caught by Siraj!! How often have you seen Watson get out, mistiming a pull? His staple shot is the pull. Made a career out of it as a batsman even fetching length balls and muscling them over mid-wicket. But Negi has him again. Credit to Kohli for throwing the ball to the left-arm spinner, he has a good record against Watson and gets him with a short ball. May have skidded on a wee bit to catch Watson's inner half, Siraj takes a dolly at mid-on and flings the ball away. Negi raises his arms in triumph. Watson c Siraj b Negi 7(4) [6s-1]
Corey Anderson to Dhoni, SIX, right in Dhoni's teeing off zone. Picks the slower delivery and murders it over long-on. As easy as you like
Negi to Dhoni, SIX, helicoptered straight down the ground! Mini-helicopter you can call. Tossed up on middle, Dhoni marmalises it back over the bowler's head. Such power
Negi to Dhoni, SIX, Negi continues to toss it up, too full and right in the hitting zone, Dhoni swings and sends it over long-on. When it is so full, Dhoni will hit everything out of the park

Negi to Rayudu, SIX, 50 for Rayudu. He is getting tired and losing some of his power, but this he sits back and waits for it to be bowled short, then mauls the pull over deep mid. Third six of the over
Siraj to Rayudu, SIX, magnificent shot. Down the track and lifts the back of a length delivery over deep cover. So effortless with so much timing. A crucial blow at the right time

Corey Anderson to Rayudu, 1 run, dropped by Umesh at extra-cover. Kohli though claps in encouragement. Rayudu moved across to the off-side, skied the lofted hit straight up. Umesh went for the conventional way, straight in and out. Will that prove to be costly?

Corey Anderson to Rayudu, SIX, back of a length outside off, Rayudu knows what is coming, a mini shuffle outside off, forehands it over wide long-off. Carries over the rope, not by much but it will do

Corey Anderson to Rayudu, SIX, this is bigger. And longer. Full outside off, Rayudu shuffles across and gives it all, off the middle of the bat and way back into the stands. Nailed that and the ball flies away to the deep mid fence

Siraj to Dhoni, FOUR, finally, he guides this in the gap and that spoils a good over for Siraj. Bowled pretty well to be honest. Back of a length and outside off stump, Dhoni steers it between backward point and short third man

Corey Anderson to Dhoni, SIX, whyyy! When those back of a length balls were working so well, why do you want to try the yorker. Dhoni smacks it. He did really smack it straight down the ground. Fifty for the CSK captain, he's determined and as always confident

Corey Anderson to Rayudu, FOUR, now then, now then, you can't bowl way too short and slow either. No sweeper cover remember, only third man and deep cover, so Rayudu stands tall, delays the cut and hits it over the infield

Corey Anderson to Rayudu, out Rayudu Run Out!! 1 run completed. They say you don't run on a misfield and Rayudu's excellent knock has been ended by a brilliant piece of fielding by Umesh. Brilliant first with the full length dive to get a hand on the attempted square-drive to save the boundary, and then brilliant with recovery time and more importantly smash the stumps with a bullet throw and he had one stump to aim at from a side on angle. RCB are back in it! Rayudu doesn't want to leave. He got greedy and hoped for a poor throw from the fielder but Umesh has a good throwing arm and was out by miles despite a dive. Rayudu run out (U Yadav) 82(53) [4s-3 6s-8]

Siraj to Dhoni, SIX, don't tell me he deliberately sliced that all the way for six! Oh he did! Genius! Low full toss outside off stump, not a really bad ball, Dhoni has been looking to target third man this innings and he's somehow got under this properly and sent it for a maximum

Corey Anderson to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, that's the healthiest of edges you can get. Lucky runs. Precious runs for CSK. The yellow contingent believes. Ceee Esss Kayyy chants ringing in the ground. Shortish delivery outside off stump, Bravo slogs and gets a thick edge that flies over the leaping QdK

Corey Anderson to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, who better than DJ Bravo to hit those inside-out shots over cover. You got to admire him. Distraught RCB fans. Delight in the CSK camp. Back of a length delivery outside off stump, Bravo backs away and gets under the ball to smash it over cover

Corey Anderson to Dhoni, SIX, that's it! How cool is he man! Is he human? CSK have won with two balls to spare! Unbelievable stuff. More than 100 runs were needed in about 7 overs but he never showed any signs of pressure, nor did he play rash shots. Just played his trumpcard of taking the match deep and backing himself to finish and boy, what a finish it was. Just a jump across to the off-side and slogs this full ball with all his might to clear deep mid-wicket. This is RCB's first loss defending in excess of 200 at the Chinnaswamy

Washington Sundar to Rayudu, SIX, the sound of bat hitting ball was like a gunshot. Such a big hit and so well hit too. After not getting to the pitch, Washington Sundar seeing Rayudu come down, dragged it down, but Rayudu is seeing so well at the moment that he goes through with the pull and muscles it over deep mid

Washington Sundar to Rayudu, SIX, good cricket awareness from Rayudu as he knew Washington Sundar will pitch it up, he does and Rayudu swings through the line and cleanly to get another six over long-on

U Yadav to Rayudu, SIX, he is in the mood. For sure. A length ball angling in, Rayudu stays back and just whips that off his pads, knew there was no-one back out there, the white ball sails into the crowd at deep backward square

U Yadav to Raina, FOUR, that is an unbelievable shot. Especially if your name is Raina and you have a problem against the short ball. The world knows it. Yadav did nothing wrong there, followed the backing away Raina with a perfect short ball, but Raina turned on the style and forehanded like Rafa Nadal at Philippe Chatrier Roland Garros. So much topspin on the crosscourt and it swings and eludes wickedly past the great AB at mid-on. How he managed to get on top of the bounce and kept it down, only he will know
Siraj to Rayudu, FOUR, short and pulled away. Rayudu didn't hit it as well as he would've liked to, but gets a one bounce over the ropes four at deep square

Siraj to Raina, FOUR, another amazing shot by Raina. Siraj with the double-teapot pose, wondering what he has done wrong. Raina down the track, in a flash and even when there's no room on the back of a length delivery, whiplashes the slash, gets it through cover and extra-cover. Right into the gap. Top batting

Siraj to Rayudu, FOUR, belted straight down the ground. Rayudu knows what is coming from his Hyderabad teammate. Skips down and then brutalises the short of length delivery back over the bowler's head. Umpire was ducking for cover there

U Yadav to Raina, out Caught by Mandeep!! The shouts of Ceeee-Sssss-Kkkkkkk have been drowned out by that wicket. Now Aaaaarrrrr-Ceeeeee-Beeeeeee back on. Leg-stump full delivery, hint of shape on that, Raina flicked too early and the leading edge landed safely in backward point's grasp where Mandeep catches and tumbles over in delight. The ploy of giving Yadav another over has worked. 100th IPL wicket for Umesh as well. Raina c Mandeep b U Yadav 11(9) [4s-2]
U Yadav to Billings, FOUR, now Billings flicks and gets four. Over mid-wicket and it races away. On the pads, Billings relies on timing and goes up and over

Chahal to Billings, FOUR, pre-meditated and four. Knelt down and paddled it fine, beats the long chase and desperate dive of Corey Anderson at fine leg. Almost played it onto the stumps, but got it wide of de Kock

Chahal to Billings, out Stumped!! Gone. Chahal is shushing Billings as he puts his finger to his lips. Magnificent bowling. Done Billings in with his quickish, flattish leggie, Billings was down the track and looking to play across the line, dangerous, deadly dangerous when it spins past you like that leaving you hopeless and helpless. Easy for de Kock to complete the formalities. Chahal is jumping up and down like a young child who has been denied his icecream. Billings st de Kock b Chahal 9(7) [4s-2]

Chahal to Rayudu, SIX, goes over deep cover. Rayudu didn't find it off the middle of the bat, but has got enough bat to send the ball soaring into the crowd over deep cover. Tough tough shot but Rayudu trusted his ability and played it supremely

Chahal to Jadeja, out Bowled!! He is punching the air as if he was a boxer beating the hell out of your defeated opponent. What bowling from Chahal. He is turning it on for RCB. That's as comprehensive as it gets. Sets Jadeja up for the cut but the ball fizzes off the pitch and beats the shot to clatter the stumps. Jadeja is not a bad player of spin, just the quality of Chahal outshining and outsmarting the spinner. Now RCB are well on top. Jadeja b Chahal 3(5)

Negi to Dhoni, SIX, crikey! We have seen everything from MS in this game. Never will play the big shot off just his second ball, but here he has done so and got six. Down the track to the tossed up delivery on leg, heaves into the deep mid fence. Off the mark with a biggie

Chahar to Kohli, FOUR, that's where Kohli is so good. Anything near his pads and he will not allow the bowler to get away. Full on leg stump and he just whipped it over mid-wicket. The uncorking of the wrists and the ball flew over the fielder

SN Thakur to Kohli, FOUR, didn't get all of it, but with the infield up, anything over them will be a boundary. Full outside off, Kohli wanted to go over extra-cover with the lofted hit, sort of sliced it, but had enough on it to clear the ring. Races away and the crowd get going as well

Tahir to de Villiers, FOUR, what batting. Must have picked it from the hand. Reverses the bat and sends the quicker dart outside off wide of short third. MS tried to get his legs in the way of the ball - as he always does, but placed so well

Tahir to de Villiers, SIX, there comes the sweep. He has got outside the line as he sits and then takes it from around fourth stump line, sweeps and connects beautifully, sends it into the deep backward square leg fence. The ball just flew off the bat

Tahir to de Villiers, SIX, the ball is lost! Find a new one. If someone is outside the stadium near the deep mid stands, they can take that as a souvenir. And frame it and keep it for posterity sake. de Villiers does a Guptill as he sits down and then does not keep his eyes on the shot, the head looks down and the eyes away from the line of where the ball is going, where's the ball? Over the roof at deep mid. One hit in the last game came back in from there, but this is isn't. Monster hit! My colleague Akshay tells me that it is a 111-metre six - the biggest of the tournament so far

Watson to de Kock, SIX, massive blow and de Kock likes that. Has 50 and points at the base of his bat to someone in the dressing room. All done with a smile on his face. Makes room and the length ball is clattered miles into the deep mid-wicket stands. More of a golf-swing that from de Kock

SN Thakur to de Villiers, SIX, now 50 for AB. Just a raise of the bat and a glove-punch with de Kock to celebrate getting there. Picks the slower delivery and heaves it into the deep mid stands. The key was standing still and then going through with the shot
SN Thakur to de Villiers, SIX, another slower delivery and another six. Predictable from Thakur. Again de Villiers stays so still, doesn't move around at all, over long-on now. Clean and beautiful

SN Thakur to de Villiers, SIX, Thakur isn't learning at all. Third slower delivery, this was the knuckle delivery, he is overdoing it, de Villiers may have seen what he is doing, even if he hasn't, can pick it from the hand, the slower delivery lands outside off and with a swing of the bat, the ball is seen flying over wide long-off. What can this man not do on a cricket field? Absolutely nothing

Dwayne Bravo to de Kock, out Caught&Bowled!! Right off the toe of the bat and Dwayne Bravo catches it. Out comes the dance. A slower ball, de Kock had to wait an age for the ball to arrive, by the time he completed the shot, it chalked the cue end and found the bowler. A wicket CSK so desperately needed. They break the stand that was threatening to consume them. de Kock c and b Dwayne Bravo 53(37) [4s-1 6s-4]

Tahir to de Villiers, out Caught by Billings!! Someone please stop Tahir. Or he will run all the way from the Stadium to Chennai. Thankfully a CSK teammate does stop him. He has gone mental. But deserved wicket for him and credit to MS too for giving the field to him. Wanted Tahir to toss it up outside off, out of de Villiers's reach. Must have expected de Villiers to go for it after just four came off the last ten balls. And it works. de Villiers wants to go in-to-out, but the spin away forces the miscue, and they have one of the best fielders in the team in Billings at deep cover, running in to settle under that. Pressure catch but he hangs on and sends the CSK section into pangs of uncontrolled emotion. de Villiers c Billings b Tahir 68(30) [4s-2 6s-8]

Tahir to Corey Anderson, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Tahir does run this time, but only halfway of the ground. Two in two and how quickly has this game turned. Googly, on a punching length, but it turns just a wee bit more than Corey Anderson expected, catches the edge and surprisingly there's a slip in for the Kiwi at this stage. Another masterstroke by MS and Bhajji is only too happy to gobble it up. Again what emotion and what drama at the Chinnaswamy. Corey Anderson c Harbhajan b Tahir 2(8)

Jadeja to Mandeep, byes, FOUR, wow! Missed stumping? What has happened to this game all of a sudden. Like a man on drugs. This ball opens Mandeep up completely, rips off middle and squares up the batsman, leaves MS clueless too, drift in and spin away, past everyone including slip and races away

Jadeja to Mandeep, SIX, almost an unbelievable catch. Boult snatched one in the last game. Billings just missing out with an incredible effort. Slogged in the air from outside off and Billings on the run from deep mid, stretched his right-hand out at full tilt but took the ball with him beyond the ropes. Had he caught that, would've been one of the all-time great catches
Jadeja to Mandeep, FOUR, too slow and too much time for Mandeep to reverse lap it over short third. Well played

Dwayne Bravo to Mandeep, 2 runs, poor from Dwayne Bravo and the man at cover, slower ball bowled on a yorker length outside off, dug out to the diving MS, who with his glove on has a shy and had he hit de Grandhomme was out. But there's no backing up and they take an extra run
Dwayne Bravo to Mandeep, 1 run, difficult return catch dropped. Drilled and hit with power to the left-hand of Dwayne Bravo, it didn't stick. Must have stung him, but he doesn't show any emotion
Dwayne Bravo to de Grandhomme, FOUR, top shot. Gets under this full delivery and manages to power it over mid-off. Well wide of him and four more

SN Thakur to Mandeep, SIX, brilliant shot. He is backing away and having to reach out but awesome timing on the lofted square drive. It was full and outside his reach, but somehow Mandeep got it over the deep point fence. All timing and the crowd have found their voice back

SN Thakur to Mandeep, SIX, bit of TR from Bumble. "Mandeep, Mandeep, goes deep." is his comment on air. Sheer power from Mandeep, waits for the shortish slower delivery, then flat-bats it with brute force and clears long-off easily. The key was knowing what Thakur will bowl and setting himself up for the shot. Perfectly executed

SN Thakur to Mandeep, out Caught by Jadeja!! Straight up in the air and caught at deep mid. Mandeep slogs the slower delivery and doesn't have the elevation to clear the fielder in the deep. Respite for Thakur who has had an absolute mare tonight - removing the wicket-maiden against Kohli and AB. Mandeep c Jadeja b SN Thakur 32(17) [4s-1 6s-3]

Dwayne Bravo to Negi, out de Grandhomme Run Out!! de Grandhomme isn't the quickest between the wickets. MS hits direct and there's no dive from the Kiwi. Negi is beaten on the dab to the slower delivery, MS does the rest with the gloves on. de Grandhomme run out (Dhoni) 11(7) [4s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Washington Sundar, out Negi Run Out!! 1 run completed. Madness from RCB and they have lost three in three. Team hat-trick. Lofted by Washington Sundar without any power, to the right of long-off. Negi wanted to come back for the second, but is sent back and can't beat the accurate throw on the bounce to MS. Flat and rocket-like by Jadeja. Negi isn't happy and is seen chuntering away in the dug-out. Negi run out (Jadeja/Dhoni) 0(1)

Dwayne Bravo to U Yadav, out Caught by Billings!! It is four in four, in between a wide too. Manic this. Madness. Sheer madness. Yadav skies the slower delivery way up in the air, when it came down, it was Billings under it at deep mid. U Yadav c Billings b Dwayne Bravo 0(1)

Dwayne Bravo to U Yadav, wide, had MS hit direct, would've been four in four. What was Yadav doing? Was a wide and he was loitering outside his crease. MS missed without the glove and not by much. Very lazy and poor by Umesh

Dwayne Bravo to Washington Sundar, SIX, just over Tahir at deep mid. Washington Sundar slogging the slower delivery and managing to clear the leggie, when he hit it, looked like he holed out. Enough, just about to get a biggie

Chahar to de Kock, SIX, mauls this slower delivery over long-on. Made slight room to the off-pace delivery and then freed his arms to go big. Connected cleanly and there was never a doubt about the hit

Chahar to Kohli, FOUR, 200 marks to Billings for the effort. But it is four. Flicked effortlessly by Kohli, races across the turf to deep mid-wicket, Billings dives and pushes it back in play, but the ball rolls back to touch the cushions as the Kent man tried to pull it back the second time. Kohli and de Kock assumed that it would go for four and had to rush to make the third. Eventually all that was not needed as the third umpire judges it correctly

Dwayne Bravo to Washington Sundar, FOUR, brilliant from Washington Sundar. These might be crucial runs. Could well be match-winning. This 10-odd runs he has managed in the last over. Wide length ball from Dwayne Bravo, Washington Sundar reached out and cut between the two men in the ring on the off-side. No-one sweeping out there and RCB end with 205

Harbhajan to de Kock, SIX, de Kock has seen enough. Decides to take matters into his own hands. Such a difficult shot to play - against the spin to a turning ball, but de Kock nailed the shot to perfection. Down the track and to the pitch before hoisting it long over long-on. Again timed so well and it went way back into the stands

SN Thakur to Kohli, out Caught by Jadeja!! Thakur strikes. What a big wicket too. Quite uncharacteristic from Kohli to get out to one of his favorite shots. Took a step down the track and whipped that with lots of bottom hand power, failed to keep it down and found CSK's best fielder Jadeja at mid-on. He judges it beautifully and slides to take it with two hands. If there was one fielder, Kohli didn't want the ball to go to, then it must have been Jadeja. Kohli is livid with himself, bangs the bat hard into his pad and trudges off. The CSK contingent erupt. Kohli c Jadeja b SN Thakur 18(15) [4s-3]

Harbhajan to de Villiers, SIX, de Villiers wants to make an impact. Takes on long-on and goes over his head. Uses his feet and then a clean swing of the bat. Rest you know. Sails into the stands. So effortless

Harbhajan to de Villiers, SIX, he played an absolute beauty of a shot against Nadeem in the last game. Does the same here. Makes room and goes in-to-out - one of the toughest shots in the business but de Villiers is a genius, makes it look so simple. Over extra-cover and just crosses the ropes for six. The crowd have gone mad at the Chinnaswamy

Harbhajan to de Villiers, FOUR, this time shows off his prowess over the backward point region. Harbhajan isn't afraid to flight it, even after getting hit, but de Villiers backs away and slices it over the infield, four more, just opened the bat face at the point of impact and eluded the horde of fielders in the ring

Jadeja to de Villiers, SIX, wow. So easy this is for de Villiers that it is absolutely ridiculous. Other mortals would have attempted to drive that through cover, but when de Villiers saw that tossed up delivery outside off he went down on his knee and swept it flat over deep square leg. The fielder was behind square and could only watch the ball go into the cushions

Watson to de Kock, FOUR, back of a length around off, what a late-cut that is. Played it so late, almost behind him, splits backward point and short third to perfection. No third man and too wide for sweeper to get across
Dwayne Bravo to de Kock, SIX, straight back over Dwayne Bravo's head. Over the sightscreen. Picks the bones out of this slower delivery, stays till and smashes the ball for a biggie
Dwayne Bravo to de Kock, 2 runs, jams out the yorker which is headed for the base of off, to the right of Billings at sweeper cover. Placed for two
Nabi to Gayle, SIX, down the track he comes and clobbers it! Just a casual swing of the arms to send it rocketing back over the bowler's head

Shakib to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Down the pitch and gone! Wasn't anywhere near the pitch of the ball, but refuses to arrest his momentum; goes through with the shot and skies it off the cue end for long-on who takes the simplest of catches. Manish Pandey it is with bucket hands. Mayank's intent was to clear long-on with the loft, but Shakib did well to drag it back. Mayank Agarwal c Manish Pandey b Shakib 12(15)

Rashid Khan to Nair, out Lbw!! Nair doesn't review. Plumb in front. Googly from Rashid Khan, Nair got forward to block ala classic Test match style, but he didn't read it too well. Was totally befuddled after he got pinged below the kneeroll. Nair walks off instantly. Nair lbw b Rashid Khan 13(17)
Shakib to Finch, SIX, in the slot and goodnight! Fuller in length and Finchy likes it, tonks it many-a-mile over long-on
