Shakib to Finch, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Gone this time. Headless batting from Finch? Rush of blood? Preempts the lofted swing and smashes it as hard as he can, puts all his body power behind it after clearing the front leg. Manish Pandey sets himself up at long-on and judges it to perfection. Taken inches inside the rope. Finch c Manish Pandey b Shakib 8(4) [6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Manoj Tiwary, out Caught by Williamson!! Give Williamson 10 bowlers and he'll win matches. Gee, how good is this SRH bowling? KXIP 6 down. Sheer panic. Manoj Tiwary got across to this off-cutter and couldn't control his flick shot on the move, foxed by the lack of pace I reckon. It smacks the toe-end and loops up to KW at mid-wicket who gobbles up with supreme ease. Manoj Tiwary c Williamson b Sandeep Sharma 1(5)

Sandeep Sharma to Andrew Tye, FOUR, dropped? Just fingertips I guess. Will go down as a missed opportunity. Andrew Tye walks out of his crease and clubs it straight down the ground, it kept teasing long-on and long-off, in the end Shakib from long-on decided to go for it, but didn't judge it well and it looped over his left shoulder

Sandeep Sharma to Andrew Tye, out Lbw!! They are crumbling like nine pins. One after the other. There's no room to breathe. Knuckle ball from Sandeep Sharma, Tye played across the line and got hit in line with middle and leg. Loud appeal and given out straightaway. Tye went for the review after a brief consultation with his skipper, thankfully they didn't lose the review. Andrew Tye lbw b Sandeep Sharma 4(2) [4s-1]

S Kaul to Barinder, out Barinder Run Out!! This is possibly the worst batting display from KXIP this season. They are inviting panic ball after ball. Sran slogs once again, gets it off the toe-end and it dribbles to Saha to his left; he puts in the dive, collects cleanly and clatters the timber at the striker's end. Both the batsmen were stranded in the middle, Ashwin took a couple of strides and stood stoned midway waiting to see the procession. Barinder run out (Saha) 2(5)

Rashid Khan to Ashwin, out Caught by Williamson!! Running out of words to describe this shambolic batting from KXIP. Ashwin goes for the hack and had to drag it off the toe-end, the ball was spinning away from him and that made it all the more difficult to execute the shot. Skies up off the toe-end and KW takes a sitter at cover. Ashwin c Williamson b Rashid Khan 4(6)
Rashid Khan to Mujeeb, FOUR, okay let's try something fancy decides Mujeeb and he goes for the reverse slap over point. Connects it well and gets it to defeat the dive from sweeper cover to his left
Rashid Khan to Mujeeb, FOUR, another reverse slap. Over short third man this time. Sweetly timed or not, it goes over the fielder and trickles into the fence

S Kaul to Rajpoot, FOUR, typical agricultural slog from Ankit Rajpoot, shaves the inside edge and runs past the keeper to his left. Thampi from short fine chases...chases...and chases...Never getting there. Ball wins the race

Basil Thampi to Rajpoot, out Bowled!! Stumps shattered, so is the KXIP dug-out. SRH win, by 13 runs. What an outstanding bowling effort this. This (the final wicket) was coming; Basil Thampi gets his line right and attacks the stumps with a full one, it was pacy and too hot to handle for Ankit Rajpoot, he went across his stumps to try the funky scoop over short fine and missed. Nailed, done and dusted. Timbahhhh...Rajpoot b Basil Thampi 8(9) [4s-1]
Nabi to Rahul, SIX, deep into the mid-wicket stands. He pounces on this short ball. Picks length up strikingly early, hops back and nails the pull away
Nabi to Rahul, FOUR, superb batting. This isn't all that short. But Rahul's footwork is excellent, enabling him to spear this cut shot through point
Nabi to Rahul, FOUR, now anticipates a slightly fuller length, walks across the stumps and sweeps over short fine leg. Class batting from Rahul. He's out-thinking Nabi at every turn
Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul silences the crowd with a glorious cover drive. Wow. Not even all that full, but he leans into it languidly and creams it through extra cover

S Kaul to Rahul, FOUR, he's not got it off the middle, but the fact he's got it over mid-on is incredible. He wasn't to the pitch of the ball after charging out, but goes through with a very stylish straight-batted punch. His strokes make for such good viewing
S Kaul to Gayle, FOUR, yorker outside off, and it's sliced away through the gap. Gayle stretches out to reach it and opens the bat-face to get it between short third man and backward point
Basil Thampi to Gayle, SIX, you brutal brutal beast. Clears his front leg and destroys this back of length delivery. It's gone soaring over long-on. Phew, enough to knock the wind out of a bowler

Rashid Khan to Rahul, out Bowled!! Rahul has this weakness against legspin. He does have a history of getting out to googlies in the past. Perhaps that could be playing on his mind while playing the wily Rashid Khan. Got forward defensively expecting a wrong 'un, but the ball held its line enough before straightening past his outside edge to hammer the off pole. Excellent set up from Rashid. A much-needed wicket for SRH and with that, they take the time-out! Rahul b Rashid Khan 32(26) [4s-4 6s-1]

Basil Thampi to Gayle, out Caught&Bowled!! Guess what, the young man from Kerala has beaten Chris Gayle for pace. The advantage of that busting action and jump. Gets the short ball to climb awkwardly onto Gayle who miscues the ambitious pull round the corner, just a few yards to the left of nonexistent square leg. Basil Thampi says mine, runs around and controls his momentum to take a clean catch. Boy, is he pumped or what... Gayle c and b Basil Thampi 23(22) [4s-1 6s-2]

Rajpoot to Williamson, out Caught by Ashwin!! The SRH supporters look stunned as the captain departs. That's a poor looking shot from KW, but it was the extra bounce that was his undoing. Banged in short and a hint of away movement from outside off, KW was in a terrible position as he went for the pull, would have been better had he tried to cut, gets a top-edge that lobbed in the air and Ashwin has a simple catch at mid-off. Williamson c Ashwin b Rajpoot 0(3)
Barinder to Dhawan, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Sran and Dhawan was all over it. Reaches out on the drive and flat-bats it past cover, beat the infield and rolled away to the fence

Andrew Tye to Shakib, FOUR, nicely played by Shakib, much needed boundary for SRH. Banged in short and just outside off, Shakib swivels across and helps it on its way, beats short fine and rolls away to the fence
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, Manish backs away and punches it to long-off for a single

Mujeeb to Shakib, out Caught by Mayank Agarwal!! This was coming! Shakib was struggling to get the young Afghan away, goes for the big mow over mid-wicket and holes out to long-on. He didn't pick this wrong 'un, came down the track, didn't get anywhere close to the ball, was eyeing the mid-wicket fence, got a fat leading edge on the lofted drive, high and towards long-on. Mayank settled under it and holds on. Shakib c Mayank Agarwal b Mujeeb 28(29) [4s-3]

Ashwin to Manish Pandey, FOUR, bad misjudgement from Rajpoot in the deep. He lets this bounce in front of him and then weakly stretches out his hand, only to parry it over the ropes. Carrom ball on leg-stump from Ashwin, Pandey stood still and swiped it through square leg. Good contact
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, SIX, he's tonked this over mid-wicket. Finally the acceleration from Pandey. Picks the ball from outside off and slogs cleanly

Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, dropped! It took an age for the ball to come down from the sky, and it bursts right through Agarwal's hands in the deep. Another big swipe from Pandey which he mistimes to deep mid-wicket. And another repreive

Ashwin to Y Pathan, SIX, another one goes down, albeit a much difficult one. Mistimed slog from Pathan, Manoj Tiwary skirts along the square leg boundary, and then tips it over the ropes. His mind was occupied by his proximity to the ropes which made him fluff the chance too

Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, FOUR, had to make a big effort to get to this wide slower ball, and then manufactures remarkable power to cover it over extra-cover. Highly valuable fifty from Manish Pandey. It's given the Sunrisers a score
Andrew Tye to Y Pathan, FOUR, back of a length delivery on leg, Pathan helps it away past short fine leg. Tye immediately turned away, knew he had missed his mark horrendously

Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, out Bowled!! Brilliant bowling. Turning out to be a great final over so far. He's varied it up nicely, so as to not become predictable. This one's almost in the blockhole and it's tailing in at a good pace. Slips under Pandey's slog and crashes into the stumps off the pad. Manish Pandey b Rajpoot 54(51) [4s-3 6s-1]
Rajpoot to Nabi, FOUR, sliced away over backward point for four. Useful from Nabi. Full and wide delivery, Nabi just about reaches it and then cleverly opens the bat face

Barinder to Saha, FOUR, that's a poor ball from Sran, too full and on Saha's pads, all he had to do was to get some bat on that, he does and beats fine leg with ease. Expensive start from Sran, 11 came from the over
Rajpoot to Dhawan, FOUR, chopped, short of a good length and just outside off, too close for Dhawan to play the cut, he gets a toe-edge and beats the lone slip, third man is square and has no chance

Rajpoot to Dhawan, out Caught by Nair!! Edged and caught! That bounce from Rajpoot, it's the undoing of yet another SRH batsman, they have lost both openers now. Banged in short and curving away from the left-hander, Dhawan didn't cover for the angle as he fended at that, doesn't get on top of the bounce and gets a thick outside edge. The ball looped and was dying on its way to Karun, but he bends forward and takes a good low catch. Dhawan c Nair b Rajpoot 11(8) [4s-2]

Rajpoot to Nabi, out Caught by Mayank Agarwal!! Lofted up, not much timing, and a good catch running in from Agarwal. He covered decent ground at long-off before diving forward with both hands. Five-fer for Ankit Rajpoot. Nabi c Mayank Agarwal b Rajpoot 4(2) [4s-1]

Barinder to Manish Pandey, FOUR, whipped, length delivery on the leg-stumnp line, Manish makes room, gets his left leg out of the way and flicks it wristily past mid-wicket, off the mark with a boundary

Barinder to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, chance and Ashwin puts in a laborious dive, don't think he even got his fingers onto the ball. A badly mistimed shovel from Manish as he looked to go back over the bowler's head, went very high and over mid-off. Ashwin ran back, kept his eyes on the ball, stretched out as it lobbed over his shoulders and can't quite complete the catch

Rajpoot to Saha, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! Another terrible slog and Rajpoot has three now. Change of pace has done Saha in, this was a slower ball outside off, Saha was looking to slog it over mid-wicket, he has no pace to work with, hit high on the bat and lobs a simple catch to Tye, jogging back from mid-wicket. Rajpoot is on a roll and SRH's batting looks very flaky once again. Saha c Andrew Tye b Rajpoot 6(9) [4s-1]

Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, no run, chance and Tye has dropped a dolly. That should have been four for Rajpoot, short and just outside off, Manish swivelled across and nailed the pull, straight into the hands of Tye at mid-wicket - who somehow clangs a sitter
Barinder to Shakib, FOUR, the free-hit and it has been smashed away, high full-toss on Shakib's pads, he pulled it without much timing, but the placement was good, past square leg and into the fence

Barinder to Shakib, FOUR, short, wide and four, Shakib gets going after some luck, short and wide of off, he gets on top of the bounce, used Sran's pace and cracked it square behind point. Third man has no chance

Ashwin to Shakib, 1 run, appeal for run-out. A lazy single from Shakib and this might cost him. Oh dear! Shakib is short, but Ashwin has missed the ball and broke the stumps with his hands, NOT OUT is the call. That's poor cricket all around, the drifter from Ashwin, spun away from outside off, Hasan pushed it to the right of cover-point and set-off for a quick single. He was very casual in his running, took the big steps when he spotted the danger, but was still short of making his ground

Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, SIX, smashed, that's a long hop from Kuldeep, it was the attempted wrong 'un, sat up to be smacked. Munro stayed back and flat-batted the pull, high and over long-on for a maximum

A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, cracking shot! This lad is putting up an exhibition tonight. Fractionally short from Russell and Shaw doesn't bother going on the back foot. Is on his initial front foot trigger as he clobbers the pull over mid-wicket. High quality!

A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, guided down towards third man. 50 for Prithvi Shaw! Joint youngest to score an IPL fifty. No surprises there if you have heard of him before. A definite prodigy

A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, oh glorious! Another classy stroke! Not all that full but Shaw reaches out and absolutely pumps the drive straight back past the bowler. Mid-off could only see it whistling away to the fence. Gee!

Kuldeep Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, ahh, the new DD captain doesn't think so. What a way to greet the mystery spinner in his new spell! Floated up around off, Iyer did well to go with the spin and executed the slog sweep beautifully. Easily over deep mid-wicket

Johnson to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, this time he does! Iyer gets third time lucky. Another shorter length delivery from Johnson and was perhaps a touch closer to Iyer who connected the ramp nicely. Over Karthik and very fine which means third man has no chance. Nice innovation

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, launched over square leg! Shaw continues in his merry ways. Fractionally short in length and he swivels a touch before propelling this with a strong bottom hand. In the air for quite a while and had enough legs to clear the fence. He is switching gears here, is Shaw and DD do need to up the ante. Looks a good batting surface

Chawla to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's H-U-G-E! Into the top tier! Whoa, what a strike! Iyer has decided to join in the fun as well. Tossed up nicely by Chawla and it's blasted high down the ground. One of those sixes that had good height and distance. Lovely

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, out Bowled!! Chawla strikes! KKR badly needed this one because this partnership was getting ready to go bonkers. This was the quicker one from Chawla and it skidded through low, Shaw didn't expect it to keep that low and his wild pull across the line didn't help his cause either. Misses it completely and the woodwork is disturbed. Nevertheless, a top quality innings from the young man. He's made a statement here in the IPL. This dismissal might actually worry KKR as they have to chase and it has started to keep low. Prithvi Shaw b Chawla 62(44) [4s-7 6s-2]

A Russell to Pant, out Caught by Karthik!! What was that, Mr.Pant? We have seen Indian batsmen get out to the bouncer but trust me, this has to be one of weirdest ways of getting out. Lovely bouncer and Pant was stuck on the crease, probably beaten for both pace and bounce. Fails to drop his wrists in time and it flies high off the glove. It's a dolly for the KKR skipper and suddenly, the visitors are right back in this with the twin strikes. The in-form Pant has to go. He has a wry smile on his face as he walks back. Knows that it looked comical. On second viewing, the ball didn't bounce much at all but Pant wasn't looking at the ball in any case. 'Never take your eyes off the ball', they say. Pant c Karthik b A Russell 0(1)

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, great placement! Nobody in the deep behind square on the off-side and all Iyer had to do was beat the man in the ring. That he does with a fine back foot cut. Too short and wide, got the treatement

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, absolutely bludgeoned! We have seen quite a bit of these flat-batted strokes tonight and this one from Iyer is another cracker. Shortish and outside off, he makes room a touch on the back foot and smears this over long-off. All the way

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, chance goes down! Uthappa the man at long-on, don't think he would have managed to stay inside the ropes even if he caught this. Fuller ball and it was lofted down the ground by Iyer. Didn't quite get the elevation on it anc went flat. Luckily for him, just about manages to go for a biggie. Brings up the 50 for Iyer! What a way to start his IPL captaincy stint!

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, scorching stroke! Iyer is going bonkers here. Expecting the shorter length and makes room before launching it over wide long-off. There was a fielder there but this was wider and higher as well. Back to back biggies for the skipper. He is having a ball on captaincy debut

Narine to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, dropped again! Rana is the man again and he fails to judge this skier well. Ends up tipping it over the ropes at long-on for a biggie. Floated up around middle, Iyer went for the lofted stroke down the ground and this went high up into the night sky before setting towards a confused Rana who ended up putting it down

Narine to Maxwell, SIX, gets hold of this one! Finally, Maxwell has middled one and sends this way over long-on for a six. Huge strike! Was backing away to make room and Narine shortened the length to help the Australian's cause. Blasted away over the long-on fence

Johnson to Maxwell, SIX, that's a flat hit! Tells you what one confident stroke can do. Maxwell is now striking them well. The short ball and he swivels to get inside the line before pulling over short fine leg. Clears the ropes as well

Johnson to Maxwell, FOUR, hammers this! Very full and outside off, Maxwell holds his shape and lifts it straight over the bowler's head. Dead straight and it rockets to the fence. 11 off the over, a good one but those three dot balls, will they hurt on this seemingly belter of a pitch? Another over left though to make up for it

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, high in the air....well over the fence! Booming stroke! Mavi isn't hitting the right length, fuller ball outside off and Iyer was already making room for the inside out stroke. Sends this into orbit with that bat swing of his

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, makes no difference! It won't as well if he continues with this length, Mavi. Fullish attacking the sticks, Iyer just shuffles across a touch and sends this flying over deep mid-wicket for a biggie. Another six that had plenty of height on it. Two towering strikes! Perfect start to the over for DD

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, out Maxwell Run Out!! Sharp from Mavi! Was quick to gather this in his followthrough from Karthik's throw and threw the stumps down at the bowler's end. Maxwell was backing away for the single and was never going to make it back. Slow off cutter outside off, Iyer tried to slog across the line but only got a bottom edge towards Karthik. Maxwell wanted the bye but in the end, had to go. Maxwell run out (Karthik/Shivam Mavi) 27(18) [4s-1 6s-2]

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, massacred away! The Shreyas Iyer show continues. Full and in the slot, poor bowling and it's been punished as well. Shoveled away over deep mid-wicket for another huge six

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, what a shot! He's been playing breathtaking strokes for fun tonight. Here is another of those. Fullish length and Iyer sits in the crease before and blasts it down the ground towards long-off. No chance for the fielder there

Chawla to Munro, FOUR, beautifully played, nicely tossed up on off, Munro gets a big stride forward, gets close to the ball and drives it back past the non-striker, beats mid-off and rolls away to the fence

Chawla to Munro, FOUR, streaky but four, tossed up slower and spinning away from outside off, Munro was making room on the inside out drive, doesn't cover for the spin and slices it over backward point, couple of bounces and over the fence

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, lovely, how well did Prithvi read this leg break? This was tossed up well outside off and spun away, Prithvi gets a big stride forward, plays with the turn and goes inside out over cover, one bounce and over the ropes

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Prithvi, Chawla dropped this one short and on the leg-stump line, pulled away hard and past square leg, beats the fielder getting across from the deep

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, ends the innings in style! Take a bow, Shreyas Iyer! Phenomenal stuff! Mavi loses his length (once more) and sprays this outside off on a good length, Iyer sits deep in the crease and flat-bats this merrily over long-off. What a way to finish! DD end on 219/4!
Shivam Mavi to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, cracking shot, back of a length and just outside off, Prithvi stands tall, plays with a straight bat and punches, beats point and rolls away to the fence
Shivam Mavi to Munro, FOUR, clobbered, Munro comes down the track, that allows him to free his arms and deposits it back past the bowler, beat mid-on to his right and races away to the fence

Narine to Munro, FOUR, nicely played! It wasn't a bad ball from Narine, slower and on the off-stump line, Munro made room by backing away, waits on the ball and finds the gap past cover with a blazing drive

Narine to Munro, SIX, lovely from Munro, he's showing why he's the number one T20I batsman in the world. This was tossed up on the stumps, Munro bent down on his knees and swept it high and over deep mid-wicket, deep into the crowd for a maximum
Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, lovely, full and wide of off, Prithvi needs no second invitation as he threw his hands at that, clears cover-point and races away to the fence

Shivam Mavi to Munro, out Bowled!! Lovely delivery from Mavi and he gets rid of the dangerous Munro. This was very full and on the stumps, bowled at 143 kmph. Not quite the yorker, but good enough for Munro, he was making room for the slog, gets a bottom-edge and the ball clatters into the base of middle-stump. A send off from the youngster and KKR get their first wicket. Munro b Shivam Mavi 33(18) [4s-4 6s-2]

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's nicely played by Prithvi, let the ball come onto him, used the pace on the ball and then nudged it behind square on the on-side, beat the man in the ring and rolls away to the fence

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, the helicopter is out, MS will be proud of this shot. Length delivery on the stumps, Prithvi waits on it, then brings his wrists into play and flicks it stylishly over mid-wicket, all the way over the ropes
Boult to Chris Lynn, FOUR, wrong lines from Trent Boult, pounds it short and sprays it around the ribcage, Lynn swivels and smacks the pull behind square
Maxwell to Narine, SIX, that ain't coming back. Woof! What.A.Strike.Sunil.Narine. Doesn't move an inch, keeps himself steady and lifts Maxwell high into the night sky. Way back over the sightscreen
Maxwell to Narine, FOUR, no-one's preventing this one. Halftracker outside off stump, Narine transfers his weight onto the back foot and hammers it powerfully wide of extra cover

Maxwell to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Wah! Look at beaming smile on Maxi's face. Boy, is he delighted! Lands this on a length and gets the ball to drift back slightly around off, Lynn wasn't fuly committed on the forward push, plays tentatively and inside-edges it back onto his stumps. Chris Lynn b Maxwell 5(6) [4s-1]

Plunkett to A Russell, FOUR, no fooling around this time! Stays back for the slower delivery and then thumps the ball away between mid-wicket and long-on for a four. That was out of the top-drawer from Russell
Avesh Khan to A Russell, SIX, thwack, thwack, thwack! That ball had wings. Infact Russell lent wings to it. Short delivery, sat up and the batsman thumped the ball away over mid-wicket for a maximum

Avesh Khan to A Russell, SIX, Russell will go down fighting. Correction - swinging.. That was short, at the body from round the wicket but Russell was ready. Opens his stance, and then muscles the ball over the on-side for a huge six. The second tier stand at deep square leg was peppered

Boult to A Russell, SIX, Ho ho! This man. Brute.. That was in the zone, pitched up and the batsman backed away to murder that over long-on. The Russell show has started. Bring on your crash helmets, folks!!

Boult to A Russell, FOUR, not all brawn with this man. Stands up and steers the ball over point for a four. That runs away into the fence. The ball was short and outside off, the room was there to send it away
Mishra to Shubman Gill, FOUR, dances down the track, picks up the googly and hoicks the ball away through mid-wicket and long-on for a four. KKR will take it, with open arms
Mishra to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, fifty of the partnership comes up as the batsman chopped the cut away to pick up a couple. The man at sweeper cover was a little too square
Rahul Tewatia to A Russell, SIX, inside out and it is a mighty one! Flighted well outside off and the batsman gave it more air-time by plundering the ball over covers. DD will start to sweat

Rahul Tewatia to A Russell, FOUR, more perspiration on the part of the DD team. Well tossed up delivery and the batsman this time thumps the ball over the bowler's head for a four. That was brutal again

Mishra to A Russell, out Shubman Gill Run Out!! The young man is gone. The calling between the two had been poor and Shubman Gill to suffer. That was chopped away into the off-side, sans any timing and despite not a great throw and desperate dive, Gill does not make it. The keeper did well to whip the bails off. Shubman Gill run out (Shreyas Iyer/Pant) 37(29) [4s-3 6s-1]

Mishra to Shivam Mavi, out Bowled!! This has been a nightmare. Finally, it ends for Shivam Mavi. That was a slow googly, the batsman was too early into the pull and misses it. The ball takes its time to tickle the leg-stick. To make matters worse for KKR, maiden over from Mishy! The three dots also would not have helped the equation for KKR. DD look set to break their jinx. Shivam Mavi b Mishra 0(3)

Avesh Khan to A Russell, out Bowled!! The base of the off-pole has been struck hard. Yorkerish delivery and the batsman trying to create room, misses it. Avesh Khan gets carried away as well after the wicket. Shouts a mouthful at the batsman. Can't interpret that. But that is GAME.SET.MATCH for DD. First Shaw, then Iyer, now Avesh Khan. DD being pulled along by the young guns. A Russell b Avesh Khan 44(30) [4s-3 6s-4]

Maxwell to Chawla, out Caught by Munro!! The DD boys can do nothing wrong tonight. Slog swept and the man at deep backward square leg jumps up and grabs it with the tip of his fingers. Superb take at the boundary line. That was hit flat and well but the fielder did well to keep his balance at the fence and grab it. In the end, the momentum on the shot almost meant the ball would explode through his fingers but it did not. Chawla c Munro b Maxwell 2(4)
Maxwell to Kuldeep Yadav, FOUR, down leg, swept fine and that will run away to the fence
Boult to Johnson, FOUR, does not miss out on the timing despite backing away. Too full and the batsman screamed the drive away through the cover region for a four

Boult to Uthappa, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! Trent Boult is such a good operator with the ball. Does have plenty of variations to nip out wickets at will. Bowls it short and creates that uncomfortable angle for Uthappa - around middle and off - no room whatsoever. A horrible mistimed shot that, the pull, spoons straight to Prithvi Shaw at mid-wicket. Uthappa c Prithvi Shaw b Boult 1(2)
Boult to Narine, SIX, pressure? Narine just doesn't know what that means. Sets himself up for a shorter length delivery, clears his front leg and goes tonkkkkkkk straight of long-off
Boult to Narine, SIX, same result! Boult persists with the shorter length, Narine whistles it into the same area with a mighty bat swing

Boult to Johnson, FOUR, slogged away off a length ball towards the deep mid-wicket fence but does not matter. DD win this by 55 runs. This has been a superb show from DD, ably led by their new skipper - Shreyas Iyer. Two vital points and KKR have been jolted badly by this

Boult to Narine, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Boult seems to have come out with a clear plan against Narine which is to bowl short and only short. One swing too many from Narine, not in the best of positions (having cleared the front leg) to flay the ball over the off-side ring; goes for it and lobs it off the toe-end. Iyer calls in early from mid-off, runs forward and grabs it with a slide. Narine c Shreyas Iyer b Boult 26(9) [4s-1 6s-3]

Avesh Khan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, that ball went searching for the middle of the blade. Nitish Rana was in such a good position, everything right about it; reads the length early, punches crisply in the gap behind point with a still head. Take four

Avesh Khan to Nitish Rana, out Caught&Bowled!! KKR are falling apart. Another wicket off a short ball. Nitish Rana was in no position to play the pull, still goes for it and pays the ultimate price. It came onto him quickly and was cramped for room to play the pull; loops up off the splice and the bowler takes the simplest of catches running forward. Nitish Rana c and b Avesh Khan 8(7) [4s-1]

Avesh Khan to Shubman Gill, FOUR, one bounce and over the ropes. Making batting look so simple is Shubman Gill. Waits for this length ball to arrive and lifts the punch over mid-off with impeccable timing
Plunkett to Karthik, SIX, short and in his arc. DK swivels a touch and plays the pick-up pull over short fine. All the way for a maximum

Vijay Shankar to Shubman Gill, SIX, time for Shubman Gill to show what he's got. Pitched up and right in the swinging zone outside off, Gill marmalizes it over long-off with a clean swing of the willow

Mishra to Karthik, out Caught by Boult!! Plays against the spin and perishes. Looks to go over long-on/mid-wicket with a wild swing and ends up slicing a dolly of a catch to backward point. Half the side back in the hut now. Karthik c Boult b Mishra 18(18) [6s-1]

Mishra to Shubman Gill, FOUR, tad short and keeps eerily low on middle, but Gill does well to keep his eyes on the ball and slam the pull along the ground through mid-wicket. A diving effort by the fielder at deep mid-wicket goes in vain
McClenaghan to Rayudu, SIX, smashed. Down the track and to the pitch of the length delivery then lifts it straight back over the bowler. No holding back from Rayudu and he gets the crowd going

McClenaghan to Raina, FOUR, just wide of Ishan Kishan, but poor bowling from McClenaghan, sliding down and easy for Raina to get inside the line and help the ball with a faint tickle. Does enough to get it past the keeper

Krunal Pandya to Rayudu, out Caught by Cutting!! Andre Gomes hangs on. Cutting if you are confused. No power on the slog-sweep by Rayudu, knelt down to slog it, but found deep mid to a nicety. Krunal Pandya held back the length a little and got his man. Looked a tired shot to me. Rayudu c Cutting b Krunal Pandya 46(35) [4s-2 6s-4]

Hardik Pandya to Dhoni, FOUR, wow. Incredible hands by Dhoni. And almost six. One bounce over the ropes. Full and with mid-off up was asking for trouble. Dhoni whiplashed it over the fielder. Raw power

Hardik Pandya to Dhoni, FOUR, now goes over mid-wicket. Predictably Hardik Pandya pings it short, Dhoni is waiting on the back foot. Hammered the pull and there's no-one at deep mid. Takes another boundary. Intelligence and cricket awareness on display

Markande to Dhoni, FOUR, that's the genius of Dhoni. He was beaten in flight and had he not reached out low and found bat on ball, would've given Kishan a chance for a stumping, but stretches to his full reach and then carves it over wide long-off, for a one bounce over the ropes four. Incredible

Markande to Dhoni, SIX, massacred over wide long-on. Again those hands. Down the track and then helicoptered miles into the crowd. The CSK crowd are sent into pangs of uncontrolled emotion. They are going wild
Bumrah to Raina, FOUR, fine leg was inside the circle and Raina gets four. Gets inside the line and then waits for the off-pace delivery which is short, pulled well wide of short fine
Bumrah to Raina, FOUR, and Raina will go wide and over that man. Helped by Bumrah bowling a low full-toss, on the pads, flicked into the gap and Raina gets to 50

McClenaghan to Dhoni, out Caught by Lewis!! Dhoni falls into the trap. There's a deep cover in place for the lofted hit and Dhoni has found the man. Low full-toss outside off, it looked like Dhoni was in two minds, whether to go full-blast or not, eventually he chips it to the West Indian on the fence. That is such a massive wicket and MI's ploy has worked. Dhoni c Lewis b McClenaghan 26(21) [4s-3 6s-1]

McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Markande!! Dwayne Bravo goes for a golden duck. MI are fighting back here. We saw Bravo miscue a few in the last game against RCB as well, but those fell in no-man's land, this sliced cut lands in Markande's hands at backward point. Beaten for pace as McClenaghan found some extra bounce off a short of length. Dwayne Bravo c Markande b McClenaghan 0(1)

Bumrah to Raina, SIX, my word. What a blow that is. The weight is on the back foot but he has powered this slower delivery over wide long-on. Looked like he had hit it straight up but it went all the way

Hardik Pandya to Billings, out Caught by Cutting!! Another slower ball and Billings is gone. Was down the track to hit it over long-on but skewed it off the base of the bat. Easy take for Cutting. The MI dugout erupt after that wicket. Turning out to be a top, top last over this. Billings c Cutting b Hardik Pandya 3(5)

McClenaghan to Watson, FOUR, that has been hit so hard. Rohit at mid-off dove to his right at mid-off, got a hand on that and took the sting out of the shot, but it still raced away to the fence. When Watson saw the pitched up delivery he just plonked his front foot and drilled it

Hardik Pandya to Raina, SIX, Raina ends in style and takes six. Hardik Pandya and Rohit are disappointed. This is a fabulous shot. Even though Hardik Pandya followed him, Raina after making room outside leg, heaved that over wide long-on flat with power to clear the fence. CSK end on 169

Hardik Pandya to Rayudu, FOUR, there's a backward point close in and then a short third man behind him, with no third man in place. Full outside off, Rayudu lashes a square drive in the air and manages to elude the leaping backward point fielder to his left

Krunal Pandya to Watson, out Caught by Markande!! Watson goes and credit to Krunal Pandya for that wicket. Slower and loopier, on off, Watson had to fetch the sweep, can only get a top edge and Markande at square leg almost made a meal of it. Manages to clutch the ball onto his chest and holds on. Important wicket in the powerplay. Watson c Markande b Krunal Pandya 12(11) [4s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Rayudu, SIX, how has Rayudu got that for six? Unbelievable wrists. Down the track and not to the pitch of this length delivery, but he trusts himself and then whips it in the air, Evin Lewis was the man circling under that at deep mid, but it kept sailing over him and then flies over the fence. Stunning batting by Rayudu

Krunal Pandya to Raina, SIX, second ball and Raina takes Krunal Pandya to the deep mid stands. The trademark Raina slog-sweep, as soon as he saw a bit of flight on that tossed up delivery on off, bent down and clattered it. Nice way to get off the mark
Hardik Pandya to Rayudu, FOUR, slower delivery outside off, Rayudu slashes and gets a thick edge that bisects Ishan Kishan and Krunal at short third. Races away
Hardik Pandya to Rayudu, SIX, nothing edgy about this one. Full on off, a clean bat swing from Rayudu and the white ball soars into the long-off stands. Great end to the powerplay for CSK and Rayudu
Krunal Pandya to Raina, FOUR, short and well outside off, Raina reaches out and cuts, beats backward point and sweeper cover has too much ground to cover. Beats him
Cutting to Rayudu, SIX, Cutting ran in hard and then bowled a slower delivery, was right in the lofting zone for Rayudu who got forward and muscled it over long-on. Six more
Cutting to Raina, FOUR, hat-trick of slower balls and so predictable. Raina gets forward and lofts over and wide of mid-off. So easy
Cutting to Raina, 1 run, finally a seam-up quick delivery, on the pads, stylishly whipped but on the bounce to deep square
Markande to Raina, FOUR, too full and too close to Raina, who just lifts it back over the bowler's head. Hit clean and hard, no chance for long-off or long-on

Markande to Raina, SIX, beautiful shot this. Uses his feet and then goes over long-on after getting to the pitch. Hardik was there at long-on but he was left a spectator by the timing on that blow. The CSK WAGS are up and celebrating

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, too much width and Yadav latches onto it. Bit of away-shape for Chahar, but the length is on the shorter side. Too easy for any batsman. Yadav stands tall and slashes it through point. SKY and MI get off the mark

Tahir to Lewis, SIX, carves this googly high and mighty over extra cover. Probably a bit too predictable from the leggie. This is what he was doing against Lewis in the entire last over. This time Lewis anticipates it, sizes it up and smokes it
Tahir to Lewis, SIX, my word, what power down the ground. Short from Tahir, Lewis thwacks it straight back over long-on. It's off the back foot too. Stunning
Dwayne Bravo to Lewis, FOUR, spoils a good over by smearing the ball into the wide long-off boundary. To be fair, Bravo was asking for it by bowling this gentle full toss outside off. Duly punished

Watson to Rohit, SIX, lofted for six with one hand. How well has he timed this. It appeared that Rohit might have been beaten for the lack of pace and was into the loft too early, evidenced by his bottom hand coming off. But mid-off was up, so he had the confidence to go through with it. Ends up getting it right off the middle

Watson to Rohit, SIX, wow, what execution! Gets right under this full ball and lap-sweeps it all the way over short fine leg. Just never looks hurried at all. Quickly took a step across, got down low and again, lovely timing

Dwayne Bravo to Rohit, FOUR, the Mumbai captain is up for it tonight. He's taking control of this chase now. Short of length ball, only chest high, and Rohit dismisses it with an authoritative pull backward of square. Huge cheers. It's a split crowd here

Dwayne Bravo to Lewis, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Slices it up a mile in the air, really cool pressure catch from Thakur at long-off. Big wicket for CSK, straight after the time-out. Good length ball wide of off, gets it out of the batsman's swinging arc. Lewis flings his hands at it, slicing it up right off the bottom. Excellent bowling. Bravo coming to the fore again. Lewis c SN Thakur b Dwayne Bravo 47(43) [4s-3 6s-2]

Watson to Rohit, FOUR, not the best effort from Tahir in the deep, lets the ball sneak through for four. He's immediately removed from that position. Good length ball outside off, Rohit doesn't get all of it but does enough to carve it away through sweeper cover's dive

Watson to Hardik Pandya, SIX, misses his length big time and Pandya laaaaaunches into it. It's a monstrous six over long-on. Probably aimed for the yorker there but ended up bowling right in Pandya's slot. Disappears

SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, low full toss outside off, Rohit ingeniously slices it away over backward point. Shades of the shot Dhoni played the other night, but not quite as good. He just about clears Harbhajan though. Thakur must be crestfallen, this was a perfectly good ball
SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, that previous ball has messed his line up. This time he goes full at the stumps, Rohit shuffles inside the line of it and whips it away to the fine leg boundary. Top batting

SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, hat-trick of fours. Rohit's doing it for Mumbai. Short of length ball outside off, slower one, and the MI skipper is able to thread it through backward point and third man. Brilliantly glided

SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, kills the game off, surely. Tremendous batting from Rohit Sharma. He picks the bowler's mind, reads the incoming yorker and sweeps it away through backward square. Raises a fifty

SN Thakur to Lewis, FOUR, that spoils the over. Not a bad ball by any means. Banged one short and generated good lift, Lewis is late on the pull, off the glove and well wide of MS. Runs away to the fine leg fence
Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries. Length ball on the stumps, Yadav hops across and flicks it very fine. Bhajji is slightly too square and he can't cut it off
Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, nicely done! Ample time for Yadav to pick his spot. Normal-paced shortish ball, no venom in it. Yadav slightly crouches and elevates it over short third man
Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, good placement. Just a bit of width outside off and that's enough for Yadav. Jumps, opens his bat-face at the last moment and forces it through backward point

Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, width served and Yadav doesn't miss out. Was on the shorter side as well and Yadav used the bowler's pace to good effect. Opened the bat-face to punch it through covers. Excellent placement

SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, wow! That's delicious. The bottom hand power, my goodness. Was a full ball on the pads, Yadav just walked across and flicked it over deep backward square leg. Top shot

SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, fuller in length and attacking the stumps, the bat-face is closed to nudge it towards square leg. Off the inside half. This is a good start for MI - 50 in the powerplay!

Tahir to Lewis, byes, FOUR, through Dhoni and that runs away into the fence. Very rare from MS. It was the googly from Tahir and Lewis tries another lofted shot. Is nowhere close to the bat and misses. Was marginally outside the tramline as well. Brushed the CSK skipper's pad and that's four bonus runs for MI

Tahir to Lewis, FOUR, a gift dished out and Lewis accepts it with both hands. He needed that. Connects and collects four. A rank full toss fired by Tahir and Lewis thumps it down the ground. Over the bowler's head and long-off had no chance

Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Jadeja!!Gone! There's the breakthrough and is that the opening CSK were looking for? Game on. What a catch that was from Jaddu. It was a shortish ball and Yadav struck it pretty well. Went back in his crease to pull and got it off middle of the bat. But, in comes Ravindra Jadeja, CSK's best fielder. Sprinted across to his left from deep mid-wicket, had his eyes on the ball and slided to snaffle with both hands. Bhajji runs towards the fielder to applaud the effort. Suryakumar Yadav c Jadeja b Harbhajan 44(34) [4s-5 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, nicely done by Rahane! This tailed in sharply from a fullish length but the line was a bit too straight. Clipped away sweetly past the diving mid-wicket fielder and it raced away to the fence. RR are away

Y Pathan to Stokes, out Bowled!! My word. He's brought on as a roller, to sneak an over under the radar, but such is the power that practically anybody in a Hyderabadi jersey can pick wickets. Pathan holds the ball back in his palm as he fires in a slider. Yes it was short, but certainly not for Stokes to rock back as deep as he did in trying to heave it away. Misses big time, sneaking under the bat. Well under. And yeah, off's uprooted. Stokes b Y Pathan 0(3)
Y Pathan to Rahane, FOUR, slipping down. That's the customary loose stuff a part-timer dishes out. Quick sweep, ensuring it goes very fine

Rashid Khan to Buttler, out Caught by Dhawan!! They're falling. Buttler tries forcing the run-rate, but against Rashid, seriously? Gets a floater around off, tries going downtown with a full-blooded swing. Mistimes, and Dhawan's waiting at long-off, with a pre-loaded thigh slap celebration ready to come out. Buttler c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 10(11)
S Kaul to Rahane, 2 runs, full, tailing back in, dug out to long-on -- credit the second to slow timing and the massive outfields
Rashid Khan to Rahane, SIX, and there. Crunch. Targets the smaller leg-side, premeditates a sweep, slogging it uppishly, deep into mid-wicket. That should simplify things

S Kaul to Lomror, out Caught by Saha!! Wide knuckle ball, angling way across -- tempting Lomror to chase, take on the big boundary. Well he has to. Throws his bat out .. he wouldn't have had a problem even with some sort of a big edge. Gets it off the outside, yes, but not past a flying Saha to his left. Lomror c Saha b S Kaul 11(12)

Basil Thampi to Gowtham, FOUR, gets his line wrong. Gets his length wrong. A yorker in the form of a half volley, the line stays on middle and Gowtham's hoick gets a fat inside edge, through his legs and through a vacant square leg

Basil Thampi to Gowtham, out Caught by Dhawan!! There's the nail. The unlikeliest of ties is out of the equation too. Quite a half volley this, Gowtham can't get under the length though, drills it uppishly, without elevation. This time Dhawan at long-off need not tumble, he can stay and collect. Gowtham c Dhawan b Basil Thampi 8(5) [4s-1]

Shakib to Rahane, FOUR, beautifully timed! Placement was spot on too. Got this wide of mid-on and well to the left of the deep mid-wicket fielder as well. A touch short around middle, skids off the deck and Rahane whips it away with strong wristwork. Nicely done by the skipper

Sandeep Sharma to R Tripathi, out Bowled!! Bowled 'em! Horror stroke from Tripathi and his woes this season continue. On a good length around middle, kept low as well and Tripathi premeditated the charge down the pitch. In the end, he couldn't do much and had to adjust to keep it out. Couldn't and heard the rattle of timber behind him. Just the start SRH would have wanted. R Tripathi b Sandeep Sharma 4(5)

Basil Thampi to Samson, FOUR, delicious shot! Oozing class! Not all that bad a ball, just a fab stroke. On a good length just outside off, Samson just stood tall and cracked the back foot punch on the up. Through the covers and it blazed away. What a shot!

Basil Thampi to Samson, SIX, that's in the stands! Samson is showing no mercy on his State mate. Fractionally short from Thampi and that's all that was needed for the in-form Samson. Swivels to pull this away for a biggie. Didn't get a full chunk of it, didn't have to in the end as it cleared the deep mid-wicket fence with ease

Basil Thampi to Samson, FOUR, clobbered away! This time, Samson connected the pull perfectly and it raced away. Short of a length around middle, not high enough to threaten the batsman and an in-form batsman like Samson isn't going to miss out. Sends this to the deep square leg fence. Thampi needs to recover quickly

S Kaul to Samson, FOUR, such is the form Samson is in, he doesn't need bad balls to score boundaries. Here is another example. A knuckle ball outside off, he just stands tall and uses his supple wrists to drop kick this wide of the long-on fence. The fielder there tried hard but couldn't get to it
Rashid Khan to Rahane, FOUR, 94.8kph, back of the hand stuff, drifting down leg though and generously full. Rahane is quick to pounce on, sits, uses the angle and drills his sweep behind square
Shakib to Rahane, FOUR, a defensive drag down. Rahane stays tall, picks his widely open cow corner. And whips. Splitting the men converging to perfection

S Kaul to Samson, out Caught by Hales!! Times his way to Hales. He just can't look ugly, and the overdose of timing he's got in him isn't quite on par with the fields put out. Kaul brings out his knuckle ball, with a late tail inwards. Samson tries punching it through the on-side, gets it off the middle too, but can't keep it down. Right where short mid-wicket's waiting. Samson c Hales b S Kaul 40(30) [4s-3 6s-1]

D Kulkarni to Hales, FOUR, gentle loosener from Kulkarni and Hales duly dispatches it to the fence. Short, wide and plenty of width on offer, Hales reaches out by flailing his hands at that and bashes it through point, who's dive goes in vain. Real warm-up delivery from Kulkarni..

D Kulkarni to Hales, FOUR, back to shortish length and Hales chooses the mid-wicket region on this occasion. Picked the length extremely early, pivoted back and pulled it firmly in front of square on the leg-side

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, third boundary of the over and you got to feel for the bowler. This full ball swung in late, but how well Dhawan played that. Cleared his front leg in a flash, such quicksilver hands that he flicked it in front of square. The outfield is lighting fast, despite a long chase from the mid-wicket fielder, the ball just about reaches the fence

Lomror to Hales, FOUR, half-tracker and Hales dismisses it from his presence. Ruins a good over from Lomror. Went back in a flash and clouted it brilliantly in the gap between deep mid-wicket and deep square leg

Unadkat to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson takes the adventure route. Walks across his sticks, waits for the ball to arrive and scooped it over short fine leg. Knew the fine leg was inside the ring and hence opted for the shot

Unadkat to Williamson, SIX, Fab stuff. Goes downtown. Moved across a bit, with a clean swing of the bat lifted it nonchalantly over mid-off. Such is the timing that it went sailing all the way for a maximum
Unadkat to Williamson, FOUR, 14 off first three balls. Unadkat overcompensates and hurls it well outside off. Williamson leant across and spanked it with ferocity over extra cover

Unadkat to Williamson, FOUR, oh, he's taking Unadkat to the cleaners. Streaky this time but Williamson won't mind. Throws his bat on this fuller length delivery outside off and gets a thick outside edge that flies away to the third man fence

Unadkat to Williamson, 1 run, fifty for Williamson. Flawless innings from the SRH skipper. Bided his time initially and just stepping the ante now. Nudges it towards mid-wicket, puts on the skates and comes back for the second fuss-free
Jofra Archer to Williamson, SIX, decides to launch Archer over mid-off. Waited in his crease, picked this fuller length delivery early and muscled it over mid-off

Gowtham to Hales, out Caught by Samson!! Gowtham has another! He's bowled exceptionally well today and has started this spell with a bang as well. Hales was moving around the crease and Gowtham smartly dragged this wider outside off. Asked the Englishman to fetch it and he could only slice it high in the air. Easiest of catches for Samson at backward point. Decent start to the IPL for Hales but he would have wanted to kick on and make a really big one. Timely strike for RR because this partnership was starting to open up. Hales c Samson b Gowtham 45(39) [4s-4]

Ish Sodhi to Williamson, out Caught by Buttler!! Huge wicket! Maiden IPL wicket for Sodhi! And it's his NZ skipper that he has sent back. Vital breakthrough for RR because the SRH captain was batting like a dream. This one shot through low shockingly from a good length as Williamson tried to play the cut from the crease. It was a great take from Buttler and S.Ravi felt there was a bottom edge. KW didn't and went for the review. The replays didn't show anything to be honest but the snicko has a different story to tell. Tiniest of spikes or murmurs to be precise and Williamson had to go. Williamson c Buttler b Ish Sodhi 63(43) [4s-7 6s-2]

Ish Sodhi to Shakib, FOUR, nice way to start for Shakib! Premeditates the paddle sweep and makes a fair amount of connection on it as well. Deflected it really fine down the leg-side and it raced away to the fence

Stokes to Manish Pandey, FOUR, up and over! With mid-off in the ring, perhaps not the ideal length from Stokes and he pays the price for it. Fuller ball and allows Pandey to get under it. Lifted cleanly over the fielder who did leap but was never going to get to it

Jofra Archer to Shakib, out Bowled!! Cleans him up! Excellent yorker from Archer and that's the end of Shakib. This was on the base of off stump and although the southpaw could see it coming, he was beaten for pace. Ended up just brushing the off bails. Fantastic comeback from RR, they are dragging things back in spectacular fashion here. Archer was unlucky not to get Williamson earlier with a yorker and was even unfortunate that a catch was put down as well of the Kiwi. Not this time. Shakib b Jofra Archer 6(6) [4s-1]

Jofra Archer to Y Pathan, out Caught by D Kulkarni!! Double strike from Archer! He turned it on at the death against the Mumbai Indians and is at it here as well. What a boost RR have got with his inclusion! Terrific death bowler and this over has been further proof of it. Pacy short ball and although it was a tad wide, Pathan was in no position to play it. Ends up trying to just guide it. Flies straight to the fielder stationed at third man. Y Pathan c D Kulkarni b Jofra Archer 2(3)

Unadkat to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rahane!! SRH are coming apart here in the death overs. Must say that the RR bowlers have been smart as well in reading the surface and executing the plans. Unadkat does what he does best, a slower ball on a good length that Pandey wants to biff by making room. He has no other choice at this stage, does he? However, doesn't connect it well at all and slices it high towards backward point where the RR skipper does the rest. Manish Pandey c Rahane b Unadkat 16(15) [4s-1]

Jofra Archer to Saha, FOUR, lovely shot. Mid-off is up and Archer bowls a fuller length to compound things. Easy for Saha though, he holds his shape and drives beautifully. Splits mid-off and extra cover easily to find the fence. Valuable runs

Jofra Archer to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Stokes!! Archer is having fun here at the death. Gets this third and this is another canny delivery. After a series of fullish balls, he drags back the length and takes all the pace off this one. Rashid was shuffling across for the slog but this got big on him. All he managed was to sky it towards deep mid-wicket. Stokes won't drop those. Rashid Khan c Stokes b Jofra Archer 1(3)

Gowtham to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Bowled 'em. Gowtham sends Dhawan packing back to the hut. Very, very poor shot from the southpaw. Totally misjudged the length there. It was rifled quick outside off, the ball was skidding off the pitch. Dhawan with his knee bent first tried to sweep and then as an afterthought tried to open his bat face to guide it past the solitary slip. But the ball just fizzed off the deck, took his inside edge and deflected back onto the stumps. Gowtham breaks into a celebratory jig. Just the wicket RR wanted, the dangerous Dhawan back to the hut early. Dhawan b Gowtham 6(4) [4s-1]

D Kulkarni to Williamson, FOUR, Kulkarni has been leaking boundaries. Errs in line again and provides width for Williamson, well outside off. KW just reaches across and slaps it square on the off-side

Jofra Archer to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson's special. Classic on-drive. Archer feeds a half-volley on the stumps, Williamson just shifted his weight forward, presented a full face of the bat and drove it neatly past mid-on. No need to run for those as it races away to the fence

Ish Sodhi to Williamson, FOUR, rank long hop and Williamson won't spare those. Well outside off, Williamson rocks back, picks his spot and hammers it to the cow corner fence. Threaded the gap beautifully

Ish Sodhi to Hales, 1 run, has Stokes taken this? Ah, nope. He signals he hasn't taken it. But outstanding effort there from the Englishman. Brownie points should be handed there, of course the fairplay points. Googly from Sodhi, lands it full at the stumps. Hales whacked it hard and flat to deep mid-wicket. Stokes stomped forward, dived and went with both hands only for the ball to bobble out of his hands. Hales' heart would've been in his mouth for a second there
Ish Sodhi to Williamson, FOUR, excellent from Williamson. Goes inside-out over extra cover. Saw the flighted delivery early, bent low and lifted it effortlessly over extra cover

Stokes to Hales, FOUR, back to back fours for SRH. Stokes ushers a short ball at Hales, no venom and he went back to smoke it in the gap between deep square leg and fine leg. Hales having a move on here

U Yadav to Narine, SIX, effortless from Narine, back of a length and just outside off, a gentle loosener from Umesh, Narine stands tall and punches it over mid-off, sailed all the way over the ropes for a maximum
U Yadav to Narine, FOUR, Narine is hurting RCB once again, short of a length and just outside off, Narine rides the bounce and steers it over short third man, no one in the deep and it's a boundary
Chahal to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa's looking ominous. He sizes up this overpitched delivery, gets his front leg out of the way and swings through the line. Clean six into the sightscreen
U Yadav to Uthappa, SIX, smashes this into the crowd. 143kph, short of length around the waist, Uthappa treats it with disdain. He belts it away from his presence. Gee that flew off the bat

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, out Caught by Southee!! The dangerous Uthappa falls. He's lured into the big shot due to the flight, but gets it right off the toe-end. Had to reach out for the loft, as the line was wide from Ashwin. It's very smartly bowled actually. The ball grips away further to take the bottom of the bat. Southee hangs on at long-on. Uthappa c Southee b Murugan Ashwin 36(21) [4s-3 6s-3]
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, crashes the sweep away behind square. He's doing nothing else, just sweeping. Gets the length he wants and muscles it
Chahal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, sweeps it away to long leg, brings up a fifty
Murugan Ashwin to Nitish Rana, FOUR, oh poor finish to the spell from Ashwin. Lands the googly outside leg and is punished. Rana grounds his back knee to sweep it over short fine

Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Chahal fails to cut it off. He gave it his best, sprinting across and diving from deep backward point but couldn't get a strong enough hand. But how well has Rana timed this yorker. It's very close to the blockhole if not right in it, but Rana slices it superbly through the off-side

Siraj to A Russell, out Caught by de Kock!! This is huuuuuuuuge. Golden duck for Russell on his birthday and the Chinnaswamy finds its voice. Siraj bends his back as he bangs it in, rushes Russell on the pull and balloons off a top-edge. Well taken by de Kock running back. Massive blow. A Russell c de Kock b Siraj 0(1)
Siraj to Karthik, FOUR, full in the slot for Karthik who smears it away through extra cover. Excellent finish to the over from the captain. Hammered this drive to the fence
Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, back-to-back fours. The power of Lynn coming to the fore. Low full toss, not an easy ball to hit but Lynn muscles it straight of long-on

Southee to Karthik, FOUR, flurry of runs in the last few balls and suddenly KKR are bossing this. Short of length delivery, Karthik beautifully swivels into the pull and helps it into the gap between deep square and fine leg. His timing's on fire
Siraj to Karthik, SIX, puts the seal on it. Crushing blow from Dinesh Karthik. He's offered a good length ball from Siraj, sets himself up and drills it over mid-off. Just over the ropes

Siraj to Karthik, out Caught by Kohli!! Breathtaking catch from Kohli. Phew. It's a mistimed loft from Karthik down the ground and it would have landed short for most fielders at long-on. But Kohli races in and then comes up with some stunning acrobatics. Karthik c Kohli b Siraj 23(10) [4s-2 6s-1]
U Yadav to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's it. 18-year old Shubman Gill slaps this short ball to the point boundary and swings his bat in celebration. Back-to-back defeats for RCB at the Chinnaswamy
Southee to Narine, FOUR, top-edge and four, another lucky boundary for Narine, banged in short and on the stumps, Narine swivelled across on the pull, gets a fat top-edge that lobs over short fine

Southee to Narine, FOUR, just over mid-on, not RCB's night? Short and at the stumps, Narine backed away on the pull, gets it right off the bottom of the bat, but has enough to clear mid-on for a boundary
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, lovely shot, tossed up well outside off, Lynn shuffles across, gets well outside off and sweeps it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Chahal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, chance and dropped, heads dropped in the RCB camp. It's Murugan Ashwin who has dropped the sitter. Lovely teasing bowling from Chahal, slowed down the pace, this was the leg-break which turned from leg-stump, Lynn was done in by the flight, gets a leading edge towards extra-cover. Ashwin had plenty of time as he ran back from cover, had the ball covered, juggled it twice and shells it
U Yadav to Chris Lynn, FOUR, low full-toss and that has been drilled through cover, Lynn got his bat down like a sledge hammer and thread the ball through the infield
U Yadav to Chris Lynn, SIX, smashed, length ball on the stumps, that was right in the slot for Lynn, he cleared his left leg and hammered it back over the bowler's head, flat and over the ropes
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, cracking shot, tad too full and too wide from Chahal, Lynn backs away and drills it over cover, one bounce and into the fence
Siraj to Chris Lynn, FOUR, cracking shot, short and wide of off, Lynn makes room, gets on top of the bounce and clatters it to the right of point, no stopping that

Murugan Ashwin to Narine, out Caught by de Grandhomme at long-off!!.. and Murugan Ashwin strikes with his first ball. This was tossed up nicely outside off, right in Narine's hitting zone, he took up the bait and was looking to cream it back over the bowler's head. The bat turned in his hands at the point of impact, he ended up slicing it high and towards long-off. de Grandhomme completes a fine catch. He had to make sure that he didn't step onto the ropes as he completed the catch - which he did. Relief for RCB and Chinnaswamy finds its voice back. Narine c de Grandhomme b Murugan Ashwin 27(19) [4s-3 6s-1]

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, SIX, just over CDG, this was tossed up on off, Uthappa got a big stride forward and lifted it with the turn, high and towards long-on. CDG looked very interested for the catch, went with his outstretched right hand, but only tipped it over the ropes
Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, that's poor from the fielder at short fine, too straight from Siraj, on Uthappa's pads and he flicked it fine. Beat Ashwin's awkward dive and rolled away to the fence

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR, beautifully played, overpitched and on Uthappa's pads, he leans forward, gets close to the ball and then plays the on-drive, beat the two fielders in the deep to a nicety
Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR, this is turning out to be an expensive over from Ashwin, dropped this one short and well outside off, Uthappa waits on it and then reverse laps it past the lone slip

Murugan Ashwin to Chris Lynn, FOUR, third boundary of the over, slower and shorter of off, Lynn bends down low and places it into the vacant gap at deep mid-wicket, split the two men in the deep to perfection

Narine to de Kock, FOUR, how slow is Uthappa? My word. Took an age to realise where the ball was going and then gave chase, but can only parry it onto the ropes. Wasn't so well-timed but Uthappa picked it up late from the bat and his sprinting ability left a lot to be desired
Narine to de Kock, FOUR, to the left of Uthappa now. No chance for him this time, another sweep, dragged from middle but gets it wide of short fine and it just raced away. de Kock gets going

A Russell to Vohra, out Bowled!! Bowled him. Russell strikes again. Does a little jig to celebrate his second wicket on his birthday. Tailed in late and took the inside edge before cannoning off the back boot onto the stumps. Vohra was giving the charge and was late on the shot, the incoming delivery sneaked through. A bit unlucky but that's how it can go in this format. Vohra b A Russell 0(1)

A Russell to Mandeep, 1 run, unbelievable shot from Mandeep under the circumstances. Dropped by Rana running back from short third. Was a short ball outside off, Mandeep left the bat llike a periscope and it looped off the toe, Rana was unsure which way to catch and what hand to use, eventually he circled around it and it went down

A Russell to Kohli, FOUR, my word. What a shot. Half-volley outside off, Kohli has dispatched that royally through the covers. No-one moved. But seems to have done some damage to his right-leg after over-stretching on the drive. A limp or two but looks like he will shrug it off
Johnson to Kohli, FOUR, no problems with the timing there. Picks the slower delivery outside off and then laces the cover-drive on the rise, sheer timing and leaves sweeper cover as a spectator

Narine to Kohli, FOUR, for a moment when he sliced that, looked like he had holed out, but perfectly placed between deep cover and long-off. Picked the one that goes away, sliced the loft and it is a one bounce over the ropes four

Shivam Mavi to Kohli, FOUR, beautiful touch. Slower ball outside off, Kohli uses the wide gap between backward point and short third to direct the ball there. Shivam Mavi perhaps gave Kohli too much room outside off to play that shot
Shivam Mavi to Kohli, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Kohli needs to miss backward point and the sweeper, does so easily, launches it in the air and well wide of both the men, races away
Narine to Mandeep, SIX, brilliant slog-sweep. Over deep mid. Too full and tossed up outside off, Mandeep kneels down and finds the biggie that his side needs

Narine to Mandeep, SIX, fine blow. Two big hits from Mandeep in this over and both have come when it has been tossed up and in the teeing off range. This time Mandeep goes straight back over the bowler's head. Good over for RCB - 15 off it

A Russell to Kohli, SIX, Kohli is pointing his finger at someone. After hitting that for six over long-on. Full and in the slot, Kohli unleashes the short-arm jabbed flick that sends the ball over the crowd. We saw MSD do that against Negi in the last game, but this is trademark Kohli. How does he get under the ball with such a low backlift and generate so much power is incredibly unbelievable

A Russell to Mandeep, out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Can Mandeep clear deep mid? No he can't. Caught right at the edge of the boundary. A slower delivery on off, Mandeep swings and doesn't get the elevation he needs. Bit more power and it would've been six. Mandeep c Shivam Mavi b A Russell 19(14) [6s-2]

A Russell to Kohli, 2 runs, 50 for Kohli and his missus is up there clapping. As are the crowd. Kohli doesn't care to celebrate. He is busy getting his breath back. Slugged wide of deep mid to get to 50

A Russell to Kohli, SIX, now he raises the bat to celebrate. Back of the hand slower delivery from Russell, but too full and Kohli gets under this and directs the short-arm jab flat wide of long-on. Brilliant brilliant use of the wrists. That's all one can say

Johnson to de Grandhomme, SIX, missed the yorker and goes for six. Turns out to be a slower delivery, de Grandhomme sits down and slices it over the sweeper, gets enough on it to go all the way. Kohli likes it and roars 'come on'

Johnson to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's Brendon McCullum at his best. Brings the crowd to life. A shimmy down the wicket and then throws his fast hands on the short of length delivery, scythed over extra-cover. Brutal hit

Johnson to Kohli, SIX, six to end. Shuffles across and inside the line, too predictable, slower delivery again, Kohli swings it to the deep backward square leg fence. No-one there and anyway it has the legs to go over the fence. RCB end with 175

Johnson to de Kock, SIX, Johnson has a wry smile at de Kock. Won't help though. Pace on the ball and off the bat as well. Full on middle, de Kock makes room and goes over cover, hit well and just about clears the ropes
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, a shimmy but stays in the crease and slog-sweeps, to the right of deep mid, in the gap and well placed to get a one bounce over the ropes four
Narine to de Kock, FOUR, bit more air, and de Kock sweeps hard, beats mid-wicket on the dive to his left and deep square has no chance. Too full and de Kock found the middle of the bat

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, SIX, when it is tossed up, Brendon McCullum will look to play over mid-wicket. That's his signature shot. Sit down and then slog-sweep the spinner. Connects beautifully and loops over deep mid

Chawla to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, horrible umpiring. Really poor. How is that runs? Brendon McCullum is beaten all ends up by one that squares him up, pitched on middle, turned past the bat and hit the back leg, raced away past DK. Chawla went for a slight appeal and then kept quiet. Llong the ump who has given it as runs. Not even close to the bat. KKR should've reviewed that, but since it was given as runs, they didn't go for it
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, short third didn't even move. Nor did backward point. Short and wide outside off, cut right into the gap between the two

Chawla to Brendon McCullum, SIX, muscled. Dragged down by Chawla and Brendon McCullum decides to go over long-on. Pure power from the Kiwi. Biffed that off the back foot and watched the ball go over long-on. 14 to him off Chawla in that over and he gets a move on

Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Gone first ball after the break. Slower and turns away from the advancing de Kock, who still goes through with the inside out hit, can only lift it up in the air for sweeper to run around to his left and take. A fist pump from Kuldeep Yadav to celebrate the wicket. de Kock c Shubman Gill b Kuldeep Yadav 29(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

A Russell to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by Karthik!! Quick short ball and he gets Brendon McCullum. McCullum actually was intending to send the ball to Banshankari, was through with the pull too early and it took the toe of the bat and looped to DK. No need for the umpire to make any decision on that. Off walks McCullum. Brendon McCullum c Karthik b A Russell 38(28) [4s-4 6s-2]

Boult to Watson, no run, drama that is what kick-starts match number 30. That looked close. The ball nipped in and struck the pads. Bat first is what the third umpire reckoned and Watson survives. That was mighty close. That looked dead but the on-field umpire said it not out and rightly so as there seemed to be a faint inside edge
Boult to Watson, FOUR, full, swinging in, clipped away, four..That sped away off the bat in a jiffy. Little bit of erring in line and put away
Vijay Shankar to Watson, 1 run, doesn't take toll of the Free Hit, Watson. Fuller ball and he wanted to smash hard down the ground. Mistimes it and it flies towards long-off

Vijay Shankar to du Plessis, out Caught by Boult!! This time, Faf holes out! He struggled to get going barring a couple of boundaries and finally, perishes in a bid to up the ante. Fuller ball and a bit wide outside off, he tried to go over the man at long-off but didn't middle this at all. Easiest of catches for Boult near the ropes. Finally the partnership is broken and DD will want to drag things back a bit now. Won't be easy though as there is some serious firepower to come for CSK. du Plessis c Boult b Vijay Shankar 33(33) [4s-3 6s-1]

Maxwell to Raina, out Bowled!! One brings two for DD and this is a massive wicket. The in-form Raina departs second ball. It's a first-ball wicket for Maxwell as well. Drifts this in just around off, straightens a tad off the deck as Raina went for a wild hoick across the line. Bizarre shot to play very early in the innings but he probably thought that the surface is good to start blasting straight away. Got burnt eventually. Just the kind of momentum DD were looking for. Raina b Maxwell 1(2)

Vijay Shankar to Rayudu, FOUR, connects this time! Clear intent from Rayudu, walks down the track and makes room to loft it inside out over extra cover. Clean strike and it races to the fence on the bounce

Vijay Shankar to Watson, FOUR, easy pickings! Full toss and a lot of width outside off as well, Watson doesn't even need these gifts in the kind of form that he is in tonight. Absolutely feasts on it with a slice through backward point. Sweeper had no chance

Vijay Shankar to Watson, FOUR, more power from Watson! There was a deep cover in place but he was a mere spectator as this blazed to the fence. Fuller ball outside off, juicy enough for Watson to lift it over extra cover. Cracked it away

Mishra to Rayudu, FOUR, freebie from Mishra and it's vanished to the fence in no time. Sprayed full and well down leg, Rayudu just had to beat the man at short fine leg and he does so with a hard sweep. All too easy

Mishra to Watson, out Caught by Plunkett at long-off!! Respite for DD! The Watson show is over for the night. But boy, what an innings it was! Pure carnage and ruthlessness from the Australian who certainly was at his vintage best. Cleverly bowled by Mishra though, flighted it up invitingly, might have been the googly and the lofted stroke went flat towards long-off. Plunkett won't drop those. This is a good passage of play for the Daredevils. They are quietly chipping away at the wickets. Watson c Plunkett b Mishra 78(40) [4s-4 6s-7]

Mishra to Dhoni, SIX, thumped away! Floated googly and fuller outside off, Dhoni was on the charge and although this was wider in line, he trusted his strong bottom hand to launch. And launch he did, flat over long-off

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, that's gone all the way! How flat he is sending this into the stands?? Wow! Fractionally short and slower in pace, Dhoni just swivels and absolutely cracks this pull over deep mid-wicket. He is looking ominous straightaway

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, kaboooooom! Another one! Dhoni is on the rampage now. Fuller in length around off, he just stands deep in the crease and belts this over long-on. Comfortably clears the fielder over there. The skipper is infusing momentum back into the innings

Boult to Dhoni, FOUR, he is playing around with the field here. Dhoni is on a roll. He is expecting the short ball and swivels to pull this wide of the man at short fine leg. Dhoni is motoring along here. DD need to somehow stop him

Boult to Rayudu, FOUR, Rayudu joins in the fun now and Boult is getting a severe beating here. Misses the yorker anmd gives a low full toss, Rayudu is already across the stumps and wrists it away powerfully wide of the long-on fielder. Nicely done

Plunkett to Rayudu, FOUR, gets it away very fine. Smart batting from Rayudu but this is equally poor from Plunkett who is having a horror night. Too straight in line on this short ball, Rayudu swivels across to get inside the line and pulls it away. Fine leg was too square

Plunkett to Rayudu, SIX, that's glorious from Rayudu! Talk about being in ripe form, this is another example of it. Premeditates the charge down the pitch and lofts it straight over the bowler's head. Dead straight and comfortably over the ropes

Plunkett to Rayudu, FOUR, bleeding runs. They have no clue how to bowl to these two at the moment. Plunkett pulls his length back but the width is there outside off, Rayudu just slashes hard at it and gets a slice that beats short third man comfortably to his left. Not exactly where he intended but he won't mind

Avesh Khan to Dhoni, 1 run, dropped! That's a dolly and Munro has spilled it. Short ball and Dhoni pulled it aerially to deep mid-wicket. Didn't connect that well but got lucky in the end. Munro probably didn't pace himself well there but no excuses really. How much will this cost DD?

Avesh Khan to Dhoni, SIX, that's deep into the crowd! After a series of good deliveries, Avesh loses his composure. Tries the yorker to be fair to him but it ends up as a juicy full toss. Clubbed away way over deep square leg. 108 meters it is! Second longest one of the tournament

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, no he cannot! Because he is bowling to someone who is in insane hitting form this season. Misses the yorker and it's a low full toss, Dhoni just uses his quick hands and it's a short arm jab. Comfortably over deep square leg. No effort at all there

Boult to Dhoni, FOUR, blasted away! Doesn't matter where you bowl to him when he is in this mood. Banged in short by Boult and Dhoni was down the track in a flash, flat-batted it powerfully past the Kiwi who did well to get out of the way. Rockets past mid-off who was in the ring. Incredible, simply incredible

Boult to Dhoni, out Rayudu Run Out!! That's the end of Rayudu, wanted to get on strike as Dhoni had missed the pull but the CSK captain remained unmoved. Pant was quick to throw it towards Boult who fired a direct hit at the other end. Rayudu was way short and was never going to make it. Another valuable contribution from him nevertheless. Rayudu run out (Pant/Boult) 41(24) [4s-5 6s-1]
Boult to du Plessis, FOUR, throws his hands at it and gets a thick edge. The ball flies away to third man and a lazy effort from Avesh Khan at deep third man allows the ball to slip under his hands

Boult to Watson, FOUR, gentle from the giant! That was short from round the wicket and the little bit of room was used well by Watson. Just guided the ball between point and short third man for a four

Boult to Dhoni, 2 runs, very full and outside off, Dhoni gets under it and smacks it hard to the left of long-off. They race back for the second and it's Dhoni's third fifty of IPL 2018! What a gala time he is having! CSK finish on a massive 211/4

Rahul Tewatia to du Plessis, FOUR, drops it short and that helped the batsman as he was backing away. Drop kicks the ball over the off-side for a four. Much needed for Faf and CSK. Breaking the shackles moment?

Plunkett to Watson, SIX, short ball, journey ball! That has gone into the stands. The batsman does not bother to go on the back foot and pulls it off the front foot. That was a bad bad delivery and the deep square leg region was peppered with the sinews working in tandem

Plunkett to Watson, SIX, pick up off the pads. And the spectators pick it in the stands. Onto the hips as it angled in and the batsman just clipped the ball away with a lot of nonchalance to soar it over deep backward square. Back-to-back sixes for Watto

Plunkett to du Plessis, SIX, Faf now rubs more salt into the bleeding wounds of Plunkett. Shuffles across and shovels the ball away over fine leg for a sixer. Pretty much like the last game here, there is a lot of carry

Avesh Khan to Watson, SIX, top-edge! Six! Gosh! Over long-on. That was unbelieveable. The short ball, the batsman seemed to be slightly late on it and the ball flew away over long-on fence. Incredible

Avesh Khan to du Plessis, FOUR, short ball at the body. Again skidded through and the batsman under-edges the ball away fine on the on-side for a four. That looked disconcerting for the batsman but he somehow got bat to it and sent it away. Lucky bargain for du Plessis. 56 off the PP!!
Plunkett to Watson, SIX, full ball, buh-bye ball! That has been spanked down the ground over long-off for a maximum! He can hit that blindfold. Overpitched and the batsman just timed it

Plunkett to Watson, SIX, strays on to the pads and clipped away over fine leg. Fifth six for Watson. This ball is flying off the bat. Bad bowling this from Plunkett, who has gone for tons of runs already
