Rahul Tewatia to Watson, SIX, short ball, the batsman drops down on to one knee and pulls the ball away over fine leg for a sixer. Fifty for Watson! That was a terrible delivery but what hitting from the burly all-rounder

Rahul Tewatia to Watson, SIX, whatta catch! But from one of the spectators. That went miles into the stands over cow corner. Slightly fuller length ball and the batsman knelt down to power the sweep away. Seventh six of the innings for Watson

KM Asif to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Shaw goes aerial and clears mid-off. Didn't time it as he would've liked but just enough to clear the fielder. On a back of a length on off, Shaw used his bottom hand to good effect to chip it over the ring. Couple of bounces and home

KM Asif to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, bosh. In the swinging arc for Shaw and he butchers it straight down the ground. Arrests his high backlift, again employs his bottom hand and bashes it straight down the ground. Watch out ump! Nearly knocked him out there

KM Asif to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Jadeja!! Adrenaline rush and Shaw falls. One shot too many for the youngster. Told you, Asif can hoodwink the batsmen with his skiddy short balls, here's the evidence. A short of length that kicks onto Shaw, he looked for a cross-batted smash across the line. Is hurried by the pace and ends up slicing it towards mid-on. Jaddu, the best fielder in the CSK set-up leaps across, times his jump to perfection and pouches the dolly at mid-off. Prithvi Shaw c Jadeja b KM Asif 9(5) [4s-2]
Jadeja to Pant, FOUR, Pant falls as he attempts that pull on the short of length ball but he gets enough bat and finds the gap through deep mid-wicket for a boundary
Jadeja to Pant, SIX, Gee! Quick hands from Pant, he picks up the length early, reaches the pitch of the ball and deposits in the stands at deep mid-wicket

Harbhajan to Pant, SIX, Pant finally connects one and when he connects it, ball stays hit. A great hit though. Flat-batted slog over the fence. He goes on the knees and strikes it cleanly, ball sails over long-on for a maximum

Harbhajan to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, poor delivery down the leg-side, Vijay Shankar puts bat to it and guides it wide of the short fine leg fielder for a four. DD needs more of these shots from Vijay Shankar

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, Vijay Shankar just puts enough power in the shot to send it over the ropes. It was in the fuller length zone, perfect length to hit. Vijay Shankar goes back in his crease and tonks it over long-on for a six

KM Asif to Pant, FOUR, sloppy effort from Rayudu at long-off. Pant doesn't get it anywhere near the middle of the bat but he puts power in the shot as he generally does and ball goes for a four. Pant brings up his fifty with that four
KM Asif to Pant, FOUR, Pant goes slightly to the off-side and sweeps it fine of the stumps, ball goes fine of the short fine leg fielder for a four
KM Asif to Pant, SIX, fast hands from Pant come into play again. You cannot bowl length ball at this stage and KM Asif does that exactly, Pant picks it up over square leg for a maximum

Dwayne Bravo to Pant, FOUR, the line is wrong and Pant is single-handedly threatening CSK here. Slower delivery down the leg-side, can't bowl there with fine leg inside the ring and Pant helps it away on his way over the man at 45
Dwayne Bravo to Pant, FOUR, low full toss and he's mishit this, yet it runs away for four. Long-on was very square and he had no chance of cutting this off

Lungi Ngidi to Pant, FOUR, you are kidding me! What sort of a shot is this? He was almost beaten by the change of pace by this shortish slower ball, slapped it pretty straight towards long-on despite having to fetch this from outside off stump. Dhoni has been having long-on very wide fro Pant and he had no chance. In fact, Dhoni and Bravo were not happy with Faf. Looks like he was standing very wide without instructions and maybe he was just wandering

Lungi Ngidi to Pant, out Caught by Jadeja!! Maiden IPL wicket for Lungi Ngidi and he's been mighty impressive. Ends an excellent innings from Pant. Shortish slower delivery outside off stump, Pant slices it high in the air, Jadeja runs forward from sweeper cover and swallows it. Pant c Jadeja b Lungi Ngidi 79(45) [4s-7 6s-4]

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, mighty swing of the bat, timing very good, but all too late? Slower delivery on the stumps, Shankar gets down on one knee and lofts it over long-on. Looks like Rayudu isn't happy with Dwayne Bravo for bowling a ball in the slot, earlier he was hinting to the bowling to bowl a bouncer

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, short ball and smashed. Back-to-back sixes. Why didn't you do this when Pant was going great guns? Would have been of great help. Anyway, this is a pull shot sweetly timed over mid-wicket. Now Rayudu is livid, he wants Dwayne Bravo to nail the yorker

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, and another one, clean hits, but the intent should have been there earlier for DD to have a real chance. Slower ball again, Shankar muscles this loft over long-on. This knock will do a world of good to Vijay Shankar's confidence. Meanwhile, MS was shaking his head

Lungi Ngidi to Vijay Shankar, SIX, now then, now then! He isn't done yet! Raises the fifty and DD can mathematically still do this. 20 needed from 4 balls. Backs away to this shortish ball and pulls over mid-wicket

Lungi Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Ngidi sought to fox Iyer once again but Iyer outfoxes him. Slipped it wider of off on seeing the batsman back away. Iyer throws his bat, reaches out and slaps it with ferocity, beating the packed off-side field

Watson to Munro, SIX, in the slot and out of the park. Watson getting a taste of his own medicine. Wafted it full just outside off, Munro with a solid base on leg-stump, gets under it and with strong wrists, whacks it into the deep mid stands. Into the crowd

Watson to Munro, FOUR, expertly done by Munro. Watson was getting monotonously predictable with his lines. Full and outside off, Munro walked across his sticks and adjusted it beautifully to lift it over mid-on
KM Asif to Munro, FOUR, sledge-hammered over point by the Kiwi marauder. Picked Asif's slower ball early, waited and stayed deep to slash it over point

KM Asif to Munro, FOUR, now the overcorrection from Asif, feeds a tasty half-volley. Munro stayed leg-side of the ball, puts his bottom hand to good effect once again to blast it straight down the ground

KM Asif to Munro, SIX, Asif getting some pasting from Munro here. 14 runs off the last three balls. The intent was fine but the execution went haywire. Banged it short, no purpose on it and allowed Munro to free his arms. Arched his back slightly and ramped it over the cordon. More off the edge but it went flat and hit the ad cushions on the full. They checked with the third umpire and it was confirmed on the replays

KM Asif to Munro, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! Munro combusts. Asif raises his hands aloft in joy. The bowler wins the battle and has the last laugh. Second wicket for Asif, nips out both openers. Looked like it was a certain trap, plotted by MSD and Asif. Much like the last ball, ushered it short and this was closer to the body. Munro swung across, only height as it went a long way into the night sky. There was a fielder waiting at deep mid-wicket and he set himself under it to gobble it up. Safe hands from Karn Sharma. Munro c Karn Sharma b KM Asif 26(16) [4s-3 6s-2]
Watson to Pant, SIX, woah. Pant wasting no time. Gets into the business straightaway. Full on the stumps, Pant gets under it and whiplashes it over cow corner. Into the stands
Watson to Pant, FOUR, Watson is not learning. Shifts his line outside off, Pant knew the third man was inside the ring. Scythed it to his right and it zoomed away into the fence. Smartly done

Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, out Shreyas Iyer Run Out!! Kamikaze running and Iyer perishes. Tragedy for DD. Iyer was looking good but a miscommunication leads to his dismissal. Push-driven towards extra cover, there was never a single there. Iyer kept running, Pant took a couple of strides down the pitch before he stopped. The DD skipper was just a handshaking distance away from his partner and no way Iyer was returning. A clean pick and throw from Watto to MS, easy-peasy. Shreyas Iyer run out (Watson/Dhoni) 13(14) [4s-1]

Jadeja to Maxwell, FOUR, Jadeja errs in line and length, Maxwell makes him pay the penalty. Short, quick and outside off, Maxwell waited and flayed it through cover. Threads the gap and it races away to the fence

Jadeja to Maxwell, out Bowled!! Lock, stock and two smoking barrels. You-miss-I-Hit stuff from Jadeja. Maxwell's form seems to be like that mythical creature which just cannot be found. Rifled fast, coming in with the arm. Maxwell lined up for a heave across the line, fails to counter for the drift. The ball snakes in and clatters the stumps. DD in strife now. Maxwell b Jadeja 6(5) [4s-1]
Duminy to Vohra, SIX, off the mark for six. Again tossed up on leg, Vohra this time slog-sweeps and hits it way back over the stands at deep backward square. The crowd getting catching practice

Krunal Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, that's one of his trademark shots. Saw the full middle stump delivery and then went inside out over cover. No chance for Polly at long-off. Gets forward and then gives himself room to get the elevation
Markande to Kohli, FOUR, phew! Markande despite getting a boot on that scorching drive, watches the ball run to the fence in a jiffy. Down the track and drilled so so hard
Markande to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, poor delivery, too much time for Brendon McCullum on the back foot. Was short and he pummelled the pull between deep square and deep mid. Perfect placement
Markande to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, and again. This time the slog-sweep. Brendon McCullum is playing a blinder now. Kneels down and nails this sweep, leaves deep square and deep mid as spectators
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, SIX, no edges this time. Down the track and over deep mid. Didn't get to the pitch but once it is in his range, he decides to deposit the tossed up delivery into the stands
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, quicker and on leg, turned to deep backward square

McClenaghan to Brendon McCullum, out Brendon McCullum Run Out!! Gone. Brendon McCullum is quick but not as quick as he was in his international playing days. Even then this single may have been tight. Smeared it to mid-off and ran, hoped Hardik would miss but he didn't. End of story. Brendon McCullum run out (Hardik Pandya) 37(25) [4s-4 6s-2]

Hardik Pandya to Mandeep, FOUR, one ball per over he will bowl short. Or else he can't bowl. That's Hardik Pandya for you. This short ball doesn't rise enough to trouble Mandeep who rolls his wrists on the swivel-pull and beats deep square to his right

Bumrah to Mandeep, SIX, smashed. Over deep mid. Picks the slower delivery and then smears it powerfully over mid-wicket. With all his body weight going into the shot. Sends the RCB-pro crowd into delights of joy

Hardik Pandya to Mandeep, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Off the base of the bat and caught by Surya at deep mid. Mandeep is unhappy at himself, screams and then taps the bat onto the helmet in despair. Was a slower delivery and in the slot for the mow over deep mid, but miscued it to the man. Mandeep c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 14(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Kohli, out Caught by Pollard!! The crowd are stunned. A hush of silence and disappointment descends on the Chinnaswamy. Their favorite son of the non-soil is gone. Ok - I made that up. Back to the wicket. This was another cutter on a short of length, trouble was Kohli looking to power it over long-on off the front foot. Such a difficult shot that one - even if you are Kohli. He holes out to long-on. Polly won't drop that. Kohli is shocked to say the least, makes his emotions known before trudging off. That's a difference of at least 20 in my book. Now Hardik Pandya suddenly is on a hat-trick. Kohli c Pollard b Hardik Pandya 32(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Rohit!! This is a dream dream over for MI. Now Washington Sundar goes. No real emotions or celebrations from Hardik Pandya. He is cool amidst all this. But familiar expressions on the RCB fans and players's faces. Washington Sundar finds deep mid-wicket with a slog off a slower delivery. No power behind the blow. All three batsmen have expertly found the fielder in this over. Washington Sundar c Rohit b Hardik Pandya 1(3)

Bumrah to Southee, out Caught by Cutting!! Southee goes now. Off-pace slower delivery outside off, Southee stands a foot outside off and then slugs this high up in the air, Cutting at deep mid actually misjudged it for an instant or two, but recovers to take it over his head and then tumbles over. Made a simple catch look difficult. Southee c Cutting b Bumrah 1(2)

Bumrah to de Grandhomme, no run, yorker outside off, de Grandhomme fails to get bat on ball. Ishan Kishan fumbles and CdG looks for a quick bye, comically he loses balance and stumbles to get back. Ishan Kishan misses and the Kiwi gets away

McClenaghan to U Yadav, byes, 1 run, Ishan Kishan with the gloves on misses to hit direct and de Grandhomme gets home. McClenaghan beats Yadav with a slower delivery, a swing and a miss but they steal a bye

McClenaghan to de Grandhomme, SIX, that's what he can do. Actually is in tremendous form in the international circuit but hasn't replicated that in this IPL. But mauls this cutter high into the stands at deep mid. Stayed back and gave it his all

McClenaghan to de Grandhomme, SIX, and he finishes with a six. This is a tremendous over for RCB. Watches the slower delivery and carves it high and wide over long-off. Pure power and CdG ends the innings in style. Boy o boy did RCB need that or what

McClenaghan to de Grandhomme, no ball, SIX, wow! What's more it is a no-ball as well. For height. Over the waist. Full-toss gone wrong and he has belted that into the crowd at deep square. That hit brings the ladies on their feet - with one even whistling away to glory
Duminy to Vohra, FOUR, that's a good shot. But he looks at his bat. Not entirely happy with the connection. Saw the tossed up delivery and charged Duminy, to the pitch and lofted wide and over mid-on
Duminy to Vohra, SIX, too full. So when it is so full, Vohra can get under that. No chance for the ball doing anything off the pitch too. Vohra gets forward and laces the loft over long-off. Easy

Duminy to Vohra, FOUR, that's a slog. But he has managed to elude mid-wicket leaping. Dragged the flighted delivery from outside off and even though it came off the thickish inside half, it was enough to beat Rohit

Duminy to Vohra, SIX, this is the best of the lot. Similar delivery to the last one and now Vohra goes over deep cover. Again Duminy keeps flighting it and doesn't pull the length back too, hammered in-to-out by Vohra. Shows how much talent he has and why Yuvraj Singh was wowing about him when he was in KXIP
McClenaghan to de Kock, FOUR, this is a thick edge but it will do for de Kock. Backs away and slashes the short of length delivery, gets enough bat on that to clear backward point and short third

McClenaghan to de Kock, out Caught by Rohit!! Rohit takes the catch and signals to the umpire to check upstairs. He is not sure. Soft signal is out. Good low catch at mid-wicket by Rohit. Slugged by de Kock and taken near his bootlaces. Looks like the fingers are under the ball. Let's wait for the third umpire's call. Who is having a look from different angles. Should be given out I guess. OUT it is. McClenaghan strikes and the pressure has told on de Kock. He was struggling and has made his way back. Didn't get enough elevation on this hit. de Kock c Rohit b McClenaghan 7(13) [4s-1]
Markande to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, no third man. Nor there is short third. Easy shot for Brendon McCullum. He reverse-swats the length ball turning away from him wide of backward point
Markande to Vohra, SIX, fine slog-sweep. Nails it from the meat of the bat. Knelt down and timed it well enough to clear Cutting at deep mid. Who watches the ball sail over

Markande to Vohra, out Lbw!! Given out lbw. Vohra immediately reviews. Has it pitched in line? No under edge on the sweep. UltraEdge throws that up. Umpire's call and Vohra is gone. Erasmus the umpire who was happy to oblige that appeal from Markande. Pitched in line with leg stump and straightened just enough to clip leg. Vohra was beaten on the sweep and has to make his way out. Vohra lbw b Markande 45(31) [4s-2 6s-4]

Hardik Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, bad call from Kohli and Brendon McCullum was gone had Duminy hit from backward point. Dabbed it to the left of the fielder who had already cut off the angle with his movement, Brendon McCullum's bat got stuck in the turf and that didn't help him. Luckily for the Kiwi it didn't hit

Hardik Pandya to Brendon McCullum, SIX, the McScoop! Ridiculous batting. Saw him do this to Tait who was bowling at the speed of light in a T20I - if I'm right at Eden Park, New Zealand - when he made a hundred. He just put off Tait that day with some unbelievable shots. This he sets up a good base, takes the full-toss from middle and ramps it over Ishan Kishan's head. All the way too

Hardik Pandya to Brendon McCullum, no ball, SIX, my word. What was that from Hardik Pandya? Must have slipped out of the hand. Above waist-height full-toss as Brendon McCullum was advancing, it takes the thickish edge and hits the cushion on the full at third man. Only McCullum can play such a shot to a delivery that was threatening to take his head off

Hardik Pandya to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, slower delivery outside off, Brendon McCullum flat-bat thrashes that, didn't hit it really sweetly, but enough to beat long-off running to his left. Looks to be finding his touch. Had to after my earlier comments about him
Duminy to Vohra, SIX, off the mark for six. Again tossed up on leg, Vohra this time slog-sweeps and hits it way back over the stands at deep backward square. The crowd getting catching practice

Markande to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, and again. This time the slog-sweep. Brendon McCullum is playing a blinder now. Kneels down and nails this sweep, leaves deep square and deep mid as spectators
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, SIX, no edges this time. Down the track and over deep mid. Didn't get to the pitch but once it is in his range, he decides to deposit the tossed up delivery into the stands
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, quicker and on leg, turned to deep backward square

Even then this single may have been tight. Smeared it to mid-off and ran, hoped Hardik would miss but he didn't. End of story. Brendon McCullum run out (Hardik Pandya) 37(25) [4s-4 6s-2]

Mandeep is unhappy at himself, screams and then taps the bat onto the helmet in despair. Was a slower delivery and in the slot for the mow over deep mid, but miscued it to the man. Mandeep c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 14(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

That's a difference of at least 20 in my book. Now Hardik Pandya suddenly is on a hat-trick. Kohli c Pollard b Hardik Pandya 32(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

All three batsmen have expertly found the fielder in this over. Washington Sundar c Rohit b Hardik Pandya 1(3)

Made a simple catch look difficult. Southee c Cutting b Bumrah 1(2)

Should be given out I guess. OUT it is. McClenaghan strikes and the pressure has told on de Kock. He was struggling and has made his way back. Didn't get enough elevation on this hit. de Kock c Rohit b McClenaghan 7(13) [4s-1]

Markande to Vohra, SIX, fine slog-sweep. Nails it from the meat of the bat. Knelt down and timed it well enough to clear Cutting at deep mid. Who watches the ball sail over

Erasmus the umpire who was happy to oblige that appeal from Markande. Pitched in line with leg stump and straightened just enough to clip leg. Vohra was beaten on the sweep and has to make his way out. Vohra lbw b Markande 45(31) [4s-2 6s-4]

Dabbed it to the left of the fielder who had already cut off the angle with his movement, Brendon McCullum's bat got stuck in the turf and that didn't help him. Luckily for the Kiwi it didn't hit

Hardik Pandya to Brendon McCullum, SIX, the McScoop! Ridiculous batting. Saw him do this to Tait who was bowling at the speed of light in a T20I - if I'm right at Eden Park, New Zealand - when he made a hundred. He just put off Tait that day with some unbelievable shots. This he sets up a good base, takes the full-toss from middle and ramps it over Ishan Kishan's head. All the way too

Hardik Pandya to Brendon McCullum, no ball, SIX, my word. What was that from Hardik Pandya? Must have slipped out of the hand. Above waist-height full-toss as Brendon McCullum was advancing, it takes the thickish edge and hits the cushion on the full at third man. Only McCullum can play such a shot to a delivery that was threatening to take his head off

Hardik Pandya to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, slower delivery outside off, Brendon McCullum flat-bat thrashes that, didn't hit it really sweetly, but enough to beat long-off running to his left. Looks to be finding his touch. Had to after my earlier comments about him

D Kulkarni to Munro, out Caught by Buttler!! Huge strike and Rajasthan pocket Munro for a first-baller. That was full, swung in a bit and the batsman ended up playing down the wrong line. The inside edge was found and carried low to the keeper. Buttler went up and the umpire had no hesitation in giving it out. Munro on his part also did not want to review it as he knew he had edged it. The bowler did not appeal straightaway. He only went up after he saw the keeper appealing so confidently. Munro c Buttler b D Kulkarni 0(1)
Jofra Archer to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, too full, too fine from Archer and that would run away. First four of the innings. Bad ball and put away with a cheeky touch through fine leg

Jofra Archer to Pant, SIX, clubbed away! Such power from Pant, he's made it look so easy but trust me, it wasn't. Fullish ball from Archer and he errs to land it in Pant's arc, merrily swung away over wide long-on with all the nonchalance in the world. Went deep into the crowd

Unadkat to Pant, FOUR, that's almost gone all the way! Pant lost his balance on this shot, which isn't unusual as we know but this is still outrageous to pull off. Swivels across on the pull and skies it in the air down the leg-side. Too fine though and the fine leg fielder could only watch it land in front of the ropes and brisk away

Gowtham to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's massive! Iyer has absolutely clouted this. Shuffles across the stumps a bit and this is flat from Gowtham, full as well and disappears over deep mid-wicket. Huge hit

Gowtham to Pant, FOUR, these two are targeting Gowtham and this is the big push DD needed. Too short in length and Pant won't miss out on these. Swivels back and nails the pull. Well to the right of deep mid-wicket
Gowtham to Pant, FOUR, incredible stroke! As if his conventional strokes aren't working enough, Pant brings out the reverse sweep. Connects comfortably to clear short third man. Bleeding runs now

D Kulkarni to Pant, SIX, wow, this is unbelievable. It's a top edge but it's gone well over the keeper down the leg-side and into the crowd. Short ball and Pant swivelled to pull it but couldn't quite control it. Eventually, trying to just use the pace helped him and of course, the shorter boundaries here at the Kotla

D Kulkarni to Pant, FOUR, this was hit so hard that the ball vanished to the fence in no time. Pant is expecting the wide yorker now and sets himself up for it. Gets a wide low full toss that's absolutely murdered through cover. Sweeper had no chance

D Kulkarni to Pant, FOUR, nearly took short extra cover's hand along with it! How hard is Pant hitting the ball! Gee, insane stuff! Half volley with a lot of width and it's absolutely crashed through extra cover. The fielder there got a hand on it and yet, it flew away to the fence. Pant is continuing exactly from where he left off in Pune the other night

Stokes to Pant, FOUR, the man at sweeper cover is of no use when Pant hits the ball like this. Can perhaps just help retrieve the ball from the fence. Full and quite wide outside off, Pant bludgeons this through the covers. Nobody moved at all

Stokes to Pant, 1 run, slower ball and well wide outside off, Pant tries the slog and mistimes it towards long-on, 6th IPL fifty for Pant. He is in serious form here. This is his fastest IPL fifty as well, getting it off 23 balls and going past the 25-ball fifty vs GL, Rajkot, 2016

Stokes to Pant, SIX, launched well over deep cover! It's raining boundaries here, doesn't matter where they are bowling. Pant is on another level at the moment. Fullish ball outside off, he didn't get the whole of this lofted stroke but still sliced it way over deep cover

Unadkat to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slower ball well wide outside off, steered through backward point for a single. 10th IPL fifty for Iyer, almost unnoticed due to the Pant mayhem. It's the fourth for the DD skipper this season and all of them have come in the last five games. Some form!

Unadkat to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by R Tripathi!! Finally, a wicket for RR! Some respite from the carnage but it's not the man they would have wanted although Iyer also was striking them really well. Slower ball from Unadkat and the length is a touch shorter, the DD captain wanted to launch down the ground but only got height on this one. Went up to the night sky for ages towards long-off where Tripathi held his nerve to settle under it. Another fine knock from the skipper, he's set it up nicely for DD to score a really imposing total. Shreyas Iyer c R Tripathi b Unadkat 50(35) [4s-3 6s-3]

Unadkat to Pant, SIX, Pant is now the top run scorer in IPL 2018! What a time he is having! This one wasn't middled well but who cares, it's way over deep mid-wicket for a biggie. Fuller ball well wide outside off, Pant still fetches it to clear the ropes

Unadkat to Pant, out Caught by Stokes!! Vital, vital breakthrough! Might easily make a difference of about 10-15 runs to the eventual total. The deadly Pant has to depart but not before he has produced another thrill-a-minute epic. Backed away to make room for the big shot but one hand comes off in the process. Didn't get hold of it and skied this high towards long-on where Stokes moved to his left a fair bit to judge the skier perfectly. Two massive wickets in the over for RR, just the comeback they were looking for. Pant c Stokes b Unadkat 69(29) [4s-7 6s-5]
Jofra Archer to Vijay Shankar, SIX, Shankar gets into the act. Short of a length that sits up nicely for him. He backs away a touch and swings over deep mid-wicket

Jofra Archer to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, gets it away very fine. Not exactly where he intended but Shankar will take this. Short of a length outside off, he went hard on the cut and got a big slice that flew away to the third man fence

Unadkat to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, poor bowling and Shankar pounces on it. Too straight in line from round the wicket and all that the batsman has to do it get it over short fine leg. Does so with a lofted stroke after a walk across the sticks

Unadkat to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by R Tripathi!! Holes out this time! Gee, some seriously high skiers tonight and RR are doing well to get under them without spilling. Unadkat gets his third and not surprisingly, it's with another slower ball. Shankar wanted to up the ante, rightfully so, but could not middle this loft at all. Tripathi at long-off does well to take it with ease. Vijay Shankar c R Tripathi b Unadkat 17(6) [4s-2 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Maxwell, out Lbw!! Needless review from Maxwell and he has to go. Pinpoint yorker from Archer and the Australian couldn't get his bat down on time. Pinned on the back pad and it rolled towards short fine leg. Umpire Nandan was quick to raise his finger and so was Maxwell to signal the T. That suggested that perhaps he might have got some bat on it but no, replays clearly show he hadn't and the rest is just a formality. Three Reds on HawkEye. It's started to rain as well!!! Could well be the end of the innings. Maxwell lbw b Jofra Archer 5(5)

D Kulkarni to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, pick and drop ala Shaw style. That was a length ball on the pads and the batsman powers the ball off the pads for a six over deep mid-wicket. Just a short arm jab and the ball was wristed away

D Kulkarni to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, drops the ball short and Prithvi Shaw is on to it in a jiffy. This tiny little ticking time bomb just shifts his base on the back foot and pulls the ball away over mid-on. That was smacked

D Kulkarni to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, slapped away!! Four between cover and mid-off. Stays leg-side of the ball, the room was there and the batsman lets his hands to whirlwind the ball away. Prithvi Shaw is handing out some pasting to Kulkarni

D Kulkarni to Prithvi Shaw, no run, dropped! RR and dropped catches of openers has cost them bad! That was a low full toss and the batsman drove it back. Kulkarni juggled it and the ball popped out like a pop-corn. Did Kulkarni get too excited?
Gowtham to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, little backing away movement supplemented with fine hands. The ball threads into the gap on the off-side and the ball races away into the cover fence
Gowtham to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, full and flat outside off, sliced away in the gap between point and cover point for a four. The room was there and the batsman chased that widish ball to put it away

Unadkat to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, length ball, Shaw stays back and punches uppishly off the back foot. Bit of a slice, which is why he isn't in control, and interestingly gets it over the man at mid-on who was running back. Jofra Archer tried to fetch it back but the ball dropped in front of him and spun into the boundary ropes

Unadkat to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, check and four! The slower delivery and the batsman just checked his punch to ensure he lent enough power on the shot. The ball raced away to the fence teasing Gowtham, the man at mid-off, till the very end

Unadkat to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, wow! Just wow! This man is a powerhouse. That was just punched. Maybe a dropkick of a punch drive and the ball just kept on going and going. It easily sailed over the man at long-off. Slightly pulled back length and the batsman had no hesitation in going through with the shot and hitting it through the line

Shreyas Gopal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, bowled at 116ks that! The quick hands come down on it like a house on fire and explodes the ball over widish long-on. He tried bowling it quick, the batsman got a length to get under it and muscled it away
Shreyas Gopal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, short ball, same result. This time off the back foot. The batsman waited on this and hammered the pull over cow corner for a maximum. That just went over the ropes
Shreyas Gopal to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, chips down the track and bang over covers for a sixer! Got to the pitch of the ball and then bulldozed it with all his sinews working in tandem. This guy! Phew!

Shreyas Gopal to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught&Bowled!! Soft dismissal. And against the run of play. That turned a bit, stopped as well on the batsman, who on his part had his feet glued to the crease and just tamely pushed it back to the bowler. A smirk on the face of Gopal after he takes the catch. Prithvi Shaw is gutted. Prithvi Shaw c and b Shreyas Gopal 47(25) [4s-4 6s-4]

Shreyas Gopal to Pant, SIX, full, tossed up wide outside off and drop-kicked with all the non-chalance in the world. The long-on area peppered this time. The length allowed the batsman to get under the ball and send it on a journey

Stokes to Pant, FOUR, short ball again but slower at 120ks. This time punished. He waited on it and muscled the ball over mid-wicket for a four. He was not over committed into the stroke and that helped him

Jofra Archer to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, sliced away nicely! Iyer has been backing away to the shorter length ball and does it again. This time he gets a fair chunk of the outer half and flies well wide of the third man fielder to his right
Nadeem to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler fails to reach the pitch of the ball, but his bat was gun-barrel straight and he lofts it straight down the ground for a boundary
Nadeem to Buttler, SIX, follows it with a maximum. He shuffles across to the off-side and slog-sweeps it over the deep square leg for a six. Clean striking from the England batsmam
Boult to D Arcy Short, FOUR, D Arcy Short likes pace on the ball. It was a fuller length ball outside off, Short drives it handsomely wide of the mid-off fielder for a four
Plunkett to R Tripathi, FOUR, cross seam delivery at the body of Tripathi who gets in a fine position and pulls it through fine leg for a four

Plunkett to R Tripathi, no run, Tripathi misses the ball again and it strikes him on the pads, DD go for a LBW review. Actually it was a win-win review for DD, or so Iyer thought. Plunkett had taken the return catch, which meant that even an inside edge and Tripathi was out. DRS shows the the ball missed the bat and was going down the leg-side clearly, so DD lose their review too
Plunkett to Gowtham, FOUR, slower ball banged in short, Gowtham gets it off the outside half, slicing the ball fine of the short third man fielder for a four

Plunkett to Gowtham, SIX, back of a length slower ball, Gowtham picks it off the hand, he waited and waited for the ball to arrive, gets himself in a decent position and tonks it over deep mid-wicket for a six

Boult to R Tripathi, out R Tripathi Run Out!! Boult calmly takes off the bails at the non striker's end and Tripathi will have to depart. This match is going Delhi's way now. Coming back to the ball, it was a perfect yorker outside off, Tripathi swings and misses; the ball goes to the keeper who balloons it to the bowler and he does the rest. Some headless running distilled in panic to be honest. Non-striker almost at the other end by the time Tripathi realizes that he has to run -- basically bullied into it -- and pays the price for it. R Tripathi run out (Pant/Boult) 9(8) [4s-1]

Boult to Gowtham, FOUR, It is a four, and it's been dropped in the deep by the captain, can you believe it! Crazy scenes here at the Kotla. This is going down to the last ball, it was on a fuller length and at the stumps, Gowtham flaunts his hitting prowess and hits the ball over long-on, timing wasn't great and Iyer at long-on spills it. Right through his hands there. Couldn't close the palms, the ball rips through it and bounces once before tagging the boundary ropes. Maxwell is around too, standing close-in and watching everything. Tries to slap the rebound off the ground into the playing area but fails to get a hand. Four! Six needed off the last ball!

Boult to D Arcy Short, no run, Short has been given out but he has taken the review instantly. Short is spot on as ball has hit his hip, and not the bat as he swatted into a pull. Umpire will change his decision. It was a short of length delivery, D Arcy Short was beaten by the pace and ball defeats him and goes to the keeper.
Avesh Khan to Buttler, SIX, Buttler has deposited it into the stands. It was a fuller length ball and Buttler lofts it with a straight bat over the bowler's head for a sixer
Avesh Khan to Buttler, SIX, Buttler shuffles to the off-side slightly and scoops this fuller length ball over short fine leg for a maximum. Second six of the over
Avesh Khan to Buttler, SIX, Buttler was deep in his crease and he gets himself in a good position and slogs it over deep mid-wicket for another maximum. Buttler is on fire here
Avesh Khan to Buttler, FOUR, Avesh Khan is under pressure and he bowls a poor delivery, ball was outside off, Buttler makes full use of the room and scythes it through backward point for a boundary
Plunkett to Buttler, SIX, it was the slower ball outside off, Buttler picks it off the hand and dispatches it over extra cover for a maximum

Plunkett to Buttler, FOUR, Pant was flying in air like David De Gea, he gets a hand on it but fails to grab the catch. It was short of length delivery down the leg-side, Buttler gets some bat to it on the pull and ball goes just wide and to the left of the keeper for a four

Mishra to Buttler, SIX, fifty off just 18 balls -- the fastest ever by a RR batsman in IPL. This has been a ripper of an innings. It was a full toss and Buttler takes out the reverse sweeps and sends it into the crowd - behind square on the off-side. Second IPL fifty for Buttler this, after 77 for MI vs KXIP in Indore in 2017

Avesh Khan to Buttler, FOUR, young man is under pressure. It was another full toss and Buttler with this form is not going to miss out. He connects well and places it well through fine leg for a single

Avesh Khan to Buttler, SIX, it was raining 30 minutes back at Kotla and it's raining sixes now. Buttler shuffles in the crease a bit to disturb the length of the bowler, his base was stable and more importantly his connection was clean. Ball has gone into the stands over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

Mishra to Buttler, out Stumped!! Mishraji will be a popular man at the Kotla now. It was a terrific delivery from him, he brings his experience to the fore and drags his length back. Buttler, on the charge, was nowhere close to the pitch of this widish leg break and he misses it totally, running past it in his shimmy. Pant behind the stumps takes off the bails, delaying it stylishly because Buttler was so far down the track, and thus a blistering innings from Buttler comes to an end. He came in like thunder and went back like lighting. Buttler st Pant b Mishra 67(26) [4s-4 6s-7]

Plunkett to D Arcy Short, SIX, D Arcy Short finally connects one. This was long due from his bat. It was on a good length and on the pads, D Arcy Short moves slightly to the leg-side and powers it over deep mid-wicket for a six. Rajasthan need more of these from his blade, if they have to travel to Jaipur with 2 points

Boult to Samson, out Caught by Munro!! This ball went into the stratosphere, thankfully it came down and Munro takes a really good catch at cow corner. Again a change in pace from Boult, it has become a stock ball for the pacers these days in this format. Samson's timing was dismal, he lofts it in the air and was cleanly caught by the Kiwi opener in the deep. Swirled under it and then positioned himself under the trajectory with a last-minute adjustment. Chest bump with Maxwell and all follow. Samson c Munro b Boult 3(5)
Boult to D Arcy Short, FOUR, intention was to hit it over deep mid-wicket into the stands, gets an inside edge and ends up hitting it wide of the short fine leg fielder for a four

Boult to Stokes, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! Poor IPL for Stokes continues. He has been in filthy form this season. It was a full toss, Stokes mistimes the heave and he has been caught at deep mid-wicket. He is going nowhere and is standing in his crease even after the catch is taken. He thinks it's a no-ball for being above the waist. The umpires have gone upstairs to check for the no-ball. The replay however shows it is below the waist height and Stokes will have to depart. Stokes c Vijay Shankar b Boult 1(2)
Maxwell to D Arcy Short, SIX, picks up the short length quickly, gets in a good position and deposits it over deep square leg for a six

Maxwell to D Arcy Short, SIX, this has been a dismal bowling change from Iyer. It was touch fuller, D Arcy Short uses his power and timing after using feet and sends the ball into the crowd again. Over the head of the bowler
Maxwell to D Arcy Short, SIX, quicker delivery outside off, D Arcy Short was deep in the crease, connection was terrific and ball sails into the crowd. Bludgeoned over long-off

Maxwell to D Arcy Short, out Caught by Avesh Khan!! Maxwell will have the last laugh in the battle of the Australians. D Arcy Short loses his shape, he wanted to slog across the line, gets an outside edge and ball scoops up in the air to Avesh, who takes a fine catch at short third man. D Arcy Short c Avesh Khan b Maxwell 44(25) [4s-2 6s-4]

Johnson to Watson, FOUR, oh, gosh. How did Watson manage to get this wide of mid-off. Lost timing totally as he went chasing for a drive to an outswinger slanted outside off. Way too early into the shot and canned it off the inner half, evades mid-off who refuses it put in a dive. All the way and Watson is off the mark with a boundary

Johnson to du Plessis, FOUR, edged and past the lone slip. Goodish length, moving away outside off. du Plessis threw his bat hard at it, ends up feathering a thick outside edge which flew past Uthappa at widish first slip. The third man had no chance as it sped away to the fence in a hurry

Chawla to du Plessis, FOUR, poor poor effort from Uthappa. What an error from the vice captain of KKR. Flat and quick outside off, du Plessis punches it from the crease towards Uthappa at cover-point, who clumsily lets it through. Chawla is not happy with the effort
Chawla to du Plessis, FOUR, tossed up teasingly outside off and du Plessis says thank you very much. Leans across, picks it up and lifts it disdainfully over mid-off. Clean swing of the bat!

Kuldeep Yadav to Watson, SIX, Watson flexes his muscles and tonks one straight over Kuldeep's head for a maximum. Thrown well outside off, Watson fetches it from there after bending low and slammed it beautifully straight down the ground. Ruins a good over from Kuldeep

Narine to Watson, out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Watson couldn't have picked the fielder out any better. He knows, can't believe his luck. Punches his bat in anger. Narine provides the breakthrough for KKR. Landed short and asked Watson to go for it. Watto rocked back and smoked it flat, forgets there is a fielder set for the trap. Hits it straight to Mavi, who takes it at the edge of the bounce. Didn't have to move an inch. Like Faf, Watto also fails to convert his start into a big-score. Watson c Shivam Mavi b Narine 36(25) [4s-4 6s-2]

Narine to Rayudu, FOUR, brilliant placement from Rayudu. Safe bet against Narine. Tossed up on middle and leg, Rayudu sank low and gets under it to sweep it in the gap between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, out Caught by Johnson!! In the air and taken at long-on. Two wickets in two overs for KKR, they are plotting a turnaround here. Both set batsmen dismissed. Well-flighted delivery outside off, Raina grounds his knee and smacked it - skews it off the toe-end - finds long-on. It was in the slot but Raina couldn't connect it well. Raina c Johnson b Kuldeep Yadav 31(26) [4s-4]

Johnson to Rayudu, FOUR, edged and profitable result for Rayudu. Johnson wears a wry smile on his face. Slanted across outside off, lured Rayudu into playing a false shot. Gets the outside edge and unfortunately for Johnson, it flew past a diving DK to his right

Chawla to Rayudu, FOUR, poor line by Chawla. Can't bowl such freebies to a batsman in such fine form. Down the leg side and Rayudu sweeps it away to the fine leg fence. Fielder is nowhere close to cut this down

Narine to Rayudu, out Bowled!! Narine is bowling a fine spell today. Gets the dangerous batsman, the highest run getter of CSK with this peach of a delivery. It's the offie that does the trick. Rayudu waited for it and tried to run it down but the ball spins in sharply, flicks his pads and takes down the sticks. Second scalp of the match for Sunil Narine and the crowd at Eden erupts in joy. Rayudu b Narine 21(17) [4s-3]

Shivam Mavi to Dhoni, SIX, too many short deliveries and MS puts one into the stands. Was getting too predictable there. Shortish in length around off, Dhoni picks it up early and deposits a flat six over the mid-wicket fence. Sweet sound on that blow

Johnson to Dhoni, SIX, that's a flat six again. Short of a length on leg, Dhoni swivels quickly and pulls it to perfection over the square leg boundary. That went to the fence at the speed of light, none of the fielders had any time to even react

Johnson to Dhoni, SIX, that's high. That's handsome. On a length on middle and leg, Dhoni stays put and towers this over long-on for six more. Rinku Singh at the fence was just a mere spectator. The crowd is loving this, when MS is in such form everybody does!

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, dropped! How costly will that dropped catch prove to be? Was a shortish delivery around off, Dhoni pulled it hard to deep square leg where Gill lets it through his palms. Tried to reverse cup it and made a mess of it
Chawla to Jadeja, FOUR, 50-run stand up with that blow. Was the googly around off, Jadeja walked down the wicket and slammed it right past the bowler and the umpire who had to take evasive action

Chawla to Jadeja, byes, FOUR, CSK will take that! Doesn't matter how they come. Was a quicker delivery around off, Jadeja tried to slog it away but couldn't connect and Karthik failed to grab it too. That raced away to the fence in no time, so quick that was

Chawla to Jadeja, out Caught by Karthik!! Top-edge and DK takes it. Was short and quick around off, Jadeja tried to pull it but all he could manage is a top edge. DK sprinted back, called for it and took it. Jadeja c Karthik b Chawla 13(12) [4s-1]

Shivam Mavi to du Plessis, FOUR, ah, time for French cricket from du Plessis. Late swing for Mavi again, du Plessis squirts an inside edge that almost shaved the leg-stump. Fine leg was inside the circle and it escapes away to the fence

Chawla to Dhoni, FOUR, Dhoni finishes off in style, with a boundary. Picks the length early on the short one, rocks back and pulls it right into the gap at deep mid-wicket. No fielder there as CSK end on a competetive score
Narine to Watson, FOUR, no half measures from Watson on this occasion. Spots the half-tracker early, chooses his spot and muscles it to the right of deep mid-wicket fielder. One-bounce four

Johnson to Watson, FOUR, oh goodness! What a strike from Watson. Johnson and the umpire had to take evasive action as it was struck so hard. Can you believe it? Still runs away to the fence. Full and on off, Watson stomps forward and hammers it back at Johnson, who puts up his left hand to take cover. The ball hits him and flies away past a ducking umpire Abhijit Deshmukh to the boundary. That must've hurt and it's his bowling arm
Johnson to du Plessis, SIX, du Plessis is looking in fine touch. Sees a short ball, backs away and gets under it to smoke it over deep backward square leg stands. Into the crowd

Johnson to Watson, SIX, proper pasting for Johnson in this over. 19 runs off it and just the momentum CSK were looking for. Went short, no real threat behind it. Watson swivels across, taking his eyes off the ball and pulls it over short fine leg. Sweet timing and it flies all the way for a maximum

Chawla to du Plessis, out Bowled!! Cleaned up. du Plessis is hoodwinked by Chawla's googly. He was strugging to pick earlier as well. Credit to DK for bringing back the leggie. KKR draw first blood. It was dropped a tad shorter - the googly - du Plessis stayed back, waiting for the leggie perhaps. The ball spun back in, goes through the bat-pad gate and crashes the stumps. The South African skipper is absolutely clueless. Eden Gardens roars. du Plessis b Chawla 27(15) [4s-4 6s-1]
Chawla to Raina, FOUR, Raina takes on his former statemate. Stretches across outside off, gets under this flighted delivery and lofts it over cover. Excellent execution!

Chawla to Raina, FOUR, Chawla errs in line and Raina makes him pay. Half-tracker down leg, Raina will keep putting this away to the fence, seven days a week and twenty four hours a day. Half-swivels and helps it away past short fine leg

Chawla to Raina, no run, was there a nick? There was a certain deviation and also, a faint noise. I guess, the reaction of Chawla suggests that there was an edge. So, will go down as a drop. Guess, who's the culprit? It's the skipper, DK. Googly, turning away from Raina, who went for the drive. Scraps the outside edge, straight in and out of DK's gloves. Costly drop? Surely
A Russell to Raina, FOUR, Russell loses radar and spills it down leg. Easy-peasy for Raina, just needed to get some bat on it. Does so and hacks it very fine
A Russell to Raina, FOUR, woah. How cleverly did Raina place that? Deft hands. Played it so late, just used Russell's pace, waited deep and glided it to the third man fence. Wonderful from Raina!
Kuldeep Yadav to Watson, FOUR, very smart from Watson. Knew there was no fine leg; plants his front leg across and rolls his wrists on the sweep. Sends it very fine and earns himself a boundary

Lungi Ngidi to Chris Lynn, SIX, into the stands and the crowd are on their feet. Picks the length early on this short one and swivels quickly to pull that over square leg. Was on to his pull in a flash on that occasion

Lungi Ngidi to Chris Lynn, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Lynn. This was a full length delivery on middle, Lynn stayed rooted and timed his loft right over the bowler. Straight as an arrow and over the boundary ropes

Lungi Ngidi to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Watson!! Was a short of a length delivery on middle and leg, Lynn went for a pull and got an inside edge before the ball clipped his pads and carried to Watson in the slip. The on field umpire couldn't pick that up in the background noise but UltraEdge comes to Ngidi's rescue. Lynn is back to the hut and all of a sudden there are CSK, CSK chants at the ground. Chris Lynn c Watson b Lungi Ngidi 12(6) [6s-2]
KM Asif to Narine, SIX, that's the first one by Narine tonight. Was a shortish delivery around off and Narine cleared his front leg to club it nonchalantly over long-on

KM Asif to Narine, no run, dropped! Can you believe it? CSK's best fielder has put one down. Narine slapped the shortish delivery to mid-off where Jadeja spills it out. He tried to take it on the second attempt too, but failed even then

Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, out Bowled!! Gone! Harbhajan Singh likes it. The quick delivery does the trick. Fired full and on the stumps. Rinku moves leg-side and swings his bat hard; misses completely. He attempted the big heave. Crashes into middle and leg. Rinku Singh b Harbhajan 16(18) [4s-2]

Harbhajan to Karthik, FOUR, good shot to get off the mark. Hint of width on this short of length and that's enough for Karthik. He is quick to trek back and employ the cut shot behind square. Finds the gap and fetches his first boundary
Dwayne Bravo to Shubman Gill, FOUR, top shot! Bravo overpitches with mid-off inside the circle. Gill stays leg-side of the ball and thumps it over wide mid-off. One bounce and into the fence

Karn Sharma to Karthik, FOUR, moves leg-side evn before the ball is delivered does Karthik and that would have distracted the bowler. Karn Sharma fires one well down the leg-side and that's easy pickings for the skipper. Stays low and sweeps wide of the man at 45

KM Asif to Shubman Gill, SIX, that's a stunning shot! That's gone a long way back. His highest score in IPL. Picked the length (short) early, got into a good position on the back foot and muscled the pull over deep square leg. Right off the meat of the bat. Picked it up beautifully

KM Asif to Shubman Gill, SIX, excellent effort from Rayudu, gets a hand on it, but can only parry it over the cushions. Short ball on off, quick hands from Gill who upper-cuts it behind square. Rayudu sprints across to his right from third man and flew with his right hand out to pluck, in vain

KM Asif to Karthik, SIX, 21 off the over and the asking rate has come down to 7.4. KKR are surely the favourites now. The inexperienced Asif bangs one short, but slightly errs in line. Leg-stumpish and Karthik takes heavy toll of it. Walks across and helps it along its way with a hook over fine leg

Jadeja to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, maiden IPL fifty for Shubman Gill! His team-mates give him a standing ovation. He's played a beautiful innings. Gets to the milestone by driving a fullish ball wide of long-off

Jadeja to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's delicious. More air on this ball from Jadeja, Gill reaches out with a stride and gets to the pitch of the ball. Follows it up with a superb drive through extra cover

Jadeja to Karthik, FOUR, now DK tries the reverse sweep and manages to get some bat on it. Off the inside part, misses the batsman's pad and beats the short third man fielder too. The asking rate is below 6
Lungi Ngidi to Karthik, FOUR, all too easy. Ngidi doles out a short ball down leg and Karthik just helps it on its way. Pulled away to fine leg for another boundary

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, FOUR, bowls a low full toss on the pads from round the wicket. A hit-me delivery. Flicked away very fine. Watson doesn't bother to put a dive. Why would you do that, when you already know the result

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik is just toying with the bowler. Well, Bravo hasn't been on target as well. Full toss on the pads, Karthik walks forward and flicks it over the square leg umpire's head

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik hits the winning runs. Slower ball wide of off, Karthik throws his bat at it and slices it wide of backward point, who put in the dive. Runs away to the fence and that's it. KKR win by 6 wickets!

KM Asif to Narine, no run, second dropped catch! This is unbelievable really. Is this Narine's night? Went hard at a shortish delivery and miscued it to Jadeja at mid-off. He jumped in order to take it but failed yet again. But you know Narine, he'll give you more chances

Lungi Ngidi to Narine, FOUR, edged away! Full length delivery around middle and leg, Narine takes on the bowler, swings hard and gets an outside edge that flies over the slip cordon to find the fence. Every boundary Narine hits from here on will hurt Jadeja

Lungi Ngidi to Narine, FOUR, pulled away! He'll continue playing the same way, doesn't matter. Short length around around off, Narine clears his front leg again and pulls it over mid-wicket, beats the man in the deep with ease

Lungi Ngidi to Uthappa, FOUR, how quick is this outfield! Or is the timing by Uthappa? Fullish on the pads and Uthappa nicely flicks it through mid-wicket. Beats short mid-wicket and deep mid-wicket with his perfect timing on this flick

Watson to Narine, FOUR, another edge, another boundary! Was a full length delivery angled away from the batsman, Narine went hard at it, swung at it and got a thick outside edge that flew over gully this time. Hit out or get out, this is the only one way Narine knows

KM Asif to Uthappa, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! The skiddy pace of Asif gets Uthappa. Was a short and quick delivery around off, Uthappa went ahead with his pull and got a top edge to mid-on. DJ Bravo won't miss those as he settles underneath and reverse cups it. Two of KKR's finest batsmen are back to the hut. Uthappa c Dwayne Bravo b KM Asif 6(8) [4s-1]

KM Asif to Narine, FOUR, Harbhajan Singh misfields! This is contagious. First Jadeja, now Bhajji. MS Dhoni would be livid with this. Was a full length delivery outside off, Narine went for a drive and got an outside edge towards third man where a misfield helped him with a boundary. Narine will be thanking CSK fielders for their generosity tonight

Watson to Shubman Gill, FOUR, how well has Gill played that? This was a short delivery and dipping into him. Gill adjusts well and pulls it nicely, beats deep square leg by some distance and gets off the mark

Watson to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's called improvisation. Picks the length early again, goes back in his crease and guides this towards the third man fence. Opened the face of the bat real late and got a cheeky boundary

Watson to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that was in the air, but in the gap too. Ends the powerplay with a boundary, does Gill. Was short and wide outside off and Gill placed his square cut right into the gap between point and cover-point. End of a fruitful powerplay for KKR
Jadeja to Narine, SIX, Narine won't hang around blocking. Definitely not against a left-arm spinner. Was bulleted on off, Narine stood tall and smoked it over cow corner. Swung hard

Jadeja to Narine, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Dropped him twice, conceded a six and finally Jadeja removes Narine. Much-needed breakthrough. The West Indian perishes trying to deposit another one into the stands. The length was on the shorter side and Narine was a touch early to swing his bat. He wanted to go over deep mid-wicket, ended up lofting it to long-on. Bravo won't drop those. Yet another important knock from Narine. He's done his job. Narine c Dwayne Bravo b Jadeja 32(20) [4s-4 6s-2]
Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, FOUR, what a way to greet a new bowler. Looped up delivery, but in the process overpitched, Rinku presses forward and chipped it inside-out over extra cover. Top shot

Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, FOUR, nicely done! Risky, but executed it so well. With a slip in place, Rinku employs the late-dab. Played very late and got it wide of the slip fielder. No third man to stop that

Harbhajan to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's an incredible shot. Was a full ball and Gill doesn't get down to sweep. Can't call it as sweep. A half-sweep, half-whip. Powerfully hit through square leg. Raced away

McClenaghan to Rahul, SIX, lovely, Rahul has been in sensational form this IPL and this was a gift from McClenaghan, full and wide of off, lets Rahul free his arms and lift it high and over cover, into the first tier of the stands

Bumrah to Rahul, SIX, cracking shot, this is an exhibition from KL, a gentle loosener from Bumrah, full and well outside off, Rahul leans forward, presents the full face of the bat, high elbow and the ball sails into the first tier of the stands at cover

Duminy to Gayle, FOUR, similar delivery but the field is slightly tinkered to Gayle. Sweeper cover was brought in and extra cover was moved back. Gayle knew it, so went deep and flashed it in the pocket between cover and backward point

Cutting to Gayle, 1 run, 24th IPL fifty for Gayle, "He's having a prime time" says Sanjay Manjrekar on air. And there comes the 'Baby in the arms' celebration. Kings XI Punjab owner Preity Zinta is up on her feet applauding. Cutting begins with a cutter on leg, turned gently to short fine leg to bring up the landmark

Cutting to Gayle, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Cutting's gotten rid of Gayle in his first over. Prized scalp this for the Australian. Seemed like the off-paced delivery once again. Gayle picked it and went back to mow it over deep mid-wicket. In the process, loses his shape completely and skies it as far as SKY, who settles under it. Throws the ball up in the air, that says a lot of how desperate they were to see the back of Universe Boss. Gayle c Suryakumar Yadav b Cutting 50(40) [4s-6 6s-2]

Krunal Pandya to Yuvraj, SIX, vintage Yuvi! Greets Krunal to the crease with a maximum. Floated up in the swinging arc for him, Yuvraj gets under it and smokes it into the deep mid-wicket stands. Too easy

Krunal Pandya to Nair, out Yuvraj Run Out!! Third umpire called in for a run-out check but Yuvi has already started walking. Oh jeez! Yuvraj is nowhere in the frame. Goner! Unnecessary wicket. There was never a run there, to be honest. "Crazy running" was the comment from Haydos on air. There was a mix-up between both batsmen in the last over as well. Dropped in front of point, they set off for a single. Yuvi's bat got stuck in the turf and a flat, neat throw from Lewis to the keeper. Kishan does the rest. Yuvraj run out (Lewis/Ishan Kishan) 14(14) [6s-1]

Cutting to Nair, FOUR, some fortune for Nair. Walked across and tried to slog it across the line. Gets a thick top-edge and it flies away to the third man fence. The fielder was inside the ring and had no chance

Cutting to Nair, SIX, whack! Too predictable lengths from Cutting. The slower ball, tad shorter. Nair picked it up early, employs his strong bottom-hand into play to muscle it over deep mid-wicket, clears the rope for a maximum
Markande to Axar, SIX, Axar decides to have some fun. Markande overdoes the flight here. Feeds it full and in the slot for Axar, who flexes his arms and tonks it a long way into the long-on stands

McClenaghan to Nair, SIX, wowza! Nair sends one into the first tier. Poor delivery from McClenaghan, short without any purpose. Nair moves across his sticks, gets under it and hammers it behind square on the leg-side. Wonderful!

McClenaghan to Axar, no run, direct-hit and Nair would've been on his way back to the hut. Patel gets an inside edge onto his pad, the ball drops into the off-side. McClenaghan rushes forward, collects the ball and sees Nair stuttering at the middle of the pitch. Picks up and rifles a throw at the non-striker's end, but misses the target

McClenaghan to Nair, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Nair was iffy with his running right from the start, rode his luck but finally perishes now. Fullish on off, Nair backed away aiming to go inside-out over extra cover. Doesn't get the timing right and ends up hitting it towards Harik at long-off, who had to run to his left and gobbles it up. Made that look so easy, didn't he? Punjab continue to lose wickets in clusters. Nair c Hardik Pandya b McClenaghan 23(12) [4s-1 6s-2]

Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run, run-out opportunity missed. An ill-advised single after Stoinis tucked to straight to short mid-wicket and took off for a single. Was always struggling and a direct-hit at the non-striker's end would've been curtains for Stoinis

Bumrah to Axar, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Bumrah has been exceptional today. Deceives Patel with an off-cutter that gripped off the deck. Patel checked his loft, didn't go full throttle and ended up chipping it tamely to Hardik at long-on. Safe as houses! Another one bites the dust. This is superb comeback by MI. Axar c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 13(12) [6s-1]

Cutting to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, kamikaze running from Punjab. Agarwal would've been dismissed for a blob had SKY effected a run-out at the bowler's end. Chopped towards cover, they risk a single and Mayank would've been short by a few inches there, despite him dragging his bat

Cutting to Mayank Agarwal, SIX, in the airrr and just clears a leaping Rohit. A handy six for Agarwal and Punjab. Pitched up just outside off, Agarwal went through with the loft with a clean swing of the bat, enough wings on it to take it over the ropes at long-off

Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, SIX, "That's the 500th six of the tournament," informs Sanjay Manjrekar on air. Hardik offers a full ball in the slot, Stoinis sets up a solid base of off and launches it over long-off
Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, FOUR, Stoinis is playing a blinder for Punjab. Sees a short ball, backs away and bludgeons it powerfully wide of long-on. Evades the fielder comfortably

Hardik Pandya to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Caught by Senior Pandya. Mayank combusts. Had to go for it simply; full and outside off, Agarwal was backing away and had to reach out for it. Threw his bat and lost his shape. Slices it up in the air to short third man. The ball was swirling and Krunal judges it well to hold onto it without much fuss. Mayank Agarwal c Krunal Pandya b Hardik Pandya 11(7) [6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, SIX, awful from Hardik. Cannot bowl short with third man inside the ring. Stoinis knew the fielder was in, so went back and ramped it over short third man. Such is the timing that it went all the way for a maximum
Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, FOUR, wow! This has been a morale-boosting over for Punjab. Banged short, at the stumps. Stoinis is too strong to miss out. Pulls it witheringly to the cow corner fence

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle breaks free and this is his first attacking shot of the night, fraction too full and just outside off, Gayle gets his left leg out of the way, brings his bat down and thumps it back past the non-striker, one bounce and over the ropes

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Gayle, fraction too short and wide of off, Gayle backs away, gets his left leg out of the way and clatters it to the left of point, no stopping that

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, three boundaries off the over and 16 came from it, too short and too wide from Hardik, can't bowl those lengths with third man in the ring, Gayle backs away and clears the fielder with the cut, one bounce and over the ropes

McClenaghan to Gayle, SIX, massive, Gayle has sent this ball into the roof of the Holkar Stadium. Banged in short and at the stumps, Gayle backs away, frees his arms and muscles it high and over square leg. This one will not come back, new balls please
McClenaghan to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle has got going now, predictable delivery from McClenaghan, full and just outside off, Gayle gets forward and thumps it over mid-off, one bounce and over the ropes

Markande to Gayle, 1 run, chance, but it was gone even before Markande could get his hands around, Dropped short and just outside off, Gayle stayed back and punched it to the right of the bowler, burst through his hands even before he could react

Markande to Rahul, FOUR, nicely played by Rahul, too full and on the stumps, Rahul gets forward, doesn't bend down completely and plays a half-arm sweep past mid-wicket, bisects the two men in the deep to a nicety

Markande to Rahul, out Caught by Duminy!! That's a rank long hop and Rahul is gutted as he walks back to the hut. This was the attempted wrong 'un by Markande, dropped it way too short though, might have stuck slightly on the pitch, Rahul had to wait that extra second as he pulled, enough to mess up with his timing and he struck it hard, flat and straight to Duminy at deep mid-wicket. Rahul c Duminy b Markande 24(20) [4s-1 6s-2]
Markande to Gayle, SIX, huge and that's into the top tier of the ground, too full and too wide from Markande, Gayle gets underneath the ball and sends it soaring - high and over cover for a maximum

Markande to Gayle, FOUR, this is excellent cricket, the wrong 'un from Markande, pitched well outside off and spun away, Gayle waited for the ball to do its bit, arched back and carved it over backward point, the fielder gave the chase, but the ball spun away past him and into the fence

Hardik Pandya to Yuvraj, 1 run, edged and dropped, short of a length and just outside off, Yuvraj went hard on the cut, gets a thick edge to the right of the keeper. Ishan Kishan didn't get his foot moving, went one-handed as he dived, the ball hit his palms and bounced out

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, leg byes, FOUR, sloppy from Ishan Kishan once again, low full-toss on Gayle's pads, he was looking to flick and missed, went fine and to the right of the keeper. Kishan was late on the dive and lets the ball slip through for four leg-byes

Ashwin to Ishan Kishan, SIX, muscled away! Much-needed release stroke for Kishan. He was crawling along and this should help. Fired flat and on a good length, Kishan was down on one knee in a flash and slog swept hard. Flat over deep square leg for a biggie. Nicely struck

Stoinis to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely stroke. Stoinis erred by gifting a low full toss on the pads, Suryakumar with that flourish of his wristed it away through square leg. Rajpoot was stationed well behind square and made a desperate attempt to get to the ball. In vain

Stoinis to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Rahul!! Huge wicket! Massive blow for Mumbai as the well-set Suryakumar has to depart. Have to say that this was a result of the slow scoring by Lewis and Kishan at the other end. Slower ball and the length is dragged back as well, Suryakumar went for the slog but only managed to sky it high in the air. Rahul was quick to call for it and trekked back nicely to sit under it. High pressure catch and it's been taken. Mumbai in a spot of bother here. They need their skipper to take charge. Suryakumar Yadav c Rahul b Stoinis 57(42) [4s-6 6s-3]

Stoinis to Ishan Kishan, SIX, helps it away for a biggie! Stoinis spoils the over with a short ball around leg stump, doesn't rise enough to threaten Kishan who swivels to just control the pull. The emphasis was to just use the pace and get it over short fine leg. In the end, it went all the way
Mujeeb to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, clubbed wide of long-on. It was in the air but Hardik got his placement right. On a good length from a flat trajectory, he gets under it and flays it away
Mujeeb to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, flatter and outside off, chops the cut towards cover and takes Yuvraj on for the single. The shy at the bowler's end misses but I reckon Hardik may have made it

Mujeeb to Ishan Kishan, SIX, that's gone deep into the crowd! Best over of the chase thus far and MI needed this to be fair. Mujeeb is under pressure now. Full and flat just outside off, Kishan fetches it with a slog sweep over deep mid-wicket. Meaty blow!

Mujeeb to Ishan Kishan, out Bowled!! Excellent comeback from Mujeeb! Got carted for two biggies but the Afghan lad has held his nerve brilliantly. Saw Kishan give the charge and hung it back a bit in the air. Pulled the length back just a touch and that meant that the wild slog was never really on. Kishan misses and finds the stumps in a mess. Back to back overs where the runs have come but so have the wickets and that's what KXIP will be concerned with as MI bat deep. Ishan Kishan b Mujeeb 25(19) [6s-3]

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Stoinis lets it through! Poor fielding and his Aussie teammate who is bowling won't be amused at all. Slower and fuller outside off, Hardik absolutely belted the drive but it shopuld have been cut off at sweeper cover. Instead it sneaks through Stoinis and crashes into the fence

Mujeeb to Hardik Pandya, SIX, dumped into the stands! Hardik Pandya has been promoted to up the ante and he is at it. Makes a hint of room and gets a fuller ball in his arc, smokes it into orbit at long-on. Powerful hit!

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, out Bowled!! The stumps are in a mess! This is excellent stuff from Tye and this is why he is sought after in the T20 format. Loves bowling at the back end of the innings. This is a big strike for KXIP as the dangerous Hardik Pandya has to depart. He did get going tonight from the word go but his cameo has been nipped in the bud. The cutter from Tye and he did smartly to attack the stumps, a wild slog attempted and once Hardik missed it, he knew the result. Woodwork destroyed! Hardik Pandya b Andrew Tye 23(13) [4s-2 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, good placement and timing to get Krunal off the mark. Finds the fence. Fuller ball on the pads, he shuffled across and flicked this well wide of the deep mid-wicket fielder who had lot of ground to cover

Mujeeb to Rohit, SIX, this will help MI! The skipper tees off and clears the fence with ease. Fullish and in the slot, flatter trajectory helped Rohit as he clubbed it dead straight over the bowler's head. Lovely placement too as you cannot have a fielder there. Not that it would have mattered

Mujeeb to Rohit, SIX, what a gigantic strike! Rohit is in the mood tonight, that's for sure. Shuffles a tad across the stumps and gets a fuller ball closer his arc. Goes through with that classy bat swing of his to send this way into the crowd at deep mid-wicket. 14 off the over! MI are hanging on here

Stoinis to Rohit, FOUR, sublime stroke! Most people would have tried slogging this but not Rohit. Uses his timing and placement to find the fence. Full and wide outside off, unfurls the drive with finesse past a diving extra cover fielder. There wasn't any protection in the deep

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, an exact replica from Krunal and the runs are coming now. Full and wide outside off, slower ball but the width allows the southpaw to free his arms. Crashes it through extra cover and the man at sweeper is very wide

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, raining boundaries now! This is the over MI needed to turn this game around and Stoinis is bearing the brunt of it. Misses the yorker for the second time in as many deliveries and it's a full toss on the pads, easily chipped away aerially but well wide of short fine leg

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, SIX, M-A-S-S-I-V-E! What a blow by Krunal! This over has most certainly sealed the game for Mumbai. Excellent hitting under pressure from these two. Stoinis errs on the fuller side once more and feeds it right where Krunal was wanting it. He backed away, cleared his front leg and deposited it over long-on for a mammoth six

Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, not where he wanted to hit this but who cares? MI are cantering now. Slower and shortish, foxed Krunal for a moment but the length allowed him to adjust. Lobbed wide of backward point and it races away. Just 11 off 10 needed now!

Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, SIX, he has absolutely blasted this away! Krunal is hitting them with such ferocity and also clearing the fence by some margin as well. Fuller ball on middle and leg, he was backing away and slogs it merrily over the ropes. Such a huge hit and with such power. Wow!

Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, leg byes, FOUR, Mumbai are alive! They live on to fight another day this season. An anti-climax of a finish, slow yorker and Krunal missed the slog to be hit on the back leg. KXIP were busy appealing for LBW and the ball raced away to the fence. They didn't have any review to challenge the call anyway and so it meant that the game was settled

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, over Mayank's ambitious one-handed leap at deep square leg! Was pulled away by Suryakumar Yadav. Short and at 132ks isn't going to threaten him on this pitch. So he swivels, without bothering to keep the shot down and gets it all the way
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, that's been picked up like a bestseller on the shelf. Length on the pads and Suryakumar Yadav's lovely wrists come into play. Whipped all the way over deep square

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's been smuggled past Ashwin at mid-on. Slower ball yeah, and Suryakumar Yadav clips it safely wide of Ashwin there. Knew the chase, as lethargic as it'll be, will be more for the cameras. And it was..
Andrew Tye to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, so starts with a slower delivery that decks away and ironically allows Suryakumar Yadav the room to slap it off the back foot. Through extra cover

Mujeeb to Lewis, out Caught by Rahul!! Gets Lewis with the back-of-the-hand delivery. But to be honest, that wasn't what defeated the batsman; it was more the drift that was taking the ball away. Lewis went for the cut, played out of sync with the lack of pace on the ball, and edged it behind. Sharp catch by KL Rahul, it must be said. Lewis c Rahul b Mujeeb 10(13)
Axar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, perfect length for Suryakumar Yadav. Not too full, not too short, so he could kneel and half-pull half-sweep that through fine leg
Stoinis to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, overpitched slower one and that's been burnt down to long-on. Absolutely drilled away with little respect

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, going...going...going..GONE! That was in the nightsky for an eternity and yet had enough distance to go deep into the crowd. Clean hit! Full and in the slot for Suryakumar who just goes through the line with the loft. Didn't seem like he got hold of it initally but boy, didn't he??

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, more runs! Just the momentum MI were needing after a lull phase. Rajpoot errs on the shorter side and there is width as well, Suryakumar holds his shape and slaps the cut behind point. Fifty for SKY

Southee to Watson, FOUR, cracking shot! That is not the place to bowl to any batsman. Short, wide and outside off, just the delivery Watson would have liked to get him going, slapped the cut square on the off-side and opened his account in style

Southee to Watson, FOUR, even with a sweeper Watson collects a boundary. Southee is still searching for swing, pitches it up and Watson leans forward to caress the drive through cover. de Grandhomme gave up the chase early

Siraj to Shorey, SIX, that ruins the over. Tries to scare the debutant with a short delivery, but Shorey has made a clean connection with the hook shot, got inside the line and used the pace on the ball to place it over fine leg
de Grandhomme to Rayudu, FOUR, poor ball from de Grandhomme, short and angling into Rayudu's pads, he swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Murugan Ashwin to Rayudu, out Caught by Siraj!! .. and he strikes first ball. It's the big wicket of Rayudu, dropped short and wide of off, Rayudu's eyes lit up as he saw the width, went way too hard on the cut, lost his poise and the thick top-edge lobbed gently to Siraj at short third man. Relief for RCB, but still need 7 wickets to pinch this match. Rayudu c Siraj b Murugan Ashwin 32(25) [4s-3 6s-2]

de Grandhomme to Shorey, out Caught by Mandeep!! Short, wide and OUT. Looks like RCB have found a way of taking wickets, another soft dismissal for CSK. Shorey is the man to go, he saw the width, went with hard hands on the cut, nailed the shot but didn't bother to keep it down. Straight into the bucket like hands of Mandeep at backward point. DO RCB stand a chance here? Shorey c Mandeep b de Grandhomme 8(9) [6s-1]

de Grandhomme to Dwayne Bravo, no run, chance and Parthiv has shelled it, it was a tough chance, he was standing up to the batsman, on a good length and well wide of off, Bravo went for the flamboyant drive, got a feather and Parthiv grabbed at that, it popped out and he had a second bite at the cherry, but can't hold on

Murugan Ashwin to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, chance and dropped, RCB simply can't afford this, Kohli looks livid, but Chahal is the man who has dropped it. This was tossed up well outside off, Bravo went for his flamboyant inside out drive, didn't bother to keep it down. Chahal did all the hard yards, ran across to his right from sweeper cover, got to the ball and then shelled it as he tumbled onto the ground
Murugan Ashwin to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, that should relieve the pressure off Bravo, a rank long hop from Ashwin, Bravo rocks back and nails the pull over wide long-on, went a long way over the ropes
Murugan Ashwin to Dhoni, FOUR, poor ball from Ashwin, drops his length short and well outside off, Dhoni is all over it like a rash, slaps it past cover and collects his first boundary

Chahal to Dhoni, SIX, massive, that should seal this match. This was the wrong 'un from Chahal, Dhoni spots it early, gets a big stride forward, plays with the turn and smashes it high and over deep mid-wicket

Chahal to Dhoni, SIX, that should be it, this was tossed up well outside off, Dhoni gets forward and thumps it high towards long-on, didn't get hold of the shot, Kohli at long-off was kept interested, but in the end - the ball sailed over his head

Chahal to Dhoni, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Dhoni, hitting of the highest order from the former India captain. This was tossed up on off, Dhoni gets forward and thumps it high and over long-on for a maximum

U Yadav to Rayudu, SIX, that is what pace brings. Rayudu is hardly in control of the pull shot, but the ball has sailed away for a maximum. Rushed the batsman with a short ball and the top-edge flies over the CSK dugout

U Yadav to Watson, out Bowled!! The perfect set-up from Umesh. Couple of short of length deliveries before the full one, Watson's feet went nowhere as he tried to get bat on ball, beaten for sheer pace and the ball uproots the off-stump. The direction is what mattered and Umesh got it spot on. Aimed right for the base of off-stump. There's the wicket RCB were looking for. Watson b U Yadav 11(14) [4s-2]

Southee to Rayudu, FOUR, slower delivery and Rayudu spotted that early, a much needed boundary for CSK that. Waited for the off-cutter, stood his ground and heaved it over mid-wicket. No chance for AB to pull it back in
