Southee to Rayudu, SIX, wrong length from Southee. The off-cutter is landed short of length, sat up for Rayudu, who gave it his all to smash the pull over mid-wicket, the in-form batsman has broken the shackles for the home side

Southee to Rayudu, FOUR, big over for CSK, 16 off it. Overpitched delivery and right in the slot for Rayudu, with the form he is, there is no missing out on such freebies, drills the drive wide of mid-off. Did Kohli err in giving Southee a third?

Siraj to Raina, SIX, that's the pressure releaser. Needed a boundary or something to get himself going. Backed away to leg and got the length delivery right in his arc, swung it away over long-on. Not quite off the middle but still had enough

Siraj to Raina, 2 runs, run-out chance missed. This is where RCB will miss de Kock. He has been brilliant behind the stumps. Very full and outside off, Raina squeezes out to square third man, Ashwin gets across and releases the ball quickly, Parthiv failed to gather the ball. Had he done so, then Raina was gone

Chahal to Raina, FOUR, poor delivery from Chahal. Rank long hop and Raina had all the time in world to pick his spot, transfers his weight on the back foot and slots the pull past square leg, no chance for the man in the deep

U Yadav to Raina, FOUR, easy! That is well played by Raina. Short of length delivery, Raina shuffled across to get inside the line, picked it up from the middle stump line and tickled it fine. Runs starting to flow quite comfortably now

U Yadav to Raina, out Caught by Southee!! Raina is waiting. He has been asked to walk back. Fine take by Southee. With a leg slip in place, Raina had to find other areas to play the short ball, so he moves away to leg and tries to flat-bat it over long-on, got it off the toe-end and it still almost cleared long-on. Southee first held on to the catch, then saw himself overbalancing, threw the ball up and went out before coming back in to complete the catch. Raina c Southee b U Yadav 25(21) [4s-2 6s-1]

Willey to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's been so brilliantly placed. Short of length but it's just outside off, so escapes the ignominy of being a short-wide ball and adds to the genius of Brendon McCullum, who's nicely used his hands to glide it right between short third man and backward point

Lungi Ngidi to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Ngidi runs his fingers across for some magic. Helped by Brendon McCullum, who came down the track and backed away early, allowing Lungi Ngidi to take pace off the ball. Checked the flat-batted smack that he intended to clear cow corner with, toe-ended it to mid-on, where Shardul made a somewhat easy catch look difficult. Probably the wind. Stuttered on the first attempt but managed to hold onto it. Brendon McCullum c SN Thakur b Lungi Ngidi 5(3) [4s-1]

Lungi Ngidi to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's over mid-on. And comfortably. Seam-up back of a length ball that allows Parthiv Patel a cross-batted swat. Not right out of the middle but the shot thrust meant that it cleared the fielder
Lungi Ngidi to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, fuller and this has been deliciously chipped over mid-wicket. All timing. No show.

Jadeja to Mandeep, out Caught by Willey!! Jadeja has his second! He doesn't celebrate like he usually does. Just stares at the batsman. Not sure why he has been subdued today despite getting the wickets. Probably the pressure leading upto today is the reason. Coming to the wicket, not the kind of shot Mandeep should be playing when you are trying to rebuild. Tries to take Jaddu on with a slog sweep but doesn't quite get hold of it. There is a deep backward square leg in place, precisely for this and he gobbles to up. More problems for RCB. Mandeep c Willey b Jadeja 7(13)

Harbhajan to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, pushed through quicker from a good length, worked off the back foot through mid-wicket. 11th IPL fifty for Parthiv Patel! He's been the lone ranger so far with the big names failing. Needs to carry on though

Harbhajan to de Grandhomme, FOUR, finds the fence! Much-needed one for RCB to break the shackles. de Grandhomme gets into the act. Used his feet to get to the pitch and what he did well was to go straight down the ground. Cannot afford to play across the line on this pitch and he does the smart thing. Hit it dead straight and Shardul from long-on did try to get to the ball but eventually missed it

Jadeja to Parthiv Patel, out Caught&Bowled!! Another one bites the dust. Jadeja is having a field day. What a spell! The slowness of the surface does Parthiv in here. He was early into the flick stroke on seeing the flight and only managed a leading edge straight back to Jaddu who accepts it. Again no real celebrations from Jadeja. This has been a fantastic spell from the left-arm spinner. Fair to say that he has made a fine comeback after all the criticism. A nice innings from Parthiv but he knew that he should have batted through. Parthiv Patel c and b Jadeja 53(41) [4s-5 6s-2]

Harbhajan to Murugan Ashwin, out Stumped!! RCB are being spun to the dumps here. Harbhajan's turn to sneak a wicket now, his second. Wonderfully bowled this, slowed it up and got a bit of drift as well. Lured Ashwin into pushing at it and this just straightened a tad to beat the edge. Dhoni has super quick to whip off the bails and as replays showed, the back leg was just on the line. That was never going to be enough. RCB sink further .Murugan Ashwin st Dhoni b Harbhajan 1(2)

Willey to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Raina!! It's all falling apart here for RCB. First IPL wicket for Willey and he is thrilled. What a horror stroke from de Grandhomme though? He knew that all the responsibility was now down to him and instead of playing through, he decides to go for broke. Never the pitch for that kind of batting and he departs. A cutter on a good length and he tried to slog this away but only managed to skew this high towards extra cover. Raina charged forward to take it with ease. de Grandhomme c Raina b Willey 8(8) [4s-1]

Lungi Ngidi to U Yadav, out U Yadav Run Out!! Bulls eye from Willey at mid-off. Charged to attack the ball and fired in an accurate throw at the bowler's end. Umesh was always struggling to get in and eventually was well short. Fullish ball that was driven off the front foot past the bowler and they were looking to sneak a quick single. Not to be. That sort of day for RCB when nothing goes right. U Yadav run out (Willey) 1(5)

Willey to Southee, FOUR, lucky runs but RCB will take them any way they come. Low full toss that Southee wanted to slug away on the leg-side. Gets an inside edge that just whizzes past leg stump. Too fine and short fine leg had no chance
Dwayne Bravo to Southee, FOUR, first ball for Bravo and he has been punished. Fuller ball outside off, Southee unfurls a cracking drive through extra cover. Finds the fence, 100 up for RCB finally

SN Thakur to Southee, SIX, mighty blow from Southee. So this is why he is denying the single on offer. Backing himself to club a few and does so this time in style. Slightly short and slow from Shardul, pulled away over deep square leg after a slight shuffle. Handy runs these

SN Thakur to Southee, FOUR, this is a very vital cameo from Southee, infusing respectability into the RCB innings. Funny shot though, walked across the sticks for the paddle scoop and instead skied it towards third man. Very fine and Ngidi tried to get to it, even got a hand on it but could only palm it to the ropes. Dropped!

Dwayne Bravo to Siraj, out Siraj Run Out!! 1 run completed A wicket to cap the innings. Full toss that Siraj mistimed towards long-on and they were going for the second run. Had to with this being the last ball but Rayudu's throw at the keeper's end was on target. Dhoni whipped off the bails in a flash and even the dive couldn't save Siraj. RCB end with an underwhelming total. Siraj run out (Rayudu/Dhoni) 3(7)

Willey to Parthiv Patel, SIX, he's hit this all the way over long-on. Backs away and makes some room whilst doing so, meaning he could pump the ball away even though Willey was bringing it in wide of the crease
SN Thakur to Kohli, FOUR, gee that's disrespectful. Transfers the weight on the front foot and flat-bats it over Thakur's head
Lungi Ngidi to Parthiv Patel, SIX, read the cutter nicely here. Shifted just outside the line of the ball, which is on middle-stump say, and picked it up -- all the way! -- over backward square

Lungi Ngidi to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, and he makes me eat crow with a dismantling cover drive. Actually not even that. Far from it. A bit of room on this fuller length delivery and he's slapped it through covers. Threw his hands at it and somehow made it look like the prettiest thing you'll see today

Jadeja to Kohli, out Bowled!! Umm, let me watch it again. Jadeja is so shellshocked that he takes all the time in the world to make sense of what has happened, and forgets to celebrate. That's what we'll assume. Note the pace: 100.7kmph. Hits a length and straightens it just enough to castle Kohli, who was looking to glide it down to third man. Beaten by the pace off the pitch. Just hurried at Kohli that. Happens. Kohli b Jadeja 8(11) [4s-1]
Harbhajan to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, sliding on off-stump from round the wicket, and Parthiv Patel's greeted him with a reverse-sweep that he deftly places wide of the lone slipper

Harbhajan to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, dropped by Bhajji. Slows the pace down, Parthiv Patel's early and pops it back at Bhajji. Slightly to his right, Harbhajan went with both hands and that was his undoing. Got himself into a tangle and was late to react

Harbhajan to de Villiers, out Stumped!! Kohli out, and de Villiers follows him into the pavilion the next over. Bizarre way to get out actually. He's trying to reverse-paddle an off break from Harbhajan. Stretches way in front to meet that, is beaten by a bit of turn down the leg-side, and then Dhoni is quick. Doesn't even allow de Villiers a chance. de Villiers st Dhoni b Harbhajan 1(4)

Harbhajan to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, top shot! Not much gap between backward point and short third man but Parthiv has found it. To begin with, there wasn't any width on offer as Harbhajan darted this around off, the southpaw still managed to get the cut away. Bhajji is not amused

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, that's a beautiful shot. On a length outside off, Shaw stands tall, reaches for the widish delivery and towers it over long-on for half a dozen. No one has treated Sandeep in such a way so far in the tournament

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, out Maxwell Run Out!! Can you believe it? Maxwell has been run out, what an unfortunate way to get out. Nothing's going right for Maxwell this year. Was a full length delivery around off and Shaw drove it straight back to the bowler. Sandeep in his followthrough got his hand to it and parried it on to the stumps at the bowler's end. Maxwell is well short of the crease and he has to walk back. Got to feel for the Aussie batsman! Maxwell run out (Sandeep Sharma) 2(3)

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, crunched away! Short and wide outside off, Shaw throws his hands at it and crunches it through the gap at cover-point, races away to the fence in a jiffy. How good has he looked in his maiden IPL season!

Rashid Khan to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by S Kaul!! Sunrisers' best bowler strikes, gets the young opener. Tossed up delivery around off, Shaw goes after it with a slog and gets a top edge to short third man. Kaul stationed in the position goes down on his knee and reverse cups it. Fine knock by Shaw, nevertheless. He has laid the foundation for the likes of Pant and other Delhi batsmen. Prithvi Shaw c S Kaul b Rashid Khan 65(36) [4s-6 6s-3]

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, no run, Saha has dropped it! Could have been the second wicket for Rashid. Iyer tried to work that short delivery away to the on side but got a thick inside edge. Saha behind the wickets makes a mess of it as the Delhi skipper gets a life

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, rubbing salt on the wounds. Flighted ball outside off, Iyer goes inside out and chips it to perfection over wide long-off. The fielder tried hard, but the ball just cleared the fence

Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, a rare blip from Shikhar Dhawan in the field, you won't see this often because he's usually a good fielder. A dipping low full toss on off, Iyer smashes it down to long-off, Dhawan was pretty squarer and had to run across to his right. Did so and in the process, sort of took his eyes off the ball. Or got an awkward bounce too, failed to get his body behind the line of the ball and lets it through to the fence

S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Dhawan!! Told ya! Shikhar is a good fielder, compensates for the early fault of his in the previous over as he holds onto a catch and does the 'Thigh five' to get the Hyderabad crowd into a frenzy. Full and on leg, Iyer had the license to go for it. Picked it off his pads and whacked hard, no real timing behind it and hits it straight to Dhawan at deep mid-wicket. Shreyas Iyer c Dhawan b S Kaul 44(36) [4s-3 6s-2]

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, a welcome boundary for Pant, this should get him going. Kaul wafts it full outside off, Pant plonks his front foot forward and blasts it straight back at Kaul, who sticks his hand out but can't cling onto it. Brushes his fingertips and trickles away to the straight boundary. Umpire Bruce Oxenford had to take cover as it was coming at him

Rashid Khan to Naman Ojha, out Naman Ojha Run Out!! Suicidal running and DD lose another wicket. Remember, Pant was involved in a run-out against CSK as well where he ran his skipper out. Today, it's the turn of Ojha, who has to depart early. Defended to the right of the bowler and Ojha took off, Pant responded and stopped, throwing his partner under the bus. Rashid Khan moves across quickly and lasers a throw to the keeper, who does the rest. Naman Ojha run out (Rashid Khan/Saha) 1(4)

Rashid Khan to Pant, out Lbw!! Pant has been given out LBW, he reviews. No issues with the front foot. Clearly no bat there. Only factor that could favour Pant is the height. Hit in-line as well. Ball-tracker is out: 2 reds. Pitched - in-line. Impact - in-line. Wickets - umpire's call. Clipping the top of middle. What a fightback from SRH this has been. Skiddy leg-break from Rashid on a short of length, Pant went back for the pull and it didn't rise much as he expected. Misses and is rapped on the back thigh. Was given out on-field, he reviewed in hope but in vain. Pant lbw b Rashid Khan 18(19) [4s-1]

S Kaul to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, run-out chance at the non-striker's end missed! Why didn't Kaul collect the ball and break the stumps? Had ample time there as Christian had given up. Poked airly to extra cover, KW fires a throw and misses the target. No backing up and they take the single eventually. Skipper gestures to Kaul that he should've collected the ball
Bhuvneshwar to Vijay Shankar, SIX, this should ease Shankar's nerves. Much-needed hit for DD. Bhuvneshwar overdoes it; full and outside off, Shankar lines up and smacks it with ferocity over long-on

Bhuvneshwar to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, Shankar picks the leg-cutter on this occasion. Took a stride forward, opened his bat face and flayed it past point. Sweeper cover fielder couldn't get across and it runs away to the boundary
Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, greets Shakib with a glorious shot. Tossed up delivery outside off, Shaw leans forward and times his chip over covers for six more, that's his second one of the night

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, boundary to end the over. Short one on the pads and all Shaw has to do is help it on its way. Does so and drags it past the fielder at short fine leg, finds the fence and moves on to 28* with that, was the knuckle ball and Shaw picked it up nicely

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, straight down the ground! Another slower delivery on a full length on middle, Iyer stays put and drives it straight back, almost takes down Shaw at the other end who takes evasive action and loses balance. Can't keep a fielder there as Iyer scores his first boundary

S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, he's picking those slower deliveries, those knuckle balls to perfection. This was a full one outside off and Shaw simply smoked it over long-off. Third one of the night for him, he's approaching another fifty
S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, pulled away! He's looking to make the most of the powerplay. This was a short delivery around off, Shaw picked the length early and pulled it nicely over mid-wicket

S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Kaul is feeling the pressure. Struggling with his lines and lengths. Has tried the knuckle ball, the short one but nothing's going his way. This was on the pads and Shaw dragged it down to fine leg with ease

S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, 20 runs off that Kaul over! Think this is Kaul's most expensive over of IPL 2018. Coming back to the ball it was a shortish one outside off, Shaw transfered his weight on to the back foot and crunched it through the gap at cover, two fielders went for the chase but none could stop that

Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, another fine fifty for Shaw! Has been consistent right throughout. This was a short and low delivery on middle, he flicked that away to deep mid-wicket for a single to reach the milestone
Rashid Khan to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, doesn't even spare Rashid Khan. Short one, probably the googly, Shaw camps back and pulls it well past the fielder at deep square leg

Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's into the stands! Iyer joins the party, scores his first maximum of the night. Gets to the pitch of the ball and sends it sailing over the man at long-on for a perfectly timed six

Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that's a perfect example of a square cut. Was another short delivery outside off and Iyer was on to it in a flash. Rocks back and chops it right into the gap between point and cover-point

Avesh Khan to Hales, FOUR, lousy beginning from Avesh. Whangs in a short ball on leg-stump line, forgets the fine leg is inside the circle. Easy picking for Hales, swivels across and helps it over the man at 45. Didn't get it off the middle but enough to clear the fielder
Avesh Khan to Hales, FOUR, Hales is aware of the field. Perhaps realised another short ball was coming. Moved away to the leg-side, opened himself up and ramps it over short third man

Avesh Khan to Hales, 1 run, Maxi drops a skier. He's having a horrible tournament, not amongst the runs and now puts down a sitter. Hales miscues the pull, gets it high on the bat and sends it high into the night sky. Maxi from deep square leg, runs in and slides with both hands cupped. Straight in and out, embarrasses himself and DD

Mishra to Dhawan, out Bowled!! A long stare to the batsman, followed by a loud roar - that's Mishra's reaction. He has removed both the openers. Beautiful bowling. Tosses this well above the batsman's eyeline and that entices Dhawan into a false stroke. He cleared his front leg to hack it over the leg-side and missed it completely. Was bowled full and Dhawan was beaten in the flight. Middle stump takes the brunt. Replay shows that it was a wrong 'un. Dhawan b Mishra 33(30) [4s-2 6s-1]

Christian to Manish Pandey, FOUR, two fielders run across, see each other and neither go for the ball. Comical. Two overseas fielders - Roy and Boult. Was a low full toss and Pandey got underneath it to bunt it over the bowler's head. Long-on should have cut that off. Ordinary stuff!

Christian to Manish Pandey, FOUR, now these two boundaries have made a mess of Christian's figures. The length was shortened by Christian, Pandey danced out of his crease and slapped it through covers. In the gap and 13 came off that over

Avesh Khan to Williamson, SIX, superb shot! Bouncer well outside off, a slight move across from Williamson, followed by an upper cut over third man. Both his feet off-ground when he made contact with the ball. Classy shot. Timing and placement was spot on

Plunkett to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! The teenager takes a high-pressure catch. The cross-seamed fuller length ball, Pandey went too hard on his lofted shot and lost all his shape in the process. Wanted to go downtown and the bat face turned at the point of impact. Went miles up in the air and Shaw settled under it after running back from extra cover. Reverse-cupped. Manish Pandey c Prithvi Shaw b Plunkett 21(17) [4s-2]

Plunkett to Y Pathan, 1 run, dropped! Vijay Shankar at deep backward square leg has put down. Probably lost it a bit and was late to go for the catch. Was a shortish ball on leg and Pathan heaved it flat behind square leg. How costly will that be?
Boult to Y Pathan, SIX, that's a massive hit! Picked the slower ball, was in his slot, and then butchered it over long-on. Fullish and misses his yorker. 22 off 11 now
Boult to Y Pathan, FOUR, gold! Boult misses his mark. Doles out a wide-ish full ball and Pathan reaches out with hard hands. Sliced through backward point and that's gone for a boundary

Christian to Y Pathan, SIX, oh, Christian, what have you done. A full toss and gets the treatment it deserved. Was slightly outside off, Pathan crouches low, got underneath and bludgeoned it over long-on. Poses for the photographs as well. Stylish..
Christian to Y Pathan, FOUR, just 2 needed now! Has to be SRH's game from here. Pacy bouncer and Pathan goes for the pull. Off the top-edge and goes over the man at short fine leg

Plunkett to Hales, FOUR, overcorrects and lands a fuller length delivery on the pads. Hales shuffled a bit and that must've put Plunkett off-guard. Moves inside the line and glances it very fine. The fielder was inside the ring and didn't have any chance

Plunkett to Dhawan, FOUR, Plunkett is spraying it all over the place. Misses the line and ends up offering a buffet ball for Dhawan down leg. Just needed to get some bat on that. Does so after a half-swivel and runs it down to the fine leg fence

Avesh Khan to Dhawan, SIX, bang! "Don't ball short to me," seemed like the body language of Dhawan. Knew what was coming, was ready on the back foot as he muscled it way back into the deep square leg stands
Avesh Khan to Hales, SIX, no respite for Avesh whatsoever. Tests Alex with a short ball, much like Hales he gets under it and blasts the pull over the mid-wicket fence

Avesh Khan to Hales, SIX, this is turning out to be an expensive over for DD. Went full outside off, Hales jumped across and lifted it over mid-off. Not off the sweet spot but enough to take it all the way for a maximum

Avesh Khan to Hales, SIX, 27 runs off the over. Avesh has been taken to the cleaners. Drops it short on seeing Hales move to leg. Hales throws it bat and smashes it over the in-field on the off-side. Sails over the ropes by a few inches. Just the momentum SRH needed at the end of Powerplay

Mishra to Dhawan, FOUR, that's a gift and Dhawan takes full toll of it. What was that from Mishra? Darts a full toss on the pads and Dhawan won't miss out on those. Bends his back leg and clouts it behind square leg. There's none to stop that

Mishra to Hales, out Bowled!! That's an absolute peach. Hales had no clue, still doesn't. Stands in his crease and stares at his stumps in total disbelief. That ball reminded me of the famous ball bowled by Warne to Gatting. Mishra gives air on this occasion, gets it to drift in and beats him with the away-turn. Pitched around middle and leg, beat the outside edge and crashed into the off-stump. There's the breakthrough DD were looking for. Hales not happy with Mishy's celebration in his face. Maybe something was said. Kept looking back while walking. Hales b Mishra 45(31) [4s-3 6s-3]

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, FOUR, edged and four, a second slip would have swallowed it, back of a length and in that channel outside off, Lynn pushed at that tamely, got a thick edge that flew past the lone slip

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Lynn and he's away, the slower ball from Bumrah, it was a back of a length delivery as well, Lynn spotted it early, got on top of the bounce and punched it through cover. Krunal Pandya gave the chase, but the ball sped away to the ropes
Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, that's good anticipation. Knew Cutting will be slow and around off, so shuffles across on his knees and swept this through fine leg. Nicely done
Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, another slower delivery. Not much to guess out there for Uthappa at the moment. Stays put and flashes the late cut in front of the backward point fielder. 79 off 51 needed

Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, first fifty of the season for Uthappa. He's making a day out of Markande's drop. Another short ball, Uthappa stays front-footed and heaves that over mid-wicket. Gloriously weird shot
Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, short and into his right shoulder, and here's what Uthappa does: Swivels and pulls it through fine leg. Life's ridiculously easy at times

Markande to Uthappa, out Caught by Cutting!! The cameras rightly pan to Hardik Pandya, who was furious when Markande had dropped Uthappa on four. Redemption for the young leggie here. First ball to Uthappa in this new spell and he's taken him out with a leg break. Got it to spin, which meant that Uthappa, on his front foot and going for the big hit, had to slice it. Carries nice and high to long-off. Uthappa c Cutting b Markande 54(35) [4s-6 6s-3]

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Bumrah!! Mumbai have found a way past their ex. Nitish Rana, as strong as he's through square on the off-side, has a few issues against the short ball. So Hardik Pandya does exactly that. Angles this seam-up short ball across from over the wicket, has Nitish Rana fetching the pull from outside off, and has him top-edging. Taken at deep square leg by Bumrah, who drops down to take it one-handed amidst fears of a spill. Nitish Rana c Bumrah b Hardik Pandya 31(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

Markande to A Russell, FOUR, that wasn't too short but look at Russell pin all his weight on the back foot, and deep in the crease, and swat it disparagingly wide of long-on. That fact that he had to summon the ball from outside off tells how powerful Russ is

Bumrah to A Russell, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! That's a terrific catch from Krunal and Russell falls to a top-edged pull. Hurried by the pace, so looked in no position to play the shot. Backed away, and met the ball with weight on his front foot. Krunal swerved in the deep, anticipating the trajectory and then dived in front at deep backward square to take the catch. Good effort, running back from short fine leg. A Russell c Krunal Pandya b Bumrah 9(10) [4s-1]
Bumrah to Karthik, FOUR, short and wide, and pumped away with an uppish cut shot behind square on the off-side
Bumrah to Karthik, leg byes, FOUR, given as leg byes. Goes for the slower delivery but gets the radar wrong. Slipping down leg; beats the batsman and then the keeper too. 43 needed off 3 overs!
Hardik Pandya to Karthik, FOUR, good follow-up with the slower delivery but got the length wrong. And the line. Shortish outside off, allowing Karthik to stay back and flash it square on the off-side

Bumrah to Karthik, SIX, what about the height on this full toss? Looked like it was below the waist. This time Karthik makes hay. Slogs it over deep mid-wicket, where Milne is trying to catch that one-handed and leaping. Well over him
Bumrah to Karthik, FOUR, misses the yorker by inches and that's good enough for DK. Went back and got under it, drilling it uppishly through a very straight long-on

Bumrah to Karthik, FOUR, Duminy drops it at deep square and then also lets it go for a boundary. Low full toss, Karthik got into a position early and swiveled the hack round the corner. It was right upto Duminy, who went for the reverse cup but lets it through. What's worse: it bounces once before the boundary ropes. Bad. Very bad
Krunal Pandya to Narine, FOUR, gee this is going south. Krunal has done nothing to allay fears. Bowls a full toss and is hammered down the ground. 19 off 5 needed

Krunal Pandya to Narine, out Caught by Rohit!! Oh, that's it for Narine. Three consecutive boundaries from KKR and here's the wicket. KP angles this across Narine, who was always going for it. Gets a toe-end and Rohit nicely traces a few yards back at extra cover to take this. Narine c Rohit b Krunal Pandya 5(4) [4s-1]
Krunal Pandya to Karthik, FOUR, wide full toss and Karthik's carved it over the infield square on the off-side

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, byes, FOUR, a hat-trick of boundaries ruins the over, lovely ball from Bumrah, cut back in sharply from a length outside off, Lynn was caught on the back-foot as he wafted, got beaten on the inside edge and the ball further swung away, leaving Ishan Kishan stranded

McClenaghan to Shubman Gill, FOUR, KKR are dealing in boundaries at the moment, tad too full and wide of off, Gill gets forward, closed the face of the bat and drives it in between the non-striker and the umpire, no need to run for those

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, this is turning out to be a fine start for KKR, too short and on the stumps, Lynn swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it behind square on the on-side, beat short fine and rolled away to the fence

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, cracking shot, this short-ball plan isn't working for MI, too short and just outside off, Lynn swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it in front of square on the on-side, the man in the deep is too square and has no chance

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Bumrah!! A soft dismissal, this came from nowhere but MI will gladly take it. The short ball has got them a wicket, Lynn is gutted as he walks away. Banged in short and at the stumps, Lynn had all the time in the world as he pulled, just didn't pick the gap, hits it straight into the hands of Bumrah at short fine. Relief for McClenaghan and MI. There's the customary check for the front-foot no-ball, but McClenaghan is fine on that count as well. Chris Lynn c Bumrah b McClenaghan 17(13) [4s-4]

Hardik Pandya to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! The Pandya brothers in action and KKR have lost both openers now. This is a horrendous shot from young Gill though, the slower off-cutter from Hardik, Gill was looking to hoist it out of the stadium, the bat turned on impact as the ball gripped on the surface, the steepling toe-end went high and towards mid-off. The elder Pandya was under the ball, completes it with great composure and all of a sudden - KKR have lost two. Shubman Gill c Krunal Pandya b Hardik Pandya 7(5) [4s-1]
Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, lovely, too full and too wide of off, allows Rana to free his arms as he scythes it past cover-point, off the mark with a boundary

McClenaghan to Nitish Rana, SIX, short, wide and six, the plan was to bowl short at Rana, McClenaghan had a backward point and a fielder square at point, but this was too short and too wide. Rana got on top of the bounce, used McClenaghan's pace and lashed it over the head of third man

Hardik Pandya to Uthappa, no run, chance and dropped, that's a dolly and Markande has somehow dropped it. Then slower short ball outside off, Uthappa swivelled across on the pull, doesn't get hold of the shot and hit it straight to mid-on. It came at a very good height, Markande went reverse cupped and somehow let the ball pop out

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, SIX, beautifully played, he pre-empted that Krunal was flighting this one, backed away, gets underneath the length and lifts it back over the bowler, clears the sightscreen and it's Uthappa's first maximum
Krunal Pandya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, cracking shot, the quicker ball from Krunal, but the length was short and wide of off, Rana backs away and beats the man at point with a fierce cut

Markande to Nitish Rana, FOUR, nicely played! Rana is looking a million dollars today, tossed up well outside off, Rana picked the length early, bent down low, rolled his wrists and swept it behind square on the on-side, beat the diving fielder in the deep

Markande to Uthappa, SIX, 4000 IPL runs for Uthappa, this is excellent cricket, tossed up nicely outside off, it was the wrong 'un and Uthappa spotted it early, got a big stride forward, hit it with the spin and into the crowd at wide long-on

Markande to Uthappa, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Uthappa, Markande drifts this one wider of off, Uthappa gets forward and thumps it back over the bowler's head, all the way for another maximum, 17 from the over
Krunal Pandya to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slower and on off, eased down towards long-on for a single

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, FOUR, a gift and Uthappa accepts it with glee, full-toss outside off, all Uthappa had to do was to find the gap, he gets forward and drills it to the right of extra-cover, no chance for the fielder getting across from long-off

Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, a gift and Uthappa will not miss out. Cutting lost his line as he attempted another slower ball, ends up drifting down the leg-side and all Uthappa had to do was to whip it into the gap - he does so, behind square on the on-side and MI continue to bleed boundaries

Prasidh to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 134.3kph, short and wide outside off, Suryakumar Yadav spots the length quickly, gets on top of the bounce and cuts through point. Perfectly placed between backward point and cover-point. First boundary of the match

Chawla to Rohit, FOUR, fabulous shot! Wee bit of space offered from Chawla on this flighted delivery and that is enough for Rohit to put it away, strides forward and creams the drive through cover. The timing ensures that sweeper is also beaten

Narine to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, fifty for Yadav. Fourth of the season and it has come against his former team. The sea of blue awaken to applaud the innings and he responds with a wave of the bat. Nudged with the spin past mid-wicket

Narine to Rohit, out Caught by (sub)Rinku Singh!! Big wicket for KKR. Another failure for Rohit this season. Only three times he has gone past 20 this season and Mumbai have won on all three occasions. They need someone now to take them close to that 200-mark. An off-spinner and it was too full to be sweeping, Rohit could not get underneath it completely and the top-edge skies towards deep mid-wicket. Rinku on as a substitute takes it calmly. Rohit c (sub)Rinku Singh b Narine 11(11) [4s-1]

Chawla to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, dropped! Narine got fingertips to it. Floated up around off, Yadav stayed leg-side to play the inside out loft, didn't get the elevation he was looking for and Narine parried it over him. A more agile fielder might have taken it

Chawla to Hardik Pandya, SIX, one-handed six for Pandya. Tossed it up on off, Pandya used his reach to get to the ball and just went through with the loft, the bottom hand comes off and the ball sails over long-off

A Russell to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Karthik!! Russell might not be bowling at full tilt but he's provided crucial wickets for KKR throughout the tournament. Got Lewis earlier in the innings and now accounts for a well-set Yadav. A tired shot from Yadav though. Sees the short of length delivery outside off and looks to play the back cut, thin edge and Karthik does the rest behind the stumps. Suryakumar Yadav c Karthik b A Russell 59(39) [4s-7 6s-2]

A Russell to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, the elder Pandya has made his intentions clear. Anything there to be hit, he's going for it. Short and slanted across off, Pandya transfers his weight back and pulls it over mid-wicket. No protection in the deep there

Prasidh to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, slapped! In trying to shorten the length Krishna offers width outside off, Pandya stands tall and cracks the cut square on the off-side, raced away quickly beating sweeper cover

Prasidh to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, the last two deliveries ruins the over for Krishna and KKR. Superb batting though from Pandya. Shuffled across and paddled the back of a length delivery over and wide of short fine leg. Just used the pace of the bowler

Narine to Krunal Pandya, SIX, Narine became a bit predictable there. Bowling offies on back of a length, Pandya waited back in the crease and then slotted the heave over wide long-on. Enough legs to carry over the rope

Narine to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Not happening this time. Similar kind of delivery and similar kind of stroke from Pandya, but he finds the man at long-on. Narine bowls the off-break with a dragged back length, Pandya with his weight back looks to muscle it over Gill, doesn't get enough and the youngsters takes it calmly. Krunal Pandya c Shubman Gill b Narine 14(11) [4s-1 6s-1]

Narine to Duminy, SIX, Duminy needs to kick on here. He knew what Narine was doing - bowling back of a length, so he moved across his sticks and muscled the pull over deep mid-wicket. Had to manufacture all the power and he got enough to clear the man

Prasidh to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, streaky! This is a cruel game. Krishna deceived the batsman with a good slower delivery, Pandya was through the shot and the outside edge bisects Karthik and short third man perfectly

Prasidh to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, if he is going to bowl the wide yorker, then third man needs to be back. Yes, it was a bottom edge but the bowler and captain need to be smart, Pandya reached out with a bent back knee and squirted it off the toe-end to the fence

Prasidh to Hardik Pandya, no run, low full toss and Pandya swings so hard that the bat flies out of his hand, he then tries to steal a bye with the bat lying near square leg and Karthik misses to run him out. He was gone by a mile, in the end they don't even go through with the run

Johnson to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, in the air and goes all the way! The man in the deep was interested, but the ball goes well over his head. The bouncer from Johnson and Suryakumar Yadav was hurried by the pace. Still goes with the pull shot and gets a fat top-edge. Had enough wood to clear deep backward square leg
Johnson to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, over-corrects by overpitching outside off. Suryakumar Yadav won't miss those. Leans into the drive and caresses it through covers. Raced away

Johnson to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, there's the width and there's the slash to follow that. Bullets away. The length was perfect to be hit. Shortish and angling away, Suryakumar Yadav stands tall and cuts it fiercely through backward point

Narine to Lewis, FOUR, didn't time it well, but manages to fetch a boundary. This was bowled fuller and Lewis went hard on the drive. He probably wanted to go through mid-off and got it off the inside edge. Beats mid-on by a long way and once it beat him, the quick outfield did the rest
Narine to Lewis, FOUR, nothing wrong on this occasion from Lewis. Saw the length on the shorter side, quickly rocked back and cut it ferociously beating the cover fielder to his left

Prasidh to Lewis, SIX, nicely done! If Lewis gets going, it'll be tough to stop him. Krishna pounds in a shortish delivery. Lewis is expecting that. Stays back in his crease and pulls it over backward square leg with a swivel. First six for the West Indian

Chawla to Lewis, SIX, my goodness! That was absolutely murdered. A juicy loopy full toss upfront from Chawla. There is no way Lewis was missing that. Moves slightly off-side and clouts it over deep square leg. That's colossal

Chawla to Lewis, FOUR, four more! It was the googly from Chawla, not sure if Lewis picked it. He went through with his lofted drive and slices it off the outside half. Over the cover region and that dribbles away over the bouindary rope

Chawla to Lewis, FOUR, got to feel for the bowler. Bamboozled Lewis with another googly and Lewis was caught in his crease looking to block. Takes the outside edge and races away to the third man fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, good use of the feet from Suryakumar Yadav. Puts on the dancing shoes, gets close to the pitch of the ball and swings his bat hard in the direction of the spin. Into the deep mid-wicket stands. Clean strike

Nitish Rana to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's a terrific shot! Wristy shot. Fired on leg and Suryakumar Yadav had his back leg off-air while he made contact. Whipped powerfully and finds the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket. Raced away

Nitish Rana to Lewis, FOUR, how did that go for a boundary. Rana saw the batsman back away and fired a yorker, Lewis brings his bat down a touch late and manages to get a toe-end on it. Luckily for the batter, misses the stumps and runs away to third man for another boundary

Nitish Rana to Lewis, 1 run, dropped! That came at a rapid pace and Nitish Rana could only get a hand on it. A full toss and Lewis hammered it straight down the ground. Rana stuck his left hand out and could only parry it towards mid-wicket. A single nabbed

Nitish Rana to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 16 runs off the over! Another glorious shot. Bottom hand power. Shimmies down the track, converts into a half-vollet and Suryakumar Yadav drove it exquisitely through extra cover. All along the carpet and into the fence. 82/0 after 8 overs!

Kuldeep Yadav to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, wow! That was superbly played. Wasn't a bad ball from Kuldeep Yadav. A good length ball on off, Suryakumar Yadav went deep in his crease and that allowed him to free his arms. Plays the back-cut perfectly to beat a diving backward point fielder to his left. Third man was inside the circle as well

A Russell to Lewis, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! Andre Russell provides the breakthrough. The slower ball - off the back of the hand - does the trick. On a fullish length outside off and Lewis was early into his shot. Looked to biff it downtown and could only get an outside edge that ballooned straight to Lynn at short third man. The 91-run stand has been broken. Lewis c Chris Lynn b A Russell 43(28) [4s-5 6s-2]
Jofra Archer to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle wants to show who is the boss here. He backs away, goes on the top of the bounce and punches it though cover for a four
Anureet Singh to Nair, SIX, drifts it on leg-stump and that's been handsomely picked up over long leg. Cross-seamed and skidding on, so Nair had the pace to work with
Anureet Singh to Nair, 2 runs, nurdles the ball round the corner and hurries back for second run. Stokes with the running one-handed throw but Nair makes it back in

Anureet Singh to Nair, out Bowled!! Looked like the knuckle ball. Banged in on a back of a length outside off, Nair looked to pull and chops an inside edge onto his stumps. Another pretty Karun Nair innings that cries for more deliveries at the crease. Nair b Anureet Singh 31(23) [4s-2 6s-2]

Gowtham to Axar, out Caught by D Arcy Short!! Excellent catch! We've seen a few crackers already in this match and here is another one. The pressure was telling on the aggressive Axar and with a spinner on, he decides to take a chance. Slogs this over mid-wicket but only gets height on it and not the distance. Well, actually almost cleared Short who took the catch calmly and ensured that his foot didn't touch the ropes. Smart work. RR are clawing their way back here. Axar c D Arcy Short b Gowtham 4(5)

Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, SIX, connects well this time! Stoinis was getting foxed a bit and decides to transfer the pressure right back on the bowler. Tossed up once more but this was in his arc, he lofted straight through the line over the bowler's head. Into the sightscreen. Relieves the pressure a touch for KXIP

Unadkat to Stoinis, FOUR, just past a flying Buttler to his right! Excellent bowling from Unadkat, totally bamboozled Stoinis with this off cutter and induced a thick edge on the drive. Buttler did all he could with a dive to his right but couldn't reach it. Raced away fine to the third man fence

Unadkat to Stoinis, 1 run, direct hit would have got Stoinis! Rahane was the man at extra cover and his reaction says how much RR wanted this. Slower ball that was tapped gently into the off-side, was always a risky run and Stoinis escapes

Jofra Archer to Stoinis, FOUR, slammed away! Archer just misses his yorker and ends up dishing out a low full toss. Width on offer too and this is crashed past a diving extra cover. Sweeper cover ain't stopping this

Jofra Archer to Rahul, SIX, that's gone all the way! What a shot! That too under pressure! Mind you this shortish length ball clocked 145kph but that's also what aided Rahul here. He stays back and upper cuts it over short third man. Deep into the crowd. Just the over KXIP wanted to ease a few nerves in the dug out. What a way to get to fifty! Top knock but he knows that the job isn't done yet

Unadkat to Rahul, SIX, he is in a hurry to finish this off now, is Rahul. Probably not interested in taking this deep. Gets a freebie, slower short ball around leg, doesn't came easier than these with short fine leg in place. He swivels to get inside the line and helps it away down the leg-side with a well-timed pull

Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, more runs! Unadkat is being taken to the cleaners here. Came round the wicket and actually got his line right but Rahul is in such a mood that he will put even the good ones away. Makes room by backing away and steers it to find the gap. Bisects short third man and backward point with ease

Jofra Archer to Rahul, SIX, stand and deliver stuff! Poetry in motion, this shot. Length ball alright but look at the way it's been put away by Rahul. Holds his shape and lifts it straight over Archer's head. Straight as an arrow and clears the ropes with ease. Just a hit away now, KXIP

Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, fittingly a Rahul signature cover drive to finish the game. He's been fantastic tonight and has calmly ensured an easy win for KXIP. Overcooked from Archer and it's been creamed away off the front foot. Long-off had no chance of cutting it off. KXIP return to winning ways
Gowtham to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul backs away and cuts it to the right of cover for a four. Excellent timing and placement!
Gowtham to Rahul, FOUR, cheeky from Rahul. He brings out the reverse sweep and plays it fine of the short third man for a four
Gowtham to Rahul, FOUR, He is timing the ball really well. Rahul goes inside the line of the ball and slog sweeps it over short fine leg for a boundary
Jofra Archer to Gayle, FOUR, brute power! Fuller in length from Jofra Archer this time, Gayle clears his front leg and absolutely smashes it wide of the mid-off fielder for a four

Jofra Archer to Gayle, out Caught by Samson!! Jofra Archer has the last laugh in this mini battle. It was another short of length ball, Gayle stays put and smashes the cut shot straight to Samson at point. Ball came at a lighting speed and Samson does really well to hold on it. Universe boss will have to depart without contributing much. Gayle c Samson b Jofra Archer 8(11) [4s-2]

Stokes to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by R Tripathi!! Dismal IPL for Mayank Agarwal continues. He will consider himself massively unlucky, a meter to the fielder's right or left and that was a four. It was a short of length ball, Mayank Agarwal gets in a good position, connects well, he does everything well but finds the fielder at deep square leg. This just get to show how imperative placement is in cricket. Mayank Agarwal c R Tripathi b Stokes 2(3)

Stokes to Nair, FOUR, throws his bat at a wide one and sends a thick edge wide of Rahane at second slip. Good effort from Shreyas Gopal at third man to cover a lot of ground to his left, but he fumbled a touch while on the dive and it runs away for a boundary
Stokes to Nair, FOUR, terrific shot, Nair portrays his class. It was a fuller length ball at the stumps, Nair brings his bat down gun-barrel straight and drives it straight down the ground for a four
Shreyas Gopal to Rahul, FOUR, touch short and Rahul makes full use of it. He goes deep in the crease and pulls it to the deep mid-wicket fence for a four

Anureet Singh to Rahul, FOUR, that shot had class written all over it. He waited and waited for the ball to come and just opens the bat face at the last moment, timing was perfect and so was placement. Ball beats the short third man fielder for a four

Shreyas Gopal to Nair, SIX, Nair doesn't reach the pitch of the ball but he still goes through with the shot and connects well. It was a flighted delivery at the stumps, Nair comes down the track and lofts it over cover with the turn for a six. He hit it inside-out, one of the hardest shots to execute. Ball hit the ropes on the full and umpires are confirming it

Ashwin to D Arcy Short, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! Skipper strikes!! Aimless slog from D Arcy Short, stays low and hacks across the line; Ash slowed it up nicely to get that extra rip, it catches the top-edge and flies high for mid-on who takes a tumbling catch after a swirling dance. Tye it is. D Arcy Short c Andrew Tye b Ashwin 2(2)
Ashwin to Buttler, FOUR, that's easy for Buttler! Bowls short and outside off, Buttler lets his lovely hands take over. Crisply punched through covers. CYA LATER
Rajpoot to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler is such a dangerous player at the top and this is why? Gets a short ball outside off, he half-swivels and pulls nonchalantly over mid-wicket. No-one there

Rajpoot to Buttler, byes, FOUR, unlucky for the bowler but Buttler and RR won't mind. Shuffled miles across his off-stump to try the funky paddle-scoop over the keeper, but Rajpoot sprayed it too far outside off to foil his plans, result? It flies past the helpless keeper
Rajpoot to Buttler, FOUR, short and wide, Buttler lashes that behind point. Gee, he's hit that with some power. Third man ain't getting there

Andrew Tye to Samson, out Caught by Nair!! That was middled to perfection, but right to the fielder near the fence at the same time. Shortish delivery around off, Samson picks the length early and pulls it nicely but Nair stationed at deep square leg moves to his right and reverse cups it just near the fence. Samson fails to capitalise on the start as Royals lose their third wicket. Samson c Nair b Andrew Tye 28(23) [4s-2 6s-1]

Ashwin to Stokes, FOUR, sweet sound on that cracking shot by Stokes. This was pushed through outside off by Ashwin and Stokes was quick to camp back and slam it to the right of long-off. Beats the man chasing it with utter ease

Mujeeb to Stokes, FOUR, is it Stokes' night? Looking at the way he's played so far, definitely looks like. This was a flat delivery and full in length outside off, Stokes went for the reverse sweep and got it right past the fielder at short third man

Mujeeb to Stokes, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! This is an excellent catch! Brilliant work by the two fielders in the deep. A tag-team effort by Mayank Agarwal and Manoj Tiwary results in his down fall. Stokes came down the wicket and towered it to long-off where Mayank grabbed it and just as he was about to lose balance he parried it to Tiwary who comes running in from long-on and takes it. Stokes stands there in disbelief but he has to walk back. Was looking so good but nothing to take away from the fielders there. Stokes c Manoj Tiwary b Mujeeb 12(9) [4s-2]

Mujeeb to Buttler, FOUR, successive fifties for Buttler. Moving up the order is certainly doing wonders for him. Short and wide outside off, Buttler camps back and cuts it through the gap at cover point

Mujeeb to Buttler, out Caught by Rahul!! Buttler departs soon after reaching his fifty. Maybe a lapse in concentration there. This was darted outside off and as Buttler tried to run it down to third man he got a thick outside edge. Rahul behind the wickets takes a sharp catch as Royals lose their fifth wicket. Mujeeb gets his second wicket. Buttler c Rahul b Mujeeb 51(39) [4s-7]

Mujeeb to Jofra Archer, out Bowled!! What a jaffa! Mujeeb is on a hat-trick. Archer had no clue about this, stands there in disbelief just like Stokes did earlier when that catch was taken. This pitched on off and came back sharply to go through Archer's defence. Takes down the middle stump and Royals are in danger of getting bowled out well within the 20 overs. Jofra Archer b Mujeeb 0(1)

Rajpoot to Gowtham, FOUR, misfield by Mujeeb results in a boundary. Rajpoot isn't pleased one bit with the effort and has his hands on his hips. This was a short and wide delivery that was cut to square third man by Gowtham. Mujeeb guarding that region lets it through and gifts four runs to the opposition

Rajpoot to Gowtham, out Caught by Stoinis!! Another one bites the dust. Was a short delivery around off, Gowtham went for a pull but the pace was too good for him and the batsman ended up splicing it to short mid-wicket. Can't get any easier for Stoinis who grabs it with both hands. This is why Rajpoot was brought back into the attack and he gets a wicket, doesn't disappoint his skipper. Gowtham c Stoinis b Rajpoot 5(3) [4s-1]

Rajpoot to R Tripathi, FOUR, won't be able to stop this though. Short again and outside off, Tripathi makes the most of the provided width and cuts it in the same direction once again. Mujeeb sprints to his right but the ball is too quick for him

Andrew Tye to R Tripathi, out Caught by Ashwin!! Punjab continue to chip at the wickets. It was the slower delivery this time around. Full without much pace in it, Tripathi lofts it but is too early in his shot. The ball spoons up to wide mid-off where Ashwin completes a safe catch. Can Punjab clean up Rajasthan's tail? Or will we get to see a fight from the Royals? R Tripathi c Ashwin b Andrew Tye 11(13) [4s-1]

Andrew Tye to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, that shot was all about timing. How quickly it ran away to the fence, quite surprising. A low full toss on leg and Gopal times his on-drive. Mayank at long-on tried hard to cut this down but couldn't stop the boundary

Rajpoot to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, these are useful runs for Royals. They'll take it and Gopal is playing a sweet little cameo here. A full length delivery outside off and the batsman slices it over point and gets a boundary

Rajpoot to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, four more! Drags the length back and bowls a slower one outside off, Gopal goes after it with hard hands and gets an outside edge. Eludes the man at short third man and gets back-to-back boundaries
Rajpoot to Buttler, FOUR, not again! Another short delivery in Buttler's arc, he transfers his weight onto the back foot and smashes the hell out of that leather over mid-wicket
Mujeeb to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler is pouncing on anything short. He opens up his stance slightly to give himself enough leverage on the off-side, jumps back and clatters it past extra cover

Andrew Tye to Unadkat, out Shreyas Gopal Run Out!! Wicket to end the innings. That sums up the innings for Royals as Rahul denies them the bye. It was a slower delivery around off, Unadkat was early in his pull again, got beaten and as Gopal tried to sneak in a bye, Rahul had a direct hit at the striker's end. Shreyas Gopal run out (Rahul) 24(16) [4s-3]

Axar to Rahane, out Caught by Gayle!! Chris Gayle is claiming a catch and the replays suggest it is O-U-T. Rahane's struggles continue. Dropped short and ripped away from Rahane's reach, he goes for the cut and slashes it hard in front of backward point and guess who? It's the Universal Boss, Chris Gayle. Dives full length and nestles it inches above the turf. Good reflexes. Rahane c Gayle b Axar 5(7)
Ashwin to Samson, SIX, Samson likes it there, no spin and slightly short, he sends it into the orbit over wide long-on. So easy. Just makes batting look so simple this lad
Ashwin to Samson, FOUR, dished wide of off-stump, Samson frees his arms and clobbers it past backward point

Axar to Samson, FOUR, half-volley outside off, Samson's back lift is so high that it allows him to cream those drives through extra cover. Advantage Samson when you bowl full. Timed and placed to perfection...

Andrew Tye to Buttler, FOUR, more than 80 percent of Buttler's runs have come off short deliveries so far. KXIP aren't learning. To make matters worse, Tye sprays it down leg and all Buttler needed to do was help it on its way. Karun Nair dives, but all of that sliding effort goes in vain

Bhuvneshwar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, beautiful shot! The inswinger from Bhuvneshwar but it's a touch too straight. Parthiv flicks it elegantly through in front of square on the leg-side and beats the fielder in the ring. Races away

Bhuvneshwar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, finds the gap this time. Just past a diving mid-on to his right. Fuller ball attacking the stumps, forced away off the front foot past the bowler. Once it beat the infield, it was always going to the fence
Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, FOUR, flashes at this googly turning away from him and the edge zooms over slip. Dhawan barely had any time to get his hands up

Rashid Khan to de Villiers, out Bowled!! He's got him this time and off goes Rashid. Oh what celebrations. It's the big wicket of AB de Villiers, who goes for the cut shot again off the googly and perishes. Tried backing away to it, but the ball kept creeping in to deny the room. Eventually, crashes into the stumps off the under-edge. This game has come alive. de Villiers b Rashid Khan 5(8)

S Kaul to Moeen Ali, FOUR, two boundaries for Moeen so far, one off the outside edge and this one off the inside. Almost chopped it back onto off-stump. Back of length outside off, loosely wafts at it with cemented feet and gets lucky

S Kaul to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Saha!! Given. Sunrisers bowlers roaring back into this. They could be ahead in the game now actually. Back of length delivery angled away from off, Moeen fancies a front-foot pull but all he does is get a faint under-edge through to Saha. Didn't look comfortable during his stay at all. Moeen Ali c Saha b S Kaul 10(7) [4s-2]

Sandeep Sharma to Mandeep, FOUR, oh this is not good from Siddarth Kaul. A good over is spoiled as he lets the ball slip through his hands at the boundary. Back of length, Mandeep drags his pull through mid-wicket wide of the deep fielder. Should still have only been two at most. But Kaul couldn't get a hand on it while tumbling to his left
Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, SIX, what a blow! He takes this leg-break on and hacks it across the line over mid-wicket. Brute power from Colin de Grandhomme. Hits the cushions on the flush
Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, SIX, COLIN DE GRANDHOMME! Back-to-back sixes off Rashid Khan for the New Zealand batsman. Sits on his back knee and wallops the slog-sweep over deep mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, good yorker from Bhuvneshwar, but he has to watch in agony as de Grandhomme's toe-edge runs away past short third man

S Kaul to Mandeep, 1 run, the inside edge saves him. An inswinging full ball on middle and leg, crashes into Mandeep's back pad as he sets up to slog. They'll take the single towards backward point. What an over from Kaul. Brilliant death bowling
Shakib to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, nails this one. Parthiv is keen to take Shakib on. Sees it floated up into the left-hander and launches the slog-sweep over mid-wicket. Clean strike

Shakib to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, hammered away. Parthiv is on a roll here. Baffling though to see KW hand the ball to a left-arm spinner in the Powerplay with the ball not really turning. Fuller ball around middle and leg, lofted cleanly over mid-on and it races away to the fence

Shakib to Parthiv Patel, out Lbw!! Okay, I take my words back. Masterstroke it has turned out to be from KW. There was risk in bringing the left-arm spinner but the idea was to tempt Parthiv into a rash stroke. He did get a couple away but not this time. It was pushed through quicker in line of the stumps and he went for a slog sweep across the line. Missed and it pinged him flush on the pads. Easy call for the umpire as far as the LBW is concerned. Parthiv did wonder about the review but then rightfully continued walking. Parthiv Patel lbw b Shakib 20(13) [4s-4]

Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, out Bowled!! Sensational bowling from Bhuvneshwar Kumar. Just brilliant. No way anyone's hitting this ball for six. De Grandhomme anticipates the yorker, walks across premeditatedly but he still can do nothing about it. Drags it off the inside edge and leaves his stumps in a mess. Leaves RCB's season in a mess. de Grandhomme b Bhuvneshwar 33(29) [4s-1 6s-2]

Bhuvneshwar to Kohli, FOUR, the signature Virat Kohli cover drive! Short cover got a hand on it, mid-off tried to get to his left and put in a slide but it beat them both en route to the fence. Too full from Bhuvneshwar and it's creamed away off the front foot
Shakib to Kohli, FOUR, mowed away over mid-wicket. Kohli has had enough of plodding around. Sees this arm ball on a good length and clobbers it over mid-wicket. Easily over the infield

Shakib to Kohli, SIX, glorious stuff from the RCB captain! He has come out with clear intent and has decided to unsettle Shakib. Expects the floater and is down the pitch in a flash. Lofts it dead straight over the bowler and into the sightscreen

Shakib to Kohli, FOUR, got it finer than he intended to but he won't mind. Flatter and closer to off, executes the late cut and it dribbles away off the outer half. Beats short third man easily and speeds to the fence

S Kaul to Kohli, FOUR, new bowler but the strategy from Kohli continues to be the same - attack! Charges down the track early and plays his favorite pick-up stroke over mid-wicket. Rashid in the deep had a bit of ground to cover and tried hard but in vain. The RCB skipper is pumped up, that's for sure

Rashid Khan to Vohra, 1 run, Kaul spills a dolly! He had enough time to judge this but rushed into the catch and eventually, it slipped and crashed into his neck before falling to the ground. Was a quickish delivery and Vohra mistimed the pull due to the bounce. Kaul from deep backward square leg anticipated it well and got to it nicely as well, just couldn't complete the job. Vohra lucky in the end. How much will this cost SRH?

Sandeep Sharma to Vohra, out Bowled!! The drop doesn't cost SRH at all in the end. Atrocious stroke from Vohra though and is undone by some wily bowling from Sandeep. Slower ball and Vohra was early into the sweep by moving across the stumps. Took a piece of the bat, the pad and then disturbed the stumps. Vohra stood there in disbelief, probably wondering how he got out. I reckon he should wonder why he tried this shot. Vohra b Sandeep Sharma 8(10)

Rashid Khan to Kohli, FOUR, goes through KW's hands at first slip! Is this the game for SRH? Massive moment in the game. Kohli plays this leg break off the back foot and ends up edging it straight to his opposition counterpart. Williamson didn't expect it to come so quickly perhaps and it went through him to the fence

Shakib to Kohli, out Caught by Y Pathan!! One-handed ripper from Yusuf! What's with IPL these days? Gayle picked up one yesterday and another big man does today. Huge wicket for SRH and Shakib has picked this up with a nothing ball to be honest. Skidded through off a good length and Kohli wanted to go across the line. Got hurried into it and ended up spooning it towards short third man where the big Pathan leapt, stretching his right hand. And it stuck folks, it stuck. Look at the joy on the SRH fielders' faces. Game on, then. Kohli c Y Pathan b Shakib 39(30) [4s-5 6s-1]
U Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, picks the slower delivery and pulls wide of mid-wicket. On the front foot too, with the weight going forward, hit the gap perfectly and it raced away
Chahal to Williamson, FOUR, poor delivery to follow. Very short, Williamson had all the time to rock back and pull. Chooses his area and gets it wide of CdG at deep square. Should've dived but didn't

de Grandhomme to Shakib, FOUR, CdG comes on and serves up a short and wide delivery outside off, again Shakib shows off his cutting skills. Plays it late and gets it to the right of backward point. No chance for third man who is pretty square, well placed
U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, anything drifting into the pads is easy for Williamson. He glances and gives fine leg no chance. Poor from Yadav

U Yadav to Williamson, SIX, what a waste of an extra ball and Williamson is too good a player to let that full-toss sliding down leg go. Nonchalantly whips and leaves deep backward square a spectator. Sailed over his head and that's a good over for SRH

Chahal to Williamson, SIX, that's a beautiful shot. Class from Williamson. Tossed up leggie outside off, too full and he has knelt down and slog-swept it flat over deep mid. Consecutive maximums for the SRH skipper

Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, tossed up outside off, pushed to deep cover. 50 for KW. What a player and captain he has been for SRH. And to think that he wouldn't have got in had Warner been here. Fifth fifty of the IPL and once again he is shepherding this innings
U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, mid-off is in and Williamson goes over extra-cover, slower delivery outside off, Williamson waits and waits, before lofting into the gap. He is getting a move on now

U Yadav to Williamson, out Caught by Mandeep!! High in the air and caught at long leg. Very tight call. As far as no-ball is concerned. Umesh has an inch of the spike behind the line. That should do. Williamson walked across to this slower delivery, aimed to go leg-side, but it looped off a thick top edge and Mandeep made no mistake. Just when Williamson was changing gears he gets out. RCB needed that. Williamson c Mandeep b U Yadav 56(39) [4s-5 6s-2]
Siraj to Shakib, FOUR, backward square is in and Shakib splits him and short fine leg, with a heave. Length ball on off, thick inside edge is enough to go into the gap

Siraj to Shakib, FOUR, brilliant improvisation. Takes it from middle and scoops wide of short fine. Nothing wrong from Siraj who attempted the yorker, didn't nail it and it was the cleverness of Shakib that outwitted him there

Southee to Shakib, out Caught by U Yadav!! Southee gets Shakib. Good bowling. Bowled the cutter outside off, made Shakib fetch the slog and he cannot clear backward square. Last over he managed a boundary, not this time. Shakib c U Yadav b Southee 35(32) [4s-5]

Southee to Y Pathan, FOUR, Pathan knows what is coming. Gets inside the line to this short of length delivery, pulls over and wide of short fine, races away. Southee became to predictable there. Needs to bowl the yorker
Southee to Y Pathan, FOUR, no he doesn't. A slower ball short bouncer, at the head of Pathan, who hooks and gets it fine of Parthiv Patel, no chance for him. Successive fours and poor from Southee

Siraj to Y Pathan, out Bowled!! That's pace and it has knocked Pathan's leg stump out of the ground. Siraj leaps and punches the air to celebrate. Big wicket that. Hint of tail on this angled in delivery, beats the heave and takes out the stump. Y Pathan b Siraj 12(7) [4s-2]
Siraj to Saha, SIX, smashed. Saha backs away and clatters the half-volley on the stumps back over the head of Siraj, flat hit and it went all the way. Power from the diminutive Saha

Siraj to Saha, out Bowled!! The stumps are a royal mess. 146 clicks this one and it has beaten Saha for sheer pace. Fired in on middle and leg, Saha was looking to scoop and saw two of his pegs splattered. Siraj jumping and punching the air for joy. End of a very good spell. Saha b Siraj 8(5) [6s-1]

Southee to Rashid Khan, out Rashid Khan Run Out!! 1 run completed. No chance of two and Rashid Khan is miles out. Spliced pull by Rashid Khan, lands in the mid-wicket area, Kohli charges and fires in an accurate throw to Parthiv Patel who does the rest. Rashid Khan run out (Kohli/Parthiv Patel) 1(3)

Southee to Bhuvneshwar, out S Kaul Run Out!! 1 run completed. Confusion and Kaul is gone. Swiped to deep mid, again Kohli is quick and a bit of an yes-no situation, accurate throw on the bounce to Parthiv Patel who whips the bails off, leaving Kaul out. He needed to dive but didn't. RCB finishing strongly. S Kaul run out (Kohli/Parthiv Patel) 1(1)

U Yadav to Hales, FOUR, full on off, Hales goes through with the loft and even though he didn't get it off the middle of the bat had enough power to clear the fielder at mid-off. The extra ball goes for four and the SRH crowd including actor Venkatesh are on their feet

Southee to Hales, out Bowled!! The middle stump goes for a toss. Southee does it again. A cross-seam delivery on middle, which Hales missed. Pretty ordinary as he was looking to turn it to leg, closed the bat face too early and saw his middle stump flattened. Hales b Southee 5(5) [4s-1]
Southee to Williamson, FOUR, easy for Williamson. He is a class player. A gift from Southee, down leg, with fine leg inside the circle, a beautiful leg-glance and Williamson is off the mark with four

Southee to Sandeep Sharma, out Lbw!! Review off the last ball. Would you believe it? It is Southee who has asked Kohli for it. Has Sandeep got outside the line? The original call was not out. Hawk-Eye in and it shows that Sandeep hasn't got outside the line. Three reds and gone. Cheeky from Sandeep, tried to reverse-sweep a full ball on off, missed and once he didn't get bat on that he was dead. Strong final over from Southee and RCB. Sandeep Sharma lbw b Southee 0(1)

Southee to Williamson, FOUR, Southee got that wrong. Tried something different with the slower delivery, floated it up full and wide outside off, Williamson crashed the drive wide of mid-off. Left everyone motionless. Replays show that it was the knuckle ball from Southee, went wrong

Siraj to Dhawan, out Caught by Southee!! Dhawan holes out and the local boy Siraj has his arms raised in triumph. Short at the body, Dhawan pulls but this is a big ground, so didn't have the power to clear Southee at deep backward square. He is a very good fielder and won't drop those. An important wicket for Dhawan is one man who can score at a fast clip. Dhawan c Southee b Siraj 13(19) [4s-1]

Chahal to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Kohli!! What a soft dismissal. And full credit to Kohli for placing himself there. Chipped in the air and straight to the RCB skipper. Did Manish Pandey not realise Kohli was right in his face? He swings the air with his bat in frustration. Held up on the pitch and tamely played by Manish. Chahal was surprised as well as how easily he got that wicket. Manish Pandey c Kohli b Chahal 5(7)
Moeen Ali to Shakib, FOUR, that's a good cut. Dangerous but Shakib plays late and takes it from off, delays the shot to get it wide of the diving Umesh at short third. Much needed boundary for SRH

Moeen Ali to Shakib, FOUR, beautiful batting. Down the pitch and to the flight of the ball, lofted clean over Moeen Ali and bisects the two men on the straight boundary. Brings the crowd back into life
Gowtham to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul responds by coming down the track, he reaches the line of ball and lofts it over cover for a four

Stokes to Manoj Tiwary, out Caught by Rahane!! Half the side back in the hut. RR are back in this!! A nothing shot from Manoj Tiwary, sits back and looks to loft-drive Stokes over cover, but he hadn't quite read the pace on this. It did stop a tad and he ended up spooning it towards cover where Jinks dives full length to grab it cleanly. Manoj Tiwary c Rahane b Stokes 7(8)

Gowtham to Rahul, byes, FOUR, it's a Test pitch now. Or seems like it. Spins in from outside off, sneaks through Rahul's drive away from the body and misses off-stump by a whisker - in the way also beating Buttler to his left

Anureet Singh to Axar, FOUR, heaved away. That kinda slower delivery that gives away its cards early because it's been pitched on a length. Axar delays his cross-batted mow and picks a boundary through wide long-on. Uppish and safe

Anureet Singh to Axar, out Axar Run Out!! 1 run completed. Run out appeal here. Slower and wider, Axar dragged it to long-on, where the fielder ran across and fired a throw to Buttler, with the batsmen trying to go for the second. Axar wasn't sure about the second, even put his hand up but Rahul was through, and he had to oblige. That's touch and go actually, the run out. Diving Axar's bat is just about at the line when Buttler takes the bails off. Oh dear, that's a tough one for the third umpire. And it's been given out.. Small margins and it goes against the batsman this time. Axar run out (Binny/Buttler) 9(5) [4s-1]

Anureet Singh to Rahul, FOUR, leg cutter and Rahul's smashed him off the front foot. Shortish, decking away, and hammered through mid-wicket with utter disadain. Another day at work, another fifty for Rahul
Jofra Archer to Rahul, 1 run, yorker on the stumps this time, Rahul opens the face of the bat to point. Quick single but Stoinis makes it in
Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, fetches it from outside off and heaves it between mid-wicket and long-on. Shuffled just a bit from leg to off, got behind the line and let his bottom hand take over

Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, not great cricket overall, except from Jofra Archer. Bowled the slower one that spins away, Rahul looked ungainly while chipping this, because he was aiming cow corner. Just manages to clear mid-off, and there's Unadkat in the deep, sliding with the ball into the ropes..

Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, oh that's another stunner from Rahul. Shuffled across and timed his pick-up scoop just right. Not easy if that's almost a yorker from Jofra Archer. Perhaps an inch short but how good was Rahul, laying into it like it's a right he's earned
Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, this boundary means that 32 is required off the last over. Rahul gets into the scoop position again, and ramps this up over short fine leg

Unadkat to Stoinis, out Caught by Gowtham!! Sehwag's smiling in the dug out, perhaps because he's seen Gowtham take the catch and put the ball in his pocket. Very cool. A full toss outside off that Stoinis timed well but this is a big ground, we must remember. So there's Gowtham waiting at a square deep cover, timing his leap just perfect to reverse-cup the ball above his head. Stoinis c Gowtham b Unadkat 11(16)
Unadkat to Rahul, SIX, he's ready for the cutter. Stays leg-side of the ball and pumps the free-hit delivery over covers. Highest score for him in IPL
Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, now he's opened his stance completely here. Chest facing the bowler as he reverses this over short third man
Jofra Archer to Rahul, SIX, this is a much better shot from Rahul. He backs away, makes room for himself and cuts it over point, connection was so good that it sails over the ropes

Gowtham to Gayle, wide, out Stumped!! Astute Gowtham gets the better of Gayle. Terrific plan this and equally good execution. It was fired down the leg-side, Gayle came down the track and was strangled outside the crease; Buttler behind the stumps takes off the bails quickly. Back to back failures for the universe boss against RR. Gayle st Buttler b Gowtham 1(1)

Gowtham to Ashwin, out Bowled!! Ashwin had taken a couple of brilliant decisions this season, but this was an absolute disaster. Dream of a delivery from Gowtham, his confidence was high after taking Gayle and he gives this ball ample air; the ball turned, gripped and went through the bat-pad gap of Ashwin. Ash was trying to mow across the line and it ended up looking silly. Ashwin b Gowtham 0(2)
Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, another similar open-chested reverse-hack over short third man but unfortunately, it's not enough for KXIP. Rajasthan Royals win by 15 runs

Jofra Archer to Nair, out Caught by Unadkat!! Oh dear! What are Punjab doing here, self-destruction of the highest order. It was a short ball at the body, Nair was hurried by the extra pace as he wanted to pull it, but the ball got big on him and he ends up slicing it. Unadakat from mid-wicket goes back and takes a brilliant catch, it is never easy taking such catches, but Unadkat made it look easy. Nair c Unadkat b Jofra Archer 3(5)
Stokes to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul latches on anything loose, he absolutely does. It was a fuller length delivery outside off, Rahul reaches for it and slams the drive over point
Stokes to Rahul, FOUR, treat to watch! Good length delivery outside off, Rahul gets into good position and drives it sumptuously through cover, raced away all along the carpet

Stokes to Rahul, no run, fuller length delivery and Rahul hits it straight to cover, he wanted a single but Akshdeep Nath wasn't interested at all. And when the fielder picked up the ball Rahul was almost in the mid crease, he had given up but throw was wayward and Rahul gets away with it

Ish Sodhi to Akshdeep Nath, no run, RR have gone up for a lbw review against Nath. The pertinent point is whether it has hit the bat first or pad? No bat involved. It hit the pad first, but the ball straightened enough to miss the off pole. It was a flighted delivery, Nath was prodding forward to tap, but the ball gripped off the pitch to clip him high on the front pad

Lomror to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, excellent shot from Akshdeep Nath. This will give him some confidence. He comes down the track and at the same time makes room for himself to loft it over deep cover for a handsome boundary

Ish Sodhi to Akshdeep Nath, out Caught by Gowtham!! Ish Sodhi was bowling beautifully and this was always on the cards. It was a flighted delivery at the stumps, Akshdeep Nath went for a wild swing against the turn, he ends up mistiming it high in the air, long-off comes under it and takes it easily. Punjab are in real trouble now. Akshdeep Nath c Gowtham b Ish Sodhi 9(13) [4s-1]
Lomror to Rahul, FOUR, touch short, Rahul picks up the length quickly, goes deep in the crease and pulls it through deep mid-wicket for a four

Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR, 135.7kph. Strays. Feeds the pads, trying out the surprise inswinger after the set up with a couple of away ones, gets it wrong and Buttler is quick to whip, neatly behind square
Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR, oh the punch. Walks down, gets behind the line, on top of the good length, and straight bats, down the ground
Axar to Buttler, FOUR, gets the width, makes it look worse moving away and inside-outs it over extra cover. Ah, the delight of watching him open
Axar to Buttler, SIX, fuller, wider, worse. Buttler doesn't need to make room, there's plenty already. Crouches low and lofts an uppish slap. Over covers, again

Axar to Buttler, FOUR, very, very poor effort from Tye. Too lazy to bend down and Axar is not happy at all. Slashed wide of long-off, Tye moves across to his left, went with one-hand pretty late and ends up letting it roll away to the fence

Ashwin to Samson, SIX, this was the shot he was looking off the last ball, gets it right on this occasion. Ashwin drops it short just outside off, Samson goes back and flat-bats it with brute power to smash it over long-on

Ashwin to Samson, FOUR, 50-stand comes up between the duo. Overdoes the carrom ball. Short, wide and width for the taking, Samson accepts it with glee and slaps it past cover-point. No sweeper cover and it'll be a boundary

Mujeeb to Samson, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! Mujeeb strikes. Suckered Samson by tossing it up and the Kerala lad fell into the trap. It was in the slot for Samson, he cleared his front leg and whacked hard - the bat face turns on impact and he ends up slicing it straight to long-on. Dolly for Tiwary and Punjab break the stand. Rahman, with the golden arm. Samson c Manoj Tiwary b Mujeeb 22(18) [4s-1 6s-1]

Ashwin to Stokes, FOUR, biceps and triceps. Wrists and fists from Stokes. Gets into business by backing away to leg and hammers it over the bowler's head. So powerful! Picked the safest spot in the ground as well

Ashwin to Buttler, 3 runs, in the air and Buttler gets away. Akshdeep Nath puts down a toughie. Buttler loses his shape and sends a leading edge into the night sky towards long-off. Nath sprinted forward, guess he picked it late as he saw Tiwary approaching from extra cover. Decided to go for it in the end, got both hands but shells it. Ashwin won't be happy
