Mujeeb to Buttler, out Stumped!! And Buttler doesn't make use of the reprieve. His watch is ended, however has done his job. The wily mystery spinner from Afghanistan picks up his second wicket. Saw the batsman advancing, pushed it through quicker and held it short too. Buttler didn't get to the pitch and misses his attempted slog. Easy stumping for Rahul. Two set batsmen back in the hut for the Royals. Rahman tops the wicket-takers chart with this scalp. Buttler st Rahul b Mujeeb 82(58) [4s-9 6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Binny, SIX, whoa! Binny gets into the act. Read the knuckle ball from Tye, it was full in the arc for Binny. He just extended his arms and lofted with a clean swing of the bat over long-on

Andrew Tye to Stokes, out Binny Run Out!! 1 run completed. Another one falls. Royals in a bit of strife here. A fuller length delivery outside off, Stokes blasted it to long-off. Karun Nair, the fielder was a little squarer and the second run was on. But after collecting it with a sliding stop, Nair released the throw in a flash accurately to the bowler. Binny was too casual and didn't bother to dive, which would've saved him. Not to be today. Binny run out (Nair/Andrew Tye) 11(7) [6s-1]

Andrew Tye to Stokes, out Caught by Ashwin!! A wicket against run of play and Tye nets the big fish. Stokes gone. The wheels are coming off for Rajasthan Royals. Tye hurls a low full toss outside off, Stokes goes for the across-the-line swipe and loses his shape completely. Skews it off the bottom to extra cover. Skipper Ash swallows it up. Tye is chuffed to bits. Stokes c Ashwin b Andrew Tye 14(11) [4s-1]

Andrew Tye to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! RR continue to lose wickets in clusters. Two wickets in three balls now. Superb bowling from Tye. Unleashes the knuckle ball and dupes Archer, who swung high in the air. Only height. Skies it into the dark sky towards long-off. Tiwary is safe as houses. Jofra Archer c Manoj Tiwary b Andrew Tye 0(1)
Andrew Tye to Lomror, FOUR, oh, this will do for the Royals. Finally, Lomror gets some bat. Goes low and scoops this full ball at the stumps over short fine leg

Mohit Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, 134.6kph. Warms up with a rather innocuous back of a length sitter. Buttler doesn't need any further warming up though. He stays up tall, rocking back and flat-bats. Hard. Crunched through mid-wicket
Mohit Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, third man isn't there. Rahane has a measure of it, and holds his cut back. Waits, lets it get close and chops it to pierce slip and short third, to perfection

Andrew Tye to Unadkat, out Caught by Nair!! A wicket to cap off the innings. Fourth scalp for Tye - who's had a field day with the ball. Lands the knuckle ball on a fuller length at the stumps. Unadkat had to go for it and lifted it high. Straight into the gullet of Nair at long-on. Catching has been really good from Punjab today. Unadkat c Nair b Andrew Tye 0(1)

Andrew Tye to Rahane, out Caught by Akshdeep Nath!! His lack of runs continue. And the first change up of the day - the knuckle ball has an instant reward. Rahane doesn't spot, tries going airy over mid-wicket with his flick. Runs down as well as he does so, closes early, spooning up the leading edge. Only as far as extra cover. And Akshdeep has a calm auspicious start. Rahane c Akshdeep Nath b Andrew Tye 9(10) [4s-1]
Mohit Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, 134.1kph. So damn deft. A seam up outside off, and Buttler, lines himself up, opening his bat face very late, just to guide it through the cordon. The empty cordon
Mohit Sharma to Gowtham, SIX, the punch. The pose. Gets the length right in his slot, loads, shows up the full face and tonks it straight down. Talk about the lack of respect
Andrew Tye to Buttler, FOUR, overcooked on the legs. And Buttler owns him, all bottom-hand in this whippy on-drive. He knows there's no long-on, and he bisects the ones inside the ring to perfection

Andrew Tye to Buttler, FOUR, further dismissive. Tye overcorrects his line, goes outside off, but the length remains just as friendly. Matters taken over the covers now, leg-bent, hands flowing and creaming it one-bounced

Stoinis to Gowtham, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! The promotion experiment to force things along doesn't pay off. Gowtham has a role to slog, he clears his front leg and tries hoicking the fuller length into long-on. But the pace is just not there, sticks into the surface, spits up, miscues and finds long-on to perfection. Gowtham c Manoj Tiwary b Stoinis 8(6) [6s-1]
Ashwin to Buttler, 1 run, shuffles to take it on the pads, and tickles it to short fine. What's more - it's a fifty, stealing the opening spot
Mujeeb to Buttler, FOUR, sprays it down leg. Buttler's quick to latch on, swivelling, swiping flat and hammering it fine

McClenaghan to Narine, FOUR, just over. For a second Narine would have had his heart in his mouth. The full length delivery from McClenaghan, Narine stays leg-side and toe-ends the loft over Rohit at mid-off. He was standing well inside the circle. Had he been on the edge, he would have gobbled that up

McClenaghan to Narine, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Narine gone. This was always on the cards. The short of length delivery has caused problems for Narine and he succumbs to it. McClenaghan angled it into the left-hander and Narine went through with the flat-batted pull, high on the bat and a skier to mid-on. Krunal steadies himself under the night sky and pouches it calmly. Perfect start for MI and not so for KKR. Narine c Krunal Pandya b McClenaghan 4(2) [4s-1]

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, streaky! But Lynn won't mind it. He's off the mark with a boundary. The idea from McClenaghan is to push it across the right-hander, Lynn throws everything at the drive and the outside edge runs away fine

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, now on the other side of the ground. McClenaghan needs to stick to one plan. Short and on leg-stump, Lynn didn't go hard on the pull, just relied on placing it fine and pocketing a boundary

Hardik Pandya to Tom Curran, FOUR, streaky! Once again Curran plays down the wrong line. He wanted to punch the back of a length delivery and got an inside edge, the ball flies over the stumps and goes away to the fine leg fence
Bumrah to Rinku Singh, FOUR, short of length delivery angled away outside off, Rinku Singh delightfully ramps it over slip. Lovely touch

Bumrah to Rinku Singh, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Very loose shot, especially with a slip in place. He's trying to steer this back of length delivery with an open face down to third man. All he does is poke it off the outside edge to Ishan Kishan. KKR going down in a heap. Rinku Singh c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 5(3) [4s-1]
Cutting to Tom Curran, FOUR, short of length, sits up for Curran who whacks it away through mid-wicket. Dismissive pull shot
Cutting to Chawla, FOUR, awful delivery. Short of length ball down leg, Chawla helps it away past the keeper

Cutting to Chawla, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Holes out in the deep. Swiped across the line of this slower ball, but got it right off the toe-end. The line was a touch wide of off, which didn't work in his favour either as he had to fetch it. Right down the throat of Suryakumar at deep mid-wicket. Chawla c Suryakumar Yadav b Cutting 11(13) [4s-1]

Markande to Kuldeep Yadav, 2 runs, healthy deflection off the edge, can't attach much blame to Ishan Kishan. Another googly from Markande, drew Kuldeep forward and took the edge. It hits Kishan on the thigh before deflecting past slip
Markande to Tom Curran, FOUR, he's done well to make the contact he's made. Floated up very wide, Curran reaches out and belts the flat-batted drive wide of long-off

Krunal Pandya to Tom Curran, out Caught by Duminy!! Not quite to the pitch of the ball as he dances down, goes through with the loft nonetheless and lobs it off the inside half to long-on. Krunal gets on the wickets column as KKR lose their ninth. Tom Curran c Duminy b Krunal Pandya 18(17) [4s-3]

Krunal Pandya to Kuldeep Yadav, out Lbw!! Kuldeep reviews a leg-before call, inadvertently extending KKR's misery by a couple of minutes. Went for a reverse-sweep and missed it by quite a bit. The ball pitched around middle and leg, straightened and would have knocked the stumps over comfortably. KKR go down to their eighth consecutive loss against MI. Kuldeep Yadav lbw b Krunal Pandya 5(15)

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, SIX, smashed! That has gone around 30 rows back. Back of a length and McClenaghan had become predictable there, Lynn lined up for that length and muscled the pull over deep square leg. That came right off the screws

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, McClenaghan has lost the plot a bit against Lynn. Goes short and at the body, no pace this time and Lynn is able to pick his spot, swivels around and places the pull backward of square. All along the ground

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, SIX, not middled but Uthappa will take it. He loves facing the spinners. Bit of air given by Krunal and that is enough for Uthappa to get underneath it, sliced the on-drive over the wide long-on fence

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, out Chris Lynn Run Out!! Yes-no and Lynn is gone. Massive wicket for Mumbai. Lynn was looking in good form and Uthappa has sold him down the river. Made room to punch the flatter delivery to cover-point, called for a single and took a couple of steps out, then said no and by that time Lynn was more than halfway down the wicket. All Suryakumar had to do was throw the ball to Krunal and he did the rest. Lynn is fuming as he walks back. Chris Lynn run out (Suryakumar Yadav/Krunal Pandya) 21(15) [4s-3 6s-1]

Bumrah to Uthappa, SIX, wow! Uthappa has had his problems against the short ball this season, not this time though. Picked the short of length delivery early, transfers his weight onto the back foot and nails the pull over deep square leg. Went a long way back into the stands

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, nice way to start the over. Rana gets a leg-stump half volley and he puts it away nonchalantly, leans forward and flicks it backward of square leg, fine leg was inside the ring and the man in the deep was square

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, bisected Ishan Kishan and wide slip to perfection. The off-cutter from Pandya and Rana read it early, waited back in his crease, opened the bat face and glided it right between the two fielders

Markande to Uthappa, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Markande strikes in his first over. Uthappa scored a fifty in the reverse fixture but not today. And like the previous game, he falls to the leg-spinner. Backs away slightly to the leg-side, Markande pushed it through a bit and hence the slog sweep is not connected properly, hit it flat and straight to deep mid-wicket. Yadav did not have to move much to take that. Uthappa c Suryakumar Yadav b Markande 14(13) [6s-2]

Hardik Pandya to A Russell, out Caught by Markande!! Is that the game? Small moments make such a big difference. Rana wanted the single off the previous ball, but Russell was not interested. Had he crossed over, then he would not have been on strike. Off-cutter outside off, Russell was backing away and expecting another short delivery, then has to reach out to play the lofted drive, doesn't get the elevation and offers a simple catch to Markande at extra cover. A Russell c Markande b Hardik Pandya 2(4)

Markande to Nitish Rana, SIX, much needed maximum for KKR. They have lost the momentum completely. Flatter delivery and Rana is quick to kneel down and deposit it over deep mid-wicket. Not off the middle but enough to clear the fielder

Markande to Karthik, FOUR, smacked! Karthik needs to get on with the game. Tossed up on off and middle, Karthik bents his back knee and powers the sweep in front of square, splitting deep backward square and deep mid-wicket

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, out Karthik Run Out!! Huge moment. The ball kissed the stumps but the LEDs didn't light up then, but it did when Hardik got his fingers to it with the ball still in contact with his forefinger. So the third umpire had a few replays and gave it in favour of Hardik. Very poor running this from KKR. Second run-out of the innings. Rana tapped the slower delivery towards backward point and took a few steps out, the ever eager Karthik was more than halfway down before being sent back, Duminy was the one who threw the ball and the rest as mentioned above. Karthik put in the dive but still was well short of the crease. Karthik run out (Duminy/Hardik Pandya) 5(3) [4s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Cutting!! That surely should be the game. Two in two for MI. Fantastic catch from Cutting. Short delivery angled across the left-hander, Rana had to fetch the pull and all he could manage was a toe-end towards deep square leg, Cutting had to cover a lot of ground, he got there and slid across to complete the catch. He was out in similar fashion in the previous game as well. Problem area for Rana? Nitish Rana c Cutting b Hardik Pandya 21(19) [4s-2 6s-1]

A Russell to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he's in sublime touch and couldn't have got off with a better shot. This was short and wide outside off, Suryakumar makes the most of the provided width and slaps it past the man at point. Was timed well and raced away to the fence in no time.

Chawla to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, Ishan Kishan is going to play his shots. Premeditated and makes good contact. A powerful reverse-sweep and strikes cleanly. Got it over short third man and there is no one to stop that

Chawla to Ishan Kishan, no run. An lbw appeal against Ishan Kishan and the umpire isn't interested. The fielding side decide to go up. Fair delivery. No bat. Pitched outside leg. No need to go further. Was a shortish ball that zipped through and Kishan missed the sweep after going down on a leg. Struck on the back thigh. Would have missed off too
Chawla to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, nicely done! Fullish ball, Ishan Kishan gets down and paddle-sweeps it behind square leg

Chawla to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, in the air, in the gap and that's Ishan Kishan's third boundary in this over. Once again, Chawla bowls one on the shorter side and Kishan went back to heave. Didn't quite get it off the middle, but the placement was right

A Russell to Rohit, 1 run, dropped! Nitish Rana is the culprit. That has to be taken at this level. Rohit saw the line outside off and threw his bat hard at it. Sliced it over backward point and the ball went quickly to the fielder there. Rana could not hold on to it. How costly is that going to be?

A Russell to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, glorious shot! Full and outside off, was probably overpitched and Ishan Kishan pounced on it. Crouches low, reaches out and powerfully cracks it through extra cover. Raced away
Prasidh to Rohit, FOUR, edged and four! The Mumbai captain saw the width outside off and slashed his bat hard. Takes the edge and runs away to the third man fence

Prasidh to Rohit, FOUR, miscued pull and the lightning quick outfield ensures that it is a boundary. Got to feel for the bowler. Bowled two good balls and both have gone for fours. Banged it short and got good lift, cramped Rohit for room. Rohit, despite not being in a good position, went for the pull. Got decent wood and more importantly it went in the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on

Prasidh to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, nothing wrong about this shot. Picked the short ball got early, gets into a strong position shuffling across and elevates it over backward square leg with his front foot off air. Pulled away!

Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, SIX, bad ball and he gets the treatment! Leg-break that pitches outside leg and turns towards the left-hander's pad. Kishan won't miss out. Gets down on a knee and nails the slog-sweep over backward square leg. Came down the track as well
Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, SIX, six more! This time goes over deep mid-wicket. This was flighted, Kishan stayed deep in the crease and mowed it powerfully over deep mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, SIX, hat-trick of sixes. Kuldeep Yadav was brave to toss the ball again. Danced down and bludgeoned it over long-on. 17-ball fifty for Ishan Kishan! A superb knock from the southpaw

Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, SIX, make it four in a row! 25 off Kuldeep's over. The previous ball - he came down. Now, he stays deep in the crease. The ball is in his arc and he uses his wrists to whip it over cow corner

Narine to Ishan Kishan, SIX, oh my goodness! Even Narine won't be spared. High and handsome. Slightly fuller in length and Kishan sends another one into the deep mid-wicket stands. Down on his knees to clout it over deep mid-wicket

Narine to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Uthappa!! End of an entertaining knock. Rohit knows the value of it. He pats Kishan's back as the latter walks off. Premeditated slog-sweep goes wrong this time, as he didn't generate sufficient power. He dragged it straight down Uthappa's throat at deep backward square leg. Takes just in front of the boundary rope. Ishan Kishan c Uthappa b Narine 62(21) [4s-5 6s-6]

Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, direct-hit would have been curtains for Hardik Pandya! Short of a length, Pandya cross-bats it to extra cover and he gave up as he was sprinting towards the other end. Chawla missed the target at the bowler's end and Pandya survives

Narine to Rohit, SIX, slogs and connects well. Moved off-side even before the ball was delivered and positioned himself for the big mow. The offie was in his slot and Rohit clouted it over deep mid-wicket
Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, SIX, slower ball at 112.6kph, on a short of length. Pandya waits, clears the front leg and heaves it over deep mid-wicket

Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, SIX, one-handed six. Full toss wide of off, Pandya throws the kitchen sink and slices it behind square on the off-side. The bottom hand comes off the handle as well. But, he's got enough wood to collect a six there

Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Rinku Singh!! Hardik Pandya is caught at long-on. A full toss and Pandya went too hard at it. The bat turns at the point of impact. Easy catch for Rinku Singh. The umpires go upstairs to check if it's a no-ball. Just below the waist height. Hardik Pandya c Rinku Singh b Tom Curran 19(13) [6s-2]

Prasidh to Rohit, out Caught by Uthappa!! Maiden IPL wicket for Prasidh Krishna! Bowls the off-cutter at 113.4 and deceives the Mumbai captain. Rohit was early to swing his bat - an attempt to loft downtown. The bat turns and the ball lobbed to long-off off the cue end. Uthappa ran back from mid-off to gobble that. Rohit c Uthappa b Prasidh 36(31) [4s-2 6s-1]

Prasidh to Cutting, SIX, this is why Cutting is here! It was another slower delivery from Krishna, Cutting walks across and uses the long levers to excellent effect. Powers the pull over deep mid-wicket
Chawla to Cutting, SIX, long-on would have been interested, but he has to watch it sail over his head. Fullish ball on leg, Cutting stands tall and bludgeons it over long-on
Chawla to Cutting, SIX, back to back sixes. Darted at 117kph, on the shorter side as well, that's all too easy for Cutting. Muscled the pull over deep mid-wicket
Chawla to Cutting, FOUR, now a four. Another fast-paced delivery, Cutting swings hard and makes good contact. Goes into the cow corner fence

Chawla to Cutting, out Caught by A Russell!! Russell takes a calm catch just in front of the boundary rope. The quick wrong 'un that zipped through and Cutting gave a mighty heave. Doesn't get the required elevation and Dre Russ snaffles it at deep mid-wicket. Cutting c A Russell b Chawla 24(9) [4s-1 6s-3]

Prasidh to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, first one of the night. Was bowling so well before this delivery. Should have stuck to his lengths. Offers a juicy half-volley outside off and Suryakumar goes hard at it, swings hard and gets a thick outside edge that flies over third man. Not convincing enough for the batsman but he'll take that

Tom Curran to Lewis, FOUR, cracking shot! Sweet sound on that blow. Full length delivery outside off, Lewis doesn't miss out and crunches this one through the gap at cover. Was in the air for a while but no fielder was anywhere near

Tom Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, ahh, the form he is in! Lovely shot by Surya there. Was a length delivery outside off, Suryakumar waited for it and opened the face of the bat real late. Gets it past the man at wide slip to find the third man fence

Chawla to Krunal Pandya, SIX, 22 off the final over! Third six of the over. Piyush Chawla fires another one flat, Krunal Pandya expected that. Stayed in his crease, stood tall and hammered it over deep mid-wicket

Narine to Lewis, FOUR, beats Russell's sprint. Another example of how quick this outfield is. Even the fastest runner in KKR couldn't reach anywhere close to this. Was a short delivery outside off, Lewis was quick to rock back and crack it to the wide of long-off. That boundary will spoil Narine's over

Prasidh to Lewis, FOUR, wasn't middled. Pitched up on a full length outside off, Lewis shuffles a bit and gives it all. Throws his bat at it and gets the outside edge beat the man at third man. No chance of stopping that
Chawla to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, what a poor delivery to start off. Gifts a juicy full toss on middle and leg, Yadav gets down on his knee and sweeps it over square leg

Chawla to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, this was even better. A full and tossed up delivery around off, Yadav strides forward and lofts it to perfection over extra-cover. His confidence is high and that shot will make him feel even better

Chawla to Lewis, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! What an unlucky dismissal this for Evin Lewis. Was a short delivery on leg, Lewis tried to drag it away but got beaten and struck on the pads. The momentum of the bat was such that as the ball lobs after clipping the pads, it flicks the back of the willow and deflects towards short third man. Lynn is the man who takes it. Lewis c Chris Lynn b Chawla 18(13) [4s-3]
Kuldeep Yadav to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, the boundaries from Suryakumar continue to flow. On the pads and the batsman does well to get down and sweep it sweetly to the fine leg fence

Chawla to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Rinku Singh!! Rohit Sharma is livid with this dismissal. The skipper thinks Surya should have carried on after getting off to such a good start. A short delivery around off, Suryakumar goes back in his crease and pulls it away. Fails to middle it though, not much power on that shot too. Easy forward catch for Rinku Singh at deep mid-wicket as the umpire signals time-out! Suryakumar Yadav c Rinku Singh b Chawla 36(32) [4s-5 6s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, 1 run, that could have been a soft dismissal. Was a tossed up delivery and Rohit chipped it straight back. Kuldeep was quick to move to his left and put in the dive but the ball just eludes him

Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, SIX, that's a big one to get off the mark. Puts on his dancing shoes, gets to the pitch of the ball and deposits it over long-on for a massive six. Was middled and timed to perfection

Sandeep Sharma to Roy, FOUR, uppish and just past the diving cover fielder! Dhawan tried but it was past him in a flash. Fullish ball and Roy was committed on the drive, doesn't bother to keep it down but the good thing was that he found the gap

S Kaul to Harshal Patel, SIX, not quite his day, it seems. Conceded 15 runs in the first over, concedes a big one early in this one. Was a shortish delivery around off, Harshal was quick to camp back and deposit it over mid-wicket for a flat six

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, another poor delivery. He's struggling with his lines and lengths tonight. Bowls a short one again but on the pads, easy for the batsman to help it on its way to the square leg fence with an easy whip. No fielder anywhere close to cut this down

Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, Pant is playing a gem here. Delhi need him to play a few of these. Flat and quick around off, Pant premeditates and reverse sweeps it through short third man. Was a well played shot by the southpaw

Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, successive boundaries for Pant. This was full on middle and leg, Pant gets down and goes for a sweep, gets a glove to it and manages to evade short fine leg this time around

Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, that's the third boundary of the over. Pant is showing no mercy against Rashid. Another short delivery down the leg side, Pant does well to drag it down to the long-leg fence. 15 runs of that over and Pant moves into the 40s

Sandeep Sharma to Harshal Patel, SIX, now you know why he has been promoted up the order. Picks the length early on this short one and slaughters it over the long-on for an impressive six. Was middled to perfection as it went deep into the stands. Held the pose for the cameras too
Sandeep Sharma to Pant, FOUR, easy pickings for the batsman. On the pads and can't get any easier for Pant who glances it past short fine. Needs one boundary more to reach his fifty

Sandeep Sharma to Pant, 1 run, 50-run stand up for the fourth wicket. How pivotal has this knock by the youngster been. Short of a length outside off and Pant does well to slap it to cover, a slight misfield too but the batsmen are satisfied with the single

Rashid Khan to Pant, out Harshal Patel Run Out!! 1 run completed. What is Pant doing? That's the second run-out he's involved in tonight. Flicks the flatter delivery to short mid-wicket and gets the single. Calls for the second too but as the throw comes in at the striker's end he sends Harshal back. Goswami fumbles on the first attempt - doesn't gather the ball cleanly - but reacts quickly and gets the direct hit right on the second one with an underhanded flick onto the stumps. Harshal Patel run out (Shikhar Dhawan/Goswami) 24(17) [6s-2]
Shakib to Pant, SIX, smoked it! Tossed up delivery around off, Pant has smacked this one over the mid-wicket fence for half a dozen to reach his fifty.
Shakib to Pant, FOUR, another impressive hit by Pant. Comes down the wicket, converts the length into a full one and hammers it past Shakib. That raced away to the fence in no time

S Kaul to Pant, SIX, Kaul keeps on getting thrashed, like he has throughout this innings. Dishes in a full length delivery on middle, Pant waits for it and pummels it over for long-on, high and handsome. The crowd absolutely loved it, they are up on their feet
Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, he has all range of strokes in his kitty. Brings in the reverse sweep into play and gets it over the point fence on a couple of bounces
Rashid Khan to Pant, SIX, Rashid Khan taken to cleaners. He has the Orange Cap now. A floated delivery around off, Pant goes after it with all might and clears the long-off fence

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, even he gets punished. Tries to bowl a yorker but ends up bowling a half-volley. Pant doesn't miss out and deposits it over mid-wicket. Way into the stands as Pant moves on to 86*
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, on to 90* is Pant. On a length outside off, Pant throws his hands at it and smacks it over the cover fence, on a few bounces and into the fence

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, amazing shot that. Was a length ball outside off, Pant does well to ramp this over short third man. The ball is just flying all over the place, to all the corners. Awestruck by this display of batsmanship!

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, that's Pant's maiden century in the IPL. Has missed out on a few occasions previously but doesn't miss out tonight. Gets a full toss around off and makes sure to muscle it over mid-wicket with all his might. Gets to the milestone and celebrates in style. Maxwell gives him a tight hug!
S Kaul to Maxwell, FOUR, first one of the night for Maxwell. Another full toss around off, Maxwell stays put and smacks it right past the bowler, intercepts long-off and long-on to perfection

Bhuvneshwar to Maxwell, out Caught by Hales!! Maxwell looks to go big but misses. Was a back of a length delivery around off, Maxwell went at it with hard hands, swung at it only to get a top edge to wide long-off. Hales is the man who settles underneath and takes it. More importantly Pant is back on strike. Maxwell c Hales b Bhuvneshwar 9(8) [4s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, have run out of adjectives to describe this masterclass by Pant. Was a full length delivery around off, Pant gets into position early and scoops it over short third man with an angled bat
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, how easy? Similar to the previous shot. An exact replica. A fullish one around off, Pant is quick to get into position and scoop it over short third man once again

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, don't think Bhuvi has been treated in such a way this season by anyone. He's under the pump! Bowls a short one around off, Pant transfers his weight on to the back foot and pulls it for a clean six over fine leg
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, that's a one-handed six! Short of a length around off, Pant goes hard at it, in the process one hand comes off but he somehow manages to clear the long-on fence

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, smart batting! Roy has sussed the pitch and decides to go straight with his aggressive shots. Pays off instantly. A touch fuller from Bhuvneshwar and it's been launched straight over the bowler's head
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, 26 runs off the final over as Pant ends on a scintillating 128*! Walks back to a standing ovation as he muscles the full toss over mid-wicket

Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, excellent footwork from Shaw! This wasn't all that full but he came down the track in a flash and lofted it over Shakib's head. Mid-on was a mere spectator. Top stroke! Not a bad ball at all, just a top shot

Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Dhawan!! Shakib strikes! It's a huge wicket as well, that of the in-form Prithvi Shaw. This skid off the track from a good length and Shaw wanted to smash this over mid-wicket. Got it off the toe end and it spooned high up towards extra cover where there were a few fielders vying for it. Dhawan called for it and took the skier with glee before letting out his trademark slap on the knee. Prithvi Shaw c Dhawan b Shakib 9(11) [4s-1]

Shakib to Roy, out Caught by Goswami!! 2 in 2 for Shakib! This is an absolute jaffa that leaves Roy clueless. Drifted into him from a good length and spun away sharply to square him up. He tried to reach out but could only get a feather on it and Goswami was sharp to pouch it behind the stumps. Even if there wasn't an edge, Roy would have been stumped as he had got out of the crease in the bid to reach it. Excellent start for the Sunrisers. DD have been starting well of late but today, have been jolted early in the Powerplay. Alarm bells ringing for the hosts on this tricky surface. Roy c Goswami b Shakib 11(13) [4s-2]
S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, that's a typical Pant stroke! Back of a length and a bit of width on offer. He throws his hands to slam it on the up and finds the gap at cover as well. Raced away in a flash

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, does it again!' Squarer this time, result is the same. Short again from Kaul and more width on offer, he stands tall to force it away through backward point. Finds the gap once more. Pant is intent on taking it on

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, flashy runs this time but another boundary! Three in a row for Pant who isn't going to die wondering. Round the wicket from Kaul and angles this into the left-hander, it's a drive with hard hands and the edge flies past the diving Goswami to the fence

Sandeep Sharma to Pant, out Shreyas Iyer Run Out!! Disaster for DD! For the second time in the tournament, Pant has ran Shreyas Iyer out due to some terrible running between the wickets. Waste of a wicket really and now, the Daredevils are in serious trouble. Another cutter and Pant got a thick inside edge onto the pad as the ball rolled to the left of an alert Goswami. Shreyas Iyer wanted the run and by the time it was denied, he was almost near a shakehand distance from Pant. Too late to go back and Goswami's throw is on the money to Sandeep who does the rest. Out by a countrymile. Shreyas Iyer run out (Goswami/Sandeep Sharma) 3(8)
Boult to Hales, FOUR, back of a length ball and that's been swatted away. Rocks back, opens his stance and swivels a boundary through mid-wicket
Harshal Patel to Hales, FOUR, back of a length but there's enough room outside off. Hales makes some of his own and punches it behind point. Softly done

Harshal Patel to Hales, FOUR, that's no way soft. No way near to soft. Back of a length again and this time Harshal Patel angles it in. Umm, only for Hales to swivel and pull that round the corner. Used that incoming angle to his advantage, does Hales

Harshal Patel to Hales, out Lbw!! You can see why Harshal Patel is pumped here. Was taken to the cleaners with two back-to-back fours and now comes up with a very full cutter, that skids on and raps Hales low on the pad. That was as out as the appeal suggested. Hales was as much beaten by the fullish length as he was by the slowness of the delivery. P-L-U-M-B. Hales lbw b Harshal Patel 14(10) [4s-3]
Mishra to Williamson, SIX, that slow-and-wide plan to KW from Mishra was better. Drifts this in and is slog-swept by KW over mid-wicket

Mishra to Dhawan, FOUR, now Dhawan was almost hoodwinked in the air. Mishra saw him charging down and bowled it slow down leg. But Dhawan was upto it. Would have been stumped otherwise. Gets some bat and deflects it wide of the keeper

Harshal Patel to Dhawan, FOUR, he's read this slower ball! gosh he has. Slow and short, Dhawan stays on the front foot as he mauls this over deep mid-wicket. Raises his bat to a fifty but we are left wanting for the pat-thigh-Mo'-twirl celebration

Nadeem to Dhawan, SIX, hundred run stand. You have to ask Dhawan how he got under this full ball. Drifted in by Nadeem, and Dhawan's waited that extra second to nail that loft over long-on. A wristspinner from Nadeem that!

Nadeem to Dhawan, SIX, strewn full and into the pads, and Dhawan's picked his area on this. Dispatches this over mid-wicket with a bat swing that suggests many more similar hits. He's hit the purple patch again, if this innings is any omen. 58 needed off last 7
Maxwell to Dhawan, FOUR, there's no mercy in the world for things that're short. In cricket too. Dhawan rocks back and smashes the pull through square leg

Boult to Williamson, FOUR, is welcomed to the crease with a boundary. Kiwi to Kiwi and Williamson greets him with a flick of his wrists to the fence and brings up his fifty as well. Superbly constructed knock from the SRH skipper, waves his bat to the dug-out. His 6th half-century of the season. It was too leg-sidish from Boult, Williamson moved across and wristed it nonchalantly through square leg. In the gap!
Boult to Williamson, FOUR, Boult is not learning. Sprays another full ball and it ends up as a half-volley again. Drilled fluently square on the off-side

Boult to Williamson, 1 run, run-out chance missed. KW had almost given up. Nothing going DD's way at the moment. Squeezed to point and they take on Iyer's throw, who misses the target at the non-striker's end

Plunkett to Williamson, SIX, another tripe ball on leg-stump line, it's half a dozen. Banged in short, on leg-stump. Williamson swivels and helps it over disdainfully to fine leg. The ball lands on the ad cushions, the umpires took the confirmation of the third umpire before signalling it a six
Harshal Patel to Dhawan, FOUR, this boundary brings the 150-run stand between the duo. Harmless length delivery outside off, no mercy whatsoever. Dhawan leans across and bashes it over extra cover
Plunkett to Williamson, FOUR, Plunkett ends his spell with a four. He has taken quite a beating today. Overpitches this time, Williamson accepts the gift with glee and drills it through extra cover

Boult to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan moves into the nineties. Short, aiming at the body. No problems for Dhawan, who gets into a strong position and pulls it witheringly through mid-wicket. No chance for the fielder in the deep

Boult to Williamson, FOUR, game, set and match - SRH. Williamson finishes things off in style. Slanting on middle and leg, KW gets across and whips it over square leg to take SRH into the Playoffs. No-one in the deep and it'll be a boundary

Harshal Patel to Dhawan, FOUR, Harshal Patel has bowled exactly like he didn't need to. Got it right first ball but not this time. Pacy ball wide of off, and Dhawan's scorched it away through point. Free swing of the arms and poof, the ball disappears

Plunkett to Williamson, FOUR, Harshal at square third man can't get to it. Played much finer by Williamson this time, opening the bat face and slicing it just wide of the keeper. No pace lost here. Plunkett bowling them at over 140 clicks and Williamson ensuring that they run to the fence as quick. Conservation of pace
Boult to Dhawan, FOUR, length ball and a front-footed Dhawan mows it over mid-on. No shame in conceding a boundary to that

Boult to Dhawan, SIX, gee, this cutter gets a treatment even worse. Drags it from outside off too -- meaning imagine the biceps he's built -- and then carts it over cow corner with a little bit of a crouch. Ungainly looking but effective

Mishra to Williamson, FOUR, slowish leg break and that's a feeder to Williamson's glory. Opens the punch and splits it between backward point and short third man. Mishra isn't happy but pretty sure he wouldn't have been able to field it either. Pretty sure.
Vijay Shankar to Dhawan, FOUR, over mid-off. And by a long way. Goes through the line and lofts it disdainfully there
Vijay Shankar to Dhawan, SIX, and this one's across the line. Shankar's angling it in, and that helps Dhawan's shot there. Swivels with the angle and plonks it all the way over deep square leg
Mishra to Dhawan, FOUR, ala laser beam. Ues his feet and drills that straight down the ground
Plunkett to Williamson, FOUR, he's gawked at Plunkett's release and read the slower delivery. Full too, so he's knelt and drilled that drive through extra cover

Plunkett to Williamson, FOUR, "that's terrible, I am sorry," says Bishop on air. Another full slower delivery from Plunkett. He's not giving up on the plan. And Williamson, not for the first time this over, creams the drive past the diving mid-off fielder

Gowtham to Rayudu, FOUR, that is the form talking. Shimmies down and though he isn't close to the pitch of the ball, but still goes through with the loft over extra cover, one bounce and over the fence

Ankit Sharma to Rayudu, FOUR, Rayudu has decided to play his shots in the powerplay. The ball was come on nicely and that is the best time to score. Dances down and lofts it straight back over Ankit, Gowtham does well to get across from long-on and get a hand to it, but the ball still rolls into the ad cushions

Ankit Sharma to Watson, FOUR, freebie and Watson accepts it gleefully. Short and sliding down leg, Watson crouches low with a bent knee and sweeps it powerfully backward of square leg, split the two fielders there to collect his first boundary

Gowtham to Raina, FOUR, that's nicely done. Goes back in the crease, picks the length early on the short one and helps it down to the fine leg fence. Short third tried hard to cut it down but it's a lightning quick outfield

Jofra Archer to Watson, FOUR, edged but safe! So unlucky for the bowler. Bowls a pacy short delivery around off, Watson goes hard at it with a pull but a thick top edge eludes the keeper to find the fence

Jofra Archer to Watson, out Caught by Buttler!! Quite similar to the previous delivery. Another short delivery around off, Watson goes for the pull once again, gets the top-edge too. But this time around it skies up towards short fine leg and Buttler has plenty of time to settle underneath and gulp it down. Second wicket of the match for Archer. Got Rayudu earlier, gets his opening partner now. Watson c Buttler b Jofra Archer 39(31) [4s-2 6s-2]

Jofra Archer to Raina, 1 run, another fifty for Raina. He continues to keep piling on runs against the Royals. This was a short delivery again and Raina helps it around the corner to reach his milestone. His job is not done yet though. Would be interesting to see how he deals with the spinners from here on

Ish Sodhi to Raina, out Caught by Binny!! The googly it is. Got away with earlier in the over but falls this time around. Was a googly around leg, Raina went for the sweep and got a top-edge. Binny at short fine leg somehow manages to hold on to the catch. That swirled in the air but Binny makes sure to not disappoint the leggie. Raina c Binny b Ish Sodhi 52(35) [4s-6 6s-1]

Stokes to Billings, FOUR, that's an impressive drive. Only the second delivery he's facing, superb stuff. Fullish delivery, slower in pace too, Billings reads it well and creams his drive and gets it past wide mid-off
Unadkat to Dhoni, SIX, finally! Too many slower deliveries, one had to go big. Dhoni picks it up nicely and deposits it well over the mid-wicket fence. First one of the night for MS

Unadkat to Dhoni, no run, that was smacked hard by Dhoni. Middled his shot but hit the stumps at the bowler's end. Billings wanted the run but Unadkat was quick to gather the ball and uproot the stumps with the ball in his hand. Billings was out of the crease for while but makes sure to get back in time

Jofra Archer to Dhoni, FOUR, no he doesn't. Was a good delivery fired into the blockhole, Dhoni went after it with a huge swing, got an inside edge, past the stumps and past short fine leg to meet the fence

Stokes to Billings, FOUR, boundaries in succession. Billings finally gets one right. Stokes bowled a shortish delivery and his team mate did well to connect his pull, beats the diving fielder at deep square leg
Stokes to Billings, FOUR, a cracking boundary to bring up the 50-run stand. Moves away, picks the length on the fuller one and lofts it well over mid-off
Stokes to Billings, 2 runs, dropped! Chopra puts one down on his IPL debut. This was whipped to deep square leg by Billings, Chopra came running in, got his hands to it but failed to hold on to it.

Stokes to Billings, out Billings Run Out!! A direct-hit by Buttler and Billings has to depart. He failed to dig out the yorker and tried to sneak in a bye. Before he could turn back and get into the crease Buttler had done his job. The batsman had given up! Billings run out (Buttler) 27(22) [4s-3]

Jofra Archer to Rayudu, out Bowled!! Dragged on! First ball wicket for Archer. And it is the dangerous Rayudu who has been sent back. He lets out an ooh as he sees the stumps disturbed. Back of a length delivery outside off, Rayudu stays leg-side of the ball to carve it through off, but the slow nature of the surface does not get the ball quickly to him and hence the inside edge onto the stumps. Much needed wicket for RR. Rayudu b Jofra Archer 12(9) [4s-2]

Jofra Archer to Raina, FOUR, Raina opens his account with an elegant flick. Archer goes round the wicket and fires in a full delivery, angled into the left-hander and Raina whips it past the man at short square leg. Raced away to the fence

Jofra Archer to Raina, FOUR, Raina makes the most of the free-hit. Archer is not impressed. Very full and outside off, Raina bends down and uses the pace of the bowler to squeeze it behind point. No chance for third man to cut that off
Gowtham to Raina, FOUR, fraction short and Raina is quick to make Gowtham pay, he goes back and punches it square on the off-side, he used the pace of Gowtham to beat the fielder at point

Gowtham to Raina, FOUR, top shot! This is Raina at his best. The slider which skids on from a fullish length, Raina makes room, exposes his stumps and drives it inside out through the packed off-side field

Stokes to Raina, FOUR, that is a horrible delivery from Stokes. Tried the slower short of length delivery, sat up nicely in the surface, Raina had all the time to pick his spot and he muscled it over mid-wicket, for a one bounce four

Ish Sodhi to Watson, SIX, there's the release shot. He's been looking for it for quite some time. Fraction short and that is all Watson needed, quickly moves back in the crease and smashes the pull a long way into the deep mid-wicket stand

Ish Sodhi to Raina, SIX, this over compensates for the previous two overs. Raina gets into the act. It was the googly and Raina was hitting it against the turn, but still had enough to clear the wide long-on fence

Unadkat to Raina, 1 run, run-out missed. Raina was a goner. Backs away to leg and is made to reach out to his slower short of length delivery, chops the cut towards cover and sets off, Rahane had one stump to aim and he misses. Raina was gone by a fair distance there

Unadkat to Watson, SIX, wow! Watson starting to unleash. Unadkat goes round the wicket and bowls the back of a length delivery, right in Watson's arc and he has no half measures as he deposits it into the deep mid-wicket stand

Willey to Buttler, FOUR, that's a gimme! No room for error when you are bowling to Jos Buttler. He likes it short and gets some width to work too, just stands back and stabs the ball through the off-side ring

Willey to Buttler, FOUR, we have seen this in the last game! Anything short and Buttler will pounce on it. Gets another back of a length dart wide of off-stump, he transfers his weight onto the back foot and drills it wide of mid-off
Willey to Buttler, FOUR, brilliant hand-eye co-ordination. Willey continues to bowl short and wide, Buttler set himself up early on this occasion, raced away off the sweet spot behind point
Harbhajan to Buttler, FOUR, drifts on Buttler's pads and gets picked away, wasn't a controlled shot that, but Buttler made enough contact off the bat to send it fine past the keeper

Harbhajan to Buttler, FOUR, reverse slap. Buttler is not hanging back. Makes his intentions clear, sees the ball outside off and times the pants of it, got it in the gap too. Just behind backward point
Harbhajan to Buttler, SIX, halfvolley, dispatched! Loads it up full and bowls straight, Buttler uses those long levers to smack the life out of that leather. All the way over long-on

Willey to Samson, FOUR, really lucky for Samson. Pressure was building on him, he makes some room and slices this up off a thick edge over short third man. The idea was to go over backward point, but it spooned up over Bhajji off the edge

Dwayne Bravo to Samson, out Samson Run Out!! Oh dear, total breakdown between the two batsmen, so much so that they were almost caught together at one end at one point. Back of length delivery, Samson pats it towards backward point and takes a couple of steps down the pitch, which lured Buttler for the single. However, Samson was guilty of ball-watching and quickly turned his back to him, while Buttler ran through to the striker's end. Eventually, Samson may have sacrificed himself. Raina passes the ball onto Bravo who under-arms it back onto the stumps to catch the struggling Samson short. Samson run out (Raina/Dwayne Bravo) 21(22) [4s-2]

Dwayne Bravo to Chopra, FOUR, beautiful timing. That sped off his bat through backward point. Back of length just outside off, not that bad a delivery, but Chopra leans back and spears a cut through to the fence
SN Thakur to Chopra, FOUR, full at the pads, Chopra gets his bat down from the big back-lift and flicks it stylishly behind square. Beats the fielder's dive in the deep

SN Thakur to Chopra, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! The big back-lift probably works to his detriment here. Full at the pads again, the ball slightly stops on him, but due to the velocity at which the bat comes down, he's unable to check the flick shot enough. Chips it off a soft leading edge straight to short mid-wicket. Chopra c Dwayne Bravo b SN Thakur 8(6) [4s-2]
SN Thakur to Binny, FOUR, throws his hands at the width on offer and lashes it through backward point. Two ordinary deliveries from Thakur back-to-back. Not good

Watson to Buttler, 1 run, clears his front leg and smacks this slower ball straight at Watson, who tried putting his hands together in front of his face but it burst through them. Half a chance, if you want to be harsh

Watson to Buttler, FOUR, audacious from Buttler, but then that's what he is about. Slower length ball, he gets into position early and slaps the reverse-hit through backward point. Much needed boundary off the over

Willey to Buttler, FOUR, oh well well. Where is sweeper cover? The fielder was very square in his position, and Buttler made some room to slap the ball away from off-stump. Brilliant batting. But was that the plan or did the fielder stand out of place. Willey shakes his head as he walks back
Dwayne Bravo to Binny, SIX, length ball from Bravo, disappears. What a blow from Binny. His base was steady as he launched it brutally over long-on

Dwayne Bravo to Binny, out Caught by Watson!! Full toss at the stumps, should have disappeared too. Instead, Bravo's got very lucky. Binny swung across it too early, and lobbed it up off a leading edge. No mistake from Watson at extra cover, with his hands like buckets. Binny c Watson b Dwayne Bravo 22(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, 1 run, dropped by Dhoni. Could have been the match right there. Fine leg is inside the ring, which tempts Buttler into looking for the scoop. But this is a slower ball, making it really difficult to get any leverage on it. He deflects it to Dhoni's left, who dives with one hand but can't cling on

Willey to Gowtham, SIX, stunning strike from Krishnappa Gowtham, that too off his very first ball. The crowds jump out of their seats as he muscles his flat-batted heave over long-off. It's gone soaring into the stands

Willey to Gowtham, SIX, this is remarkable from Gowtham. He's come out and nailed two balls out of the three he's faced. Willey misses his mark with the yorker, offers it in the slot and Gowtham tonks it over long-off's head

Willey to Gowtham, out Caught by Dhoni!! Back of length outside off, width on offer, Gowtham slashes at it but only gets an edge through to Dhoni. Precious little cameo though. It's got the equation down to 12 off the final over. Gowtham c Dhoni b Willey 13(4) [6s-2]

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, SIX, the Rajasthan dugout erupts. Back of length slower ball, not easy to hit, but Buttler hacks it with stunning power over mid-wicket. Wow what a shot. This should be the blow which seals it
Jadeja to Buttler, FOUR, this is batting of the highest class from Jos Buttler! Steps outside leg to create room and lifts it nonchalantly over extra cover. The timing on that takes cares of the rest

Harbhajan to Buttler, FOUR, that's so effortlessly done! So, its a short ball on middle, Buttler jumps back to create that extra leeway on the leg-side, spots the ball and punches it crisply through mid-wicket. Easy peasy
Harbhajan to Stokes, FOUR, makes room once again and swings wildly, the drift picks the thick inside edge and runs fine of the keeper to his right
Harbhajan to Stokes, SIX, nothing wild about this one, sets himself on one knee and launches Bhajji for a many-a-mile over mid-wicket. Clean as a whistle

Harbhajan to Stokes, out Bowled!! Stokes is livid, yells out all the frustration after he missed the shot. Looks to charge at the bowler and exposes his cards way too early in the process, Bhajji fires it in quickly to defeat Stokes's bat swing and hit the middle of middle. Stokes b Harbhajan 11(7) [4s-1 6s-1]
Jadeja to Rahane, FOUR, dragged short and drifting down, Rahane clears his front leg and helps it away through backward square

Jadeja to Rahane, out Caught by Raina!! Spin, spin and spin. Ah, this is going to be some contest. Jaddu gets enough rip off the pitch, lands it around the ideal length and gets some purchase off the surface, hits the seam and turns just enough to kiss the outside edge. Raina at first slip has bucket hands, he doesn't miss many, does he? Rahane was caught in two minds there, wasn't fully forward neither back, just hung in there and poked at it. Late spot: The ball deflected off Dhoni's glove before it lobbed up to Raina. Rahane c Raina b Jadeja 4(3) [4s-1]

Jadeja to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler's game keeps getting better and better! Employs one of the best tactics to play spin. Gets down on one knee and swats the reverse sweep from outside off, right in the gap behind point, sweeper cover can't get there
Karn Sharma to Buttler, 2 runs, straighter one, Buttler paddles it fine to bring up his fourth successive fifty to match Virat Kohli's feat. Only Viru has five in a row
Karn Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, spins away from a shorter length, Buttler goes hard and sends a thick edge fine of third man. Streaky, but Buttler won't mind
SN Thakur to Samson, FOUR, that's a gift. Full and down leg, Samson glances it off his pads and off she goes...

Mohit Sharma to Chris Lynn, FOUR, how lucky is Lynn? This could have easily chopped on. Short and wide outside off, Lynn plays it with hard hands and gets an inside edge that goes past the stumps and all way to the fine leg fence

Mohit Sharma to Chris Lynn, FOUR, replica of the previous delivery. Believe in luck? Another short delivery outside off, Lynn goes after it and gets an inside edge, past the stumps again to meet the fine leg boundary in succession.

Barinder to Uthappa, 1 run, a direct hit there and it was curtains for Narine. He was nowhere in the frame and had given up. Short of a length around off, Uthappa chops it to short third man, calls for a single and completes it. Mohit Sharma is the one who fails to score the direct hit

Barinder to Narine, SIX, how good is his bat? Or is the ground? Whatever it is, six runs in Narine's account. Was a slower delivery on middle and leg, Narine waited for it and flicked it over mid-wicket. High, handsome and just over the fence

Barinder to Narine, FOUR, carnage! Haven't seen a better knock from him. Was a full toss and Narine made sure to time his flick through mid-wicket. KKR chants in the crowd as the batsmen are showing no mercy

Barinder to Narine, SIX, unstoppable! Shortish delivery around off, Narine camps back and pulls it over the mid-wicket fence. The fielder near the fence watches it sail over him. Has been the story of the match so far...
Andrew Tye to Narine, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Narine stands tall and pumps it over cover. One bounce and into the fence. Running out of adjectives here

Andrew Tye to Narine, out Caught by Rahul!! Tye gets the second wicket too. Bowls a short delivery around off, Narine tries to pull that away but ends up getting a top edge. Easy take for Rahul to hold on. It's Andre Russell who walks out to bat at Narine's fall. Was such an entertaining knock by the all-rounder. Has left the Kings stunned and speechless. Narine c Rahul b Andrew Tye 75(36) [4s-9 6s-4]

Andrew Tye to Uthappa, out Caught by Mohit Sharma!! Double strike in the same over for Tye. This spell might help the Kings to get back in the game. Was a fullish delivery outside off but Uthappa got deceived due to the slower one. He reaches for it and ends up slicing it to Mohit Sharma at backward point. Has been the story of the season for Uthappa. Has got his eye in and thrown it away more often than not. Uthappa c Mohit Sharma b Andrew Tye 24(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Axar to Karthik, FOUR, played, well played DK! This was a flighted delivery and Karthik played with an angled bat to pierce the gap on the off-side. Gets it past short third man and the timing was such that it races away to the fence

Axar to Karthik, FOUR, edged away! If there was a slip, this could have been a catch. An easy one. Karthik went back in his crease to cut it but got an outside edge, through the empty slip cordon to find the third man boundary
Mohit Sharma to A Russell, SIX, woah, that's a biggie. And someone's caught it in the top tier. Massive swing of the bat by Russell. Clears the front leg and swipes to glory over cow corner
Axar to Karthik, FOUR, swept from in front of off-stump and Tye's lazy at the deep square leg ropes. Doesn't bend down enough as he picks it one-handed
Axar to A Russell, SIX, that's an okay slog-sweep. Stretches far in front, picking it from an off-stump line and swamping it over backward square leg

Axar to A Russell, SIX, we need a replacement ball. You know why? This one's on the roof. An uncouth slog that pays off this time. Half-crouched, front leg outta way and hocus pocus - that's sailing over deep mid-wicket. 19 runs off the over
Mujeeb to Karthik, SIX, KKR right now are an efficient courier service, sending everything into the crowd. Angled in, Karthik played with it, slogging it over deep mid-wicket

Mujeeb to Karthik, FOUR, that's the front of the hand cutter kinda delivery. Slow off the deck and bouncing, and Karthik got a top-edge as he looked to swat it leg-side. Wide of the keeper and it runs away, deflecting off KL's helmet
Mujeeb to Karthik, SIX, gets into the position early. Stays in the crease and dispatches this carom ball through square leg. Wafting it across

Mujeeb to A Russell, FOUR, it's gone a little wrong for Mujeeb this over. Overcooks the googly down the leg-side and Russell's helped him through short fine leg for a boundary. A 19-run over followed by a 21-run over
Andrew Tye to Karthik, SIX, how nicely has that been played. That's a slower short ball but Karthik steps out and loops the pull over his shoulders. Just helped the ball there to the fine leg fence

Andrew Tye to A Russell, FOUR, squeezed away over Gayle at short third man. Wide yorker length delivery, Russell threw his hands at it and popped it over the fielder. Very deliberate, with the open bat face

Andrew Tye to A Russell, out Caught by Rahul!! He's finally picked him with a seam-up back of a length ball. Russell preps for a big swing over mid-wicket but doesn't get hold of the ball. Miscued high in the air, and back, and Rahul takes care of the steepler with a little swirl. A Russell c Rahul b Andrew Tye 31(14) [4s-2 6s-3]

Mohit Sharma to Nitish Rana, SIX, cameras pan to Mohit's face and he's clueless at the monstrosity of his home venue. Slow ball angles across, but Nitish Rana's dispatched him over deep mid-wicket first ball. Is there a pitch in the pavilion?

Mohit Sharma to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Miller's jump at long-off isn't good enough. This was barelled away by Nitish Rana. Absolutely brutal. Gets a fullish delivery and he got under it, pumping it with a straight 45-degree bat for a hit in the V. Now who doesn't like it

Mohit Sharma to Nitish Rana, out Caught by (sub)Miller!! That was a wide.. had Nitish Rana left it. But he doesn't. Goes after the slower ball, slices it up in the air, and Miller comes in a few yards from long-off to catch it. Nitish Rana c (sub)Miller b Mohit Sharma 11(4) [4s-1 6s-1]
Mohit Sharma to Karthik, FOUR, switches his stance open and reverse-pulls that to the third man fence. Cricket in modern times is truly ridiculous. And fun

Andrew Tye to Shubman Gill, FOUR, Gayle's fielding in boots so heavy that it doesn't allow him to move. Standing at short third man, intending to field this outside edge from Shubman Gill, but his feet don't move. And he surrenders to his constraints
Andrew Tye to Karthik, 1 run, inches short of a yorker and he's squeezed it out to backward point. Karthik's 15th IPL fifty - and his first this season

Barinder to Karthik, out Caught by (sub)Miller!! He's done two things wrong here: a) gone against the angle on this slow short ball from over the wicket, and b) played the slog-pull off the front foot. Misuced to Miller at long-on but he's done his job, has Karthik. Karthik c (sub)Miller b Barinder 50(23) [4s-5 6s-3]
Barinder to Shubman Gill, FOUR, played the slower ball at 93ks brilliantly here. Waits and pulls, splitting the two fielders in deep square on the leg-side
Barinder to Shubman Gill, FOUR, tries to bowl the pacy full-wide ball from over the wicket but Shubman Gill's reached out and ushered it to the ropes off the toe-end. Through to square third man
Barinder to Searles, SIX, his first ball in the match has sailed over long-on. wow. Full and swung away. KKR finish with whoppin' 245

Mujeeb to Narine, no run, dropped! That was a tough chance as it was struck hard by Narine. Mujeeb hardly had any time to react there. Got his right hand to it but failed to cling on. He's in some pain, in fact he's going off the field. How costly a blow will that be for Kings XI? He has been one of their best bowlers this season.
Ashwin to Narine, SIX, finally connects. Was trying since quite some time. Receives a short delivery and Narine makes sure to camp back and heave it over the mid-wicket fence. Clean as a whistle!

Ashwin to Narine, FOUR, Ashwin goes full this time. Tossed up delivery around middle, Narine clears his front leg and smacks this one over mid-on. The fielder there tried all that he could with a leap but the ball eluded him with ease

Barinder to Chris Lynn, SIX, this is massive, out of the park. Literally. Bowls a slower delivery to start off, Lynn picks it early, gets into position and smokes it over mid-wicket, over the roof and six runs for the big man
Barinder to Narine, FOUR, up and over! Shortish delivery, bowled at express speed. Narine goes after it with a swing and gets an outside edge. Beats short third man and finds the fence on one bounce
Barinder to Narine, FOUR, boundaries continue to flow as Narine continues to take them on. This was a full length delivery and Narine manages to heave it over mid-on. Expensive first over by Sran!
Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, SIX, even the Purple Cap holder hasn't been spared. Stands tall and towers the length ball over long-on to welcome Tye into the attack

Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Lynn finally runs out of luck. Got lucky on quite a few occasions earlier but not this time. This was a short one around leg, he tried to pull it away but the ball clips his thigh, then it deflects off his glove to disturb the stump. He has given the start KKR required though. Chris Lynn b Andrew Tye 27(17) [4s-2 6s-2]

Andrew Tye to Narine, FOUR, Narine keeps marching on. Wickets won't make any difference to him, he'll play like he always does. This was a short delivery aimed at the hips and all Narine had to do is help it on its way. Manages to do so and beats short fine leg
Axar to Narine, SIX, excellent shot! Moves inside the line, swings hard and towers it right over the bowler's head for a maximum. He's looking in good touch today
Ashwin to Narine, FOUR, there's no stopping him. Walks down the wicket and chips the widish delivery over cover. Long-off sprints across to stop it but the ball wins the race
Ashwin to Narine, FOUR, successive boundaries! Goes straight this time, smacks the tossed up delivery hard and beats the fielder at long-on this time around

Axar to Uthappa, FOUR, first one of the innings for Robbie. Stays put and times his loft right over the bowler's head. The man in the deep was a bit wide and even if he was fine, wouldn't be able to stop it

Axar to Narine, 1 run, third fifty for Narine in IPL and second one this season. Nudges the floater away to deep mid-wicket to reach his milestone. But he needs to carry on. Usually throws it away after reaching fifty
Axar to Narine, FOUR, pulled away! Shortish on the pads and Narine goes back in the crease to pull it past deep square leg. Striking at a rate of over 200 at the moment
Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR, Gayle has given up! As soon as this was swept. Was the leg spinner around the leg stump and Uthappa did well to elude Gayle at short fine leg
Ashwin to Uthappa, SIX, that's the second 50-run stand of this match. KKR showing some intent. This was slogged over the mid-wicket fence by Uthappa to perfection
Narine to Rahul, SIX, that's meditative. Pure timing. Uses his feet and times this carom ball over long-off
Narine to Rahul, SIX, again shimmying down and going inside-out with this loft over cover. Got right to the pitch and under it. KL Rahul's good. Real good
Prasidh to Rahul, FOUR, 137ks and on a back of a length, Rahul looked a little cramped for the glide to third man and squeezed it out off the splice. Wide of the lone slipper

Kuldeep Yadav to Axar, FOUR, good use of the feet. Axar puts on the dancing shoes and gets close to the flighted delivery, then muscles the drive straight of long-on, where Russell's dive is an after thought

Kuldeep Yadav to Axar, SIX, now sends it over Russell. Not connected properly, but the small boundaries aid him in. Shuffled across to the conventional chinaman and heaved it with a bent back knee over long-on, just over

Kuldeep Yadav to Axar, out Caught by Searles!! Wicket for Kuldeep. That should get back his confidence, especially after what Ishan Kishan did in the previous game. Switched to round the wicket and fired the full delivery outside off, Axar moved a bit and lofted it to long-off. The length was tad too full and hence Axar could not get underneath it. A well-judged catch by Searles, who timed his jump to perfection. Axar c Searles b Kuldeep Yadav 19(11) [4s-2 6s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, SIX, half tracker and Finch dismisses it from his presence. Real poor bowling from Kuldeep. Gave Finch all the time to pick his spot and muscle the pull over the cow corner fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, SIX, consecutive sixes for Finch. He needs to kick-on, at least to get his form back. Wrong 'un and Finch had to fetch it from outside off, cue-ends the slog sweep just over a leaping Searles at long-on
Chawla to Ashwin, FOUR, similar to the previous delivery and this time Ashwin uses the pace on the ball smartly, waits and back cuts it behind point, bisected the two fielders there to perfection
Searles to Finch, SIX, Finch is not given up yet. Length delivery right in the slot, Finch winds up with the front leg cleared and gives it his all, heaved away into the deep mid-wicket stand

Searles to Finch, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! And he's gone.. Finch is livid. Lets out a grunt before storming off. Searles went round the wicket and hurled it across the right-hander, Finch shuffled across and did well to get under the ball to play the scoop, couldn't find the elevation and Kuldeep takes a good catch at short fine. Either side and that would have been a boundary. FYI, maiden IPL wicket for Searles. Finch c Kuldeep Yadav b Searles 34(20) [6s-3]

Searles to Andrew Tye, SIX, off the mark in style. Tye does not want to hang around. Back of a length and not much wrong with the delivery, Tye just goes through the line and smashes it over the leaping long-on fielder

Searles to Ashwin, SIX, third six of the over. This time off Ashwin's willow. Searles hurls it full and in the swinging arc, Ashwin presses forward and sends it sailing over long-off. Searles ends with 4-0-52-1 on IPL debut
Narine to Ashwin, FOUR, delicate. The quicker offie and Ashwin picked it alright, camped back in the crease and used the pace on the ball to direct it fine past short third man
Narine to Ashwin, FOUR, now shows his power. Narine offers him the space to free his arms and Ashwin thumps it straight back over Tye, no chance for long-on to get across and stop that
Prasidh to Andrew Tye, FOUR, length delivery and Tye gives it his all, shuffled across to get inside the line and powered it away along the ground to deep mid-wicket, no chance for Gill to get around

A Russell to Ashwin, SIX, wow! That is a massive hit from Ash. Picked the back of the hand slower ball, lined himself up for the big heave-ho and gave it the full monty, cleared long-on quite comfortably

A Russell to Ashwin, SIX, Ashwin is helping his team's NRR with these strikes. Back of a length and at the stumps, Ashwin cleared his front leg and hammered it over cow corner. Got the elevation and the distance

A Russell to Ashwin, FOUR, KXIP are in this mathematically. 38 off 7. Ashwin is playing a gem here. Short delivery and Ashwin cheekily periscopes his bat up and ramps it over DK. It almost went the distance

Prasidh to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Karthik!! Excellent take! Sharp short delivery on middle and leg, Tye moved across, got inside the line and attempted the pull, the pace was just too quick for him, kissed the glove and flew to the left of DK, who flings full length to glove that. Andrew Tye c Karthik b Prasidh 14(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Prasidh to Ashwin, out Lbw!! Ouch! Ashwin is limping off the field. DK helped his state mate compose himself. He was struck on the right knee. Length delivery right on the stumps, Ashwin with a cleared front leg missed the slog to the on-side, hit flush on the back knee in front of middle. The umpire took a while before raising his finger, but he made the right decision. Ashwin grunted in pain after the blow and was on his haunches for a bit. Ashwin lbw b Prasidh 45(22) [4s-4 6s-3]

Prasidh to Mohit Sharma, FOUR, fuller and outside off, a handsome square drive to get off the mark from Mohit, he presses forward and creams it with an open bat face square of the wicket, giving sweeper no chance
Searles to Rahul, FOUR, this is why the first ball to Rahul was into the batsman. A bit of width and Rahul's found the room to slash it disembowelingly wide of backward point
Searles to Gayle, FOUR, switches to round the wicket to Gayle, who's laid into this room offered outside off. Cracks it with a slash over third man

A Russell to Gayle, FOUR, action-reaction law? Gayle rubbished it. Hits it harder than it arrives. Full, he's drilled it off the toe-end and you had to look at Russell and the umpire ducking to save their lives

A Russell to Gayle, 1 run, dropped by Karthik. A leading edge kinda top-edge there as Gayle looked to run it into the leg-side. Looped behind, DK leaped but deflected it off the tip of his gloves. A bit high that but it'll be recorded as a drop
Prasidh to Rahul, SIX, 143ks and that's why it's rushed away to the third man fence. Full and wide, Rahul made some room and carved it away with disdain
Prasidh to Rahul, 1 run, 50 up. Length ball at 143ks, worked effortlessly through mid-wicket
A Russell to Gayle, SIX, that isn't for aspiring fast bowlers. Look away! Gayle backs way and pummels this pull off the front foot. Over deep mid-wicket without any fuss

A Russell to Gayle, out Caught by Karthik!! He had to fall to a short ball, didn't he? Fast bowling mostly wins. Got his front leg outta way to similarly hack the ball open-stanced over square leg -- like he had done first ball of this over -- but he's in a horrible shape, is Gayle. Gets a top-edge that carries nicely to Karthik behind the stumps. Gayle c Karthik b A Russell 21(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

A Russell to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Searles!! Mayank falls for a first-ball duck, and gets Russell on a hat-trick. Another short ball does the trick. He's pulling a short ball that's climbing at him off the front foot. Gee, that deserves to be punished with a wicket. They're checking Russell's front foot, but he's landed well behind the line. You'll have to question the on-field umpiring here. Oh wait, I'm told that they also checked for the second bouncer for the over, and Russell was okay there too. Mayank Agarwal c Searles b A Russell 0(1)
Searles to Rahul, SIX, stand and deliver. Pings the sightscreen. Searles errs by going full and it is right in Rahul's arc, he latches onto it and dismisses it straight back over Searles

A Russell to Rahul, SIX, fifty for Rahul. A thumbs up to his partner followed by a bat wave to the crowd. Third on the trot for him. He's to continue if KXIP have to win this. Shuffled a bit in his crease before making room to this short delivery, upper cuts it into the second tier over third man. Also gets the orange cap back

A Russell to Nair, out Caught by Prasidh!! Dre Russ doing all the damage for KKR. Third wicket for him. The off-cutter on a length, Nair spots it early and goes through with the lofted on-drive, seemed to have struck it enough before Krishna came into the frame, ran to his left from long-on, went with two hands over his head, but the ball got stuck in his left hand. Lucky! But that will do. Nair c Prasidh b A Russell 3(6)

Narine to Rahul, SIX, that's outta here. Third time the ball has been smashed out of the stadium today. Rahul once again picks what Narine is bowling, runs down the wicket and gets close to the ball, lofts it handsomely over long-on and out of the ground

Narine to Rahul, SIX, Narine being taken to the cleaners. That is the fourth six Rahul has struck off Narine. Half tracker on leg-stump, Rahul transfers his weight back and deposits the pull over deep backward square leg

Narine to Rahul, out Bowled!! Narine has his man. Big moment in the game. That might be the match. Even Narine enjoyed out. He lets out a roar. Never seen him express his delight after picking a wicket. The round the wicket ploy has worked, carrom ball on the stumps, Rahul kneels to play the slog sweep, gets an inside edge onto the front thigh, the backspin on the ball takes it onto the stumps. Unfortunate way to get out. Rahul b Narine 66(29) [4s-2 6s-7]

Searles to Axar, FOUR, crunched! 100 comes up within 10 overs and KXIP still need to strike over 14 per over. On a length and outside off, Axar stands and thumps it on the up past Russell at extra cover. Raced away!

Chahal to Prithvi Shaw, out Bowled!! What a rippah! Chahal shows who's the boss here. Imparts loads of revs on this and gets the ball to straighten at a rapid pace to bamboozle the 18-year old. Prithvi Shaw clearly didn't pick that. Was standing languidly on the back foot hoping to milk that across the line, wasn't to be. Pegs are back... Prithvi Shaw b Chahal 2(4)
U Yadav to Roy, SIX, this is what Roy can do? Such a brute of a player. It's a sit-up outside off, begging to be smashed; Roy nonchalantly pulls it into the stands over mid-wicket. Simple ain't it?
U Yadav to Roy, FOUR, tad full and that's all Roy needed. Transfers his weight onto the back foot to cream the punchy-drive through covers. No-one moved
de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, nice use of the pace from Shreyas Iyer, sits back in the crease and opens the bat face at the right moment to send it fine of third man
Moeen Ali to Pant, SIX, into the stands! Premeditated hack and he's got all of it. Nicely floated up by Mo Ali and the next thing he sees is the ball sailing into the mid-wicket stands

Chahal to Pant, SIX, fuller and wider, Pant frees his arms and lays into it, sends Chahal for a 83-metre maximum over long-on. He's striking the ball clean as ever is Rishabh Pant, just one short of his fifty now

Chahal to Pant, FOUR, 7th IPL fifty for Rishabh Pant! The DD dug out is up and applauding this wondrous talent. Slightly short and he's laced all the power into the pull shot, raced away behind square
Moeen Ali to Pant, FOUR, that's a one-handed hoick. Saw the line (drifting down leg) and swiped it as hard as he can, no-one there at fine leg. Great placement

Moeen Ali to Pant, out Caught by de Villiers!! That's a sliding specky from AB. Makes up for the catch he dropped earlier. Pant went for his go-to shot - agricultural slog - and couldn't quite manage it off the middle. Flew off the bottom hand to the left of long-on where AB covered great distance to slide and gobble it before tripping over with a tumble. All of that inches inside the rope. It certainly needed some brilliance to end Pant's blitzkrieg. Pant c de Villiers b Moeen Ali 61(34) [4s-5 6s-4]
U Yadav to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, oh dear. With nobody at fine leg, Yadav for some strange reason decides to feed the ribs. Shankar swivels, pulls, one-legged. And his strike-rate's up to decency

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Kohli!! No, no. None of his late antics tonight. The innings was always painful .. to play, to watch. And it ends painfully. It's quick from Siraj, zipping in a little too straight. But Iyer decides to swing him over cow corner. Barely connects, gets the elevation. And Kohli's waiting. Shreyas Iyer c Kohli b Siraj 32(35) [4s-3]

Siraj to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, oh the swagger. It's supposedly his first ball in the IPL and he starts off in all glory. A juicy pitch up, he gets under, flows through the line and lofts it over mid-off. Well over
Southee to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, on the dance down, flings his hands out and slices. Can't keep it down. And Siraj running in from third man can't keep it in. Misjudges his dive

Southee to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, oh yes. That's off the middle alright. Southee tries the sucker full ball to follow. And Abhishek tonks it straight down, full flow, full elegance, full pose. And to imagine he's 17
Southee to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, some more. Southee loses his line, ends up too straight and finds it swatted. Hard, flat, cow corner

Siraj to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, he's toying here. And from Pant's brutal attack, it's come down to Abhishek's delicacy. Siraj threatens him with a bouncer, it's off target, it's with width and he carves/upper-cuts it over a vacant third man

Siraj to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, and now Shankar rubs it in. He's playing second fiddle mind you, but he's got enough punch lines with himself. Another horrific delivery, down leg, all it needs is a tickle and Shankar gives it a glance instead. Save your legs
Siraj to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, he's lighting it up. Gets the front leg out, loads up, from that massive backlift as he hoicks. Meaty. Long-on. Murder

Siraj to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, and now save your heads. Siraj dishes out friendly length at this stage, Abhishek gets under and puts all his muscle in drilling it straight back. Everyone in the firing line .. and everyone can only jump out. Boundary + the 50-run stand

Chahal to Roy, out Bowled!! Chahal is doing what he's been asked to. Bowls the wrong 'un and catches Roy by surprise; no clue. Knocked him over. Roy was prodding forward to drive, thought it was a conventional legbreak, wasn't to be. The ball lands on a good length and snakes in viciously to sneak through the bat-pad gate. RCB couldn't have asked for a better start. Roy b Chahal 12(9) [4s-1 6s-1]
Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, googly again, Iyer picks it out of the hand, had enough time to pick his spot; just backs away and stabs the ball behind point. Raced away...
Southee to Pant, FOUR, short and smashed! Pant picked the length early there, the line was there to help him too. Just swivels and belts the pull backwards of square leg
U Yadav to Pant, FOUR, short and no sparing this. Pant gets into good position to maul this pull through mid-wicket, gee! He's hit that with some power
U Yadav to Pant, FOUR, width on the other side this time, Pant frees his arms and thrashes it over extra cover
Siraj to Pant, SIX, get outta here, Rishabh Pant's bat screamed with delight. Saw the length (short) early and launched this flat over mid-wicket at the rate of knots. Phewfff!
Siraj to Pant, SIX, he is constantly feeding to Pant's strengths. That ball sat up nicely outside off, Pant uses all his bottom hand power to hammer it straight of long-off. All the way
Moeen Ali to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, 50 partnership! Gets there with a flick off the pads to short fine
de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that's a friendly dart outside off stump, Iyer makes use of the width on offer and glides late with an angled bat wide of short third
de Grandhomme to Pant, 1 run, slapped back. Would have been a brilliant reaction catch from de Grandhomme. Sticks his right hand out and only manages to cut some pace on that

de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, dropped by AB. Didn't pick that clearly. At least that's what he's indicating to VK. Iyer tried to loft this straight, ended up hitting it miles in the air and it hung in for an eternity. AB backtracked all the way from covers, but ended up swirling all around it before grazing the ball off his fingertips
