Lamichhane to Parthiv Patel, byes, FOUR, foxing through everyone. Patel doesn't read the wrong 'un, pulls all around it, and it's too good for Pant behind as well. Never mind the dive at the ropes, Harshal Patel's boot is touching. Just

Boult to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! Nope, the Mo experiment ain't coming good today. Boult hits his hard good length, Moeen tries crashing through the line as he goes to loft an uppish drive. The ball though gets big, gets the fat miscue and Prithvi Sahw at cover can catch, tonight. Moeen Ali c Prithvi Shaw b Boult 1(3)

Boult to Kohli, FOUR, draws the edge. But this is no England, this is not 2014 - so this will be a boundary. Kohli's squared up with the angle going across him on off, jabs his bat out, outside-edging it past the lone slip
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, cheeky! This guy is not all about power! Full ball and he's smartly moved across to scoop this over the infield with fine leg inside the ring

Lamichhane to de Villiers, SIX, he's hit that in the airrr, not timed that well, there is a man at deep backward square leg, he jumps and it's evaded him. The length was just a bit too full, de Villiers got inside the line of this flighted delivery and slog-swept it over backward square leg

Harshal Patel to Kohli, SIX, finally, a 100-run partnership between Kohli and AB this season. Harshal Patel bowls a good length delivery down the leg-side in trying to follow Kohli, but the Indian captain is so good with his wrists and whips it away over mid-wicket

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, oh lovely. Third man is inside the ring and that is exactly why de Villiers wants to give himself a bit of room. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, de Villiers cracks the cut past backward point

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, SIX, that's masterful! Masterful because he's picked this slower ball, waited and muscled the loft over long-on. Fifty for AB de Villiers as well. RCB fans would be delighted to see both AB and Kohli score fifties in the same innings. Part of the reason why they weren't clicking as a batting unit this season. Kohli is so happy for AB

Mishra to Kohli, FOUR, oh you are unreal man! This fella has bowled a pretty decent leggie and you've whipped it with your rubber wrists from the within the stumps, finding the cow corner fence. Not many would have split deep mid-wicket and long-on because it's hard to time that ball so well with such a shot

Mishra to Kohli, out Caught by Pant!! Now then, now then. Is this a bit of a turning point? Look at the turn for Mishra. Pitched just outside off stump and spun big, sucked Kohli into the drive and he went for a big drive targetting cover. He couldn't counter for the spin and got an edge, Pant somehow managed to cling on. Kohli walks without waiting for the umpire. He's done his part, but he's livid with himself because he normally loves finishing games when set. Kohli c Pant b Mishra 70(40) [4s-7 6s-3]

Junior Dala to Mandeep, SIX, how easy was that? Mandeep has been in good touch, getting starts this season. This was a short delivery down the leg-side, Mandeep easily pulls it over long leg as he got inside the line

Boult to Mandeep, out Bowled!! Oopsy! Why would you swipe across the line from a good length on this pitch. Made it look as if it stayed low. The scrambled seam delivery and the ball ignited the stumps after beating the ugly swipe from the batsman. Dan Vettori gestures to someone to go out now from the dugout. Okay, it's Sarfaraz! Mandeep b Boult 13(14) [6s-1]

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, lovely lofted drive and this should lift Sarfaraz Khan's confidence. Straightaway looks to the heavens after connecting well. Full ball outside off stump, Sarfaraz hits this over cover

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, oh superbly guided away past point and he thanks the heavens again. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Sarfaraz uses the pace on the ball and beats third man

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! You got to be kidding me. Take a bow Shreyas Iyer. He's placed a man very straight behind the keeper and this ball goes to him. For a moment it looked a brilliant, cheeky scoop shot from Sarfaraz Khan to this low full around off stump, until the little fella - Prithvi Shaw - sneaked across to his right into the frame. He almost made a mess of it, juggled and took it on the second attempt. Don't be harsh on Sarfaraz Khan people, he actually played a good shot, but fell in the trap set by Iyer. Sarfaraz Khan c Prithvi Shaw b Harshal Patel 11(8) [4s-2]

Boult to de Villiers, SIX, Boult has actually bowled a full toss way outside off stump, but that big back and across movement of de Villiers helps him easily time this kind of sweep shot over backward square leg. He's just awesome to watch

Boult to de Villiers, SIX, fitting finish from AB de Villiers. RCB are still alive and DD have officially been knocked out. Slower delivery outside off stump, AB waits for the ball and lifts this over long-off
Lamichhane to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, goes straight. From the back of the hand goes Lamichhane, flighting it full and Patel is quickly down slamming it down, with all the anger

Lamichhane to Parthiv Patel, out Lbw!! There comes Nepal on a scoreboard -- you've officially been inducted. Sandeep after being smacked down gets it quicker, fuller, on middle. Parthiv done in for the length, it's just not there to be sweeping, but he tries, misses, and finds himself struck plumb. A rewind of his fall in Pune. Doesn't even bother considering a review, walks, quickly. Parthiv Patel lbw b Lamichhane 6(8) [4s-1]
Junior Dala to Kohli, FOUR, that one sighter is enough. Premeditates another back of a length, gets his front leg out and delightfully crunches it, flat-batted through mid-wicket
Junior Dala to Kohli, SIX, wo-aw. Picks up the length, with that jabby whip of his. And swishes it to split mid-on's left. It's a return show
Junior Dala to Kohli, FOUR, keeps bettering them. Dala keeps it full, Kohli isn't complaining, leans out, and inside-outs it over extra cover

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, his famed cut. Those four dots were always leading into this, doesn't try and go too hard, waits for the room dished out outside off get big and bisects mid-off and extra cover

Harshal Patel to Kohli, FOUR, you mind-reader Kohli. Knows he's going to get it full, so moves away, gives room and with a measure of mid-off in the circle, goes inside-out in his lofted drive over. So very easy

Boult to Kohli, SIX, stands, plants his leg out and holds his position to punch it through the line. High, mighty, and Kotla's switched sides .. RCB, RCB. And you thought the earlier one was the shot of the night. Poor you
Boult to de Villiers, FOUR, nothing half-tracker, AB's quick to pounce. And he does with a swipe, mowing it into mid-wicket. On, on
Lamichhane to Kohli, FOUR, no it gets better. Some width in the float up, Kohli crouches, with his rubber wrists, whisking it through extra cover
Mishra to Kohli, 1 run, flat and short enough for Kohli to go back and tuck into the on-side towards long-on

Mishra to de Villiers, SIX, okay, you have to learn! Got away with one previous ball bowling full, this time the line is outside off and allows de Villiers to swing his arms. Easily lofted over long-off and AB is pretty good with his timing, isn't he?

Junior Dala to Kohli, FOUR, tickled and fifty for captain Kohli. Immediately raises the bat to the dug-out and the crowd. Looks determined as always. Really terrible short of length delivery down the leg-side, just helped on its way with fine leg inside the ring

Mishra to de Villiers, SIX, that's the bowler getting greedy with the turn on offer and offering a freebie. Way too full, the length is still acceptable, but the line is way outside off stump, got to be closer to the sticks. AB just waited for it and smashed that lofted drive over extra-cover

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, Sandeep offers width and Watson doesn't let it go scot-free. Flails his hands and creams it with super timing past a diving Manish Pandey at cover-point. First boundary of the innings
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, SIX, Bhuvneshwar goes short and Watson dispatches it over long-on. Went back and flat-batted it disdainfully. The key was - he picked the length early

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, just bowled a slower ball, tries to repeat, but this is well outside off stump and the batsman read this from the hand. No third man, so Watson camps back and cuts past backward point. A 31-ball fifty for Watto, another very handy innings at the top

S Kaul to Rayudu, SIX, gee there's a lot of audaciousness with the way he bats. He knows Kaul way too well. Two short balls first up in the over, but expects Kaul to try another one, the bowler dished out exactly what the batsman wanted and that back and across movement from Rayudu makes a strong statement that he is bossing the show, out comes the pull shot and clears deep mid-wicket. Brilliant fifty

S Kaul to Rayudu, FOUR, wow! Just wow! The yorker goes as a juicy full ball and Rayudu thrashes the drive wide of extra-cover. Interesting to see Kaul try three bouncers and then only try the yorker. What's the thought process there?

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, SIX, has he sliced this? Yes he has, but that bat in his hands is very good and it takes the ball all the way. The leggie outside off stump, Rayudu gets down on one knee and goes hard at it, looked like it was going to long-off for a moment, but this isn't Uppal. The boundaries are smaller

Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, SIX, this is precisely why SRH need Rayudu ASAP! Just look at him run down at SRH's key bowler. Got beaten previous ball, but no respect whatsoever and he forces Bhuvi to shorten the length, with it swings across the line with a pull and powers it over the mid-wicket boundary. He's just toying with them

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, FOUR, the runs are leaking. Short of a length on the leg stump, poor line with not much of protection behind square on the on-side, Watson pulls and sends it to the long leg boundary

Shakib to Rayudu, SIX, oh my god! This guy is playing some outrageous shots. Flighted delivery from Shakib, Rayudu steps out, gets closer to the pitch of the ball and slogs it hard over deep mid-wicket

Shakib to Rayudu, out Watson Run Out!! Shane Watson was moving slowly as he went for that run, wonder if he was carrying a niggle there. Rayudu pushed this flatter delivery towards extra-cover and set off, Watson was slow to take off, captain Kane threw it to the keeper, who did the rest. Finally a breakthrough for SRH, but Watson has done his job. Watson run out (Williamson/Goswami) 57(35) [4s-5 6s-3]

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, out Caught by Williamson!! Now then, is there a change in the tale? SRH are masters at staging comebacks from nowhere. Don't write them off yet. Short of a length delivery it was from Sandeep Sharma, Raina wanted to play across the line, but he ended up slicing it towards mid-off, hit high on the bat, Kane ran to his left from extra-cover and put in the dive to complete the catch. Raina c Williamson b Sandeep Sharma 2(3)

Shakib to Dhoni, 1 run, I can't believe my eyes. Manish Pandey has dropped a sitter by his standards. It's MS Dhoni too! Pandey is one of SRH's finest fielders. Flighted delivery on the stumps, Dhoni steps out and mistimes the loft, hit flat to long-on, Pandey was close to the rope, took it too casually and it popped out
Shakib to Rayudu, SIX, he's back to taking the aggressive route again. Advances, takes it on the full and muscles it over the man at long-off
Shakib to Rayudu, FOUR, use of the feet again, Rayudu is just rubbing it into Shakib, who has had a catch being put down. Goes straight down the ground and over the umpire's head. Into the 90s now
S Kaul to Dhoni, SIX, he got away with a couple of full tosses earlier in the over, but Dhoni has had enough. Absolutely tonks it flat over the square leg boundary. Just 8 needed now.
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, FOUR, oh he's hit this for four. CSK need 3 more to win and Rayudu needs one for a hundred. Length delivery down the leg-side, Dhoni swings it away behind square on the on-side

Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, 1 run, that's it! Maiden IPL hundred. The crowd roars. What a knock from Ambati Rayudu. He takes the helmet off, raises the bat and enjoys the moment with a big smile. He has been exceptional this season. The teams applauds and Dhoni congratulates him too. Short of a length delivery on the leg stump, Rayudu moves across and works it towards square leg
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, Sandeep's slower ball goes awry. It was the knuckle ball and Watson spotted it early. Squated low and helped it over short fine leg. Clears the rope for a maximum

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, 'don't bowl short to me' - Watson's body language suggested as Sandeep overbakes and goes short. Watson stays in his crease, allows for the ball to come and pulls it with brute force over mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, SIX, Rayudu gets into the act. Reaches out for a fuller length delivery outside off and effortlessly lifts it over extra cover

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, Rayudu brings out the sweep. Safe bet against the spin. Went low, rolled his wrists and placed it in the gap in front of square on the leg-side. Hooda from the deep ran across and dived near the ropes, but in vain
Shakib to Watson, FOUR, begins with a tripe on leg-stump. Watson accepts it with glee and glances it off his pads, beats short fine leg and races away to the fence
Shakib to Rayudu, FOUR, 50-up for CSK with this boundary. Rayudu takes on Shakib, uses his feet and reaches the pitch. Lets his bottom hand do the talking. Lofting him over Shakib's head

S Kaul to Rayudu, FOUR, short, no real purpose and Rayudu pulls it away to the mid-wicket boundary. Didn't time it alright, but placed it in the gap. The ball hurried onto him a bit and that foiled his timing

S Kaul to Rayudu, SIX, in the air and clears Hales at long-on. He seemed to have misjudged it there, runs forward and later realises that the ball is sailing over his head. Short again, Rayudu stayed back and smacked it flat and hard - enough wood to take it all the way

S Kaul to Rayudu, FOUR, magnificent. No half-measures whatsoever. Saw a pitched up delivery outside off, props forward and presents a straight bat to drill it past mid-off. Third boundary of the over so far
Shakib to Watson, FOUR, splits the gap perfectly. Shakib goes short once again, Watson stays low and pulls it through mid-wicket. Beats long-on and deep mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, half-tracker and punished. Rayudu camped back, twirls his wrists and hammers it to the cow corner fence. Shikhar had no chance cutting that off

SN Thakur to Dhawan, FOUR, a french cut to get his first boundary. On a good length around off, shaping into the batsman. Dhawan tries to fend it late and ends up getting an inside edge. Past the leg stump and all the way to the fence she goes, in a jiffy.

Jadeja to Dhawan, FOUR, that was four the moment it was hit. A good length delivery around off, Dhawan is quick to camp back and punch it away. Beats the fielder at extra cover and the man at sweeper cover too
Jadeja to Dhawan, 1 run, another 50-run stand up between these two. This was a short delivery and Dhawan pulled it down to long-on
Jadeja to Dhawan, SIX, only a hit away from his fifty now. This was a full delivery outside off and Dhawan smoked it over long-on for half a dozen. Great shot by the southpaw

Watson to Williamson, FOUR, the boundaries have started to flow. A good length delivery outside off, Williamson moves away and carves it over point. No chance for the fielder at third man to cut this down
Watson to Williamson, SIX, impressive! How well was this timed! Length ball on middle and leg, Williamson pulls it over square leg for a well timed six. Came right from the meat of his willow
Jadeja to Dhawan, SIX, what a shot to reach his fifty! Shortish delivery around off, Dhawan doesn't miss out on the opportunity and swings it over mid-wicket. Flat and over the ropes, she goes!

Harbhajan to Williamson, SIX, if Dhawan from other end is changing gears, Williamson decides to up the ante as well. Skips out, Harbhajan gives more flight. KW isn't to the pitch, but still goes through by getting his weight forward. Sends it soaring over long-off. All the way!
Harbhajan to Dhawan, SIX, bread and butter for Dhawan. It looked as though he was waiting for it. Harbhajan drops a rank long hop, Dhawan sits back and smokes it over cow corner. Into the crowd

Willey to Williamson, FOUR, 100-run stand comes up between the duo. Cross-seamer from Willey, but it's too full outside off. Can't bowl there with mid-off in the circle. Williamson leans forward and drills it over the fielder's head beautifully

Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, swings south does Dhawan. But the ball goes in the direction of north. He won't mind though as long as boundaries are coming. Shortish outside off, Dhawan goes hard and gets a thickish outside edge that flies away to the third man fence

Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, stand and dismiss stuff from Dhawan. Just admires the shot, knew the moment he connected it was a boundary. Willey serves it full, in the slot and Dhawan blasts it with ease to the long-off fence. The fielder was squarer and had no chance
Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, FOUR, Bravo is welcomed to the crease with a boundary. Feeds it full, overpitches it a tad and Williamson makes him pay by cracking it through extra cover

Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, 1 run, and that's fifty for SRH's skipper Williamson. His 10th IPL fifty. Continuing from where he left off from the last game. Eases a single to long-off and reaches the milestone, raises his bat to soak in the applause from the dug-out

Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, FOUR, expertly done. Uses his quick-silver hands to direct this wide yorker into the third man fence. Gets his bat down in time and threaded the gap between short third man and backward point with perfection

Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, out Caught by Harbhajan!! The breakthrough has been achieved. End of the 123-run stand between Dhawan and Williamson. Bravo, the man, with the much-needed wicket for CSK. Change of pace deceives Dhawan, who was into his cheeky lap way too early. Had to generate some power to get it over short fine leg, couldn't and ended up hitting it straight to Harbhajan, who pouches it at the edge of the ring. Dhawan c Harbhajan b Dwayne Bravo 79(49) [4s-10 6s-3]

SN Thakur to Williamson, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Woah. Screamer from DJ Bravo. This wicket purely belongs to him. Two wickets in two balls for CSK and they are fighting back here. Both set-batsmen back in the hut. Thakur went wider of off, Williamson sliced it airly, there was a fielder at deep point. Bravo had to run across to his left, does so and brilliantly gobbles it up. He's a mighty fine fielder, breaks into a jig as well. Williamson c Dwayne Bravo b SN Thakur 51(39) [4s-5 6s-2]
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, mid-off in the circle and Hooda goes over his head. Scrambled seam lengh delivery around off, Hooda backs away and gives charge to lift it over mid-off

Dwayne Bravo to Deepak Hooda, no run, Hooda has been given out LBW, he has a word with his partner and decides to review. Bravo's foot is way behind the line, so no problems with the no-ball. Moving on, looks like no bat as well. Ultra-Edge confirms it. HawkEye in - Pitching - In-line. Impact - In-line. Wickets - missing. Superb review from Hooda. It was full and spearing in, Hooda was shuffling across and misses the clip. Is thudded low on the pad, the on-field call was OUT and Hooda challenged it. Gets the decision in his favour in the end with the ball missing the leg-stump

SN Thakur to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Willey!! Pandey perishes. SRH lose their fourth wicket. Cross-seam full ball from Thakur, Pandey went hard at it and the bat turned on impact in his hands. Hence, skies it towards long-off. Willey steps forward and grabs it with ease. The visitors are losing steam here. Manish Pandey c Willey b SN Thakur 5(6)
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, SIX, in the slot and out of the park. Thakur gets his line closer to off, Hooda stays still and biffs it powerfully over long-off

Dwayne Bravo to Shakib, FOUR, just eludes Rayudu's outstretched right hand. Bravo lands the slower ball on the middle stump, Shakib gets low and slogs it across the line. Rayudu tried his best at square leg, but it evaded him
Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, that'll give him some confidence. Length delivery on middle, Dhawan stands tall and pummels this one over mid-wicket, that's a fine shot by the southpaw

Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, this one is even better. Full length ball outside off, Dhawan reaches for it and slaps it through the gap at extra-cover. The fielders on the off side had hardly any time to react

Chahar to Hales, out Caught by Raina!! First blow of the match for Sunrisers. His struggle finally comes to an end. Never looked comfortable at the crease. Throws his hands at an away swinging length ball and ends up chipping it straight to Raina at cover-point. He wont miss those and reverse cups it in that region. Another fine start for the pacer. How often have we seen him doing this? Hales c Raina b Chahar 2(9)

SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, that's the form he is in. Picks the length early on the shortish delivery. He's quick to transfer his weight on to the back foot and pull it to perfection through mid-wicket. Made sweet sound of the willow as the ball met it

Harbhajan to Dhawan, FOUR, well played! This was a tossed up delivery, Dhawan comes down the wicket and smokes it right over the bowler's head. Straight as an arrow, on a bounce and over the fence. Hit the cushions in fact

Chahar to Dhawan, FOUR, here it is! Finally a boundary against Chahar. This was a half-volley outside off, Dhawan is quick to lean ahead and cream his drive through cover. Beats the two fielders chasing to stop this from reaching the fence
Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, FOUR, finally a boundary of Williamson! That'll give him some relief. This was short one on leg, Williamson does well to drag it down to the fine leg fence

Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, FOUR, poor effort by Bhajji near short fine leg. Perhaps he slipped there, hence couldn't stop the ball. This was a short one down the leg-side and Dhawan pulled it away, beating Harbhajan at short fine
Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, now the homeboy roar. On the dance, in the slot and tonking it straight down. Oh the bat flow
Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, defensively wide. Suryakumar smart enough, stays back, stretches and carves it away through extra cover
Gowtham to Lewis, FOUR, oh boy. If 0.3 was timing, this is its square. Pitched up, Lewis strides, flows through with a defensive push. Yeah, that's all. And screeching past mid-off. Wow, Wankhede ..

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, chipped up. And just short of a diving mid-on. Suryakumar's early into his flick, miscues, balloons, but Gowtham just can't dive down in time. Blame his frame. Oh no wait, these dastradly slomos tell us it's into his fingers first before it pops out
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, width. A helpful dragged back length too and he stays back, opens his bat face and whacks, hard, square

Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Unadkat!! All it required was for Archer to come back. Bends his back, digs it into the surface, climbing into Yadav, who given the pace is predictably late into his pull. Off the splice and Unadkat at fine leg almost makes a mess -- loses it in the light, spots it very late and plucks it right off the grass. Suryakumar Yadav c Unadkat b Jofra Archer 38(31) [4s-7]

Jofra Archer to Rohit, out Caught by Unadkat!! And another. Oh Rohit can't score against the Royals .. it's certified. A golden duck in Jaipur. A golden one now. Archer's bouncer ploy consumes him, with Rohit being the compulsive puller going through with the swivelling flat-bat, timing it rather well in fact, but just not right when fine leg is that square. Another wobble, carrying on from the SMS? Rohit c Unadkat b Jofra Archer 0(1)
Gowtham to Lewis, SIX, full toss. Talk about ruining a quiet over under the radar. Lewis has his muscles blowing them out of here. 88 meters into the stands behind the sightscreen. And it's a fifty

D Kulkarni to Lewis, SIX, welcome back Kulkarni! Off-speed delivery and Lewis picked the bones out of that, spotted it early and powered straight back over the bowler. He then stood and admired that shot

D Kulkarni to Lewis, out Caught by Samson!! Big wicket for Rajasthan. A well-set Lewis throws it away. Kulkarni is delighted and his hands arm up. He had a chat with Unadkat before this delivery and whatever it was, it has worked. Nothing but an away angler outside off, Lewis throws his hands at that and slices it towards sweeper cover, Samson covers ground to his right and clings on to a good catch. Royals fighting back after that opening partnership. Lewis c Samson b D Kulkarni 60(42) [4s-4 6s-4]

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, not timed, but Kishan will collect the boundary. Rushed him with a short delivery and Kishan took it on, pulls off the splice and once it clears the fielder at mid-wicket, the lightning fast outfield does the rest

D Kulkarni to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, cheeky! He plays this shot quite a lot, does Pandya. Banged in and the line being outside off allowed Pandya to periscope the ramp to the third man fence. Got it fine enough to beat the fielder

Stokes to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Samson!! Another one down. What are you doing Mumbai? From 86/0 they have slipped to 119/4. Slower short of length delivery and Kishan didn't have the required room to free his arms on the pull shot, miscues it towards deep mid-wicket. Samson almost overran it, but then leaped back and took it reverse cup. Ishan Kishan c Samson b Stokes 12(11) [4s-1]

Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Gowtham!! Gowtham juggles but manages to hang on. Krunal never looked in. Yes, seven deliveries is enough to judge that. The off-cutter from Unadkat, Pandya had to for the heave and all he could do was sky it up towards long-on. Gowtham settled under it and almost made a mess. Luckily for him it didn't go far from his body and he took it on the second attempt. Krunal Pandya c Gowtham b Unadkat 3(7)

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, SIX, into the second tier. Unadkat is predictable with his change of pace and Pandya was waiting for it, cleared his front leg and smashed it straight back over the sightscreen. Mumbai need plenty more of this

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, now the attempted wide yorker goes wrong, full toss outside off, Pandya crouches a bit and slices it deliberately over backward point, one bounce and over the fence. Wankhede finds its voice again..

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Unadkat is dishing out freebies. Another nice juicy full toss outside off, just the right amount of width for Pandya to tonk the loft over extra cover. He didn't overhit; just a lift and off she went into the crowd. 17 already off the over

Unadkat to Cutting, 1 run, dropped! Archer puts down a sitter. Warne is livid in the dugout but he isn't showing any emotions. Cutting was deceived completely by the slower delivery and miscues the big hit towards point, Archer was a bit too casual with his approach and hence spills it
Stokes to Cutting, SIX, Cutting making RR pay for the drop catch. Stokes is slower ball is right in the slot, Cutting delayed his shot for a second and hammered it with a clean swing over long-on

Stokes to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, premeditated. Pandya shuffled across early and Stokes smartly dragged his length back, Pandya still went through with his paddle and got the faintest of connection to beat Buttler to his left

Stokes to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Samson!! Stunner from Samson. Wow! The replays show it to be even better. Should be in the top five list. Full and angled in, Pandya whips it with plenty of bottom hand towards deep mid-wicket, Samson runs across to his right, but the ball seemed to be out his reach, that is when he decides to put in the full length dive and the ball sticks in his right hand when he is parallel to the ground. Simply superb! Hardik Pandya c Samson b Stokes 36(21) [4s-3 6s-2]

Jofra Archer to Lewis, 3 runs, slogged high. Woah, it's checking the stratosphere. A cool ten seconds for it to come down, where Binny's done all the hard work of running back from mid-on .. to misjudge. Goes reverse cupped. There's never a good time to wait for anything, certainly not these swirlers

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, connects. Kulkarni gets a touch too straight in trying to cut off the off-side play, but Yadav's quick to get one-legged, lifting a glance of sorts over mid-wicket

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he's expensive. Can't expect to pitch it up to Suryakumar and not pay the price .. it's the delightful price of watching it being driven straight back. Thank god for Lewis' duck, it's saved a head

Stokes to Lewis, FOUR, short, nothing in terms of pace, everything in terms of width. And Lewis makes it worse with him backing away, throws his hands out, gets a fat edge. And a vacant cordon is enough

D Kulkarni to Lewis, FOUR, 118.3kph. Those hands, those adjusting hands. It holds up for much longer, Lewis almost commits into his slap early, but all of sudden can hold it, let the ball get close and guide it to point's left. Now ..
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, digs out a drive, almost drilling it past mid-off. Almost. Because Stokes is swooping down, releasing before he collects. A direct hit and Yadav was going back

D Kulkarni to Lewis, FOUR, full toss number five. And for a change Lewis can put it away. Swings a little too hard, mistimes his swinging slap, but the powerplay is enough to find him the gaps at sweeper
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, nothing two-paced when you grant out a friendly overpitch. Lovely bat swing, opening up the gap over mid-off and timing the pants off it .. inside-out slap
Shreyas Gopal to Lewis, SIX, the launch. Can't bowl down leg, not a googly either. Knee, slog, sweep, backward square leg. It's flatly powerful enough to damage a billboard
Shreyas Gopal to Lewis, SIX, on the move, Gopal corrects on middle, but Lewis' gone over extra cover. Throws every cell in his body into this hoick
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that backlift. And then that drive on the up. So damn predictable. With mid-off in the circle, these are serious runs being leaked

Bumrah to D Arcy Short, FOUR, streaky! Bumrah thought he had his man, so did Rohit. An curling low full toss right at the stumps, Short does extremely well to bring his bat down and squirt it off the inside edge to the fine leg fence. He was a goner had he missed

Bumrah to D Arcy Short, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Short is gone. He's had a forgettable IPL season. Could not play spin and now has succumbed to pace as well. Back of a length and seaming away around off, Short goes feeling for the ball and the outside edge is found, it was carrying to first slip, but Kishan decides to dive across and glove it. The much needed early breakthrough for Mumbai. D Arcy Short c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 4(5) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Rahane, FOUR, cracking shot! Losing Short might not be the worst thing happening for Rajasthan. Brings Rahane in early and he likes the new ball coming on. Pitched up outside off, Rahane leans forward and creams the drive through the packed off-side field. Off the mark in style
Markande to Buttler, SIX, that ones with the crowd now. Big hit over long-on there. Markande bowls it a touch slow, and Buttler makes that last-minute room to chidingly loft it away

Krunal Pandya to Rahane, no run, Krunal has won here. Not with a wicket yet, but with a review. Implored Rohit, convinced him, and the captain yielded. On first sighting, that's going down leg. Arm-ball that Rahane's trying to sweep. Misses and is hit on the front pad. Ball-tracking suggests that the impact is on leg-stump, so with the left-armer's angle from round the wicket, that must be going down. Is actually. Not out. Review wasted.

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, a helluva lot happened off this one ball. Now Rahane was shaping to scoop, and Hardik Pandya nicely bowls the cutter wider of off-stump. Rahane adjusts though. Slices it, making the most of the room he had, but wasn't in control. Just cleared short third man's right-handed leap

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, five fifties in a row for Buttler in IPL 2018. He's equaled the record of Sehwag, who was harvesting runs for a living back in 2012. And what a way to get there. Backs away, exposes the stumps and slaps the ball from in front of them audaciously. Connects. Anyone who's near as good as Sehwag -- statiscally! -- will connect

McClenaghan to Buttler, FOUR, some width on the cutter, and that cut shot creams past Lewis's dive at deep cover. Just slid through the ball there, cutting the trajectory at 90 degrees. Must be a good outfield

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! That's a crucial wicket. Rahane's found long-off, where SKY takes the catch and has a pratfall. Just lost his balance a bit and slipped backwards. Was a front footed power-punch but there's not enough wattage in the shot. So much for being a touch player. And here's Pandya picking a wicket just when you least expect him to. Rahane c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 37(36) [4s-4]

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, SIX, not quite as pretty as those Dhoni's bottom-handed whips over long-on but this is good enough. Carries all the way. Takes on the seam-up length ball and muscles it across the line

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, front leg is already out of the way, and this fuller delivery goes for a four. Just moved a little to the off-stump and opened his torso side-on, and goes through with the flat mow through long-on

Bumrah to Buttler, FOUR, he's making a living out of his hands. Nicely keeps his weight distributed between front and back, so he can go either way. Opens the stance and swats this back of a length delivery over mid-wicket
Bumrah to Buttler, SIX, and now one better. Swivels this time, and deposits the short ball over long leg this time. Game slipping, or has it already?
Markande to Samson, FOUR, drifting on leg-stump and it's been cutely paddled away. Runs very fine, through keeper's left and runs for a boundary. Not a great start that by Markande

Markande to Samson, FOUR, he's joining the party. Very slow from Markande, trying to get Samson to miscue one, but doesn't on this occasion. Makes room, waits for the dip and lofts it over straight mid-on
McClenaghan to Buttler, FOUR, that's been muscled through long-on. Going against McClenaghan's angle from over the wicket and going through the line. One bounce and into the ropes. Just the 16 needed

Hardik Pandya to Samson, SIX, that's flown off Samson's bat. He walks stone-faced to the middle of the pitch and punches gloves with Buttler. Slow ball sitting up and Samson mowing it over cow corner has to be a sight to behold

Hardik Pandya to Samson, SIX, this is a glorious glorious pull. Pandya just stares and walks back to the top of his mark. You do that when you've been pulled off the front foot, and the ball flies over deep mid-wicket

Hardik Pandya to Samson, out Caught by (sub)Rahul Chahar!! With 4 needed, he goes for the glory hit and falls. Slow cutter, Samson went for the all-hands loft over cover and found Chahar in the deep. Samson c (sub)Rahul Chahar b Hardik Pandya 26(14) [4s-2 6s-2]
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, SIX, Mumbai Buttler'ed at home. Slow ball sitting up and martyed over cow corner
McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, wrong lines. Off-cutter down leg, Rahane tickles it fine past short fine leg. The fast outfield does the rest

McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, second boundary and it is to the same area. This was not on leg-stump, but straight enough for Rahane to glance it wristily past short fine leg, just used the pace on the ball

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, wow! That is a fine shot. Moved away to leg and even a dragged back length didn't deter him, went up and over the infield off the back foot. A very difficult shot to play but Buttler made it look easy

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, SIX, just over Hardik. The slog sweep and Buttler almost found the only man in the deep on the leg-side, shuffled across and mistimed the sweep towards deep mid-wicket. Hardik jumped but the ball was well over him

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, that's more like it. Stand and deliver. Gets a length ball in his arc and he gives it his all. In fact it was the knuckle ball and Buttler dispatched it straight back over Hardik

Bumrah to Buttler, FOUR, that was an attempted slower delivery but it turned out to be a full toss. Manjrekar on air said how he's never seen Bumrah bowl "such a slower ball." Anyway, Buttler makes a bit of room and thumps that to the fence through long-off
Markande to Rahane, 1 run, a low full toss in trying to bowl flat from over the wicket, Rahane pats it to long-on to bring the 50-run stand up
Markande to Buttler, FOUR, a bit of flight and Buttler goes through the line. Weight on front foot and boom, it's flying over straightitsh long-on already

U Yadav to Gayle, no run, dropped!! Parthiv dives to his left and the ball pops out of his left mitt. That angled away late and the batsman poking at it, got a thick edge. The keeper went for it one-handed only to drop it. His left hand was lower than the actual trajectory of the ball and that meant he was hit higher on the palm, forcing the spill

Moeen Ali to Finch, SIX, welcome to the attack Moeen Ali! Dragged back length and Finch makes room to thump the pull over deep mid-wicket. That is a monster hit from the Aussie and he remains the key for KXIP

Moeen Ali to Finch, out Caught by Kohli!! Moeen Ali strikes. Each of Kohli's moves have paid off today. Brought in Siraj got a wicket, de Grandhomme did the same and Moeen Ali follows. Bit of air on this one and Finch is down on one knee to play the slog sweep, does not get the required elevation to clear deep mid-wicket and finds Kohli to perfection. The skipper had moved himself there after the third ball. KXIP slip further and their chances of getting a good total are gone with Finch. Finch c Kohli b Moeen Ali 26(23) [4s-1 6s-2]

Moeen Ali to Ashwin, out Ashwin Run Out!! That's what wickets and pressure do. There was never a single in it and Ashwin wanted the run, Axar was tad late in sending him back and the skipper's dive was in vain. Nothing but a tossed up delivery which Ashwin taps to the left of cover, Axar took a step out before aborting from the run. And with Ashwin not being the swiftest he was always in trouble. Put in a desperate dive but was still short by some distance. Ashwin run out (Negi/Parthiv Patel) 0(1)

U Yadav to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! What happened there? Looks like Tye wanted to review. But he's walking back. Not sure what happened. Banged in and with Umesh's pace the ball climbs up awkwardly, Tye goes for the pull and a faint top-edge settles into Parthiv's mitts. Did he run out of time to review? That might be the only reason. Nonetheless, there was a sound as the ball passed the bat. Andrew Tye c Parthiv Patel b U Yadav 0(3)

Moeen Ali to Mohit Sharma, out Mohit Sharma Run Out!! A typical number 10 run-out. Mohit works the off-break past mid-wicket, but was not sure whether to go for the run or not, he decides late and AB from mid-wicket runs back, slides and fires a throw to Mo, who deflects the ball onto the stumps. Brilliant bit of work from AB and Mo. Mohit Sharma run out (de Villiers/Moeen Ali) 3(5)

Moeen Ali to Axar, out Rajpoot Run Out!! 1 run completed. KXIP have been bowled out for 88. Axar wanted to keep the strike and pushed Rajpoot for a non-existent second. In fact, it was Rajpoot who wanted the second. Axar worked the flatter delivery towards wide long-on, he was content with the single but upon seeing Rajpoot charge across, he relcutantly went for it, nice flat throw right next to the stumps from Southee and Mo did the rest. Rajpoot run out (Southee/Moeen Ali) 1(5)

Southee to Rahul, SIX, hello says the batsman as he was greeted with a short ball. The batsman did not waste time to transfer his weight on the back foot and hammers it over deep backward square leg off the front foot. Terrific hit
U Yadav to Rahul, SIX, short ball, journey ball and goes the distance. The batsman this time stayed firm on the back foot and hammered the pull over deep fine leg for a sixer. Into the second tier
Southee to Gayle, FOUR, powers the ball away! That is a four. Little backing away movement and the batsman gatecrashes that one past cover for a four. The lack of pace did not help

Southee to Gayle, FOUR, that is typical Gayle! Clears his front leg, moves to the leg-side and then the long tentacles get into the act. Fetches the short of length delivery and clubs the pull away towards the deep mid area for a four
Southee to Gayle, FOUR, absolute gift! Full toss, little dip on it but the batsman lifts the ball away easily over mid-off's head for a four. This will break the shackles

U Yadav to Rahul, SIX, picks the slower short ball like dead meat and picks the bones out of it by smacking it over deep mid-wicket. He waited on it and then smashed it out of his sight. Third six of the evening for Rahul

U Yadav to Rahul, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! The short ball does it. You live by the sword and you die by it as well. The short balls had been disappearing but not this one. This came on slightly quicker on to the batsman, skidded on and Rahul went for it by hitting it flat. The man at deep square leg raced to his right and took it really well as the momentum on the ball threatened a drop from CDG. But that is a huge wicket!! Rahul c de Grandhomme b U Yadav 21(15) [6s-3]

U Yadav to Gayle, FOUR, clears his front leg again, the typical Gayle template to get the boundaries away and is successful. The men at cover and mid-off had no chance. The length ball also helped the cause of the batsman

U Yadav to Gayle, out Caught by Siraj!! The short ball is doing the trick here. The batsman got a huge top edge and Siraj at deep square leg gobbles it up. Banged in short at a good pace and again the batsman never got a lot of distance on it. The ball went really high and the fielder did well to munch on it. KXIP have already got their back broken. And RCB are looking to inflict more wounds. Gayle c Siraj b U Yadav 18(14) [4s-4]

Siraj to Nair, out Caught by Kohli!! Catching practice! And taken to his left at slip by the skipper. That was an away going short of length delivery and the batsman just opened his bat face to run it down. Cardinal sin it was with a slip in place. RCB are all over KXIP like a rash. The battle of the reds certainly has seen the visitors having the upper hand in the powerplay period. Nair c Kohli b Siraj 1(3)
Siraj to Finch, FOUR, tries to land it on a length and is greeted with a drive on the up. Lovely timing and placement on it takes it away to the fence. Finch is away

Chahal to Stoinis, out Bowled!! The yorker from Chahal. Played it too late and did not pick the length to york himself. The ball sneaking under the bat. How on earth?! That was the googly. KXIP in deep waters now. Stoinis can't believe his luck. That was just a well flighted ball and he fails to pick it up. The LED bails sparkled red and RCB rejoiced more. Where is the fight KXIP? Stoinis b Chahal 2(3)

Siraj to Finch, SIX, this is exactly what RCB don't want. That was full and that disappeared. Booming hit over covers for a sixer. Flat and powerful. This landed in the range of the batsman and Finch drop kicked the ball away. Is there Finch magic on the cards?

de Grandhomme to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! It cannot get any worse for KXIP and Mayank Agarwal. He is having a terrible season and has only dashed the hopes of a KXIP revival in this game as well. Gentle delivery on the pads and the batsman ended up nicking it to the keeper. The keeper went up almost instantly and RCB have their man. Mayank Agarwal c Parthiv Patel b de Grandhomme 2(6)
Ashwin to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Parthiv decides to get a move on. On the shorter side from Ashwin and it's leg stumpish as well. Pulled away through the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on. Races away
Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, gift for Parthiv and he accepts it with glee. Tye strays on the pads with a half-volley, easily glanced away down to the fine leg fence

Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's a signature Parthiv Patel stroke. Not all that full but there was width and that's what the southpaw loves. Uses his quick hands to power it on the up through the gap at cover

Rajpoot to Kohli, SIX, look at the swagger on this shot! With due respect to Rajpoot, the man facing him is just too good. Full and in the slot, it's in the arc for Kohli who nonchalantly clubs this into the stands at cow corner. Cold welcome for the young man
Rajpoot to Kohli, FOUR, hammered away. Cannot bowl that length at this pace to Kohli. He'll punish you all night. Back of a length from Rajpoot and it's pulled away wide of mid-on. All too easy

Rajpoot to Kohli, FOUR, he is on the charge, is Kohli. He doesn't want to let this opportunity of a crushing win slip. Charges down the track and makes some room for this good length delivery. Slaps it away over point comfortably

Rajpoot to Kohli, 1 run, dropped! Finch the culprit at mid-off, was late to trek backward and in the end, he did get a hand on it but spilled it. Low full toss from Rajpoot that Kohli mistimed. The loft came off the toe end and eventually, he got lucky. Second life for the skipper

Andrew Tye to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, Kohli survives easily in the end. Looked closer to the naked eye but when KXIP reviewed it, Hawk Eye showed it to be missing leg stump comfortably. Fuller ball that angled into Kohli, he was on the shuffle and missed the flick. Looked really close initially, not to be

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, crunched away! Full and quite wide outside off, right up Parthiv's street and he feasts on it. Unfurls a lovely square drive through cover-point. Blazed away in a flash

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, good adjustment from Parthiv. Seemed like he was early on this slower bouncer but then decided to just control it. Got it wide of short fine leg and that was enough. Brings up the 50 as well

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, this has been pummelled away. Banged in short by Mohit and this is the normal pace delivery, sits up nicely for Parthiv who swats the pull through backward square leg. The man from deep square did try hard to get to it but was never going to reach it in time
Andrew Tye to Kohli, FOUR, deft touch from Kohli. Pacy back of a length delivery, he just waits on it and dabs it late. Only had to beat the short third man fielder and he did it with ease

Andrew Tye to Kohli, SIX, that's dumped over long-off. RCB cantering away to victory. Just a few blows away if they go at this rate. Too full from Andrew and it's criminal with mid-off up. Kohli launches it over the infield and it goes away for a flat maximum

Stoinis to Kohli, FOUR, sublime, really sublime. Oh, he is making this look like an exhibition match. Short of a length, a touch wide and he stands tall to punch it beautifully through backward point. Timed it so sweetly
Stoinis to Kohli, FOUR, fantastic placement. A trifle too short from Stoinis and Kohli clobbers the pull by standing up tall. Splits deep mid-wicket and long-on with precision

Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, back to normal pace and Tye suffers. Shortish length and Parthiv waits to ramp it just wide of Rahul. Got it very fine and third man had no chance. Just a hit away now

Rajpoot to Kohli, FOUR, RCB have demolished KXIP! Not the fairytale big hit to finish but a boundary nevertheless. Short ball and Kohli only manages a top edge on the pull. Gets it comfortably over a leaping Rahul and that's the end of that
Gowtham to Narine, SIX, how that's! Skid it into Narine, who went with it and swung it over deep mid-wicket
Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, this flies squarer but he's middled it again somewhat. Swivels a little, carting the ball round the corner
Gowtham to Narine, SIX, now puts on the wheels. Comes down the track and mauls it over long-on. Gowtham clasps his hands but that's not in appreciation, as you'd have guessed
Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, he's an antidote to everything that Gowtham can be tonight. Backs away and lofts one at the stumps, splitting the air-gap between mid-off and extra cover

Stokes to Narine, out Caught by Gowtham!! Gowtham is dramatic in his celebration. If you don't know why, scroll down and see how he was taken for runs in the last over. Takes the catch at extra cover and flings the ball at the stumps, and aggressively. A little OTT, the celebrations, but RR will take it. A short ball from Stokes does the trick. Narine is awkward as he goes back but is not really in a position to swat that across. Miscues that in the air and is caught. Narine c Gowtham b Stokes 21(7) [4s-2 6s-2]
Unadkat to Chris Lynn, FOUR, 119.3kph. And then half way down the pitch. And then down leg. Well .. well. Lynn swivels, adjusts to the lack of bounce. But pulls, very fine
Anureet Singh to Karthik, FOUR, that's the ruin. All the width put out for Karthik to get .. and he chases, carving it over extra cover
Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, FOUR, 118.9kph. And then length and width. Lynn gets forward, and rocks back in a fierce cut. Nothing a diving point can do

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, FOUR, rub in the luck too. Neat bouncer, at the nose, but Lynn's already moving away, putting everything in his hooky-swing. Gets a fat edge that proves just enough to clear the keeper
Ish Sodhi to Karthik, FOUR, gets cheeky. Picks up the floaty leggie outside off, knows there's nobody at third man. And reverses. Nailing it past slip

Stokes to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Anureet Singh!! Strokes has another. Oh where was he hiding all this while? Anyway, it takes him to dish out a short-slower sticker into the pitch. Lynn as usual can't resist, loads up with a leg-cleared-cut. But doesn't quite adjust to the time the ball takes in getting there, slices off the top-edge and deep point couldn't have been placed better. Chris Lynn c Anureet Singh b Stokes 45(42) [4s-5 6s-1]

Stokes to Karthik, leg byes, 1 run, it slams the pad. Buttler seems to be jumping up in appeal. Stokes is busy trying to clean up the possible leg bye. Oh Rajasthan have to take it up. It's all up to the angle .. how big is it getting? Okay so DK has missed the glance, he's stuck in front of middle. And yes, HawkEye shows it clipping the edge of the bail. Everyone's happy
Unadkat to A Russell, FOUR, innocuously short, dishing out full pace. Russell gets back fiercely on his back leg, swings his cut, going over point and almost into deep point .. millimeters

Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, pulls out some deft dabs from his bag of tricks. Unadkat keeps going through with full-paced seam ups .. Karthik's waiting, showing it the opened up face and dabbing it just wide of Buttler's dive
Jofra Archer to A Russell, FOUR, oh the hammer. Brute. Archer misses the yorker by an inch, Russell takes out a mile. Launching into the overcook to crunch it through the covers

Jofra Archer to Karthik, FOUR, genuine edge. Zips up off the turf to take the splice on Karthik's lost overused dab. But the pace is enough to run it into third man. Or is it? Gowtham chases, dives, but nope, can't get his hand off the ball while his leg touches the rope
Jofra Archer to Karthik, SIX, goes over. And Kolkata keep the 16-pointer dream alive. Shortened length, Karthik deposits it into long-on with an all muscle heave

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, SIX, a 145ks delivery no good for all-hands Lynn. Moves a little leg-side and scythes this short incoming delivery over backward square leg. Didn't even rock back fully. Didn't need to

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, FOUR, now over third man. Just bounces inside the ropes and hits the cushions on the half-volley. Jofra Archer bowled it short again but shifted the line to outside off, and Chris Lynn nicely ramps it away

Stokes to Uthappa, out Caught by R Tripathi!! This is not over yet, folks. Second short ball from Stokes that gets the wicket. Got a little big on Uthappa, who agreeably was pirouetting well on the back toe. Ended up top-edging it high to deep backward square, where Tripathy was waiting. Uthappa c R Tripathi b Stokes 4(6)

Stokes to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's a nice drive through covers. Chris Lynn leaning a bit into it and reminding Stokes that he wasn't the batsman who faced the short ball, so a full ball outside off isn't going to work
Jofra Archer to Nitish Rana, FOUR, past Samson's one-handed effort at backward point. An uppish cut shot that he placed just wide enough of the fielder

Ish Sodhi to Nitish Rana, FOUR, that's past backward point's dive. Got the ball to straighten on off-stump, which makes Nitish Rana's shot a good one. Didn't have much room to work, so uses his cocked wrists and thrusts the ball away
Gowtham to Nitish Rana, SIX, Gowtham's horror isn't over. Brilliant loft from Nitish Rana, stepping out and timing it over extra cover. Flew into the crowd

Ish Sodhi to Nitish Rana, out Lbw!! Loud shout for LBW. And Rajasthan go upstairs with the review. Drifted across from over the wicket and it spun into the left-hander, surprising him with the turn. Pitching just outside off-stump -- slowmo replays suggest -- and rapping the front leg near the knee-roll. Impact on middle and that's crashing into the top of leg-stump, says ball-tracking. So Nitish Rana will have to go, as RR hold on to their review. Nitish Rana lbw b Ish Sodhi 21(17) [4s-2 6s-1]
Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, that's a glorious front-foot punch through covers. Gets on his toes and on top of the bounce to pack a punch through diving cover

Shivam Mavi to R Tripathi, 1 run, dropped! Fired in on a short of length @144.8kmph, angling in towards leg, Tripathi is intimidated and tentatively defends off the back foot, gets an edge to third man for a single as Rana drops it at slip... Went flying for it two-handed but no dice
Prasidh to R Tripathi, SIX, full and not too wide, on off-stump in fact, Tripathi makes his own width by making room outside off and slices that over the sweeper cover fence for six! Massive hit!
Prasidh to R Tripathi, FOUR, short and a little wide, no power, just a dab off the back foot, placed perfectly behind backward point for four. Surgical precision...
Prasidh to R Tripathi, FOUR, a bit of swing away from a good length outside off, Tripathi tries a preempted helicopter and gets a leading edge to third man for four.
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, FOUR, perfect length, but it doesn't matter which variation it was, Samson reaches out and sweeps it hard to backward square leg for four. Incredible shot, and four...

Narine to Samson, out Lbw!! The flattish ball spun in sharply and hit the batsman high on the back leg. Looks a little high. Was there an inside edge? NO! The height is not an issue. Three Reds. RR are going down like a lead balloon. The ball skidded on and the batsman was late on the attempted swat on the on-side. This is tragedy for RR. From 59 in 4 overs to this. T20 cricket and its speed taking a toll on RR. In dire straits. Samson lbw b Narine 12(10) [4s-2]

Kuldeep Yadav to Binny, out Stumped!! The googly and RR implode further. The batsman predictably does not read it. Looks to whip a flighted ball outside off and misses it. The ball turned away past the blade and DK does the rest. He whipped the bails off in a flash. Kuldeep leaps up in his celebratory jump. The spinners are choking their opponents here. You have seen this script from KKR. Haven't you?
Binny st Karthik b Kuldeep Yadav 1(4)

Shivam Mavi to Gowtham, out Caught by Karthik!! The pace has the last laugh. Disconcerting bounce coupled with it forces an almost evasive action from Gowtham, who fails to get his gloves out of the way. The ball flicked the gloves and went up for the keeper to take it with ease. The Eden is alive and noisy. Eden has witnessed many collapses and this one is dear to KKR. Gowtham c Karthik b Shivam Mavi 3(5)

Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, out Caught&Bowled!! The last straw is gone. RR will drown it seems. Too full, flighted as well and the toe-ended push finds the bowler. The bowler stays low and pouches it. DK and team erupt. A hattrick against Aussies and now this. Kuldeep can't do anything wrong at the Eden. A 4-fer in a big game. Stokes ends a horron run in the IPL. He has been off-color throughout and it has ended like that as well. Stokes c and b Kuldeep Yadav 11(13)
Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, FOUR, just a push..may be an exagerrated punch. But that raced away across the turf past the man at cover. Whatta shot. Not a pushover for sure

Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, SIX, short ball and six! That was a splendid hit. More of a reactive shot as he looked like he was slightly late on it but that travelled the entire journey. Over the deep square region and Mavi takes some more punishment
Narine to Unadkat, FOUR, little short outside off and the batsman latches on to it. Smokes the cut past point and the ball reaches the ropes. These are useful runs on the board

Narine to Unadkat, FOUR, phew! That was close. Shortish, again slightly turning in and the cut is played off the top-half of the bat. The man at backward point leapt up but still could not even get finger-tips to it. 10 runs of the over and RR fight on thanks to this cameo from Unadkat. Narine ends a decent spell - 4-0-29-1

Prasidh to Ish Sodhi, out Caught by Karthik!! The yorkerish delivery was jammed out and it popped up. KKR think it went off the boot and into the keeper's gloves. They may be right!! It seems the batsman did jam it out off the inner half of the bat but into his boot. And then it went up for DK to take it and bring to the notice of the umpires that they should go upstairs. They did, the soft signal was not out but was not to be as the replays were conclusive enough for the third umpire to make the decision. Ish Sodhi c Karthik b Prasidh 1(6)

Prasidh to Jofra Archer, FOUR, not a bad start! Short ball at the body and pulled away into the on-side for a four. The man at fine leg had no chance. He played it slightly late but did well to get enough meat on it

A Russell to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Another one bites the dust. KKR fans find their voices again. Short ball, rising up and the batsman trying to pull it away, managed only a lot of height. The man at deep square leg came in and took it, not exactly with a lot of ease but effectively in the end. Might have lost it in the lights. Jofra Archer c Shubman Gill b A Russell 6(5) [4s-1]

Prasidh to Unadkat, out Bowled!! RR won't play out their quota of overs. That was a slower delivery and the batsman went for the slog sweep but was outdone by the lack of pace on it. The batsman knelt down, may be guessed the pace right, but could not connect at all for the LED bails to lighten up. KKR camp is chuffed. So is the crowd and the entire team. The on-field umpire did check for a no-ball but it is KKR's evening and nothing can go wrong. Unadkat b Prasidh 26(18) [4s-3 6s-1]

Prasidh to R Tripathi, FOUR, why try the helicopter when you can play these? Half-volley, on middle and leg, Tripathi gets slightly forward and push-drives it straight down the ground for four. 19 off the over.
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR, short and wide, Buttler is about half a meter outside leg reaches out Sehwagesquely to slice it towards the third man boundary for four
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, SIX, fuller length delivery just outside off, Buttler preempts the periscope and laps it over the tiny fine leg boundary for six!
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR, short and fractionally wide, Buttler has a lower and wide stance and has a solid base to execute the perfect cut shot to deep backward point for four. Unbelievable...

Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR, length ball outside off, a cardinal sin in T20, Buttler opens up his stance, clears his front leg, and carts it away cross-battedly to long-on for four. RR bowlers under fire, and Buttler's epiphany continues...
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, SIX, he moves leg, moves to the off-side again, picks up the good length ball on the stumps to ramp it over fine leg for another six. Last 9 balls: 6 fours, 3 sixes.

Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Buttler reaches out and slices that away to square third man for four, and that's the second time Mavi has conceded more than 28 in an over in this IPL. Surreal hitting...
Narine to R Tripathi, FOUR, flatter trajectory, off-break and in the slot, R Tripathi gets on his knees and mows that to wide long-on with a slog-sweep. Up comes the 50 partnership!

Narine to Buttler, FOUR, thats almost an inch-perfect yorker outside off, errs marginally, Buttler, with all his hockey experience, gets under it to bottom-hand that away to the deep extra cover fence for four

A Russell to R Tripathi, out Caught by Karthik!! Gone! A sigh of relief for the hosts! Short one angling towards the leg-side, and the side-on stance of Tripathi gives him that fraction of a second less to get into the hook. Beaten for pace, and he gets a feather of a glove on it to DK behind the stumps. Is this the breakthrough, or the rhythm-breaker that KKR needed? The crowd would certainly hope so! R Tripathi c Karthik b A Russell 27(15) [4s-4 6s-1]
Narine to Rahane, FOUR, shortish off-break, erring in line, drifting into the pads, whipped away off the back foot to the backward square leg fence for four. Threaded the needle there...

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, out Bowled!! Oh, it's ugly when a batsman with a Test hundred in almost every country tries circus tricks. Kuldeep fires in the googly on middle and leg, Rahane gets across his stumps and tries to whack it away behind point with a reverse sweep, misses it altogether and ends up making a fool of himself. The furniture is knocked over, and a the flashing red bails reflect ominous signs for RR. Rahane b Kuldeep Yadav 11(12) [4s-1]
Prasidh to Samson, FOUR, just a fraction short, a tad outside off, Samson pokes it with an angled bat away to the third man fence for four. Races away...

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, out Caught by Searles!! Massive moment! Fullish one, too full to reverse, Buttler goes for it anyway, and gets it off the top half of the bat, and lobs it to Searles at short third man. A tame end to an otherwise excellent innings, and Buttler's streak of 5 consecutive 50s comes to an end. 3 down, and Kuldeep has made an important breakthrough. Buttler c Searles b Kuldeep Yadav 39(22) [4s-5 6s-2]

McClenaghan to Rahul, SIX, long stop! Leave the bat regulations alone, they've gotta have some boundary regulations! A 64-meter six! A shortish ball on the hips, Rahul shuffles across and swat-pulls it half-heartedly, gets a top-edge over the long stop fence for six

Krunal Pandya to Finch, FOUR, that's well done. Finch walked across, expecting Krunal to keep it straight and quick. He got inside the line of the ball and then swept it powerfully past short fine leg
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, 102kph, Rahul knocks it down to long-on to bring up yet another fifty this season. What a time he's having

Bumrah to Finch, 1 run, back of a length, Finch is hopping back in the crease as he defends it to the left of short mid-wicket, so he really has to put the skates on as he bolts towards the non-striker's end. McClenaghan throws himself forward as he releases the ball in one motion along with the dive, but Finch gets there

McClenaghan to Rahul, FOUR, short fine leg is motionless as Rahul helps this pull shot past him. Poor ball really. Angled into the body from round the wicket, all Rahul has to do is to miss the lone fielder after swivelling across and that's what he does as he leaves Surya a mere statue

McClenaghan to Finch, FOUR, mid-off is up so Finch clears his front leg in order to go over the infield. It's a short of length delivery from McClenaghan, not the ideal ball to hit straight down the ground, but Finch had his mind made up. He flat-bats it hard enough, and although it came off the toe-end, it's enough to go over the fielder. Cutting gives good chase and tries hauling it back in with a slide, but his foot was in contact with the ropes

Krunal Pandya to Finch, FOUR, he's hit that with a battering ram! Makes some room, Krunal darts it into the slot for Finch who tonks the leather off it by muscling it back over the bowler's head. Krunal tried going for the catch, but by then the ball was whistling into the fence
Markande to Rahul, SIX, this is the ball he wanted. A bit of flight from Markande, Rahul gallops down to the pitch of it and lofts it cleanly over long-on

Markande to Rahul, SIX, and again. Much cleaner, much bigger. The Kings XI dugout is on its feet as Rahul finishes the over off with back-to-back sixes. Puts his dancing shoes on again and swings through the line of the delivery

Bumrah to Finch, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Outstanding pressure catch from Hardik Pandya in the deep. Finch had skied this up a mile off a top-edge, he had Evin Lewis in the corner of his eye - converging towards him, but Pandya calls for it and takes it much to the delight of the roaring fans at the Wankhede. Length ball, Finch saw the opportunity and cleared his front leg to make the most of it. But his heave came right off the toe-end. Finch c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 46(35) [4s-3 6s-1]

Bumrah to Stoinis, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Hoho, Stoinis doesn't have a clue of what's happened. He's too slow. This bumper from Bumrah hurries on from the middle of the pitch, and even as Stoinis tries sitting down to it, he leaves his gloves up there. The ball kisses them enroute to Ishan Kishan. A gamechanger this Bumrah over. Stoinis c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 1(2)
Cutting to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul gets this away! This is the man standing between MI and victory. Short of length at the body, Rahul nails the pull backward of square

Cutting to Rahul, FOUR, oh my, this is extraordinary. The expression on Rohit's face, rather the blankness of it tells the story. Wide leg-cutter from Cutting, Rahul switches his stance and reverse-scoops it over short third man

Cutting to Rahul, FOUR, he's done it again. He has done it again. Quite brilliant. Slower ball wide of off, and Rahul puts it over short third man's head. He's whisked into the 90s. Some player this lad

Bumrah to Rahul, out Caught by Cutting!! Bumrah wins the battle with Rahul. He has sent Wankhede rocking. Slower ball, it deceives Rahul as he lofts it right off the toe-end into the grateful hands of Cutting at long-off. So then, is that it for Punjab? Rahul c Cutting b Bumrah 94(60) [4s-10 6s-3]

McClenaghan to Yuvraj, out Caught by Lewis!! Full ball outside off, Yuvraj slices it straight to Lewis at sweeper cover. He was right back in the crease expecting the fuller length, and was probably aiming to go inside out over extra cover. But the bat twisted in his hands. A fist-pump from McClenaghan. Yuvraj c Lewis b McClenaghan 1(3)
McClenaghan to Axar, SIX, it's not over yet. Axar has pumped this full toss over the ropes. McClenaghan misses the blockhole, and disappears over mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Gayle, SIX, abysmal start for Hardik (sans highlights), a lousy half-tracker, Gayle just swivels into an effortless six in front of deep square leg
Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, another short one, this time across the left-hander, Gayle tries to cut it away, gets a top-edge over the fly slip and towards fine third man for four

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, edged, and gone for four! Fortuitous boundary to third man. Knuckle ball pitching on a length, seaming away, Rahul gets a controlled outside edge with soft hands and it rolls away to the third man fence
McClenaghan to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, short of length delivery at the body, swivelled away past short fine leg. But it doesn't matter. MI clinch this by three runs to stay alive in the tournament

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, yet another slower one, errs in length this time, half-cook, and Rahul transfers his bodyweight into an elegant extra cover drive for four. Balances himself and poses for the cameras after the shot. Yep, that was right out the meat!

McClenaghan to Gayle, FOUR, geee, that was hit hard. Fuller ball just outside off, Gayle clears his front leg and slugs that over mid-on to the long-on fence for four. Lands just short of the rope. Odd how the top-edge carried and this didn't :O

McClenaghan to Gayle, out Caught by Cutting!! A short one, outside off, Gayle tries to fetch it and attempts a pull, gets a top-edge. The ball crosses the stratosphere, makes a trip to heaven and lands up in the lap of Ben Cutting coming in from deep mid-wicket. Made it look rather easy. Universe Boss departs. Gayle c Cutting b McClenaghan 18(11) [4s-2 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Finch, SIX, gigantic, massive, monstrous! Length ball outside off, a huge no-no in T20, Finch gets room to swing his arms, and goes through the line, golf-swings that over wide long-on for six. Monumental hit...
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, a hint of flight, pretty good length, on off stump, Rahul gets down the wicket and lofts it nonchalantly towards long-on for four
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, slightly short, Rahul is early into it as it stuck in the pitch a little, carved to cover where Cutting makes an excellent effort but drops it!
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, fired in on the stumps again, lap-swept expertly to fine leg for four. Knew where the short fine fielder was and got it well past him
Markande to Rahul, FOUR, flat leg-break just around off-stump, Rahul crouches low and cuts that when it was inches from the stumps past backward point for four
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Rahul carves it away to deep backward point for four. A hit-me delivery and gets the treatment.
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, 2 runs, back of a length delivery around off, Rahul gets on the back foot and punches that to deep backward point for a brace. 50 partnership up!
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, edged and four, width on offer from Rajpoot and Suryakumar threw his bat at that, gets a healthy edge that flies through the vacant second slip region

Mohit Sharma to Lewis, SIX, the first six of the evening - on a good length and just outside off, Lewis got forward on the lofted drive, didn't time it all that well - ended up slicing it high and over mid-off - has enough to clear the ropes on the full

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, SIX, just over the outstreched hand of Ankit Rajpoot at long leg. Just! Krunal went for the pull, didn't get all of it, dragged it off the bottom half and it eluded the fieldsman near the boundary ropes. Rajpoot kept his head still and flung himself backwards, but it fell tantalizingly past his fingertips
Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, SIX, nothing half-hearted about this. Picked the length (short) early and deposited this over wide long-on with an air of nonchalance. Typical Krunal
Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, half-volley, keep 'em coming screams Krunal's willow. Just leans forward slightly and creams it off the middle wide of mid-off

Axar to Pollard, SIX, becoming too predictable is Axar Patel. The last four balls have been over 100ks. This one's no different either; KP did the smart thing, gave himself room outside off by jumping to the leg-side and tonked this into the cow corner stands with a mighty swing of the bat

Rajpoot to Pollard, SIX, KP is upping the ante now. A risky shot, but he generated enough power to clear the ropes. A 76-metre six. Short ball wide of KP's off-stump, he fetches from there and hacks the pull over long-on. Manoj Tiwary was interested for a bit, but that was always travelling

Rajpoot to Pollard, FOUR, sloppy work from Finch. A crisp drive to the left of mid-off, Finchy was late to react and hence the dive came in late, gets some hand on it, but ends up parrying it to the fence
Rajpoot to Pollard, FOUR, full on the pads, CYA TOMORROW! KP was quick to pounce, just needed to help the ball and he did that with some ease, past square leg with courtesy a magical wristwork

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Rajpoot!! Deceived him with the slower short ball there. It never arrived. Krunal decided to go for the pull and he fails to arrest the momentum, ends up feeding the top-edge and offers a dolly of a catch to Rajpoot at short fine. Krunal Pandya c Rajpoot b Stoinis 32(23) [4s-1 6s-2]
Stoinis to Pollard, FOUR, cross-seamer, fuller and wider of off, KP manages enough contact on the rash drive and the edge flies wide of the keeper
Stoinis to Pollard, FOUR, another wild swing and another edge. Looped up and kept third man interested for a while, Yuvi with the dive to his left, but he fails to flick the ball back into play

Stoinis to Pollard, SIX, a 22-ball fifty for KP. He pumps his fists and lets out all the excitement. It was full and right in his swinging arc, KP gets underneath that and launches it many-a-mile over long-off

Ashwin to Pollard, out Caught by Finch!! Skipper strikes! Lovely stuff from Ash, didn't get great turn on this but ensured there's no pace and made KP fetch for that by tossing it far of off-stump; KP made room and went hard with his flat-bat swing, straight into the pocket of Finchy at wide long-on. Pollard c Finch b Ashwin 50(23) [4s-5 6s-3]

Ashwin to Cutting, out Caught by Axar!! Poor shot selection from Ben Cutting. Carrom ball bowled wide of off-stump, Cutting drags the slogsweep from there and hits it straight to the man at deep mid-wicket. Axar trundles forward and gobbles it with ease. Cutting c Axar b Ashwin 4(7)

Ashwin to McClenaghan, SIX, McClenaghan's known for this; hitting biggies at will. Stoops to one knee and gives it a full monty on the slogsweep, found the middle and off she goes. Into the mid-wicket stands

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Ashwin!! Third fourth wicket haul in four games for Andrew Tye. He is increasing the gap for the leading wicket takers tally. Pitched the ball short and got it to grip off the surface, it kept decking away from Hardik's reach, he slapped hard and got a thick toe-edge to short third man. Hardik Pandya c Ashwin b Andrew Tye 9(12)
Andrew Tye to McClenaghan, FOUR, full toss wide of off-stump, McClenaghan thrashes it powerfully square on the off-side. No-one there and it's a boundary
Mohit Sharma to Markande, FOUR, seam-up short ball wide of off-stump, Markande waits and opens the bat face to ramp it over short third. Smart batting

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely shot, too short from Rajpoot, Suryakumar swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it past square leg, no one in the deep and it's a boundary - Suryakumar's second of the night
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, top-edge and six, Suryakumar was done in by the bouncer, was clearly late on the pull, gets a fat top-edge that sailed over the ropes at fine leg

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, lovely shot, back-to-back sixes for Suryakumar and he was in complete control here. This was the slower ball from Rajpoot, Suryakumar gets forward and thumps it over mid-off, went sailing over the ropes for another maximum

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cheeky and four, back of a length and just outside off, Suryakumar waits on it, lets the ball come onto him and then defltly glides it past the keeper, third man was square and has no chance, 21 from the over

Andrew Tye to Lewis, out Bowled!! Brilliant from Tye and he has his 21st wicket of IPL 2018. This is deception at its very best, the knuckle ball, pitched around off and seamed back into the left-hander, the length drew Lewis into an expansive drive, the gap between bat and pad was created, the ball snuck through and the off-stump went for a walk. Lewis b Andrew Tye 9(7) [6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, edged and four, unlucky for the bowler, on a good length and a hint of seam away from the left-hander, drew Kishan into the drive and found a thick edge, past the lone slip and races away to the fence

Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, SIX, massive, too short and the angle worked against Mohit here, Kishan swivels across, doesn't bother to keep the ball down and sends it soaring into the second tier - way over backward square leg for a maximum

Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Kishan, came charging down the track, Mohit went full and wide of off, Kishan was committed to the drive, gets it off the outside half and still has enough to sail over the ropes - at deep backward point

Andrew Tye to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Stoinis!! Kishan's streaky innings comes to an end and it's that man - Tye, who takes the wicket once again. This was another knuckle ball that angled across the left-hander, Kishan was looking to heave it over mid-wicket, doesn't cover for the angle, gets it high on the bat and spoons it over mid-on. Stoinis was the fielder there - he kept his eyes on the ball as he back tracked and completed a simple catch. Ishan Kishan c Stoinis b Andrew Tye 20(12) [4s-1 6s-2]

Andrew Tye to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Rahul!! Back to back wickets and Tye is on fire. This was short and just outside off, Suryakumar was looking to help it on its way with a flap pull, gets a big inside edge that pops up off his knee-roll. KL runs forward and completes the catch, silence at the Wankhede as Tye scalps his 23rd victim of the season, he's on a hat-trick as well. Suryakumar Yadav c Rahul b Andrew Tye 27(15) [4s-3 6s-2]

Rajpoot to Rohit, out Caught by Yuvraj!! Another low score for Rohit, he's been undone by the short ball once again. This was banged in short and just outside off, skidded through and hurried Rohit with pace, he was in a terrible position as he pulled, got a top-edge and all he managed to do was to find Yuvraj at mid-on. He accepts the chance gleefully and his reaction suggests how pumped up he's for this match. The customary check for the front-foot no-ball and Rajpoot is fine on that count. Off he goes, Rohit. Rohit c Yuvraj b Rajpoot 6(10)

Stoinis to Pollard, FOUR, beautifully played, this should give Pollard some confidence, back of a length and wide of off, Pollard stands tall andc punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover and races away to the fence

Sandeep Sharma to Parthiv Patel, no run, dropped first ball! What a beginning that would've been to the game. Straight in and straight out. Deepak Hooda at short cover who got both hands and then it went out. Was a fairly straightforward chance too. Driven in the air and Parthiv Patel gets lucky

Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, FOUR, what a shot to get off the mark. Kohli on the walk, trying to get ahead of Sandeep Sharma and prove his superiority over him. Converts a length ball into a half-volley and drives it wide of mid-off, superb shot and all along the ground, lovely way to get going and a statement made by Kohli

Sandeep Sharma to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by S Kaul!! Top edge and gone. Parthiv Patel wasn't going to die wondering. He was going to play his shots, here he pays the price, short of length on the stumps with steepling bounce, Parthiv Patel gets a fat top edge and third man takes a good catch. That was a skier and not easy under the lights. But Kaul hangs on. Sandeep Sharma strikes in the first over. Parthiv Patel c S Kaul b Sandeep Sharma 1(4)
