Shakib to de Villiers, FOUR, like Kohli de Villiers too gets off the mark with a boundary. Fraction short around off, de Villiers makes room and cuts wide of point. Expertly placed and it raced away

Shakib to de Villiers, FOUR, this is how he started against Nadeem. Went bang bang. This is a top top shot. Shakib loops it up on the stumps, de Villiers gets forward and opens his body to go inside out over extra cover. That's trademark AB

Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, SIX, Moeen Ali is dealing in sixes. Rashid Khan has a wry smile on his face. Down the track and to the pitch before lofting this clean over long-off. The fielder was just a spectator

S Kaul to de Villiers, FOUR, how good is de Villiers. Unbelievably good. Was a back of a length delivery around off, de Villiers pummelled the cut and left the sweeper with no chance. The fielder just had to cover a little distance but gave up as it rocketed to the fence

S Kaul to de Villiers, FOUR, now pulls regally and gets to fifty. Is this the knock that will win RCB the game tonight? Was a length ball on the stumps, powerfully hit wide of deep mid, again one bounce over the ropes and the fielder was left helpless

S Kaul to Moeen Ali, SIX, Moeen Ali is taking all his frustration at not being selected for the Test side against the SRH bowlers. He was a sureshot selection last year at this time, not anymore. This short ball is at Moeen Ali's chest, he plays a smashing pull high into the deep square leg stands. That was meaty

Basil Thampi to Moeen Ali, FOUR, Moeen Ali gets to his maiden fifty. Gets a hug from de Villiers. Kohli punches the air in delight. They are happy for him and rightly so. What a time to come to the party. Low full-toss, sliced in the air but in the gap as well

Basil Thampi to de Villiers, FOUR, only he can execute this shot with so much success. Sits down and moves across even before the ball has come out of the bowler's hand. It is a slower delivery on the stumps, de Villiers waits and pulls over short fine

Basil Thampi to de Villiers, SIX, that has gone out of the Chinnaswamy! And might have landed on something or someone outside the ground. What's AB's reaction - stoic! Again his trademark shot, sit down, move across, a juicy full-toss and it has been sent over the deep backward square leg roof. A souvenir for someone to take home. Chants of "AB" echo around the ground as the players wait for a fresh cherry. Meanwhile AB and Moeen Ali have some refreshments

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, he doesn't want the wide, he wants more. Sits almost as he connects, back knee on the ground, reaches out to a slower delivery outside off, carves it over backward point. That's enough. Had he left that, it was a wide

Sandeep Sharma to Moeen Ali, SIX, it has gone for six. A checked loft. Are you serious? Dhawan can only smile wryly, as it loops over his head. Sandeep Sharma deceived Moeen Ali completely, with a slower delivery outside off, Moeen Ali arrested his shot at the last moment, but it just flew and flew

Rashid Khan to de Villiers, out Caught by Dhawan!! Rashid Khan has done the double over AB this season. Got him both times. This wicket the credit has to go to Dhawan. What a catch under extreme pressure. Could mean a difference of 30 easily. de Villiers slogs and doesn't get the elevation, Dhawan at deep backward square was on the edge, but leapt at the right time, caught it and ensured that the left leg didn't trod on the cushion. He raises his finger Ricky Ponting Sydney style to say it's out. Kohli is anxious and cranes his neck out to check whether this is a legal catch. It is and de Villiers walks. Again silence at the Chinnaswamy. 150th wicket for Rashid in T20s. de Villiers c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 69(39) [4s-12 6s-1]

Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, FOUR, from round the wicket, tossed up and Moeen Ali has smote it back over Rashid Khan's head. Flat hit and bisects long-off and long-on. Super shot. He is continuing his stroke-making

Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Goswami!! Brain-melt from Moeen Ali. Nothing more than that. Suddenly he has kicked the door wide open for SRH to come back into the game. Rashid Khan's last over and with AB gone, he decides to play a cute reverse paddle, when he was hitting them so well straight down the ground. Such a low-percentage shot and one must applaud Goswami's take. On the rebound and it was a clear deflection too. Moeen Ali walked as soon as Goswami took it. That shot could potentially send RCB out of the tournament. But Moeen Ali plays that way and has got out many times previously very softly. Fantastic innings nonetheless. Moeen Ali c Goswami b Rashid Khan 65(34) [4s-2 6s-6]
Basil Thampi to de Grandhomme, FOUR, thick outside edge and four. Wide full delivery outside off, de Grandhomme's edge flies over short third
Basil Thampi to de Grandhomme, SIX, right up there and de Grandhomme has teed off. Full on the stumps, de Grandhomme lofts and clears long-off. He can time them really well too
Shakib to de Grandhomme, SIX, does loft over extra-cover really well. Bit of air outside off, de Grandhomme launches Shakib inside out and gets the maximum. Good end to the over

S Kaul to Mandeep, out Caught by Dhawan!! The slower delivery does the trick. Dhawan takes it at long-off and does his trademark thigh-slap. Would make a good South Indian hero in movies. With that move of his. Mandeep getting under that slower delivery a bit too much. Dhawan does the rest. Mandeep c Dhawan b S Kaul 4(6)

S Kaul to de Grandhomme, SIX, high high and over the backtracking Rashid at deep mid. That was a misjudgement from the Afghan. He was inside the field of play and not at the edge of the boundary. So can't track back in time and it lobs him despite getting his hands across to try and catch. One more biggie to de Grandhomme

S Kaul to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, Basil T is having a mare out there. KW - the cool cat - just rubs his beard. That's his way of showing disappointment. Cut late by Sarfaraz Khan and Basil diving to his right at short third allowed the ball to sneak under his hands. One becomes four

Basil Thampi to de Grandhomme, SIX, that is brute power from CdG. Brutal from the Zimbawean-turned-Kiwi. Waited for the slower delivery and then slapped it high and powerfully over extra-cover. Kohli smiles and claps

Basil Thampi to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, my colleague Kumar who dines and drinks on stats tells me this - Basil Thampi now has the most expensive figures this IPL. Not a proud record if you are the youngster. Good shot, full delivery on off, Sarfaraz Khan opened the bat face and that's why he could find the gap with the square-drive wide of the fielder in the deep

Basil Thampi to Sarfaraz Khan, SIX, last match they had a fielder just behind the keeper, very fine and he was caught. Not this time. Just reverse-laps a full-toss and it goes all the way. The RCB dugout love it. Sarfaraz Khan is known to be innovative and he is showing us why

S Kaul to de Grandhomme, 2 runs, that has gone into the stars and come back down, KW drops it. Gaping open mouths from the RCB fans. Who are enjoying the Schadenfreude. A slower delivery is skied miles up, miles literally, KW was setting himself at around mid-off, got both hands, out it went. Sarfaraz Khan dives and makes it back to prevent the run-out opportunity

S Kaul to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Has to go as one of the best catches in the IPL this season. On par with Boult. So similar. One-handed and behind him too. A pure reflex effort from Rashid at deep mid. Takes it and falls flat on the ground, can't believe has plucked that out of thin air. That was hit so powerfully and flat by de Grandhomme, but Rashid pulled off a blindy! de Grandhomme c Rashid Khan b S Kaul 40(17) [4s-1 6s-4]

S Kaul to Sarfaraz Khan, 2 runs, good effort by Sandeep, but he has dropped Sarfaraz Khan at long-stop! Ran in and got there, but the ball went out. A thick top edge on the pull and Sarfaraz Khan almost gets out in the same fashion for the second game running

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, one-handed back foot square drive. On a short of length outside off, de Villiers didn't intentionally pull the bottom hand off, but it raced off the middle and split cover-point and backward point. AB is in the mood tonight
Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, superb shot. The crowd go wild. So cleanly struck too. On a length and around off, lifted over extra-cover. A proper cricketing shot

S Kaul to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, Sarfaraz Khan has played his part. Whips a full-toss on the stumps wide of backward square and it raced away. Grand end to the innings and he walks back with a swagger. RCB end on 218

Shakib to de Villiers, FOUR, he is looking to play aggressively and maximise the powerplay. This is tossed up outside off, de Villiers moves across and slog-sweeps over mid-wicket, one bounce over the ropes. Lovely batting
Rashid Khan to Kohli, FOUR, short and pulled over mid-wicket. Judged the length so quickly, left deep square chasing shadows. Top shot

Rashid Khan to Kohli, out Bowled!! The RCB fans are stunned into deathly silence. Deathly. While Rashid Khan celebrates with a finger-twirling celebration. Kohli doesn't pick Rashid Khan, slogs in hope to a googly which is bowled on a fuller length and sees the stumps re-arranged. Difficult to say whether Rashid Khan has the wood over Kohli - a very small sample size for that. But for sure Rashid has the bragging rights over the RCB skipper. Kohli was so disappointed at missing that. Rarely does he miss those, but tonight he did. Massive massive wicket too. Kohli b Rashid Khan 12(11) [4s-2]

S Kaul to de Villiers, FOUR, not sure whether it is four or six. de Villiers grits his teeth and it is not a six. Maybe AB thought it didn't go all the way. It has been sent upstairs. Has the ball landed bang on the cushion? After de Villiers lifted a length ball on the stumps towards wide long-on. Still looking. Umpire Chettithody Shamsuddin wants to get this absolutely correct in the third ump's box. They are zooming in and zooming out. Crowd keep waiting. S Ravi does too. To get the orders from above. They could have taken the strategic timeout and got done with it. More than 3 minutes as I type. Finally a decision has been made. It is four. And it is the right call too, one angle showed clearly that the ball bounced in front of the cushions. The game moves on - thankfully

Rashid Khan to de Villiers, FOUR, not sure what Rashid Khan is appealing for? Clearly off the bat as de Villiers reverse-swept and got a bottom edge, also de Villiers had got outside the line when playing the shot, beats short third and it raced away

Basil Thampi to Moeen Ali, SIX, Moeen Ali launches Basil Thampi over long-off. Was right in the slot to play the lofted drive, hit it cleanly and went all the way. Basil Thampi came round the wicket and bowled a loosener, paid the price

Basil Thampi to Moeen Ali, SIX, this is a fine shot. He has a problem with the short ones, much like Raina, but not at that height, at waist-height, he pulls handsomely and sends the white Kookaburra over the deep square leg's head. That shot brings the crowd back to life

Basil Thampi to de Villiers, FOUR, his eyes were wide open as Basil Thampi was running in, maybe he was waiting for the short ball. Murdered through mid-wicket. That's actually so disrespectful to a fast bowler, but this is a tough game

Sandeep Sharma to Moeen Ali, SIX, caught by Shikhar Dhawan but goes over the rope. Six more. Moeen Ali powered this flat and over the head of Dhawan at long-on, he caught it well but went one step back and trod on the cushion. Still manages a wry smile and a "ooooohhhhhhh"
Southee to Dhawan, SIX, so easy. Overpitched by Southee and he sees the white ball fly over long-on. Clean bat-flow and sweetly struck. A welcome Southee won't like
Southee to Hales, SIX, it has gone for six despite it coming off the bottom of the bat. Again a bit too full from Southee, in the hitting range and Hales tees of. Over long-on

Siraj to Williamson, SIX, fractionally short outside off, Williamson stays low and shuffles across, gets under it and pulls it flat to deep mid-wicket. Goes just over the rope for six. Magnificent hitting.
Siraj to Williamson, FOUR, slower one @117km/h, Williamson waits for it, calm as a cucumber (maybe change the idiom to Dhoni), steers it away to deep backward point for four
de Grandhomme to Williamson, 2 runs, 8th fifty for KW this IPL, his 11th IPL fifty in his 28th game. Flat and shortish, whipped away off the back foot to deep mid-wicket for a brace

de Grandhomme to Williamson, SIX, in the slot, a bit of air too, Williamson gets on his knees, and puts all his might into that slog-sweep over deep mid-wicket for six. Didn't seem to time that perfectly, managed to clear it. How does he look elegant while slogging? 50 partnership is up, and it almost hits a car.

U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, not even close to a half-tracker, just outside off, uses those beautiful wrists and splits that gap surgically behind backward point for four. Class. Yes, even T20 can be classy.

U Yadav to Williamson, SIX, this guy is amazing! Not a T20 player, they said. Short one outside off, drags that with a pull over deep mid-wicket for a massive six. He's carting sixes on his way to a win.

de Grandhomme to Manish Pandey, FOUR, anti-climactic end to a superb effort. Put in a pool like dive at deep mid to get to it. But then kept sliding and the ball slipped away. Just touched the ropes and their was dismay on the face of the skipper. The short ball was thumped away between mid-wicket and long-on by the batsman
de Grandhomme to Manish Pandey, FOUR, low full toss, dipping and the batsman clips the ball away past deep square leg for a four. That was superb from Manish Pandey as he gets it away

de Grandhomme to Williamson, SIX, low full toss and Williamson goes one step better compared to his mate. That has been drop-kicked over deep square for a maximum. The runs are raining now. RCB ducking for cover but no where to hide

de Grandhomme to Manish Pandey, SIX, gargantuan! More height and enough distance. That was on a length and the batsman dismisses it over long-on for a sixer. Only 67 now off 30 balls as 22 is leaked in that over
Chahal to Manish Pandey, FOUR, drags the ball short, bad ball and put away. The batsman decides to drag the pull behind square and gets it past the man at 45 degrees for a four. SRH would take it

Chahal to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, fifty of the partnership comes up as Pandey comes back for a brace again. That was on the sticks again, might have been the quicker ball and the batsman turned the ball away between long-on and deep mid for a brace. 55 off the last four overs.

Siraj to Manish Pandey, SIX, Siraj misses the mark and pays the price. Manish Pandey dances across his sticks, exposes all of it and picks the ball over fine leg for a sixer. That was smart, not from the bowler though

Siraj to Manish Pandey, FOUR, slower ball, Manish Pandey waits till eternity and upper steers the ball over short third man for a four. 10 off the first two balls. Pressure back on RCB and Siraj as Kohli tries to egg his bowler on

Southee to Manish Pandey, FOUR, slippery conditions or too casual was CDG? The batsman biffed the full and wide ball over the bowler. The man at long-on did the slide well but the ball bobbled away after hitting the torso. Pressure is doing all the talking now. 31 needed now
Southee to Manish Pandey, FOUR, mid-off inside the circle and the batsman gets under the fullish ball to nail it over mid-off. That is something SRH would take with open arms

Southee to Manish Pandey, FOUR, four to end! The drama continues. 20 to get in the last over. That was full, more of a half-volley as he missed the mark and the batsman brought all his sinews to play. Muscled past long-off, to his left for a four

Siraj to Williamson, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! The swirler has been taken at deep fine leg, inches inside the fence. The batsman shuffled across the sticks and swept the ball away high up in the air. The ball went skywards and when it came down, it had a nervous Kiwi under it. The fielder took it really away from his body. He was inches inside the fence though and that played on his mind. Williamson c de Grandhomme b Siraj 81(42) [4s-7 6s-5]

Siraj to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, dropped! How many dropped catches tonight? And second drop for the skipper. The length ball was delivered for the batsman to send it to the moon. But the batsman lifted it up without any distance for the man at long-off to come in but he dropped it

U Yadav to Hales, FOUR, Siraj is the man at mid-on. Last over it was AB, they changed and the pacer allows the ball to miss his hand on the dive, wristily flicked wide of mid-on. Credit to Siraj for the run and dive, but the ball bounced over the hand
U Yadav to Hales, SIX, that's a top shot. Granted it was overpitched on middle, but what wrist-work from Hales, nonchalantly whipped it flat and cleared deep mid. That is a statement of authority
Siraj to Dhawan, SIX, smashed for six. Was a length ball and he picked his spot, rocked back and sent it into the crowd at deep mid-wicket. Siraj is welcome with a biggie

Siraj to Hales, no run, dropped by Kohli diving at mid-on. Dove too far actually. Ended up hitting his wrist. Drilled by Hales and the RCB skipper got both hands and spilled it. Isn't happy with himself at all
Siraj to Hales, SIX, the next ball goes for six. Length ball on the stumps, Hales heaves and clears deep mid. Just. But that will do

Chahal to Dhawan, out Caught&Bowled!! It is Chahal makes the breakthrough. Soft dismissal it must be said. Down the track and chipped back to the bowler. Who throws the ball away in delight. Wakes the crowd up who were starting to get restless. Dhawan c and b Chahal 18(15) [6s-2]

Chahal to Williamson, FOUR, that has to be the softest stroke played to get a four this IPL. Unreal actually. Too full and Williamson got forward before wristing it wide of a diving Southee at mid-on. Placed expertly and the ball kissed the turf along its way to the fence. Delightful from KW

Chahal to Hales, FOUR, the last ball goes for four. Dragged down and Hales lapped it over short fine's head. Needed to get enough bat to clear the fielder and did so. Poor end to the powerplay for RCB

Moeen Ali to Hales, out Caught by de Villiers!! No way. He didn't just do that. It's all about the Avengers now, but AB is the only one keeping DC alive. A toss-up outside off, Hales gets down the wicket and bottom-hand swats that flat towards deep mid-wicket, seems to have cleared it till the last moment until Superman arrives from Krypton to pluck that out of thin air. Leaps and grabs that one-handed. Absolutely ridiculous. The right foot was in fact extremely close to the rope and he landed on the right foot and had enough balance at the age of 34 to hold on and he was dancing like a teenager. Absolute magic. Hales c de Villiers b Moeen Ali 37(24) [4s-2 6s-3]
Southee to Williamson, FOUR, a tad short and angling into the body, Williamson shuffles across and guides the pull to backward square leg where Sarfraz misfields and lets it through for four
Southee to Williamson, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Williamson gets down the wicket and slaps that over deep extra cover for four
Moeen Ali to Williamson, FOUR, flat delivery, skidding, Williamson gets low and swat-sweeps that to deep square leg for four
Moeen Ali to Williamson, FOUR, tossed up outside off, pitched up, Williamson comes forward and whips it between mid-wicket and long-on expertly for four. Elegance personified

Moeen Ali to Williamson, SIX, Wow! Tossed up, in the slot, Williamson keeps a still head and golf-swings it through the line to deep mid-wicket for four. The most underrated of the big four, and he is proving his credentials today

Harshal Patel to Rayudu, out Caught by Maxwell!! Oh, may I just say that could've hit a plane. A length ball on middle, Rayudu comes down the track and isn't quite to the pitch of it, gets it off the meat but gets the timing just wrong on the lofted whip which makes it gain more height than distance as Maxwell does phenomenally well to sight the ball and settles under it at deep mid-wicket. Lies out on the grass under the heavens, a relieved man. Made it look much easier than it actually was. That went a kilometer up in the air. Rayudu c Maxwell b Harshal Patel 50(29) [4s-4 6s-4]
Maxwell to Raina, FOUR, vintage Raina! Tossed up outside off, Raina reaches out, gets to the pitch of it, and lofts that inside-out over extra cover for four
Maxwell to Dhoni, FOUR, what amazing placement! Flat one just outside off, not short at all, Dhoni whips a cut between gully and backward point for four. Surgically bisected the field

Lamichhane to Raina, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! Loopy googly on leg-stump, Raina predictably goes for his almighty heave over mid-wicket which has brought him much success over the years. Not tonight though as he flat-bats it straight down the throat of Vijay Shankar at cow corner. That's the end of a the most un-Raina innings of all time. An innings of more than ten balls, with a strike-rate below hundred. *Shaking my head* Raina c Vijay Shankar b Lamichhane 15(18) [4s-1]

Mishra to Billings, out Caught by Abhishek Sharma! Mishraji wins the mind-game. Leg-break just a tad wide outside off, Billings goes for an ill-advised sweep trying to drag it into the on-side, gets a feeble top-edge that lobs into the hands of short fine leg. Mishy is pumped. Billings c Abhishek Sharma b Mishra 1(5)

Lamichhane to Jadeja, SIX, googly on middle, Jadeja gets down the wicket and tonks it straight down the ground over the sightscreen! Full swing of the blade, >360 degrees, and it sails away for an 89 meter six

Boult to Dhoni, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! And the mentalist fails to pull off the unfathomable tonight! Low full toss, Dhoni finally nails the timing on this with a bottom-hand whip, flat and fittingly straight the his opposite number at long-on. A sigh of relief for DD. Dhoni c Shreyas Iyer b Boult 17(23) [4s-1]

Harshal Patel to Jadeja, SIX, first of all, kudos to the cameraman for following that one. Half-volley on middle, in the slot, Jadeja lofts it with every ounce of his power straight down the ground for six. That went through to the stratosphere and back into the sightscreen

Boult to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Vijay Shankar! Half-volley on off, Dwayne Bravo swings through the line, once again gets far too much height and hardly any distance, holes out to Vijay Shankar running in from long-off. That ball must have little drops of heaven on it by now, the number of times it has crosses the earth's atmosphere tonight. Dwayne Bravo c Vijay Shankar b Boult 1(2)

Boult to Watson, SIX, cannot bowl there to Watson, he'll feast on it. Banged short by Boult but it's not that high. Sits up nicely for the Australian who powers the pull over deep mid-wicket. One of Watto's favorite hitting zones

Avesh Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, crashed away! He had been trying to blast it for a while and finally, connects. Wide half-volley and Rayudu's quick hands on display as he thumps this with all his power. Well wide of mid-off who was a mere spectator

Avesh Khan to Rayudu, SIX, clears the fence! Rayudu has looked really fidgety, trying to hit too hard and connects here. On a shortish length and he was across the stumps in a flash. Pumps it over deep square leg with a meaty strike

Avesh Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, blasted away. Avesh needs to be careful with his lengths here. Errs on the shorter side once more and Rayudu gets across to blast it over mid-wicket. Just on the bounce before crashing into the ad hoardings

Avesh Khan to Rayudu, SIX, it's gone all the way! Rayudu is taking a liking to Avesh. Charges down the track and knows that the length will be shortened. Adjusts to pull it over deep mid-wicket. Easily over the ropes

Avesh Khan to Rayudu, SIX, third maximum of the over! Rayudu has gone bonkers. Walks down the track and makes room as well, Avesh continues to err on the shorter side and this disappears as well. Way into the crowd at cow corner

Mishra to Watson, out Caught by Boult!! The old warhorse has broken through for DD. Must say that this was on the cards with Watson really struggling to get going. Needed a move on and perishes in the process. The leg break from Mishra and invites the Australian to slog against the turn. Risky shot when there is some spin and it skews high off the outer half towards long-off. Boult ain't dropping those. Watson c Boult b Mishra 14(23) [6s-1]

Mishra to Raina, no run, dropped! Oh, Pant! He would be gutted not to have held onto this one. What a moment it would have been for DD! The slider which goes across Raina with the angle, he pushed with hard hands and got a tiny feather, it went rapidly to the left of Pant and smacked him on the leg. Tough one, but goes down as a chance
Mishra to Rayudu, FOUR, full, gives it a bit of air outside off, in the slot for Rayudu, who shimmies down, makes a bit of room, and punches that through deep extra cover for four

Mishra to Rayudu, SIX, straight down the ground! The pressure builds, Mishra bowls a full-toss on middle and off, Rayudu nimble down the track and clubs that straight down the ground into the sightscreen

Mishra to Rayudu, 1 run, full and flighted outside off, Rayudu gets forward and pushes to mid-off, takes off for a risky run, and Maxi is quick to fire in the throw to the non-striker's end. Rayudu was gone if that had hit. Not even in the frame! Where was Mishra?
Harshal Patel to Rayudu, FOUR, very quick, almost yorker length on leg, misses by half an inch perhaps, and Rayudu shuffles across to tickle it away to fine leg for four

Harshal Patel to Rayudu, 1 run, another full one on off-and-middle, and a punch from the crease to long-on for a single, to bring up yet another 50 for Rayudu in this IPL. He's knocked the door down to get into the Indian side, and his batting epiphany continues
Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Shaw opens his account with a boundary. A shortish ball that's picked early by the batsman. Gets into a good position and pulls it over square leg. Good shot

Lungi Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, out Bowled!! Knocked him over. An ordinary shot from the DD captain. It was bowled at 139.5kph and Iyer was backing away to cut. It was neither short nor wide. A skiddy short of length delivery on off. Iyer can't make contact and the ball crashes into the off-pole. Beaten for pace. The partnership has been broken. Shreyas Iyer b Lungi Ngidi 19(22) [4s-3]

Lungi Ngidi to Pant, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Two wickets within a span of four balls. Ngidi sports a bright smile. A pacy short of length delivery slanted across the left-handed batsman, Pant tries to fetch it from outside off and heave over the leg-side. The edge flies and settles into the safe hands of Bravo at third man. And, of course, the jig follows it. Pant c Dwayne Bravo b Lungi Ngidi 38(26) [4s-3 6s-2]

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, that's been hammered. A half-volley, Vijay Shankar stands tall and drills it straight down the ground. Bravo, in his followthrough, moves away from it. Rockets away to the fence

Jadeja to Maxwell, out Bowled!! Horrible shot! Not the first time this season that Maxwell has departed playing an atrocious stroke. Here is another example of it. The previous ball sowed the seeds of doubt in his mind and he went for a reverse sweep. Except that this was a dart from Jadeja aimed at middle and leg. 'You miss, I hit' type and it crashes into the stumps. Perhaps was too full for the stroke as well. Either ways, poor dismissal. Maxwell b Jadeja 5(7)

SN Thakur to Abhishek Sharma, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Another one bites the dust. No heroics tonight from Abhishek Sharma after his impressive debut the other night. Sharp bumper from Thakur and the southpaw is rushed into the pull. Only manages a fat top edge that bobbles high towards mid-on. Bhajji settles under it merrily. DD have lost half their side now. Abhishek Sharma c Harbhajan b SN Thakur 2(4)

SN Thakur to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, that's a freebie and Shankar puts it away. Shortish and sliding down leg, he just walks across a bit and deflects it well wide of Dhoni with a neat glance. Races away to the fine leg fence

Lungi Ngidi to Harshal Patel, FOUR, handy blow from Patel. He does pack a punch in his shots, as we saw during his batting promotion earlier this season. This is fractionally short and there is a lot of width as well, he waits for it and slaps hard past extra cover. Once it beat the infield, it was always racing to the fence

SN Thakur to Vijay Shankar, SIX, that's deep into the crowd! Plenty of power from Vijay Shankar on this stroke. He's smoked it away. Short of a length and he is now expecting this length. Sits deep in the crease to clobber the pull away by standing tall. Meaty blow

Dwayne Bravo to Harshal Patel, SIX, for a moment Rayudu at fine leg thought he had a chance as he raced to his left but this cleared the square leg fence. Fuller ball on middle and off, Patel just went across to play the pick up shot. Quick hands and supple wrists on the drop kick from Patel as this whistled away

Dwayne Bravo to Harshal Patel, SIX, hugeeeeeeeeee! Bravo decides not to bowl the slower ball and it disappears. Fullish and in the slot, lots of pace and it's in the arc as well. Patel does the needful by bludgeoning it way over long-on. Handy blows, these, for DD

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, there goes another! Bravo's death bowling issues this season continue. Is being taken to the cleaners tonight as well. Slower but it's on the shorter side, Shankar gets hold of it and pulls it away over deep backward square leg

Dwayne Bravo to Harshal Patel, SIX, this is fantastic hitting from Harshal Patel. He is being aided by some poor bowling too. Half-volley and it's a pacy ball, Patel drills it dead straight down the ground. Into the sightscreen for another maximum

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, Chahar errs and Shaw pounces. Shortens the length and angles one on middle and leg, Shaw gets into a good position with a slight shuffle and shoves it over mid-wicket. Goes all the way

Dwayne Bravo to Harshal Patel, SIX, 26 off the final over! Just the momentum push DD were seeking and they've finished with a flourish here. Bravo loses the plot completely to dish out a juicy full toss, Harshal in this hitting mood isn't going to miss out. Goes straight once again with the loft and once more, crashes into the sightscreen for a maximum

Jadeja to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, a drop! Shardul Thakur is the culprit. Shaw once again kneels down to employ the slog sweep against an in-dart. Mistimed and went to the right of mid-on, where Thakur leapt and couldn't snaffle

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Thakur doesn't drop it this time. A simple catch, and he will be a relieved man. A short of a length delivery around off, Shaw loading his back foot decided to hoick over cow corner. Gets it off the bottom part of the bat and the ball settles into the hands of the long-on fielder. Thakur moved to his right and reverse-cvupped it. Way too many high risk shots from Shaw. Prithvi Shaw c SN Thakur b Chahar 17(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, no run, Thakur, again. A direct hit would have been curtains for Pant! The run was definitely not on. Iyer slightly backed away and Chahar followed him with a short of length ball, thereby cramping him for room. It was punched towards mid-on. A yes-no situation and Pant put in a desperate dive. Luckily, the fielder failed to hit the target
Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, shot! Backed away, manufactured room and then slapped this short ball over backward point. Once bounce and into the fence
Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, cheeky! Chahar bangs one short, Iyer waits for the ball, hops and elevates it over the slip cordon. There is no one to stop that
SN Thakur to Pant, FOUR, Thakur bowls a short ball, no venom. And Pant takes full toll of it. Swivel-pulls it fiercely in front of square leg for a boundary

Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, the gap is found. Jadeja shortens his length and serves a bit of width, Iyer stays back in his crease and cuts it to pierce the gap between short third man and backward point. Superb placement
Harbhajan to Pant, FOUR, short, wide, turning away, Pant, who was initially pressing forward, goes deep in the crease and scythes it through covers. Powerfully hit

Harbhajan to Pant, SIX, that's one helluva shot! From round the wicket, Harbhajan doles out a leg-stump half-volley, Pant goes slightly leg-side and clouts it over deep mid-wicket. Way into the stands. Absolutely pummeled
Harbhajan to Pant, FOUR, short-and-wide outside off, asking to be punished. Pant stays back in his crease and cuts it fiercely between short third man and backward point

Harbhajan to Pant, SIX, how did that go for a six? Did Ngidi misjudge that? He ran forward from long-off and then had to come back again. Jumps up in the end, but in vain. Coming to the shot, Pant wasn't targeting that region. He got down to slog over cow corner. The ball ballooned up off the top-edge and just cleared the ropes

Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, SIX, how good is that? Pacy short delivery and at the body, what does Parthiv Patel do? He just ramps it for six. Using the bat as a help, periscope style. I guess it is Baz who caught that? in the RCB dugout. No my colleague - Nikhil tells me Baz has dropped it and he is right

Shreyas Gopal to Mandeep, out Stumped!! Loopy leggie and the batsman is stumped. Jumped out of the crease and tried to go aerial on the off-side but missed it by a mile. Beaten in flight and the rest was done by the keeper. RCB are messing up the chase here. Third wicket for Gopal. The ball dipped on him and the preempted movement deserted him. Mandeep st Klaasen b Shreyas Gopal 3(4)

Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, FOUR, sixth fifty for Mr. 360! That was shortish, the batsman jumped on the opportunity and muscled the ball away past the dive from the man at deep square leg. Superb execution

Ish Sodhi to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Rahane!! Gone. RCB are impoding here. That was a typical leggie's dismissal. Landed outside off and turned away, lured the batsman for a drive to catch the edge. There was a slip fielder and the captain can give himself a pat on the back. For taking the catch and for having a slip in place. Superb bit of passage for RR. Kohli looks on in shock and dismay. de Grandhomme c Rahane b Ish Sodhi 2(3)

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, out Stumped!! Game. Set. Match. That is a hugeeeeeeee wicket. The googly is misread. Looks to drive and misses it. The batsman tried to drive it but the ball bent in and the keeper did the rest as the back foot dragged out of the crease. Kohli is shocked. RCB camp cannot believe it. More than that, Gopal has hands on his mouth. He has shocked himself to a massive wicket. RR all over RCB like a rash. One should compliment Klaasen for his sharp work, so quick with the gloves ala MSD. de Villiers st Klaasen b Shreyas Gopal 53(35) [4s-7]
Unadkat to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, slower ball and drop-kicked over mid-off. Played the drive on the up, did not intend to keep it down and got it over the head of the fielder for a four

Laughlin to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Klaasen!! The fat lady's whisper can be heard. That was a terrific take from Klaasen. The slower delivery and the batsman backed away to steer the cut, the shot was not too away from the keeper, who leapt to his right and takes it. Superb day behind the sticks for the RR keeper. First with the bat and now with the ball. RCB fans continue to wear a disappointed look. Sarfaraz Khan c Klaasen b Laughlin 7(8) [4s-1]

Laughlin to U Yadav, out Bowled!! Golden duck for Umesh. A taste of his own medicine. That was fuller, on a length and the batsman never covered the line of the ball. A little gap was found and the ball traverses between the bat and pad to strike timber. The RR fans erupt. Early finish? Hat-trick ball coming up. U Yadav b Laughlin 0(1)
Laughlin to Siraj, FOUR, something to cheer for RCB fans. Short ball and has been pulled away into the on-side past deep square leg. He got hold of the short ball and muscled it away into the on-side

Jofra Archer to Southee, FOUR, slaps the low full toss back at the bowler. Archer could not react in time to clasp that and the ball goes through his hands to race away to the long-off fence for a four. 44 off 18 balls is of academic interest. Or is it?

Unadkat to Southee, FOUR, flogged away as he picked the slower delivery up like dead meat. Then muscled the ball away between deep mid and deep long-on to pick the bones out of it. Southee was deep in his crease and waiting for the slower ball

Unadkat to Southee, out Caught by Gowtham!! Final nail in the coffin. Shortish, slower ball and the batsman heaved the pull away to be taken at cow corner. The batsman never connected properly and the mistimed hit was taken. RR only a wicket away from staying in contention for a place in the play-offs. RCB's dreams are over. Well almost. Southee c Gowtham b Unadkat 14(17) [4s-2]

Jofra Archer to Chahal, leg byes, 1 run, that was a comedy of errors? The yorkerish delivery was missed by the batsman and was hit on the boot. It was going down leg and the bowler kept on appealing. Number 10 and Jack decided to steal a single and they did. The keeper could not manage to throw the sticks down at the bowler's end, else it could have been tight
Unadkat to Siraj, FOUR, reverse paddle and gets the ball away past short third man. That was on the sticks and the batsman got it away amidst an appeal from the bowler

Unadkat to Siraj, out Caught by Gowtham!! What just happened there? A relay catch! Kohli looks bemused. The length ball and the batsman slogged it away to send it skywards. Samson came charging in and dropped it, but the ball popped up. But Gowtham, who almost collided with his mate kept his wits and took it low and one-handed. Tremendous reflexes after the ball ricocheted off Samson's palm. Siraj c Gowtham b Unadkat 14(12) [4s-2]
Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, SIX, six again. An action replay of the first six. Just that Baz didn't drop it in the dugout. Using the pace of Jofra Archer to a nicety. Expensive over from the Bajan

Gowtham to Kohli, out Bowled!! Kohli is bowled to a spinner. Seen that so often in this IPL. I can recollect Mujeeb, Rashid and now Gowtham. The bowler does a cool fist pump to celebrate the wicket. Kohli knew he had to do something against Gowtham, struggled in the first over, and decided to step out, but cleverly bowled by Gowtham, going wide of the crease and darting in a fast offie, which breaks in through the bat-pad gap to take Kohli's off stump out. They check for the no-ball on the side crease, but Gowtham had his leg up in the air and didn't land. A body blow to RCB. Kohli b Gowtham 4(9)

Jofra Archer to de Villiers, FOUR, de Villiers is away. How easy he makes it look. Pacy short ball on the hips, he just whipped that wide of short fine, and Jofra Archer is bowling in the high 140s. Only a genius can do things that de Villiers does
Jofra Archer to de Villiers, FOUR, wow. Wow. What a front foot punch that is. Just a checked punch and look at the ball race away. Extra-cover was wide open and it raced away

Jofra Archer to de Villiers, FOUR, Jofra Archer ends another expensive over with a good length delivery on off and middle, flicked through mid-wicket, in the air but in the gap. He again looks in the mood today and that's bad news for RR fans
Laughlin to de Villiers, FOUR, again greatness from AB. Got close to the swinging slower knuckle ball, but used his bottom hand to great effect, squeezing down on it hard and beats mid-on to his left

Laughlin to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Parthiv Patel gets lucky. Sliced the slower delivery straight up but it had enough elevation to clear the short third man fielder. Came down the track and aimed to go over cover, was beaten by the angle across him

Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, superb effort from Samson but he has dropped that and it has rolled to touch the cushions. Length ball on middle, heaved away towards deep mid, Samson was in from the boundary, backtracked and stuck his right hand up on the leap to catch, but it didn't stick. Would've been a competitor to Boult and Rashid Khan's catches had he hung on. Has a wry smile on his face
Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, very full, Parthiv Patel crunches a drive between extra cover and mid-off. Really hit it hard and gets another boundary
Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, FOUR, he got out against CSK playing this, but that was to an offie, this is a leggie, reverse-swept and well wide of backward point. Ish Sodhi is welcomed with a boundary

Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, FOUR, Archer is having a nightmare today. Pulled to the left of him at deep mid, he got there and picked up the ball with his left-hand, then inadvartently the right-hand flicked the ball onto the cushions. Tried to scramble and pull the ball back with a dive, to no avail

Shreyas Gopal to Parthiv Patel, out Stumped!! Parthiv Patel is walking. Because he knows that he has not got the back foot back inside. A toppie, from the front of the hand, slides on quicker, beats the backing away Patel on the cut, he overbalanced and when Klaasen whipped the bails off, the foot was on the line. Superb keeping from the South African as well. RR needed that wicket. Parthiv Patel st Klaasen b Shreyas Gopal 33(21) [4s-3 6s-2]

Shreyas Gopal to Moeen Ali, out Caught&Bowled!! Moeen Ali closes his eyes and grimaces. While Shreyas Gopal is being mobbed by his mates. A thick leading edge and Shreyas Gopal timed his leap to perfection and came up with the return catch in two hands. The catch was all about the leap. Two wickets in an over and the pressure multiplies many times on de Villiers. Moeen Ali c and b Shreyas Gopal 1(2)

U Yadav to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Umesh Yadav strikes. The ploy to send Archer up the order hasn't worked. He's gone for a duck - third this season. A bumper down leg from Umesh and Archer goes for a pull - looked like a half-hearted one. Only manages a glove and Parthiv Patel snaffles it with ease. The RCBians knew it straightaway and the umpire got it right too. Jofra Archer c Parthiv Patel b U Yadav 0(4)

de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, 2 runs, fine knock by Tripathi, his first one of this season. Gets a shortish delivery and has plenty of time to hook it away to deep square leg. As the fielder had to charge in to collect the ball, the batsmen managed to get the second two

de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, SIX, now he'll try to shift gears. Walks down the track and chips the length ball right over the bowler's head. Such sweet timing on this blow. For a moment I thought this was only a boundary, but no. It's a maximum!

Chahal to R Tripathi, FOUR, the boundaries have started to flow. This was fired outside off, Tripathi came down the track and threw his hands at it. Gets a thick outside edge that flies down to the third man fence

U Yadav to Rahane, out Lbw!! The impact was marginal but enough to go against Rahane. It was the off-cutter outside off, Rahane moved inside and went for a wild heave. Got beaten and was struck on the pads. The umpire took his time to give his decision but in the end he's right. So, finally Rahane' struggle comes to an end. Might be a blessing in disguise for the Royals. They need someone who can strike the ball well. Rahane lbw b U Yadav 33(31) [4s-3]

U Yadav to Samson, out Caught by Moeen Ali!! Two in two for Umesh. His third wicket of the match, he's on a roll in the past few games. Getting better with every game. Bowls a gentle length delivery first up and Samson flicks it straight to the man at short mid-wicket. A soft dismissal, indeed. Scored 90-odd against RCB earlier in the tournament, walks back for a duck today. Samson c Moeen Ali b U Yadav 0(1)

U Yadav to Klaasen, no run, the review was retained and lucky for Royals as Klaasen survives. Decision has to be over-turned! Excellent delivery by Yadav though. He's on fire today. Bowls a full length delivery tailing into the batsman, almost a yorker and Klaasen manages to get an inside edge as he brings his bat down in time.

Moeen Ali to R Tripathi, SIX, that's a massive blow. Nicely done. Was a tossed up delivery outside off, the batsman came down the wicket and went ahead with his loft, right over the bowler's head and over the ropes. The fielder at long-on was a mere spectator

Siraj to Klaasen, FOUR, that's the french cut. Short of a length around off, Klaasen goes at it with hard hands, pulls and ends up getting an inside edge. Past the off-stump and runs down to the fine leg boundary. Was very close to knocking down the off-pole

Siraj to Klaasen, FOUR, this is better. Will make him feel better, this shot. Makes room and punches the length delivery through extra-cover. No fielder in the deep as Klaasen collects his second boundary
Siraj to Klaasen, SIX, this is the class of Klaasen. This is what he can do. This was a full length delivery outside off, Klaasen frees his arms and carves it over third man. Beautiful shot!

Siraj to Klaasen, FOUR, improvisation at its best. This was a full toss outside off, Klaasen shuffles across and scoops this gift over short fine leg. On a bounce and into the fence she goes. Has quietly moved into the 30s

Siraj to Klaasen, out Caught by Moeen Ali!! Siraj has the last laugh! Conceded a boundary and six earlier in the over but does well to get the better of the South African. Bowls a slower delivery outside off, Klaasen goes ahead with his aggressive loft and holes out at long-off. Moeen Ali won't drop those and he doesn't. Klaasen c Moeen Ali b Siraj 32(21) [4s-3 6s-1]

Southee to Gowtham, SIX, how often has he done that? Makes six hitting so simple, does Gowtham. Wonder why he wasn't sent to open the innings. This was a short delivery and the all-rounder simply pulled it over mid-wicket
Southee to Gowtham, SIX, excellent shot! Full in length around off, Gowtham stands tall and pumps it over long-off. Back-to-back sixes for Gowtham and the crowd is lovin' it

Moeen Ali to R Tripathi, SIX, first maximum! Premeditated, but he made excellent contact. Flat ball wide of off, Tripathi gets down on a knee after moving towards off. Follows with a massive slog sweep over deep backward square leg

Southee to Gowtham, out Gowtham Run Out!! An anti-climax to end the innings. A yorker outside off that's too quick for Gowtham to squeeze it out. They try to steal a bye but the keeper parries the ball to Southee who does the rest. RR end on a competitive score, nevertheless. Gowtham run out (Parthiv Patel/Southee) 14(5) [6s-2]
U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, good looking shot! Slightly on the shorter side, Rahane treks back and opens his bat face to force it through point. Races away
U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, shot! Offers a straight bat and lifts it downtown. Over and wide of the mid-on fielder. Slightly overpitched and Rahane pounced

U Yadav to R Tripathi, FOUR, shortish ball, Tripathi was expecting that. Remains back in his crease and heaves it over mid-wicket. Didn't get it off the middle, but had enough wood on it to go for a boundary. 13 off Umesh's second over

Southee to Rahane, FOUR, nicely done! Didn't over-hit and relied on timing. Scrambled seam short of length delivery, on the stumps, Rahane hops across and tucks it through square leg. No chance for the long leg fielder to cut it off

Chahal to R Tripathi, FOUR, lovely shot! Tossed up delivery, Tripathi dances down the track and in the process backs away to manufacture room. And then, follows it up with a sweetly timed lofted inside-out shot over extra cover
Chahal to R Tripathi, FOUR, now Chahal overcorrects. Drags the length short on this leg-break and Tripathi was quick to latch onto it. Goes back in his crease and muscles the pull through mid-wicket
Siraj to R Tripathi, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Tripathi jumps and cuts to deep point. Brings up the 50-run stand between the duo

Siraj to R Tripathi, 1 run, Tripathi sees the width on this short of length delivery and punches on the rise. Falls short of backward point, where Mandeep dove forward. Collects and has a shy at the striker's end. Doesn't hit the target, Rahane would have been in anyway

U Yadav to R Tripathi, FOUR, he was in good shape when he made contact with the ball. Overpitched, Tripathi with a high-backlift lofts the drive over extra cover. No chance for long-off to stop that. High elbow and there's the pose for the photographs
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, room on offer and Lynn accepts gleefully! Frees his arms and flashes it past cover-point. Absolutely creamed

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, length and width, that's a harmful combo to serve in the powerplay; Lynn doesn't miss out. Pounces on it with a wielding willow and hits the gap with an air of authority
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, just over a leaping backward point! Just. Full and wide, Narine drills off the lower half and manages it get it just over the fielder. Lots of oohs and aahs
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, jumps down the pitch and squirts an inside edge on the cross batted swat, no-one in the deep at mid-wicket and he'll claim another boundary

Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, that's not the area to be bowling, certainly not to Sunil Narine. He loves width and with the length full it only makes matters easy for him, pumps this over extra cover with ease

Sandeep Sharma to Chris Lynn, SIX, that's just a blatant display of biceps. Comes on the front foot and scythes this length ball over cow corner. Trust me when I say this: it was hammered away disdainfully with a torso torque
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, 50 run stand. Shakib adjusts, bowling this arm-ball slow and full. To long-on for a single
Shakib to Uthappa, SIX, he's like a scoop of butter today. Reads the length so early that he has the time to get under a Shakib darter. Lifts it over long-on
Shakib to Uthappa, FOUR, now uses the pace and splits short third man and backward point. Played that delightfully late, with a nice clean lean towards off-side

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Pandey's run in an arc at long-on and taken an in-out-in catch right at the boundary ropes. It's been referred upstairs, with the soft signal being out. It is out indeed. Just one of Chris Lynn's slogs that goes wrong. Hits it flat and across, seemed to have miscued it -- triggered by the lack of room -- and there Pandey was, running and plucking it out. Realizes he's going to run over the ropes, parries the throw in, hops out, hops back in and then almost steals that out of the hands of Rashid, who was lurking around. Rashid's hands cupped Pandey's -- so close. Chris Lynn c Manish Pandey b S Kaul 55(43) [4s-4 6s-3]

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, SIX, top-edges are the new first aid in cricket. Didn't KKR need that. A back of a length delivery going down leg-side, DK was late on the slog-sweep and ushered a top-edge over fine leg. It was way into the crowd, trust me
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, 2 runs, a direct-hit from extra cover but Uthappa has made it back into the bowler's end with a sharp second. Squeeze-driven by DK that, as BK went full and wide
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, FOUR, overpitched, and that's flying over Uthappa's scalp. Scooped away straight down the ground
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, SIX, only fair that Rashid takes the brunt. It's outside off but it's enough for Uthappa. Enough full, enough close. Slogged over deep mid-wicket

Brathwaite to Uthappa, out Caught by Goswami!! Brathwaite is riding a horse in celebration. Or something like that. He's undone Uthappa with a short ball. Weight not quite back, the bounce getting big on the batsman, and we have a top-edge, that the keeper runs around and collects it near say leg gully. Uthappa c Goswami b Brathwaite 45(34) [4s-3 6s-2]
Brathwaite to Karthik, FOUR, slower delivery sitting up, and the perils of having DK at the death. Hits the pull flat over the mid-wicket region. It's racing away.. it's a four!

S Kaul to A Russell, FOUR, that top-edge to fine leg has arrived, beaten Sandeep Sharma and run away for a boundary. Sandeep, running to his right, leapt in front, went two-handed but the ball just slid through, deflecting to the ropes. 13 needed, only

S Kaul to A Russell, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Russell has been baited here. All he got until now was a barrage of incoming short balls, so he was going to want to take full toll of this one. Slogs across, totally misreading the slower delivery and offering a steepler to long-on. Manish had to come in a few paces but he was right under the ball. Brilliantly taken. A Russell c Manish Pandey b S Kaul 4(4) [4s-1]

Brathwaite to Nitish Rana, FOUR, tries to bowl very full and wide from round the wicket but Nitish Rana's reached out to it. Throws his hands, slices it away, and it's been hit with power. Skittles away, beating Sandeep's dive. Scores level

Brathwaite to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Now this finds the fielder. More like a hoick-pull that Nitish Rana's fallen to. Takes the short ball on, swivels into an attempted glory hit and succumbs to the placement of the fielder at fine leg. Nitish Rana c Bhuvneshwar b Brathwaite 7(5) [4s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Narine, SIX, 20 off the over. KKR are making the most of the powerplay. Once again, it's in Narine's swinging territory, he clears his front leg and lifts the ball back over the bowler's head for a stunning maximum

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, SIX, ah! That shoulder seems to functioning just fine. It was short and drifting into leg stump channels, Lynn clears the front leg and smokes it for a 69-metre maximum over mid-wicket

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, smart cricket from Lynny! Knuckle ball, Lynn had all the time in the world to pick his shot, makes room outside off and bludgeons it straight back over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four
Shakib to Narine, FOUR, half-tracker, the line doesn't matter, Narine rolls his wrists and slambangs it with a swivel pull down to deep square

Shakib to Narine, SIX, long-on jumped back in desperation, but he never looked like catching that. Clean swing of the willow from Narine, thumps it from middle-stump channel and deposits it way over the fence

Shakib to Narine, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Not this time. Not again. Narine throws his head down in disappointment. Tried for a encore and failed to find the sweet-spot of the blade, enough air-time for Manish Pandey to run forward and claim a simple catch at long-off. Narine c Manish Pandey b Shakib 29(10) [4s-4 6s-2]
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, smacks the ball and flexes his muscles. Doesn't move. Whoa, how's that for a confidence! Slightly fuller and wider of off, Lynn cracks it straight past mid-off
S Kaul to Uthappa, FOUR, no-one at deep mid-wicket and Kaul bowls a rank bad ball. Short on middle, Uthappa swivels and crunches the pull over mid-wicket
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, SIX, length ball in the channel, Lynn feasts on it with a mighty hoick over cow corner. 87-metres to be precise
Nitish Rana to Dhawan, FOUR, that's a dream start from Dhawan, Rana dropped one short and just wide of off, Dhawan backed away and cracked it square past cover, no need to run for those
Prasidh to Dhawan, FOUR, lashed over backward point, width on offer from Krishna and Dhawan cashed in big time. Reaches out and slaps it over point, a few bounces and over the ropes

Prasidh to Dhawan, FOUR, was that a half-chance? Short and wide of off, Dhawan got on top of the bounce as he cut, didn't bother to keep it down, went to the right and well wide of Uthappa at backward point, the man in the deep has no chance

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, SIX, "That is what form does to you," says Harsha Bhogle on air. Kuldeep gives plenty of air, but it lands as a freebie for Williamson. On the pads and he comfortably dispatches it over cow corner

Searles to Dhawan, 3 runs, in the airr and Narine puts it down. Never looked like taking it any point, to be honest. So much so that he didn't even get a hand to it. A fat leading edge as Dhawan closes the bat face early on the whip, goes very high into the night sky and took an eternity to descend. The ball was swirling and the West Indian grasses it. Collects the ball and fires a direct-hit at the striker's end, it riochets away and they pinch three runs. They went upstairs for the run-out check but Dhawan was well in

Searles to Williamson, SIX, this will hurt KKR. Williamson can play this shot in his sleep. Lenght ball down leg, Williamson gets inside the line and hacks it behind square for a maximum. Easy pickings

Searles to Williamson, SIX, make that two sixes in two balls for Williamson. This was the shot he attempted against RCB in the previous game and picked out the fine leg fielder. This time he knew the fielder was inside the ring. Moved across his sticks early, stayed low and helped it supremely over the fielder's head for half-a-dozen

Searles to Williamson, out Caught by A Russell!! Williamson could'nt have picked the fielder out any better. Surely, will be disappointed. Anyway, Searles retaliates and gets his revenge. Went wide of off, Williamson slashed it hard and straight to deep cover. Russel was under it and he won't drop those. It was an off-pace ball and KW had to generate some power to elevate it over the fielder's head. 2 or 3 inches away from Russel, it would've been a boundary. Nonetheless, KKR will breathe a sigh of relief as they break this dangerous stand. Williamson c A Russell b Searles 36(17) [4s-1 6s-3]

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, buzz in the crowd as Dhawan reaches his fifty. 32nd IPL fifty for the southpaw, mind you he was averaging around 24 against KKR before this game. A flighted delivery just outside off and Dhawan thrashes it to long-off to bring up the milestone

A Russell to Manish Pandey, FOUR, two dots and Pandey breaks free. Employs his dexterous wrists - ala Dhoni. Full and just outside off, Pandey jumped back and wristed it beautifully to bisect long-on and deep mid-wicket

A Russell to Manish Pandey, FOUR, KKR have been very clumsy and poor in the field. Here's more evidence. Half-volley just outside off, Pandey slammed the drive wide of long-off and called "Two". Chawla was patrolling the fence and sprinted to his left, trips and loses his balance allowing the ball to roll away to the fence. Messy!

Prasidh to Dhawan, out Lbw!! Dhawan is given OUT lbw, he's having a discussion with Pandey before eventually walking off. Krishna roars back strongly in his new spell after leaking 11 in his first over. Cuts back in from round the wicket, seemed like the slower ball. Dhawan was lining up for a mow across the line, misses it totally and is hit on the back thigh. Looked pretty adjacent and umpire S Ravi took his time before raising the dreaded finger. so, Dhawan falls right after his fifty. Dhawan lbw b Prasidh 50(39) [4s-5 6s-1]

Narine to Y Pathan, out Caught by Uthappa!! Stunned silence among the Orange army supporters. Pathan departs early as he fails to clear the long-on fence. Floated up and wooed Pathan into a biggie, who fell for the trap. Lofted it high, only height and it sailed into the black sky to long-on. Uthappa sets under it and swallows it. Excellent comeback this from KKR after being under the pump. Y Pathan c Uthappa b Narine 2(4)

Prasidh to Manish Pandey, SIX, cow corner is Pandey's favourite spot and he dismisses one for a maximum. Krishna misses his yorker, Pandey cleared his front leg and banged it flat, enough timing on it to take it all the way

A Russell to Brathwaite, out Caught by Karthik!! KKR are chipping away with wickets as Brathwaite perishes. Russell gets the better of his countryman. Skiddy short ball that tucks Brathwaite for space and hurries onto him, went for the pull and failed to get any timing on it. Splices it up in the air and DK prances forward to grab it. SRH losing gas at the death. Brathwaite c Karthik b A Russell 3(4)
A Russell to Shakib, FOUR, Russell persists with short to Shakib, but it was the slower short ball and Shakib read it early. Stayed back and pulled it over square leg

Prasidh to Manish Pandey, out Caught by (sub)Rinku Singh!! Has that been taken? Oh, it has. It has. The default Sub fielder for KKR - Rinku Singh takes a stunning catch. Another one falls and SRH are losing the plot here. Second wicket for Krishna, who's been brilliant in his fresh spell. The slower ball, that dips and Pandey takes it on the full to mow it towards deep mid-wicket. Doesn't get it off the middle and the ball was dying in front of Rinku - who dives forward and gobbles it up. Manish Pandey c (sub)Rinku Singh b Prasidh 25(22) [4s-2 6s-1]

Prasidh to Shakib, FOUR, misses the yorker on this occasion and Shakib makes him pay. Fuller length delivery outside off, Shakib plants his front foot across and hammers the drive through extra cover. Rocketed away to the fence

Prasidh to Shakib, out Caught by Narine!! And Shakib combusts. Krishna has been pretty impressive today. The slower short ball, angling at Shakib, who in a bid to pull - gets it high on the bat. Skes it to square leg and Narine ain't dropping those. Shakib c Narine b Prasidh 10(7) [4s-2]

Prasidh to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Karthik!! Raining wickets for Kolkata. Two in two for Krishna and he becomes the second player from Karnataka to take four wickets so far today, informs my colleague Varun Dixit. Banged in short just outside off, Rashid slogs across the line and gets a thick top-edge that goes high in the air. Skipper takes the matter in his own hands and backtracks, keeps his eyes on the ball and nestles it safely in his glove. Rashid Khan c Karthik b Prasidh 0(1)

A Russell to Goswami, no run, Goswami has been given out caught at slip, he wants a review. It's a fair ball, it's gone off the helmet, but is there some glove before it? I don't think so, there's daylight between gloves and the ball, should get this decision overturned, Goswami. Ultraedge confirms it as well. NOT OUT is the call. That's a good review from Goswami, he knew there wasn't any bat or glove, the bouncer from Russell and Goswami was way too late on the pull, thudded into his helmet and lobbed towards Rana at slip. Umpire Anil Chaudhary was quick to raise his finger, but he has to change his call

A Russell to Goswami, SIX, that's adding insult to injury for Russell, on a good length and just outside off, Goswami backs away slightly, plays with an open face and slices it high and over cover, went a long way over the stands

A Russell to Goswami, FOUR, cracking shot, Goswami is chancing his good luck now, this was full and this was wide of off, Goswami makes room and cracks it square past cover, beats the fielder in the ring and scorches away to the ropes

A Russell to Goswami, byes, FOUR, that took off from a length, this is turning out to be a big over for SRH. This was a back of a length delivery just outside off, surprised Goswami as it took off from a length, he stabbed and was done in by the bounce, it kept rising and even a leaping keeper can't stop it, four byes added to the total

Prasidh to Bhuvneshwar, out Bhuvneshwar Run Out!! Wow. Wow. This is exceptional finish from Krishna and KKR. 4 wickets and just 4 runs in the over. Take a bow, Krishna. Ushered it short and gets it to rise over Kumar's attempted hoick. Fails to connect and they try to sneak in a bye. But DK hits the bulls-eye and catches the batsman well short of his crease. Bhuvneshwar run out (Karthik) 0(1)

A Russell to Goswami, FOUR, finesse from Goswami, back of a length and just outside off, Goswami waits on it, plays with an open face and steers it in the gap behind square on the off-side, 20 from the over

Chawla to Goswami, FOUR, woeful from the fielder at cover, I think it's Uthappa. This was tossed up wide of off, Goswami reached out and crashed it towards cover. The ball bounced awkwardly in front of him and Goswami didn't get his body behind it either

Chawla to Dhawan, FOUR, that's all too easy for Dhawan, wrong line from Chawla, drifted this one down the leg-side, the fielder at fine leg was inside the ring and all Dhawan had to do was to find the gap past him, he does so with the sweep and raises SRH's 50

Narine to Dhawan, SIX, lovely, tad too full from Narine, Dhawan gets a good stride forward, drives it through the line and clears the ropes at long-on with ease. The key was he didn't look to muscle the shot, nor did he play across the line

Kuldeep Yadav to Goswami, FOUR, beautifully played, this was tossed up well outside leg, Goswami went down low, reversed his stance, got on top of the bounce and then found the gap behind square on the off-side

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, poor ball from Kuldeep, dropped it short and at the stumps, Dhawan had plenty of time as he rocked back and pulled it wide of mid-wicket, even the big dive from Russell can't prevent the ball from hitting the ropes

Searles to Dhawan, 1 run, had Searles hit the target, Goswami might have been struggling. Dhawan set off for a quick single after nudging the ball towards short mid-wicket. Searles was quick on his follow-through, ran across Goswami, got to the ball and then fired a throw at the striker's end, he missed with Goswami way short of his crease

Kuldeep Yadav to Goswami, out Caught by A Russell!! Catching practice for Russell at long-on and SRH have lost their first wicket. This was tossed up nicely by Kuldeep, Goswami came down the track, didn't get close to the ball as he went through with the lofted drive, went off the inside half of the bat and looped towards long-on. Goswami has played his part though, walks off to a decent round of applause. Goswami c A Russell b Kuldeep Yadav 35(26) [4s-4 6s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, cracking shot, that's quite a way to get going, dropped short and at the stumps, Williamson gets halfway down and pummels it past square leg. Kuldeep is disappointed, knew immediately that it was a bad first ball to the new batsman

Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, FOUR, fired in from round the wicket once again, angling towards leg-stump, Maxi plants his front leg across and slugs a pseudo-pull off a low stance towards fine leg for four. Used the pace and angle, didn't need much power

Bumrah to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, slips through slip's hands! A fraction short, very little width, Shaw's teenage upper body tries a cut, gets a top-edge that flies over Suryakumar Yadav at slip, as he gets a fingertip to it. Away to third man for four

Cutting to Vijay Shankar, SIX, massive, that should break the shackles for DD, too full and in the slot, Vijay Shankar extends his arms and lifts it high and over long-on, Rohit was a mere spectator as the ball sailed over his head

Mustafizur to Pant, SIX, a one-handed six now, how do you bowl to this man? On a good length and well outside off, Pant was looking to swipe it towards the on-side, his bottom hand came off at the point of impact, but it still had enough power to sail into the crowd at wide long-on

Mustafizur to Pant, 1 run, Mustafizur keeps it full and just outside off, driven back at the bowler who gets a hand onto it and deflects it away towards long-on, that single raises another fifty for Pant - who also has the orange cap back with him

Mustafizur to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, edged and four, Vijay Shankar was clueless when he last batted against Mustafizur, but he gets away with a boundary first ball this time. Nothing convincing about the shot though, this was the off-cutter that gripped the surface and was pushed across the right-hander, Vijay Shankar went hard on the cut, got a fat top-edge that flew in the gap between the keeper and short third man

Hardik Pandya to Pant, SIX, cheeky and six, how good is this shot? Length delivery on the stumps, Pant was quick to reverse his stance, plays with an open face and ramps it over short third man, Hardik's pace is enough for the ball to sail over the ropes

Hardik Pandya to Pant, no run, Pant has been given out LBW and he immediately reviews. I think it's pitching well outside leg, a shocker from umpire Nandan and feel this will be overturned. No bat on that and it's confirmed by Ultraedge. Hawk-Eye will confirm my doubt and it has pitched miles outside leg. NOT OUT is the call. Poor decision from umpire Nandan and the crowd cheer as NOT OUT flashes on the screen. Pant was looking to whip a full ball on his pads and missed

Hardik Pandya to Pant, leg byes, FOUR, poor line and length from Hardik, length ball on Pant's pads, he was looking to flick and missed, struck his pads and ran away fine, beat the keeper and rolled away to the fence

Hardik Pandya to Pant, SIX, another one-handed six, Hardik is getting a serious pasting here. Another length ball on Pant's pads, he was looking to swipe it over square leg, the bottom-hand came off at the point of impact, still it flew high and deep into the stands

Krunal Pandya to Pant, out Caught by Pollard!! This was coming, not many runs in the over and Pant was getting increasingly agitated, deserving reward for the elder Pandya. This was tossed up on the stumps, perhaps a bit slow off the surface as well, Pant slogged hard and flat, no real elevation behind the shot, straight into the bucket hands of Pollard at long-on. Pant gets a pat on his back by his former U-19 captain, Kishan, as he walks back. Pant c Pollard b Krunal Pandya 64(44) [4s-4 6s-4]
Mustafizur to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, lovely, length ball from Mustafizur and it sat up to be smacked, Abhishek waits on it and then pummels it sweetly - high and way over mid-wicket for a massive six

Bumrah to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, chance and dropped, Rohit is wriggling in pain, but he gets up and it seems to be all OK. Coming to the ball, it was a high full-toss that was sliced to the left of backward point. Rohit tumbled across and think the ball hit him high on the arm

Cutting to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, another poor ball from Cutting, full-toss on Vijay Shankar's hips and all he had to do was to clip, he does so and beats the tumbling dive from Rahul Chahar - running across from fine leg

Cutting to Vijay Shankar, SIX, beautifully played, length delivery on the stumps, Vijay Shankar leans forward, presents the full face of the bat, high elbow and the ball sails over the sightscreen for a maximum

Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, back of a length delivery angling towards off and middle, Maxwell shuffles across to get off-side of the ball and tickles it away to fine leg for four. Uses the pace extremely well, does Maxwell. Not something he's known for, but there he is proving everyone wrong and playing the finesse game
Hardik Pandya to Maxwell, FOUR, good length delivery in the channel outside off, Maxwell lets it come on, true bounce and no lateral movement, driven away on the up to deep extra cover for four

Hardik Pandya to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, short delivery outside off, Prithvi shows poor technique and shot selection, trying to drag it towards the on-side with a pull, gets a thick under-edge away to fine leg where Bumrah puts in the dive but in vain as it goes through for four. Good effort, but not good enough

Mustafizur to Maxwell, out Prithvi Shaw Run Out!! Looks like it's a run-out! Just an off-cutter, sliced away off the front-foot towards backward point where Pandya picks up and throws at the non-striker's end. Shaw sees the ball coming, and is still walking towards the crease, assuming that the ball will miss the stumps! Absolutely abominable from Shaw. He wants the ground to swallow him up, does Shaw. Prithvi Shaw run out (Hardik Pandya) 12(8) [4s-2]
Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, slower one, off-cutter on a good length, not much deviation, and Maxwell bottom-hand-lofts it through the line to long-off for a one-drop four

Bumrah to Maxwell, out Bowled!! That's quick stuff @144km/h. Bumrah is no sulker! No LBW? No problem. Leave nothing to the umpire. Length delivery, seaming in just enough, Maxwell tries to loft through the line, gets an inside edge onto his pad and it finally ricochets onto his stumps. Huge breakthrough for the Mumbaikars, as their stump-vanquisher uproots the sticks of the Big Show one last time. Maxwell b Bumrah 22(18) [4s-4]
Mustafizur to Pant, FOUR, shortish delivery, not much width, Pant punches it to sweeper cover off the back foot and freeze-frames his stance for a future batting manual
Markande to Pant, FOUR, leg-break, but down the wrong line, and a tad short, Pant gets back and helps it on its way with a pull to backward square leg for four. Easy picking for a man in form.

Markande to Pant, SIX, full delivery angling towards leg, the googly, but Pant comes down the track and gets to the pitch so fast that he doesn't let it turn. Gets that bat of his down from a high backlift and slogs it into the deep mid-wicket crowd for six
Cutting to Pant, FOUR, crash, bang, wallop! Short, fractionally wide, Pant lashes out at it and finds the gap between short third and backward point for four. Hardest cutter since Sehwag, may I say?

Cutting to Pant, 1 run, slower shot one, Pant is early into the pull and gets a thick under edge towards square leg for a single. A throw at the striker's end, and a direct-hit. The umpire goes up to his ally upstairs, but all is well.
Markande to Pant, FOUR, drag-down of a leg-break, Pant gets on the back foot, clears the front leg, and whip-pulls that to deep square leg for four

Markande to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! The wrong 'un on off, a tad short, Shreyas Iyer gets deep in the crease and has enough time to check out the leg-side field and then go for the shot. Pulls it straight down the throat of Krunal at deep mid-wicket who takes it comfortably. Is the foot on the rope? Nope, apparently not. Captain Capital's got to go. Shreyas Iyer c Krunal Pandya b Markande 6(10)
Hardik Pandya to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, shortish and skiddy outside off, Vijay Shankar gets low and slices that away to deep backward point for four. Perfect placement behind backward point

Lamichhane to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, poor start from the young leggie. Real loosener - a rank long hop, offering a freebie for Suryakumar first up. The batsman rocks back and murders it over mid-wicket

Lamichhane to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, the intentions are clear from Suryakumar. Wasting no time whatsoever in putting these filths to the fence. Another dragged down delivery, on leg. Suryakumar bends low to get in line with the ball and hacks it behind square for a maximum. 10 off first two, pressure on the bowler

Lamichhane to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! The adrenaline rush from Suryakumar, was never going to clear long-on. The googly from Lamichhane, skidded off the surface and Suryakumar was on the back foot. In a bid to unleash his bottom-handed whip, mistimes, gets a leading edge and picks out Vijay Shankar, who sprinted forward and tumbles. Importantly holds onto it. Sandeep roars, for he gets his revenge. Suryakumar Yadav c Vijay Shankar b Lamichhane 12(4) [4s-1 6s-1]

Lamichhane to Hardik Pandya, SIX, but that is not the way Hardik thinks.. Anything with flight and in his arc, Hardik will go for it, through the line and with a clean bat swing sends it soaring over the long-on fence, into the second tier

Lamichhane to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, hammered! Pressure on the teenager. Lamichhane tries to fire it full and outside off, Pandya did well to get under that and drill the drive through extra cover. No chance for Boult from long-off to cut it off

Lamichhane to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, that left shoulder will certainly be tested with the dive. Pushed it through and got the ball to grip, Pandya squirts it off the outer half to the left of Iyer at cover, Rohit called for the single and had to put in the dive to make his ground. Direct hit might have made things more interesting

Boult to Rohit, FOUR, there's the boundary for the over Mumbai need. Low full toss outside off, Rohit crouches a bit and uses the pace of Boult, opens the bat face and steers it between backward point and short third man

Boult to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, 17 off the over and that releases the pressure that Mishra and Lamichhane built up. Full and on the pads, easy pickings for Pandya, who flicks it nonchalantly past the diving short fine leg fielder. It was just the matter of putting it in the gap and Pandya did it to perfection

Harshal Patel to Rohit, out Caught by Boult!! It is the Maxwell-Boult partnership again. Seemed like a replay of the Pollard dismissal. The duo even have a laugh together. This was much more easily done by Maxwell. The third umpire has a check and there's nothing to overturn the soft signal. Another failure for Rohit. He's had a terrible season. More importantly leaves his team in a spot of bother. The slower off-cutter grips the surface and deceives Rohit compeletly, he was into the shot early and went through with it, the bottom hand comes off and the ball skies towards long-on, Maxwell runs across and takes the catch, but with the momentum taking him out, he lobs the ball to Boult, who came running from long-off. Rohit c Boult b Harshal Patel 13(11) [4s-1]

Mishra to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by (sub)Rahul Tewatia!! Is that the game? Ishan Kishan thinks so as he has his hands on his head. One of the MI cheerleaders did not like Pandya's shot selection either. Needless from Pandya. Last over for Mishra and he should have tried to play him out, but that is not the sort of batsman he is. Saw the floaty delivery outside off and went for the big loft downtown, sliced it off the outer half to backward point, where Tewatia picks up his second catch. Hardik Pandya c (sub)Rahul Tewatia b Mishra 27(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Boult to Cutting, SIX, that's more like it. Right in the slot and it is a 83 meter six from Cutting. Just a bit of shuffle to off and got nicely underneath the length ball, the big forearms then took over to smash it over long-on

Boult to Cutting, 1 run, direct hit and Markande was a goner. Low full toss and Cutting shuffled across and tried to help it round the corner, found the fielder at short fine and pushed Markande for the single, he wanted to retain the strike. Markande was not even in the frame as Lamichhane missed the sticks

Plunkett to Cutting, FOUR, good way to start the over. Shade too straight from Plunkett, on off and middle, Cutting gets inside the line and whips it backward of square leg. He ensured that he got it past the man at short fine leg

Plunkett to Cutting, SIX, wow! That's gone a long way. This match ain't over. Mumbai's season ain't over. Until Cutting is there. Plunkett is bowling length and Cutting is waiting for it, muscles the loft well over the long-on fence

Plunkett to Cutting, FOUR, 14 runs off the first three balls. Pressure. Pressure! Once again Plunkett goes full with a pacy delivery, Cutting says thank you very much and smashes the leather off the ball, right over Markande and giving long-on no chance. Even Rohit could afford a clap with that boundary

Boult to Markande, 1 run, direct hit and that was over. Cutting went for the single and he was not even in the frame. Full delivery and Markande digs the drive out to cover, the pair had to go and Shaw was the fielder. Took his time and fired a throw at the striker's end. Missed and Mumbai stay alive. Pant also came charging forward and slipped while collecting the ball. Had he stayed on his feet and collected it cleanly, Cutting was still gone

Boult to Markande, out Bowled!! Bowled 'im. Top over under pressure from the Kiwi. Mumbai could get only 5 runs off it.
