Round the wicket and though he misses the yorker length, his pace makes up for it, Markande does not lay bat on the pacy full toss and has his off-stump uprooted. Markande b Boult 3(10)

Harshal Patel to Cutting, SIX, oh my! Cutting has got the best possible start to the over. Patel does not have the pace to bowl short and it sits up nicely for Cutting, who swivels across and sends the pull soaring over the long leg fence

Harshal Patel to Cutting, out Caught by Maxwell!! Patel pumps his fist. Cutting hangs his head down and trudges off. The Mumbai supporters are in shock. That must be the match? The slower delivery and it was right in the arc, but the slow nature made Cutting generate all the power and he could only heave it as far as deep mid-wicket. Maxwell keeps his cool and takes it calmly. Settled nicely under it. Cutting c Maxwell b Harshal Patel 37(20) [4s-2 6s-3]

Harshal Patel to Bumrah, out Caught by Boult!! Mumbai have been knocked out. Cutting and Rohit take a moment to soak in what has transpired. The Mumbai skipper then gathers himself and shakes hands with his team mates. It is only the fourth time that Mumbai have not made the playoffs. Some happy faces in the Delhi camp as they finish with back to back wins. Another slower delivery and Bumrah had to go for it, miscued it towards long-on and Boult ran in to complete the catch. Bumrah c Boult b Harshal Patel 0(1)
Harshal Patel to Lewis, FOUR, Lewis was waiting for this. Half-volley begging to be smashed and Lewis accepts it with glee. Planting his front foot across and belts it through cover

Harshal Patel to Lewis, 1 run, in the airr and Vijay Shankar shells it down. It was a tough chance as Lewis had hammered it hard. And guess what? Lewis could've still been dismissed had Iyer - who was backing up, effected a direct-hit at the non-striker's end. Lewis had given up

Harshal Patel to Lewis, FOUR, ungainly loft but Lewis manages to clear the in-field on the off-side. Cutter outside off, Lewis threw it all, lost his shape but the power of his willow takes it all the way to the fence. Iyer with a desperate chase, but in vain

Harshal Patel to Lewis, SIX, Lewis is wading into Patel now. Overbakes and bangs it short, Lewis can deal with short balls with ease. Sits back and muscles it way back into the deep mid-wicket stands. Into the second tier

Maxwell to Lewis, SIX, in the slot and Lewis makes Maxwell pay the penalty. Flighted full outside off, Lewis chips out of his crease, flexes his muscles and smokes it over long-off. Stand and dismiss stuff
Maxwell to Lewis, FOUR, two dots and Lewis breaks free. Flat and short down leg, Lewis swivels across and helps it behind square for a boundary

Maxwell to Lewis, SIX, a six off the final ball and 16 runs to cap off the over. Lewis is getting a move on here. Motions out of his crease to meet the pitch and allows his bottom hand to take over. Blasted disdainfully over long-off

Mishra to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! First ball wicket after the break. Mishra strikes gold. But wouldn't have been possible without Vijay Shankar - who has pulled off a blinder at long-on. Compensates for his earlier blip where he dropped Lewis at cover. Flighted teasingly from Mishra, Kishan took the bait -- had to because he was struggling a bit. Meets the pitch in a hurry and smashed it flat towards long-on. Vijay Shankar at the edge of the ropes, judges it well and clings onto it above his head. Made sure, he didn't topple over the ropes despite one leg balancing in the air. Ishan Kishan c Vijay Shankar b Mishra 5(13)

Mishra to Pollard, 3 runs, edged and put down by Shaw. Mishra is not happy with the effort. Slips in the leggie and lured Pollard once again, who outside-edged it to first slip. Shaw leapt, it was sailing over his head. Gets a finger-tip to it and it runs away towards third man. What a miss for Delhi!

Mishra to Lewis, SIX, Lewis gets underneath this flighted delivery and sweeps it straight into the ad-cushions behind square on the leg-side. Mishra looped it on leg-stump and Lewis went low in time to connect it beautifully to smash it for a maximum

Mishra to Lewis, out Stumped!! Mishra has the last laugh and pumps his fists. Just when Lewis was looking more threatening, DD have sent him packing back to the hut. The wrong 'un from Mishra that foxes Lewis, stepped forward and aimed to for a cross-batted slog over long-on. The ball dips and turns in to slider under his bat. Pant was waiting behind and breaks the stumps in time. Lewis st Pant b Mishra 48(31) [4s-3 6s-4]

Lamichhane to Pollard, out Caught by Boult!! Wowza! Maxi-Boult combo pulls off a replica of Mayank-Tiwary's catch. But hang on, they have referred it to the third umpire. No issues with the front foot and no issues with the catch too, looks pretty clean and Pollard can continue his long walk back to the pavilion. Two in two for Delhi and what a comeback. Jitters in the Mumbai camp as they lose their fourth. Tossed up on the stumps, Pollard lifts it with a straight bat. Doesn't get enough power to clear long-on. Maxi stays at the edge of the ropes, grabs it and realises that he is going over the ropes. Throws the ball to Boult - who was waiting to gobble it up. Talk about tag-team effort. Outstanding. Pollard c Boult b Lamichhane 7(7)
Lamichhane to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, Krunal is off the mark with a boundary. Floated on leg, Krunal sinks low and sweeps, gets it much finer and collects a boundary

Lamichhane to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by (sub)Rahul Tewatia!! In the air and taken. Mumbai crumbling as they lose half their side. Phew! Look out for Lamichhane, he's off for a celebratory run. Googly again, in the driving spot. Krunal went for it and spooned it uppishly to cover. The sub fielder Tewatia, does a fine job. Sprawls across and pouches it safely. Krunal Pandya c (sub)Rahul Tewatia b Lamichhane 4(3) [4s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Rayudu, out Caught by Rahul!! Edged and taken! Mohit gets the man in form. Swing does the trick once again. Short of a length around off, with a bit of away swing written on it. Rayudu tries to fend it down but gets an outside edge and Rahul doesn't make any mistake. Can Mohit get one more? Rayudu c Rahul b Mohit Sharma 1(3)

Ashwin to Harbhajan, out Lbw!! Ashwin strikes first ball! This was plumb. A carrom ball which pitches in line with middle and straightens. Harbhajan kneeled down to slog-sweep but in vain, to be hit on the back leg. Only one way that was headed. Harbhajan lbw b Ashwin 19(22) [4s-2 6s-1]

Ashwin to Chahar, SIX, he has whacked this carrom ball over deep square leg's head. Not long boundaries here, so even a decent contact comfortably takes it over the ropes. Walked across the stumps, sat down low and got a great length for the slog-sweep
Ashwin to Chahar, SIX, now a blistering strike over long-off. Wow. Ashwin had fired this pretty wide of off, so Chahar had to reach out slightly, but the timing is still so sublime
Ashwin to Chahar, FOUR, short and wide, Chahar stretches out to reach it and then cuts it away to the point boundary. He's taking Ashwin apart
Axar to Chahar, SIX, my word does he have some ability with the bat! This is a stunning shot. Makes some room to a length ball and flat-bats it over long-off. Wow Deepak Chahar

Ashwin to Chahar, out Caught by Mohit Sharma!! Sliced up off a thick edge, Mohit Sharma gets underneath it comfortably at cover. So Chahar's joyride comes to an end. The carrom ball was cleverly fired out of his arc, and his leg-side swipe was always vulnerable to the ball turning away. He's done his job though. He's done more than what could've been asked of him. Chahar c Mohit Sharma b Ashwin 39(20) [4s-1 6s-3]

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, FOUR, Dhoni absolutely nails this! Spoils what was turning out to be a good over. Brings up 4000 IPL runs for himself as well. Back of length at the stumps, he opens himself up and swings into a brutal cross-batted smite through square leg

Andrew Tye to Raina, SIX, finally gets hold of one! He waited just a moment longer to account for the knuckle ball, and then heaved it away for a flat six. Even this had come more off the bottom of his bat actually, but again, these are short boundaries

Andrew Tye to Raina, SIX, pops Tye over long-on to raise his fifty! The equation has come down to a run-a-ball. Don't think he got this one off the middle either, but got enough to just clear the leaping fielder

Andrew Tye to Raina, FOUR, sliced away in front of deep point, where the fielder dashes in only to find that he's badly misjudged it. Then he doesn't put his body behind it either, allowing it to slip past the side of him
Andrew Tye to Raina, FOUR, short ball at the head, Raina swivels across nicely and helps the pull away to the fine leg boundary. Just one more needed. What a late assault

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, SIX, finishes it off by pulling this short ball over the long leg boundary, and then calmly tips the bails over. And that's how the IPL 2018 league stages end, with SRH, CSK, KKR and RR going through
Mohit Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, in the air... but safe! Length ball around off, du Plessis checks his drive and manages to elude the bowler. Any other day and this would have been a catch

Rajpoot to du Plessis, FOUR, du Plessis is riding his luck! This was a length delivery snaking away, he tried to punch it on the up and got a thick outside edge. Past the man at second slip and into the third man fence. As a result of this, Ashwin has decided to bring in the third slip too

Rajpoot to du Plessis, FOUR, first convincing shot of the day by du Plessis. Thinks he's had enough of Rajpoot! Dances down the wicket and chips the back of a length ball over cover. That'll make him feel much better
Andrew Tye to Raina, FOUR, width on offer and Raina pounces on it. Was short and wide outside off, Raina reached for it and carved it over point. Third man is too fine to cut this down

Andrew Tye to Raina, FOUR, what a fine shot! This is what he's known for. Charges down the wicket and drills this one past the bowler. Tye had no chance to stop it, nor did any of the fielders out there

Rajpoot to du Plessis, out Caught by Gayle!! That's gone! Have to give full marks to Gayle for this effort. Both openers are back in the pavilion without doing much. Was short of a length and outside off, du Plessis went hard at it and got an outside edge. Gayle at first slip was quick to get down and reverse cup it just before the ball was about to hit ground. Had his fingers beneath and the replays confirm it. du Plessis c Gayle b Rajpoot 14(15) [4s-3]

Rajpoot to Billings, out Bowled!! Jaffa. Peach. Ripper. Call it whatever. This was unplayable, indeed. Pitched on off and snakes away a tad to beat Billings defence. Hits the top of off and Billings is a dead duck. Rajpoot is on a hat-trick and he can might well get it. It's Harbhajan Singh who walks out to bat ahead of Dhoni, Bravo and Jadeja. Billings b Rajpoot 0(1)

Rajpoot to Harbhajan, no run, dropped! Rajpoot almost gets another one. Finch the culprit on this occasion. Squared him up completely with the length delivery and induced an outside edge too. However, Finch at second slip makes a mess of it! This was a straight-forward catch for Gayle. Double wicket-maiden for Rajpoot. Absolute gold!

Mohit Sharma to Raina, 1 run, tucks the length delivery to square leg and calls for a risky single. Had this been a direct hit at the striker's end, Bhajji was gone. Miller was the fielder and he could have taken some more time before having a go
Mohit Sharma to Harbhajan, FOUR, this is what he's here for! Short of a length around off, Harbhajan clears his front leg and slashes this over backward point. One bounce and into the hoardings
Rajpoot to Harbhajan, SIX, finally gets some bat on it! Was trying to do this since ages. Clears his front leg and pumps the length delivery over long-off for a flat six
Axar to Harbhajan, FOUR, wants to drag the sweep shot from well wide of off, but only manages an under-edge. Cruelly for Axar though, it's gone between the keeper's legs for four
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, magnificent stroke! Not a bad ball by any means. A good length outswinger, Rahul leans forward and creams the drive through extra cover. No need to run for shots like that

Lungi Ngidi to Gayle, out Caught by Dhoni!! What was that? A half-hearted appeal for caught-behind, the umpire doesn't raise his finger, but Gayle walks. Well, CSK have the breakthrough. And, it's a big wicket. A harmless ball sliding down leg from a back of a length, Gayle gets a glove on it, trying to tuck. The Jamaican stood for a while and decided to go off. Gayle c Dhoni b Lungi Ngidi 0(2)

Jadeja to Manoj Tiwary, out Caught by Dhoni!! Have CSK forgotten to appeal? Didn't appeal for Gayle, he walked. This time a timid appeal for the sake of it from RJ and the umpire raises his finger. A wicket off his first ball for Ravindra Jadeja. Gave a bit of flight on this ball from round the wicket did RJ and the ball doesn't spin much after pitching outside off. Tiwary is down on his knee to swipe and gets a faint edge to the keeper. Off the toe end. That threatened to bobble out of the keeper's hand, but MS doesn't make any mistake. Manoj Tiwary c Dhoni b Jadeja 35(30) [4s-3 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Miller, out Bowled!! The zing bails light up and then there's the jig from Bravo. Perfect yorker from the West Indian, Miller slightly moved leg-side to create room. He is too late to bring his bat down and the ball crashes into the middle stump. KXIP in deep trouble here - 80/5! Miller b Dwayne Bravo 24(22) [4s-1 6s-1]

Jadeja to Nair, SIX, just clears the man in the deep. Flatter around middle and leg, Nair goes down on his knee and slog sweeps it over square leg. Ngidi is the man in the deep who tries hard to grab it in left hand but it's way above him

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, SIX, excellent lofted shot. Full in length around off, Nair moves away, makes room for himself and times his loft over long-off. Right from the meat and comfortably over the ropes
Jadeja to Axar, SIX, lovely shot! Picks the length early on the short one, backs away and nonchalantly lofts it over long-off. Has enough on it to evade the man in the deep

SN Thakur to Axar, out Caught by Billings!! Terrific catch by Billings! Short delivery around off, Axar goes for the pull and miscues it to deep mid-wicket. Billings comes running in and just as the ball is about to die in front of him, he puts in a dive and pulls off a ripper. The wicket belongs to the fielder, more than the bowler. Axar c Billings b SN Thakur 14(12) [6s-1]

SN Thakur to Nair, FOUR, Nair continues to march on. The wicket won't make a difference to him. A full length delivery around off, Nair moves away and chips it over covers. Billings can't get there in time
SN Thakur to Nair, SIX, shot! This is what KXIP exactly want. Short again on middle and leg, Nair stays in his crease and swings it over square leg. Way into the stands, such sweet was the timing

SN Thakur to Nair, FOUR, 18 runs off the over! Just what the doctor ordered for Punjab. This was full and outside off, Nair threw his bat at it and got an outside edge that eluded Dhoni and found the fence

Lungi Ngidi to Ashwin, out Caught by Dhoni!! Full marks to the bowler there. He was sure that the batsman had nicked it and Ashwin has to walk back for a golden duck. Short delivery outside off, Ashwin tries to run it down to third man but gets a slight feather on its way to the keeper. Even he wasn't sure that if had nicked it. UltraEdge confirms with a spike! Ashwin c Dhoni b Lungi Ngidi 0(1)

Lungi Ngidi to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Raina!! Another one for Ngidi. He's taking down Punjab single handedly tonight. Got Rahul and Gayle earlier, gets Ashwin and Tye now. This was short of a length around off, Tye tried to punch it off his back foot but his bottom hand came off and he ended up miscuing it to mid-off. Can't get any easier for Raina! Andrew Tye c Raina b Lungi Ngidi 0(2)

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, FOUR, that's a fantastic shot by Nair. Full length delivery on leg, Nair improvises at the last moment and reverse whips it over backward point. Just eludes the man stationed in that position
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, SIX, he's getting better as this innings is progressing. Gets down on his knee and picks the length delivery over fine leg. Good enough to reach the distance
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, SIX, fifty for Karun Nair! Preity Zinta in the stands loves it. Was a short delivery around off, Nair comes down the wicket and slaps the slower one over long-on

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, out Caught by Chahar!! He's disappointed, disappointed at throwing his wicket away. He has done his job though. Tries to chip the low full toss over mid-off but gets it off the toe end and Chahar at mid-off completes the formalities. Should have waited for the last over, would have made some difference to the end score. Nair c Chahar b Dwayne Bravo 54(26) [4s-3 6s-5]

SN Thakur to Rajpoot, out Caught by du Plessis!! du Plessis takes a clean catch at long-on and that's the end of Punjab. Reckon, this total is not good enough to take them through to the playoffs. Was a short delivery that was swatted away to long-on by Rajpoot. du Plessis was the man near the fence who took it and managed to stay inside the boundary. Rajpoot c du Plessis b SN Thakur 2(4)
Chahar to Finch, FOUR, seam-up delivery swinging away, Finch rocks back and punches it beautifully through covers, beating a diving Faf. First boundary for Finch

Chahar to Finch, out Caught by Raina!! Superb catch from Raina at first slip. Moved swiftly to his left and catches it above his head. A nothing shot from Finch. He knew that the ball is swinging, still flirts with a ball outside off sans any feet movement. Short of good length and nipping away from the right-hander, Finch gets squared up and can only manage an outside edge that finds the safe palms of Raina. Finch c Raina b Chahar 4(6) [4s-1]

Lungi Ngidi to Rahul, out Bowled!! Wow! This is excellent bowling from Lungi Ngidi. After all those away-going deliveries, he gets one to shape in. Rahul shoulders arms and loses his off-stump. Top-class bowling. A goodish length from over the wicket and Rahul anticipating the ball swing away raised his bat. It was however,, the inswinger. Hits the top of off. KXIP's best batsman this season departs for a cheap score. Rahul b Lungi Ngidi 7(11) [4s-1]

Chahar to Miller, FOUR, good shot to get going. He is out of his crease to negate swing. Chahar's inswinger ends up on his pads and Miller doesn't miss out. Leans across and flicks it beautifully through backward square leg

Chahar to Miller, SIX, for a moment, I thought that he had mishit that. How wrong was I? Pitched up delivery outside off, Miller reaches out, bends the back knee and lofts it over long-off. High and handsome. A six off the free-hit

Harbhajan to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, horror ball to begin. Short, wide asking to be punished. Tiwary stays leg-side of the ball as he goes deep in his crease. Then employs the cut shot behind square on the off-side

Harbhajan to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, Jadeja can only get a hand on it and he parries it over the ropes. Would be very harsh to call it a drop. Tiwary danced down the track and slug in the direction of the turn. Just over RJ at long-on, who timed his jump to perfection and went for a one-handed catch

SN Thakur to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, not sure if he intened to go there. Fuller length ball swinging in on leg, Tiwary's bat turns at the point of impact as he looks to on-drive. The ball races away to deep square leg off the inside half of the bat
Dwayne Bravo to Miller, 1 run, slower ball, full on leg, wristed to mid-wicket and the charging in fielder - Thakur slides and loses his balance. Luckily, no damage

Dwayne Bravo to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, edged and four. Tiwary didn't see a short ball coming ball. Got big on the batsman and Tiwary persisted with the pull shot. The top edge flies over Dhoni's head for a boundary

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, out Caught by Goswami!! Edged and caught! The perfect start from Bhuvneshwar, an absolute peach and he has gobbled Watson up. Fraction short in length and a hint of shape away from outside off, made Watson feel for the ball, found the tiniest of bat and Goswami does the rest. Defending 140, they needed early wickets and Bhuvneshwar has just got them one. Watson c Goswami b Bhuvneshwar 0(5)

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, too short and too wide from Sandeep, that's a loosener and that's been put away with ease. Had to reach out - Raina, but he got on top of the bounce and found the gap past cover-point

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, lovely shot, too full and too wide from Sandeep, he hasn't found the right line and length so far. Raina leans into the drive, didn't get close to the ball, as a result it was in the air for a long time, but he found the gap to the left of cover and it scooted away

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, cracking shot, this is the best of the lot, full and just outside off, Raina leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and drives it back past the non-striker, no need to run for those

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Dhawan!! Pouched at slip by Dhawan. Rashid Khan jogs away with his arms spread. Oh he loves bowling at the Wankhede. The extra fizz off the surface works wonders for him. Pushed through on a good length outside off, Bravo wafts at it and perishes to the turn and bite. SRH on a roll. Dwayne Bravo c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 7(11)

Sandeep Sharma to Jadeja, out Caught&Bowled!! Not anymore he's not. Dear me. He's chipped this knuckle ball straight back to Sandeep, completely bamboozled. Beautifully disguised on a good length around middle, Jadeja tries working it through the on-side but he's way too early into the shot. SRH are turning a defence of 140 into a one-sided affair. Quite unbelievable turn of events here. Jadeja c and b Sandeep Sharma 3(5)

Shakib to du Plessis, FOUR, backs away against this arm-ball and hacks it through mid-wicket. He's got it between long-on and deep mid-wicket, and despite a committed dive from Manish Pandey, he can only parry the ball into the ropes

Shakib to du Plessis, SIX, straight down the ground from Faf, clean strike. He's got to pick his bowlers now, and he's got 10 off two balls from Shakib. Swings through the line of the full ball and sends it soaring over long-on

Sandeep Sharma to Chahar, SIX, and Chahar goes bang. Well, not quite a BANG, but bang enough. Off-pace back of length delivery, he swipes cross-batted and clears the mid-wicket boundary. It came off the toe-end, but these are short boundary

Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, carved away over extra-cover, and all of a sudden CSK have the momentum. Full ball outside off, Faf somehow manages to get under it and lifts it over Williamson in the infield

Sandeep Sharma to Chahar, out Caught by Brathwaite!! Has Brathwaite taken this? It will be a sensational catch if he has. Tom Moody gets on his feet in the dugout. Big moment. The soft signal is out. And it doesn't take long for the third umpire to uphold the onfield call. Dhoni looks a bit miffed as he crosses his arms. Full ball, not an easy length to get under, which is why Chahar's loft hardly finds much elevation. It's a flat hit in front of long-on, with the ball dipping on Brathwaite and making him the second favourite. But he charges in while covering great ground and dives forward to get his fingers underneath. What a game he's had. Chahar c Brathwaite b Sandeep Sharma 10(6) [6s-1]

Rashid Khan to du Plessis, no run, and this call, if upheld, could seal the game. Faf given out LBW to a googly from Rashid. He's gone for the review. This is shady, as the ball seems to be a bit leg-sidish. You can see middle and off stump when it hit the pad. Williamson has already got his fielders in position, so he doesn't seem very confident. Yes, as expected, it's missing leg stump. Faf survives. CSK still alive, if only just
Brathwaite to du Plessis, FOUR, he's successfully targetted extra cover again. Full ball outside off, pretty short of the blockhole, so Faf has enough space to get it over Williamson's head

Brathwaite to du Plessis, SIX, oh what a shot. He's picked the bones out of it. An 87-metre six pumps up the CSK dugout while raising the fifty for the South African player. Brathwaite offers it in the slot again, and gets smoked away
Brathwaite to du Plessis, FOUR, four more. Just the over CSK need. Leg-cutter on a back of length, and although he's deceived by it, he's able to drag it away past short fine leg

Brathwaite to du Plessis, out Harbhajan Run Out!! 1 run completed. This is stunning bit of work in the outfield from Rashid Khan. Faf had absolutely drilled this drive to his right at deep extra cover. But not only does he race across and slide to stop it, he also fires in a rocket throw back to Brathwaite to catch Harbhajan well short. Harbhajan run out (Rashid Khan/Brathwaite) 2(9)

Brathwaite to du Plessis, FOUR, he's got the boundary. Full ball outside off, the field is set in a way that there are three fielders to the left of point in a ring, and sweeper cover is pretty straight. So Faf carves this full ball square enough of Rashid in the deep to beat him. What a knock he's playing

S Kaul to SN Thakur, FOUR, forget turning the strike over, Thakur has squirted this for four. It's running CSK's way. Kaul's so terribly unlucky though. Beaut of a yorker on off, Thakur gets it right off the toe-end, and with third man up, it runs away
S Kaul to SN Thakur, FOUR, would you believe it? Another french cut for four. Kaul doesn't know how to react. Back of length, cramps Thakur up and takes the inside edge to the fine leg boundary

S Kaul to SN Thakur, FOUR, Shardul Thakur, are you kidding me! He's making up for all the punishment he took from the hands of Carlos Brathwaite. Wankhede erupts. Full ball at the stumps, drilled back past the bowler's head. Swirls away into the fence

Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, SIX, Faf du Plessis, you champion! He takes just one ball to do it. Slower ball on a length, whacks it back down the ground to smash those LED boards before raising his arms and letting out a huge roar

S Kaul to Raina, FOUR, lovely, sublime timing from Raina, full toss outside off, he waits on it, uses the pace on the ball, plays with an open face and guides it behind square on the off-side, beats Manish and runs away to the fence

S Kaul to Raina, out Bowled!! Oh dear! The fear of the short ball has consumed Raina once again, a nice little cameo, but nothing else. He pre-empted that Kaul would bowl a short ball and shuffled across his stumps, in the process, he left the leg-stump exposed. This wasn't a short ball, just a length delivery that was heading towards the leg-stump, once Raina clipped and missed, it was curtains for the left-hander. Raina b S Kaul 22(13) [4s-4]

S Kaul to Rayudu, out Bowled!! Two in two for Kaul and SRH are back in business. Not sure what Rayudu could have done here, this is simply sensational from Siddarth, the slower ball yorker, moved away off the seam as well, opened up Rayudu completely as he played for the original angle. The ball curved in and then shaped away beautifully, Rayudu was through with the shot, the ball gently seamed past the closed bat face and crashed into the base of middle and off-stump. A duck for Rayudu and Siddarth is on a hat-trick. Rayudu b S Kaul 0(1)
S Kaul to Dhoni, FOUR, lovely shot, too short from Kaul and he can't afford it at his pace, Dhoni swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it over square leg, no chance for the fielder at long leg

Rashid Khan to Dhoni, out Bowled!! That's big, that's huge and that might have just won this match for SRH. The wrong 'un from Rashid and MS didn't read it, he was lunging forward, was perhaps looking to push it too square, the ball grazed the inside edge, went through the huge gap between bat and pad and disturbed the stumps. Rashid is thrilled to bits, so are the SRH camp. They are defending a modest target with elan once again. Dhoni b Rashid Khan 9(18) [4s-1]

Brathwaite to du Plessis, SIX, risky but much needed for du Plessis, banged in short and just outside off, du Plessis was on the back-foot, didn't get hold of the cross-batted slap, just about has enough to clear the man at long leg

Chahar to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Out first ball. Whoa! What.A.Start. Gabbar gone for nought. It was a classic away-swinger, Dhawan went chasing after that and ended up dragging it back onto his stumps, off the inside edge of course. No room for error from Chahar, bowled it on a good length and arrested Dhawan's feet movement to force an error. A mere push from Dhawan, just feeling for the ball. Dhawan b Chahar 0(1)

Chahar to Williamson, FOUR, that's what players like Williamson do. Let the bowler bowl to his strengths that is. It was full, but the line's wide of off-stump, KW leans forward and creams the drive wide of mid-off
Chahar to Williamson, FOUR, seam-up, searching for swing around middle and leg, too easy for Williamson as he shuffles to flick that wide of fine leg

Chahar to Williamson, FOUR, another hit-me on leg-stump, all Williamson needed to do was get some bat on that; he spots the line early and manages enough contact to clip that fine for a boundary. A wicket a three fours, an eventful over comes to an end

Jadeja to Manish Pandey, out Caught&Bowled!! Easy peasy! SRH lose another. Pandey's woeful season continues. Nothing but a dart on middle and leg, might have slightly gripped the surface, Pandey wanted to work it into the on-side and closed the bat face, the leading edge lobs up to the right of Jadeja, who moves across and ahead of Pathan to gobble that up. Manish Pandey c and b Jadeja 8(16)

Jadeja to Brathwaite, no run, run-out chance missed. Brathwaite taps the flatter delivery into the on-side and sets off, Pathan is not interested and the big bloke has to turn and run back, Dhoni runs forward, picks the ball and has a shy, misses and Brathwaite survives

SN Thakur to Y Pathan, FOUR, boundary after ages. Much needed one for SRH. They need to get a move on here. Full and sliding on the pads, Pathan gets enough on the flick to clear Watto at mid-wicket. No chance for the fielder in the deep to cut it off

Jadeja to Y Pathan, FOUR, excellent placement from Pathan. Waited for the quicker delivery and then back cut it past a diving backward point. Once it beat Bhajji there was no stopping that. Superb spell from Jadeja, who has come into his own as the tournament has progressed, ends with 4-0-13-1

Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, FOUR, Pathan has slowly started to up the ante. Slower short of length delivery and it sat up nicely for Pathan, who forehands the slap in front of square and gives sweeper cover no chance

Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, out Caught&Bowled!! You go boy! That is a stunner and deserves the dance moves. Bravo starts his trademark Run The World jig as soon as he completes the catch. Full delivery and Pathan's eyes lit up on seeing it, went full throttle on the drive and didn't even bother to keep it down the ground, struck it hard and low towards Bravo, who had very little time to react, but he did. Went down with both hands but the force was such that it got stuck in the right hand. Another crucial breakthrough for CSK as they get rid of a set batsman. Y Pathan c and b Dwayne Bravo 24(29) [4s-3]

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, first six of the innings, taken SRH 17 overs to smack one out of the park. Brathwaite gets the perfect length delivery, right in his arc to swing it over the deep mid-wicket fence. Went a long way back

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, back to back sixes. Thakur overcorrects by dragging the length back, but Brathwaite was up for it. In fact, he might have been waiting for it, stands tall and murders the pull over deep mid-wicket

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, small margins for errors. Thakur missed his yorker and bowled a friendly full toss, Brathwaite was waiting for it with a cleared front leg, nice clean swing of the bat and off she goes sailing over the long-on fence

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, FOUR, wow! What power! This was close to yorker length, but Brathwaite used the depth of the crease nicely, went deep to get underneath it and hammered it over extra cover. There was a fielder in the deep but he had no chance

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, Brathwaite is walking off thinking it is the end of the over. But someone tells him there's a ball to go. He was off there thinking the job is done. Short and outside off, Brathwaite stands tall and flat-bats it straight over Thakur

Lungi Ngidi to Goswami, FOUR, second slip would have gobbled that! Genuine outside edge. Just a push away from the body, the ball swerved away off a good length to click the edge and even a dive from first slip (to his left) wasn't good enough
Chahar to Williamson, FOUR, smashed! Not an error from the bowler, but that shot was all about Williamson's class. Hawkeyed the ball and freed his arms to slaughter the cut through covers

Chahar to Williamson, 3 runs, MS tries a funky flick-the-ball-to-the-stumps and it backfires, Goswami was a goner there! Flicked away to the left of deep square, Bhajji picks it late after a marathon-like sprint and what was Williamson thinking there? No three there tbh, but they decided to take on Bhajji's arm. It came flat and high which tempted MSD to try one of his tried-and-tested tacticts to run Goswami out. Unfortunately, missed by a big margin. Goswami wasn't even in the frame

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, out Bhuvneshwar Run Out!! Bhuvneshwar is run-out trying to steal a bye. MS does not miss out on the opportunity. Bouncer on middle and leg, Brathwaite shuffled across, got inside the line and failed to connect with the pull shot, Bhuvneshwar called for the run and he was caught well short. Dhoni hitting the sticks with an under-arm throw. Excellent finish to the SRH innings though, 20 runs off the final over. Bhuvneshwar run out (Dhoni) 7(11)
Lungi Ngidi to Goswami, FOUR, too full and gets slammed! Right in the swinging arc for Goswami who times the pants of a flashy drive and gets it in the gap through covers

Lungi Ngidi to Goswami, out Caught&Bowled!! Excellent return catch from Ngidi. Ensured he didn't offer any room to Goswami there, bowled it on a length and extracted some zip off the pitch; Goswami had nowhere to go, went flat and hard, ended up splicing it straight to Ngidi who bent down to claim a clean, low catch. Ngidi is pumped and so is CSK. Goswami c and b Lungi Ngidi 12(9) [4s-2]

SN Thakur to Williamson, out Caught by Dhoni!! Is that the game for CSK? Tom Moody looks stunned. An absolute gift of a wicket this. Short and drifting down leg, Williamson senses a boundary-scoring opportunity and gives it a real whack, no bat. It spooned up off the glove and travelled straight into the bucket hands of MS behind the stumps. Williamson c Dhoni b SN Thakur 24(15) [4s-4]
SN Thakur to Shakib, FOUR, cross-seam delivery, width on offer, Shakib stands tall and stabs it through covers. The fielders on the off-side ring stay unmoved
Chahar to Shakib, FOUR, sits up from back of a length, Shakib had all the time in the world to pick his spot; swivels and muscles the pull behind square

Dwayne Bravo to Shakib, out Caught by Dhoni!! Strangle down leg episode 2!! CSK are literally strangling SRH here. Another SRH batsman gets out to a poor delivery. It was slow, down leg and asking to be whacked, Shakib swivels and tries to oblige, ends up dragging it off his glove which makes a tiny tickle off his thigh pad before nestling into Dhoni's mitts. CSK are on fire.... Shakib c Dhoni b Dwayne Bravo 12(10) [4s-2]
Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, Narine wastes no time in getting away. Backs away to this flatter ball, to make room, and bashes it through the covers. KKR are away

Gowtham to Narine, out Stumped!! Gowtham has his revenge instantly! After the last boundary, I was beginning to think that RR have missed a trick by giving Gowtham the new ball, again, with Narine on strike. But hasn't the off spinner justified the decision or what! Clever bowling, expected Narine to give the charge and hung it up in the air a touch more on a slightly shorter length. The West Indian didn't bother adjusting to the length, that's not his way anyway and goes through with the shot. A bit of grip off the surface and whizzes past the edge. Easy for Klaasen. Narine st Klaasen b Gowtham 4(2) [4s-1]

Gowtham to Uthappa, byes, FOUR, that's beaten everyone! Lots of turn on this off break and Uthappa brings out the reverse sweep to combat it. Cannot connect and Klaasen didn't anticipate the spin either. Races away

Laughlin to Shubman Gill, FOUR, and now young Gill takes a leaf out of his skipper's book. The seam-up ball that held its line just outside off, Gill is pretty glued to the crease and smartly just uses the pace of the bowler to guide it to third man. Beats Sodhi on this occasion, who tried his best but couldn't stop it
Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, there's that customary dragger from the leggie. Rare loose ball, short and width for the taking, Gill carves his bat staying deep and finds the gap, beats point

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, SIX, Gill is getting a move on. Knew what was coming from Gopal, it was the juicy leg-break. Gill charges out and tonks it through the line over long-off. Archer can only watch it sail over his head for a maximum

Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, SIX, this maximum brings the 50-stand up for the duo. Another drag down delivery from Gopal, comes off the final ball of his spell. Karthik sees it early, pivots back and smacks it over cow corner. Feel for Gopal, he's bowled so well, just that lost his line and lengths in his last over

Jofra Archer to Shubman Gill, FOUR, Eden Gardens is loving it. Fearsome striking by Gill. No margin for error at all, Archer errs by giving him the width, Gill stands tall and crashes it through extra cover. Fierce!

Jofra Archer to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Klaasen!! And does him next ball. Archer retaliates. Sticks to his strengths. Keeps it short and cramps Gill for room and space. Gill was backing away, in a bid to slash it through point. Is defeated by the extra bounce and zip. Gets a faint nick and Klaasen nestles it in his gloves. The partnership has been broken and KKR lose half their side. Shubman Gill c Klaasen b Jofra Archer 28(17) [4s-3 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to A Russell, SIX, wades into Archer. Just cannot bowl there for Russell. Goes full and at the stumps, Russell takes his front leg out of the way and dismisses it over long-on. Sheer disdain

Unadkat to Karthik, SIX, top-edge but it's that sort of an edge that batsman loves. Unorthodoxy by Karthik, moves across to hoick it across the line with a horizontal bat. A fat top-edge is found and it's going only one way. Over the keeper's head and off she goes for half-a-dozen. Fifty up for the skipper, much vital this for the team. Raises his bat and the dug-out in all applauses

Unadkat to A Russell, SIX, Unadkat's nightmarish day continues. Cutter to Russell? Too full and Russell feasts on it. Sets up a low stance and hacks it violently through mid-wicket. Flat and the deep mid-wicket fielder was lining up, but it cleared Samson in the end. Hits his fingertips and parries over. Brutal
Unadkat to A Russell, FOUR, Unadkat is not learning. Just shortens his length and keeps it outside off, Russell reaches out and slaps it through extra cover. Rocketed away to the fence

Laughlin to Karthik, out Caught by Rahane!! Eden Gardens is shellshocked. Reason - Karthik perishes. Laughlin strikes gold and is pumped. The top-of-the-hand slower ball, on a fuller length. Karthik was shaping up for a biff across the line, loses his shape and loses his timing as well. Slicing it up in the air towards extra cover. Rahane keeps his eyes on the ball, back-pedals and holds on. Karthik c Rahane b Laughlin 52(38) [4s-4 6s-2]

Laughlin to A Russell, SIX, incredible! How do you bowl to this guy? Laughlin digs in the slower short ball, Russell stayed back but had to generate some power to clear the deep mid-wicket fielder. Gets more than enough to power it into the crowd

Laughlin to A Russell, SIX, woah. Change up from Laughlin, ushers in the pacy bouncer at Russell's torso. Took the gamble but didn't come off well. Russell pulls it over his head and dismisses it over fine leg. All the way!

Jofra Archer to A Russell, SIX, phew! That bat-speed and the muscle power from Russell. Didn't get it off the middle but it hardly matters to him. The back of the hand slower ball, rising up and Russell forehand swats it over long-off. Sends it a long way over long-off. Came off the bottom, still dispatched it for a maximum. How?

Laughlin to A Russell, FOUR, misses the length and Russell makes him pay. Clears his front leg, unleashes his bottom hand and whacks it across the line, the practice pitches help his cause. Trickles away wide of long-on

Laughlin to Searles, out Caught by Jofra Archer!! Laughlin hoodwinking the batsmen with his canny slower balls. This was on a length around off, Searles swung it hard, lost his shape and skied it as far as long-off. Two fielders were converging and Archer completes the catch in the end running forward. A dot ball but Russell gets back on strike. Blessing in disguise? Eh? Searles c Jofra Archer b Laughlin 2(5)
Laughlin to A Russell, FOUR, wow! Bludgeoned away. Russell gets deep in his crease, Laughlin fails to nail the yorker. And Russell caresses it through extra cover

Gowtham to Uthappa, out Caught&Bowled!! Soft, soft dismissal! Gowtham is on a roll here! It's Uthappa who has to go and another massive blow to KKR. This was tossed up generously and perhaps held onto the pitch a tad. Uthappa didn't help his cause by trying to work across the line. The leading edge balloons towards Gowtham who just has to leap a touch from his tall frame to grab the return catch. The hosts have been jolted here at Eden Gardens. It's all happening. Uthappa c and b Gowtham 3(7)

Gowtham to Chris Lynn, FOUR, bludgeoned away! Typical brute force from Lynn. He had been trying to break free for a while now and finally, gets one away. Not much room, but he makes some by backing away and smacks it away through the gap at cover. Nobody moved

Jofra Archer to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Unadkat!! Atrocious from Rana! Another one bites the dust and KKR are clearly struggling at the moment. They aren't helping their cause either by not adapting to this surface. Short of a length from Archer and Rana once again backs away, like he did previous ball. What he also did, was to try a weird slog that was never a percentage stroke on this pitch. Only manages it high, off the inside half of the bat, towards mid-on. Nitish Rana c Unadkat b Jofra Archer 3(5)

Jofra Archer to Karthik, FOUR, beautifully timed! Karthik is away with a sublime stroke. Half volley on the pads, he latches onto it with a wristy flick that's placed quite wide of the fine leg fielder

Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, up and over! Loosener from Unadkat to start with, wide half volley and Karthik just ensures that he clears the infield. That he does so with a front-footed lofted chip over cover. Easily done

Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, cracking stroke! The previous one was a bad ball but this is just a stunning shot. There was width but on a length, Karthik just went through on the front foot and thumped the drive on the up. Bisected mid-off and extra cover easily

Unadkat to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Lynn joins the party. Have to say that Unadkat is releasing all the pressure built with some poor bowling. Once again gifts width outside off and Lynn was waiting for this for a while now. Frees his arms to go over cover. Didn't middle that well but still had enough to go over the infield

Shreyas Gopal to Chris Lynn, out Caught&Bowled!! Another return catch. There were a few at the Wankhede yesterday and the Eden surface is creating the same havoc. The googly from Gopal which sticks onto the pitch a touch, Lynn wanted to work it away off the back foot but could only spoon it back to the leg spinner. A scratchy innings from the Australian. Never looked comfortable on this pitch. Right then, that means more responsibility for DK. Chris Lynn c and b Shreyas Gopal 18(22) [4s-2]

Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, FOUR, deft by Karthik. This is sliding down leg and on the shorter side as well. He just gets across to get a tickle that beats Klaasen. Quick outfield and short fine leg's chase is in vain
A Russell to Rahane, SIX, ah Jinks. Gets a wide-short combo, Rahane rocks back, sways, but the hands are quick to pounce on. Cuts, airy and that Centurion-2003 moment as it flies into deep point
Prasidh to Rahane, FOUR, feeds the pads. Rahane gets on his toes, shuffling inside the line and whippy hands in flicking it in front of square. The class .. sheer tons of it
A Russell to Samson, 1 run, the partnership between Samson and Rahane is now 50. Uppish tuck to an in-ducker and has been fielded at deep mid. A single

Narine to Samson, SIX, that is a jail-break from Samson! Retaliation from the batter as he camped back to smoke a sixer over deep mid. That was gargantuan from the young man and 61 is needed now. RR, more importantly Samson, needed that

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, out Caught&Bowled!! The time-out has struck. That was a flighted ball, the batsman skews the sweep back and the bowler does the rest. Caught and bowled is trending. The googly dipped, spun a little and the lack of pace from the wicket also helped. Huge strike for KKR. They are back in this. Rahane c and b Kuldeep Yadav 46(41) [4s-4 6s-1]
Narine to Klaasen, FOUR, the reverse sweep! Played with disdain as he lofted it high over short third man for a four. He did it against the Indian spinners in South Africa. Rang a bell?

Chawla to Samson, FOUR, low full toss, trying for a yorker but gets it wrong. That was 120kph! The batsman though stays calm, maintains his shape and open-faces the ball over cover for a four. The deep cover was too straight. Three men were around the point region
Chawla to Samson, 1 run, uppish tuck, awkwardly done but fifty it is from the young man. In the night of the eliminator, he has come good. Gutsy knock from him

Chawla to Samson, out Caught by Searles!! Gone. Taken at long-on. That was dragged short, quicker as well. The batsman went for the pull but there was no distance on it. A lot of elevation though and was taken in the deep. Huge strike again from KKR. They keep dragging this back. The batsman got a bit carried away with the length I guess but the half-trackers have done the job in this edition of the IPL. Samson c Searles b Chawla 50(38) [4s-4 6s-2]

Prasidh to Binny, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! Slower dipping full toss and the slog sweep, sans any power, finds the man at square leg. Huge wicket or a blessing in disguise for KKR? Tough to say. It would bring in Gowtham. Three dot balls from him will hurt RR. But my word, this boy is special. Nailed the blockhole stuff and slower balls to perfection. Binny c Chris Lynn b Prasidh 0(3)

Chawla to R Tripathi, FOUR, rare float up. So unlike Chawla .. wide, asking for treatment. And obliged. Tripathi reaches out to the pitch, clearing his back leg and then full flowing hands as he drills it through the covers

Chawla to Rahane, no run, quick skidder. Rahane's done in, struck on his pad. And the umpire gives into Chawla's celebratory LBW appeal. Tripathi doesn't allow him to leave, forces him to review. So Rahane's well deep in the crease, doesn't read the googly, is beaten on pace as well. But he's struck on the front pad. And yes .. the angle is enough to take it down leg.

Prasidh to Gowtham, FOUR, mark the calendar! KKR vs SRH - 25th May! KKR win this by 25 runs as they did the choking act much better than RR in the death overs. RR's dream run has been stalled. The last ball was short, the pull was not controlled but went fine on the on-side for a four. Did not matter

Prasidh to Rahane, FOUR, 134.1kph. Sitting up in the slot, nicely getting onto the hips at a good height for Rahane to latch. Does it with a swiping glance, getting airborne and pinching the mid-wicket gap

Prasidh to Rahane, FOUR, typical overcompensate. After a drifter into the pads, Krishna goes into a bouncer, wide outside off. Rahane has his timing tonight, and enough on it to jump-cut it square. The powerplay's enough to do its bit
Narine to R Tripathi, SIX, there's long-on. But why bother when you can time it like this. Narine tosses his carrom ball full, Tripathi's down on a knee already. And smoking it .. 20 rows back
Narine to R Tripathi, SIX, it can get longer. Tripathi makes his 'V' bigger, clears his leg, sits as usual. And it's for cow corner's crowds to try and grab that lakh

Narine to R Tripathi, no run, massive inside edge. But DK's desperation in the carnage forces him to go upstairs. So Tripathi's pinned on the back foot. And yes .. it's a big chunk of the wood onto his pad

Chawla to R Tripathi, out Caught&Bowled!! Oh Chawla. Ignore that stout frame, he has a habit of plucking one-handed stunners - surely when he's the bowler. Tripathi couldn't have defended it with harder hands, he gets all traditional in a front foot block. And the ball instead of dying down, ends up being the wrong 'un, takes the splice and pops up to Chawla's right, who's palm stuck out is enough. R Tripathi c and b Chawla 20(13) [4s-1 6s-2]

Narine to Rahane, FOUR, no Rahane ain't cheeky enough for these late cuts. Just can't line himself up right, just about fetches it out of DK's gloves as he outside-edges it past the cordon. Ah, never mind
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, FOUR, juicy half tracker. Samson waits, waits some more. And some more. Loads up a pull, with all the muscle to swat it away through mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, FOUR, rubs in some more elegance. Clears his back leg, reads the flight, reads the googly and inside-outs it over extra cover. Oh Kolkata need the breather .. time-out
Searles to Samson, SIX, 122.9kph of a filthy nothing. Samson stays up tall, swinging horizontally. Picks up the empty mid-wicket and a 68-meter hit will do
Searles to Samson, FOUR, more width. Samson's as good as most with flat-bats. This time he's carving them behind point. Absolute crunch
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, length ball wide outside off, a horizontal-batted crash to deep point for four. They're away
K Khaleel Ahmed to Narine, FOUR, full delivery sliding towards the on-side, a tickle away to fine leg for four. @143.6km/h, good pace

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, no frickin' way! Lady luck can't possibly be so mean! Back of a length outside off, jumps up and catches Chris Lynn by surprise, who gets a leading edge which, believe me, goes through the gap at deep backward point for four

Rashid Khan to Uthappa, out Bowled!! That's not very smart from Uthappa, his flattened leg-stump tells him the same. The very first ball he faces from Rashid, he tries to reverse-sweep him premeditatedly. It was too full to be doing that. The ball slid on under his bat and crashed his wicket away. Off you go, says Rashid with a twirl of his wrist. Uthappa b Rashid Khan 2(8)

Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Lynn has made his mind up. He isn't deviating from it. This is what he'll do, live or die. Length ball at the stumps, and he sweeps it away through square leg. It was uppish, and there was a fielder in the ring, but he got it to his left
Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, beautiful footwork from Karthik, so nimble. He's been in such sublime form. The length is short, which he picks in a flash, and pummels the pull through mid-wicket

Shakib to Karthik, out Bowled!! What a massive wicket! Sunrisers are absolutely pumped, with Shakib furiously swinging his hand in celebration. Oh, this form. Such a tricky thing. Karthik gets carried away a touch, tries cutting a ball from off-stump and chops it back onto leg. The length wasn't short either, and his balance just wasn't there as he was leaning backward in trying to manufacture the room which wasn't there. This match is well and truly alive. Karthik b Shakib 8(6) [4s-1]

Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, out Lbw!! Lynn falls sweeping. That was his ploy against spin. He was aware of the dangers associated with it, and was willing to take them anyway. Rashid's googly skids back in sharply and hits him on the knee-roll in front of off and middle. Plumb. What a turnaround this. Chris Lynn lbw b Rashid Khan 48(31) [4s-6 6s-2]

Shakib to A Russell, no run, is that a drop? Arm-ball, slides back in and probably takes an inside-edge onto pad before popping towards Saha who never gets his gloves in the right place. Shakib with a priceless reaction, collapsing at the bowler's end

Rashid Khan to A Russell, out Caught by Dhawan!! What has Russell done here. What has he done? He can't believe it. Takes a moment to himself, before striding back into the pavilion. Flat googly turning in from outside off, Russell decides to go for a big cut, just unable to resist his attacking instincts. He's too cramped up to get it away, the ball fizzes off the edge, straight into the hands of Dhawan at slip. Rashid Khan, wow. A Russell c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 3(7)

K Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, FOUR, stunning timing from Shubman Gill! Back of length outside off, Gill didn't even go through with this back foot punch. He checks the shot late, but it skims off the sweet spot to beat Williamson at extra cover
batsman: K Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill

comment: K Khaleel Ahmed to Chawla, SIX, clears the front leg to this length ball and muscles it over mid-wicket. Length ball from Khaleel, right into Chawla's arc. 14 off the over to revive KKR's chase

Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, FOUR, Bhuvneshwar dared to put his hands up, but he wasn't stopping this. A bit short of the blockhole this time, Gill accentuates the error by going deep in his crease and drills it hard and straight. Keeps KKR breathing

S Kaul to Chawla, out Bowled!! Off-stump ripped off! Kaul points to the heavens. Williamson claps. SRH leap closer. Full ball on middle, Chawla eyes an inside-out drive after clearing his front leg but only gets an outside edge to send the ball smashing into the off pole. Chawla b S Kaul 12(12) [6s-1]

S Kaul to Shivam Mavi, 1 run, this is unbelievable bowling under pressure. Yorker on off, Mavi jams it to short cover and then they run, because they have to, and not because it was on. Direct-hit would have ended Gill and with him, KKR's hopes

S Kaul to Shubman Gill, SIX, and clears long-off! Gill has ensured that there will still be some pressure on the weaker bowling option - whoever that is, when the final over starts. Full ball outside off, Gill is deep in the crease to smash it back down the ground. Powers it into the crowd
Brathwaite to Shivam Mavi, FOUR, how are the nerves now SRH? How are the nerves now Carlos? Full ball outside off, Mavi slices it away over backward point

Brathwaite to Shivam Mavi, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Slogs, connects hard and flat, but picks out deep mid-wicket, and who should it be there. Of course Rashid Khan. To Brathwaite's credit, he bowled this pretty full and prevented Mavi from getting much elevation. KKR will at least have Gill on strike. Shivam Mavi c Rashid Khan b Brathwaite 6(4) [4s-1]

Brathwaite to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Rashid Khan has gobbled this up like a candy in the deep. What ridiculous ease. Full ball on leg stump from round the wicket, Brathwaite's round the wicket angle cramped Gill up meaning that there was no power behind the shot. He merely chipped it up. Rashid settles under it, around five yards in front of the boundary, and swallows it. Shubman Gill c Rashid Khan b Brathwaite 30(20) [4s-2 6s-1]
K Khaleel Ahmed to Chris Lynn, SIX, slower one at 127km/h, length ball outside off, child's play for Lynn, who smokes this flat over deep extra cover for six
batsman: K Khaleel Ahmed to Chris Lynn

comment: Bhuvneshwar to Narine, FOUR, 3rd full-toss from Bhuvi! Low full-toss around off, Narine punches that to sweeper cover for four. Pure timing!
Bhuvneshwar to Narine, SIX, length ball outside off, Narine effortlessly tonks it over long-off for six! Just over the rope...

Bhuvneshwar to Narine, FOUR, wow, Bhuvi under pressure straight away! Is Narine the new Jayasuriya? A back of a length delivery drifting into the pads, a slog across the line, and a thick inside edge to backward square leg for four
Bhuvneshwar to Narine, FOUR, another back of a length ball, and just cross-batted disdainfully over the bowler's head for four. No respect!

S Kaul to Narine, out Caught by Brathwaite!! Knuckle ball by Kaul does the trick! Full delivery on middle and leg, Narine was always trying to get under it and loft it away over long-on, but gets a mile of height on it, but not distance. Brathwaite settles under it and lets out a roar, and somewhere hidden underneath it, a sigh of relief. Narine c Brathwaite b S Kaul 26(13) [4s-4 6s-1]
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, full toss down leg, tickled away to fine leg for four

K Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana, SIX, fractionally short, skidding outside off, Nitish Rana could've done that without an ounce of muscle in his forearms, cheekily steers that upper cut over the jumping giant (Brathwaite) at third man for six
batsman: K Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana

comment: K Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana, SIX, into the stratosphere and back! Oh these massive top-edges! Bat regulations who? Shortish and angling into the body, Nitish Rana turns on his heels into a Ganguly-pull towards fine leg as the spectators' have a deja-vu. High into the sky and lands just over fine leg
batsman: K Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana

comment: S Kaul to Chris Lynn, SIX, length ball outside off, Chris Lynn gets out of the way, gives himself room, and launches this over long-off for an 85-meter six

Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, no run, interesting stuff. SRH have gone for the review for LBW. Leg-break straightening and the sweep takes the glove on it's way! The appeal was for an LBW, but there was glove on it. It actually came off the glove, but the keeper has dropped it.

Brathwaite to Nitish Rana, 1 run, back of a length delivery on the hips, dropped off the back foot to square leg where Williamson picks up and throws at the non-striker's end. He wasn't even in the frame when the ball crossed the stumps. Terrible running from Rana
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, FOUR, short and wide, Chris Lynn slashes at it, gets it over the infield towards third man for four
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, FOUR, wide half-volley outside off, Chris Lynn has his feet glued to the turf and lofts it towards sweeper cover for four. Lands about a centimeter short of the rope
Shakib to Nitish Rana, FOUR, flat and angling towards middle, Nitish Rana switches his stance into a right-hander's, reverse-sweeps to third man for four

Shakib to Nitish Rana, out Nitish Rana Run Out!! 1 run completed. You've gotta be kidding me! Full ball nurdled away towards deep mid-wicket, Rashid (who can't be kept out of the game) fires in the throw at the keeper's end. Rana, who slipped at the non-striker's end, ran to the danger end (the striker's end) for the fatal second run and was caught just marginally short. Throws his bat in disgust as he walks back, embarrassed. Nitish Rana run out (Rashid Khan/Saha) 22(16) [4s-1 6s-2]

Prasidh to Saha, no run, Saha is looking very nervous, pushes a length ball straight to Uthappa at short extra-cover and set-off for a quick single. Dhawan wasn't coming this time, Saha has to turn around, put the dive and make his ground

Kuldeep Yadav to Saha, FOUR, lovely, Saha is sweeping Kuldeep into frustration, this was very full and well wide of off, Saha bent down low and then swept it in front of square on the on-side. Lynn was very square on the on-side and even a big dive can't help him pull the ball back into play

Chawla to Shakib, FOUR, boundaries starting to flow for SRH. They need to move on here. Chawla has been too full today and this was no different, googly overpitched and Shakib drills the drive through extra cover. The fielder at long-off didn't even bother to chase

Chawla to Saha, out Stumped!! Saha is waiting. Not sure why? They are checking whether Karthik has the ball in his gloves, he does. It pops out after the stumps are broken. So that is fine. TV umpire is having multiple looks. Why is he taking so much time? The square leg umpire had raised the finger and just because Saha stood his ground, the umpires went upstairs. Finally, we have a decision and it is OUT. The Eden crowd had to wait for almost three minutes to start their celebration. The googly and Saha hung back to nudge it into the on-side, gets an inside edge onto the under side of the thigh pad and the ball rolls back towards Karthik, Saha was taking off for the run and by the time he saw where the ball was, DK had broken the stumps. The ball did slip out of his grasp, but that was after he had lit the LEDs. Saha st Karthik b Chawla 35(27) [4s-5]

Chawla to Shakib, FOUR, Shakib backed away to free his arms and unlike Narine, Chawla tosses it up on the stumps, right sort of room to play the drive and Shakib places it perfectly past extra cover, even beat long-off to his right

Narine to Shakib, FOUR, half tracker and Shakib makes him pay. There was ample width as well, Shakib reached out and flayed the cut behind square on the off-side, no chance for the sweeper cover to get across

Narine to Shakib, FOUR, now to the other side of the ground. Bit more air and Shakib fetches the sweep from outside off, he rolled his wrists to place it in front square on the leg-side - right between deep mid-wicket and long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Deepak Hooda, out Shakib Run Out!! KKR keep chipping away at the wickets. Just when the partnership had started to built, they have got rid of the set batsman. Floaty delivery and Deepak clears his front leg to have a clean swing at that, drills it straight back and Kuldeep gets a fingertip on it before the ball crashes into the stumps. Shakib was backing up and he had no time to make his way back. Caught well short of the crease. Shakib is disappointed and keeps shaking his head as he makes his way to the dugout. Shakib run out (Kuldeep Yadav) 28(24) [4s-4]

Kuldeep Yadav to Deepak Hooda, SIX, Hooda is not bothered with a wicket or the break. First ball after the break and he sends it soaring over the fence for a maximum. Tossed up delivery on a fullish length, Hooda just went through the line and lofted it handsomely over long-on

Narine to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by Chawla!! Well, the conventional sweep didn't work so lets try the reverse sweep. It still doesn't come off and Hooda has to go. The off-break from Narine and kept turning into Hooda, who shaped to play the reverse sweep/pull, fetched it from outside leg and spliced it towards backward point. Chawla ran back a few yards and reverse cupped it. In fact, Hooda changed his grip and tried the switch hit. Deepak Hooda c Chawla b Narine 19(19) [6s-1]

Prasidh to Brathwaite, SIX, that is the problem with yorkers, you can't miss it by much. Nice juicy full toss and Brathwaite said thank you very much by depositing it into the cow corner fence for half a dozen

Prasidh to Brathwaite, out Brathwaite Run Out!! 1 run completed. Brilliant bit of work from Rana. Brathwaite is down on the floor and he takes ages to make his way back. Very full and almost close to the yorker length, Brathwaite slices it with an open bat face wide of short third man, Rana runs to his left from deep backward point, flings full length to stop the ball and then bullets a flat throw right next to the stumps to Karthik. There was never a second and even though Brathwaite put in the dive, he was well short. Huge wicket at this stage for KKR. They have removed one of the big hitters. Brathwaite run out (Nitish Rana/Karthik) 8(4) [6s-1]

Prasidh to Rashid Khan, FOUR, streaky! But that is the way Rashid plays. Short and outside off, he just threw the kitchen sink at it and the top-edge flies over a leaping Karthik. Big over for SRH, but the loss of Brathwaite would hurt them

Shivam Mavi to Y Pathan, out Caught by Chawla!! Now Pathan is gone. KKR are on fire. They are catching everything, running batsman out and bowling to their fields. Full and outside off, Pathan thought it was in his range and went for the loft over long-off, got it off the toe-end and skied it towards deep cover. It was in the air for a long time and Chawla held his nerve to cling on. Y Pathan c Chawla b Shivam Mavi 3(7)

Shivam Mavi to Rashid Khan, SIX, Chawla in action again and this time he parries it over. Misjudged it completely. Rashid charged down and threw everything at the back of a length delivery, sliced it towards sweeper cover and Chawla ran forward to take the catch, got fingertips to it and parried it over. Had he stood his ground, it was coming straight to him

Shivam Mavi to Rashid Khan, SIX, Rashid is playing a blinder here. And he still has one over to go. Can he get SRH to 165-170? Full and outside off, Rashid reaches out for it, down on knee and smashing it a long way back into the deep extra cover stand. A top order batsman would have been proud of that shot

Prasidh to Bhuvneshwar, FOUR, good start to the over, some glove love as well between Bhuvi and Rashid. Short and outside off, Bhuvi arches back and carves the cut over backward point. No one out there to stop that from reaching the fence

Prasidh to Rashid Khan, FOUR, lovely batting from Rashid. It was the slower delivery and he didn't try to overhit it, saw mid-off inside the circle and delayed his loft for a second, struck it cleanly and got a one bounce four

Prasidh to Rashid Khan, SIX, oh geez! "This is the shot of the innings," calls Sanjay M on air and couldn't agree more. Full on off, Rashid went deep in the crease and whipped it with all his bottom hand over deep backward square. It was just a flick of the wrists and the pace of Prasidh took care of the rest

Prasidh to Dhawan, SIX, cracking shot, that should get Dhawan and SRH off and running, a friendly length ball on Dhawan's pads, he picked it up, used Prasidh's pace and clipped it high and behind square on the on-side, went a long way over the ropes for a maximum

Shivam Mavi to Saha, 1 run, chance and dropped, DK with the big gloves called for the catch, Lynn - who was very near the ball moved away and then the captain shells it. That's a bad miss from DK, coming to the ball, it was another ugly slog from Saha, got it off the toe-end, very high and towards square leg. Karthik had plenty of time, but the ball seemed to swirl away at the very end and that perhaps put him off

Prasidh to Rashid Khan, SIX, Rashid, you beauty! He has given SRH the total they were looking for. 24 runs off the final over. Just what the doctor order for SRH. It was the slow off-cutter and Rashid picked the bones out of that, waited for it and thumped it over the long-on fence for a maximum. Tom Moody, the SRH coach, now affords a smile and has a word with Williamson

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, smashed, Saha had to jump and get out of the way, it was coming at a rate of knots, back of a length delivery outside off, Dhawan got forward and absolutely drilled it back at the non-striker, no need to run for those

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, lovely, four men in that off-side ring and still Dhawan manages to pierce the gap. The slower ball from Russell, a hint of width on offer and Dhawan was all over it, crashes it square past cover-point and watches it hit the ropes

Shivam Mavi to Saha, FOUR, edged and four, handy runs for Saha, back of a length and rising onto the batsman, Saha didn't get on top of the bounce, was looking to cut, gets a thick edge that runs away past the lone slip

Shivam Mavi to Saha, FOUR, cracking shot, that might help Saha break the shackles, on a good length and just outside off, he plonked his front-foot forward and lifted it through the line, over mid-wicket and almost all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Chawla to Dhawan, FOUR, lovely shot, very full from Chawla, right in the zone for Dhawan, he gets his front-foot forward and drills it to the left of the umpire. The two fielders in the deep have no chance
Chawla to Dhawan, 1 run, tossed up well outside off, Dhawan bends down low and sweeps it towards deep mid-wicket for a single

Chawla to Dhawan, FOUR, cracking shot, Chawla has been too full this over, Dhawan gets forward, gets close to the ball and drills it back past the non-striker, even a big dive at long-off can't stop the ball, it was Prasidh there

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, out Lbw!! Kuldeep is on all fours and on the ground, but he has a wicket first-ball. This is as plumb as it gets, Dhawan is gutted with himself as he walks back to the hut, didn't even consider reviewing it, it was as dead as one gets. Coming to the ball, this was nicely floated around middle, a hint of shape and that was enough to beat the batsman, Dhawan was shaping for the sweep, the ball was too full for that, he missed and was struck on the back-thigh, adjacent to middle-stump. It was going to crash into middle and umpire Nitin Menon has one of the easier LBW decisions of his career. Dhawan lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 34(24) [4s-4 6s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, out Caught by Karthik!! Two wickets in the over and Kuldeep is on a roll. The wrong 'un and Williamson has been done in completely. He has a word with his partner, but decides against a review, off he goes. Is this the game turning over? Coming to the ball, this was nicely tossed up around off, Williamson prodded forward on the drive, but unlike the previous ball - he didn't get to the pitch of it. The bat hit the ground, the ball caught the outside edge and Karthik completes a fine catch. Williamson c Karthik b Kuldeep Yadav 3(3)
Prasidh to Saha, FOUR, beautifully played, a rare bad ball from KKR tonight, a floaty half-volley outside off, Saha leans into the shot, finds the gap past cover and watches it roll away to the fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Saha, no run, appeal for LBW and Kuldeep prods his captain to go for the review. It's a fair delivery and replays suggest that there was some bat on that. Ultraedge confirms it and KKR have lost their review. This was very full and on the leg-stump line, Saha was looking to sweep and the inside edge perhaps saved him

Kuldeep Yadav to Saha, FOUR, nicely played by Saha, Narine gave up the chase very early, this was tossed up on middle, Saha went down low, used the pace on the ball and lapped it fine, beat short fine and rolled away to the fence

Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, punched away off the back foot with a slightly horizontal bat. Stays forward and takes care of the shortish ball. Not too short and the batsman thumped the ball away. He is in good form

Rashid Khan to Raina, FOUR, round the wicket, fired down leg, Raina tries a sweep, gets a tickle on it to get it away to (extremely) fine leg for four. Almost long stop. Runs coming in a hurry for CSK
Shakib to Watson, SIX, over the wicket, odd angle for Shaks, Watson gets low and plays a hybrid sweepull over backward square leg for six. Fifty up for Watto! Big match, and the big man stands up!
Shakib to Raina, SIX, tossed up on an enticing length outside off, Raina reaches out and gets to the pitch, check-lofts it over long-on for six! Raina turning it on in a big match!

Brathwaite to Watson, FOUR, this will do. This will do for CSK. Slower ball but Brathwaite landed that way too short, pulled powerfully through mid-wicket and it's well wide of the fielder in the deep

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, low full toss and he's crashed that over extra-cover, the shoulders are dropping in the Orange camp. The yellow in the stands is very bright. Watson got down low on his knees and loft-drove that

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, oh my word! How on earth has he managed to hit that so well and so cleanly? This is actually a slower ball very well disguised by Sandeep Sharma, Watson was beaten for pace, almost was early into the shot, but managed somehow to reach out and muscle the ball over long-on
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, and he's not done yet! Don't bowl full tosses sir! At least not when he's in this mood. Watson waits for the ball and smashes it over the mid-wicket boundary

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, hat-trick of sixes. He's carrying a niggle, but he's hitting them cleanly. Gee, what a turnaround this has been been. Took 11 balls to get off the mark and now he's 82 off 44. Length ball and Watson blasts that over long-on

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, oh this is sublime batting from Watson. Knows Sandeep Sharma is going for the wide yorker with third man inside the ring and he smartly squeezes it in the gap between short third man and backward point. A massive 27-run-game-killing over

Brathwaite to Raina, out Caught by Goswami!! That's the end of a fantastic 117-run stand. Sharp bouncer from Brathwaite. We all know Raina has a problem with the short ball, glad SRH thought about it too. This was a really good steepler cramping Raina on the half-hook shot, was almost trying to evade, the ball catches the glove and Goswami jumps to catch the ball. The appeal was confident, umpire Marais Erasmus said no. SRH went for the review and Raina walked off without waiting for the replays because he knew he hit that. Raina c Goswami b Brathwaite 32(24) [4s-3 6s-1]

Brathwaite to Watson, FOUR, audacious is the word for this shot. The bowler runs in and bowls a pacy length ball, this lad doesn't move and just opens the face of the bat at the very last moment to beat the diving short third man fielder. He's playing around with the bowlers and the fielders
Brathwaite to Watson, SIX, he wants to finish this early. He is just a hit away from a hundred now. Back of a length delivery on the stumps, Watson pulls and clears deep mid-wicket

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run, googly from Rashid Khan, Rayudu reads off the surface and plays off the back foot, gets hit on the pad first before the ball touched the bat, but Rayudu was well outside the line of off stump, review wasted
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, SIX, two dot balls and Rayudu has had enough. Runs at the bowler and nonchalantly lofts it over wide long-off, easily clears the rope

Rashid Khan to Watson, 1 run, take a bow, Shane Robert Watson. He becomes the fourth player to have two or more hundreds in an IPL season. If at all you are struggling in life, just watch this innings folks. This is a serious life lesson. He couldn't time the ball, was only hitting it to hand, was getting beaten, his first run came off the 11th ball he faced, but he didn't lose heart. Backed himself like his captain always does and he now has a hundred off 51 balls. When his trigger is that slight movement backwards with a gentle hop of the front leg, you know as a bowler he's in the zone. He switched gears and muscled all the bowlers around. The hundred ball though was just a gentle push to the left of cover and off comes the helmet, great applause from the crowd and the CSK dugout and soaks them all in with his hands aloft
Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, cheeky, gets inside the line of this googly and paddles it past the man at short fine leg, this is clever batting from Watson

Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, the fielder at deep backward square leg has misjudged this. Watson slogged this in the air, the fielder dived but couldn't get there. On the biggest night, CSK have negated Rashid Khan without a wicket
S Kaul to Watson, FOUR, oh that's a bowler-killer. Luckily it didn't come very straight at Kaul. Very full from Kaul, Watson drills it hard and beats long-off

S Kaul to Watson, FOUR, and he's doing it in style. Kaul tries the yorker and Watson drives it straight and hard, Kaul takes his leg out of the way to save himself and the ball rockets to the boundary

Brathwaite to Rayudu, FOUR, that's it! Chennai Super Kings are champions of IPL for the third time. What a brilliant return to the stage this is from CSK after a two-year ban. The players rush to the middle to mob Watson. Meanwhile, captain Dhoni is gently walking around with a gentle smile of his
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, full, too full and biffed! Murdered down the ground past the bowler for a four. The man at mid-off had no chance

Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, out Caught&Bowled!! The slower ball and that lands a wicket. The ball holds up thanks to knuckle ball and the lifted hit finds the bowler's hands. The bowler called for it and takes it. He charged out and tried to go aerial but never timed it. Watson's dot ball a reason for this? Might well be. CSK are off to the worst possible start. du Plessis c and b Sandeep Sharma 10(11) [4s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, biffed away! That goes the journey as it was dragged slightly short. The seam up delivery came on to the bat nicely and was in the arc for the batsman to put it away over deep square leg. CSK breaking the shackles?
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, full delivery and the batsman has pile-driven the ball down the ground. The man at mid-off was wide enough for the ball to fly into the fence on a bounce

S Kaul to Watson, SIX, oh a horror of a delivery by Kaul! A length ball angling into the pads, Watson just has to flick it away over deep backward square leg for six! Watto has started to find the meat. A neat and violent pick-up shot...
S Kaul to Raina, FOUR, short one from over the wicket, Raina just has to guide the pull to fine leg for four. Easy pickings
S Kaul to Raina, FOUR, just a fraction short towards leg-stump, Raina twists his torso into another late pull to fine leg for four. Excellent over for CSK!
S Kaul to Watson, SIX, looked like another slower one, Watson doesn't try anything straight batted this time (wary of the knuckle ball) and cross-bats that over long-on for six. Muscled.

S Kaul to Watson, 2 runs, falls short of Rash at sweeper cover. Low full toss just outside off, Watson is down on his knees and gets under it to slice it towards sweeper cover where Rashid tries to take it. It falls just short. 50 partnership up!
S Kaul to Watson, FOUR, short-ish delivery outside off, Watson reaches out and cross-bats the loft towards long-off for four. Falls only just inside the rope

Lungi Ngidi to Dhawan, FOUR, Karn Sharma might have saved a few for CSK. Ngidi errs in line, on the hips and Dhawan glances it towards fine leg. Karn was square and had a lot of ground to cover, he runs to his left and puts in the full length dive, flicks the ball in play. Third umpire has a look and sees that he is in contact with the ad cushions, first boundary off the final

Lungi Ngidi to Goswami, out Goswami Run Out!! 1 run completed. Needless! This is a gift from SRH. Never a second in it and Goswami is well short of the crease. The CSK fans at Wankhede explode. Short of length delivery, Goswami jumps and tucks it backward of square leg, he wanted the second and pushed Dhawan for it, Karn ran in from long leg and fired a flat throw right next to the stumps, easy peasy for Dhoni. Goswami was couple of yards short. Goswami run out (Karn Sharma/Dhoni) 5(5)

Jadeja to Williamson, FOUR, a leaping Ngidi .. and if something evades him, it's never a catch good enough to be called a drop. Williamson half-dabs, off the outer half and short third man can only try
Jadeja to Shakib, SIX, umm. Sitting up in the slot, and Shakib's sitting too. Full-swing, slogging it into cow corner
Jadeja to Shakib, FOUR, and he drills it better. It's fuller, it's wider, but Shakib's back on his knee, slapping it much straighter. Yea, there's nobody at long-on
