Dwayne Bravo to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, Dwayne Bravo misses his length horribly this time. It was a slower nut on the stumps and was a full-toss, Rahul Tewatia moves to the off-side and half-scoops it fine of short fine for a boundary

SN Thakur to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, nicely guided away to third man, a slide by Deepak Chahar and he's let the ball go through. Dhoni won't be happy, with the bowler first for needlessly trying stuff, and with the fielder for his effort. Hat-trick of fours now

Chahar to Dhawan, FOUR, this is a dream start for DC. Four boundaries in four balls now. You can't complain about this ball though. Nice good length delivery outside off stump, Dhawan punches off the front foot and gets a thick edge that rolls fine and beats third man

Harbhajan to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, there he comes racing down the pitch to the offie with the ball turning in and plays the lofted drive, didn't connect with the middle of the bat, toe-ends it well enough to beat mid-off into the fence

Harbhajan to Dhawan, FOUR, swept and swept fine, flighted delivery from round the wicket, Dhawan took a big stride forward and powered that on his knees by rolling the wrists over the shot to keep it all along the ground through backward square leg

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Watson!! This is very good limited overs bowling from Chahar. We saw him adjust very well to Dhawan when he was given the charge, now Shaw runs down the pitch to smash the bowler, but Chahar takes pace off, shortens the length and also follows the batsman, leaving Shaw nowhere to go. The batsman backs himself to play the pull shot, only mistimes it as far as mid-wicket. A dolly for Watto! Prithvi Shaw c Watson b Chahar 24(16) [4s-5]
Harbhajan to Dhawan, FOUR, this is good batting, knows Harbhajan isn't going to toss the ball up, so has a short backlift to reverse lap this flatter ball past short third man

Harbhajan to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, in the airrrrr but it drops short of Dududu Rayudu. But he does extremely well to get his hand behind the line and save the boundary. Shreyas Iyer steps out and flicks without control, gets away with it as it lands right in front of deep mid-wicket
Tahir to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, hint of flight and Iyer's eyes light up. Loads up big time and clears his front leg to deposit into the empty stands over long-off. First six of the innings!
Chakravarthy to Narine, SIX, Narine gets off the mark with a maximum. A looped up ball, full and in Narine's arc. The southpaw stands tall and thumps it over long-off
Chakravarthy to Narine, FOUR, carrom ball, but the length is short, Narine muscles the pull through mid-wicket. Tye moves to his left from long-on, but is lethargic to bend low
Chakravarthy to Narine, SIX, shot! Narine gets down on a knee and slogs this length ball over the deep mid-wicket
Ashwin to Nitish Rana, SIX, full toss and Rana has launched it into the crowd over mid-wicket. That's a gimme and Nitish Rana took full toll of it

Ashwin to Nitish Rana, SIX, another one from Nitish Rana! For a fleeting moment he seemed to have mistimed it, but the breeze takes it over the boundary ropes. Fired wide of off, Rana reaches out and toe-ends the lofty hit over wide long-off
Mandeep to Uthappa, FOUR, seems like Ashwin has ran out of options...a short and wide hit-me from Mandeep and Uthappa smacks it off the back foot behind point. Too easy
Mandeep to Nitish Rana, SIX, another one in the zone and this time it's Nitish Rana! Clears his front leg and clouts the length ball over cow corner
Mandeep to Nitish Rana, SIX, flat and over the leaping fielder at sweeper cover! Two sixes in a row. Was smidgen short and Rana freed his arms to slap it over Shami in the deep

Viljoen to Nitish Rana, FOUR, back-to-back fifties for Nitish Rana! A dolly of a delivery from Hardus Viljoen, sprayed into the pads and Rana just puts bat to ball. Fine leg inside the ring and that's a easy boundary
Viljoen to Nitish Rana, SIX, hits back of a length and Rana clubs it over long-on with ease! Set himself on the back foot and mauled it with full might
Viljoen to Nitish Rana, FOUR, full and wide, sliced away backwards of point. Excellent timing and even better placement from Nitish Rana

Chakravarthy to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Agarwal!! Maiden IPL wicket for Varun Chakravarthy! A moment he'll remember for a long, long time. Rana just had one aim: to slog and slog big. Goes for it but doesn't quite get it off the middle and his attempt to go over cover fails miserably. Skews it off the cue-end and Mayank Agarwal takes a brilliant catch running in from long-off. Nitish Rana c Agarwal b Chakravarthy 63(34) [4s-2 6s-7]

Viljoen to Uthappa, FOUR, 24th IPL fifty for Robin Uthappa! Gets there with a boundary, perhaps the easiest ball faced in his entire IPL career. A full ball slanting down leg, Uthappa just needed to meet that and meet that he did. Clean and quick into the fine leg fence

Shami to Uthappa, FOUR, very full delivery on the pads, 143km/h, whipped away to the backward square leg fence for four where Chakravarthy puts in the dive but fails to cut it off - a little slow to start, Varun, and the practice pitch didn't help

Tye to A Russell, SIX, are ya kiddin' me? A slower one aimed at the body, into the ribcage, Russell just twists into a pull, gets a massive top-edge that sails over fine leg for six - speaking of laws of the game, what happened to the bat-laws?
Tye to A Russell, FOUR, short one, slow, well-directed, but he's picked it - Russell waits for it and absolutely smites that pull to the deep mid-wicket boundary for four

Tye to A Russell, FOUR, to give you an idea of how high it went, the camera did well to follow it, but it did seem clouded by the - well, clouds for a moment. A tad short, Russell swats across the line, gets another massive top-edge, and it is absolutely skied. So high, that even Rahul, the 'keeper, has reached the fine leg fence and tries to pull it back but it beats him, one bounce, to the fence
Tye to A Russell, SIX, length ball, a sin at this point, right in the arc, and Russell opens up to cart that over long-on for six
Shami to A Russell, SIX, 143.1km/h, an inch too short for the yorker length = half-volley, Russell opens up his stance, clears the front-leg, and absolutely clouts that over long-off for six

Shami to A Russell, SIX, attempts another yorker, errs on the fuller side this time, a full-toss in the slot, Russell swings across the line, clubs a gigantic six over cow corner - spectators of Bengal, watch out!

Shami to A Russell, SIX, another full-toss, 142.9km/h, from round the wicket, misses the yorker by a long way, clearly holding the ball too tight, Russell follows that algorithm of opening up that stance for a trigger and carts it over deep mid-wicket for six

Shami to A Russell, FOUR, looks like he's just streamed that 2011 flick "Carnage" before getting to the ground, has DreRuss. A wide half-volley this time, clearly indicating that Shami has lost the plot, and Russell has absolutely smoked that through deep extra cover for four. Gaps? The fielders can't see that whizzing projectile - such is the power. That's the second 25-run over in the innings.

Tye to A Russell, out Caught by Agarwal! Short ball angling in but still outside off, Russell needs no distance parameter to get leverage on that - the force is more than enough - but then, Agarwal at the cow corner fence, hops up to take a magnificent catch. Absolute carnage once again, and he's done his job, has DreRuss. Misses out on a fifty for the second time in a row. A Russell c Agarwal b Tye 48(17) [4s-3 6s-5]

Chakravarthy to Narine, SIX, 25 off the over! Not the start the debutant would have hoped for. The pressure got to him and he darted a full ball on the pads. Easy pickings for Narine, who flicked it over backward square leg
Shami to Chris Lynn, FOUR, it's raining boundaries! Hint of width on offer outside off and that's sufficient for Lynn, who stays in his crease and carves it over point
Shami to Chris Lynn, FOUR, biffed! Watch out, Narine. A short of length delivery at 139kph, Lynn pummells the straight-pull over a ducking Narine at the non-striker's end. No chance for mid-on

Shami to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Miller!! One shot too many? But, that's how Lynn plays. A seam-up back of a length delivery at 144.3kph, Lynn goes for another straight-pull from the crease. Went too hard and in the process lost his shape. The ball ballooned up off the top-edge. It went up a long way and Miller called for it. The South African settled under it by moving to his right from extra cover and completed a very good catch. KXIP have the breakthrough! Chris Lynn c Miller b Shami 10(10) [4s-2]

Shami to Narine, no run, dropped! Shami has put down a tough return catch. A back of a length delivery on the stumps and Narine wanted to slap it straight down the ground. Doesn't get the required elevation and it went to the bowler at a catchable height. Shami went with both hands in his followthrough, but the ball didn't stick

Tye to Uthappa, FOUR, oh that's a fantastic shot! Tries backing away towards the on-side initially, then steps across shaping up to scoop, and then moves back again, only to steer that back of a length slower delivery in the channel late, with an open face, wide of backward point towards the deep backward point fence for four to finish off the innings...

Viljoen to Narine, out Caught by Rahul!! KKR have lost both their openers now. A hit-the-deck-hard back of a length delivery that cramps the batsman for room. Narine clears his front leg for a pull shot, gets a top-edge that pops up a long way in the air. KL Rahul, the man with the gloves, moves backwards to snaffle it. Narine c Rahul b Viljoen 24(9) [4s-1 6s-3]

Viljoen to Uthappa, SIX, shot! Viljoen provided a bit of width outside off on this short of length delivery and Uthappa used his quick hands to great effect. Carved it over backward point and the ball has enough wings to go the distance

Ashwin to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa goes after Ashwin with deep mid-wicket and long-on in place. It was floated up outside off, Uthappa got down, fetched it from there and slogged it over cow corner. Good contact
Chakravarthy to Uthappa, FOUR, a freebie! A 91kph, short-and-wide ball, cut hard to the left of backward point. Raced away

Chakravarthy to Uthappa, FOUR, away-turner, but the length is on the shorter side and there's too much width outside off. Uthappa won't miss out. He rocks back and cuts it fiercely to the right of backward point
Ashwin to Nitish Rana, SIX, Ashwin gives a lot of air on this off-break, but the length is slightly too full. Nitish Rana gets down on a knee and bludgeons it over long-on for half a dozen
Ashwin to Nitish Rana, SIX, touch short and Rana pounces on it. Keeps his head still and smacks it from outside off for a 80-metre flat maximum over long-on
Ashwin to Nitish Rana, 1 run, low full toss on the stumps, Rana pushes it down to long-on and brings up the 50-run stand

Prasidh to Gayle, SIX, 145.1km/h, too short and too wide, Gayle has no interest in it until the ball is almost parallel to him, no unnecessary movement, just gets under it and upper-cuts it over third man for six!

Prasidh to Gayle, FOUR, short of length delivery rising steeply outside off, Gayle backs away and tries carving it away through the point regio, gets a massive top-edge over slip for a boundary to third man

Ferguson to Rahul, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav! An abomination fo a shot for an Indian Test opener. Rahul backs away into the on-side, picks up a length ball from middle-stump, 145.7km/h, and tries to run his hands through the ball in chipping it over mid-off, miscues and and ends up lobbing it straight to the man at mid-off, succumbing in a rather soft manner. That was pressure. Pressure talking. Rahul c Kuldeep Yadav b Ferguson 1(5)

Narine to Agarwal, FOUR, a whippy sweep-type-clip off the pads as it was too full for Agarwal to abort his attempted sweep. So, he bent a little and whipped it away past the dive of the deep square leg fielder for a four. The rate required is now 14.2
Kuldeep Yadav to Miller, SIX, and the sweep gets him out of jail. Emphatically. Knelt down and smacked it. The bat made a massive noise as it met the ball. The ball whistled over deep mid
Narine to Miller, SIX, too full, the leverage was there and he has muscled it over the bowler's head for a towering sixer. Massive hit from Killer Miller
Narine to Miller, FOUR, smashes the ball away again. Shortish ball and has been pulled away past deep mid for a four
Narine to Agarwal, FOUR, slapped! That was powered down the ground. Not too far from the bowler, not too far from the sticks and the ball escaped into the fence
Narine to Agarwal, FOUR, and cheeky! Waits on it and opens the face of the blade to glide it away to deep third man for a four

Chawla to Agarwal, SIX, oh these bats, modern day cricket, power, so cruel for the bowler. Quickish delivery on the leg stump, Agarwal was caught between a sweep shot and a pull shot, but he's somehow sweetly muscled this to clear backward square leg
A Russell to Agarwal, 2 runs, flicked wide of long-on, two is call and he's home. Fifty for Agarwal, his 4th in IPL, good length delivery on the stumps, Agarwal hits the gap nicely on that occasion

Kuldeep Yadav to Agarwal, 2 runs, in the airrr, dropped, Rinku Singh the sub! Flighted delivery outside off stump, Agarwal steps out and reaches out to this widish delivery, sliced it, Rinku ran to his left and dived full length forward but it didn't stick

Kuldeep Yadav to Miller, FOUR, down the track to drill this hard wide of short cover, Dre Russ slides and stops the ball, but was his back foot in touch with the rope when he was in contact with the ball? Third umpire checks, four it is

Chawla to Agarwal, out Bowled!! The googly and it takes out the leg stump. Agarwal on one knee to slog-sweep it for six, but missed the ball completely and lost the pole. A fine fifty from Agarwal, but KXIP needed him to push a little more hard chasing 219. Agarwal b Chawla 58(34) [4s-6 6s-1]

Chawla to Miller, no run, this is a very wide short ball, Miller tried to fetch the pull shot, missed, the ball sneaked under the under edge, Karthik was confident in his appeal, given out and Miller overturned the call by reviewing

Ferguson to Mandeep, SIX, this is a lovely lofted off-drive, nothing better than this sort of a shot to get going. Length ball, nice pitch to bat on, so Mandeep hit through the line and collected a maximum

Ferguson to Miller, FOUR, this is class batting, knows third man is inside the ring, as soon as Ferguson dropped the slower ball short, Miller was there to just guide in the gap wide of backward point
Prasidh to Miller, FOUR, low full toss, drilled hard between the sticks and the non-striker, Dre Russ can't cut it off running from long-off
Prasidh to Mandeep, FOUR, clever hit, short delivery rising steeply, Mandeep stays leg side of the ball and guides it over Karthik for a much needed boundary
Ferguson to Mandeep, FOUR, short delivery outside off stump, Mandeep stays back and cuts past backward point, third man doesn't have a real go. Fours won't do it for KXIP
Ferguson to Miller, 2 runs, slower delivery on the leg stump, tucked away towards mid-wicket, easy two. Fifty up for Miller, but no celebrations

Ferguson to Miller, SIX, now then, KXIP need seven more of these. But hey, this bloke has backed away to this full ball and somehow sliced this ball over backward point, normally you see the ball travel over cover, incredible hit
Chawla to Mandeep, FOUR, short googly, pulled away to deep mid-wicket, Uthappa runs to his right, gets to the ball but fumbles as he tries to hop and stop the ball
Chawla to Mandeep, FOUR, Chawla is only going to bowl googlies, so Mandeep moves across and scoops the ball over Lynn at short fine leg

Prasidh to Agarwal, FOUR, 142.7km/h, length delivery angling into the pads, towards middle, Agarwal shuffles across and closes the face at the last moment whilst on the backfoot to guide it away towards the deep square leg boundary for four
Prasidh to Agarwal, FOUR, oh that is laced! Backs away into the on-side, picks up the length ball on off-stump, and absolutely flays that over the in-field to the deep extra cover fence for four
Prasidh to Agarwal, FOUR, 149.2km/h, really quick, but strays on the pads, a full-toss, whipped away to the deep mid-wicket boundary for four. Easy pickings
Ferguson to Gayle, FOUR, short of length delivery on the stump, 115.9km/h, Gayle clears that leg and clubs it off the toe-end just over mid-on to the long-on fence for four

Ferguson to Gayle, SIX, 142.9km/h, doesn't take the pace off this time, short one on the stumps, but Gayle's trigger is to back away into the on-side - he's absolutely clubbed that, cross-batted, over the long-on fence for six. A fantastic first four balls, spoiled by the last two balls...

A Russell to Gayle, out Caught by Prasidh! What can't you do DreRuss? Have you got a deal cut out with the God of fortune? A short one at the body, not particularly quick @130.8km/h, Gayle gets his weight on the backfoot to pull it away, but with that bat-face turning upwards, gets it off the splice, skywards, as Prasidh runs in to pick it up at mid-on. Huge moment in the game, as both the openers depart. Gayle c Prasidh b A Russell 20(13) [4s-2 6s-2]
A Russell to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, uncanny? Usual Sarfaraz Khan stuff as he sits down on both knees and upper-steers it. Risky but effective
A Russell to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, what lovely timing! Shortish delivery outside off and has been chopped behind point for a four. That was just touched and it ran away

A Russell to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Karthik!! Slower delivery gets the scalp here. That was down leg, Sarfaraz Khan ended up closing the face of the bat a bit too early and the leading edge was taken by the keeper, who moved to his left by quite a few paces to take it. Dre Russ continues his impact on this game. And have the deliveries started to hold on more now? Might well be the case. Sarfaraz Khan c Karthik b A Russell 13(13) [4s-2]
Kuldeep Yadav to Miller, FOUR, when in doubt, sweep! Did so of late against Lanka in the T20Is and now also repeating the same. Knelt down and swept it in front of square for a four

U Yadav to Rohit, FOUR, oh, that's a dreadful delivery and Sharma rightly makes him pay. Now attempted the inswinger to Sharma, the line all awry as it is drifted down leg. MI captain gets inside the line and glances it very fine to open his account. First boundary and Sharma is away!
U Yadav to Rohit, FOUR, gift for Sharma. Loosener once again from Yadav, sliding it on the pads and Sharma was alert enough to clip it past square leg

Navdeep Saini to Rohit, FOUR, inside edge and that nearly shaved the leg-stump. Rohit is very lucky that it missed the sticks. It was the indipper at 144kph, Rohit was chained to his crease and didn't expect it to come back into him. Had a late poke at it and the ball trims the inside edge and runs away to the fine leg fence. Remember, he was caught off an inside edge last year too - at this same venue

U Yadav to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, a short of length delivery, Suryakumar Yadav picks the length early, stands tall and pummels it through mid-wicket. A desperate dive from the long-on fielder, but in vain

U Yadav to Rohit, out Caught by Siraj!! This is a big wicket for RCB! The home crowd knows that. They go berserk. Umesh Yadav has a beaming smile on his face. A hit-the-deck-hard back of a length delivery wide of off and Umesh induces a rare miscued pull shot from Rohit. The ball ballooned up off the top-edge. Siraj comes forward from long-off to gobble it up. Rohit c Siraj b U Yadav 48(33) [4s-8 6s-1]

Moeen Ali to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, Suryakumar Yadav has had enough of the miscues. Backs his power and goes for the biggie. It was a flat length ball, the right-hander stood tall and bludgeoned it over long-on. Didn't worry about his shape, there did Suryakumar

Moeen Ali to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, classy batting, this from SKY! Uses his writs to superb effect. Moeen darted a length ball and Suryakumar superbly clipped it through the mid-wicket region. Split the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on perfectly. The last two balls have spoilt the over
Chahal to Yuvraj, SIX, a freebie from Chahal and Yuvraj doesn't need second invitations. A half-tracker from the leggie, Yuvraj rocks back and muscles the pull over deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Yuvraj, SIX, kaboom! Vintage Yuvi. Yuzvendra Chahal over-corrects and doles out a half-volley. Right in the southpaw's slot and Yuvraj has bludgeoned it straight down the ground
Chahal to Yuvraj, SIX, hat-trick of sixes! Chahal bowls this wider outside off, Yuvraj goes deep in the crease and also moved towards off to hoist it over long-on. He lofted it off the back foot

Chahal to Yuvraj, out Caught by Siraj!! Yuvraj wanted to go for the fourth six, but holes out. A fullish googly marginally outside off, it was in the slot for the lefty to go over long-off. But, the bat turned at the point of impact. Siraj, at long-off, initially misjudged as he was a couple of yards inside the boundary rope. However, he recovered well and timed his jump perfectly to take a pressure catch. Yuvraj c Siraj b Chahal 23(12) [6s-3]
de Grandhomme to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cheeky and effective! A dibbly-dobbly length ball around off, Suryakumar gets down on a knee and paddles it over short fine leg

de Grandhomme to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, got to feel for the bowler here? Suryakumar Yadav wants to play a premeditated scoop shot. It was the off-cutter and the ball bounced a tad more than the batter expected it to. Catches the top-edge and flies over the keeper's head for a boundary

Chahal to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Moeen Ali!! An away-turning leg-break at 82.4kph, a backing away Suryakumar Yadav had to reach out for it. He was trying to carve it over the covers, but ended up slicing it off the cue end. Moeen Ali settles under it at point and takes a calm catch. Suryakumar Yadav c Moeen Ali b Chahal 38(24) [4s-4 6s-1]

Chahal to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, Chahal has put down a return catch! A tossed up leggie and Krunal Pandya pushes with hard hands. The bowler went with both hands moving to his left, but the ball doesn't stick

Chahal to Pollard, out Caught by Hetmyer!! The extra ball has benefited the home side. The previous ball was wrongly wided and Chahal has dismissed the dangerous Pollard off his last ball of the spell. Another floated leggie outside off and Pollard decided to go for the inside-out loft. Off the outer half and also bottom part. Hetmyer gathers it with both hands at sweeper cover. Pollard c Hetmyer b Chahal 5(6)

U Yadav to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Navdeep Saini!! A bumper and Krunal Pandya plays a hook shot. He's been caught at fine leg by Saini. But, has he made contact with the boundary rope? The umpires send it upstairs. It's a legal ball. And, no part of the boot/pant has touched the ad-cushions. Krunal has to walk back. RCB continue to take wickets. It was a pacy bumper and Krunal made decent contact after getting inside the line. However, Saini timed his jump to perfection. Once again, cricket shows you the value of an inch or two! Krunal Pandya c Navdeep Saini b U Yadav 1(2)

Siraj to McClenaghan, out Bowled!! Another one bites the dust. A seam-up ball from a short of length, McClenaghan stands tall to heave across the line when he could have cut it through the off-side. All he manages is an inside edge that cannons onto the stumps. McClenaghan b Siraj 1(4)
Siraj to Markande, FOUR, poor ball with a slip in place! A short of length delivery on the pads. Markande shuffles and glances. Off the inside edge and the ball races away to the fine leg fence
Siraj to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, 141kph, full on off and middle, Hardik Pandya moves across and there's the quick hands from Pandya to flick it through backward square leg

Navdeep Saini to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, stand and deliver! Saini doles out a full toss, Hardik Pandya stays put in his crease and lifts it over the bowler's head. No big back-lift, but still manages to generate the botttom hand power. The batter poses for the photographs

Navdeep Saini to Hardik Pandya, SIX, 137.4kph, shortish ball that sits up nicely. Having already shuffled across, Hardik waited for the ball to come to him. A pivot across, followed by a fierce pull over deep mid-wicket. That's mighty

Siraj to Markande, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! In-slanter at 135kph just outside off, Markande tries to run it down to third man and gets a faint inside edge. The RCB players went up straightaway and umpire S Ravi was late to raise his finger. The fielder from the off-side and threw the ball towards the bowler's end to effect a run-out. In the end, Ravi confirmed that it was caught-behind! Markande c Parthiv Patel b Siraj 6(5) [4s-1]

Siraj to Bumrah, leg byes, 1 run, 144.7kph, very full ball on the pads, Bumrah misses the flick and is struck on the front leg in front of leg. RCB went up for a review, but that was more out of desperation. The batters stole a run and Hardik will be on strike

Siraj to Hardik Pandya, SIX, huuuuge! Mohammed Siraj bowls a fullish ball, Hardik stays deep in the crease and it ends up right in his slot. Gets underneath it and massacres it straight down the ground

Siraj to Hardik Pandya, SIX, over deep mid. This is the biggest! It's gone outta here. Once again, Siraj misses his yorker by a couple of inches, Hardik Pandya stays deep in the crease and uses his wrists to send it out of the ground. For those stuck in the traffic jam, watch out!
Navdeep Saini to Rohit, FOUR, neatly driven and it beats the packed off-side field. Half-volley just outside off, tempting Sharma who leans across and creams it magnificently through extra cover

U Yadav to de Kock, FOUR, "That is a typical left-hander's shot," says Haydos on air. de Kock makes excellent adjustment by taking a stride down the pitch and converts this into a full ball, then unleashes a clean swing by whacking it past mid-on. That was timed extremely hard and rockets away to the boundary

Navdeep Saini to Rohit, SIX, never bowl short to Rohit, Saini learns why. Bends his back and goes short, Rohit quickly shifts his weight back and pulls, not too convincing but enough timing on it to send it into the deep mid-wicket stands. Imperious from MI captain

Siraj to de Kock, SIX, woah! This is a shot of authority from de Kock. Effortless and dominant stuff from the South African. Siraj served it up in the slot, de Kock takes his front foot forward and freed his arms, making proper connection to launch over long-on. He's the batsman in form!

Siraj to de Kock, 1 run, oh close! Risky single attempted and de Kock had to dive full-length to make his ground. Tucked into the leg-side and got the nod from his skipper. Siraj swiftly moved across and collected the ball before hurling the stumps at the non-striker's end, that was a nervy moment for de Kock
Siraj to Rohit, FOUR, slapped past mid-off. Dismissive from Rohit. Sees a pitched up delivery outside off, loads up and absolutely smacks it off the meat with ferocity. All power from the MI skipper

Navdeep Saini to de Kock, FOUR, dropped. CDG is the culprit and it should've been taken. A straightforward chance but the Kiwi all-rounder fails to cling onto it. Whacked hard and towards mid-wicket, I reckon CDG mistimed his jump and it bursted through his fingers. You cannot drop a form batsman like de Kock and this will hurt RCB

Navdeep Saini to Rohit, FOUR, 50 comes up for MI with this boundary. They are off to a great start here. Saini misses his mark and hurls a delivery just outside off, Rohit went hard at that and skewed it over extra cover. Didn't come off the middle as the bat face turned in his hands

Chahal to de Kock, out Bowled!! 50th scalp for Chahal at the Chinnaswamy. Told ya! He's RCB's trumpcard and straightaway gets his team the breakthrough. CDG will be a relieved man for sure. Poor shot from de Kock, especially having tried this off the first ball of the over. Spinning into him and the Southpaw went for the fancy reverse after taking his front foot forward. Was in no position to play that shot and gets an under-edge which deflects back onto the stumps. The home crowd goes bonkers as RCB pick up their first wicket. de Kock b Chahal 23(20) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chahal to Suryakumar Yadav, byes, FOUR, the non-turner outside off, Suryakumar Yadav goes for a premeditated sweep shot and the ball scoots under his blade. Kept low too and hence the keeper couldn't stop that
Chahal to Rohit, FOUR, 85.6kph, Chahal gives air on this occasion, but he's drifted it down leg. Easily put away by Rohit, who gets down on a knee and powerfully sweeps it backward of square leg
de Grandhomme to Rohit, FOUR, another off-pace delivery - 111.5kph. The skipper picks it, gets down on a knee and swipes it over square leg. There's no one in the deep there

McClenaghan to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Chota Gayle hits the first boundary for RCB. Easy length ball drifting down the leg-side, just the roll of the wrists on this shot and he placed it wide of mid-wicket

Markande to Kohli, FOUR, enough of dots, Kohli wants to get on with the game! Gets a full legbreak on off, with a high back lift and thumping wrists he powers it down the ground for a blazing boundary
Markande to de Villiers, SIX, in the arc and that's gone! Lovely floater outside off, AB gets underneath it and smites it over wide long-off with the cleanest of bat swings you'll ever see
Malinga to de Villiers, SIX, slower, loopy, leg-stump. Okay, does it matter to a batsman like AB? He just stands his ground and whiplashes it into the crowd over backward square. Gee, the ease...

Bumrah to Kohli, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Bumrah gets the better of Virat Kohli! Gets him with a short ball. Pounds it into the pitch and gets it to angle in into the body, Kohli hadn't really moved back, but still goes through with the shot (pull) and the top-edge lands in the bucket hands of Hardik Pandya at square leg. Kohli c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 46(32) [4s-6]

Hardik Pandya to de Villiers, FOUR, Hardik Pandya is not happy with the effort from Suryakumar Yadav. Was a tough one, but chance nonetheless! No feet from AB, just swats the pull from the crease and it went flat to the right of wide long-on, SKY did well to anticipate it but in the end he went for the dive and lost track of the ball
Hardik Pandya to de Villiers, FOUR, that was pitched halfway down the track, AB hammers it with brute power over mid-wicket. Hadn't got the timing right, but he did well to place it in the gap

Malinga to de Villiers, FOUR, huge appeal for lbw, but no signs of review and rightly so. Off the willow. A loopy full toss from Malinga, AB had walked a long way and had to adjust to the line at the last moment, plants his front knee onto the ground and manages to find a flicker of an inside edge on the slog to send it fine past the keeper
Malinga to de Villiers, SIX, length ball outside off, AB clubs it clean over extra cover. That's gone straight into the second tier

Malinga to de Villiers, SIX, too predictable from Malinga. Another slower ball and the length is way too short, AB had all the time in the world to pick his spot and he marmalizes it into the mid-wicket orbit without breaking sweat

Bumrah to Hetmyer, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Needless stuff from Hetmyer. Wanted to go for the glory hit and perished; was fullish and angling in, Hetmyer made room early and cleared his front leg to go over the leg-side, slices it off the toe-end and Hardik Pandya takes the simplest of catches at mid-off. Hetmyer c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 5(6)
Bumrah to de Villiers, 1 run, 29th IPL fifty for AB de Villiers! Punches a length ball square of sweeper cover and gets to the landmark with an air of nonchalance
Bumrah to de Grandhomme, no run, clipped to the left of mid-wicket and they think of a quick single, Suryakumar Yadav was quick to gather the ball and he missed the direct hit at the batting end
Hardik Pandya to de Villiers, FOUR, AB shuffles and meets this ball on the full, sits on one knee and swats it in the gap between deep mid-wicket and deep square

Hardik Pandya to de Villiers, SIX, for a fleeting moment AB seemed to have mistimed it. Wasn't to be. AB was moving to the leg-side but Hardik kept it wide of off, bowled it on a length and made AB fetch; carved off the bottom half but no problems, it keeps traveling and sails over the leaping sweeper cover fielder
Hardik Pandya to de Villiers, SIX, full toss on the pads, see you tomorrow! Can't bowl there to AB and that's disappeared at the rate of knots. Straight into the third tier over square leg

Bumrah to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Similar lines again: wide of off, CDG thumps it into the air sans any conviction and KP at sweeper cover runs forward to snaffle a dolly of a catch. de Grandhomme c Krunal Pandya b Bumrah 2(7)

Malinga to Shivam Dube, SIX, this is why he's been picked in the IPL. Shows no sign of nerves and pumps the full ball over long-off, Malinga didn't have the pace to trouble the batsman and it was righ in the slot for a left-hander

Malinga to Shivam Dube, 1 run, dropped! Bumrah is the culprit. Slower length delivery outside off, Dube slices it high into the air and it kept swirling backwards behind the keeper, Bumrah runs back from short third but can't cling onto it
McClenaghan to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's a nice pull shot, he's short in stature, but he packs a punch with his shots. A gentle step forward and then a pull over mid-wicket
McClenaghan to Moeen Ali, FOUR, top edge, but it flies high over QdK. Short fuller length on the stumps, Moeen was beaten for pace on the pull shot, gets away with it

McClenaghan to Moeen Ali, SIX, oh what a shot! McClenaghan will be kicking himself for bowling a freebie full ball on the leg stump, Mo flicks with a strong bottom hand grip and it sails over backward square leg

Bumrah to Parthiv Patel, out Moeen Ali Run Out!! This is a big moment. What a direct-hit from the skipper. Mo was starting to time the ball well, a stutter has cost him. Parthiv flicked this slower ball in front of short mid-wicket and set off, Ro attacked the ball and knocked the sticks over with a rocket through. The crowd, disappointed for a fleeting moment with the dismissal, yells out a loud roar. Enter King Kohli! Moeen Ali run out (Rohit) 13(7) [4s-1 6s-1]

Bumrah to Kohli, FOUR, oh this could so easily have been in mid-on's hands. Shortish delivery, Kohli pulls off the front foot, not in control, Yuvi was very wide there and had no chance. This is the battle of the best bowler v best batsman

Bumrah to Kohli, FOUR, outside edgeeee but safe! Kohli really throws his hands at this length delivery wide outside off stump, wanted a drive through cover, got a thick edge that went wide of slip and beat third man

Bumrah to Kohli, FOUR, this is a brilliant shot. Not a bad ball at all for the field set. Fullish and outside off stump, Kohli leans forward and punches it with an angled bat, splits backward point and cover-point

Hardik Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, Hardik Pandya missed his length by a couple of yards and that's all waht Kohli needed to get going. Back of a length and well outside off stump, Kohli cuts, beats backward point and look at him, he's fired up. Cheers himself up with a soft of fist pump, he didn't like being dominated/threatened by Hardik Pandya for those three deliveries

Hardik Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, and look at this cover drive, he's moved onto 20 and all have been boundaries. Fullish delivery outside off stump, Kohli leans forward and creams the ball along the ground, raced away to the boundary
Krunal Pandya to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, flicked along the ground, big Polly runs to his right and dives, misses the ball and it escapes for four. Too full from Krunal Pandya and he pays the penalty
Krunal Pandya to Parthiv Patel, SIX, this is a brave ball, but Parthiv is a good player of spin and he loves the slog-sweep. Landed full and Parthiv went aerial over mid-wicket
Markande to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, driven wide of long-off, oh dear, Hardik Pandya has let this go through between his legs. Off-drive along the ground, should have been stopped

Markande to Parthiv Patel, out Bowled!! A chop on from Chota Gayle. He gets a start, but throws it away. We have seen that way too many times. Did the job though. Googly from Markande, Parthiv goes back to cut, looked too close for the shot and ended up dragging it back onto the sticks. Parthiv Patel b Markande 31(22) [4s-4 6s-1]

Markande to de Villiers, no run, Yuvraj Singh, what have you done?. He's dropped de Villiers first ball. Flatter delivery outside off stump, de Villiers was looking to punch off the back foot, gets a thick edge that travels, Yuvi moved to his right and the ball came to the left and hit the knee

S Kaul to Samson, FOUR, just a chip and off she goes. Full and in the slot, Samson extends his forward push and sends it over mid-off, who was inside the ring. The timing was brilliant as the ball flew off the middle

S Kaul to Rahane, FOUR, runs starting to flow from both ends now.. Rahane has also up the ante. Picked the short ball and pulled it backward of square, giving the fielder at deep square no chance of getting across

Shankar to Rahane, SIX, hit-me delivery and Rahane obliges. A gift on the pads and Rahane picks it up nonchalantly over backward square, struck it flat and got it over the rope. Bhuvi also might have misjudged as he came in before running back, too late by then

Shankar to Samson, FOUR, it is not working for Shankar. Hyderabad's fifth bowler is becoming a problem. Nadeem leaked runs and Shankar too is going for a few. The back of hand but overpitched it, Samson delays the loft and sends it soaring over extra cover, one bounce and over the rope

Rashid Khan to Rahane, 1 run, fifty for Rahane. First of the season for the skipper. Just a quick bat raise towards his team and on his goes.. Wrong 'un and on the shorter length, tucked away in front of square on the leg-side

Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, shot! He's bisected the two fielders with precision. 107ks knuckle ball around off, Rahane makes room and drives on the up past extra cover, where KW can't go full throttle on the dive as it is to his left and Rashid also can't get across from sweeper cover

Sandeep Sharma to Samson, 2 runs, Rahane was in trouble here. Full and outside off, Samson drives it towards deep extra cover, Rashid swoops down and releases the ball quickly as well but Sandeep fails to gather it, Rahane puts in the dive to make his ground

Sandeep Sharma to Samson, 1 run, fifty for Samson. 11th in the league and Rajasthan's mentor, Shane Warne picked him as the player to watch out for in this edition. He's started off nicely. Picked the slower delivery and works it into the open mid-wicket area

Rashid Khan to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane getting innovative. Rashid is taken by surprise. The fast wrong 'un and Rahane decides to play the reverse sweep, more of a top-edge and the ball clears backward point before running away to the fence

Nadeem to Rahane, SIX, woah! What timing. Rashid thought he was in with a chance near the rope but the ball kept sailing over him. Nadeem in an attempt to dart it in offers an half volley, Rahane backs away and chips the loft inside out, yes just a chip and off went the ball clearing the rope comfortably

Nadeem to Samson, FOUR, cheeky! Smart batting by Samson. He knows that Nadeem is firing 'em in and he uses that to his advantage, walks across his stumps and laps it over the keeper, the pace takes care of the rest

Nadeem to Rahane, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Gone! The partnership has been broken. But it might be a good thing for Rajasthan. Rahane has done his job - setting it up for the likes of Stokes and Gowtham. He shimmies down and is deceived by Nadeem's dragged back length, still goes through with the loft and gets more height than distance, Pandey takes it easily near long-on. Rahane c Manish Pandey b Nadeem 70(49) [4s-4 6s-3]

S Kaul to Samson, 2 runs, dropped! Bairstow charges from behind the sticks and grasses it. He should have left it to Rashid, who was coming in. Samson is deceived by the knuckle ball and is early into the flick, the leading edge balloons towards square leg, Bairstow sprinted across and Rashid ran forward, in the end the man with the mitts called for it and he only got a tip of the glove on the ball

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, SIX, fabulous shot! This for me is the shot of the innings. The leg-cutter on a length outside off, Samson plonks his front foot forward and lofts it over extra cover. The power he generated on the slower ball was ashtonishing

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, wow! He's playing a gem here. Bhuvi misses the yorker by a couple of inches and that is enough for Samson, he opens the bat face and square drives it to the fence. Sweeper had no chance

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, and again.. Bhuvi does not look at his best in the death. Taken to the cleaners by Russell in the previous game and now Samson getting stuck into him. Missed the yorker and the squeezed drive beat Pathan near backward point and raced away

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, this is class batting. He is toying with the field. Third man was inside the ring, Bhuvi bowled a short of length leg-cutter and Samson opened the bat face to guide it behind square on the off-side - between backward point and short third man

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, 24 runs off the over. This is batting of the highest quality. No slogging or blind smashing but pure textbook cricket shots. Full delivery outside off, Samson slices it over the point region and though there was a deep point in place, Pathan could not get there

Sandeep Sharma to Samson, SIX, into the 90s now.. Sandeep offers a friendly full toss just below the waist, Samson deep in the crease is set up for a heave into the leg-side, the ball was right in his arc and he swings it away 20 rows back near deep square leg

Bhuvneshwar to Stokes, FOUR, geez! Stokes showing he has the innovative game. He set up for the heave, then wanted to scoop but since the line was outside off, he reverse scooped it over short third man and the connection almost took it the distance

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, hundred for Samson. Second in the IPL for him. Both have come in the last two seasons. He is making sure that Warne was right about his prediction. A innings of top quality. He raises bat and fist pumps both his hands. The Royals family love it and all are on their feet to applaud the innings. Short of length and Samson slaps the pull to long-on, the fielder gets across and dives but does not get enough to stop the ball

Bhuvneshwar to Stokes, FOUR, Stokes being cheeky. He telegraphed his ploy very early, Stokes shuffled across to get inside the line and scoop it over short fine. He generated enough power to clear the fielder
Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, FOUR, 125.3kph. Top hands, and Buttler lets them overcompensate for the lack of feet. Leans back, lets it get close and steers his drive square

Bhuvneshwar to Stokes, FOUR, Rajasthan Royals finish with a mammoth 198. Bhuvi concedes 45 runs from his last 2 overs. Full and wide outside off, Stokes throws the kitchen sink and the outside edge flies over short third man

Rashid Khan to Buttler, out Bowled!! Yeah, that's how you halt rampagers -- with drift. Rashid starts wide of his crease, entices Buttler to go sweeping with the angle. But he gets a little too greedy, shuffling way across, sweeping, and getting fully foxed by the dip, which sneaks under the bat, kisses the glove and is still quick enough to uproot leg. Buttler b Rashid Khan 5(8) [4s-1]
Rashid Khan to Samson, FOUR, streaky edge. Samson has no clue which way this one's spinning, sticks his bat out away from his body desperately and runs it just wide of the diving slip
Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, this is simple. Sandeep strays into the legs, and Rahane isn't foxed on this side of the wicket. Whips, with a lot of bottom-hand, splitting mid-wicket and mid-on
Nadeem to Samson, SIX, bang in the slot. And here's Samson's lazy elegance. On a knee, swinging, sorry slogging, and depositing it deep into cow corner

S Kaul to Samson, SIX, another knuckle pace-off. But Samson picks it perfectly, staying on the front foot and pulling it high. Shankar's waiting for this at deep mid-wicket, he leaps one-handed as well, but despite the 73-meter boundary, the timing takes it just over

Rashid Khan to Samson, FOUR, deft. Samson clears his back leg, perhaps forcing Rashid to go straighter - which he does - and then uses all his pace on offer to merely stick his bat out in a paddled sweep, very fine
Nadeem to Samson, 1 run, miscued front-footed pull. Straight to long-on. Also, the 50-stand between these two
Nadeem to Rahane, SIX, runs down, gets close to the pitch of it and smacks it straight down. He's been looking for this for quite some time now, and he really needs this
D Kulkarni to Warner, FOUR, strays on the pads, swings into the left-hander from round the wicket, a little too much, Warner just has to tickle it away to the fine leg fence for four

D Kulkarni to Warner, SIX, geez that's massive! Banged in on a back of a length @143.5km/h, Warner gets his weight on his backfoot and carts that into the second tier over the cow corner fence. Brutal with a dash of panache...

Gowtham to Warner, FOUR, round the wicket, fires it in flat on a length, Warner steps across and just whip-jabs it with a checked followthrough (or lack thereof) over the fielder at square leg inside the circle for four
Gowtham to Warner, FOUR, fires it down leg, out of fear more than anything else, Warner gets on his knee and gets some bat on it, deflects it away towards the (extremely) fine leg boundary for four

Stokes to Bairstow, 1 run, dropped by Kulkarni at third man! Short one just outside off, angling in, Bairstow stays low and gets under it, runs his hands through the upper-cut, Dhawal runs from third man in to take the catch but fluffs it - concedes a single

Shreyas Gopal to Bairstow, out Caught by D Kulkarni!! Dhawal Kulkarni dropped a relatively easy one last over, but he's taken a blinder at long-off. He was close to the boundary, had to jump to grab the ball, got the timing right and managed to hold on and also stay inside the rope. Bairstow was running back for the second and stood midway in disbelief that the catch was taken. It was a flighted delivery outside off stump, Bairstow steps out and toe-ends the lofted drive, holes out in the end. So both the set batsmen have been removed in quick succession. Bairstow c D Kulkarni b Shreyas Gopal 45(28) [4s-6 6s-1]
Stokes to Williamson, FOUR, oh what a shot! Leans forward and plays that drive with an angled bat to get it past backward point, timing very good and it runs away for four

Stokes to Shankar, FOUR, lovely pull shot. Short delivery, but Shankar rocked back to power it through square leg, Unadkat runs to his left in the deep but can't stop it. But why is he running around near the rope and not bowling?
D Kulkarni to Shankar, SIX, he's powered this all the way over long-on. Backs away, gets a nice short ball, and Shankar flat-batted that hard over the boundary

D Kulkarni to Shankar, SIX, gee he's hit this really, really hard! Slower delivery, but Shankar went back in his crease and positioned himself nicely for the pull shot over mid-wicket, the man in the deep was interested for a bit but it cleared him comfortably
Unadkat to Shankar, SIX, it's a slower ball alright, but this bloke is picking them from the hand, so he's being disguised, nicely gets under the ball and smashes it over mid-wicket
Unadkat to Williamson, FOUR, in the air but wide of backward point, short delivery outside off stump, Williamson cuts hard, the fielder jumped to his right inside the circle but it was well past him

Unadkat to Williamson, out Caught by R Tripathi!! This is going to hand. Slower delivery, Williamson jumped out of the crease to cut, but this one bounced a tad extra, so Williamson couldn't keep it down, easy grab at backward point. Williamson c R Tripathi b Unadkat 14(10) [4s-2]

Shreyas Gopal to Shankar, out Caught by (sub)Chopra!! He's mistimed this loft and long-on swallows the ball. This is an area Shankar has to work on. He gets set, looks so good, but throws it away. It's something that will be on his mind. Lovely googly from Shreyas Gopal, gave it a lot of air, Shankar wanted a maximum, but the bat turned in his hands on impact with the ball and the timing was messed. Anyway, such a good innings from Shankar. Shankar c (sub)Chopra b Shreyas Gopal 35(15) [4s-1 6s-3]

Shreyas Gopal to Manish Pandey, out Lbw!! Appeal and given. Shreyas Gopal wins the Karnataka battle and he's on a hat-trick. Pandey knew he was plumb, didn't bother reviewing. The googly from the bowler, Pandey was lunging forward in his defence, ball hits the pad first and then the bat. Impact in line and it would have crashed into leg at least. Middle and leg according to HawkEye. Manish Pandey lbw b Shreyas Gopal 1(4)
Jofra Archer to Y Pathan, SIX, gee! The bloke is bowling over 140kph, but Yusuf didn't bother going back to pull this hard, hit it flat and all the way over deep square leg
Jofra Archer to Rashid Khan, FOUR, that's the strong bottom hand grip on this punch from Rashid, stayed deep in the crease, converted this yorker into a full ball and crashes it to deep cover

Jofra Archer to Rashid Khan, SIX, oh wow! What a hit and what a shot to finish. Just a whip of the wrists, Jofra Archer's pace helped here, but he middled that so well. Leg-side line again from Archer with the yorker, just a flick with those rubber wrists. SRH win with an over to spare

D Kulkarni to Warner, FOUR, wide yorker length delivery @135.8km/h, just slightly too full, ends up being a full toss only after Warner leans forward, just times it through the gap in the cover for four
Stokes to Warner, FOUR, short one from round the wicket , cross-seamer, Warner opens up his stance and clubs that pull away to wide long-on for four
Stokes to Warner, FOUR, just short of a half-volley, not quite to the pitch, Warner just goes through the line and lofts it over mid-off towards the long-off boundary for four
Stokes to Warner, FOUR, another slower one @112.9km/h, Warner backs away into the on-side, gives himself some space, and slaps it over the in-field towards the sweeper cover boundary for four
Stokes to Warner, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the pads @138.4km/h, clipped away to backward square leg for a single - and that brings up the half-century opening partnership!

Stokes to Bairstow, FOUR, slightly more open-chested from Stokes from wide of the crease, angles it into a short of length spot, Bairstow gets under it and has a slash at it, gets a top-edge that just evades the 'keeper's leap to the third man (almost long stop) boundary for four. 17 off the over!

Jofra Archer to Warner, FOUR, that's the mother of all cross-batted shots! @149.4km/h, no width on the short of length delivery, and a straight pull past the non-striker to the long-off fence for four

Jofra Archer to Warner, 2 runs, short of length delivery angling away @140.3km/h, but not too much, Warner backs away into the on-side and chips it only just over Samson at mid-off towards the extra cover region for a couple to bring up his fifty - raises his bat to the local crowd
Jofra Archer to Bairstow, FOUR, 149.8km/h, but it's a half-volley on the pads - wasted pace. Just an effortless whip to the backward square leg fence for four

Jofra Archer to Bairstow, FOUR, 132.6km/h, that's a slower one, shortish and no width on offer, Bairstow is asked to manufacture his own, and he does so byb moved away into the on-side and slapping it through the gap in the cover region to the deep extra cover fence for four

Shreyas Gopal to Bairstow, FOUR, skids through towards leg, Bairstow steps across and sweeps, in the air for a while, and falls short of Kulkarni at fine leg who can neither catch it, nor stop it, as it goes away for four
Gowtham to Warner, SIX, right in the swinging arc for Warner, wide and full outside off, Warner steps forward and lofts it flat over long-off for a six

Gowtham to Warner, FOUR, pulls the length back, nothing wrong with this one, Warner opens the face and threads the needle that is the gap in the cover region - touch and class, and away she goes to the deep extra cover fence for four

Shreyas Gopal to Bairstow, SIX, what a way to bring up the hundred partnership! Dropped short, a rank half-tracker, Bairstow uses the depth of the crease, rocks back, and throws his entire weight behind that pull over cow corner for six

Stokes to Bairstow, FOUR, 140.4km/h, back of a length delivery without width, Bairstow backs away into the on-side, gives himself room, and carves it away towards the deep backward point fence for four. NOT a lot of width, but the arm-power made up for it...

Stokes to Warner, out Caught by D Kulkarni! When Warner departs in an away venue, you can hear the combined sound of a city sighing in relief - but at home, you can hear a pin drop. Bangs it in short this time, Warner gets under it by shuffling across to hook, gets a bit of a top-edge and spoons a catch to Kulkarni at the fine leg boundary! The God of Carnage departs. Warner c D Kulkarni b Stokes 69(37) [4s-9 6s-2]
Stokes to Bairstow, FOUR, shortish, marginally wide, Bairstow just stays back and focuses on the placement - carves it away towards the deep backward point fence for four

McClenaghan to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle plays the ramp now, safe shot as third man was inside the ring - short and well wide of off, he waited on it, opens the face of the bat and ramps it over the empty slip cordon, one bounce and over the ropes

Krunal Pandya to Agarwal, SIX, that's quality hitting from Agarwal. He didn't try to hit it hard, comes close to the ball, keeps his shape and larrups it down the ground. The timing was good enough to clear the long-on fence which is not a short boundary at all
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, pushes it with the spin to deep cover and he will retain the strike

Krunal Pandya to Agarwal, SIX, he is playing the innings of his life in the IPL. Gets a six off the first ball of the over- doing it the Kohli way. Holds his shape, clears his leg and smashes it down the ground for a six

Krunal Pandya to Agarwal, out Caught&Bowled!! An excellent innings from Agarwal comes to an end. He is a disappointed, looks upwards after giving the catch. It was a flatter one on the stumps and Agarwal smashes it straight back to the bowler. It was hit at a ferocious pace and Krunal Pandya did really well to grab the catch. He takes off the bails at the non striker's end too, not sure why. Agarwal c and b Krunal Pandya 43(21) [4s-4 6s-2]

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, SIX, this is more like Rahul. This is the Rahul we know. It was a back of a length delivery wide of off, there was enough room available for Rahul. He backs away, brings his willow down at a tremendous speed and cuts it over deep backward point for a six

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, tell you what, his touch is back. It was fuller and Rahul creams it wide of Rohit at cover. He wasn't far from the ball but it was hit very hard and will canter to the fence

Hardik Pandya to Miller, FOUR, nicely done by Miller! Expensive over from Hardik Pandya. 19 runs off it. It can be a match-changing over. It was short and was aimed on the body, Miller gently clips it wide of the keeper for a boundary

Malinga to Rahul, FOUR, fifty for Rahul! Not the most ravishing innings but it has been a fighting knock from the Karnataka lad. And he looks like taking his team home. It was a short of length delivery on the face, Rahul gets inside the line of the ball and pulls it fine of fine leg for a boundary
Bumrah to Rahul, FOUR, Bumrah misses the yorker. This is rare from India's number-one bowler. Rahul has got his touch back and he punches it wide of long-off for a boundary

Bumrah to Rahul, FOUR, he looks in fabulous touch, how quickly things can change for a batter in this format. It was a back of a length delivery on the stumps, Rahul hops a touch and half-pulls it wide of deep square leg for a boundary. Sweet timing!

McClenaghan to Miller, FOUR, smashed! Punjab are just a hit away from winning this. It was a fuller length delivery and was wide of off, Miller backs away, makes room and thumps it wide of deep cover for a boundary. It rockets to the fence!
McClenaghan to Miller, wide, 50-run partnership comes up. It has been a match-winning one for Punjab. McClenaghan gets his line wrong this time, it was well down the leg-side and Miller lets it go

Bumrah to Rahul, FOUR, cheeky from Rahul. He is taking his side over the line for sure. It was on a length and there was just a bit of room, Rahul waits for it to arrive, opens the face of the bat at the very last moment and guides it fine of third man who had no chance to stop it

McClenaghan to Gayle, SIX, massive, you can't bowl short to this man - this simply sat up to be smacked, Gayle stands tall and pummels it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum, 101m hit, a colossal one
McClenaghan to Gayle, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Gayle, his 300th six in IPL, length ball at the stumps, he leans forward and thumps it high and over mid-on, went a long way over the ropes
Bumrah to Rahul, FOUR, beautifully played, fraction too full and well outside off, Rahul leans into the drive and places it into the gap past cover-point, beats the infield and runs away to the ropes

Malinga to Gayle, FOUR, lovely, very full and at the stumps, Gayle gets his left leg out of the way and plays a pristine straight drive - past Rahul and beyond Pollard's reach - running across from long-on
Malinga to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle is in his elements today, slower short ball outside off, Gayle picked the length early and found the gap past cover-point with the cut

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, SIX, clears the mid-wicket fence, but only just. It's a baby six by Gayle's gigantic standards. It was a slower one on the stumps, Gayle backs away, clears his front leg and powers it over deep mid-wicket.

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, SIX, you can't miss your length by an inch when Universe Boss is in this mood. Attempted yorker goes wrong, Gayle goes deep in his crease, makes it into an overpitched delivery and larrups it straight down the ground for a massive six

Krunal Pandya to Gayle, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Pandya brothers come together to get rid of the Universe Boss! This is excellent captaincy from Rohit. He was brave enough to bring his left-arm spinner against Gayle and the man from Baroda hasn't disappointed him. It was wide of off and Gayle wanted to clobber it down the ground. Doesn't get it off the sweet spot and it went a long way up in the air. Hardik at long-on takes it with ease in the end. It wasn't the easiest of catches. Gayle c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 40(24) [4s-3 6s-4]
Krunal Pandya to Agarwal, FOUR, just a chip shot from Agarwal but he has timed it to perfection. And has placed it well too. It will beat the straight fielders for a boundary

Markande to Agarwal, FOUR, he looks in great touch does Agarwal. It wasn't that bad a delivery, just a little bit short. Agarwal rocks back and powers it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary. He bisected long-on and deep mid-wicket to perfection

Markande to Agarwal, FOUR, Agarwal is seeing the ball really well. And he is placing them well too. He goes on the back foot and pulls it wide of deep mid-wicket. Doesn't try to hit it too hard, placement was the key

Krunal Pandya to Agarwal, FOUR, 18 off 7! He is playing a gem. Backs away on this delivery, creates his own room, wanted to cut it wide of backward point. Gets an oustide edge and it ends up fine of short fine for a boundary
Shami to Rohit, FOUR, can't bowl short to Rohit when it's not that high. He'll pick on you every single time. Swivels this time and helps it along, clearing short fine leg quite easily

Shami to Rohit, FOUR, classy shot! Sublime stuff from Rohit, struck this punchy drive on the up and once he pierced the gap at cover, it was always racing along. It wasn't a bad ball to be honest, just one of those things this man can do when on song

Tye to Yuvraj, FOUR, one-handed check drive from Yuvraj, aerial as well but then, the intention was to clear the infield. Therefore, the deception didn't of the slower ball didn't dent his intent and he went through with the chip shot. Over extra cover and to the fence

Tye to Yuvraj, FOUR, straight as an arrow! Now this shot should boost Yuvraj's morale. Low full toss alright but the execution was admirable. Punchy drive that was straight back past the bowler and it rocketed to the fence. Didn't overhit it and that was the key

Murugan Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR, in the air....safe and to the fence! Was a lofted hit from de Kock and he got more height than distance on the stroke. Long-on and deep mid-wicket were converging on the stroke but with no real chance of getting to it. The former, Mayank, tried in vain as it landed short of him and to the fence. 50 for QDK! Super knock so far

Shami to Yuvraj, 1 run, cramps Yuvraj with this good length ball, stabbed towards extra cover for a sharp run. 50-run stand comes up! Valuable one for MI who now have the platform to launch at the death
Shami to de Kock, SIX, sensational pick up shot from de Kock! Treats Shami as a spinner here by walking across and just drop kicks it over deep square leg. Beautiful connection

Shami to de Kock, out Lbw!! Much-needed breakthrough for KXIP. de Kock was getting into overdrive and this shot perhaps, was a result of that. Premeditated by walking across the stumps and Shami did the basics right, full and straight. de Kock couldn't connect the sweep and once he got hit on the pad, it was always going to be out. The umpire felt so too and although the South African opted for the DRS, there was nothing on UltraEdge to save him. Three Reds on HawkEye to compound the misery and MI have lost the review. Excellent innings nevertheless. de Kock lbw b Shami 60(39) [4s-6 6s-2]

Murugan Ashwin to Yuvraj, out Caught by Shami!! This was coming - Yuvraj was being tied down and he falls while trying for that big hit - picked the wrong 'un as he went down on the sweep, couldn't roll his wrists over and ended up swiping it in the air. Shami was the man running across to his right from deep backward square leg, gets himself into a good position and holds on. MI are stuttering once again in the middle overs. Yuvraj c Shami b Murugan Ashwin 18(22) [4s-2]

Murugan Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, edged and four, another wrong 'un from Murugan, fraction short and spinning back into the right-hander, Hardik didn't pick it as he went for the cut - cramped up for room, gets a thick outside edge that brushes Rahul's gloves and runs away to the third man fence

Viljoen to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, cracking shot, tad too short from Viljoen, Hardik swivels across, rolls his wrists and finds the gap between the two men in the deep, much needed boundary for the Mumbai Indians

Tye to Pollard, out Caught by Agarwal!! That's a high catch and Mayank has judged it to perfection at long-off. 'This went to the moon and came back' chirps Danny Morrison on air. Pollard got this one very high and it took an age to come down - but it looked like it didn't have enough legs to clear the fielder, Mayank was the man under it, he held his cool, waited for the ball to arrive and pouched it with both hands. The knuckle ball and Pollard didn't spot, was way too early on the lofted drive - plenty of height but not the distance. Pollard c Agarwal b Tye 7(9)

Viljoen to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, Oh dear! That's extremely poor from Shami - ran across from deep backward square leg, got close to the ball and then let it for the other fielder - in the end, both are nowhere close to the ball and it costs them a couple of extra runs, short and at the stumps, pulled away past square leg

Viljoen to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Krunal, he's getting a move on, length delivery outside off, Krunal delayed his drive by a moment and then placed it wide of extra-cover - no one in the deep and the ball ran away to the fence

Viljoen to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Murugan Ashwin!! That's a good wicket at this stage of the innings - Krunal was opening up, but Viljoen has his man. Short and angling down the leg-side, Krunal was looking to help it on its way with the shovel - didn't get hold of the shot and popped it in the air over square leg. Murugan Ashwin ran across to his left from the deep and completed the catch with soft hands. Krunal Pandya c Murugan Ashwin b Viljoen 10(5) [4s-2]
Viljoen to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, short, wide and four, Hardik has plenty of width on offer as he scythes this one past point, no need to run for those

Shami to Hardik Pandya, SIX, and this is why - another full-toss and it has been sent into the mid-wicket stands, presses across and then whips it with the bottom-hand, high and long into the crowd - Shami can't bowl such stuff at this stage of the innings

Shami to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Mandeep!! That's the end of Hardik, but he has played another fine hand for his team. Short and just outside off, he got into a good position on the pull, but doesn't get hold of the shot. Went high and straight into the hands of mandeep - who was standing in front of the ropes at mid-wicket. Hardik has his bat on his shoulder as he walks away in disappointment. Hardik Pandya c Mandeep b Shami 31(19) [4s-3 6s-1]

Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR, just over a leaping Viljoen! Nervy moment for de Kock who went for the slog sweep and it wasn't that far away from backward square leg where Viljoen leapt with all his might, only to clear him en route to the fence

Tye to Rohit, FOUR, up and over! Might have been the slower ball from Tye but it's was quite wide and that allowed Rohit to extend his arms. Didn't connect the loft perfectly but had enough to clear the infield

Tye to Rohit, FOUR, genius stuff from Rohit! Was giving the charge and then got a slower ball in response, quite shorter too but the MI skipper adjusted with an elegant back foot punch through backward point. Style, grace and placement all ticked
Tye to Rohit, FOUR, more runs! Rohit is shifting gears now. This was a touch too straight in line and he just shuffled across to help this away past short fine leg

Viljoen to Rohit, out Lbw!! Massive strike from Viljoen! Rohit was looking ominous and if KXIP needed him gone, it was right here right now and that's exactly what the South African has done. Must say it wasn't a great shot from the MI skipper, stood rooted on the crease to an extremely full in-angler, attempted to just slog across the line, only to get struck on the back leg. Looked plumb in real time itself unless there was an inside edge but there wasn't. Rohit lbw b Viljoen 32(18) [4s-5]
Viljoen to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, deft touch from Yadav! Too straight in line from Viljoen and it's clipped softly wide of short fine leg

Viljoen to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, ominous! Whoa, the bloke is looking in sync from ball one. Got forward to this fuller one and just eased it past the bowler. Just a mere push and such was the timing that it raced away, beating mid-on comfortably

Murugan Ashwin to Suryakumar Yadav, out Lbw!! The other Ashwin gets into the act! Just two balls to take the wicket and it's another vital one as Yadav can be dangerous. This was slider and kept a trifle low perhaps as he tried to whip-pull across the line. Once he missed it, there was no doubt on the LBW. As plumb as it gets and Yadav knew it too as he continued the walk to the dugout. Suryakumar Yadav lbw b Murugan Ashwin 11(6) [4s-2]
Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR, too close to cut! de Kock pulls it off though and gets it away very fine, beating short third man to the fence. 1000 IPL runs up for QDK!

Murugan Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR, bulldozed away! Came down the track and Ashwin adjusted with a shorter one wider outside off, flat-batted powerfully straight down the ground. Long-on was wider and had no chance

Murugan Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR, to the other side of long-on this time. Was floated up fuller outside off and de Kock whipped it away with that strong bottom hand of his. Power and precision in placement as he got it between long-on and deep mid-wicket

Shami to de Kock, SIX, dumped into the crowd! Fractionally short from Shami and it's not that high to threaten de Kock either. The South African swivels across to shovel the pull high and handsome over deep backward square leg. Huge hit!

Prasidh to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, boundary to end the over. The short of length delivery sits up on the surface, Shaw had plenty of time to swivel and nail the pull in front of square, no chance for Ferguson this time
Ferguson to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, whippage! Ferguson tries the slower delivery but offers a half volley on middle and leg, Shaw leans forward and whips it with a lot of bottom hand to deep mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, proper drag down - as bad as it can get. And it's the googly as well in it, giving Iyer all the more time to read it better - not that he needed it - but then he waits slogging it several rows into deep square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, now the advance, stepping away from the line to free up his hands. And his hands take it inside-out over long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, quickly on a knee, and to his credit doesn't try getting under the already-full length. Instead settles to sweep, and does it straight down the ground
A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, juicy overcook - oh no it's a full toss - and Shaw has half a helicopter and half a flamingo. So he Dhoni-Pietersen's it through cow corner. Go, figure ..

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, there's insult. And then there's this. Firstly Russell's bowling because he has to, and then he's been carted around, and to top it all, the one chance he creates it put down so damn casually. Iyer whips uppishly, doesn't get the distance, straight to Gill, who just lets it spill through
A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, full, outside off, Iyer slices hard, drilling it in fact through extra cover. More insult .. an injured soul to top an injured shoulder

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Catching confusion. Gill - in redemption - has done a Dinesh Karthik, plucking pretty much one he would've been forgiven for putting down after dropping one he couldn't have been forgiven for. Iyer whips again, airily, Gill, at cow corner's boundary goes reverse cupped right at the edge over his head. But, but, is his foot touching the cushions? The umpires aren't taking a chance, they go up. And gee, this is really tight. The soft signal wins - OUT. Shreyas Iyer c Shubman Gill b A Russell 43(32) [4s-4 6s-2]
Nitish Rana to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, quick, short, outside off. Never mind it spinning back in, Shaw's already deep enough in the crease and very cheekily dabbing it off the keeper's gloves

Prasidh to Pant, FOUR, it's getting predictable. 97.8kph here, which Pant first presses forward to and then piles on the line already on the pads to help - with a lot of power in his whack of course - behind square
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, sitter googly. Shaw sits over it, no sorry stands over it, and slaps it away hard, and doesn't even bother keeping it down as he goes over cover
Ferguson to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, threatens with the bouncer, but Shaw's not not taking it on. He's waiting deep in the crease just for it and swivels in his hook to put it away very fine
Ferguson to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, short again. Shaw goes 180-degrees the other way now .. makes room and upper-cuts, over short third man

Prasidh to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, oh he wants a century. And Krishna surely is helping him to it. An overtly friendly drifter down leg, Shaw stays his ground, picks and dispatches it off his legs past the diving keeper

Prasidh to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, and he has the time to rub in some grace as well into this carnage. The full-faced punch down the pitch, which should ideally have been just a couple, but Russell just doesn't dive. Poor guy, he just can't

Kuldeep Yadav to Pant, out Caught by Chawla!! Miss. Miss. Connect. And when he does, it picks out the man in the deep. Pant refuses to ditch his failed slog sweep from a ball earlier, goes through but Kuldeep very smartly has dragged his length back on this one, making Pant eventually go one-handed in his followthrough. Miscued severely, to deep mid-wicket. Pant c Chawla b Kuldeep Yadav 11(15) [4s-1]

Ferguson to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Karthik!! Kotla heartbreak. A quicker bumper, Shaw can't resist, but for once doesn't find his bat's middle. Big fat top-edge, ballooning high, where DK calls, and nearly makes a mess under the skier, eventually having to take his tummy's help in holding on. So Shaw may have missed out on becoming the youngest IPL centurion, but he becomes the second in these 12 seasons to get out on 99. It's all about getting into trivia books after all, right?! Prithvi Shaw c Karthik b Ferguson 99(55) [4s-12 6s-3]
Ferguson to Ingram, FOUR, short, angling across. But Ingram goes almost as deep as his stumps and waits for the slant to get big as he pulls it away, splitting the massive leg-sided gap perfectly

Kuldeep Yadav to Hanuma Vihari, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! It will twist, ever so slowly, but it will twist. Short, skiddy, heaved, and it's straight down deep mid-wicket's throat. The favourites have turned, clearly. Hanuma Vihari c Shubman Gill b Kuldeep Yadav 2(3)
Ferguson to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan has his first boundary. Delhi need him to fire and fire quickly. Picks the fullish length and just lofts through the line, clears mid-on quite comfortably

Chawla to Dhawan, FOUR, up and over. This is good intent from Dhawan. Shimmies down the wicket and gets a bit too close to the delivery, but still goes through with the loft and clears a leaping Russell near the mid-off ring

Chawla to Dhawan, SIX, now follows it up with a maximum. This is Dhawan at his best. Googly around leg-stump, that is easy pickings for the left hander, kneels down and sweeps it with a clean bat swing over long leg

Chawla to Dhawan, out Caught by A Russell!! Gone! One shot too many from the southpaw. KKR have got their early wicket. He cleared mid-off a couple of deliveries ago but not this time. He advances and once more gets very close to the ball, spoons the loft straight into the bucket hands of Russell at mid-off. Dhawan c A Russell b Chawla 16(8) [4s-2 6s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Ingram, out Ingram Run Out!! 1 run completed. Swipes behind square. And he runs. He HAS TO. Beats short fine leg. But all his desperation is good enough for a single. Uthappa swooped in there, and capped it with a flat throw at the striker's. And DK turns the lights up .. SUPER OVER. Oh Kolkata have stolen this, right under Delhi's nose. Ingram run out (Uthappa/Karthik) 10(7) [4s-1]
A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, overpitched and Shaw does not miss out, he stays leg-side of the ball and lifts it over mid-off. Just managed to clear Ferguson on the edge of the 30-yard circle

A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, cracking shot! Shaw picked the length so quickly there, it was fraction short and he was onto it in a flash, gets into a good position and nails the pull flat into the crowd at deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, he connects and that should be a relief. Floated up outside off and that was in the slot for Iyer, who free his arms and smashes it straight back over his partner

Kuldeep Yadav to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, in the air and over the rope. Seemed like a mishit by Shaw but it carried a good fair distance. Flighted outside off and Shaw lofts it down the ground, clearing long-off. 13 off the over and it was much needed for Delhi
Chawla to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, conventional, leg-lined, but Iyer's smarter. Clears his forward leg, steps away too and then swings. Into long-on's first floor
Ferguson to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, too short. And that fiendly short. Iyer jumps, doesn't mind pulling it with an air-swivel, powerfully through mid-wicket

Rabada to Nikhil Naik, FOUR, Rabada almost strikes on his first ball, almost! Pitches this one up around the off-stump line, Nikhil Naik looks to defend this and ends up getting an inside edge. The ball whizzes past the leg stump and races away to the fine leg fence. Lucky start!

Rabada to Chris Lynn, FOUR, excellent timing! Another delivery pitched on a full length by KG, Chris Lynn leans forward and just play a gentle push. Timing is good enough to beat the fielder at wide mid-off as the ball rockets to the fence, two boundaries in the over so far..

Lamichhane to Nikhil Naik, no run, Delhi have taken a review in the second over of the match itself. They've challenged the umpire's call. Has Nikhil Naik edged this? Rishabh Pant was excited but there's clear daylight between the bat and ball. Delhi lose their review! Was a quicker legbreak outside off and the batsman was looking to steer it to third man before he got beaten on his bottom edge
Mishra to A Russell, SIX, 100 runs for Russell in the league after this six! Was a tossed up delivery around off and the Dre Russ muscles it over long-off for a flat six
Lamichhane to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik brings out his sledge hammer! Treks back and clobbers it through mid-wicket. Sheer power and the placement was perfect too
Lamichhane to A Russell, SIX, Muscle-Russell in the house! Reads the googly and pumps it over deep mid-wicket with all his might. There was a fielder in the deep but he was a mere spectator

Lamichhane to A Russell, SIX, is this going to be another one of those nights? If Dre Russ stays out there, it probably might. Down on his knee as he clubs the juicy legbreak right over the bowler's head. That was absolutely launched by the beast

Mishra to Karthik, FOUR, classic Karthik! Takes a forward stride and flicks this one effortlessly through mid-wicket. All about timing, yet again. Not for the first time has DK timed it so well, have been quite a few in this innings so far

Chris Morris to A Russell, FOUR, uhhh! That was streaky but KKR won't mind it. Low full toss close to the yorker range, Russell bends down to try and squeeze it out, the under edge bounces past the stumps and races to the fine leg fence

Chris Morris to A Russell, leg byes, FOUR, loses his radar does Morris. Tries to follow Russell and cramp him for room, but sprays it too far down leg, the ball takes a deflection off the pad and beats Pant to his left

Chris Morris to A Russell, SIX, straight over the sightscreen. Morris goes off-pace but the length is right in the slot, Russell spotted it out of the hand, waited for the ball to arrive and smacked it with all that Caribbean power back over Morris

Harshal Patel to Karthik, FOUR, power from one end and finesse from the other - perfect combination. A low full toss outside off, Karthik just had to put it in the gap, he leans forward and creams the drive through extra cover - splitting the two fielders

Harshal Patel to A Russell, SIX, massive! This one hits the roof of the top tier and falls back into the ground. Length and that is one thing you can't bowl to Russell, he just uses that raw muscle power to club it over long-on

Harshal Patel to A Russell, SIX, oh geez! Absolute carnage at Kotla. How things turnaround in T20 cricket.
