Just a while back KKR looked down but now they are bossing this game through Russell and Karthik. Another length ball and Russell says thank you very much and puts it into the crowd near the cow corner region

Rabada to A Russell, FOUR, fifty for Russell. This might be a very typical Russell innings but the circumstances were different as compared to the previous two outings. Came in to bat inside the 10th over and has bailed his side out of trouble. Dug in short and Russell is waiting for it, nails the pull wide of deep mid-wicket

Chris Morris to A Russell, FOUR, even fours matter for Russell. It is not only about sixes. A few inches short of yorker length and that is enough for Russell to go through with his heave, one bounce and over the ropes near deep mid-wicket

Chris Morris to A Russell, FOUR, this is top top batting. Fires the yorker from round the wicket but Russell is up for it, he makes room and bends down to squeeze it past backward point, the pace of Morris took care of the rest

Chris Morris to A Russell, out Caught by (sub)Rahul Tewatia!! A collision between the fielders but more importantly the catch is taken. A brutal innings from Russell comes to an end. He's put his side in the ascendancy here. The slower short of length delivery and Russell was a tad early into the pull shot, the top-edge flew up towards deep square leg and Tewatia ran in to catch it. Rabada was the one who collided as he ran back from short fine with his eyes on the ball. A Russell c (sub)Rahul Tewatia b Chris Morris 62(28) [4s-4 6s-6]
Mishra to Chawla, SIX, that is dismissive from Chawla. Off the mark with a maximum. Wrong 'un and Chawla picked it, went down on his knee and slog swept it with a clean bat swing over long leg

Mishra to Karthik, SIX, fifty for Karthik. Cometh the hour, cometh the captain. This is what responsibility has done to DK. He is a completely different batsman and this knock should rate among his best. Shuffles across, bends down and sweeps it high and into the stands at fine leg

Mishra to Karthik, out Caught by Pant!! He walks! Some respite for Mishra, who has taken a beating in this over. This would have been a wide had Karthik let go but instead he goes chasing after it. The leg-break trying to keep it away from the batsman's range, but DK reaches out and feathers an outside edge to Pant. He does not even wait for the umpire to raise his finger. Karthik c Pant b Mishra 50(36) [4s-5 6s-2]

Rabada to Kuldeep Yadav, FOUR, poor bowling from Rabada. He misses the yorker and bowls a juicy full toss outside off, Kuldeep uses the pace and steers it to third man, no one there to stop the boundary
Rabada to Chawla, FOUR, all these are bonus runs. Banged in short and aimed for the badge on the helmet, Chawla pulls and the top-edge runs away fine beating Patel near the fine leg fence

Rabada to Chawla, out Chawla Run Out!! 1 run completed. Confusion and it results in a run out. Chawla mistimes the loft towards long-on and he was never interested in the second, Kuldeep pushed for it and Chawla decided to go, but the batsmen didn't cross each other when Rabada removed the bails which means Chawla was the one to be dismissed. Chawla run out (Dhawan/Rabada) 12(5) [4s-1 6s-1]

Lamichhane to Nikhil Naik, out Lbw!! Nikhil Naik's struggle comes to an end. Walks back after consuming 16 deliveries for his 7. Scored a boundary that too off an inside edge. Hard luck. Was the wrong 'un around middle and the batsman got beaten due to the googly. Struck in front of middle and going on to hit the leg-stump. Lamichanne makes an impact in his first game of the season. Nikhil Naik lbw b Lamichhane 7(16) [4s-1]

Lamichhane to Uthappa, FOUR, off the mark with a boundary! Scored a fifty in the last match too. Plants his front foot forward and creams the legbreak through the gap at covers. The outfield is quick enough to get him off the mark with four runs

Chris Morris to Chris Lynn, FOUR, clean strike! Width on offer on this length delivery and Chris Lynn chips it over wide mid-off. Clears the infield comfortably and gets his second boundary of the match
Chris Morris to Chris Lynn, FOUR, hacked down to fine leg by Chris Lynn! On the shorter side around middle and leg, Chris swivels and puts it away to the fine leg fence for another boundary
Harshal Patel to Uthappa, FOUR, that shot proves how good a form Uthappa is in. Was a shortish delivery outside off, Robbie makes the width on offer and chops it past the fielder at point

Harshal Patel to Uthappa, out Lbw!! That's P.L.U.M.B! If that's not out, nothing else can be. Patel outfoxes Robbie with the off-cutter. He was looking to flick across the line but he gets beaten due to the lack of pace. Struck in front of middle and it would have crashed into middle and leg. Middle, probably. No reviews left and even if there was one, it wouldn't have made a difference. Uthappa lbw b Harshal Patel 11(6) [4s-2]

Rabada to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Pant!! That's a terrific catch by Pant. Is there anything, he can't do? Flies to his left and plucks this one with his left glove. Knight Riders in trouble with three of their top-order batsmen back to the hut. A short delivery down the leg side and Chris Lynn gets a glove as he looks to play the pull shot. The run rate is well under 6 at the moment. Can they stitch in a partnership? Chris Lynn c Pant b Rabada 20(18) [4s-3]

Rabada to Karthik, FOUR, intent from the skipper! Wastes no time. Gets a half-volley on the pads and DK flicks it with nonchalance. The timing was such that the fielder had deep mid-wicket could nothing else than admire the shot

Harshal Patel to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Rabada!! Wickets continue to tumble at the Kotla. KKR struggling big time in their first away game of the season. Patel bags his second wicket! This was a back of a length delivery down the leg side and Nitish Rana flicks it straight to fine leg. The ball flew of the blade and Rabada in the deep took a well judged catch running to his right. 44/4 stands the score. The crowd at Delhi is lovin' it. Nitish Rana c Rabada b Harshal Patel 1(2)

Harshal Patel to Karthik, SIX, 50 up for KKR with a maximum! Too hot, too cool. A short delivery down the leg side and Karthik picks it up over deep backward square leg for a flat six. Right over the opposition's dug-out she goes

Mishra to Karthik, FOUR, that's a lucky boundary for KKR! Was the slider outside off, DK goes for a cut and gets an underedge. Nutmegs the keeper and races away to third man fence. There were two fielders chasing but both were inside the circle, hence there was no chance of stopping this

Lamichhane to Shubman Gill, out Shubman Gill Run Out!! 2 runs completed. KKR sink further! Not their day, perhaps. All credit to Rabada though, he dived full stretch to his left after he sprinted across from sweeper cover. Gill had square driven it through point and was expecting a boundary but is denied that due to some brilliance it the field. KG had parried the ball to Patel in the deep and the throw came in at the bowler's end. The batsman was ball watching while going for the third run and has to pay the price for it. Shubman Gill run out (Harshal Patel/Lamichhane) 4(5)
Bhuvneshwar to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, lovely, on a good length and well outside off, Parthiv leans into the drive, plays it on the up and finds the gap to the left of cover - no need to run for those
Nabi to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short from Nabi, Parthiv is quick to pick the length early, rocks back and pulls it over mid-wicket for a boundary
S Kaul to de Grandhomme, SIX, knuckle ball from Kaul, Grandhomme picks it early and waits back to heave it over deep square leg. Didn't come off the middle but enough to clear the fielder's head

Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, SIX, rare loose delivery from Rashid and Grandhomme comfortably smokes it over the fence at deep mid-wicket. Dragged it short, sits up superbly for Grandhomme and he takes toll..
Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, FOUR, Grandhomme shows some deftness. Uses the pace of this delivery, goes deep in his crease and guides it past backward point. Cleverly done

Bhuvneshwar to Prayas Barman, FOUR, well-directed short ball from Kumar but Barman manages to help it over the keeper. Gets himself into a tangle as he was late on the pull, however gets some glove on it and it purrs away to the fine leg fence
Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, Kumar continues to struggle with his lines. Attempted pitched up delivery, ends up in the slot for Grandhomme who makes merry. Hoicking it over wide long-on

Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, FOUR, that's hit uppishly and Manish Pandey at long-off tries his best diving to his left but it eludes him. Floater outside off, Grandhomme plants his front foot across and lofts it towards long-off and luckily gets away as Manish's outstretched lefthand was far enough

Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, no run, leading edge lands short of Bhuvi at point. And there's some confusion in the running but Barman gets back in safely at the non-striker's end. Lures Grandhomme into playing an across-the-line-heave, loses shape as the ball sharply turns away and it drops a couple of inches in front of SRH's captain
S Kaul to Prayas Barman, FOUR, 50-partnership comes up with this boundary. Short ball that lacks pace, Barman gets into a wonderful position and connects the pull sublimely over square leg

Sandeep Sharma to Prayas Barman, out Caught by Hooda!! Sandeep Sharma foxes the young Barman with a knuckle ball but he's showed his skills with the bat. It was full and Barman was early into the shot, ends up chipping it Hooda at short mid-wicket, who takes the sitter. The spirited partnership has been broken and RCB have lost their seventh wicket. Prayas Barman c Hooda b Sandeep Sharma 19(24) [4s-2]
Sandeep Sharma to U Yadav, SIX, you can't keep bowling knuckle balls every now and then. This was right in the arc for Umesh, who swings his bat and muscles it into the second tier at long-on
Shankar to U Yadav, FOUR, drilled wide of mid-off. Shankar overpitches outside off, Umesh loads up and bottom-hands the drive in the gap between extra cover and mid-off

Shankar to U Yadav, no run. Bairstow appeals but umpire S Ravi signals it a wide. The wicket-keeper has a word with his bowler and the captain, off they go for a review. Nothing wrong with the front foot and there's a certain deflection but I think it's come off the trousers. Clearly missed the bat and it's a smart review from SRH because S Ravi changes his decision about the wide and it's deemed a legitimate delivery. Full and nipping down leg, Umesh lines up for the swipe and it brushes his trousers on the way to the keeper

Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, out U Yadav Run Out!! 1 run completed. This is suicidal. Chipped away towards sweeper cover and Grandhomme wanted the second. Just went through without looking at his partner who was busy ball-watching. They stumbled mid-pitch and Umesh eventually paid the price. Vijay Shankar fires a clean throw to Rashid, who waits before dislodging the bails. Umesh was not even in the frame and this sums up RCB's day. U Yadav run out (Shankar/Rashid Khan) 14(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shankar to de Grandhomme, 1 run, Bhuvi drops a straightforward catch at extra cover but SRH won't mind match. Williamson and Co. are in all smiles at the dug-out. Hammered airly, went straight to Bhuvi, who mistimed his jump and ended up shelling it

Shankar to Siraj, no ball, out de Grandhomme Run Out!! Low full toss outside off, Siraj drives it to extra cover and went for the single. Grandhomme took a few yards before backing out. Both batsmen tries to return back to the crease and the throw from the fielder comes to the non striker's end. The Kiwi all-round was pretty lazy in grounding his bat and Shankar breaks the stumps to catch him short of his crease. There was also another run-out chance at the striker's end as Siraj was struggling to make his ground. Shankar lasers the throw to Bairstow, who ends up crashing into the stumps. Total confusion there. Phew! de Grandhomme run out (Bhuvneshwar/Shankar) 37(32) [4s-3 6s-2]

Sandeep Sharma to Siraj, 1 run, anti-climax. Nabi puts down a tough chance at long-off. Siraj miscues the pull and Nabi comes charging in from long-off, bends forward and gets both hands but fails to hold onto it

Sandeep Sharma to Chahal, out Caught by Hooda!! End of RCB's misery. Chahal surrenders. Short delivery, too pacy and Chahal went for the pull, launches it into the night sky as far as mid-wicket. Hooda cups it easily and that's the game in the bag for SRH. Chahal c Hooda b Sandeep Sharma 1(3)

Nabi to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! That's a gift from Parthiv and Manish takes it with glee - a low full-toss from Nabi, Parthiv backed away as he looked to clear the infield - doesn't get hold of the shot and pops it straight to cover. Not the start RCB wanted - their little pocket dynamo falls early. Parthiv Patel c Manish Pandey b Nabi 11(8) [4s-2]

Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, SIX, clubbed, Hetmyer comes with a reputation and he gets his first six of the IPL - back of a length and just outside off, he clears his left leg and hammers it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum

Nabi to Hetmyer, out Stumped!! One shot too many and Nabi has two-in-two. He's on a hat-trick now. Gave his intentions away quite early, came charging down the pitch, allowed Nabi to shorten his length - once past the swinging blade of Hetmyer, there was no coming back. Quick work from Bairstow and Hetmyer is well short of his ground. Hetmyer st Bairstow b Nabi 9(9) [6s-1]

Nabi to de Villiers, out Bowled!! Nabi is running through RCB single-handedly - the dangerous AB falls and the Banglaore franchise are in a mess. Lovely loopy delivery on off, dragged AB forward as he looked to go inside out over cover, the ball drifted away and then dipped past the outside edge - clatters into the stumps and that's the end of AB - End of RCB? Think so. de Villiers b Nabi 1(2)

Nabi to Moeen Ali, byes, FOUR, a rare botch-up from Bairstow tonight - he has missed a simple stumping chance. Moeen rushed down the track, swung in hope against the ball kept slanting in, past the inside edge and past the gloves of the keeper

Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, out Caught by Warner!! If it wasn't over, it's definitely over now. Kohli falls and RCB are staring at humiliation. Length ball and it was there to be smacked - Kohli leant into the drive and drilled it towards cover - didn't bother to keep it down - straight into the hands of Warner who made it look easy - a head-high catch and he clasps it with ease. The misery continues for RCB. Kohli c Warner b Sandeep Sharma 3(10)

Sandeep Sharma to Shivam Dube, out Moeen Ali Run Out!! Make it five down now. I'm pretty sure that Moeen is short of his ground, his bat is in the air and he already looks downcast. Well short, Moeen is OUT. Oh dear, RCB are batting and now running like senseless chickens. On a good length and just outside off, Dube clipped it towards mid-wicket and took a start, that prompted Moeen Ali to make a dash, sent back late - too late though - Nabi shies and misses, sandeep has time to break the stumps with the batsman well short. Moeen Ali run out (Nabi/Sandeep Sharma) 2(8)
Sandeep Sharma to Shivam Dube, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer and Dube gets on top of it with the cut - behind square on the off-side and races away to the ropes

Nabi to Shivam Dube, out Caught by Hooda!! It's getting worse and worse for RCB. Nabi is having a dream spell as he picks up his fourth wicket. Dube had a chance to prove his mettle but he just miscues one into the hands of long-on. Nothing shot really and the nightmare continues for the visitors. It was flighted just outside off and kind of held up on the pitch, Dube was deluded by the flight as he went after it and could only succeed in finding Hooda. Shivam Dube c Hooda b Nabi 5(7) [4s-1]

Moeen Ali to Bairstow, FOUR, SRH are away in a fine fashion. He takes a huge stride forward. Comes close to the ball and sweeps it like a boss. It goes over backward square leg and thuds into the fence

Moeen Ali to Warner, FOUR, offie or no offie. Warner is not concerned at all. He is in brilliant form and look how easily he lofts it over cover. Mind you it is one of the most difficult shots in our game. He backs away, makes room and dispatches it over cover for a boundary

Moeen Ali to Bairstow, FOUR, third boundary of the over. And SRH are off to a flyer. There was room on this delivery, Bairstow stays put in the crease and cuts it past backward point for a boundary. Excellent placement!

U Yadav to Warner, SIX, this is batting of the highest quality from Warner. It was an overpitched delivery on the stumps, Warner is not shy to hit the first ball of Yadav's spell. He clears his front leg and larrups it straight down the ground for a sensational six

Moeen Ali to Warner, SIX, has he got enough bat on it? Yes, he has. Nothing is going right for RCB. It was a full-toss on the stumps, Warner stays put in the crease and clobbers it over long-on for a flat six. It was inches over Hetmyer at long-on who leaps in the air but fails to reach it
U Yadav to Bairstow, FOUR, this is sheer carnage from Jonny and Warner. It was a back of a length delivery on the body, Bairstow pulls it brilliantly wide of deep square leg for a boundary
U Yadav to Bairstow, SIX, wow! Just wow! Outstanding hitting this is from Bairstow. He backs away, clears his frong leg and disaptches it over long-on for another six

U Yadav to Bairstow, FOUR, gee! Look at the bat speed on that speed. It came at around 140 kph and was dispatched by Jonny even quicker. On a fuller length and on the stumps, Bairstow smashes it wide of mid-off for another boundary

Prayas Barman to Warner, 2 runs, his comeback has been like a dream for SRH. He has been out of competitive cricket for one-year but that hasn't made an iota of difference to his batting prowess. His third fifty of this IPL season in that many matches. It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps and he pushes it to long-on for a brace
Prayas Barman to Bairstow, SIX, oh no Jonny show some mercy on the 16-year-old. He dashes down the ground, takes it on the full and clobbers it over deep mid-wicket with utmost ease for a maximum

Chahal to Warner, SIX, lovely, it's raining fours and sixes at the moment, fraction short and at the stumps, Warner rocks back and pulls it flat and hard - went sailing over wide long-on for a maximum
Chahal to Bairstow, FOUR, thumped, no mercy for the RCB bowlers, flighted delivery on off, Bairstow gets a big stride forward and drills it wide of mid-wicket, no chance for the fielder in the deep

Prayas Barman to Bairstow, 2 runs, maiden IPL hundred for Bairstow - and look at the celebrations, this means a lot for him, punches in delight, removes his helmet and lifts both arms towards the dug-out - the Hyderabad crowd has certainly enjoyed it. Coming to the ball, it was tossed up on the leg-stump line, he got close to the ball and whipped it wide of long-on for a brace
Prayas Barman to Bairstow, SIX, massive, a little shimmy, Bairstow gets close to the ball and lifts it nonchalantly - wide of long-on for a maximum
Prayas Barman to Warner, FOUR, that's a poor ball, flighted and drifting down leg, Warner backs away and then heaves it over backward square leg for a boundary

Prayas Barman to Bairstow, SIX, smashed, what more can RCB do? Even muscled mishits are sailing into the stands, a back of a length delivery outside off, Bairstow stood firm and then clubbed it over long-on - makes the boundaries look so short. Bairstow on fire, RCB look down and out at the moment

Chahal to Bairstow, out Caught by U Yadav!! There's the wicket for RCB - ends an outstanding knock from Bairstow. It's not a no-ball, so Chahal can relax, the leg-break, slower and turning away from off, Bairstow was down on his knees as he hoicked, gets a thick top-edge, it looped in the air and looked like was falling short of backward point. Umesh charged in athletically, dived forward with both hands and holds on. A standing ovation as Bairstow walks away. Bairstow c U Yadav b Chahal 114(56) [4s-12 6s-7]
Chahal to Shankar, SIX, .. and Shankar needs just one ball to continue RCB's torment, flighted delivery at the stumps, he leans forward and smashes it high and over long-on for a maximum

Siraj to Warner, SIX, that's straight into the RCB dug-out, the yorker strategy lasted one ball, Siraj drops this one an inch short, allows Warner to get under it and thump it over Hetmyer's head at long-off

Siraj to Warner, out Shankar Run Out!! 1 run completed. Has Vijay Shankar run himself out? Has the dive saved him, NO - he's well short and RCB have a second wicket. Warner got lucky, but his partner wasn't. Siraj followed Warner as he backed away, induced a thick outside edge on the heave - was in the air for a long time, but dropped right in between AB - who was running back from cover and Hetmyer - running in from long-off. Shankar wanted the second run, but didn't spot that his partner wasn't coming back - stranded in the middle, he made a dash towards his end, put in the dive, but all in vain. Shankar run out (Hetmyer/Parthiv Patel) 9(3) [6s-1]

U Yadav to Warner, FOUR, cheeky and four, low full-toss from Umesh, was trying to follow Warner as he made room - he waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and runs it behind square on the off-side for a boundary
U Yadav to Warner, SIX, this is a poor ball from Umesh, slower ball, but the length was short and just sat-up to be smacked - pulled with disdain and pulled over long leg for a maximum

Siraj to Warner, FOUR, hundred for Warner and another SRH batsman is thrilled to bits - rushes half-way towards the SRH dressing room, delight on his face as he punches his fist - raises his bat and acknowledges the applause from the Orange Army - full-toss and it was squeezed behind square on the off-side. Backward point dived, but to no avail
Chahal to Warner, FOUR, smashed. He is playing with the mind of the bowler. This time backs away, makes room for himself and cuts it past cover for a boundary. Great timing and equally good placement
Siraj to Bairstow, FOUR, that's an old-fashioned heave from Bairstow. He gets behind that back of a length delivery and tonks it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary.

Siraj to Bairstow, FOUR, that's edged and four. They are dealing in boundaries here. It was short and there was width, Bairstow throws his hands at it. It comes off the outside half of the bat and it runs wide of third man for a boundary

U Yadav to Bairstow, FOUR, 50-run-partnership comes up between this pair. They have been the best opening pair in this season's IPL so far. It wasn't that short and there was hardly any room. But Bairstow backs away creates his own room and cuts it wide of backward point for a boundary. He is a magician in that area of the ground

Siraj to Bairstow, FOUR, oh Jonny, you are clearing the fields with mishits too. It was a slower one, Bairstow wanted to loft it down the ground, his timing was in a mess. But he gets just about enough bat on it to clear mid-off and it races to the fence

Siraj to Bairstow, FOUR, don't bowl short to Bairstow. You just't can't, Siraj. It was short and was wide of off, Bairstow cuts it formidably well, beats point and cover and it races to the fence in a canter

Prayas Barman to Bairstow, SIX, that is a comprehensive hit from Bairstow. And he has deposited it a long way back. It was fuller and was wide of off, Bairstow larrups it over deep cover for a maximum

Prayas Barman to Bairstow, FOUR, this is an ordinary effort from Siraj at long-on. And he gifts a boundary to Bairstow. It was on the pads and Bairstow flicks it wide of long-on. Siraj at long-on was clumsy in the deep and he lets it through

Prayas Barman to Bairstow, FOUR, maiden fifty for Bairstow in the IPL. Brilliant innings from the Englishman. He is giving a taste of IPL cricket to the young man now. It was on the stumps and Bairstow paddles it fine of fine leg for a boundary. Sweet timing!

de Grandhomme to Bairstow, SIX, that was a miserable delivery and Bairstow has given it the treamtment it deserved. It was a slower one on a short of length, Bairstow goes on the back foot and pulls it over deep mid-wicket for a massive six

de Grandhomme to Bairstow, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Bairstow. It's raining sixes here in Hyderabad. It was a good length delivery on the stumps, Bairstow clears his front leg, keeps his shape and tonks it deep into the mid-wicket stands for a six
Shreyas Gopal to Raina, SIX, flush in the slot, and Raina's V is always smoke-worthy. He gets his front leg out of the way, makes room and slogs it high and long into cow corner
Unadkat to Dhoni, FOUR, 125.5kph. Juicy stuff sit up on the legs, and Dhoni's just too good to miss out on all this. He swivels, swats hard and nails the backward square leg gap
Unadkat to Raina, FOUR, 130kph. Just too straight, and this in no way is helping Rajasthan's cause here. Raina won't complain though, surely not with fine leg in the circle, tickling it fine

Unadkat to Dhoni, FOUR, that's how you deal with the slower balls. A short of length delivery from round the wicket, Dhoni dances down the track and smashes it over Raina's head. One bounce and into the long-on fence. All power!

Unadkat to Raina, no run, a direct hit there would have been curtains for Raina. The southpaw shuffled across and tucked this length ball to short fine and set off for a quick single. Dhoni wasn't interested and sent him back. Kulkarni had all three stumps to aim, but missed the target at the striker's end

Unadkat to Raina, out Bowled!! The partnership has been broken. Unadkat yells out a loud roar. Change of pace does the trick. Fullish ball at 116.5kph, Raina backed away a long way and exposed all his stumps. The southpaw didn't pick the slower one and wafted his bat at it, probably looking to go over the covers. Connected with thin air and the ball smashed into the sticks. Raina b Unadkat 36(32) [4s-4 6s-1]

Stokes to Dhoni, 1 run, 132kph, Dhoni dances down the ground and batters it to the right of extra cover. It travelled quickly to Gowtham and he failed to hold onto it. Would be very harsh to call it a drop

Stokes to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, Stokes shortens his length, Bravo waits for it from the crease and uses his wrists to elevate it over extra cover. Didn't quite middle it, but had enough to get it over Gowtham

Stokes to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, 137.1kph, full and outside off - you can't be bowling there to this guy. He plays one of his favourite shots. Throws his blade with an opened bat-face and sends it over backward point. 11 off the over

Jofra Archer to Dhoni, FOUR, superb placement! Another off-pace ball from a back of a length at 109.9kph, Dhoni spotted that and delayed his shot from the crease. Dabbed away through the gap between short third man and backward point
D Kulkarni to Dhoni, SIX, and, the skipper takes full toll of the freebie. A low full toss outside off at 132.9kph, Dhoni bends his back leg, gets under it and then lofts it over deep extra cover

D Kulkarni to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, 99.9kph, too slow. Bravo picked that but still was early into his shot. Gave himself some room to go over point, gets a top-edge that evades short third man to his right

D Kulkarni to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, that's the trademark Dwayne Bravo shot! Kulkarni doles out a half-volley, right in the DJ's arc. The right-hander moves leg-side, arches his back and lofts it handsomely over deep extra cover. The maximum also brings up the fifty run stand!

Jofra Archer to Dhoni, FOUR, 21st IPL fifty for Dhoni, and his first against RR. A pacy low full toss, Dhoni uses the bowler's pace to drive it through the gap between backward point and short third man. The placement was spot on

Jofra Archer to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by D Kulkarni!! Bravo perishes trying to play a good shot. Archer banged it in short at 132kph and Bravo went through with his pull shot despite not being in a good position to play it. The top-edge balloons up and settles into the safe hands of long-on. He went too hard and in the process lost his shape. Dwayne Bravo c D Kulkarni b Jofra Archer 27(16) [4s-3 6s-1]

Unadkat to Jadeja, SIX, terrific shot! It was a slower delivery, Jadeja deals with him like he'd treat a club bowler. Waltzes down the ground, gets to the pitch of the ball and bludgeons it over long-on for a flat six

Unadkat to Dhoni, SIX, slower ball bouncer, sits up nicely for the right-hander and Dhoni deposits it into the stands. The ball doesn't rise as much as Unadkat would have liked it to. Dhoni stands tall and pulls it fiercely over deep square leg. CSK have crossed 160
Unadkat to Dhoni, SIX, this is exactly what the Chennai crowd wanted. A fuller than a good length ball outside off, Dhoni hoists it over long-off. Set his base and then bludgeoned

Jofra Archer to Rayudu, out Caught by Buttler!! 0.0.0.0.0 and Rayudu - injured forearm and all - can't stay patient any longer. Archer stays quick on a back of a length, but it sticks on the surface as it kicks up, making a real mess of Rayudu's attempted upper-steer to third man. All he gets is a thick feather on the outside edge, straight to the keeper. Rayudu c Buttler b Jofra Archer 1(8)

D Kulkarni to Watson, no run, Watson reviews, and then stands in disbelief that it has to come down to this. It's a leg-line, and Buttler was probably appealing for the strangle down leg only to avoid this from being given a wide. But the umpire - Nandan - is fooled. It's clearly off the thigh pad, and the bat's not even close. Overturn
D Kulkarni to Watson, FOUR, goes swinging. Watson isn't foxed by the short length, presses forward to it instead and pulls it away hard, over mid-wicket. Chennai have their move on ..

Unadkat to Dhoni, SIX, 28 off the over! It was another off-pace ball from a short of length, Dhoni waits and flat-bats it over long-on. The fielder in the deep - Tripathi - jumps in an attempt to catch it. It beats him comfortably

Stokes to Watson, SIX, gets hold. And gets it into the empty deep square leg, and then into the empty stands behind that. Stokes bangs it in short, Watson - now with more of a measure of this pitch - rocks behind and pulls it yummily, uppishly. Also, there's nobody in those stands to give the ball back as well. So, get the fourth ump working ..

Stokes to Watson, out Caught by Jofra Archer!! Short again. And this time Watson can't resist not poking. He goes back in the crease, goes up tall and tries half a cut, half a punch, and a full flirt after getting tied up with the zip in. Ends up with a thick outside splice, flying straight to the fine short third man placed perfectly out there. Watson c Jofra Archer b Stokes 13(13) [4s-1 6s-1]
Stokes to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, too short, too leg-sided. Jadhav swivels inside it and then doesn't hold back on his pull, uppishly, into fine leg

Stokes to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, another bumper, another pull. Jadhav's not in control, but it doesn't matter, it's the powerplay after all. Drags it from outside off in front of square, and nothing the chase or the dive from the guy chasing it from square leg can do to stop

D Kulkarni to Raina, FOUR, 131.3kph. Kulkarni will have to do with a moral victory. It's the bouncer, which makes Raina wait on his committed pull position, only to then take the top-edge and fly over the keeper

D Kulkarni to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Buttler!! A wide innocuos delivery does what all the variations haven't. It's full, way outside off and Jadhav stretches out to drive. Hard. The problem though are his feet, which are stuck in the crease, just not getting close as he ends up getting a fat outside edge. And Chennai are officially on a top-order collapse. Kedar Jadhav c Buttler b D Kulkarni 8(3) [4s-2]
Shreyas Gopal to Raina, FOUR, another drag down, and Raina makes it worse with his camp deep in the crease. And the uses the width outside off to carve it away behind point
Gowtham to Raina, FOUR, when it's turning, when it's Raina, this inside-out was only a matter of time. Gowtham tosses it wide for a drive, but Raina goes over extra cover. Ahh, those hands

Chahar to Rahane, out Caught by Jadeja!! Ideal start for the hosts. A corker from Jaddu at backward point. Another outswinger and Rahane drives with hard hands. Only gets an outside edge that dips as it approached the backward point fielder. Don't think many would have taken it. But, Jadeja is one of the best fielders in world cricket. He swoops forward and takes a diving catch inches above the ground. Rahane asked the fielder and decided to walk off. But, the umpires wanted to be 100% sure and hence went upstairs. Legal ball and a clean catch. A 2-ball duck for the Rajasthan skipper. Rahane c Jadeja b Chahar 0(2)
SN Thakur to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler is underway straightaway! Poor ball from Shardul Thakur. Ample width outside off, Buttler doesn't over-hit, reaches out and cuts it through point

Tahir to R Tripathi, out Caught&Bowled!! It's a leading edge, and taken! The cross-seamed leg-break, fired in full @90ks, full and outside off, Tripathi tries to get forward and flick it away against the spin, gets a leading edge back to the bowler who throws it right up into the humid skies in glee to see the back of Tripathi. An important partnership broken, and the aggressor, Tripathi, departs. R Tripathi c and b Tahir 39(24) [4s-5 6s-1]

Tahir to Smith, out Caught by (sub)Shorey! GONE! That's a key wicket! The leg-break, very full, Smith charges down the track, feeling the pRRRessure, and takes it on the full - tries lofting it straight into the sightscreen, but literally plays right into the hands of Shorey at the long-off boundary. Tahir is thrilled to bits. He knows how important this wicket is. Smith c (sub)Shorey b Tahir 28(30) [4s-2]
Jadeja to Stokes, SIX, fired in flat from over the wicket, angled in, Stokes gets on his knee and throws the kitchen sink at it - flat-bats that over deep mid-wicket for six
Tahir to Gowtham, SIX, absolutely smoked! A googly on leg and middle, Gowtham comes down the track and swings it against the turn over cow corner for six

SN Thakur to Gowtham, out Caught by Raina! GONE! A very full one outside off, Gowtham, in a bid to up the ante, throws it all behind that carve over cover, ends up scooping it towards Raina at cover, who picks up yet another catch for himself. RR's morale is inversely proportional to the RRR. Six down. Gowtham c Raina b SN Thakur 9(8) [6s-1]
SN Thakur to Jofra Archer, FOUR, back of a length and wide outside off, Jofra Archer throws his hands at the cut, beats backward point to the deep backward point fence for four

SN Thakur to Jofra Archer, SIX, swings through the line of that half-volley and connects! Angles it in towards the leg and middle-stumps, right in the slot, Jofra Archer clears the front-leg a little and brings those massive forearms into play - goes right through the line, beautiful head position, and deposits that over the long-on fence for six
Dwayne Bravo to Stokes, SIX, is there a twist? 104.9km/h, a slow length ball outside off, Stokes waits for it and clubs that flat over deep extra cover for six!

Dwayne Bravo to Stokes, FOUR, back of a length delivery angling in from round the wicket, Stokes gets under it by getting across, shapes up to scoop, gets enough on it to paddle it away past Dhoni towards the fine leg boundary for four
Dwayne Bravo to Jofra Archer, SIX, oh that's a poor ball. A absolute no-no at this stage, Dwayne Bravo takes the pace off, and Jofra Archer swings through the line, clubs it over long-on for six
SN Thakur to Stokes, SIX, he's nailed it! Angles it in from round the wicket, Stokes gets under it, gets the bottom-hand off, and gets topspin on that flat hook over backward square leg for six!

Dwayne Bravo to Stokes, out Caught by Raina! GONE! Let the DJ's party begin. Off he goes, on his turntable - a yorker length delivery on off, Stokes tries getting under his, with the bottom-hand dominating, scoops it, gets his wrists over it, and Raina is waiting at cover - straight to him, and he holds on to yet another low catch today. A pressure catch! A key wicket, this, and this is going to be interesting. Surely, not another late-night/early-morning super-over. Stokes c Raina b Dwayne Bravo 46(26) [4s-1 6s-3]

Dwayne Bravo to Shreyas Gopal, out Caught by Tahir! The Yellow Army explodes! Another one @130.7km/h, on a length and angling into the body, Shreyas Gopal clears his leg and backs away going for a wild heave, gets a massive top-edge towards third man where Tahir gets under the pressure catch - pouches it and sets off on a celebratory run. Shreyas Gopal c Tahir b Dwayne Bravo 0(3)

Chahar to Samson, FOUR, eye-pleasing! Yes there was width on offer, but still had to be put away. On a short of length, Samson stays put in his crease and then the there's the perfect eye-hand combination. Caressed through point with a horizontal blade

Chahar to Samson, out Caught by Raina!! The centurion in the previous game is gone! A 134.1kph fullish ball outside off and Samson threw his bat at it. The bottom hand comes off the handle and hence the miscue. Raina takes a sharp catch bending forward, but Samson stands his ground. The on-field umpires send it upstairs with OUT being the soft decision. An easy one for the TV umpire as Raina had both his palms underneath the ball. Samson c Raina b Chahar 8(10) [4s-1]

SN Thakur to Buttler, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Rajasthan Royals lose their best batter and are in deep trouble. A fuller-than-a-good-length ball on the stumps and Buttler wanted to bash it over mid-on. The ball might have held up into the wicket and that robbed the batter's timing. The bat turned at the point of impact and Buttler ended up slicing it over mid-off. Bravo takes a couple of steps backwards and snaffles it with ease. Buttler c Dwayne Bravo b SN Thakur 6(7) [4s-1]

SN Thakur to Smith, FOUR, Steven Smith gets off the mark in an emphatic fashion. Shortish ball at 132.6kph that sits up nicely for the Australian. Smith moves back and across to pull it through square leg
SN Thakur to Smith, FOUR, back-to-back fours. Thakur doles out a full toss. There's the customary shuffle from Smith and then he glances it neatly through square leg
Santner to R Tripathi, FOUR, 76.9kph, not a great start to your IPL career. A rank full toss and Tripathi's thumped it over mid-on for a boundary

Santner to R Tripathi, SIX, Tripathi goes downtown and the sightscreen has to take the brunt. A fullish ball at 90.6kph, Tripathi gets low and underneath it to hoist it over the bowler's end. 15 runs off 3 legal balls in this over
Santner to R Tripathi, no ball, FOUR, another high full toss - above-waist and Tripathi slashed his bat at it. Gets a fat outside edge that beats first slip and runs away to the third man fence
Chahar to R Tripathi, FOUR, nicely done! Chahar errs in his line. Shortish ball sprayed down leg, Tripathi stays inside the line and helps it on its way with a pull shot. Placed it fine too

Jadeja to R Tripathi, FOUR, tossed up, far too full, Tripathi leans into it and runs his hands through it to whip-drive it away towards deep extra cover for four - a top effort from Kedar at the boundary, but it beats him in the end
Santner to Smith, 1 run, banged in on a back of a length, angling into the pads, tucked off the pads towards wide long-on for a single - 50-run partnership between these two

Santner to R Tripathi, FOUR, flatter one outside off, Tripathi is fully to the pitch of it this time and and absolutely goes through with that mighty followthrough to loft it over the man at cover for four - inside out, and that was nailed

Rabada to Rahul, FOUR, 142.9km/h, back of a length delivery angling into the hips, tucked away with fabulous timing towards the cow corner fence for four. Harshal Patel's valiant effort at the boundary in vain...

Chris Morris to Rahul, FOUR, strays on the pads @139.7km/h, futile pace, Rahul's eyes light up as he sees it's on his pads, just closes the face on the ball at the last moment to glance it away in front of deep square leg for four

Chris Morris to Rahul, SIX, a fantastic hook! @136.2km/h, not the quickest or steepest of bumpers, Rahul gets back and across, into the front-on position early, gets under the short one and swivels into a fantastic hook over fine leg for six!

Chris Morris to Rahul, out Lbw! Rahul's been given LBW! He's gone for a review straightaway! Now that the umpire has given it out, I think this is clipping leg. Just a hunch. A full delivery angling into the pads, he's missed a juicy half-volley, attempting a cross-batted flick. Pitching in line, hitting him in line, and clipping the leg-stump. Yep, I was right - not for the first time (wink) - it's the umpire's call taking a toll again as the batting side are left with the consolation prize of a retained review. Rahul lbw b Chris Morris 15(11) [4s-2 6s-1]

Hanuma Vihari to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, ruins the over. But it was a top shot from Sarfaraz. Speared into the blockhole and Sarfaraz almost casually squeezes the slice past the diving point fielder, the lightning fast outfield takes care of the rest

Lamichhane to Miller, SIX, smoked! That's twice in a row that Delhi have conceded a boundary/six off the last ball. It was turning out to be an excellent over until Miller decided to use his feet, gets to the pitch of the ball and launches it over wide long-on
Harshal Patel to Miller, 2 runs, pace off and Miller waits before clipping it wide of deep mid-wicket, easy two. That brings up the 50-run stand for the pair and they need to keep going

Harshal Patel to Miller, FOUR, Miller has stepped on the gas now. The slower short of length delivery and he's into position quickly, swivels and places the pull with a nice wrist roll backward of square leg

Harshal Patel to Miller, FOUR, cheeky! Normal pace delivery from Harshal but he's offered space outside off, Miller allows the ball to arrive and runs it away fine to third man. The ball raced away to the fence

Lamichhane to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Pant!! Gone! That is the problem with Sarfaraz. He will give you those cute little 30s and 40s but never a man for a big innings. Nothing but a leg-break with a hint of turn, Sarfaraz stays flat-footed and has a poke at it, very casual in his approach and the ball finds a feather of the outside edge. Pant does well to hold on to the catch as it almost popped out. Sarfaraz Khan c Pant b Lamichhane 39(29) [4s-6]

Avesh Khan to Miller, FOUR, the extra delivery and a boundary conceded. That's what you call small margins in cricket. Misses the yorker and offers a low full toss outside off, Miller dinks it over extra cover and the timing is such that it beats long-off comfortably
Harshal Patel to Miller, FOUR, that's a gift and Miller ain't missing out. Loopy full toss outside off, Miller does not do anything fancy, uses his power to drive it past extra cover

Chris Morris to Miller, out Caught by Pant!! And Morris wins the battle.. Huge wicket at this stage. Miller shuffled across and aimed to go across the line, Morris cleverly rolled his fingers across the ball, the top-edge went straight up and Pant settled under it. Punjab have kept losing wickets at the wrong time today. Miller c Pant b Chris Morris 43(30) [4s-4 6s-2]

Rabada to Mandeep, FOUR, Ayappa has misjudged it horribly. Short of length and Mandeep pulls it to deep mid-wicket, Ayappa is late to charge in and then has to run back because the ball bounced in front of him, can only parry it over the rope

Rabada to Viljoen, out Caught by Chris Morris!! Punjab's innings is coming apart. Rabada is just too good for Viljoen. Short of length and climbs up awkwardly onto the batsman, Viljoen tries to turn it into the leg-side but only manages a leading edge to cover. Morris completes the dolly. The umpire checks for front foot error but Rabada is fine. Viljoen c Chris Morris b Rabada 1(3)

Chris Morris to Ashwin, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! It has all gone downward in the last 20 minutes or so. Morris picks up his third. A juicy full toss and Ashwin could have hit it anywhere, he backs away and is beaten for pace, the ball brushes the off-stump to light it up. Ashwin b Chris Morris 3(4)

Rabada to Murugan Ashwin, out Caught by Avesh Khan!! Collision, a pop out and taken in the end. Pant and Avesh almost made a meal of it. Rabada sees the funny side of it. Ashwin wanted to heave it into the cow corner fence and the top-edge went straight up towards point, Pant ran across even as Avesh steadied himself under it, the ball hit Pant's gloves and then popped up, Avesh was the first to react and he claims the catch. Murugan Ashwin c Avesh Khan b Rabada 1(2)

Rabada to Shami, out Shami Run Out!! Shami is made to sacrifice his wicket. Short ball at the body, Shami takes his eyes off as he aims to pull, the ball hits him on the shoulder and drops down, Mandeep races to the other end and Shami just crosses him to ensure he's out. Rabada does the easy part of collecting the ball, walking back and removing one bail. Shami run out (Rabada) 0(1)
Rabada to Mandeep, FOUR, slower short of length delivery and Mandeep waits for it, gets on top of the bounce and slaps it over mid-off. The fielder was inside the ring and he just had to clear him

Avesh Khan to Sam Curran, FOUR, Gayle who? 144.7km/h, all of it in vain because it's a half-volley outside off, Sam Curran doesn't move his feet and plays a transfer of weight drive between extra cover and long-off for four!

Avesh Khan to Sam Curran, FOUR, oh this is fantastic batting! Did they drop him for his bowling? Oh well well. Looks like we have Narine 2.0. Another half-volley outside off, this time it's lofted over the infield to the deep extra cover fence for four

Avesh Khan to Sam Curran, FOUR, 138.1km/h, a full-blooded drive through the vacant extra cover region! A good length delivery in the zone, angling in, and not much wrong with it, Sam Curran takes a small step forward and drives it through the line towards the deep extra cover fence for four

Rabada to Mandeep, SIX, Mandeep finishes with a maximum. Rabada misses his length and bowls it right in the arc, Mandeep clears his front leg and smashes it straight back over. The boundaries straight are not big and it clears 'em with ease

Lamichhane to Sam Curran, SIX, slows the pace down, tossed up above the eye-line, the googly, Sam Curran spots it, hurries down the track to the pitch of it, and lofts it straight down the ground for a colossal six!

Lamichhane to Sam Curran, out Lbw! Doesn't even wait to review! Angles it across after pitching in on leg and middle, straightens, does the leg-spinner, and Sam Curran is trapped on the backfoot, trying to tuck across the line - but the whippy action and the lack of backspin means that it will hurry on and he is trapped in front. He's on his way back after an impressive cameo up top. Sam Curran lbw b Lamichhane 20(10) [4s-3 6s-1]

Rabada to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, 148.2km/h of wasted energy as he dishes out a half-volley on the pads, and Sarfaraz Khan gets a tasty starter, flicks it off his pads towards the backward square leg fence for four

Chris Morris to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, good length delivery outside off, hard length, Sarfaraz Khan runs his hands through a cover drive without any feet and caresses that with sweet timing to the sweeper cover boundary for four
Chris Morris to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, a pacy full-toss on the pads, 142.4km/h, whipped away with utmost ease to the deep mid-wicket fence for four. All timing.

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, out Agarwal Run Out! Already a slower one @116.8km/h on a good length, Sarfaraz Khan delays a transfer-of-weight punch to Dhawan, and Agarwal tries to recover after backing up, but a direct-hit from Dhawan (and a thigh slap to follow it up) with one stump to aim at, has sent Agarwal packing! Fantastic throw by Dhawan, and certainly nothing iffy about that dismissal, with KXIP on the receiving end this time. Just a moment of brilliance. Agarwal run out (Dhawan) 6(9)

Avesh Khan to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, nothing wrong with that, a back of a length delivery @137.1km/h, Sarfaraz Khan stays stable on the backfoot and opens the face, surgically bisects the field behind point for four

Avesh Khan to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, back of a length del - doesn't matter - Sarfaraz Khan gets on his knee, bows his head down, and absolutely nails the scoop over the gaping 'keeper to the long stop fence for a one-bounce four

Harshal Patel to Miller, SIX, oh he's made up for those dot balls! A fuller length delivery with a bit of width, right in the slot, Miller swings through the line and runs those massive arms through it - lofts it high and mighty into the crowd in the deep extra cover region for six! Strike-rate back at 100!

Rabada to Rahul, FOUR, 142.9km/h, back of a length delivery angling into the hips, tucked away with fabulous timing towards the cow corner fence for four. Harshal Patel's valiant effort at the boundary in vain...

Chris Morris to Rahul, FOUR, strays on the pads @139.7km/h, futile pace, Rahul's eyes light up as he sees it's on his pads, just closes the face on the ball at the last moment to glance it away in front of deep square leg for four

Chris Morris to Rahul, SIX, a fantastic hook! @136.2km/h, not the quickest or steepest of bumpers, Rahul gets back and across, into the front-on position early, gets under the short one and swivels into a fantastic hook over fine leg for six!

Chris Morris to Rahul, out Lbw! Rahul's been given LBW! He's gone for a review straightaway! Now that the umpire has given it out, I think this is clipping leg. Just a hunch. A full delivery angling into the pads, he's missed a juicy half-volley, attempting a cross-batted flick. Pitching in line, hitting him in line, and clipping the leg-stump. Yep, I was right - not for the first time (wink) - it's the umpire's call taking a toll again as the batting side are left with the consolation prize of a retained review. Rahul lbw b Chris Morris 15(11) [4s-2 6s-1]

Hanuma Vihari to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, ruins the over. But it was a top shot from Sarfaraz. Speared into the blockhole and Sarfaraz almost casually squeezes the slice past the diving point fielder, the lightning fast outfield takes care of the rest

Harshal Patel to Miller, FOUR, cheeky! Normal pace delivery from Harshal but he's offered space outside off, Miller allows the ball to arrive and runs it away fine to third man. The ball raced away to the fence

Nothing but a leg-break with a hint of turn, Sarfaraz stays flat-footed and has a poke at it, very casual in his approach and the ball finds a feather of the outside edge. Pant does well to hold on to the catch as it almost popped out. Sarfaraz Khan c Pant b Lamichhane 39(29) [4s-6]

Harshal Patel to Miller, FOUR, that's a gift and Miller ain't missing out. Loopy full toss outside off, Miller does not do anything fancy, uses his power to drive it past extra cover

Miller shuffled across and aimed to go across the line, Morris cleverly rolled his fingers across the ball, the top-edge went straight up and Pant settled under it. Punjab have kept losing wickets at the wrong time today. Miller c Pant b Chris Morris 43(30) [4s-4 6s-2]

Rabada to Mandeep, FOUR, Ayappa has misjudged it horribly. Short of length and Mandeep pulls it to deep mid-wicket, Ayappa is late to charge in and then has to run back because the ball bounced in front of him, can only parry it over the rope

Short of length and climbs up awkwardly onto the batsman, Viljoen tries to turn it into the leg-side but only manages a leading edge to cover. Morris completes the dolly. The umpire checks for front foot error but Rabada is fine. Viljoen c Chris Morris b Rabada 1(3)

Chris Morris to Ashwin, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! It has all gone downward in the last 20 minutes or so. Morris picks up his third. A juicy full toss and Ashwin could have hit it anywhere, he backs away and is beaten for pace, the ball brushes the off-stump to light it up. Ashwin b Chris Morris 3(4)

Rabada to Murugan Ashwin, out Caught by Avesh Khan!! Collision, a pop out and taken in the end. Pant and Avesh almost made a meal of it. Rabada sees the funny side of it. Ashwin wanted to heave it into the cow corner fence and the top-edge went straight up towards point, Pant ran across even as Avesh steadied himself under it, the ball hit Pant's gloves and then popped up, Avesh was the first to react and he claims the catch. Murugan Ashwin c Avesh Khan b Rabada 1(2)

Rabada to Shami, out Shami Run Out!! Shami is made to sacrifice his wicket. Short ball at the body, Shami takes his eyes off as he aims to pull, the ball hits him on the shoulder and drops down, Mandeep races to the other end and Shami just crosses him to ensure he's out. Rabada does the easy part of collecting the ball, walking back and removing one bail. Shami run out (Rabada) 0(1)
Rabada to Mandeep, FOUR, slower short of length delivery and Mandeep waits for it, gets on top of the bounce and slaps it over mid-off. The fielder was inside the ring and he just had to clear him

Avesh Khan to Sam Curran, FOUR, Gayle who? 144.7km/h, all of it in vain because it's a half-volley outside off, Sam Curran doesn't move his feet and plays a transfer of weight drive between extra cover and long-off for four!

Avesh Khan to Sam Curran, FOUR, oh this is fantastic batting! Did they drop him for his bowling? Oh well well. Looks like we have Narine 2.0. Another half-volley outside off, this time it's lofted over the infield to the deep extra cover fence for four

Avesh Khan to Sam Curran, FOUR, 138.1km/h, a full-blooded drive through the vacant extra cover region! A good length delivery in the zone, angling in, and not much wrong with it, Sam Curran takes a small step forward and drives it through the line towards the deep extra cover fence for four

Rabada to Mandeep, SIX, Mandeep finishes with a maximum. Rabada misses his length and bowls it right in the arc, Mandeep clears his front leg and smashes it straight back over. The boundaries straight are not big and it clears 'em with ease

Lamichhane to Sam Curran, SIX, slows the pace down, tossed up above the eye-line, the googly, Sam Curran spots it, hurries down the track to the pitch of it, and lofts it straight down the ground for a colossal six!

Lamichhane to Sam Curran, out Lbw! Doesn't even wait to review! Angles it across after pitching in on leg and middle, straightens, does the leg-spinner, and Sam Curran is trapped on the backfoot, trying to tuck across the line - but the whippy action and the lack of backspin means that it will hurry on and he is trapped in front. He's on his way back after an impressive cameo up top. Sam Curran lbw b Lamichhane 20(10) [4s-3 6s-1]

Rabada to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, 148.2km/h of wasted energy as he dishes out a half-volley on the pads, and Sarfaraz Khan gets a tasty starter, flicks it off his pads towards the backward square leg fence for four

Chris Morris to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, good length delivery outside off, hard length, Sarfaraz Khan runs his hands through a cover drive without any feet and caresses that with sweet timing to the sweeper cover boundary for four
Chris Morris to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, a pacy full-toss on the pads, 142.4km/h, whipped away with utmost ease to the deep mid-wicket fence for four. All timing.

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, out Agarwal Run Out! Already a slower one @116.8km/h on a good length, Sarfaraz Khan delays a transfer-of-weight punch to Dhawan, and Agarwal tries to recover after backing up, but a direct-hit from Dhawan (and a thigh slap to follow it up) with one stump to aim at, has sent Agarwal packing! Fantastic throw by Dhawan, and certainly nothing iffy about that dismissal, with KXIP on the receiving end this time. Just a moment of brilliance. Agarwal run out (Dhawan) 6(9)

Avesh Khan to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, nothing wrong with that, a back of a length delivery @137.1km/h, Sarfaraz Khan stays stable on the backfoot and opens the face, surgically bisects the field behind point for four

Avesh Khan to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, back of a length del - doesn't matter - Sarfaraz Khan gets on his knee, bows his head down, and absolutely nails the scoop over the gaping 'keeper to the long stop fence for a one-bounce four

Harshal Patel to Miller, SIX, oh he's made up for those dot balls! A fuller length delivery with a bit of width, right in the slot, Miller swings through the line and runs those massive arms through it - lofts it high and mighty into the crowd in the deep extra cover region for six! Strike-rate back at 100!
Gowtham to Kohli, FOUR, nicely played by Kohli, fraction too short and drifting onto Kohli's pads, he waits on it and then works it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, edged and four, on a good length and in that channel outside off, drew Kohli into playing at that - pushed away from his body, the edge runs away through the vacant slip cordon

Shreyas Gopal to Hetmyer, out Caught by Buttler!! Gopal is on fire. Third wicket and all big ones. Hetmyer's struggles in IPL continue.. RCB in a spot of bother now. The wrong 'un spinning across the left hander, Hetmyer stays back and has a tentative poke at that, feathers an outside edge and Buttler does the rest behind the wicket. That is 9 wickets in 3 games now for Gopal against RCB. Hetmyer c Buttler b Shreyas Gopal 1(9)

Stokes to Parthiv Patel, SIX, just over.. Stokes knows how close it was. Short of length and there was no pace on the ball, Parthiv goes for the pull and the top-edge clears a leaping Tripathi near deep backward square
Stokes to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, offers pace and width, Parthiv will feed on that all day, he cracks the back cut behind point and pace on the ball meant it raced away to the fence beating third man

Jofra Archer to Stoinis, SIX, exactly what Stoinis needed to get himself going. He takes full toll of the free-hit. Archer went off-pace but the length allowed Stoinis to flexes those muscles, he powers it over wide long-on. Lot of height and the much needed distance as well

Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, no ball, 1 run, so many things happening on one ball. Lets first acknowledge Parthiv's fifty. A fine knock on a surface where the rest have struggled. And whatsmore it is his fastest IPL fifty. Now to the rest of the ball: Archer oversteps to deliver the slower ball, dabbed to short third and Parthiv wanted a single, Stoinis sends him back and he makes it just in time as there was a direct hit, the deflection forces Stoinis to go for the run and they steal it in the end quite comfortably

D Kulkarni to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, top shot! He knows his strengths and hitting areas. Another slower length ball outside off, Parthiv uses the depth of the crease, gets underneath the ball and lofts it over extra cover handsomely

Stokes to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, much needed boundary for RCB. Parthiv has been mistiming those pulls/heaves but not this time. He waits for the delivery to arrive and pummels it to wide long-on, couple of bounces and into the fence

Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Rahane!! Gone! But Parthiv has done more than his job. A fine knock from the 'keeper. Slower delivery at 125.4ks and Parthiv does not have the power to clear this big boundaries, he still goes through and makes a decent connection, holes out just in front of the long-on rope. Parthiv Patel c Rahane b Jofra Archer 67(41) [4s-9 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Moeen Ali, FOUR, streaky! Spears a full delivery at 147.6ks and Mo squirts a thick inside edge through his legs, the placement is such that he splits fine leg and deep square leg perfectly

Stokes to Stoinis, FOUR, thumped! Stoinis picks the slower delivery, maintains a good base by going deep in the crease and whips it with a lot of bottom hand to wide long-on, one bounce and over the ropes

Stokes to Stoinis, no run, pacy short ball from Stokes and Stoinis is a bit surprised by that, he is late on the pull/hook and the ball flies over the top-edge. Buttler went up but Stokes gestured he didn't hear anything

Jofra Archer to Moeen Ali, SIX, another six that is just over.. Archer bowls the slower delivery on short of length, Mo picked the bones out of that, he was expecting this and it was right in his arc, hammers it over a leaping deep mid-wicket fielder

Jofra Archer to Moeen Ali, FOUR, past Gowtham's dive. Lands the slower delivery in a fullish range, Mo with a readymade clear of his front leg pumps it straight down the ground, the wet outfield makes the ball skid off the ground

Jofra Archer to Stoinis, FOUR, cheeky! Stoinis had made up his mind even before Archer was about to bowl. He crouched low, moved across his stumps and scooped the full toss to the fine leg fence, 17 off the final over

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, nicely played - was in the air for a long time, but Kohli got the placement right - took a step down the track on the flick, didn't time it all that well - but found the gap

D Kulkarni to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, lovely shot, the slower ball from Dhawal, but sprayed it onto Parthiv's pads, whipped away over short fine, couple of bounces and over the ropes - RCB needed some momentum and 9 came from this over
Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, cheeky and four, short and just outside off, Parthiv arches back, opens the face of the bat and then runs it late - past the keeper, one bounce and over the ropes

Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Parthiv - not all that convincing, but he will take the runs on offer - the idea was right, fine leg was inside the ring and he was looking to clear him - late on the shot, off the gloves and past the diving keeper
Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, beautifully played, length ball and Parthiv was waiting on it, gets a good stride forward and thumps it over mid-off, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, out Bowled!! No need to appeal for this - a corker from Gopal and he has got rid of the RCB and India captain - A loose shot from Kohli, another wrong 'un and he didn't read it, lazily pressed forward on the drive - big gap between bat and pad and the ball found its way through, crashed into the off and middle stump and Kohli has to go. Not the most convincing of knocks from the captain - 23 off 25 is plain average at this level. Replays suggested a thin inside edge. Kohli b Shreyas Gopal 23(25) [4s-3]
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, FOUR, cheeky from AB, a pre-meditated lap sweep, bends down low, uses the pace on the ball and laps it past the keeper for a boundary

Aaron to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, lovely shot, Aaron - from round the wicket, slides this one onto Parthiv's hips, he gets inside the line, uses the angle and clips it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
Aaron to de Villiers, FOUR, streaky and four, fuller length delivery and well wide of off, AB saw the width and threw his hands at that, gets a thick inside edge that races past the off-stump

Aaron to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Parthiv is putting on a show here - Aaron leaks 16 in his first over, width on offer and Parthiv chopped it behind square on the off-side, to backward point's right and the man in the deep had a lot to do - can't get there despite the slide

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, out Caught&Bowled!! Gopal got rid of Kohli, he now gets rid of AB - this is simply sublime stuff from the Karnataka leg-spinner - and he's doing all the damage to his home based franchise. Another wrong 'un, think AB read as he went back, stayed a bit low and that meant the ball caught the leading edge on the flick. It was dying down on the bowler who does remarkably well to dive forward and grab it. After the fine start, RCB have lost their two big guns. de Villiers c and b Shreyas Gopal 13(9) [4s-2]
U Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler is off and running. Done with his sighter and stands tall to this length delivery. Gets on top of the bounce and caresses it through the gap at extra cover

Navdeep Saini to Rahane, 1 run, edged and dropped. That's an early chance that goes begging for RCB and Saini can't do much because it's the skipper Virat Kohli who puts it down. Short of a length and held its line just outside off, Rahane chased with no feet and feeds an outside edge that flew very quickly to first slip where Virat was standing a bit wide. The RCB skipper moved swiftly to his right, got both hands but grasses it. Probably, didn't anticipate it to come so quickly at him

Navdeep Saini to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler rubs salt into RCB's wounds. Fullish and stops on the pitch a bit, Buttler didn't go with full conviction, just checks his loft straight down the ground and it races away to the fence

Navdeep Saini to Buttler, FOUR, wow! This was brute power. Dismissive stuff from Buttler. Saini floats up a half-volley just outside off, Buttler with his quicksilver hands lunges across and slaps it with precision through extra cover

Stoinis to Smith, FOUR, streaky! Slightly slower - 129.9kph, doesn't bounce much and Smith is early into his pull shot as he fetches from outside off. Gets a fat inside edge that eludes the leg-stump and runs away to the fine leg fence

Moeen Ali to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler doesn't need sighters against his fellow countryman! Fifty for Buttler and he brings it up in style. Tossed up ball, Buttler skips down the pitch and batters it straight down the ground. No chance for the long-off fielder
Moeen Ali to Buttler, SIX, Moeen Ali as expected shortens his length, but in the process has over-corrected. A half-tracker, Buttler is quick to jump back and pummel the pull over deep mid-wicket

Chahal to Buttler, out Caught by Stoinis!! Second wicket for Chahal. Needless from Buttler. The asking rate is under control and he wants to go after RCB's best bowler. Pays the price for doing so. Smart bowling from Chahal, though. A slow, tossed up ball outside off, which spun further away from the right-handed batsman. Buttler decides to thump it over long-off, miscues and Stoinis takes a calm catch well in front of the boundary ropes. Buttler c Stoinis b Chahal 59(43) [4s-8 6s-1]

U Yadav to Smith, FOUR, 139.8kph, length ball outside off, Smith gets a thick outside edge as he looks to force it through the off-side. He did open his bat-face, but it was clearly off the edge. Goes fine to third man for four more
Stoinis to R Tripathi, FOUR, 125.3kph, a harmless short ball that sits up nicely for the right-hander. Tripathi waits for it on the back foot and easily pulls it over mid-wicket for a one-bounce four

Chahal to Smith, 1 run, dropped! No, RR don't want to bat sensibly. Smith decides to go after this flighted delivery outside off from Chahal with an inside-out loft. Doesn't middle and hits it straight to sweeper cover, where Umesh decides to be generous and puts down a dolly! Oh, RCB!

Siraj to R Tripathi, FOUR, 139.5kph, fuller than a good length ball outside off. The width was on offer for Tripathi to free his arms and the Royals batter takes full toll of it. Presses forward and lifts it handsomely over extra cover. Classy shot!

Siraj to Smith, SIX, heaved away for a maximum. Too predictable. Yet another slower delivery from Siraj, it was in the arc outside off. Smith picked it early, moved across towards off and swung his bat hard to smash it over cow corner
Navdeep Saini to R Tripathi, FOUR, 142.2kph, full toss on the stumps, Tripathi backs away a long way and carves it behind backward point. Used the bowler's pace to his advantage did Tripathi

Siraj to Smith, 1 run, Negi dives forward at mid-wicket, but fails to hold onto it. Short ball and Smith pulls of the top part of the bat, it kept dipping at the fielder, but carried to Negi. Tough chance
Siraj to R Tripathi, 1 run, another drop! Short again and Tripathi gets a top-edge on his pull, Moeen runs to his right from deep mid-wicket and slides, fails to snaffle it. Dew factor?

Siraj to Smith, out Caught by U Yadav!! Siraj bowls length outside off, Smith clears his front leg and backs himself to clear the fence. Doesn't get the timing right and spoons a simple catch to Umesh at long-on. Smith c U Yadav b Siraj 38(31) [4s-2 6s-1]

U Yadav to R Tripathi, SIX, Tripathi caps off the match in style. A short ball at 139.1kph, Tripathi picked the length early, got into a good position and pulled it fiercely over deep mid-wicket. Rajasthan Royals win by 7 wickets

U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, that's criminal from Umesh. Veers it down leg with fine leg inside the ring, easy-peasy for Rahane. Slower ball, goes all awry and Rahane with soft hands that beats the keeper

U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, consecutive fours for Rahane. Umesh corrects his length and pounds it short just outside off, Rahane exploits the width and flashes his bat. Hetmyer should've done well at point, fails to stop it and off she goes to the fence in a hurry

Navdeep Saini to Buttler, FOUR, boom! That's a fierce slap from Buttler. Suddenly, it's raining boundaries for RR. Very full and overpitches in the process just outside off, Buttler conserves some energy by wielding his bat and creams the drive through extra cover

Navdeep Saini to Buttler, byes, FOUR, nothing is going right for RCB at the moment. Sloppy from Nath. Full and swerved in a little, Buttler failed to connect on the big heave and Nath makes a mess of it behind. Very lazy stuff, was late to bend down and misses it altogether

Navdeep Saini to Buttler, FOUR, this looked intentional from Buttler. Shows off his dexterity. Lenght delivery cutting back in just outside off, Buttler uses the pace and opens his bat face at the last moment in running it past short third man, who's dive went in vain

Navdeep Saini to Rahane, FOUR, woah! This is a very uncharacteristic from Rahane. Kohli-esque wristy flick. Very full and around off, Rahane shuffles across and twirls his wrists at the nth minute to clip it nonchalantly through mid-wicket. All swag from the RR skipper!

Navdeep Saini to Rahane, FOUR, lofted over extra cover. He's one of the best manipulators on the off-side. But Saini keeps providing him with freebies like these. Pitched fuller and just outside off, Rahane shifts his weight forward and handsomely lifts it over the in-field

Chahal to Rahane, out Lbw!! Chahal strikes. Gets the breakthrough for RCB which should give them some respite. Googly, spinning in and Rahane was trying to make room to cut. Was late to get his bat down and fails to read it. It thuds him on the pad - in-line with the stumps. Total misjudgement from the RR skipper, looked plumb straightaway and the umpire was spot on. Would've crashed into the middle stump. Rahane knew that he was in trouble and didn't bother it review it. Rahane lbw b Chahal 22(20) [4s-4]

Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR, short and put away behind square with disdain. Nothing delivery from Stoinis, can't drop at this length, especially at his pace. Sits up nicely for Buttler, who takes full toll of it

Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR, expertly done by Buttler. Stoinis went for the slower short ball but Buttler was upto the challenge. Jumped high and plays the pull off the front foot over mid-wicket. Generates some power and collects four

Behrendorff to Rayudu, out Caught by de Kock!! There's a noise and Rayudu's gone. His poor form continues and it's a first-baller for the opener. But what a corker from Behrendorff this was. Pounded it short, sprang up like a spitting Cobra after hitting the deck just outside off. Rayudu was just pushing his bat forward aiming to defend. Scary extra bounce scraps the shoulder of the bat and carries to QDK. Behrendorff is elated and Mumbai have struck early. Rayudu c de Kock b Behrendorff 0(1)

Malinga to Watson, FOUR, edged and flies over the slips. Doesn't matter how they come but Watson will take it. Fuller length and seaming away just outside off, Watson goes hard on the downtown swing and gets a thick outside edge which balloons over to the third man fence

Malinga to Watson, out Caught by Pollard!! In the air and taken. Straight to Pollard at cover-point, who juggles a bit and holds onto it. Both openers back in the shed for CSK and it's been a wonderful start for Mumbai. Short and well wide of off, Watson cuts and doesn't keep it down. Hits it airly and finds Pollard, who leaps and it bobbled out of his hands, but he keeps his calm and grabs it on the second attempt. Wankhede explodes.. Watson c Pollard b Malinga 5(6) [4s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, much needed boundary for CSK! Jadhav didn't get hold of the slog sweep that well here, still got enough and also found the placement well. Speeds away to the deep square leg fence

Hardik Pandya to Dhoni, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Dhoni departs! Never got going today and with the required rate soaring, he had to take a risk. Tries but doesn't work. Stepped out in a premeditated manner and Hardik smartly dug it short, at the body, cramping MS completely. The result is a forced pull and it's aerial too. Dolly for Surya at square leg. Massive dent to CSK's already fading chances in the game. Dhoni c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 12(21)

Hardik Pandya to Jadeja, out Caught by de Kock!! Second in the over for Hardik! What a game he is having! A blitzing cameo earlier in the night and now two strikes with the ball. Pounded this on the hard length with good pace, Jadeja was backing away for the slash but got done in by the speed. Too late and gets a healthy nick that's pouched by a beaming de Kock. Wheels coming off for CSK. Not far away from hearing the fat lady sing. Jadeja c de Kock b Hardik Pandya 1(2)

Hardik Pandya to Dwayne Bravo, leg byes, FOUR, not off the bat but CSK won't mind. Was angling in on leg stump and Bravo shuffled early for the flick. Off the pads and races away down to the fine leg fence

Malinga to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, cheeky way to bring up a fine fifty! Shortish with good bounce from Malinga, Jadhav just waits and dabs it with an open face. Well wide of de Kock and quite fine to the third man fence. It's been a good knock so far from Jadhav but he has lacked support

Malinga to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, sensational stroke! It was fed on the pads, yes, but the execution of the stroke was superb from Jadhav. Drop kicks it through backward square leg and a sliding Bumrah from fine leg can't cut it off. Perfect start for CSK in this over

Malinga to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by de Kock!! Jadhav's defiance ends. Fought hard but with this kind of a target, he needed support which he never got. Slower ball from Malinga and Jadhav went for a wild heave across the line. Only manages a thin feather through to de Kock who is having a good time behind the sticks. Kedar Jadhav c de Kock b Malinga 58(54) [4s-8 6s-1]
Malinga to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, smoked! Probably has come a bit too late in the game I reckon. Bravo picked the slower ball this time and swung this merrily into the third tier at long-on. Mammoth blow

Malinga to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by de Kock!! Stunner from QDK! Brilliance from the South African and that's the end of a forgettable night for Bravo. Made room for the big shot but this was in the blockhole, cramped him as well and he got a faint inside edge. De Kock was initially blinded, as keepers usually are in such a scenario, but reacted sharply with a two-handed diving catch to his left. Excellent work indeed and that's the third of the night for Malinga. Dwayne Bravo c de Kock b Malinga 8(9) [6s-1]
Bumrah to Chahar, FOUR, nicely struck! Overpitched and Chahar makes room to biff it over extra cover. Clean hit and in the gap as well

Hardik Pandya to Chahar, out Caught by Bumrah!! Another one bites the dust. The hard length has done the trick many a time on this pitch tonight and here is another example of it. Well-directed pacy bumper and Chahar gets into a tangle on the pull after having backed away early. Gets a top edge towards deep backward square leg where Bumrah takes a running catch, having covered decent ground from fine leg. Chahar c Bumrah b Hardik Pandya 7(7) [4s-1]

Hardik Pandya to SN Thakur, SIX, in the air for an eternity and it's also cleared the ropes! Not a bad hit from a lower order batsman. Fuller length from Hardik and Thakur lifts it high down the ground. Plenty of elevation and just about has the distance to clear long-off

Hardik Pandya to SN Thakur, FOUR, smacked hard! Thakur having some fun here. Another overcooked delivery from Hardik with width on offer, blasted away through extra cover and well wide of long-off. Handy runs for CSK to reduce the margin of defeat

Behrendorff to Raina, SIX, typical inside-out shot from Raina. Triggers his back leg, creates some room to this full ball and lifts it beautifully over cover. The timing was supreme and it clears the ropes for a maximum

Malinga to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, flicked away for a six. Horror delivery from Malinga, very identical to the previous ball. Slanting it on the legs, Jadhav ain't missing out on these freebies. Walks across and helps it away expertly over short fine leg. Almost smashed it towards the Harrier car

Malinga to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, this is poor bowling from Malinga. He's just not finding his lines right. For the umpteenth time, drifts it down leg. Bread and butter for Jadhav, who picks it away over short fine leg. Behrendorff leaps but it comfortably clears him

Behrendorff to Raina, FOUR, educated edge and Raina collects a boundary. Shortish just outside off, Raina intentionally opens the bat face at the last minute and guides it through the vacant slip cordon. Cheekily done!

Behrendorff to Raina, FOUR, consecutive fours for Raina and the "CSK, CSK" chants are back. Behrendorff wafts it full and gives some width for Raina to free his arms. Lifted over mid-off, holds his shape nicely and desperate chase from the fielder but in vain

Behrendorff to Raina, out Caught by Pollard!! Oh my word! There's that customary stunner from Pollard for the season. His batting form may have dipped but not his fielding and catching. This is smart field placement from Rohit and Behrendorff executed it well. Dug it short and offered width, Raina forgets there's a fielder at sweeper cover. Slashed it on the up and Pollard was waiting for it. Though he kind of charged in a bit early, he made sure he kept his calm and stretched his giant right hand to nonchalantly grab it. Dives and thumps his chest towards the MI fans in the stands. Blinder from the big man and CSK in trouble now. Raina c Pollard b Behrendorff 16(15) [4s-2 6s-1]

Bumrah to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, dismissive pull from Jadhav. Skiddy short of length just outside off, Jadhav gets quickly onto the back foot and short-arm jabs it wide of mid-on. Rolled his wrists at the right time to find the gap

Bumrah to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, wow! Helicoptered over mid-on. Brilliant from Jadhav. It was nearly a yorker length from Bumrah, Jadhav took his front leg out of the way and stayed deep. Lifted it excellently over mid-on. Even the inventor of the helicopter shot, MS Dhoni - who's at the other end - would've enjoyed that

Bumrah to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, four more. He's a smart customer, is the pocket-rocket Jadhav. Bumrah is under pressure now. Peppered it short outside off, Jadhav cleverly arched his back at the last moment and elevated it over the slip. Third man had no chance and he'll collect a boundary

Rahul Chahar to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, outside edge and beats short third man. Floated up, spins away after pitching and lures Jadhav into a drive, who goes with hard hands and gets an thick outside edge. Zooms away to the third man fence
