Tahir to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, fired down the leg-side, Suryakumar gets down on one knee and sweeps it fine past the man at 45

Mohit Sharma to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, this will ease his nerves a bit. Mohit Sharma is bowling back of length balls so there was no long-off in place. Krunal Pandya moves forward, and lofts it over mid-off. The timing again wasn't great but it was good enough to get it over mid-off

Mohit Sharma to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, poor effort from Rayudu in the deep. And that will result in a four. Back-to-back fours for MI and Krunal. It was short and was on the body, Krunal Pandya gets behind it and pulls it with a lot of power to deep square leg. Rayudu there should have easily stopped it but instead he lets it go

Dwayne Bravo to Krunal Pandya, no run, in the air and dropped! Mohit Sharma is the culprit. Krunal wanted to clear mid-off, fails to do so and ends up hitting it straight to Mohit at mid-off. It was hit hard and Mohit fails to get his fingers in the right position to grab it

SN Thakur to Krunal Pandya, no run, Review time: Krunal Pandya has been given out lbw. And he has taken the review. I don't reckon there is an inside edge on it. UltraEdge will confirm it. And there is a spike on UltraEdge. Just a tiny bit but that will be enough to save Krunal. Rod Tucker will have to change his decision. It nips back in off the deck, Krunal Pandya wanted to heave it to the on-side, plays it down the wrong line and it raps him on the pads. It looked plumb to the naked eye but an inside edge saves Krunal

Tahir to Krunal Pandya, SIX, that's an old-fashioned heave. And it will clear long-on with ease. It was a leggie on the stumps, Krunal Pandya clears his leg, keeps his shape and dispatches it into the stands

Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, nicely done from Suryakumar Yadav! He was anticipating a slower one and it indeed was one, Suryakumar Yadav backs away, makes room and eases it past short third for a boundary. No need to run for that!
Dwayne Bravo to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, yorker on the stumps and Krunal Pandya drills it down the ground. Jadeja of all people misfields it at long-off and that will allow batsmen to take an extra run

Mohit Sharma to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, time to buy a lottery ticket, Krunal! He has been saved three or four times in this knock so far. It was a slower one wide of off, Krunal Pandya attempts a slog, it comes off the outside half of the bat and just about clears short third. Jadhav gives a chase but ball will win

Mohit Sharma to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, just above the cover fielder. Can you believe it, he is teasing the fielders to the fullest at the moment. It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, Krunal Pandya gets it just enough bat on it to send it to fence

Mohit Sharma to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Jadeja!! A scratchy innings from Krunal Pandya comes to an end. But it was an important innings. It was a slower one on a length, Krunal Pandya wanted to clobber it to the on-side. He swings it down the wrong line, it clips the outside half of the bat and was in the air for a long time. Jadeja at long-on comes under it and takes it with utmost ease. Krunal Pandya c Jadeja b Mohit Sharma 42(32) [4s-5 6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, that's Surya-special for you! He shuffles towards the off-side, picks up the slower one, goes down on his knees and slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket. Into the stands!. Fifty for Surya with this big-hit!

Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that has been clobbered down the ground. And it will beat Jadeja at the long-on fence. Dwayne Bravo misses the yorker just a bit but that allows Suryakumar Yadav to get under it and power it straight back past the bowler. Jadeja dived full-stretch but his effort went in vain

Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Jadeja!! A brilliant innings from Surya comes to an end. His knock has ensured that Mumbai reach close to the par score on this wicket. He fails to get under the yorker, but still goes through with the hit. Ends up skying it in the air and Jadeja at long-on makes no mistake. Suryakumar Yadav c Jadeja b Dwayne Bravo 59(43) [4s-8 6s-1]

SN Thakur to Hardik Pandya, SIX, that's an air-strike from Hardik Pandya. You cannot bowl length to Hardik at this stage, he gets behind it, keeps his shape and absolutely smashes it over deep mid-wicket. It went a long way back into the stands

SN Thakur to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, steers it wide of backward point and they will take a single. Dhoni fumbles and Hardik Pandya wanted a double, MS quickly recovered and had he hit at the non striker's end, Pandya would have been in trouble

SN Thakur to Pollard, SIX, Pollard power for you! It was on a length and was wide of off, Pollard stays in the crease and smashes it over long-on with utter disdain for a maximum. Hardik Pandya at the non striker's end loved it too!

Dwayne Bravo to Pollard, no ball, SIX, just praised his skill of bowling yorkers and guess what, he delivers a full-toss above the waist height. Pollard larrups it over deep mid-wicket for a gigantic six. Free-hit coming up! It wasn't above the waist height so that was a harsh call from the umpire

Dwayne Bravo to Hardik Pandya, SIX, wow! Just wow! You will very rarely see a better power hit than this. It was a yorker on ths stumps, Hardik Pandya was deep in the crease and uses his wrists to dispatch it over deep mid-wicket for a massive maximum. Wrist of steel from the younger Pandya!

Dwayne Bravo to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, he has powered this one for another four. Hardik Pandya is playing a gem. It was a fuller length delivery wide of off, Hardik Pandya reaches for it and pumps it wide of cover for another boundary. He loved it! Punches the air in delight!
Chahar to de Kock, FOUR, inside edge past the sticks. It's always dangerous playing a horizontal shot to an inswinging delivery, de Kock wanted to cut, luckily it missed the poles and beat fine leg

Chahar to de Kock, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! He does it again, Chahar! Bowls tight, builds pressure and forces the mistake. Such as asset he's turned out to be for Dhoni and Co. This is an inswinging short of length delivery, de Kock wanted to smash this to the mid-wicket boundary as the runs weren't coming, the bat turned in his hands as he slogged at this and it went straight to square leg. Chahar roars in delight. Mind you, QdK is in great form and it's not easy to keep him calm. de Kock c Kedar Jadhav b Chahar 4(7) [4s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Hardik Pandya, SIX, 29 off the last over! And Mumbai ends the innings in a sensational fashion. It was a fuller length delivery wide of off, Hardik Pandya uses his wrists brilliantly again to lift it over deep backward point for another maximum

SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, overpitched and Suryakumar just essays a lovely cover drive. Gentle step forward and then the free flow of the bat, he ball bounced over cover-point, that tells you how good the square is. A batsman's paradise it should be

SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, MI need more of these. The start doesn't justify the surface on offer, yes CSK bowled tight, but they could have had more runs. This is full and on the stumps, Suryakumar on-drives and beats mid-on

SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, in the airrrr and just wide of cover-point. It went just a yard or two away from Raina's outstretched left arm. Short and wide delivery, poor delivery, Rohit cuts uppishly and gets away with it

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, now then, this is too much from CSK! Yes, the ball is swinging away, but you can't have such a big Test-match kind of gap at cover in a T20 game and this isn't the red ball which moves better. Fullish and outside off stump, Suryakumar easily drives and picks up a boundary

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, oh shot! Brilliant hit, the shot of the game thus far and will take some doing to beat this. A simple on-drive it looks like, but it's tough to play an on-drive with a straight bat to the right of mid-on, let the short of length delivery come and timed it sweetly, Rayudu gives chase and loses the race

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, freebie down the leg-side and Suryakumar won't miss out after this kind of a start, a gentle flick shot in the gap at mid-wicket and that's all you need at the Wankhede with a fast outfield

Jadeja to Rohit, out Caught by Dhoni!! What a start for Jadeja. Gets a faint edge and Dhoni manages to cling on. Flighted delivery pitching on the off stump and spinning away sharply, Rohit tried defending but the feet were stuck in the crease. Dhoni made no mistake and also checked the bails off to be doubly sure about the dismissal as Ro was close with his back foot in the crease. Tough catch because the ball almost shaved the off stump as well. Oh they are checking for the no-ball, Raina blocks the side angle from deep cover, but the other angle shows a very minute portion of the heel to be behind the crease when Jadeja landed. Third umpire is convinced and it will be OUT. A sluggish start from Rohit, he needs to be a lot more positive as an opener. Rohit c Dhoni b Jadeja 13(18) [4s-1]

Tahir to Yuvraj, out Caught by Rayudu!! Tahir takes off on his celebratory run. Fullish delivery outside off stump, Yuvraj lofts looking for a six, targetted the long-off region, but Rayudu was stationed perfectly under it. He was very close to the rope, but did exceedingly well to balance himself just inside the boundary. Umps check with the third umpire with the soft signal being OUT, replays confirmed it was a clean catch. Yuvraj c Rayudu b Tahir 4(6)
Jadeja to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, out comes the reverse paddle from Krunal, third man was inside the ring, so he did well to get bat on ball and it escaped to the boundary to ease some pressure

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, oh my word! What a shot, definitely not a bad ball at all. The end result of this back foot punch was great, but that's not how you should actually be playing. Worked on that occasion, could have been a drag on another day. Inswinger from Bhuvi, Shaw has this strange ability to play off the back foot to ones that aren't actually short, the ball escapes through the gap at cover

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, it's such a poor idea to remove the slip without seeing through at least one over, Bhuvi does this time and again, now one escapes through the vacant cordon, a wide slip would have had him. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Shaw looks to punch off the back foot, gets a thick edge that runs away to the third man fence

Nabi to Rahul Tewatia, no run, close call! But umpire Anantha Padmanabhan is a happy man. The slider which skids on and pings Tewatia on the front pad before deflecting onto the back, he played for the turn when there wasn't any. Ball-tracking showed it to be clipping leg-stump

Sandeep Sharma to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, lovely shot! Tewatia can bat. And he can to do it at a brisk rate. Delhi would want him to get them the momentum. On a length around off, Tewatia stays leg-side and uses the space he created to drive on the rise past mid-off

Sandeep Sharma to Rahul Tewatia, out Caught by Nabi!! Gone! The promotion does not work out for Delhi. Another knuckle and this time there is no bounce to save Tewatia, he is completely fooled by it and just leaves his bat hanging in front, the ball pops towards cover and Nabi completes the dolly. Rahul Tewatia c Nabi b Sandeep Sharma 5(7) [4s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, much needed for Delhi. The crowd find their voice with this boundary. Sandeep bangs it in short and at his pace on this surface it sat up, Iyer thumps the pull over mid-wicket and the ball raced away to the fence

S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Ingram had given up. Iyer taps it in front of point and sets off, Ingram had to respond and he just hoped Pandey missed, he did and the southpaw survives. It was not far though

S Kaul to Ingram, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Pandey has his man this time. Missed the direct hit but makes up with a terrific catch. Delhi slip further as the experienced Ingram departs. He sees the shortish length and the width outside off, cracks the cut towards backward point and the ball was dying in front of the Pandey, who dived across and caught it centimeters from the ground. Ingram c Manish Pandey b S Kaul 5(8)

S Kaul to Chris Morris, FOUR, almost similar to the Ingram delivery. Slow but on the shorter side outside off, Morris keeps the cut down and hits it behind point, got enough power to beat third man in the deep

Rashid Khan to Chris Morris, no run, that did not look close. Not sure what made Rashid go for the review. The leg-break and Morris misses the sweep, the ball misses the front pad and strikes the back thigh, impact was always one of the issues and the turn took it past off-stump

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that is a top shot. Iyer has been so good today. He has waited for the bad delivery and once he has got one, he's ensured to put it away. This was an overpitch and Iyer smacks it straight back over Rashid

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, out Bowled!! Cleans him up! Body blow to Delhi's chances of posting a fighting total. It's the skipper who's fallen. Iyer looked alright in his stay tonight but won't be there for the final flourish. Not the wisest of shots either, goes for a wild slog sweep against Khan, was the googly and hence, the shot was on. But it needed better execution as well which didn't happen. Sneaks through to ruffle the sticks. Shreyas Iyer b Rashid Khan 43(41) [4s-3 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Chris Morris, SIX, clobbered! Got hold of this alright, big Morris! Slower ball on a shortish length, the South African picked it early and swatted it high over deep square leg. Much-needed one for DC

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Morris, out Caught by Nabi!! Another one falls prey to the slower ball. On such a sluggish surface, it's expected really but even then, DC's batsmen have mostly failed to apply themselves. Can't fault Morris though for going big with less than two overs left. Tries to go over cover but it's the slower ball that's well wide outside off, he had to reach it and mistimed it horribly. Spoons a dolly to extra cover. Chris Morris c Nabi b Bhuvneshwar 17(15) [4s-1 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Rabada, 2 runs, Sandeep spills a sitter! Inexcusable really. Was a fuller one from Bhuvneshwar and Rabada went for the pick up shot. Got more height than distance on it and Sandeep should have gobbled this. Got under it well but probably lost balance a touch. Not only has he dropped it, but also allowed DC to get a brace
Bhuvneshwar to Axar, FOUR, fine shot from Axar! Width on offer and although the length isn't very full, his hands do the rest as he powers this through extra cover. Finds the gap perfectly

S Kaul to Rabada, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! That's the end of Rabada. Had to try the big shot with this being the final over but Kaul outsmarts him with an off cutter that's quite wide outside off. Was always a risk to go across the line and the result is a miscue that goes up in the air for a while towards short third man. Bhuvi calls for the catch and takes it comfortably. Rabada c Bhuvneshwar b S Kaul 3(4)

S Kaul to Axar, SIX, that's some power from Axar! Didn't seem initially like he hit this that well but it went soaring over wide long-on. Slower ball on a good length, it's leg stumpish and the southpaw whips it merrily

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, out Bowled!! Finally, Bhuvneshwar Kumar has a wicket against his name this season, in his fourth game. Well disguised slower delivery, not the knuckle ball, the traditional off-cutter, Shaw didn't read this and played an ugly swipe across the line, only to see the off pole cartwheeling. Will be interesting to see if Bhuvi refrains from bowling the knuckle ball. People have been picking them easily of late off his hand! Prithvi Shaw b Bhuvneshwar 11(11) [4s-2]

S Kaul to Axar, SIX, cracking blow from Axar! Perfect finish for DC. Picked the slower ball early this time, was actually getting predictable from Kaul and it's deposited straight down the ground. Clean hit and it goes crashing into the sightscreen

S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, excellent shot, because he played that almost with a straight bat, full and down the leg-side, the front foot opened up meant he had that area open for a free swing of the bat, timed it sweetly to clear wide long-on
Nabi to Dhawan, FOUR, this time backward square leg is back for Nabi, but Dhawan sweeps this very fine from him and also takes out the man at 45, nicely placed

Nabi to Dhawan, out Caught by Sandeep Sharma!! This is astute planning from Nabi. Dhawan plays the sweep to the spinners. He knows this is a spinning surface, so pushed backward square leg back and kept fine leg in to invite Dhawan, who fell in the trap top-edging a sweep to short fine leg. The length was full enough to play the shot, but it turned to take the edge. The line was also slightly outside off. Dhawan c Sandeep Sharma b Nabi 12(14) [4s-1]
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, full toss to begin with, Iyer creamed that nicely along the ground to cover, freebie to begin with from Rashid Khan

Nabi to Pant, out Caught by Hooda!! Wicket right after the break. How many times have we seen that! And it is a big one. Pant, who scored a hundred against this team last yer at the same venue, holes out in the deep. Flighted outside off, Pant bends forward and does not go through with the loft, just a check-lift and it still ends up near the long-off rope, Hooda used his height well and took it over his head right on the edge of the fence. Pant c Hooda b Nabi 5(7)
Lamichhane to Bairstow, FOUR, fine shot to start for Bairstow! Picked the googly and got across on one knee to sweep it hard. Connected well, got it wide of short fine leg and it raced away

Axar to Bairstow, no run, dropped! Axar has landed badly it seems. Was a fairly straightforward chance though and he spilled it. Bairstow used his feet for the lofted hit and ended up stroking it straight back at Axar who reacted quickly, had two bites at the cherry but couldn't cling on. Would have been a massive wicket for DC

Ishant to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! Pick. Heave. And perfectly picking out the fielder. Ishant Sharma - hidden all this while for some strange reason - comes, keeps hitting his trademark back of a length on the tummy. Pandey tries making some room to this and swipes it in quite an agricultural hack. Can't keep it down. Can't get the distance on it either. Bang. Deep square leg. Manish Pandey c Prithvi Shaw b Ishant 10(13)
Rahul Tewatia to Hooda, FOUR, and here's the overcompensated rubbish to follow up the ripper. Drifting well down leg, very full too .. and swept away firmly behind square

Rahul Tewatia to Hooda, no run, dropped -- Shreyas Iyer of all people -- and it just doesn't get simpler. Hooda drives uppishly, hard, finds extra cover, where Iyer reverse cups, and is a little too casual

Axar to Shankar, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The pitch-grip does its bit. And add to it Shankar's attempt to go a little too powerfully at this. It was short, innocuous-looking, and then it sticks in the surface, making Shankar lose all shape as he commits to his slap -- eventually dragging it tamely to extra cover, where life gives Iyer a second chance, and he doesn't mess it up. Shankar c Shreyas Iyer b Axar 16(21) [4s-1]

Lamichhane to Y Pathan, FOUR, when you're six-foot-something, you'd rather use it. Well Pathan does, stretching forward big time, getting to the pitch of the ball outside off and nailing his sweep behind square. Rabada tries sweeping and diving, but no, can't

Lamichhane to Hooda, out Caught by Rabada!! Lamichhane ends with a googly. Lamichhane ends with a wicket. Hooda hasn't been reading it well all innings, so does what the manual teaches on such occasions - sweep - and so what if the line is well outside off? Hooda commits, gets a big top-edge and Rabada's waiting there at deep mid-wicket. Delhi making Hyderabad pull off a Delhi? Hooda c Rabada b Lamichhane 10(11) [4s-1]

Chris Morris to Nabi, FOUR, oh easy. Short, but not short enough. Leg-lined and leg-lined enough. Quick and real quick enough. All Nabi needs is a bat, swivelling, pulling and getting enough of a tickle fine past the keeper

Rabada to Nabi, FOUR, drags it off the inside half, ahh, no wonder it's a batsman's game. Rabada tries a slower cutter on the stumps, which Nabi makes room to and tries slicing over the covers -- but ends up with the edge on the inside pulling through an empty cow corner. Just a shot stands in between Hyderabad and a victory

Rabada to Nabi, SIX, oh and he isn't wasting around. Rabada tries delaying things with a real fierce bumper, you know, quick, climbing up outside off. But Nabi backs away bigger, swishes outside off and upper-slices .. and Kotla is tiny, really tiny to stop Hyderabad from topping the table
Lamichhane to Bairstow, SIX, G-I-G-A-N-T-I-C! Made a cracking sound off the blade and Bairstow has sent this into the top tier at long-on. There was plenty of flight and he absolutely clouted this

Lamichhane to Bairstow, FOUR, more runs! A wild slog this time from Bairstow who picked the googly but got it off the inside half of the blade. Still had enough on it to find the deep mid-wicket fence

Lamichhane to Warner, no run, review wasted! Shockingly poor review! Iyer didn't do the right thing by agreeing to an emotional Lamichhane. This pinned Warner on the pad after missing the sweep. Always seemed to pitch outside leg but the leggie somehow convinced his skipper, despite a rejection from Pant. Result is, pitched outside leg and review gone in the drain. Poor, poor stuff

Chris Morris to Bairstow, FOUR, he's carrying on from where he right off in Hyderabad. DC are helping him by offering pace too. Morris bangs this short and that's right down Bairstow's ally. Forehand pull pumped away to the deep mid-wicket fence

Chris Morris to Bairstow, FOUR, clears the infield! Bairstow's intentions very clear, he wants to kill the game in the Powerplay. Not really in the slot but he goes through with the chip shot down the ground. Easily over mid-on and it speeds to the fence
Chris Morris to Bairstow, FOUR, he's toying around with the bowling, Bairstow. Another loose half tracker and he picks it up with a shovel pull over short fine leg. Wrong line and duly punished

Chris Morris to Bairstow, leg byes, FOUR, bonus runs! They all count though. Pacy delivery on leg stump, was a freebie in every sense and though Bairstow couldn't get bat on the flick, it brushes the pad and splits the keeper and short fine leg

Axar to Warner, byes, FOUR, It goes through everyone. It was a short of length delivery, keeps low, Warner was taken aback by the low bounce. He fails to get any bat to it. It misses the leg-stump by a whisker and the low bounce beats Pant too

Axar to Bairstow, FOUR, Jonny is on fire! He dashes down the ground, wasn't to the pitch of the ball still goes through with the shot and times it well enough to smash it down the ground for a boundary

Rabada to Bairstow, FOUR, kind of a shot Jonny would salivate upon for days! It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps, Bairstow takes a good stride forward and creams it through cover for a boundary. Another 50-run wasy partnership for Jonny and Warner. It's an easy game for them at the moment
Rabada to Bairstow, FOUR, wow! Jonny, you champion! He can't do nothing wrong at the moment. Waits for the slower one, delays his bat swing and tonks it straight down the ground

Rabada to Bairstow, FOUR, that's edged and four! All of a sudden, this has become a different match. We are playing on the same wicket, mind you! It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps, Bairstow waits for it to arrive and opens the face of the bat at the very last moment to guide it past third man. No stopping that!

Rahul Tewatia to Bairstow, out Lbw!! Rahul Tewatia gets the all-important breakthrough. But is it too late for Delhi? It was a slider on a fuller length, it skids off the deck. Bairstow was late on the shot, it misses his bat and raps him on the pads. Umpire raised his finger straightaway but optimistic Jonny challenged that decision (I don't know why) and was proved wrong within minutes. He misses his fifty by 2 runs. But has done enough damage at the top to put his team in the driver's seat. Bairstow lbw b Rahul Tewatia 48(28) [4s-9 6s-1]

Rabada to Warner, out Caught by Chris Morris!! Two quick wickets for Delhi and they are still alive in this match, only just though. The middle-order of SRH hasn't been tested yet so the next phase can be an interesting one. It was a fuller length delivery attacking the stumps, Warner was getting restless. He goes back and wanted to lift it over mid-off, no timing on it and ends up hitting to Morris at mid-off who takes a good low catch. Warner c Chris Morris b Rabada 10(18)

Chris Morris to Shankar, FOUR, gee! He is in some form these days, few months back, he would have hit it straight to cover. But, not now! He clobbers it over cover, bat turns in his hands but that didn't make any difference. It canters to the fence

Southee to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, massive top-edge. Massive swirl on the ball and it's gone a mile into the night-sky. Who wants it? Parthiv and Saini back-track but it's taking an eternity to come down. Oopsy. Saini gets to the ball but can't quite hold onto it. So, it will go down as a drop, tough chance but lucky Lynn. It was a shortish and bounced more than Lynn expected as he went for the pull. What's worse is that it dribbles away to the boundary after Saini shelled it
Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, adding insult to injury. Poor follow up delivery from Southee, drifting on the pads and Lynn duly puts it away with a fine clip off his pads over short fine leg

Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, not a good finish by Southee. Another loosener outside off, too short and wide of off. Lynn throws his bat and drills it hard along the ground through extra cover. Strong bottom-hand power and beats a desperate dive from Klaasen at sweeper cover

Navdeep Saini to Narine, FOUR, the plan was right from Saini, almost had Narine in trouble but somehow the batsman manages to help it away towards the fine leg fence. Bouncer following Narine, who was moving to leg and he gets cramped for all room because of the spicy bounce but Narine manages get it away to the boundary

Navdeep Saini to Narine, FOUR, miss the yorker, get set to face the penalty. Saini misses it by an inch, ends up as a low full toss and Narine after clearing his front leg, whips it to the left of mid-on. Raced away in a jiffy

Navdeep Saini to Narine, out Caught by Negi!! Chinnaswamy breaks the sound barrier because Narine's dismissed. Hang on! They are checking for the no-ball but Saini's foot is fine on this occasion. So, Narine can continue his long walk back to the pavilion. Ushered it short at an awkward height for Narine - tucking him for room, who tamely pulls it without any timing. Loops up to Negi at fine leg who has to cover some ground and also mind the ad cushions. Keeps his calm and snaffles it in front of his face, making sure he doesn't make any contact with the boundary. Outstanding catch and KKR have lost their first wicket. Good comeback from Saini. Narine c Negi b Navdeep Saini 10(8) [4s-2]

Stoinis to Chris Lynn, 1 run, Siraj puts down a sitter! Will this be the decisive moment in this game? RCB will hope not. It's a massive though, it's Lynn. Smart from Stoinis as he kept this slower ball wider outside off, forced Lynn to reach it and the result was a miscue that flew at a comfortable height to sweeper cover. Siraj had it covered and then let it pop out. VK is livid

Stoinis to Nitish Rana, SIX, that's in the crowd! Typical powerhit from Rana. He will go after it from the word go. This was the bouncer, leg stumpish and he got inside the line to help it over fine leg. Into the second tier

Negi to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Absolute ripper from Negi! Negi had been getting it to turn since ball one and with Lynn not being great against spin, this was on the cards. He was premeditating the charge down the track and Negi smartly held the length back. Kept it straighter too on middle and leg, spun sharply past the outside edge to make a mess of the stumps. The left arm spinner might well be the difference between the two sides. Lynn was looking threatening but has been removed at the right time as far as RCB are concerned. Chris Lynn b Negi 43(31) [4s-4 6s-2]
Negi to Nitish Rana, FOUR, blasted away! Much-needed for KKR. Gets width on offer and he was hanging back for the slap-cut. Smashed hard and it's wide of sweeper as well

Negi to Nitish Rana, SIX, clubbed over long-on! The home crowd were extremely hopeful that it would carry to the fielder but it's cleared him comfortably. Rare bad ball from Negi who gives one in the slot for Rana who doesn't try to overhit it. Just a clean bat swing to send it over the fence

Chahal to Nitish Rana, out Caught by (sub)Klaasen!! Chahal has his man! He's deserved a wicket and has got a timely big strike. The ploy of bowling googlies against Rana pays dividends. The left hander charged down and wanted to go with the spin on the off-side but skewed it aerially towards sweeper cover. The sub, Klaasen, clings onto the chance, much to the relief of his mates and the energetic home crowd. Nitish Rana c (sub)Klaasen b Chahal 37(23) [4s-1 6s-2]

Chahal to Karthik, no run, good review in the end by DK. Got flummoxed by the fastish leg break, got pinged on the back pad as well with the turn and fizz doing him in. The umpire was late in raising his finger and Karthik chose to go for the review, almost out of hope. He probably was banking on the turn to save him and that's precisely what happens. HawkEye shows to be going over the stumps

Navdeep Saini to Karthik, FOUR, almost a blinder at mid-off by Kohli! Dived swiftly to his left and had it in his left hand mid-air but couldn't hold on. RCB have spilled quite a few already tonight and though this isn't an easy one, you'd hope that some stick at least. Was a bludgeoning drive from DK and he couldn't quite keep it down. Nearly paid the price but eventually gets a boundary

Navdeep Saini to Karthik, SIX, just clears deep mid-wicket! Typical DK stroke. Half volley on leg stump, he holds his shape and doesn't go hard at it. Rather swings with the flow and it has enough to clear Chahal in the deep. The skipper is keeping KKR afloat

Navdeep Saini to Karthik, out Caught by Chahal!! Gone this time. Can't clear Chahal on this occasion. Was again in the slot from Saini but Karthik didn't get the timing right on the slog. Could only skew it high towards deep mid-wicket where the RCB leggie is waiting for it. Pouches the catch safely and celebrates wildly. VK is also chuffed, as he usually is when he gets excited. RCB are slowly going towards the finish line. Karthik c Chahal b Navdeep Saini 19(15) [4s-1 6s-1]

Stoinis to A Russell, SIX, six more! Russell has woken up! Slower and wider outside off, Russell sits back and flat-bats it down the ground. Clears the ropes with ease, as is the case when he connects well

Siraj to A Russell, no ball, SIX, Siraj is out of the attack! Another high full toss, Russell stays put and smokes this over deep mid-wicket. Clean hit and it goes all the way. Timely one for KKR but they need plenty more. Second beamer by Siraj and the umpires rightfully inform VK that the pacer can't bowl anymore

Stoinis to A Russell, SIX, smokeyyyyyyyyyyy! Another one! In the slot from Stoinis, tried to keep it wide of the big man's reach but Russell gets there and swings clean through the line. Booming hit into the crowd at long-off. The chase is alive and in fact, RCB are now in danger
Southee to A Russell, SIX, swings it into the stands! The carnage continues. In the slot for Russell who shovels it over deep mid-wicket. Clobbered deep into the crowd. Pressure on RCB

Southee to A Russell, SIX, just over the third man fence! Raining sixes now. Short and wide this, third man is up and Russell goes for the upper cut. Got more height on it actually and Chahal from deep backward point fancied a running catch. Not to be

Southee to A Russell, SIX, he's gone nuts, he's gone absolutely nuts here Dre Russ! Southee misses the yorker from round the wicket, it's a low full toss and it's dumped over wide long-on. Flat maximum. It's a storm out here
Southee to A Russell, FOUR, more runs! He can do no wrong! Short ball this time, Russell waits for it and ramps merrily over Parthiv. Races away to the fence in no time

Southee to A Russell, SIX, 29 off the over! Russell has killed the game. RCB are dead and buried with this onslaught. In the slot from Southee, doesn't miss the yorker by much but that's enough for Russell who blasts it over long-off for another six. Scores level!

Navdeep Saini to Uthappa, FOUR, top-edge and over the keeper. Sometimes extra pace can let you down but Saini shouldn't mind this. Bouncer, rearing off the deck and Uthappa for the nth time tries the pull and gets a top-edge to his favour
Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, larruped over mid-on. Easy-peasy for Lynn. Southee missed the yorker, Lynn gets deep and clears his front leg to whip it firmly over the in-field

Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, back-to-back fours for Lynn. He's getting a move on. Southee overcorrects and slips in the slower short ball, Lynn waits and pulls it after twirling his wrists behind square. Big gap and he will earn a boundary

Southee to Uthappa, FOUR, textbook-esque inside-out loft from Uthappa. All class from Robbie. Expensive over for RCB. Nothing delivery from Southee, pitches it right in the slot and Uthappa gets forward and just stylishly lifts it over extra cover

Chahal to Chris Lynn, SIX, Lynn gets into the act. Oh boy! He's launched this out of the ground. Nicely tossed up, Lynn quickly used his feet and outsmarted the bowler, flaunts his muscle power and dismisses it over long-on. New balls please!

Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, woah! All timing from Uthappa. Very cheeky, saw the width provided, so just waited deep and steered it behind point. This outfield is pretty quick and third man can't cut it off
Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, Siraj is epitome of waywardness. Slips this one down leg, just help-your-self-with-a-boundary ball. Uthappa accepts it with glee and walks across to tickle it very fine

Siraj to Chris Lynn, no ball, SIX, this is dreadful stuff from Siraj. What was he trying to bowl there? Steams in and hurls in a full toss that is just over the waist, Lynn takes full toll. Dispatches it into the deep square leg stands. It's called a no-ball for height

Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, stand and deliver from Uthappa. Half-volley from Siraj, begging to be hit and Uthappa takes his front foot across and slams the drive with brute power past mid-off. Nobody moved and it sped off the bat in a hurry

Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, this is ridiculous from Siraj. The slower bouncer, well wide of off and third man was inside the ring. Too easy for Uthappa, just waited and dinked it effortlessly over the fielder at 45. Big over for KKR, 19 coming off it

Negi to Uthappa, out Caught by Southee!! This was on the cards. The pressure was building on and Uthappa perishes. Excellent from Negi, kept hitting the right length and forced Uthappa into playing a bad shot. Looped up temptingly just outside off, the batsman was early into the loft and didn't go with full conviction. Ended up checking it and offers a sitter to Southee at long-off. Virat roars in delight. Much-needed wicket for RCB, just to lift their spirits. Uthappa c Southee b Negi 33(25) [4s-6]
Prasidh to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, early signs that this deck is a beauty. It was banged in short, came at a comfortable hip-height for Parthiv and he whips it over short fine for a boundary

Prasidh to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli-special! Treat for the crowd. It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps, Kohli takes a good stride forward and leans into it, he times the drive superbly well. It beats the cover and races to the fence

Prasidh to Kohli, FOUR, back-to-back fours for Kohli. And this crowd is buzzing with excitement. Prasidh is looking for some swing on offer, he bowls another fuller length delivery, Kohli takes a good stride forward and drives it like a boss through cover. No stopping that!
Chawla to de Villiers, FOUR, gets loop, gets room, gets turn too. And AB decides to help it along .. stepping forward a touch and lofting it inside-out over extra cover
Chawla to Kohli, FOUR, 50*35. Chawla drags the length back, which means Kohli decides to wait. And wait. And wait some more, before fetching a real late cut out of DK's gloves to guide it real fine

Kuldeep Yadav to de Villiers, 2 runs, big miscue. Ugly, like really ugly slog-sweep, gets only a big top-edge on it -- and the skier goes into a no man's mid-off. Ferguson gives it the charge from the deep, and even his dive can't get him under it cleanly

Narine to de Villiers, FOUR, dropped short. AB makes it look much, much worse, rocking behind in the crease and then throwing his weight behind a tonked loft, splitting long-off and extra cover in the deep perfectly
Narine to de Villiers, FOUR, another backing in, another flat-batted throw, and another hammer over extra cover. Oh he's making it a habit, a very, very lovely-looking habit

A Russell to de Villiers, SIX, it's THE battle of ego .. and AB's setting it up for Russell to match. Gets a sitter on the body - yes - but picks it perfectly with his pull as he deposits it into the second tier behind square. 88 meters
A Russell to de Villiers, SIX, 134.4kph. And all of it is bang in the slot. Russell bowls length for some reason, ask him, and AB sinks, gets under and smokes it over long-off .. 16 off the over

Nitish Rana to Kohli, FOUR, 105.6kph. Yorker. Leg-lined. Kohli's wrists are quicker, with a lot of bottom-hand flicking it away behind square. Kuldeep sweeps from fine leg, dives, and his palm can only parry it over
Nitish Rana to Kohli, SIX, 105.1kph. Length now, Kohli's into death mode already, committing big-time into a tonk downtown, smashing the free-ticketers at long-on
Nitish Rana to de Villiers, SIX, another cardinally ball-gone-wrong length. Oh at leasy give AB a challenge - for now he continues rocking behind and muscling them high over long-on

Prasidh to de Villiers, FOUR, 110.9kph, ah, Djoker! The change up finally goes wrong. AB reads the long hop, stands up full height and forehands it inside-out over extra cover. It's his fifty too -- 30th
Prasidh to de Villiers, FOUR, the horrors of a wide full toss. High. Lots of width. AB doesn't overhit, piling on and just slicing it behind point
Ferguson to Kohli, SIX, rank length. Kohli lays in, pulling it away, hard, long, cow corner. Such is this pitch, such is this ground, such is I0$ guy, such is I0$ carnage
Ferguson to Kohli, FOUR, 130.7kph, just too full. Kohli's already deep in his crease, incubating half vollies and then carving them inside-out over long-off
Ferguson to Kohli, 2 runs, tickled it so damn softly into long-on, and they steal a couple well before long-on could come in .. somebody, check their shoes for nitro-boosters

Ferguson to de Villiers, SIX, make it 19. Poor Ferguson's tried out everything - full tosses, bouncers, length - andhence decides to try out the one thing that remained, a back of a length sitter on the tummy. AB obliges, with a swivel, and a proper hack behind square

Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, out Caught&Bowled!! Ah, the perils of timing them so damn well. But Kuldeep - to his credit - is really brave to toss it up despite the carnage, and is really full as well. Kohli doesn't get under, just whipping it down the pitch, hard, flat, and Yadav's stuck out palms come in between. THIS is silence. Kohli c and b Kuldeep Yadav 84(49) [4s-9 6s-2]
Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, FOUR, big edge. Stoinis misreads the googly, wafts down the wrong line, but what are outside-edges for? The ball gropes at it, running through the slip cordon

Narine to de Villiers, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Mis-pumped. Narine goes back to keeping them short, which AB actually does well to pick up and try and launch over long-off. But no, there's only SO much even a superhero can do. Gets it off the under half, without a lot of bottom-hand and Gill waits at the boundary, reverse-cupped. de Villiers c Shubman Gill b Narine 63(32) [4s-5 6s-4]

Prasidh to Stoinis, FOUR, 150.3kph in a low full toss. Stoinis' measured this field, he knows Krishna can't bowl short with the first ball wide and then sits way, way inside his crease to slash it away through an empty point
Prasidh to Stoinis, SIX, slower cutter, and the levers have been cut loose. Stoinis rocks behind and swings. No, murders. Many, many rows into mid-wicket
Narine to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, gee! Parthiv Patel is in some form. He goes down on his knees and slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket with utmost ease for a boundary
Prasidh to Stoinis, FOUR, and gets funky. Shuffles, doesn't mind showing away his stumps as he scoops this one really fine .. 18 off this one, 205 in all, and Bangalore nail the perfect finish!

Ferguson to Kohli, FOUR, ball has flown off the bat. Wow! What timing! Ferguson did the mistake of bowling on the pads and Kohli generally punishes when someone makes such mistake. He gets in a good position and whips it wide of mid-wicket for another four

Ferguson to Kohli, FOUR, it's raining boundaries here! It was on a fuller length and wide of off, Kohli plunges forward and times the drive incredibly well. The placement was excellent too, it beats backward point and third man. And canters to the fence

Ferguson to Kohli, FOUR, an on-drive with a straight bat is one of the hardest shots to play in our sport. But how insanely easy Kohli made it look. Class, sheer class! He comes on the front foot and drives it past mid-on for another four

Chawla to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, he wants to match Kohli, It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps. Parthiv brings his bat down early and sweeps it wide of deep backward square leg for a four. Incredible bat-speed!
Narine to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, 50-partnership comes up! Parthiv Patel steers it wide of short third for a single

Nitish Rana to Parthiv Patel, out Lbw!! Gamble to give Nitish Rana the ball has worked for DK. Parthiv was trying a little to hard, he was looking to smash everything. But was not able to time most of the shots. This one was a slider on a good length, it skids off the deck. Parthiv Patel was late on the hoick. It misses his balde and raps him on the pads. Plumb infront! Parthiv Patel lbw b Nitish Rana 25(24) [4s-3]

Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, FOUR, bonus runs for RCB, exacly what they want. Very rarely, a bowler of Kuldeep's caliber delivers a morsel like this. It was down the leg-side and Kohli just helps it to the the fine-leg fence with a flick
Ashwin to Watson, FOUR, rank length, quite leg-lined too .. and Watson's quickly under it, sitting on a knee and sweeping it firmly through square leg

Ashwin to du Plessis, SIX, lovely shot! Should be the shot of the match. Carrom ball from Ash, Faf picked it out of the hand, charged out and lofted it with a straight bat right back over the bowler. All the way!

Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, SIX, fifty for Faf. Picked for the first time and he's grabbed the opportunity. Why were they hiding him? Flighted delivery around off, Faf kneels and smokes the slog sweep into the advertising hoardings near deep mid-wicket

Ashwin to du Plessis, out Caught by Miller!! Carrom ball and Faf is gone. Second wicket for the skipper. He spotted Faf clearing that front leg and kept the carrom ball close to him, the South African could not get underneath it and hence the mistime, Miller claims it comfortably near the long-on fence. The crowd erupts at Chepauk and that is because Thala Dhoni has walked out. du Plessis c Miller b Ashwin 54(38) [4s-2 6s-4]

Ashwin to Raina, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Two in two for Ashwin. Third in the game and he's delighted. On a hat-trick as well. Very poor from the experienced Raina. Just had lost Faf and he tries to slog sweep this ball, it is slower through the air and beat Raina for lack of pace, missed and the furniture is left in a mess. Wrong time for CSK to lose wickets. Two new batsmen at the crease now, advantage KXIP. Raina b Ashwin 17(20) [4s-1]

Shami to Rayudu, FOUR, pace is one thing you can't bowl on this surface. 143.2kph and Rayudu even advanced to make his own speed, makes just enough room to thump it over extra cover, Miller tried his best but the timing was good enough to beat him
Tye to Dhoni, FOUR, and thumped! That was a mini helicopter as he smashed a full ball down the ground past long-off for a four. The ball was full, Dhoni just gave himself a little room and smashed it

Sam Curran to Dhoni, SIX, you can't be slotting in those balls. That was up there, missed the length by a little margin and it was smacked over deep square leg for a sixer. You miss, Dhoni hits it out of the park

Sam Curran to Dhoni, wide, fuller and slipped down leg-side. MS allows the ball to go through to the keeper. Ashwin has reviewed this. Was it a nick down the leg-side? It was wided and Ashwin out of the blue decided to review. Nothing of the UltraEdge and it stays as a wide. That was bizarre
Sam Curran to Dhoni, FOUR, and that wasn't timed! Off the inner half of the bat and the ball escapes into the gap between deep square and deep mid for a four. Poor delivery and was put away

Sam Curran to Dhoni, FOUR, fuller and channelling away, Dhoni lifts the ball away over cover and that is a four. One bounce into the fence. These death overs are his territory and Sam Curran is messing up his lengths as well
Shami to Rayudu, SIX, length ball? That was a poor one from Shami and has disappeared over long-on. Rayudu expanded his long handle into the shot and smoked it over long-on

Shami to Dhoni, FOUR, not the smartest of bowling from Shami. The deep fine was in and Shami bowls it short. Dhoni hangs back and pulls it over short fine leg for a four. The Chennai crowd loving every bit of it
Shami to du Plessis, FOUR, ah, neat. When there's no pace off the pitch, Faf decides to generate some himself. Lovely step away, step down and goes inside-out over mid-off

Shami to du Plessis, FOUR, another Shami outfoxing. Faf continues coming down the pitch, Shami tries pulling his length back, but then Faf is happy to wait on it, present a nice full bat face in slapping it away over point
Shami to du Plessis, SIX, 138kph. Now the adventure. He's done coming down the pitch, so shuffles, sits and waits under the good length to scoop it really fine .. 16 off the over
Tye to Watson, FOUR, juicy. Full, easily down leg, and all Watson has to do is tickle - but he swings, middles his sweep behind square powerfully
Tye to Watson, SIX, the cross-seaming sit up. Tye stays in the slot, and Watson stays tonking. Holds his pose, doesn't over-hit, and still manages to loft it all the way over long-off

Tye to du Plessis, SIX, rank overcook, and Faf doesn't even have to advance out to this one - managing to stay his ground, clear out his front leg and go through the line, swinging, smoking into cow corner
Sam Curran to du Plessis, 1 run, short, but nothing at all on the ball. du Plessis has to wait, wait some more, and then when he pulls, drags it away into the leg-side with no timing whatsoever

Sam Curran to Watson, no run, smashed hard .. and flush into Curran's collar bone. Watson holds nothing back here, forehards a slap down the ground, where Curran tries his desperate best to get his hands in the way, or even save his face. Is hammered into his chest
Sam Curran to Watson, FOUR, ruins what should've been a really good over. Slips into the pads and Watson plays some sort of a half-flick, half-sweep to nail it in the gap behind square

Ashwin to Watson, out Caught by Sam Curran!! Watson has picked out cow corner - the longest part of this ground - and Ashwin knows this, so ends up bowling a carrom ball forcing him to go across the line and against the spin. But once a Watto commitment stays a Watto commitment, ending up in the slog sweep leading to a big top-edge, which Curran - a cool few yards inside the boundary - runs across to gather. Watson c Sam Curran b Ashwin 26(24) [4s-3 6s-1]

Tye to Raina, FOUR, that line was not going to work for long, especially with third man in. Angled outside off and Raina uses that smartly to steer a boundary behind point - splitting backward point and short third

Chahar to Gayle, FOUR, prodigious movement for Chahar. Pitched up and late shape away for Chahar just outside off. Gayle goes after it, hard hands and gets a thick outside edge which eludes Bhajji at short third man

Harbhajan to Gayle, out Caught by Dhoni!! It's throwback to 2011 IPL finals. Ravi Ashwin got rid of Gayle in a similar fashion and 8 years later, Bhajji repeats it again. Big scalp for CSK and the crowd are delighted. Harbhajan loads it up with flight, extracts some turn after pitching just outside off and Gayle wields his bat ungainly. Slight nick and MSD grabs it and knew it straightaway. Throws it up and Gayle is a goner. Gayle c Dhoni b Harbhajan 5(7) [4s-1]
Kuggeleijn to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, and the dilscoop! Done really well as he scooped it over the keeper's head for a one bounce four. And Sarfaraz Khan has a go at someone after playing the shot
Kuggeleijn to Sarfaraz Khan, SIX, length delivery and has been driven on the up! What a shot! Has lifted the ball away over long-off for a sixer. This might be the game changing over
Tahir to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, very full and on the stumps, Sarfaraz Khan knocks it down to long-off. And he will reach his maiden IPL fifty with it. He is finally coming off age
Harbhajan to Rahul, 2 runs, fuller length delivery turning back into Rahul, he nudges it to the on-side. And will come back for a brace
Harbhajan to Rahul, 1 run, very full and on the stumps, works it to long-on. And he will bring up his fifty too, he is palying the role of anchor to perfection here, needs to carry on for his team

Kuggeleijn to Rahul, out Caught by Jadeja!! Kuggeleijn's first wicket in the IPL is a huge one of Rahul. This is a match-changing event for sure. Rahul was waiting for the seamers to come on. And it was a given that he will go after them. He sets himself to slog this one out of the park. Kuggeleijn again is smart enough to bowl an off-cutter. He gets the desired help from the deck and Rahul's timing was in a mess on the slog. He could only hit it to deep mid-wicket and Jadeja there makes no mistake. He takes it with utmost ease. Rahul c Jadeja b Kuggeleijn 55(47) [4s-3 6s-1]

Kuggeleijn to Miller, FOUR, it was in the arc for Miller and he dispatched it for a boundary. Kuggeleijn after bowling brilliant slower ones decides to bowl a yorker. He fails to get the yorker right, Miller gets under and powers it wide of long-off. It rockets to the fence

Chahar to Sarfaraz Khan, no ball, FOUR, it slips out of Chahar's hand. And this is not the first time it has happened. It was a full-toss above the waist height and Sarfaraz Khan reaches for it and smashes it wide of third man for a boundary. Free-hit coming up!

Chahar to Miller, out Bowled!! That word of advice from MSD after two shockers from Chahar has made a massive difference. And he has probably won the match for CSK. It was a length delivery on the stumps, Miller swings and misses and it smashes the stumps. The leg-stump goes for a toss. Miller b Chahar 6(5) [4s-1]

Kuggeleijn to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by du Plessis!! Kuggeleijn on debut has won the match for CSK with some excellent death bowling. He has bowled slower ones after slower ones and that has worked for him brilliantly on this deck. Kuggeleijn = Replica of Bravo. It was on a good length and Sarfaraz Khan wanted to clobber it over long-on not enough willow behind it and Faf takes an easy one at long-on. Sarfaraz Khan c du Plessis b Kuggeleijn 67(59) [4s-4 6s-2]

Harbhajan to Agarwal, out Caught by du Plessis!! What an over this. Double-wicket maiden. KXIP have been jolted early and it's the in-form Agarwal who departs. Another tempting tossie, Agarwal stepped out and doesn't quite time his loft. Skies it up as far as long-on and there was a fielder waiting for this. Faf doesn't make any mistake and Agarwal shakes his head in disappointment. Harbhajan roars. Agarwal c du Plessis b Harbhajan 0(2)

Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, glorious from Rahul. Indipper on a fuller length at the stumps, Rahul doesn't try to hit it too hard. Just presents a straight bat face and drives it elegantly past mid-on. His drives are a thing of beauty..
Chahar to Rahul, SIX, you can't bowl short at this pace. And Rahul is a good puller of the cricket ball. Quickly spotted the length, went back and hammered it powerfully over cow corner

Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, follows it up with another loosener down leg, Rahul makes him pay again. Tried the in-angler, overcompensates and Rahul gets across to tickle it very fine. Good over for KXIP, all the pressure created has been released now off the final two balls

Kuggeleijn to Sarfaraz Khan, SIX, welcome to the IPL, says Sarfaraz. No respect whatsoever. It was dished out right in the arc just outside off, Sarfaraz freed his arms and opened his bat face at the right moment to clear the in-field. Lost a bit of shape but managed to chip it over point. Superb timing and it just clears the fence for a maximum
Tahir to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, poor finish to the over. Too short and too wide of off, Sarfaraz goes back and opens his bat face to lace it past point. Sweeper cover tries his best but in vain
Jadeja to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, wonderfully done! Waits on it, and then dabs it away with an open face of the bat. Dhoni did spread his legs in anticipation but it nutmegged him
Jadeja to Rahul, FOUR, was that a punch or a cut! But was beautifully done as he used the pace of the bowler to send it away. The man at deep cover put in a clumsy dive but couldn't cut it off

Bhuvneshwar to Rohit, no run, angles the ball in, the ball strikes the inside edge and thuds into the pad. The bowler, keeper and almost the entire squad miss the inside edge and take a review. The UltraEdge makes it clear. Rohit survives

Bhuvneshwar to Rohit, 1 run, and Kaul has dropped it. Lost it in the lights may be or might have been the swirling ball coming down. Eventful first over. Rohit danced out, looked to loft, got a big fat outer-edge and the man at deep third dropped it. The fielder did not even get a hand to it
Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, SIX, that's huge! Outta here! On the pads, Rohit lifts the ball away and it soars away over deep square leg for a massive sixer

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, and the extra delivery costs them a boundary.. Quick and drifting across the left hander, Kishan plays the late cut even though there's a slip in place, but the pace of Rashid was too quick for Warner to react

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Bairstow!! Krunal is not resurrecting the innings today like he did against CSK. Kaul celebrates ala Afridi - with the legs spread and the arms aloft. Mumbai sink further. A sharp short ball and Krunal is rushed on the pull, the top-edge goes straight up and Bairstow accepts the dolly. The front foot is checked again and Kaul is fine, again. Krunal Pandya c Bairstow b S Kaul 6(13)

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, out Ishan Kishan Run Out!! Excellent awareness from Bairstow. He even fooled Warner at slip, who gestured that it was not out. Kishan pats it towards cover and sets off, Pollard doesn't move and the young man has to turn back, run and puts in the dive as well. By this time, Bairstow had disturbed the stumps with his pad before the throw came but he ensured he uprooted one of the stumps with the ball in his hand. Kishan's dive meant the bat popped up and he was caught short of the crease. If the stumps were not uprooted, Kishan would have survived this. Ishan Kishan run out (Shankar/Bairstow) 17(21) [4s-2]

Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, SIX, boom! Finally, Pandya swings his bat and connects, connects big. Sees a flighted delivery, just outside off and takes it head-on. Strong muscles and biffs it a long way over the stands at long-on. Wears a cheeky smile on his face

Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Shankar!! The case of Rashid winning the battle, it's not the first time and the arms go wide in celebration. Pandya is stunned but has to go. This could dent MI's prospects of posting a par total. Tosses it outside off and forces the batsman to fetch for it. Pandya goes on one-knee and clouts it across the line, airy and Vijay Shankar, manning the deep mid-wicket fence moves across and takes a smart catch. Hardik Pandya c Shankar b Rashid Khan 14(14) [6s-1]
Rashid Khan to Rahul Chahar, FOUR, oh, this is nicely done by Rahul. He's no mug with the bat. Picks the googly, waits and waits before dabbing it past slip. Has enough legs to reach the fence

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, 1 run, in the air and Rashid grasses it. Instantly puts his hand up and apologises. Another cutter, thrown outside off. Pollard flashes his bat and spanks it towards sweeper cover. Rashid runs across, covers good ground in getting towards the ball but unfortunately can't hold onto it as he slides. Bhuvneshwar is not happy

Bhuvneshwar to Rahul Chahar, FOUR, well, this is clever batting frm Rahul. He's too good with the dinks. Again picks the length delivery, gets deep in his crease and opens his bat face at the last minute to glide it past Bairtsow

Bhuvneshwar to Rahul Chahar, out Caught by Bairstow!! Edged and gone. Slower balls in loop from Kumar, this was much fuller and Rahul swings blindly. Is too early into the shot and ends up nicking it to the keeper. Bhuvneshwar picks up his first wicket and MI lose another wicket. Rahul Chahar c Bairstow b Bhuvneshwar 10(7) [4s-2]

S Kaul to Pollard, SIX, oh jeez! What power from Pollard. For a second, thought he mistimed it as his bottom hand came off the handle but such is the power from the big man that he still manages to deposit this 10 rows back over long-off. It was another canny slower ball from Kaul, Pollard didn't pick it and threw everything at it and gets the desired result

S Kaul to Pollard, SIX, low full toss and Pollard clouts it over cow corner. If you miss your length against Pollard, he will make you pay. Kaul misses his yorker by an inch or so, Pollard connects and launches it into the stands

S Kaul to Pollard, SIX, takes full toll. Kaul again misses the yorker, offers a juicy full toss outside off and Pollard takes it on the full to smoke it over cow corner. 83-metre six, Pollard is on song here
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, FOUR, chipped over extra cover! Fuller and wide of off, Pollard with his long levers spanks it over the in-field. It came off the cue-end but comfortably cleared the fielder

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, SIX, dropped. Nabi palms it over for a maximum at deep square leg. Very sloppy, should've taken by his standards. Whipped across the line and went towards deep square leg, Nabi sprawls across and gets both hands on it, only to tip it over the ropes

Bhuvneshwar to de Kock, SIX, easy pickings. Picked off the pads and heaved away behind square for a sixer. Not the biggest ground and the ball went over the ropes. Little charge down the track and then the club

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, FOUR, another blemish and it's a boundary. MI and Pollard will not mind this. Very full from Kumar, Pollard clubs it down the ground. Hooda misjudges it and charges in way too early, doesn't get his body behind the line of the ball and lets it through to the boundary

Nabi to Rohit, out Caught by Hooda!! Hangs the ball in the air by bowling it slower, Rohit fails to control the hack and holes out at deep mid. He inner-halved the stroke and never timed it. The ball was tossed up at 82.9kph and all the power in the shot had to be invested by the batter. That is where he lost his shape trying to hit it hard and the length also was dragged back. Huge wicket for SRH. Rohit c Hooda b Nabi 11(14) [6s-1]
Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, punched down the ground! Hits it on top of the bounce with the full face of the bat and beats mid-off with elan

Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, out Lbw!! He plays such unorthodox shots but falls prey tonight. Looked to slog a slower delivery and missed it completely. The impact looked a little dicey at first but was umpire's call as Suryakumar Yadav decided to review. SRH are on top now. Suryakumar Yadav lbw b Sandeep Sharma 7(8) [4s-1]
Y Pathan to de Kock, FOUR, bad ball on to the pads and has been paddled away fine past short fine leg for a four

S Kaul to de Kock, out Caught by Hooda!! Gone! Mumbai's in-form batsman has been sent back. Front foot no-ball - check. QdK has to continue his walk back. The well-disguised knuckle ball and de Kock thought it was in his slot, so he went through with the heave but the slowness didn't allow him to clear the rope, Hooda settles under it at deep mid-wicket. de Kock c Hooda b S Kaul 19(18) [4s-1 6s-1]

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, what timing! It was just a short-arm jab on the dab and the ball races to the fence. Short of length, Kishan rides the bounce and steers it late behind point, Pathan had no chance in the deep

Behrendorff to Bairstow, FOUR, crunched through cover. Shows the kind of form he's been in this tournament. Short and fraction width provided, enough for Bairstow to cash in. Getting on top of the bounce and slapping it in the gap

Behrendorff to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rohit!! Manish Pandey absolutely belted that but hits it straight into the hands of Rohit Sharma at mid-wicket. Sharp reflexes from Rohit though, a meter to the right or left of him would have been a boundary. But this sport is all about few centimeters. And this dismissal was just a vindication of that. It was a back of a length delivery on the stumps, Manish Pandey got a lot of willow behind the pull shot but when luck is not going your way you tend to find fielders. And that's exactly what happened there with Pandey. Manish Pandey c Rohit b Behrendorff 16(21)

Rahul Chahar to Y Pathan, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! SRH are committing a harakiri here. They are five down now. It was a googly which was wide of off, Pathan goes down on his knees and wanted to slog-sweep over deep backwad square leg. It comes off the top-half of the bat and ballons up in the air. Ishan Kishan in the deep makes no mistake. Y Pathan c Ishan Kishan b Rahul Chahar 0(4)
Rahul Chahar to Hooda, FOUR, goes on the back foot and cuts it well, beats deep backward point for a boundary. Welcome boundary for SRH!

Bumrah to Nabi, SIX, 120kph. In the back of a length zone just outside off, but Nabi's happy to open up his cards early - which are the same cards he's been trying to deal with all over - backing away and then generating enough power in this lofted tonk of sorts. It looked like he only had the height on first impression, but no, the legs are there, over long-off

Alzarri Joseph to Hooda, out Bowled!! It was a troubled stay, and the end is just as troubling. Joseph anticipates some more shuffling extravaganza here from Hooda and keeps it dead straight on middle. Hooda - this time - isn't as creative, sits down trying to slog it out over cow corner. But it's too quick. Too full. Under the bat and leaving a mess behind. Hooda b Alzarri Joseph 20(24) [4s-1]

Alzarri Joseph to Rashid Khan, out Caught&Bowled!! There's the virtual nail into Hyderabad's coffin. It's quick, it's bouncy and it's into Rashid's shoulder. Poor Rashid, he didn't even get a sighter to deserve this brute. So he backs away, tries to get some bat, somehow in a weird pull of sorts. Ends up with the bat's shoulder, onto his shoulder for Joseph to run under the balloon up. Rashid Khan c and b Alzarri Joseph 0(1)

Bumrah to Nabi, out Caught by Rohit!! Remember what SRH did to MI last year at the Wankhede? Well, this is revengeful payback. JUST AS COLD. Bumrah bangs it in, continues cramping Nabi up for room, for height as he continues swinging desperately -- this time for the bat face to turn in his palms, get a big fat top-edge, as far as mid-off. Nabi c Rohit b Bumrah 11(14) [6s-1]

Alzarri Joseph to Bhuvneshwar, out Bowled!! WWWWW -- IPL debut you say! It's easier than an EA Sports Cricket '07 debut. He needed Malinga to return home, and he's perhaps even nudged him further into Sri Lanka here. So it was the same old usual stuff, full, on middle and Bhuvneshwar's tried funky scoop does him no good. Only uproots middle. Bhuvneshwar b Alzarri Joseph 2(6)
Alzarri Joseph to Sandeep Sharma, FOUR, on the legs at full pace. Sharma gets a tickle, and that's all he needed to .. into fine leg

Alzarri Joseph to S Kaul, out Caught by de Kock!! Sorry Sohail Tanvir, Joseph's knocked you out -- It's the BEST IPL figures by a bowler. EVER. And it's taken 12 years and a 22-year-old from Antigua to do it. Again, a Ripley's Believe-It-Or-Not fact, he's on debut. Hits the hard heavy back of a length just outside off, which Kaul sticks his bat out in a poke to - and the feather to the keeper will do. S Kaul c de Kock b Alzarri Joseph 0(1)

Behrendorff to Warner, FOUR, poor delivery from Behrendorff and gets the punishment. Swinging into the pads of Warner, who shuffles across and flicks it with supreme timing behind square on the leg-side. There was a fielder in the deep but had no chance of stopping that

Behrendorff to Bairstow, FOUR, seems like Bairstow read the bowler's mind here. Expected the short delivery, went deep in his crease and cleared his front leg to mow it over mid-wicket. Vijay Shankar in the dug-out enjoyed that
Behrendorff to Bairstow, FOUR, strokes it on the rise but it beats Rohit's dive at mid-off. Fullish just outside off, Bairstow hammers it hard and luckily the ball teasingly evades the MI skipper

Rahul Chahar to Warner, FOUR, Warner latches onto it, on this occasion. Pushed through quicker on middle, Warner took some time in getting his bat down on the heave, gets it off the inner half in the pocket between short fine leg and square leg

Rahul Chahar to Bairstow, out Caught by Bumrah!! No Bairstow show today. Perks of having a leggie in your team. Leg-spinners might go for a few runs but on most occasions will fetch you a wicket. Rahul Chahar has just done that and gives MI the first breakthrough. Serves the googly on a luring length outside off, Bairstow went for it, gets deceived by the flight and lost his shape completely. The outcome is a top-edge which spoons up to Bumrah at short third man, who takes the sitter. Bairstow c Bumrah b Rahul Chahar 16(10) [4s-3]

Alzarri Joseph to Warner, out Bowled!! Wow! First ball in IPL cricket and Alzarri Joseph gets one of the most successful batsmen in the history of IPL. Stuff of dreams! It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, Warner throws his bat at it in a clumsy fashion perhaps some overconfidence. It clips his inside edge and comes back to disturb his timber. Warner b Alzarri Joseph 15(13) [4s-2]

Rahul Chahar to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Pollard drops a dolly at long-off. Can you believe it, I can't. Let me pinch myself. Yes, Pollard has dropped. It was a miscued loft from Manish Pandey, was in the air for a long time. Pollard comes under it but for some reason fails to grab it. Rohit is stunned
Rahul Chahar to Shankar, FOUR, width available that time, Shankar waits for it to spin and steers it wide of backward point for a boundary

Alzarri Joseph to Manish Pandey, 1 run, direct hit and Shankar would have been gone. Manish Pandey taps it to cover and charges for a single. Surya picks it up cleanly but fails to nail the direct hit at the striker's end. And Shankar survives!

Alzarri Joseph to Shankar, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! The decision to play Alzarri Joseph is proving to be a masterstroke for Mumbai Indians so far. It was a back of a length delivery and was wide of off, it skids off the deck. Shankar was a week late on the pull shot. It comes off the upper half of the blade and pops up in the air. Hardik Pandya at backward point won't do a Pollard. He takes a sitter of sitter. Shankar c Hardik Pandya b Alzarri Joseph 5(10) [4s-1]

Southee to Dhawan, out Caught by Navdeep Saini!! Dream start for RCB as Dhawan departs for a duck. Pitches this one up and tempts the batsman to go after it. The left-handed batsman goes for a booming drive and gets an outside edge that flies to short third man. Saini is swift to move across as he plucks this one nicely before he hits the ground. The crowd is ecstatic as the Kiwi pacer strikes early. Dhawan c Navdeep Saini b Southee 0(1)

Southee to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, should have been stopped by Chahal there. Iyer leans ahead and times his square drive to beat the leggie's dive at point. First one of the innings for Delhi and their skipper

Southee to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, dropped by Parthiv! That could possibly have been the second wicket of the innings, but Southee has his hands on his head. The keeper has let him down. Iyer went for a drive away from his body as an outside edge flies straight to the keeper. Parthiv dives to his right, gets his glove to it but fails to cling on to the catch. Quite an eventful over that
Negi to Ingram, SIX, oh so very defensive. Negi continues firing them wide outside off to cut off Ingram's leg-side play - square of the wicket he goes slicing, flat over extra cover
Negi to Ingram, FOUR, too short. Ingram rocks behind, lining up well to allow the ball to do its bit and then cut it away really late past the keeper

Chahal to Ingram, FOUR, nails the sweep. Ingram gets out a big stride, and then does well to roll his wrists on the ball as he powers it away despite the slight kick up off the pitch - keeping it down and into square leg

Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, chops the cut away off the back foot and gets it past the man at point for a four. DC are racing away towards the target. 42 needed now. Dropped it slightly short and Shreyas Iyer was quick to pounce on it

Moeen Ali to Ingram, out Lbw!! What happened there? Against the run of play, DC have lost Ingram. Looks to play the scoop and misses it completely. The ball hits the front pad and it looked quite adjacent to the sticks. Good decision from umpire S Ravi to give it out. It looked like there might have been some bat but wasn't to be and Ingram was happy to walk off. Ingram lbw b Moeen Ali 22(21) [4s-2 6s-1]

Moeen Ali to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, this shortish length ain't working for RCB. Shreyas Iyer treks back, stands tall and cuts it past point for a double. That is fifty for the skipper. His first of the season. Has been a tough start for him but would want to make this count

Navdeep Saini to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, fundamental error! The ball lands on the practice wickets and skids. Siraj at third man took it easy and the skid off the ground had enough pace to burst through the hands of the fielder. Shreyas Iyer picked up the short ball and slashed it for the ball to race away off the outer-half of the bat

Moeen Ali to Pant, FOUR, fetches the length ball from outside off and drags the sweep away into the on-side. The ball raced away square of the wicket on the on-side for a four. Didn't time it but had enough on it for a single
Chahal to Pant, FOUR, terrible delivery and has been put away. Pant rocked back and allowed the bat flow to take over and cut it past point. The man at deep cover had no chance

Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, well looped up delivery and has been smacked down the ground. Only a shot away now are the Capitals from investing in a win. Poor delivery again from Chahal and Shreyas Iyer was in no mood to let that go away

Navdeep Saini to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Chahal!! The short ball gets big on him and the top-edge has been taken at cover. That was a close call for the bowler as he almost was on the line while delivering it but a dew millimetres saved him. A wicket too late in the evening for RCB. The formalities have been delayed. Shreyas Iyer c Chahal b Navdeep Saini 67(50) [4s-8 6s-2]

Navdeep Saini to Chris Morris, out Caught by de Villiers!! Slammed on the up and it finds the man at mid-off. That was a back of a length delivery and Chris Morris tried to flat-bat it but ended up finding ABD at mid-off. Soft dismissal. Chris Morris c de Villiers b Navdeep Saini 0(3)

Siraj to Pant, out Caught by Southee!! Cross-seam length ball and has been slapped straight to the man at mid-off. Pretty much like Morris, Pant also tried to power the ball down the ground but ended up hitting it straight to the fielder at mid-off. Still 3 needed. Some atrocious batting from DC again. Pant c Southee b Siraj 18(14) [4s-2]

Siraj to Axar, FOUR, and those are the winning runs! Stand and deliver. Length delivery decking away, Axar lifts the ball over the in-field and gets it away to the fence for a four to complete the formalities

Southee to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's a good shot by Shaw. Has timed the ball nicely so far. Gets one overpitched dolly on the pads and he makes sure to put it away to the deep mid-wicket fence with a flick

Southee to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for the youngster. Gets one short ball down the leg side and Shaw drags it past the fielder at short fine leg. Kohli's expressions say it all, not a great line to bowl
Southee to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, shawt! Width on offer and no great pace either, Prithvi Shaw reaches out for it and slaps it through cover-point. Hat-trick of boundaries for the opener

Southee to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, make it four in a row. Exhibition of stroke play by Shaw. Short ball well outside off and the batsman plays an exquisite square cut. No chance of stopping that, neither for the fielder at point, nor for the fielder at third man

Southee to Prithvi Shaw, leg byes, FOUR, from bad to worse. 20 runs of the over already. Short ball around leg, Prithvi Shaw tries to flick it away but the ball clips his pads instead and races away to the fine leg fence

Navdeep Saini to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, doesn't matter where the field is when you're bowling full tosses. Shaw stands deep in his crease, swinging with a lot of bottom-hand to whack it straight down the ground

Navdeep Saini to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, hard slog across the line. Doesn't pick it cleanly, dragging it in the end only off the inside half of his bat .. the powerplay and Southee's chasing dive can't stop it from trickling into cow corner

Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, big jump down the pitch, and a bigger bat swing. It really looked a miscued slice at first, but there's enough bottom handed power, and Chinnaswamy isn't the biggest to get it to sail over the sightscreen
Negi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, just too easy. Strays down leg, and then refuses to turn back in. But Iyer turns on his heel, swivelling big to heave it away fine

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, 144.7kph. Damn, violence. Iyer anticipates the back of a length sitter with a lot of width outside off and backs away further to free up his hands as he slices a flashy cut into an empty backward point zone

Negi to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Akshdeep Nath!! The juicy long hop does what a bunch of tight lines couldn't. Negi drags his length back, and Shaw's eyes light up in a big agricultural mow getting deep in the crease. However, gets a big fat top-edge, and Akshdeep at cow corner, after all the initial misjudgement is sitting under. Prithvi Shaw c Akshdeep Nath b Negi 28(22) [4s-5]
Negi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, continues backing away in the crease, giving his arms the free-up space and slaps, hard, through point

Moeen Ali to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, cheekily experimental. An early premeditated lapped-scoop on realizing that there's no short fine leg, and Iyer doesn't mind walking all the way across his stumps if he has to. Doesn't find the middle, but the ballooning miscue is just as good
Ishant to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, lovely, Parthiv is the man in form for RCB, length ball on the pads, he gets inside the line and clips it over mid-wicket, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Chris Morris to Kohli, FOUR, edged and four, Dhawan was the fielder at wide slip - dived to his right, but the ball was just wide of him. An awkward jab from Kohli as he pushed away from his body, didn't count for the extra bounce

Axar to Stoinis, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Gone! One thing you can't do on a slow track is play the pull. Remember RCB's first game? Kohli and AB getting out playing the pull. This was short alright but the surface robs the pace off the ball, Stoinis pulls it straighter than he would have liked and picks out long-on. Good catch from Tewatia - he ran forward and pouched the flat hit. Stoinis c Rahul Tewatia b Axar 15(17) [6s-1]

Axar to Moeen Ali, SIX, it was a matter of time before Mo took on one of these two. He brings out the dancing shoes, gets close to the flighted delivery and smokes it with the spin over the cow corner fence

Ishant to Moeen Ali, SIX, second time RCB have hit a maximum right after the time out. Back of a length delivery and on a slow surface it was a hit-me ball, Mo swivels back and nails the pull flat over deep mid-wicket

Ishant to Moeen Ali, FOUR, wow! Mo has just squeezed a yorker for a boundary. The only thing wrong on Ishant's part is - it was outside off, Mo bends down, opens the bat face and squeezes it past backward point

Lamichhane to Moeen Ali, SIX, change of ends for Lamichhane and he's greeted in the same way as he was in his first over. Mo jumps out of the crease, gets close to the googly and smacks it flat over long-off

Lamichhane to Moeen Ali, out Stumped!! And Lamichhane has his man.. Brave bowling from the youngster. He was not afraid to toss it up even after getting hit for a six. It was the wrong 'un and Mo could not reach the pitch of the ball, still swings through the line and is beaten by the away turn. A nice little cameo but RCB needed more than a cameo here. Moeen Ali st Pant b Lamichhane 32(18) [4s-1 6s-3]

Lamichhane to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, cheeky! First ball and Akshdeep is down on his knee to play the paddle, uses the pace on the ball and places it fine, the lightning fast outfield took care of the rest

Chris Morris to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, it was boom or bust for Akshdeep with three dots, he decides it is the latter. Charges down and converts it into a full length delivery, cracks the drive past extra cover and there was no stopping that

Lamichhane to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, good effort by Morris, but in vain. Akshdeep Nath was down the wicket to chip this widish delivery to long-off. Morris sprints across, gets his hands to it but his knee gets stuck in the turf, hence he fails to stop it cleanly
Lamichhane to Kohli, SIX, finally! Finally, a sweetly timed shot by VK! Down on his knee in a jiffy as he pumps the floated delivery over deep mid-wicket for a flat six

Lamichhane to Kohli, SIX, it's Kohli time at the Chinnaswamy. The decibels have got a notch higher. Treks back and pulls the short ball over deep mid-wicket. Two in two for the skipper as the ball just clears the fence

Rabada to Kohli, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Rabada comes back in the attack and strikes. How often do we see that? Got de Villiers earlier, gets another big wicket now. A length delivery around off and Kohli holes out to long-on as he looks to clear the fence this time around. Kohli c Shreyas Iyer b Rabada 41(33) [4s-1 6s-2]
