Rabada to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, cheeky shot by Akshdeep! Waits for the ball to arrive, opens the bat face very late and guides it to the third man fence. With that pace, it was always going to race away to the fence

Rabada to Akshdeep Nath, out Caught by Pant!! Rabada has bagged three wickets now! Akshdeep was looking to play a similar shot. Opens his bat face late and guides this one straight to Rishabh Pant. Got a boundary on the previous ball but the same shot has brought about in his downfall. Can Rabada take a five-wicket haul? Akshdeep Nath c Pant b Rabada 19(12) [4s-4]

Rabada to Negi, out Caught by Pant!! Superb over by Rabada! Claims his third wicket of the over as Negi perishes for a golden duck. A short ball around off, Negi tries to scoop it over the keeper but all he can manage is a feather to it. Pant leaps, gets his glove to it initially and takes it on the second attempt. All of sudden, there is pin drop silence at the stadium. Negi c Pant b Rabada 0(1)

Chris Morris to Siraj, out Lbw!! Siraj has been adjudged lbw and he has decided to challenge the umpire's call. This probably is hitting the leg-stump, hence the batsman will have to walk back to the pavilion. Three reds and another wicket goes down. Siraj was trying to play a cheeky scoop shot, gets struck on the pads instead. Pitching in line, impact on leg and hitting the leg stump. Dead. Siraj lbw b Chris Morris 1(5)

Chris Morris to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Lamichhane!! The extra ball has got Morris a wicket - this was full and this was wide of off - Parthiv's eyes lit up as he saw the width, went hard on the slash, gets a thick edge and the ball is swallowed by Lamichhane - running in from third man. Parthiv walks off to loud cheers and that's because the new man is AB. Parthiv Patel c Lamichhane b Chris Morris 9(9) [4s-1]

Chris Morris to de Villiers, SIX, cracking shot, that might get AB going, banged in short and just outside off, in the zone for AB as he pulls it over mid-wicket, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum

Chris Morris to de Villiers, 1 run, a direct hit at the bowler's end and AB would have been running to the pavilion. It was his call after he drove it straight to mid-off. The fielder had time to shy and then missed, AB was a long way away from safety had he hit

Ishant to de Villiers, FOUR, lovely, more of the AB we know and love of the past - back of a length and just outside off, not a bad ball by any means, AB comes down the track, makes room and cracks it square past cover-point - Two men dived, but the ball split them expertly

Rabada to de Villiers, out Caught by Ingram!! The extra ball has got the Capitals another wicket - AB was been done in by his fellow countryman - the slower ball from Rabada, think AB spotted it as he looked to go back over the bowler's head - didn't get hold of the shot as much as he would have liked - was in the air for a long time and a third South African - Colin Ingram - completes the catch even as he ran back from mid-on. de Villiers c Ingram b Rabada 17(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

Lamichhane to Stoinis, SIX, welcome, Mr. Lamichhane. First ball and Stoinis puts it into the last tier. Flighted on middle, Stoinis clears his front leg and swings it cleanly to send it sailing over long-on. Kohli enjoyed it at the other end

D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, FOUR, french-cut! Drags back the length, does Dhawal and Lynn goes ahead with a pull shot. Gets an inside edge that rockets past the stumps and races away to the fine leg fence

D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, FOUR, second boundary of the over! Short and wide outside off, Chris Lynn reaches out for it and slaps it past the diving fielder at cover. Once it's past the ring it's always going to be a boundary with such a quick outfield
Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, easy pickings for Narine! This was a flatter delivery on the pads and the southpaw flicks it past the fielder at short fine leg, nicely placed shot that

Gowtham to Narine, SIX, a flashback of Gowtham against Narine. Remember that night in 2018? A tossed up delivery, touch short in length and it's been clubbed over deep mid-wicket by the opener, six runs
Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, expensive over so far... Floated around middle and leg, Narine picks it over square leg and adds four more to his tally. That's the only way he plays

Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, another mediocre delivery by Gowtham. Drifts this one on the pads and Narine gets it over square leg with a nonchalant flick, the home crowd is loving this even though the Royals are getting belted here
Shreyas Gopal to Chris Lynn, SIX, and that has crashed into the demonstration car! Went down on to his knees and slammed the slog sweep flat out of the ground. Cliched but was Lynntastic

Shreyas Gopal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, and that might have been an outer edge! Kept low and went between the keeper's legs for a single. Fifty for Lynn. He has set it up for KKR for a big win. Needed this knock to bolster his confidence as well

Shreyas Gopal to Chris Lynn, out Caught by S Midhun!! Top-edge on the sweep and is taken by the man at deep backward square leg. You live by the sword and you die by it as well. The sweep had been beneficial for him but this time the top-edge was found and was taken by the fielder coming in. Easy take in the end. Chris Lynn c S Midhun b Shreyas Gopal 50(32) [4s-6 6s-3]
Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, SIX, dropped too short - it's the scarred scared bowling - and Uthappa piles on with a rock behind, a front-leg clear and a heave into cow corner

Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, SIX, bang in the arc. Uthappa won't let the rhyme go wrong, he'll tonk it out of the park. Short, full, short .. and yes, too full - which Uthappa gets slightly inside the line to and lofts it behind the sightscreen

Stokes to Shubman Gill, leg byes, FOUR, the pad-tickles will do just as well. Stokes slips in radar and Gill would feel he's missed out on some free runs here, missing the glance, but his pads take it fine enough

Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, 22 runs of Gowtham's opening over! The required run rate is down to 6 within a span of 6 deliveries. Narine treks back and chips the short ball over the infield at wide mid-off

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, FOUR, has been the Lynn and Narine show so far! Short in length and width on offer, the batsman reaches out and carves it past the fielder at square third man, four more for the right hander

D Kulkarni to Narine, 1 run, Tripathi has dropped a sitter and Kulkarni can't believe it. Got deceived due to the slower delivery as he was early in his chip. The ball was in the air for an eternity and Tripathi, at point, had all the time to get under it. Gets his hands to it and spills it out

D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, FOUR, can you believe this? Dhawal could have had two wickets in two deliveries, but the wicket column reads zero. Lynn had got an inside edge that richocheted on to the stumps and raced to the fine leg fence thereafter. Happened with Dhoni a couple of days back as the bails didn't move. Lynn had even started walking but according to the law he survives. His night, probably

D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, FOUR, short and punished! Was a slower delivery and Lynn hacks it over mid-wicket. Four more to the opener who was somewhat deceived due to the lack of pace and was early in his shot

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, SIX, that's nailed over long-on, 50-run stand up. Also the fastest team fifty in IPL 2019. Lynn puts on his dancing shoes and thumps the short ball over the fence, just clears it

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, in the air but it's in the gap too. Narine had slogged the length delivery towards cow corner but the fielders were stationed at long-on and deep mid-wicket. Neither of them could reach as the ball found the fence

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, nothing's going right for Dhawal Kulkarni. Attempts another slower delivery and Narine bludgeons it over mid-on. Had enough elevation to clear the fielder stationed inside the ring

S Midhun to Narine, SIX, Narine moves into the 40s in style. Goes down on his knee and lifts the tossed up delivery over deep square leg. Clears the fence comfortably for his second maximum of the night. Time for a new ball as it's disappeared in the crowd
S Midhun to Narine, SIX, deposited over deep mid-wicket! Latches on to the floated delivery and slogs it over the fence for six more. The required run rate is just over 4.5 at the moment
Shreyas Gopal to Chris Lynn, SIX, it's raining sixes in Jaipur. Lynn gets hold of it and slogsweeps it over deep square leg for another massive six

Shreyas Gopal to Narine, out Caught by Smith!! The googly gets the powerhitter here. Slashes at the away going ball and ends up edging it. The slip fielder had to react quickly and he did so to pouch it. RR have finally something worth celebrating. It was supposed to be a tough wicket to bat on but Narine had other ideas tonight. Going back to that ball, it was slightly flatter that googly. Narine c Smith b Shreyas Gopal 47(25) [4s-6 6s-3]
S Midhun to Uthappa, FOUR, was a flighted ball and Uthappa got to the pitch of the ball to slam the drive past cover. Was hit well enough for the ball to race through to the fence
S Midhun to Chris Lynn, FOUR, drops the ball short and has been cut away. More of an outer-edge on the cut and that was well away from the man at slip for a four. Tripathi had no chance this time
Chawla to Rahane, FOUR, lovely, tossed up just outside off, Rahane went down on his knee, played with the spin and swiped it over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

Prasidh to Rahane, out Lbw!! Loud shout for LBW and Rahane decides against a review. A little bit of a nibble and Rahane was caught right in front. On a good length and shaping back in, Rahane was shuffling across on the tuck, gets beaten on the inside edge and is struck around the knee-roll - adjacent to middle and leg, was going on to crash into the top of middle-stump and umpire Gaffaney has an easy call to make. Rahane has a chat with his partner and off he goes. Rahane lbw b Prasidh 5(7) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Smith, FOUR, edged and four. The googly with some extra bite, Smith was taken aback by the bounce and tried to withdraw his bat, but the outside edge had already been found and it raced away fine

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, read the batsman changing his grip and fired in a quicker delivery at 107ks, Buttler still adjusted and reverse swept it past a diving Lynn at backward point. It was a tentative dive from the Australian

Gurney to Buttler, SIX, will this get Buttler going? RR will hope it does. Gurney drops the slower delivery short and gives time for Buttler to pick his spot, pulled over deep square leg and that is the first maximum of the day

Gurney to Buttler, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Nope. He's gone. Maiden IPL wicket for Gurney. He sends back his fellow countryman. The slower delivery which is fuller than the previous one, Buttler targets cow corner this time, but he was hitting against the wind and to the longest part of the ground, only succeeded in getting it to Gill at the edge of the rope. Buttler c Shubman Gill b Gurney 37(34) [4s-5 6s-1]
Prasidh to Smith, FOUR, expertly played! The off-cutter on a shortish length and moreover Smith had the width, he back cuts it behind point and Narine never looked like getting to the ball

Prasidh to Smith, FOUR, fifty for Smith. He is the key for RR if they have to get a good total. Has played himself in and now has the hang of the surface. Waits for the slower delivery, shuffles across and pulls it backward of square leg

Gurney to R Tripathi, out Caught by Chawla!! Never easy for a new batsman to play his shots on this surface. Till now Tripathi was just nudging around but it was time for him to go. Takes on Gurney's slower ball and can only sky the loft straight up, plenty of air time and Chawla settles under it near cover. R Tripathi c Chawla b Gurney 6(8)

Kuldeep Yadav to Smith, 1 run, a certain chance has gone down here..pushed the googly into the off-side and set off. The man at cover rushed in, had a flick on to the sticks but missed it. Smith survives
Narine to Smith, SIX, and boom! That has gone into the orbit. Charged out and muscled it over deep mid for a sixer. Huge hit
Prasidh to Smith, FOUR, edged and runs! Four of them. Yorkerish delivery outside off, Smith squeezes it out and the ball flies away past the dive of the keeper for a four
Gurney to Smith, FOUR, and finally a four! Smart play from the Aussie. Was a full ball, Smith opened the bat face and placed it in the gap between short third and point

Chawla to Buttler, FOUR, lovely, the wrong 'un from Chawla, but the length is way too short, allows Buttler to go back and whip it behind square on the on-side - no one in the deep and the ball runs away to the ropes

Prasidh to Buttler, FOUR, nicely played, Buttler was so quick in reading Prasidh's slower ball, prods across and clips it in front of square on the on-side - beats mid-wicket and runs away to the ropes
Prasidh to Buttler, FOUR, lovely, this is Buttler at his best, length ball outside off, he's quick to move across and then paddles it towards the vacant fine leg region, one bounce and over the ropes

Narine to Smith, FOUR, cracking shot, much needed for the Royals, dropped short and spinning back into the right-hander, Smith waited on it and then cut it late - beat backward point and raced away to the fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, much needed boundary for Buttler. He was feeling the pressure. Waits for the flighted delivery to land and reverse sweeps it over backward point, came right off the meat as it raced away

Kuldeep Yadav to Smith, FOUR, shot! He picked the wrong 'un and though he was hitting against the spin, he was in complete control. Went down on his knee, rolled his wrists and broomed it to deep square leg
Gurney to Buttler, 1 run, another slower delivery and Buttler is happy with a push down the ground, 50-run stand up

Sandeep Sharma to Gayle, FOUR, there he goes - the enforecer - clearing out his front leg, not quite getting hold of his rather agricultural hoick, but his biceps will do it, get it over the mid-wicket infield
S Kaul to Agarwal, FOUR, driven on the up and the length ball disappears into the deep cover fence. Climbed into the delivery and hit it on top of the bounce to get it between cover and mid-off
S Kaul to Rahul, FOUR, picked his spot and pulled it away! Short ball, was chest high and Rahul pulled it with a lot of disdain. One bounce and into the fence. Man at deep mid had no chance

S Kaul to Rahul, SIX, that is the delivery service from Rahul we all know of. Picks a length ball and delivers it over long-off for a sixer. The bowler went a bit towards the body of the batter but Rahul timed it well enough to get it over the fence
Nabi to Rahul, FOUR, deft touch from Rahul! Spotted the length of this flat delivery early and opened the bat face at the last minute to guide it past Bairstow's gloves fine of third man

Nabi to Rahul, FOUR, fifty for KL Rahul! His third in his last four games. Jumps out of his crease and hacks the flat delivery wide of long-on, Manish Pandey runs across and dives but couldn't only manage a fingertip on that

Bhuvneshwar to Agarwal, 2 runs, that was in the air for an eternity and Yusuf Pathan drops an absolute dolly. Short outside off, Mayank skewed it up off the toe-end as he went for the carve over point, Pathan at sweeper cover had ample time and he indeed was on his knees trying to grab it near his chest. Straight in and straight out
Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, 2 runs, opens the bat face and punches the length ball wide of deep extra cover, brings up the 100-run partnersnip too

S Kaul to Agarwal, SIX, KXIP have gone after Siddarth Kaul from his first over and they aren't holding back now either. Was on a length and Mayank had ample room to free his arms outside off, transfers his weight onto the back foot and pumps it high and over the long-off fence
S Kaul to Agarwal, 1 run, 5th IPL fifty for Mayank Agarwal! Gets there with a tickle off his pads through square leg

S Kaul to Agarwal, FOUR, thwacked from the crease. No feet. Just stand and deliver: pumps the length ball to the right of long-off and Manish Pandey does well to flick the ball back while on the move. He, however, took a brief while to regather his momentum and by that time the ball had rolled back to kiss the boundary hoardings. Unlucky!

Sandeep Sharma to Agarwal, out Caught by Shankar!! Mayank perishes trying to seal things early. Slower short ball outside off, was dug into the pitch with plenty of effort, and therefore Mayank's ill-timed pull shot couldn't clear the ropes. Straight down the throat of Vijay Shankar at deep mid-wicket ala Manish Pandey's dismissal. Agarwal c Shankar b Sandeep Sharma 55(43) [4s-3 6s-3]

Sandeep Sharma to Miller, out Caught by Hooda!! Another greedy dismissal. Knuckle ball bowled a shade outside off stump, Miller doesn't pick the variation and lofts it high into the night sky, Hooda had a week's time before catching that around his throat at long-on. Easy! Miller c Hooda b Sandeep Sharma 1(3)

S Kaul to Mandeep, out Caught by Hooda!! Excellent final over from Sid Kaul. Kept his composure and bowled a slower full ball outside off asking Mandeep to take a risk from there, Mandy obliges and goes for the smack over long-off. Doesn't quite get the elevation and Hooda claims his third catch of the game. Did well to run a few yards to his left from long-off. Mandeep c Hooda b S Kaul 2(3)
Nabi to Rahul, FOUR, flat and full on off, Rahul hammers it straight and got enough power to beat the diving fielder at long-off. Crowd going bonkers now
Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, SIX, 138.1kph. It's the good length with Gayle in the slog mode. He steps away, frees up his hands and lofts the flat-batted tonk over long-on

Rashid Khan to Gayle, out Caught by Hooda!! They've played with his ego, and Gayle's fallen right into it. A leg-breaking skidder in the slot inviting Gayle to go over long-on. He does just that, gets it flat, but with the lofted drive coming off the inside half. And Hooda steals the show, spotting it quickly from a wide long-on and sliding under it in front of the sightscreen. The show's over boys. Gayle c Hooda b Rashid Khan 16(14) [4s-1 6s-1]
Rashid Khan to Agarwal, FOUR, quicker slider in the slot, and Agarwal's already taken his front leg out of the way to drill it uppishly down the ground

Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, FOUR, 138.4kph. Too full, Rahul does well going inside-out with his slice over backward point .. but Kaul runs across from third man, gets the slide in as well, but probably ends up slipping with the dew, slipping all over it

Nabi to Agarwal, SIX, rank sitter. Agarwal holds his pose, holds his shape and decides to time it out of here - rocking behind and playing it with the straightest of bats as he punches it straight down, flush

Nabi to Rahul, FOUR, just doesn't give out any pace to work around with, but Rahul has enough of his own. Making some room, and going back in the crease to pile on the drag down as he slaps it damn violently through extra cover

Nabi to Agarwal, SIX, quickly down a knee and there's no missing about. Slogs. Holding his pose as he goes through with the swing in depositing it long and deep into cow corner. Shankar, fielding at the fence does try but ends up parrying it over

S Kaul to Rahul, FOUR, wow! That was a superb shot. High elbow in combination with a still head helps the ball to speed past the dive of the man at mid-off. Pitched up delivery and Rahul hit it on top of the bounce to thread it through
Rashid Khan to Rahul, 1 run, stabs the ball out with soft hands into the off-side and gets a single. Fifty of the partnership comes up as well

Mujeeb to Bairstow, out Caught by Ashwin!! Big wicket! It is not swing but spin that breaks this dangerous pair. The carrom ball drifts in and Bairstow wanted to clip it off the pads, he does not keep it down the ground and Ashwin at mid-wicket takes a good low catch. He dived forward and scooped it inches off the ground. Bairstow c Ashwin b Mujeeb 1(6)

Ashwin to Shankar, FOUR, finally a boundary for Hyderabad! All about timing, this shot was. A floated and full delivery and the batsman chips it straight to long-on. The fielder in the deep was a touch square, hence he couldn't cut this down

Ashwin to Shankar, out Caught by Rahul!! Ashwin strikes! Bowls a carrom ball in the channel outside off, Shankar looks to slice it but all he can manage is a feather to it. Sharp catch by Rahul and the gritty partnership has been broken. Probably a blessing in disguise for the batting team as the pair was consuming too many deliveries. Shankar c Rahul b Ashwin 26(27) [4s-2]

Ashwin to Warner, FOUR, that's a rare loose delivery by Punjab tonight. Ashwin darts this one outside off on a shorter length and Warner makes the use of the width on offer. Reaches out for it and slices it past the fielder at point. No fielders in the deep and that shall be the second boundary of the over
Mujeeb to Warner, FOUR, nicely done by Davey! Premeditates and puts this straighter delivery away to the deep point fence with a well timed reverse sweep

Ashwin to Warner, out Nabi Run Out!! That's a fine effort by Ashwin as he's ran Nabi out. Warner had smashed the short ball back to the bowler and Ashwin stops it with his right hand. Nabi was backing away and he was miles outside his crease. Ashwin parries the ball on to the stumps and the Afghan all-rounder is gone. Nabi run out (Ashwin) 12(7)
Ashwin to Warner, FOUR, short ball down the leg side and Warner drags it past the fielder at short fine leg, sends it to the fence and adds four more to his tally

Mujeeb to Warner, SIX, first six of the innings! It comes in the 16th over. Better late, than never. Warner makes room and thumps the fullish delivery right over the bowler's head. Straight into the sightscreen and that's a maximum

Mujeeb to Warner, 2 runs, another fifty for Warner! Has been a very gritty knock as he hasn't been at his fluent best. Reaches out for this widish delivery as he drives it to deep cover. Takes two runs and gets to the landmark but there are no real celebrations. His job ain't done yet
Shami to Manish Pandey, FOUR, backs away and blasts it past mid-off for a four. That was on a length, Manish Pandey backed away, created room and allowed his hands to do the needful
Shami to Warner, FOUR, backs across, gives away and swords the ball past point for a four. Much needed boundaries these for SRH. The run rate getting a facelift here. Poor length again from Shami

Sam Curran to Manish Pandey, FOUR, slower length delivery and jhas been upper steered away past the short third fielder for a four. Was preempted and despite that being a slower ball, Manish Pandey managed to usher enough pace on to the shot to get it past the fielder. Cheeky Pandey
Sam Curran to Warner, 1 run, the partnership between Warner and Manish Pandey is now 50. Lowish full toss on the pads. The best that Warner can do is whip it away to deep mid for a single

Sam Curran to Warner, FOUR, and a good ball but a bad result. Squeezed through the third man region for a four. Got bat to ball and almost an educated edge to put it fine past short third for a four. 11 off the over. 31 runs off the 3 last overs

Shami to Manish Pandey, out Caught by (sub)Nair!! The field was set for the short stuff and it has worked. Manish Pandey despite waiting on the back foot could not place the pull past the man at deep mid, who hardly moved to cup that. Short ball bereft of room and the pull despite being decently timed wasn't placed in the gap. Manish Pandey c (sub)Nair b Shami 19(15) [4s-2]

Shami to Hooda, FOUR, walks across his sticks and tickles the ball away fine. Perfect ball but Hooda managed to get enough bat on it to peel the ball away fine. Shami almost went up in an appeal before realizing that it was off the bat
Shami to Hooda, FOUR, brilliant shot! Straight drive down the ground. Back past the bowler and it was a four. Was full and Hooda nailed it

Mujeeb to Shankar, FOUR, overpitched and Shankar puts it away. Mujeeb overcooks the flighted delivery and offers width as well, Shankar bends his back knee and creams the drive through extra cover. He did well to pierce the crowded field

Shami to Hooda, SIX, 1 off the first 3 balls and 14 off the next 3. T20 cricket for you. Low full toss and Hooda climbed into it. Smoked it over long-off for a sixer. Much needed finish as they scale 150
Rajpoot to Shankar, 1 run, close! Shortens the length and Shankar taps it to the left of backward point, Miller has a shy at the striker's end and he misses, Warner might have been in trouble there

Rajpoot to Warner, FOUR, that might just ease Warner. Full and on the stumps, Warner stays back but leans forward and clips it wide of mid-on, Ashwin's dive is not good enough to stop the ball and it races away
Chawla to Watson, FOUR, proper half volley. That's no hard work for Watson, just cruising through the line and drilling it through deep extra cover
Chawla to Watson, SIX, dragged down short. Watson is quick to pile in, rocking behind, making it look all the more worse and pulling it away, high, long, into cow corner

Kuldeep Yadav to du Plessis, FOUR, this was probably the first quicker one from Kuldeep Yadav, it was on a fuller length. And du Plessis goes down on his knees and slog-sweeps it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary

Chawla to Rayudu, 2 runs, and action immediately after the break! Krishna at deep cover drops it. Came charging in, got to it but fluffed it. Rayudu takes two. Was the leggie and the inside out shot scaled more height than distance

Chawla to Rayudu, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Goes for the slog sweep, gets a top-edge and Rana at short cover calls for it and takes it. That was unneccesary. May be at the break they decided one of them will go for it but this hasn't worked for CSK. Is the game still alive? Too tough for KKR. Rayudu c Nitish Rana b Chawla 21(31) [4s-2]
Chawla to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, whatta start! Gets a flighted ball outside off and has been lifted over cover for a four. That was unexpected. First ball and he went for it
Gurney to du Plessis, FOUR, low full toss and slapped over cover for a four. Few bounces and into the fence. Stayed steady and slammed it

Gurney to du Plessis, FOUR, waits on it and pulls it down past short fine leg for a four. Drops it short and slow, du Plessis stayed still and waited on it before pulling it past the fielder. Only 6 runs needed now

Narine to Watson, FOUR, quick legs. And quicker hands. Narine starts short with an off-break spinning into leg-stump, giving Watson ample time to go deep in his crease and punch it away as he splits the two men on the off-side

Narine to Watson, out Caught by Chawla!! The bonus off a half-tracker. Narine produces another sitting up off-spinner, but that manages to confuse Watto whether to go uppishly or keep it along the floor. Ends up doing a bit of both, dragging it in the end and picking out square leg perfectly. Watson c Chawla b Narine 17(9) [4s-2 6s-1]
Narine to Raina, SIX, bang in the arc, Raina obliges it out of the park. Does well to stay inside the line and free up his hands to tonk it into his own dug-out at long-off
Prasidh to Raina, FOUR, vintage. Typical. Backs away, makes a lot of room and slices it inside-out over cover. Timing, placement don't really get better

Narine to Raina, out Caught by Chawla!! In the air and taken. Brilliant catch by PC, he charged back from mid-on, kept his eye on the ball and takes a beauty. It was a flighted delivery wide of off, Raina wanted to loft it over long-on, it comes off the bottom half of the willow and goes a long way up in the air. And PC there did exactly what the KKR wanted him to do in the outfield. Raina c Chawla b Narine 14(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Prasidh to Rayudu, FOUR, Rayudu makes full use of the free-hit, he picks up the slower one early, gets himself in a good position and tonks it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary. This should get him going
Gurney to Rayudu, FOUR, Gurney is guilty of providing width on this one, Rayudu delays his bat swing and cuts it wide of backward point for a boundary

Chahar to Narine, 5 runs, direct hit would have taken out Narine! Rayudu the man at mid-on but he can't get it on target and what's worse, there is nobody backing up. Races away to the extra cover fence. Bonus runs for KKR. Was worked softly with a straightish bat but it was a risky run and Narine is lucky to survive

Chahar to Chris Lynn, out Lbw!! Chahar draws first blood! Was getting the ball to shape inwards and Lynn was never going to die wondering irrespective of the surface. Sits back to this nip backer and goes for an agricultural slog, only to miss it altogether. Past the inside edge and raps him on the back leg. Looked quite plumb in real time and I don't think a review would have saved Lynn. Hence, he walks back to the hut. Chris Lynn lbw b Chahar 0(5)

Harbhajan to Narine, out Caught by Chahar!! Harbhajan has the last laugh! He is just too good on such surfaces and you can't just slog him away, which is what Narine does to spinners anyway. Used his feet early and made room but Harbhajan cleverly dragged the length back with no pace whatsoever. The result is a miscue that bobbles over the backward point region and Chahar trekked back to take a good tumbling catch. Both the openers sent back to the hut really early. Narine c Chahar b Harbhajan 6(5)

Tahir to Shubman Gill, out Stumped!! Oh goodness! Has he got another one? Has MSD pulled off a stumping here? Tahir is already celebrating and yes, Gill has started to walk. KKR in complete disarry now with six down. It was the googly from Tahir, such deception that Gill is foxed by the spin. Goes searching for the drive away from his body and doesn't read it at all. It beats his inside edge and overbalances himself by dragging his back leg out of his crease. MSD was quick to spot it and whips the bails off in a flash. No need to go upstairs as well. CSK all over KKR like a rash. Shubman Gill st Dhoni b Tahir 9(12)
Harbhajan to A Russell, SIX, muscled over cow corner. Russell has seen enough, clears his front leg and whacks it with ferocity across the line. It goes sailing over the ropes at deep mid-wicket

Tahir to A Russell, no run, oh dear, Bhajji makes a mess of this skier. Stunned faces in the crowd, they can't believe it. Uff! This is a costly miss, can't give a lifeline to someone like Russell. What have you done Bhajji? Phew. Slower and tempted Russell, who clears his front leg and aims a biggie across the line, totally miscue and sends it into the night sky. Bhajji at mid-wicket steadies himself, it was swirling in the air for a long time and he makes a meal of it. So much so that he doesn't even get a hand on it as it lobs behind him. He sort of lost his balance and slipped over
Tahir to Chawla, SIX, clubbed over deep mid-wicket. Chawla takes on Tahir, gets underneath it and slams it powerfully over cow corner

Kuggeleijn to A Russell, 1 run, Jaddu nearly took a blinder at deep mid-wicket. Very hard to call this a drop but Russell continues to ride his luck. Banged in short outside off, Russell stays back and pulls it hard towards deep mid-wicket. Jadeja was a few yards inside the ropes, sees the ball sailing over his head so he backtracks and uses his one hand to keep it on. The momentum was taking him over the ropes, so he couldn't quite cling onto it. But certainly saved some runs for his team. Brilliant from Jaddu
Kuggeleijn to A Russell, FOUR, short again and Russell pulls it in the gap this time. Backed himself, stayed deep in his crease and puts it in the gap between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket
Tahir to A Russell, FOUR, that's crunched past long-off. Loopy low full toss, Russell makes a bit of room and frees his arms to slap it firmly down the ground. Long-off had no chance

Tahir to A Russell, no run, lands the leggie on leg-stump, Russell's head was falling away as he was looking to flick. It grips and turns past his blade to knock him on the pad. Tahir went up straightaway but umpire Chettithody Shamshuddin was spot on with his call as the ball was spinning too much and eventually missed the off-stump by a few inches

Harbhajan to Chawla, out Stumped!! The wheels are coming off for KKR. Another one goes and Harbhajan picks up his second wicket. Saw the batsman skip out, so Bhajji smartly slowed it up and pulled his length in addition to getting some spin off the deck. Chawla was nowhere near the pitch and flashed his bat in vain after getting beaten by the flight. MSD collects it and breaks the stumps. Easy stumping and CSK on top. Chawla st Dhoni b Harbhajan 8(13) [6s-1]

Harbhajan to Kuldeep Yadav, out Kuldeep Yadav Run Out!! Kuldeep has been dismissed off his first ball. Mix-up between both batsmen and Kuldeep was not even in the frame there. Gee! Another one bites the dust. Flighted outside off, Kuldeep pokes it to backward point and Russell wanted a single. Kuldeep was ball-watching and was late to kick-start. The fielder collects the ball and fires a throw to the bowler, who takes the bails off to catch the batsman short of his crease. Kuldeep Yadav run out (Rayudu/Harbhajan) 0(1)

Jadeja to Prasidh, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Kolkata are dominos and Harbhajan - if not pushing them out on his own, continues having himself in some form or the other on the scorecard. This time, courtesy a lame flick uppishly off his legs, picking out a funky silly mid-on perfectly. Prasidh c Harbhajan b Jadeja 0(2)
Kuggeleijn to A Russell, FOUR, 110.2kph. Slow, short, spinning in. Russell clears out his front leg, very agriculturally in a murdering heave through mid-wicket

Chahar to A Russell, SIX, yup, a smoke. Chahar continues keeping it on a good length, and this time Russell connects, slogging, getting a slight top-edge, but those biceps have been good enough to clear most ropes, so what is Jadeja's diving there now at long-on? ..
Kuggeleijn to A Russell, SIX, never mind those wrists, Russell will forget them for a second. He continues his love affair with cow corner, swatting it hard, flat and several rows back

Kuggeleijn to A Russell, FOUR, another muscled heave. It couldn't have gone quicker through square leg, where Rayudu tries his best to leap up on the bounce and pull it back into play, but no, such is the momentum on this that even his palm-ricochet has the legs to roll over

Chahar to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Rayudu!! Sharp stuff from Rayudu! KKR are falling apart quite early here. The shot selection is going awry at the moment. This was slightly short but not much bounce as Rana looked to whip this away aerially on the leg-side. Didn't get the required timing as it dipped on short mid-wicket where Rayudu took a really sharp catch. Nitish Rana c Rayudu b Chahar 0(3)

Kuggeleijn to A Russell, FOUR, and it'll end with another. Russell - like he has been all season - continues to be the lone hand, getting under another pretty full delivery and still manages to generate a lot of bottom-handed power to drill it straight back, beating long-off as well .. 108 it will be

Jadeja to Karthik, FOUR, edged but doesn't carry and beats first slip! Jadeja is getting some bite off the pitch, got this to spin away sharply but Karthik did well to play with soft hands. Hence, the edge fell short of Watto and beat him as well to the fence. Bhajji gave chase but in vain

Chahar to Uthappa, FOUR, uppish but just through the gap! Was a 'hit me' ball from Chahar, shortish with width on it but Uthappa didn't want to keep the cut down. Not a wise thing on this pitch but he got it in the gap
Chahar to Uthappa, FOUR, fab shot! More authority this time from Uthappa who sat back to the half-tracker and nailed the pull comfortably over mid-on

Chahar to Uthappa, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Outrageous shot from Uthappa! Was looking in good touch but just when he should have started to kick on, falls to a terrible stroke. Despite a deep mid-wicket in place, he goes for the aerial pull off the shortish length ball that had no pace at all. Gets it off the top half of the blade and it's a rather easy catch for Jadhav stationed there, precisely for this kind of a stroke. It's one-way traffic in Chepauk at the moment. KKR don't seem to have turned up yet. Uthappa c Kedar Jadhav b Chahar 11(9) [4s-2]
Jadeja to Karthik, FOUR, good shot! Fraction short and this time Karthik sits deep in the crease for the cut. Beats the diving point fielder and it races away

Tahir to Karthik, FOUR, oh risky but it's come off for Karthik. Preempts, gets down low and paddles it. Nutmegs Dhoni and runs away to the fine leg fence. It skimmed the under-edge but it's DK's pet shot, so he earns a boundary

Tahir to Karthik, out Caught by Harbhajan!! Redemption for Tahir. Sombre faces among KKR fans in the stands and Tahir unleashes the Baby-in-the-arms celebration for a change. No celebratory run on this occasion. But poor shot this from Karthik. Just runs out of patience and goes hard on the whippy flick, hits it airly and finds Bhajji at short mid-wicket, who takes a sharp catch. Tahir gave more flight and it kind of dipped which tempted the KKR captain into playing that false shot. Karthik c Harbhajan b Tahir 19(21) [4s-3]
Rahul Chahar to Gayle, SIX, lots of flight on this delivery, Gayle clears his frong leg and pumps it straight down the ground for a maximum

Krunal Pandya to Gayle, SIX, that's been hit off the back foot, straight back down the ground for six. Some shot. And that's his fifty too. Krunal must have thought he'd done enough by sliding it across on back of a length to prevent damage. But Gayle just leans across and thumps it

Rahul Chahar to Gayle, SIX, that's a googly delivered outside off, not a bad idea. But it's too full, right in the slot, which counters Chahar's thinking. Gayle reaches out and clobbers it over long-on
Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run, eases this full ball to extra cover, thus bringing up his fifty with a quick single

Behrendorff to Gayle, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Behrendorff's got Gayle, or maybe the Mumbai heat has. This is the exact kind of delivery that was disappearing earlier in the night when the Jamaican got stuck into Behrendorff. But after a brief delay where he was attended by the physio, Gayle - even Gayle - fails to find the strength to clear deep midwicket. It's right in the slot for him, but he drags it off the inside half to Krunal Pandya. Gayle c Krunal Pandya b Behrendorff 63(36) [4s-3 6s-7]

Hardik Pandya to Miller, FOUR, not where he intended but it's a welcome boundary for Kings XI. Just been a bit of a lull after Gayle's dismissal. Length ball angling away outside off, throws his bat at it and carves it off a thick outside edge between short third and backward point

Hardik Pandya to Miller, out Caught by de Kock!! Full and wide, Miller has a go, only to get it through off the outside edge. This wasn't in his arc to hit outta the park. Well bowled by Hardik Pandya who lets out some steam in his celebrations, probably still angry with himself for the previous wide. Miller c de Kock b Hardik Pandya 7(8) [4s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Nair, out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! This has been a superb comeback from Hardik Pandya, and from Mumbai Indians indeed. He was taken for 17 in his first over, but has come back strongly. Low full toss at the stumps, Nair attempts a cross-batted swing - more like a sweep, and skies it up off a thick top-edge. No problems for Chahar at long leg. Nair c Rahul Chahar b Hardik Pandya 5(6)
Bumrah to Sam Curran, FOUR, quite a start from Sam Curran who effortlessly lofts Bumrah on the up over extra cover, with no one back at the boundary there
Bumrah to Sam Curran, FOUR, two fours out of two. Clears the front leg and scythes this full-wide delivery to the left of sweeper cover

Bumrah to Sam Curran, out Caught by de Kock!! Yeah, Bumrah has the final laugh, as he so often does. Slower ball, probably a response to Curran going for a scoop. And scoop he does, straight up and to the keeper with there being no pace to work with. Sam Curran c de Kock b Bumrah 8(3) [4s-2]
Bumrah to Rahul, FOUR, full ball outside off, not quite in the blockhole, and Rahul uses that error in length to slice it through past backward point
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, SIX, good length ball outside off, Rahul slaps it over extra cover for six

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, over extra cover again. This time it's close to the bottom of his bat, so doesn't have enough power to clear the ropes. But it does have enough power to clear the infield
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, SIX, the result of that deliberation is a short ball at the body. It's brisk from Pandya, but Rahul's sharper. He's onto the back foot quicker, swinging the pull over fine leg

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, SIX, and six more. He's tearing into Hardik Pandya here. 22 off the over already, with two balls left. And Pandya doesn't know how to react. Poor bowling to be honest. Offers length outside off and is slapped back over long-off
Bumrah to Rahul, SIX, here's six of them. He's deep in the crease to Bumrah, he's cleared his front leg and he's swung this into the stands behind deep midwicket. Bumrah missing his length there

Bumrah to Rahul, 2 runs, he's slipped at the non-striker's end while coming back for two, but he manages to pick himself up for the second run. Take a bow, KL Rahul, it's been a pleasure. Slower ball wide of off, jams it towards long-off and then pushes hard on the first run. Mandeep is a willing ally at the danger end, and so Rahul gets to the ton he deserves

Behrendorff to Rahul, FOUR, kind of a shot batsman would salivate on for days. Wow from Rahul! It was on a good length and was wide of off, Rahul rocks back and punches it off the backfoot. It beats the cover fielder and races to the fence on this rapid outfield
Bumrah to Mandeep, FOUR, short of length delivery outside off, Mandeep makes room for himself and spears the cut between short third man and backward point. Smashing finish for the Kings XI

Alzarri Joseph to Rahul, SIX, that is a high-quality shot. Oh hold on, bat turned in his hand at the point of contact. But the velocity of his bat swing helps him in clearing the fence. It was a pacy delivery on the pads and Rahul takes out this closed-faced whip shot and clears the fence
Behrendorff to Gayle, SIX, seven balls faced and he has got his eye in now. It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps, Gayle clears his front leg and clobbers it over long-on for a maximum

Behrendorff to Gayle, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Gayle. Are we in for a Gayle-storm at the Wankhede! There was hardly any effort behind it. He just waits for the delivery to arrive, it was in his arc around his off-stump and he lifts it over deep mid-wicket for another maximum
Behrendorff to Gayle, FOUR, another off-cutter from Behrendorff and this time, Gayle was ready for it. He hangs back and smashes it over the in-field on the off-side for a boundary

Behrendorff to Gayle, SIX, 23 off the over! Wow! Universe boss is on fire! Behrendorff delivers another slower one, he is not learning from his mistake. It was on the stumps, Gayle waits for it and unleashes it straight down the ground for another six

Bumrah to Rahul, FOUR, these two compliment eachother so well. If, Gayle bludgeons the ball, Rahul just caresses it. It was a slower one from Bumrah, Rahul picks it up easily, gets in a might fine position and punches it like a boss. It beats cover and races to the fence
Bumrah to Rahul, 1 run, runs it down to third man. 50-run partnership comes up! These two are looking ominous for Mumbai

Alzarri Joseph to Rahul, SIX, he is looking in his elements today. Form is back, it is certainly back! He identifies the length in a canter(sign of a batsman in form), gets a terrific position and pummels it over deep mid-wicket for another maximum

Alzarri Joseph to Rahul, FOUR, another terrific shot, his back leg was flying when he attempted that shot. And white cherry was flying too. Picks up the slower one quickly, delays his bat swing and lifts it over mid-off for another four

Rahul Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, terrific shot! Flighted delivery on the stumps, Rahul whips it with a lot of class and authority. It beats deep mid-wicket and canters to the fence. He is in fabulous touch!

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, SIX, that is hugeeeeeeeee! Into the second tier! It was a bumper on the face, Gayle stays put and smokes it over deep backward square leg. Good bye ball! Sit back and enjoy that! We are in for a Gayle-storm today

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, that has been smashed. Wow! What power. It was on a fuller length and was in the arc of Gayle, he clears his front leg and pumps it straight down the ground for a boundary. No stopping that!

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, Hardik Pandya needs a hand on his shoulder. And yes, Bumrah is there. He is your mate, Pandya. This is serious hitting from Gayle, it was wide of off and Gayle carves it wide of long-on for another four
Rahul Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, very full and wide of off, Rahul went for a reverse, ended up missing it. It might have clipped his edge, it deflects off QDK to the leg-side

Rajpoot to Lad, SIX, ho ho ho! He might have waited 5 years for an IPL debut with MI but has taken one ball to make an impact. Short, down leg and has been lifted over fine leg for a sixer. Whatta start for Lad!
Rajpoot to Lad, FOUR, back of a length delivery and has been helped off the hips again. Tucked past deep fine leg for a four. A strike-rate of 500 for Lad

Ashwin to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, slapped over extra cover! Just the kind of release shot Kishan was looking for. Wide half volley, he reaches out and chips it comfortably over the infield. No protection in the deep

Ashwin to Pollard, SIX, just over a leaping Miller! If there was one KXIP fielder who could have gotten to this, it was him but not to be. Drag down from Ashwin and Pollard launches it off the back foot down the ground. Raw power and just about manages to get it over long-on. Miller leapt high as much as he could but it kept going over

Sam Curran to Pollard, SIX, launched over deep square leg! Short balls might trouble Pollard but not this harmless drag down at generous pace. Climbs onto the pull and smashes it into the crowd. Curran better be on his toes because Pollard seems to be lining him up

Sam Curran to Pollard, FOUR, just past the diving mid-wicket fielder! But this was struck beautifully by Pollard. Sat deep to this extra fullish delivery and jabbed it with those strong wrists of it. Flew off the bat and sped to the fence in no time

Sam Curran to Pollard, SIX, another flat maximum! Pollard has started to find his range and MI are clawing their way back into the game through him. In the slot again from Curran and it's been powered down the ground with loads of power. Long-on tried to get across but it was comfortably over the fielder's head

Sam Curran to Pollard, out Ishan Kishan Run Out!! Sharp work from Curran! He lets out a roar too. Surely might have been frustrated at the onslaught in the over and although it's not the wicket KXIP wanted, it's definitely potential danger out of the way. Was a good full ball that cramped up Pollard on leg stump. He squeezed it to the left of Curran who was quick to get to the ball and fired a direct hit at the bowler's end. Ishan Kishan was always going to be in trouble if the throw hit and that's what happened. Ishan Kishan run out (Sam Curran) 7(10) [4s-1]

Viljoen to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, not in control but he's found the gap behind square on the leg-side. Short ball that climbed on Pandya who miscued the pull over backward square leg. Split fine leg and deep square leg with precision

Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, here we go, Hardik gets off the blocks. Rubbish half tracker from Ashwin, not much bounce but Hardik crouches low and slaps the pull into the gap at deep mid-wicket fence

Ashwin to Pollard, SIX, muscled away by Pollard! Once again, not off the middle but who cares when he can clear the ropes? Makes room and swings through the line over long-on. More off the toe-end but it goes deep into the stands

Ashwin to Pollard, SIX, bang into the comm box! There was a cracking sound and it's back into the ground. Pollard has gone bonkers here. In the slot this one and he just extends the chip shot down the ground. Beautifully done and comfortably goes over the fence. Wow!

Shami to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Miller!! There's the wicket that KXIP were looking for. Precisely why Shami was brought on, in this over. Not a wicket-taking ball, was actually in the slot but was pacy from Shami and Hardik didn't get hold of it. Never really got going tonight to be honest and the miscue finds a gleeful Miller at long-on. Dolly it is and that's the end of HP. Hardik Pandya c Miller b Shami 19(13) [4s-2]

Shami to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Miller!! Clever from Shami! Second strike in the over and he's doing exactly what he was asked to do. Removes the Pandyas and now, Pollard is stranded with the tail left. This was a slower ball, comfortably slower than his stock pace and Krunal got early into the loft. Ends up chipping it towards extra cover where it's that man, Miller, again. Another sitter for the South African. Krunal Pandya c Miller b Shami 1(2)

Shami to Alzarri Joseph, FOUR, dropped! Henriques at deep square leg got across to his right and put in a dive, got his hand on it too but didn't stick. And worse, it trickled past him to the fence too. Did take a fine catch earlier and nearly had another really good catch to his name. Joseph was clearly rushed on the bumper and he managed only a top edge on the pull. Gets himself a useful boundary in the end

Sam Curran to Pollard, SIX, that's a six to begin with! Can't bowl in the slot to a rampaging Pollard, you just can't. Just lifts it down the ground, this is another mishit that clears long-off comfortably. How does he hit these mistimed shots for six? Insane!

Sam Curran to Pollard, SIX, freebie and away she goes into the crowd! 50 on captaincy debut in the IPL for Pollard. Promoted himself at a crucial part of the run chase and now seems in command. Has to finish it though. Poor ball from Curran who gives a full toss and it's swung over deep square leg Way into the crowd

Shami to Alzarri Joseph, FOUR, hammered wide of mid-off! Joseph showing that he can fetch boundaries too. Not the right length from Shami who put this on a length and Joseph just made room to biff it through the infield. Found the gap perfectly

Sam Curran to Pollard, FOUR, that went to the fence like a bullet! Oh, my! Curran missed his length and delivered a slot ball, width on offer as well and Pollard won't miss out. Smacks the bones out of this one and it goes on the bounce to the wide long-off fence

Sam Curran to Pollard, SIX, dumped over long-off! This is incredible from Pollard. We've seen this so many times over the years but still, it looks better every time he repeats it. Another horror ball from Curran, widish length ball and it's dumped with that clean bat swing

Sam Curran to Pollard, SIX, that's into the second tier! H-U-G-E! Curran is extremely young and he's paying the price for inexperience. Still doesn't justify the lengths he's bowling. Middle and leg, in the slot once more and Pollard bulldozes it over long-on. Mammoth hit. Wow!

Rajpoot to Pollard, FOUR, MI are almost there! The captain for the night is producing a knock for the ages. Shortish one on leg stump, Pollard just swivels across and helps it well wide of short fine leg. Just a hit away now!

Rajpoot to Pollard, no ball, SIX, one-handed shovel over deep mid-wicket! The Wankhede is roaring in delight. Whoa! Fantastic scenes at the moment. Rajpoot loses his composure, gives a full toss and he's overstepped too, so many blunders and it's picked over deep mid-wicket. Just another mishit you know, but that's the big man for you

Rajpoot to Pollard, out Caught by Miller!! Stunned silence at the Wankhede! Pollard falls! Gee, what an anti-climax! The big man thought he had hit another six, the match-winning one but nope, he's found Miller at deep mid-wicket. Was a short ball outside off, had to really fetch it but Pollard rode his luck on the pull. Could only sky it high and not long enough. What a turnaround! Rajpoot could still be the hero. Wowza! Pollard c Miller b Rajpoot 83(31) [4s-3 6s-10]
Rajpoot to de Kock, FOUR, length delivery on the pads and heaved away off the inner half of the bat. The ball dribbled away towards the deep mid fence for a four
Rajpoot to de Kock, FOUR, walks down the track, gets hold of the slower length delivery and pierces the gap between cover and extra cover for a four with a drive on the up. Back-to-back fours

Shami to Lad, out Bowled!! Lad walks across his sticks and misses the clip to be clean bowled. Quick yorker and Lad was late on it. The leg pole was pegged back. The pressure of 3 dot balls got to Lad and he tried something different. Shami had been bowling the wicket-to-wicket channel and slips in the yorker to out do the batter. Silence prevails at Wankhede. Lad b Shami 15(13) [4s-1 6s-1]
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, starts the over with a short one and has been dispatched away past point for a four. Suryakumar Yadav played it late and got it fine enough

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, what happened there? Miller has spilled this one. Ill-timed jump and he manages to grab a left hand to it and the ball doesn't stick. He leapt up too early and in the end only had to go with a left-hand. Suryakumar Yadav gets a life here

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, in the slot and disappears over the bowler's head. The cameras pan on Miller, who has a clueless expression on his face. Poor delivery it was and Suryakumar Yadav muscled it down the ground

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he does this so often! Uses the pace of the bowler and just dabs it fine to send the ball racing away to deep third man for a four. Was wide, and Suryakumar Yadav just got enough wood to send the ball away. 12 runs off the over. Rajpoot has gone for 37 already

Viljoen to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, pulled or tucked? Decide for yourself. Was very wristy though as he got hold of the short ball and just gave it direction to get it past short fine leg. That scorched away

Viljoen to de Kock, 1 run, dropped down the leg-side. Second drop of the innings. This might turn out to be costly for KXIP. Short ball, down leg, de Kock goes for the pull and gets a glove. The ball flies fine and Rahul got both hands to it diving to his right but spilled it. The two batters steal a single as well. And to make matters worse, a bout of cramps seem to have engulfed Rahul. He seems to be in some agonising pain

Sam Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by (sub)Henriques!! Flicked off the pads and taken superbly by the man at deep backward square. That was on the pads and Suryakumar Yadav nonchalantly clipped it away without even thinking of keeping it down. The ball kept flying away before being plucked out by the substitute fielder. Suryakumar Yadav c (sub)Henriques b Sam Curran 21(15) [4s-4]

Ashwin to de Kock, out Caught by Miller!! Charges out, slams it down the ground and Miller makes amends for the drop by taking a good catch here. Miller covered some good ground to his left, then put in the slide with his knees dug into the ground and plucked it out of thin air. KXIP making this game their own with a couple of good catches here. de Kock c Miller b Ashwin 24(23) [4s-2]

D Kulkarni to Watson, out Bowled!! That is a peach, an absolute peach. Give Kulkarni the new cherry and more often than not he will deliver. It was on a good length and it shapes away from Watson a bit, he wanted to whip it across the line, ends up playing it down the wrong line. It breaches his defence and clatters the stumps. The horrible season for Watson continues. Watson b D Kulkarni 0(4)

Unadkat to Raina, FOUR, Raina is away and how! He is fearless and he flaunted that there. It was on a length and was wide of off, Raina backs away, makes room and thumps it wide of cover for a boundary

Unadkat to Raina, out Raina Run Out!! Stephen Fleming shakes his head in the dug-out. And this is probably the first time he is showing discontentment in this IPL season. It was on a length and Raina tucks it straight to Archer at short fine, Faf charges for a single and Raina for some reason instead of running was ball-watching ( A criminal thing to do). Archer picks it up cleanly and smashes the stumps at the non striker's end where Raina was short of the crease. RR are off to a perfect start. Raina run out (Jofra Archer) 4(4) [4s-1]

Riyan Parag to Dhoni, SIX, Dhoni powers this slog-sweep to the left of deep midwicket, sending it crashing into the ad cushions. That's hit them on the full. Dhoni has come out firing from the onset in contrast to his usual formula

Riyan Parag to Rayudu, FOUR, nails this overpitched delivery straight back down the ground. This is excellent batting. They've not allowed Rahane to get through a few cheap overs of spin which he would've so dearly loved

Jofra Archer to Dhoni, no run, huge shout of "no" from Dhoni, but that came only after he took a couple of steps down which set Rayudu on the charge. Rayudu had made it almost halfway down before having to turn back. Back of a length just outside off, patted to backward point. Rayudu changed direction while running and had the throw hit him, or even with a direct-hit, he was gone

Shreyas Gopal to Dhoni, SIX, fetches this leg-break from well outside off and muscles it over long-on. Gopal turns back as if to say he didn't do much wrong there, and he maybe right. But Dhoni looks on tonight

Stokes to Rayudu, SIX, advances to a slower ball and slaps it over mid-off, and over the boundary too. He had stepped towards the leg-side, and found himself reaching for the ball that was outside off. But that didn't seem to hamper the timing
Unadkat to Rayudu, SIX, Rayudu is getting there. He's getting back to being the player he is. Steps out and swats this length ball over long-on
Unadkat to Rayudu, FOUR, sits back deep in the crease to a slower ball, getting in a great position to dispatch it through midwicket. That brings up his fifty, just the boost in confidence he needed
Stokes to Dhoni, FOUR, short of length at the body, carrying none of the venom that Archer's bouncer did. So Dhoni just leans back and helps the pull away comfortably wide of fine leg

Stokes to Rayudu, out Caught by Shreyas Gopal!! That's turned out to be a superb catch from Shreyas Gopal. He may have misjudged it initially, came running in, but then has to cut back to the right, almost going zig-zag. Eventually takes it behind his body. It's the slower ball from Stokes that brings out the miscue from Rayudu, and these long square boundaries ensure that it doesn't go over. Rayudu c Shreyas Gopal b Stokes 57(47) [4s-2 6s-3]
Jofra Archer to Dhoni, 2 runs, slower leg-cutter just outside off, Dhoni steers it through point and charges back for two
Jofra Archer to Dhoni, FOUR, and the inside edge for four. That's just kept CSK in it. Full ball angled in on leg, it was in the slot and Dhoni swings hard, only to send it racing off the inside edge

Stokes to Jadeja, SIX, this is an unbelievable shot from Ravindra Jadeja, even going past the one that Russell hit against SRH. Russell was only about to fall down while reaching for a wide one outside off, but Jadeja has proper fallen down but has still managed to club it down the ground for six. This is ridiculous

Stokes to Dhoni, out Bowled!! He probably won't bowl a better yorker than this one. That's just perfect from Ben Stokes as he cannons it on middle and has Dhoni playing over it. Smashes into the base of middle stump. Phew, what drama! Dhoni b Stokes 58(43) [4s-2 6s-3]

Stokes to Santner, SIX, he's hit this miles! slower ball around off, right in the slot for Santner who smokes it down the ground. This has cleared the boundary, and then some, as he clinches it for CSK. What an insane, insane finish to wrap up the drama of a final over which will be talked about for a while

Unadkat to du Plessis, out Caught by R Tripathi!! Oh dear! Oh dear! What is happening! CSK have turned ON the HARAKIRI mode! This is rare, very rare. And look at Unadkat, he is pumped. It was a short of length delivery around hip-height, du Plessis pulled and he gave the impression that he got decent amount of willow behind it. But square boundaries at SMS are massive and Faf picked up the man in the deep to perfection. Tripathi dives forward and takes a terrific catch. Fielding has been top-notch from the Royals! du Plessis c R Tripathi b Unadkat 7(10)

D Kulkarni to Rayudu, SIX, this is typical Rayudu, he charges down the ground to gather momentum, transforms the good length delivery into a fuller one. And lofts it straight down the ground, the timing was pretty good and it sails over the fence for a maximum

Jofra Archer to Kedar Jadhav, no run, Steve Smith thinks Kedar Jadhav has got an outside edge to it. And Rahane has showed trust in the Australian, he has gone for a review. Kedar Jadhav has missed it by a country mile. And I have no clue what Smith heard there. It proved to be a horrible decision as there was a huge gap between the bat and the pad. It was a good length delivery wide of off and it beats the outside edge of Kedar Jadhav

Jofra Archer to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Stokes!! Wow! What a moment in the match. Stokes you beauty! David de Gea would have been proud of that effort. It was a short of length delivery wide of off, Kedar Jadhav cuts and cuts hard. It was in the air, Stokes flies in the air, times the jump to perfection and pulls off a stunning catch. Catch for the ages! He charges towards third man and punches the air in delight. Such moments can change the match, such moments can turn around the tournament for your team. CSK are in huge huge trouble now. Kedar Jadhav c Stokes b Jofra Archer 1(6)

Shreyas Gopal to Dhoni, SIX, this is an air-strike from MS. Even IAF would have been proud of it. He dashes down the ground in a canter, gets to the pitch of the ball and clobbers it into the night-sky. It sails into the crowd!

Chahar to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler gets off the mark in style! A 132.7kph length ball, Buttler walks forward and across, closes his bat-face and clips it through the mid-wicket region. The fielder on the on-side got a hand to it, but the outfield is swift here

Chahar to Buttler, SIX, incredible shot! Wasn't a bad ball by any means. A short of length delivery from Chahar, Buttler stayed in his crease and went downtown. Thumps it over the bowler's head for half a dozen. It was on the stumps and Buttler generated all the power from the crease
Santner to Rahane, FOUR, good shot! The RR skipper shimmies down the track, gets close to the pitch of this quicker ball and chips it over wide mid-on

Santner to Rahane, FOUR, once again Rahane advances down the track, Santner saw that and shortened his length. It was slower as well. But, Rahane is well equipped. Despite not getting to the pitch of the ball, he holds his shape and lifts it over extra cover

Jadeja to Smith, out Caught by Rayudu!! It's not happening on the night for the Royals. An ugly looking slog for Smith and he becomes RJ's 100th IPL wicket. A nothing shot from one of the premier batsman across every format - this was tossed up around middle, Smith bent down on the slog sweep, didn't get close to the ball and only managed to shovel it into the safe hands of Rayudu at deep mid-wicket. A disappointing shot and the Royals have lost half their side. Smith c Rayudu b Jadeja 15(22) [4s-1]

Santner to Stokes, no run, was there an edge on that? Yes, but it was too fast - even for someone like MSD - pushed through flatter and quicker of off, stayed a tad low as well - Stokes was back on the punch, gets a toe-end that rolls off MSD's pads
Tahir to Riyan Parag, FOUR, lovely shot, a juicy full-toss from Tahir, Parag comes down the track and clears mid-wicket with the lofted on-drive

Tahir to Riyan Parag, FOUR, that was a half-chance, but Tahir was way too late to react - dropped short and at the stumps - Parag backed away on the punch, was done in by the wrong 'un and looped it back at the bowler - huit it hard enough to bisect both men in the deep

SN Thakur to Riyan Parag, out Caught by Dhoni!! Edged and caught! Shardul can buy a lottery ticket today - this was a cross-seam delivery that was short and wide of off, Parag's eyes lit up as he saw the width, went hard on the cut and only managed a thick audible edge. Straight through to MS and young Parag walks. Six down and the Royals are struggling to set a competitive score. Riyan Parag c Dhoni b SN Thakur 16(14) [4s-2]
Tahir to Stokes, FOUR, lovely, tossed up just outside off, Stokes is quick to bend down, rolls his wrists and then plays the reverse sweep - past short third man and runs away to the ropes

SN Thakur to Stokes, 2 runs, a run-out chance and Thakur has missed it - couldn't collect the ball - had he done so, Jofra Archer was a long way short - was called for the second run and he wasn't ready for it. Gave up the ghost - but so did the bowler, who didn't gather an awkward throw - it was worked square past point and Stokes always wanted two

Chahar to Stokes, out Bowled!! A big heave and Stokes has missed it completely - the leg-stump is on the ground and Chahar continues to be impressive. The knuckle ball, pitched on off and kept coming back with the angle, Stokes backed away on a mighty heave and missed - stumps in a mess and so are the Royals' hopes of getting to 150. Stokes b Chahar 28(26) [4s-1]
Chahar to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, lovely, the slower ball and Shreyas picked it, backed away and lifts it over mid-off, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes for a boundary

SN Thakur to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, cracking shot, Shreyas is playing a handy cameo here, length ball and he drilled it back over the bowler's head - mid-off was inside the ring and the man at long-on couldn't get across in time

SN Thakur to Shreyas Gopal, SIX, lovely, Shreyas is making the CSK captain think - length ball outside off and he lifted it nonchalantly over the head of the fielder at mid-off - the timing is sweet and the ball sailed over the ropes for a maximum
SN Thakur to Jofra Archer, FOUR, cracking shot, this is a poor over from Thakur, banged in short and at the stumps, Archer swivels across and helps it over short fine, one bounce and over the ropes

Chahar to Rahane, FOUR, shot! A short of a good length ball at 133.4kph, Rahane stays back in his crease and punches it superbly through the gap between cover and cover-point. Once he found the gap, the outfield did the rest

Chahar to Rahane, out Lbw!! MS has a chat with the bowler and decides to review .. in the nick of time. Rahane shuffled across and missed the flick. A fair delivery. Clearly no bat. The impact is on middle and ball-tracking shows it to be hitting leg! Bruce Oxenford has overturned his original decision. The bowler had a lengthy chat with skipper and a jovial-looking MS Dhoni signalled 'T' only at the last second. Turned out to be the correct move. A fuller-than-a-good-length ball and Rahane had walked across a long way to work it square on the leg-side. Three reds on HawkEye! Rahane lbw b Chahar 14(11) [4s-3]

Chahar to Samson, FOUR, terrific shot to get off the mark! Chahar shortens his length, no real pace to threaten the batsman. Samson stands tall and pulls it backward of square leg. The man in the deep dives, but in vain
SN Thakur to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler welcomes Thakur with a boundary. Another venom-less shortish ball, Buttler pulls it hard behind square on the on-side
SN Thakur to Buttler, FOUR, shot! Thakur bowls length at 140kph, Buttler stays in his crease, slightly clears his front leg and batters it between mid-off and extra cover
SN Thakur to Buttler, FOUR, hat-trick of fours! Too straight on this occasion and Buttler tickles it to fine leg for another boundary

SN Thakur to Buttler, out Caught by Rayudu!! Shardul Thakur has the last laugh. MS applauds. A horror shot from Buttler, though. After hitting three successive boundaries, Buttler tries to play another biggie. He hung back and wanted to thump it downtown - this short of length delivery - similar to the shot he played off Chahar. But, this time, Jos lost his shape in the process and the ball ballooned up a long way off the top part of the bat. Rayudu settles under it at the extra cover region and snaffles with both hands. The danger man has thrown his wicket away here. Buttler c Rayudu b SN Thakur 23(10) [4s-4 6s-1]

Chahar to Smith, FOUR, makes contact on this occasion and the ball reaches the fence in a jiffy. Similar length - back of a length - normal-paced though. Smith picked the length early and pulled it through the gap between mid-on and mid-wicket

Santner to Samson, out Caught by (sub)Shorey!! One, two, three and taken in the end. The substitute fielder takes a juggling catch. Rajasthan lose their third wicket. Hint of away-spin, and Samson doesn't get the timing right on his one-legged sweep. It was on the leg-stump line and hence Samson went for that shot. Shorey ran in from deep square leg and almost made a mess of it. It brushed the cap and made contact with his right arm too. In the end, he pouched that. Samson c (sub)Shorey b Santner 6(6) [4s-1]
Santner to R Tripathi, no run, turns away tantalizingly beating to the outside edge. Replays show that there was an outside edge and MS dropped it
Jadeja to R Tripathi, FOUR, shot! Jadeja bowls it slightly fuller and Tripathi plays the inside-out shot superbly. Faf runs across and slides to his left, but allows it to go past the ropes

Jadeja to R Tripathi, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Kedar takes a smart catch and Rajasthan lose their fourth wicket. Tripathi tries to play another inside-out drive against this 94.6kph fullish ball. The ball spins away and flies off the outside edge. Kedar Jadhav at backward point, jumps and goes for a one-handed catch. Doesn't succeed in the first attempt, holds his nerves and gobbles it with both the hands in the end. R Tripathi c Kedar Jadhav b Jadeja 10(12) [4s-1]

Ferguson to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, an absolute treat to watch him bat. Especially when he gets his timing right. Goes down on his knee early and carves the length delivery over deep point, that's a flat six for Shaw

Kuldeep Yadav to Pant, SIX, one-handed slap! Wow! Over long-off for a sixer. Tossed up ball and Pant danced out to canon the ball over the deep long-off fielder's head for a big six. The ball has been kissed by the curse of oblivion as well

Ferguson to Dhawan, FOUR, the partnership between Dhawan and Pant is now 50. Sublime! Pitched up delivery outside off and Dhawan cracks the drive past cover for a four. The ball sped away past cover in a flash. Stand and deliver from Gabbar
Ferguson to Dhawan, FOUR, pitched up delivery and that has been spanked on the up. The ball rockets off the bat and past the dive of the man at cover for another four
Chawla to Pant, FOUR, thrashed! That was a poor delivery and has been spanked off the back foot. Picked the googly and smashed it past cover for a four

Chawla to Pant, FOUR, takes it from well outside off and sweeps it away squarer. That was off the inner half of the blade and made enough contact to speed away into the gap on the on-side. 49 needed. The game getting easier for DC

Prasidh to Dhawan, FOUR, the sound of the bat when it met leather! Wow. Pitched up delivery and smoked past mid-off. Russell put in a pool-like dive but in vain. The pitched up deliveries aren't working

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, chips down the track, converts it into a pitched up delivery and smokes it down the ground for a four. He has been finding gaps at ease tonight. That was the googly from Kuldeep Yadav
A Russell to Pant, FOUR, blasted! Full again. The length on the fuller side has disappeared. That was rocketed past cover for a four. 26 off 22

A Russell to Pant, SIX, the partnership between Pant and Dhawan is now 100. Kneels down on one knee and smacks it over long-on for a sixer. Slower delivery and Pant picked the bones out of that dead meat of a delivery

Nitish Rana to Pant, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! And the move works. Pant has again thrown it away and failed to finish. Not what DC wanted. Not what Ponting wanted either and not what he himself wanted ahead of the WC selection. All these little things matter. Fantastic knock but he has thrown it away at the brink of it. 17 still needed. Was loopy ball, Pant charged out, threw his weight behind the shot with one hand off and the ball landed straight into the hands of the man at long-on. Pant c Kuldeep Yadav b Nitish Rana 46(31) [4s-4 6s-2]
Chawla to Ingram, FOUR, handy runs! Looks to smash it away and the ball runs away off the outer edge for a four. 7 more needed now. He wanted to smack it out of the park but ended up edging it

Chawla to Ingram, SIX, and another DC batsman has been denied a century here. This time by his partner but the team wins. Was a floaty delivery and was heaved over long-on for a sixer. KKR were favorites and have been humbled here by a professional DC team, who move to number 4 in the points table

Ferguson to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, two sixes in the over, just the kind of momentum Delhi were looking for. Shaw was expecting a short ball and Ferguson gives him what he desired for. The ball skids on, Shaw takes his eyes off the ball and swivels. Gets a fat top-edge that flies over the keeper's head. 14 runs in the over!

Prasidh to Dhawan, SIX, Delhi openers dealing in sixes! Another short ball outside off, Dhawan slashes hard at it and gets an outside edge. This one flies over the cordon and that's six more for the Capitals

Prasidh to Dhawan, FOUR, both batsmen have a good time out in the middle. They're making the most out of these powerplay overs. Dhawan puts down on his dancing shoes and slices the short ball over cover-point. No fielder in the deep and that's a boundary

Prasidh to Dhawan, no run, KKR review! Has Dhawan nicked it? Or did it come off the jersey? There was a certain sound but don't think it came off the willow. Or is it the trouser? Waiting for the replays. There's a spike on UltraEdge but not sure whether it's the inside edge or off the trousers. A tough call for the third umpire. No conclusive evidence and the onfield decision stays. KKR have lost their only review. A short delivery that was angled into the batsman, Dhawan was looking to block it as the ball brushed his trouser and settled into the keeper's gloves

Prasidh to Dhawan, SIX, KKR bowlers have been too short so far! Prasidh bowls another short ball outside off, Dhawan hops a touch and slices it over deep backward point for six more. It's raining sixes at the Eden Gardens, Delhi Capitals off to a flier

Prasidh to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Karthik!! Terrific catch by a flying DK! Excellent delivery too. Short of a length around off and jags away a tad. Shaw tries to defend it off his back foot, gets squared up somewhat and gets a thick outside edge. The KKR skipper flies to his right and plucks it out of thin air. Not for the first time have we seen him take such a blinder. Quite an eventful over that. 17 runs and a wicket to cap it off. Prithvi Shaw c Karthik b Prasidh 14(7) [6s-2]

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, that's an awful misfield by Krishna! Russell ain't a happy man. Was a short delivery that was chopped to short third man where Krishna lets it through him and gifts four to the batting team

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, edged but safe! On a length outside off, slanted away from the batsman, Dhawan pokes at it and gets a regulation outside edge. Rana was stationed at wide slip throws himself to his right but fails to cling on to the catch

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, gorgeous shot by Shikhar! Gets an overpitched delivery and the southpaw makes sure to make the most out of it. Drills it straight past the fielder at mid-on who was a touch square, four more for Dhawan

Ferguson to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, 50 up for Delhi and it has come at the rate of knots. Ferguson serves another overcooked delivery and the Delhi skipper plays an exquisite on-drive. Mid-on is no where close to cut this down, beautiful shot!

Ferguson to Dhawan, FOUR, dispatched with disdain! Short in length around off, Dhawan stands tall and hacks across the line. Times this one to perfection and sends it to the deep mid-wicket fence. Proper knock-out punch this is proving to be. Things are only going to get worse from here on, especially with the dew setting in

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Karthik!! Is there anything that Dre Russ can't do on the cricket field? Wasn't that great a delivery but Kolkata will take it. A short ball down the leg side, Iyer tries to play a leg glance but gets a feather as the ball swings away. A much easier catch for DK this time around and Iyer doesn't wait for the umpire's call. Starts walking straight away. Probably the reason why they're ranked first in the Fairplay points table. Shreyas Iyer c Karthik b A Russell 6(6) [4s-1]

Chawla to Pant, FOUR, slogged away! Pant gets his first boundary of the night. Goes down on his knee and places the slog to perfection. Finds the pocket at cow-corner and that shall spoil Chawla's opening over. Had conceded only six till then, but the boundary takes it into double digits

Brathwaite to Dhawan, 2 runs, short in length around middle and leg, Dhawan shimmies down the wicket and tucks it through the leg side. Hadn't got the timing right and that allowed him to easily come back for two

Brathwaite to Dhawan, FOUR, 34th fifty for Dhawan! Gets there in style in. Slower ball outside off, Dhawan reaches for it and smashes it through the gap at covers. Gets to the milestone and announces his return to form

Brathwaite to Dhawan, FOUR, gift of a delivery for the batsman. Short in length on leg and Dhawan pulls it with nonchalance. Beats the fielder at deep backward square leg and adds four more to his tally

Ishant to Denly, out Bowled!! A first-ball duck on IPL debut for Denly - a perfect start to the game for Ishant, this was pitched up and nipped back in sharply - Denly hasn't had an idea about the conditions, went with hard hands on the drive - the ball burst past the inside edge and rattled the off-stump. It goes for a walk and the celebrations start in the DC camp. Denly b Ishant 0(1)

Chris Morris to Shubman Gill, FOUR, beautifully played, a gentle loosener from Morris, half-volley on Shubman's pads, he gets inside the line, brings his wrists into play and flicks it past square leg
Chris Morris to Uthappa, FOUR, lovely, too straight from Morris, he hasn't hit his stride as yet - Uthappa gets inside the line and clips it neatly through mid-wicket, no need to run for those

Axar to Shubman Gill, SIX, superb shot! Much-needed for KKR. Probably the first one that Axar floated ever so slightly and Gill was down the pitch in a flash. Lofted through the line and send it soaring down the ground. Clears the ropes with ease

Chris Morris to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 2nd IPL fifty for Gill! First innings as an opener and he's grabbed the opportunity. This kid is class apart and it's only a matter of time before he proves that. Good knock so far and will want to bat deep. Reaches the landmark with a slice down to third man

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, SIX, just clears Dhawan! For a moment, he was certainly excited but it just about cleared him. The miscued pick up shot from Rana and he got plenty of height on it. As it panned out, the distance too by a whisker
