Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, out Bowled!! Yorks him! Brilliant riposte from Morris. Nails the yorker with perfection and Rana who was backing away to make room, had to get his bat down in time. Couldn't due to the pace and precision of the delivery. Timber. DC are keeping a squeeze on this game with some superb planning in the bowling department. Nitish Rana b Chris Morris 11(12) [6s-1]
Axar to A Russell, FOUR, Russell is away. Gets width on offer and he just backs away to hack this through point. Well wide of sweeper who had no chance

Axar to Shubman Gill, SIX, smoked over wide long-on! Gill has to up the ante now, being the set batsman and seems like he has made up his mind. In the slot, slightly oustide off and he fetches it with a clean bat swing. Slog swept merrily over the ropes

Axar to Shubman Gill, FOUR, deft touch and more runs. Axar fires it well down leg and Gill responds with a calm paddle sweep. Gets it past the diving short fine leg fielder and this outfield shows no mercy

K Paul to Shubman Gill, FOUR, batting of the highest class! There is a backward point and short third man in place, it's a slower ball and what does Gill do? Calmly open the face of the blade to split the two with pinpoint precision. The lad is putting on a show here

K Paul to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Axar!! What an anti-climax for Gill! For someone who batted with so much authority, he's got out to a poor delivery, a scoring delivery. Was fed down the leg-side and he went for an aerial flick. Just had to beat short fine leg to get another boundary but picks out Axar stationed in the ring. Soft dismissal and Gill knows it. Superb innings nevertheless from the young man. Shubman Gill c Axar b K Paul 65(39) [4s-7 6s-2]
K Paul to A Russell, FOUR, wrong line from Paul who gets this shortish length ball on the hips, Russell just gets a tickle down to the fine leg fence

Rabada to Karthik, out Caught by Dhawan!! Another soft dismissal. Rabada has his second and DC are pressing the advantage home here. Pacy full ball on the pads and Karthik goes that favorite aerial flick of his. Only that this time, there is a deep square leg in place for such kind of an adventure. Dhawan gobbles it up and gives his signature thigh slap. Rabada was brought to break this potentially threatening pair and he does precisely that, although Russell is still there. Karthik c Dhawan b Rabada 2(3)

Rabada to A Russell, FOUR, clever from Russell. Was winding up for the big hit but sensed the slower ball, adjusted and opened the bat face ever so late. Split the diving backward point fielder and it was wide of short third man too

Rabada to A Russell, SIX, length ball, boom! Slower ball from Rabada but misses his length, right down Russell's street and he clears his front leg to dump this over wide long-on. First maximum for the big man

Chris Morris to A Russell, SIX, high full toss and Russell clobbers this over deep square leg. Meaty hit and it's goes deep into the crowd. Not given a no ball and Russell is livid! Maybe DK should walk out into the field? No such drama this time but to be honest, this is another of the countless umpiring howlers we've had this IPL

Rabada to A Russell, SIX, top-edge but it's six! And he's not even looking at the ball while connecting here, yet gets a maximum. How Dre Russ? How? Was rushed by the pacy bumper which was well-directed, wanted to duck but couldn't and the fat top edge sails over fine leg. Whoa!

Rabada to A Russell, SIX, he's got a big piece of this one alright! Short ball again, right approach but Russell backs away and blasts the pull over deep square leg. Again not off the middle of the bat but these trivial things don't matter for Russell

Chris Morris to A Russell, out Caught by Rabada!! Massive wicket! Good planning from DC for this wicket. Morris went round the wicket and wanted to execute the wide yorker from that angle. Didn't get it fully right and was a low full toss but induced the slice from Russell who didn't get the desired connection. It's flat and towards deep backward point where Rabada accepts it with glee. This wicket will definitely make a difference of 15-20 runs to the eventual total and DC know it. A Russell c Rabada b Chris Morris 45(21) [4s-3 6s-4]

Chris Morris to Chawla, FOUR, fortune for Chawla but he won't mind as long as the runs keep coming. Wanted to heave this away but got deceived by the slower ball and got an inside edge onto the pad. Trickled past leg stump and went very fine down the leg-side to the fence. Handy for KKR

K Paul to Chawla, 3 runs, in the air...falls safe! Rabada and Tewatia were after the chance, was ideally the South African's catch but his mate tries with a dive, only to get nowhere near the ball. Chawla had got the timing wrong once again on the loft but survives. Excellent running gives KKR three more

K Paul to Brathwaite, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Brathwaite's innings ends. Rightly played second fiddle to Russell earlier although he could have tried at least one big shot. Now, in an attempt to up the ante, doesn't get the placement right on the slog. Timing wasn't great either and holes out to deep mid-wicket. Brathwaite c Rahul Tewatia b K Paul 6(7)

K Paul to Chawla, FOUR, squeezed away by Chawla! He's providing the hosts with some useful runs. Terrific yorker from Paul and it's stabbed with an open bat face. Gets it wide of short third man somehow and away she goes to the fence

Ishant to Shubman Gill, 1 run, a direct hit might have been interesting - Shubman pushed this one in front of mid-on and called for a quick single - it was always a dicey single - Shreyas was quick on the ball and has a shy - had he hit, Shubman would have been short, despite the dive

Ishant to Shubman Gill, FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short from Ishant, Shubman stands tall and pulls it in front of square on the on-side - beat mid-wicket and raced away across the fast outfield

Rabada to Uthappa, FOUR, that's a typical Uthappa shot - made room to a good length delivery and then sliced the drive over backward point - didn't get hold of the shot, but has enough to clear the fielders inside the ring

Rabada to Uthappa, FOUR, lovely, floaty half-volley on the pads and Uthappa needs no second invitation, gets inside the line and flicks it behind square on the on-side - almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Rabada to Uthappa, FOUR, nice touch from Uthappa, back of a length and just outside off, Uthappa waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and runs it fine, good enough to beat third man
Ishant to Shubman Gill, FOUR, lovely, tad too short from Ishant, Shubman waits on it and then flat-bats it wide of mid-on, no need to run for those

Ishant to Shubman Gill, FOUR, beautifully done - he's got a promotion and he's showing his class, leg-stump half-volley from Ishant, Shubman gets inside the line and flicks it over square leg, one bounce and over the ropes
K Paul to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa breaks the shackles, back of a length and well outside off, sat up to be smacked and Uthappa pulled it high and over long-on for a maximum
K Paul to Shubman Gill, FOUR, lovely, back of a length and well wide of off, Shubman stands tall and caresses the punch behind point - the timing is sublime and the fielder at third man has no chance

Rabada to Uthappa, out Caught by Pant!! That's a top catch from Pant and Rabada has got his man - followed the slower yorker with a fiery bouncer - short and angling down the leg-side, Uthappa was looking to help it on its way - all that he managed was a glove. The ball was travelling, but Pant tumbled to his left, leapt high and completed a fine catch. Uthappa c Pant b Rabada 28(30) [4s-4 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Rohit, out Caught by Buttler!! Jofra Archer finds the breakthrough. A length ball at 146.3kph, Rohit tries to smash across the line by fetching it from outside off. Loses his timing - courtesy the extra pace - and spoons a straightforward catch to Buttler at long-on. Rohit isn't happy with himself. He knows that he has gifted his wicket away here on a belter. Rohit c Buttler b Jofra Archer 47(32) [4s-6 6s-1]

Unadkat to de Kock, 1 run, eighth IPL fifty for de Kock - second this season. Unadkat pulls his length back, de Kock has ample time to muscle the pull to deep mid-wicket. Just a raise of the bat from the southpaw

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, Suryakumar Yadav goes downtown and he's made good contact. Gopal slightly overpitches and the right-hander takes heavy toll of it. Stays leg-side of the ball, stands tall and bludgeons it over long-off for a maximum

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, out Bowled!! Bowled 'em! 'You miss, I hit' stuff. It was a cutter from Dhawal Kulkarni, not sure if Suryakumar Yadav picked that. He backed away to crash it through the off-side. But the ball sneaked under his blade to dislodge the off-bail. Suryakumar Yadav b D Kulkarni 16(10) [6s-1]
D Kulkarni to de Kock, FOUR, spanked! Slow, short and wide - asking to be punished. de Kock makes room as he walks down and slaps it through extra cover. Raced away to the fence

Unadkat to de Kock, FOUR, 114.1kph, slower full ball around off, de Kock gets down to swipe across the line, gets a fat top-edge and the ball runs away fine for a one-bounce four into the third man fence

Jofra Archer to de Kock, leg byes, 1 run, good yorker, follows de Kock who was backing away. Off the right boot towards short fine leg. Direct hit would have gotten Pollard who was lazy as he ambled in

Jofra Archer to Pollard, out Caught by Shreyas Gopal!! Archer wins the battle straightaway! Massive strike, considering Pollard's recent hitting form. He never got going today though, seemed scratchy and even disinterested a bit. Had to launch now with enough batting in the shed and opts for the muscular slog of his. The length isn't there and the result is a miscue that goes miles in the air. Brilliant catch from Gopal who steadied himself nicely at mid-wicket to take it with a tumble. Never easy these catches, especially if they are of a dangerous batsman, the pressure just adds up. Pollard c Shreyas Gopal b Jofra Archer 6(12)

Jofra Archer to de Kock, FOUR, streaky runs but MI won't mind it at this stage of the innings. Full toss and should have actually been dispatched for a six but de Kock doesn't middle it well enough. Gets a fat inside edge that's well wide of short fine leg and speeds away
D Kulkarni to Hardik Pandya, SIX, this is a Hardik special! Picked the slower ball early and shuffled across to slug this over deep mid-wicket. Clean bat swing and struck it ever so cleanly

Jofra Archer to de Kock, FOUR, clears a flying extra cover fielder! Good hit from the increasingly tired de Kock. Made room and read the slower ball well before slapping it over the infield. Smashed it really well

Jofra Archer to de Kock, out Caught by Buttler!! Stunner of a catch from Buttler! Wow! Had to cover a lot of ground from long-off, did so and timed the dive to perfection as well. Mind you, he didn't have the reaction time to do it with ease and so had to really rush. But that's the hallmark of a superb fielder, made it look like regulation stuff. Ends a fine knock from de Kock who was visibly jaded. Went for the loft but was undone by the slower ball this time. Sliced it down the ground and on some days, might have survived but not today. Not with Buttler manning that area. de Kock c Buttler b Jofra Archer 81(52) [4s-6 6s-4]

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, SIX, lovely mini-helicopter from Hardik! It's a shot that he's developed in recent times and not only is it great to watch but also is extremely effective. Archer didn't really miss his yorker by much here, was quite full in length but HP is sitting very deep, waiting for any slipup in length. Then just propels it with that flourish of his to send it deep into the stands
Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, Kishan joins the party now. Length ball from Unadkat, horror stuff at this stage of the innings and it's heaved away over the gap at mid-wicket. Struck really hard

Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Buttler!! Buttler is having a field day with his catching. This is a dolly though. Was a low full toss and Kishan couldn't quite get the desired distance on the loft. Skewed it more off the toe-end and it went flat to long-off where Buttler made no mistake. Hardik Pandya has got back on strike though as the batsmen crossed and that's a positive for MI. Ishan Kishan c Buttler b Unadkat 5(3) [4s-1]

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, two was the call from Hardik as he hit this but he's got enough power to get this all the way to the fence. Slower short ball, he tried to muscle it with all his might and forced this through the gap at mid-wicket. Bisected the big gap on the leg-side and though the mid-wicket fielder tried to get across, he couldn't

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, SIX, smoked away! Slower ball but it's in the slot and Hardik has picked it as well. Sits deep to clobber this over long-on. For a moment, Buttler thought he had another catch but in the end, it's well over his head. Brilliant cameo from Hardik
Gowtham to de Kock, SIX, massive, tossed up on off, de Kock gets close to the ball and lifts it with the angle, sent it high and deep into the stands at long-on
Gowtham to Rohit, FOUR, nicely played, flighted on the leg-stump line, Rohit bends down low and then helps it over square leg with a half-lined sweep, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR, this is excellent batting from de Kock, tad too full from Gowtham, can't do so with mid-on inside the ring - de Kock gets a good stride forward and lifts it over that man, almost went all the way, one bounce and over the ropes - 18 from the over
D Kulkarni to Rohit, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Dhawal, Rohit leans into the drive, played with a closed face and found the gap wide of cover-point for a boundary
D Kulkarni to Rohit, FOUR, this is all too easy for Rohit, length ball outside off, he backed away, opened up the off-side and cleared cover with the lofted drive, one bounce and over the ropes

D Kulkarni to Rohit, FOUR, cracking shot, too much width from Dhawal, can't do so against the quality of Rohit - he leans into the drive, plays with an open face and drives it square past cover-point for another boundary

Jofra Archer to de Kock, FOUR, edged and four, wry smile on Archer's face, shortened his length and got it to hold its line, de Kock was looking to work it to the on-side, closed the bat-face, got a thick leading edge that raced away through the vacant slip cordon

Jofra Archer to de Kock, SIX, massive, de Kock is in the mood today, short of a length and at the stumps, de Kock swivelled across on the pull and sent it miles in the air - high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum
Livingstone to de Kock, SIX, the attempted off-break from Livingstone, turns out to be a juicy full-toss, de Kock leans forward and deposits it high and over long-on for a maximum
Livingstone to de Kock, SIX, lovely, too full from Livingstone, de Kock gets under it and clobbers it high and over wide long-on for a mamximum
Gowtham to Rohit, SIX, a biggie! Krishnappa Gowtham fires a ball right in Rohit's slot. The skipper, with a big back-lift, swings his bat hard to deposit it over cow corner
Gowtham to Rohit, FOUR, Gowtham bowls it slightly wide of off, but Rohit is well equipped to put that away. Bends his back leg, gets underneath the ball and tonks it over the bowler's head
Gowtham to Rohit, FOUR, a dart at 99.8kph wide of off, Rohit throws his bat at it and slashes it through backward point. 15 off the over with two balls to go

Behrendorff to Rahane, FOUR, dropped by Rohit! Sharp chance but he didn't time the leap well, ended up getting a hand and it dribbled away down to the long-off fence. Was in the slot as Rahane went for the loft down the ground. Didn't get it off the middle and if not for Rohit's lapse in fielding, the RR skipper might have been on his way

Behrendorff to Rahane, no run, good review in the end from Rahane! Fell across a bit on the flick and missed the indipper to get pinged on the front pad. The umpire didn't waste any time in raising his finger for the LBW but Rahane wanted to review it. Height was the only thing that could have bailed him out and even that didn't look likely in real time. However, the nature of the Wankhede surface aids Jinks in the end as HawkEye shows it to be going over the sticks

Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, FOUR, lifted over the infield! One of Buttler's go-to shots in the powerplay. Stands tall this time to the good length ball and carves it over cover. More off the cue-end really but he's got enuugh power to clear the field and it trickles away

Behrendorff to Buttler, 1 run, fifty for Buttler. He holds the key to this run chase for both sides. The longer he stays the better for Rajasthan, but not for Mumbai. Fuller and outside off, Buttler is happy to push it down to long-off and take the single
Rahul Chahar to Buttler, SIX, this was coming with Bumrah's quiet over. Buttler shimmies down the wicket, gets close to the flighted delivery and smokes it into the second tier near cow corner
Rahul Chahar to Buttler, 1 run, delivers this by coming in between the umpire, Buttler nudges it to mid-wicket
Rahul Chahar to Samson, SIX, they have made up for Bumrah's over. Samson comes down the track, takes it on the full and the rest was easy, he uses a clean bat swing to clear long-off
Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, SIX, steps leg-side, gets a full toss and biffs it straight back down the ground. Another six, his sixth of the evening
Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, FOUR, they're taking the game away in a rush. Pitched up outside off, Buttler stands where he is, no movement of the feet and crashes it through extra cover

Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, FOUR, no stopping him here. Joseph's given a full toss, he's pitched one full and wide, and now he's gone for a back of a length slower ball outside off. Buttler picks it up, waits on it and cuts it through backward point
Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, FOUR, and even a yorker isn't spared. Reaches out for this outside off and squeezes it past the keeper. Third man was in the ring anyway

Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, FOUR, steers another yorker to the third man boundary. Mumbai looking absolutely clueless. Rohit claps for his bowler who's hardly faltered with his execution, but that's hardly much consolation for Alzarri Joseph
Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, SIX, in the slot for Buttler who swipes it into the stands over wide long-on. 28 off the over. He's killed this game off just like that

Rahul Chahar to Samson, 1 run, that sums up the kind of day Mumbai are having. Sliced up in the air off the outside half, falls right between extra cover and sweeper cover. Rohit may have fallen on his face while diving back. He looks to be all right

Rahul Chahar to Buttler, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! He's skied this up off the outside half and is caught down at long-off. No hundred for Jos Buttler, who wasn't playing for it either. Saw the flight and went for it. This is very well bowled from Chahar as he slowed it up and teased him with a leg-break well outside off. Buttler c Suryakumar Yadav b Rahul Chahar 89(43) [4s-7 6s-7]
Krunal Pandya to Smith, FOUR, premeditates a paddle-sweep, then has to reach for it as Krunal bowls this well wide outside off, but somehow gets a top-edge over the keeper's head
Krunal Pandya to Samson, FOUR, drifting in on off and middle, Samson bends across and deflects it fine with a paddle-sweep

Bumrah to Samson, out Lbw!! Samson steps across the stumps, swipes across the line and misses. Given out leg-before. But is this slanting down leg? That's what he's hoping for while going for the review. But as is the case, the ball's just clipping the side of leg-stump to make it stay with the onfield call. Samson lbw b Bumrah 31(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

Krunal Pandya to R Tripathi, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! This is poor from Rahul Tripathi. Really unnecessary. Looks to slog-sweep Krunal Pandya and top-edges it to deep midwicket. From nowhere, Mumbai's celebrations show that they haven't given it up yet. R Tripathi c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 1(2)

Krunal Pandya to Livingstone, out Bowled!! There's going to be drama here, make no mistake. This is getting a bit too uncomfortable for the Royals, and when you see shots like this, you understand why. Livingstone has swiped right across the line of this delivery, missed it completely and lost his stumps. Livingstone b Krunal Pandya 1(2)

Bumrah to Smith, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Huge appeal from Bumrah, and Smith walks. Don't think the umpire was raising his finger initially. Anyway, this is unbelievable from the Royals. How they've found themselves in such a position after that Buttler innings is just... Back of a length, gains pace of the pitch and takes a faint outside edge through to Ishan Kishan. Massive blow to lose someone with Smith's experience. Now into the lower-order. Smith c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 12(15) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, flies away off the outside edge through to the third man boundary. Short of length outside off, maybe not the best option from Bumrah as it gives a slashing Gopal more than a fifty-fifty chance. He just needed to get something on it, which he did

Bumrah to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, dropped by Ishan Kishan! Back of a length around off, Gopal is squared up while moving around in the crease, gets a healthy outside edge. Would've been a sharp catch. Kishan dives full stretched to his right but puts it down

Hardik Pandya to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, full on off, Gopal doesn't time it perfectly but manages to drive it through the gap at extra cover. Rajasthan Royals, who almost messed up the chase at the end, have been bailed out by Shreyas Gopal

Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, FOUR, paddlescooped just past short fine leg! Once again, Buttler hasn't got it off the middle but still has enough wood to get it past the fielder in the ring. Walked across very early, signaling his intentions to this fuller ball, had to fetch it from outside off but his brisk initial movement allowed him to do that, just

Behrendorff to Rahane, FOUR, not a kind of shot that you would associate with Rahane. Gets a length ball and just clears his legs to club this over mid-wicket. An agricultural hoick of sorts and it's come off

Behrendorff to Buttler, SIX, chipped all the way! Superb stroke from Buttler. Sat deep in the crease and didn't try to overhit this one. Just hit through the line and stressed on timing more than power. Served him well as it's cleared the ropes at long-off

Behrendorff to Rahane, FOUR, silky stroke from Jinks. Was a bad ball though, full and down leg, he just got across to glance it wide of short fine leg. The outfield here is the batsman's ally once he gets past the infield
Alzarri Joseph to Rahane, FOUR, full and outside off, Rahane bends down and spoons it over the infield, there was a man at deep point but he couldn't get there in time to stop the boundary
Alzarri Joseph to Rahane, SIX, up and all the way! He has been good with this shot today - the heave over mid-wicket. Shuffles across and down, gets the right length to send it sailing over the fence
Alzarri Joseph to Rahane, FOUR, now the finesse. Banged in and the ball was climing around off-stump, Rahane arches back and ramps it over de Kock, one bounce and over the ropes. Rohit looks worried!

Bumrah to Rahane, FOUR, welcome, Mr. Bumrah. This is Rahane at his best. Full delivery outside off, he has a good front foot stride, the high elbow and the straight bat - creams the drive textbook style through extra cover. None of the fielders moved

Bumrah to Buttler, FOUR, boundaries continue to flow.. Even Bumrah has conceded two in the over. A venomless short delivery that sits up for the Englishman, Buttler swivels and pulls it over the square leg umpire. No protection in the deep

Krunal Pandya to Rahane, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Gone! How many times have we witnessed that? Wicket right after the break. Big one for Mumbai as Rahane looked in his elements today. Slowed up and got a bit of purchase as well, Rahane goes for the slog sweep, the ball turns away with some bounce, the top-edge balloons towards deep mid-wicket, where SKY takes a sitter. Rahane c Suryakumar Yadav b Krunal Pandya 37(21) [4s-6 6s-1]
Rahul Chahar to Buttler, SIX, Chahar errs by landing one in Buttler's arc, it was the googly which was right in the slot, Buttler goes with the spin and smashes the loft over the long-on fence

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, SIX, Buttler has taken over the baton after Rahane's dismissal. Runs down the wicket, gets close to the delivery and then uses his power to muscle the ball over the cow corner fence

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, SIX, he just stands there and admires the shot. Darted into the slot, Buttler with a cleared front leg helps himself to another maximum, smacks with minimum backlift over long-on

Behrendorff to Samson, FOUR, worrying signs for Mumbai. They can't afford to leak runs from both ends. Samson holds a good shape and lofts the length delivery inside out over extra cover. A calculated shot as mid-off was inside the ring

Behrendorff to Buttler, FOUR, the angle works against Behrendorff. He slips on the pads and that is easy pickings, Buttler got some wood on that, the ball then deflected off the pad to the fine leg fence

Navdeep Saini to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle has had enough of pushing and prodding, makes room to a good length delivery and hoicks - off the thick inside edge and past square leg, runs away to the ropes in a jiffy
Chahal to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, poor delivery and Chahal knows it immediately. Drifts it way down leg and Sarfaraz helps it along the way with a bit of glove, the fast outfield takes care of the rest

Siraj to Sarfaraz Khan, SIX, it is not Gayle but Sarfaraz who will have a piece of Siraj. The cheeky right hander, goes down to play that over-the-head-scoop, makes decent connect and the ball sails into the stands

Siraj to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Gone! Siraj learns quickly from his mistake this time. He also gives a send off to Sarfaraz. Dug in short and it was pacy, Sarfaraz swivels to play the pull but only manages a glove to Parthiv, who takes a good catch over his head. Sarfaraz Khan c Parthiv Patel b Siraj 15(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Moeen Ali to Sam Curran, out Lbw!! Mo has deserved this wicket. The promotion to send Curran up the order does not work for KXIP. The offie kept it simple, pushed it through and attacked the stumps, Curran tries a cheeky reverse sweep and is beaten for pace, struck right in front of the stumps and the umpire had no doubt. Sam Curran lbw b Moeen Ali 1(3)
Chahal to Gayle, FOUR, in an attempt to keep it away from Gayle's range, Chahal sprays it down leg, the left hander gets enough bat on the glance to take the ball fine and into the fence

Siraj to Gayle, SIX, he's sent this to the moon! Oh, my! What a hit! Short of a length, sits up nicely for Gayle who clears his front leg and goes booooom! Soaring into the skies at the deep mid-wicket region

Navdeep Saini to Mandeep, FOUR, timely boundary for Mandeep who has been looking to make a move on for some time now. Shortish and angling into him, was pulled away hard in front of square through the leg-side. ABD in the deep got across but probably timed the slide wrong. Ends up palming it past the ropes

U Yadav to Gayle, FOUR, full toss and you can't be bowling those at this stage to a well-set Gayle. He shovels it over mid-wicket, into the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on. Was more of a chip stroke and gets the boundary

U Yadav to Gayle, 1 run, Kohli spills a dolly! An extremely unusually sight, especially when he is fielding in the deep. Gayle mistimed this low full toss and hit it flat towards long-on. Was a regulation take for VK who timed his run forward properly, only to let it through in the end. Poor!
U Yadav to Gayle, SIX, smashed into the stands! Another full toss and this time, Gayle makes no mistake. Wades into the slog and sends it comfortably over the ropes at deep mid-wicket
Siraj to Mandeep, 1 run, short of a length, follows Mandeep who mistimes the heave towards deep mid-wicket

Siraj to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle inches closer to another IPL ton. Wide full toss and there aren't many worse deliveries to bowl to a set batsman. Especially with third man in the ring. Gayle slices it away, well wide of the fielder in the ring and away she goes to the fence
U Yadav to Gayle, FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short from Umesh, Gayle stands tall, rolls his wrists and pulls it in front of square on the on-side, no need to run for those
U Yadav to Gayle, SIX, lovely, length ball outside off, Gayle clears his left leg and heaves it back over the bowler's head, went high and sailed over long-on for a maximum

Siraj to Gayle, FOUR, he almost did! Ends unbeaten on 99! Gayle would have wanted that one run but then, don't think he will be too worried about not getting to the milestone. Siraj missed the wide yorker marginally this time and it was sliced away, well wide of short third man and to the fence for a boundary. Gayle is only the second batsman to end on 99 not out in the IPL after Raina

Navdeep Saini to Gayle, FOUR, that has been muscled away, think he didn't get it off the middle of the bat, but almost sent the ball over the ropes - backed away to a length ball and went over the bowler's head
U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, that's easy pickings for an in-form batsman, leg-stump half-volley and Rahul whips it away behind square on the on-side for a boundary

U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, that's some timing from KL, length ball at the stumps, Rahul leant forward and played a one-handed on-drive - was in the air for a while but rushed past the diving fielder at mid-on
Siraj to Gayle, FOUR, that's some way to welcome Siraj to the crease, length ball outside off, Gayle backs away and drills it through the line, one bounce and over the ropes at long-off

Siraj to Gayle, SIX, you simply can't bowl short to this man - not at Siraj's pace, back of a length and from round the wicket, Gayle made room and swung - didn't get hold of the shot, but has enough to sail over long-on for a maximum
Siraj to Gayle, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, short of a length and well outside off, Gayle leans across and cuts it in front of square on the off-side, past AB at cover and runs away to the ropes
Siraj to Gayle, SIX, hammered, tad too short from Siraj, Gayle swivels across and muscles the pull - high and over square leg for a maximum, turning out to be a big over
Siraj to Gayle, FOUR, make that 24 off the over, length ball on the pads and it's flicked away disdainfully past short fine. RCB need time to breathe and they call for a strategic break
Chahal to Rahul, SIX, lovely, nicely tossed up at the stumps, Rahul leans forward and lifts it nonchalantly over long-on for a maximum. Pressure straightaway on Chahal

Chahal to Rahul, out Stumped!! That's a fine comeback from the leggie. The leg-break and he has got rid of the dangerous KL. Was it the adrenaline that was pumping inside KL? He lost his head and he has lost his wicket now. Came rushing forward, didn't spot the leg-break, beaten in the flight and the drift - swung all over the place and Parthiv has an easy stumping to his name. Rahul st Parthiv Patel b Chahal 18(15) [4s-2 6s-1]
Moeen Ali to Agarwal, FOUR, cheeky and four, tossed up well outside off, Mayank bent down low, used the pace on the ball and lapped it fine, fine leg is very square and has no chance

Chahal to Gayle, 1 run, fifty for Gayle. He continues his fine form.. Third of the season and this against his old team. Just a bat raise and on he goes.. Turning into the big man and Gayle is happy to nudge it square on the leg-side

Chahal to Agarwal, SIX, fabulous shot! Chahal gets wicket with this delivery but not that of Agarwal. Floated it outside off and tempted the batsman, Agarwal keeps a low base, gets low and underneath that to loft it handsomely over extra cover. Goes all the way

Chahal to Agarwal, out Bowled!! Timbah! What a response. He's pumped. Celebrates the wicket with a fist pump on his knee. Agarwal is left clueless with this delivery. Drifts in the air and lands near leg and middle-stump, Agarwal is caught in the crease because of the length, he then tries to maneuver with his hands, but the ball spins across to hit top of off-stump. Dream delivery for any leg-spinner. Agarwal b Chahal 15(9) [4s-1 6s-1]
Sam Curran to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, classy shot from Parthiv! Curran provides a floaty half volley and it's creamed through the gap at cover. Lovely timing and it raced away. RCB are away in style

Shami to Kohli, FOUR, the signature Kohli straight drive! Like Curran, Shami also starts with a half volley. The RCB skipper leans forward and strokes it past the bowler and beats the diving mid-off fielder

Shami to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli is off the blocks in a jiffy. Not that bad a ball, just a superb shot. Was on a length around off, he shuffled across and clipped it away sweetly through mid-wicket. Once again, outstanding timing on the shot. Nothing much you can do as a bowler except applaud the batsman

Shami to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, heaved away! The length is wrong from Shami this time, gives one in the slot for Parthiv who is ready to throw his bat at anything that's within his reach. Clubs it through mid-wicket

Ashwin to Kohli, FOUR, the partnership between Kohli and de Villiers is now 50. Slow through the air - 81.6kph, Kohli cuts off the back foot and Shami at backward point is too slow to bend down to his right. Doesn't get a hand on it and the ball reaches the fence in a jiffy. Ashwin isn't happy with that effort

Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, fifty for Kohli! A different bowling action from Ashwin as he bowls a fullish ball outside off. Drilled to long-on for a single and Kohli points at his team's symbol on the shirt before rasing his bat
Tye to Kohli, FOUR, wayward ball. Slips it down leg and Kohli clips it square of the man at short fine leg. Easily put away
Sam Curran to de Villiers, FOUR, plants his back knee across off stump and swipes this slower ball over short fine leg. Almost went for six, just the one bounce

Shami to Kohli, out Caught by Murugan Ashwin!! Kohli absolutely smashes this pull shot, but it goes straight to Murugan Ashwin who was standing at least 15-20 yards inside the boundary. That positioning was probably to stop the second run, which this pair has so frequently charged for to exploit the long boundary. But it works brilliantly in a separate context here. Short ball, hammered off the front foot well in front of square, it goes flat and hard - straight to deep midwicket. Ashwin comes charging across in celebration. There might yet be some more chapters to write before this game is done. Kohli c Murugan Ashwin b Shami 67(53) [4s-8]

Tye to Stoinis, FOUR, nicely whipped away by Stoinis. He's timed it beautifully, although Tye did much of the work for him by giving a gentle full ball on the pads. And then Stoinis gratefully picked it up backward of square, past fine leg

Tye to Stoinis, FOUR, short of length delivery wide of off, it's a slower ball but on this pitch, it has come on so brilliantly onto the bat. Stoinis has just opened the face, that's it, but it's sped away through backward point

Tye to Stoinis, 1 run, Murugan Ashwin drops a skier! The nightmare in the field continues for Kings XI. Back of a length outside off, Stoinis looks to hoick through midwicket but gets a thick top-edge that goes way up in the air, giving Murugan plenty of time to settle underneath. Almost too much time. He makes a meal of it
Tye to de Villiers, SIX, short of length delivery wide of off, punished by de Villiers who slaps it over extra cover. Turning out to be a great over for RCB

Tye to de Villiers, 1 run, full and wide, creamed to extra cover where Ashwin does a brilliant job of a pick-up and throw. A direct-hit might've even had him, or maybe not. He's in, well in. And that's his fifty too. The job's not done yet though
Shami to Stoinis, FOUR, this won't please Ashwin one bit. Having called mid-off inside the ring, Shami bowls a low full toss and is tonked straight back over that fielder. Another chat

Shami to de Villiers, SIX, and this should seal it from de Villiers. He gets low, bends across, moves late to the off-side and sweeps this low full toss into the crowd backward of square. Classic de Villiers
Sarfaraz Khan to Stoinis, FOUR, drops it down short and is smoked back down the ground. Slapped to the fence for four

Sam Curran to Kohli, FOUR, ominous signs for KXIP because Kohli is timing them sweet and crisp. Not that full in length but he is well forward and punches it on the up. Beats the diving mid-off fielder and it's sped away to the fence

Sam Curran to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, raining boundaries in the Powerplay. Just the kind of start RCB were looking for. Too full from Curran and it's hammered straight back past him and down the ground. Mid-off had no chance

Sam Curran to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Curran is spraying them all around. Shortish this time but at a gentle pace and leg stumpish, Parthiv just had to beat short fine leg to get a boundary. He ends up clearing that fielder comfortably with a half-pull

Ashwin to Kohli, FOUR, smacked straight back past the bowler! Those famous wrists of Kohli and although it was aerial, Ashwin had no chance. Was a float up that got drilled mercilessly down the ground. Rocketed to the fence

Ashwin to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Agarwal!! Clever from Ashwin! Sensed Parthiv giving the charge and slowed it down considerably, while also dragging the length back ever so slightly. The attempted lofted stroke ended up as a miscue and Mayank at long-off accepted the sitter with joy. KXIP have broken through, courtesy their skipper who is actually having a fine season so far. Parthiv Patel c Agarwal b Ashwin 19(9) [4s-4]

Shami to de Villiers, FOUR, AB de Villiers is underway! Seam-up ball, the length is on the shorter side and de Villiers is quick to pounce on it. Jumps on the back foot and punches it wide of mid-off beating the fielder to his left. Excellent placement

Shami to de Villiers, FOUR, nicely done! Good length, seam-up delivery, marginally outside off, de Villiers opens his bat-face at the last moment and runs it very fine to the third man fence. Used the bowler's pace to good effect
Murugan Ashwin to Kohli, FOUR, too wide from Murugan Ashwin and Kohli punishes. Camps back and cuts it in the direction of the turn. Beats point and races away to the fence

Murugan Ashwin to Kohli, FOUR, four more! A desperate dive to his left in the deep from Mayank, but in vain. A length ball and Kohli walked across towards off to clip it away through mid-wicket using those mighty wrists. Agarwal got a hand to it, but couldn't stop the ball from going past the ropes
Tye to de Villiers, FOUR, de Villiers has no trouble this time. Slow, short and wide outside off. AB jumps and slaps it up and over extra cover. Easily done

Murugan Ashwin to de Villiers, FOUR, sloppy, slippy! KL Rahul, the culprit. de Villiers drove this flighted delivery all along the ground to the left of long-off. There was no need to slide, but KL does that and over-does - courtesy dew? In the end, he could only watch the ball go past the ropes
Prasidh to Watson, FOUR, and that's a fine start for CSK! Fuller delivery and has been on-driven down the ground. The full face of the bat showcased and the ball sped away
Prasidh to du Plessis, FOUR, fuller ball on the pads and clipped away past the square leg umpire for a four. Poor from Prasidh. Too full and put away off the pads

Kuldeep Yadav to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, oh, he's miscued this but guess what? It's sailed all the way for a maximum. Plenty of flight from Kuldeep, Jadhav sits low and goes across the line with the spin on the swipe. Gets enough bat on it to send it into the stands

Kuldeep Yadav to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, rank long hop and Jadhav takes full toll. Kuldeep Yadav knows it was a bad delivery and he's disappointed with himself. Pulled his length back, Jadhav pivots back and muscles it in the gap - splitting deep mid-wicket and long-on

Chawla to Kedar Jadhav, out Lbw!! Jadhav's been trapped in front but he walks down the pitch to have a chat with Raina in quest for a review but nope, the Southpaw advises him against going for the review and off he goes. Eden explodes. Chawla picks up his second wicket and he's keeping KKR in the game. Such a vital wicket this because Jadhav was looking ominous. Quicker delivery, skidded through after pitching and KJ misjudged it, ended up playing it down the wrong line and it pings him on the front pad. HawkEye's in and it says the ball is crashing the leg-stump. Good call from umpire Rod Tucker. Kedar Jadhav lbw b Chawla 20(12) [4s-3 6s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, and now he middles it.. into the crowd. Advances down, it's a googly again and this time Dhoni picks the bones out of it. Crucially, he went with a straight bat and not across the line. Deposits it over long-on
Chawla to Raina, FOUR, this time he knows exactly what Chawla has bowled. Picks the googly, steps away from the line and opens the face on his cut past backward point
Chawla to Raina, SIX, steps out close to the pitch and launches it down the ground. May have come close to the bottom of his bat, but there's still enough for a 74-metre six
Gurney to Raina, FOUR, that's a shocking delivery. A full toss on the pads from round the wicket, that too with fine leg in. Raina can't believe his luck as he glances it to the fence

Narine to Dhoni, out Lbw!! Dhoni given out leg-before. Now then, this is a big moment. He has gone for the review. Oh this looks close on the front-on replay. There's some turn, and Dhoni is well forward. So there's a chance it might go down. No, it doesn't. Per ball-tracking, it's crashing leg stump - three reds. KKR needed this desperately to have any hope of getting back. And they're surely back in it now. Like the previous delivery, this one turned in as well with Dhoni having little clue on the front foot. And this was much more adjacent. Dhoni lbw b Narine 16(13) [6s-1]
Prasidh to Raina, 1 run, short of length, Raina hops back and tucks this through square leg for his fifty. Much appreciation shown from the CSK dugout
Prasidh to Jadeja, FOUR, now that's been struck extremely sweetly. Full ball around off, Jadeja gets the front leg out of the way and nails the drive straight of mid-off
Narine to Raina, FOUR, what a bonus for CSK. Don't think they're looking to attack Narine, but he himself has presented a half-tracker. Raina happily belts the pull wide of long-on
Gurney to Jadeja, FOUR, advances down close to the pitch and hammers it down the ground, with Gurney having to duck for cover

Gurney to Jadeja, FOUR, pitched up on middle, Jadeja swipes right across the line of it, and it somehow balloons off his leading edge over backward point. Third man was inside the ring, so it runs away for four. Back-to-back boundaries for Jadeja

Gurney to Jadeja, FOUR, really poor from Gurney, who switched to round the wicket and delivered a low full toss on the pads with fine leg inside the ring. The second time he's done that tonight. Easy put away for Jadeja

Chawla to Jadeja, FOUR, 120kph, seam up delivery that's short and wide outside off. Definitely surprised Jadeja who was late on it, but he managed to get it off the toe-edge. The pace on the ball did the rest as it raced past a helpless short third man
A Russell to du Plessis, FOUR, short ball, bad ball and has been put away. Swivelled on the back leg and pulled it in front of square for a four
A Russell to du Plessis, FOUR, not too short but punished again. Stood up, bent his back a bit and pulled it flat towards deep mid for a four
A Russell to du Plessis, FOUR, the short ball ain't working here. Walks across his sticks and scoops it fine on the on-side for a four. Third four in succession

A Russell to du Plessis, FOUR, Russell getting a taste of his own medicine. That was a slower delivery and du Plessis walked across his sticks again and scooped it fine. The short fine fielder had no chance

Gurney to Watson, out Lbw!! That was a length ball and has trapped Watson plumb in front of the sticks. Nipped in from a length, Watson was trapped on the back leg and missed the line to be adjudged LBW. His bad form with the bat continues. CSK lose their first wicket. That was the pacy and skiddy delivery from Gurney which angled in from round the wicket. Watson lbw b Gurney 6(7) [4s-1]

Gurney to Raina, no run, the inside edge saved the southpaw. Length delivery angling in, Raina hopped back to defend and missed it. But there was an inside edge and that helped him overturn the umpire's decision which was out
Gurney to Raina, FOUR, on the pads, clipped away to deep mid-wicket and that has raced away to the fence in a jiffy

Prasidh to Raina, FOUR, that's a buffet ball from Krishna. Sends a length delivery down leg, easy pickings for Raina as he gently shuffles across and helps it very fine. Fine leg was inside the ring and just watched the ball elude to his left
Prasidh to Raina, FOUR, oh, this is wayward stuff from Krishna. Another loosener down leg and Raina tucks in the gift. Moves across, allows for the ball to arrive and glances it past short fine leg

Narine to du Plessis, out Bowled!! Narine gets his man and sends the dangerous du Plessis packing back to the hut. He's been short on confidence with the ball in this tournament but this wicket is a much-needed boost. Poor shot from du Plessis, perhaps was tempted by the flight there as he leant forward aiming for an agricultural heave, didn't fully commit himself as the ball dipped in after pitching. Sneaks in with a hint of spin and rattles the off-pole. du Plessis b Narine 24(16) [4s-5]
Narine to Raina, FOUR, that's a horror delivery from Narine. Slips it down leg, too easy for Raina as he bends low and sweeps it very fine, earns himself a boundary

Chawla to Rayudu, out Caught by Uthappa!! Talk about lapse in concentration. It happened with KKR and now with Rayudu. Just throws it away, probably has thrown his spot away as well in the Indian team for the World Cup. Chawla with the golden arm; tosses it luringly outside off and Rayudu chases with hard hands. Slaps it uppishly and finds Uthappa at cover, who takes a good catch. Rayudu c Uthappa b Chawla 5(11)

Chawla to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, Jadhav picks the googly and lifts it over extra cover. High percentage shot against spin. Waited for the ball to arrive, lunges forward and cashes in with a nonchalant loft. All grace from Jadhav

Chawla to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, now the cheekiness. How smart is Jadhav here? Nothing wrong with the delivery from Chawla, it was flighted delivery just outside off but KJ cleverly went deep in his crease and opened his bat face at the last moment to guide it past short third man. The fielder gave a long chase but the ball wins the race

Chahar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, 1000 runs for Lynn in IPL! Wide-ish delivery in the channel outside off, very close to tramline, Lynn gets down on his knee and smacks it over covers, one bounce and into the fence she goes

Chahar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for the opener! This was slightly short in the channel outside off, Chris Lynn treks back and slaps it wide of the fielder at sweeper cover, great timing and power on that

Tahir to Nitish Rana, out Caught by du Plessis!! Rana looks to up the ante and falls in the process. It's turning out to be another season where Rana gives it away in the middle and latter half. He spotted the leg-break, made room for the lofted on-drive, didn't quite get hold of the shot, off the inner half of the bat and dragged it down the throat of du Plessis at long-on. A simple catch and the South African holds on. Nitish Rana c du Plessis b Tahir 21(18) [4s-3]

Tahir to Uthappa, out Caught by du Plessis!! A ripper from Faf du Plessis - but what was Uthappa doing? First ball and he was looking to smash Tahir out of the park, it was the leg-break and he didn't spot it, ended up slicing across the line, gets a thick edge that goes high and over the bowler's head. Faf charged in from the deep, kept his eyes on the ball and held on - despite sliding forward. KKR are losing the plot in the middle overs. Uthappa c du Plessis b Tahir 0(1)
Chahar to Chris Lynn, SIX, cracking shot, too short from Chahar, Lynn swivels across and then helps it on its way, high and over long leg for a maximum
Jadeja to Chris Lynn, SIX, smashed, a flat six from Lynn, backed away to a short ball and clattered it over cover, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum
Jadeja to Chris Lynn, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Lynn, tad too short from RJ, allows Lynn to rock back and pull it hard and over mid-wicket for another maximum

Jadeja to Chris Lynn, SIX, hat-trick of sixes, RJ is under the pump here at the Eden - tossed up on off, Lynn came down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it high and over long-on for a maximum

Jadeja to Karthik, FOUR, cheeky and four, nicely done by Karthik, this was the drifter that was angled down leg, he bent down, used the pace on the ball and lapped it behind square on the on-side for a boundary, 23 from the over

Tahir to Chris Lynn, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Wickets keep coming for Tahir and this is his trademark celebration on show. Pushed through with a flatter trajectory, Lynn bent down on the slog-sweep, struck it hard and flat, but didn't find the placement that he wanted. Shardul was the man at deep backward square leg, bends down low and accepts the catch gleefully. Exit Lynn, but enter Andre Russell. Chris Lynn c SN Thakur b Tahir 82(51) [4s-7 6s-6]
Tahir to A Russell, FOUR, .. and he's off and running with a boundary - tossed up on the leg-stump line, Russell gets forward and thumps it wide of mid-wicket - no one in the deep to stop that

Tahir to A Russell, SIX, thumped, the leg-break and it has been dropped into the second tier - Too full from Tahir, Russell bent down low and heaved it with sheer power - didn't middle it but the ball went a long way into the stands

Tahir to A Russell, out Caught by (sub)Shorey!! One shot too many and the celebrations start in the CSK camp - Look at Tahir go, he got Lynn first and now Russell - surely has cut short KKR's final score by at least 25 runs if not more. Another leg-break and Russell brought out an ambitious slog-sweep - Didn't get hold of the shot, off the toe-end and dragged it towards long-on. It was dying onto him, but Dhruv Shorey bent forward and held on. A Russell c (sub)Shorey b Tahir 10(4) [4s-1 6s-1]
Santner to Karthik, FOUR, nicely done, low full-toss from Santner, Karthik leans forward and chips it over mid-wicket for a boundary

SN Thakur to Karthik, out Caught by du Plessis!!Jinxed! Poor from the skipper. Length delivery and he just skied it up in the air for Faf, the ball magnet for the day, to take it at mid-off. That was a nothing shot. The bat face turned in the hands of the batsman for it to sky up. Fourth catch of the day for Faf. Karthik c du Plessis b SN Thakur 18(14) [4s-2]

SN Thakur to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Jadeja!! And a tough learning curve for Shubman Gill is over. Slaps a shortish ball straight down the throat of the man at deep mid. That was slower and Shubman Gill despite timing it found the fielder. KKR have lost the plot here. Shubman Gill c Jadeja b SN Thakur 15(20)

Chahar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's in the air but it's wide of the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Lynn latches on to the short ball and hacks it over mid-wicket. On a bounce and over the ropes. The fielder near the boundary was sprinting across but couldn't reach there
Chahar to Chris Lynn, SIX, that's nailed over deep mid-wicket. Shimmies down the wicket and pulls the short ball over the fence for half a dozen, way back into the stands

Chahar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, drilled through extra cover! Pitched on a full length and Lynn creams it past the fielder at wide mid-off. Pressure on the bowler, 14 runs of the over already. Still 3 balls to go!

SN Thakur to Chawla, out Kuldeep Yadav Run Out!! Swinging in yorker and a run-out as the keeper lobbed the ball to the bowler who whipped the bails off with the non-stiker stranded in the middle of the crease. Chawla almost fell down failing to wood the yorker and Dhoni behind the sticks did the rest. KKR has derailed pretty badly here. Kuldeep Yadav run out (Dhoni/SN Thakur) 0(0)

SN Thakur to Chris Lynn, FOUR, bludgeoned down the ground! An overpitched delivery around off and Lynn had absolutely hammered it past the bowler, no chance of stopping that. Thakur hardly had any time to react

SN Thakur to Chris Lynn, FOUR, looks a belter of a wicket this one. Just look at the timing on that. Minimum effort, maximum result. Was swinging into the batsman this full length delivery and Chris Lynn creams it past the fielder at cover-point. Lynn has scored six boundaries and a six, Narine none

Santner to Narine, out Caught by du Plessis!! Santner strikes in his first over! A tossed up delivery around middle and leg, Narine looks to clear long-on with this loft but finds the fielder stationed near the fence. du Plessis is the man who takes a safe catch. Just like his previous match against CSK, Narine fails to fire yet again. The bowling change works for Dhoni. Narine c du Plessis b Santner 2(7)

Jadeja to Nitish Rana, FOUR, good move by DK to send Rana at number 3. With two left arm spinners in CSK, he can get a few handy runs. This was wide outside off and Rana slaps it wide of the fielder at cover, placement was the key on this occasion

Jadeja to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Lynn is looking in good touch today! Intent in his gameplay. This was short and wide outside off, the opener makes use of the width on offer and thrashes it past the man at cover

Santner to Chris Lynn, SIX, going, going and gone! One of the cleanest strikes of the afternoon. Lynn puts on his dancing shoes and lofts it over long-on for a towering six. Could have been a maximum on any ground, anywhere in the world

Jadeja to Nitish Rana, FOUR, excellent square cut by Rana! This was another short ball and well outside off, Rana sees the opportunity there and cuts it very late, past the fielder at backward point and that's four more
Tahir to Chris Lynn, 1 run, fifty for Lynn, his 8th in IPL, the leg-break from Tahir, but the length was short, allowed Lynn to go back and cut it towards backward point
Jadeja to Nitish Rana, FOUR, lovely, RJ dropped one short and wide of off, Rana made room and then chopped it behind square on the off-side for a boundary
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, FOUR, oh outside edge and it's flew past the man at slip. Outswinger from a good length, Dhawan tries to defend, gets a thick edge and gets away with it

Khaleel Ahmed to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Bairstow!! Khaleel Ahmed gets a wicket in his first over of the season. Short of a length delivery just outside off stump, Shaw tries to punch off the back foot, the ball bounces, hits him high on the bat and the edge goes straight to the keeper. Prithvi Shaw c Bairstow b Khaleel Ahmed 4(5)

Shankar to Pant, FOUR, another edge and Pant escapes this time. Hands on the head for SRH's fielders. It was pitched up outside off, Pant's eyes light up as he goes hard on the drive. No feet, just hands following the ball. Thick outside edge beats Bairstow to his left - who dived but it was far from him
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, smacked over mid-wicket. Rare loose ball from Rashid, a rank long hop and Iyer was so quick to read it. Hangs back and places it supremely in the gap

Sandeep Sharma to Pant, FOUR, oh, poor Rashid. The ball's following him and this time he fails to stop it. Should have done better definitely because the standards he sets in the field is amazing. Shortish from Sharma, well outside off. Pant gets deep and cuts it past point. Rashid did cover good ground but ended up letting it away to the fence at sweeper cover
Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, 50-stand comes up between Iyer and Pant. Slower delivery from Sharma, on the pads and Iyer whips it wide of long-on. Easy two as even Warner can't do much

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Bairstow!! Kumar's worked Iyer out with a short ball. The DC captain doesn't even wait for the umpire to raise his finger as he trudges off the field. It's Bhuvi's 100th scalp for SRH. Followed a full ball with a spicy short delivery, Iyer was backing away and tried to ramp it over the keeper but failed in execution. Gets a slight edge and Bairstow makes no mistake. The partnership has been broken. Shreyas Iyer c Bairstow b Bhuvneshwar 45(40) [4s-5]

Khaleel Ahmed to Pant, out Caught by Hooda!! Proving to be a fruitful night for Khaleel Ahmed. Comes back into the attack and gets the big fish. Bowls a low full toss and Pant looks to lift it over long-on. Gets it off the bottom end of the bat as it's miscued towards the man charging in. Hooda is the man in the deep who takes it. Pant c Hooda b Khaleel Ahmed 23(19) [4s-3]

Rashid Khan to Chris Morris, no run, Bairstow puts down a catch! Was a googly outside off and Morris got an outside edge as he tried to punch off the back foot. The keeper shows some generosity by not holding on to the catch

Rashid Khan to Chris Morris, out Bowled!! Rashid ends his spell with a wicket. Pitches this one on a tad fuller length and bowls a quicker legbreak, Chris Morris with lack of footwork tries to punch it, can't get any connection however. The ball knocks the top of off stump and Morris is gone! Chris Morris b Rashid Khan 4(8)

Sandeep Sharma to Axar, FOUR, finally a boundary for Delhi! It has come after ages. A wide full toss by Sandeep and Axar makes sure it's sent to the boundary. Reaches out for it and slaps it past the man at cover, also manages to beat the sprinter in the deep

Sandeep Sharma to K Paul, leg byes, 1 run, SRH review against Keemo Paul! Doesn't look out though as the impact was outside leg and it was clearly sliding down the leg side. Was a slower delivery on leg and Keemo got beaten as the ball moved away to an extent. Impact - umpire's call and it's missing leg confirm the replays
Bhuvneshwar to K Paul, SIX, Paul has picked the bones out of this! A slower length delivery around off, Keemo lines up for it and swings it over the cow corner for a gigantic six

Bhuvneshwar to K Paul, out Lbw!! Bhuvi has the last laugh as he gets his man. Concedes a six and comes back strongly to dismiss Keemo. Nails his yorker to perfection and traps the batsman in front of the wickets. He was looking to swing his bat but got beaten due to the hint of inswing. Out from the moment it struck his pads and the batsman doesn't even think of reviewing it. K Paul lbw b Bhuvneshwar 7(4) [6s-1]
Sandeep Sharma to Munro, FOUR, a man at slip would have swallowed that. Outswinger outside off stump, Munro slashes hard, gets a thick edge and escapes

Sandeep Sharma to Munro, FOUR, driven hard into the square and it bounces to the right of the man at cover, Rashid tries to hunt it down, but can't cut it off in time, he flicked the ball but it touched the rope

Khaleel Ahmed to Dhawan, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Top edge, oh Bhuvi juggles but manages to take it on the second attempt. Lovely short delivery, Dhawan goes for the hook shot, gets a thick edge, Bhuvi takes a few steps forward and manages to hold on. Great start from Khaleel Ahmed, got both the openers. Dhawan c Bhuvneshwar b Khaleel Ahmed 7(8) [4s-1]
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, FOUR, fullish and swinging away outside off stump, Munro stays in the crease and cuts hard, through cover-point and it races away for four
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, SIX, what a shot! He's very good with that pick up shot, fullish and on the off stump, Munro gets his front across the line and sends it all the way over backward square leg

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, outside edge and it's escaped past the diving man at slip, fullish delivery outside off stump, Iyer plays inside the line and tries to push at the ball, gets away with it
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, SIX, slower ball and smashed, Munro danced down the pitch and slogged at this, didn't catch the middle of the bat but caught enough to clear the fence
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, FOUR, oh good bouncer but Munro has managed to top edge this fine to the fine leg boundary, smiles at the bowler acknowledging that it was a good ball
Hooda to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, how did he cut a ball that wasn't short! Iyer gave himself room and sliced the ball square past backward point, Ricky Bhui couldn't cut it off
Abhishek Sharma to Munro, SIX, lovely hit, down the pitch, lofted with the spin and way back over long-on, the leggie again, picked that from the hand and smashed it, highest IPL score for Munro

Abhishek Sharma to Munro, out Caught by Bairstow!! And he nicks off immediately. Full and wide outside off stump, Munro tries to square-drive, but gets a thick edge and he doesn't wait for the umpire. Abhishek Sharma gets his first IPL wicket. Munro c Bairstow b Abhishek Sharma 40(24) [4s-4 6s-3]

Shankar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, wow! Surgical precision from Iyer. Two fielders dived but in vain. Juicy half-volley from Shankar, Iyer gets his front foot across and nails the drive fabulously through extra cover

Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, Pant greets Rashid to the attack with a boundary. Not the ideal start as he drops it short, Pant rocks back quickly and swats it in front of square on the leg-side. Threads the gap between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket to perfection

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, edged and flies past slip. Steaky but Iyer won't mind. Loopy delivery, almost a yorker length outside off. Iyer squeezes it and gets a healthy outside edge which eludes slip and beats short third man as well

Rabada to Warner, FOUR, welcome into the attack Mr. Rabada! Back of a length delivery at 150kph, Warner swings hard and gets it off the inside edge through square leg. No fielders stationed in that region and that shall be the first boundary of the innings

Rabada to Bairstow, FOUR, not a great line by Rabada! Short ball at the hips and Bairstow glances it past the fielder at short fine leg with nonchalance. All he had to is get some bat on it, which he does. The pace at which Rabada is bowling makes it easy to take it away to the fence

K Paul to Williamson, out Caught by Rabada!! Done in by the slower ball, chips it up to the right of mid-off where Rabada comes flying across for the catch. Clings onto it. Then clings onto Prithvi Shaw who jumps right onto him. Brilliant from Paul to turn it around for Delhi. Pressure on the vulnerable SRH middle-order again. Williamson c Rabada b K Paul 3(8)

Mishra to Bhui, no run, loopy ball and slammed down the ground for the man at long-off to drop it. That was a poor drop from Munro coming in from long-off. Warner at the other end is furious as Bhui didn't even stay alert to take a single. The young man is under the pump here

Chris Morris to Warner, FOUR, takes strike after sometime but that doesn't deter him from getting a four. Jumped on to the short ball and pulled it away towards deep mid for a four. Played it in front of square and got it in the gap
Chris Morris to Warner, FOUR, gift of a delivery. A full toss. And Warner laces that by backing away. Crunched it past cover for a four. Important four

Mishra to Warner, no run, and Mishra ji has dropped a tough one! That was muscled back to the bowler. Quicker one outside off and was spanked back to the bowler who got both hands to it before dropping it

K Paul to Bhui, out Caught by Axar!! This is proving to be a match defining spell by Keemo Paul. Ricky Bhui never looked settled and his struggle comes to an end. Was a slower delivery outside off, the batsman swung his bat and got it off a thick leading edge towards backward point. Axar Patel sprints across towards his left, puts in a dive and pulls off a brilliant catch. This match is going right down to the wire. Bhui c Axar b K Paul 7(12)

Rabada to Warner, 2 runs, starts with a length delivery and that has been lifted away over the bowler's head for a double. Fifty for Warner. This has been scratchy knock from the southpaw. Wasn't timed at all as he tried to lift that away

Rabada to Warner, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The slower delivery does it again. Dada and Ponting at the dug out are roaring out loud as well. Big moment in the game. Warner looked to slap it, toe-ended it and the man at midoff back-pedalled a bit to take it. Huge, huge wicket for DC in the circumstances. Warner c Shreyas Iyer b Rabada 51(47) [4s-3 6s-1]

Rabada to Shankar, out Caught by Pant!! The short ball does it now. The quick short ball, no room for the batter and only musters a top-edge for the keeper to cover some distance and take it at the short third cordon. Back-to-back wickets have almost sealed the game for DC. Shankar could have been the man for SRH but not to be. The ball skidded on to him and he was late on the shot. Shankar c Pant b Rabada 1(2)

Chris Morris to Hooda, out Bowled!! The corker yorker has got the leg pole cartwheeling here. Looked to open the face of the bat on that yorkerish delivery but missed it and the leg-stick went for a toss. SRH are crumbling too quickly here. Perfect yorker and the perfect result as well. Hooda b Chris Morris 3(4)

Chris Morris to Rashid Khan, out Caught by K Paul!! And another South African is on a hat-trick. Slower delivery, Rashid Khan got under the ball and slammed the slog sweep for it to be taken at deep mid. Keemo Paul in the deep mid region gobbled it up. Chris Morris is on a hat-trick now. Rashid Khan c K Paul b Chris Morris 0(1)

Chris Morris to Abhishek Sharma, out Caught by K Paul!! Keemo Paul is like air. He is everywhere. An easy catch around the mid-off region. Length delivery and was heaved away off the toe-end of the blade, never went anywhere and the catch was taken easily. SRH going down like a lead balloon here. Totally messed up the chase in the second part of the innings. Abhishek Sharma c K Paul b Chris Morris 2(3)

Rabada to Bhuvneshwar, out Caught&Bowled!! What's happening here? They keep getting sucked into more miseries SRH. Short ball, looks to pull and the top-edge was taken by the bowler himself. The keeper also went for it as no one called for it. But Rabada kept his balance to take it. Bhuvneshwar c and b Rabada 2(4)

Rabada to Khaleel Ahmed, out Bowled!! Backs away, creates room and misses the fullish ball for DC to complete the formalities. From 101 for 2 to 116 bowled out. DC jump to second in the points table. Khaleel Ahmed b Rabada 0(1)
Ishant to Bairstow, FOUR, Bairstow knows only way! The aggressive way. Sees the width on offer and slices the shortish delivery over point. Enough wood on it as the ball races away to the boundary
Ishant to Bairstow, FOUR, successive boundaries for the Englishman. This was on his pads and Bairstow flicks it wristily over square leg. Very VVS-esque shot that and it's four more for the opener
Chris Morris to Bairstow, SIX, stand and deliver! Length delivery around off and Bairstow stays put and lofts it straight over the bowler's head. Straight as an arrow and that shall be a maximum

Axar to Bairstow, FOUR, slightly short, Bairstow quickly responds by jumping back on the cut. But it's not really that short. So he's not in control, gets a thick outside edge and it runs away through the vacant slip region
K Paul to Bairstow, 1 run, low full toss on middle, eased down to long-on
Axar to Warner, SIX, bashes this into the crowd. The way he took stance, it was clear he fancied a bite of Axar. Sensing this, Axar blinked. He dropped it short and was muscled over midwicket

Axar to Bairstow, FOUR, only slightly short, not a lot, but Bairstow has gone so far back in the crease, using the depth of it superbly. He's manufactured this pull shot through midwicket, and then succeeds in beating deep midwicket too

K Paul to Bairstow, out Caught by Rabada!! Fuller, slower and wider, Bairstow reaches out for it and drills it straight down long-off's throat. That's the opening Delhi needed. Because he was stretching for it, Bairstow wasn't as balanced as he would've liked to be. And so, that affected - or rather hindered - the power he was able to generate. Went flat to Rabada who made no mistake. Bairstow c Rabada b K Paul 41(31) [4s-5 6s-1]
U Yadav to de Kock, FOUR, bottom-handed whip and it finds the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on for a four. On a length, de Kock swipes across the line and gets it into the gap for it to dribble away
U Yadav to de Kock, FOUR, poor channel from Umesh, slips it down leg and de Kock swivels on the back foot to pull it fine for a four. Was a gift of a delivery from Umesh

Navdeep Saini to Rohit, SIX, did he hit it that well? Got hold of the short ball and just rolled his wrists over that. The ball seemed to have flown away over fine leg for a sixer. Might have been a bit of a top-edge
Chahal to Ishan Kishan, SIX, that's another monstrous hit from Ishan Kishan! Shimmies out of his crease and smokes this well flighted delivery into the cow corner orbit with a dash of swagger

Chahal to Ishan Kishan, out Stumped!! Gets greedy does Ishan Kishan and throws his wicket away. Didn't pick the top-spinner outside off and his wild bat swing only meets with thin air, PP completes the formalities behind the stumps sans any fuss. Ishan Kishan st Parthiv Patel b Chahal 21(9) [6s-3]

Chahal to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, smartly played by Krunal Pandya! Gets down on one knee and paddles the full legbreak in the gap through short fine, Siraj puts in a dive after a long sprint but ball wins the race
Chahal to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, gets as low as he can, picks the flighted delivery from outside off and swipes it over square leg for his first boundary
Negi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, why bowl a short quick ball when the flighted deliveries are doing the job for you. Surya stays back, lets the ball come and cuts to the right of short third man

Chahal to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Navdeep Saini!! This is a big wicket for RCB, the move to bowl Chahal has worked. Just as SKY was looking very determined to take MI home, he gifts his wicket. Flighted delivery spinning away outside off stump, not easy to loft the away-spinning ball on this surface, goes for the extra-cover region but hits it too high and very straight. Long-off moves to his left and swallows the ball to delight the away camp. Suryakumar Yadav c Navdeep Saini b Chahal 29(23) [4s-2 6s-1]

Navdeep Saini to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, I have no idea how Hardik has cut this all the way towards widish third man. Short ball yes, but looked like Hardik was slightly late on the shot, but he actually middled it, just fell an inch inside the rope, poor start to the over for RCB

Navdeep Saini to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, in the airrr, Southee was at mid-on, runs back but only manages to fingertip it to the boundary. Clever batting from Hardik, he lofted that deliberately in the air knowing there was no one in the deep, Navdeep Saini bowled very full this time and paid the price. Hardik went back and across for this ball, he went so deep in his crease that he would have been out hit wicket had he been in line with the stumps

Siraj to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, don't understand this field. Mid-off in at this stage to a player who loves lofting the ball straight. Siraj dishes out a full ball and Pandya happily powers it over the bowler's head

Siraj to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by (sub)Milind Kumar!! Yikes! That was an ugly hit with no real intent from Krunal. Ugly because his front foot was pointing towards cover and when you do that, there's no way you can flick the ball with control. Just a chip in the end to this back of a length delivery and deep mid-wicket ran forward to take the catch. In fact he caught that with one hand despite going with both hands. Crowd cheers as they see Pollard walk out. Krunal Pandya c (sub)Milind Kumar b Siraj 11(21) [4s-1]

Negi to Hardik Pandya, SIX, now then, now then, it's not a well timed hit but it timed well enough to just clear long-on. Shortish delivery spinning away, Pandya goes back and powers the ball in the air and gets a vital maximum
Negi to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, is that the game already! Poor short ball wide outside off stump, Pandya slaps it hard and splits long-off and deep mid-wicket to perfection
Negi to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Hardik Pandya has killed the game. Or should I say Negi? Why dart the ball when it's turning! Pandya slogs and hits it well enough and wide of long-on
Negi to Hardik Pandya, SIX, take a bow Hardik. This time Negi actually gave it some air, Pandya got under the ball and muscled it hard over wide long-on
U Yadav to de Kock, FOUR, fuller ball and has been laced off the front foot past cover for a four. Fuller, wider and de Kock got enough bat on it to send it away into the gap
U Yadav to de Kock, FOUR, and off the outer edge. Toe-end may be. Cruel game for the bowlers. Length delivery outside off, de Kock looks to mow it across the line and gets it off the edge

U Yadav to de Kock, SIX, that was a golf hit! That has gone into orbit. Outtaaaaaaa here! Short ball and de Kock has picked the skeletons out of that. Muscled over deep square leg for a sixer. Hardly transferred his weight on to the back foot to slam it away

U Yadav to de Kock, no run, length delivery and has been pushed back to the bowler. Umesh went for the throw after picking the ball up and misses. Had he hit, QDK wasn't even trying to get back. The batter had chipped out to push it back to the bowler
Siraj to Rohit, SIX, this is silly from Siraj. You can't be bowling short and wide to Rohit. Rohit stays back and square cuts the ball over deep point fence for a sixer. Easy peasy!
Siraj to Rohit, FOUR, this is pick your spot bowling from Siraj. Short delivery outside off, pleading to be hit and Rohit slaps it over cover. MI are off to a flier
Chahal to de Kock, 2 runs, full on leg-stump and de Kock's swept that to the left of backward square who fumbles to allow the second
Chahal to de Kock, FOUR, sits down on one knee, picks the length early and swipes it over square leg with sheer timing
Navdeep Saini to Rohit, FOUR, in the slot for Rohit Sharma! Full and plenty of width outside off, Rohit lashes on it with a crunchy drive through extra cover, superbly timed!
Navdeep Saini to de Kock, SIX, 143ks dug in short at the batsman, de Kock picks the length slightly late but he has such wonderful hands and he clouts it for a 77-metre maximum over mid-wicket

Moeen Ali to Rohit, out Bowled!! Wicket off the first ball for Moeen Ali. He can do no wrong today. Lands the offbreak miles outside off stump and thus, Rohit Sharma thinks he can cut that off the back foot, wasn't to be. The ball spins a long way and clatters quickly into middle and leg. Rohit b Moeen Ali 28(19) [4s-2 6s-2]

Moeen Ali to de Kock, out Lbw!! Plumb. de Kock's caught on the crease and Moeen Ali is chuffed to bits. Pitches this on a length and gets just the right amount of turn into the left-hander, de Kock's stranded on the back foot and that's crashing into middle and leg. Played all around it and paid the price. de Kock lbw b Moeen Ali 40(26) [4s-5 6s-2]
Negi to Ishan Kishan, SIX, charges out of his crease, gets closer to the pitch of the delivery and clubs it many-a-mile over long-on
Negi to Ishan Kishan, SIX, make that two in a row! Closer to the pitch of the delivery again and Ishan Kishan has nailed that over cow corner for a flat maximum
Moeen Ali to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, tossed full outside off and SKY pumps it for a 73-metre maximum over extra cover, well timed!
Behrendorff to Kohli, FOUR, stylish shot to get off the mark! A tad too straight in line, full as well and Kohli wrists it away past the diving forward square leg fielder. Timed it sweetly

Hardik Pandya to de Villiers, SIX, top-edge and over the keeper. Oh, in fact, it's gone all the way. Fortune favouring de Villiers at the moment. Pandya bends his back and digs it into the pitch, de Villiers went for the pull and gets a fat top-edge to his benefit

Malinga to de Villiers, SIX, shouts of "ABD, ABD" were ringing across Wankhede and de Villiers treats them by dismissing this into the deep mid-wicket stands. What a strike! Gee. Picked the short delivery early, it sat up well for him too. Easy-peasy as he nails it off the meat and smokes it over the fence

Rahul Chahar to de Villiers, no run, was it a chance for de Kock? He's having a off-day behind the stumps today. Well, looks like there wasn't any edge there. So, won't go down as a drop. It was tossed up luringly outside off, de Villiers wanted to have a piece of it as he threw his bat without any feet movement but the ball straightened and beats his outside edge
Rahul Chahar to de Villiers, FOUR, de Villiers brings out the innovation. Spotted the leg-break early, gets low and reverse-sweeps it past short third man. Brilliant!

Rahul Chahar to Moeen Ali, SIX, Ali tees off and oh, that's a poor effort from the fielder at long-off. Surely should have done better as he parries it away for a six. Looped up just outside off, Ali got underneath it and blasted it - didn't get it off the middle but fortunately gets away. Seemed like SKY was the fielder, who made a meal of it

Krunal Pandya to Moeen Ali, SIX, and he spoils the over with a maximum. Pandya gives a bit of flight, Ali extends his arms and clubs it over long-on. He had to fetch it from well outside off but Ali's got some long levers. Clean strike from the southpaw

Behrendorff to Moeen Ali, FOUR, slapped through extra cover. Behrendorff goes full, overpitches it in the process just outside off. Ali stays deep and creams it hard, beats a desperate dive from Chahar at sweeper cover. Flawless timing from Ali

Behrendorff to Moeen Ali, SIX, he's started to tee off here. Behrendorff misses his mark, bowls a slower ball on a length. Ali was just waiting for this, backs his muscle power and smokes it over cow corner

Behrendorff to Moeen Ali, SIX, wow! This is a big over for RCB. Second six and 17 has come off it. Behrendorff fails to nail the yorker, misses it by an inch and Ali makes him pay. Gets under it and dumps it over cover

Bumrah to de Villiers, 3 runs, lofts the low full toss over the bowler's head and a misfield from Pollard allows the duo to take a triple. Fifty for de Villiers. It has been labourious by his standards but now is the time, when he can cash in

Bumrah to Moeen Ali, 1 run, waits on the slower delivery by hanging on to the back foot but inside halves the ball away into the on-side for a single. Fifty for Moeen Ali as well. This has been one cracking innings from the English all-rounder. Has delighted the crowd with some luscious big hits. Even Kohli gets up and applauds this quick fifty

Malinga to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Fifty and gone. Slower delivery and Moeen Ali was early into his uppish tuck. Moeen Ali was through with his shot too early and the ball soared away for it to be taken at deep mid by Pandya, who moved across to his left and took it. End of a game changing innings from Mo! MI will take this with both hands. Moeen Ali c Hardik Pandya b Malinga 50(32) [4s-1 6s-5]

Malinga to de Villiers, SIX, ABD kneels and he will eventually bring you down on to your haunches. Stays low, and scoops the ball over fine leg for a huge six. Full marks to the anticipation and execution

Malinga to Stoinis, out Caught by Rohit!! The slower delivery does the trick.
