Tucked the batsman up with an off-cutter, which bounced on the batter, who got a leading edge and was taken by the man at cover. tried to close the face of the bat a bit but was undone by the clever change of pace. Top-clas from Malinga. Stoinis c Rohit b Malinga 0(2)
Bumrah to de Villiers, FOUR, misses the yorker, not by much and de Villiers was quick to squeeze the ball between mid-off and cover for a four. Genius on show
Bumrah to de Villiers, FOUR, again Bumrah misses the yorker and de Villiers shows his wizardry. Gets deep, opens the bat face and pile drives the ball past cover for a four. Superb from Mr. 360

Malinga to de Villiers, SIX, misses the yorker again, this time Malinga, and de Villiers has hammered it over deep square leg for a big six. Sized up for a length ball and got a full toss to scream it away

Malinga to de Villiers, out de Villiers Run Out!! 1 run completed. That was superb from Pollard. A bullet of a throw from deep long-on and has found ABD short. de Villiers slogged it away towards the long-on area and wanted to come back for a second only for him to sent back by Akshdeep Nath. ABD tried to turn back but the direct hit found him short. de Villiers run out (Pollard) 75(51) [4s-6 6s-4]

Malinga to Akshdeep Nath, out Caught by de Kock!! Charges out, looks to loft the slower ball away and top-edges it for the keeper to run towards the short fine area and take it. This again won't please the skipper. QDK had his eyes on the ball and took it nicely despite the ball going away from him. Akshdeep Nath c de Kock b Malinga 2(3)

Malinga to Negi, out Caught by de Kock!! And another one for the Slinga! Slower delivery cutting across, Negi throws his bat at it and skies it up. The keeper again calls for it and catches it near the point region. This is extremely poor from RCB. Throwing it away at the end of it. Negi c de Kock b Malinga 0(2)

Behrendorff to Kohli, out Caught by de Kock!! Body blow by Behrendorff! Cracking delivery and Kohli has been sent back early. Was angling across from a good length around off, held its line after pitching and bounced just a bit more than Kohli anticipated it to. He was looking to force it through the off-side and got cramped, thereby getting an inside edge through to de Kock who took it with ease. Just the kind of start MI were looking for. Kohli c de Kock b Behrendorff 8(9) [4s-1]

Behrendorff to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, just clears mid-on! Was a miscued lofted flick from Parthiv who saw the length full and tried his luck. Wasn't off the middle of the blade, yet managed to get it past the leaping fielder in the circle

Behrendorff to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, slapped over mid-wicket! Fractionally short and Parthiv picked the length early, didn't bother going back as he pulled this comfortably over mid-wicket. Clean strike

Behrendorff to Parthiv Patel, SIX, just over deep mid-wicket! Kishan was the fielder there and he leapt as much as he could but it went well over him. A taller fielder, Pollard perhaps, could have had a better chance. Take nothing away from Parthiv though, this is a cracking stroke. Picked the slower ball early and though he had to fetch it from outside off, did so with a cross-batted slap

Behrendorff to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, deft touch this time from Parthiv! Uses the pace of Behrendorff and steers it with an open bat face. Splits the slip and gully fielder to pick up a boundary. Smart batting

Behrendorff to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, more runs! This is a good counterattack from Parthiv. Not in control this time as he goes for a flashy drive, slices it wide of the slip and once again, it's wide of gully and races away to the fence

Bumrah to de Villiers, FOUR, clubbed over point! First confident shot from de Villiers for the night. Short and wide, he stands tall and bashes it square through the off-side. Didn't connect cleanly enough but had enough wood to clear the infield with ease

Bumrah to de Villiers, no run, Parthiv Patel was in some trouble here but puts in a dive as the throw at the bowler's end misses. Might have been 50-50 if it hit. Shortish delivery that struck de Villiers on the thigh pad as he got cramped on the flick

Hardik Pandya to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! What a soft dismissal! For all the shots he's played so far, Parthiv departs in tame fashion. It's been the story of his IPL career by and large. Gets attractive starts but perishes after the Powerplay. This was a cleverly bowled off cutter from Hardik and Parthiv wanted to go aerial through his favorite region square through the off-side. Misread the pace and ended up chipping it straight to Yadav at backward point. Parthiv Patel c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 28(20) [4s-4 6s-1]

Rahul Chahar to de Villiers, FOUR, cheeky from ABD! The reverse paddle and it's actually risky with a slip in place but the South African connects fairly well. Well wide of backward point to get a boundary

Hardik Pandya to de Villiers, FOUR, french-cut from de Villiers and it almost shaved the off-stump. Nervy times for the South African these. This good length delivery nipped in a bit and de Villiers was cramped for room as he went for the cut - too close for comfort. Thick inside edge goes teasingly past the stumps to the fine leg fence

Rahul Chahar to Moeen Ali, SIX, effortless flick from Ali and it sails over the deep mid-wicket fielder's head for a maximum. It was floated on the pads, Ali's propensity on leg-stump balls is well documented. Just stays inside the line and latches onto the freebie

Rahul Chahar to Moeen Ali, no run, was there an edge? QDK can't collect it cleanly and yes, there was a definite bottom-edge there. Googly from Chahar, dropped short and it was spinning away from Ali. He went for the pull a tad early and feeds a tiny edge but QDK messes it behind, grassing it onto the floor

Unadkat to Gayle, SIX, this was in the air for a long time, for a second the fielder at deep square leg looked in business but the breeze here in Mohali takes it away over the ropes. Probably, Archer - the fielder - was standing a few yards inside the rope, had he been near the boundary, he would've had a better chance of catching it. Big misjudgement from him there as Gayle gets away. It was banged in short, Gayle after a few sighters takes it on and pulls. Didn't time it as he would've liked but luckily, the ball sails over the ropes for a maximum

Unadkat to Gayle, SIX, after a few sighters, Gayle gets into action. Unadkat lands a length ball, sits up nicely for Gayle to free his arms. Whacked elegantly over long-on. Back-to-back sixes for the Universe Boss. He's starting to tee off. Ominous signs for RR

Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, first boundary for the opener has come in the 12th over! Rahul makes room for himself, shimmies down the wicket and lifts the shortish delivery over mid-off. The fielder was inside the circle and all he needed was to clear him, which he does. A sigh of relief for KL

Shreyas Gopal to Miller, FOUR, finally a boundary for Miller! He was trying to find this gap since quite some time. Goes down on his knee and finds the fence with a nicely timed sweep shot, first one of the innings for him

Ish Sodhi to Rahul, SIX, that's huge! Short length by Sodhi, Rahul waits for it and smokes it over deep square leg for a massive six. Just the kind of delivery he was looking for in order to break the shackles. Sodhi has just given him that
Ish Sodhi to Miller, SIX, thumped down the ground! A googly by Sodhi, Miller reads to perfection, treks back and bludgeons it over long-off for the second maximum of the over. Pressure on Sodhi!

Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, time for the Rahul show! Goes down on his knee and scoops the length delivery over fine leg. The fielder was inside the circle and the opener clears him comfortably. That almost went the distance

Unadkat to Miller, SIX, Bowled a rather decent spell in the last game against MI but he's back to leaking runs. Bowls a gift of a full toss on the pads and Miller with utter ease flicks it over deep mid-wicket. The timing was bang on!

Unadkat to Rahul, SIX, Unadkat has run out of ideas! Rahul moves miles away from the leg stump and the bowler tries to follow him. Goes full though and the batsman goes inside out to clear covers with this exceptional shot. Wow!

Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, super shot! Saw the length slightly short and though there wasn't room, he created some by backing away and punched it sweetly wide of the mid-off fielder. Raced away to the fence. Another 50 for Rahul this season! This has been brilliantly paced, was really slow to begin with but is shifting gears with ease now

Unadkat to Rahul, out Caught by Jofra Archer!! Unadkat has the last laugh! Was carted around in the last over but responds by breaking the partnership. Was the slower ball and quite full as well, Rahul wanted to carve this through the gap square through the off-side but ended up slicing it straight to Archer at backward point. Simple catch and it ends a decent knock from KLR. So, the gamble works for RR and Rahane. Rahul c Jofra Archer b Unadkat 52(47) [4s-3 6s-2]

Unadkat to Miller, FOUR, launched over extra cover! Spoils an otherwise good Unadkat over. A trifle too full and a bit of width as well, Miller stood still and lifted it easily over the infield. Clean strike

Jofra Archer to Pooran, out Caught by Rahane!! Mistimed and picks out extra cover. Pooran has been done in for pace here, it's a low full toss but quite brisk and hence, isn't able to connect properly. Ends up cue-ending the shot towards the off-side where the RR skipper takes a tumbling catch, diving forward. This is a fine passage of play for the visitors. Pooran c Rahane b Jofra Archer 5(6)

Jofra Archer to Mandeep, out Bowled!! The leg stump has been flattened! Outstanding over from Archer, just three runs and has taken two wickets too. After a series of fiery pacy deliveries, he opts for the slower one, the back-of-the-hand option and Mandeep clearly hasn't picked it at all. Saw the length very short and backed away for the pull but the ball never really arrived. Ends up getting an inside edge that damages the woodwork. Brilliant fightback from the Royals. Mandeep b Jofra Archer 0(2)

D Kulkarni to Miller, out Caught by Buttler!! The KXIP innings is falling apart at the final leg, thereby derailing that flourish that they were looking for. The well-set Miller is the latest casualty. Made room for the big shot but Kulkarni followed him with a slower ball on a good length. Couldn't free his arms properly and ended up skewing the loft high into the night skies at deep mid-wicket. Not easy, these high catches but Buttler is a pro in the outfield. Pouches the skier with ease. Miller c Buttler b D Kulkarni 40(27) [4s-2 6s-2]

D Kulkarni to Ashwin, FOUR, useful boundary for KXIP! Width on offer and shortish as well, Ashwin was waiting for any room to be provided and sliced it away wide of backward point. Third man had no chance of cutting it off

D Kulkarni to Ashwin, SIX, crunched! Solid hit from the KXIP skipper. Picked the slower ball and the shorter length helped, he sat deep on the back foot and clouted it merrily across the line. Superb batting!

D Kulkarni to Gayle, FOUR, this is erratic from Kulkarni. Serves up a low full toss outside off, Gayle reaches out and throws his bat. Gets a thick outside edge but the third man is inside the ring and it beats the fielder at 45 before running away to the fence

D Kulkarni to Ashwin, SIX, terrific cameo from Ashwin to finish! Premeditates the yorker and walks across the stumps early, thereby putting Kulkarni off. The result is a full toss that's paddle scooped beautifully. All the way over fine leg

D Kulkarni to Gayle, FOUR, very predictable from Kulkarni. He's bowling an array of slower balls, Gayle anticipated it and made room to spank it in the pocket between short third man and backward point

D Kulkarni to Gayle, SIX, woah. This is very uncharacteristic from Gayle. Let's the world know about his cheekiness too. Spotted the short ball early, arched his back and ramped it beautifully over the keeper. Normally, it's all about power but not on this occasion

Jofra Archer to Gayle, byes, FOUR, messy. Archer is fuming as Samson fumbles behind. Can't blame him much because he got an iffy bounce. Off-pace delivery, snaked away sharply outside off. The keeper couldn't get his body behind the line and it runs away to the boundary

Jofra Archer to Gayle, out Caught by Samson!! Archer gets the prized scalp of Gayle. He's such a smart operator and gives RR the first breakthrough. It was on a back of a length, decked away with some extra bounce. Gayle with a tentative and loose poke at that, it brushes the outside edge and Samson makes no mistake this time. Stunned silence in the crowd as KXIP have lost the in-form Gayle. Gayle c Samson b Jofra Archer 30(22) [4s-2 6s-3]

Ish Sodhi to Agarwal, SIX, Agarwal at his very best. He's very good against spin and shows no respect whatsoever to Sodhi. Flighted with more air, Agarwal lowers his stance and lifts it straight down the ground. The timing is really good and it goes all the way for a six

Shreyas Gopal to Agarwal, FOUR, what a shot. Gopal drags it short, Agarwal is extremely quick to read the length. Pivots back and hammers it through mid-wicket. Stuart Binny from the deep sprints across and dives, but ends up parrying it to the boundary

Shreyas Gopal to Agarwal, SIX, launched over long-off! Agarwal is looking in superb touch today. Tosses it enticingly just outside off, Agarwal props forward and clobbers it disdainfully for a maximum

Ish Sodhi to Agarwal, out Caught by Jofra Archer!! Agarwal perishes in his quest to clear long-on. Goes down on his knee to thump this one over the fence but miscues it completely. The ball goes miles up in the air and Jofra in the deep settles underneath the skier. Waits for an eternity but does well to position himself under the night sky as he reverse cups it to perfection. Agarwal c Jofra Archer b Ish Sodhi 26(12) [4s-1 6s-2]

Mujeeb to Buttler, SIX, dispatched over long-on! Clear intent from Buttler, doesn't want to settle Mujeeb settle. There is a long-off in place, so he charges down the pitch and goes in the other direction. Over long-on and it was struck so well that it soared into the second tier

Ashwin to Samson, out Bowled!! The sweep has brought about his downfall this time. After crunching the previous two straight to the fielder, Samson goes for it again but misses it completely. That it was a carrom ball that straightened on off may have had to do with the error. Or it may not have. But it's floored the off stump all right. Samson b Ashwin 27(21) [4s-2]
Shami to Rahane, FOUR, great timing from Rahane as he whips this delivery backward of square. Back of a length on middle and leg, Rahane climbs onto it. A boundary at the start of his innings
Shami to R Tripathi, FOUR, poor from Shami. Bowls a hit-me on leg-stump and Tripathi tickles away neatly in the gap between deep square and fine leg
Ashwin to R Tripathi, 1 run, flighted around off, Tripathi pulls to deep mid-wicket and that'll be his first fifty this IPL

Ashwin to R Tripathi, out Caught by Agarwal!! The carom ball has done the trick again! It was pushed around fifth stump channel and Tripathi intended to clear the fielder in the deep, went for the loft but sliced it off the bottom half straight into the mitts of Mayank Agarwal at long-off. R Tripathi c Agarwal b Ashwin 50(45) [4s-4]

Murugan Ashwin to Turner, out Caught by Miller!! No Mohali heroics from Ashton Turner tonight. Unfortunately he doesn't have the time to play the nudge-and-nurdle game, prefers to attack and uses his long levers to tonk Murugan Ashwin into the stands, wasn't to be. Connects right off the cue end and Miller ain't dropping that at long-off. Turner c Miller b Murugan Ashwin 0(1)

Shami to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Rahul!! KL Rahul is such a brilliant fielder and boy, he makes catching look so easy. A pacy short ball outside off, Archer's so tall that he could actually stay flat-feeted and swipe at it with full throttle, hit that real hard but flat it went to the right of long-on. KL Rahul sprints across and controls the slide before tumbling over to complete the catch. Jofra Archer c Rahul b Shami 1(3)
Shami to Binny, FOUR, Binny's off the mark with a boundary! A gentle short delivery on the stumps, Binny waits on the back foot and pummels it over mid-wicket with brute power

Shami to Binny, SIX, there's nothing brute about this shot. Just a serene pick up off his hip, just watched the ball spear into the leg-side and did well to get inside the line and help the cherry on its way for a 75-metre maximum over fine leg

Arshdeep Singh to Rahane, out Caught by Shami!! Rahane's ordeal comes to an end and the 20-year old is absolutely pumped. Couldn't have asked for a better debut. Rolled his fingers over this full delivery and asked Rahane to fetched it from outside off, the aimless slog loops up high in the air where Shami runs around to take a fine catch from short third. Rahane c Shami b Arshdeep Singh 26(21) [4s-1]
Arshdeep Singh to Binny, SIX, length ball in the slot for Binny, he stands rooted to the crease and powers it into the cow corner orbit with tremendous timing
Arshdeep Singh to Binny, SIX, no missing this time around. Watches the ball like a hawk, sets himself deep inside the crease and smokes the full ball straight back over the bowler's head

Shami to Shreyas Gopal, out Caught by Agarwal!! Pacy full ball from Shami, followed the batsman and fired it around the pads, Gopal had made room outside off but the extra pace from Shami skid onto the bat and hit the toe-end on the loft, a simple chance for Mayank at long-off. Shreyas Gopal c Agarwal b Shami 0(1)

Arshdeep Singh to Buttler, SIX, scorching hit from Buttler! Prowled down the track in a jiffy and although this wasn't that short, he picked it up beautifully. Propelled it over deep mid-wicket with a shovel-flick. Such power! He's looking ominous tonight again

Arshdeep Singh to Buttler, FOUR, another beautiful shot! Buttler is turning it on. Sees width on offer and just eases it through backward point. Just relied on timing and boy, didn't he time the pants off this one! Sweeper tried hard but was never chasing it down

Shami to Binny, FOUR, KXIP - 2, RR - 0 this season! A comfortable victory for the home team, win by 12 runs. Binny sliced the full ball one-handed and managed to get it over extra cover, Mayank Agarwal chases the ball to his left but he couldn't arrest him momentum and ended up sliding over the ball

Arshdeep Singh to Buttler, out Caught by Pooran!! Arshdeep Singh has got Jos Buttler as his maiden IPL wicket. What a moment for the 20-year-old left-arm seamer. He's deceived him with the off-cutter here. It was slanted across well wide of off, Buttler - almost premeditatedly - wanted to slug it through midwicket but goes through with it too early. Went up off the toe-end and the keeper Pooran took a fine catch running back towards fine leg. Big celebrations from Punjab, particularly Ashwin. Buttler c Pooran b Arshdeep Singh 23(17) [4s-1 6s-2]
Arshdeep Singh to R Tripathi, FOUR, full and wide, Tripathi grounds his back knee and carves it up and over backward point. Beautiful shot

Arshdeep Singh to R Tripathi, FOUR, that's gone through Shami's hands at short third man. Poor effort. Length ball outside off, the angle induced the error from Tripathi as he drove away from the body. Went quickly off the outside edge to Shami's left, should've been comfortably stopped
Murugan Ashwin to R Tripathi, FOUR, uses the pace superbly. Murugan was mostly flat through the over, so Tripathi anticipated a similar trajectory, stayed back to the ball and then dabbed it fine
Shami to Samson, FOUR, it's been helped away quite fine from Samson, capitalizing superbly on just a bit of misdirection from Shami who strayed ever so slightly on middle and leg

Shami to Samson, FOUR, now this is class batting. He's chopped a ball - that was on off stump - and sent it really fine into the third man boundary. What makes it an even better shot is that it was the off-cutter from Shami, so it's not as if he had a lot of pace to work with
Ashwin to Samson, 1 run, wide on the crease again is Ashwin, straightens it on off stump, it takes a thick edge from Samson before rolling to short third man

Shankar to du Plessis, out Caught by Bairstow!! One brings two!! Shankar uses his height and bowls the scramble seam short of length delivery outside off, Faf made room early and was looking to go over cover, gets a faint outside edge and YJB does the rest behind the stumps. du Plessis c Bairstow b Shankar 45(31) [4s-3 6s-3]
Rashid Khan to Raina, FOUR, risky shot and he gets a boundary! Expects the googly and jumps deep inside the crease, plays the cut at the last instant and the edge flies wide of Warner at slip
Shankar to Raina, FOUR, streaky! A full throttle cross bat swing against a length delivery and Raina sends a huge chunk of top-edge on that, one bounce and over the ropes at third man

Rashid Khan to Raina, out Lbw!! Raina has been given out lbw off Rashid. CSK review: Fair delivery, looks to be pitching in line and no bat involved. Umpire's call on hitting and he has to go. Hasn't been at his fluent best and this shot is a firm proof of that. Just looks to slog without having a real sense of where the ball pitched and he loses his shape in the process, swings way too early and Rashid's floaty legbreak clonks him in front of middle. Technology shows it to be brushing the leg bail. Just enough. Raina lbw b Rashid Khan 13(13) [4s-2]

Rashid Khan to Kedar Jadhav, out Lbw!! Kedar Jadhav's out lbw. Another review from CSK: Legal delivery and there seems to be no bat involved. Has it done too much though, the googly? He's struck in line with off and there's another umpire's call on hitting. Shaving the top of leg peg. OUT!! A rather simple set-up this from Rashid, bowled the wrong 'un and gave it ample flight to draw Jadhav on the front foot. The batsman clearly didn't pick the variation and his forward stride meant he was struck adjacent to middle and leg. Kedar Jadhav lbw b Rashid Khan 1(2)

Khaleel Ahmed to Billings, out Caught by Shankar!! Nought for Billings. Been strangled with a slew of dots and he lets the pressure get better off him. A slower full ball outside off, Billings didn't really have the pace to force the uppish drive but he goes for it and chips a dolly of a catch to Vijay Shankar at cover. Billings c Shankar b Khaleel Ahmed 0(4)
Sandeep Sharma to Rayudu, FOUR, slower ball again but Rayudu has second guessed Sandeep Sharma there. Waited deep inside the crease and pounced on the width to flay it behind backward point

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run, ripper from Rashid, absolute ripper. So good was the ball, that they feel compelled to go for a review after Rayudu is beaten on the outside edge. He's missed this by inches. Only clipped the trouser on the way through. Oh well, SRH have retained their review because ball-tracking shows it to be umpire's call on off stump. I'm sure they weren't appealing for leg-before there
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, FOUR, slower ball outside off, there was enough width for Rayudu to free his arms and he does so by slapping this through backward point

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, FOUR, that shall release some pressure. Watson throws his hands at a wide-ish delivery as a thick outside edge is induced. It flies over Warner at slip and races away to the third man boundary. First one of the night for CSK!

Khaleel Ahmed to du Plessis, FOUR, Faf breaks the shackles! Stays put in the crease and lifts the length delivery right over the bowler's head. Can't keep a fielder there and that's a four for the South African, his first one

Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, CSK are either scoring in boundaries or not at all. This one was a loosener on the pads and du Plessis clips it past Khaleel at short fine leg. Although the pacer puts in a dive, he finds it difficult to get his hand to it, all the way to the fence she goes

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, that shall give him some confidence. A booster! This was an overpitched delivery by Sandy and Watto caresses it through extra-cover. Beats Williamson who was stationed inside the circle and sends it away to the boundary

Khaleel Ahmed to du Plessis, SIX, crack made the sound! Such a sweetly timed shot that was. du Plessis waits back in his crease, reads the slower short ball and thumps it over the cow-corner for six runs

Khaleel Ahmed to du Plessis, FOUR, shouldn't have given him the third over. Khaleel is become a touch predictable now. Overcompensates by going too full outside off, du Plessis creams it through covers for an elegant boundary

Nadeem to du Plessis, SIX, that shot was all about timing! Minimum effort and maximum result. du Plessis shimmies down the wicket and lofts the flighted delivery against the spin. The timing was such that it just about manages to clear Warner at long-off, beautiful
Nadeem to du Plessis, 1 run, 50-run stand up between the openers as du Plessis tucks this one through mid-wicket off an inside edge

Nadeem to Watson, FOUR, both batsmen are dealing in boundaries now. They've got a hang of the wicket. Watson backs away and slices the shortish delivery past the fielder at point, four runs for the Aussie international
Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, welcome into the attack, Mr Rashid. Watson goes down on his knee and sweeps the floated delivery with all his might. So much power in that shot, four more for CSK

Nadeem to du Plessis, SIX, skips out of his crease, isn't close to the pitch of the delivery but Faf doesn't back out; just goes through with the loft and pings it right over the leaping fielder at wide long-on

Nadeem to Watson, out Bowled!! A hint of uncertainity consumes Shane Watson. He was on the back foot, trying to cut this off his off-stump but the ball doesn't turn as expected and grips a touch before crashing into off peg. Smart bowling from Nadeem as he landed it in line with off to keep Watson honest. Watson b Nadeem 31(29) [4s-4]

Chahar to Bairstow, FOUR, the timing off the very first ball, it's like he's turned up after an hour's batting in the nets. Fuller than a length on middle and leg, some shape for Chahar but Bairstow whips it with such class through square leg
SN Thakur to Bairstow, FOUR, full ball on off, drilled into the pitch and bounces over Thakur's head before racing away to the ropes

SN Thakur to Warner, FOUR, right off the toe-end from Warner as he slashes at a wide length ball. Balloons over backward point, and beats a stiff effort from Tahir at third man as he couldn't bend down enough to cut it off
Karn Sharma to Bairstow, SIX, swivels on the back foot and pulls it handsomely over deep mid for a sixer. Superb hit as he was quick to pick the length on it
Karn Sharma to Bairstow, SIX, and Bairstow is in some hurry now! Kneels down and slog sweeps it over the widish long-on region for a sixer. They are racing towards the target

Tahir to Shankar, out Caught by Billings!! The RRR may be in the 3s, but that's not bad enough for Tahir to deny himself the marathon-to-nowhere celebration. And he's earned it with a ripper of a leg-break - pitching on a length, drawing Shankar forward in classical style, only to spit up a touch more off the pitch and take the splice through to the keeper. Shankar c Billings b Tahir 7(11)

Karn Sharma to Bairstow, 2 runs, too straight again, but Bairstow manages to nurdle it softly enough through square leg. And the softness gives him the second, and his fifty -- talk about making the most before you HAVE to go back home
Karn Sharma to Hooda, FOUR, proper slice. He steps down, steps away and makes the length right into his slot to carve it away with a lot of bottom hand -- into that one-shot distance now ..

Karn Sharma to Hooda, out Caught by du Plessis!! Ah, that desire to unleash your inner Dhoni, I0$ desire to smack big when singles could do just as well. Well Hooda falls for just I0$. So he rushes down, tries to hoick one downtown, but in the end ends up just too close to the pitch of it, miscuing it big time to a backtracking mid-off. Hooda c du Plessis b Karn Sharma 13(16) [4s-1]

Karn Sharma to Bairstow, SIX, oh well Bairstow will do THE Dhoni. It was full, allowing him to come forward and then free up his hands to whip the tonk long, deep, over cow corner. 6 wickets | 19 balls remain ..
Chahar to Warner, FOUR, he's waited on this slower ball, and then just chipped it back over Chahar's head. Superb from Warner, first to watch it like a hawk and then to have the composure
Chahar to Warner, FOUR, short and wide, it's met with a punishing slap over extra cover. Deserved the treatment it got, really poor delivery
SN Thakur to Warner, FOUR, awful from Thakur. Just bonus runs. Full toss outside off, Warner simply lays his bat on it and finds the gap through extra cover
SN Thakur to Warner, FOUR, short of length outside off, Warner steps to the leg-side to add to the width that was on offer and carves it over extra cover. SRH have raced to 44 in four overs
Tahir to Warner, FOUR, kneels down and slog sweeps it behind square for a four! That was spilling down and has been helped on its way
Tahir to Warner, FOUR, this pocket-sized dynamite is exploding and taking CSK down to the smithereens here. Reverse swept over backward point for a four. He is in a hurry
Tahir to Warner, FOUR, the entire repertoire of shots is out there! The exhibition mode is on. Tossed up delivery and was driven into the covers for a four
Chahar to Warner, FOUR, Chahar's stocks are on a free fall. Short, slow, Warner gets into position and pulls it over short fine leg for a one bounce four

Chahar to Warner, FOUR, and that is fifty for Warner! He has wasted no time today to get going. 45th Fifty plus score for Warner. Flat-batted it down the ground and got it over mid-on for a four. On a track where batters have struggled for timing, he has looked in supreme touch

Chahar to Warner, out Caught by du Plessis!! Fuller, slower delivery and has hit it straight to the man at mid-off. Backed away, toe-ended it and could not infuse any momentum on the shot to hole out. But he has done his job. CSK strike but seems a little too late in the context of the game. Change of pace has accounted for another wicket though. Warner c du Plessis b Chahar 50(25) [4s-10]

Tahir to Williamson, out Caught&Bowled!! That has happened all evening long. Flatter outside off, stopped and bounced on the batter, Williamson goes through with his punch and hits it back to the bowler. Tahir does his celebratory run. CSK get a quick second wicket. But they need a horde of them now to even think of making a match of it from here. Williamson c and b Tahir 3(5)
Jadeja to Bairstow, FOUR, charges out, goes through with the shot and gets it over the bowler's head for a one bounce four
Hardik Pandya to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, too short, too wide, carved away between point and cover point for a four. Got the room and got the boundary to get off the mark
Hardik Pandya to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, strays on to the pads from over the wicket and has been tickled away fine for a four. DC will take these
Rahul Chahar to Dhawan, FOUR, fetches it from outside off and has swept it past square leg for a four. More of a hacked sweep to get it past the fielder
Rahul Chahar to Dhawan, FOUR, takes it from the sticks and gets it between short fine and square leg for a four. More off the inner half of the bat but that was enough

Rahul Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, out Bowled!! Quite a ripper from Chahar, pitching leg and hitting off. Along the way, it brought Iyer tentatively forward, then beat him with the dip, before spinning past his outside edge. Mumbai Indians are all over the Capitals. Shreyas Iyer b Rahul Chahar 3(6)

Bumrah to Pant, out Bowled!! Knocked up clean. Pant goes for a very un-Kotla-approved drive - you know, away from his body, on the up - missing the line completely and with Bumrah making it worse with the extreme jag back in off the pitch. And off-stump's on a cartwheel. And so are Delhi's hopes tonight. Pant b Bumrah 7(11)

Malinga to Axar, FOUR, and another ventilator-shot - the kind that just about keeps a chase alive. It's another slower-wide combo, but Axar's not getting fooled (any longer). Throws his bat out and slices it away over extra cover

Bumrah to Chris Morris, SIX, dishes out full pace and goes 73 meters. It's right in the slot too as Morris lines up and tonks it straight back. Two balls, two hits and Delhi's asking rate falls down by an entire run ..

Malinga to Axar, SIX, 111.4kph. Picks the slower one, picks his slot and picks the maximum. His hands were always swinging, with the legs going away and making the space to -- in lofting it way over long-on

Malinga to Chris Morris, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Yup, the slog was always on the way. Malinga knew, oh he surely did, taking pace off his millionth full-cutter tonight. Surely Morris knew THIS was coming too, but with the RRR touching 20, he had to go for the smash. So he clears his front leg, doesn't really get under the length but still swings, dragging it off the under-edge to a running in long-on. Chris Morris c Hardik Pandya b Malinga 11(9) [6s-1]

Bumrah to Axar, out K Paul Run Out!! Well it can get worse. Bumrah - if his yorker doesn't get you, his direct hit will. Axar just dug it out down the pitch but Paul nevertheless was half way down the pitch. Bumrah fielded, lined up, aimed, waited, aimed better and nailed the throw at the non-striker's. It helps when Paul gives up and stands to watch it as well. K Paul run out (Bumrah) 0(0)

Bumrah to Axar, out Bowled!! Full, all-pace, dead straight on middle. Well, certain things in life are just too good. This one was better than that good. Poor Axar, he tried backing away to carve it through sweeper, but ended up missing it all ends up. It's middle's turn to get uprooted. Axar b Bumrah 26(23) [4s-1 6s-1]
Malinga to Mishra, leg byes, FOUR, loses radar. Well down leg, and Mishra gets a tickle off his pads, under Quinton's rather lazy dive as well

Malinga to Rabada, 1 run, dropped - Pollard of all people, and the simplest take of them all. Rabada goes on a knee, swings, top-edges, skies. Pollard meanwhile runs in from long-on, casually, settles, gets both palms and then lets it pop out
Hardik Pandya to Rabada, SIX, oh there's the crunch. Another swing, and this one's surely into cow corner. Latches onto the slower one, getting under it and pumping it deep, very deep

Hardik Pandya to Rabada, out Caught by Pollard!! It's a new entrant into the Dinesh Karthik school of catching - taking blunders after dropping lollies. And this is tough-er, with Rabada throwing his hands at a wide one and inside-outing the carve over extra cover. Pollard's at the boundary - running to his right, taking it palms pointing sideways. Rabada c Pollard b Hardik Pandya 9(8) [6s-1]
Malinga to Dhawan, FOUR, hangs back on that slower and wide ball to slam it off the front foot. Didn't preempt and got the gap on the off-side for a four

Malinga to Dhawan, FOUR, picks the bones out of that dead meat of a slower ball! Charges out, gets hold of the length and goes through with the lofted hit to send it packing through the covers. Was aerial and landed a few times before the fence
Jayant Yadav to Dhawan, SIX, out of the crease in a flash and so was the ball. Tossed up delivery and Dhawan charged out to heave it over long-on. Big six. Dhawan has put on a show so far

Jayant Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, oh superb shot. Drifting in on leg stump, and Dhawan just whips it over midwicket. It was too full from Jayant, and so he was right to the pitch of it. Didn't have to worry about playing against the turn

Rahul Chahar to Dhawan, out Bowled!! That looked a good shout for leg-before, and probably would've been given. But the umpire didn't need to bother eventually, as Dhawan managed to drag it back into the stumps somehow. Leg-break that straightened on middle, Dhawan missed his reverse-sweep and was struck low on the pad. It then ricocheted onto his gloves and was deflected back into the stumps. Dhawan b Rahul Chahar 35(22) [4s-5 6s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Holes out at long-on. Advanced down for a big shot, not quite getting to the pitch of the leg-break, so it came right off the toe-end from Shaw. With the hardness of the ball fading, and with both openers dismissed, it's getting difficult for Delhi now. Prithvi Shaw c Hardik Pandya b Rahul Chahar 20(24) [4s-2]

Krunal Pandya to Munro, out Bowled!! Yorked! 108kph from Krunal again as he fires it in from round the wicket, and it slips right underneath Munro who was late on the ball. Knocks over the base of off stump. His struggle at the crease, worth 9 balls, ends. Munro b Krunal Pandya 3(9)

Rabada to Rohit, FOUR, classy from Rohit. Displaying pure elegance. Half-volley from Rabada at 149.4kph, immense bat-speed from Rohit as he props forward and times the drive sublimely through extra cover. Just rocketed away to the fence
Mishra to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, gets as low as possible and scoops the full ball to the left of the keeper, timed it well and the pace on the ball took care of the rest
Rabada to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, slower ball bouncer and SKY had just ample time to pick that off the back foot, he arches slightly and ramps it over the keeper with a touch of delicacy

Rabada to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Pant!! Excellent reflexes from Pant, KG has his man! Goes wide of the crease and digs the short ball into the surface, doesn't get as much bounce and the ball grips enough to mess SKY's plans to scoop it over the keeper. Takes the toe-end and flies to the right of Pant who adjusts nicely to pouch it safe on the dive. Suryakumar Yadav c Pant b Rabada 26(27) [4s-2]
Rabada to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, that's a gimme from Rabada! 144ks slipping down the leg-side, KP helps it on its away with a fine tickle off his pads to the fine leg fence
Chris Morris to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, fuller, wider, squeezed, four! Bowls it quick and full, the quicker hands of the batter come into play and squirt the ball past point for a four. Much needed one

K Paul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, does he have the hands of an artisan? Because that was crafty. Length delivery at the sticks, Krunal Pandya creates room and just opens the bat face at the last moment to run it down past the short third fielder
K Paul to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, walloped! The latex-laden iron wrists come into play and whip the ball away between long-on and deep mid for a four

K Paul to Hardik Pandya, SIX, slower delivery and Hardik Pandya has smacked it over long-off. The whirlwind of the arms into the shot and it took the ball sailing into the stands. Length balls are supposed to go the journey. Hardik is just being the postman..the most powerful one I suppose

Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, SIX, patent those quick strong tentacles! Low full toss, missed the mark by an inch and has to pay for it. Whips it over deep backward square for a sixer. Cruel stuff from the batter. Four inch perfect deliveries and you miss one ball and are made to pay for it

Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, misses the mark again and overcompensates with a full toss. That was helped on its way over the short fine fielder. Hardik hasn't been missing anything though. Anything in his range has been disappearing

Rabada to Hardik Pandya, SIX, wow wow wow! The helicopter has crash landed into the hearts of DC fans. That was a superb blow. Stays deep in his crease, and those steely wrists take the ball over the fence

Rabada to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Pant!! And Rabada has his man. The pacer's ego was hurt. And he retorts with a bumper. Hardik Pandya is late on it and the ball scooped up for the keeper to take it. Superb bouncer as it was at the body and cramped the batter for room. Hardik Pandya c Pant b Rabada 32(15) [4s-2 6s-3]

Rabada to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, length delivery just outside off and has been whipped from there. Difficult shot to call but was a hybrid of the helicopter that his brother had played a few balls back. Bisected the gap between deep square and deep mid
Rabada to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, throws his bat at a length delivery and gets it past the man at point for a four. MI are running away with the show here

Chris Morris to Rohit, FOUR, 8000 runs in T20s for Rohit, reaches the milestone in a streaky fashion. Pitched up just outside off, Rohit throws his bat hard seeking for a swing downtown, gets a thick inside edge which misses the stumps and runs away to the fine leg fence

Chris Morris to de Kock, FOUR, Morris misses his mark and de Kock dispatches it duly to the fence. Hurls in a low full toss just outside off, de Kock strides out and drills it - skews it off the bottom part but enough to beat mid-off

Chris Morris to de Kock, SIX, connects and connects well. This time gets on top of the bounce of this length delivery, takes on the short ball and hacks it with ferocity into the deep square leg stands. This should get him going

Ishant to Rohit, FOUR, doesn't get it where he intended, however still collects a boundary. Back of a length delivery, holds up a touch on the pitch and Rohit is through his pull short early. Ends up trimming it off the cue-end past mid-off

K Paul to de Kock, SIX, short and butchered into the crowd at deep square leg. Nothing delivery from Paul, went short but it lacked pace. de Kock was taking a stride down the pitch and it sits up pretty well for him. Launches it powerfully for a maximum

K Paul to Rohit, no ball, SIX, what was that? Seemed like it slipped out of Paul's hands. Delivers a waist-high full toss, Rohit gets into a great position and slams the pull towards deep square leg. Morris, the fielder was setting himself near the fence but it soars over his head for a six. It's called a no-ball and it also brings up the 50-run stand between Rohit and de Kock - their third consecutive half-century partnership

Mishra to Rohit, out Bowled!! Peach from Mishra. Absolute peach. Knocks over Rohit's middle-stump with a ripping leg-break and he's off. 150th wicket for Mishra in IPL - only the second bowler to achieve that feat. What a start for him and DC draw first blood. It was pitched on middle and leg, Rohit was waiting on the back foot and misjudges it. It also stayed low and spun sharply to make it difficult for the MI captain as he was rooted to the crease. Rohit b Mishra 30(22) [4s-3 6s-1]

Axar to Cutting, out Lbw!! Cutting misses a sweep and is trapped plumb in front. He doesn't even bother to review and walks off. So, the promotion not working for MI. Always dangerous to sweep someone like Axar, who is a skiddy customer and very accurate. Cutting premeditated it, sank low and it just zipped through quicker to rap him on the pad. Too quick for the Australian as he failed to get any bat on it. Umpire Nigel Llong raises his index finger and he's spot on. It was crashing the middle stump and Mumbai have lost two wickets in two overs. Cutting lbw b Axar 2(4)

Mishra to de Kock, FOUR, picks the gap does Quinton de Kock, it was full and in his zone - he goes down on one knee and hammers it over mid-wicket to ping it in the gap between long-on and deep square. Smart batting!

Axar to Suryakumar Yadav, out de Kock Run Out!! Needless stuff from Mumbai. Will this prove to be a game-changing moment? SKY cut this flat delivery straight to Rabada at backward point and he instantly ambled forward before aborting his sprint midway down the pitch, de Kock though was committed on the run and he kept racing to the other end seamlessly. Rabada spotted the hara-kiri and fired a smart throw to Pant who relayed it back to the bowler to catch de Kock a country mile short of his crease. de Kock run out (Rabada/Pant/Axar) 35(27) [4s-2 6s-2]

Steyn to Chris Lynn, 1 run, dropped first ball! 140ks away swinger from Steyn and Chris Lynn was caught poking without any feet movement, a thick edge flies to the right of Stoinis at first slip who gets a hand but fails to cling onto it
Steyn to Narine, leg byes, FOUR, inswinger on middle and leg, Narine hops and gets a fine tickle on the thigh pad and Steyn's pace takes care of the rest

Steyn to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Kohli!! Steyn is thrilled to bits and he totally deserves all of it. A full inswinger and Chris Lynn's lack of feet movement meant he chipped the drive straight down the throat of Kohli at mid-off. Came right off the cue end. Chris Lynn c Kohli b Steyn 1(2)
Navdeep Saini to Narine, FOUR, clears his front leg and thrashes the pitched up delivery past the non-striker. Brute power from Narine!
Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, this short ball sits up nicely outside off and Rana takes full toll of it, maintains solid base and swat-pulls it in the gap through mid-wicket
Chahal to Nitish Rana, FOUR, short ball on leg, Rana goes down on his knee and hacks it over square leg
Chahal to Nitish Rana, FOUR, goes the other way round! Changes grips and goes for the reverse hit, ends up getting a top-edge that flies over short third man. Four more for the left hander

Chahal to Uthappa, no run, run-out chance missed! Uthappa is struggling out in the middle. The required run rate is out of their reach now! He was trying to flick the slider but got struck on his pads. Rana wanted a single but the striker wasn't up for it. Nitish was almost halfway down the track and had Chahal collected the throw from Parthiv, it would have been curtains for him
Stoinis to Nitish Rana, FOUR, short and punished! Width on offer outside off, Rana plays a upper cut and sends this loosener to the boundary at deep point. Still no six in this innings

Stoinis to Uthappa, out Caught by Negi!! That brings an end to Uthappa's struggle. Finally! This innings has actually taken the life out of the chase. Too much to do! Guess even Russell can't do anything from here on. A short ball around off, Uthappa goes for a pull and mistimes it horribly. Negi at deep square leg takes a comfortable catch and out walks Dre Russ to a huge cheer from the crowd. Uthappa c Negi b Stoinis 9(20) [4s-1]

Chahal to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Rana keeps getting those boundaries! KKR need a few more of these. Was a loopy legbreak down the leg side and the left hander sweeps it past the fielder at short fine leg, getting a move on. Slowly but surely

Chahal to A Russell, SIX, first six of the innings! Any guesses, who has hit it? It's Dre Russ and that's his 31st six of the tournament. A floated delivery outside off, the batsman goes down on his knee and pumps it over wide long-off for a flat six

Navdeep Saini to A Russell, FOUR, square-cut! Short in length outside off, Russell makes room and absolutely powers it past the man at point. That went to the boundary ropes before any of the fielders could blink their eye
Chahal to A Russell, SIX, just look at the power of this man! This wasn't middled, whatsoever. Was a loopy delivery around middle and leg, Russell goes down on his knee and pumps it over long-on
Chahal to A Russell, SIX, successive sixes for the big man! The crowd is loving this. Russell takes on the leggie and smokes it over his head for a massive six, couldn't have hit it any straighter

Chahal to A Russell, SIX, hat-trick of sixes for Dre Russ! His arrival at the crease has infused some life in this chase. Should have come much earlier. Another juicy legbreak by Chahal and the power-hitter sends it sailing over the long-on fence for six more. This was the cleanest of the lot. 20 runs of that over
Navdeep Saini to Nitish Rana, FOUR, boundaries flowing from both ends now! Rana goes deep in his crease and bludgeons the length delivery past the man at long-on. Good connection there!
Navdeep Saini to Nitish Rana, SIX, Rana brings up his fifty in style! Latches on to the short ball and smokes it over long-on for a massive six. His 8th IPL fifty, this is insane!

Navdeep Saini to Nitish Rana, SIX, in the previous over Russell was striking 'em big, it's Rana in this one. A juicy full toss around off and Rana has hacked it over deep mid-wicket for another towering six. He's asking for a waist-high no ball but replays confirm it wasn't one
Siraj to A Russell, FOUR, hammered! Russell pounces on the width on offer and slams it past point. His front foot was in the air like a flamingo when he connected this one

Siraj to A Russell, SIX, 150 up for Kolkata Knight Riders! Pitched up around off, Russell reaches out for it and tonks it over long-off - possibly for the longest six of the night. Chants of Kay, Kay, Aar all round the stadium!
Steyn to Nitish Rana, SIX, Steyn goes the distance! Pitches this one on a full length around off and Rana goes down on his knee to pound it over long-off, over the fence comfortably
Steyn to Nitish Rana, SIX, that's a home-run! Goes for the slower one and concedes six more. Rana goes deep in his crease and towers it right over the bowler's head. It's raining sixes, literally

Steyn to Nitish Rana, FOUR, 18 runs of Steyn's final over! KKR need 43 off the remaining two. Full in length outside off, Rana pounces on the opportunity once again and thumps it over the infield at extra cover. That almost went the distance. Dre Russ back on strike

Stoinis to A Russell, SIX, finally gets one right! Short in length and Russell makes sure to send it over the deep mid-wicket fence. Slapped for a flat six by the big man. So much power behind that shot

Stoinis to A Russell, SIX, anothe fifty for the incredible Hulk! This is the second fastest fifty in IPL 2019. Right into the slot this length ball and it's been smoked over the bowler's head for another magnificent blow

Stoinis to A Russell, SIX, what a match this is proving to be! One of the best of the season. Right into the slot yet again and Russell who's watching the ball like a hawk powers it down the ground. The power behind that blow would be enough to clear the fence. 24 runs needed of the final over

Moeen Ali to A Russell, SIX, four sixes were needed off the final 4 balls and here's the first one of the lot. A floated delivery around off, Russell holds his shape and tonks it over long-on, just clears the fence

Moeen Ali to A Russell, out A Russell Run Out!! Russell walks back after playing a gem. So near yet so far. He did all that was possible, but even that wasn't enough. Swings this one to deep mid-wicket and finds him short at the bowler's end as Kohli fires in a rocket throw at the bowler's end. A Russell run out (Kohli/Moeen Ali) 65(25) [4s-2 6s-9]
Steyn to Narine, FOUR, makes room, creates his own width and smashes the length delivery through covers. Simple cricket!
Steyn to Narine, FOUR, connects this time and although it hasn't met the middle, Narine's muscled it in the gap between mid-on and mid-wicket to send it racing along to the turf
Steyn to Narine, FOUR, gets a hint of width outside off, Narine throws the kitchen sink and the top-edge flies to the third man fence in a giffy, no chance for the fielder in the deep

Moeen Ali to Nitish Rana, SIX, RCB beat KKR by 10 runs! Let me take a breather! An offbreak by Moeen and Rana ends the match with a maximum by smoking it down the ground. Not enough though as the Royal Challengers clinch their second win of the season

Navdeep Saini to Narine, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Sees Narine making room and pounds the short ball wide of off-stump, Narine couldn't control his instincts having cleared his front leg way too early, finds a thick top-edge on the swat pull. All Parthiv Patel needed to do was amble back a few inches to pounch the catch, good pace from Navdeep Saini. Narine c Parthiv Patel b Navdeep Saini 18(16) [4s-4]
Steyn to Shubman Gill, FOUR, stands tall and slaps a 137ks good length delivery past Virat Kohli at mid-off, played it with a flat bat and managed to pierce the gap between mid-off and extra cover

Steyn to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Kohli!! Juggling take by Virat Kohli. RCB have three, Steyn has two. Pinned this full ball at the base of off-stump asking the youngster to go aerial if he can, Gill obliges and seeks to loft it over the infield but doesn't get any timing on that. Skews it off the cue end and it loops up over mid-off where Kohli gathers the rebound with his left hand after having juggled it twice on the first attempt. Shubman Gill c Kohli b Steyn 9(11) [4s-1]
Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, errs in length a fraction and Rana is onto it in a flash. Sees the ball dip right in his arc (fuller length) and thumps the drive square over backward point

Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, lovely shot by Rana! Pitched on a full length outside off, Rana eyes the covers boundary and lifts this one over the infield. No fielders in the deep and that shall be four runs for the left hander

Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, there you go! Uthappa breaks the string of dots with a sublime boundary. Makes a hint of room, stays leg-side of the full delivery and clobbers it through extra cover with ease

Narine to Kohli, no run, KKR's LBW review. Narine gets this to rip in big, beats Kohli's flick and finds his front pad. Now, it's struck him in front of leg, it's hit the knee roll as well in a massive stride. But it's not needed much convincing for the bowler or DK to take it up. In fact it's missed the leg-stump by another cool two stumps

A Russell to Kohli, SIX, imperious from Kohli. Russell peppers it short, Kohli climbs into a great position and seizes on it. Muscling it some ten rows back over deep square leg. Dismissive from the Indian captain
Chawla to Moeen Ali, SIX, Chawla offers a little bit of flight and Ali goes big. Down on his knees, gets maximum connection and pummels it over long-on.

Narine to Moeen Ali, FOUR, that's fortuitous for Ali. Narine fires it in, Ali was setting up for a wild slog and goes hard. It cuts him for room and the batsman gets a thick inside edge which shaves the leg-stump and runs away to the fine leg fence
Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, SIX, smoked over deep mid-wicket. Kuldeep flights it teasingly outside off, Ali sinks low and gets under it to smack it all the way for a maximum

Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, FOUR, finesse followed by power. So smart from Ali, saw the quicker ball and stays rooted to the crease. Uses the pace and opens his bat face to guide it in the pocket between backward point and short third man
Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, 1 run, biffed away to long-off and that brings the 50-run stand between the duo

Prasidh to Kohli, 1 run, fullish just outside off, Kohli drives it to mid-off and takes the single. Fifty for Kohli, his 37th half-century in the IPL and he gets a rousing reception from the Kolkata crowd. The RCB dug-out stands and applauds, Kohli waves his bat around to soak it all in

Prasidh to Kohli, FOUR, leading edge and it balloons over short third man. Got to feel for the bowler, set him up really well. Good length delivery, seaming in and just straightens off the pitch. Kohli was aiming for an across-the-hoick and lost his shape. Thick edge and gets away fortunately as it soars over the fielder's head before rolling away to the fence
Prasidh to Moeen Ali, FOUR, another edge and another four. Shortish and moved away just enough, Ali swings his bat and gets an outside edge which loops over the keeper
Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, FOUR, hammered past long-off. Flighted outside off, Ali lowers his stance and reaches out to smack it in the gap. Even Dre Russ can't stop that

Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, SIX, Ali is teeing off now. Reaches his fifty in style. His 3rd IPL half-century. Slower and Kuldeep went wider of off, Ali goes low and hacks it powerfully over cow corner
Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, FOUR, wow! Ali is full flow here. Kuldeep is not learning. Pitches it up in the slot, Ali keeps a solid base and dumps it straight down the ground

Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, SIX, it's raining fours and sixes here at the Eden Gardens. Kuldeep is being taken to the cleaners. Looped up just outside off, Ali shuffles across and blasts it over long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, SIX, wow! This is brutal hitting from Ali. Third six off the over. Again Kuldeep hurls it quick and in the arc for Moeen, who waits deep in his crease and tonks it over long-off. "Merciless" is the word which pops up on the giant screen

Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Prasidh!! And Kuldeep Yadav has the final laugh but the damage has been done. What a knock from Ali. He's put RCB in a prime position. Kuldeep went round the wicket and slowed it up, Ali sits low and attempts a big heave. Miscues it big time and skies it as far as long-on. Prasidh neatly settles under it and some respite for KKR. Moeen Ali c Prasidh b Kuldeep Yadav 66(28) [4s-5 6s-6]
Gurney to Kohli, FOUR, swivel-pulled past short fine leg. Off-pace delivery from Gurney, too short and down leg. Kohli pulls it hard and places it in the gap
Gurney to Kohli, FOUR, squeezes the drive in the gap between cover and point. Wide yorker from Gurney, Kohli gets his bat down quickly and times it superbly to pick up his second boundary of the over

Gurney to Kohli, SIX, thumps it straight down the ground. Nothing delivery from Gurney, pitches it up and in the zone for Kohli, who extends his arms and goes with a clean bat swing to send it all the way for a six
Narine to Kohli, SIX, tripe. Drags it short and Kohli is so quick to latch onto that. Rocks back and dismisses it way back into the deep mid-wicket stands
Prasidh to Kohli, SIX, he's getting close to the hundred now. Krishna sends down a length delivery, easy-peasy for Kohli. Just stands tall and dispatches it over long-on

Prasidh to Kohli, FOUR, shot of the innings so far. Flamboyance from Kohli. Krishna corrects his length and wafts it full outside off. Kohli bends low, chases it and drives it off the meat through extra cover. It just zoomed away to the fence in a jiffy

Prasidh to Stoinis, FOUR, it doesn't matter for Stoinis. He joins the party as well. Walks across his stumps, waits deep and absolutely spanks it wide of long-off, who gives up the chase. Another massive over, 19 off it

Gurney to Stoinis, FOUR, Kuldeep is having a forgettable outing. Slower short ball, Stoinis pivots back and pulls it uppishly. Lands in front of Kuldeep at deep square leg, who perhaps gets caught in two-minds. Doesn't attempt a catch and neither does he gets his body in the line. It sprang up and loops over his head to the fence
Gurney to Stoinis, SIX, swatted down the ground for a maximum. Full and in the swinging zone, Stoinis gets forward and murders it straight down the ground for a maximum

Gurney to Kohli, FOUR, the moment has arrived. Hundred for Kohli. His first this season and look at him go. Leaps up, roars in delight and brandishes his bat. Even the Kolkata crowd are going bonkers. Special knock from the Indian captain. Shuffles across his stumps and whiplashes it through mid-wicket. Kuldeep's miserable day continues as he fails to stop the ball near the fence

Prasidh to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, ah, you don't nail yorkers better -- 144kph on the base of off. Parthiv desperately jams his bat down, somehow getting an inside tickle past his stumps, and there's nothing fine leg's running dive can do to stop it either

Gurney to Kohli, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Finally, he's been dismissed. Fullish on middle, probably a tired shot from Kohli as he can't middle this swipe. It comes off the bottom and picks out Shubman at deep mid-wicket. Kohli c Shubman Gill b Gurney 100(58) [4s-9 6s-4]

Prasidh to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, gets away. Krishna bangs it short again outside off, which Patel throws his hands out to - more in getting out of this non-self-imposed shell - and slaps it powerfully over point. It also helps his cause that it is the tiny Piyush Chawa fielding there

Narine to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Parthiv and a slog can't be kept away for long. He'd tried it against Prasidh's pace and taken blows on his tummy, he does against Narine, only for a top-edge. One-kneed, stepping away from his stumps and then swipes across the line. Gets only height on this miscue, for Rana - at deep mid-wicket - to run and juggle. Parthiv Patel c Nitish Rana b Narine 11(11) [4s-2]
Narine to Kohli, FOUR, hard pull, straight to deep mid-wicket. Yea, simple, single. But no, Gill messes up, bending low a little too casually and letting the ball slip through
Prasidh to Akshdeep Nath, SIX, sits up short. And Nath isn't hanging around waiting, takes it off the front foot and muscles it uppishly over deep mid-wicket

Prasidh to Kohli, FOUR, 143.8kph. And Kohli's being given a real workout here -- this time undoing him on a flick across the line, only for the genuine leading edge flying away through an empty slip cordon

Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, FOUR, loopy dip, but Kohli's just too smart. He runs down, maybe yorking himself in the process, but why bother when you have bottom-hands as good as these .. drills it straight down
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, FOUR, more flight, this time drifting wide outside off. Kohli moves the other way, piling on the overcook to carve it away through sweeper

A Russell to Akshdeep Nath, out Caught by Uthappa!! Well this was coming. Nath was scratching around, playing a couple of shots every ball, and he succumbs to it again. It's more of a skidder this time, cramping Nath for room as he pulls across the line, only to sky the top-edge. Uthappa runs in for it, so does Russell and neither call. But Uthappa's just a touch quicker, plucking it from right over Russell's nose. Akshdeep Nath c Uthappa b A Russell 13(15) [6s-1]
Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, SIX, good feet use in coming down the pitch and then he milks his form. Swings, lofting a hoick over long-on, and just over the fielder's jump

D Kulkarni to de Kock, FOUR, fifty for de Kock. Second against Rajasthan this season. Can this be a match winning one? He knew fine leg was square, so he walked across his stumps and scooped the slower delivery to the vacant fine leg fence

Unadkat to de Kock, SIX, smashed! Right in the slot for de Kock - full and angled into the pads, he had made room and then his arms came down at a great speed to send the ball sailing over deep mid-wicket

Binny to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he must be relieved. Binny tries a leg-cutter and ends up bowling a full toss, Suryakumar takes a step out to get under it and slams it straight back, one bounce and over the ropes

Binny to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by D Kulkarni!! Gone! He had no choice but to go after the bowling. There is plenty of batting still left for Mumbai. Slower short of length delivery and Suryakumar is backing away, all cramped up he tries to pull but only manages a top-edge to deep backward square, Kulkarni covers ground to his right and takes a well-judged catch. Suryakumar Yadav c D Kulkarni b Binny 34(33) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to de Kock, out Caught by Stokes!! Back to back wickets for Rajasthan. Two new batsmen at the crease. Not what Mumbai would have wanted. de Kock needed to be smarter and batted through. He decides to take on Gopal's googly and miscues it horribly towards long-on, Stokes settles under it and he ain't dropping those. de Kock c Stokes b Shreyas Gopal 65(47) [4s-6 6s-2]

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, Archer drops his second catch of the match! de Kock scored 65, how much will Hardik score? He had slogged the length delivery to deep mid-wicket where Jofra puts down a sitter. Not a great day for him in the outfield

Unadkat to Pollard, SIX, insult to injury! Short of a length around middle and leg, Pollard stays put and hacks it over deep mid-wicket for a 98m six. There wasn't much power behind the shot, it was the timing that was sublime

Unadkat to Pollard, out Bowled!! Unadkat has the last laugh and boy look at him, he's pumped! After bowling a length delivery the left arm pacer comes back strongly to get KP with a slower one. Pollard never really read it and was too early in his shot. Tried to play across the line as the off-cutter went through him and took down the sticks. Pollard b Unadkat 10(7) [6s-1]

Unadkat to Cutting, FOUR, nicely done! Cutting's off the mark with a boundary. That was all about precision. A length delivery angled across him and the Australian all-rounder guides it through the gap at point and short third man. Couldn't have placed it any better

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, first one of the innings for Pandya! Makes the most out of the pace on this ball. Shuffles in his crease and flicks the ball over backward square leg. No fielders in the deep and that shall be a boundary for Hardik

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, edged away to the fence! Angled across the batsman outside off, Pandya throws his bat at it and gets an outside edge past Samson. Although the keeper dived, he couldn't quite reach there. Can't keep a slip either with just 10 balls to go

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, third dropped catch by Archer! It's proving to be a disastrous day for him. Pandya had top-edged the slog to wide long-on where the lanky pacer puts down another sitter. Unbelievable!
Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, SIX, stand and deliver! On a length around off, Pandya lines up for it and clubs it right over the bowler's head. Just manages to clear the fence

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, out Lbw!! Rajasthan review against Hardik! Looks very close but might probably be umpire's call. In fact, it's out. Pitching in line, impact in line and it's hitting the leg-stump. Terrific yorker by Jofra as Hardik couldn't connect his flick. The ball struck the sole of his shoe and replays confirm that he's a dead duck. Hardik Pandya lbw b Jofra Archer 23(15) [4s-2 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Rohit, FOUR, top-edge and four, pushed through quicker and sliding down leg, Rohit was down on his knees as he swept, off the top-edge and went wide of the fielder in the circle at short fine

Shreyas Gopal to Rohit, out Caught&Bowled!! Innocuous dismissal for Rohit, lovely stuff from Shreyas - this was the wrong 'un, Rohit came down the track, didn't get close to the ball, with bat and pad close-by, he pushed with hard hands, a simple lobe back at the bowler and it's celebration time amongst the Royals. Rohit c and b Shreyas Gopal 5(7) [4s-1]

Jofra Archer to Cutting, SIX, Mumbai Indians post a competitve score of 161/5 as Cutting finishes it off in style. Gets in a good position and tonks the length delivery across the line. A home-run over deep mid-wicket and Mumbai will be pretty satisfied with the end score

Shreyas Gopal to de Kock, 1 run, a chance and Jofra Archer can't quite hold on, it was always going to be tough - he came running in from long-on, slid forward, goth both hands and then the ball bounced out. A mistimed heave from de Kock as he looked to break the shackles - got it horribly wrong and nearly was dismissed
D Kulkarni to de Kock, FOUR, cracking shot, tad too full from Dhawal, de Kock takes a step forward and then drills it back at the bowler, too pacy though and Dhawal has no chance in stopping it
D Kulkarni to de Kock, FOUR, lovely, tad too short and wide of off, de Kock came down the track, made room as he did so and cracked it square past cover-point for a boundary

D Kulkarni to de Kock, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, Dhawal tried to follow de Kock as he came down the track, too short though and it's helped off the pads - over short fine and rolls away to the ropes
D Kulkarni to de Kock, SIX, beautifully played, poor ball from Dhawal, short and at the stumps, de Kock swivels across and then pulls it high and over backward square leg for a maximum
Jofra Archer to de Kock, FOUR, cracking shot, too full and too wide of off, de Kock gets well forward and drills it over cover, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, leg byes, FOUR, this is poor bowling from Unadkat, might not go against him, but it's still a boundary against the team. Too full and on Suryakumar's pads, he was looking to flick and missed, brushed the pads and beat the diving keeper
Binny to de Kock, FOUR, that's a poor ball to end the over, short and on de Kock's pads, he gets inside the line and pulls it fine - past Archer's dive at short fine
Riyan Parag to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, much needed for Suryakumar and Mumbai. Picked the carrom ball on the sticks, cleared the front leg and smoked it through the line straight back over the bowler

Hardik Pandya to Samson, FOUR, Sanju wasting no time, gets going with a first-ball boundary. Latches on to the length delivery and pulls it through mid-wicket without much hassle, beats the sprinter in the deep quite convincingly

Hardik Pandya to Samson, FOUR, two in two for Samson! Uses the pace on this short of a length delivery and glides it past the fielder at short third man. The dive by the man inside the ring wasn't able to stop the ball from making it to the fence
Krunal Pandya to Samson, FOUR, Samson taking on the Pandya brothers. Makes room for himself and lofts the tossed up delivery straight over the bowler's head, four more for the youngster
Krunal Pandya to Samson, FOUR, beautiful shot! Goes inside-out and times this fullish delivery over extra cover. Was timed so neatly that it almost went the distance

Krunal Pandya to Riyan Parag, FOUR, promising start here from Riyan Parag. A couple of boundaries already. This is flat at the stumps, and he's down on one knee to put the slog-sweep away through deep midwicket
Krunal Pandya to Smith, 2 runs, short-arm pulls this wide of long-on, placed it well enough for a couple. Oooh, Parag was gone at the non-striker's end had there been a direct-hit

Hardik Pandya to Riyan Parag, FOUR, yup, getting cheeky isn't a bad way of breaking the shackles. Pandya gets a touch predictable with one good length too many, and Parag shuffles quickly, realizes fine leg is inside the circle and scoops it away over him
Hardik Pandya to Riyan Parag, FOUR, more leg-lined, but Parag's quick to make room this time, and his outside edge is thick and hard enough in the wafty drive to run away through the empty slip

Rahul Chahar to Riyan Parag, SIX, ah, the pump. Chahar drags his length back, and Parag makes it worse with his own rock inside. And then adjusts to the scoot in this as well as he crouches, heaves, a long way over cow corner

Rahul Chahar to Smith, 1 run, knocked out to mid-on, where Chahar is quick to run across, swoop low, gather and then fire it back at the non-striker's as well. A direct hit would've ruined all of Smith's hard work
Rahul Chahar to Riyan Parag, 1 run, high wide full toss, carved away through sweeper
Malinga to Riyan Parag, FOUR, so now some feet as well. This kid's putting up a show here, stepping away from the line, getting under the good length to go inside-out over extra cover

Bumrah to Smith, FOUR, wow. So damn neat. A very tight cramping back of a length stuff, which Smith waits, and waits on, lets it get really close to him before opening up his bat face and guiding it perfectly behind point, and toying around with the angle for third man to cut off either

Bumrah to Smith, 2 runs, 144kph, full, just outside off. Smith tries driving through the line, through extra cover, but will settle for the inside edge running down to mid-wicket. Comeback. Captaincy. Fifty

Hardik Pandya to Smith, out Riyan Parag Run Out!! 1 run completed. Rocket armer Cutting. Smith actually does decently to chip it softly through mid-wicket, and calls for the second immediately. But Cutting's quick to get to it and fire it back really flat and one-bounced to Pandya, waiting right next to the stumps. Well, well, well, Parag ain't becoming the youngest ever IPL 50-ian. But leave that, have the favourites turned? Riyan Parag run out (Cutting/Hardik Pandya) 43(29) [4s-5 6s-1]
Hardik Pandya to Smith, FOUR, the horrors of a short-wide combo. Smith arches back, throws his hands out and smashes a cut wide of backward point's left reach

Bumrah to Turner, out Lbw!! Duck. Duck. And Ashton Turner's Indian journey after the miracle at Mohali has been a real disaster. Bumrah - meanwhile - is doing what he does best, fire it in quick, dead straight on the stumps. Turner doesn't help his cause either, shuffling a little too much and then getting beaten for pace as well as he tries to tuck it away. The mother of plumb. Turner lbw b Bumrah 0(1)

Malinga to Binny, FOUR, aand it doesn't EVER mater where your fielders are when the ball is a very friendly full toss drifting down leg. Binny tries to sweep, getting a tickle somewhere off something to run away really fine .. and we thought 160 was too many!

Krunal Pandya to Samson, FOUR, 15 runs of Krunal's first over! Rajasthan couldn't have asked for a better start. Another floated delivery around off, that doesn't spin much. Samson moves to an extent and creams it through the gap at covers yet again. Three boundaries in the over and the Royals are off to a flier

Malinga to Rahane, leg byes, 1 run, Mumbai Indians review against Rahane! Rohit took his time, had a discussion with his team mates and signals for the review with just a second to go. Looks a bad call though. Rahane was way outside his crease when the ball struck him and the replays confirm the ball to be missing the stumps by a fair margin. He was trying to flick across the line but got beaten as the ball struck him on the pads. Impact was umpire's call and it was going over the stumps

Malinga to Samson, byes, FOUR, de Kock apologizes as he makes a mess of it. Should have been stopped by him, but instead it's four byes. The boundaries are leaking and Royals wouldn't mind it. Samson was looking to guide the slower delivery through third man but got beaten due to the lack of pace. The keeper couldn't gather it cleanly as he parried it away to the fence in the process

Rahul Chahar to Rahane, FOUR, welcome into the attack Mr. Chahar! A short legbreak with width on offer, Rahane eyes lit up on seeing that and he chops it through the gap at point and short third man, sublime
Rahul Chahar to Rahane, FOUR, the leg spinner has been put under pressure right away! Rahane goes down on his knee and sweeps the tossed up delivery over square leg, four more

Rahul Chahar to Rahane, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Chahar comes into the attack and gets the breakthrough straightaway. Got three crucial wickets in the previous match too. Invites the batsman by tossing this one outside off and Rahane falls for it. Chips it towards cover where Suryakumar takes a catch diving forward. Rahane c Suryakumar Yadav b Rahul Chahar 12(12) [4s-2]

Rahul Chahar to Samson, FOUR, has been an exhibition of finesse by Samson so far... It's not about power always. A floated delivery down the leg side and it's been lapped down to the fine leg boundary by Sanju. He's moved on to 26 off 11 balls
Malinga to Smith, FOUR, lashes the cut between backward point and short third man. Short and wide from Malinga, and this time it was a normal pace delivery. Smith used that pace and carved it away

Malinga to Smith, FOUR, short of length outside off, punched through backward point. With this field - no protection deep on the off-side - there's no room to offer any width which Malinga has done a couple of times already

Markande to Smith, SIX, this is glorious from Smith. He wasn't to the pitch of this leg-break, but the timing is still so beautiful that it's gone all the way over wide long-on. The form seems to have come back along with the captaincy

Markande to Samson, SIX, incredible batting from the Royals. They're bossing this so far. Lavish off-drive from Samson, and his flourish has taken it all the way over wide long-off. Markande disappears for 15 in his first over

Rahul Chahar to Samson, out Caught by Pollard!! Advances down looking to go all the way, but Chahar hasn't allowed him to get to the pitch. As a result, there's some room for the ball to turn, which is enough to take the outside half of the bat. Goes straight up and MI couldn't have asked for anyone better than Pollard to get underneath. Desperately needed this wicket, the visitors. Samson c Pollard b Rahul Chahar 35(19) [4s-6 6s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Stokes, out Bowled!! Chops it back on! Poor from Stokes. Hardly has had his eye in, and tries to cut a leg-break from off stump. Gets inevitably cramped for room. Mumbai have more than an opening now, especially given Royals' track-record this season. Stokes b Rahul Chahar 0(2)
Markande to Smith, FOUR, short ball outside off, Smith capitalizes. He drags the pull in the gap between long-on and deep midwicket to ease the pressure

Markande to Riyan Parag, FOUR, short again from Markande, and Parag doesn't need to get his eye in to dispatch it. He rocks back and thwacks it wide of deep midwicket. Not the follow-up MI needed after that Chahar over
Sam Curran to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, sits up nicely in the slot. Shaw continues with his really high backlift, lofting a whack straight down the ground
Sam Curran to Dhawan, FOUR, 124.3kph, massive slip down leg. And Dhawan couldn't have asked for it easier, going through his full-blooded pick-up-and-swipe shot behind square
Murugan Ashwin to Dhawan, 1 run, knocks this googly in front of point for a quick single. Brings up his fifty too which is greatly appreciated by his teammates as well as the home crowd

Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's a clean strike by Iyer. Skipper versus skipper and the younger one wins the contest. Takes on Ash and thumps the floated delivery right over the bowler's head, straight as an arrow and over the ropes

Viljoen to Dhawan, FOUR, Delhi inching closer to the target! Dhawan is looking unstoppable, just like he was against KKR. Latches on to the short ball and swivel-pulls this one through backward square leg, beats the sprinter in the deep quite comfortably

Viljoen to Dhawan, out Caught by Ashwin!! That's a fantastic catch by Ashwin. Takes a well judged catch at mid-wicket running to his left. Even Gayle was circling around but it's the skipper who takes it eventually. Just as we were praising Dhawan for playing another gem of a knock he's thrown it away. Got outfoxed due to the slower delivery as he swung across the line and got a top-edge on his drag. He has done his job though. Should be a walk in the park for Delhi unless they face another dramatic batting collapse. Dhawan c Ashwin b Viljoen 56(41) [4s-7 6s-1]

Sam Curran to Pant, FOUR, misfield by Gayle and that shall be the first boundary of the innings for Pant. Was a slower short ball down the leg side and Pant helped it to short fine leg where Gayle got his hands to it and parried it away to the fine leg fence

Sam Curran to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Curran looks disappointed as Iyer ends the over with a boundary. Makes room for himself and slices the length delivery over short third man. There were two fielders stationed there but both were inside the circle. Toying with the field is Iyer at the moment. Just 36 needed off 5 overs

Viljoen to Pant, out Caught by Sam Curran!! Pant throws his wicket as he tries a fancy shot. Goes down on his knee to pick the length delivery over deep square leg but ends up getting a top-edge. Curran settles himself under it and pouches it safely. Hopefully the batsmen to follow next bat sensibly. There was no need for Pant to try out anything like this. Pant c Sam Curran b Viljoen 6(7) [4s-1]

Viljoen to Ingram, FOUR, safe shot by Ingram as he eyes the vacant deep mid-wicket boundary. A short ball around off, the southpaw stands tall and slogs it over mid-wicket. One bounce and over the fence for as Ingram gets his first boundary
