Viljoen to Ingram, FOUR, that's an excellent shot by Ingram. Was a yorker outside off and the South African squeezes it past the man at short third man. Gayle had no chance to even react as the ball raced past him and rushed into the fence

Viljoen to Ingram, FOUR, Ingram is finding the gaps in the field like a boss. A short ball at the hips and it's been dragged through deep square leg by the southpaw, second boundary of the over. He hasn't taken any risks either

Viljoen to Ingram, FOUR, another cracking shot to end the over. Backs away, makes room and crunches the overpitched delivery through cover-point for his third boundary of the over. The required run is down to 5 now

Shami to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, skipper leading from the front, brings up his 12th fifty in IPL. Gets a standing ovation from his team mates in the dug-out. Has been a responsible knock by the lad. Hooks the short ball to deep mid-wicket and gets to the milestone. Gets there and raises his bat to acknowledge the crowd

Shami to Ingram, out Bowled!! Sweet sound of timber! Ingram walks down the wicket to play this but Shami slips in yorker and nails it to perfection. The batsman couldn't do nothing there as the middle stump was uprooted. Is there a twist in the tale? Surely not! Ingram b Shami 19(9) [4s-4]

Shami to Axar, out Axar Run Out!! 1 run completed. This match is turning out to be a humdinger. Second wicket in as many balls. Axar plays this one with soft hands towards deep square leg and called for two. While charging back for the second Shami somewhat got in his way and hence the batsman couldn't really take off. Mayank fires in a throw at the striker's end and Patel is nowhere in the frame. Drama! Delhi don't like easy wins, is it? Axar run out (Agarwal/Rahul) 1(1)

Sam Curran to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Shreyas Iyer hits the winning runs - it's a boundary! Sixth win of the season for the Delhi Capitals as their captain sends this one away to the deep mid-wicket fence with a fantastic pull shot. Nerves of steel by the young skipper towards the closing stages. DC beat KXIP by 5 wickets

Shami to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, desperate ducking-hook. Damn fiery bouncer into the head, which Shaw in his attempt to get away from swings his bat mid-way, and surprise, surprise, connects really cleanly, flat and deep over fine leg
Shami to Dhawan, FOUR, and Dhawan and his cover drives. Shami floates it full, gives out width as well. Sliced, powerfully, and over extra cover's leap from within the circle

Viljoen to Dhawan, out Prithvi Shaw Run Out!! Confusion^confusion. Shikhar calls, runs half way down, but is ball-watching all through as he does. Shaw responds, only to be sent back. And hence when both of them are stuck half way down the pitch, Mandeep nails the direct hit. How did it get to Mandeep? Well, it was a msicued chip to cover. Prithvi Shaw run out (Mandeep) 13(11) [4s-1 6s-1]
Viljoen to Dhawan, FOUR, lucky edge. Dhawan charges down to open up a cut over the off-side, but the bounce gets big on him, and the outside splice is good enough to fly over the slip cordon

Viljoen to Dhawan, FOUR, nothing lucky here, it's a proper crunch. Viljoen goes shorter, but ends up dishing out a half tracker, which Dhawan can upper-cut now, and there being no third man helps his cause as well
Harpreet Brar to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan attacks the debutant off his very first ball. Dances down and launches him back over the long-off boundary
Harpreet Brar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that's superbly played. Waits on the ball and back-cuts it through backward point
Harpreet Brar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, back of a length, spinning away from off, Iyer steps back and punches it through the covers
Ashwin to Dhawan, FOUR, short ball at the stumps, real stinker to start his spell. Dhawan rocks back and smashes the pull through midwicket
Ashwin to Dhawan, 1 run, pulled away to deep midwicket

Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, no slip in place and this outside edge has run away for four. Grip and turn with the carrom ball for Ashwin, enough to find Iyer's outside edge and also enough to keep rolling into the ropes
Murugan Ashwin to Dhawan, FOUR, he's fetched this googly from outside leg stump and reverse-swept it through backward point. Incredible shot
Lamichhane to Rahul, SIX, massive, that's one way to greet the leg-spinner, Rahul backed away, lost his bottom hand but still has enough power to send the swipe high and over long-off for a maximum

Lamichhane to Rahul, FOUR, it's all one-handed from KL and he's getting the runs as well, flighted delivery outside off, he bent down low, used the bottom hand and then swept it over square leg for a boundary

Lamichhane to Rahul, out Stumped!! Appeal for a stumping and Pant looks confident. He's on the line and that means KL is OUT. That's some comeback from Lamichhane, a beaut of a leg-break, drifted in from outside off, dragged Rahul forward and then spun past his outside edge. Rahul was lunging forward in defence, dragged his right-foot out and Pant is quick enough to whip the bails - even as Rahul's feet stayed static on the line. Good bargain for Lamichhane, 10 runs and a big wicket so far. Rahul st Pant b Lamichhane 12(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

Lamichhane to Gayle, SIX, going, going and gone. No respite for Lamichhane today. Flighted just outside off, Gayle bends his back knee and slog sweeps it high into the night sky. These Kotla boundaries are not big enough for the Jamaican, for that matter which ground is

Lamichhane to Gayle, out Caught by Axar!! Stunning work! This is the perfect definition of team work by Ingram and Axar. Lamichhane has traveled a lot but will be relieved to see the back of Gayle. The wrong 'un which is fraction short, Gayle does not get enough power behind the pull shot, skies it to deep mid-wicket where Ingram is waiting, he takes it right on the edge of the boundary cushion and since the momentum was taking him over, he threw the ball all the way to Axar near long-on. The back hand flick was just perfect as Axar didn't have to move much. Huge moment in the game. Gayle c Axar b Lamichhane 69(37) [4s-6 6s-5]

Lamichhane to Sam Curran, out Caught&Bowled!! Second wicket in the over. What a day Lamichhane is having. Belted by KL, picked his wicket. Smashed around the park by Gayle, sent him back as well and now picks another. The googly which sticks in the surface a tad more than Curran expected, he is early into the back foot push and lobs a dolly back to Lamichhane. He flings it up and pumps his fist. Boy isn't he delighted. Sam Curran c and b Lamichhane 0(4)

Lamichhane to Ashwin, FOUR, lovely shot! Dropped short and Ashwin is quick to latch onto it, transfered his weight back and pulled it over the mid-wicket fielder, placement was perfect from the skipper

Lamichhane to Mandeep, 1 run, dropped! Rabada apologises. Half tracker and Mandeep could have hit it anywhere, instead he swivels and pulls it to deep backward square, Rabada misjudged it badly and tracked back before running in, dived forward and got his hands to it. But the ball did not stick. That would have been an impressive end to Lamichhane's spell

Mishra to Mandeep, FOUR, horrible bowling and that is putting it mildly. Rank long hop outside off and this time Mandeep does not miss out, he waits and holds his shape to slap it over extra cover, one bounce and over the ropes

Axar to Mandeep, out Stumped!! Some really smart bowling. Mandeep gives away his cards early, running down the pitch even before Axar gets into his delivery stride - allowing him all the time to fire it short and well outside off. Obvious miss, sneaking under the bat and Pant's gloves almost outdo Dhoni. Mandeep st Pant b Axar 30(27) [4s-1 6s-1]
Axar to Harpreet Brar, FOUR, well, well. Smashes his first IPL runs -- getting a juicy short-wide one to crash into, slapping it through extra cover
Rabada to Ashwin, FOUR, lots of clubbing in this. A 117.1kph slower cutter tried, digging it short, which Ashwin goes right behind to in mowing it very agriculturally into cow corner
Ishant to Harpreet Brar, FOUR, 139.8kph, corrects his overdose of wides with a shorter, but wide one nevertheless. Brar carves, uppishly, over extra cover

Rabada to Ashwin, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Skiddy 143.4kph bumper into the ribs. Ashwin had to go after everything, obviously it is the 20th over, and he tries a tennis-like-pull on this one. But can only mistime it to long-on, where Iyer, after misjudging, does well to dive in front to pluck it cleanly enough. Ashwin c Shreyas Iyer b Rabada 16(14) [4s-2]
Ishant to Gayle, FOUR, neatly done, Ishant took some pace off the ball and angled it across the left-hander, Gayle waited on it, played it with an open face and ran it past short third man

Ishant to Gayle, SIX, massive, that's the Gayle we know in the IPL - that's out of the ground, the knuckle ball from Ishant, on a length and just outside off, Gayle cleared his right leg and heaved it high and over long-on, 101m on that shot

Rabada to Harpreet Brar, SIX, top stuff. And to imagine this guy hasn't played a FC match yet .. he anticipates the quick bouncer, is quicker to pull it off his shoulder, smoking it so damn cleanly over deep square leg. Punjab > 160
Lamichhane to Gayle, FOUR, they're looking to attack Lamichhane, too short and too straight from the leg-spinner, Gayle rocks back and pulls it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Lamichhane to Gayle, FOUR, belted, Lamichhane got a hand onto it, but such was the fierceness of the shot - he could only get a hand onto it - tossed up on middle, Gayle pressed forward and drilled it back at the bowler, will go down as a half-chance
Lamichhane to Gayle, FOUR, too full and sliding down leg, Gayle bends half-way down and sweeps it fine - Ishant, at short fine dived over the ball and lets another boundary through
Lamichhane to Gayle, FOUR, 16 from the over, Lamichhane dropped this one short and well outside off, Gayle rocked back and punched it hard - into the gap wide of cover-point, no need to run for those

Rabada to Agarwal, out Caught by Rutherford!! This was always coming! Four dot balls and Mayank throws his wicket away, came down the track way too early - Rabada saw it and went short, good pace and good bounce - cramped for room, Mayank's attempted cross-batted swat went nowhere, straight up in the air and towards cover-point. The debutant Rutherford was under the ball, watched it like a hawk and completes the catch. Agarwal c Rutherford b Rabada 2(9)

Rabada to Miller, FOUR, streaky and four, on a good length and from round the wicket, Miller was late in getting his bat down, squirted off the inside edge and past short fine, runs away to the ropes in a hurry
Ishant to Gayle, FOUR, cracking shot, short of a length and well outside off, the slower ball from Ishant, punched off the back-foot and to the right of Shaw at cover-point

Mishra to Gayle, SIX, a rank long-hop and Gayle has sent it soaring over long-on. Mishra tries something funky, bowls a flat off-break on off, Gayle rocks back and pummels it high and over long-on for a maximum

Axar to Miller, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! One shot too many and KXIP batsmen are throwing away their wickets - trying to match Gayle's power. Not a smart shot from Miller, ran down the track, got himself too close to the ball, went through with the lofted on-drive, plenty of height but not the distance. Shaw settled underneath the skier at deep mid-wicket and holds on. What are KXIP trying to achieve? This isn't a 200 wicket for sure. Miller c Prithvi Shaw b Axar 7(5) [4s-1]
Mishra to Gayle, SIX, two gifts from Mishra and both have disappeared. Full toss just below the waist, Gayle says thank you very much and launches it into the stands near deep mid-wicket

Mishra to Gayle, 1 run, fifty for Gayle. He shows the sticker on his bat that says - Universe Boss. Job not done as Punjab need to bat deep and take them to a competitive total. Wrong 'un around leg-stump and Gayle sweeps it to deep backward square

Mishra to Gayle, SIX, another rubbish delivery from Mishra. Googly that is pitched halfway down, Gayle had ample time to pick his spot and it is cow corner, rocked back and pulled it all the way for a maximum

Axar to Mandeep, SIX, wow! That is a top shot from Mandeep. Flighted outside off, Mandeep bends low and gets under the ball, chips it with the spin over extra cover and the timing is such that it clears the rope

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that is not the place to bowl to Lynn or for that matter any batsman. Short and outside off, Lynn had the width and he slaps it hard through the packed off-side field. No need to run for that

Bhuvneshwar to Narine, FOUR, help yourself delivery and Narine does just that. In an attempt to go short, Bhuvi slips one on the hips, Narine with one leg up in the air pulls it past the man at short fine. Good start for KKR, 10 off the first over

Nadeem to Chris Lynn, FOUR, poor start from Nadeem. Half tracker and Lynn does not miss out, he plays the back foot punch past extra cover and the timing takes care of the rest. He relied on timing rather than power
Nadeem to Narine, SIX, another gift from Nadeem. Long hop and Narine had all the time to pick his spot, he rocks back and muscles the pull over deep square leg, just managed to clear the rope

Sandeep Sharma to Chris Lynn, FOUR, much needed boundary for KKR! Lynn latches on to the short ball and swivel-pulls it into the gap at deep mid-wicket. The ball drops just in front of the boundary cushions, such sweet was the timing

Sandeep Sharma to Rinku Singh, SIX, dropped and parried over the fence! Nadeem even before taking the catch was looking whether he was about to the touch the boundary. Lucky escape for the left hander batsman. A short ball that was pulled away to deep mid-wicket by him and as a result of Rinku's mess, he not only gets a life but also a six

Bhuvneshwar to Rinku Singh, FOUR, Rinku finally connects one. A wide delivery that was angled across the left hander who punches it past the fielder at cover. The fielder in the deep was way too square in order to cut this down

Sandeep Sharma to Rinku Singh, SIX, Rinku Singh brings up the 50-run stand with a maximum. Gets a low full and the southpaw makes sure to thump it over the long-on fence for a powerful six. The ball's lost in the crowd as the fourth umpire runs in with a box of used Kookaburras

Sandeep Sharma to Rinku Singh, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Rinku Singh departs after a handy knock! Time for Dre Russ to walk in next. Was a short ball around middle and leg and Rinku pulled it straight to deep mid-wicket. The Afghan leggie charges to his left and takes a fine sliding catch to bring an end to Singh's stay at the crease. Rinku Singh c Rashid Khan b Sandeep Sharma 30(25) [4s-1 6s-2]

Khaleel Ahmed to Chris Lynn, FOUR, another miscue but it won't matter. Lynn brings up his 9th fifty in IPL. Another slower cutter slanting away from the right-hander, Lynn throws the kitchen sink and gets a thick outside edge which flies over backward point and into the square third man fence

Khaleel Ahmed to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Williamson!! Lynn runs out of patience. Frustrated with a flurry of mistimed strokes he decides to smash this over cover and could only chip it inside the ring. Williamson runs to his left from cover and times his slide to perfection to claim a fine catch. Chris Lynn c Williamson b Khaleel Ahmed 51(47) [4s-4 6s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to A Russell, SIX, misses the yorker and bowls a juicy low full toss on the pads, Russell whips it over the square leg fence with an air of nonchalance. Creamedddddd
Bhuvneshwar to A Russell, SIX, slower ball bumper but Russell picked the bones out of it. Sets himself deep inside the crease and powers the pull way over the leaping fielder at deep square

Bhuvneshwar to A Russell, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Oh, the Dre Russ fireworks has been cut short. It's the best Sunrisers bowling combo that does the trick. Bhuvi looks to pin the yorker but feeds a low full toss on the pads instead, Russell batters it off the cue end and he didn't get as much of an elevation as he would have liked. Straight down the throat of Rashid at deep mid-wicket. A Russell c Rashid Khan b Bhuvneshwar 15(9) [6s-2]
Rashid Khan to Chawla, FOUR, picks the legbreak, jumps back inside the crease and clobbers the pull over square leg. In the gap and that's a boundary

Rashid Khan to Chawla, out Caught by Bairstow!! Chawla has done all sorts of Bollywood moves whilst at the crease. It's very hard to hit Rashid Khan with such constant shuffly movements. So, Piyush Chawla tries to reverse swat Rashid Khan over short third but all he could manage was a fine tickle on the glove. Sharp reflexes from YJB. Chawla c Bairstow b Rashid Khan 4(8) [4s-1]
Rashid Khan to Cariappa, SIX, stands solid inside the crease and pumps this quicker delivery into the long-on stands. Timed!!

Nadeem to Chris Lynn, SIX, "catch, catch" shouted Bairstow but it is just over a leaping Shankar. Nadeem gives it air and Lynn is not holding back, lofts through the line and it was a mishit, stayed up for a long time before evading long-on. 28 off 2 overs and KKR are off to a flier
Khaleel Ahmed to Narine, SIX, this is rubbish bowling. Short and outside off, Narine stands upright and slaps it flat over extra cover, got enough power behind that to clear the boundary rope

Khaleel Ahmed to Narine, FOUR, need to get the short delivery higher, Narine is waiting for these, clears his front leg and pulls it over mid-wicket, once more just managed to clear the fielder on the edge of the circle

Khaleel Ahmed to Narine, FOUR, Narine is already winning the mental battle. Khaleel goes for the yorker and misses it, the low full toss outside off and Narine spoons it over the off-side field, the fast outfield does the rest

Khaleel Ahmed to Narine, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! But KKR will reckon he has done his job. Khaleel is pumped. He tried the short ball - didn't work. Tried the yorker - didn't work. What was left? The slower ball - worked. The off-cutter and it holds up on the surface, Narine is through his heave early and the ball arrives later to uproot the leg-stump. Narine b Khaleel Ahmed 25(8) [4s-3 6s-2]

Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Shankar!! Another slower delivery. Another wicket. Khaleel might go for runs but he's a wicket-taker. Angled it across the right hander, Gill wanted to drive but was into the shot early, sliced it towards backward point where Shankar takes a good catch. SRH pulling things back after that quick start. Shubman Gill c Shankar b Khaleel Ahmed 3(4)

Sandeep Sharma to Nitish Rana, FOUR, shot! Fuller and outside off, Rana leans forward and creams the drive past cover-point, Nadeem ran behind the ball and only managed to escort it to the fence. The dive never came

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Bairstow!! Brought back and Bhuvi strikes first ball. It is the in-form Rana who has to depart. Short of length and bit of extra lift in the corridor around off-stump, Rana tries to steer to third man but is undone by the bounce, the outside edge carries at a nice height for Bairstow. Nitish Rana c Bairstow b Bhuvneshwar 11(11) [4s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, 1 run, direct hit and Karthik was gone. Hesitation between the two batsmen and it was the KKR skipper who was in trouble. He tried to force the good length delivery through the off-side and mishit it towards point, started to go for the single before stopping, Lynn kept going and that left Karthik with no choice. He put in a desparate dive but Shankar's throw was not on target

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, FOUR, cheeky! That is what you get with Karthik. On a length and outside off, Karthik opens the bat face at the last second and runs it fine, beating third man in the deep comfortably

Nadeem to Karthik, out Karthik Run Out!! 1 run completed. KKR have lost four wickets and Rashid Khan is yet to bowl. 4 overs of him remaining. This was a suicidal second by DK and he's livid with himself. Had flicked the flatter delivery to deep mid-wicket and two was the call straightaway. He decides to take on one of the best fielders in SRH's team though. Shankar charges in towards the ball, gathers it neatly and gets rid of the ball in the blink of an eye. Bairstow collects the ball and takes down the bails and DK's dive ain't enough as he's well short of the crease. Karthik run out (Shankar/Bairstow) 6(4) [4s-1]

Yarra Prithviraj to Warner, SIX, 135ks doesn't matter this time! Yarra Prithviraj missed his length and bowled it slightly short outside off, Warner pounces on it as he sends it soaring into the long-on stands with a well-timed loft

Yarra Prithviraj to Bairstow, FOUR, Cariappa has denied Yarra Prithviraj his maiden wicket in IPL. Short and wide outside off, Bairstow frees his arms and slashes hard, it goes flat and straight into the hands of KC Cariappa at deep point who lets it slips through his fingers and to make matters worse, it has gone over the boundary ropes

Narine to Bairstow, 3 runs, and another drop! Slog sweep attempted, and was a fot top-edge for the man at deep backward to drop it. He never even got close to it. Such a poor effort from Gurney. KKR are on a free fall
Narine to Warner, FOUR, slapped down the ground! That is a four..waited on it and slammed it over the bowler's head
Narine to Warner, SIX, goes big again! That's outta here as well. Flighted ball, Warner decided to free his arms and pump it over long-on for a sixer. SRH want an early finish

Yarra Prithviraj to Bairstow, 1 run, Chawla at deep square drops one now. Oh KKR! This is shambolic. Young Yarra Prithviraj has another drop off his bowling. Not his day. Short ball, Bairstow goes for the pull, gets a top-edge and the ball stayed in the air for an eternity. Chawla though never got anywhere close

Yarra Prithviraj to Warner, out Bowled!! And Yarra Prithviraj exults. He has got his first IPL wicket and that is Warner. He would want to cherish this amidst the gloom surrounding KKR. The KKR camp can hardly celebrate. Slower delivery at the sticks, Warner was through with his slog a little too early and the wickets were disturbed. Warner b Yarra Prithviraj 67(38) [4s-3 6s-5]
Chawla to Bairstow, FOUR, gets his bat down on a shortish ball at the last moment and places it well past the man at short third fielder for a four
Chawla to Bairstow, SIX, he doesn't want to hang around for too long..loopy ball, Bairstow sits down and slog sweeps it over deep square leg for a sixer. Only a shot away

Chawla to Bairstow, SIX, keep calm KKR and accept the Murphy's law! They have been annihilated here. Loopy ball and has been banged over deep mid with the help of a slog sweep. Bairstow, like he did against CSK, finishes off with a sixer
Yarra Prithviraj to Bairstow, FOUR, short ball on the stumps, Bairstow swivels and powers the pull in the gap through mid-wicket, no need to run for those
Gurney to Warner, FOUR, sets himself up for a slower delivery and clobbers the off-cutter over the fielder at extra cover, excellent timing and placement from Warner
Chawla to Bairstow, FOUR, slightly full outside off, Bairstow gets down on one knee and slogsweeps it over mid-wicket. Easy!

Chawla to Bairstow, SIX, and the new bat brings the result straightaway. Picks out the googly, sits on one knee and smokes it into the second tier over the long-on fence. Can't be that full to Bairstow
Narine to Warner, SIX, bashes this short ball into the crowd. Picked the length up so quickly. Leapt back in the crease and pummelled it
Cariappa to Warner, SIX, disappears into the crowd. Slanted in on leg from round the wicket, Warner lowers himself to get under the ball and swings it backward of square
Cariappa to Warner, FOUR, similar ball into the pads, this time he just helps it away through the gap between short fine and backward square

Cariappa to Warner, SIX, tearing into Cariappa here. 20 off the over already and there's still a ball left. He had gone full at the stumps with this delivery, right in the slot for Warner loft it down the ground for six
A Russell to Bairstow, FOUR, short of length at the hip, such a loosener at 126kph, and Bairstow punishes it with a thumping pull to the long leg boundary
Chawla to Bairstow, FOUR, drifting down leg, so Bairstow doesn't have to worry about the leg-before. He goes down on the back knee and sweeps hard, sending it fine of short fine leg

Cariappa to Bairstow, SIX, smoked into the second tier. No respite for Cariappa. After an expensive first over, here he is hoping to quietly start a new spell. But Bairstow catches him at the door. Swipes him away over midwicket
Cariappa to Bairstow, FOUR, spinning away outside off, had been pushed through the air much quicker. Bairstow sits back in the crease, anticipating it, and dabs it cunningly past the keeper
Cariappa to Warner, 1 run, length ball outside off, slapped to deep point. It's the fourth 100-run stand that these two have put up this season. Incredible!
Narine to Warner, 2 runs, pushes this off-break gently in front of long-off and hurtles the second run. Fifty for Warner. Keeps going from strength to strength

Narine to Bairstow, 1 run, Bairstow's turn. More cheers from the crowd. This is a celebration going on, not a run chase. Clipped off the pads backward of square. For all their brutality otherwise, they've brought up fifties with innocent singles
Steyn to Watson, FOUR, drops the length short and allows Watson to stand back and pull it away to deep square leg. Pivoted on his back leg to power the ball away

Steyn to Watson, out Caught by Stoinis!! The away swinger does it. Spills the ball outside off and Watson looks to drive and edges it to the man at first slip. That flew off the blade and was taken by the slip fielder who sat under it and took it over his head. Nice carry off the wicket as the batter threw his hands at it. CSK have lost Watto early, again. Watson c Stoinis b Steyn 5(3) [4s-1]

Steyn to Raina, out Bowled!! Whatta delivery! Between the legs and the bat to rattle the sticks. Steyn guns down Raina here. Back-to-back wickets for RCB and Steyn. Inch-perfect yorker with the new nut. Chinnaswamy erupts as well. RCB fans have found their voices again. Game on! Steyn, what an inspiration. Raina b Steyn 0(1)

Stoinis to Dhoni, SIX, Dhoni has arrived! Remember his knock here last year? Jumps out of his crease, shows no signs of nerves and launches Stoinis over deep extra cover with a power-packed smack on the shuffle
U Yadav to Rayudu, SIX, short of length delivery just outside off, this time Rayudu stayed put in his crease and heaved the pull wide of long-on. Just clears the boundary
U Yadav to Dhoni, 1 run, length ball on middle and leg, nudged quietly through midwicket
U Yadav to Rayudu, FOUR, steps out, makes some room and slaps this short ball over mid-off. In this partnership, he might now start to be the aggressor to keep the rate in control

Chahal to Rayudu, out Bowled!! Chahal has broken through. Just what RCB needed of him. It's the drift that gets Rayudu here. Curves in nicely towards leg-stump, slips past the inside edge into the front pad, before ricocheting onto the stumps. Brilliant from Chahal. Rayudu b Chahal 29(29) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chahal to Dhoni, SIX, sees some loop on the delivery, and puts his dancing shoes on in a flash. That's superb batting. He got right to the pitch before launching it straight back for six. 13 off Chahal's final over. It's set up superbly for the final four

Navdeep Saini to Dhoni, out Jadeja Run Out!! Both batsmen are at the striker's end, and Saini calmly picks the ball up and runs at his end for the run out. He had rushed Dhoni for pace with this short ball, inducing a mistimed pull shot beside the pitch. Dhoni initially came down for a single, which set Jadeja on his way, but then turned his back on him. There was no turning back for Jadeja from there. Jadeja run out (Navdeep Saini) 11(12)

Navdeep Saini to Dhoni, FOUR, flies off the outside edge past short third man, no chance for the fielder who was inside the ring. He just threw his hands at the slightest amount of width that Saini had provided

Steyn to Dhoni, SIX, back of a length delivery just outside off, Dhoni simply clears the front leg and belts it over wide long-on to bring up his half-century. He just knows how to turn on in these run-chases

Navdeep Saini to Dhoni, no ball, SIX, oh this is just awful from Saini, not only with the delivery he's bowled, but also that he's overstepped. With third man inside the ring, he bangs it in short outside off. Dhoni happily throws his hands at it and whirls it into the crowd

Navdeep Saini to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Short of length on off, Bravo swings wildly but only manages a top-edge through to the keeper. There's a check on the no-ball but Saini is fine, just. Dwayne Bravo c Parthiv Patel b Navdeep Saini 5(4)
U Yadav to Dhoni, FOUR, he goes short first ball and Dhoni dispatches him through square leg. Oh those nerves, watch those nerves RCB
U Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, oh my! This is gigantic. It's gone on the roof. Short of length, another really nothing ball that Dhoni absolutely destroys. It's a 111-metre six
U Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, six more. Umesh Yadav crumbling. Tries a yorker but misses it at least by a couple of feet and Dhoni lofts it with enough power - if not timing - to clear long-off

U Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, stunning scenes! A full toss is fiercely swiped over the deep midwicket boundary. An absolute skimmer from MS Dhoni who is on the verge of doing the unthinkable at the Chinnaswamy again. RCB in shock

Steyn to du Plessis, 1 run, slower delivery and was ill-timed to mid-off. Faf wanted a single and set off. ABD had to get the direct hit in but didn't take his time to throw the sticks down. Faf was gone for all money

U Yadav to Dhoni, out SN Thakur Run Out!! What drama! What unbearable drama. But RCB, who almost looked like having a meltdown in the final over, have been bailed out by a direct-hit from Parthiv Patel. Very brave from Umesh initially to go for the slower off-cutter. And his execution is spot on, as it sneaks through Dhoni's attempted cut. They have to run, and Parthiv is alert to it. With the ball bouncing just in front of him, the gather couldn't have been easy, but he makes no mistake and his throw at the stumps is on target too, finding Thakur just short. SN Thakur run out (Parthiv Patel) 0(0)

U Yadav to du Plessis, leg byes, FOUR, terrible delivery! That's Umesh for you. Two ends of the spectrum can be seen. Was well down leg and clipped the pads off the attempted heave to run away to the fine leg fence

U Yadav to du Plessis, out Caught by de Villiers!! Short ball, gets big on the batter and du Plessis looking to pull, gets a top-edge for ABD to take it. Almost collided with Nath trying to take it. But completes the catch without any fuss. CSK are three down now and in deep trouble. Once again are three down inside the powerplay. RCB have turned this game around on its head. du Plessis c de Villiers b U Yadav 5(15)

Steyn to Kedar Jadhav, no run, inswinger on a length around leg-stump, Jadhav looks to get some tickle on that but fails to make any contact off the bat. It brushes the thigh pad and flies to PP to his left, Kohli checked with his bowler and keeper and then went up for the review

Steyn to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, luck's written all over that delivery. A peach of an inswinger from Steyn, bowled at 139ks and nearly cut Jadhav into half. Was caught poking around the fifth stump channel and the inside edge flies wide of PP to his left

U Yadav to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, just a flick of the wrists, nothing less nothing more! Sees the ball angle into his pads and unveiled those whippy wrists on the flick did Kedar Jadhav, all the way through mid-wicket...

U Yadav to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by de Villiers!! RCB pacers are on fire and we haven't said that very often in the history of IPL. Ah, this is some night for the RCB fans. Umesh kept rattling the batsmen with pace and something had to give; Jadhav tries to go across the line and doesn't bother to move his feet while at it. It takes the thick top-edge and lands straight in the bucket hands of AB at mid-off. Kedar Jadhav c de Villiers b U Yadav 9(9) [4s-2]

U Yadav to Dhoni, FOUR, streaky! Would have been out had there been a backward point, wasn't to be. Dhoni gets a full ball outside off and he fishes at it sans any feet, sliced it off the thick outside edge and it flies square past non-existent point
Navdeep Saini to Rayudu, FOUR, short ball outside off, Rayudu had some extra time to adjust as it was around the 130ks, he arches back and ramps it over non-existent short third

Negi to Dhoni, FOUR, Dhoni's so good at playing smart cricket shots and this is one of them. Sees the ball slide down leg and paddles it in a flash past the keeper, played it late but found the middle which is what matters the most
Stoinis to Dhoni, FOUR, short ball down the leg-side, Dhoni swivels and powers the pull in the gap behind square on the leg-side, no need to run for those

Chahar to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli is off and running. Chahar gets a bit greedy. Tries to swing it from middle-stump and in the process gives Kohli a freebie, flicked away uppishly over the square leg umpire

Jadeja to Akshdeep Nath, SIX, that's a great shot by Akshdeep Nath. Walks down the wicket and flicks the shortish delivery against the turn, the pitch makes it easier for the ball to go the distance, clears deep mid-wicket comfortably
Tahir to Parthiv Patel, SIX, pumped over deep mid-wicket! Patel reads the googly to perfection and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for half a dozen. Couldn't have played it any better

Jadeja to Akshdeep Nath, out Caught by du Plessis!! Jadeja gets rid of Akshdeep Nath. He shimmies down the wicket and lofts the delivery high up in the air. The ball went miles up in the air but it could travel as far as deep mid-off. du Plessis charges in from the deep, settles underneath the skier and takes it safely. Akshdeep Nath c du Plessis b Jadeja 24(20) [4s-1 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Patel ends the over with a boundary and moves closer to his fifty. Gets a full toss and the southpaw makes sure to chip it over the infield at covers. No fielders in the deep and that's an easy four

Tahir to Stoinis, SIX, that's a huge six! Slightly short ball and Stoinis treks back to smoke it over deep mid-wicket. Could have been a six on any ground. Just the kind of shot Stoinis was looking for to cut loose

Dwayne Bravo to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, RCB fans give Parthiv a standing ovation as the opener gets to his fifty with a boundary. Waits for the slower delivery and whips it through the gap at mid-wicket to send the ball away to the fence. Has been a crucial knock but he needs to get a move on

Dwayne Bravo to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Watson!! Parthiv departs after getting to his fifty. That has been the problem with him this season. Not able to carry on and get a big score. Makes room and slaps the short ball straight to Watson at who was stationed close to the ring at covers. Time for Moeen to walk in next. Parthiv Patel c Watson b Dwayne Bravo 53(37) [4s-2 6s-4]

Tahir to Stoinis, out Caught by (sub)Shorey!! Catch of the season? Faf has done something remarkable here. Heaved down the ground, Faf held his balance at the fence and scooped it up for the man at long-on - Shorey - who was closeby to take it. Credit to Shorey as well not to distract Faf and also linger closeby in case something like this happened. Superb presence of mind to throw the ball away in the nick of the time. Stoinis c (sub)Shorey b Tahir 14(13) [6s-1]
Tahir to Moeen Ali, FOUR, tickled away fine as that was the quicker ball. Has run away to the fence for a four
SN Thakur to Moeen Ali, FOUR, bangs the ball short and has been pulled away! There was no one at deep mid and it was a four

Chahar to Moeen Ali, FOUR, right up there! Brilliant delivery and equally well played. Opened the face of the blade and dug it out to squeeze the ball past the dive of the man at short third for a four. RCB need more of these

Chahar to Negi, out Caught by Rayudu!! Scoops up a length ball which bounced a touch higher and the man at point takes it. That got big on him, Negi could not keep it down and the man at point took an easy catch. RCB have been poor at the death. Negi c Rayudu b Chahar 5(6)
Dwayne Bravo to Moeen Ali, FOUR, with the point and cover point in, the fuller ball was a bad idea. Moeen Ali got his bat down and slammed it over point for a four. The wrists of steel came into play
Dwayne Bravo to Moeen Ali, no run, that was full, wide, Moeen Ali threw his bat it and misses. There was a noise, MS went for the DRS but there was nothing on the UltraEdge. Mo continues..
Dwayne Bravo to Moeen Ali, FOUR, steered! Four! past short third man that one. Fuller and wider one, Moeen Ali maintained his balance to squeeze it past short third

Dwayne Bravo to Moeen Ali, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Looks to launch the slower ball and holes out at long-off. That was touch slower off the deck and Moeen Ali wanted to muscle it down the ground only to find the man in the deep. Thakur after it taking does a gig. CSK continue their good work at the death. Moeen Ali c SN Thakur b Dwayne Bravo 26(16) [4s-5]
Chahar to Kohli, FOUR, streaky! Not where he intended but he won't mind it. Runs down the wicket and swings through the line, the outswinger takes the outside edge and flies over short third man

Chahar to Kohli, out Caught by Dhoni!! Gone! Chahar has the big wicket and he's unstoppable. He goes off on a run like Tahir. Perfect start for CSK. RCB's lynchpin is sent back early. Good length ball outside off, Kohli drives without accounting for the swing and the outside edge is found, Dhoni dives to his right and takes it safely. That is the area to bowl to Kohli in whatever format - on a good length and outside off. Kohli c Dhoni b Chahar 9(8) [4s-2]

SN Thakur to de Villiers, FOUR, AB is away. They need a move on and who better than de Villiers to rely on. Not a bad delivery by any means. Back of a length delivery and de Villiers thumps it over mid-on, one bounce and over the ropes

SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, SIX, good end to the over. Parthiv hits the first six of the game. He waits for that short of length delivery and picks it off with a well timed pull shot, sails into the crowd near backward square leg

Chahar to de Villiers, SIX, this time it comes off. Chahar was a bit straight in his line and that allowed de Villiers to make contact, sets up a firm base and heaves it over deep square leg. That should make him feel good

SN Thakur to de Villiers, 1 run, oh! Faf almost pulls off a stunner. This would have been the catch of the tournament. de Villiers struck the off-drive uppishly towards mid-off, Faf times his jump perfectly and goes with one hand, it doesn't stick
SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, SIX, Parthiv is peppering that backward square crowd. Another good length ball right in his arc, he maintains a low base and heaves it with a clean bat swing over the rope

SN Thakur to de Villiers, FOUR, Thakur has lost his line in the last 10 balls or so. Strays on the pads and that is easy pickings, de Villiers flicks it in front of square and Tahir's dive was nowhere close to the ball

SN Thakur to de Villiers, FOUR, 16 runs to end the powerplay. Thakur tries to follow the backing away de Villiers with a full delivery, but ends up bowling it in the slot, pumped right back over and the ball bounces just inside the fence

Jadeja to Parthiv Patel, SIX, plenty of hang time but Parthiv gets the desired distance as well. He goes down on his knee and slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket, managed to clear the rope comfortably in the end

Jadeja to de Villiers, out Caught by du Plessis!! de Villiers gone! Faf judges it perfectly. Jadeja gets the big wicket. RCB's backbone is back in the hut within 7 overs. de Villiers shimmies down the wicket, isn't to the pitch and the ball turns a bit as well, the cue-end skies up towards long-off and Faf is right on the edge of the boundary rope. He takes it with his fingers pointing upwards. de Villiers c du Plessis b Jadeja 25(19) [4s-3 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, lovely shot! Right out of the coaching manual. Nothing much wrong with the delivery. Fuller and outside off, Nath leans forward and creams the drive past mid-off. Thakur can only fetch it from the fence
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, SIX, that's the kind of form he is in! Can't bowl it there. On the pads and Dhawan flicks it over deep square leg with utter ease. Sweet!

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, just look how quick the outfield is. This wasn't middled whatsoever but the pace makes it easier for Dhawan. Gets heaves across the line and gets it off the inside half of his bat, beats the fielder at short mid-wicket initially and finds the boundary thereafter
Riyan Parag to Pant, FOUR, sliding in on leg stump, Pant picks the line early, bends his back knee and swings it backward of square
Riyan Parag to Pant, FOUR, short ball on middle stump, Pant smacks the pull through square leg. Smith just throws his head back after another poor delivery

Shreyas Gopal to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, this is such a fantastic shot. He was beaten in length after stepping out, as Gopal pulled it well back. But Shaw remains undeterred, going through with the cover drive and creaming it to the fence
Shreyas Gopal to Pant, SIX, clears the front leg to a googly that was right in his slot and lofts it through the line over long-on. Clean strike from Pant

Unadkat to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Shaw has found the gap to perfection. There was a man at fine leg and at deep mid-wicket but Prithvi Shaw pulls it right between the two fielders. The timing was also good enough and it races to the fence

Unadkat to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, high and handsome! This should get Prithvi Shaw going. Unadkat was bowling brilliant slower ones but for some reasons he went for a yorker, misses it and ends up serving it right into the slot for Prithvi Shaw. He clears his front leg and hoicks it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

D Kulkarni to Pant, 2 runs, direct hit from the fielder at deep mid-wicket. But Pant is easily home. It was on a good length and was on the stumps, Pant tucks it wide of deep mid-wicket and charges back for a quick double

D Kulkarni to Pant, FOUR, excellent from Pant, he knows Kulkarni is one of the weaker bowler in this Royals attack and he wants to target him. The pace of Kulkarni allows Pant to go down on his kness and he half-sweeps-half-whips it over fine leg for a boundary

Unadkat to Pant, FOUR, Pant tumbles but Pant connects and gets a boundary. Things only Pant can do! He gets inside the line of the ball, goes down on his knees and almost paddles it over short fine for a boundary

Jofra Archer to Pant, SIX, fifty in a canter for Pant. Wow! This guy is a gem of a player. Archer misses his yorker, it was in the slot for Pant. He clears his front leg, gets in a good position and lifts it over deep square leg for a maximum
Shreyas Gopal to Pant, FOUR, fuller and on the stumps, Pant pumps it straight down the ground for a boundary. That went to the fence like a tracer bullet
Shreyas Gopal to Pant, no ball, FOUR, Pant has dispatched it for a boundary. It is a No-ball too, it was a full-toss above the waist height, Pant pumps it wide of fine leg for a boundary. Free-hit!

Shreyas Gopal to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Much- needed wicket for Royals. It was a flighted delivery on a fuller length, Prithvi Shaw wanted to dispatch it over long-on. It spins away and due to that Prithvi Shaw failed to time it as well as he would have liked it. Parah at long-on came under it and takes it with utmost ease. Prithvi Shaw c Riyan Parag b Shreyas Gopal 42(39) [4s-4 6s-1]

D Kulkarni to Rutherford, SIX, first six for Rutherford in his IPL career. I am sure it's not the last. You cannot bowl length at this stage and D Kulkarni did exactly that. It was wide of off, Rutherford reaches for it and clobbers it over deep mid-wicket. It comes off the bottom half of the willow but the power that he posseses takes it over the fence

D Kulkarni to Rutherford, FOUR, that has raced to the fence in some micro seconds. It was in the slot for Rutherford, on that fuller length. He clears his leg and powers it with utter disdain, wide of deep cover for a boundary. The young man loved it too, he punches the air in delight

D Kulkarni to Rutherford, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Staright to long-off. A short little cameo from Rutherford! He has helped bring down the required rate but would have wanted to take his team home. It was a slower one on a back of a length, Rutherford wanted to lift it over long-off ends up finding it where parag makes no mistake. Rutherford c Riyan Parag b D Kulkarni 11(5) [4s-1 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Pant, SIX, Pant has dispatched it over for a maximum .Whatta hit from Pant! This has surely sealed the match for DC. It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, Pant comes under it and pumps it over long-on for a maximum

Unadkat to Pant, SIX, Pant has finished off the things in style. DC win by 6-wickets and go top of the table. Incredible hitting from the southpaw. Hold On! Umpires are still checking whether that ball hit the rope on the full. It's a six and Delhi has sealed the victory!

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, another sublime shot by Shikhar! Puts on his dancing shoes and bludgeons the shortish delivery through mid-on. The fielder was very square, hence this was always heading to the fence
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, SIX, what a superb shot by Shikhar! Trying to outplay the shots played by Rahane. Goes down on his knee and picks this one up with nonchalance to clear the fine leg fence

Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, FOUR, he loves to bat on these kind of tracks, doesn't he? Walks down the wicket and lifts it over the bowler's head for four more. There was a fielder at long-on but this just manages to beat his sprint
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, FOUR, Gopal struggling against the left hander! Dhawan goes down on his knee and lifts the tossed up delivery over square leg for four runs this time around
Jofra Archer to Dhawan, FOUR, some lovely wristwork from Dhawan. Length ball at the stumps, picks it away through midwicket with great force off the wrists
D Kulkarni to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, short of length at the body, Shaw's arms don't have the space to move freely, but he manages enough power through the swing to heave this over midwicket

D Kulkarni to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, Ashton Turner is having a nightmare. After three ducks in a row, he's now put down a skier. Thick top-edge on the pull shot from Shaw, Turner went back from position at midwicket to get under it, but it bounced off his palms
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, walks across the stumps, receives a full toss and paddles it past short fine leg
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, swats the off-cutter through midwicket for four more. He's looking in ominous touch. Just sits up so beautifully on this pitch for Dhawan to have a biff

Riyan Parag to Dhawan, 1 run, driven off the back foot wide of Smith at extra cover. Good effort there with the dive, but can only make a half-stop, not enough to stop Dhawan from getting to his fifty. He's gone a few notches higher in these last few games
Riyan Parag to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, short ball from Parag which is almost nonchalantly dispatched through midwicket. Way too easy
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, FOUR, short googly outside off, really ordinary stuff, and Dhawan isn't in the mood to let them get away. Smashes the pull wide of deep midwicket

Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, out Stumped!! Gopal's come back superbly. He's spotted Dhawan advance down the pitch, and so he's fired this well wide outside off to beat him. Samson completes a nice stumping. Dhawan st Samson b Shreyas Gopal 54(27) [4s-8 6s-2]

Riyan Parag to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Stokes!! Iyer holes out at deep midwicket. Maybe the perils of good form, which gave him enough confidence to go after the bowling straightaway. But this comes right off the toe-end as he heaves it from outside off. Easy catch for Stokes. Shreyas Iyer c Stokes b Riyan Parag 4(5)

Ishant to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane at his sublime best! Not all that full but a hint of width and he trusts the surface by driving on the up. Relied on timing and placed it through the crowded off-side cordon. Raced away past point in a flash

Rabada to Rahane, out Samson Run Out!! Absolute waste of a wicket! Samson is livid as he walks back to the hut but he is also partly to blame. Was an in-angler on a good length and Rahane dabbed it towards the short mid-wicket region. Always was a risky run with Rabada quickly moving across in his followthrough and there is a massive mix up with Samson way down the track. All three stumps to aim at and Rabada doesn't miss. Not the start that the Royals were looking for. Samson run out (Rabada) 0(0)

Rabada to Rahane, FOUR, crisply struck! Another delightful shot from Rahane. Overpitched and he is well forward to this one, times the straight drive with aplomb to send it racing past the right of mid-off
Mishra to Smith, FOUR, typical Steven Smith! All wristy. Ambles down the pitch and uses those whippy wrists to time and place the flick in the gap wide of long-on
Mishra to Smith, FOUR, stays inside the crease this time, uncorks his wrists and flays the cut in the gap behind point
Mishra to Smith, 1 run, skates down and flicks the flatter delivery off his pads to deep mid-wicket. 100-run partnership's up
Rutherford to Smith, FOUR, poor delivery from Rutherford! Bowls a slower ball but he's dished it on Smith's pads, tickled away past short fine. Easy!

Rutherford to Smith, FOUR, this is batting practice for Steven Smith. He had all the time in the world to smash this slower length ball outside off and smash it he does. Clears his front leg and clobbers it wide of the fielder at long-on
Rutherford to Smith, FOUR, make that three in a row! Too full and Smith slices the drive behind point
Chris Morris to Rahane, SIX, this is innovation at its very best! Moved across his off-stump and uses Morris' pace to lap the full ball high and over the fine leg fence

Chris Morris to Rahane, FOUR, that's just a check shot and Rahane timed that to perfection. Waits for the pitched up delivery to arrive and crunches it with a straight bat face, no heavy backlift but it still flies over the man at mid-off
Chris Morris to Smith, 1 run, biffed to mid-off and that'll be Steven Smith's 8th IPL fifty

Axar to Smith, out Caught by Chris Morris!! How often have we seen this? A batsman throwing it away after reaching the milestone. Smith uses his feet, looks to go straight and throws his weight into the lofted hit over mid-off, he seemed to have got enough height on that but Morris set himself cleverly on the edge of the long-off boundary to claim a well-judged catch. Smith c Chris Morris b Axar 50(32) [4s-8]
Ishant to Stokes, FOUR, comes dancing down the pitch and punch-drives the full delivery to the left of mid-off, Stokes batting with full freedom and he has got the license to do that

Ishant to Rahane, FOUR, timed! That's what you get with class players like Rahane. Just stands his ground, waits for the fullish delivery to arrive and chips the drive over cover with an air of confidence. All the way...
Chris Morris to Rahane, FOUR, full toss around the knee roll, Rahane stays still and flicks it over the square leg umpire. No need to run for those...

Chris Morris to Stokes, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Stokes is disappointed with himself and rightly so. He's failed to take toll of a full toss. Doesn't really move around the crease, just looks to power it away over mid-wicket but doesn't get the required timing on that. Catching practice for Shreyas Iyer at long-on. Stokes c Shreyas Iyer b Chris Morris 8(8) [4s-1]

Ishant to Rahane, 2 runs, Rahane drives this one to long-off and calls for two. The throw came in at the bowler's end and Turner just manages to get back in, the throw was a flat one but a direct-hit would have been curtains for the Austraian

Ishant to Rahane, 2 runs, relief for Rahane! What a fantastic knock this has been. Notches up his second IPL century and raises his bat to acknowledge the crowd. There was no need for him to bat down the order. This is where he's at his best - as an opener. Plays the length delivery with soft hands to long-on and manages to storm back for two. Take a bow Jinx!

Ishant to Turner, out Caught by Rutherford!! Hat-trick of golden ducks for Turner! Becomes the first ever batsman to get out for five successive ducks in T20 cricket. Can you believe it! Things going from bad to worse! Gets deceived due to the slower delivery once again and chips the fullish delivery straight to Rutherford at extra cover. Turner c Rutherford b Ishant 0(1)

Rabada to Binny, FOUR, not a great day for Rabada in the field. Since that run-out of Samson, nothing has gone his way. Even this was a false shot but the end result is a boundary. Nothing's working for the speedster. Drags back the length on his delivery and Binny ends up top-edging it over the keeper's head as he hacks across the line

Chris Morris to Binny, FOUR, boundary to end the over but Morris wouldn't mind - concedes only 8 runs in it. This was in the slot and Binny heaves it into the vacant region at cow-corner. The fielder was perhaps inside the circle and that shall be four more for the all-rounder

Rabada to Binny, out Bowled!! You miss, I hit. Rabada goes full and straight, very close to a yorker. Binny makes room to smash that but the speed is enough to beat him. Goes through his flashy drive and knocks over the middle-stick. Picks up the ball and hands over to Rabada too. Binny b Rabada 19(13) [4s-2]
Rabada to Riyan Parag, FOUR, that's a full toss on the pads and Riyan Parag whips it past the man at fine leg who had no chance to stop this. He was a touch too fine in order to cut this down

Axar to Rahane, FOUR, whipped over the infield! Clever batting from Rahane, got one tossed up and he didn't go hard at this one. Just used his wrists and ensured that he got it over mid-wicket as there was nobody in the deep. Makes terrific contact and reaps the reward. He's looking good tonight

Rabada to Riyan Parag, out Bowled!! Bull's eye! Rabada cleans up Parag with a full toss as the batsman backs away to smash the ball away. At the speed of which Rabada is bowling, it's never so easy. The leg stump is uprooted but Rajashtan have managed to post an excellent score of 191/6. Riyan Parag b Rabada 4(3) [4s-1]

Ishant to Smith, FOUR, just past a diving Rabada! Was always difficult for him to take this but made a heroic effort nevertheless. Pitched by Ishant and Smith went for loft down the ground. Got it straight but Rabada from mid-on sensed it and moved swiftly to his left before diving mid-air. Past him and to the fence

Axar to Rahane, no run, Ishant spills a sitter! Embarrassing stuff from DC's senior man. Rahane shuffled well across for the sweep and skewed it aerially to short fine leg. Straightforward take but Ishant spills it. How costly will this be?

Axar to Rahane, SIX, superb hit! Adding insult to injury, is Rahane. Charges down on seeing the flight and hoists it merrily straight down the ground. Plenty of elevation and also has the distance as this crashes into the sightscreen

Axar to Rahane, FOUR, Ishant won't want to watch this, his drop has started to cost heavily already. Flatter one from Axar and Rahane gets across to sweep this well over short fine leg. Clean strike and more runs

Rabada to Rahane, SIX, excellent hit from Rahane! Refreshing intent from the RR former captain and he is wading into the bowling. Short of a length from Rabada and Jinks just backs away to flat-bat this down the ground. Such fine connection that it goes all the way. Superb stuff!

Rabada to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane is in overdrive in this Powerplay. Raining boundaries at the moment. Rabada spills one on the pads and that's criminal with fine leg up. Rahane just gets a tickle on it and sends it racing past that fielder to the fence in no time
Mishra to Rahane, 2 runs, superb running and it's an easy brace. Was knocked gently through mid-on and with the dimensions being as big as it is, there's a two to be had if you can run hard

Chris Morris to Rahane, FOUR, fist pump from Rahane as he gets to his fifty! Seems determined to make a statement tonight and to be honest, it's been his best knock in ages. Fractionally short and he dispatches the pull over mid-wicket. There is a man in the deep but Jinks has placed it wider. He is flowing freely at the moment, needs to bat through from RR's POV

Chris Morris to Smith, FOUR, brilliant placement! There is a fine leg and deep mid-wicket in place but Smith has bisected them beautifully. Gets on the pads and he duly flicks it through square leg. Called for two but such is the timing that it leaves the deep fielders with no chance of getting to it
Mishra to Smith, FOUR, excellent placement from Smith! Uses his feet, gets closer to the pitch of the delivery and whiplashes it over mid-wicket, right in the gap between the fielders in the deep
Axar to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane unleashing class! Skips out of his crease and plays a gorgeous inside out drive over extra cover with sublime timing
Axar to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane is looking unstoppable at the moment! Picks the arm-ball, settles on one knee and paddles it fine of the fielder at short fine

Rashid Khan to Raina, out Stumped!! Walks right past the googly, didn't have a clue about it! Fuller length from Rashid, pitched around middle and Raina was looking to work it through the on-side, expecting a leg-break. But he's wrong. He's also reaching for the ball, as it has pitched well short of him, and so the balance - the lack of it - takes him out of the crease. Excellent stumping from Bairstow. Raina st Bairstow b Rashid Khan 38(24) [4s-6 6s-1]
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, short of length outside off, guides it with an open face between backward point and short third man
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, great crack of the bat as Watson crunched this flat-batted swipe wide of deep midwicket. Sandeep's slower ball was short in length and sat up
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, brings up his fifty in thunderous style! Watson roars back to form for CSK. Short ball, 116kph, and it goes soaring into the second tier
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, smashed away! A trifle too short from Rashid and Rayudu picked the length early. Swivelled and pulled it hard, bisecting deep mid-wicket and long-on perfectly

Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, smacked away by Watson! Got down on his knees and swept this hard in front of square through the leg-side. Sandeep got across with a slide but couldn't palm it away properly

Rashid Khan to Watson, SIX, Watson is putting on a show alright! This is what confidence can do. He's a different player now and in some mood. Gets a flattish low full toss that's sent over cow corner with a slog sweep. Such a clean hit and he stares at Rashid

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, FOUR, he's in autopilot mode now, Watson! Gets to 8000 T20 runs! Not a bad ball, almost the perfect wide yorker from Bhuvneshwar but Watson is in the zone now. Waits deep in the crease and opens the bat face late. Bisects short third man and backward point easily

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, FOUR, deft once again! Watson wants to finish this in a hurry. Slightly shorter this time, not much room but he plays is late with an open face. Gets it wide of Bairstow and short third man had no chance

Rashid Khan to Watson, SIX, smokedddddddddddd! Nothing much you can do when Watson is hitting them like this. Not even Rashid has any answers. Tossed it up, inviting the big hit and that it was for sure. Blasted away by Watson over long-on for a mammoth blow

Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, 15 off the over! Watson is motoring towards yet another IPL century! Too short from Rashid and the Aussie sits back to pull this away through backward square leg. Short fine leg is the only man there
Khaleel Ahmed to Watson, SIX, this is some hitting from Watson! Slower and short, climbs onto the short ball and muscles it over deep mid-wicket. Another huge hit!

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, out Caught by Bairstow!! Watson is walking! No century but hasn't he put on a show tonight or what! Was a good short ball from Bhuvneshwar and Watson got rushed on the pull. There was a definite top edge as it went through to Bairstow who took a stunning one-handed catch, diving to his left. The umpire was probably blinded and didn't know what to do. Watson did the right thing, would have been out anyway if SRH reviewed this. Ends a sensational knock from one of IPL's and T20 cricket's legend. Watson c Bairstow b Bhuvneshwar 96(53) [4s-9 6s-6]

Sandeep Sharma to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, that's the game! Slower ball and Jadhav charged down for the swipe over mid-wicket. Was a skimmer and Pandey in the deep showed good awareness as he caught this mid-air in an attempt to palm it back. Managed to parry it as well but the foot touched the ground outside the ropes Just 2 needed now!

Sandeep Sharma to Rayudu, out Caught by Shankar!! Anti-climax for the CSK fans in the stadium. Rayudu wanted the winning hit but departs. Ends up miscuing the pull and top edges it straight in the air. Dolly for Shankar at mid-off and he gobbles it up. It's been a scratchy season for Rayudu and today is another innings of that kind. Rayudu c Shankar b Sandeep Sharma 21(25) [4s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, out du Plessis Run Out!! Appeal for a run-out taken upstairs! It's a direct-hit, mind you. Looks very close. Although du Plessis had put in a dive at the bowler's end, it's not enough. Touch and go! The batsman had driven the ball to Hooda at mid-off and a direct-hit at the bowler's end brings curtains to the South African's stay at the crease. Another awful start for CSK this season. du Plessis run out (Hooda) 1(7)

Bhuvneshwar to Raina, FOUR, Raina gets off the mark with a glorious off-drive. Gets hold of the overpitched delivery, presents the full face of his willow and creams it past the fielder at mid-off. Great shot to open his account
Shakib to Watson, FOUR, that shall give him some confidence! Tad full in length around middle and leg, Watson goes down on his knee and sweeps it uppishly over square leg. Almost went the distance

Khaleel Ahmed to Watson, SIX, short of length on middle, this off-cutter from Khaleel sits up nicely to be whacked. And Watson isn't one to refuse such opportunities. Belts it over the square leg boundary

Khaleel Ahmed to Watson, FOUR, length ball outside off, Watson plants his foot back in the crease and hoists it over extra cover. Extraordinary shot, generating all that power from the bottom hand. Vijay Shankar's diving effort in the deep not enough
Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, short balls have had a history of troubling Raina, true, but not at 118kph. Muscles this pull well in front of square
Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, slower length ball on leg stump, too easy for Raina who is well aware of short fine leg's presence inside the ring. Just whips it past the man

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, this isn't intentional, but it's useful. Length ball outside off, Raina had charged down looking to biff no matter what. So it doesn't matter to him that the ball's far away. He throws his hands at it, and ends up slicing it off the outside half over short third man

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, fourth boundary of the over, third one in a row. The shackles have been broken. Slower ball on middle, Raina swipes agriculturally and gets enough off the inside half to impart the legs to roll into the square leg boundary
Sandeep Sharma to Raina, SIX, massive over for CSK, 22 off it. Short of length on leg stump, pulls it away ferociously and hits the cushions on the full

Shakib to Watson, SIX, this time he does get under the short ball, and absolutely pummels it over backward square. It's his favourite pull shot, and Shakib's lack of bounce isn't going to dissuade him once the length's there

Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, Rashid jumps away from the path of this bullet-drive from Watson. He had made the mistake of overpitching, but he wasn't going to make the mistake of risking himself once Watson drilled it back. Smartly so

Rashid Khan to Raina, FOUR, short ball outside off, seemed like an intentional dab from Raina, although Warner wasn't far from getting a hand at slip. With the pace of Rashid, this absolutely flew off Raina's bat

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, 1 run, dropped by Bairstow! It was a meaty outside edge from Watson, who was looking to swing through the line of this full ball. Bairstow dives to his right, goes with one hand, but it doesn't stick
Rashid Khan to Raina, byes, FOUR, goes right through Raina, but bounces over the stumps. That's beaten everyone. An absolute ripper from Rashid

Harbhajan to Bairstow, out Caught by Dhoni!! An excellent IPL comes to a sorry end for Jonny. And Harbhajan as he has done throughout this IPL delivers for CSK with the new ball. It was a quicker one and was wide of off, it skids off the deck, takes the outside edge of Bairstow who plays down the wrong line. And Dhoni makes no mistake, he never does! Bairstow c Dhoni b Harbhajan 0(2)

Harbhajan to Manish Pandey, FOUR, intent from Manish Pandey straightaway, much better from the Karnataka lad. It was a flighted delivery and was spinning back into Manish, he plunges forward and lofts it straight down the ground for a boundary
Dwayne Bravo to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Pandey is absolutely belting it today! Sees the slower full ball dip outside off and times the slap-drive to perfection, raced away to the deep cover fence

Dwayne Bravo to Manish Pandey, FOUR, one of Manish Pandey's best IPL innings this, brings up his fifty in 25 balls. Picks the slower ball early, times his swivel and pulls it past the diving left hand of short fine
Tahir to Warner, 1 run, quicker on middle and leg, tucked away into the leg-side and that'll be 43rd IPL fifty for David Warner
Jadeja to Manish Pandey, FOUR, he's in overdrive is Manish Pandey! Jumps out of his crease, shows no signs of fear and pumps Jadeja straight down the ground for a one-bounce boundary

Harbhajan to Warner, out Stumped!! Gives it plenty of air and catches Warner on the move. No balance from pocket rocket, swings wildly and the bottom hand comes off while doing so, his back foot got dragged too far in the process and Dhoni ain't missing that stumping chance. Warner st Dhoni b Harbhajan 57(45) [4s-3 6s-2]
Tahir to Shankar, SIX, effortless stroke from Vijay Shankar! Lets the googly dip and marmalizes it for a 84-metre maximum over long-on
Tahir to Manish Pandey, SIX, dispatched! Short in length around off and Manish Pandey pumps it over the cow corner for half a dozen! Sweetly timed blow

Dwayne Bravo to Shankar, FOUR, another fine shot by Shankar! Looks in sublime touch. Reaches out for the overpitched delivery wide ball and chips it over cover-point. There were two fielders inside the circle and this ball cleared them by some distance

Chahar to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Raina drops a sitter! Not only his batting, but his fielding hasn't been great either. A couple of misfields earlier in the innings and now he puts one down. Pandey got deceived due to the slower delivery as he miscued it towards mid-off where Raina fails to cling on to the catch

Chahar to Shankar, FOUR, in the slot and Shankar drags it over the infield at mid-wicket. There were two fielders in the deep but this was placed right into the gap as he heaved the length ball across

Chahar to Shankar, out Caught by Jadeja!! Deepak Chahar ends his spell with a wicket. Just 7 runs in that over. Shankar was looking to clear the deep mid-wicket fence with this heave but he couldn't get the timing right. Holes out to the fielder in the deep and that brings an end to Shankar's handy cameo. Shankar c Jadeja b Chahar 26(20) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chahar to Warner, FOUR, you cannot miss your length by an inch against Warner. It was marginally short and was directed on the body, Warner gets in an excellent position and times the pull shot brilliantly. It goes over square leg and races to the fence

Harbhajan to Warner, SIX, Warner attacks Harbhajan straightaway and gets a maximum. This is going to be an interesting battle. It was a flighted one and was on the stumps, Warner takes a good stride forward and lofts it straight down the ground for a maximum

Harbhajan to Manish Pandey, SIX, Pandey Ji means business today! He has promoted to number three and he looks in no mood to waste this opportunity. It was an offie on the stumps and Manish Pandey larrups it over long-off for a maximum

Chahar to Warner, FOUR, that's a tennis forehand, Roger would have been proud of that. It was a good length delivery and was just wide of off, nothing wrong with the delivery. But Warner flat-bats it wide of the bowler and the timing was so good that it canters to the fence

Chahar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, smashed! It as full and was on the stumps, Manish Pandey pumps it down the ground, Chahar did well to get his head out of the way. It runs along the carpet for another boundary

Harbhajan to Manish Pandey, FOUR, flighted delivery down the leg-side, Manish Pandey goes deep in the crease and tucks it wide of the leg-slip, it beats short fine and will reach the boundary too. Pandey is on fire!

Harbhajan to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Dhoni shouts Na na na from behind as it was a short one, it was wide of off too. Manish Pandey rocks back and cuts it wide of short third. Another boundary for Pandey!

Jadeja to Warner, FOUR, dispatches the first delivery of Jadeja for a boundary. It was wide of off, Warner plunges forward and tonks it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary. It spilts the gap to perfection

Dwayne Bravo to Warner, 1 run, sharp bumper on the face, Warner was surprised by how quickly it came to him. He mistimes the pull totally and ends up hitting it just to the left of the side wicket. Bravo charges quickly towards but fails to pick up the ball cleanly. And he is gutted with himself
Jadeja to Warner, SIX, launched!! Slightly fuller and in the arc for Warner, he stays low and smokes it into the stands over cow corner
Tahir to Manish Pandey, SIX, that's the biggest of the lot! Pandey on fire...picks up the flight, gets underneath it and hammers it high and soaring into the second tier over long-on
Southee to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle is underway! Fullish ball outside off, Gayle reaches out and throws the kicthen sink. Sliced over point and the Universe Boss collects his first boundary

Southee to Gayle, FOUR, nicely done! Not a shot that you'd normally assocciate with Gayle. Short of a length ball outside off and the lefty used the bowler's pace to guide it through backward point and short third man
Southee to Gayle, FOUR, 14 off the opening over! Southee continues to have a terrible IPL. A wide half-volley outside off and Gayle flays it over backward point. Third boundary for Gayle!
U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, another bad ball! Slants in a back of a length delivery at 137kph, straighter line as well. Rahul, with one leg off ground, controls the pull through backward square leg
U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, horror ball! An overpitched delivery on the pads - almost pleading the batsman to punish. And, KL doesn't miss out. Flicks it handsomely behind square on the leg-side

Moeen Ali to Rahul, out Caught by Southee!! Ali strikes with his very first ball. His introduction was too tempting for Rahul, who advanced down and wanted to loft it straight. But he gets too close to the pitch of it, and miscues it off the toe-end for a simple catch at long-off. Kohli explodes in celebration, probably even gave a send-off. Two new batsmen at the crease now. Rahul c Southee b Moeen Ali 42(27) [4s-7 6s-1]

Washington Sundar to Pooran, SIX, he has got his eye in and he has smashed this one for a gigantic six. It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps, Pooran backs away, clears his leg, gets under it and tonks it over long-off for a maximum
Washington Sundar to Pooran, SIX, another six. Pooran gave himself room again, Washington Sundar follows him but Pooran still had enough room to clear his arm and dispatch it over long-off again
Washington Sundar to Pooran, SIX, third six off the over! In the same area again. It was very full and on the leg-stump, Pooran gets under it and launches it over long-off again. Into the stands
Navdeep Saini to Pooran, FOUR, Pooran looks in his elements today. It was a slower one on the stumps, Pooran picks it up early, delays his bat swing and smashes it over cover for a boundary

Moeen Ali to Pooran, SIX, Mr Pooran why were you hiding in the dressing room in the previous matches. It was a flighted one on a good length, Pooran backs away, makes room and dispatches it over long-off
Moeen Ali to Pooran, SIX, fifth six for Pooran. He is putting on a show here. Pooran clears his leg, keeps his shape and tonks it over long-on for another six. He is dealing in sixes at the moment!

Southee to Miller, FOUR, Miller welcomes Southee with a four. It was a good length delivery on the stumps, Miller wanted to cut it wide of backward point, gets an outside edge and it races fine of third man for a boundray
Southee to Miller, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Miller. It was a slower one on the stumps, Miller picks it up early and powers the pull shot wide of deep mid-wicket for another four

U Yadav to Pooran, 1 run, the horror IPL for RCB in the field continues. It was a sitter, an absolute sitter. Kohli must be livid, he has turned his face away from the camera. It was a length delivery on the stumps, Pooran fails to time the heave. It was in the air for an eternity and Stoinis at long-on had all the time in the world to settle himself. He spills it though

Navdeep Saini to Miller, out Caught by de Villiers!! ABD dives and ABD snaffles it. Kohli with the fist pump. It was a length delivery on the stumps, Miller wanted to smash it over long-on. He hasn't timed it all evening and he failed to do so on this occassion also. ABD dives to his right emphatically and takes a beauty! Miller c de Villiers b Navdeep Saini 24(25) [4s-2]

Navdeep Saini to Pooran, out Caught by de Villiers!! ABD takes it again. He is having a dream of a match. And the dangerous Pooran departs. RCB are surely winning it now. He fails to get under the delivery, swings hard at it. It goes a long way up in the air and lands in safe hands of ABD. Pooran c de Villiers b Navdeep Saini 46(28) [4s-1 6s-5]
U Yadav to Ashwin, SIX, wow! Ashwin has dispatched it for a six. Can he replicate MSD? Yadav misses the yorker, Ashwin comes under it and pumps it over long-on

U Yadav to Ashwin, out Caught by Kohli!! No, no, no. Ashwin is no Dhoni. And he has hit it straight to Kohli who it seems was asking Ashwin what the heck he was doing? Ashwin fails to get under it and mistimes it, hits it straight to Kohli at long-on. Ashwin absolutely throws his gloves after crossing the fence. He is frustrated, well that's an understatement. Ashwin c Kohli b U Yadav 6(2) [6s-1]

U Yadav to Viljoen, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Two in two for Yadav. And he will be on a hat-trick! Umesh has won the match for RCB. It was a short of length delivery near the left shoulder, Viljoen was hurried on the pull shot. It clips his glove and Parthiv takes a good catch diving to his left. Viljoen c Parthiv Patel b U Yadav 0(1)

U Yadav to Murugan Ashwin, 1 run, dropped! Kohli drops a dolly. He might have been more worried about the celebration. Slower one on the stumps, Murugan Ashwin is completely deceived and he still goes through with the big hit, mistimes it towards long-on and the RCB skipper makes a mess of it

Navdeep Saini to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle greets the new bowler with a boundary. Shortish ball at 139.7kph, Gayle stays back in the crease and pulls it straight of mid-on. He got it almost off the toe end, but that's more than enough to run away for a boundary
Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, shot! Class written all over it. A short of length ball at 145.1kph, Rahul gets on top of it and punches it superbly through the covers, beating a diving Chahal
Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, Saini over-corrects. He doles out a half-volley at 146.4kph outside off. Rahul gets forward and plays the lofted off-drive over extra cover
U Yadav to Gayle, SIX, this is bad bowling! A full toss and Gayle doesn't need second invitation to put it away. Hoisted over long-on for half-a-dozen

U Yadav to Gayle, out Caught by de Villiers!! Gayle's gone, Kohli is pumped. Umesh Yadav shortens his length and Gayle is a touch late into his stroke. The southpaw was trying to heave it away and got it slightly off the top edge. Almost went the distance, but there was a fielder manning the fence. AB, at long-on, takes a calm catch. Gayle c de Villiers b U Yadav 23(10) [4s-4 6s-1]
U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, wow! Those wrists. Full ball on leg - a hit-me delivery and Rahul whips it over mid-wicket
Southee to Agarwal, FOUR, stylish from Mayank Agarwal, whipping a length ball round his front pad. Nice bent front knee there, as he picked it away from off stump to the long leg boundary
Southee to Agarwal, FOUR, if the last one was Agarwal's brilliance, this one is Southee's mediocrity. Strays on leg stump and is glanced fine for four
Chahal to Rahul, SIX, this one drifts in on leg, sliding on with the arm, and Rahul just lifts it through the line over long-on. A shot requiring great ability, especially as he's not to the pitch
Chahal to Rahul, FOUR, now he waits on the inevitable short ball and latches onto it. Cut away through the gap at point
Navdeep Saini to Agarwal, FOUR, that's been absolutely lambasted through extra cover. Back of a length outside off, Agarwal slaps it red, leaves a vapour trail enroute to the boundary

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, good length ball outside off, tentative footwork from Rahul. But it doesn't cost him. Instead, he benefits. The loose poke results in an outside edge which runs away fine to the third man boundary

Stoinis to Agarwal, FOUR, short of length at the body, Agarwal's eyes aren't on the ball all the way through, but he's controlled the pull nicely behind square. And the timing is brilliant, even though he's checked the shot

Chahal to Agarwal, SIX, skims over long-off's reach! Picked the googly there, which was overpitched anyway, and hammered it down the ground. Would've been worried for a brief moment, as he hadn't found the elevation, but it's high enough to escape Saini's one-handed leap
Chahal to Agarwal, FOUR, short ball on off stump, which to be fair isn't that short as Agarwal's made it out to be. He collapses his back leg to get low and swats it wide of long-on

Stoinis to Agarwal, out Caught by Chahal!! He's got this pull high on the bat, and the miscue is taken at midwicket. Stoinis screams in celebration, Kohli screams louder. Short of length, it was onto Agarwal quicker than he expected, and so there was no timing on the shot. Much needed for the RCB. Agarwal c Chahal b Stoinis 35(21) [4s-5 6s-1]
Rajpoot to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, 135ks hint of width outside off and Parthiv lashes on it with a fierce cut through point. RCB and Parthiv Patel off the mark in style
Rajpoot to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, 137ks, keep that coming says Parthiv Patel...leans onto his front foot and hammers the pitched up delivery straight back over his skipper
