Narine to Pollard, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Narine comes back into the attack and breaks the partnership that was turning out to be a threatening one. A floated delivery delivery leg, Pollard flicks it towards deep mid-wicket in his quest to clear the fence but doesn't get the timing right. Rana who was stationed near the fence, charges forward and puts in a dive to complete the catch. Pollard c Nitish Rana b Narine 20(21) [4s-2]

Narine to Hardik Pandya, SIX, fastest fifty of IPL 2019. This is insane hitting by the six hitting machine. He's turning it on here! Heaves the flatter delivery over the deep mid-wicket fence for a massive six, gets to his half century in style. What a knock!

Narine to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, full in length by Narina and Hardik Pandya hacks it into the gap at deep mid-wicket. The ball is just sailing all over the park, the fielders are going to have a neck-ache by the end of this innings
Chawla to Krunal Pandya, SIX, Krunal Pandya joins the party now. Why should Hardik have all the fun, says the elder brother. Goes down on his knee and smokes it over long-on for half a dozen

Chawla to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, dropped! Miscommunication between Karthik and Uthappa and they've put down a sitter. Uthappa had called for it but DK tries to go for the catch and the former ends up spilling it. Pandya had horribly miscued this slog as the top-edge ballooned into the off side
Chawla to Hardik Pandya, byes, FOUR, fires this one at 120ks around off and beats both the batsman and the wicket-keeper. Frustration creeping in and that delivery by Chawla says it all
Chawla to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, floated outside off and Hardik has chipped it over covers for four runs, runs are leaking as Pandya brothers are having some fun out in the middle

Chawla to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, hammered! Things going worse for Chawla who has now conceded 48 runs. Another floated delivery outside off and Hardik slams it through the gap at covers. Hardik's looking unstoppable

Narine to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Hardik is in some pain but he's keeping the scoreboard ticking. Smacking 'em all over! Goes down on his knee and bludgeons it right over the bowler's head for a boundary
Narine to Hardik Pandya, SIX, bring out the helmet folks! Hardik gets underneath this full delivery and tonks it over the deep mid-wicket fence for another massive six. It's raining sixes!
Narine to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 50-run stand up between Hardik and Krunal! Slaps the shortish delivery to mid-off for a single, does Hardik

Gurney to Hardik Pandya, SIX, magnificent shot by Hardik! Russell hit 8 sixes in his innings but Hardik has just hit his 9th maximum of the night. Gets inside the line and picks up the length delivery over deep square leg for half a dozen
Gurney to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, into his 90s is Hardik! Full in length outside off and Hardik chips it over covers for four more. Amazing display of batting by Pandya

Gurney to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by A Russell!! That brings an end to Hardik's belligerence. That was some knock! He set Edens on fire! Goes hard at a slower short delivery and mistimes it to deep mid-wicket. Dre Russ is the man who gets under the skier and takes the catch safely. A round of applause for Hardik who walks back to the pavilion after playing a quality knock. Hardik Pandya c A Russell b Gurney 91(34) [4s-6 6s-9]
Chawla to Krunal Pandya, SIX, Krunal is not done here yet! Down on his knee and slogs it over wide long-on for half a dozen

Chawla to Krunal Pandya, out Caught&Bowled!! Piyush Chawla becomes the third bowler in the history of IPL to claim 150 wickets. Calls for the catch, sprints back and takes it eventually. Was another googly and Pandya got a top-edge as he tried to slog it across the line. Krunal Pandya c and b Chawla 24(18) [6s-2]
Warrier to Lewis, SIX, 138.5kph, short and wide outside off which allows Lewis to free his arms. The southpaw throws his bat at it and flays it over deep point for a maximum

Gurney to Rohit, out Lbw!! Rohit goes for the big hoick, gets hit on the back leg. KKR players go up for an lbw appeal and the umpire has raised his finger. Rohit decides to review it. Legal ball. No bat involved. What does the HawkEye say. Umpire's call on hitting wickets. The on-field call stays. Rohit has to walk back. While going back, Rohit has a word or two with the umpire. He knocked down the bails with his bat at the bowler's end too. It was an in-slanter from round the wicket and Rohit wanted to play it across the line. Missed it and was struck on the back leg in front of middle. The ball-tracker showed it to be clipping leg-stump. Rohit lbw b Gurney 12(9) [4s-3]

Warrier to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, that is his area. Anything on off and middle, Suryakumar picks it away nonchalantly over mid-wicket. The ball lands right on the ad cushions - second six of the innings

Gurney to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, just can't bowl straight to Suryakumar. The slower delivery drifts with the round the wicket angle, flicked away with a lot of bottom hand in front of square, beating the fielder in the deep comfortably
Gurney to Lewis, FOUR, full delivery and Lewis picked the bones out of that. It was in the slot and Lewis lofted it through the line ovr extra cover, couple of bounces and into the rope

A Russell to Lewis, out Caught by Karthik!! It is Russell's day. He can do no wrong today. Strikes with his first ball. Back of a length in the channel around off, Lewis looks to force it from the crease and the outside edge nestles into the safe mitts of Karthik. KKR are running away with the game. Lewis c Karthik b A Russell 15(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

A Russell to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, sloppy from Chawla. Russell will not be a happy man. It was a brilliant over until this misfield. Back of a length outside off, Suryakumar steers it to third man and Chawla is all over the place with his dive, the ball just escapes past him

A Russell to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, much needed six for Mumbai and Suryakumar. They need to put their foot on the accelerator. Shuffles across, crouches a bit and flicks it over deep square leg. Just managed to clear the rope

A Russell to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Karthik!! He's getting wickets of full tosses. That smile on his face says it all. Russell is enjoying every minute of it and he also has a quick jig for the KKR supporters. Full toss around knee height, Suryakumar goes for his favoured pick up shot but gets only a leading edge, straight up and Karthik settles under it. Suryakumar Yadav c Karthik b A Russell 26(14) [4s-2 6s-2]
Chawla to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Chawla is welcomed with a straight six by Pandya. Flighted delivery and Pandya just swings through the line, clean connection and the ball travels the distance

Chawla to Hardik Pandya, SIX, second six of the over. Fired in but the length allowed Pandya to get under it, he just elevated himself and launched it into the crowd near cow corner. DK walks up to have a word with Chawla
Chawla to Pollard, FOUR, googly but on the shorter length, Pollard does not go hell for leather, slides on the back foot and crunches it square on the off-side, no chance for a diving sweeper cover

Khaleel Ahmed to Gayle, FOUR, Gayle opens his account with a boundary. That was no where close to the middle of his bat though, it came off the cue end. A length delivery outside off, Gayle goes hard at the first ball he faces and as a courtesy of the power on that shot gets a four through square third man, that was in the air for a while but well over the fielder inside the circle

Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, FOUR, quite an edgy start for the Kings. Rahul goes for an expensive drive against an outswinger and gets a thick outside edge. The ball flies over Guptill at wide slip and races away to the fence. Both batsmen have scored a boundaries but they haven't been convincing ones

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, SIX, Bhuvi has taken it. But he has jumped over the ropes. Khaleel Ahmed would be gutted! Bhuvi throws the ball in disgust. It was a short of length delivery on the body, Pooran mistimes the pull to fine leg but he gets just enough bat on it to fetch a maximum
Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, FOUR, smashed! This is an excellent shot. On a length and on the stumps, Pooran uses a straight bat and tonks it straight down the ground. It rockets to the fence

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, FOUR, another boundary from Pooran. He is putting on a show here for Punjab. It was a slower one and was wide of off, Pooran goes down on his knees and sweeps it through fine leg for a boundary. Great connection!

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Bhuvi has made amends. He has taken a spectacular catch at fine leg! And the orange army supporters are on their feet in the crowd. Umpires have gone for a review just to be absolutely sure. Soft signal is OUT and he is OUT. It was a terrific short delivery on the face, Pooran was clearly beaten by the pace there. The situation demanded him to play another big shot and he went after it again via: A pull shot. Gets it off the top-half, Bhuvi at fine leg, charges forward, dives in a dramatic fashion and takes a beauty. Pooran c Bhuvneshwar b Khaleel Ahmed 21(10) [4s-2 6s-2]
Rashid Khan to Miller, FOUR, freebie and Miller puts it away. Need to make this into a big over now. Long hop and Miller had ample time to pick his spot, rocked back and pulled it in front of square

Rashid Khan to Miller, out Caught by Shankar!! Second for Rashid. Not the greatest of deliveries but SRH won't be complaining. Another one of KXIP's big hitters is back in the pavilion. It was a half tracker and Miller picked it early, went back and pulled it flat to deep mid-wicket. He just could not place it better. Miller c Shankar b Rashid Khan 11(11) [4s-1]

Rashid Khan to Ashwin, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Rashid is on a hat-trick. Ashwin coming ahead of debutant Prabhsimran doesn't pay off. What started with a boundary has ended with two wickets. Googly outside off, Ashwin spotted it off the hand and heaved it with the spin, but could not generate power to clear long-on. Pandey takes a sitter. Ashwin c Manish Pandey b Rashid Khan 0(1)

Nabi to Rahul, SIX, Rahul has no other option but to go for it. Even though he is losing partners in a heap at the other end. Quicker and outside off, Rahul lofts it handsomely over extra cover and clears the rope comfortably. The most difficult shot to play against an offie and he's made it look ridiculously easy

Nabi to Rahul, SIX, now is helped by Nabi. A full toss just below the waist, Rahul waits and swings it over long leg. Back to back sixes and with that it also brings up the fifty for Rahul. The chase depends on him
Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, SIX, clobbered! Bhuvi starts with a length delivery right in the slot, Rahul with a cleared front leg swings through the line and gets plenty of distance over long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, FOUR, knuckle ball and Rahul smokes it over extra cover. He made room and generated enough power to take it over Williamson, the ball bounced just inside the rope
Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, SIX, a one-handed six from Rahul. A full toss, Rahul went deep in the crease and smashes it straight back over Sandeep, with the bottom hand coming off the bat handle
Bhuvneshwar to Simran Singh, SIX, wow! Seemed to be a mishit but Warner watches it sail over him. Full, slow and outside off, Simran lofts it off the base of the bat and it soars just over long-off

Khaleel Ahmed to Rahul, out Caught by Williamson!! Fine catch! Khaleel picks up his third wicket. He's been the pick of the bowlers along with Rashid. Change of pace and Rahul went after it, cleared his front leg and swung as hard as possible, came off the toe-end and went straight up, Williamson ran across from extra cover and took it near mid-off. It was in the air for a long time and the skipper had to put in a dive to take it. Rahul c Williamson b Khaleel Ahmed 79(56) [4s-4 6s-5]
Khaleel Ahmed to Simran Singh, FOUR, slower delivery combined with width, Simran flays it behind point and bisected the fielders expertly

Sandeep Sharma to Simran Singh, out Lbw!! Looked a 50-50 call and that's why only Sandeep went up for it. A slow dipping yorker and Simran swings blindly without watching the ball, the ball lands in front of him and strikes him on the back leg around leg-stump. Ball-tracking has to be kissing the stumps. Simran Singh lbw b Sandeep Sharma 16(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Mujeeb, out Bowled!! It was a matter of Sandeep getting it on target. Another knuckle ball and Mujeeb slogs without a clue in the world, the ball arrives later to mess up the stumps. Is it going to be a double wicket maiden for Sandeep? Mujeeb b Sandeep Sharma 0(3)

Khaleel Ahmed to Gayle, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Khaleel Ahmed strikes as Manish Pandey takes a skier. No special knock by the Universe Boss tonight. Goes hard at a length delivery and gets a top-edge that goes miles up in the air. Manish at point settles under it and takes it, not on the first but on the second attempt. The ball almost popped out of Manish's hands who did well to cling on the catch eventually. Sunrisers on top! Gayle c Manish Pandey b Khaleel Ahmed 4(3) [4s-1]
Khaleel Ahmed to Rahul, SIX, that's the kind of form, KL Rahul has been in. Stands tall and flicks the length delivery over deep mid-wicket for a towering six, his first one of the night
Sandeep Sharma to Agarwal, FOUR, deft touch! On the pads and Agarwal clips it past the fielder at short fine leg. The fielder in the deep was very square in order to cut this down

Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, FOUR, all about class! Down on his knee early and picks the slower delivery over fine leg for a boundary. Was the slower delivery and Rahul played the lap shot to perfecion. Almost got a six as the ball hit the cushions on a boundary

Abhishek Sharma to Agarwal, FOUR, Rashid lost in the lights there. And he has allowed it to go for a boundary. Agarwal rocks back and thumps it straight to sweeper cover. Rashid should have stopped it on the bounce but instead he lets it go and gifts a boundary to Kings

Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul is flowing like a river. He is timing the ball so very well. But the required rate demands more out of this. It was a slower one on the stumps, Rahul flicks it handsomely, beats fine leg and it races to the fence

Rashid Khan to Agarwal, SIX, that's been belted by Agarwal. He sure has some muscle power and he has flaunted it there! He plunges forward, clears his front leg, keeps his shape and absolutely smashes it over long-off for a gigantic six

Rashid Khan to Agarwal, out Caught by Shankar!! Mayank gets greedy there. And he pays the price for it. Rashid is so skilfull a bowler that you just can't hit him for consecutive sixes. It was a flighted delivery on the stumps, Agarwal goes down on his knees and wanted to launch it over deep mid-wicket, fails to connect as well as he would have liked. And ends up gifting a catch to Shankar at deep mid-wicket. Agarwal c Shankar b Rashid Khan 27(18) [4s-2 6s-1]

Nabi to Pooran, SIX, that's more like it, Kings need more of these hits. It was on a fuller length, Pooran gets under it, clears his leg, opens up his shoulders and dispatches it over long-on. High and handsome!

Arshdeep Singh to Warner, FOUR, erratic and Warner puts it away this time. Arshdeep strayed on the pads once more with this pacy inswinger, the southpaw just had to get bat on it and he tickled it past the keeper. Fine leg was quite squarer and had no chance

Arshdeep Singh to Warner, FOUR, this is poor bowling from Arshdeep after a good start. Once again errs in line, feeds it down leg and Warner takes full toll of this inswinger. Fine is up in the ring and this is clipped fine enough. All too easy

Mujeeb to Warner, SIX, beautifully struck! Turn on this off break but there is width on offer and Warner does the smart thing, goes with the turn as he chips it over wide long-off. More of an extended defensive push and it goes all the way. Shot of a man in supreme form

Murugan Ashwin to Manish Pandey, FOUR, delicate hands from Pandey. Ashwin pulls his length and feeds him with width outside off, Pandey goes deep in his crease and opens his bat face at the last moment to place it in the gap past point. The timing is flawless and the sweeper in the deep had no chance

Shami to Manish Pandey, 1 run, oh boy! He almost had it till the last second there is Ashwin, would've been a stunner had he held onto it, but unfortunately, he couldn't and Pandey gets a lifeline. Fullish and on off, Pandey lifts it hard and ends up hitting it towards KXIP skipper at mid-off, who leapt high and plucked it with his right-hand. He was air-borne when he took it but just when his heels touched the ground, the ball popped out of his hands. Very unlucky

Shami to Warner, FOUR, fifty for Warner. It's most likely his last game for the season and he wants to finish on a high. Shorter and wobbled away just outside off, Warner waited deep and slashed at it, thick outside edge runs away to the third man fence. SRH dug-out up on their feet and Warner acknowledges them with a raise of the bat

Murugan Ashwin to Manish Pandey, SIX, 50-stand comes up between the duo with this maximum. Such a clean strike from Pandey. Tossed up at th stumps, Pandey loads up big time and hammers it over the bowler's head. Held his shape and connected it beautifully

Mujeeb to Warner, FOUR, There's the trademark switch-hit from Warner. Flighted full just outside off, Warner changes his stance and lifts it over short third man. He was itching to play this shot for a while, does so now..

Arshdeep Singh to Warner, FOUR, well, the plan was good from Arshdeep, but the execution part went wrong. Swerving in, tried for the yorker but missed by a few inches. Ends up as a low full toss on the pads for Warner, who gets across and flicks it past Gayle at short fine leg. Cricket can be cruel sometimes, ain't it?

Arshdeep Singh to Manish Pandey, FOUR, this is poor from the youngster. Nah, nah, not where you bowl with fine leg inside the ring. Went for the bouncer, but didn't quite hit his target. Pandey gets on top of it and pulls it over short fine leg for a boundary

Ashwin to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Shami!! Ashwin removes Pandey. Finally, a wicket for KXIP which should give them some lift. Wasn't that great a delivery from Ashwin. Rifled it quick - the carrom ball and down leg, Pandey tried to be cheeky and thought of helping it over the man at 45. But he didn't get the required timing to clear the fielder and hits it to Shami at short fine leg, who clings onto it. First wicket for Ashwin and let's see if they can put the brakes from here. Manish Pandey c Shami b Ashwin 36(25) [4s-3 6s-1]

Ashwin to Warner, out Caught by Mujeeb!! Wow! Is this the game-changing over from Ashwin? He's gotten rid of both the set-batsmen in this over and Warner is livid with himself as he thuds his bat onto his pads. But doesn't matter because he's played a fabulous knock here. The Hyderabad crowd gives him a rousing reception. It was the round-arm darter from Ashwin, bowled it quick outside off. Warner with a tired looking shot as he threw his bat and skews it up towards point, who takes a couple of steps back and grabs it. Warner c Mujeeb b Ashwin 81(56) [4s-7 6s-2]

Mujeeb to Williamson, FOUR, what has Gayle done there? He's kicked that ball away to the boundary. Went for the chase from short third man and ends up kicking it away to the fence. Williamson went hard at this one as the thick outside edge flew over the fielders at short third and backward point
Mujeeb to Williamson, SIX, that's more like it! Goes down on his knee and hacks the floated delivery over deep backward square leg for half a dozen does the SRH skipper
Mujeeb to Nabi, SIX, time for Nabi to join in the party! Takes on his Afghan team mate and thumps the floated delivery right over the bowler's head for a clean six, couldn't have played it any better

Mujeeb to Nabi, SIX, Mujeeb has conceded 65 runs already! Nabi gets underneath the full ball and smokes it right into the sightscreen. He's turning it on here, brilliant striking and the decibels have gone a notch higher in Hyderabad. Crowd is loving it

Shami to Williamson, out Caught by Murugan Ashwin!! That's a stunning catch by Murugan Ashwin at cover as he times his jump to perfection and plucks it out of thin air. Was a back of a length delivery and Williamson had chipped it in order to clear the infield, however the fielder does well to pull off a blinder. With 10 balls remaining, Williamson had to go for it and perishes in his quest to get some quick runs. Williamson c Murugan Ashwin b Shami 14(7) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shami to Nabi, out Bowled!! Shami has ripped the stumps apart. Dishes out a sizzling full length delivery and it was the pace that got the better of him. Nabi swung hard but there was daylight between his willow and the ball - end result is that the sticks are rattled and it's game over for Nabi, at least with the bat. Nabi b Shami 20(10) [6s-2]

Arshdeep Singh to Rashid Khan, out Bowled!! Wickets are tumbling towards the death but the total is more than enough. Arshdeep Singh nails his yorker right and uproots the leg-stump as Rashid Khan fails to squeeze it out. Some decent death bowling by Kings XI Punjab. Rashid Khan b Arshdeep Singh 1(2)

Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, that's a crispy drive by Abhishek Sharma! An overpitched delivery outside off and the southpaw creams it through extra cover. Miller in the deep sprinted across and although he put in a dive, he couldn't quite stop the ball, four runs for the young batsman

Arshdeep Singh to Saha, FOUR, heaved over mid-wicket! Looked ungainly from Saha but he's managed to clear the infield with ease. Was a length ball, picked from outside off and lobbed with a heave across the line

Arshdeep Singh to Saha, byes, FOUR, bonus runs! It's an IPL debut for Simran Singh and this won't do much to his confidence, that's for sure. Was a slower ball from Arshdeep and Saha wanted to hoick across the line. Got beaten by the lack of pace and it went on the bounce to Simran Singh who just couldn't cover the line as it sneaked past him to the fence. Don't want to be gifting easy runs to the opposition, not in such high-pressure games
Mujeeb to Warner, FOUR, Warner is having fun! Slower and fuller, he just shuffles a bit and slog sweeps merrily over backward square leg. Clean strike and it races away to the fence

Mujeeb to Warner, FOUR, this is superb batting! He's toying with the field, Warner. Makes a bit of room to the loopy off break and goes with the turn on this chip over extra cover. Another clean connection and the boundaries continue to rain here in Hyderabad

Mujeeb to Saha, FOUR, fastest fifty partnership in IPL 2019! SRH are on rampage here! Saha joins in the fun with a lovely paddle sweep, the line was too straight from Mujeeb and it was helped away quite fine. Well wide of short fine leg who could do nothing
Shami to Saha, FOUR, sublime from Saha! He's looking in great touch tonight, isn't he? Too full from Shami and it's been drop kicked over wide mid-on. Supple stuff and easily over the infield

Shami to Saha, SIX, my word, hasn't he clobbered this or what! Saha is going bonkers here! Gets one slightly too short from Shami and belts the pull over deep backward square leg. Absolutely waded into the pull and sent it deep into the crowd

Ashwin to Warner, SIX, the KXIP skipper is welcomed with some rough treatment! Warner shuffles around in the crease and slog sweeps this over fine leg for a maximum. No respite whatsoever from the Orange Army thus far

Murugan Ashwin to Saha, out Caught by Simran Singh!! Murugan draws first blood! Was a quickish slider and Saha wanted to pull across the line. Got a tiny under edge and Simran Singh who had looked awful initially, held on to a brilliant catch. The fun part began after this, because the appeal for caught behind wasn't given at first. As KXIP were about to review, the umpire raised his finger but Saha didn't probably see that. He was standing with Warner, which made it seem like he wanted the review. It seems like he wasn't clear of the decision and once it was clarified, he walked away Saha c Simran Singh b Murugan Ashwin 28(13) [4s-3 6s-1]

Ashwin to Manish Pandey, FOUR, superb shot! Pandey is in some form and this shot is a reflection of it. Ashwin went wide of the crease to cut off room but Pandey backed away a touch to drive this inside out through extra cover. Bisected the deep fielders well
Aaron to Kohli, SIX, Kohli wasting no time whatsoever. Aaron pitches it right in the slot outside off, Kohli doesn't want any sighters and leans across to dump it into the long-off stands

Aaron to Kohli, SIX, six more! Not so convincing this but Kohli won't mind. This was a short of length delivery from Aaron, corrected his length and slightly cramped the batsman for room. Kohli throws his bat hard and skews it off the outer half. Such is the power that it sails over the third man fence for a maximum

Aaron to de Villiers, FOUR, de Villiers is off the mark with a boundary. Streaky but he'll take it. Length delivery that gained some extra bounce, ABD flashes his bat and ends up getting a thick outside edge that beats short third man. Aaron can't believe his luck, got to feel for him

Aaron to de Villiers, FOUR, one bounce and over the ropes. 23 have come off the opening over. Went fuller, aimed at the stumps and de Villiers made room. Cleared his front leg and blasts it over cow corner. The fielder in the deep gave up the chase..

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, SIX, this is some statement from Kohli. RCB fans are going berserk in the stands. Flighted delivery from Gopal, Kohli stays low and pummels it over long-on. Welcome to the attack, Gopal..
Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, FOUR, oh my word! He's hammered it past mid-off. What a hit. Gopal went quicker and fired it outside off, Kohli gets under it and drills it with ferocity down the ground

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, out Caught by Livingstone!! The fun comes to an end for Kohli. Bunny alert! Gopal gets the prized scalp of the RCB skipper for the second time in the tournament. What a tournament he's having. Some relief for RR here. It was tossed up luringly at the stumps, Kohli flexes his arms and slogs it, didn't connect it as he would've liked and picks out Livingstone at long-on, who comfortably holds onto it. Kohli c Livingstone b Shreyas Gopal 25(7) [4s-1 6s-3]

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Wowza! It's two in two for Gopal. Pin-drop silence in the ground. Put your hands together for this young leggie. He's been a star for RR and continues to impress. Well-flighted delivery again, drawing de Villiers into a false shot. AB wielded his bat hard, loses his balance and shape completely. Skies it into the night sky as the timing goes for a toss. Riyan Parag at extra cover calls for it and settles under it. Big setback this for RCB. Gopal on a hat-trick now. de Villiers c Riyan Parag b Shreyas Gopal 10(4) [4s-2]

Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, out Caught by Smith!! He's done it. Hat-trick for Shreyas Gopal, take a bow. Look at him celebrate, totally deserves it. RR dugout is over the moon. RCB fans are stunned as they are quaking now. Loopy delivery outside off, Stoinis gets under it and bashes it airly. Finds Smith at mid-off. Gopal is off on a celebratary run. Stoinis c Smith b Shreyas Gopal 0(1)
Riyan Parag to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, what happened there? Pushed through flatter down leg, Mann sinks low and is a bit early into the shot. Gets a top-edge which balloons away to the fine leg fence

Riyan Parag to Gurkeerat Singh, out Caught by Lomror!! The procession continues. Parag joins the party as he removes Mann. Also, breaks into a jig. RCB have lost the plot completely. Drifted quicker on middle and leg, Mann heaves it across the line and miscues it totally. Only succeeds in finding the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Gurkeerat Singh c Lomror b Riyan Parag 6(3) [4s-1]

Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, he's been pushed down the order but Patel is off and running. Slower delivery from Unadkat, reared up a touch and Patel was through the pull early. Fat top-edge loops over short fine leg and trickles away to the boundary

Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Thomas!! Another soft dismissal and another instance of an RCB batsman throwing his wicket away. Patel tried to be cheeky and walked across his stumps to lap it over the fielder at 45. But unfortunately, he ended up hitting it straight to Thomas, who accepts it with glee. PP can't believe it, couldn't have placed it any better. Parthiv Patel c Thomas b Unadkat 8(5) [4s-1]

Thomas to Klaasen, out Caught by Livingstone!! Klaasen perishes. Fast, fiery and full outside off, Klaasen was beaten for the pace as he loses his shape attempting an across-the-line mow. Slices it off the outer half and it balloons towards sweeper cover where Livingstone grabs it with ease. Klaasen c Livingstone b Thomas 6(7)
Thomas to Negi, FOUR, edged and four! Handy boundary for Negi and RCB. Thomas bombarded it short, hustles Negi for pace as he hooks. Top-edge is found and it sails over Samson

Thomas to Negi, out Caught by Samson!! No escape for Negi this time. Thomas picks up his second wicket. Short of a length delivery outside off, Negi slashes his willow and gets an outside edge which is gobbled up by Samson. Negi c Samson b Thomas 4(3) [4s-1]

U Yadav to Samson, SIX, Samson is underway with a six. Stunning hit! Short of length around off, Samson picked the length early. Stayed in his crease, waited for the ball to come to him and deposited it over deep mid-wicket with a pick-up shot

U Yadav to Samson, FOUR, poor ball! The line is too straight, ends up bowling the length ball on the pads and that's easy pickings for any batter. Samson helps it on its way with a flick through the gap between short fine and backward square leg

Navdeep Saini to Livingstone, FOUR, skiddy and pacy back of a length delivery at 152.4kph, Livingstone sees that coming. Clears his front leg and heaves it hard and over mid-wicket. Couple of bounces and into the fence

Navdeep Saini to Livingstone, SIX, Saini bangs it in short, Livingstone once again cleared his front leg to pummel the pull. Didn't quite middle it, got it off the top part of the bat. But, he swung his bat so ferociously that it went all the way over long-on for a maximum

Navdeep Saini to Livingstone, 1 run, 152.8kph, full toss, Livingstone clobbers it through the off-side - off the top part again. Klaasen dived full length to his right at cover-point, but the ball doesn't stick. It'd be harsh to call that a drop. Saved three runs for his team there did the South African

Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, two men in the deep (long-on and deep mid-wicket), but all they can do is watch the ball sail over the ropes. A harmless short of length delivery, Samson swings his bat hard and dispatches it over cow corner
Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, much-needed six for RR. Touch fuller from Khejroliya, Samson crouched a bit low, sets the base and smokes it over long-on for half a dozen
Khejroliya to Samson, FOUR, edged and four! Away-angler at 136.4kph, Samson throws the kitchen sink and gets a thick outside edge that runs away through the gap between the keeper and short third man

Chahal to Samson, out Caught by Negi!! This is a big wicket! Chahal strikes. Flat, quick and outside off, Samson had to reach out and he tried to go over extra cover. The ball lobs up off the outside half. Negi settles under it at backward point and gobbles it up. Samson c Negi b Chahal 28(13) [4s-2 6s-3]
Rutherford to Raina, 1 run, short of length and Raina hops to tuck it backward of square. The 50-run stand comes up
Mishra to Raina, FOUR, just over Morris. Lands the wrong 'un outside leg, Raina is down on his knee to play the sweep, waits for the ball to turn across and helps it over a leaping Morris

Rutherford to du Plessis, SIX, first of the game and Chennai need plenty more of this going into the final phase of the innings. Slower cutter on a length outside off, du Plessis delays his loft and crunches it over extra cover. That came right off the screws and went a long way

Axar to du Plessis, SIX, biggie straight down the ground and almost went into the press box. du Plessis puts on the dancing shoes, comes down the track and strikes it sweetly with the full bat face right back over Axar

Axar to du Plessis, out Caught by Dhawan!! Taken! It was in the air for a long time but Dhawan kept his composure to snaffle it well inside the rope. A big cheer engulfs Chepauk as MS Dhoni makes his way out to the middle. Axar gives is not afraid to toss it up and du Plessis is down the track to go big again, he gets it somewhere close to the bottom and Dhawan steadies under it at long-off. He had run in and needed to track back, took it with his hands over his head. du Plessis c Dhawan b Axar 39(41) [4s-2 6s-2]

J Suchith to Raina, FOUR, not where he intended but Raina will take the final result. He went down to play the slog sweep, but dragged it off the inner half of the bat to cow corner - bisecting deep mid-wicket and long-on

J Suchith to Raina, FOUR, fifty for Raina. It is his 50th fifty in all of T20 cricket. He gets there with a fabulous shot. Charges down the wicket, reached out for the delivery and pumped it over Suchith, couple of bounces and over the rope

J Suchith to Raina, SIX, Boult tries to take a one-handed stunner but fails to hang on. Raina has decided it is time to go, puts the skates on and heaves it towards wide long-on, Boult runs to his left and dives full length, goes with his left hand and the ball doesn't stick. He was looking to flick it to the fielder coming across from deep mid-wicket

J Suchith to Raina, out Caught by Dhawan!! Suchith has his man. But Raina has done his job. He resurrected the innings after a slow start and given them the impetus going into the final 5 overs. He looks to go across the line against a ball that is angled across him, slices it off the outer half towards backward point, Dhawan gets into all sorts of tangle as he runs back, but he manages to hang on to it. Kept the hands close to the body and used it as a shield for the ball. Raina c Dhawan b J Suchith 59(37) [4s-8 6s-1]

Axar to Jadeja, SIX, parried over. Jadeja has been sent above to do this. Goes for the slog sweep and hits it to deep backward square, Rutherford is running back to take the catch but he could only palm it over. The momentum did not help him there
Axar to Jadeja, FOUR, charges down and Axar makes him reach out by firing it outside off, Jadeja still goes through with the big hit and the outside edge flies away fine, beating Pant to his left

Chris Morris to Dhoni, FOUR, finds the gap this time. Not a lot wrong with this delivery, it was a slower one and was on the stumps. Dhoni picks it up early, swivels and pulls it wide of fine leg for a boundray. Sweet connection! First boundary for MS in this innings, this might get him going!

Chris Morris to Jadeja, FOUR, he is playing a cameo here, is Jaddu. It was an off-cutter, there was just a little bit room. Jadeja waits for it to arrive, opens the face of the blade at the last moment and guides it wide of short third man for a boundary. Exemplary placement!
Boult to Dhoni, FOUR, you cannot bowl short with fine leg up in the circle. Dhoni knows where the fielders are and he pulls it over fine leg. The connection was good enough and it runs for a boundary

Boult to Jadeja, SIX, this is the best we have seen Jadeja bat in this season. And it is a positive not only for CSK but also for India with WC coming up. Boult misses the yorker, it ends up being in the slot. Jadeja clears his front leg, keeps his shape and larrups it over long-on for a maximum

Chris Morris to Dhoni, FOUR, not where Dhoni wanted it to go but he will take it with both hands at this stage of the innings. It was on a fuller length and was attacking the stumps, Dhoni swings his willow hard. He gets a thick inside edge and it beats short fine for a boundary

Chris Morris to Jadeja, out Caught&Bowled!! That's a brilliant running catch from Morris. The slog was miscued by Jadeja, it went a long way up in the night sky and was about to land in no man's land. But Morris for some seconds became Usain Bolt, he charged towards mid-wicket, just about reached it and takes it wonderfully well in the end. But a brilliant cameo from Jadeja! Jadeja c and b Chris Morris 25(10) [4s-2 6s-2]

Chris Morris to Rayudu, FOUR, he doesn't want to get his eye in, does Rayudu. It was in the slot for Rayudu and he smashes it over deep mid-wicket. Not timed as well as he would have liked. So, it didn't go over the ropes but will fetch him a boundary

Chris Morris to Dhoni, no ball, SIX, that's a nasty nasty delivery from Chris Morris. He came to Dhoni to apologize immediately. It was a full-toss above the waist height, Dhoni gets his bat down in a good position and smashes it over short fine for a maximum

Boult to Dhoni, FOUR, check for a spark on the bat! Wow that was hit hard! Hard is an understatement of the highest order. It was a yorker on the stumps. Dhoni was standing deep in the crease, he gets under it and pumps it straight down the ground. It rockets to the fence!

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, smashed over deep mid-wicket. You cannot bowl length to Dhoni at this stage. It was a slower one on a good length, Dhoni waits for it to arrive and tonks it high and handsome over deep mid-wicket. It sails into the crowd!

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, he has finished again with a maximum. Dhoni and last ball sixes is a story for the ages! It was angled away from Dhoni, was on a length again. Dhoni slogs, gets Dhoni power behind it. And gets just about enough bat to clear deep square leg who jumped but it was out of his grasp

J Suchith to Watson, out Caught by Axar at mid-wicket! He's picked him out! A half-tracker that stays low, picks out the ONE man at cow corner with the pull - a shot he nails every time. Hasn't managed to get it over the boundary and he's out for a nine-ball blob. More disappointment for Watson, after what might be a false dawn. Watson c Axar b J Suchith 0(9)
Chris Morris to du Plessis, FOUR, low full-toss on leg-stump, easy pickings, just a deflection away towards the fine leg fence for four - CSK's first boundary comes after 26 balls
Chris Morris to Raina, FOUR, very full, very wide, 141.6km/h, Raina reaches out and opens the face, slices it away through the third man region for four
Axar to Raina, FOUR, skids through low, a tad short, Raina gets low and carves it away through the gap between cover point and backward point for four - bisected perfectly. Surgical precision
Axar to Raina, FOUR, fired on the leg-stump, Raina gets on his knee and plays the fall-over Kanhai sweep to the fine leg fence for four
J Suchith to Raina, FOUR, tossed up very full, in the slot, Raina reaches out and whip-drives it between extra cover and long-off for four
Chris Morris to Raina, FOUR, stand and deliver. Morris helped him with the perfect length, Raina cleared his front leg and thumped it straight back over Morris. He didn't even bother to run

Chris Morris to du Plessis, FOUR, hit-me delivery and du Plessis does not miss out. Slow, short and down leg, du Plessis swivels and helps it along the way to fine leg. Mishra was square and well in front of the rope, he had no chance of stopping that
Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, misses his length and misses his line too. It ends up being a half-volley on the pads, Prithvi Shaw flicks it wide of fine leg for a boundary

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Raina!! Shaw has hit it straight to Raina at cover and he looks bamboozled. Chahar has yet again picked up a breakthrough with the new ball. It was on a good length and there was lot of width. Prithvi Shaw was enticed by the room, he went hard on his trademark punch shot, fails to control it and ends up gifting a catch to cover. Prithvi Shaw c Raina b Chahar 4(5) [4s-1]
Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, down the leg-side and Shreyas Iyer clips it fine of fine leg for a boundary. Nice way to get off the mark!

Tahir to Axar, out Caught by Watson!! More energy expended by Imran Tahir in celebration. Tiring just to watch. He floats this googly wide outside off, makes Axar reach for it, and then turns it away further. Flew off the edge to Watson at slip who took a sharp catch. Delhi slide further. Axar c Watson b Tahir 9(9) [4s-1]

Tahir to Rutherford, out Caught by Chahar!! Tahir on a roll. Third wicket for him in just his second over. Another googly wide of off, and in throwing his hands at it, Rutherford has sliced it to backward point. Delhi sinking quickly. Rutherford c Chahar b Tahir 2(4)

Jadeja to Chris Morris, out Stumped!! That's another addition to the Dhoni collection of brilliant stumpings. Morris's back foot barely lifts up for a brief moment, and that's enough for Dhoni as he whips the bails off in a flash. Superb delivery to begin with from Jadeja, managed to turn it at pace to which Morris had no answer. Chris Morris st Dhoni b Jadeja 0(1)

Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, out Stumped!! Beaten on the edge, and more brilliant glovework from Dhoni behind the stumps. He's not got him, has he? Oh dear, Iyer's back foot is in the air slightly when the bails are taken off. He's gone. Another brilliant delivery from Jadeja. Flat through the air, still manages a good deal of turn from a length. Delhi crumbling. Shreyas Iyer st Dhoni b Jadeja 44(31) [4s-4 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to J Suchith, out J Suchith Run Out!! Such has been the day for CSK today that even the least athletic fielder in their unit manages to break the stumps. Thrown wider of off, Suchith leans across and pushes it to point. Watto sprawls across, collects it and nails the stumps at the non-striker's end. There was a slight hesitation in the running as Suchith was ball-watching. He stopped mid-way and lost his balance, ended up running himself short of the crease. J Suchith run out (Watson) 6(15)

Dwayne Bravo to Mishra, FOUR, rare boundary for Delhi. Loosener from Bravo, drifting it on the pads, Mishra shuffles across and whips it off his legs behind square. Splits the gap between deep square leg and fine leg to perfection

Tahir to Mishra, out Caught by Dhoni!! Is there an edge? Yup, up goes the finger. How fitting is it that it's the combo of Tahir-MSD which has capped it off for CSK. Tame surrender this by Delhi. This is their biggest margin of defeat for the season. Coming to the ball, it was another slowish leggie that spun away sharply outside off, Mishra on this occasion gropes at it and nicks it off behind. CSK reclaim the top spot! Mishra c Dhoni b Tahir 8(11) [4s-1]
Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, width available on this delivery, Shreyas Iyer makes full use of the room and punches it wide of deep backward point for a boundary

Harbhajan to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan has belted this one. Geee! He is in amazing touch. It was a nicely flighted delivery wide of off, Dhawan dashes down and larrups it against the turn over long-on for a maximum. The connection was sensational and it sailed over!

Harbhajan to Dhawan, FOUR, finds the gap again. He has taken a liking to Bhajji. It was full and was wide of off, Dhawan plunges forward and creams it wide of cover. The placement was good as it beats the deep cover fielder into the fence

Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, pitched up outside off, seemed like a knuckle ball, but Iyer had no problems picking it. He holds his shape and lofts it cleanly over wide mid-off. Brilliantly timed, goes all the way
Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, short of length delivery close to off, Iyer arches back and ramps it over short third man. This is superb from Iyer who's got off to a flier

Harbhajan to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Rambunctious roars from Harbhajan Singh in celebration as Dhawan is cleaned up. He'd got down to sweep this off-break but missed it completely, beaten by Harbhajan's extra bounce. Much needed for the Super Kings as they seek to reign Delhi back. Dhawan b Harbhajan 19(13) [4s-1 6s-1]
Harbhajan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, short ball outside off, dispatched by Iyer who hasn't put a foot wrong so far. Camps back and cuts it through point. Harbhajan shakes his head in disappointment
Tahir to Pant, FOUR, Tahir overpitches outside off and Pant drills him through extra cover. That was fiercely struck, went to the boundary in a hurry

Tahir to Pant, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Now he goes uppish, hits it flat and hard, and finds long-off. Tahir is off celebrating in some part of Chepauk, while Pant is left to rue his choice of shot, not for the first time this season - an area where he has a long ways to go yet. Pant c Dwayne Bravo b Tahir 5(3) [4s-1]

Jadeja to Ingram, out Lbw!! Spins in and traps Ingram on the crease. Up goes the finger. The ball was spinning sharply, which probably prompted the review, but it wasn't enough to save him as it would've clipped the top of leg stump. Delhi go from 52/1 to 66/4. Ingram lbw b Jadeja 1(5)
Dwayne Bravo to Axar, FOUR, squeezes out a wide yorker past backward point. That's superbly done from Axar Patel, first to reach out and then to guide it with an open bat-face

Bhuvneshwar to Rohit, FOUR, that's a horrible start for Thampi in this year's IPL. He gifts a boundary to Rohit who won't mind this at all. He opened the face of the bat for a single, Thampi was casual in getting down at third man. It goes through him for a boundary

Bhuvneshwar to Rohit, FOUR, when you can hit on the up in that manner than deduce it's a belter of a wicket to bat on. Rohit charges forward, transforms the length into a fuller one and just eases it through cover. The timing was stellar and it raced off the bat and reached the fence in some micro seconds!

Khaleel Ahmed to Rohit, FOUR, how easy does he make it look. Trademark of a class batsman! It was on a good length and was angling away from Rohit who leans into it and flays into the drive wide of cover like a boss. It beats the cover fielder and canters to the fence

Khaleel Ahmed to Rohit, FOUR, tell you what this is a batsman's paradise! Just a hint of room for Rohit, it was a slower one too. Rohit waits for it to arrive, adjusts his bat-swing brilliantly and guides it wide of backward point. This outfield = National highway and third man had no realistic chance of stopping that

Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, SIX, this will do! Get-out-of-jail shot from de Kock. Ahmed steams in and pounds it in the swinging arc, de Kock sets up deep in his crease and clobbers it over deep square leg for half-a-dozen

Khaleel Ahmed to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Straight down the throat of sweeper cover. Suryakumar Yadav is gutted, can't believe his luck. Another instance of not converting a start from SKY as Ahmed gets his second wicket. It was pitched fuller and SKY made room slightly and bent low, slapped it firmly. It was flat and went straight to Rashid in the deep, who gleefully accepts it. SRH anthem blares in the background. Suryakumar Yadav c Rashid Khan b Khaleel Ahmed 23(17) [4s-3 6s-1]

Nabi to Lewis, out Caught by Shankar!! Lewis' patchy form continues, he was looking clueless and ends up gifting his wicket to Nabi here. Mumbai have lost two wickets in two overs, slightly under the pump now. Very well bowled by Nabi, didn't offer any pace and kept it slower. Lewis goes down on his knees and attempts an ugly mow across the line. The timing goes haywire and he hits it towards deep mid-wicket. Vijay Shankar swiftly moves across and grabs it. Lewis c Shankar b Nabi 1(6)

Basil Thampi to Hardik Pandya, no run, fuller length delivery swerving down leg, Hardik shuffled a bit in a bid to flick it fine but couldn't make any contact. It skims the outer half of the pad en route to the keeper

Basil Thampi to Hardik Pandya, SIX, wow! Hardik's intentions are clear here. What a shot this is, nonchalantly picks it off his pads to dump it into the cow corner stands. It was full and in the slot, such fast hands from HP as he takes full toll of the delivery

Basil Thampi to de Kock, FOUR, muscled over mid-wicket and de Kock manages to find the gap. Didn't time it as he would've liked as it kicked off rapidly off the deck. de Kock got it high on the bat, enough to beat long-on

Basil Thampi to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, a boundary to cap off the over. 16 off it. Short and hint of width provided, Hardik exploits it by riding the bounce and spanks it crisply through extra cover. No long-off and Hardik collects four

Bhuvneshwar to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Nabi!! Hardik Pandya has been worked out. This is a crucial wicket for SRH as we all know how dangerous Hardik can be towards the back-end of the innings. It was banged in short, the batsman wasn't expecting it. Gets cramped for pace and room, went for the pull and poor connection sees him slicing it off the top half of the bat to long-off. Nabi takes the sitter. Hardik Pandya c Nabi b Bhuvneshwar 18(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Basil Thampi to de Kock, FOUR, attempted yorker length delivery, errs on the fuller side, de Kock backs away into the on-side and gets low to slice it away behind point for four - his 4th fifty for the Mumbai Indians this season, and he raises the bat to the dressing room. A good recovery from him after a slow start. Can he finish off with a flourish?

Basil Thampi to de Kock, SIX, another full-toss just about waist high from round the wicket, de Kock gets his front leg out of the way and slams it into the deep mid-wicket crowd for a massive six! Looks confident, doesn't he?
Rashid Khan to Pollard, SIX, skids through once again, but Pollard is waiting on the backfoot - very decisive, and he thumps it away over long-on for a six
Rashid Khan to de Kock, FOUR, fired down leg, de Kock is late on the expansive fine sweep, gets some bat on it though, and gets it away to the fine leg fence for four

Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, out Caught by Abhishek Sharma! 120.9km/h, a slower bouncer on the body, the off-cutter, the easiest of all slower balls, and he foxes Pollard. Early into the pull, induces the top-edge as the ball goes high in the air towards deep backward square leg and Abhishek Sharma rushes in to take an impressive catch diving forward. Pollard c Abhishek Sharma b Khaleel Ahmed 10(9) [6s-1]
Khaleel Ahmed to Krunal Pandya, SIX, short one angled into the body, gets behind the line and transfers his weight onto the backfoot to deposit it over deep mid-wicket for six

Khaleel Ahmed to Rohit, FOUR, another boundary to finish the over. Rohit is off to a flyer here. It was on a short of length and was wide of off, Rohit powers the pull shot wide of mid-on, Nabi puts in a valiant effort there by chasing it down. He puts in a dive too but his foot was touching the ropes when ball was in his contact and that will be signalled as a boundary

Bhuvneshwar to de Kock, FOUR, Bhuvneshwar strays on the pads and de Kock punishes. All de Kock had to do was to beat the short fine fiedler which he did with ease with the flick shot, and it raced to the fence

Bhuvneshwar to de Kock, FOUR, de Kock joins the party too. It was slower one a short of length, de Kock swivels, gets in a terrific posiition and thumps it wide of deep backward square leg for a boundary.

Khaleel Ahmed to Rohit, out Caught by Nabi!! Rohit would be gutted with himself. He was timing the ball beautifully but the pressure of five dot balls that de Kock consumed in the previous over probably got to him. And he played an overambitious pull-shot. Khaleel Ahmed got the ball to bounce extra off the deck. It hit the splice of the bat and popped up in the air, Nabi takes a sitter of sitters at mid-on. Rohit c Nabi b Khaleel Ahmed 24(18) [4s-5]

Khaleel Ahmed to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, shot mahn! Suryakumar Yadav has this unique way of pulling the ball. It was around the hip-height, Suryakumar Yadav swivels and powers the pull shot wide of short fine leg for a boundary
Khaleel Ahmed to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, class written all over it! It was on a good length and was wide of off, Suryakumar Yadav drives it like a boss, places it well and it runs along the carpet

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he has bisected the gap between long on and cow corner to perfection! It was an offie on the stumps, Suryakumar Yadav uses his bottom hand to good effect and whips it with the spin to the on-side for another boundary. He has started really well!

Basil Thampi to de Kock, FOUR, he has placed it to perfection! It was on a good length and was wide of off, de Kock opens the face of the bat at the very last moment and guides it in between backward point and third man for a four! His third of the innings!

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, Suryakumar Yadav has looked ultra-positive from the start and this is an effortless hit. He's predominantly a leg-side player and very good with the pick-up shots. Nabi tosses it on the pads and Suryakumar makes him pay. Gets under it and whiplashes it away into the cow corner stands
Barinder to Saha, FOUR, whatta start! A wide half-volley, Saha leans into the square drive and caresses it behind point and wide of third man for four
Malinga to Guptill, FOUR, slings away with the arm, back of a length, a whippy cut attempted, toe-ended away wide of the 'keeper to the third man fence for four. Fortuitous.

Rahul Chahar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, the boundary releases all the pressure Chahar built up. Poor bit of work from Anukul Roy. It was on the shorter side and Pandey pulled it to deep square leg, Roy was late to spot the ball and by the time he did and put in the dive, it was too late

Krunal Pandya to Manish Pandey, FOUR, consecutive boundaries for Pandey. Once again the length is wrong - on the shorter side, Pandey makes room and slaps the cut in front of square, no chance for Sran coming across from sweeper cover

Krunal Pandya to Shankar, out Caught by Pollard!! The nudge and nurdle around ploy comes to a halt. With required rate shooting up SRH had to find momentum and in the process of finding some, Shankar goes after a floated up delivery and toe-ends the loft to long-on. KP moves a few yards to his right and takes it comfortably. Shankar c Pollard b Krunal Pandya 12(17)

Hardik Pandya to Abhishek Sharma, out Caught by de Kock!! Hardik Pandya ambles forward with a smile, doesn't even bother appealing for he knew Abhishek nicked it. There was a sense of doubt as Abhishek stood his ground momentarily but he started walking off soon as the umpire gave his verdict. Short, skiddy and angling away outside off, Abhishek looks to steer it square on the off-side and sends a fine bottom edge through to the keeper. Excellent low take from QDK. Abhishek Sharma c de Kock b Hardik Pandya 2(3)
Malinga to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Manish Pandey responds in style; keeps his head still and smashes the straight drive past the non-striker, that was timed to perfection and no-one's gonna stop that
Bumrah to Nabi, FOUR, sits on the back foot this time, expects the length to be short and swivels into his pull in a flash. Placed it in the gap behind square and that's Nabi's first boundary

Malinga to Nabi, FOUR, slice of luck for Nabi and SRH. Malinga executes another yorker outside off and Nabi swung himself (quite literally) into that, managed to get a thick inside edge which flies past QDK to his left

Malinga to Nabi, SIX, Nabi ruins a fine over from Malinga. Plenty of width outside off, all Nabi had to do was watch it close and get it over point (no fielders in the deep). He does exactly that by timing his upper cut and slicing the ball over the boundary ropes for a crisp maximum

Bumrah to Manish Pandey, FOUR, a rare bad ball from Bumrah and Manish Pandey takes full toll of it. On seeing Pandey shuffle forward, Bumrah loses his length and feeds a full toss at the body, Pandey knows where the gap is and he swats it for a one-bounce boundary over square leg

Bumrah to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Manish Pandey thinks it's a no-ball for height, but wasn't to be. A fair call from the umpire as it was clearly below waist. Full toss again, Pandey clears his front leg and hammers it in the gap between deep mid-wicket and deep square

Hardik Pandya to Nabi, SIX, Pollard is flirting with the boundary hoardings today, another crash avoided. A full toss from Hardik Pandya and Nabi got all of it; he seemed to have mistimed it for a fleeting moment but got enough height on it to get it well and over the leaping fielder at long-on. Pollard tried his best and nearly crashed into the hoardings

Hardik Pandya to Nabi, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Gone this time. This one looked like a six to the naked eye, wasn't to be. A full ball outside off, Nabi went for the loft over extra cover but he skewed it off the toe-end and offered a dolly of a catch to SKY at wide long-off. Nabi c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 31(20) [4s-2 6s-2]

Barinder to Saha, FOUR, short and wide, a slash at that, and just wide of a diving Rahul Chahar at backward point for four. Saha is away. The confidence reflects in his conviction of the shots and his footwork.
Barinder to Saha, FOUR, short of length delivery wide outside off, Saha clears his front-leg and drags it from outside off, clubs it away flat and wide of mid-off to the wide long-on fence for four

Hardik Pandya to Manish Pandey, SIX, it's a tie and we have a Super Over!! Whew! What.A.Game. After all that long, never-ending confab Hardik Pandya delivers a juicy length delivery on the stumps, Pandey keeps his calm and marmalizes it into the mid-wicket orbit for a scintillating maximum. Pandey knew it was six the moment it left the bat and he pumps his fists before soaking in joy. Rohit doesn't seem too pleased and he is busy picking balls for the Super Over
Barinder to Guptill, SIX, round the wicket, a length ball angling in, no insecurities there, as Guptill uses his long levers to loft it through the line and over long-off for six
Bumrah to Saha, FOUR, fuller length delivery on middle, whipped away from the crease past mid-on to the long-on fence for four. Fantastic shot.

Bumrah to Saha, FOUR, short one outside off, pulled away with very little timing to deep mid-wicket for four as Pollard chases and tries to kick it back, but ends up being carried over the advertising board by the momentum. Hopefully, he hasn't hurt himself

Bumrah to Saha, out Caught by Lewis! On a back of a length and just outside off, Saha gets low and tries carving it away through backward point, but fails to find the gap, picks out Lewis at backward point and that's the end of the road for Saha tonight. An excellent catch by Lewis, diving to his right, and a bit of a send-off by Bumrah. Saha c Lewis b Bumrah 25(15) [4s-5]

Malinga to Manish Pandey, FOUR, confidence, I tell you is a very big thing in sport. First ball and Pandey has put it away for a boundary. Not a bad delivery - short of length angled at the body, Pandey elevated himself and pulled it past the diving mid-wicket fielder. The timing was spot on

Malinga to Manish Pandey, SIX, geez! He's looks so good while playing positively. Banged in halfway down, Pandey waits for the ball to climb on him and ramps it over third man, Bumrah could only collect it from the dugout

Malinga to Manish Pandey, FOUR, this is poor bowling. Even the experienced Malinga feeling the heat. Sprays it down leg and all Pandey had to do was place it in the gap, tickled fine and the fielder at 45 had no chance

Bumrah to Guptill, out Lbw!! Guptill's first game is cut short by a Bumrah nip-backer. SRH are off to a flier but have now lost both their openers. This is a typical Bumrah wicket - fast, angled in from a length and just beats the batsman for pace, Guptill went nowhere with his footwork and remained rooted to the crease, pinged right in front of middle and ball-tracking showed it to be crashing into leg-stump. Second wicket for Bumrah and he's keeping the game in balance. Guptill lbw b Bumrah 15(11) [4s-1 6s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Pandey keeps dealing in boundaries. He waits for the leg-break to arrive and dabs it past Rohit at slip, placed it fine enough and beat Bumrah behind square on the off-side

Krunal Pandya to Williamson, out Lbw!! Huge wicket and the blue flags are hoisted up at the Wankhede. Rohit is jubliant and so are rest of his mates. They know the value of this wicket. Williamson could have played anchor to this chase and he has been sent back early. The SRH skipper premeditated the paddle and missed it completely, the ball struck him around the thigh pad in front of middle, it was going on to hit leg-stump. Williamson lbw b Krunal Pandya 3(7)

Arshdeep Singh to Chris Lynn, SIX, Chris Lynn has belted this into the stands for a 94-meter six! It was on a back of a length, Chris Lynn charges down and backs away, keeps his shape and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. This should get him going!

Ashwin to Uthappa, out Caught by Agarwal!! Ashwin strikes! KXIP needed a wicket and the skipper delivers. He pumps his fist in delight. Carrom ball around off, Uthappa makes room to go over extra cover, but hit it straighter than he would have liked, Mayank didn't have to move much and took it with his fingers pointing upwards near long-off. Uthappa c Agarwal b Ashwin 22(14) [4s-2 6s-1]

Sam Curran to A Russell, FOUR, bangs the slower delivery into the surface, Russell waits and waits some more to play the flat-batted hit, strikes it square on the off-side and leaves sweeper with no chance
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, SIX, Gill keeps producing some fabulous shots even though he is playing anchor. Picked the carrom ball, used his feet and lofted it through the line, all the way over long-on
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, SIX, tries a little too much with his action, fires it into middle and leg, Shubman Gill gets on his knee and sweeps it high and mighty over deep backward square leg for six

Ashwin to Shubman Gill, FOUR, another quick skidder outside off, sliced away to the third man boundary for four, bringing up another fifty for Gill as an opener - further accentuating the fact that bringing him in down low was always a bad idea
Tye to A Russell, SIX, errs big time with a full-toss, Russell opens up his stance and swings those brawny levers over cow corner for six. Tough man man to bowl to, this guy...

Tye to A Russell, SIX, ALMOST nails the yorker, on off-stump, Russell backs off and clubs it flat, straight to Agarwal at long-off, who fluffs the catch! He was too far inside, and to add insult to injury, parries it onto the rope to concede six! A crucial drop from Agarwal this. Won't do his confidence much good. And he'd better not look at his captain - the murderous stare of the basilisk will be waiting for him...
Shami to A Russell, FOUR, short and wide, this is poor stuff, Russell has a lot of time to rock back and slap it away through deep extra cover for four. Races away...

Shami to A Russell, out Caught by Tye! GONE! The top-edge is not good enough this time, as the short in-angler cramps him up, beats him for pace and bounce (just about) and induces a top-edge that falls just short of the cow corner boundary. Tye picks up a good catch at the rope and he's pumped - as are the rest of the KXIP team. They seem some light at the end of the tunnel, now that the DreRuss-shaped Frankenstein's monster isn't eclipsing everything. A Russell c Tye b Shami 24(14) [4s-2 6s-2]
Tye to Shubman Gill, FOUR, short one at the body, and that's a torso-twisting whippull towards the deep midwicket boundary for four

Sam Curran to Karthik, FOUR, oh, it's a harsh game, cricket. An inch-perfect yorker length delivery outside off, angling in, Karthik did try to open the face and run it down, but gets a thin outside edge that just about beats the diving Pooran and runs away to the fence
Sam Curran to Karthik, SIX, short one angling into the gut, Karthik backs away and nails the pull, transfers his weight onto the backfoot, and deposits it over deep square leg for six!

Sam Curran to Karthik, FOUR, that's that, then! KKR live to fight another day, and as do KXIP, who need far too many results to go their way. An in-angler from round the wicket, and Karthik sways it away fine towards the long leg for four, to hand KKR a second consecutive win!

Shami to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that ball had no right to go to the fence. It was just touched by Shubman Gill on the whip but the timing was extraordinary and it raced off his blade. It beats the man at mid-on and canters to the fence

Arshdeep Singh to Chris Lynn, FOUR, this one surely hit the sweet spot. And it has reached the fence like a tracer-bullet! It was a slower one on a fuller length, Chris Lynn delays his bat swing and powers it wide of long-off for a boundary

Arshdeep Singh to Chris Lynn, FOUR, gee! That has been smashed. Chris Lynn looks in his elements today, ominous signs for Kings. It was on a fuller length, was in the slot for Chris Lynn. He gets under it and pumps it straight down the ground
Arshdeep Singh to Chris Lynn, FOUR, flurry of boundaries for Lynn. And KKR are off to a sensational start. It was a short of length on the pads, Chris Lynn pulls it wide of the keeper for a boundary
Ashwin to Chris Lynn, FOUR, edged and four! Lynn won't mind it. Ashwin starts with a carrom ball, Lynn makes room and swings through the line, the outside edge runs away fine to the third man fence

Ashwin to Chris Lynn, SIX, that is not the length to bowl to Lynn. Back of a length, is this carrom ball and Lynn sets himself up for a big shot down the ground, his bat speed ensured that the ball cleared the long-off fence with ease

Tye to Shubman Gill, FOUR, poor start from Tye. He needs to be better than that. Back of a length and on the hips, Gill does nothing fancy, whips it with a strong bottom hand backward of square, no chance for the fielder in the deep

Tye to Chris Lynn, SIX, might just be Lynn's night. Even mishits are fetching him runs. This was a short of length delivery at the body, Lynn swivels to play the pull and the top-edge sails over long leg, for a maximum

Tye to Chris Lynn, FOUR, yes, it is his night. Now an inside edge escapes past the stumps to reach the fence. Good length ball and Lynn backs away to swing across the line, the edge evades leg-stump and races to fine leg

Tye to Chris Lynn, out Caught&Bowled!! No, not his night. But he's gotten KKR off to a flier. Tye is relieved and delighted - throws the ball away after taking the catch in frustration. 127.1ks short of length delivery and Lynn looks to pull it to deep mid-wicket, the top-edge takes it straight up and Tye moves to his right to reverse cup it. KXIP needed that badly. Chris Lynn c and b Tye 46(22) [4s-5 6s-3]

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR, oh no! Rahul has let one go right through his legs. Drifting on the legs and Uthappa whips it powerfully to wide long-on, Rahul gets there but allows it to escape past him. That should get Uthappa going
Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, SIX, one boundary and Uthappa has found his touch. Flighted delivery and it is in the slot, Uthappa extends his arms and lofts it straight back over Ashwin, all the way

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR, that is the Uthappa of old. Put the bowler under pressure and then toy with him. Ashwin went short with his length after being hit over his head, Uthappa waits and back cuts it behind point - bisecting backward point and short third man expertly

Sam Curran to Shubman Gill, FOUR, top shot! Nothing much wrong with the delivery. Cutter on a length, Gill stands tall and drives on the rise past mid-off, the timing he generated on the slower ball was just amazing
Warrier to Gayle, FOUR, way too full. Gayle opens up his bat face, laying into the width to slice it away through point. That's more the Chris ..

Warrier to Gayle, FOUR, 141.5kph. Another juicy overcook. Gayle has a big stride to it, making the half volley all the more fuller and holds all his shape to drill it through the covers. There may be three men there, but he's still finding the angles perfectly
Nitish Rana to Agarwal, SIX, that's right in the swinging arc for Mayank Agarwal! Loopy on off-stump, he gets underneath the flight and pumps it for a mighty maximum straight down the ground

Nitish Rana to Pooran, out Caught by Warrier!! DK's ploy to bring Nitish Rana works wonders for KKR. It was that sort of a delivery where you have too much time and end up tripping over while playing the shot. Short, slow and drifting in, Pooran rocked back and nailed the pull as hard as he could, sends the toe-end flat to the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Warrier, who's been involved in all three dismissals so far, claims the catch with ease. Pooran c Warrier b Nitish Rana 48(27) [4s-3 6s-4]

Warrier to Mandeep, FOUR, smart cricket from Mandeep Singh! Sits deep inside for the slower ball and steers it with the finest of touches at the last minute in the gap between the keeper and short third

Narine to Mandeep, out Agarwal Run Out!! 1 run completed. Mayank Agarwal and his never-ending love affair with thirties. Lost the count of number of times he's been dismissed around 30s in the last two seasons. So Mandeep flicks this to the left of deep mid-wicket and calls for two straightaway, Agarwal responds and had to put in a desperate dive to have a sniff at survival, wasn't to be. The throw from Rinku Singh was sharp and adjacent to the stumps, Narine doesn't gather it clean but manages to deflect the ball onto the stumps off his palm, totally unintentional but effective nevertheless. Agarwal run out (Rinku Singh/Narine) 36(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chawla to Mandeep, SIX, that's an extension of punch! Just a mere extension. Mandeep expected the googly and hung back to target the shorter boundaries (straight down the ground), timed the stroke to perfection while on the move and cleared the ropes with ease
A Russell to Sam Curran, FOUR, full and in the zone outside off, Curran stands still and spanks the drive through extra cover, timing coupled with a hint of power on that

Narine to Sam Curran, SIX, that is a shot and a half. We have seen him dispatch spinners in Test cricket and he is replicating that in this six-hitting format too. He dashes down with a lot of intent, swings hard at it, gets enough bat on it. The timing was incredible, it hit the sweet spot and it sailed into the night sky over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

Narine to Sam Curran, 1 run, in the air and dropped. Mohali and drop catches, the saga continues! Sam Curran wanted to repeat his effort of the second ball, he miscues this one. And it goes a long way up in the air. Rinku at long-on comes forward, he fails to get his hands in good position and it pops out
Narine to Sam Curran, FOUR, boundary to finish the over. It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, Sam Curran reaches for it and smokes it wide of long-on for a four. It raced off the bat!

Gurney to Mandeep, out Caught by Uthappa!! Uthappa takes it without much fuss. And Kings lose another one at the wrong time. It was a slower one on a back of a length, Mandeep moves back, makes room, he wanted to thump it over mid-off. It comes off the bottom half of the bat and pops up in the air. And Robbie makes no mistake at mid-ooff. Mandeep c Uthappa b Gurney 25(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

A Russell to Ashwin, out Bowled!! Ashwin drags it back onto the stumps. This innings is coming apart for Kings! It was an off-cutter around off, Ashwin went for an old-fashioned heave to the on-side. It comes off the inside edge and shatters the stumps. Ashwin b A Russell 0(3)

A Russell to Sam Curran, FOUR, he is putting up a show, is Sam Curran! He gets cheeky this time, moves to the off-side, opens up the leg-side for himself and paddles it over short fine to collect a boundary

A Russell to Sam Curran, FOUR, now, he flaunts his power! Gee! He hit that hard. He is a short man but sure he has some muscles. It was in the slot, Sam Curran clears his leg, keeps his shape and pumps it down the ground for a boundary
Gurney to Sam Curran, FOUR, Curran-show at the PCA continues! Gurney misses the yorker this time, Sam Curran gets under it, makes room, keeps shape and powers it wide of long-off! Amazing bat speed!

Gurney to Sam Curran, SIX, wow! Just wow! He punches his bat in delight. It was a slower one on a fuller length, Sam Curran picks it up, delays his bat swing and smokes it high into the sky and over long-on for a maximum

Gurney to Sam Curran, FOUR, maiden IPL fifty for Curran. He punches the air in delight! We have found another 360 degree player! Whatta cameo this has been! He moves to the off-side, takes it on the full and paddles it fine of fine leg for another four

Warrier to Rahul, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! The knuckle's fooling enough. And Chris Lynn - miked up and talking to the on-air comms - is still awake enough to judge the miscued chipped loop going over his head to lap it reverse-cupped without fuss. So it was full, and Rahul, early into his flick, ends up without control. And succumbs to give Warrier his maiden IPL wicket. Rahul c Chris Lynn b Warrier 2(7)

Warrier to Agarwal, FOUR, dishes out width outside off, and it's just too short as well. There may be a gully and a backward point, but Agarwal lines up really well, opening up and delaying his cut to bisect those two

Gurney to Sam Curran, FOUR, Sam Curran ends the innings in style. This has been the innings of highest quality from the southpaw. And he has powered his team to a formidable total! It was a full-toss on the stumps, Sam Curran shuffles to the off-side and smashes it wide of deep fine leg to end the innings with a four!

Warrier to Gayle, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! It's no big secret that Punjab are way too top heavy, but KKR have successfully knocked out the snake's head. Warrier - with another - lets out a nice back of a length sitter on the hips. Gayle lines up for a half-hearted swat as well, but the ball just doesn't come on. Ends up taking the upper half of the bat and picks out the only man out there, deep square leg. Gayle c Shubman Gill b Warrier 14(14) [4s-2]

Warrier to Pooran, FOUR, 140.7kph. There's the crunch. Warrier gets a little too greedy, going short without a lot of pace and Pooran's ready for it, bringing out a short arm jab to smack it into cow corner
Gurney to Pooran, SIX, 104.5kph from the back of the hand. And Pooran's picking the screws off it, flat-batting, uppishly, way, way over cow corner. Gee, the audacity

A Russell to Pooran, SIX, 129kph. There's really nothing wrong with this - it's a tight back of a length in fact, but Pooran clears his front leg, takes it off the front foot and goes baseballing it into an empty long-off
A Russell to Pooran, FOUR, 130kph, a long hop, and a lucky edge. Pooran tries swivelling on a pull intended through mid-wicket, but ends up with a toe-end, running through the slips - the empty slips

Chawla to Pooran, SIX, ooh. It's the googly, and Pooran couldn't care less. He stands his ground, clears his front leg and swings big, lofting it so damn cleanly, with lots and lots of altitude over long-off
Chawla to Pooran, FOUR, another googly taken apart. Pooran is reading them perfectly, going really deep to this one and then timing his cut really well behind point
Narine to Pooran, 1 run, brings up the 50-run stand with a clip off his pads to deep square
Chawla to Agarwal, FOUR, lures Agarwal with flight and bam! Agarwal had enough time to launch it and he absolutely thrashes it over the bowler
Chawla to Pooran, SIX, Pooran is in sublime touch tonight! Wasn't all that short, but Pooran jumps deep inside the crease and converts it into a half-tracker before muscling the pull over deep square

Aaron to Dhawan, leg byes, FOUR, help-yourself-with-a-boundary ball, although Dhawan didn't get any bat on it, still it's a boundary for DC. Did he try the slower ball? Could be.. however the line was poor. Slanted it down leg, Dhawan misses the glance and it goes off the pads, beats Samson and runs away to the fine leg fence

Ish Sodhi to Ingram, out Caught by Rahane!! And when Pant's extravaganza doesn't consume him, Ingram's cheek will. So he tries to be cute, with a late fine sweep past the keeper. But in his pre-guessing, gets a little too early into it and the length's just too full for it as well, resulting in a glove, popping up off his shoulder to a very-alert Rahane - at slip - who runs to where a leg-slip would've been. Ingram c Rahane b Ish Sodhi 12(23)

Aaron to Pant, SIX, full pace at a back of a length - never mind how slow Kotla is when Aaron's dishing out juicy freebies. Pant lays into in style, walking across his stumps, making it into a leg-line and then swivelling as well to ensure he makes full use of fine leg being inside the ring with the airy mow
Aaron to Pant, FOUR, still short, and worse, wide too. Pant throws his hands out quickly to slice it away with a lot of power over backward point. Okay, he's officially in a hurry

Shreyas Gopal to Rutherford, SIX, the mother of long hops. And Rutherford nails his pull, flat and with seemingly enough distance over deep square leg. But Parag's there, and he leaps up, doesn't get to the ball but ends up falling flat over on top of the ice-bucket kept in front of his team's dug-out

Shreyas Gopal to Rutherford, out Caught by Livingstone!! Brave. He might have been smashed for a six, but now with nothing to lose - except this match which is alrady lost - Gopal tosses his googly up. Rutherford charges down, doesn't really get close enough but still goes through with the hoick. Ends up with a massive miscues to long-on, where Livingstone runs in to, and then adjusts really well to the ball dipping behind him. Rutherford c Livingstone b Shreyas Gopal 11(6) [6s-1]
Shreyas Gopal to Pant, SIX, yea, he's in a hurry. One knee, angry hands and a fierce swing as he swipes it across the line, hammering it flat over long-on. And Kotla's boundaries are no enemy ..

Ish Sodhi to Pant, SIX .. aaand Delhi make it to the top two, for today at least. Rajasthan get knocked out, officially. Everything courtesy yet-another Pant slog, the usual, sitting on a knee and smoking it into the first floor at cow corner. Oh also, he has his personal fifty
Thomas to Dhawan, FOUR, width to Dhawan? Really? Is that a deathwish? It was short, plenty of width outside off. Dhawan reaches for it and slaps it up and over point

Thomas to Dhawan, FOUR, "Rewind and show me that once again," gushes Ian Bishop on air. Dhawan oozing class here. Innocous fuller length delivery outside off, Dhawan stretches across and times it off the meat. Didn't try to over-hit it and focussed more on placement and timing
Thomas to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's a loosener from Thomas. He's not finished it well as Shaw tucks in a four. Angled it down leg, fine was inside the ring and Shaw glances it past the man at 45

Ish Sodhi to Dhawan, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! What was the hurry? First ball from Sodhi and Dhawan wants to take him on. Charged down the track, decided to launch it in the 'V' but gets it off the bottom part of the bat. Skies it up in the air and Parag from mid-on calls for it, keeps his eyes on the ball and cups it safely. RR have their first wicket, can they nip out a few more? Dhawan c Riyan Parag b Ish Sodhi 16(12) [4s-2]

Ish Sodhi to Prithvi Shaw, out Bowled!! Chopped on. Sodhi gets two in two and he's on a hat-trick. It's jitters in the DC camp now as RR are back in the game. Another flop show from Shaw - getting dismissed again for a single-digit score. The top-spinner from Sodhi, gave more loop and Shaw opted to play it on the off-side staying back in his crease.
