Goes hard away from the body and gets a thick inside edge which shatters back onto the stumps. Sodhi is elated. Prithvi Shaw b Ish Sodhi 8(8) [4s-1]

Ish Sodhi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, Shreyas Iyer is one of the best players of spin in the country and here's the testament. Sodhi gives more air, overpitches in the process and Iyer frees his arms to thawart it straight down the ground for a maximum

Ish Sodhi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, consecutive sixes for Iyer. He doesn't want Sodhi to dictate terms. Sees another flighted delivery just outside off, extends his long levers and lofts it over long-off. Clean as a whistle!

Ish Sodhi to Pant, FOUR, pressure-releasing over from Sodhi. After a great opening over where he picked up two wickets for no run, he leaks 17 in his second. Drags it too short, Pant was quick to pick the length as he pivots back and bashes it through extra cover. This outfield is very quick and there's no stopping those
Riyan Parag to Pant, SIX, so, it was just a sighter from Pant. Spots one in the zone, gets low and imbues his forearm strength to clout this into the deep mid-wicket stands

Riyan Parag to Pant, SIX, gee! How on earth did he get this away for a six? Parag has a wry smile on his face. This was a mis-hit from Pant, lost his balance as he threw everything at it. Skews it off the cue-end and got plenty of height. He placed it in the gap over mid-wicket and in the end, it soared over the ropes for a six

Shreyas Gopal to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Livingstone!! Perks of having a leggie in your team. Shreyas gets the prized scalp of Iyer, who can't believe his luck that he's holed out to the fielder. Shreyas continues to grow from strength to strength and provides his team a crucial breakthrough. Throws it up luringly, Iyer takes his front leg out of the way and launches it down the ground. The timing goes haywire and picks out Livingstone at long-on, who didn't have to move an inch. Shreyas Iyer c Livingstone b Shreyas Gopal 15(9) [6s-2]
Ishant to Livingstone, SIX, massive, Livingstone has had enough of prodding and poking, waltzes down the track, gets close to the ball and bludgeons it over mid-wicket for a huge maximum

Mishra to Shreyas Gopal, out Stumped!! This was always on the cards. And MishraJi wins this battle between leg-spinners! It was a well flighted delivery and was well wide of off, Shreyas Gopal dashes down the track to play a glory shot. It spins away, goes past his willow and Pant takes off the bails in no time. Shreyas Gopal st Pant b Mishra 12(18)

Mishra to Binny, out Caught by Pant!! Mishraji is turning it on at Kotla. He will be on a hat-trick. It was a leggie wide of off, it spins away, clips the outside edge of Binny who was probably playing for the wrong 'un. It clips his outside edge and Pant takes it with ease. Golden duck for Binny!Binny c Pant b Mishra 0(1)

Mishra to Gowtham, 1 run, oh dear! Would you believe it! Trent Boult has denied Amit Mishra his fourth hat-trick in the IPL. And he would be absolutely gutted. It was a well flighted wrong 'un, Gowtham bends down low and goes for an almighty heave. It comes off the top half of the bat and was in the air for a long time. Two men called for it, one was Boult and the other was Rutherford. Perhaps that put the former off, he misjudged it completely and then had to jump back to complete the catch - can't grab hold of the ball and Mishra has his hands on his head
Axar to Gowtham, FOUR, short and down the leg-side, Gowtham rocks back and powers it fine of fine leg for a boundary. Good connection!

Mishra to Gowtham, out Caught by Ishant!! In the air and taken. What are RR doing here? This is the most ordinary batting performance we have seen by any side in this year's IPL. It was a flighted delivery on the stumps, Gowtham charges down, wanted to loft it over long-off. He failed to time it as well as he would have liked and ends up gifting a catch to long-off. Gowtham c Ishant b Mishra 6(6) [4s-1]

Ishant to Riyan Parag, FOUR, Ishant is really struggling here. He is bowling all over the pitch. It was on a short of length and was down the leg-side, Riyan Parag holds his shape nicely and powers the pull shot wide of fine leg for a boundary

Ishant to Riyan Parag, FOUR, it is getting from bad to worse for Ishant. And finally, something to cheer for the Royals fans. It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps, Riyan Parag gets underneath it and pumps it wide of cover for a boundary

Boult to Ish Sodhi, out Caught by Mishra!! Mishraji in action again! You cannot take him out of the game today! Brilliant with the ball and now brilliant in the field. It was a slower one around off, Ish Sodhi wanted to turn it to the on-side. He closes the face of the bat early, it clips the leading edge of the blade. And 36-year-old Mishra, dives forward and takes a mighty fine catch. Ish Sodhi c Mishra b Boult 6(11)

Boult to Riyan Parag, SIX, just enough willow behind it to clear the fence. It was full and was wide of off, Riyan Parag clears his leg, keeps his shape and hoicks it over long-off for a maximum. Much-needed for RR!

Boult to Riyan Parag, SIX, gets his maiden IPL fifty in style with a maximum. He becomes the youngest cricketer in the IPL to score a fifty! Gee! This young man has some power. And he has flaunted that on this delivery. It was in the slot on a fuller length, he swings his willow, gets it off the sweet spot and it went a long way back into the stands. And boy, isn't he pumped!

Ishant to Rahane, out Caught by Dhawan!! That's a soft dismissal for the captain - a leg-stump half-volley from Ishant, Rahane was looking to work it to the on-side, closed the bat-face early, gets a fat leading edge, high and behind square on the on-side. Dhawan called for the catch, gets across from deep backward square leg, watches the ball all along and completes the catch - cuts to his trademark thighslap celebrations, the Royals have lost an easrly wicket. Rahane c Dhawan b Ishant 2(4)

Boult to Riyan Parag, out Caught by Rutherford!! Riyan Parag will find the fielder. He is disappointed with himself. But cheer up young man, you have just played a special innings for your team. It was on a fuller length again, Riyan Parag wanted to dispatch it over long-off, he wasn't balanced at the point of contact. And lost his shape, it comes off the bottom half of the willow and Rutherford makes no mistake at long-off. Riyan Parag c Rutherford b Boult 50(49) [4s-4 6s-2]

Ishant to Livingstone, FOUR, just short and wide of mid-on, Livingstone came charging down the track, doesn't get hold of the slog - off the toe-end and the ball lobbed in the air, to the left of mid-on who puts in a valiant dive, but can't reach it

Ishant to Livingstone, out Bowled!! The fallacy of the Kotla wicket does Livingstone in - this wasn't a slower ball, but there's no pace on this off-cutter - Livingstone came down the track and was way too early on the slog - completed the shot even before the ball arrived, let a big gap between bat and pad - the ball found its way and rattled the top of middle-stump. Ishant loved it, his second wicket of the day and the Royals have lost both openers. Livingstone b Ishant 14(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Ishant to Lomror, FOUR, nicely done by Lomror, his first runs of #IPL2019 - a friendly back of a length delivery on his hips, he gets inside the line and clips it behind square on the on-side, past the diving short fine and races away to the fence

Axar to Samson, out Samson Run Out!! Oh dear! This is disaster for the Royals - zero communication from both batsman - Lomror kept screaming at his partner who was oblivious to his call, kept running down the track aand then had nowhere to go. This was tossed up on off and Samson pushed it towards cover-point, he took a step down the track and stopped, so did his partner and then suddenly Samson had this urge to run - kept running even as his partner asked him to go back. All Shaw had to do was to pick the ball and throw to the kepeer - he does better and finds the stumps with a direct hit. Samson run out (Prithvi Shaw) 5(8)

Ishant to Lomror, FOUR, cheeky and four, on a good length and in that channel outside off, Lomror leans across, opens the face of the bat at the last moment, uses the pace on the ball and runs it past the keeper

Ishant to Lomror, out Caught by Pant!! The Royals are in a shambles at the moment - a nothing shot from Lomror and Ishant has his third wicket of the day. He shortened his length and angled this one across the left-hander, Lomror's feet went nowhere as he looked to guide it towards the off-side, hung his bat out and the edge carried nicely through to the keeper. Lomror c Pant b Ishant 8(3) [4s-2]

Mishra to Riyan Parag, FOUR, clubbed, tossed up well outside off, Parag bends down low, gets close to the ball and then swipes it wide of mid-wicket, bisected the gap between the two fielders in the deep perfectly

K Paul to Riyan Parag, FOUR, smashed, length ball outside off and Parag has drilled it. It was the slower ball and Parag spotted it - gets forward and drivs it back past the bowler, no chance for the man at mid-off

Bhuvneshwar to Parthiv Patel, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! The best batsman in the tournament for RCB flops in the final game of the season. Rare failure for PP as RCB lose their first wicket. Lenght delivery that gained some extra bounce, Patel was rooted to the crease and whips his bat across. Thick leading edge is found and it goes up in the air. Local boy Manish Pandey sets himself under it at point and pouches it. Parthiv Patel c Manish Pandey b Bhuvneshwar 0(3)

Bhuvneshwar to Kohli, FOUR, looks like go big or go home for RCB. That seems to be the philosophy for them. Kohli gets into business rightaway. Flashes his bat at this away-swinger, the bat face turns at the point of contact but he manages to clear the in-field on the off-side. Opens his account with a boundary

Khaleel Ahmed to Kohli, FOUR, drilled ferociously past mid-off. That should dent Ahmed's confidence. Pitches it up outside off, it's a tasty half-volley and Kohli gets into the act, hammering it past mid-off

Khaleel Ahmed to Kohli, SIX, what a shot. Kohli special. The lofted on-drive - his signature stroke. Ahmed once again hurls it up, tempting Kohli and he nonchalantly picks it with all the dexterity of the wrists over long-on

Khaleel Ahmed to Kohli, out Caught by Saha!! Khaleel Ahmed crashes Kohli's party. And he's off. Gets rid of the Indian captain, SRH have their tails up. It was short, it was wide and there was width. Kohli wanted to have a piece of it, throwing his bat at it. Only succeeds in feeding an outside edge. Saha grabs it in front of his face and Ahmed didn't wait for the catch to be taken. Roars and redeems himself after getting slammed for a four and a six earlier in the over. Pin-drop silence in the stands. Kohli walks off for one last time in this tournament, not a great IPL by his standards, definitely. Kohli c Saha b Khaleel Ahmed 16(7) [4s-2 6s-1]
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, SIX, goes for a big one and dispatches it over deep mid-wicket. He is taking a liking to Rashid Khan! He goes down on his knees and slog sweeps it for a maximum

Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, SIX, wow! That has been smoked from Hetmyer. Maiden IPL fifty for him. And he is pumped, look at him celebrate. He goes down on his knees and connects it magnificently well and dispatches it over deep square leg for a maximum. Insane hitting!

Basil Thampi to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, well controlled pull shot from Gurkeerat Singh. And it will fetch him four. It was on a short of length and was around tummy height, Gurkeerat Singh gets in a good position and places the pull shot incredibly well. It beats fine leg for a boundary. He is complimenting Gurkeerat Singh pretty well!

Bhuvneshwar to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, fantastic touch-play from Gurkeerat Singh! This is the best I have seen him bat in the IPL. It was a good length delivery and there was a hint of room, Gurkeerat gets in a fabulous position and just eases it past backward point for a boundary. Stellar timing!

Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, SIX, smashed! Hetmyer-show continues at the Chinnaswamy! This is high-quality hitting from the West Indian. It was short and was around face height, Hetmyer absolutely nails the pull shot. But he failed to get the elevation and Pandey at deep mid-wicket had a chance. But it was hit at such ferocious pace that it went through the hands of Pandey and went over the ropes

Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, 1 run, dropped again! This one was much easier. Yusuf Pathan, the culprit. He got to be doing better there. It was a slower one on the stumps, Hetmyer was early into the shot and it comes off the outside edge. It came too slowly to Pathan at point and he spills it
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, FOUR, another boundary from Hetmyer. He is putting up a show here. It was a flighted delivery and was wide of off, Hetmyer lofts it wide of long-off for a boundary
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, 1 run, pushes it to sweeper cover for a single

Basil Thampi to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, one shot ball too many from Basil Thampi! This one lacked venom! It was around hip-height, Gurkeerat Singh gets in good position and he powers it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary!

Basil Thampi to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, Gurkeerat is playing a gem here! He isn't trying to hit too hard just relying on placement. And he is placing them really well. It was a slower one on a short of length, Gurkeerat Singh picks it up early, delays the bat swing and pulls it wide of fine leg for a boundary

Basil Thampi to Gurkeerat Singh, no run, SRH have gone for a review for a caught behind. There is surely gap between the bat and the pad. And I will be very surprised, if something comes up in UltraEdge. There is nothing on UltraEdge. And SRH will lose their review too. It was a brilliant delivery nevertheless, it was on a good length and it snaked back in after hitting the deck. Gurkeerat Singh played it down the wrong line and it went between his bat and pad. Manish Pandey strangely heard something and he was the one who pushes Williamson to go for the review!

Shankar to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, Gurkeerat welcomes Shankar with a boundary! It was a slower one on the stumps, Gurkeerat Singh whips it in between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket. He found the gap to perfection! The placement was the key their!

Shankar to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, fifty for Gurkeerat! This has been a sensational knock from the lad from Punjab! He raises his bat in delight! He waits for this delivery to arrive and places it wide of backward point. Again, placement was best aspect of the shot

Shankar to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, pulls and pulls well. Bhuvi gets a bad bounce at deep mid-wicket. And that will result in another boundary for Gurkeerat Singh. It is getting from bad to worse for SRH!

Rashid Khan to Gurkeerat Singh, SIX, Rashid Khan has had a rare off day today. It was a wrong 'un on a short of length, Gurkeerat Singh rocks back and clobbers it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. Gee! He is in fine touch!

Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, SIX, why were you sitting in the dug-out, Mr. Hetmyer! Red flags flying high and handsome in the crowd. It was touch short, Hetmyer picks up the length early, goes on the back foot and thumps it over long-on

Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, out Caught by Shankar!! Hetmyer has found the fielder there. And he is furious with himself. Look at the anger on his face. It means a lot to these players. Kohli appreciates the effort from the balcony. It was well wide of off, Hetmyer wanted to lift it over long-off. It wasn't timed as well as compared to his previous shots. And Vijay Shankar takes a brilliant catch at long-off. He knew exactly where the ropes were and made sure he didn't touch it. Hetmyer c Shankar b Rashid Khan 75(47) [4s-4 6s-6]

Khaleel Ahmed to Gurkeerat Singh, out Caught by Y Pathan!! Oh dear! Gurkeerat follows Hetmyer in the dressing room. Don't write SRH off yet, they are still in the contest. And Khaleel Ahmed just can't stop taking wickets. It was a slower delivery on a back of a length, Gurkeerat Singh picks it off the hands. He wanted to steer it over short third. It bounces more than Gurkeerat anticipated and hits him high on the bat. Pathan at backward point makes no mistake. Gurkeerat Singh c Y Pathan b Khaleel Ahmed 65(48) [4s-8 6s-1]

Khaleel Ahmed to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! RCB in Kamikaze mode here at the Chinnaswamy. And Khaleel Ahmed with the breakthrough again for SRH. He has been absolutely superb for his side. It was another well disguised slower one and was wide of off, Washington Sundar wanted to lift it over mid-on. He was taken aback by the slower one, he miscues it horribly and Pandey at mid-on takes it with utmost ease. Washington Sundar c Manish Pandey b Khaleel Ahmed 0(1)
Nabi to U Yadav, FOUR, terrible delivery from Nabi! It was full and there was lot of room, Yadav chases it and pumps it wide of backward point for a boundary

Nabi to U Yadav, FOUR, boundary for Yadav. And he has finished off this match! RCB win by 4 wickets! Hugs in the RCB camp. Finally, something for RCB fans to cheer who have been truly incredible in this season. Kohli with a child-like jump in the dressing room! He has a wide smile on his face! Nabi was guilty of providing the width again and it was in the slot again, Yadav throws his bat at it and powers it wide of backward point for another boundary

Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, out Caught by Guptill!! ABD goes. Big, big wicket for SRH and they are cock-a-hoop. Like Kohli, it's a sorry end to de Villiers' IPL campaign as he falls cheaply. But it was a nothing shot from the South African. It was shortish and curled away outside off, he just flirted his bat at it without any intent and guided it straight into the hands of Guptill at slip. VVS Laxman is all smiles in the dug-out. RCB in all sorts of trouble now. de Villiers c Guptill b Bhuvneshwar 1(2)
Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, FOUR, stamping of authority from Hetmyer. Ahmed gets predictable, bangs it short and it sits up wonderfully for Hetmyer. Rocks back and pummels it wide of mid-on

Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, FOUR, follows violence with finesse. Nothing much wrong with the delivery from Ahmed, saw the batsman move to leg so kept it wider of off. But Hetmyer expertly flails his hands and uses the pace on offer to cream it in the gap at cover

Khaleel Ahmed to Gurkeerat Singh, FOUR, that's a quality stroke from Mann. Hint of width and he latches onto it in a flash. Riding the bounce and punching it with all grace and flair - threading the gap between cover-point and point
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, SIX, whacked over cow corner. Hetmyer tees off, gets under a flighted delivery and pumps it just over the ropes for a maximum

Nabi to Hetmyer, FOUR, spoils it, does Hetmyer. It was turning out to be a good over from Nabi. Goes for the quicker ball and messes it up, veering it down leg and Hetmyer glances it past the man at 45
Nabi to Hetmyer, SIX, smoked over cow corner. Flighted delivery from Nabi, Hetmyer goes back very quickly on seeing the length and powers it into the stands. Dismissive stuff!
Nabi to Gurkeerat Singh, 1 run, slower and turning in, Mann knocks it through mid-wicket
Navdeep Saini to Guptill, FOUR, too short and too straight from Saini, on Guptill's pads and it's neatly flicked away towards fine leg, beats CdG - running across from long leg

Navdeep Saini to Guptill, SIX, lovely, a little shimmy down the track, Guptill gets close to the ball, plays with a still head and a straight bat - high and over mid-off, sails over the ropes for a maximum
Washington Sundar to Williamson, FOUR, lovely, a rare loose ball from Sundar, dragged short and wide of off, cracked square behind point and the ball runs away to the ropes
U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, 134.7kph. He's right up tall to a delivery that's not really short, but then executes a perfect pick-up-swish through mid-wicket. Lots, lots of bottom hand

de Grandhomme to Shankar, SIX, comes on. Gets dispatched. A proper sitter, neither-here-nor-there and Shankar's always been stylish, clearing out his front leg and pulling it bang off the middle over long-on
Washington Sundar to Shankar, SIX, 105kph. Dropped short, Shankar still takes it off the front leg, freeing up his hands once again over long-on. Ah, flat
Washington Sundar to Shankar, SIX, off a knee now. Sundar tries going down the brave route - tossing it up - and finds it being slog-swept deeper, longer, cow corner

Washington Sundar to Shankar, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! Yup, a little too greedy. Shankar tries tonking another, revealing his cards a touch too early as he commits down on a knee. Sundar spots, shortens his length a wee bit, letting the ball spin in, which it does to take the eventual top-edge, and CdG isn't messing up the skier, waiting patiently under at short fine leg. Shankar c de Grandhomme b Washington Sundar 27(18) [6s-3]
Khejroliya to Williamson, SIX, a similar length, but Williamson's too smart to be fooled twice in a row. So he walks well across his stumps and pummels it off his legs into deep square leg, 86 meters

Khejroliya to Williamson, SIX, it's an empty cow corner, and KW's exploiting it a little more with his walking-across-carts. Gets behind this back of a length delivery, on top of it as well, in a much smaller smoke

Chahal to Y Pathan, out Caught by U Yadav!! 100th IPL scalp -- and Chahal celebrates it by kissing the RCB badge and just in case you didn't get the message, making a heart as well with his fingers pointing towards the sky to make it all the more apparent. He does it with a pretty innocuous-looking short-wide sitter outside off, but it's foxed Pathan to go hard at it, which he does without a lot of control. Slicing off the outside half in picking out the fielder out there at deep sweeper perfectly. Y Pathan c U Yadav b Chahal 3(4)
Navdeep Saini to Williamson, FOUR, goes funky. And gets edgy. Another usual walk across and then a sit to sweep, but the inside half of the bat gets it fine, really fine

Navdeep Saini to Nabi, FOUR, 147.8kph. And dispatched at almost double the speed. Nabi - cleverly - stays deep in the crease, manages to get under the full length and drill it to bisect extra cover and mid-on

Navdeep Saini to Nabi, out Caught by Gurkeerat Singh!! Just not in control. Another Hyderabad batsman falls in the quest to pump one over, somewhere, but once again, cannot time it one bit. So Nabi picks long-on in trying to go over with a lofted hoick, but ends up getting it high on the bat, dragging it away to Gurkeerat - who runs in, overruns perhaps, but does decently in the end to take it with tummy-support. Nabi c Gurkeerat Singh b Navdeep Saini 4(3) [4s-1]

Khejroliya to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Hetmyer!! Another pull, another miscue. Hurries Rashid into this one, and he tries some sort of a tennis forehand in the end, which ends up getting spooned tamely to deep mid-wicket this time. Hyderabad are falling apart, quite badly too. Rashid Khan c Hetmyer b Khejroliya 1(2)
U Yadav to Williamson, SIX, real smart stuff, he's spotted mid-off in the circle and is happy to loft a very, very flat drive over that guy. It's his fifty as well - the first of 2019

U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, oh it gets worse - a full toss now and wide outside off too - for Williamson to once again lift it over mid-off. Not quite off the middle, but even the mistime will do when you just aren't bowling to any plan
U Yadav to Williamson, SIX, shuffle, swing, six. Picks out the off-cutter, gets under the length and heaves it with lots of bottom-hand over mid-wicket
U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, 143.2kph. Okay, well it CAN get worse. Williamson makes room now for a change, has his hands freed up to the wide full toss and slices it over extra cover
Navdeep Saini to Saha, FOUR, lovely, 19 from the over, fraction overpitched and wide of off, Saha throws his hands at it and drills the drive over cover, few bounces and over the ropes
U Yadav to Guptill, SIX, massive, SRH have got going, comes down the track - did Guptill, makes room as he did so and carves a length ball over cover, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum

U Yadav to Saha, 1 run, chance and Chahal has dropped - RCB have been far too clumsy with their catching this season - short and at the stumps, Saha swivelled across and pulled it over square leg - was in the air and Chahal did all the right things, ran across and then slid, got both hands but couldn't hold on
U Yadav to Bhuvneshwar, FOUR, make it 28. And Umesh's gifted away the momentum, although with a really good ball here. Bumper, Bhuvi gets under pulls desperately, top-edges, over short fine leg. 175

Chahal to Saha, FOUR, top-edge and four, tossed up just outside off, Saha went down low on the sweep, didn't get on top of the bounce, but he knew there was no one in the deep, bounces a couple of times and rolls over the ropes
Chahal to Saha, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries, Chahal dragged his length back a fraction, Saha is quick to rock back and beats mid-wicket with the pull, pressure straightaway on Chahal
Chahal to Saha, FOUR, make it a hat-trick of boundaries, he's toying with Chahal, comes down the track, gets close to the ball and does enough to clear the leaping fielder at mid-off

Navdeep Saini to Saha, out Caught by U Yadav!! This was coming - Saha was throwing his bat with gay abandon, change of pace does the trick for Saini - the slower ball outside off, Saha didn't spot it, went hard on the drive and dragged it to Umesh at mid-on. RCB needed this wicket - Saha though has done his job. Saha c U Yadav b Navdeep Saini 20(11) [4s-4]
Navdeep Saini to Guptill, FOUR, cracking shot, short of a length and just outside off, Guptill made room for himself and clattered it over cover, no one moved and that brings up SRH's 50
Khejroliya to Manish Pandey, FOUR, crisp, length ball and well outside off, Manish leans into the drive, plays it on the up and past the fielder at mid-off, nice way to get going

Washington Sundar to Guptill, out Caught by Kohli!! Pace off the ball and Guptill has clipped it straight into the hands of Kohli at mid-wicket - yelps in despair, but he can now go and cool his heels in the dressing room. Flatter and at the stumps, perhaps it straightened a bit off the pitch, Guptill went back on the clip, didn't account for the drift and the leading edge went straight into the hands of the opposition skipper. Guptill c Kohli b Washington Sundar 30(23) [4s-2 6s-2]

Washington Sundar to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Hetmyer!! Smart catch from Hetmyer, but think he's unsure about the catch. The umpires will go upstairs and the soft signal is OUT. Did he get his fingers undernath the ball? It's a fair delivery and it's a fair catch, but has the ball touched the ground as he rolled over? Was he under control? Sunil Gavaskar thinks it's NOT OUT as he wasn't in complete control. But what will the third umpire think? He thinks Manish is OUT. Two wickets in the over and RCB are pulling things back - this was dropped short and Manish's eyes lit up - rocked back on the pull, didn't get hold of the shot, was in the air for a long time, Hetmyer got across from deep mid-wicket, slid forward and completed a good two-handed catch. As he rolled over, the ball might / might not have touched the grass. Tough call, but the soft signal was OUT and the third umpire had no conclusive proof to overturn it. Manish Pandey c Hetmyer b Washington Sundar 9(12) [4s-1]

Harpreet Brar to Watson, FOUR, that should make him feel better. Brar errs in his line here - just outside off and Watson is quick to latch on, he moves back in the crease and caresses the punch through cover-point. All timing!

Shami to du Plessis, FOUR, gift from Shami and du Plessis accepts it gleefully. Good length ball on the pads, he leans forward and clips it neatly past the square leg umpire, the quick outfield does the rest
Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, 1 run, half-tracker to begin with, keeps really low and du Plessis accounts for it by getting his body weight down and dragging the pull to deep mid-wicket

Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, FOUR, du Plessis puts his dancing shoes on and lifts it over the bowler's head. Such clean hitting, holds his shape and earns a boundary. The key was he picked the length and met the pitch at the right time, then his fast hands taking over to execute the shot. It bounces just inside the ad cushions

Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, FOUR, oh, that's sloppy from KL Rahul. School-boyish error as he fails to get his body behind the line and lets it through his legs. du Plessis shaved it towards long-on, KL Rahul moves across to his right and perhaps took his eyes off the ball completely. Don't even look at your skipper, KL..

Tye to Raina, FOUR, appaling from Tye. Splays it on leg-stump, Raina is clever as he moves inside the line and tucks it fine. Harpreet from fine leg was slightly squarer and despite his dive, the ball runs away to the fence

Tye to Raina, no run, a dipping slower delivery from Tye, Raina didn't pick it as he misses the flick and overbalances a touch. Tye was confident enough to convince his skipper to go for the review but it was confirmed by UltraEdge that there was a clear inside edge

Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, 1 run, nurdled away through square leg and that brings up du Plessis' fifty. He's found form of late and this is a massive boost for CSK. Raise of the bat to soak in all the applauses from the dug-out

Murugan Ashwin to Raina, FOUR, bisects the gap on this occasion. Raina reaches his fifty, up goes the bat as well. Similar delivery from Ashwin, getting too predictable as Raina lines up and smashes it in the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on
Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, FOUR, he's changing his gears now. Runs down the track, takes this floater on the full and drills it straight down the ground
Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, SIX, it's getting worse for Ashwin. du Plessis skates down the track again, meets the pitch and extends his arms into a lofty hit over long-on

Tye to du Plessis, FOUR, bullied through extra cover. The intentions are clear from du Plessis. Knuckle ball, on a fuller length outside off. du Plessis sets a solid base and crunches it wide of long-off

Tye to du Plessis, FOUR, back-to-back fours. It's been raining boundaries in the last few overs. Tye digs it short, sits up emphatically for du Plessis as he nails the pull in front of square on the leg-side

Tye to du Plessis, SIX, Tye is being taken to the cleaners. 14 runs off the first three balls. Pitches up, just where du Plessis was hoping for. Gets under it and thumps it over long-on for a maximum. Just clears M Ashwin, who was patrolling the fence

Sam Curran to du Plessis, SIX, tonked down the ground for a six. It's in that swinging arc, just outside off. du Plessis arrests his back-lift and launches it over the bowler's head. For a moment, looked like he didn't get it off the middle but still he manages to get it over the fence

Sam Curran to Raina, out Caught by Shami!! There's the sucker-punch. Curran's the partnership breaker. This should soothe some nerves in the KXIP camp. Went shorter and cramped Raina for room, he tried it help it fine but ended up hitting it straight to Shami at 45 - who gobbles it up. Fine innings from Raina comes to an end. Curran spotted that the batsmen didn't cross, so alerts the umpire about the same. Smarty! Raina c Shami b Sam Curran 53(38) [4s-5 6s-2]

Sam Curran to du Plessis, SIX, slotted over cow corner. du Plessis inching closer to his ton. Another short ball, du Plessis gets into a brilliant position and sends it a countrymile over deep mid-wicket

Sam Curran to du Plessis, out Bowled!! Fiery response from Curran. Very impressive delivery from the youngster. It was full, it tailed in sharply and du Plessis was all at sea as he falls over. Gets rapped on the pad, then it deflects onto the stumps. Unfortunate end to what's been a thoroughly entertaining knock from the South African captain. The ton was definitely there for the taking. Good sportsmanship from the bowler as he pats Faf on the back. du Plessis b Sam Curran 96(55) [4s-10 6s-4]

Shami to Rayudu, out Caught by Mandeep!! Straight down the throat of Mandeep at deep mid-wicket. Rayudu is disappointed, reckons he should've got it away over the ropes. Fullish, nipping back in a bit and Rayudu wallops it off his pads. Didn't impart enough power to clear the fielder and Mandeep doesn't drop those. Rayudu c Mandeep b Shami 1(2)

Shami to Kedar Jadhav, out Bowled!! This is turning out to be an outstanding final over from Shami. CSK falling away. Another top-notch full delivery, straightening on and Jadhav exposes his stumps. Trying to make some room and misses it completely. The stumps are shattered and Shami picks up his second wicket. Kedar Jadhav b Shami 0(1)

Sam Curran to du Plessis, FOUR, shot! Just a mere push and the ball races away. Full and angled across off, du Plessis eases with a forward extension past the bowler and the timing takes care of the rest

Shami to du Plessis, FOUR, the pressure is released with a low full toss. Shami went for the yorker and did not get it right, du Plessis flicks it past the mid-wicket fielder and once it passes the inner ring, there is no stopping that

Sam Curran to Watson, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Watson's struggles continue.. Apart from one innings, he has looked woefully out of form. Fuller than a good length and Watson wanted to steer it to third man, too close to him and the off-stump is pegged back. CSK once again lose a wicket in the powerplay. Watson b Sam Curran 7(11) [4s-1]
Sam Curran to du Plessis, FOUR, lovely shot! Good use of the feet. He left the crease and did not allow Curran to change his length, right in the slot and he creams the drive straight down the ground
Ashwin to Raina, FOUR, fraction short and Raina is quick to pounce on that, he rocks back and nails the pull in front of square, couple of bounces and into the fence

Harpreet Brar to Raina, SIX, that is much better. Why nudge and nurdle when you have the shots? Raina shimmies down the wicket and though he wasn't to the pitch, he went through with the loft and it sailed over long-on
Ashwin to Raina, FOUR, neatly done! He waits and the ball was outside off, dabs it past Gayle at slip and the chasing fielder had no chance. Raced away..

Harpreet Brar to Raina, SIX, super shot! He is picking his deliveries and time to attack the left-arm spinner. Raina dances down the wicket and gets close to the ball, swings it with the spin over deep mid-wicket. This came right off the screws and went a long way

Tye to du Plessis, FOUR, fabulous shot! Good length ball outside off, du Plessis stays his ground and lofts it handsomely over extra cover, just an extension of the arms and the connection was exquisite
Tye to Raina, FOUR, poor bowling. Offers width outside off and Raina places it expertly, he waits for the ball to arrive and steers it behind point - between short third man and backward point

Chahar to Rahul, SIX, just the perfect over-ruiner. And Chahar's to blame -- letting out a rank short sitter outside off, slow as well for Rahul to line it up as he swivels and pulls it over cow corner
Harbhajan to Gayle, FOUR, well this is no Chepauk .. Bhajji tries spinning one across from a leg-line, alas, it goes straight on for an easy flick right through square leg
Harbhajan to Rahul, SIX, slowed up just for a change, and Rahul's no slow coach - he makes room and goes inside-out in a lofted extension of his arms over extra cover

Harbhajan to Rahul, SIX, now a shuffle, and goes the other way. It's in line with the stumps, which Rahul now has the spin for help as well as he sweeps it without even bothering to keep it down. Way over fine leg

Harbhajan to Rahul, out Caught by Tahir! A sigh of relief, as the breakthrough arrives! Looks like the topspinner, that straightened naturally a little from the over the wicket angle, Rahul charges down the wicket to loft it out of Punjab (Udta Punjab?) slices it high in the air and Tahir at extra cover settles under it. Rahul c Tahir b Harbhajan 71(36) [4s-7 6s-5]

Harbhajan to Gayle, out Caught by (sub)Shorey! "Wickets in packs" - that was Bhajji's catchphrase when he played for India, and it has reappeared all these years later. A gentle half-tracker, Gayle rocks back and nails itflat towards long-on but picks out Shorey to perfection! Gives Gayle a little smile, and he looks shell-shocked, does Gayle. Gayle c (sub)Shorey b Harbhajan 28(28) [4s-2 6s-2]
Harbhajan to Agarwal, FOUR, flat one angled into middle and leg, Agarwal gets low and swats a sweep away to backward square leg for four

Harbhajan to Agarwal, out Caught by Jadeja! Can you believe it? He's dragged another rank half-tracker with a pull straight to Jadeja at deep backward square leg. What a meltdown. I'm out of words - which can be a pivotal drawback in my line of work. Agarwal departs. Agarwal c Jadeja b Harbhajan 7(6) [4s-1]
Harbhajan to Pooran, SIX, dropped short, poor bowling, Pooran rocks back, very deep in the crease, and pulls it with an elegant flourish high and mighty into the cow corner crowd
Dwayne Bravo to Pooran, no run, dropped by the substitute, Vijay! A wide and full one, Pooran gets forward and lashes it square, straight to Vijay at point where Vijay spills a rgulation chance
Dwayne Bravo to Pooran, FOUR, half-volley right in the slot, Pooran doesn't need to get forward just leans into it with the powerful forearms and thrashes it through deep extra cover for four
Jadeja to Pooran, SIX, half-tracker from round the wicket, flat one, Pooran whacks it high and mighty over deep mid-wicket for six
Jadeja to Pooran, FOUR, another one dropped short, Pooran gets his weight onto the backfoot and smokes the pull to the long-on fence for four
Tahir to Pooran, byes, FOUR, yorker length delivery, Pooran tries squeezing it away, nutmegs Dhoni to the long stop fence for four byes
Tahir to Pooran, SIX, dropped short, absolutely abominable delivery, Pooran rocks back and deposits it over deep mid-wicket with a pull for six

Jadeja to Pooran, out Caught by Dhoni! Gone! Another short one, a bit of extra bounce and topspin, Pooran tries getting low and carving it away behind point, gets a little big on him, take the top-edge and into the gloves of the unerring MS Dhoni. Another one down, and that delays CSK's inevitable doom. Not a phrase you use very often, and perhaps one that has made several mortals on the sidelines swallow their words, but this one isn't looking great. Pooran c Dhoni b Jadeja 36(22) [4s-2 6s-3]

Tahir to Sam Curran, FOUR, all over! Bittersweet win for KXIP at home to finish off the season, as they manage to avoid the wooden spoon - that was to be RCB's destiny this time. It's a very full ball that's swatted over mid-on to the boundary for four to seal a consolation win for KXIP
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, the yorker goes wrong. Just an inch too full, just a degree too leg-sided and Rahul has easy pickings, flicking it perfectly behind square
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, 115.9kph, it's a larget buffet. Chahar tries overcorrecting, goes short, on the hips and swats don't really get any easier - whacking it once again into fine leg

Harbhajan to Rahul, FOUR, full toss. Rahul's cleared out his front leg, laying into it with a fierce cover drive. Bravo - at mid-off - is right there, but he charges at it and his old back is really slow in bending down in time, misfields
Harbhajan to Rahul, FOUR, and now Harbhajan overcompensates with the drag down. Rahul rocks behind, pumping the pull over mid-wicket
Harbhajan to Rahul, FOUR, oops. Harbhajan and no-Chepauk is a turning into a nightmare. H continues to keep it short, and Rahul continues heaving them mercilessly into cow corner
Harbhajan to Rahul, SIX, oh he'll run down now. Closes in on where it pitches and then goes inside-out, long levers, long-off. It's KL, the 2018 version

Harbhajan to Rahul, SIX, 19 balls | 52 runs -- the third fastest of the season. And it's just as stunning a shot to get there, the usual straight high-elbowed lofted punch. It's not everyday that you leave Gayle stranded at 4 off 5 balls while you have your fun
Dwayne Bravo to Rahul, leg byes, FOUR, hmmm, slips into the thighs, and the thighs are good enough to nudge them away fine, certainly helps his cause when fine leg's inside the ring
Tahir to Gayle, FOUR, wide full toss. Gayle, thankfully, holds his shape, quietly relying on placing it through the cover gap. And the gap's good enough
Tahir to Gayle, SIX, brave toss up, but it goes wrong big time. Just too full and outside off as well with Gayle hanging back in his crease to smoke it typically into the sightscreen straight down
Tahir to Gayle, SIX, and now he'll use the turn as well. Tahir goes length and Gayle goes tonking them over long-on, swishing the whack, long, hard

Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, walking swat, utterly outrageous. Rahul - clearly with no respect - walks down the pitch and then rocks onto the front foot to pull it so damn neatly to bisect deep mid-wicket and long-on
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, more grace, and rubbed in with more CSK misery. A very short arm drill, leaning back and generating a lot of power to pump it just in front of long-off's ropes

Malinga to Uthappa, SIX, is that the shackle breaker? He doesn't even want to go to Karthik and punch gloves. Tells his skipper to stay put. Malinga dishes out a slower length delivery from round the wicket, Uthappa clears his front leg and smokes it over cow corner

Malinga to Karthik, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Krunal has plucked it out of thin air. This might be a blessing in disguise for KKR. They need Russell out in the middle. Karthik and Uthappa were going nowhere with this innings. Full and on the stumps, Karthik whipped it cleanly and thought he had got it over the man at mid-wicket, but Krunal uses his height and times his jump to perfection to catch it with both hands. Karthik c Krunal Pandya b Malinga 3(9)

Malinga to A Russell, out Caught by de Kock!! Oh dear! The faces in the KKR dugout tell it all. Russell picked the wrong day to fail. His first single digit score and it has come in a crunch game. He doesn't walk back to the dugout but climbs up the stairs and goes into the dressing room. Malinga's ploy to bowl round the wicket has worked. Dug in short and gets it to climb near chest high, Russell arches back to evade it but leaves his gloves hanging mid-air, there is a brush and de Kock does the rest. Umpire Nandan took his time but eventually made the right decision. Russell didn't bother to have a word with Uthappa for the review as he knew he had got something on it. A Russell c de Kock b Malinga 0(1)

Bumrah to Uthappa, FOUR, needed, much needed. KKR will take them any which way. Backed away and created the room to get the bat swing, carved behind point and the pace Bumrah is enough to beat the third man fielder

Bumrah to Uthappa, SIX, four followed by a six. That should ideal get him going but not sure today. Short ball at the body, Uthappa has no other option but to take it on, the top-edge sails over the deep backward square fielder

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, SIX, second ball and Rana puts it into the stand. Gentle full delivery outside off, Rana just extends his arms and lofts it handsomely over mid-off, the timing was such that it goes the distance

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, SIX, 14 off the 3 balls. This is smart batting by Rana. He backs away and waits for the slower short of length delivery, ramps it over short third and the ball just manages to clear the rope
Bumrah to Nitish Rana, 1 run, direct hit and Rana was gone. Full delivery outside off, Rana cue-ends the drive to extra cover and takes on Rohit's throw, he's lucky that it was not on target
Bumrah to Uthappa, SIX, just over Pollard. Misses the yorker and bowls a juicy full toss, Uthappa goes straight down the ground and gets enough wood on it to clear a leaping Pollard

Malinga to Nitish Rana, SIX, consecutive sixes. The slower delivery from Malinga and not sure Rana was looking to go deep square leg, he intended to hit it over mid-wicket but ended up dragging it over deep square. He won't mind the final result though

Malinga to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Pollard!! Gone! He had to go after every delivery and this time he mistimes it. Third wicket for Malinga. Rana's cameo is cut short. Another slower delivery, Rana went deep in the crease and got underneath it, but could not generate enough power to clear the incoming long-off fielder. KKR needed Rana to play through as he was looking more dangerous out of the two batsmen. Nitish Rana c Pollard b Malinga 26(13) [6s-3]

Bumrah to Uthappa, out Caught by Rohit!! The pain, the suffering comes to an end. The off-cutter from Bumrah and it dips on Uthappa, who looks to go across the line, the toe-end goes straight up and Rohit settles under it near extra cover. He walks back to the dressing room and would love to be a fly in there. Uthappa c Rohit b Bumrah 40(47) [4s-1 6s-3]

Bumrah to Rinku Singh, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Taken! Bumrah ends the innings with a couple of wickets. A fast full toss on the stumps, Rinku Singh gave it his all to clear the field near long-on, but could not get the distance. Hardik is well inside the rope as he takes it calmly. Rinku Singh c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 4(6)
McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, SIX, there's the first maximum for the evening. Lynn cuts loose, gets the required length to swing his arms and clouts it way back into the cow corner stands
Malinga to Chris Lynn, FOUR, smacked. Malinga's slower ball provides width for Lynn, frees his arms and throws his bat. Crashes it in the gap at cover. That sped off the bat in a jiffy

Malinga to Chris Lynn, SIX, not going to see it off on this occasion. This bouncer is directed at the torso, it was kicking rapidly at him. But Lynn gets his weight back and helps it over short fine leg for a six

Bumrah to Shubman Gill, 1 run, good length, in the channel just outside off. Gill drops it with soft hands in front of extra cover and charges across to the other end. Rohit rushed in and under-armed a throw, but couldn't nail the target

Bumrah to Chris Lynn, no ball, FOUR, slower ball goes all awry for Bumrah. Ends up as a waist-high full toss outside off, Lynn was making room and connects with the slash. Sending it over point and free-hit beckons for Lynn
Rahul Chahar to Chris Lynn, SIX, serves it up in the zone and gets punished. Lynn shows no mercy as he clears his front leg and dismisses it straight down the ground for half-a-dozen

Rahul Chahar to Chris Lynn, SIX, dumped disdainfully over long-off. He's continuing from where he left off from the last game. Chahar under the pump now. Flighted it more luringly, Lynn gets under it and butchers it over long-off

Hardik Pandya to Shubman Gill, out Lbw!! Gill walks off after having a chat with his partner. The golden arm of Hardik strikes for MI and KKR lose their first wicket. Gill wasn't looking fluid from the start, found it difficult to get going and Hardik has trapped him. It was the off-paced delivery, dipped upon pitching and the batsman was caught playing down the wrong line. Completely missed it, getting struck in-line with the stumps. HawkEye confirms that it's crashing into middle and leg stump. The blue flags are out and MI fans are elated. Shubman Gill lbw b Hardik Pandya 9(16)

Hardik Pandya to Chris Lynn, out Caught by de Kock!! Hardik Pandya is turning it on for MI. "You cannot keep Hardik out of the game," chirps Kevin Pietersen on air. It was the slower ball, lands it well outside off making Lynn to fetch for it. The batsman accepts the challenge and reaches out aiming for a biggie. Terribly mistimes, slicing it up off a top-edge. QdK back-tracks, calls for it and nestles in his gloves. Huge blow for KKR this. Chris Lynn c de Kock b Hardik Pandya 41(29) [4s-2 6s-4]

Warrier to de Kock, SIX, short one at the body, de Kock shapes up to hook - oops, he's late on it - bit of a top-edge, very high on the bat, goes over the expectant fine leg fielder for six! QdK is surprised it carried!
Narine to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, off-break. Suryakumar too continues staying on the back foot, whipping it with a lot more intent, under short mid-wicket's dive
Narine to Rohit, FOUR, so very beautiful. And trust Rohit to come up with them time and again -- this time courtesy just a punch, splitting the two covers
Warrier to Rohit, 1 run, 140.7kph, middle-lined, quiet wristy knock down to long-on
Narine to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, okay, finally, a hurry. Yadav gets half a press in front and lofts his whip, many rows into cow corner

Narine to Rohit, FOUR, drags it down, and fittingly as KKR's campaign has gone in 2019, Narine too bowls out with a long hop. Rohit goes back in, makes it look a lot worse and pummels it wide of long-on
Gurney to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, another overcook. This time Suryakumar's good enough to ensure he doesn't need a fielding blunder, does it with an on-drive, through a straighter long-on
Gurney to Rohit, 1 run, just a punch, lining up well as he carves it through the covers. Also, a fifty -- and Rohit points his bat to his daughter holding it up against his shoulder
Gurney to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, it's into the fun zone. Gurney gives out another short one well down leg and Surya heaves it further. A tickle would've done here, but no, he'll do a carnage
Prasidh to Rohit, FOUR, woah. Rohit > elegance. It's too full anyways and Sharma lays in with a stride getting to it in drilling a lofted drill straight into long-on

A Russell to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, and the strategy dished out means it needs only one ball to finish things up. Mumbai top the table, Kolkata get wrapped up. Russell takes all his anger out in this delivery, banging it in short, down leg and Suryakumar hooks it away fine, very fine, very long. Mumbai seem calm, but trust Hyderbad to errupt.
A Russell to Rohit, FOUR, delicate! Banged in on a back of a length, good bounce, Rohit gets low, steers it away fine towards the third man fence for four
A Russell to de Kock, SIX, ah, the good ol' length-ball swat! On a length, and hence, in the slot - de Kock plays the pick-up swat over deep mid-wicket for six

A Russell to de Kock, SIX, consecutive sixes! Another short one @144km/h, de Kock swivels on his toe and gets it off the sticker of the bat over the fine leg fence for six. Very fine, and that's landed just in front of the more vocal comm. box!

A Russell to de Kock, FOUR, he persists with the short ball ploy, the slower one this time, de Kock shapes up for the pull, delays it beautifully, and clubs it over the in-field to the deep square leg boundary for four. QdK with an epiphany here!
Warrier to Rohit, FOUR, short and wide, Rohit flat-bats a pull over a frustrated, crimson Russell, to the long-on fence for four

Prasidh to de Kock, out Caught by Karthik! What a deperately fantastic catch that is! A short one at the body, de Kock isn't second-time lucky with a top-edged hook, skies it towards fine leg, looks, for an eternity, like it will land in no man's land, but Karthik, the stubborn Karthik, chases it down from the 'keeper's stop and dives full-stretch to take a magnificent catch. It's that kind of inspirational moment by the skipper, the kind of fairytale moment, that can turn a match, or even a tournament, on its head. de Kock c Karthik b Prasidh 30(23) [4s-1 6s-3]
Prasidh to Rohit, FOUR, short and wide, poor bowling, and a gorgeous punch in front of deep point for four

Prasidh to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, short one at the body, Suryakumar Yadav hasn't opened up his stance, finds himself in an awkward position, knows he'll be late on it, and goes for a blind hook - gets bat on it and deflects it away towards fine leg for four
Narine to Rohit, FOUR, fired down leg, Rohit steps across, laps it away with a fine sweep towards fine leg for four
Prasidh to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, fuller length delivery outside off, whipped away, dragging it from outside the off-stump with a Laxman-esque flourish for four
A Russell to Rohit, FOUR, short, not fast enough - @138.9km/h but a lot of pace lost on this dry wicket. Pulled away off the frontfoot for four through cow corner

Krunal Pandya to du Plessis, FOUR, just over a leaping Bumrah! Fortune for du Plessis who went hard on seeing the width but was never in control. Ended up slicing it towards short third man and Bumrah despite a great leap could barely get his fingertips on it. Phew!
Malinga to Rayudu, FOUR, nicely done by Rayudu, he pre-empted that Malinga was going to bowl full, bent down low, uses the pace on the ball and flicks it fine, no chance for the fielder at long leg

Bumrah to Rayudu, 1 run, a direct hit from Rohit and Vijay would have been running all the way to the dug-out - a suicidal call from Rayudu, came down the track and pushed it straight to cover, bounced nicely into Rohit's hands and he had time to to take aim and hit the stumps

Rahul Chahar to Vijay, out Stumped!! A ripper of a leg-break and Rahul has struck with his first ball of the comeback over - a top delivery and even better keeping - Vijay looked good during his stint, but he has to walk back to huge roars - that's because the next man in is MS. A quality delivery from Rahul, drifted in, dragged Vijay forward with the length, made him think he could work it to the on-side, then the ball gripped and turned past the outside edge - quicksilver work from de Kock and Vijay was stranded way outside the crease. Vijay st de Kock b Rahul Chahar 26(26) [4s-3]
Jayant Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, cracking shot, excellent use of the feet from MS, comes down the track, gets close to the ball, plays with the turn and lifts it high and over long-on for a maximum
Jayant Yadav to Rayudu, SIX, massive, the pep talk has worked, Rayudu dances down the track, gets close to the ball, lets the ball turn and then clouts it high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

Hardik Pandya to Rayudu, FOUR, nicely played by Rayudu - he's taking the lead here, mid-off was inside the ring and Rayudu chanced his arm - length ball outside off, he didn't time it all that well, sliced it high and cleared the fielder in the ring, one bounce and over the ropes

Bumrah to Rayudu, FOUR, mind-reader Rayudu. Expected the slower delivery from Bumrah, so walks across his stumps and gets into a great position to smack the pull over square leg. Picked his spot and executed it to perfection

Malinga to Dhoni, SIX, monster blow from Dhoni. He'll make a mockery of you if you miss your length. And this is the shot he will play even in his sleep. Malinga misses the yorker, sends it into the swinging zone for Dhoni and he makes him pay. Gets under it and tonks it powerfully over long-on. That's going, going and goes a long way into the stands
Malinga to Dhoni, SIX, it's two in two now. Malinga under the pump. Errs again, hurls in a similar delivery. Dhoni was ready for it, waits for it and absolutely clobbers it over long-on again

Rahul Chahar to du Plessis, out Caught by (sub)Anmolpreet Singh!! Chahar strikes first ball! He lets out a roar too and why not! This is a massive strike for the Mumbai Indians as CSK's last match hero du Plessis goes. Was a similar shot to the one he survived in the previous over, went hard on the cut this time and it was a fizzing leg break that turned quite a bit. The bounce also undid Faf who sliced it straight to backward point. Super Kings dented early! du Plessis c (sub)Anmolpreet Singh b Rahul Chahar 6(11) [4s-1]
Jayant Yadav to Raina, FOUR, this time Raina gets the boundary! On the pads and he swings merrily over backward square leg. Lovely bat swing and it races away to the fence

Jayant Yadav to Raina, out Caught&Bowled!! Another massive strike! This is another severe dent made by the Mumbai Indians. Rash from Raina who goes for the wrong option on a spinning pitch - against the turn. Wanted to hoick across the line but could only sky it high in the air. Jayant himself called for it, trekked back and got under the skier with ease. What a start this is for MI! Raina c and b Jayant Yadav 5(7) [4s-1]
Bumrah to Watson, FOUR, some respite for CSK as they get a much-needed boundary. Was a bit too straight from Bumrah and Watson helped it wide of short fine leg with a neat glance
Bumrah to Watson, FOUR, crunched away! Fractionally short from Bumrah and it's the trademark pull from Watson. Rocks back quickly and dispatches it over mid-wicket. Clean hit

Krunal Pandya to Vijay, FOUR, streaky runs but they all count! Flattish and turning away from around off, Vijay was squared up all ends up on the flick. Thick edge and it beat backward point, all the way to the fence

Krunal Pandya to Vijay, FOUR, this is superb batting from Vijay, attacking spin with positive strokeplay. Shuffles a bit early across the stumps and slog sweeps it cleanly over short fine leg. One bounce to the fence

Krunal Pandya to Watson, out Caught by Jayant Yadav!! Brilliant catch! Jayant is the man at mid-on and he had to go with his back to the ball. Such catches are never easy but he made it look effortless. Once again a wicket due to poor shot selection, the partnership was budding and Watson opts for a pull off the back foot. Against the turn and ends up mistiming it down the ground. Wasn't in control and perishes. Pressure mounts on CSK! Watson c Jayant Yadav b Krunal Pandya 10(13) [4s-2]
Rahul Chahar to Vijay, FOUR, crisply struck by Vijay, got forward to this half volley and creamed the drive through extra cover. Pollard in the deep made an attempt but couldn't quite succeed

Chahar to Rohit, FOUR, glorious way to kick-start your innings. Outswinger from Chahar, too short and swinging away outside off. Rohit stands tall, hands following and creams it stylishly through extra cover. MI's captain is off and running

Chahar to Rohit, out Lbw!! Rohit has been given out lbw, he has a chat with QdK and reviews. Did it pitch in-line? That could be the only factor saving Rohit here because there's no bat, HawkEye confirms it. Pitching - In-line. Impact - In-line. Wickets - Umpire's call. It's crashing the top of leg-stump. Rohit's a goner. Huge strike for CSK. Glum faces in the MI camp. It's a similar delivery that trapped Chris Lynn. The outswinger again, pitched on a length and straightened viciously leaving Rohit all at sea as he plays down the wrong line. Gets beaten on the outside edge and it clicks him on the back pad. Umpire Nitin Menon was quick to raise his finger and he's spot on. Rohit lbw b Chahar 4(2) [4s-1]

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Suryakumar flashes and flashes hard, nearly picked out the fielder at short third man but it's just out of reach of Tahir. It was short and plenty of width for the taking, Suryakumar obliged and ended up outside-edging it. Luckily, gets away as it just about beats Tahir's dive to his left and runs away to the boundary

Harbhajan to de Kock, FOUR, oh! This was fraught with danger. The quicker delivery from Harbhajan, gunning at the stumps and de Kock went deep for the cut. Manages to get his bat down in time and scythes it past backward point. That was a close call
Tahir to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, there's some helicopter in this one, piling on the low full toss and whipping it into cow corner
Tahir to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, more helicopter. A more-standing one here, staying up on the back foot and the power imparted on it is enough to whack it once again wide of long-on

Jadeja to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely batting from Suryakumar Yadav. Jadeja gets slightly short, and he pounces on it. Right back in the crease, waits for the ball and dabs it past slip. Jadeja livid with himself, swings his hand wildly in frustration
Tahir to Ishan Kishan, 4 wides, that's just bonus runs. Down the leg-side, turning away further and even Dhoni fails to get across in time. Desperate effort from Harbhajan to save the boundary

Tahir to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, should I, shouldn't I.. while Harbhajan deliberates on the dive, the ball goes through. Another deft touch from Suryakumar, dabbing this flat leg-break fine of backward point

Tahir to Ishan Kishan, out Bowled!! Beaten by pace, and by the length. Flat and quick from Tahir, looked like the flipper which gained pace off a length and went right through Kishan who was in the middle of an attempted pull. Completely misjudged the trajectory. The off stump is knocked over. Ishan Kishan b Tahir 28(31) [4s-1 6s-1]

Tahir to Krunal Pandya, out Caught&Bowled!! Chipped back to Tahir. A yorker length delivery that was squeezed back off the toe-end, and not many CSK players appeared too excited about it. They thought it was a bump ball. But Tahir went up straightaway. And he's right. Third umpire verifies that it landed on the pitch, then came off the bat. Krunal Pandya c and b Tahir 0(1)

Jadeja to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, the outside edge flies between keeper and slip. Absolutely flew off the bat. Length ball ripping away from off, draws Yadav forward in defence and the turn is prodigious. Watson is slow to react, and when he does, it doesn't stick in the left hand
Tahir to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, drifting down leg, Hardik Pandya picks the line up quickly, gets down low and paddles it on its way
Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, walks across, gets underneath this back of a length delivery and scoops it fine. He's been different class tonight

Chahar to de Kock, FOUR, wonderful adjustment from de Kock. It was length outside off, de Kock sits low, rolls his wrists and laps it to the fine leg fence. Knew the fielder was squarer, so placed it beautifully

Harbhajan to de Kock, out Caught by du Plessis!! Trap set, trap sprung. de Kock couldn't have placed it any better and Faf takes a smart catch at long-off. Floated up by Harbhajan, de Kock creates room seeking for the inside-out loft and ends up lofting it towards du Plessis at long-off who moved to his right and gobbled it up. The fielder was a bit wider and de Kock intended it to go more squarer there. Unfortunately, picked out the fielder. Both openers back in the hut for MI. CSK fans find their voice back. de Kock c du Plessis b Harbhajan 8(12) [4s-2]

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, loses radar. Yea, the overestimation of his swing - starting on the middle-stump line and expecting it to go across. But alas, it goes straight on, and Suryakumar makes it worse with his shuffle, tickling it off his thighs fine

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, dropped. Yadav tries a cross-batted whack, but the ball sticks in, just doesn't come on. And Vijay - the mid-on guy - is a touch late in reacting, but does decently towards the end to stretch out, only for the ball to burst through the palms

Harbhajan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, ah, ugly. Really, really bad-looking. Kishan - desperate to breach this pressure he's put on himself - runs down the pitch, hoicks big, hoping to go somewhere over cow corner, but only ends up with a thick leading edge, just past Watson leaping up at slip and managing to trickle under Bravo's diving attempts in the deep

Harbhajan to Ishan Kishan, SIX, he'll bite the bait. Is happy to go against the turn, milking the last ball of the powerplay that doesn't allow a deep mid-wicket - sitting on a knee and slogging it over. Cleanly
Dwayne Bravo to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 131.6kph, continues dishing out full pace and Yadav obliges with the elegant-est of cover drives, on the up,through both the dives of extra cover and mid-off

Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan is off and running. That is a super shot. Not much wrong with the delivery. Good length just outside off, Dhawan drives with minimal footwork and pierces the gap wide of cover. The timing was exquisite

Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, FOUR, overcorrects his line and is made to pay. On a length on leg-stump, Dhawan leans into the flick and strikes it square past the umpire, no chance for fine leg to get across and stop that

Khaleel Ahmed to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Saha!! Khaleel gets the breakthrough and he is absolutely loving the celebrations, mimics a phone ring as soon as he sees Saha gather the catch. Bowled it in that uncertainty channel outside off and caught Shreyas Iyer poking at it sans any conviction, a thick edge and Saha does the rest. Shreyas Iyer c Saha b Khaleel Ahmed 8(10) [4s-1]

Khaleel Ahmed to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Shankar!! One brings two!! Is this the game changer? It's a slower short ball outside off, Prithvi Shaw went for the pull but didn't really move his feet in terms of trying to reach the line of the delivery, it was well wide of him and that meant he got a thick top-edge which has been snaffled by Shankar at point. Prithvi Shaw c Shankar b Khaleel Ahmed 56(38) [4s-6 6s-2]
Nabi to Pant, SIX, gets underneath the tossed up delivery and smokes it for a 91-metre maximum over long-on. Gee, that power off the bottom hand...
Basil Thampi to Munro, FOUR, jumps out, looks to slam it away into the on-side and gets a fine inside edge for the ball to whizz past the keeper to his right for a four. Streaky but much needed
Basil Thampi to Munro, SIX, that is where he is very strong! On the hips, just a pick up shot and that has gone many a mile over the deep backward square stands. 53 off 37 looks far more gettable

Rashid Khan to Munro, out Lbw!! Fuller and flatter, Munro missed the clip for the ball to thud his front pad. Bruce Oxenford had his finger up and Munro after some deliberation with his partner decided to review. But that was in vain as it was three reds. SRH are still breathing.. Munro lbw b Rashid Khan 14(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Rashid Khan to Axar, out Caught by Saha!! And Axar is not a happy man trudging off. Don't think he gloved that flattish leggie. Looked to cut, was cramped for room and the ball jammed off his thigh pad into the gloves of the keeper. DC had lost their review earlier in the over and Axar had to proceed with his walk towards the pavilion. DC are in disarray!! Axar c Saha b Rashid Khan 0(3)
Nabi to Pant, SIX, kneels down and lifts the ball away! That wasn't too far away from Rashid at the boundary line. The ball pops over the fence as well. Much needed sixer for DC
Bhuvneshwar to Rutherford, SIX, length delivery going across and has been lifted away over deep long-off for a sixer. Poor choice of ball and has been deposited over the fence
Basil Thampi to Pant, FOUR, fuller and slower, thumped down the ground! That was blasted past the bowler. Basil Thampi had no chance. Have SRH made a mistake by giving it to Thampi?
Basil Thampi to Pant, SIX, another slower delivery and has been thumped over deep mid. Got hold of the ball and muscled it over the boundary. Poor execution
Basil Thampi to Pant, FOUR, DC and Pant are bossing this chase now! KW has played his cards wrong tonight. Length ball on the pads and has been whipped away past the short fine leg fielder for a four
Basil Thampi to Pant, SIX, you beauty! Pant on beast mode. Only 14 needed now. In the right slot, Pant has smacked it over deep mid. 20 off the over already. What have you done Mr. Thampi?

Bhuvneshwar to Rutherford, out Caught by Nabi!! Is there a late twist? Slower delivery going across, Rutherford lifts the ball away and has been taken by the man at long-off. Was that shot needed? A few dinks here and there would have done it. But Rutherford wanted to go for the glory shots and slammed it away uppishly without any timing to be caught. Rutherford c Nabi b Bhuvneshwar 9(12) [6s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, in the slot and that disappears! This man is a visual delight. Pitched up and Pant went bonkers to send it over long-off for a sixer

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, out Caught by Nabi!! Length delivery going across and was a slower delivery, Pant tried to take the skin off the ball and miscued it for the man at long-off to take it. This is one frustrating aspect of his batting. Looks to finish it with a glory shot and perishes. Three wickets remain. Can SRH script something miraculous? I feel its too late. Pant c Nabi b Bhuvneshwar 49(21) [4s-2 6s-5]

Khaleel Ahmed to Mishra, out Obstructing the field!! This is drama. Some thriller novel will struggle to match up to this. Mishra ran completely in the middle of the turf and the throw hit him. SRH first went up for a caught-behind call and then for obstructing the field. Mishra obs 1(2)

Khaleel Ahmed to K Paul, FOUR, Paul has done it! DC have pulled it off. They are through to qualifier 2. Short ball, Paul got hold of it and pulled it away, the ball evaded Shankar in the deep. A cliff-hanger and DC have held their nerves despite huffing and puffing a lot towards the end
Khaleel Ahmed to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, normal pace delivery and Khaleel is put away over mid-on. Back of a length and Shaw gets into a good position and pumps it over the fielder inside the ring

Khaleel Ahmed to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, this is even better. Khaleel has to correct his length quickly, short of length and Shaw had the pace to work with, rocks back and nails the pull in front of square, one bounce and over the ropes

Khaleel Ahmed to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, woah! That is smoked to the fence. Good length ball outside off, Shaw brings that high backlift into play and crunches the square drive past cover-point, no one moved in the off-side ring

Nabi to Prithvi Shaw, 2 runs, dropped! Tough chance but you are expected to take at this level. Flatter delivery outside off, Shaw smashes it flat to mid-off, Thampi comes charging in and dives forward, the ball hits him somewhere on the arm and escapes past him. He chases behind and keeps it to a brace

Nabi to Dhawan, FOUR, that is a good shot. Nabi is disappointed but there was not much he could do. Drifting in from round the wicket, Dhawan fetches the reverse sweep from leg-stump and places it past the backward point fielder

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Prithvi Shaw is looking in sublime touch. Just leans forward, presents full face of the bat and pings the push drive off the middle past the diving fielder at extra cover
Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, he is toying with the bowlers now. Stands deep in his crease, spots the short ball early and ramps it over a helpless third man fielder

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, this is sheer stand-and-deliver stuff! Gets a length ball outside off with a hint of extra bounce, Prithvi Shaw doesn't care one bit and thumps it over the mid-off fielder in a jiffy
Rashid Khan to Dhawan, 1 run, gets low and brings up the 50-run stand with a sweep to the right of short fine

Rashid Khan to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, picks the legbreak and pumps the drive over cover, excellent batting this from Prithvi Shaw. Making great use of the fielding restrictions and looking to pierce gaps as often
Hooda to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, Prithvi Shaw is flying at the moment. First ball against Hooda and he launches him way over long-on with a clean swing of the bat

Hooda to Dhawan, wide, out Stumped!! That's an excellent piece of keeping from Saha, nearly matched MSD (in terms of alertness) there. Hooda may have second guessed Dhawan's intentions and he hurled the ball miles down the leg-side and kept it short too; Dhawan was never backing away, went charging down and missed the ball completely. Looked to force himself back into the crease, but Saha did a wonderful job stretching across to take the bails off in the nick of time. Dhawan st Saha b Hooda 17(16) [4s-3]
Hooda to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, fifty for Shaw. He points at his badge to the dugout. Delhi need him to kick on and convert it into a big one. Waits for the ball to turn and nudges it past mid-wicket

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, don't want to jinx it but Shreyas Iyer is one of the best batters of spin bowling. Sees a hint of width on this legbreak and jumps on it in a flash, opens the bat face and nails the cut behind point

Boult to Saha, no run, excellent use of technology and Saha survives! Height was the factor that could have saved him but in the end, inside edge does. Was a lovely nipbacker from Boult that pinged Saha on the back pad. Didn't look dead plumb but the umpire was impressed and raised his finger. After a chat with Guptill, Saha opted for the DRS and it has saved him in the end

Boult to Saha, FOUR, beautifully struck! Hint of width from Boult and Saha lays into the back foot punch, square through the off-side. Finds the gap at point and it scooted away to the fence. Elegant shot!

Ishant to Guptill, SIX, into the night sky, going..going..gone! Jeez, that was in the air for a long time but guess what, he's got the distance as well! And quite a bit of it too. Length ball, just where Guptill likes it and he swings merrily through the line. Didn't hold back at all and that helped him in the end to take full toll. Into the second tier at long-on

Mishra to Williamson, no run, a chance and Pant has dropped it, that was a regulation catch and Pant didn't go down with the ball - stood tall and fluffed it - the leg-break and Williamson pushed at it, straight in and out of Pant's gloves

Axar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short and wide of off, Manish makes room, waits on it and then slices the cut past the reach of Munro at backward point - much needed boundary for the Sunrisers

K Paul to Manish Pandey, 1 run, stunning bit of work from Shaw at cover - a direct hit might have had Manish in trouble. On a length and just outside off, Manish backed away and drove it to the left of cover, Shaw tumbled, stopped the ball, turned around and had a shy at the bowler's end - all in one motion

K Paul to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rutherford!! This isn't happening, not for Manish at least - after taking plenty of time to settle, he's thrown his wicket away. The two West Indians in action - smart bowling from Keemo, spotted Manish making room and followed him with a full ball - with no room to free his arms, Manish shovelled the lofted drive into the waiting hands of Rutherford at long-on. The partnership was beginning to grow, but it's all over now. Manish Pandey c Rutherford b K Paul 30(36) [4s-3]

Rutherford to Williamson, FOUR, cracking shot, a half-tracker from Rutherford, short and wide of off, Williamson makes room and clatters it wide of cover - the man in the deep is very square and has no chance

Ishant to Williamson, FOUR, poor cricket from Boult - he was never going to get to the ball, not with the angle he was running into - dived forward and then let the ball go past him, concedes a boundary. The slower ball from Ishant, rolled away fingers across the seam, Williamson picked it and then swung it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Ishant to Williamson, out Bowled!! The perfect riposte from Ishant, saw Williamson backing away and then went straight with the yorker - right at the base of off-stump. Try as much as he could, Williamson was never going to dig this one out - the zing bails go flying and the Sunrisers have lost their fourth wicket. Williamson b Ishant 28(27) [4s-2]

Ishant to Nabi, FOUR, beautifully played, nice way to get your innings underway, back of a length and well wide of off, Nabi waited on it, used Ishant's pace and then chopped it late - behind square on the off-side and into the ropes

Axar to Nabi, FOUR, that's two delicate shots from Nabi for two boundaries. He waits for the ball to turn away, opens the bat face and runs it past short third man. The pace of Axar takes care of the rest

Axar to Shankar, SIX, that is his strength. Anything that is back of a length and Shankar is quick to pounce on it, he uses his reach to good effect to thump it with a straight bat over cow corner. Just managed to clear the rope

K Paul to Nabi, FOUR, smashed! Stand and deliver from Nabi. He literally stood there and admired the shot. Similar delivery to the previous one, but this time Nabi does not miss, he hammers it straight back over Paul and the ball almost went the distance

K Paul to Shankar, FOUR, very well played. Another short delivery and almost near the badge, Shankar is quickly into position and pulls it with a nice wrist roll backward of square leg. No chance for Dhawan in the deep

Boult to Shankar, FOUR, lovely shot! Shankar has used the angle of Boult to superb effect. Slanted across the right hander outside off, Shankar shuffles across and lofts it handsomely over extra cover, one bounce and over the ropes

Boult to Shankar, SIX, oh no! Iyer did all the hard work and catching the ball, but the toss up to the incoming fielder goes awry. Similar line and length from Boult and a repeat of a shot from Shankar, smashes it to wide long-off and Iyer races across to his left, takes it over his head but with the momentum taking him over, he tries to flick the ball up for Dhawan. No dice as he ends up throwing it over the ad boards

Boult to Shankar, out Caught by Axar!! Gone! Shankar's cameo comes to an end. He is disappointed with himself. Slower short of length delivery and Shankar picked the bones out of that, struck right off the meat but he couldn't have picked the fielder out at deep mid-wicket better. Axar didn't have to move much to take that. Shankar c Axar b Boult 25(11) [4s-2 6s-2]

K Paul to Nabi, no ball, SIX, Keemo Paul is struggling. He was on his haunches after the second ball and now he has overstepped. Hobbles to his run-up. Is not fit? Full and in the slot, Nabi nonchalantly picks it over cow corner for half a dozen

K Paul to Nabi, out Caught by Axar!! He might go for runs but Paul has the knack of picking wickets. An off-cutter outside off, Nabi reaches out for it and slices it straight to sweeper cover. Another sitter for Axar in the deep. Nabi c Axar b K Paul 20(13) [4s-3 6s-1]

K Paul to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Pant!! Paul has his third wicket. Another slower delivery outside off, the ball dips in front of Rashid and he is down on his knee to play the slog, the top-edge lobs to Pant and he makes no mistake. Rashid Khan c Pant b K Paul 0(1)

K Paul to Hooda, wide, out Hooda Run Out!! Here is what happened - Slower ball outside off, Hooda swings and misses, the umpire calls it a wide as it was away from the guide line, Rashid calls for a bye and Hooda responds, Pant throws at the bowler but Paul doesn't get there, instead Hooda trips over the bowler and goes to ground. The ball goes past them to remove the bails. There was no need of a third umpire but Ravi asked Delhi captain Iyer if he wants to continue with the dismissal. He first gave Hooda an opportunity to bat on but was convinced otherwise by Pant. Hooda run out (Pant) 4(4)

Boult to Guptill, SIX, one-handed chip over deep extra cover! Second time that Guptill hasn't quite middled it but has as many sixes to his name. Will this be his night? Was probably undone by the slower ball and got early into the chip shot. One hand came off in the process too but what he did well was to have clarity. Chose to go over the infield and ended up going over the ropes too. Wow!
Boult to Guptill, SIX, muscled away! Guptill is on a roll here! Shortish and a bit of width as well, he feasts on the offering with a ferocious slap cut over sweeper cover. Bludgeoned it!

Ishant to Saha, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The hard length inevitably does Saha in! He wasn't shying away from getting on the front foot, even to deliveries that didn't warrant it and that brings about his dismissal in the end. Ishant kept it on the hard length and Saha tried to go big down the ground. Never in control and the result is a miscue that Iyer takes at mid-off after trekking back a few yards. Saha c Shreyas Iyer b Ishant 8(9) [4s-1]
