Ishant to Guptill, FOUR, poor ball and Guptill punishes it! Sprayed on the pads, fuller as well and he just had to pick his spot. Watches it onto the bat and glances it very fine, beating short fine leg with ease
Axar to Guptill, SIX, hacked away! Guptill is in the mood! Axar fired this in and the Kiwi sat down to half-pull this over deep square leg. Absolutely clobbered it!

Ishant to Manish Pandey, FOUR, misfield allows a boundary! Ishant can't even complain because it's his skipper who is the culprit at mid-off. Pandey thumped the drive really well and Iyer wanted to attack the ball to have a shy at the bowler's end. Eventually missed it completely

Ishant to Manish Pandey, FOUR, top edge but it's nearly gone all the way! Cons of having pace! Good fiery bumper from Ishant and Pandey is clearly late on the pull. But he knew that fine leg was up and hence, there wasn't much risk on the stroke. Eventually fetches a boundary

Mishra to Guptill, out Caught by K Paul!! Mishy provides the massive strike! Guptill was looking ominous and DC badly wanted to see the back of him. That's precisely what their senior most bowler has done in his very second delivery of the match. Floated it up, inviting the big shot but the length wasn't there for the slog sweep as Guptill went through with the stroke. Skews it towards deep mid-wicket where Paul took a fine tumbling catch. DC have sprung to life with this wicket! Guptill c K Paul b Mishra 36(19) [4s-1 6s-4]

Boult to du Plessis, 1 run, huge mix-up and this has to be in list of all-time best moments of IPL. So, before I could miss important details, here's what happened. This was dabbed to point and Watto nearly ran in towards Faf who was struck midway having taken a couple of strides forward. Axar Patel then threw the ball to the bowling end where Munro collects and instead of throwing down stumps at his end he chose to fire a wayward throw at the batting end, Pant dives and misses and in the end they sneak in a run. For good part of this chaos, both batsmen were struck in the middle of the pitch and DC had way too many options which eventually led to a disaster

Boult to du Plessis, out Caught by K Paul!! Mistimed pull, in the air and it's a very good catch by Keemo Paul running forward and diving low at deep square leg. Short ball, Faf tried to take the bowler on, the ball caught him high on the bat. End of a fine innings. Faf's counter-attack in the powerplay was very crucial with Watto taking his time at the other end. du Plessis c K Paul b Boult 50(39) [4s-7 6s-1]
K Paul to Watson, SIX, horrible ball, short delivery down the leg-side, Watson pulls and times it sweetly, in fact just helped on the way over long leg
K Paul to Watson, FOUR, short slower ball and Watson has smashed that over mid-wicket, Keemo Paul has been off colour unfortunately for DC on the big day
K Paul to Watson, SIX, the slower ball is telegraphed early, got to be well disguised to a top player, Watson picks it, waits and slogs it on one knee to the cow corner fence

K Paul to Watson, SIX, fifty for Watto. From 18 off 20 balls, he's raced to 50 off 31 balls. This is precisely why CSK never mind a slow start from Watson. Slower delivery full and outside off stump, Watson lofts, mistimes to an extent but has enough power to hit it over long-off

Mishra to Watson, out Caught by Boult! GONE! A premature end to the pyrotechnics. A loopy leg-break on a nice length, Watson is enticed into running down the wicket and lofting over the straight boundary, gets it off the outside half and slices it away towards wide long-off where Boult picks up a catch. Makes some amends for that hat-trick ball. Watson c Boult b Mishra 50(32) [4s-3 6s-4]
Axar to Rayudu, FOUR, round the wicket, angles it in, Rayudu was already setting up for this - dances down the track and lofts it inside out towards the deep extra cover fence for four

Axar to Raina, out Bowled! He's been extremely iffy this over, and finally gives in! Angles in, some turn, Raina tries cut it away, chops it onto his stumps trying to cut and looks disgusted with himself. Just at the stroke of the strategic time-out. Raina b Axar 11(13)
Boult to Dhoni, FOUR, the crowd go berserk! A poor delivery on the torso, on the leg-side, Dhoni just gives it some topspin and swivels on it to deflect it away to fine leg for four
K Paul to Rayudu, FOUR, erring in line, angling into the pads once again, tickled away fine towards the long leg fence for four
K Paul to Rayudu, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Rayudu carves it away with a massive flourish between short third man and backward point for four

Ishant to Dhoni, out Caught by K Paul! He's gone! This is the very definition of disappointment - from the crowd AND from the CSK dug-out. A short one, with the pace off, Dhoni goes for the signature six to finish with a pull towards cow corner where he picks out Keemo Paul. You can hear a pin drop at Vizag. Dhoni c K Paul b Ishant 9(9) [4s-1]

Ishant to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR leg-byes, CSK are through to their 8th final in 10 editions they have played! A short one that's angling down leg, Dwayne Bravo whips it away off the backfoot (off the pads in fact) past a desperately-diving Pant towards the fine leg fence for four - and there are hugs in the changing room already. CSK are through to another final - surprise, surprise!
Boult to du Plessis, FOUR, too short perhaps and Faf powers it through mid-wicket with a crisp pull off the bottom hand, picked the length early and got onto his back foot in a hurry
Axar to du Plessis, FOUR, stands outside leg stump and thumps this in the gap between backward point and cover. Made room early and cuts the quicker delivery in the gap on the off-side

Axar to du Plessis, SIX, yet again its that premeditated movement tat enables Faf to smash a big one. Transfers all his weight onto the back foot and clubs this flat over extra cover with a hint of class and elegance

Ishant to du Plessis, FOUR, pulled away and Faf is looking to mae the most of the final over of the powerplay, back of a length delivery on the stumps, du Plessis waits and pulls behind square, the man in the deep is very square and it goes to his right
Ishant to du Plessis, FOUR, guided away uppishly and just wide of Munro at short third man, short of length again from Ishant, this time it's slightly outside off stump, Faf guides and gets four more
Ishant to du Plessis, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, short delivery on the stumps, du Plessis rocks back and pulls over mid-wicket, easy boundary, CSK well ahead now
Mishra to du Plessis, FOUR, oh excellent sweep shot, got low early with no one at deep square leg and absolutely smashed this shot from the middle of the bat to find the fence

K Paul to Watson, 5 wides, oh dear, tries the fast yorker and bowls down the leg-side, Pant can't cut if off. 50 up for CSK and they have got a solid start in the all important Qualifier game after struggling throughout the league phase. That's what experience does!
K Paul to Watson, FOUR, low full toss on the leg stump, easily ball, Watson glances it fine and beats short fine leg

K Paul to du Plessis, FOUR, this is very unlucky for the bowler. He's actually beaten Faf with a back of a length delivery, inside edge onto pad, goes past Pant, Munro gives chase from short third, dives and pulls it back, probably he was in touch with the rope for a moment and it's been signalled four
Mishra to Watson, FOUR, nicely paddled away, no fine leg, so he was aware of the field and was in position early to help it on its way
Axar to du Plessis, 1 run, punched down to long-on and a big cheer from the crowd as Faf raises the bat for his fifty

Axar to Watson, SIX, swept away all the way over backward square leg and CSK are running away with the game now. The heads are dropping in the DC camp. Fired down the leg-side, Watson meets the ball nicely and sends it into the stands, they are searching for the ball
Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, smashed! This is the length that Shaw enjoys a lot. Shorter from Chahar and it's been dispatched with a nonchalant pull through square leg
SN Thakur to Dhawan, FOUR, beautifully timed! Thakur searches for swing and in the process, overcooks this outside off. Stroked sweetly down the ground and beats the diving mid-off fielder with ease

SN Thakur to Dhawan, FOUR, this is a stunning shot! Wow! Another fuller one and this time, Dhawan was merely pushing it straight back past the bowler. Such amazing timing and the ball just rocketed away. Signs that this is a much better surface than the eliminator
SN Thakur to Dhawan, FOUR, pressure telling on Thakur and Dhawan is ruthless. Harmless short ball that's pulled away through square leg. 'Gabbar' seizing the momentum straightaway

Dwayne Bravo to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, cracking shot! Tad fuller around off, Iyer brings his bat down in a sweet flow and crunches his drive past the fielder at cover. There was a fielder in the deep to hunt it down but the timing was just about right

Tahir to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Raina!! Brainfade for the Delhi Capitals skipper. A googly around middle and leg, Iyer goes down in order to slog it but ends up getting a top-edge. The ball skies up towards Raina at point who settles underneath it and takes it safely. CSK on top, Delhi in trouble. Shreyas Iyer c Raina b Tahir 13(18) [4s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Axar, out Caught by Tahir!! The champion strikes! Time to bring out those moves. That shot looked good for a moment but the lack of pace on it results in Axar's downfall. Was a short one around off and the southpaw guides it straight into the mitts of Imran Tahir at third man. Had there been some more pace on the ball, it would have probably gone the distance. Axar c Tahir b Dwayne Bravo 3(6)

Tahir to Rutherford, leg byes, FOUR, CSK take a review against Rutherford! Imran Tahir looked excited but the impact looks just outside off, or probably umpire's call. Nope, wait. The impact was in line but the ball was bouncing over the stumps by some distance. Rutherford was trying to play a drive but got beaten for spin. The ball clips his pads and races away to the fence thereafter. The onfield call stays
Harbhajan to Rutherford, SIX, just look at that shot! Unbelieveable, reckons Sunny G on air. Was a touch short around off, Rutherford treks back and lifts it over covers for a lovely six. Class!

Harbhajan to Rutherford, out Caught by Watson!! Bhajji strikes again and brings out his fist pump to celebrate this wicket. Rutherford plays one shot too many and has to pay the price for it. He had struck a six already and there was no need to go after the offie. Goes hard at it and gets a thick outside edge that flies to short third man. Watto completes the formalities inside the ring. Rutherford c Watson b Harbhajan 10(12) [6s-1]
Tahir to Pant, FOUR, controlled aggression from Rishabh Pant! Sits on one knee, picks the legbreak and sweeps it in the gap between deep square and deep mid-wicket

Tahir to Pant, SIX, Deepak Chahar catches it......and steps back to ruin the party for CSK! MSD is not pleased and he immediately brings Chahar into the infield. Tahir almost started celebrating, but had to hold back and so are the CSK fans in the stands. A loopy full delivery outside off, Pant goes for the biggie and slices it high into the air off the cue end, the ball keeps swirling and Chahar at long-on couldn't control his momentum around the boundary ropes. Took the catch cleanly but the momentum way always dragging him back. Big moment in the game?

Dwayne Bravo to K Paul, out Bowled!! DJ Bravo gets the better of Keemo Paul. And the GANGNAM is on. 130ks yorker from round the wicket, goes slightly wide of the crease and pins it at the base of leg-stump, Paul looked to hammer it down with a violent bat swing but his leg peg goes cartwheeling; dips under the bat and crashes into the woodwork. K Paul b Dwayne Bravo 3(7)

Chahar to Pant, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Pant had to go for the big shot and unfortunately for DC, he loses balance as one hand comes off the bat. Hits the slog flat and DJ Bravo times his jump to perfection at wide long-on to gobble the catch. Pant c Dwayne Bravo b Chahar 38(25) [4s-2 6s-1]
Chahar to Mishra, FOUR, gets across and picks Chahar off his pads over fine leg, clean swing of the bat and timed it to perfection
Jadeja to Boult, no run, flat and fast on off-stump, Boult forces it straight back at Jaddu who couldn't cling onto a return catch
Jadeja to Boult, SIX, shortens his length and keeps it around off, Boult stays on the back foot and thrashes it way over long-on

Jadeja to Boult, out Bowled!! Clever from Jaddu. Bowled the arm-ball and managed to beat the inside edge. Boult expected it to be around off-stump and poked at it without much conviction, the ball dips short of him and smashes the leg bail. Boult b Jadeja 6(3) [6s-1]
Jadeja to Ishant, FOUR, no spin on this, Ishant uses his long levers and muscles it to the left of long-on, Faf tried his best to get behind the ball but Ishant, perhaps, timed it too well

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, out Lbw!! Excellent review and Shaw has to go! He was looking good once again tonight but falls prey to his addiction for the pull shot. The length wasn't really there on this occasion and he missed it altogether to be hit on the back knee as he crouched a bit. CSK were confident on the LBW appeal and sent it upstairs after the umpire's rejection. Nothing on UltraEdge and HawkEye shows Three Reds. Good review. Prithvi Shaw lbw b Chahar 5(6) [4s-1]
Chahar to Munro, FOUR, hammered! Clear intent from Munro as he gives the charge and forces this length ball past the bowler. Well wide of mid-on and it speeds away

Jadeja to Ishant, SIX, walks down the pitch and smashes it for a maximum. Just the kind of finish DC wanted and the whole of Delhi camp are delighted on seeing Ishant Sharma get his highest score in IPL. It was straight and short from Jaddu, Ishant ambled down and clobbered it straight back over the bowler's head. Crashed flat into the boundary hoardings...

Harbhajan to Munro, FOUR, 'hit me' ball from Harbhajan and Munro pummels it through the off-side. Slower, shorter and wider as well, gift for any batsman and it gets the treatment. Slapped through point

Harbhajan to Dhawan, out Caught by Dhoni!! Dhoni takes it on the second attempt! Sharp catch as this was a healthy edge and the dangerous Dhawan has to depart. Was the quicker one and he wanted to essay the back foot cut. Got a thick nick that bobbled up off Dhoni's gloves for a moment and he held on. Dhawan c Dhoni b Harbhajan 18(14) [4s-3]

Harbhajan to Munro, FOUR, crashed away by Munro! Got a bit of width on this turning off break, the length allowed him to wait and he slapped it through cover-point. Sweeper is behind square on the off-side and had no chance
Harbhajan to Munro, FOUR, over the infield! Fuller this time and Munro wisely goes over cover. With the spin and the loft is clean. This stroke should give him confidence

Jadeja to Munro, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Jadeja gets rid of the set batsman. Munro was looking so good, until he played this shot. Once again he goes down on his knee to play the sweep shot but fails to keep it on the ground. Dwayne Bravo stationed at deep square leg takes a regulation catch and Delhi sink further. They'll have two new batsmen at the crease now and Imran Tahir is yet to bowl his first over. Interesting passage of play on the cards. Munro c Dwayne Bravo b Jadeja 27(24) [4s-4]

Tahir to Pant, FOUR, there's never a dull moment when Pant is out there. Premeditates yet again and scoops the floated delivery towards fine leg. The fielder was no where close to cut this down, neither inside the circle nor outside it
McClenaghan to du Plessis, FOUR, that's overpitched and it's gone to the fence in a flash. Du Plessis leans across, right on top of it, before drilling it through the covers
Krunal Pandya to Watson, FOUR, way too full from Krunal, a half-volley really which Watson pulverizes through the covers. That's too easy, something MI can ill afford

Bumrah to Rayudu, out Caught by de Kock!! They sense it. Mumbai are gaining the upper hand. This is such brilliant captaincy from Ro. CSK just lost a wicket and he brings his key bowler back for an over and prises out another. Rayudu with a very lame attempt to pull/hook this short ball, wasn't going really hard at it, the ball takes the edge and QdK makes no mistake as it grabs the ball with a jump. Big roar for MSD as he walks out. Rayudu c de Kock b Bumrah 1(4)

Rahul Chahar to Watson, FOUR, oh Bumrah! Rahul Chahar will be livid with him. Bowled so well and he's let this go right through him for four. Would have been a single maximum. But Chahar's got to blame himself in the first place for bowling a freebie down the leg-side, Watto sweeps and gets it through short fine leg

Hardik Pandya to Watson, out Dhoni Run Out!! 1 run completed. Phew! What drama! CSK have lost their captain in a big pressure final! This was an overthrow which Dhoni was trying to steal and he will be unhappy with himself for doing something like this in a final. It was a short ball which Watson got the glove on the pull shot, he hit it to Malinga's left and Slinga fired an overthrow at the bowler's end. The ball went only as far as mid-off, but Dhoni tried it take on the fielder but Kishan hit the bulls eye and ignited the stumps. This was a very tough decision to make. One angle showed Dhoni was on the line, but there was another angle which reckoned Dhoni may have just sneaked in. Thoughts of benefit of doubt going to the batsman circled, but Llong took a long time. Saw various different angles and pressed the red button. Dhoni run out (Ishan Kishan) 2(8)

Rahul Chahar to Watson, no run, oh is that a dropped chance? Yes it was. It's the set Watto. Full delivery on the stumps, Watson drives hard and hits it back at the bowler, who doesn't accept the offer

Malinga to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, 138.6kph, misses his yorker and worse - he's got reverse swing on it as well - but it's bang in the slot and Bravo also makes it worse by getting deep in the crease as he whips it uppishly, high and over deep mid-wicket. Hardik doesn't help himself either at the boundary, running in at first, and then having to go back .. watches in the nd

Malinga to Watson, FOUR, 138.8kph. Keeps dishing out pace, keeps it wide outside off and Watson's edge will do just as well. There may have been a short third man, but the slice is such that it's very fine

Malinga to Watson, FOUR, oh, better. Malinga - with more pace - and with more in the slot. Wide, outside off, Watson moves away, sits down on a knee and carves it away into third man, almost all the way too

Malinga to Watson, FOUR, it's on loop. 15.3, 15.4 and 15.5, each one predictable perfectly -- all pace dealt out outside off, lots of width too and this time Watson picks out deep extra cover with that usual muscular slash

Bumrah to Watson, 1 run, oh Watto, you four-lifed cat. Bumrah lines him up perfectly with a sharp nippy bouncer, Watson pulls, gets hurried up big time, gets a top-edge and Rahul Chahar - running in from deep backward square leg wouldn't have had it easier. But alas, it's the finals, he slides, lets it pop out

Krunal Pandya to Watson, SIX, this was coming, this was exactly what Krunal was gambling again. He flats it wide outside off, there may have been a deep extra cover, but Watson carves it powerfully, well over that guy

Krunal Pandya to Watson, SIX, it had to be short. It HAD to be given the last ball's treatment, but Watson's smarter, rocking behind, going with a straight punch, extending his followthough into the sightscreen down the ground
Krunal Pandya to Watson, SIX, well, well, well, it can get cleaner. Krunal's darted this bang into the arc, Watson's down on a knee too and goes slogging. If only boundaries were in the second tier!
Krunal Pandya to Watson, 1 run, squeezed away to the right of point, Ishan does superbly out there, diving, keeping it to onlly a single

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by de Kock!! 148.5kph of a brute. It's lethal. It's murderous. Bumrah keeps the seam up, bangs it some more on his neither-here-nor-there lengths and Bravo continues backing away to have punchy wafts over extra cover at them. But this one's too fiery to not be nicked, and a kiss on the outside splice will do just as fine. Just when you thought things were slipping out, eh!? Dwayne Bravo c de Kock b Bumrah 15(15) [6s-1]

Bumrah to Jadeja, byes, FOUR, oh Quinton .. you may have heard of cups dropped, this is probably the cup misfielded. It was quick, really quick, and going well over the cut, and de Kock, in his quest to throw it quicker and stop the bye, ends up not collecting at all

Malinga to Watson, out Watson Run Out!! 1 run completed. Wide yorker. Squeezed away to deep point. But suddenly, for some weird reason Watson then doesn't want the second. Yes. No. Yes. No. And the half-hearted yes without proper consent ends up with him falling short, clearly short. The throw's f;at, which Quinton collects from well behind the stumps and under-arms it onto the stumps. Watson run out (Krunal Pandya/de Kock) 80(59) [4s-8 6s-4]

Malinga to SN Thakur, out Lbw!! Slower off-cutter, and things don't dip in the slot any better. 2013. 2015. 2017. 2019, you don't mess with Arithmetic progressions and you don't mess with these mathematical Mumbai Indians. Thakur - poor old Thakur - sent ahead of his usual position - walks across his stumps, freezes bang in front of middle looking to flick it across the line. But again, it's the finals, he chokes, misses and is trapped plumb, bang in front of middle. Oh Malinga, you really couldn't have redeemed yourself any better. SN Thakur lbw b Malinga 2(2)
Krunal Pandya to du Plessis, FOUR, steps outside the leg stump again, Krunal follows him again but he errs with his length this time. It's too full. Du Plessis lofts it over mid-on
Krunal Pandya to du Plessis, SIX, over mid-on again, a much cleaner strike. Krunal is drawn towards du Plessis down the leg-side, and is bashed through the line

Krunal Pandya to du Plessis, FOUR, completely unsettling the left-armer here. Backing away, making him change the lines. Krunal doesn't follow him this time, so instead, he gets cut through backward point

Krunal Pandya to du Plessis, out Stumped!! Krunal has the final say. He spots du Plessis's charge early, and yorks him with a quick, wide dart. Animated celebrations from the Mumbai Indians. After the stick he got for most of the over, this was much needed for Krunal. du Plessis st de Kock b Krunal Pandya 26(13) [4s-3 6s-1]
Malinga to Watson, FOUR, wasn't in control, Watson. Overpitched outside off, he went so hard on the drive that the poise was lost and his bat-face opened up - slicing it uppishly past backward point

Malinga to Watson, SIX, drifts on leg-stump with this off-cutter and is swept into the stands. Watson, having picked up the line in a flash, got into a brilliant position there before swinging it over backward square

Malinga to Watson, FOUR, finds the gap between backward point and short third man. These are mostly off-cutters from Malinga, which explains why third man is up. But this one has enough width on it, so Watson can manufacture the pace with his hands as he cuts

McClenaghan to Raina, no run, Raina given out on the field, but he's reviewed it. He got into a terrible position against a cracking bouncer from McClenaghan, just left his hands up there, and according to umpire Gould it brushed his glove on the way. But there's nothing on Ultra-Edge. However, the third umpire still goes through to check if there's any visible deflection. That's interesting. Still, he can't find much to uphold the onfield call. So the decision will have to be overturned

McClenaghan to Watson, FOUR, wowww! What an off-drive, the strike-rate is up and running again. Very brave from Ro to have mid-off in at this stage, but Watto made full use of this juicy full ball and powered it to the fence

McClenaghan to Watson, 2 runs, top edgeeeee, it's Malinga and he isn't stable, doesn't even get a hand on it! MI cannot be sloppy in the field. They defended miraculously against RPS a couple of years ago at this very venue. They need to be sharp now. This was a slower short ball, Watson went for the pull shot and got an edge that went way up in the air, Slinga moved sluggishly to his left from short fine leg and he never judged it properly

Rahul Chahar to Raina, out Lbw!! Raina's hot and cold season comes to an end with him eating up a review in an all important final when he was absolutely dead in front. Lovely bowling from Rahul Chahar. Leggie from the leggie, Raina was hanging back to defend, missed the ball, the impact was on the front pad first before it smashed into the back pad. Impact in line with middle and it's hitting the top of middle stump. Mumbai have an opening now. Can they put CSK under serious pressure? Raina lbw b Rahul Chahar 8(14)

SN Thakur to Rohit, SIX, smashed! A sharp bouncer @139.8km/h, Rohit isn't back and across, but natural talent comes to the fore - the frontfoot across and that pulled high in front of deep square leg for six!

Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, terrific catch from RJ - well, nearly, only he could have got to the ball, ran in a long way from deep mid-wicket, dived across to his left, went one-handed and got to the ball, but it kept going away and bounced past his outstretched hands. Nicely played by Suryakumar, knew that mid-wicket was wide and clipped it high and wide of that fielder - any other fielder and it was an easy boundary

Harbhajan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, that has been muscled - Kishan making his intentions clear - fetched a well flighted delivery from outside off and heaved it wide of mid-wicket - the fielder at long-on can't get across in time

Tahir to Suryakumar Yadav, out Bowled!! Tahir is off and running here in Hyderabad - big wicket in the context of the innings, Suryakumar was one who could have anchored this innings for MI - the slider from Tahir, pitched around off and kept going straight, Suryakumar was perhaps playing for the wrong 'un, made room and pushed limply - with a horizontal bat, the ball grazes the inside edge and bounces through to the middle-stump. Suryakumar Yadav b Tahir 15(17) [4s-1]

SN Thakur to Krunal Pandya, out Caught&Bowled!! That's a top-catch from Shardul - he called for the ball, sprinted a long way towards square leg, got to the ball and then juggled it, but doesn't panic - holds onto the second attempt and MI have lost their fourth wicket. He's on a roll, the Mumbai speedster. This was a well directed bouncer, short and climbing onto the left-hander, cramped for room, Krunal still went for the pull, gets a big top-edge, high and towards square leg. MS went for the catch, but the bowler called it out and then held on. Krunal Pandya c and b SN Thakur 7(7)

Tahir to Pollard, SIX, low full toss, didn't dip on the batter and has been spanked down the ground over the bowler's head for a sixer. Pollard didn't hold back there. Mistimed hits from him will carry as well

Tahir to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Raina!! What have you done mr. Kishan? Was that needed? Tries to go for a big slog sweep against a googly, gets a huge top-edge and Raina takes a dolly at cover. And Tahir becomes the leading wicket-taker of the tourney. Is it a game changing moment? Might well be. CSK fans erupt. Ishan Kishan c Raina b Tahir 23(26) [4s-3]

Jadeja to Pollard, FOUR, Chahar goes for the catch at deep cover and the ball bounces just in front of him to go away to the fence. That was sliced away powerfully and Chahar came charging in only to find the ball dropping right in front of him
Tahir to Pollard, SIX, you can't drop it that short! Mince meat for Pollard. Picks the short ball and slams it over deep square leg for a sixer. Much needed one for MI

SN Thakur to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, have you dropped the game Mr. Raina? That was a short ball, Hardik Pandya mistimes the slap and Raina at cover drops a dolly. Big final and Hardik Pandya gets a chance!!! MI have a huge reprieve
SN Thakur to Pollard, SIX, and Pollard slams the pull away! Adds a lot of red chilly into the wounds of CSK. Powered over deep mid for a sixer. That was hugeeeeee

SN Thakur to Hardik Pandya, SIX, fuller ball and has been whipped away over deep mid. This is what a redemption does to a batter. Frees his arms and helicopters it over deep mid for a sixer. Oh Raina!!
Chahar to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, short ball, Hardik Pandya stays back and pulls it down to deep mid for a four. Was in the gap between deep mid and long-on. MI on a roll post the drop!

Chahar to Hardik Pandya, out Lbw!! That dropped chance might not hav cost a lot of runs as Pandya is out LBW. Chahar nailed the yorker against a rampaging Hardik Pandya. Hardik Pandya looked to whip it staying deep in his crease and missed it. He was given out LBW and challenged it immediately. But it was three reds. And Pandya had to walk off. Excellent thinking on the part of the young man. Hardik Pandya lbw b Chahar 16(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Chahar to Rahul Chahar, out Caught by du Plessis!! Chahar gets his younger brother. Length delivery curling away, Rahul Chahar looks to go down town and slices the ball away to mid-off. Simple catch for the fielder who accepts it with ease. Pollard couldn't crossover either. MI being dented here. Rahul Chahar c du Plessis b Chahar 0(2)

Dwayne Bravo to Pollard, out McClenaghan Run Out!! 1 run completed. McClenaghan sacrifices his wicket trying to get Pollard back on strike. Was struck down the ground over the bowler's head as another wide yorker was executed. The man at long-off zoomed the throw to the bowler's end for the bowler to whip the bails off. Bravo shows emotions as well and bangs the ball on to the turf after whipping the bails off. McClenaghan run out (du Plessis/Dwayne Bravo) 0(2)

Dwayne Bravo to Pollard, FOUR, power, brute power! Full, outside off and slammed between deep cover and deep long-off for a four. Whatta shot!!! Pollard absolutely drilled that. Dwayne Bravo missed the wide yorker not by much

Chahar to de Kock, SIX, another lost ball? A length ball, the white marshmallow deceives Chahar, as it doesn't move off the wicket, a tad wide outside off, but de Kock shuffles across and clubs that high and mighty over cow corner for six! Into the stands!

Chahar to de Kock, SIX, an away-swinger, nothing wrong with this one, on a good length and not a lot of width, de Kock just backs away and has a flash at it - and he's sliced it away over deep backward point for six. Just over Bhajji at the fence

Chahar to de Kock, SIX, VVS was spot-on with his pitch report, he's definitely trusting the bounce off a length, it's angling away, de Kock lines himself and just casually lofts it over deep extra cover for six

Dwayne Bravo to Pollard, FOUR, and Pollard signs off with a four! An angry Pollard walks off. That 'could have been wide ball' playing on his mind. Was fuller, missed the mark though, and Pollard butchered it between deep cover and long-off. Sped into the fence in a jiffy
Harbhajan to Rohit, FOUR, errs off the final ball - a flat one on the pads, Rohit is quick to pounce on it, shapes up to sweep, and nails it to the backward square leg fence for four
SN Thakur to de Kock, SIX, short one angling away outside off, de Kock plays a southpaw's forehand and absolutely slaughters that over deep mid-wicket for six. That's an absolutely stunning shot...

SN Thakur to de Kock, out Caught by Dhoni! Short ball, and that does the trick! Right at the body, really brave bowling, he's hurried on the pull and top-edges it - hardly any bat on that and Dhoni comes around, moves to his right, to take the citter of the century. A huge wicket in the context of the game, and Shardul has taken a key wicket here. de Kock c Dhoni b SN Thakur 29(17) [6s-4]

Chahar to Rohit, out Caught by Dhoni! The slower one has done it! 119.8km/h, the knuckle ball, that wobbles unpredictably in the air, swerves away, courtesy a falling seam towards the on-side, and Rohit has been done in by the lack of pace - can't decide when to get his weight forward and has a waft at a transfer-of-weight drive into the off-side - his bottom-hand has come off the bat, no control, and he gets a healthy edge. Dhoni dives forward to pick up the catch that's dipping on him. Both the openers have departed, and CSK right back in it! Rohit c Dhoni b Chahar 15(14) [4s-1 6s-1]

Harbhajan to Ishan Kishan, no run, just short of Raina at cover, dropped short and wide of off, Kishan made room for the punch and didn't bother to keep it down, almost carried to cover as raina tumbled forward

Dwayne Bravo to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, clubbed, nice way to start after the break, length delivery outside off, Kishan leant forward and lifted it high and over mid-on, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Dwayne Bravo to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, nicely played, the loopy slower ball from Bravo, kept dipping onto the left-hander - Kishan was setting himself up for the pull, bends down low with the ball and then sweeps it behind square on the on-side - beat the man in the ring and raced away to the ropes
Boult to Watson, FOUR, fetch that! On a full length outside off, shaping away to an extent and Watson throws the kitchen sink at it. Smacks it over extra cover as he's off the mark with a boundary

Boult to Watson, out Lbw!! Sweet vengeance for Boult as he comes back on the very next ball having conceded a boundary. Full, quick and swinging into the batsman. Watson goes for a drive with lack of footwork and gets rapped on the pads. Impact on middle and this would have crashed into middle and leg. Good call by the openers to not opt for the review, else they would have regretted it after watching the replays. Watson lbw b Boult 4(5) [4s-1]
Krunal Pandya to Rayudu, SIX, horrible drag down this. Rayudu's charged down, made it into one in his slot and smoking a cross-batted heave over cow corner

Bumrah to Rayudu, FOUR, absolute smash back, tennis forehand. A walk, clearing the front leg and a swat downtown, with Bumrah getting a fingertip as he tries pulling his hand out of the way. Oh and also, a fifty -- and revenge for the 2019 WC is well and truly complete
Rahul Chahar to Rayudu, SIX, oooo, wow. Just wow. Rayudu continues dancing, going inside-out, and then holding his pose. Yep, extra cover
Pattinson to du Plessis, 1 run, back of a length, on off. Swatted off the front foot, to a sliding long-on who's Pandya, Hardik Pandya
Bumrah to Rayudu, 1 run, 142.8kph, yorker, off-lined. Jammed down the ground, coincidentally bringing up the 100-run stand as well
Bumrah to du Plessis, FOUR, 144.5kph. Slight width, wth Faf backing away to snatch a lot more to slap this with lots of bottom-hand, past Rohit's dive at short cover

Rahul Chahar to Rayudu, 1 run, dropped -- a massively tough one, but nevertheless, it's put down. Rayudu reverse-sweeps, and Krunal Pandya - backward point - dives to his right, gets both palms, and can't hold on

Rahul Chahar to Rayudu, out Caught&Bowled!! Nobody's taking his catches, and so what if he needs to sprint backwards for this. Yeah, he does. Rayudu, third time unlucky, has a dance, a hoick, only getting the toe-end and skewing up a skier. It's somewhere around mid-on, and the run-dive's more than good enough. But forget that, it's been a top knock from India's best number four who wasn't in the World Cup. Rayudu c and b Rahul Chahar 71(48) [4s-6 6s-3]
Pattinson to Jadeja, FOUR, filthy loose a line. Full, leg-lined and Jadeja just waits for it to get close before whipping it really fine
Pattinson to Jadeja, FOUR, nothing dicey here. Pattinson feeds him a high full toss outside off and Jadeja neatly opens his bat face to carve it backward of point

Krunal Pandya to Jadeja, out Lbw!! Plumb. Dead. Gone. A straight delivery, angling in and the Jadeja's been fooled by the pace as he plays all around this with his flick after plonking his front leg in front of off. It can't get easier for umpires, and for Jadeja with the decision to not review. Jadeja lbw b Krunal Pandya 10(5) [4s-2]
Krunal Pandya to Sam Curran, SIX, low full toss. Curran stays crouched, gets under, and boom. Swinging slog, into cow corner

Krunal Pandya to Sam Curran, FOUR, there's nobody in the deep on the off-side, but Pandya for some reason still wants to bowl a half-tracker with lots of width. Curran won't complain, slicing it over cover, which is all he had to do
Bumrah to Sam Curran, SIX, game over. Bumrah tries the slower one, but Curran - in some mood - picks it early and nails it right off the screws, over deep mid-wicket

Bumrah to Sam Curran, out Caught by Pattinson!! Misbah moment? A scoop, after shuffling across to a slower delivery, but unlike Sreesanth, Pattinson has to backpedal and hold on. Doesn't matter, this game's sealed. Sam Curran c Pattinson b Bumrah 18(6) [4s-1 6s-2]
Bumrah to du Plessis, FOUR, sealed some more. Another poor delivery, slow, short, wide. Faf has all the time he needs, staying up tall and slicing over cover in the ring with nobody behind
Bumrah to du Plessis, 1 run, a sort of a miscued punch, wide of extra cover, but nothing's miscued in this fifty

Bumrah to Dhoni, no run, Dhoni reviews a caught behind: You'd think when he reviews from behind the stumps, he'd know when he hasn't nicked it. It was the typical strategy -- short, incoming bouncer, which MS pulls and apparently gloves away to the keeper. Nope, clear daylight between glove and ball, and more daylight between bat and ball. But there was a noise, which probably was his clicking bat
Boult to du Plessis, FOUR, sliced over point. Boult goes round the wicket and dishes out a floaty lazy non-warmed-up delivery that's full, wide and worthy of a dispatch. Yep, over backward

Boult to du Plessis, FOUR, no fuss. Boult overcompensates with one that's short, into the body and gets swiped into deep mid-wicket. Again, no fuss, not even a celebration. Typical dad stuff, you're never happy, and that's exactly what this CSK are

Pattinson to Vijay, out Lbw!! Gone this time! Faf du Plessis was asking him to opt for the review, but Vijay thinks otherwise and decides to walk back. This one shaped into the batsman on a fullish length and beat Vijay's across-the-line flick. Struck in front of middle, but looking at the replays, I think it might have clipped or probably missed the leg stump. Vijay lbw b Pattinson 1(7)

Boult to du Plessis, FOUR, that shall release some nerves in the CSK camp. Pitched on a full length outside off, du Plessis reaches out for it by leaning ahead and creams it through extra cover as the ball races away in no time

Pattinson to Rayudu, FOUR, swinging like the pendulum of a clock already, this innings. Back of a length delivery outside off, width on offer and Rayudu has thumped it through cover-point with authority. No need to run for those
Boult to Rayudu, FOUR, quality shot! Typical Rayudu as he leans forward, converts the length into a slight full one and creams it through the gap on the off side. Looks batting look so effortless

Bumrah to Rayudu, SIX, that will hurt. The free-hit has gone the distance as Rayudu lines up against the short ball and clubs it off the back foot over wide long-on. Sweetly timed maximum. Started with four dot balls and ends up conceding 14. Life's harsh sometimes
Bumrah to Rayudu, no ball, FOUR, slashed away! Not that short, neither too full. Sets up for Rayudu who makes use of the slight width and flashes it over point. No ball. Free hit coming!

Rahul Chahar to du Plessis, FOUR, fantastic Faf! All about timing, this shot. Shimmies down the track and although the ball sticks into the surface - the class of du Plessis takes over. Goes inside out with a checked lofted drive and manages to beat Surya at long-off

Krunal Pandya to Rayudu, 1 run, was that a dropped catch? Rayudu was down the track to play an uppish flick as Chahar failed to grab it although he put in a dive. It escaped him as he couldn't quite reach there
Krunal Pandya to Rayudu, 1 run, 50-run stand up as Rayudu eases it down to long-off for a gentle single
Rahul Chahar to Rayudu, FOUR, not a great effort by Bumrah at short fine leg, he should have stopped this. Was down the leg side as Rayudu swept it past the man at short fine leg

Rahul Chahar to Rayudu, FOUR, back-to-back sloppy efforts. A tossed up delivery outside off and Rayudu chips it to deep cover where Boult makes a mess of it. Was charging in to avoid the batsmen from taking the second, and ends up gifting them a boundary. Rohit Sharma wouldn't be a happy skipper with those two boundaries..

Chahar to Rohit, FOUR, there is swing alright, but it's an absolute loosener. Sitting up from a back of a length outside off, gets whacked through covers. Rohit is underway in IPL 2020. Stood there in the crease and nonchalantly drove it on the back foot
Chahar to de Kock, FOUR, been a rusty start from Chahar, who now doles out a half-volley on the pads of de Kock. Gleefully flicked through midwicket, the timing is superb

Sam Curran to Rohit, FOUR, plenty of width outside off, the hard part for Rohit is to stretch out to meet it. So it's commendable that his timing is still so great as he smears it through backward point

Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Sam Curran!! In the airrr, has he timed this? No pace on the ball, to be honest can't blame the pitch for this dismissal. Was right in the slot to tee off, but Suryakumar was hanging back for this one, didn't go through fully and sort of chipped it, long-on steadies and takes this around his left shoulder. Suryakumar Yadav c Sam Curran b Chahar 17(16) [4s-2]

Jadeja to Hardik Pandya, SIX, that's all the amount of respect Pandya had in the tank. He loves spin. As soon as Jadeja bowled a little full, he went down on his knees to power it over deep mid-wicket

Jadeja to Hardik Pandya, SIX, now that is some shot! Don't think many would hit that so far from that length. Not really short and leg stump line, but went back, despite not using the depth of the crease and being cramped, he swivelled and pulled it over the backward square leg boundary and that seems to have cleared the ground. All those gym sessions, that's great flexibility

Ngidi to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, shortish and Tiwary has pulled. This is a seriously good cameo from Tiwary. Came in at the fall of two big wickets, but kept the shots coming. This one's pulled over mid-wicket

Ngidi to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, oh Lungi! He's the old fit self that he is. The rhythm isn't there, the strides aren't intense. Full delivery, Tiwary charges and slaps wide of mid-off. Can't be bowling full with mid-off in

Chawla to Saurabh Tiwary, no run, CSK review for LBW, but looks like it was missing off stump, or maximum shaving off stump. Umpire's call will do for the batsman. Was the googly, so tough to be out LBW from over the wicket, oh yes, ball-tracker says missing off stump. Tiwary went for the big sweep and missed

Jadeja to Saurabh Tiwary, out Caught by du Plessis!! Faf and his magic at the boundary. Those spring ankles take over. Tiwary powered this flighted delivery down the ground, but Faf, very mindful of the boundary, jumped, landed on the left foot, released the ball as he was about to cross the boundary as he was overbalancing. Then quickly recovered to pouch it safely. A really handy innings from Tiwary. He's impressed for sure! Saurabh Tiwary c du Plessis b Jadeja 42(31) [4s-3 6s-1]

Jadeja to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by du Plessis!! You are kidding me Faf! Surely you can't be taking these nimble footed catches twice in an over. Jadeja bowled full, so Pandya went for a loft over long-off, hit it really flat and hard, Faf had to move to his right a bit this time, yet he timed the jump brilliantly, released the ball as he was going over the rope and then swallowed it again. Big wicket this for CSK, will make a difference of 10 runs at least to the final total. Hardik Pandya c du Plessis b Jadeja 14(10) [6s-2]

Chawla to Pollard, SIX, na, na, na, just waited for it to land in his zone. With that sort of a form in CPL, he won't mishit those. Easy to the eye straight loft into the sightscreen. Expect the bowler to push it quick and short?

Ngidi to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Dhoni!! That's a soft dismissal! Nothing back of a length delivery down leg, Krunal tried to glance fine, but got an edge and Dhoni was sharp moving to his right and grabbing that. Unlucky! Krunal started walking before the decision. Can CSK stage a comeback and stall MI? Krunal Pandya c Dhoni b Ngidi 3(3)
Sam Curran to Pattinson, FOUR, Pattinson powers this down the ground, no long-off so it runs off to the boundary. Sam Curran overpitched this one and got punished
Sam Curran to Pollard, FOUR, this is really poor bowling! Low full toss down leg, Pollard flicks, fine leg in, it's a sin to bowl there. Pollard calmly glances knowing the field and collects four

Ngidi to Pollard, out Caught by Dhoni!! Edged and taken. All those bowlers in the CPL, hope you note this length. Back of a length is the toughest to hit. If you have pace, it's a no brainer for you to use at the death to power-hitters than bowling freebies in the name of trying the fancied yorker, for which the margin of error is very less. Pollard slogs and gets a thick outside edge through to Dhoni. CSK have stolen 10 runs off the total. Pollard c Dhoni b Ngidi 18(14) [4s-1 6s-1]

Ngidi to Pattinson, FOUR, oh Chahar! Dhoni won't be happy with that effort. Short of a length delivery on the stumps, Pattinson pullls through mid-wicket, what should have been maximum two is now four because Chahar didn't bend enough. The eternal fast bowler's problem! I know!

Ngidi to Pattinson, out Caught by du Plessis!! Catch numer three for Faf and wicket number three for Ngidi. What a turnaround this has been from him. 29 in the first two overs, now has three. Sticks this back of a length delivery into the pitch, a brilliant option on slow surfaces, Pattinson looks to pull, high in the air and Faf has it easy. Pattinson c du Plessis b Ngidi 11(8) [4s-2]

Chahar to Boult, out Bowled!! Leg stump out of the ground. Length delivery on the leg stump, Boult slogs and misses. Oh Chahar is limping after delivering that ball. Looks like the hammie. He's stretching it. Hope it's not too serious as he wants to continue. Boult b Chahar 0(1)
Chahar to de Kock, FOUR, slower ball at 119kph, sits up for de Kock from the middle of the pitch as he heaves through midwicket. Chahar's not been great here at the start
Ngidi to de Kock, FOUR, full in the slot for de Kock who pumps it over mid-off. Really taking the bowling on, although the bowling is really ordinary at this stage

Ngidi to de Kock, FOUR, four more for de Kock, although this has come off a perfectly decent delivery. Back of a length at the top of off, and it's been met with disdain from de Kock who clears his front leg and slogs it over mid-on. Almost went all the way
Ngidi to de Kock, FOUR, he's on an absolute roll. Succeeds with the scoop this time, something which he was trying earlier in the over. Walks across, gets a length ball and ramps it over short fine

Chawla to Rohit, out Caught by Sam Curran!! Such a soft dismissal as Rohit just chips this into the hands of mid-off. Half-hearted loft, never went through with it and to make it worse the timing isn't there at all. Bounces off the toe-end and it's a dolly for Curran. The MI captain gone early. Rohit c Sam Curran b Chawla 12(10) [4s-2]

Sam Curran to de Kock, out Caught by Watson!! Okay, the slowness of the surface is really coming to the fore here. After Rohit, de Kock toe-ends one. And it elicits a mighty roar from Ngidi who took some punishment from the left-hander. Back of a length around off, stops on de Kock as he heaves it straight to midwicket. Curran might've rolled his fingers across it as well. de Kock c Watson b Sam Curran 33(20) [4s-5]
Sam Curran to Saurabh Tiwary, 2 runs, full on middle and leg, clipped through midwicket. Raises fifty for MI
Jadeja to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, beautiful from Suryakumar as he clears the front leg and lifts this delivery over extra cover. Great timing on it to beat long-off

Sam Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, back of a length, cutting away across off. There should've been no room for Suryakumar here, but he's manufactured it for himself by stepping away. But even from his modified position, the width isn't quite there to free the arms. Still, he's able to scythe this through baclward point. Beats third man's diving effort

Jadeja to Saurabh Tiwary, SIX, Jadeja gets it right into the slot for Tiwary who lofts it downwind to clear long-off. The wind was the key here. Don't think he struck it that well but the wind made sure it carried
Jadeja to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, short enough and wide enough, slapped away for four through backward point. MI regaining momentum through these two again

Cottrell to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, edged and four, full and angling across the right-hander, Shaw saw the width and went hard on the drive, gets a thick edge that flies through the vacant slip region - a desperate dive from Sarfaraz near the third man rope, but he can only palm it to the ropes

Shami to Dhawan, out Dhawan Run Out!! A poor dismissal for the Capitals and Dhawan walks back for a duck. He might have actually been reprieved first up, think he gloved the pull and KL spilled it - the ball rolled wide of him and Dhawan thought there was a single on offer - dashed way down the track only to watch his partner motionless at the other end. Too late to return, KL ran across, collected the ball and lobbed in a throw at the striker's end - Gowtham was waiting for it and breaks the stumps, with a disconsolate Dhawan stranded in the middle. Dhawan run out (Rahul/Gowtham ) 0(2)
Gowtham to Pant, 1 run, short, skidding on outside off. Pant crashes it through cover

Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, FOUR, 89.3kph, the googly spinning away across the left-hander outside off. Pant swings hard, balance out of sync and elicits a thick outside edge which flies through the vacant slip region. Bishnoi has his hands on his head.. lucky Pant
Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, 1 run, slants it away outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover and 50-run stand between these two
Gowtham to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, see-ball, hit-ball. As simple as that. Iyer finds one in his arc, brings those strong muscle power and butchers it over long-off. Second six for DC's skipper..

Gowtham to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, whoa.. Iyer, you beauty. This lad is a very good player against spin and he's showing his class here. Gowtham doesn't correct his length, floats it up just outside off and Iyer's eyes lit up once more. Gets under it and whacks it a mile over long-on

Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, FOUR, Pant gets into the act now. Bishnoi pitches it teasingly just outside off, Pant bends low and goes for a cross-batted down-town swing. Picks the gap at long-on and it's a boundary..

Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, out Bowled!! Maiden IPL wicket for Ravi Bishnoi. Nice comeback, young man. Long way to go! Bowls the wrong 'un, gets it to spin away outside off. Pant tries to do an encore, didn't sort of get into a good position and morever had to fetch it from outside off. Ends up dragging it onto the stumps via an inside edge. Bishnoi is upbeat and a crucial wicket for Punjab as Pant - the dangerman departs. Pant b Ravi Bishnoi 31(29) [4s-4]

Shami to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Jordan!! One brings two as they say. Two wickets in two overs for Punjab and both set batsmen back in shed for Delhi. Not a wise shot from Iyer at this stage. It was fuller just outside off, Iyer knew the mid-off was inside the ring, so got tempted and wanted to lift it over him. But his bat turns in his hands at the point of impact and as a result of which he miscues and offers a dolly to Jordan. Third wicket for Shami, brilliant. Shreyas Iyer c Jordan b Shami 39(32) [6s-3]

Cottrell to Axar, out Caught by Rahul!! Has this been taken? KL and Cottrell are ready to celebrate but umpire Nitin Menon pauses them, he isn't sure if the catch is clean. So, they are referring it to the third umpire. Axar is also asked to wait. No doubt about the glove, it's all about the catch. It's dipping on the way to Rahul and seems like he's grabbed it cleanly. OUT is the decision and the batsman can continue his walk back to the hut. Delhi are falling away quickly. A back of a length, veering down leg. Patel wanted to tickle it fine and he ended up gloving it to KLR, who went to his right and took a good low catch. Axar c Rahul b Cottrell 6(9)
Cottrell to Stoinis, 1 run, pacy fuller length delivery at 136.2kph, Stoinis meets it with a crisp drive to sweeper cover and brings up Delhi's 100

Jordan to Stoinis, SIX, muscled over cow corner. A 92-metre hit from Stoinis. Got the required length from Jordan, who perhaps missed his yorker and Stoinis punishes it with a massive strike, sending into the empty second tier

Jordan to Stoinis, FOUR, uff! How did Stoinis manage to get some bat on this? A fast low full toss, Stoinis gives everything at it and it brushes the inside edge, beats the man at short fine leg. Had he missed it, he would've caught plumb in front. KXIP knew how close it was.. sigh!

Cottrell to Stoinis, FOUR, bullied past mid-off. Stoinis is the designated finisher for DC and he's playing a gem here. Takes toll of this overpitched delivery outside off and places it perfectly in the gap

Cottrell to Stoinis, FOUR, back-to-back fours for Stoinis. This is a well-calculated shot. Just got inside the line of this slower ball and helped it over short fine leg's head disdainfully. Fantastic start to the 19th over for Delhi

Cottrell to Stoinis, FOUR, third boundary of the over and KL Rahul immediately walks up to have a chat with the bowler. A juicy low full toss outside off, Stoinis with fast hands hammers it powerfully square on the off-side and threads the gap

Cottrell to Ashwin, out Caught by Shami!! There's the salute as Cottrell gets a wicket off his final ball. Went for the short delivery and it worked for him. Ashwin hopped back, opened his bat face and flayed it up in the air to third man. Couldn't find the distance and Shami pouches it comfortably. Ashwin had the licence to go for the kill, but eish.. Ashwin c Shami b Cottrell 4(6)
Jordan to Stoinis, SIX, wow! Stoinis is on fire here. He's raced to 34 off just 16 balls. Jordan serves it fuller and on middle, Stoinis moves across and wallops it over deep square leg.

Jordan to Stoinis, FOUR, edged and four. DC and Stoinis won't mind how the runs come at this stage. Shortish outside off, Stoinis goes for the cut with horizontal bat and gets an outside edge which travels in a jiffy to the third man fence

Jordan to Stoinis, FOUR, four more to Stoinis! Jordan trusts his instincts and tries the yorker, misses it by a few inches and Stoinis, in this form, won't miss out. Whips it off his pads behind square and collects another boundary
Jordan to Stoinis, FOUR, hat-trick of fours here. Raining boundaries. Jordan shifts his line outside off, Stoinis with a bent knee reaches out and drills it over extra cover

Jordan to Stoinis, SIX, 20-ball fifty for Stoinis. Rabada congratulates and his mates in the dressing room are delighted. Stoinis raises his bat and soaks in all the applause. Jordan struggles again, keeps missing his length and gets punished once again. Stoinis takes it on the full and dispatches it into the deep mid-wicket stands

Shami to Hetmyer, 1 run, chance and Gowtham can't hold on - a lively start in Dubai, banged in short and angling across the left-hander, Hetmyer was in no position on the pull, gets a fat top-edge that goes high and over square leg. Gowtham circled around it, he wasn't balanced as he positioned himself, did get both hands and can't hold on

Jordan to Stoinis, no ball, out Stoinis Run Out!! 1 run completed. Short of a length delivery outside off, Stoinis carved it towards sweeper cover, there was never a second run but considering it was the final ball, he just put his head down and raced back for the second. Clean pick and throw from Pooran to the keeper, Stoinis is run-out by a countrymile. Okay, so, it's a no-ball. One more ball left, officially. Stoinis run out (Pooran/Rahul) 53(21) [4s-7 6s-3]

Shami to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Jordan!! This is a reckless start from the Capitals - short of a good length and well wide of off, not the length to be attempting the pull - Shaw goes for it, gets it low off the bat and it spoons high and towards mid-on. Jordan is the man under it and you don't expect him to drop those. Number two for the Kings and no wonder their management and owners look thrilled. Prithvi Shaw c Jordan b Shami 5(9) [4s-1]

Shami to Hetmyer, FOUR, cracking shot, too short from Shami, Hetmyer swivels across, doesn't bother to keep it down and pulls it over square leg, one bounce and over the ropes - a shot of real authority

Shami to Hetmyer, out Caught by Agarwal!! This is turning out to be a awful start for the Capitals - another soft dismissal and Shami is on cloud nine. He shortened his length and got one to angle across the left-hander, Hetmyer was looking to work it to the on-side, closed the bat-face early and the front-edge looped straight into the grateful hands of Mayank at extra-cover. As simple as it gets and the Capitals have been reduced to 13 for 3. Hetmyer c Agarwal b Shami 7(13) [4s-1]
Jordan to Pant, FOUR, short, wide and four, width on offer and Pant is all over it like a rash - gets on top of the bounce and clatters it square past backward point for a boundary

Gowtham to Pant, FOUR, this was coming - Pant can't be kept quiet any longer, bends down low and plays a pick-up sweep over backward square leg, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Gowtham to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, massive, too full from KG, right under Shreyas's arc and he doesn't let that go unpunished - gets forward and thumps it high and over long-on, went into the top tier for a 99m hit

Nortje to Agarwal, leg byes, FOUR, pace can be your ally sometimes and it can be your enemy too! Nortje bowls it at 146ks but spills it down leg and Agarwal manages to get some thingh pad as he misses the flick. Races away...
Mohit Sharma to Rahul, SIX, bread and butter for KL Rahul! On the pads and a real loosener that from Mohit Sharma, lines it up perfectly and swats it into the mid-wicket stands

Axar to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! The pressure gets to Sarfaraz and he holes out to long-on. Advances and tries to dispatch Axar Patel over long-on, but the connection ain't sweet and he could only skew up a bottom edge to Shaw at long-on. Half the side back in the hut at the half-way stage. Sarfaraz Khan c Prithvi Shaw b Axar 12(12) [4s-2]
Stoinis to Agarwal, SIX, gets one out of the screws, finally! Gets into position early against the short ball and hammers the pull flat into the mid-wicket stands
Nortje to Agarwal, FOUR, 142.9km/h, short and marginally wide, Agarwal can just hang back and carves that away to the deep backward point fence for four!
Nortje to Agarwal, FOUR, back of a length ball that skids a little lower than true, and Agarwal opens the face to steer it away to third man for four! A composed shot!
Mohit Sharma to Gowtham, SIX, rank length ball, released off the knuckles, a massive no-no at this point, and he's carted that over long-on for six!
Mohit Sharma to Gowtham, FOUR, is this the over? Just a glimmer of width on that short one, and Gowtham hops, slaps it away through the gap to deep extra cover for four! Incredible shot!

Rabada to Agarwal, 2 runs, he's taken two catches today, but he drops this one running backwards! Gets under the short ball, hooks, gets a bit of a top-edge towards midwicket, Prithvi is running backwards and dives - and that just pops out of his hands!

Rabada to Gowtham, out Caught by Pant! That's a shot of panic, and lack of faith in his technique. 142.7km/h of oomph on that one, Gowtham backs away and tries to use the pace, attempting to steer it away towards the third man area - gets a feather of a top-edge to Pant who holds onto the simplest of catches! More pressure on Agarwal now! Gowtham c Pant b Rabada 20(14) [4s-1 6s-1]
Nortje to Agarwal, FOUR, backs away and clubs this one cross-batted to the long-off boundary for four! Good start for Agarwal here...

Nortje to Agarwal, FOUR, 110.4km/h slower one on a length with a bit of width, Agarwal waits on it and unleashes the wrists - runs his hands through the slap through sweeper cover for four as Axar fails to cut it off with a dive...

Mohit Sharma to Agarwal, SIX, that's a start to the over, and the pressure is right back on the bowler now! Full and wide, and he gets on his knee to slice this over deep backward point for six! Fifty for Agarwal, and this may well be a coming-of-age story in Dubai tonight, as he raises his bat...

Mohit Sharma to Agarwal, SIX, he's picked the bones out of the slower one, and it's clear why - 75.5km/h, off the back of the hand, and it was so slow, he could have swung once and swung it again in time. Decides to wait, and clubs this over long-off for six!
Rabada to Agarwal, FOUR, misses the length by a mere few inches, Agarwal gets under it and slams this straight down the ground for four! Incredible!

Rabada to Agarwal, FOUR, it's all happening for the Kings XI Punjab, a miscue, a steepling top-edge and Iyer off all people has made a mess of it. Could this be the pivotal moment of the game? Banged in short and Mayank got into a poor position on the pull, was cramped for room and all he managed was a thick leading edge over mid-wicket, went high and down towards the rope. Iyer came running across from the deep, did all the hard yards, got both hands and let it burst through - to add insult to injury, it rolled over the ropes
Stoinis to Agarwal, SIX, 13 off 6, and he's slammed the first ball of the final over for six! Far too slow to bother him, and he's nailed this loft over his head for for six!

Stoinis to Agarwal, FOUR, scores level! This is his night! Backs away and picks this up from leg-stump, opens the face and flays this between perfectly through the gap in the extra cover region for four! A dive at the boundary, but that won't save the boundary...

Stoinis to Agarwal, out Caught by Hetmyer! The agony! It was a full-toss, just a moment too less for Mayank to process this, flays this on account of the width, trying to slice this over deep backward point for six, but ends up finding the ONE fielder at the boundary - Hetmyer. Screams at the heavens for snatching this moment away from him, but he has only himself to blame, does Mayank. Just hasn't managed to finish this off! Agarwal c Hetmyer b Stoinis 89(60) [4s-7 6s-4]

Stoinis to Jordan, out Caught by Rabada! It's a super-over! A full-toss on the leg-stump, and he's flicked this straight to Rabada at short square leg, who holds on! A nightmare start to the over, from Stoinis, and he's managed to bring it to a tie. NOW NOW! Jordan c Rabada b Stoinis 5(6)
Nortje to Rahul, FOUR, 141ks garnered with a hint of width, Rahul feasts on it with a smacking cut past the diving left hand of backward point
Nortje to Rahul, FOUR, 145ks short and moving away, Rahul opens the bat slightly and guides it to the left of Rabada at third man who half-stops, but eventually lets it sneak through his palms

Mohit Sharma to Rahul, out Bowled!! First breakthrough for DC and it's a big one. Rahul chops this onto his stumps. A 134.2ks inswinger from Mohit Sharma, managed to pitch it on a good length and that sharp inward movement meant Rahul played it slightly outside the line of the delivery (he was trying to flick on the leg-side) and the timber's been rattled. Takes the inside edge and hammers the woodwork. Rahul b Mohit Sharma 21(19) [4s-2 6s-1]

Ashwin to Nair, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! A wicket off his first delivery against his former side for Ravi Ashwin. Loops it up teasingly and lures Nair into a big hoick on the leg-side, poor connection and he top-edges it high into the night sky. Prithvi Shaw at short fine had ample time to settle under it. Nair c Prithvi Shaw b Ashwin 1(3)

Ashwin to Pooran, out Bowled!! Got him and Ashwin has two in five balls. What a sweet revenge for the former KXIP skipper. Tosses this around middle and leg and gets it to rip sharply off the surface, Pooran was leaning forward but wasn't ready to counter the extra bounce as it kisses the pad before hitting the top of off. Left-handers against off-spin will always be a challenge and wasn't long ago we witnessed CSK send a left-hander against left-arm spin. Tactics, strategies...ah! What do the data analysts know? Pooran b Ashwin 0(3)

Rabada to Maxwell, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Not falling short this time around, Shreyas Iyer has his bucket hands wrapped around the dolly of a catch. Honestly, it's catching practice! Maxwell once again is early into his shot as he tries to loft the 144.2ks delivery over long-off. Doesn't get anywhere near the middle and Iyer does the rest. Maxwell c Shreyas Iyer b Rabada 1(4)

Rabada to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, edged and it flies between keeper and slip! Sarfaraz pokes at this pacy good length delivery and the edge flies past the diving right hand of Pant. The slip was a little late to dive to his left, but its well past him before he could react
Stoinis to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, lack of pace but it's a half-volley outside off! Sarfaraz leans onto the front foot and spanks the drive wide of the sliding fielder (to his left) at mid-off

Sandeep Sharma to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, first signs of audacity. Keep them coming young man! Sandeep bowls the away swinger but it's a half tracker, Padikkal confidently chipped down the track and pulled over wide mid-on

Sandeep Sharma to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, with Bhuvi maintaining pressure, it's important Sandeep Sharma backs up but he's spraying the ball around looking for that perfect outswinger starting outside leg and ending off stump, this leg-side freebie flicked wide of short fine leg for four

Shankar to Devdutt Padikkal, 2 runs, mindlessly slogged .. and then more mindlessness in the catch-calling. Well, we;;. Padikkal looks to heave this across the line somewhere into mid-wicket, uppishly, gets the top-edge, gets it to backward square leg, where both other legs - deep square and fine - run, collide, crash into each other, and drop

Shankar to Devdutt Padikkal, out Bowled!! Yep, another aimless heave and the inside-edge doesn't need fielders to catch it; it takes care of crashing it the stumps. So Padikkal didn't quite want to be playing sensibly anymore and not-find the boundaries with Kohli and AB sitting inside. And he clears out his front leg, swings big, and misses it completely. He swung so hard that his top hand slipped off the handle as well. Devdutt Padikkal b Shankar 56(42) [4s-8]

Abhishek Sharma to Finch, out Lbw!! Oh plumb. A harmless straight delivery, on a length, on middle and not really turning either. Finch sweeps, or at least tries to. And misses big time to find himself trapped, dead. Finch lbw b Abhishek Sharma 29(27) [4s-1 6s-2]
Rashid Khan to de Villiers, 1 run, another flick, no fuss, no risk, mid-wicket
T Natarajan to de Villiers, FOUR, 137.9kph, dishes out pace, dishes out width, dishes out room with that over the wicket angle. AB slices over sweeper, something he could've done in his sleep

T Natarajan to Kohli, out Caught by Rashid Khan !! It's a thing with Kohli and the left-arm angle going across. This time it's no poke though, it's a slog in an innings that was looking for a step-up gear. So he tries to take on the longest boundary he has - cow corner - and he does it against Natarajan's slower cutter. It didn't sound bad or miscued in the way he connected, but, no, this is no anti-gravity Chinnaswamy; it's a sea-level Dubai. Long-on's there, inside the ropes. Kohli c Rashid Khan b T Natarajan 14(13)
Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, FOUR, bang in the slog, at pace .. and AB's already crouches under as he waits and smokes this over cow corner
T Natarajan to de Villiers, FOUR, 122.5kph, swings through the line, clearing his front leg, plonking in front and then slamming it straight down. Sure, it was in the slot, but still, murderous ..

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, carves it over extra cover. AB waits patiently now, it's another one of Sharma's slower balls that sits up on a length. And boom, and the virus has saved someone in the crowd from a broken nose
Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, width again. Sharma doesn't bother changing his approach, something AB's read well in advance to slap over point this time
Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, FOUR, wow. Just murder. Just AB things. Plonks in front, gives his arms the room to swing and then tonks this straight down, nearly all the way
Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, 2 runs, slices through extra cover, damn cleanly. And fifty - the second-best in this game

Bhuvneshwar to de Villiers, out de Villiers Run Out!! 1 run completed. Drilled through the covers again, and flies full-length in trying to get back in for the second as well. But Manish's throw is flat, bang on top of the stumps. Yea, he's an AB on the field. de Villiers run out (Manish Pandey/Bairstow) 51(30) [4s-4 6s-2]

Bhuvneshwar to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, horrible wide delivery, the freebies will come with time. Padikkal had to really reach out, all he did was just put bat on ball and find the middle, slapped wide of cover and it teases the fielders

Bhuvneshwar to Shivam Dube, out Shivam Dube Run Out!! Just top skills. The field was set for a yorker -- long-off, long-on, deep mid-wicket. But Kumar does the double bluff, going for the quick bouncer. Dube meanwhile had himself committed to his front foot, and by the time he can rock back and look to pull, has the ball going over comfortably. Anyway, then he decides to step out for the single and doesn't even bother getting back in after getting nothing from Philippe as Bairstow runs to the stumps to whip the bails off. Okay, 163 then .. Shivam Dube run out (Bairstow) 7(8)
T Natarajan to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, stylish swivel pull, more towards finding the gap wide of deep square leg. Shortish and on the leg stump, Padikkal creams that nicely again

T Natarajan to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, the overcorrection. Too full, in the slot and Padikkal is a high quality batsman who won't miss out on those. Natarajan went for swing but it didn't and he went to the deep cover boundary on the bounce
T Natarajan to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, he's a tall bloke and he's managing to pull not really short deliveries quite easily. Short of a length, Padikkal stays in the crease and lofts over mid-wicket

Mitchell Marsh to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, what's the point of bowl a full ball in the slot with a new ball if you are not a swing bowler? This just came so slowly, Padikkal said thank you very much and smoked it over the bowler's head. Oh RCB are loving this!

Shankar to Finch, no ball, SIX, he's just landed this in the slot for him to power it over mid-wicket. A lot of height on that one and it cleared the fielder in the deep. Oh he's overstepped again! What are you doing Shankar!
Sandeep Sharma to Devdutt Padikkal, 2 runs, full and down leg, clipped behind square, couple of runs and that's the fifty partnership
Rashid Khan to Finch, FOUR, too short and Finch did well to get under that and thump it over the leaping fielder at mid-wicket to take pressure off after those dots
Rashid Khan to Finch, SIX, Rashid Khan goes full and Finch slog-sweeps behind square, Rashid Khan was doing alright bowling the hard length, Finch wins the battle

Abhishek Sharma to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, in the airrrr, oh he's misjudged the catch. Rashid Khan, a fine fielder, the culprit there. But Padikkal deserves this bit of luck. Fifty on debut. What a start. Can't imagine Kohli's emotions right now. He would be really excited. Flighted delivery on the stumps, the slog-sweep behind square, Rashid attacked the bat as it was hit flat, but he realised it was going over, so put the brakes and tried to go back but slipped and the outstretched arm wasn't long enough. Kohli stands and applauds as Padikkal raises the bat

Steyn to Warner, FOUR, smokes this half-volley through extra cover to get the chase up and running. No great footwork, there didn't need to be as the hands are good enough for a delivery right in the slot
U Yadav to Bairstow, FOUR, this is filth. Juicy half-volley on the pads, flicked away past fine leg

U Yadav to Bairstow, SIX, more filth from Umesh. This is an awful start. Short of length at the body, sitting up for Bairstow who helps the pull behind square and helps it over the ropes. Great timing

U Yadav to Bairstow, out Warner Run Out!! This is so unlucky. Warner is run out at the non-striker's end off a delivery that was smashed back by Bairstow. Another ordinary delivery that's pitched right up, it's hammered back down the ground but Umesh somehow gets a hand and deflects it onto the stumps. What a massive wicket in the middle of an over that's been dreadful up until this point. Redemption for Umesh I guess. RCB certainly see it that way. Warner run out (U Yadav) 6(6) [4s-1]

Navdeep Saini to Bairstow, 2 runs, dropped! How costly is that going to prove? A very full delivery from Navdeep Saini and Bairstow toe-ended the biff-drive towards Finch at extra cover who looks to reverse cup, but ended up letting it through. Could be the pace which ensured it burst through his fingers

Chahal to Bairstow, byes, FOUR, looked like the googly and Bairstow threw everything at it. Loses shape and fails to make contact, the ball sneaks past the inside edge and races past the keeper in a hurry

Chahal to Manish Pandey, no run, the keeper got excited as soon as he caught the ball and that induced a review from Kohli. Big legbreak from Chahal and Pandey looked to flay it flat on the off-side, misses it by a whisker and there was a slightest bit of deviation after pitching which got RCB excited

Chahal to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Navdeep Saini!! Gets him this time! Chahal once again lures Manish Pandey with the flight and the attempted loft doesn't find the middle, skews it off the bottom half of the bat and offers catching practice to the fielder at long-off. More pressure on Bairstow now... Manish Pandey c Navdeep Saini b Chahal 34(33) [4s-3 6s-1]

U Yadav to Bairstow, 2 runs, a chance missed and a huge one at that! It's Bairstow and it's Steyn who's dropped a skier. A sharp bouncer that Bairstow top-edges and Steyn, at fine leg, circles under it and doesn't even get a fingernail. Well, he's claiming he's lost it in the lights

U Yadav to Bairstow, FOUR, that's brute power from Jonny Bairstow! Just stands tall and murders the short ball with a flat pull over mid-wicket, the fielder in the deep tries to dive but couldn't get anything on it

U Yadav to Bairstow, FOUR. DO NOT BOWL FULL TO Jonny Bairstow. NEVER! He just eases into the drive so casually and all he needed to do was pierce the gap which he did with supreme perfection, past the diving left hand of extra cover and the pace on the ball takes care of the rest
Steyn to Bairstow, FOUR, superb batting this from Bairstow! Waits for the full delivery to land and just opens the bat face at the last instant to send it between the keeper and short third. Deft!

Steyn to Bairstow, 1 run, dropped! It's Padikkal and it's a real toughie. A flat pull from Jonny Bairstow and Dev dives full length to his left after sprinting forward but couldn't quite get the control over the catch

Steyn to Priyam Garg, FOUR, short and there's just enough pace for Priyam Garg who belts the pull and the best part about this shot is: He made sure he picked the gap to perfection, right between deep square and deep mid-wicket

Chahal to Bairstow, out Bowled!! There's the wicket and there's the man for RCB. Kohli is absolutely pumped and rightly so. Must say it's a poor shot from Bairstow. The leggie from Chahal and Bairstow looked to send it to mars with a I-do-not-care-one-bit heave-ho on the leg-side, the flight and lack of pace meant Bairstow couldn't get under it and the leg peg has been shattered. Brave from Chahal to toss it up and invite the big hit. Bairstow b Chahal 61(43) [4s-6 6s-2]

Chahal to Shankar, out Bowled!! Chahal is on a hat-trick! The googly and it has gone right through the gate. A huge forward stride from Vijay Shankar, but he clearly misread the delivery there and played for the leg-break, not to be. It's RCB's game now and SRH will need some magic if they are to pull it off from here. Shankar b Chahal 0(1)

Chahal to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, nice shot from Abhishek Sharma! Targets straight boundary and hits it with a neat lofty drive down the ground, picked the full delivery around off and lifted it with ease. That is a really crucial boundary. Kohli talking to Chahal about that ball, looks like he's telling Chahal that he should've been defensive. Because these are two young players at the crease, may find it difficult against Steyn. Four vital runs given away. Credit to Sharma for smoking it

Shivam Dube to Priyam Garg, out Bowled!! Talk about unfortunate dismissals and SRH have two now! Must say it's a poor shot selection from Priyam Garg for there is no pace on offer from Shivam Dube. Garg shuffled across his off-stump and looked to scoop it past the keeper, lack of pace meant he failed to get any proper connection and ended up deflecting the ball onto stumps off his chest. Priyam Garg b Shivam Dube 12(13) [4s-1]

Shivam Dube to Rashid Khan, FOUR, easy pickings for Rashid Khan! Gets plenty of width outside off and Rashid Khan throws the kitchen sink to smash the boundary ropes wide of the fielder at square third man

Shivam Dube to Abhishek Sharma, out Abhishek Sharma Run Out!! 1 run completed. It's getting chaotic out in the middle and Rashid Khan was ball-watching as he tried to complete the second, didn't realize he was running in the same line as Abhishek Sharma and both batsmen collided mid-pitch which led to an easy run-out. In fairness, there was never a second there and it's pressure that's consuming SRH at the moment. Abhishek Sharma worked it to deep square and by the looks of it, he wanted second right from the onset. Abhishek Sharma run out (U Yadav/Philippe) 7(4) [4s-1]

Navdeep Saini to Bhuvneshwar, out Bowled!! PACE.FULL.STRAIGHT. Always a deadly combination against the lower order batters. A 143ks thunderbolt from Navdeep Saini and the middle pole is absolutely hammered. Bhuvi plays a nothing shot as he tries to slog across the line and only swishes thin air. Bhuvneshwar b Navdeep Saini 0(2)

Navdeep Saini to Rashid Khan, out Bowled!! Off pole this time. Navdeep Saini likes hitting the stumps and we have seen a lot of that in the domestic cricket. A delivery that was too good for Rashid Khan. 144ks coming in from slightly wide of the crease and Rashid Khan is opened up by the angle, plays outside the line of the delivery and loses his off pole. Surely he's not 100 percent. A normal Rashid would have smashed that full ball over the rope! Rashid Khan b Navdeep Saini 6(5) [4s-1]

Shivam Dube to Mitchell Marsh, out Caught by Kohli!! Told ya, it's boom-or-bust and in all fairness, Marsh didn't have too many options there. Went for a mighty slog against a slower full ball and the moment it left the bat, he almost fell backwards before limping awkwardly behind the stumps. The slog came off the toe-end and Kohli accepts the dolly at long-on. Marsh is being helped off the field by the physio.Mitchell Marsh c Kohli b Shivam Dube 0(1)
