Shivam Dube to T Natarajan, 1 run, pushes the full ball to Padikkal at cover and sets off for a quick single. Dev attempts a direct hit at the bowling end and misses, had that hit Natarajan was gone

Steyn to Sandeep Sharma, FOUR, 141ks short and wide of off, Sandeep Sharma exposes his stumps and throws everything at it, gets a massive outside edge and it races down to the third man boundary in a jiffy

Steyn to Sandeep Sharma, out Caught by Kohli!! It's all over. RCB start their campaign with a victory and it's their second successive win over SRH. Sandeep Sharma gets pace but this time there isn't enough width and all he could do with the incoming angle was miscue the pull into safe hands of Kohli at long-on, who took a splendid catch sprinting across the boundary rope to his right. Sandeep Sharma c Kohli b Steyn 9(6) [4s-1]
Steyn to Manish Pandey, FOUR, just a little full from Steyn, and Pandey has sussed out that there's little swing here. So he's not afraid to hit through the line as he lofts it over mid-on
U Yadav to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Umesh's struggles continue. Strays onto the pads and Pandey flicks it for four through midwicket. Timing is delightful with the ball racing away

U Yadav to Manish Pandey, FOUR, oh dear! The confidence is just not there. And with each delivery it gets worse. Low full toss on leg, Pandey helps himself to another boundary as he flicks past short fine

Navdeep Saini to Bairstow, FOUR, that's a Bairstow special. The short-arm pull.. the way he just picks length quickly and whips it so effortlessly with superb timing. Flies away over square leg. Don't think Saini did too much wrong here. Just slightly short maybe, but we're talking inches here

Washington Sundar to Manish Pandey, SIX, so tempting. So, so tempting and whacked! 85kph, looped up by Sundar. It's brave, but it's also too full so it eliminates the risk for Pandey who wallops it over midwicket. Smashes the roof over the first tier
U Yadav to Bairstow, SIX, the scoop for six! Incredible shot. Good length delivery outside off, he sits on the back knee while leaning into the off-side and helps it on its way

U Yadav to Bairstow, FOUR, when it's not going your way, these things also tend to happen. Full ball just outside off, Bairstow aims for the covers as he drives but it comes off a thick inside edge and runs past leg stump. Kohli applauds his bowler with a wry smile
Shreyas Gopal to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, flat one on the stumps, whip-driven straight down the ground for four. Finally, some runs in boundaries...
Shreyas Gopal to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, the shackles are showing signs of coming lose - reaches out and slices this marginally wide one square of the wicket for four...

Shreyas Gopal to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, a hat-trick of boundaries! Backs away into the on-side, and flays this inside out over the in-field to the deep extra cover boundary for four! CSK needed this - the activation energy for something exothermic to begin
Shreyas Gopal to du Plessis, 1 run, flatter one topspinning into Faf's gut, as he crouches and pulls it away to backward square leg for one

Tom Curran to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Samson! Charges, and tries to swing this over the on-side, but gets it close to the shoulder of the outside edge and almost over the 'keeper, but Samson can do no wrong today! Leaps to take that one, and it sticks! Maginificent catch to get rid of Jadhav! Kedar Jadhav c Samson b Tom Curran 22(16) [4s-3]

Rahul Tewatia to du Plessis, SIX, SMACK! Parag at the boundary has woefully misjudged it, and not for the first time, the outfielder is pointing at the floodlights! Charges down and carts it, with a bit of a hind-limb pirouette, over long-on for six!
Rahul Tewatia to du Plessis, SIX, backs away into the on-side, Tewatia serves one up in the slot, and clobbers this over long-on for a gigantic six! More of these needed. Many more.
Jofra Archer to du Plessis, FOUR, another slower one, leg-cutter, like Tendulkar predicted in his tweet, and Faf backs away to slap it away through the gap at to extra cover for four
Unadkat to du Plessis, SIX, charges this slower one and lifts this over long-on for six! Absolutely smoked that over one of the longer boundaries here at Sharjah!
Unadkat to du Plessis, SIX, far too slow for even two bat-swings - 105.2km/h - and this ridiculously slow short ball has been clubbed over deep mid-wicket with a late pull for six!

Unadkat to du Plessis, SIX, 14th fifty in IPL for Faf, and it's been brought up by one of the cleanest, straightest swings of the blade down the ground. Another six that seems to have cleared that diminutive Sharjah roof!

Tom Curran to du Plessis, SIX, half-volley outside off, clears his frontfoot, and makes it 4 out of 5 balls dispatched for six! Clobbers this over long-off! That's the fifty-stand - only 7 of which have been scored by Dhoni. Faf is in rhythm...

Tom Curran to du Plessis, no run, that's an inch-perfect yorker, dug-out from between his legs away to short fine leg - Faf is down, gets up and tries to run across, but there's a shy at the striker's end. Would've been out if it had hit...
Jofra Archer to du Plessis, SIX, drops it short and into the body, but Faf picks the slower one - waits for it to arrive and clubs the pull over deep midwicket for six!

Jofra Archer to du Plessis, out Caught by Samson! Short at the body, du Plessis loses his shape, instinctively worried about his fingers - he has history - and goes for a half-hearted hook. Gets a top-edge, as it lobs up towards the leg-gully area where Samson comes across to collect the catch. du Plessis c Samson b Jofra Archer 72(37) [4s-1 6s-7]

Tom Curran to Dhoni, SIX, MS Dhoni, far too late in the final over, dispatches this over deep midwicket for six! A Dhoni six, and the world goes crazy! My neighbours have gone crazy! Right in the slot and that's carted into the Sharjah streets...
Tom Curran to Dhoni, SIX, what's in that cricket bat? A slower one on a length, and that's a no-no to the world's best finisher - on his knee and he's mowed that over wide long-on for six! 92 meters!

Tom Curran to Dhoni, SIX, THWACK! MS Dhoni in the final over is a sight to behold! Slams this short ball, pulling it over deep square leg for third successive six. That's a joint IPL record - 33 sixes in a game...
Unadkat to Vijay, FOUR, there's the first boundary of the innings. Length ball on leg, Vijay whips it away fine enough to beat fine leg
Unadkat to Vijay, FOUR, Unadkat shifts his line over to off stump where Vijay is waiting after clearing his front leg. Just sets up brilliantly to smoke this flat-batted over mid-off

Unadkat to Vijay, 1 run, a direct hit and Vijay was gone. The idea of a quick single, after tapping this slower ball in front of cover, is well and good. But Vijay is no spring chicken. Would've been a few inches short as the fielder swooped and spun around for the throw
Jofra Archer to Watson, SIX, this is just a flick from Watson and it's gone all the way over square leg. Slower ball from Archer that drifted into the pads nicely to be put away

Shreyas Gopal to Vijay, FOUR, beats square leg this time. This was dragged down short on leg stump and Vijay had ample time as he rocked back for the pull. Didn't time it all that well, but well enough

Shreyas Gopal to Watson, SIX, there he goes, and clears the roof! Signature Watson this. So good with the pull shot against spin. Even deliveries that are slightly off in length, he pounces on them. This one, though, is a proper long hop and Watson just nails it over square leg
Tom Curran to Watson, SIX, short of length delivery around the hip, and if there's anyone you don't want to bowl this length at, it's Watson. Whips the pull away into the stands

Tom Curran to Watson, SIX, this is not good bowling. Dare I say Tom Curran doesn't have the pace to trouble Watson with the short ball. It's playing into his strengths. And he's absolutely nailing these pull shots
Tom Curran to Watson, FOUR, there's four more. Back of a length outside off, Watson's aware that third man is in and he uses the pace to dab it past the fielder

Rahul Tewatia to Watson, out Bowled!! The pull, the famed Watson pull, has brought about his downfall. Problem is the length isn't short at all. He's just trying to manufacture it out of nothing. Fails badly as this skids through onto his back pad and crashes into leg stump. May have been fooled by the trajectory actually. Tewatia kept it quite flat, pushing it through off the front of his hand. May have caused him to believe it was shorter than it was. Watson's furious with himself. Watson b Rahul Tewatia 33(21) [4s-1 6s-4]

Shreyas Gopal to Vijay, out Caught by Tom Curran!! Gopal's not only gotten away with a short ball, he's got a wicket for it. Vijay toe-ends his pull straight to deep square leg. Took his time, made a run-a-ball 21 and now departs. This will hurt CSK. Vijay c Tom Curran b Shreyas Gopal 21(21) [4s-3]
Shreyas Gopal to Sam Curran, FOUR, it's short once more from Gopal and Curran shows how it's done. Belts the pull away over midwicket
Rahul Tewatia to Sam Curran, SIX, Curran races down, ensures he gets right to the pitch of this googly and smokes it downtown. Already injecting life into the chase and he's only 3 balls in

Rahul Tewatia to Sam Curran, SIX, there's six more. Tewatia may not be feeding it into the slot for him, but Curran is creating his own length with excellent use of the feet. Gets close enough to this and hammers it back down the ground

Rahul Tewatia to Sam Curran, out Stumped!! Tewatia gets the better of him this time. He shortens the length far enough to give room for the googly to turn past the outside edge. Curran, who's running down the pitch again, doesn't back out despite not reaching to the pitch. He slogs in vain. And because he is so far down, there's no going back either despite a valiant effort to do so. Neat stumping from Samson. Sam Curran st Samson b Rahul Tewatia 17(6) [4s-1 6s-2]

Rahul Tewatia to Ruturaj Gaikwad, out Stumped!! Charges down first ball and is nowhere near it. Ruturaj Gaikwad, finding a place in the team today, goes for a duck. Third wicket for Tewatia, who kept this wide outside off and once again ensured the length's short enough. Easy stumping. Ruturaj Gaikwad st Samson b Rahul Tewatia 0(1)
Jadeja to Samson, SIX, lovely tossed up on off, Samson gets a big stride forward and then lifts it nonchalantly over long-off, went a long way into the stands

Ngidi to Samson, out Caught by Chahar!! That is the end of the Samson show - he's furious with himself as he walks back. Would have been a wide had he let it go - but the adrenaline was pumping and he couldn't hold back - went chasing after that and lifted it towards deep cover - Chahar ran in, took it awkwardly around his chest, reverse cupped - it threatened to pop out, but he manages to clutch it safely. Was the slower short ball and Samson didn't have the pace on the shot. Some relief for the CSKians, they clearly looked rattled. Samson c Chahar b Ngidi 74(32) [4s-1 6s-9]

Ngidi to Smith, out Miller Run Out!! 1 run completed. Appeal for a run-out at the bowler's end, Miller dived, has it saved him? A flat throw and a good pick-up. No, the dive's not good enough and Miller falls for a diamond duck on his Royals debut. Unfortunate way to get dismissed - it didn't help that Miller lost his bat as well, could have saved him else. On a length and at the stumps, worked in front of square on the on-side and it was Smith's call for the second. Miller responded well, but lost his bat as he dived - good throw from Gaikwad and Kedar was at hand to break the stumps. Miller run out (Ruturaj Gaikwad/Kedar Jadhav) 0(0)

Jadeja to Smith, SIX, chance, dropped and six - it's not happening in the field for CSK - Sam Curran, the culprit, this was tossed up slower and wider of off, Smith had to reach out and didn't get enough on the lofted drive - went flat and and wide of long-off. Curran stretched out with both hands, got to the ball and then let it burst through - was right in front of the ropes and that perhaps put him off

Chawla to Uthappa, out Caught by du Plessis!! A chance and Faf has grabbed it cleanly. Redemption for Piyush, he struggled in the first two overs, but is pulling things back a touch. A poor start for Uthappa in Royals colours - came down the track, got close to the ball and drilled the drive - went flat, hard and straight to long-off. Was perhaps looking to go over cover, but ended hitting it a lot straighter - was dying onto Faf, who slid forward and held on. Uthappa c du Plessis b Chawla 5(9)
Chawla to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, slower and wider of off, eased square on the off-side for a single

Ngidi to Smith, FOUR, cheeky and four, Smith at his best, moved all around the crease - Ngidi saw it coming and went wide of off, but Smith still reaches out and then paddles it over short fine - think, only AB could have rivalled him for that shot
Ngidi to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, cracking shot, the shots are coming off today for the Royals, friendly length ball wide of off, Tewatia drives it on the up and over cover - no need to run for those

Sam Curran to Rahul Tewatia, out Lbw!! That looked plumb and Rahul Tewatia has been given OUT LBW. He has a chat with his captain and decides to review. It's a fair delivery, looks like no bat and UltraEdge confirms it, directly onto his toes, bang in front of middle and it's crashing low into the middle. Three REDS and Rahul Tewatia is OUT. A poor review from Tewatia, think he thought he got an inside edge. Almost the perfect yorker from Curran, turned out to be a low full-toss, Tewatia swung all around it and missed. Rahul Tewatia lbw b Sam Curran 10(8) [4s-1]

Sam Curran to Riyan Parag, FOUR, streaky and four, wide full-toss from Curran, Parag was shaping for the drive, opened the face of the bat and the edge flies behind square on the off-side for a boundary

Sam Curran to Riyan Parag, out Caught by Dhoni!! Edged and caught - A straightforward dismissal and the Super Kings are pulling things back nicely. Two wickets in the over for Curran - shortened his length and angled one across the right-hander, Parag was looking to run it past the keeper, got it too fine though and MS did the rest - dived across to his right and the ball got stuck in his fingertips, he clasped it cleanly on the second attempt. Riyan Parag c Dhoni b Sam Curran 6(4) [4s-1]

Sam Curran to Smith, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! CSK are pulling things back very nicely, this was a length ball at the pads, Smith shuffled across and whipped it firmly, hit it in the air and straight down the throat of Kedar at deep mid-wicket. Smith is annoyed with himself as he walks back - suddenly, 200 looks very distant now. Smith c Kedar Jadhav b Sam Curran 69(47) [4s-4 6s-4]

Sam Curran to Tom Curran, FOUR, streaky and four, Tom must have faced Sam many a times at home - almost the perfect yorker, right at the base of off, Curran somehow jams his bat down and squeezes it past the diving short third man fielder for a boundary
Ngidi to Jofra Archer, SIX, lovely, that's a clean hit from Archer, picked the slower ball early, extended his arms and lifted it high and over long-off for a maximum

Ngidi to Jofra Archer, SIX, back-to-back sixes and the Royals are finishing on a high - Archer expects Ngidi to go short and he's quick to swivel across, gets a lovely connection on the pull and sends the ball soaring over square leg - went out of the ground as well

Ngidi to Jofra Archer, no ball, SIX, four sixes on the trot - this is a stunning cameo from Archer - length ball at the stumps, Archer backs away and lifts it high and over long-off.. and the third umpire decides that the front-foot is just over, called as a no-ball

Ngidi to Jofra Archer, no ball, SIX, a hat-trick of sixes, length ball at the stumps, Archer clears his front leg and thwacks it flat and hard, wide of long-on for a maximum - worse, Ngidi has overstepped by a massive margin and a free-hit is coming up

Chahar to Jaiswal, FOUR, first boundary for Jaiswal. Short of length delivery and he did not have much space to free his arms, but manages to pull it over mid-wicket and the fast outfield does the rest

Chahar to Jaiswal, out Caught&Bowled!! Oh no! Good comeback by Chahar. He persisted with the short ball and got it higher than the previous ball. Jaiswal went for the pull and only managed a top-edge, goes straight up and both Chahar and Dhoni converge, in the end it is the bowler who gets there first. Jaiswal c and b Chahar 6(6) [4s-1]

Chahar to Smith, FOUR, another short ball and this time Smith puts it away. No height or venom on this, Smith is quickly into position and nails the pull over mid-wicket, couple of bounces and it races away

Ngidi to Smith, SIX, loosener from Ngidi and he has been dispatched into the empty stands. Back of length angling into leg, Smith loves it there, picks it up nonchalantly and sends it sailing over backward square leg

Sam Curran to Samson, FOUR, not sure he intended it to go that fine. Short of length with a bit of extra bounce, Samson steers it and the outside edge runs away fine - bisecting Dhoni and short third man
Sam Curran to Samson, SIX, cracking shot! That's more like it. Short of length around the hips, Samson gets into a good position this time and smashes the pull into the deep mid-wicket stands

Chahar to Samson, SIX, wow! That is some shot. He looks so elegant when on song. Picked the short of length delivery early, stayed on the front foot while transferring his weight back, pulls it handsomely over deep square leg and cleared the field comfortably

Chahar to Smith, FOUR, poor bowling from Chahar. He has been all over the shop. Straying down leg and that is not where you bowl to Smith, easy pickings for the Royals skipper as he glances it fine past the fielder at 45
Jadeja to Samson, SIX, he's dealing in sixes at the moment, third for him. Drifting in from the round the wicket angle, Samson swings through the line and smokes it all the way over wide long-on

Jadeja to Samson, SIX, Jadeja put under pressure straightaway. Samson does not want him to settle. This is touch wide of off-stump and he goes with the spin, nice clean bat swing to take it over long-off. Might have gone out of the ground

Chawla to Samson, SIX, woah! Samson is on fire. First ball from Chawla and he launches him straight down the ground. This was right in the slot though but still had to be put away, Dhoni has a word with Chawla

Chawla to Samson, SIX, this is now officially a carnage. Chawla goes wide of off-stump and Samson was happy with that line, good stride forward and lofts it with the spin over extra cover. Another one out in the car park

Chawla to Samson, 1 run, fifty off 19 balls. Samson has turned it around for the Royals. Just a bat raise and is congratulated by his skipper. Quicker delivery outside off, Samson cracks it to sweeper cover

Chawla to Samson, SIX, "looks like he is having a net," quips Gavaskar on air. He is treating them that away and has even impressed his skipper at the other end. Flighted and lands full, Samson clears his front leg and goes straight, that high backlift allows him to have a clean swing and it goes over the roof

Chawla to Smith, SIX, Smith has a piece of the leggie. 28 runs off the over. Chawla went fast and short outside off, Smith does not commit to the shot, waits for it and then smacks it over extra cover.
Jadeja to Smith, 1 run, flatter and around off, Smith moves back and across to work it towards mid-wicket

Chawla to Smith, SIX, Chawla continues to travel.. Throws it up wider expecting to get away but Smith has other plans, he makes use of the width and smokes it straight back over, not the power of Samson but has enough to clear the rope

Chawla to Samson, SIX, this is bad bowling now. He is just feeding it in his slot. Flighted and lands it on a fullish length, right where Samson likes it, he lofts through the line and clearing the fence has not been difficult for him, well over long-off

Chawla to Smith, FOUR, good batting but poor bowling. Smith expected the fast short ball outside off, waited on it and carved it behind square on the off-side - right between backward point and short third man

Pattinson to Narine, SIX, you just can't bowl full to Narine. Especially not at his pads, he will make you pay everytime. Pattinson went for the slower ball and Narine accepts the gift, picks it away off his pads effortlessly over deep square leg for the first six of this innings

Rahul Chahar to Karthik, out Lbw!! DK and his slog, well, the love story isn't screening tonight. Chahar's kept it simple -- quick, straight, on off, no room, no spin. Karthik goes one-kneed early, premeditatingly, and misses the sweep all ends up. Yep, plumb, not even worth reviewing a review. Karthik lbw b Rahul Chahar 30(23) [4s-5]

Pollard to Morgan, FOUR, off-cutter, but short, wide (aka long hop). Morgan throws his hands out and carves it behind point. The fielder in the deep tries a sliding tackle, but no, UAE is no football fan

Pollard to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Pollard has his first IPL wicket since 2015. But no, forget that. That's not the best part. Hardik Pandya's a credit stealer .. with Rana slicing yet another off-paced delivery outside off. But that means he's got to manufacture all the pace on this himself, which he can't with these 70-meter-boundaries. Anyway, here's what Pandya does: he's at sweeper, and the ball's quickly flying wide of him to his left. So he runs, intercepts while running, side-on, and makes sure he doesn't overbalance. Sorry, words will never do justice. Nitish Rana c Hardik Pandya b Pollard 24(18) [4s-2 6s-1]
Pattinson to Morgan, SIX, feeds the slot. And finally, FINALLY, Morgan connects. He stands his ground, staying crouched, clearing his front leg and mowing this over cow corner
Boult to Russell, FOUR, 131.5kph, wide high full toss, full paced. Russell flays, gets it past cover's dive. Well, it doesn't get easier
Boult to Russell, FOUR, attempted: big smoke over extra cover. The result: a big fat outside edge over short third man. Russell and KKR couldn't care any less
Boult to Russell, 1 run, closer towards off, with Russell clearing out his front leg to and slogging away straight to long-on

Bumrah to Russell, out Bowled!! That's it. Get on with the handshakes. Rohit's killed it by persisting with Bumrah. And Bumrah's killed it with simple sheer lack-of-pace. He's leg-cuttered it in full, angling in on leg-stump, and Russell's clearly beaten on his hoick of sorts with his bat going through with the swing only to hear the rattle of death behind. Russell b Bumrah 11(11) [4s-2]

Bumrah to Morgan, out Caught by de Kock!! Edges. And KKR are happy to get generous with their wickets. They aren't doing a CSK. So Morgan backs away in trying to slap this over the covers, but Bumrah - with yet another cutter - gets it well across, taking the outside-edge and down the keeper's throat. Morgan c de Kock b Bumrah 16(20) [4s-1 6s-1]

Boult to Nikhil Naik, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Sharp bouncer, a left-arm round angle that climbs up around the head, which Naik has no option but to try pulling off his front foot. Top-edged, tame, and deep mid-wicket. Nikhil Naik c Hardik Pandya b Boult 1(3)

Boult to Cummins, FOUR, slaps over mid-off. Well, well. It might be a very miniscule drop in the ocean remaining for Kolkata, but a smoke nevertheless. Backs away, and absolutely thumps this shorter delivery over mid-off
Boult to Shivam Mavi, FOUR, keeps the pull down, staying up on the bounce that doesn't get big and nailing it through square leg. Again, just a drop, one tiny drop ..
Bumrah to Cummins, SIX, 126.4kph, innocuous lazy delivery, off a back of a length sitting up on the pads. And Cummins swipes across the line, getting it over short fine leg
Bumrah to Cummins, SIX, follows him in with the bouncer, but Cummins' undoing some of his rubbish with the ball. And this one's with a super hook, comfortably over fine leg
Bumrah to Cummins, SIX, tonks off the front foot now. Gets under the good length and lofts it over long-on
Bumrah to Cummins, SIX .. make it 27, and remember it's off Bumrah -- 3-0-5-2 and then 1-0-27-0 to ruin. It's a low full toss, and is smoked straight over his head

Pattinson to Cummins, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! The fun's over. A length delivery, in the slot you'd think at this stage of the game and with pace. But Cummins goes a little too hard on his bat-swing, inside-halving the miscued balloon to deep mid-wicket. Cummins c Hardik Pandya b Pattinson 33(12) [4s-1 6s-4]
Boult to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's a pie for Gill. Short, width and studded with pace on it outside off. Gill throws his bat and crunches it through the packed off-side field

Boult to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Pollard!! Gill gets carried away and picks out Pollard at mid-wicket. He's aghast and well, Rohit, who's back on the field enjoyed that. Banged in short outside off, it was getting big and Gill wanted to pull. Was in no control and the timing also went for a toss. Boult draws first blood for Mumbai. Shubman Gill c Pollard b Boult 7(11) [4s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Shivam Mavi, out Stumped!! Gives away his cards early with a charge down the pitch, which Chahar pulls his length back to and makes sure Mavi never gets there and finds himself stuck half way down. That sums up KKR tonight: Stuck cluelessly half way down with no chance of return. Shivam Mavi st de Kock b Rahul Chahar 9(10) [4s-1]

Boult to Karthik, FOUR, nice, confident beginning for DK. Of course, Boult was generous there; hurling it too full and thereby overpitching it just outside off, Karthik didn't do anything fancy. Just leant forward, kept his head steady and drove it beautifully through extra cover

Bumrah to Narine, 1 run, rattles Narine with a short delivery and cramps him up for pace as he backs away to the leg-side. Pulls and it deflects onto his helmet before falling to the floor. His skipper calls him for a quick single and it would've been a disaster if Bumrah had hit the stumps there

Pattinson to Karthik, FOUR, glorious shot from Karthik. He's come out with a positive intent. Sees the width, transfers his body weight across and slaps it wonderfully past cover. That just rocketed away to the fence in no time

Pattinson to Narine, out Caught by de Kock!! That's how you pluck a fruit from a tree. Nonchalance from Qdk. Narine's feathered an edge and has to walk back. Never looked comfortable at the crease to be honest. Pattinson just kept it short and took it away from him. The Southpaw went for the cross-batted pull and it didn't really come off for him, de Kock timed his jump to perfection and snatched it with one glove. Pattinson roars and KKR have lost their second wicket. Narine c de Kock b Pattinson 9(10) [6s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Nitish Rana, SIX, Rana stamps his authority against spin. Read this tossed up delivery from Chahar that was planted outside off, made enough room and lifted it over mid-off. Has enough power to clear the ropes on the full

Pollard to Karthik, FOUR, "Catch" was the cry from Pollard but Karthik has placed it just wide of Bumrah at short third man. Shorter outside off, Karthik went for the cut and flashed hard at it. Outside edge flies quickly and rolls through to the boundary

Rahul Chahar to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik is playing with a lot of freedom today. Floater just outside off, Karthik opens his stance and lofts it inside-out over extra cover. High percentage shot against spin.. brilliant!
Rahul Chahar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, second boundary of the over. Flatter from Chahar, Rana went low and executes the reverse sweep, hitting it over short third man's head
Krunal Pandya to Karthik, FOUR, sliced over point! Rifles it full and wide of off, Karthik reaches out and hits it uppishly in the gap

Krunal Pandya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, okay, KKR's engine has started to rev up. Both batsmen changing gears now. Krunal Pandya keeps bowling it wider, Rana got into a good position and also anticipated it to be on the shorter side. Slapped it ferociously past extra cover and it trickles to the boundary

Warrier to Rohit, SIX, as anticipated, the extra ball goes the distance. How often do we see this? Short and wide outside off, plenty of time for Rohit to free his arms. Throws the kitchen sink and plays an upper cut as the ball sails over deep point for the first maximum of the evening. Frustrated is Warrier as he spoils his over

Shivam Mavi to de Kock, out Caught by Nikhil Naik!! Mavi strikes in his first over. That was in the air for an eternity, but the fielder there - Nikhil has managed to pouch it. Back of a length delivery by the young pacer and de Kock plays an-across-the-line wild hoick, A thick top-edge is induced as the South African gets caught at mid-wicket. de Kock c Nikhil Naik b Shivam Mavi 1(3)

Narine to Rohit, out Suryakumar Yadav Run Out!! 1 run completed. Yadav knew too. He put in the desperate dive but stayed down as he knew he had not made it in. Rohit steps out and is met by a back of a length delivery, he nudges it into the empty mid-wicket pocket and calls for the second, Narine chases after it and throws it to the bowler's end, Morgan gathers the ball and lights up the stumps. Even with a full length dive Yadav was six inches short. Suryakumar Yadav run out (Narine/Morgan) 47(28) [4s-6 6s-1]
Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, leg byes, 1 run, spinning in but down leg, Rohit sweeps and misses, the ball deflects off his pad and nutmegs Karthik, the pair manage to cross over

Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, 2 runs, fifty for Rohit. He may not be in Eden or Wankhede but he still loves playing against KKR. Now needs to kick on and make it into a big innings. Slower and turning in, Rohit commits to the sweep and gets a top-edge over the vacant short fine region, the duo are able to come back for the second

Warrier to Rohit, FOUR, KKR have bowled a lot of short balls to Rohit today and most of them have disappeared. This was outside off and Rohit had the room to free his arms, slaps it over extra cover and the ball bounces just inside the rope

Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, SIX, ufff! When he plays the pull there is no ground big enough for him. Kuldeep errs in length, Rohit had ample time to go back, get into position and nail the pull over deep mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, SIX, this is Rohit at his best. 200th IPL six. Dances down the wicket, gets to the pitch of the delivery and once he does that the rest is easy, lofts through the line and clears long-on comfortably

Cummins to Saurabh Tiwary, FOUR, not a good start. Back of a length angled across the left hander, Tiwary flat-bats without any timing straight past Cummins, with mid-on and mid-off inside the ring the ball races away to the fence

Cummins to Saurabh Tiwary, SIX, 10 off the first two. This is a fabulous shot. Length ball around off-stump, Tiwary clears his front leg and then brings his bat down in a straight arc, sending the ball sailing over long-on

Narine to Saurabh Tiwary, out Caught by Cummins!! Much needed wicket for KKR? I ask that because it brings more dangerous batsmen out to the middle. This was sort of a knuckle ball from Narine, Tiwary made room to go over extra cover but was deceived for the lack of pace, hit it much straighter than he would have liked and Cummins settles under it near long-off. Saurabh Tiwary c Cummins b Narine 21(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

Cummins to Rohit, 1 run, in the air and lands safely. Slower ball banged into the surface, Rohit goes for his favorite pull but was a bit early into the shot, the ball hits him high on the bat and balloons towards square leg, no one there to take the catch

Cummins to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, tight single. Pandya moves across to flick it into the on-side, the leading edge flies towards backward point and Rohit calls for the quick single, he would have been short with a direct hit

Cummins to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, lovely shot! Slower short of length delivery and Pandya pulls it in front of square, the best thing was he rolled his wrist to keep it in the gap and bisect the two fielders in the deep

Cummins to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, and again.. Cummins became predictable there. Pandya was waiting for the short of length stuff, he strikes this much better than the last one and it almost goes the distance

Cummins to Hardik Pandya, SIX, ufff! Pandya was lining up for the back of a length/ short of length delivery, he moves across and nails the pull flat over deep mid-wicket, the ball goes on to strike one of the ad boardings in the stand. Another costly over from Cummins, 19 runs off it and he still has an over

Shivam Mavi to Rohit, FOUR, well KKR bowlers have to go back to the drawing boards after this game and come up with a different plan to Rohit next time. Because the plan to bowl short hasn't worked today, this was off-pace but it didn't matter to Rohit who smacks it to the right of deep mid-wicket, just short of the boundary rope

Shivam Mavi to Rohit, out Caught by Cummins!! A fine knock comes to an end. Cummins might not be bowling well but he is catching everything that is coming his way. It was a juicy full toss but a tired Rohit did not have enough in the tank to capitalize, he miscues the big heave and holes out to long-on. Mavi picks up his second and he has done a decent job this over. Can he finish it well? Rohit c Cummins b Shivam Mavi 80(54) [4s-3 6s-6]

Russell to Hardik Pandya, out Hit Wkt!! What happened there? Pandya starts walking. Karthik then sees the the stumps light up. Pandya has brought his bat down in such a way that it has clipped the off-bail. Russell went round the wicket and spears in the yorker outside off, Pandya goes deep in the crease to play that but as he is about to bring his bat down, he hits the stumps. Walks off with a smile on his face. Russell too had no idea as to what had happened. Hardik Pandya hit wkt b Russell 18(13) [4s-2 6s-1]

Shivam Mavi to Pollard, FOUR, misses the yorker and it is a juicy full toss just below waist, Pollard picked his spot and it is deep mid-wicket. Not the best of connections and hence he picks up only a boundary

Shivam Mavi to Pollard, wide, full delivery outside off, it was away from the tramline and Pollard threw the kitchen sink at it, but still could not make any sort of connnection. Ravi signals a wide but Karthik challenged the decision. In the end, it stays with the onfield call

Warrier to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, inside edged! Short of a length delivery outside off, seams into the batsman and Suryakumar Yadav gets an inside edge as he flashes hard. Rockets past his stumps and races away to the fine leg fence in no time

Warrier to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, not impressive lines by Warrier. Straying on the pads and Suryakumar Yadav clips it through square leg as the impeccable timing sends the ball to the deep square leg boundary

Warrier to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, off the radar again. Width on offer as he bowls a length delivery. Suryakumar Yadav goes back in his crease and caresses it through the gap at covers for the third boundary of this over. Dealing in boundaries is Surya at the moment

Warrier to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, classic counterattack by Surya. This was a dropped catch at mid-wicket as Narine failed to reverse cup it, parrying it away to the fence. Warrier bowled an overpitched delivery on leg and the right hander flicks it uppishly for the fourth boundary of the over

Cummins to Rohit, SIX, the Hitman has arrived. Not for the first time has Cummins been at the receiving end of such brilliance by Rohit. Remember that six over extra cover Down Under? Hangs back in his crease, stands tall and thwacks the short ball over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen

Cummins to Rohit, SIX, did someone say the boundaries are bigger? Not for this guy. Cummins feeds him another back of a length delivery and the Mumbai skipper has smoked it over deep mid-wicket for six more

Narine to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, whipped away! Floated on middle and leg, Suryakumar Yadav is on his front foot to heave this one towards the deep mid-wicket fence. Played that in the air, but more importantly in the gap

Narine to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 50-run stand up for the second wicket. Short ball by Narine and Suryakumar Yadav lines up for it. Treks back in the crease and pulls it over mid-wicket. Having conceded two boundaries in the over, Narine opts for a deep mid-wicket immediately
Russell to Rohit, FOUR, Russell ain't happy with the fielder at fine leg. Was a short ball and Rohit it pulls it away as he beats the fielder in the deep

Russell to Rohit, SIX, into the stands! Clearly the biggest one of the evening. Typical Rohit who nails his pull shot again. Back in his crease as he picks the length early and deposits it over deep square leg for many-a-mile

Kuldeep Yadav to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, what a shot! Suryakumar Yadav puts on his dancing shoes, reads the googly, gets to the pitch of the delivery and lofts it over deep extra cover for a perfectly timed six. Run fest at the moment! And that has forced Karthik to have a word with his bowler
U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, there's the loosener that spoils a good over - fuller length ball on the pads, clipped away to fine leg for four with just a tickle
Steyn to Rahul, FOUR, back of a length, doesn't quite hurry on from the surface, and that's all class from Rahul - opens the face and steers it away to the deep backward point fence for four
Steyn to Rahul, FOUR, slightly short, doesn't exactly rise, but width on offer - chopped off the attempted cut, over backward point and away to the boundary where Umesh Yadav dives in vain

Washington Sundar to Rahul, 1 run, fifty for Rahul. Applause from his team mates in the dugout. It is his 17th IPL fifty and first as skipper. Pooran walks up to congratulate his skipper. Flatter delivery on the stumps, Rahul works it to deep mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length on off, Rahul punches it to long-on

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, leg byes, FOUR, poor delivery to start with. Rahul might not have got any bat on this length delivery down leg, but there is a big deflection off the pad to beat a diving Philippe

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, top-edge and it runs away to the fence. Rahul was in no control there. Sharp bouncer around the left shoulder, Rahul was late on the hook and hence the edge, flies right over Philippe. He then practices playing the ramp instead of the hook

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, and Saini errs in length. He goes full and Rahul is just too good there, extension of the arms and lofts it over extra cover, the ball has enough to trickle into the fence

Shivam Dube to Pooran, out Caught by de Villiers!! Oh no! Pooran has nailed this but straight to the fielder. Dube's golden arm strikes again. Big call to trust him with this over after Saini had gone for a few, but Pooran has just thrown it away. Charges down, converts it into an overpitched delivery and drills it straight to AB at mid-off. The idea was to place it wide of the fielder like he done to Umesh but Pooran was not able to do that. Pooran c de Villiers b Shivam Dube 17(18) [4s-1]

Shivam Dube to Maxwell, 1 run, now Maxwell almost chips one to mid-off. Ful delivery on off-stump, Maxwell is half hearted in his attempted loft, chips it towards mid-off, Negi is quick to race across the turf and dive to his right, just out of his reach

Chahal to Rahul, FOUR, poor delivery and Rahul does not miss out. Drifts this leggie too far down leg and it is easy pickings for Rahul, he kneels down and sweeps it fine to the left of short fine leg

Shivam Dube to Maxwell, out Caught by Finch!! There's something about Dube. Batsmen feel they can take him on but that has not been the case. First Pooran and now Maxwell. Those are two big wickets especially in such a situation where they have to license to go after the bowling. Maxwell backs away and takes a step down, Dube cleverly bangs the slower delivery into the surface, the flat-batted shot does not have the elevation to go over, Finch takes a good low catch at cover. Maxwell c Finch b Shivam Dube 5(6)

Steyn to Rahul, SIX, woah! That's smashed. Steyn became predictable there. Slower ball back of a length and Rahul was waiting for this, gets into position quickly and nails the pull flat over deep mid-wicket

Steyn to Rahul, 1 run, dropped! Kohli has put one down in the deep. Low full toss and Rahul crouches low to whip it over the rope, he doesn't get enough to clear the long boundary in Dubai, Kohli moves to his right and might have just overran a bit. He tries to adjust and take it over his head, but the ball just doesn't stick. How costly will it be?
Navdeep Saini to Nair, FOUR, neatly done. The dipping slower delivery, Nair moves around in the crease, gets inside the line and crouches a bit to scoop it over short fine leg

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, 116.8kph and Rahul is waiting for it. Saini has to mix it up. This one had width as well, Rahul throws his bat at the right time to bisect backward point and short third man

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, 1 run, oh no! Dropped again. Kohli again. Another slower ball on a fullish length, Rahul tries his best to manufacture power, but doesn't manage to and skies it towards long-off, Kohli runs in and this was a much easier chance than the previous one. He wriggles his hand as to gesturing that the ball might have been wet due to dew

Steyn to Rahul, SIX, AB tries his best to pull off another one of his Superman catches. But is not able to. Slower delivery on the stumps, Rahul picks it away over backward square and he gets the elevation to beat a leaping AB. The South African tried to parry it in but he was not able to

Steyn to Rahul, FOUR, hundred for Rahul. Fine innings from the Kings XI skipper. He has led from the front and has put his team ahead in this tie. Takes off his helmet and soaks in the applause from his team mates and owners. And does the "I don't hear anything" celebration that he does. Full delivery outside off, Rahul throws the kitchen sink and the outside edge flies over short third man

Steyn to Rahul, SIX, oh my! That's disappeared into the top tier. Steyn is just too predictable with his slower deliveries, it is all back of a length stuff, Rahul waits and swings his bat at the right time, pumps it flat and all the way over deep mid-wicket

Steyn to Rahul, SIX, he is putting on a show now. Not leaving any delivery that is in his arc. This was full and outside off, Rahul stays leg-side to give the room to open his arms, opens the bat face and slices it over point. Another biggie..

Steyn to Rahul, FOUR, he has had luck and this proves that today is his day. Good length ball around off, Rahul clears his front leg to have a heave to the on-side, the thick inside edge races past the the stumps

Shivam Dube to Nair, FOUR, Nair also gets into the act. Short and lacked venom, Nair gets inside the line and pulls it backward of square, he rolled his wrist to get the placement right and there was no stopping that

Shivam Dube to Rahul, FOUR, that's not a bad delivery but a fine shot. Dube spears in the wide yorker outside off, Rahul makes room and opens the bat face to slice the drive behind square on the off-side, no chance for the sweeper to get across

Shivam Dube to Rahul, SIX, Rahul brings up the 200 in style. Dube misses his yorker by a long distance, this was right in the swinging arc, Rahul clears his front leg and pumps it into the first tier near long-on
U Yadav to Agarwal, FOUR, this man in a different zone right now - charges down and flays this inside out over extra cover for four
U Yadav to Agarwal, FOUR, into the pads, half-volley, and that's clipped away with ease through deep mid-wicket for four! Nope, ain't no white ball gonna swing in the third over - as KP points out...

Shivam Dube to Rahul, SIX, Rahul finishes it in style. This is the highest ever score by a captain in IPL. He walks off to a standing ovation. We have been witness to a great innings from the Kings XI skipper. Slower delivery that is back of a length, Rahul waits for it and flat-bats it straight down the ground. When he's striking them so well there are no grounds big enough
Navdeep Saini to Rahul, FOUR, half-volley, a rare one from Saini, and Rahul just has to step out as he crunches it through deep extra cover for four! Stunning shot!

Steyn to Agarwal, FOUR, a 135km/h bouncer from Steyn, but Agarwal has picked it up, rocks back and nails the pull to the deep mid-wicket boundary for four. Not the best timing on that, but he's got it away...
Navdeep Saini to Agarwal, FOUR, that's a terrible full-toss at a gentle 133.1km/h, and Agarwal lays into it, caressing it through the covers for four. Nobody moved...

Navdeep Saini to Rahul, 1 run, another slower one on a length, worked away for a single (well, inside edge to be honest) to bring up the fifty-run stand in the powerplay. That's one box check. Platform laid for a good score.
Chahal to Rahul, FOUR, tossed up but drifting into the dangerous pad-line, and he's thrashed the sweep away to the backward square leg boundary for four

Chahal to Agarwal, out Bowled! Knocked him over! Agarwal has no clue about that googly, hasn't read it out of the hand, leaves a gaping hole between the bat and pad trying to play the expansive inside out drive, as if to a leg-break, but that one turns in and crashes into the stumps of Agarwal. It's Yuzi again, who's picked up the King-pin (from the last game at least). Agarwal b Chahal 26(20) [4s-4]

Washington Sundar to Rahul, FOUR, not too short, skidding through very close to the stumps, and that's chopped away off a crouch to the third man fence for four! That's through Dale Steyn at short third man, who's absolutely made a mess of this!
U Yadav to Pooran, FOUR, right in the slot, wide half-volley, and Pooran has just leant into a fabulous drive through the covers. Not even a dive in the infield can cut that off...
U Yadav to Rahul, SIX, free-hit, a half-volley, Rahul gets under it, and slices this high and mighty over sweeper cover for six!
U Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, strays on the pads, and that's tickled away to the fine leg boundary for four! Yadav, Yadav, Yadav - you simply cannot do that...

Cottrell to Devdutt Padikkal, out Caught by Ravi Bishnoi!! The young man perishes. The run rate might have had a role to play. More than 10 per needed from ball one and Devdutt Padikkal tried for an over enthusiastic pull. Backed away, top-edged it and the man at mid-on took it. The 'Salute Celebration' is back as well. Devdutt Padikkal c Ravi Bishnoi b Cottrell 1(2)

Shami to Philippe, out Lbw!! That was plumb! The ball landed on a length, angled in and hit the batter dead in front of the sticks. Philippe looked to play across the line and missed it to be in trouble. The umpire didn't take much time to make his decision. Philippe lbw b Shami 0(3)

Shami to Washington Sundar, FOUR, nice late guide to this short ball, third man dives to his right and palms it on the bounce as he can't get there. Oh is the right foot touching the rope as he recovered and try to flick it back? Yep, four!

Neesham to Shivam Dube, SIX, wow! What a shot! A great chance for Dube to knock a few in the middle and prepare for the remaining games. Short of a length delivery on the stumps, Dube pulls over mid-wicket and clears quite comfortably

Maxwell to Shivam Dube, out Bowled!! That's the problem of being rooted to the crease. Never one to use his front foot well to the spinners, loves to play off the back foot. If Maxwell spotted that and deliberately fired this in on a good length, then full credit to him. Ill-advised flick off the back foot and that too off balance when he was trying shift back. Off the pad and into the sticks. Shivam Dube b Maxwell 12(12) [6s-1]

Ravi Bishnoi to U Yadav, out Bowled!! No, no! This is so poor from a senior pro who knows how exactly the IPL pans. Why not play out the overs! Yadav goes for an almighty hoick, he does muscle them long if he middles, but he misses and it crashes into middle and leg. Second wicket for the youngster. U Yadav b Ravi Bishnoi 0(2)
Maxwell to Washington Sundar, FOUR, Washington Sundar flicks through mid-wicket, oh big gap there and Pooran fumbles trying to slide and stop the ball. Maxwell looks away

Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, SIX, this bloke is a good batsman. Smoked quite a few in the TNPL. Ravi Bishnoi floated the googly, but he's lunged forward to that and powered the ball over long-off

Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Agarwal!! Ravi Bishnoi, in his debut IPL, bags the purple cap in the second game. Five wickets for the youngster, third of the game. Oh scratch that, actually got only one wicket in the first game. So doesn't have the cap yet. Needs one more. He nicely floats and invites the lofted hit, Sundar was tempted to back himself and go for the big hit, mistimed it to long-on. Washington Sundar c Agarwal b Ravi Bishnoi 30(27) [4s-2 6s-1]
Murugan Ashwin to Navdeep Saini, FOUR, that's a nice hit over wide long-off, with the spin, off the front foot, decently timed. Oh the lofted inside-out drive is a great feeling!

Murugan Ashwin to Navdeep Saini, out Bowled!! Shake of the head from Murugan Ashwin. Why did he bowl the leggie to the tailender and not target the sticks with a googly like this one, says Ashwin to himself. Saini lofts over the top, or he wanted to, misses and sneaks through the gate. Navdeep Saini b Murugan Ashwin 6(7) [4s-1]
Murugan Ashwin to Chahal, out Lbw!! Misses the sweep and the finger goes up! 97-run win for KXIP. Woah! Thats massive. Chahal lbw b Murugan Ashwin 1(3)

Cottrell to Kohli, out Caught by Ravi Bishnoi!! Bangalore pressing the self destruct button now. This shot from Kohli reminds me of his dismissal in the 2015 WC semis. A left-armer digging it short and getting the better of him thanks to an ungainly top-edge. This was caught easily at mid-on. That was short and angled across after a couple of fuller deliveries. Nicely set up by the bowler. He bent his back on this delivery and got his reward. Kohli c Ravi Bishnoi b Cottrell 1(5)
Shami to Finch, FOUR, slow full toss and lofted over mid-on for the first four of the innings. That was a terrible delivery and Finch took advantage of it

Shami to Finch, no run, Is Finch gone? The umpire has given him out caught behind. But Finch was quick to review it. That nipped in, Finch pushed at it and seems to have missed it. Mostly it went off the pads and into the keeper's gloves. Not out is the verdict and Finch is safe. Even he was safe on the LBW call as it was missing the wickets

Cottrell to de Villiers, SIX, length delivery, off-pace as well, de Villiers has his weight on the back leg but still manages to slam it over long-off for a sixer. Was sweetly hit. de Villiers has to fire tonight for RCB
Cottrell to de Villiers, FOUR, some room and de Villiers capitalises on it. Smashes it through the covers for a four. Got the room and pounced on it

Ravi Bishnoi to Finch, FOUR, too short, Finch pulls it down the ground over the mid-off fielder for a four. Shouts of catch were there but it was well away from the fielder. Even long-on tried to cut it off but couldn't
Ravi Bishnoi to de Villiers, FOUR, stays back, de Villiers pulls it behind square. That was once again short and punished by de Villiers

Ravi Bishnoi to de Villiers, FOUR, is it a four? Or has Cottrell managed to push it back into the playing area? Seems to be a four. Went really fine and the man at short fine leg gave it a good chase. ABD shows his deft side as well. He is off to a flier
Murugan Ashwin to Finch, FOUR, sweeps it fine and sweeps it well to get it away for a four. That was well down leg and Finch helped himself to a boundary by placing it to the fine leg fence
Ravi Bishnoi to Finch, 1 run, goes a little wide of the crease to deliver that googly. Finch nudged that out to deep mid-wicket for a single

Ravi Bishnoi to Finch, out Bowled!! The quickish flattish leggie does it for Ravi Bishnoi. That beat Finch on the outer edge as he looked to punch it and missed it for the off pole to be disturbed. The young man has a huge scalp. The partnership was building and has been broken now. Punjab get an important wicket to stop the momentum. Finch b Ravi Bishnoi 20(21) [4s-3]

Murugan Ashwin to de Villiers, FOUR, floated up outside off and has been spanked past cover for a four. That was hit really hard and the man at deep cover despite trying his best just couldn't stop it

Murugan Ashwin to de Villiers, out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! The bat face turned on impact and has been taken at deep cover. The googly has done it for Murugan Ashwin. ABD has problems against leggies and has been exposed once more. The run rate also had a role to play in the dismissal. RCB have lost their top half and don't have much on the board. de Villiers c Sarfaraz Khan b Murugan Ashwin 28(18) [4s-4 6s-1]
Mishra to du Plessis, 1 run, use of the feet to drive this firmly down the ground to long-on
Avesh Khan to du Plessis, FOUR, neat hit that to this short of length delivery. Wristed that behind square at the last minute to pick up the backward square leg gap. No chance for the man at fine leg

Avesh Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, he's not hit this well. He grunts "Aaaargh" as soon as he hit that in the air and Hetymer has put down a sitter. What has he done? This was the short delivery outside off stump, du Plessis just chipped it high over cover-point, Hetty ran in and probably overran, came around chest height and he couldn't control. This is a massive let off!

Mishra to du Plessis, FOUR, in the airrr, and in the gap! Is this Faf's day? He hasn't timed everything as well as Sharjah or Abu Dhabi! This time he ran down the pitch and had a wild swing at the lofted drive, good from Mishy to push it outside off stump and force Faf to fetch that, leading edge actually and it flew between cover and point. Dhawan didn't cut the angle and was slow to take off, he assmued the man at cover would grab that

Avesh Khan to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, oh that is quite a flick shot off the back foot. Wasn't all that short to be honest, he flicked that off the kneeroll! My word! Somehow generated enough power to beat the deep mid-wicket fielder

Avesh Khan to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, in the airrrr and just over the leaping Nortje at mid-off. Jadhav jumped down the pitch and flat-batted that short of length delivery, hit it flat, Nortje is tall, tried his best there but it escaped.

Rabada to du Plessis, FOUR, that's an audacious pull shot from du Plessis to his countrymen. KG tried the slower delivery but dropped it short, Faf played the, aah let it come pull shot over the infield over mid-wicket

Rabada to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, now deft touch from Kedar, oh that's beaten third man near the fence. Faf was shouting run, run, run.. to Kedar, who was so confident and just jogging. He was right. Third man was wide and he couldn't cut it off. That's one problem of having pace up your sleeve, batsman sometimes use it to their advantage
Rabada to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, tucks this short of length delivery to backward square leg. Fifty stand between these two

Nortje to Kedar Jadhav, out Lbw!! That is plumb in front! Impact right in front of off stump. You can't be slogging with a pull shot when it's not really short. Hit around the kneeroll. Jadhav seemed to be rushed by that length delivery and DC have a breakthrough! Okay, was a slower delivery, so he was trying to adjust and that's why he missed. So far, a top over from Nortje. Kedar Jadhav lbw b Nortje 26(21) [4s-3]
Nortje to Dhoni, 3 runs, uppish guide to this short delivery past backward point, they race back for three

Avesh Khan to Dhoni, FOUR, low full toss and he's lofted that with such calmness. No real rush to power that ball, just placed it perfectly back over the ump's head and no chance for the men in the deep
Avesh Khan to Dhoni, FOUR, oh no! Not there! Avesh Khan tried to nail the leg stump toe-crusher but bowled a low full toss down leg, Dhoni happily helps it away to fine leg for four

Rabada to du Plessis, 2 runs, he hasn't timed it, it's highhhh and it's Hetmyer again who drops it. Full and on the stumps, du Plessis looks to loft over the infied, but he's skied this. Hetymer ran back from cover, a tough catch, but it looks like he never got a finger on it. No, on second viewing it is clear that he got both hands but it bursts through to fall on the ground

Rabada to du Plessis, out Caught by Pant!! Edged and into the hands of Pant. Is that the game for DC? Death bowling is all about watching what the batsman does. Faf was backing away, so KG fired this short of length delivery wide of off and forced him to fetch, Faf tried to reach but only managed to kiss it to Pant as he overbalanced playing the shot. du Plessis c Pant b Rabada 43(35) [4s-4]
Rabada to Jadeja, FOUR, guided, in the air but in the gap between short third man and backward point. Jadeja used pace on that short of length delivery really well

Rabada to Dhoni, out Caught by Pant!! Dhoni walks! Slower short delivery, Dhoni early into the pull shot, gets a thick edge that lobs in front of Pant who dives forward to complete the catch. This is so good from DC. Oh a bit of glove love between KG and Jadeja too. Nice to see. Dhoni c Pant b Rabada 15(12) [4s-2]

Axar to Vijay, FOUR, this by no means looked convincing. Vijay backed away to open up the off-side field, Patel fired it within the stumps and Vijay was committed to go for it. Dragged it off the cue-end and hits it uppishly, just manages to clear mid-on and earns a boundary

Nortje to Watson, no run, dropped. Pops out of Shaw's hands at square leg like a bar of soap. He got a lifeline when he was batting and now this. Karma eh? A strong wristy whip from Watson, hitting it on the up and straight to Shaw, who couldn't lock his hands in time and grasses it. Watson will breathe easy.. you can't drop these catches at this level

Rabada to Jadeja, out Caught by Mishra!! Cut straight to hand and Rabada has three. Nice end to a comprehensive win from DC. Short of a length, Jadeja guides and that's catching practice for Mishy. Jadeja c Mishra b Rabada 12(9) [4s-1]

Avesh Khan to Watson, FOUR, he's welcomed into the attack with a boundary. Went fuller just outside off, Watson goes hard and sort of squirted it off the inner half, miscued it airly and it flies past Rabada's dive at mid-on. No point chasing it as it scurries away to the fence

Avesh Khan to Watson, SIX, Avesh is the weak link among DD's pacers and Watson knows it. A free-flowing swing of the bat, nailing it off the middle and launches it into the long-on stands. Can't bowl this length Avesh..

Axar to Watson, out Caught by Hetmyer!! Watson walks straight into the trap set by Iyer and Co. For a second, I thought Hetmyer misjudged it by running in too far, but he keeps his calm and holds onto it. Another game, another instance of CSK losing an early wicket. Watson will be kicking himself there, couldn't have placed it any better. A short delivery begging to be hit, Watson jumped back and pulled it uppishly, didn't have the power to clear the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Very poor.. Patel is pumped. Watson c Hetmyer b Axar 14(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

Nortje to du Plessis, FOUR, not too smart bowling from Nortje. Drifting onto du Plessis's pads, too easy for Faf as he just gets inside the line and tucks it past square leg. The timing is good enough to fetch him a four there

Nortje to Vijay, out Caught by Rabada!! This was inevitable. With the way, he was timing it, you'd sensed it, a wicket was round the corner. Vijay's painful stay at the crease comes to an end and has he played his last game for CSK? You never know. DC are a happy bunch. A simple back of a length delivery just outside off, some extra zip and pace did the trick for Nortje. Vijay just swung his bat, got it high on the bat and spooned a dolly to Rabada at mid-on. CSK two down and in a spot of bother. Vijay c Rabada b Nortje 10(15) [4s-1]

Axar to du Plessis, out Ruturaj Gaikwad Run Out!! This is the last thing CSK would've wanted at this stage. Needless. Patel lasers in the armer, du Plessis is cramped for room as he inside-edges it towards square leg. Ruturaj was keen to get to the other end as he races across the pitch only for Faf to send him back. Pant quickly sprints across and flings in a sharp throw to the bowler. He put in a full-length dive but wasn't enough. Axar cleanly breaks the stumps and he's a goner! Ruturaj Gaikwad run out (Pant/Axar) 5(10)

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, yup, cover, punch, high-elbows, covers. Typically Shaw. Spots the back of a length early and rocks behind in his crease to not over-hit this crunch, perfectly through the point and extra cover gap
Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, pitched up this time with a bit of away swing. Shaw leans forward, and stays just as elegant -- drilling this cover drive with a louder crunch
Jadeja to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, thumped over long-off. Not quite to the pitch of it, and he's against the spin, but there's enough in those arms to tonk over

Chawla to Dhawan, FOUR, pressure on the spinners as the openers are in complete control. Boundaries coming from both ends. Dhawan gets to the pitch of this delivery and whacks it over the bowler's head for four runs. Chawla is running out of ideas

Chawla to Dhawan, out Lbw!! Gone! Just the wicket they were looking for. He was playing so well, there was no need to play the reverse sweep. Actually the reverse heave. Chawla goes very full and the batsman gets beaten and rapped on the pads. The impact was around middle and this might have gone on to crash into the off-stump. Nevertheless, this was also the highest opening wicket stand for Delhi since 2016. Dhawan lbw b Chawla 35(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

Jadeja to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Delhi have just lost a wicket, but that's not going to affect Shaw. He'll keep playing his shots. This was short and wide outside off, Prithvi goes deep in his crease and cuts it past the man at short third man, four more..

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, out Stumped!! Chawla gets rid of both the openers in successive overs. Prithvi Shaw walks down the wicket to play the flatter delivery and gets outfoxed. Comes off an inside edge, rolls back off the pad towards Dhoni who had to lunge forward to get the ball and stretch to break the bails. No chance of getting back in and that's the end of an impressive innings by the Capitals' opener. Can CSK get a few more wickets and stem the flow of runs? Prithvi Shaw st Dhoni b Chawla 64(43) [4s-9 6s-1]

Jadeja to Pant, FOUR, typical Pant. Down on his knee in a flash as he picks the floated delivery to perfection. Enough elevation behind this scoop-like shot, with a lot more power behind. Almost went the distance at fine leg

Chahar to Pant, FOUR, impeccable timing behind this cover drive, and even Faf du Plessis can do nothing about it. Touch fuller outside off and it has been absolutely creamed through the huge gap on the off side

Sam Curran to Pant, FOUR, that was not needed. Dhoni wouldn't be happy with that. Pant had eased this one back to the bowler and Curran has a needless overthrow to give them four bonus runs. Would have been a dot ball, but he threw it down leg and Dhoni had no chance

Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, not an impressive delivery by Chahar. He has sprayed a full toss on the pads in his quest to attempt the yorker. Easy pickings for Shreyas Iyer was flicks it away to the deep square leg fence. That went flat and for a moment it seemed as if this will go the distance. Alas, it didn't

Hazlewood to Pant, FOUR, misfield by Kedar Jadhav at sweeper cover. This was absolutely smashed through the off side by Pant, but the fielder couldn't stop it in the deep. Dhoni applauds him for the effort though
Hazlewood to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, 50-run stand up between this pair as Shreyas Iyer squeezes the yorker to square third man. They need to hit a few big ones here..
Hazlewood to Pant, FOUR, and Pant is exactly doing that. On a length around off, Pant picks the length early and chips it over extra cover for a cracking four

Sam Curran to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Dhoni!! MS files to his right and takes a superb catch. What a spectacular over by Curran as he concedes only four runs. Slightly short ball outside off, Shreyas Iyer swings across the line and gets an outside edge which has been taken. A rather rusty knock comes to an end. Shreyas Iyer c Dhoni b Sam Curran 26(22) [4s-1]
Hazlewood to Pant, FOUR, smashed! In the slot outside off and Pant has thumped it right over the bowler's head, can't keep a fielder there, can you?

Hazlewood to Stoinis, FOUR, first-ball four for Stoinis. Shuffles in the crease, moves miles across the crease and drags the short ball from outside off and manages to get it past the man at short fine leg

Hazlewood to Stoinis, leg byes, FOUR, runs for Delhi! Fired outside off on a yorker length and Stoinis once again attempts a similar shot. This one comes off his pads and beats Dhoni as it races away to the boundary. Doesn't matter how these runs come, as long as they do..
Sam Curran to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, 130.1kph, ah, too easy. Leg-lined, leg-cutter and Shaw glances it into the totally empty backward square leg
Sam Curran to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, 120.7kph, goes airy. Curran feeds length, and Shaw goes full-hearted, committing to slicing this easily over mid-off
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, slashed through the covers .. and Chahar, chasing it from sweeper just doesn't put in the dive, merely sticking his foot out. Oh dear ..
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, picks the gap behind square, and nails. Opening his bat face and using the sheer pace that Chawla's dishing out all over to get it perfectly out there
Jadeja to Dhawan, SIX, here's the shackle-breaker. Dhawan finally middles, finally shows intent, sitting under this length and using the in-spin to slog it over deep square leg
Jadeja to Dhawan, FOUR .. and again. Jadeja feeds it in the slog, and Dhawan slog-sweeps, more into cow corner though
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, top stuff. Chawla gets just that little fuller-than-good, and Shaw goes inside-out, without a lot of feet movement either, lofting it wide of long-off comfortably
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, googly. But as if Shaw could care less, he's dancing down this time, making room for his arm and inside-outing it once again into that extra cover zone
Jadeja to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, 96kph, straighter one on middle, with Shaw shuffling and tucking into mid-wicket. Also, a fifty
Jadeja to Dhawan, FOUR, it's his turn to inside-out. Steps away, makes room and lofts one-bounced into extra cover's ropes
Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, FOUR, lovely, not a great ball from Bhuvneshwar, floaty half-volley on the pads, Gill gets inside the line and whips it over square leg, the man in the deep has no chance

Khaleel Ahmed to Narine, out Caught by Warner!! The start SRH would have wanted after being restricted to a modest score. Look at Warner go, he's pumped up, this could lift his team as well. Back of a length and at the stumps, Narine was slightly cramped up on the pull, gets a steepling top-edge towards mid-off and Warner made sure that everyone else stayed away. Watched it all along and held on, a fist pump from Khaleel Ahmed as he exults. Narine c Warner b Khaleel Ahmed 0(2)

Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, SIX, clubbed, Gill charges down the track to a good length delivery, didn't look like he got to the pitch of it, still went through with the bludgeon and gets enough to send it over the ropes at long-on
Rashid Khan to Shubman Gill, FOUR, breaks the shackles in style! Swung across the line for a four. That was in the arc for Shubman Gill to thwack it through the square leg region

T Natarajan to Shubman Gill, FOUR, short delivery outside off and has been cut away past point for a four. That was delightfully done. Fifty for the young man. Has been an excellent knock! He has played shots all around the ground and more importantly very judiciously

T Natarajan to Shubman Gill, 1 run, full toss and almost a return catch! That was played with a twisted face of the bat and just away from the clutches of the bowler, who made an attempt to grab it to his right
Nabi to Morgan, wide, again down leg, Morgan misses the tuck and this time it has been wided
Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, fifty of the partnership comes up! That angled in and has been pushed down to long-on for a single. KKR in control
Bhuvneshwar to Morgan, SIX, fuller delivery angled across, Morgan lofts it huge over deep cover for a sixer! Lovely hit. The freedom was there for the southpaw and he just opened his arms
Rashid Khan to Morgan, FOUR, tossed up delivery and has been slog swept! That was floated up and Morgan knelt down to thwack it hard
Abhishek Sharma to Shubman Gill, SIX, chips down the track and lofts it huge down the ground! Superb hit from Shubman Gill as he wants to have an early finish

T Natarajan to Morgan, SIX, short ball outside off and has been pulled away handsomely over deep mid for a sixer! Got under it and slammed it. Only 2 needed now. Morgan unleashed that big shot as he saw it too short

T Natarajan to Morgan, FOUR, redemption for KKR! And that too without much hullabaloo. That was a full toss and Morgan powered it past the bowler for a four. Struck really hard by the southpaw to bring about their first win of the season!

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, cracking shot, hint of width and those fast hands of Rana does the rest - stands tall and punches it in front of square on the off-side, past the dive at backward point and runs away to the ropes

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, lovely, he's looking in excellent touch, Rana - back of a length and just outside off, not much width on offer, Rana still stands tall and punches it on the up, past the fielder at cover and runs away to the ropes

Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana, FOUR, top-edge and four, no control over this pull from Rana, but he got enough bat to clear Saha and his gloves, banged in short and well wide of off, Rana was clearly late on the shot

Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana, FOUR, sheer timing from Rana, back of a length and on the hips, he gets inside the line and clips it past square leg, the timing is sweet and the ball runs away to the boundary ropes
Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, short and wide of off, Rana gets on top of the bounce and cuts it up and over backward point - third man is fine and has no chance

T Natarajan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Rana can't do much wrong today, friendly full-toss from Natarajan, he leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and drives it back past the umpire - two fielders gave chase, but the ball beats them to the ropes

T Natarajan to Nitish Rana, out Caught by W Saha!! A loose moment and Rana finds himself back on the way to the dressing room. He would be livid with himself, looked a million dollars, only to throw it all away. On a good length and a hint of shape away from the left-hander, Rana's feet went nowhere as he drove, gets a thick audible edge and Saha snaps it up. A wicket against the run of play, a wicket that would raise the hopes of SRH once again. Nitish Rana c W Saha b T Natarajan 26(13) [4s-6]

Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, FOUR, short, wide and four, the attempted slower ball from Khaleel, but it all went wrong - sat up to be smacked, Gill backed away and then thrashed it over cover for a boundary

Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries - Gill is batting beautifully, men inside the ring in the off-side and he's opening up that gap with subtle feet movements - backs away to a length ball and then cuts it behind square on the off-side for a boundary

Rashid Khan to Karthik, out Lbw!! Celeb appeal and the umpire's finger goes up for LBW. Think DK was happy to go, but he then chatted with his partner and decided to review. Pretty sure the 15-second time gap had elapsed, but here we go. It's a fair delivery and there's no inside edge on that. Was the wrong 'un and DK didn't read it one bit. UltraEdge confirms that there's no bat on that, Hawk-Eye in and it's three REDS. Karthik is OUT and KKR have wasted their review. Lovely delivery from Khan, slipped in the wrong 'un and Karthik didn't spot it - ended up playing outside the line as he lunged forward. Past the inside edge and struck adjacent to middle, was going on and crashing into the middle-stump. SRH keep themselves in the hunt with timely wickets. Karthik lbw b Rashid Khan 0(3)
Rashid Khan to Morgan, FOUR, nicely played, Morgan brings out the reverse sweep - bends down low and gets enough bat to clear short third man - was the leg-break and he played with the turn

Chakravarthy to Manish Pandey, FOUR, 101kph, Chakravarthy fires one in the blockhole outside off, Pandey reaches out to squeeze it away with a horizontal blade and gets a faint under edge. The ball goes through the legs of the keeper and runs away to the fence. Chakravarthy has his hands on his head

K Nagarkoti to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Nagarkoti slightly errs with his length and Pandey takes toll of it. Overpitched outside off at 139.5kph, the right-hander stays leg-side of the ball and batters it wide of mid-off. No need to run for those
Chakravarthy to Manish Pandey, 1 run, 92kph, very full and around off, Pandey clears his front leg for a hoick-across-the-line and inside-edges it to mid-wicket

Chakravarthy to W Saha, SIX, Saha had to up the ante! Shimmies down the track, crouches low and swings his bat hard to flog it over mid-wicket. There was a man in the deep, but the keeper-batsman got enough wood on it to clear the fielder. Nevertheless, an excellent spell from Chakravarthy comes to an end -- 4-0-25-1

Cummins to Manish Pandey, FOUR, just wide of mid-off! 135.4kph, shortish ball, Pandey wanted to flat bat it over mid-off. Got it off the top part of the bat and wasn't in control of his shot. Fortunately for him, it beat Narine to his right and the ball raced away to the long-off fence
Cummins to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fifty for Manish Pandey! An off-pace ball, Pandey reaches the landmark with a cut to deep point. Just a raise of the bat from SRH's No. 3

Russell to Manish Pandey, out Caught&Bowled!! A high full toss at 139.4kph, and is Manish Pandey is out caught-and-bowled? The umpires send it upstairs. It's below the waist and Pandey has to walk back. This is a big wicket. A full toss just below the waist from round the wicket, Pandey was initially looking to run it down to third man and later decided to work it into the on-side. In the end, the ball lobbed up off the splice of the bat. He was taken aback by the full toss. A simple return catch for Dre Russ. Manish Pandey c and b Russell 51(38) [4s-3 6s-2]

Russell to W Saha, FOUR, in the air and Nagarkoti has misjudged it! He charged in from third man and over-ran, put in a desperate leap in the end, but the ball was out of his reach. Goes to the fence on the bounce. A leg-stump full toss and Saha got a big leading edge trying to flick it away. Streaky, but SRH won't mind

Shivam Mavi to Nabi, FOUR, slapped! A short of length delivery outside off at 138.1kph, Nabi clears his front leg and muscles the cross-batted shot through the covers. Not a muscle moved. Stand and deliver
Russell to Nabi, FOUR, 134.9kph, full toss on leg from round the wicket, Nabi flicks it away handsomely over square leg for a one-bounce four. Good start to the over for SRH

Russell to Nabi, out W Saha Run Out!! 1 run completed. Better length from Russell, full and outside off, Nabi batters it to long-off. Saha decides to come back for the second, but Nabi is unmoved. The former spots it only after coming halfway down the pitch. Cummins fires a good throw to the keeper's end and Karthik completes the proceedings. Easy call for the TV umpire. W Saha run out (Cummins/Karthik) 30(31) [4s-1 6s-1]

Russell to Abhishek Sharma, byes, 1 run, 140.6kph, shortish ball outside off, Sharma wafts and is beaten by the pace and bounce. The batsmen decide to sneak a run via byes. Karthik lobs it to the bowler, but Russell misses the target at his end

Narine to Warner, SIX, up, up and over long-on. Warner has seen enough and it's time to get into business. Slightly bends forward, reaches out with his long levers as he pummels it high and sends it over the ropes. There was a fielder waiting but it cleared him. First shot of real intent and it's a six
Narine to Warner, FOUR, muscled past mid-on. Narine dropping it a tad shorter, Warner takes full toll of it. Sits deep, twirls his wrists and places it perfectly in the gap..

Cummins to Bairstow, no run, fullish just outside off, Bairstow sits low outside off looking to scoop it over short fine leg. Loses his balance and it flies off the pad to short third man. DK calls for it and grabs. Appeals and the finger went up. Bairstow knew he didn't hit it, so got it overturned

Cummins to Bairstow, out Bowled!! Knocked him over. So, he doesn't last long then. Cummins cleans him up. He's been excellent today, rarely has bowled a bad ball. Just sticks to the traditional length and targets the stumps. Bairstow follows a similar approach of making room and exposes all the three stumps. Misses it altogether on this occasion and the off-pole takes a beating. KKR have struck early here. Cummins is delighted with the breakthrough.. Bairstow b Cummins 5(10)

Shivam Mavi to Manish Pandey, SIX, that's Manish Pandey for you. Banged in short and Pandey smokes it over cow corner. A 81-metre hit. The ideal length for him and he tees off. He's away with a maximum and Warner liked it too

Cummins to Warner, FOUR, there was a man at deep square leg but Warner still went for it and timed it properly. Got a hunch that a short ball was coming, quickly hung back and got on top of the bounce. Then employed some power and pulled it exactly where he wanted. To the right of deep square leg and it travels rapidly to the fence
Kuldeep Yadav to Manish Pandey, SIX, clean hitting from Pandey. Uses his feet, gets to the pitch and extends his bat swing in tonking it over long-on. Stunning timing on that

Chakravarthy to Warner, out Caught&Bowled!! First IPL scalp for Varun Chakravarthy in this edition of IPL. And it's the big fish - Warner. A blip in concentration for SRH's captain after the break. A nothing shot really. This gave an impression of stopping upon reaching the batsman. Teased Warner into pushing at it, he went a bit too hard and chips it back to the bowler. Chakravarthy doesn't drop those. It was catching practice indeed. KKR camp are elated. Warner c and b Chakravarthy 36(30) [4s-2 6s-1]
Chakravarthy to W Saha, no run, it was the slider, Saha stayed back and didn't pick it. Played it outside the line, gets trapped on the back leg. Oh, it was the googly in fact.. close shave for Saha

Udana to Rohit, SIX, that's one length you don't bowl to Rohit. He thrives with anything short, the round the wicket angle was also taking it down leg, Rohit swivels and helps along the way over fine leg. With the fielder inside the ring it was more comfortable to put it away

Udana to de Kock, FOUR, in the air and just over. Expensive start for Udana, 14 off the first over. Full and curling away outside off, de Kock is in no control of the drive as he hits it uppishly and manages to get it over the leaping cover-point fielder

Washington Sundar to Rohit, out Caught by (sub)Negi!! First time Sundar has opened the bowling this season and he has got the big wicket of Rohit. Just the start RCB wanted especially after an expensive over from Udana.
