Rohit had enough of defending and was looking to go for the biggie, the length was fraction short and he was quick to pounce, pulls it high and that would have gone the distance in any other ground but not in Dubai, Negi settles under it at deep mid-wicket and hangs on comfortably. Rohit c (sub)Negi b Washington Sundar 8(8) [6s-1]

Navdeep Saini to Ishan Kishan, SIX, welcome back to the attack, Saini. Kishan lays into him, showing no respect to this full ball. Right in his arc and that's been slammed straight down the ground for a maximum

Navdeep Saini to Ishan Kishan, SIX, okay, Kishan has decided to change gears and he's targeting Saini. Again gets the length up, Kishan was waiting for this. Just gets under it and muscles it a mile over deep mid-wicket. Second six of the over, pressure on the bowler

Zampa to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by (sub)Negi!! The celebration from Virat Kohli and Co. just tells you this wicket meant a lot to them. Zampa strikes gold for his team as Hardik Pandya departs. Got a lot of height on this mow, it's a big boundary at deep mid-wicket, it required more power to clear the fence, but sadly he couldn't generate it. Ubiquitous Negi circles around and pouches it safely. Massive blow to MI. Hardik Pandya c (sub)Negi b Zampa 15(13) [6s-1]

Zampa to Ishan Kishan, SIX, fifty for Ishan Kishan. It's his comeback game, replaced Tiwary and he's making this opportunity count. Zampa gets it too full, Kishan gets underneath it and smokes it a long way over cow corner. Brings up the milestone in some style

Chahal to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, They are checking for a boundary. Udana seems to have done a good job in saving a couple for his team. A thick top edge on the sweep, the fielder at short fine leg thought he was in business but it soared over his head. Udana runs across from the deep and keeps the ball in play

Chahal to Ishan Kishan, SIX, Mumbai need more of this. A dragged-down delivery from Chahal, Kishan has all the time in the world to hang back and swipe it over deep backward square leg. Brute force from Kishan..

Chahal to Pollard, FOUR, chance? Nope, seems to have dropped just in front of Devdutt at long-off. A toe-ended swat from Pollard, dumps it to the left of Devdutt, who bolted to his left and went for the catch. But the ball dipped and unfortunately, he couldn't get his body behind the line as well. Four more to Pollard

Navdeep Saini to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, gotta feel for Saini. This was a yorker just outside off, Kishan waited and waited for it, opened his bat face and just guided it very fine at third man. Talk about placement and timing... wow

Zampa to Pollard, FOUR, that's bullied down the ground at long-off. My god! What power from Pollard. Zampa errs and bowls it in the slot for him. No chance for the fielder there, it just rocketed away to the fence in a jiffy

Zampa to Pollard, SIX, oh boyyyyy! Has Negi dropped the match here? What a big miss from him at deep extra cover. After taking so many catches, he lets one burst through his hands. Flighted just outside off, Pollard mistimes it as it comes off the toe-end. Skies in the air near the fence, Negi was in good position but it slips through and sails over the rope. You can't give a lifeline to someone like Pollard, he will make you pay..
Zampa to Pollard, SIX, and he does. Rightaway! A rank long hop, Pollard sits back and clobbers it a countrymile over cow corner

Zampa to Pollard, SIX, told ya! Pollard is making that drop count. Yet another maximum.. Tosses up by Zampa, Pollard didn't get it off the middle but still has imparts enough power on it to smash it over long-on

Zampa to Pollard, 3 runs, in the air.. another chance and Chahal this time makes a meal of it. What are RCB doing? Very poor.. Pollard looks to go for another biggie, gets a thick edge which goes up towards backward point. Chahal circles around, never looked comfortable and worse is.. doesn't even get a hand on it. Phew!

Chahal to Pollard, SIX, naahhh! Pollard ain't showing any mercy. Tonks it over long-off. Served it up slower and wider of off, Pollard's long levers coming to the fore.. sends it into the empty stands

Chahal to Ishan Kishan, SIX, Kishan gets into the act now. Not so great bowling from Chahal. Where's the googly mate? Just tosses another leg-break, Kishan pivots back, reads it and slogs it over deep mid-wicket

Chahal to Pollard, SIX, 20-ball fifty for Pollard. What a player. What a knock this has been. MI back in the game. Another big over. Flatter leg-break from Chahal, Pollard skips back, makes room and murders it over long-off

Navdeep Saini to Ishan Kishan, SIX, my word! How did this fly over the ropes? A proper mis-hit from Kishan, directs it into the night sky and Virat at long-off was setting himself near the boundary, but it gains some distance and loops over his head. Crazy

Udana to Ishan Kishan, SIX, butter fingers everywhere for RCB. Gurkeerat at long-on messes it up. Kishan muscled it flat and straight to him, he got both hands but couldn't lock it in time. Terrible.. and morever, he tips it over the bar for SIX

Udana to Ishan Kishan, SIX, Ishan Kishan, you beauty.. connects and connects this one properly. Moves across his stumps and pummels it over long-on. Too predictable from Udana and Virat throws his head in anger. Rohit jumps from his chair. Oh! What's happening!

Udana to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! More twist. More drama. Kishan's fallen a solitary run short of his century. Uff! A slower ball from Udana, trimmed his length a bit and Kishan slogged it hard, doesn't have power to clear deep mid-wicket and Devdutt clasps onto it. Take a bow, Kishan though. He's played a gem and has taken MI closer.. Ishan Kishan c Devdutt Padikkal b Udana 99(58) [4s-2 6s-9]

Udana to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by de Villiers!! RCB have two now. They had a solitary wicket in the powerplay before today and that too a lucky dismissal of Warner and now they have two in the space of four balls. Short of length delivery angled across the right hander, the ball bounces more than Suryakumar anticipated, he goes for the steer and edges it behind to the keeper. AB has a juggle before completing the catch. Suryakumar Yadav c de Villiers b Udana 0(2)

Udana to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, that's a freebie first up. Short and plenty of width on offer, Kishan tries his best to get on top of the bounce to play the cut, but flays it uppishly past the diving backward point fielder

Udana to Pollard, FOUR, IT's a TIE. The scores are level as Pollard pulls this to the fence at deep mid-wicket. Dug in short, Pollard stayed back and placed it perfectly. SUPER OVER to decide the winner. Elation in both camps. Kohli is relieved for the moment and smiles that they haven't come second. He walks off briskly to push for a Super Over win

Navdeep Saini to Ishan Kishan, SIX, shot! That's a fine hit from Kishan. Short and at the body, Kishan swivels and pulls, he got it right off the meat as the ball sailed over the long leg fence. The ball is lost in the stands and the fourth umpire brings out a box of replacement balls..

Chahal to de Kock, out Caught by (sub)Negi!! This was on the cards. de Kock never looked comfortable at the crease and with the required rate shooting up he had no other choice but to go after the spinner. Chahal is not afraid of getting hit, he tosses it up generously but gets it to dip on the southpaw, de Kock goes for the slog sweep and miscues it horribly, a much simpler catch for Negi at deep mid-wicket this time. de Kock c (sub)Negi b Chahal 14(15) [4s-1]

Zampa to Hardik Pandya, SIX, that's a horrible delivery. Zampa overcooks the delivery and it ends up as a full toss, Pandya does not need a second invitation, deposits it to the biggest part of the ground - to deep mid-wicket. Even some of his team mates were impressed on the distance he got

Boult to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, that's a freebie for any batsman. Boult gets a bit greedy tries to swing it away from middle and leg, but the ball keeps going with the angle, Padikkal flicks it stylishly backward of square and the new cherry races away to the fence

Pattinson to Finch, FOUR, edged and four, clear intention from Finch, runs down the track, was done in the by slower ball, but he had a free swing at that, gets a fat edge that flies over the lone slip

Rahul Chahar to Kohli, out Caught by Rohit!! No. no. no! You don't want to see that if you are a Kohli fan! That was a painful stay, but credit to Rahul Chahar. He troubled Kohli and deserved this wicket. Was the leggie, probably that diagonal over the wicket angle is troubling him - he was bowling most deliveries to Kohli from that angle. However, this was bowled with a conventional run-up, pitching on a length and turning away, Kohli loses one hand on the handle and chips it to cover. Kohli c Rohit b Rahul Chahar 3(11)

Pattinson to Devdutt Padikkal, SIX, now that is some shot! Kohli hit a six over long-off in an international game and this is a little similar to that. Not easy to loft handsomely off the back foot and he did so without balance too. Great shot!

Pattinson to Devdutt Padikkal, SIX, now the full flowing bat down the ground to loft Pattinson into the sightscreen. Devdutt Padikkal, what a talent. Length delivery, in the slot, but Padikkal made it look so easy. Rohit not happy with the length or the idea from the bowler
Krunal Pandya to de Villiers, FOUR, oh that seemed effortless. Short and angling in, de Villiers was cramped on the pull, but lofted that over infield, the timing was good enough to clear long-on
Krunal Pandya to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, they have been trying to bowl wide of off to Padikkal and he smartly targets the cover region with a nice lofted hit, just bounced inside the line

Pollard to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, no pace on this length delivery, but enough width to free the arms. Past backward point and the cut shot heads to the boundary. Second fifty in three games for young Padikkal. The RCB dugout is so happy for him. AB pats him on the helmet
Pollard to de Villiers, FOUR, taking pace off is fine, but you can't bowl down leg with no fine leg. Easily helped away behind square for a boundary

Bumrah to de Villiers, FOUR, if you are bowling full and outside off stump it's got to be really wide. This is right in the slot as Bumrah misses the yorker, de Villiers gets into a great position to loft over cover

Bumrah to de Villiers, SIX, okay! Never bowl within the bodyline to AB when he's looking for quick runs. The slower ball sat into the surfaces, de Villiers hangs back and pulls over mid-wicket. Didn't bother running

Bumrah to de Villiers, SIX, no Jas B! Unless you get that yorker right, it's difficult to control AB when you bowl into his body! This is another yorker missed, right in the slot and de Villiers, clearing the front leg out of the way, powers it handsomely over the bowler's head for a maximum

Boult to Devdutt Padikkal, out Caught by Pollard!! Pollard takes a really good catch. Boult dropping the slower ball short and wide of off, forcing Padikkal to fetch, Padikkal went for the pull, hit it decently, but big Pollard ran to his left, used all his height to great effect to take a gentle leaping catch. Well played young Dev! Boult's actually on a hat-trick, got Finch off the last ball of his previous over. Devdutt Padikkal c Pollard b Boult 54(40) [4s-5 6s-2]

Boult to de Villiers, SIX, just 4 runs off the over till this ball, so it should have been a smart delivery, but Boult, having got away with a short slower ball first delivery, tries again, but AB will feed on those anything within his bodyline at the end overs. Pulls, really high and into the stands over long leg

Bumrah to de Villiers, FOUR, Jas B isn't nailing those yorkers. Low full toss outside off stump, de Villiers lofts straight down the ground and any batsman need not hit such deliveries hard, just placed over the bowler

Bumrah to Shivam Dube, FOUR, smart, really smart from Dube. Seriously can't understand Bumrah bowling short and angling outside off stump with third man in, Dube just uses the pace offered and guides past the fielder inside

Bumrah to de Villiers, SIX, how high was that hit? What a way to raise a fifty. Such a lovely player to watch at the death. Really interesting ploy from Bumrah to continue to bowl into AB's body than bowl outside off stump and make him to force pace. This is just a length delivery that's been absolutely muscled over deep square leg

Pattinson to Shivam Dube, SIX, wow! Really nice cameo this from Dube. Knew Pattinson is going to bowl full and wide of off stump, read the slower delivery, got down on one knee and powered this over cover

Pattinson to Shivam Dube, SIX, this is so stylish flicked! Stunning hit! Rohit folds hands and looks. Fullish and angled in, Dube just uses his hands on that to wrist it with a strong bottom hand grip, so easily clearing mid-wicket

Boult to Finch, no run, chance and Rohit has dropped it - fair to say, he has saved four runs - short and just outside off, Finch rocked back and drilled the pull, to the left of mid-wicket. Rohit moved across quickly, got both hands on the ball, but can't hold on

Boult to Finch, SIX, lovely, superbly played by Finch, length delivery outside off, he reached forward, got close to the ball, a clean extension of his arms and he drop kicks it over the long-off fence

Pattinson to Shivam Dube, SIX, why? Just why? Coaches, experts plead not to bowl length at the death but Pattinson has bowled a slower ball halfway down the pitch. Dube stands tall and flat-bats it really straight. What a finish for RCB - 201

Pattinson to Finch, FOUR, cracking shot, Finch is on a mission - back of a length and well wide of off, he swivels across and pulls it in front of square on the on-side - one bounce and over the ropes
Rahul Chahar to Finch, FOUR, lovely, Chahar was trying to follow Finch as he backed away, but the length is far too short, pulled away with immense power over square leg for a boundary

Rahul Chahar to Finch, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Finch, this is excellent batting, fired short and down leg, he bends down low, uses the pace on the ball and laps it over short fine for a boundary

Rahul Chahar to Finch, FOUR, make it a hat-trick of boundaries - this is poor bowling from Chahar - dropped short and on off-stump, Finch made room and cracked it square on the off-side for yet another boundary

Bumrah to Devdutt Padikkal, leg byes, FOUR, poor line from Bumrah, short and on Padikkal's hips, he was looking to flick and missed, clipped the thigh-pad and beat the diving keeper - brings up the 50 for RCB

Bumrah to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, cracking shot, he isn't afraid of playing his shots - banged in short and at the stumps, Padikkal swivels across and pulls it over square leg, no one in the deep and it's another boundary
Krunal Pandya to Finch, FOUR, nicely played, loopy delivery wide of off, Finch gets a good stride forward and goes inside out over cover, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

Rahul Chahar to Finch, FOUR, nicely played, fifty for Finch, his first for RCB - tossed up quicker and sliding down leg, he bends half-way down and sweeps it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Boult to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, this is smart batting. Looked like the short slower delivery on the leg stump, Padikkal gets inside the line, swivels and helps it away fine knowing fine leg is very square

Boult to Finch, out Caught by Pollard!! Catching practice for Pollard at long-off - the threatening partnership has been broken. Change of pace and Finch was done in completely - the slower ball and Finch had to manufacture all the pace on this attempted lofted drive - was looking to go over cover, but it skewed off the inner half and lobbed down towards Pollard at long-off. He didn't have to move, a fine knock from Finch comes to an end. Finch c Pollard b Boult 52(35) [4s-7 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Bairstow!! There is the edge.. Bairstow takes it neatly in front of his face and Bhuvi strikes in his first over. Got extra lift on this outswinger, beautiful seam presentation as it nibbles away outside off. Shaw with zero feet movement chases and nicks it behind. Early jitters in the DC camp. Prithvi Shaw c Bairstow b Bhuvneshwar 2(5)

Rashid Khan to Dhawan, out Caught by Bairstow!! SHR review an edge: A googly, spinning sharply across Dhawan's heave. And there's a little tickle off the toe-end. Bairstow's heard it, but he whips the bails off before appealing, confusing the umpire. So again, the excuse of blaming it on the loud noisy crowds for umpires missing nicks stands exposed. Dhawan c Bairstow b Rashid Khan 34(31) [4s-4]

Abhishek Sharma to Pant, SIX, and there's the insult rubbed in .. Pant's not messing around, staying his ground and for a change not over-hitting as he manages a lovely bat flow in slogging it over cow corner
Abhishek Sharma to Pant, SIX, more insult -- off a slice this time, over long-off. Neat bat swing, and a flat tonk

T Natarajan to Pant, leg byes, FOUR, 135kph, high full toss, and as if that weren't enough, he's dished out a filthy line heading down leg as well. Pant whips, or rather gets a thick chunk of his thigh pad, and it comfortably goes past the keeper

Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, SIX, 137kph, feeds a full toss in the arc at full pace. Well, well, it can't get easier. Hetmyer finds his arc, swinging and heaving over cow corner. This should break shackles
Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, SIX, picks the off-cutter for treatment here -- with Ahmed insisting on feeding it short, wide, and getting sliced uppishly over backward point

Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! One bobble, second pouch. Kumar - bringing all his experience into this - keeps it slow, outside off and forces Hetmyer to reach out and slice it to the longest part of the boundary at long-off. Doesn't matter, he'd miscued it alright as Pandey runs in from the boundary, and holds on with some help from his chest. So SRH finally are into their home territory of small defences, choking out teams at the death. Hetmyer c Manish Pandey b Bhuvneshwar 21(12) [6s-2]
Bhuvneshwar to Stoinis, FOUR, 122.6kph, back of a length, slow, but there's width, generous width. Stoinis stays on his back foot, and cuts away through point, beating third man comfortably

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, 120.2kph, whacks it alright. Kumar once again loses his line on the change of pace, keeping it short and wide outside off. Pant - for a change - doesn't commit early, waiting on it to slap it through sweeper

Rashid Khan to Pant, out Caught by Priyam Garg!! Rashid Khan, rare loop, rarer flight and a Rishabh Pant freaky sweep -- mix it, and a disaster's a certainty. So it starts with Pant premeditatingly shuffling across his stumps, Khan tossing it up on leg-stump, extracting bounce, getting the top-edge and going down deep square leg's throat. Pant c Priyam Garg b Rashid Khan 28(27) [4s-1 6s-2]

T Natarajan to Stoinis, out Lbw!! LBW reviewed compulsively with the knowledge that he's the last remaining batsman with the skill to stand up to this bully of a bowling attack. Natarajan keeps it the same, very full, on middle, and Stoinis in a hope to manufacture something funky out of this, shuffles across, misses his flick and finds himself plumb in front of middle. Yea, that's exactly what HawkEys also says - hitting the base of off in three reds, dark reds. Stoinis lbw b T Natarajan 11(9) [4s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Rabada, FOUR, 139.5kph, full toss. Rabada slices, has his bat turning in his palms, but still has enough in it to chip it over extra cover, and beat Rashid's sliding dive from sweeper

Khaleel Ahmed to Rabada, 2 runs, dropped -- and it's Manish Pandey of all people .. Rabada holds his pose on the one-kneed high-elbowed punch through the covers, which only finds long-off perfectly. Alas, too casual

Khaleel Ahmed to Axar, out Bowled!! Through him. A big hoick across the line, and not that he had much of a choice here did Patel, but clearly wasn't even close to the line, that manages to drift in through the air and come in with the angle to drag off the inside edge to leave an LED-lit mess behind. Axar b Khaleel Ahmed 5(6)

Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, FOUR, shot of the evening so far! A fuller length delivery that jagged back in a little, Dhawan charged out of his crease, gave himself some room and presented a straight bat in lifting it over the bowler's head. Balance and timing in sync and then he poses for the cameras too

Khaleel Ahmed to Rabada, SIX .. and he'll finally get his cover-chip-drive right, getting under this length and tonking it over long-off rather comfortably. Clearly SRH couldn't care less, in fact Warner's even celebrating while the ball's in trajectory

T Natarajan to Dhawan, FOUR, chipped over mid-on. Dances out of his crease without any trace of worry, converts it into a fullish delivery and holds his shape nicely. Hits it through the line and enough wood on it to get it sail over the fielder's head

Khaleel Ahmed to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan knows Iyer is biding his time, so he has to attack. Spots an overpitched delivery outside off, transfers his weight quickly forward and bashes it past cover. It was on the rise but just wide of the fielder and off it trickles away to the boundary
Khaleel Ahmed to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, a junk from Ahmed and Iyer says thanks. Strays on the pads, Iyer gets inside the line and tucks it very fine

T Natarajan to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, quality shot from Iyer. Made that look so easy. Natarajan pitches it up just outside off, Iyer stomps forward and lofts it magnificently over mid-off. He's getting a move on now

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Abdul Samad!! Goneeee! Just needed two balls to get a breakthrough. Iyer wasn't in his zone tonight. Wanted to slice it over extra cover, the bat face turned in his hands at the point of contact and as a result of which, he skies it to deep cover. Samad runs in, doesn't panic and grabs it. His first catch in IPL and DC have lost their second wicket. Rashid is thrilled. Shreyas Iyer c Abdul Samad b Rashid Khan 17(21) [4s-2]
Rashid Khan to Dhawan, FOUR, excellent execution of the sweep. Preempted, went down and predicted the bowler to pitch it on leg-stump. Swept it wide of short fine leg and Dhawan earns a boundary

Rabada to Warner, FOUR, nicely played, tad too full and at the stumps, Warner stays deep in the crease and then gets enough power on the lofted on-drive, clears mid-on with ease and bounces away to the ropes
Mishra to Bairstow, FOUR, cracking shot, dropped short and wide of off, Bairstow makes room and clatters the cut behind square on the off-side, no one moved

Axar to Bairstow, FOUR, brilliant placement! There is a long-on in place but Bairstow had got this well wide of that fielder who had no chance to cut it off. Bad ball from Axar though, too short and allowed Bairstow to sit back on the pull. He cleverly picked his spot

Mishra to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rabada!! Weird shot from Pandey!! He had just come in and this isn't the easiest of surfaces to start on. Looks to take Mishra on with the slog sweep but is done in flight and gets a top-edge that's pouched comfortably at deep mid-wicket. It's that longer part of the ground which undid MI yesterday in Dubai, and just like that here in Abu Dhabi, has taken out Pandey today. He was clutching his hamstring last over, so did that play a role in this shot? Either ways, DC aren't complaining. This is a fab phase for them. Manish Pandey c Rabada b Mishra 3(5)

Mishra to Williamson, 1 run, slight hesitation but they get the single as extra cover can't get across. Williamson drove this gently and wanted one from the outset but Bairstow was a bit unsure. It eventually goes down to long-off

Mishra to Williamson, FOUR, chipped over a leaping extra cover! Williamson was a bit in two minds as he played this, almost as an afterthought but did well to clear the infield eventually. Was looped wider outside off, and Williamson didn't really get to the pitch but went through with the stroke. Picked his gap well

Nortje to Williamson, FOUR, terrific placement! Fine leg and deep mid-wicket are the fielders on the leg-side boundary, so KW decides to ping that gap. Shuffles across early and gets inside the line to pull this short delivery that didn't rise as much to trouble Williamson

Nortje to Williamson, FOUR, what a shot! Mid-off up, the length had to be a tad short but Williamson is ready for it. Stands tall and flat-bats this wide of mid-off. Lovely connection and it's raced away. Much-needed momentum for SRH

Stoinis to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson is unleashing himself! Full and outside off, not the slower ball and Williamson is across the stumps in a flash to play his typical pickup stroke. Dhawan at deep backward square leg tried to get across but couldn't

Stoinis to Williamson, FOUR, he is toying around with the field! Makes room this time and although it's a hard length from Stoinis, Williamson biffs it over mid-on. Not a meaty connection but enough to clear the infield. What a gem of a knock this is turning out to be from the Kiwi in his first outing of the season

Rabada to Bairstow, 2 runs, fifty for Bairstow and also the 50-run stand! Terrific yorker from Rabada and Bairstow somehow digs this out between his legs, towards deep square leg. They run hard and though the second run was risky, JB is comfortably home. It's been an unconventional Bairstow innings so far, not that free-flowing but the crucial part is that he has adapted. Also a very handy partnership, this

Rabada to Bairstow, out Caught by Nortje!! You can't deny Rabada for long at the death. He thrives in these situations and has struck a vital blow here. Cross-seamer from Rabada, very full and Bairstow made room for the loft. Didn't get any timing whatsoever and absolutely sent this straight up into the night skies. We've seen many such ones dropped, but Nortje holds his composure and takes it near the deep mid-off region. Bairstow falls after an workman-like innings. Bairstow c Nortje b Rabada 53(48) [4s-2 6s-1]

Nortje to Abdul Samad, FOUR, top-edge but goes to the fence! Another attempted swipe across the line, this is short and pacy, and it's no surprise that young Samad is very late. Slices this way over the keeper and very fine down to third man fence. They all count

Nortje to Abdul Samad, SIX, he's got hold of this one! Wow! First signs of Samad's abilities. In the slot alright and he's pumped this high over wide long-on. Brute force and to do it against a bowler of Nortje's pace shows that the bloke has the talent for sure

Rabada to Williamson, out Caught by Axar!! Holes out to deep mid-wicket. Slower ball, wide outside off and Williamson has to really fetch this one. Looks to wrist this away but these are big dimensions on that part of the ground. Doesn't get the distance on the stroke and picks out the fielder to perfection. A priceless cameo from the NZ skipper though. Williamson c Axar b Rabada 41(26) [4s-5]

Stoinis to Warner, 1 run, a direct hit and even Warner's dive wouldn't have saved him - drilled the drive straight to extra-cover and set-off for a quick single - Shreyas Iyer was helped by some good bounce and has a shy at the bowler's end

Stoinis to Bairstow, leg byes, 1 run, appeal for LBW - Stoinis liked it and Shreyas points towards the review. Only the height is a matter of concern, looked pretty adjacent to the stumps. It's a fair delivery and there's no bat on that, UltraEdge confirms it. It's umpire's call on hitting the stumps, Bairstow survives. Short of a length and the ball skidded through after pitching, Bairstow was early into the pull and is beaten, struck high on the thigh-pad and the ball is only clipping the bails of middle

Nortje to Bairstow, 1 run, chance and Shreyas can't hold on - would have been a good catch had he held, the ball was always dying onto him, just got his fingertips, but the ball popped out. Bairstow is done in by the slowness of the pitch and is early into the shovel, lobbed off the inner half and towards mid-on

Nortje to Warner, SIX, cracking shot, Warner breaks the shackles at last - change of pace on this cutter from Nortje, but the length was wide of off - Warner bends down on his knees and pumps the drive over cover - went a long way over the ropes for a maximum

Nortje to Warner, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Warner - this was a streaky one though, short of a length and on off, he was hopping across on the pull, gets an inside edge onto the thigh-pad and it rolls away to the third man ropes
Mishra to Bairstow, SIX, clubbed, nicely tossed up outside off, Bairstow gets down on his knees, picks the length early and plays the slog sweep over mid-wicket - hard, flat and over the ropes

Mishra to Warner, 2 runs, good running from Warner, nudged a well flighted delivery in front of mid-wicket and the call was always for the second run - Bairstow responded and they complete it with ease

Ishant to Warner, SIX, lovely, the slower ball from Ishant, but it's too full and right under Warner's arc - he clears his left leg and drills it back over the umpire's head, has enough power to sail over the ropes for a maximum
Mishra to Warner, FOUR, Warner sets himself up for the reverse sweep, gets a bottom edge and the ball runs fine, past Shaw at short third man and beats his chase to the ropes

Mishra to Warner, out Caught by Pant!! Another attempted reverse sweep and Pant reckons there was some glove on that. The Capitals have reviewed the caught behind call. This looks close, think Warner might be in trouble, looked like a feather on the glove. UltraEdge in and there's a minor spike when the ball is past Warner's gloves. That's enough for the third umpire to overturn the original call. Warner is OUT. Think it's a fair decision from the third umpire, Chris Gaffaney. The spike wasn't huge, but there seemed to be a deviation when the ball went past the gloves - Warner was attempting the reverse sweep to one that drifted across him - caught the glove and Pant stood low to hold on. A wicket against the run of play, the dangerous Warner departs. Warner c Pant b Mishra 45(33) [4s-3 6s-2]

Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, SIX, has that gone the distance? Yeah, of course, it has! Right into the slot around off, slightly up, Shubman Gill shuffles a touch in the crease, gets underneath the length and clubs it over long-on for the first big one of this evening in Dubai

Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Tewatia gets Rana. A floated delivery around off, Nitish Rana looks to take on Rahul Tewatia and fails in his quest to clear long-off. Lofts it high up in the air, but fails to get the distance. It's Riyan Parag who completes a safe catch in the deep. This has been the problem with Rana this season. He's getting those starts, but he's not really able to convert them. Nitish Rana c Riyan Parag b Rahul Tewatia 22(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, Archer is disappointed with himself. Overpitched flighted delivery and Gill drills the drive straight down the ground, Archer gets across from long-on and tries to stop it with one hand, the ball does not stick

Jofra Archer to Shubman Gill, out Caught&Bowled!! And Archer strikes. He was brought back to take out Russell but Rajasthan won't mind this. The set batsman departs and it is two new batsmen out in the middle. 140.5kph back of a length delivery angled in to the right hander, Gill is a tad early into his flick and the leading edge balloons up, Archer calls for it and tumbles backwards as he completes the catch. Shubman Gill c and b Jofra Archer 47(34) [4s-5 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Russell, SIX, there he goes! First of the night for Dre Russ. Googly and Russell was waiting for it, it landed right in his arc and he went down on his knee to bludgeon it over cow corner

Shreyas Gopal to Russell, SIX, number 2! Gopal is erring in line and Russell is not one to miss out. This one drifts in on leg-stump, Russell clears his front leg and muscles it flat over deep mid-wicket. The fielder was left as a spectator

Jofra Archer to Karthik, out Caught by Buttler!! Archer is on fire. This is a jaffa to remove the KKR captain. A typical Archer wicket. Pounds it hard at 147.3kph on back of a length and gets it to straighten a tad, just a tad and Karthik ended up playing the wrong line, the outside edge settled nicely into Buttler's mitts. Karthik c Buttler b Jofra Archer 1(3)
Rajpoot to Russell, SIX, this is a buffet delivery for Russell. He is just waiting for that length - back of a length, he waits for the ball to arrive and pumps it flat over deep mid-wicket. Six #3!

Rajpoot to Russell, out Caught by Unadkat!! And gone! Rajasthan have their man. Russell cannot believe it as he walks back with both his hand along with the bat over his head. KKR in trouble now with half the side back in the dugout. There was a plan and Rajpoot has bowled to it. Third man was up, deep backward point was in place and a deep extra cover. Rajpoot went for the wide yorker and even nailed it, Russell bends down and slices it straight to Unadkat at deep backward point. That was right off the meat but the long boundaries did not help him there. Russell c Unadkat b Rajpoot 24(14) [6s-3]

Jofra Archer to Cummins, FOUR, first boundary conceded by Archer. 121.4kph back of a length delivery, Cummins had the width to work with and he times the pants off this backfoot punch, sweeper was not on the boundary line and he is not able to cut the angle as the ball races away to the fence

Jofra Archer to Morgan, SIX, oh no! Curran has palmed it over the rope. Short and angled across the left hander, Morgan uses the space on offer to play the upper cut to deep backward point, Curran runs across and he is thinking of parrying the ball in even before catching it, in the end he allows it to slip past his grasp

Tom Curran to Morgan, FOUR, Morgan is switching gears now. But he is aided by Curran here. Juicy full toss outside off, Morgan moves across and slaps it over extra cover, no chance for the sweeper cover

Tom Curran to Cummins, out Caught by Samson!! Wow! Has Samson hurt his head? Landed badly on it. Slower short ball and Cummins takes it on, he miscues the pull to deep backward square, Samson misjudges it slightly as he overruns it but adjusts well to leap up and take it over his head, he tumbles backwards and that's when he hits his head onto the ground. Seems to be fine.. Cummins c Samson b Tom Curran 12(10) [4s-1]
Rajpoot to K Nagarkoti, 1 run, full and close to yorker length, Nagarkoti jams it out to long-on

Rajpoot to K Nagarkoti, FOUR, that's poor planning by Rajpoot. With mid-off inside the ring he dishes out a half volley outside off, Nagarkoti just needs to clear the infield and he does that quite comfortably, well over Smith and the ball races away to the fence

Tom Curran to Morgan, SIX, and he's got the distance. It was in the air for a long time but he had made enough connection to beat deep mid-wicket. Slower short of length delivery and it sat up nicely, Morgan shuffles across and heaves it with a clean bat swing

Unadkat to Narine, 1 run, dropped! The ex KKR player has done them a favour. Narine could have been dismissed for a duck, but he has been given a life by Uthappa. Got deceived due to the slower one and ended up chipping it towards mid-on where the fielder puts down a dolly as he tries to reverse cup it

Rajpoot to Narine, FOUR, four runs! Will he make them pay for that dropped catch? A back of length delivery by Rajpoot and Narine heaves it through mid-wicket as the fielder in the deep fails to stop it even after his dive, parrying it away to the boundary

Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, FOUR, short and punished! I mean it wasn't all that short, but Shubman Gill is quick to pick the length. Treks back in the crease does the opener and slams it through mid-wicket, that's four more! Rajpoot proving to be slightly expensive

Unadkat to Narine, SIX, that shall give him some confidence. Or rather, a lot of it. He's a confidence player. Picks the bones out of this slower delivery and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen

Unadkat to Narine, FOUR, each and every run will hurt Uthappa. A short of a length delivery around off, Narine reaches out for it and punches it through covers as he beats the fielder's dive inside the ring

Unadkat to Narine, out Bowled!! Oh yeah, Robbie will be a relieved man! His prayers have worked, and the dropped catch hasn't cost much. Unadkat sticks to his slower ones and he has managed to knock down Narine. Rolled his fingers, pitched this one on a good length. Narine like always, swings and misses. Failed to get him in his previous over, but has managed to get his man eventually. First wicket for Unadkat this season. Narine b Unadkat 15(14) [4s-2 6s-1]

Tom Curran to Nitish Rana, FOUR, finally Nitish Rana gets off the mark. Was waiting for a loose delivery and he has latched onto it with both hands. Throws the kitchen sink at this short and wide ball and cuts it over backward point as the fielder in the deep couldn't do nothing about it

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, a half-tracker by Shreyas Gopal and it has spoiled the over for him. Was proving to be quite economical till then. Gill rocks back in his crease and hammers the pull as it beats the sprinter at deep mid-wicket. Bowled well against Rana, but not so well against Gill

Riyan Parag to Nitish Rana, SIX, Rana welcomes Riyan Parag with a maximum. A loopy delivery around off and the shouthpaw has lofted it over wide long-off with impeccable timing, looked a six the moment he connnected that
Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, such an artist! This was darted around middle and leg, Shubman Gill waits for it to arrive and heaves it into the huge gap at deep mid-wicket

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, smashed down the ground! Shubman Gill into his 40s as he makes sure to make the bowler pay for pitching this one up. Played it straight as an arrow as the fielder at long-on couldn't get there
Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Samson dives at deep point, but this kept curving away from him. Was a short ball again and Nitish Rana's square-cut fetched him four runs

Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, SIX, has that gone the distance? Yeah, of course, it has! Right into the slot around off, slightly up, Shubman Gill shuffles a touch in the crease, gets underneath the length and clubs it over long-on for the first big one of this evening in Dubai

Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Tewatia gets Rana. A floated delivery around off, Nitish Rana looks to take on Rahul Tewatia and fails in his quest to clear long-off. Lofts it high up in the air, but fails to get the distance. It's Riyan Parag who completes a safe catch in the deep. This has been the problem with Rana this season. He's getting those starts, but he's not really able to convert them. Nitish Rana c Riyan Parag b Rahul Tewatia 22(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, Archer is disappointed with himself. Overpitched flighted delivery and Gill drills the drive straight down the ground, Archer gets across from long-on and tries to stop it with one hand, the ball does not stick

Jofra Archer to Shubman Gill, out Caught&Bowled!! And Archer strikes. He was brought back to take out Russell but Rajasthan won't mind this. The set batsman departs and it is two new batsmen out in the middle. 140.5kph back of a length delivery angled in to the right hander, Gill is a tad early into his flick and the leading edge balloons up, Archer calls for it and tumbles backwards as he completes the catch. Shubman Gill c and b Jofra Archer 47(34) [4s-5 6s-1]

Shreyas Gopal to Russell, SIX, there he goes! First of the night for Dre Russ. Googly and Russell was waiting for it, it landed right in his arc and he went down on his knee to bludgeon it over cow corner

Shreyas Gopal to Russell, SIX, number 2! Gopal is erring in line and Russell is not one to miss out. This one drifts in on leg-stump, Russell clears his front leg and muscles it flat over deep mid-wicket. The fielder was left as a spectator

Jofra Archer to Karthik, out Caught by Buttler!! Archer is on fire. This is a jaffa to remove the KKR captain. A typical Archer wicket. Pounds it hard at 147.3kph on back of a length and gets it to straighten a tad, just a tad and Karthik ended up playing the wrong line, the outside edge settled nicely into Buttler's mitts. Karthik c Buttler b Jofra Archer 1(3)
Rajpoot to Russell, SIX, this is a buffet delivery for Russell. He is just waiting for that length - back of a length, he waits for the ball to arrive and pumps it flat over deep mid-wicket. Six #3!

Rajpoot to Russell, out Caught by Unadkat!! And gone! Rajasthan have their man. Russell cannot believe it as he walks back with both his hand along with the bat over his head. KKR in trouble now with half the side back in the dugout. There was a plan and Rajpoot has bowled to it. Third man was up, deep backward point was in place and a deep extra cover. Rajpoot went for the wide yorker and even nailed it, Russell bends down and slices it straight to Unadkat at deep backward point. That was right off the meat but the long boundaries did not help him there. Russell c Unadkat b Rajpoot 24(14) [6s-3]

Jofra Archer to Cummins, FOUR, first boundary conceded by Archer. 121.4kph back of a length delivery, Cummins had the width to work with and he times the pants off this backfoot punch, sweeper was not on the boundary line and he is not able to cut the angle as the ball races away to the fence

Jofra Archer to Morgan, SIX, oh no! Curran has palmed it over the rope. Short and angled across the left hander, Morgan uses the space on offer to play the upper cut to deep backward point, Curran runs across and he is thinking of parrying the ball in even before catching it, in the end he allows it to slip past his grasp

Tom Curran to Morgan, FOUR, Morgan is switching gears now. But he is aided by Curran here. Juicy full toss outside off, Morgan moves across and slaps it over extra cover, no chance for the sweeper cover

Tom Curran to Cummins, out Caught by Samson!! Wow! Has Samson hurt his head? Landed badly on it. Slower short ball and Cummins takes it on, he miscues the pull to deep backward square, Samson misjudges it slightly as he overruns it but adjusts well to leap up and take it over his head, he tumbles backwards and that's when he hits his head onto the ground. Seems to be fine.. Cummins c Samson b Tom Curran 12(10) [4s-1]
Rajpoot to K Nagarkoti, 1 run, full and close to yorker length, Nagarkoti jams it out to long-on

Rajpoot to K Nagarkoti, FOUR, that's poor planning by Rajpoot. With mid-off inside the ring he dishes out a half volley outside off, Nagarkoti just needs to clear the infield and he does that quite comfortably, well over Smith and the ball races away to the fence

Tom Curran to Morgan, SIX, and he's got the distance. It was in the air for a long time but he had made enough connection to beat deep mid-wicket. Slower short of length delivery and it sat up nicely, Morgan shuffles across and heaves it with a clean bat swing

Unadkat to Narine, 1 run, dropped! The ex KKR player has done them a favour. Narine could have been dismissed for a duck, but he has been given a life by Uthappa. Got deceived due to the slower one and ended up chipping it towards mid-on where the fielder puts down a dolly as he tries to reverse cup it

Rajpoot to Narine, FOUR, four runs! Will he make them pay for that dropped catch? A back of length delivery by Rajpoot and Narine heaves it through mid-wicket as the fielder in the deep fails to stop it even after his dive, parrying it away to the boundary

Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, FOUR, short and punished! I mean it wasn't all that short, but Shubman Gill is quick to pick the length. Treks back in the crease does the opener and slams it through mid-wicket, that's four more! Rajpoot proving to be slightly expensive

Unadkat to Narine, SIX, that shall give him some confidence. Or rather, a lot of it. He's a confidence player. Picks the bones out of this slower delivery and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen

Unadkat to Narine, FOUR, each and every run will hurt Uthappa. A short of a length delivery around off, Narine reaches out for it and punches it through covers as he beats the fielder's dive inside the ring

Unadkat to Narine, out Bowled!! Oh yeah, Robbie will be a relieved man! His prayers have worked, and the dropped catch hasn't cost much. Unadkat sticks to his slower ones and he has managed to knock down Narine. Rolled his fingers, pitched this one on a good length. Narine like always, swings and misses. Failed to get him in his previous over, but has managed to get his man eventually. First wicket for Unadkat this season. Narine b Unadkat 15(14) [4s-2 6s-1]

Tom Curran to Nitish Rana, FOUR, finally Nitish Rana gets off the mark. Was waiting for a loose delivery and he has latched onto it with both hands. Throws the kitchen sink at this short and wide ball and cuts it over backward point as the fielder in the deep couldn't do nothing about it

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, a half-tracker by Shreyas Gopal and it has spoiled the over for him. Was proving to be quite economical till then. Gill rocks back in his crease and hammers the pull as it beats the sprinter at deep mid-wicket. Bowled well against Rana, but not so well against Gill

Riyan Parag to Nitish Rana, SIX, Rana welcomes Riyan Parag with a maximum. A loopy delivery around off and the shouthpaw has lofted it over wide long-off with impeccable timing, looked a six the moment he connnected that
Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, such an artist! This was darted around middle and leg, Shubman Gill waits for it to arrive and heaves it into the huge gap at deep mid-wicket

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, FOUR, smashed down the ground! Shubman Gill into his 40s as he makes sure to make the bowler pay for pitching this one up. Played it straight as an arrow as the fielder at long-on couldn't get there
Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Samson dives at deep point, but this kept curving away from him. Was a short ball again and Nitish Rana's square-cut fetched him four runs

Boult to Agarwal, FOUR, if the idea was to surprise Agarwal first ball with a short one, it hasn't worked. He's in position quickly, leaning back, hitting the pull over square leg. Did take the eyes off it eventually, but still got it crack off the middle

Boult to Rahul, FOUR, the short ball didn't work against Agarwal.. it almost did against Rahul. Hits him high on the bat as he pulls. No control as it flies to the left of Krunal but he can't get to it at long leg
Pattinson to Agarwal, FOUR, backs away, receives one that is pounded in on short of length and slaps it over cover. Some form these blokes are carrying, and the confidence is on show

Rahul Chahar to Pooran, leg byes, 1 run, Pooran tried to slog-sweep the googly and missed, luckily the ball pitched outside leg stump. Mumbai needlessly reviewed, only to lose. QdK was blinded by the batsman, so he couldn't tell the full story
Rahul Chahar to Pooran, SIX, Nic Pooran in the house folks! Back in his crease as he tonks the short ball over long-on for a huge six

Bumrah to Pooran, FOUR, harmless short of length delivery, sits up nicely, Pooran powers off the back foot over mid-wicket. He's keeping them in the game big time. Mumbai will want to hunt him down quickly

Pattinson to Pooran, 2 runs, in the airrr, Hardik Pandya can't get there. Pooran sliced this lofted drive as Pattinson floated a full one, looked like pace off that, Hardik had a lot of ground to cover, he had to skate to get there

Pattinson to Pooran, out Caught by de Kock!! A game of angles, nothing else folks. You would think how on earth did a set batsman of Pooran's ability not muscle that juicy full ball over the ropes. but there's a lot on the technical side in this game. Pooran took the invitation without knowing there was trap, he swung too hard and lost a bit of shape which is why he couldn't find the middle. Edge to QdK who takes a simple catch. A lot of times people wonder why Cottrell and not Jordan in a team. It's all about the angles. Left-arm angle to right-handeed batsman isn't all that easy. Pooran c de Kock b Pattinson 44(27) [4s-3 6s-2]

Rahul Chahar to Maxwell, out Caught by Boult!! Okay it's so simple. If you have a leggie in your team, make him bowl into the wicket/not too full and get it to turn outside off stump, Maxwell can't resist slogging across the line, unfortuanly the bat keeps turning in his hands and he slices them. This had a lot of height as he tried to fetch a pull shot, Boult moved a few paces forward and catches it. Maxwell c Boult b Rahul Chahar 11(18)

Bumrah to Neesham, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Caught off a high full toss, they are checking but it's just below the waist and a legal delivery. When it's not your day even the full toss go to fielders. Neesham wanted to smash over mid-wicket, miscued it high and actually a good grab running back from backward point over his right shoulder.Neesham c Suryakumar Yadav b Bumrah 7(7)
Boult to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, now that makes a lot of sense, third man is in, third man Sarfaraz plays the reverse slog and connects really well. Clears the infield and it's a boundary

Pattinson to Sarfaraz Khan, out Lbw!! That's a toe-crusher at the base of leg stump. Sarfaraz couldn't get that away with the attempted flick shot, ump raised the finger. Batsman reviewed, but he knew he was a goner. Sarfaraz Khan lbw b Pattinson 7(8) [4s-1]

Boult to Ravi Bishnoi, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! SKY has been really busy in the last few minutes. Full and into the sticks, Bishnoi actually squeezed that well, but hit it straight to backward point. The fielding show should lift SKY after the run-out today. Ravi Bishnoi c Suryakumar Yadav b Boult 1(5)
Boult to Gowtham, FOUR, sliced with one hand, full and outside off stump, pace off, so Gowtham was deceived but he went through with the loft, clears short third man
Boult to Gowtham, SIX, in the airrr and just over Pollard at long-off. Boult went full and outside off stump, Gowtham toe-ended the loft, Pollard jumped on the boundary but it evaded him
Bumrah to Gowtham, FOUR, short delivery, Gowtham backs away and guides, gets it fine and over the keeper
Boult to Agarwal, FOUR, proper batting from a proper batsman. Short of length outside off, Agarwal waits long enough on it as he steers the ball fine to beat Hardik at deep backward point

Bumrah to Agarwal, out Bowled!! Castled! Massive breakthrough as Bumrah goes right through a dangerous Agarwal. Pitched right up, finds movement off the seam as it comes in off the deck. Agarwal hadn't bargained for it. He threw his hands on the drive without any footwork. It's a shot you play on a flat pitch. This, however, has something in it. Bowls him through the gate. Agarwal b Bumrah 25(18) [4s-3]

Krunal Pandya to Nair, out Bowled!! Nair chops on! He attempts to cut this ball away from close to off stump but never has enough room to do so, despite his effort of stepping into the leg-side. The length isn't all that short either. Been up and down the order in this tournament, and this duck will only add to the pressure. Nair b Krunal Pandya 0(3)
Krunal Pandya to Pooran, SIX, this is why Krunal was afraid to get anything close to him. The slog-sweep has gone miles. Pooran shuffles across, fetches it from a length outside off and finishes it
Krunal Pandya to Pooran, FOUR, wide yorker outside off, runs away for four off the outside edge. One of the pitfalls with Krunal firing them in. No chance for short third man

Rahul Chahar to Rahul, out Bowled!! Rahul steps across to paddle sweep and is bowled behind his legs. Oh what a massive wicket. Just went too far and then missed it, getting done by the pace at which this skidded through. Probably only clips the leg bail, but that's all it had to do. Mumbai in control now. Rahul b Rahul Chahar 17(19) [4s-1]
Pattinson to Pooran, FOUR, what a response. Flays this through backward point. And it's not all that short either. But the width is there from Pattinson and Pooran jumps all over it

Cottrell to de Kock, out Bowled!! Cleans him up, right through everything. It's that pre-covid-Starc dismissal -- which Quinton's looking to whip against the outswing. Clearly he's in no position to connect, but Cottrell's perfectly in position and pose in his salute. de Kock b Cottrell 0(5)
Shami to Rohit, FOUR, absolute overcook outside off. Sharma leans, drives, and creams it through the covers to help himself past 5000 IPL runs
Shami to Rohit, FOUR, now the back-footed punch, typically Rohit, standing on the bounce, arching behind and nailing this between point and cover

Ravi Bishnoi to Ishan Kishan, SIX, that's into the stands! A loopy delivery around middle, Ishan Kishan shuffles across, goes down on his knee and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for a massive six. 84 metre maximum that!
Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit, 1 run, 50-run stand up as Rohit nudges the shortish delivery through mid-wicket for one. Need to up the ante now that both the batsmen have got their eye in

Neesham to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, dropped by Bishnoi at deep mid-wicket. Ishan Kishan had completely mistimed the pull shot, but the fielder running in couldn't latch onto the catch. Was a good effort to get there with a sprint, just that the end result wasn't in the fielder's favour. Was a short ball that induced a top-edge

Gowtham to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Nair!! Ishan Kishan's struggle comes to an end. Probably, a blessing in disguise for Mumbai Indians. Time for Pollard and the Pandya brothers to take charge from here on. Was down on his knee to play the slogsweep as Kishan finds the man at deep mid-wicket. Two contrasting knocks for Kishan then. 99 the other night, and only 28 tonight. More importantly, he has used up too many deliveries in this innings. Ishan Kishan c Nair b Gowtham 28(32) [4s-1 6s-1]
Ravi Bishnoi to Pollard, SIX, how easy was that for him? Stands tall and nonchalantly lofts the tossed up googly over long-on for half-a-dozen. Pressure on the young wrist spinner

Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit, SIX, got out to a half-tracker in the previous game, but not this time. Rocks back and manages to beat the fielder at deep mid-wicket by quite some distance. Wasn't in complete control of this pull, but the timing was good enough to go the distance, and it was also the shorter boundary that he targeted

Neesham to Rohit, FOUR, fifty for the Mumbai skipper and he gets there with a boundary. 5000 runs earlier in the day, and now a good fifty-plus innings. Premeditates this one and scoops the full toss towards the fine leg fence. Almost cleared the boundary there
Neesham to Rohit, FOUR, time to roll! Full toss around off and it has been creamed past the diving man at extra cover, no stopping that

Neesham to Rohit, SIX, yeah, that's what I was talking about! So pleasing to the eyes. Short ball around middle and leg, "Rohit has more than a second to spot the length," as Kohli says. Doesn't even need to transfer his weight as he pulls it over deep square leg. 86 metres!
Neesham to Rohit, SIX, such a talent! Goes inside out, plays with the field and lofts the pitched up delivery over deep extra cover. Raining sixes in Abu Dhabi!

Shami to Rohit, out Caught by Neesham!! Tag-team effort by Maxwell and Neesham has helped Punjab get rid of the Hitman. Maxwell did all the hard work there, but Neesham makes sure that his effort isn't in vain. Was lofted towards long-off by Rohit as Maxy grabbed it and just when he was about to overhaul the boundary, he parried it to Neesham who was charging across from long-on. Shami has been the strike bowler for Punjab this season, and here's why. Rohit c Neesham b Shami 70(45) [4s-8 6s-3]

Shami to Pollard, no run, Pollard reviews! He was adjudged lbw here by the umpire, but he has straight away signaled for a review. Think there was some bat on it, as I look at the replays. Was a low full toss on leg that Pollard failed to middle. Luckily for him there was some bat on it. So the onfield decision has to be overturned. The original decision was out, hence although he got some bat on it, it will be called as a dead ball

Neesham to Hardik Pandya, SIX, stand and deliver! Short of a length delivery around off, Hardik Pandya reads the length early and lofts it over the leaping Maxwell at long-on. He can attack right from the word 'go', hence he's so crucial towards these later stages
Neesham to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, no stopping that! Backs away, manufactures room and whacks the shortish delivery at he manages to beat the fielder at deep extra cover this time around

Neesham to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Punjab leaking runs towards the closing stages. Their bowlers are running out of ideas. This was slightly wide outside off and Hardik Pandya slams it through deep extra cover for another scintillating boundary. Neesham stands there in disbelief
Shami to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, a short and wide ball with third man inside the ring? Hardik Pandya is not going to miss out on those as he plays an upper cut and finds the fence at square third man

Shami to Pollard, FOUR, that's an edge, but it won't matter. Was a really full ball around off, seaming away from Pollard who goes at it with hard hands. As the ball shapes away from him, it takes an outside edge and runs past the man at short third man
Shami to Pollard, FOUR, slammed! Goes deep in his crease and pulls the short ball to the deep mid-wicket fence with that meaty swing of his
Shami to Pollard, FOUR, 19 runs off the 19th over. A full toss to end the over as Pollard flicks it over square leg. The fielder was inside the ring, hence Polly will get four more

Gowtham to Hardik Pandya, SIX, the last ball he smacked back to the bowler, but this one he has smacked out of the park. Right into the slot around middle as Hardik Pandya smokes it over deep mid-wicket. High and handsome!
Gowtham to Pollard, SIX, the carnage continues! Pitched up by Gowtham, and although it was wide - Pollard manages to reach for it as he tonks it right over the bowler's head, and into the sightscreen
Gowtham to Pollard, SIX, 97 metre six! A floated delivery around middle and leg, Pollard gets under it and clubs it over deep mid-wicket for six more

Shami to Rohit, no run, Mumbai review this given LBW: Full, straightening back in off the pitch, and Rohit's trapped on the front pad in his crease. But, but, the impact's in front of leg-stump, and ball-tracking shows it to be going down leg. False alarm, and Rohit will stay there
Cottrell to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, perfect cover drill -- big plonk in front, leaning through the line, still head, high elbows and the fullest of bat-faces in bisecting the two men out there
Cottrell to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, and the covers again. It wasn't all that full, and Yadav's going through with what's more a punch this time, and the rest is the same (2.4)
Gowtham to Pollard, SIX, vintage Pollard finishes off the innings in style. A hat-trick of sixes for the big man as he bludgeons this one over the bowler's head. Mumbai end with 191/4

Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit, out Suryakumar Yadav Run Out!! Direct hit, and Punjab are already celebrating. Yadav clearly underestimates Shami - the short fine leg - as Rohit's sweep goes to his right and decides to take his aim and his arm on with the quick single. Yea, nothing helps when it's a direct hit, not even a full stretch, and just like that, Surya finds himself run-out for the second time in these four games. Suryakumar Yadav run out (Shami) 10(7) [4s-2]

Cottrell to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, carved over cover, which Pooran chases and appears to have pulled back at the boundary. But no, he isn't all that good, for when his fingers are on the ball, his elbow's on the rope
Gowtham to Rohit, FOUR, jumps away, gives himself room and punches against the spin. That's not the fun part. The fun starts when this seeming push ends up splitting mid-off and extra cover. Wow
Gowtham to Rohit, FOUR, there's no point, literally. But Gowtham dishes out width off a shortened length and allows Sharma to go behind and cut it square
Neesham to Rohit, FOUR, leg-cutter. Seams away. Rohit gets squared, and edges it straight to first slip. Well, well. There's no first slip, and third man can't come around either
Shami to Rohit, 1 run, bodyline, swatted round the corner

Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit, FOUR, delicately cut late. Cute. Bishnoi gives it some flight, but then gets it to dip short and wide allowing Sharma a rock behind and a carve between point and short third man

Abdul Samad to Dhoni, FOUR, stand and deliver! A tossed up delivery by Abdul Samad, goes a touch full and Dhoni slams it past the bowler. Abdul Samad hardly had any time to react, but believe me, had he got his hands to it, he could've been seriously injured. It was hit so hard!

T Natarajan to Jadeja, FOUR, and that shall release some pressure! T Natarajan in his quest for the yorker, bowls a low full toss and Jadeja makes full use of it. Times his flick to perfection and manages to find the fence at deep square leg

Abdul Samad to Jadeja, SIX, here we go! Jadeja is down the wicket as he tonks the tossed up delivery over long-on for a 84 metre six. There was a fielder sprinting across in the deep, but this cleared him comfortably..

Rashid Khan to Jadeja, leg byes, 1 run, SRH review. It's a referral against Jadeja for an lbw. But I think this was sliding down the leg side, and Hyderabad will lose their review in that case.. As I look at the replays, it's pitching outside leg as well. Jadeja tried to whip it through the on side, but couldn't connect it..

Rashid Khan to Dhoni, FOUR, and this time he has managed to beat that fielder, has MSD. Was a half-tracker by Rashid Khan and the CSK skipper has timed his pull and placed it into the gap at deep square leg
Bhuvneshwar to Jadeja, FOUR, edged, but safe! Short of a length on leg, Jadeja swings across the line and gets a under-edge that dips in front of Bairstow, beats his dive and finds the fence

Bhuvneshwar to Jadeja, FOUR, 50-run stand up for the fifth wicket! Bhuvneshwar immediately has a change in the field. Goes short and Jadeja makes sure to send it away to the fence. Hooks it over the fielder at short fine leg for four more..

Bhuvneshwar to Jadeja, FOUR, that's a hat-trick of boundaries. Spears a full ball down the leg side and Jadeja has glanced it away to the fine leg fence. Just had to get a faint tickle, which Jaddu managed to pull off..

T Natarajan to Jadeja, FOUR, dropped by Pandey! That was a tough chance, but you can expect Manish to take those. That's the standard he sets in the field. Was a full ball by Natarajan and Jadeja miscued his loft towards deep mid-off where he was put down. The ball was eventually parried away to the fence
T Natarajan to Jadeja, SIX, fifty for Jadeja! Please move him up the order. A full toss on leg and the southpaw heaves it over deep square leg as he brings out a rather tired sword celebration

T Natarajan to Jadeja, out Caught by Abdul Samad!! Jadeja departs after an enterprising knock. Gets a short ball to have a go after and he has swung it straight to Samad at deep square leg. Looked a slightly tired shot, but he has made up for that strike rate. Was struggling initially, but this innings will give him some confidence going forward. Jadeja c Abdul Samad b T Natarajan 50(35) [4s-5 6s-2]

T Natarajan to Sam Curran, SIX, that's the first ball Sam Curran's facing and he has struck the biggest six of the night. A short ball by Natarajan and Sam Curran pulls it over deep square leg as it goes deep into the stands. WoW!

Khaleel Ahmed to Dhoni, FOUR, "that's a terrible misfield," reckons Slater on air. Dhoni slogs the length ball towards deep mid-wicket where Samad charges in, takes his eyes off the ball as he tries to grab the ball, and makes complete mess of it..
Khaleel Ahmed to Dhoni, SIX, so the break has helped. It has helped him regain his focus. Picks the bones out of this slower short ball and thumps it over deep mid-wicket for a flat six
Abdul Samad to Dhoni, FOUR, and the equation is down to 17 off 4 balls! A tossed up delivery by Abdul Samad and Dhoni has smashed it right past the bowler, it's four more..

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, out Bowled!! Chopped on - Have to say this was coming, Watson was never at home against Bhuvneshwar - short of a length and just outside off, a flat-footed Watson aimed at the cut, cramped for room - all he managed was a big inside edge, the ball bounced back onto the off-stump and the lightened up bails signals Watson's sorry exit. CSK have once again lost an early wicket in this season's tournament. Watson b Bhuvneshwar 1(6)

Abdul Samad to Sam Curran, SIX, the last ball of the match has gone the distance! But, Chennai Super Kings face their third straight loss after winning the tournament opener. Gets to the pitch of the delivery does Sam Curran and thumps it right over the bowler's head for half-a-dozen!
T Natarajan to Rayudu, FOUR, Rayudu is up and away, low full-toss and he has whipped it past mid-wicket - the man at deep square leg has no chance - a boundary to break the shackles for CSK

Khaleel Ahmed to du Plessis, FOUR, smashed, CSK need to get going and du Plessis will start playing his shots - came down the track and drilled this short ball wide of cover - Warner gives chase, but he was always coming second best

Khaleel Ahmed to du Plessis, FOUR, cheeky and four, a pre-meditated paddle from du Plessis, got down low, waited on the ball and then scooped it over fine leg's head, the fielder was inside the ring and has no chance

T Natarajan to Rayudu, out Bowled!! A peach and the in-form Rayudu has been sent packing. Lapse in concentration? Could be the case, but this was a cracker of a delivery from the Tamil Nadu pacer - hit the deck hard around leg and then seamed away sharply - Rayudu was completely opened up as he looked to tuck, past the closed the bat-face and the ball went on to hit the top of off-stump. A dream dismissal for any left-arm pacer. Rayudu b T Natarajan 8(9) [4s-1]

T Natarajan to du Plessis, FOUR, clubbed, excellent use of the feet from du Plessis, waited until the ball left Natarajan's hand, shimmied down the track and then lifted it back over the umpire's head for a boundary

T Natarajan to du Plessis, FOUR, change of tactics from du Plessis - he's going to be the aggressor - came down the track, Natarajan responded by bowling short and wide - du Plessis uses his reach and thwacks it back over the umpire's head for another boundary

T Natarajan to Kedar Jadhav, out du Plessis Run Out!! A direct hit would have definitely run du Plessis OUT, but is he still short? Great work from Bairstow as he pushed the ball at the stumps. du Plessis is definitely short, but was it the ball hitting the stumps or did Bairstow break the stumps without the ball in his hand? Actually, the ball slipped out of his hands, but think it inadvertently went on to hit the stumps. OUT is the call. That's a massive blow for the Super Kings - the in-form du Plessis has been sent packing. Never a run there and Kedar must cop the blame for it - tucked it to the right of mid-wicket and set-off for a single. Garg was quick on the ball and has a shy at the striker's end - he missed, but Bairstow was covering for the throw. The ball did slip out of his hands, but luckily for him, it fell onto the stumps. Either way, du Plessis was well short. Replays suggest that du Plessis didn't really sense the danger first-up, was a bit slow to start and by the time he realised his mistake, it was all too late. du Plessis run out (Priyam Garg/Bairstow) 22(19) [4s-4]

Abdul Samad to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Warner!! Chennai in trouble as they've lost almost half of their side. Abdul Samad strikes in his first over. Played a handy cameo a few days ago and strikes right away today. Tempts the batsman with a loopy legbreak around off and Kedar chips it straight to the SRH skipper at covers. Good reflexes shown by Warner as he completes the catch and isn't he delighted? Kedar Jadhav c Warner b Abdul Samad 3(10)

Chahar to Bairstow, out Bowled!! Gets him with a peach of an inswinger. Full and swinging in towards middle and off, Bairstow looks to flick over mid-wicket and plays all around it. Gets completely beaten by the inward movement and the woodwork is all over the place.Bairstow b Chahar 0(3)
Chahar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, edged and four! Full away swinger and draws Manish Pandey into a drive away from the body, Pandey goes hard and the edge goes flying down to the third man fence

Sam Curran to Manish Pandey, FOUR, anything pitched up and Manish Pandey is not gonna let it go scot-free. Maintains solid base and crunches the loft over mid-off, Sam Curran's pace takes care of the rest
Chawla to Warner, FOUR, lovely placement from Warner! Gives himself a bit of room and sits on one knee to pull this short ball in the gap between deep mid-wicket and deep square

Chawla to Warner, out Caught by du Plessis!! Faf is making a habit of pulling off these boundary-flirting catches and he makes it look so easy. Warner is disappointed and he knew he was in trouble from the moment it left the bat. Huge wicket for CSK. Warner danced down the track and perhaps got a little too close to the pitch of the delivery, miscues the loft off the toe-end, it did seem like going for a maximum but there's always a risk involved when you take on a fielder like Faf. He Leaps up full length, grabs the ball on the jump and quickly realizes, he's gonna go over the ropes. What does he do then? Just maintains his composure, lobs the ball in the air before going over the ropes and collects the ball with ease on the second attempt. Warner c du Plessis b Chawla 28(29) [4s-3]

Chawla to Williamson, out Williamson Run Out!! This is disaster of the highest class. Williamson flicks it to mid-wicket and calls for a quick single, Priyam Garg barely responded and Williamson was left stranded mid-pitch. There was never a single there and Rayudu at mid-wicket had all the time in the world to lob the ball to Dhoni who does the rest. He looks upset, not sure if it was his call, but having played it to the right of mid-wicket, there was no single on there. Williamson run out (Rayudu/Dhoni) 9(13) [4s-1]
Chawla to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, full and sliding down the leg-side, Abhishek uses the line to broom it fine past the keeper for an easy boundary

Jadeja to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, nicely played - a little counter-punch from young Abhishek - bends down half-way, uses the pace on the ball and plays the reverse pull, behind square on the off-side for a boundary
Jadeja to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, lovely, RJ doesn't learn, tosses one just outside off, Abhishek gets across, plays with the angle and swings it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum

Dwayne Bravo to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, cracking shot, too full and too wide of off from Bravo, almost a half-volley length and Abhishek can get under it on the drive - has enough power to clear mid-off and rolls away to the ropes

SN Thakur to Priyam Garg, FOUR, lovely - Garg is making most of this opportunity to bat time - had a part in the run-out of KW, but that hasn't figured in his plan since - tad too short and he's very quick on the pull, swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it over square leg for a boundary

Sam Curran to Priyam Garg, FOUR, beautifully played, a touch of class from Garg - overpitched and well wide of off, he leant into the drive, opened the bat-face at the last moment and sliced the drive behind square on the off-side for a boundary

Sam Curran to Priyam Garg, SIX, this is batting of the highest quality from young Garg - full and coming back into the right-hander, from that round the wicket angle - he bends low, picks the length early and slaps it over square leg for a maximum

Sam Curran to Priyam Garg, no ball, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Garg - this is a no-ball for height as well - high full-toss outside off, Garg makes room and lifts it over backward point for a boundary

Sam Curran to Priyam Garg, FOUR, cute, Garg is taking Curran to the cleaners - another proper cricketing shot, back of a length and well wide of off, he waited on it, opened the bat face and ran it behind square on the off-side, third man was inside the ring and has no chance

Chahar to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, chance and dropped - and it's by RJ of all people - length ball outside off and Sharma swiped it over square leg. RJ ran across to his left, got there with plenty of time, got both hands and then let the ball burst through - to add insult to injury, it dribbled over the ropes

Chahar to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run, another chance and Shardul has put down a sitter - butter fingers all of a sudden from CSK, on a good length and angling across the left-hander, Abhishek was looking to go inside out over cover - the bat-face turned on impact and he carved it over point - Shardul had plenty of time on the ball and somehow makes a mess of it
Chahar to Priyam Garg, FOUR, top-edge and four, banged in short and just outside off, Garg was a tad late on the pull, the ball caught the fat top-edge and lobbed over MS for another boundary

Chahar to Abhishek Sharma, out Caught by Dhoni!! Abhishek's fun-filled innings is over, but he has done his job. Banged in short and angling across the left-hander, the attempted slower bouncer from Chahar - Abhishek was looking to nail the pull wide of mid-wicket, gets an audible edge and MS does the rest. Abhishek Sharma c Dhoni b Chahar 31(24) [4s-4 6s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to Priyam Garg, FOUR, Garg continues to ooze class - knew that Bravo would be bowling a slower ball, went right across on the paddle sweep and clears backward square leg. MS isn't looking all that impressed
Dwayne Bravo to Priyam Garg, 1 run, Maiden IPL fifty for Garg, first of many to come? Low full-toss on the pads and it's clipped past square leg for a single
Chahar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, class from Manish Pandey! Sees the outswinger pitch in the fullish zone and shows the full face of the bat to silk a gorgeous straight drive past mid-off. Too good!!
Sam Curran to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Manish Pandey unleashing! Gets a full delivery in his zone and he clubs it straight back over the bowler's head for a delightful-looking boundary
Chahar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, 136ks length ball outside off, Pandey picks it up from wide of off and swats it over Bravo at mid-on, easy pickings for the batsman
SN Thakur to Warner, FOUR, half-volley on off-stump and Warner will not miss out. Unleashes those powerful bottom hand as he chips the loifted drive straight down the ground, straight as an arrow!!

SN Thakur to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Sam Curran!! Manish Pandey perishes and instantly shadow-practices the execution. It was a cross-seam delivery from Shardul Thakur and the length - full - lured Pandey to go for big shot. He looks to slap-drive it over mid-off but doesn't get the timing right, skews it off the thick toe-end and offers catching practice to Curran at mid-off. Manish Pandey c Sam Curran b SN Thakur 29(21) [4s-5]

SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, just needed one delivery to get his timing right and it's pure class flowing from the bat of Kane Williamson! Gets into superb position as he jumps on this full ball and creams the drive sweetly past the diving left hand of cover

Chawla to Warner, FOUR, a quicker one from Chawla and Warner makes use of the pace to reverse slap it past the diving left hand of Watson at backward point. Got great power behind the shot did the SRH skipper

Jofra Archer to Finch, FOUR, lifts this over the in-field on the off-side. Finch is off the mark with a four. This should ease his nerves a bit. Too short, too wide and Finch will not let this go scot-free. Rides the bounce and makes hay

Unadkat to Devdutt Padikkal, SIX, where has this gone? Monster hit from Padikkal. Remember him playing a similar kind of shot in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, he's so good with the flicks and glances. Unadkat bowls the inswinger onto his pads, Padikkal says thanks and decimates it a long way into the grass banks at deep square leg

Unadkat to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, bashed over mid-wicket. The shot of a man in prime form. Not all that short from Unadkat, but Padikkal quickly read the length, camped back and took heavy toll of it

Unadkat to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, deft! 108.7kph, slower ball around off, Padikkal spots it, waits for the ball and opens his bat-face at the last moment to guide it cheekily fine of the man at short third man. Third half-ton in four matches for Devdutt Padikkal! Brilliant
Riyan Parag to Kohli, FOUR, slapped over extra cover! That went like a bullet. Kohli shimmies down the pitch and Parag shortens his length. There's ample width and Kohli flayed it powerfully!

Riyan Parag to Kohli, SIX, even better! Parag bowls a full one, right in the slot. Kohli makes room by moving leg-side and lofts it handsomely over deep extra cover. Superb inside-out from the skipper. This is the Kohli we know....

Rahul Tewatia to Kohli, 2 runs, 88.1kph, Kohli jogs down the pitch and hammers it over the bowler's head. Tewatia got fingertips to it and the long-off fielder put in a dive to his right to save a couple of runs. tough to call it a drop! That came towards the bowler very quickly

Rahul Tewatia to Kohli, SIX, shot! Kohli is definitely finding his touch! Dances down the track to this flighted delivery, gets to the pitch of the ball and tonks it powerfully over long-on. Moves to 49!
Rahul Tewatia to Kohli, 1 run, you can't keep him silent for long! Beware, other IPL teams! Fifty for Virat Kohli and he reaches there by dinking a full ball down to long-on

Jofra Archer to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, 142.6kph, short ball from Archer, it was on the stumps. But, Padikkal walks away towards the leg-side which allows his free arms and plays an aerial cut shot over backward point. A one-bounce four and Padikkal made it look so easy

Jofra Archer to Devdutt Padikkal, out Bowled!! Timber! 145.7kph, very full and attacking the sticks from round the wicket, Padikkal backs away a long way and is too late to bring his horizontal bat down. Crashes into the base of off and middle. First wicket for Archer, is it too late though? Devdutt Padikkal b Jofra Archer 63(45) [4s-6 6s-1]

Tom Curran to Kohli, FOUR, wow! A fullish ball at 133.8kph, Kohli shimmies down the pitch, converts it into a half-volley and drives it exquisitely straight of the mid-off fielder. With mid-off inside the circle, it wasn't a great idea to bowl full. Kohli took full toll of it

Tom Curran to Kohli, FOUR, 124.4kph, slow, short and wide. Kohli stands tall and throws his bat at it. Gets a fat top-edge that flies over the short third man fielder. Uthappa did run back and dived but to no avail

Tom Curran to Kohli, FOUR, 16 runs off the over! Kohli is in a hurry to finish this match. Another slower ball, shortish in length, Kohli gets behind the line by shuffling across and pulls it nicely over backward square leg

Unadkat to Kohli, 3 runs, 129kph, Unadkat probably saw the batter step down and shortened his length. Kohli checks his lofted drive and the ball falls short of in-running-and-diving Gopal at long-off. Meanwhile, Kohli runs three by the time Gopal recovers and releases the ball. Just incredible stuff...
Tom Curran to de Villiers, FOUR, low full toss, de Villiers crouches a bit and batters it to the right of Jofra at mid-on. Runs away to the fence and RCB win by 8 wickets
