Shreyas Gopal to Finch, FOUR, yes, he was right. It's indeed the googly but Gopal errs in length, getting it too short and following the batsman. Finch backed away too far but manages to hack it past square leg

Shreyas Gopal to Finch, out Lbw!! It's that man again - Shreyas Gopal, who strikes for Rajasthan. He usually does well against RCB and has got a wicket in his first over. Flighted just outside off - the googly which spun back in - Finch was alerted by his partner about this threat, still he went low to sweep and failed to connect. The impact was in-line and the only question was whether it was hitting the stumps. Gopal was proved right and RCB have lost their first wicket. Finch lbw b Shreyas Gopal 8(7) [4s-2]
Jofra Archer to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, that's a poor delivery from Archer. Easy pickings for Padikkal. Drifts it on the pads, Padikkal moves across and just helps it fine past the man at 45

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli's first boundary of IPL 2020! Whodathunk.. He's been having a lean patch and Gopal offered him a freebie. A rank long hop, Kohli had all the time in the world to shift his weight back and pummel it to the deep backward square leg boundary

Tom Curran to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, superb from Padikkal. Doesn't overhit this short ball, just waited for it and lifted his one leg to unleash a short-arm pull past the fielder at short fine leg. Bread and butter for him.. too leg-sidish from Curran, needs to shift his line to outside off
Tom Curran to Devdutt Padikkal, FOUR, brute force. Nipping away outside off, plenty of room to free his arms and Padikkal seizes.. slapping it over extra cover with enviable timing!

Tom Curran to Devdutt Padikkal, 1 run, a proper miscue.. who wants it? Actually nobody as it falls safely at long-on. Was through the shot early, skews it up after losing his balance.. Padikkal gets away. Lady luck shining brightly on him so far

Tom Curran to Kohli, FOUR, that's clumsy from the fielder at extra cover. This should've been stopped. I guess Lomror is the culprit, Smith ain't happy. A fuller length delivery just outside off, Kohli just sublimely drives it crisply and sends it to extra cover where Lomror couldn't get his body in-line and fumbles. It scurries away to the boundary

Rahul Tewatia to Kohli, FOUR, wow! Those magical wrists of Kohli coming into play. Went back upon seeing this darter on leg, just swatted it across the line through square leg and pierces the gap to perfection

Shreyas Gopal to Devdutt Padikkal, 2 runs, great work from Tewatia at long-off. Padikkal drilled it powerfully along the ground, it was racing away quickly and Tewatia bolted to his right and keeps the ball in play. Two to Padikkal and it's 50-partnership between these two

Udana to Buttler, FOUR, loose ball and Buttler has put it away. On the pads, shortish and Buttler walks down to tuck it away easily wide of short fine leg who was a bit off the mark too. VK isn't amused with that

Udana to Smith, FOUR, this is poor from Udana. He's getting the slow nature of the deck to assist him but instead of bowling tigher, feeds a boundary ball. Fed on the pads with fine leg up, Smith isn't missing out. Shuffles across and glances it wide of that fielder in the ring

Washington Sundar to Buttler, FOUR, third boundary of the innings and all have been to the same area - fine leg. Quicker one from Sundar, probably put off a bit by Buttler's initial walk down the pitch and it's fed on the pads. Swept away past short fine leg

Chahal to Uthappa, out Caught by Udana!! Uthappa looks to go big against Chahal and he has found the man at long-off. Was a loopy legbreak around off and Robbie miscues it completely in his quest to clear the fence. Udana takes a comfortable catch in the deep and Chahal has just bagged his second wicket of the match. Sunrisers were in a similar situation yesterday. 70/4 when two youngsters braved them out of trouble. Uthappa c Udana b Chahal 17(22) [4s-1]

Zampa to Riyan Parag, FOUR, finally connects one! A tossed up delivery on middle and leg, Riyan Parag waits for it to arrive and powers is past Zampa. Straight as an arrow as this one races away to the fence in double quick time..
Chahal to Lomror, SIX, this one's got the height.. and the distance! Enormous! Lomror gets to the pitch of the ball and smokes it over long-on for a massive six. Was in the air for an eternity
Udana to Lomror, 1 run, full toss outside off and it has been driven through covers by Lomror for one

Udana to Riyan Parag, out Caught by Finch!! The experience of Udana overcomes Parag. He looks to slap the short ball, but fails to get the distance. Mistimed to long-on where Finch moves forward and reverse cups it. Right then, time for the miracle man - Tewatia to come in and take charge. Do we have another Tewatia special on the cards? Riyan Parag c Finch b Udana 16(18) [4s-1]

Chahal to Lomror, SIX, this is proving to be an enterprising knock by Lomror! Chahal at its receiving end once again, as the southpaw goes down on his knee and swings it over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen

Chahal to Lomror, out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! Chahal brings an end to Lomror's stay! Keeps this one slightly wide outside off and the batsman has to reach out for it. Throws his hands at it, as the ball is miscued towards long-off where Padikkal isn't going to miss out. He'll be disappointed that he couldn't get a fifty. Right then, it's Jofra time.. Lomror c Devdutt Padikkal b Chahal 47(39) [4s-1 6s-3]
Navdeep Saini to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, that's the confidence he's carrying! On the pads and Rahul Tewatia helps it over the deep square leg fence. How nonchalant did he make that swipe look like?

Navdeep Saini to Jofra Archer, FOUR, french-cut by Jofra Archer as he swings hard and gets an inside edge on the full toss. The fielder at fine leg was inside the ring, hence this was an easy boundary
Udana to Jofra Archer, SIX, that's Archer-ed! A slower delivery by Udana, on the shorter side and Jofra bludgeons his pull over deep mid-wicket for a flat six. All about power!

Udana to Jofra Archer, no run, chance of a run-out, but Udana has made a mess of it. Tewatia was almost at the striker's end when Archer asked him to go back. But, Udana couldn't get rid of the ball quickly. Had he gone for a direct-hit at the bowler's end, Tewatia could have been in trouble. The throw wasn't an impressive one, as he parried it away towards the fielder who was charging in from mid-off. Was delivered on the pads as Jofra Archer failed to connect his flick

Navdeep Saini to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, and the free-hit is out of the park! The reply couldn't have been a better one. Length delivery by Navdeep Saini and Rahul Tewatia swings it over deep square leg for a monster hit. Once again, RCB are proving to be expensive in their death overs

Navdeep Saini to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, dealing in sixes is Tewatia. Rahul - it's in the name! A full toss around off, Rahul Tewatia shuffles across and swipes it towards deep square leg as he manages to beat the fielder's leap near the boundary

Udana to Buttler, SIX, that's a Buttler special! Wow! Slower ball, on a shorter length and not many can generate such power by standing in the crease. Waited that bit longer and unleashed his short-arm jab. Minimum fuss, maximum result

Udana to Buttler, FOUR, can't bowl short to Buttler at this pace, Udana! Gonna get punished for sure. This is a harmless half-tracker on leg stump, Buttler sits back and pulls this away through mid-wicket. Didn't middle it all that well, still got it to the fence

Udana to Smith, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Smith is livid with himself. It was there to be hit, short and wide but the slowness of the deck, and the lack of bounce does him in. Udana had offered no pace and so, Smith's attempted cut stroke results in a big inside edge that disturbs the furniture. Udana is elated, his slower ball menu has finally found success. Smith b Udana 5(5) [4s-1]
Udana to Samson, FOUR, how is that for a start? Gentle half-volley from Udana alright but look at that execution from Samson. Just leans into the drive and caresses the drive wide of mid-off. Class!

Navdeep Saini to Buttler, out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! What a way to start your spell! This is a massive strike first-ball by Saini. The dangerous Buttler is out of here. The umpires wanted to refer it upstairs for a bump ball but Jos was already walking. He knew it was a fair dismissal. Raw pace probably did him in here, very full and outside off, Buttler tried to squeeze the drive but could only get a thick edge. Padikkal was placed at a wide slip, perhaps strategically and it's straight at him. Sharp low catch and RCB are absolutely pumped. Dream start for them. Buttler c Devdutt Padikkal b Navdeep Saini 22(12) [4s-3 6s-1]

Chahal to Samson, out Caught&Bowled!! And he strikes first-ball! What a catch from Chahal! They're checking for a clean catch. Soft signal is OUT. Seemed alright in real time. Okay, the replays are quite confusing. It does seem like a bit of his fingers are under the ball, but also a portion of it seems to be touching the ground. The third umpire isn't sure but he feels there isn't enough evidence to overturn the onfield call. So, Samson has to walk. Huge, huge wicket this. Was doled out full by Chahal and Samson moved leg-side to drive through the covers. Got it off the inside part of the bat and the ball was travelling to the right of the bowler. Chahal stuck his right hand to pouch it. A very fine reflex attempt. RR in disarray here. Samson c and b Chahal 4(3) [4s-1]

Zampa to Uthappa, FOUR, brilliant effort by Gurkeerat at long-on! Raced across to his left and dived full-length but couldn't do much. Seemed like a mishit from Uthappa initially, went hard on the halfvolley from Zampa but did well to go dead straight down the ground. One bounce into the ad hoardings
Washington Sundar to Uthappa, 1 run, fuller and on the pads, Uthappa flicks it away towards deep square leg

Zampa to Lomror, SIX, huge blow! This boy is known to hit the ball long and hard, and this is a sample of that. Slot ball from Zampa, leg break and Lomror gets down on his knee to slog sweep this over deep mid-wicket. Clean strike and a much-needed blow for RR

Navdeep Saini to Lomror, FOUR, this is great awareness from Lomror. Saw mid-off was up and wanted to get this past the fielder. Backed away for the flat-batted stroke and although he didn't get a big chunk of this, still had enough to beat the diving fielder in the circle

Cummins to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, full pitched at the stumps, Shaw - with his high backlift - punches it sweetly over mid-on. With his flourish as it is, if the timing is good, he doesn't need to worry about clearing the infield
Shivam Mavi to Dhawan, FOUR, short ball angling across, Dhawan cuts from underneath it and gets it over short third man

K Nagarkoti to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, fifty for Shaw. Second of the season for him. He shakes hands with his skipper at the other end and then raises his bat to the dugout. Slower that is dragged back, Shaw backed away and though he had to reach for the flat-batted hit, he manages to clear the long-on boundary

K Nagarkoti to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, second six of the over. He bowled a similar delivery to Iyer early in the over and got away with it but not this time, the flick is uppish and the ball sails over the backward square leg fence
Chakravarthy to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, patted in front of backward point and the pair cross over. The 50-partnership comes up between these two
Chakravarthy to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, edged and four. Flighted outside off, Shaw drives and the ball flies off the outside edge, runs away fine and Rana had no chance catching up with it

Chakravarthy to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, oh my! This would have been a six in any ground. Googly around off-stump, Iyer keeps his head down and then has a clean bat swing to send it soaring into the roads over long-on

Chakravarthy to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, and a boundary to finish.. Chakravarthy does not want to pitch it on a length, so he errs on the shorter side, Iyer is waiting for it and flays the cut behind square - bisecting backward point and short third man

K Nagarkoti to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, small margins for error. Nagarkoti fails to nail the yorker, it is a juicy knee high full toss and though Shaw does not middle his pick up shot, half a decent connection on this ground is enough to take it all the way. Mavi could only watch it go over him near deep mid-wicket

K Nagarkoti to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Nagarkoti has his man. He has gone for quite a few but this should give him some relief. [Pounded it back of a length and Shaw backed away to hack it into the leg-side, but only manages a toe-end towards long-on, Gill runs and settles nicely under it. A fine knock comes to an end. Can KKR apply brakes now? b]Prithvi Shaw c Shubman Gill b K Nagarkoti 66(41) [4s-4 6s-4][/b]

Cummins to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, shot! Cummins tries the same full wide delivery to Iyer but ends up conceding the boundary. This was right in the slot for the Delhi skipper, uses his reach and lifts it handsomely over extra cover, one bounce and over the ropes
K Nagarkoti to Pant, wide, another wide, tries to keep it out of the southpaw's range and sprays it too far outside off, Pant has no chance of reaching that

Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR, Cummins was straighter at mid-off but Pant still manage to beat him. Full delivery outside off, Pant swings through the line past Iyer and Cummins had no chance of getting across

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, oh no! Cummins has made a mess of it. Meanwhile, Iyer reaches his fastest IPL fifty. He has to bat through and ensure his side get the total they need. Full delivery on middle and leg, Iyer flicks it uppishly to wide long-on, the ball lands just in front of Cummins and he ends up overrunning the ball.
Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR, smashed! 141.2kph short of length delivery outside off, Pant sets himself up nicely and slaps it hard over extra cover, goes flat and almost all the way

Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR, not sure he intended that to go there but he won't mind it. Full delivery around off, Pant aims to drive it through extra cover, but the bat face turns and the ball ends up in front of square on the leg-side - splitting deep mid-wicket and long-on

Cummins to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, these small boundaries, I tell you. This was a miscue, right off the cue-end but the ball just clears the rope. A low full toss and Iyer didn't get it off the meat, but enough to clear cow corner

Cummins to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, oh no! Even good deliveries are going for runs. Sloppy bit of work from Narine. Cummins nails it in the blockhole, Iyer shuffles across and gets his bat down in the nick of time, squeezes it to short fine and Narine ends up diving over the ball. Cummins is not impressed with the effort

Cummins to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, hammered! He is putting on a show here. Keeps moving around in the crease, makes room as the ball is delivered and drives it with his weight on the back leg, pierces the gap between extra cover and mid-off

Russell to Pant, SIX, that's outta here. Length delivery at this venue goes only one way - onto the roads. This was right in the swinging arc for Pant and he doesn't miss out, deposits it over deep mid-wicket
Russell to Pant, FOUR, that's poor planning. He goes short with square leg and fine leg inside the ring, even the mistimed pull from Pant races away to the fence

Russell to Pant, FOUR, Pant looks at the base of his bat. He knows that it didn't come off the middle. Full toss outside off and Pant swings it away in front of square on the leg-side, wide of the long-on fielder

Russell to Pant, out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Better from Russell. More the area he needs to bowl. This is right up there, near to yorker length, Pant goes deep in the crease and plays the helicopter, but doesn't get enough to clear long-on, Mavi does not have to move much as he takes a simple chance. A perfect cameo from Pant but he would have wanted to bat a bit longer. Pant c Shivam Mavi b Russell 38(17) [4s-5 6s-1]

Chakravarthy to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, first ball has disappeared to the fence. He dragged the length back and Iyer waited for it on the backfoot, muscles the pull in front of square on the leg-side - right between deep mid-wicket and long-on
Chakravarthy to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, 12 off 3 balls. This delivery had width on it and Iyer picks his spot - deep extra cover, extends his arms and launches it with a clean bat swing over the rope

Chakravarthy to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, 20 off the over. So the move didn't work. This flighted delivery lands right in the arc, Iyer clears his front leg to get a golf-like swing and he smashes it over deep mid-wicket. Can he get a hundred?

Russell to Stoinis, out Caught by Chakravarthy!! Stoinis cannot believe it. He moved across his stumps and reaches out for a slow delivery way down leg, the cue-end balloons towards short fine and Chakravarthy takes a dolly. It would have been a wide had he let go but at this stage batsmen want to put bat on ball all the time. Stoinis c Chakravarthy b Russell 1(3)

Russell to Hetmyer, SIX, high and long. Right into the KKR dugout. Russell misses the yorker and it is a full delivery, Hetmyer doesn't get hold of the loft but you don't need much to clear the fences here

Russell to Hetmyer, no run, this is excellent stuff from Russell. Another short ball that is banged into the surface, he slants it across the left hander and Hetmyer cannot connect with the pull, the ball flies under his bat

Cummins to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Cummins hits 151kph as he pounds it in on short of length, and is pulled over midwicket. Shaw didn't quite get hold of it though. Definitely a little rushed for pace. But enough meat on it
Cummins to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, now this has been crunched. Short of length into the body, 147kph, Shaw treats it with contempt as he pulls over midwicket. Skimmer!
Chakravarthy to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan barely has a followthrough on this cover-drive, but the timing is sublime. Smears it over cover. Chakravarthy went too full there
Narine to Dhawan, SIX, collects a six as he gently sweeps over square leg. Nicely on a length from Narine, Dhawan meets it with good timing
Narine to Dhawan, SIX, six more with the sweep. Went a touch harder there, but once again the length is perfect for the shot. It goes further. Goes over the roof
Narine to Dhawan, 1 run, fires this short outside off, it spins back in slightly and Dhawan mistimes the cut wide of cover
Chakravarthy to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Shaw seems like he's picking him. Or maybe it's just premeditated. Backs away to a length ball, it turns away from him and he cuts through cover

Chakravarthy to Dhawan, out Caught by Morgan!! Has struck a couple of sixes with his sweep shot. This one though goes straight up off the top-edge. It was the one that turned away from Dhawan and got him closer to the toe-end, hence the error. Morgan is underneath the skier at square leg. Swirls under it. Eventually has to put in a bit of a dive, but grabs it with both hands. Dhawan c Morgan b Chakravarthy 26(16) [4s-2 6s-2]

Russell to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Shaw may have been struggling here. Have to confirm with the replay. But Morgan's under-arm flick running in from cover misses the mark. Would've been touch and go. It was Shaw's call anyway, so he had no one else to blame. Iyer was less sure after tapping this back of a length delivery into the off-side
Shivam Mavi to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, makes room to a length ball and slaps this over extra cover. Oh the wonders of batting in Sharjah, hitting through the line like this
Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, driven hard enough to burst through Mavi's hands. Races away to the boundary. It wasn't an obvious drive-ball so to say, but it might as well be over here.

Russell to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, Shaw had given up at the non-striker's end. Cummins, from mid-off, misses the stumps but he has hit Shaw right on the boot. He looks in some pain, but is back up quickly
Narine to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, Iyer's been made to fetch this from outside off. He does so and swipes over midwicket. Just clears the boundary with this 75-metre hit
Nortje to Narine, byes, FOUR, 138.7kph, sharp bumper first up, Narine is beaten - courtesy pacy and bounce. He is in no control to pull and misses it comfortably. Fies over the keeper's leap too

Nortje to Narine, out Bowled!! Knocked him over! Nortje is pumped up. Another failure for Narine. 147.6kph, Narine is expecting a short ball, the bowler smartly bowls a length ball. The left-handed batter backs away in an attempt to hoick across the line. Too quick for him though. Gets beaten on the inside edge and the ball hits the top of leg. Narine b Nortje 3(5)

Nortje to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 149.6kph! Very full ball, Gill jams it out towards mid-off and sets off for a tight single. Iyer misses the target at the bowler's end. A direct hit would have been curtains for Gill
Harshal Patel to Karthik, 2 runs, 120.3kph, off-lined yorker. Whipped round the corner, pinches the second, and KKR pinch a 100 ..
Stoinis to Nitish Rana, FOUR, slow, short, sitting up outside off. Rana finally finds a gap, rocking behind and slaps it backward of point
Stoinis to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slow, just outside off, and angling away. A quiet, neat run down to third man -- and fifty
Harshal Patel to Nitish Rana, SIX, more in the slot, more of the obvious slower ones. Rana can line it up, swing, and hoick downtown

Harshal Patel to Nitish Rana, out Caught by (sub)Axar!! It's not that Rana had much of a choice apart from hopeful bat-swings. But Patel had this shorter, slower, hence ruining the timing on Rana's attempted heave over mid-wicket. The miscue is a top-edge, and the Patel-unity will do it by the boundary. Nitish Rana c (sub)Axar b Harshal Patel 58(35) [4s-4 6s-4]

Harshal Patel to Karthik, out Caught by Dhawan!! And the game's killed. Go on, shake your sanitized hands and move on with life. Patel digs in a short-quick one, hurrying Karthik into his pull for a top-edge that balloons and dips in front of mid-on. Fhawan's there, diving into it, and thigh-slapping. Karthik c Dhawan b Harshal Patel 6(8)
Nortje to Cummins, FOUR, genuinely squared up outside edge -- but Cummins manages to keep some control and drop his wrists to guide it past the keeper

Nortje to Cummins, out Caught by Harshal Patel!! Top-edged splice. 151ks, back of a length, outside off and Cummins attempted carve over point ends up at third man, where Harshal does rather well to get low and under. Cummins c Harshal Patel b Nortje 5(4) [4s-1]
Nortje to Morgan, SIX, brutal, murderous. And it's the first ball that he's faced -- swivelling, pulling, tonking flat over deep square leg
Rabada to Morgan, FOUR, there's no long-off, and Rabada dishes out a full toss, aka, juicy freebie, deservedly sliced over mid-off
Rabada to Morgan, SIX, slogged, and bursting straight through a jumping Rahane at deep mid-wicket -- for Morgan's 301st T20 six. Anyway, it's helped the equation come under three runs per ball
Rabada to R Tripathi, 1 run, 140kph, sharper bouncer, following the backing away for another adjusted hook to fine leg
Stoinis to R Tripathi, SIX, 116.1kph, bang in the slot, bang-er in the arc, and BANG. Tripathi's already one-kneed, smoking this over cow corner's roof
Stoinis to R Tripathi, SIX, slow full toss .. Tripathi's once again gone one-kneed and is slogging this flatter, cow corner
Stoinis to R Tripathi, FOUR, one-handed, outside-edge, and third man's inside the ring to be causing problems. Stoinis goes full and wide outside off, but Tripathi throws his bat out, ah, well ..

Stoinis to R Tripathi, SIX, certified opener to certified finisher -- Rahul Tripathi's making the Cummins promotion look really silly. Another wide full toss and his one'kneed adventures get it sliced over extra cover
Rabada to Morgan, SIX, 139kph, bouncer, nah, never mind. Morgan stands with an opened up stance, whacks a pull, and gets it high, almighty outside the stadium, via fine leg
Rabada to Morgan, SIX, more fun. MORE FUN. A 121kph slower cutter on a length. It's a sin, it's a cardinal sin. Morgan stands like he does, crouched, under it, and slogs over deep square leg

Rabada to Morgan, SIX, Morgan's half a Yuvraj, 3/5th a Tewatia. Another full toss, and Morgan - as if for fun - just swipes and smashes a hoarding on the square leg boundarys roof. Right, just to make sense: with an asking rate of 18-an-over, Morgan's done it n half the time

Rabada to R Tripathi, no run, Tripathi reviews a caught behind: It's a nasty bouncer, head-high, over the pull and with a clear sound as it goes through to the keeper. It's the sound of the ball brushing the helmet. Okay, Tripathi will survive ..

Rabada to R Tripathi, FOUR, another yorker goes wrong -- this one the other way in the form of a half volley that Tripathi hammers downtown, with mid-off in the circle. This is a joke, an unfunny joke
Nortje to R Tripathi, 1 run, back of a length, sensibly. Tripathi slaps, and finds sweeper

Nortje to Morgan, out Caught by Hetmyer!! Brave delivery this -- back of a length, into the body and Morgan in fact swipes it rather well. But no, it's flat and straight to a waiting backward square leg. The trick was that this one skidded along more than normal, getting Morgan crouched more than normal. Okay, now, surely game over? No? Okay. Morgan c Hetmyer b Nortje 44(18) [4s-1 6s-5]
Stoinis to R Tripathi, FOUR, over point. Tripathi's one-kneed, staying under the low full toss and nailing it over. Now, now

Stoinis to R Tripathi, out Bowled!! Yorker. Timber. Stoinis finally gets it right, dipping under Tripathi's yet-another one-kneed-hoick and sneaking further to clean him up. R Tripathi b Stoinis 36(16) [4s-3 6s-3]

Ashwin to Nitish Rana, SIX, Nitish Rana greets Ashwin with a maximum! That's gone outta here. Flat, non-turner on a length, Rana gets down on one knee and nails the slog sweep to send it over deep square leg. New ball please!
Ashwin to Nitish Rana, SIX, 15 runs off the over! In-drifter, but the length is tad too full. Ends up bowling it in the slot, Rana gets under it and swings his willow hard to dispatch it over long-on
Nortje to Shubman Gill, FOUR, 145kph, full and outside off, Gill lifts it over mid-off. Used the bowler's pace to his advantage. A couple of bounces and into the fence. Good start to the over for KKR

Nortje to Shubman Gill, SIX, that's a nice shot! Banged in short, head-high bumper at 140.4kph, Gill picks the length early, stands tall and pulls it away with aplomb over deep square leg for a 68m six!

Stoinis to Shubman Gill, FOUR, authoritative shot! Short ball, not much venom, Gill stands tall and pulls it through backward square leg. The man in the deep didn't have much distance to cover, but the ball bulleted away
Harshal Patel to Nitish Rana, FOUR, fuller ball outside off, Rana clears his front leg for a big hoick, gets a fat outside edge that goes fine of short third man and runs away to the third man fence
Harshal Patel to Nitish Rana, FOUR, four more! 118.8kph, slow and full, Rana slightly looks to squeeze it out and gets another outside edge that beats a diving Pant to his left
Harshal Patel to Nitish Rana, 1 run, full on leg, flicked away to long leg

Mishra to Nitish Rana, no run, dropped! It was a return catch and Mishra has spilt it. Flighted around off, Rana leans forward and closes the bat face to work it into the leg-side, the leading edge pops to the right of the bowler, Mishra dives across and gets both hands, but the ball does not stick. He has also hurt his finger in the process..

Ashwin to Nitish Rana, FOUR, 93.7kph, quick, short and wide. Nitish Rana takes heavy toll of it. Treks back in his crease and uses the bowler's pace and width to his advantage, Cut fiercely square of the wicket on the off-side

Mishra to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Pant!! Amit Mishra breaks the 64-run stand. He conceded just 2 runs in his opening over, should have scalped Nitish Rana too. Nevertheless, he has nipped out Gill. A floaty leg-break, spins away a bit, Gill gets down to slog-sweep and only manages a top edge. Went a long way up in the air and Pant moves towards the square leg region to pouch it. Shubman Gill c Pant b Mishra 28(22) [4s-2 6s-1]

Mishra to Nitish Rana, SIX, and, Nitish Rana takes full toll of the free-hit. Mishra overpitches one, it's right in Rana's arc. The left-hander clears his front leg, bends his back leg and bludgeons it straight down the ground for a 81m six!

Rabada to Russell, FOUR, 125.1kph, Rabada resorts to a slower ball from a shortened length. Russell clears his front leg and swings his bat hard to hammer it over vacant straight mid-on. One bounce and into the fence. The long-on fielder didn't even bother to move

Rabada to Russell, SIX, smacked! Rabada misses his yorker by a couple of inches - ends up bowling a half-volley. Russell moves leg-side, clears his left leg and hoists it over the bowler's head. Bent his back leg and muscled it!

Rabada to Russell, out Caught by Nortje!! Rabada has the last laugh! 144.6kph, dug in short, Russell wants to hit another six. Despite not being in a great position, hurriedly plays a pull shot and gets a big top edge. Nortje runs in from third man and holds onto it safely. Rabada is cock-a-hoop! Big wicket for Delhi Capitals... Russell c Nortje b Rabada 13(8) [4s-1 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, SIX, there's the first six of the game. Didn't take long. You cannot bowl short to Rohit not on this ground, not on any ground, easy pickings as he nonchalantly pulls it over deep mid-wicket

Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, out Caught by Bairstow!! Massive wicket for Hyderabad. Superb review from them. There was a sound but umpire Illingworth was not convinced. It was short and way outside off, close to being called a wide but Rohit goes chasing after it and gets a toe-end, Bairstow does the rest behind the stumps. Replays also show a clear deviation in the path of the ball. Rohit c Bairstow b Sandeep Sharma 6(5) [6s-1]

Williamson to de Kock, SIX, lovely, excellent use of the feet from de Kock, comes down the pitch, gets close to the ball and then launches it back over the bowler's head, brings up his first fifty of the season

Williamson to Ishan Kishan, SIX, one over too many for KW - Warner had to complete the fourth over from his fifth bowler- but this is going the distance. Tad too full and well outside off, Kishan reaches out and slugs it high and wide of long-on for a maximum

S Kaul to de Kock, FOUR, cheeky and four, short of a length and angling across the left-hander, de Kock moves right across, uses the pace on the ball and paddles it fine, past the keeper and runs away to the ropes

S Kaul to de Kock, SIX, nicely played, de Kock is looking in top form now, length ball on off, he gets under this one and clubs the on-drive over mid-wicket - went flat and wide of Manish at long-on, over the ropes for a maximum

Rashid Khan to de Kock, out Caught&Bowled!! A miscue from de Kock, Rashid called for the catch and Rashid takes the catch - running all the way to mid-wicket. The quicker delivery from the Afghan maestro - was the wrong 'un and de Kock didn't spot it, was setting himself for the pull and ended up playing against the turn. A massive top-edge and the ball was in the air for a long time. Rashid was always under the delivery, watches it keenly and takes it over his shoulder. End of a fine knowck from the MI opener. de Kock c and b Rashid Khan 67(39) [4s-4 6s-4]

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, SIX, Kishan is in some form - he will have to take over the role of the aggressor now, full and just outside off, he bends down low and pumps the slog-sweep over mid-wicket for a maximum

Sandeep Sharma to Hardik Pandya, SIX, fingertips and Warner has parried one over the ropes. Will it prove costly for SRH? Was a brilliant effort, he was on the move, leapt as high as he could, but managed to only parry it over the ropes - length ball outside off and Hardik pumped it high and over long-on

Sandeep Sharma to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Manish hasn't had a great day in the field - fuller length delivery and well wide of off, Hardik sliced the drive wide of cover. Manish got across to his left at long-on and then went one-handed on the stop - can't stop it cleanly and the ball hit the ropes

Sandeep Sharma to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Now, now - this is simply sensational from Manish. He's had a shocker by his own high standards today, but he has pulled off an absolute ripper now. Kishan will consider himself desperately unlucky here, length ball and he flat-batted the lofted drive to the right of long-on. Had enough power, but not the elevation. Manish rushed across from long-on, threw himself at the ball - was parallel to the ground when he completed the two-handed catch and then had the sense to make sure that it didn't pop out when his elbow hit the ground. Ishan Kishan c Manish Pandey b Sandeep Sharma 31(23) [4s-1 6s-2]
T Natarajan to Hardik Pandya, SIX, clubbed, fraction too short from Natarajan, angling across the right-hander, Pandya stays back and pummels the pull over mid-wicket for a maximum

Sandeep Sharma to Pollard, SIX, even mishits can fly on this ground - Sandeep misses his yorker, offers a full-toss on the pads, Pollard didn't get hold of the shovel, but the short boundaries takes care as the ball sails over the ropes. 100th six in Sharjah this IPL

Sandeep Sharma to Pollard, SIX, just over Rashid at backward square leg, low full-toss on the pads and Pollard whipped it over backward square leg - Rashid got across and was trying to drag the ball back into play with his right hand, can't do so though

Sandeep Sharma to Hardik Pandya, no run, a loud shout for LBW and SRH will review. The angle means this ball must have pitched outside leg. Think so, can see all the three stumps, no bat for sure and UltraEdge confirms it. But it has pitched marginally outside leg and SRH lose their review. Good delivery to complete the spell, the slower dipping yorker from round the wicket, Hardik was looking to shovel it over the leg-side and is done by the late dip, struck low and in front of the leg-stump

T Natarajan to Pollard, SIX, thumped, low full-toss wide of off, Pollard reached out and got it pretty low off the bat - but the short boundaries meant that the fielder in the deep at long-off could only watch it sail over his head

T Natarajan to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, nicely played, Natarajan missed his yorker by an inch, but that's enough for Hardik - opens the face of the bat and slices the drive over backward point for a boundary

S Kaul to Hardik Pandya, out Bowled!! The perfect yorker, this time by Siddarth and he has Hardik's stumps in a mess. Came from round the wicket - fired it very full and at the stumps, Hardik was opening himself on the helicopter shot, missed and the ball pinged the leg-stump, off his back-pad. If it hadn't hit the stumps, he would have been OUT plumb LBW. Hardik Pandya b S Kaul 28(19) [4s-2 6s-2]
S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, SIX, smashed, change of pace and Krunal spotted it early, threw everything he had on the slog, gets enough to clear the fielder at long-on by a distance
S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, Krunal is finishing in some style - low full-toss at the stumps, he gets under it and drilled it back past the bowler, the fielder at long-on has no chance

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, low full-toss outside off, Krunal stayed deep inside the crease and scythed the drive wide of extra-cover. no wonder, he looks absolutely chuffed
S Kaul to de Kock, FOUR, poor start from Kaul. First ball and he sprays it down leg, de Kock does not miss out, he clips it backward of square leg and the ball races across the turf

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, there is still a bit of movement. Outswinger outside off and Yadav plays it with the swing, lifts it over the infield on the off-side and almost collects half a dozen, just bounced inside

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, fabulous shot! Kaul is going for plenty here. Should Warner have persisted with Sandeep? This was a back of a length delivery, Yadav stands tall and punches it elegantly through extra cover

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, fourth boundary of the over. Kaul is all over the place. He overcorrects the length and offers a half volley, Yadav drives it straight of mid-on and the timing takes care of the rest

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, SIX, a four-ball unbeaten 20 for Krunal and he has lifted MI to 208, length ball at the stumps - Krunal gets under it and sends it high and over long-on. Warner can only watch it sail into the stands. Krunal is absolutely thrilled as he walks back

Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Yadav is dealing in boundaries at the moment. All his runs have come in fours. Swinging down leg, Yadav flicks it backward of square and beats the fielder in the deep comfortably

T Natarajan to de Kock, FOUR, no timing on that but it still beats the fielder to the fence. Full delivery and de Kock tries to force it straight down the ground, gets it off the inner half and the ball races past mid-on

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Kaul is having a horror time. This is the fifth boundary he has conceded in seven balls. A full toss just below the waist, Yadav helps it along the way past short fine

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, make that six fours in ten balls. He is just feeding it right in the slot. Overpitched delivery outside off, Yadav decides to go up and over, lofts it over extra cover with the full face of the bat

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by T Natarajan!! Horrible cricket from both Kaul and Yadav. This was another rubbish delivery from Kaul. Full and spraying down leg, like Rohit, Yadav goes chasing it and flicks it straight to Natarajan at short fine leg. He could have let it through and collected a wide, he could have hit it along the ground but instead Yadav picked out the fielder. Suryakumar Yadav c T Natarajan b S Kaul 27(18) [4s-6]
Abdul Samad to de Kock, 2 runs, flighted on the stumps, de Kock works it square on the leg-side and scampers back for the second

Abdul Samad to de Kock, SIX, oh no! Pandey has parried it over the rope. Is this the luck de Kock needed to get going? This was not all that short and hence de Kock could not get the elevation on the pull, hit it flat towards long-on where Pandey moves to his left and allows the ball to burst through his fingers. Tough chance but you expect it to be taken

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, "catch it" shouted Bairstow but it was nowhere close to the fielder. The wrong 'un is leg-lined, Kishan goes down on his knee and nails the sweep over the square leg umpire, no chance for the long leg

Abdul Samad to de Kock, SIX, this was right in the slot and de Kock ensures it is dispatched. Flighted outside off, de Kock had the width to free his arms and he smacks it straight down the ground, clearing the sightscreen comfortably

Abdul Samad to de Kock, FOUR, de Kock is finally getting into his groove. This was fraction short and he was quick to pick the length, rocks back and pulls it in front of square - bisecting long-on and deep mid-wicket

Boult to Bairstow, SIX, what a way to get off the mark! Wide half-volley and at Sharjah of all places, that's gotta go. Bairstow reaches out and lofts it cleanly over long-off. It's gone for a mammoth six
Pattinson to Bairstow, FOUR, absolutely smashed! Bairstow premeditates the length and charges down the track, holds his shape and nails the pull over mid-wicket. Total nonchalance

Pattinson to Bairstow, FOUR, Pattinson is losing his radar a bit here and probably, confused with his lengths too. Goes very full but it's on the pads, Bairstow gets a tickle on it. More of the inside half and it beats de Kock down the leg-side

Krunal Pandya to Warner, SIX, round-arm ball from round the wicket, a length ball outside off at 93.5kph, Warner swings his bat hard and deposits it over long-on. Got it off the bottom of bat, but all those won't matter at this ground

Krunal Pandya to Warner, FOUR, Pandya goes for the yorker, misses his length by an inch or two and Warner takes heavy toll of it. The skipper gets under it and lofts it over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four

Bumrah to Warner, 1 run, 146.2kph, Bumrah tries to bowl a yorker and ends up bowling a low full toss. Warner push-drives down the pitch and the mid-off fielder dives to his left to stop it. The single also brings up Warner's fifty! Can he take his team over the winning line. Just 6 runs came off the over - SRH were happy to take the singles against Bumrah

Boult to Williamson, out Caught by de Kock!! Boult has deceived the NZ captain with a slower delivery. Off-speed, on a shortish length and just outside off. Williamson arched his back to play a late-upper-cut. He was through with his shot and only managed a faint outside nick. Simple catch for the 'keeper. Williamson tried to pull his bat in, but it was too late. Williamson c de Kock b Boult 3(5)

Boult to Warner, FOUR, 110.8kph, slow, short and wide. Warner backs away and slaps it fiercely over extra cover. Couple of bounces and into the fence. Still a good over for Mumbai as they managed to nip out KW

Pollard to Priyam Garg, 1 run, just 7 runs off the over. Overpitched delivery at 121.5kph, Garg gets under it and absolutely smashes it. Pollard is brave to stick his right hand out - over his head - and parry it towards the mid-wicket region. Too harsh to call it a drop...

Krunal Pandya to Priyam Garg, out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! Full toss and out! Garg shapes up to slog-sweep, gets the timing wrong - courtesy top edge - and Chahar has pulled off a brilliant catch at deep square leg. The leggie moved to his left, and reverse-cupped it. He was very close to the boundary rope and tumbled to complete the catch. Did he touch the boundary rope while tumbling and getting up? The TV umpire has been summoned and he rules it rightly in the favour of the fielding team. Priyam Garg c Rahul Chahar b Krunal Pandya 8(7)

Pattinson to Warner, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Pattinson has his man! It's the slower ball off the back of the hand, wide outside off at 110.8kph, Warner chases it for a cut and gets a thick top edge. Kishan dives to his right at short third man and completes the formalities. The fielder is pumped up, I'm sure the entire MI set-up is. Warner c Ishan Kishan b Pattinson 60(44) [4s-5 6s-2]

Bumrah to Abdul Samad, SIX, this lad is known to hit massive sixes. 143.2kph, Bumrah misses the yorker, Samad stays deep in his crease, gets under it and bludgeons it over the bowler's head. The sightscreen has to bear the brunt..

Bumrah to Abdul Samad, FOUR, four to end the over! 142.7kph, very full and wide of off, Samad shuffles across and superbly slices it over backward point. Pattinson runs to his right in the deep, but puts in a lousy effort to stop that. Bumrah wears a cheeky smile on his face, sure he didn't like it
Bumrah to Abdul Samad, SIX, 128.8kph, slower ball on a shortish length, sits up nicely. Samad walks across, waits for the ball and pummels it over deep backward square leg with a pull shot

Bumrah to Abdul Samad, out Caught by Rohit!! 146.8kph, Bumrah goes full, the line is around off, Samad wants to slog across the line. The ball pops up off the leading edge and Rohit completes the formalities in the extra cover region. Abdul Samad c Rohit b Bumrah 20(9) [4s-1 6s-2]

Bumrah to Abhishek Sharma, out Bowled!! The middle-stump has been uprooted! Goes for the yorker, bowls a low full toss at 141.4kph, Abhishek Sharma moves across to scoop and doesn't connect. Hears the death rattle! Abhishek Sharma b Bumrah 10(13)
Krunal Pandya to Bairstow, SIX, the first bad ball of the over and Bairstow says 'Thank you very much!'! Dropped short by Krunal and it's launched over deep mid-wicket. Easy peasy for JB

Boult to Bairstow, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Superb bowling! Slower bouncer from Boult, kept it wide outside off and that meant Bairstow had to really fetch it on the pull. He is clearly foxed by the variation, and one hand coming off during the shot execution doesn't help either. Straight down the throat of deep square leg. Brilliant cricket from MI. Bairstow c Hardik Pandya b Boult 25(15) [4s-2 6s-2]

Boult to Manish Pandey, FOUR, he's getting into the act straightaway. Perhaps a slower ball again from Boult, this is fuller though and Pandey waits for it, before dispatching it straight down the ground
Boult to Manish Pandey, FOUR, probably another slower ball but this is a fraction short and sits up for Pandey who pulls this over mid-wicket. Picks his spot and gets a boundary

Bumrah to Warner, FOUR, first time that Warner has tried to time the ball and he gets rewarded instantly. Short and angling across him, he just uses Bumrah's pace to steer it between short third man and backward point

Bumrah to Warner, FOUR, and again! Much better from Warner, not so from Bumrah. Short again and allows the left-hander to free his arms. Punches this on the up and splits the gap at cover. This should get the SRH skipper going

Bumrah to Manish Pandey, FOUR, how about that for timing? Geez! A fairly good delivery from Bumrah, angles this on a good length and Pandey just pushes it with a straight bat past the bowler. Just a gentle-looking push but it speeds across the turf to the fence in no time. Wow!! Shot of the day?

Pollard to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Hardik puts down a dolly! The catching in this IPL hasn't been good at all. This is another instance of a superb fielder spilling an easy chance. Was short and wide, bowled cleverly by Pollard and Pandey tried to upper-cut it. Doesn't get the distance and Hardik at sweeper overruns the ball. What's worse, it's gone to the fence. He has his sunglasses on so no excuse of the sun in the eyes either

Rahul Chahar to Manish Pandey, SIX, didn't I tell ya? Pandey loves to murder spin, especially when it's tossed up fuller and at this ground, hitting that for six is just a formality. Clobbered over cow corner. Easy as you like

Rahul Chahar to Warner, SIX, that's on the roof! Chahar isn't learning, errs on the fuller side again and it's slower too. Warner mows it over long-on for a huge hit. SRH sensing that this is the time to go big

Rahul Chahar to Warner, 2 runs, superb batting! Slower on leg stump, it's the googly and Warner called for two as soon as he wristed this through mid-wicket. Gets the right response from Manish Pandey

Pattinson to Warner, FOUR, this is excellent batting! Not that bad a ball from Pattinson, on a good length around off stump but Warner backs away early to make room. And then uses the pace to steer it between short third man and backward point

Pattinson to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Pollard!! There's the wicket MI were looking for! Precisely why Rohit brought Pattinson on, and the plan has worked. Fuller and wider outside off, might have been a tad slower than Pattinson's usual deliveries and Pandey doesn't get the timing on the loft. Picks out Polly at long-off and he ain't dropping these, not even with this 'catching flu' that's caught the IPL. An enterprising little knock from Pandey ends but he'll be gutted to go at this point. Manish Pandey c Pollard b Pattinson 30(19) [4s-4 6s-1]
Cottrell to Watson, FOUR, 134.2kph, strays on the hips. Okay, this should help Watson, it better help Watson, with free runs off a fine leg-glance
Cottrell to Watson, FOUR, that's more Watto-like. A big forward plonk, leaning under the length and lofting this punch over mid-on
Jordan to Watson, FOUR, strays on the hip and Watson picks it away wide of short fine leg. Jordan isn't very pleased by the effort. Basically there was no effort
Jordan to Watson, FOUR, oh that's vintage Watson. Reaches fifty by planting his foot down to a length ball and crashing it through extra cover. Comforting sight for the dugout
Jordan to du Plessis, 1 run, Faf follows Watson in raising his fifty. Opens the face as he pushes a full ball to third man. Continues his good form in this tournament
Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, FOUR, overpitches outside off, Watson muscles the drive wide of long-off. Doing it in a canter
Cottrell to Watson, SIX, Watson's found his range tonight. Clears the front leg to a length ball and clubs it down the ground. Clean hitting
Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, FOUR, Punjab aren't going to turn this around with these deliveries. Short at the stumps, Faf crunches the pull between long-on and midwicket
Harpreet Brar to Watson, SIX, Harpreet is almost forced to bowl it closer after the call, gets into Watson's arc and gets nailed over long-on
Harpreet Brar to Watson, 1 run, hammered to long-on. 150 stand up. It's as if their earlier troubles didn't even exist
Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, FOUR, spoils a good over by pitching it too full. It's a blistering drive through extra cover from Watson
Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR, full toss outside off, Faf flays it over point. Now the highest partnership for CSK in IPL
Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR, yorker outside off, runs away fine past short third man. Faf reached out to it and got it right off the toe-end. What a miserable return for Jordan this is turning to be
Shami to du Plessis, SIX, what a ridiculous shot. Slices it one-handed over cover for six. Was a near yorker from Shami and gets creamed by du Plessis
Shami to du Plessis, FOUR, low full toss outside off, driven through extra cover. The sweeper gives up. It's a 10-wicket hammering
Cottrell to Watson, FOUR, it's in the slot, it's in Watson's arc, and he makes sure he plonks in front and smokes this downtown, and makes sure he makes it look seriously brutal
Harpreet Brar to Watson, FOUR, overpitches. There's no one straight down in the deep, and Watson easily gets under this one to go over, typically
Shami to du Plessis, FOUR, there's an entirely empty deep mid-wicket, so Faf walks across his stumps and tucks this uppishly with a lot of bottom hand into that area. Just timing, checked timing
Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR, neatly ramped. A cutter from Jordan, which Faf's spotted early, shuffling big time and sitting under to scoop it over the keeper
Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR, again, not off the middle, but he's managed enough chunk on this inside-halved-pull between mid-wicket and mid-on
Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR, overcompensates with width this time. Now, now. Faf slices, over and wide of short third man with nobody behind

Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR .. and CSK have officially arrived. 19 off this over, with a forehand smash down the ground. He made room, made sure he was on top of the the in-angling short one and muscled it wide of mid-on. It's Jordan's birthday, and this is the equivalent of birthday bumps ..
Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, FOUR, punishes the short ball and pulls hard through square leg. Motoring along is du Plessis
Harpreet Brar to Watson, FOUR, Watson steps across and paddle-scoops this off the stumps. Long chase for Cottrell running across from long leg. Puts in a big dive but to no avail
Harpreet Brar to Watson, FOUR, this won't help. This won't help Punjab at all. Swept straight to Shami at short fine leg, but he doesn't even get a hand on it. Right through the legs.
Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, FOUR, advances down, gets beside the ball, lofts it over extra cover. Lovely batting

Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, FOUR, almost got himself in trouble looking to pull a ball that wasn't very short. It skids through off a length, headed towards middle and leg. But Watson manages to get it off a thick under-edge, which then beats Shami at short fine
Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, SIX, Watson has destroyed this googly. He has absolutely destroyed it. Slog-swept into the top tier. That's soul-crushing
Shami to du Plessis, 1 run, right in the blockhole, Faf squeezes it wide of square leg. A 100-run opening stand for CSK. What bliss for their teammates who stand up to applaud

Sam Curran to Rahul, FOUR, there's a sweeper cover in place, but he can't do nothing about it. Full and wide outside off and Rahul creams it past the fielder with impeccable timing and incredible placement

Chawla to Mandeep, SIX, shot! Mandeep goes down on his knee and smokes the tossed up delivery over deep mid-wicket with a meaty slog. Such. Sweet. Timing! Maxwell does some bhangra in the dug-out to acknowledge the batsman
Chawla to Mandeep, SIX, Mandeep is dealing in sixes! A short ball by Chawla, Mandeep rocks back in the crease and pulls it over deep mid-wicket for six more. Just the momentum they were looking for!

Jadeja to Mandeep, out Caught by Rayudu!! A fine low catch by Rayudu brings an end to Mandeep's cameo. Slightly up outside off and Mandeep plays an uppish drive straight to the man stationed at cover. Looks skyward does the batsman as he's disappointed at his dismissal. Was looking for a boundary and has perished in the process. Mandeep c Rayudu b Jadeja 27(16) [6s-2]

Dwayne Bravo to Rahul, FOUR, an edge and that has fetched him a boundary. Was a slower delivery outside off and Rahul got an outside edge on his drive. The fielder at third man tried his best to stop it with a dive, but he couldn't really do it
Dwayne Bravo to Pooran, 1 run, opens the bat face and glides it down to third man for one
Jadeja to Pooran, FOUR, slams over extra cover. Shuffles across early, which Jadeja sees and goes wider .. and gets carved over
Jadeja to Pooran, SIX, another shuffle, and Jadeja fires it in quicker and into the body. Pooran pulls, no, wait, tonks, over an empty backward square leg

SN Thakur to Rahul, SIX, finally. FINALLY. Rahul goes uppish, shows intent, getting under Thakur's juicy length delivery to smoke it over long-off. Also, a fifty, and no one's keeping count anymore, there's no point
SN Thakur to Rahul, FOUR, the tap's opened. Thakur tries going wider and fuller, but Rahul still finds a way to get under it and slice over extra cover
SN Thakur to Rahul, FOUR, delicate now -- lining up, opening his bat face and bisecting backward point and short third man. yep, he's officially found his gear box
Sam Curran to Pooran, SIX, 134.3kph, absolutely holds onto this heave. He's already standing with an open stance, swinging across the line, and then boom. Onto cow corner's second tier
Dwayne Bravo to Pooran, SIX, high full toss, and whacked with disdain. Pooran doesn't even bother looking up after flat-batting this into cow corner
Dwayne Bravo to Pooran, 2 runs, chopped away, under-half, and an easy second before the man in the deep can clean up

SN Thakur to Pooran, out Caught by Jadeja!! Cross-seamed one in the slot, which Pooran's shaping up to smoke somewhere into the desert outside deep mid-wicket. But, but, there's something called not finding the middle, and as shocking as it might sound in this innings for Pooran, this delivery was that. He gets a lot of height, but Jadeja's swirling under at the boundary, reverse-cupping a seriously good catch. Pooran c Jadeja b SN Thakur 33(17) [4s-1 6s-3]

SN Thakur to Rahul, out Caught by Dhoni!! W.W. And just like that, both set batsmen who'd laid this platform for the final assault, won't be the ones doing it, if it ever goes on to happen. A full wide delivery that Rahul throws his bat out to, but doesn't get close to the line, ending up outside-edging the squeeze to a diving MSD -- who has his 100th IPL catch. Wow, quite the equivalent of 400 Test wickets. Rahul c Dhoni b SN Thakur 63(52) [4s-7 6s-1]
Dwayne Bravo to Maxwell, FOUR, okay, it's tennis now. Maxwell's already standing in a very-open stance, swatting this short-wide delivery like a forehand smash over mid-off
SN Thakur to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, remember 2015? Yea, it's that Sarfaraz -- sitting down, staying under the low full-paced full toss to discoop it over the keeper

SN Thakur to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, wide yorker, and really nothing wrong with this. There was a deep third man and a backward point as well. But still, Sarfaraz's found a way to angle his bat out and squeeze it extremely fine
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, lovely cut! Back of a length outside off, width on offer and Rahul plays a fine square cut as the ball races away through the backward point region for four runs

Sam Curran to Agarwal, FOUR, Agarwal is riding his luck. Slightly up outside off, this one seams away from the batsman who flays at it and gets an outside edge that flies over short third man. Fleming's reaction in the balcony depicts how desperate CSK are for a win..

Sam Curran to Rahul, FOUR, just the kind of over Punjab needed to get going. 12 runs off it as Rahul square drives the slightly full ball through point and manages to beat the sprinter in the deep. Rahul knocked over Curran at the other end as his eyes were on the ball. The little guy is on the floor..
Chahar to Agarwal, FOUR, smashed! Full length delivery outside off and Mayank absoutely belts it over covers as he finds the boundary once again. Went flat and almost cleared the boundary on the full
SN Thakur to Agarwal, FOUR, Agarwal welcomes Thakur with a boundary. A front foot pull shot by Agarwal as the bowler goes slightly short. That's the kind of form these openers are in
Dwayne Bravo to Agarwal, 1 run, 50-run stand up between the openers as Agarwal glides the short of a length delivery down to third man
Dwayne Bravo to Rahul, FOUR, short and punished! Width on offer outside off, Rahul opens the bat face and cuts it past the diving fielder at point. Can see a few Punjab flags in the stands

Chawla to Agarwal, out Caught by Sam Curran!! Chawla get Agarwal! The leg spinner strikes on his first ball. Was a short ball by Piyush as Agarwal pulled it straight to Sam Curran at deep mid-wicket. Looked a tired shot and the batsman will have to make his walk back to the pavilion. That's also a time-out.. Agarwal c Sam Curran b Chawla 26(19) [4s-3]

Udana to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, 123.7kph, harmless short of length ball. Shaw doesn't need second invitations to put it away. The right-hander stands tall, fetches it from outside off and pulls it fiercely in front of square on the leg-side. Off the mark with a boundary

Udana to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, slower ball, full on leg and middle, Shaw picks it and brings his wrists into play. Flicked away through the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on. Second boundary of the over
Udana to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, make that three! Poor stuff from Udana. He shortens his length and strays it on leg, wristily tucked away through backward square leg. 14 runs off the over

Moeen Ali to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! Fantastic catch by Padikkal. Huge wicket for RCB as it is the in-form Delhi skipper walking back. He does fancy clearing the rope against the spinners and would have as well if he was playing in Sharjah or Abu Dhabi, but not here. Flighted around off, Iyer goes with the spin and heaves it to deep mid-wicket, Padikkal settles under it and clutches with both hands, then throws the ball up, goes outside the boundary rope and comes back in to complete the catch. Excellent awareness shown by the youngster. Shreyas Iyer c Devdutt Padikkal b Moeen Ali 11(13) [4s-1]

Chahal to Pant, FOUR, Pant will take on Chahal even with the long boundaries. Flighted outside off, Pant is down on his knee and launches the slog sweep over mid-wicket, since it is a big side of the ground, the ball bounces inside the rope
Chahal to Pant, 1 run, once more keeps it on middle and leg, Pant nudges it square on the leg-side
Moeen Ali to Stoinis, SIX, Stoinis does clear the boundary rope at deep mid-wicket. This a half tracker and those bulging forearms come into play, he muscles it way over the fence

Moeen Ali to Stoinis, FOUR, the extra deliveries cost him a boundary. 15 off the over and a much needed one for Delhi. This was also quicker but right in the slot, Stoinis smacks it straight down the ground for a one bounce four

Navdeep Saini to Stoinis, SIX, woah! That's some shot from Stoinis. Back of a length delivery and he was so quick to pick that, transferred his weight back and bullied it for a flat six over cow corner

Navdeep Saini to Stoinis, FOUR, Stoinis is on fire here. Remember he is playing against his old franchise. Length delivery and Stoinis swings through the line, not off the middle but goes straight and collects a one bounce four

Navdeep Saini to Stoinis, FOUR, just over the fielder. Saini proving to be expensive today, already gone for 29 in 11 balls. He goes for the wide yorker, Stoinis lines up by going down on his knee, slices it over backward point and just over the fielder

Navdeep Saini to Stoinis, 1 run, dropped! How costly a miss is this going to be? They dropped Rahul around the same time and we know what happened after. This was a full toss and Stoinis does not get it off the middle, heaves it towards deep mid-wicket where Chahal moves to his left and lets it slip through his hands. Moeen too was running across from long-on. Did that put him off?

Siraj to Stoinis, FOUR, dipping full delivery around off, Stoinis moves across, waits for the ball to arrive and then drills it hard past extra cover. No chance for the sweeper to get across and stop it
Siraj to Pant, 1 run, back of a length around off, Pant miscues the heave and the ball bounces just in front of long-on. The 50-run stand comes up between the duo and it has come in quick time

Navdeep Saini to Stoinis, FOUR, Stoinis is picking his gaps for fun here. The full delivery isn't working for him, stays deep in the crease and manages to whip it away to deep mid-wicket, Padikkal has no chance this time

Navdeep Saini to Stoinis, 1 run, run out chance missed. RCB making the same mistakes they made in their loss against KXIP. Low full toss outside off, Stoinis moves across and flicks it to the right of deep mid-wicket, he wanted the second and was halfway down, even given up since Pant didn't want it. But Kohli does not gather Padikkal's throw and that allows Stoinis to make his ground back

Navdeep Saini to Pant, SIX, Pant gets into the act now. Saini is being taken to the cleaners. Slower delivery and Pant spotted it early, lined himself for the big hit and smacked it straight back over the bowler, just clearing the rope

Navdeep Saini to Pant, FOUR, superb, sensible batting. Saini is all over the shop. Slower delivery down leg, Pant moves inside the line and helps it along the way past short fine, no chance for Finch or the fielder getting across from deep square leg

Udana to Pant, FOUR, miscued but it was in the gap. Slower delivery outside off, Pant is through the shot a bit early and ends up slicing it over extra cover, the ball has enough to beat a chasing Finch from long-off

Siraj to Pant, no ball, SIX, oh my! Now Siraj does a Saini. High full toss that almost took out Pant's head, the keeper-batsman does well to duck and swing across the line, the top-edge sails over the fine leg fence

Siraj to Pant, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Siraj has his man. The partnership has been broken but the damage has been done. The slower delivery from Siraj, rolled his fingers across the ball at the last second, Pant goes on his knee to play the slog sweep but is through the shot early, the ball clips the inside edge brushes his thigh and ends up on the stumps. Pant b Siraj 37(25) [4s-3 6s-2]

Siraj to Stoinis, FOUR, fifty for Stoinis. That's his second of the season and it has been a brutal innings. Apart from the first ball, it was a decent over from Siraj. He went full and wide outside off, Stoinis moves across and whips it in front of square. The shot was on as fine leg and square leg were inside the ring. He raises his bat and soaks in the applause of his team mates
Udana to Hetmyer, SIX, Udana misses the yorker but Hetmyer doesn't miss. It was a full toss and Hetmyer uses his power to muscle it over deep mid-wicket, cleared the fence quite comfortably there

Navdeep Saini to Dhawan, FOUR, a gift first up from Saini and Dhawan gleefully accepts it. A wide, half-volley outside off at 139.9kph, Dhawan throws his arms and flays the drive through the covers. Sped away to the fence

Navdeep Saini to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, that's an incredible shot from Prithvi Shaw! Fullish ball outside off at 143.6kph, Shaw bends his back leg and lofts it handsomely over extra cover. Came off the meat of the bat and went all the way. Mind you, it was the longer side too
Chahal to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's a freebie from Chahal. A flat leggie at 89.4kph, on the shorter side too. Shaw clears his front leg and slaps it through the covers. Authoritative shot

Chahal to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, now a biggie! Chahal is brave to toss this one up, bowls it full and outside off. Shaw gets down on one leg and bludgeons it over wide long-on for a mighty six. New ball, please!
Chahal to Dhawan, FOUR, Delhi have decided to go after RCB's best bowler. Leg-stump line, Dhawan crouches and slog-sweeps it over backward square leg for a one-bounce four

Washington Sundar to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Washington Sundar concedes his first boundary of the match. Shaw shuffles and gets low to slog-sweep. Gets a top edge against this leg-stump line ball. Flies over the keeper and runs away very fine to the fence

Siraj to Dhawan, FOUR, that's a hit-me delivery. Siraj shortens his length and there's not much pace or bounce to threaten the batter. Dhawan gets into a strong position and pummels the pull in front of square on the leg-side

Siraj to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by de Villiers!! RCB have the breakthrough and Kohli is pumped up. Shaw has been bounced out. A head-high bumper on leg from Siraj, gets a bit big on Shaw who got inside the line to hook it away. The ball trims the glove on its way to the keeper. AB moves to his left to pouch it. End of an entertaining knock from Shaw. Prithvi Shaw c de Villiers b Siraj 42(23) [4s-5 6s-2]

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Siraj welcomes Iyer with a gift by doling out a leg-stump half-volley at 140kph. The skipper, who is in great form, gets off the mark with an easy flick off his pads through backward square leg

Udana to Dhawan, out Caught by Moeen Ali!! Holed out! 134.4kph, full on the stumps, Dhawan stands outside leg-stump and backs himself to clear the ropes. The bat turns at the point of impact and robs all the timing. It comes off the bottom part of the bat too. Moeen takes a couple of steps forward from long-on to complete the catch. Dhawan c Moeen Ali b Udana 32(28) [4s-3]

Rabada to Finch, no run, Rabada drops it! Such an easy caught and bowled chance, but KG has put it down. Finch had chipped it right back to the bowler who got his palms to it, but nothing more. Maybe, he got deceived due to the trajectory as the ball was dipping on him
Nortje to Finch, FOUR, cracking shot by Finch to greet Nortje. Short of a length outside off, Finch reaches out for it and slams it through the gap at cover-point for a boundary

Nortje to Finch, 2 runs, dropped again! What's going on? Finch gets an another life as Dhawan fails to latch onto this one at slip as he tries to reverse cup it. Went at the full ball with hard hands and got an outside edge that absolutely flew to the man in the cordon. Looks like it's his day

Axar to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Hetmyer !! It's the longest part of the boundary at cow corner, but Moeen thinks his forward-charging-hoick would do it. Nope, much like his innings, and much like RCB, this goes nowhere .. and that nowhere is straight down deep mid-wicket's throat. Moeen Ali c Hetmyer b Axar 11(13) [4s-1]
Harshal Patel to Kohli, SIX, steps down, makes room for himself, gets it perfectly in the slot, and tonks this into long-on's first floor
Harshal Patel to Washington Sundar, FOUR, 123.8kph, just a punch. First ball, eh. High elbows, standing up on the length delivery and stroking away through the line, through the covers

Rabada to Kohli, out Caught by Pant!! So Rabada's now got Kohli thrice in seven innings -- Bunny worthy? Anyway, Kohli didn't have much of a choice here. He'd realized he's got to everything left by himself, and so what if it's the Delhi's best bowler, He charges down, swipes across the line and ends up getting a thin inside-tickle through to the keeper. Kohli c Pant b Rabada 43(39) [4s-2 6s-1]
Ashwin to Shivam Dube, SIX, gets hold of this .. under the length to a fuller-than-usual delivery to smoke it over long-on against the spin
Rabada to Washington Sundar, FOUR, 142kph, short, wide and Sundar uses all of it in a jumpy upper-cut, behind point, in front of third man
Rabada to Washington Sundar, FOUR, 141.8kph, pitches it up in the slot .. and Sundar drills it straight down, lofting it over Rabada's head

Rabada to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Ashwin!! 141kph. Short. Head-lined. Sundar looks to make room. Pulls. Zero timing. Negative control. Mid-wicket inside the circle. And just like these broken sentences, RCB crumble further. Washington Sundar c Ashwin b Rabada 17(11) [4s-3]

Rabada to Shivam Dube, out Bowled!! 143kph bolt -- full, into middle-stump, and Dube's aimless swing isn't even close to connecting. Yea, sheer pace, and sheer-er accuracy, going under the bat and making a real mess of the stumps. Shivam Dube b Rabada 11(12) [6s-1]

Rabada to Udana, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! WW.W. Rabada's putting up a spectacle here, courtesy Udana's top-edged slice, barely clearing the infield as Iyer - the extra cover - runs backwards and takes it without fuss. Udana c Shreyas Iyer b Rabada 1(3)
Nortje to Siraj, FOUR, very low full toss, marginally outside off. But Siraj after backing away manages to stick his bat out and somehow connect to get it really fine past backward point

Nortje to Siraj, out Bowled!! Typically tail-ender like. Siraj clearly (and smartly) keeps backing away to save getting hit and this time Nortje's not taking chances. He's kept it really full, on middle, and is uprooting middle. Siraj b Nortje 5(4) [4s-1]

Harshal Patel to Navdeep Saini, FOUR, boom. With 24 runs needed per ball, Saini's managed one-sixth, but it's a night time one-sixth. Backing away, getting under Patel's full one and swinging downtown

Ashwin to Devdutt Padikkal, out Caught by Stoinis!! Ravichandran Ashwin gets the man in form. An off-break by Ashwin, that was bowled a lot slower through the air. Devdutt Padikkal swings his bat and gets it off the cue end as Stoinis takes a comfortable catch at deep mid-wicket. The pressure of big scores, he's yet to deal with that, is Devdutt Padikkal. Even against Punjab when RCB were set a big target, Padikkal failed to get going. Same is the case today. Devdutt Padikkal c Stoinis b Ashwin 4(6)

Axar to Kohli, FOUR, he announced his return to form in the previous game, and here's another superb shot. Gets off the mark on the first ball of the innings as he creams the floated delivery through covers with sublime timing

Axar to Finch, out Caught by Pant!! Finch has been dismissed, finally. So, the couple of dropped chances haven't cost much. This pitched outside off and spun away sharply from the batsman who tried to flirt with it and got an outside edge. Sharp reflexes by Pant as he takes it. Both RCB openers are back to the pavilion as the Delhi spinners are choking their opposition at the moment. Finch c Pant b Axar 13(14) [4s-1]

Harshal Patel to Kohli, FOUR, easy pickings for Kohli! This was speared down the leg side by Harshal Patel and the skipper flicks it past the man at short fine leg with nonchalance. 9000 runs in T20 cricket for Kohli, informs Sunny G on air..

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, that was in the air for a while, but just eluded the man at mid-off. This delivery was pitched up by Harshal Patel and AB played a gentle chip. Almost got deceived due to the slower one, but luckily he played it with a straight bat to get it past the fielder stationed at mid-off

Nortje to de Villiers, no run, a direct-hit at the bowler's end and Kohli was gone! This was driven to Ashwin at mid-on by de Villiers and Kohli was almost halfway down the track. Ash had plenty of time to aim and go for the direct-hit at the bowler's end, but he couldn't pull it off
Nortje to de Villiers, FOUR, short in length around off, de Villiers treks back in his crease and slams it over extra cover for a boundary

Nortje to de Villiers, out Caught by Dhawan!! Royal Challengers Bangalore in trouble as AB de Villiers walks back. Was a length ball by Nortje and the batsman completely miscued it. Tried to hoick across the line and mistimed it towards mid-wicket where Dhawan takes a comfortable catch. In the battle of two South Africans, it's the younger bloke who comes out on top. de Villiers c Dhawan b Nortje 9(6) [4s-2]
Ashwin to Moeen Ali, FOUR, swept away! Down on his knee as he sweeps the loopy delivery past the man at deep square leg for four runs
Axar to Kohli, 1 run, darts this one outside off and Kohli punches it through covers for a single

Rajpoot to de Kock, FOUR, lovely, a friendly half-volley outside off and de Kock is off and running with a boundary, leans into the drive and places it straight of mid-off, the fielder didn't have a chance

Rajpoot to Rohit, FOUR, lovely, poor line and length from Rajpoot, can't offer width with third man inside the ring - Rohit waits on the ball, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and guides it behind square on the off-side for a boundary

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, fabulous shot! It was the wrong 'un and Suryakumar picked it, he went down on his knee and swept it with the spin backward of square, giving no chance for the fielder in the deep

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's another excellent shot. A inside out loft off the backfoot. This was fraction short and Suryakumar forced it over the cover fielder, he had enough power to beat the sweeper

Rahul Tewatia to Krunal Pandya, SIX, pressure releaser for Krunal. He was not getting anything off the middle till now. Tewatia floats one up and Krunal takes it on, slog sweeps straight down the ground and collects half a dozen

Jofra Archer to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Shreyas Gopal!! Of course he can. That's Archer at his best. Exploits the weakness of Krunal and sends him packing. Short of length delivery at the ribs, Krunal is not comfortable anything around there, he gets all cramped up as he attempts the pull, it is a tame one and Gopal gobbles up the dolly at mid-wicket. Krunal Pandya c Shreyas Gopal b Jofra Archer 12(17) [6s-1]

Tom Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, neatly done! Fifty for Suryakumar. First of the season for him. He has looked good in the last few games but has been run-out in a couple of them. Today he has not thrown it away. Coming to the ball: Slower delivery and Suryakumar waited for it, steered it so well that he bisected Buttler and short third man
Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, stand and deliver! Mid-off was inside the ring. Archer offers width on the back of a length and Hardik flat-bats it straight past the fielder at mid-off

Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, good improvisation there from Suryakumar. Mumbai needed a boundary to make it a good over. He moves inside the line, gets under the back of a length delivery and helps it over short fine

Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, full toss outside off and though Hardik didn't get it off the middle, he gets it into the gap - sliced over extra cover and Gopal cannot chase it down. He immediately asks for a drier pair of gloves..

Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, 137.5kph right in the blockhole, Hardik jams it with a closed bat face into the mid-wicket region, the fielders are on the boundary edge allowing the second to be taken

Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, dropped! How costly will that be? Curran has no one else to blame than himself. The slower short ball outside off, Hardik tries to flat-bat it down town but the top-edge flies straight up to the right of the bowler, Curran sets himself up and lets it slip through his hands. He took his eyes off just at the right time

Tom Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, superb batting. Suryakumar shuffles across, goes down on his knee and waits for the low full toss, then nonchalantly helps it over backward square. The connection was so good that the ball sailed over

Tom Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 19 off the over.. That's the big one Mumbai wanted. Curran goes for the slower back of a length stuff, Suryakumar walks across, gets inside the line and laps it over short fine leg

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, free-hit and Hardik cannot take toll of it. Low full toss on middle and leg, Hardik drills it down to long-on and Suryakumar races back for the second. He was helped by a slight fumble

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, no ball, byes, FOUR, oh my! That must have slipped out of Archer's hand. High full toss right at Hardik's head, he does well to duck under it. The ball bounces just in front of Buttler and escapes past him. Archer immediately had his hands up apologetically

Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, wow! That's special. We have seen this before but to do it to Archer after being hit on the head. Hats off! Full delivery just short of yorker length, Suryakumar crouches down and reverse laps it straight over Buttler, the pace of Archer ensures it goes the distance. Even Smith was impressed with that shot

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's brilliant cricket. Suryakumar moved across early and Rajpoot followed him with a full toss, but the batsman adjusted and scooped it over short fine, one bounce and over the ropes

Rajpoot to Hardik Pandya, SIX, once more not off the meat but the power of Hardik ensures it goes sailing over the rope. It was a freebie from Rajpoot, juicy full toss and Hardik goes straight, clearing the boundary quite comfortably

Rajpoot to Rohit, SIX, beautifully played, tad too full and wide from Rajpoot, Rohit leans forward, gets close to the ball, extends his arms and launches it over mid-off went sailing over the ropes for a maximum

Rajpoot to Rohit, FOUR, cracking shot, Rajpoot is proving to be expensive - back of a length and wide of off, Rohit waits on it and then cuts it late, beats the sliding effort of the fielder running across to his left from deep point

Rajpoot to de Kock, FOUR, cheeky and four, change of pace from Rajpoot, the slower ball angling across the left-hander, de Kock shuffles across, gets inside the line and helps it on its way over short fine for another boundary

Jofra Archer to de Kock, FOUR, a big effort from Rajpoot at fine leg, but that would have been the catch of the season had he held it - length ball down leg and de Kock whipped it violently towards fine leg - The ball was travelling and Ankit ran across to his left - put in the dive, but the ball was always going away from him
Jofra Archer to de Kock, SIX, massive, fraction short and de Kock is quick on the pull - rocks back and pulls it high and over backward square leg, went sailing over the ropes

Kartik Tyagi to Rohit, SIX, a high full-toss and Rohit has sent is sailing into the stands - prods across and then brings his wrists into play, came at an uncomfortable height, but he was equal to the task, pulled over backward square leg for a maximum

Kartik Tyagi to de Kock, out Caught by Buttler!! Maiden IPL wicket for Kartik - beaten for sheer pace was de Kock - banged in short and at the stumps, de Kock was rocking back on the pull, the ball kept getting big on him, he was in no control over the shot, gets a top-edge that spills straight up - Buttler called for the catch and holds on with ease. de Kock c Buttler b Kartik Tyagi 23(15) [4s-3 6s-1]
Kartik Tyagi to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, dabbed down towards third man and Suryakumar is off the mark with a single
