Tom Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, nicely played, too straight from Curran, Suryakumar shuffles across, gets inside the line and picks the gap wide of mid-on with the on-drive, no need to run for those

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, beautifully played, the leg-spinner from Shreyas, drifted wide of off, Suryakumar leans forward, opens the face of the bat and lifts it inside out over cover for a boundary
Shreyas Gopal to Rohit, SIX, cracking shot, too short from Shreyas, Rohit stays on the front-foot and then pummels the pull over mid-wicket, went a long way over the ropes for a maximum
Kartik Tyagi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, short, wide and four, a bad ball from Tyagi at 133 kmph, Suryakumar had to reach out as he steered the cut over backward point, one bounce and over the ropes

Kartik Tyagi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cheeky and four, this was the shot that had him against trouble against RCB, but he's played it well here - short of a length at 137 kmph, some extra bounce and Suryakumar made sure he got on top of it, chops it past the keeper and into the third an ropes

Kartik Tyagi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, edged and four, three boundaries and three dots in the over - the length was wide once again, Suryakumar threw the kitchen sink on the drive, gets a thick edge that flies through the vacant slip cordon

Shreyas Gopal to Rohit, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! A soft soft dismissal for Rohit - he falls to leg-spin once again. The wrong 'un and Rohit read it well, came down the track, got close to the pitch and was then looking to launch it back over the bowler's end. Unfortunately for him, the bat turned slightly on impact and he ended up heaving it down the throat of Tewatia at long-on - didn't have to move an inch and the Royals have their man. Rohit c Rahul Tewatia b Shreyas Gopal 35(23) [4s-2 6s-3]

Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Samson!! Back to back wickets for Shreyas, but what was Ishan Kishan trying to do? First ball and he looks to slog Shreyas out of the park - was the wrong 'un and he didn't get anywhere near the ball, sliced it high and over cover. Samson circled around it, kept his eyes on the ball and pouches it with glee. All of a sudden, Shreyas finds himself on a hat-trick. Ishan Kishan c Samson b Shreyas Gopal 0(1)

Boult to Jaiswal, out Caught by de Kock!! Jaiswal gets back into the team and gets a duck on return. Back of a length outside off, just a hint of shape for Boult, nothing great. But this is a bad shot. Plays away from the body looking to run it to third man, only succeeds in nicking it behind. Jaiswal c de Kock b Boult 0(2)
Boult to Smith, FOUR, what wrists from Smith as he whips this through square leg. Back of a length around off, shovels it with the bottom hand, hurries to the fence

Bumrah to Smith, out Caught by de Kock!! A replica of his dismissal against Cummins in that game against KKR, where he looked so frenentic. Was more composed at the crease in the time he spent here, before this happened. Tries slogging Bumrah off a length and inside-edges it behind. De Kock flies to his left for an excellent grab. Royals in a hole. Smith c de Kock b Bumrah 6(7) [4s-1]
Rahul Chahar to Buttler, SIX, slips out of his hand into the half-tracker mark, Buttler rocks back and launches that over long-on for a gigantic 82-meter six!
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, SIX, he's backed away to a flat one that's intended to cramp him, and mowed it over deep mid-wicket for six!
Pollard to Buttler, SIX, for the faintest moment, all was gone for RR. He backed away to the on-side, waited for the pace-off delivery to reach, and bottom-handed the swat late over long-on for six!
Pollard to Buttler, FOUR, another slower one, and Buttler waits again to let it reach, carting it over the on-side for four! Buttler on fire!

Pattinson to Buttler, out Caught by Pollard! That is an incredible catch! I mean, he did make things difficult for himself to be honest. Not sure he knew where the boundary was. Buttler just got under a really full one and tried to launch this over long-on, but hand to take on the tallest fielder in the opposition - Pollard ran towards the left and leapt up, got a hand, but the ball bounced out in the first attempt - and yet, he was quick enough to grab it in the second attempt! Buttler c Pollard b Pattinson 70(44) [4s-4 6s-5]
Pattinson to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, full and wide, no feet to go towards it, just gets under it and lifts it away towards long-off for four

Pollard to Tom Curran, FOUR, full and wide, Tom Curran gets under it and slices high towards the cover region, Krunal comes in from wide long-off to dive and cut it off, but he's touching the boundary as he does that - boundary it is...

Pollard to Tom Curran, out Caught by Hardik Pandya! Curran's gotta go! Doesn't quite have Buttler's bottom-hand, and with the pace off, he's tried to club this with a dominant bottom-hand over long-on - doesn't get much distance, and Hardik runs in from wide long-on to comfortably hold on to a catch. Tom Curran c Hardik Pandya b Pollard 15(16) [4s-1]
Pollard to Jofra Archer, FOUR, all kinds of zig-zag, that run-up, a slower, wide length ball, Jofra Archer delays the shot and then just cross-bats a slap to long-off for four

Bumrah to Rahul Tewatia, out Bowled! Knocked him over! The form-temporary-class-permanent thing is the cliche of all cliches, but he's nailed another yorker at 142.1km/h. Tewatia has to move around and improvise to get under that and score some much-needed runs, but it's not going to happen. Not tonight. The bails light up and Rahul Tewatia has to go. Rahul Tewatia b Bumrah 5(6) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Shreyas Gopal, out Caught by de Kock! Oh this is Vintage Bumrah. Maybe Bumrah isn't old enough for the word VIintage to be associated with him, so lets say "typical" Bumrah! Angling in sharply, brute-forcing even this unresponsive Kookaburra to straighten off the seam, and take the hopping batsman's outside edge to the 'keeper for a catch. QdK just about keeps that off his face. Might consider a helmet. Shreyas Gopal c de Kock b Bumrah 1(2)

Boult to Jofra Archer, SIX, short ball at the off-stump, Jofra Archer has a free swing across the line between mid-wicket and long-on and gets it over the fielder for six! Terrific shot, and they'll need a lot more of those!
Bumrah to Jofra Archer, FOUR, slams a length ball between mid-wicket and long-on for four! Just mows this away without a care in the world!

Bumrah to Jofra Archer, FOUR, another one that doesn't really have width, a short one, but even though he's cramped for room, he's picked up the length quick enough to hit the middle with the pull and club it away towards long-on for four

Bumrah to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Pollard! Tries getting under it, but doesn't do so well enough to a really full ball, and the result is that he can't quite get the desired height - and that would mean Pollard at long-on has to hold on to a ridiculously easy catch. Jofra Archer c Pollard b Bumrah 24(11) [4s-3 6s-1]

Pattinson to Rajpoot, out Caught by Rohit! That's the end of a comprehensive performance from the Mumbai Indians. Rajpoot backs away and tries slicing that over cover, but Rohit inside the circle takes a catch above his head to end a memorable night for Mumbai. Rajpoot c Rohit b Pattinson 2(5)
Boult to Buttler, FOUR, strays it wide outside off with the angle going across, Buttler slaps it through point

Boult to Samson, out Caught by Rohit!! Mumbai pacers on fire again. And not for the first time in this tournament has Samson been dismissed after being rushed on the pull. So after a great start, he's had three successive failures. The ball just comes onto him quicker than expected as he camps on the front foot. Spoons it up off the splice to mid-on. Royals losing this match in a hurry. Samson c Rohit b Boult 0(3)
Bumrah to Buttler, FOUR, full on middle, strong wrists from Buttler as he drives past mid-on

Boult to Buttler, FOUR, back of a length delivery across off, Buttler opens the face on it to guide it past Pollard at short third man. If nothing else, it's a good chance for Buttler to play himself into some form. Or is it too early to write them off?
Pattinson to Lomror, FOUR, more conviction in this from Lomror. Short and wide, puts the cut away through cover-point

Rahul Chahar to Lomror, out Caught by (sub)Anukul Roy!! Different ways to get your name out there. He probably won't get a chance to showcase his left-arm spin this season, but Anukul Roy has pulled off a blinder as a substitute fielder. Sliced off a thick outside edge as Lomror tries to go leg-side. It goes up and behind Roy at short cover. He runs back, eyes on the ball which is going further and further away, but he races after it and dives with both hands, parallel to the ground while taking it. Stunning. Lomror c (sub)Anukul Roy b Rahul Chahar 11(13) [4s-1]
Rahul Chahar to Buttler, SIX, half-tracker at the stumps, swatted into the grass banks behind midwicket
Rahul Chahar to Tom Curran, 1 run, sliding in on middle and leg, works it through midwicket

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, SIX, drops it so short that it was on its way down when reaching Buttler. And he does so well to generate power, which isn't always the easiest thing with such deliveries. Slaps it over the extra cover boundary
Chahar to R Tripathi, FOUR, 134.3kph, into the feet again. It's less worse, meaning Tripathi can tickle, and gets it really fine

Karn Sharma to Narine, out Caught by du Plessis!! Just Jadeja things! Takes an absolute specky, at deep mid-wicket, diving parallel to the ground to his right and just when he was about to skid onto the boundary triangles, tosses the ball to Faf (running from long-on) to complete the catch. Was loopier and the line teased Narine to go for the big one, attempts a heave, only to be bettered by the fielding brilliance of CSK. The KKR management won't be too disappointed and we could see Narine play more of such roles for the rest of the IPL. Narine c du Plessis b Karn Sharma 17(9) [4s-1 6s-1]
SN Thakur to Morgan, FOUR, crunched off the middle! Full pitcher in the zone outside off and Morgan just leans into the drive while slotting it in the gap through extra cover, raced away!

Sam Curran to Tripathi, 1 run, a direct hit from Sam Curran would have sent Tripathi back to the pavilion, wasn't to be. Tripathi gave up mid-way after knocking this into the leg-side and Curran did well to gather the ball quickly, missed the target by some distance though

Sam Curran to Morgan, out Caught by Dhoni!! Huge wicket in the context for CSK and it's Curran who's got his England skipper. Surprises Morgan with a short ball and gets good fizz off the pitch to get it climbing and restrain the timing on the shot, Morgan was probably aiming for the deep square region, but the shot lacked intent and MSD does the rest behind the sticks. Morgan c Dhoni b Sam Curran 7(10) [4s-1]
Chahar to Tripathi, FOUR, too easy! Drifting down leg on a length and all Tripathi had to do help it on its way, he sits on one knee and scoops it fine of the keeper to his left

Chahar to Tripathi, SIX, this is poor execution from Deepak Chahar! He serves another leg-stump dross and it's been picked up neatly from the in-form Tripathi who smokes it on one knee and sees the ball sailing over the fine leg fence

SN Thakur to Russell, out Caught by Dhoni!! Shardul Thakur has been terrific with his lengths and variations today. Bowls the cross-seam delivery and pitches it much shorter than it did against Gill. A similar dismissal though. Russell looks to go over mid-wicket with a cross-bat swipe and sends a crisp edge through to the keeper. Russell c Dhoni b SN Thakur 2(4)
Dwayne Bravo to Tripathi, FOUR, a real smash-me outside off. Short and wide of off, Tripathi gets on his tippy toes and flays it with brute power over backward point

Dwayne Bravo to Tripathi, out Caught by Watson!! First wicket for DJ Bravo in IPL 2020. Pushes this fuller and in the outside off zone, Tripathi looks to play a cheeky dab with an open bat face but the ball takes the bottom half and lands in the bucket hands of Watto at short third man. Bravo went up straightaway and so did Watson, the umpires just wanted to be sure as they deemed the soft signal in favor of the bowler. Tripathi c Watson b Dwayne Bravo 81(51) [4s-8 6s-3]

SN Thakur to Cummins, FOUR, Pat Cummins would have grown up playing such shots and the length was ideal. Short at 138ks and right in the slot for him, powers the pull and gets it in the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket

SN Thakur to Cummins, SIX, another one to feast on for Cummins and he doesn't miss out. Short and angled into the batsman, Cummins loads up on the back foot and smites it many-a-mile flat over the cow corner fence

Sam Curran to Karthik, FOUR, dropped! A relatively easy chance by Jadeja's standards. DK muscles the pull and it was hit flat to the right of the fielder at deep mid-wicket, Jaddu got there quickly but the momentum was always taking him to his right and he seemed to have lost the trajectory momentarily as he tried to take it in front of his face. Sneaks through his fingers and travels to the fence

Sam Curran to Karthik, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Gone this time. Thakur juggles once and takes it on the second attempt. Short and got big on DK outside off, he still tries to force the upper cut and hits it flat and straight to the fielder at square third man. Karthik c SN Thakur b Sam Curran 12(11) [4s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to K Nagarkoti, out Caught by du Plessis!! Catching practice for Faf at mid-off. Bravo is back to doing what he does best, take wickets in the death overs and unleash his dance moves. Deceives Nagarkoti with a slower ball outside off and a tame chip to mid-off meant curtains for the batsman. K Nagarkoti c du Plessis b Dwayne Bravo 0(2)

Dwayne Bravo to Shivam Mavi, out Caught by Dhoni!! Goodness me! That is a spectacular catch from MSD. Sheer commitment and his athleticism was on full display while grabbing the catch. Dhoni seemed to have signalled something to Bravo just before this delivery and I'm guessing it's something to do with lack of pace. Keeps it in the shortish length area does Bravo and induces a thick outside edge on the slog. Dhoni dives full length to his right, juggles it on the first attempt and then takes the rebound with a sharp spring to his right. 150th IPL wicket for Bravo! Shivam Mavi c Dhoni b Dwayne Bravo 0(1)
Chahar to R Tripathi, 1 run, hops, dabs in front of backward point (Jadeja again), and this time Tripathi would've comfortably been out had it been a direct hit at the non-striker's. Alas ..
Chahar to Shubman Gill, FOUR, ah, stunning. Chahar looks to bang it in short, but Gill's standing taller, with a lofted pull, over mid-wicket

Chahar to R Tripathi, FOUR, hoicked agriculturally, against the line, and despite the miscue, he's gotten it over the leg-side infield. Thakur chases, slides, flicks it back, and his knee has just brushed the boundary while a finger's still on the ball

Dwayne Bravo to Chakravarthy, out Chakravarthy Run Out!! 1 run completed. Jadeja and Dhoni, goodluck taking risk against this duo. Chakravarthy powers this low full toss to deep mid-wicket and there was never a two there, KKR still run in hope and hope is all that'll remain for them. Jaddu fires it quickly and MSD was in perfect position to deflect it onto the stumps. Chakravarthy run out (Jadeja/Dhoni) 1(1)

Chahar to R Tripathi, FOUR, 130kph, another bouncer gets punished. Chahar clearly doesn't have the pace to trouble, but this delivery's a little higher, but still, the shortness of it allows Tripathi the time to get inside the line, swivel and hook it really fine. It also helps that fine leg's inside the ring
Sam Curran to R Tripathi, FOUR, 127.2kph, on the pads, but instead of just flicking it away, Tripathi makes sure he crouches and makes it more of a sweep off his legs
Sam Curran to R Tripathi, FOUR, overpitched. Tripathi connects with his swing this time, getting under this and lofting this over mid-off. This is how you celebrate promotions ..

SN Thakur to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Dhoni!! Big loud nick. Thakur has Gill for the third time in as many IPL innings -- this time with Gill throwing it away after losing patience, losing shape and losing his timing. He tries a cross-batted heave but the length's a little too full to be doing this, and ends up getting a tickle on the under-edge through to the keeper. Shubman Gill c Dhoni b SN Thakur 11(12) [4s-1]
SN Thakur to Nitish Rana, FOUR, 140kph .. and Rana flashes hard. Full, wide and a thick outside edge on Rana's slap, but there's no slip, and third man's rather square
Chahar to R Tripathi, SIX, the knuckle ball in the slot .. and Tripathi has a full-blow at this, slicing his loft, with more height than distance, but is still over deep extra cover
Chahar to R Tripathi, wide, 115.2kph, slower shorter one, but gets too leg-sided, angling past Tripathi's attempted pull
Karn Sharma to R Tripathi, SIX, slogged. One-kneed, murderous bat-swing, and despite Curran's full-leap at long-on, it just goes over. Alas, not everyone has a Polllard ..

Karn Sharma to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Jadeja !! Miscued slog-sweep. It's a normal leg-break, but Rana's adventures of wanting to smoke this over the longest part of the ground - cow corner - ends up in the hands of the fielder out there. Clearly not full enough to be slogging these .. Nitish Rana c Jadeja b Karn Sharma 9(10) [4s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to R Tripathi, FOUR, 132.5kph, juicy this. Short, wide, and it's Bravo's birthday, but for some reason, he's the one giving out gifts here. Tripathi thrashes a square cut, over point, and has a fifty. Yea, that's how you seal spots and kill debates
Dwayne Bravo to Narine, SIX, 99.9kph. Wide floaty, loopy off-break. Narine lays in, this is bang in his zone, and slices this typically over deep extra cover
Dwayne Bravo to Narine, FOUR, overcooks it now at full pace. Narine opens his bat face and squeezes this between point and short third
Chahar to R Tripathi, FOUR, 134.3kph, into the feet again. It's less worse, meaning Tripathi can tickle, and gets it really fine

Karn Sharma to Narine, out Caught by du Plessis!! Just Jadeja things! Takes an absolute specky, at deep mid-wicket, diving parallel to the ground to his right and just when he was about to skid onto the boundary triangles, tosses the ball to Faf (running from long-on) to complete the catch. Was loopier and the line teased Narine to go for the big one, attempts a heave, only to be bettered by the fielding brilliance of CSK. The KKR management won't be too disappointed and we could see Narine play more of such roles for the rest of the IPL. Narine c du Plessis b Karn Sharma 17(9) [4s-1 6s-1]
SN Thakur to Morgan, FOUR, crunched off the middle! Full pitcher in the zone outside off and Morgan just leans into the drive while slotting it in the gap through extra cover, raced away!

A similar dismissal though. Russell looks to go over mid-wicket with a cross-bat swipe and sends a crisp edge through to the keeper. Russell c Dhoni b SN Thakur 2(4)
Dwayne Bravo to Tripathi, FOUR, a real smash-me outside off. Short and wide of off, Tripathi gets on his tippy toes and flays it with brute power over backward point

Thakur has Gill for the third time in as many IPL innings -- this time with Gill throwing it away after losing patience, losing shape and losing his timing. He tries a cross-batted heave but the length's a little too full to be doing this, and ends up getting a tickle on the under-edge through to the keeper. Shubman Gill c Dhoni b SN Thakur 11(12) [4s-1]
SN Thakur to Nitish Rana, FOUR, 140kph .. and Rana flashes hard. Full, wide and a thick outside edge on Rana's slap, but there's no slip, and third man's rather square
Chahar to R Tripathi, SIX, the knuckle ball in the slot .. and Tripathi has a full-blow at this, slicing his loft, with more height than distance, but is still over deep extra cover
Chahar to R Tripathi, wide, 115.2kph, slower shorter one, but gets too leg-sided, angling past Tripathi's attempted pull
Karn Sharma to R Tripathi, SIX, slogged. One-kneed, murderous bat-swing, and despite Curran's full-leap at long-on, it just goes over. Alas, not everyone has a Polllard ..

Karn Sharma to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Jadeja !! Miscued slog-sweep. It's a normal leg-break, but Rana's adventures of wanting to smoke this over the longest part of the ground - cow corner - ends up in the hands of the fielder out there. Clearly not full enough to be slogging these .. Nitish Rana c Jadeja b Karn Sharma 9(10) [4s-1]

Dwayne Bravo to R Tripathi, FOUR, 132.5kph, juicy this. Short, wide, and it's Bravo's birthday, but for some reason, he's the one giving out gifts here. Tripathi thrashes a square cut, over point, and has a fifty. Yea, that's how you seal spots and kill debates
Dwayne Bravo to Narine, SIX, 99.9kph. Wide floaty, loopy off-break. Narine lays in, this is bang in his zone, and slices this typically over deep extra cover
Dwayne Bravo to Narine, FOUR, overcooks it now at full pace. Narine opens his bat face and squeezes this between point and short third

Sandeep Sharma to Agarwal, FOUR, that's a lovely shot by Mayank! That's the kind of form he is in. Pitched up outside off and the right hander plays a gentle punch to pierce the field at covers, it's a rollicking boundary and the first one of the night for Punjab

Khaleel Ahmed to Agarwal, out Agarwal Run Out!! 1 run completed. A mix-up between the openers and Mayank has to depart. Brilliant stop by Warner at mid-off though. He sprinted across and stopped the drive with a dive. Mayank was committed for the second, but Rahul sends him back. And by the time he can react, Warner's throw is already at the bowler's end. That's that for Agarwal tonight, then. Agarwal run out (Warner/Khaleel Ahmed) 9(6) [4s-1]

T Natarajan to Maxwell, 1 run, put down! 121.1kph, length ball, driven back at the bowler and it comes at knee-high to the left of the bowler. Natarajan was a bit late to react and ended up parrying it to mid-on
T Natarajan to Maxwell, 1 run, 134.2kph, Natarajan gets away with a full toss as Maxwell miscues the aerial flick. Falls in vacant deep-ish square leg region
T Natarajan to Pooran, FOUR, that's a gift! All Pooran had to do was get some willow on it. A full toss on the pads at 137.1kph, Pooran flicks it fine of the man at 45. Easily done

T Natarajan to Maxwell, out Maxwell Run Out!! Direct hit at the non-striker's end and Maxwell is walking! Doesn't wait for the TV umpire's call. 139.5kph, yorker length, Maxwell jams it to extra cover and the Punjab batters decide to go for the risky single. Garg collects the ball cleanly and hits the bullseye at the bowler's end to catch Maxwell short of his crease. Brilliant work from the youngster as he had only one stump to aim at. Second run-out of the innings! Maxwell run out (Priyam Garg) 7(12)

Rashid Khan to Mandeep, out Bowled!! Cleaned up with a googly! 88.7kph, lands marginally outside off, spins in quite sharply and Mandeep gets into a tangle. He is neither forward nor back to play it. To make matters worse, he is late in bringing in his bat down. The wrong 'un spins past the inside edge to cannon onto the sticks. Mandeep b Rashid Khan 6(6)

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, FOUR, falls short of the man in the deep. Off-speed short ball, Pooran swivel-pulls and isn't quite control of his shot. Samad comes in from deep backward square leg and dives forward. The ball bounces in front of him and goes past him for a boundary

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, FOUR, superb batting! Nothing much wrong with the ball. A wide-ish yorker at 135.1kph, Pooran opens his bat-face at the last moment to squirt it fine of the man at short third man. Just a hint of width and Pooran used the bowler's pace to his advantage

Khaleel Ahmed to Mujeeb, out Caught by Bairstow!! An appeal for caught-behind, SRH decide against the review. Meanwhile, the umpires have sent it upstairs to check if it was a bump ball. The soft signal is Not Out. A yorker length ball from round the wicket, Mujeeb stays leg-side of the ball to jam it out. Don't think it is a bump ball. OUT signalled on the giant screen. And, the drama doesn't end there. Mujeeb starts to walk ... and then decides to challenge the call. The umpires had a chat and decided to call the third umpire, again! A review for caught-behind. There's a spike on Ultra Edge and it's clearly an outside edge as the bat hits the ground later. After all the drama, Mujeeb is out and he's wasted a review too. Mujeeb c Bairstow b Khaleel Ahmed 1(3)

Rashid Khan to Pooran, out Caught by T Natarajan!! He tried to save his team-mates, and in the end perishes. Didn't take singles off the previous two balls, sees the ball on the shorter side and goes after it with a cut shot. Isn't in control of it and offers a dolly to Natarajan at backward point. With that goes KXIP's hopes! Pooran c T Natarajan b Rashid Khan 77(37) [4s-5 6s-7]

Rashid Khan to Shami, out Lbw!! Shami wants to review, but Punjab don't have any left. A double-wicket maiden from Rashid Khan! The googly does the trick, Shami doesn't pick it and ends up playing way outside the line of it. Gets rapped on the pads adjacent to the sticks. Only height could have saved him, but he was playing off the back foot. Umpire's call on HawkEye. Shami lbw b Rashid Khan 0(1)

Sandeep Sharma to Ravi Bishnoi, FOUR, another off-speed ball, full and on the stumps at 123.3kph from wide of the crease. Bishnoi clears his front leg and hoists it over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four

T Natarajan to Cottrell, out Bowled!! Timber! Natarajan bowls the perfect yorker. Right in the blockhole at 135.2kph and the line is accurate too. Cottrell goes for an ambitious drive, brings his bat down late and also plays outside the line of it. The ball crashes into the middle-stump! Cottrell b T Natarajan 0(2)

T Natarajan to Arshdeep Singh, out Caught by Warner!! A pitched up delivery at 133.4kph, Arshdeep Singh drives hard and hits it straight to Warner at wide mid-off. The skipper pouches and then fist-pumps in delight. SRH win by 69 runs! Arshdeep Singh c Warner b T Natarajan 0(3)

T Natarajan to Simran Singh, FOUR, a helicopter flick by Simran Singh! Overpitched delivery by Natarajan, it's right in the slot and the batsman does a Dhoni there. Flicks it and clears the man at mid-wicket quite comfortably
Khaleel Ahmed to Simran Singh, FOUR, aggression written all over that shot! Pitched up outside off, Simran Singh brings his bat down in a jiffy and lofts it over the leaping man at mid-off

Khaleel Ahmed to Simran Singh, out Caught by Priyam Garg!! Quality catch by Priyam Garg at cover-point. This was struck so hard, but Garg has managed to take a sharp low catch towards his left. A short of length outside off and the cut flies straight to the fielder. Khaleel absolutely loves it as he celebrates his run with his arms wide open.. Simran Singh c Priyam Garg b Khaleel Ahmed 11(8) [4s-2]
Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, FOUR, creamed through covers by Pooran! Half-volley to greet the batsman as the southpaw nails his drive through perfection, right into the gap and he's off the mark in style
T Natarajan to Pooran, SIX, lovely shot by Pooran! Length delivery on leg and Pooran has played a superb pick up shot to clear the fence at deep square leg
Abhishek Sharma to Pooran, SIX, stand and deliver! A tossed up delivery on middle and off, Pooran gets it right into the slot and thumps it over long-on for a huge six
Abhishek Sharma to Pooran, SIX, two in two! Overpitched delivery by Abhishek Sharma and it has been pumped over long-on by Pooran once again. The young spinner put under pressure by Nicky P

Abhishek Sharma to Rahul, out Caught by Williamson!! Mayank in the balcony cannot believe this, has his hands on the head. Meanwhile, Rahul looks towards the heaven and starts walking back to the pavilion in disappointment. Was down on his knee to play the sweep that induced a top-edge and flew straight to Kane Williamson at deep square leg. He's not going to miss out on those. Good comeback by Abhishek as he gets a huge wicket. Rahul c Williamson b Abhishek Sharma 11(16)
Abdul Samad to Pooran, SIX, he means business today! Showing no mercy on the young bowlers. Loopy delivery on off, touch fuller and it has been smoked over long-off for half-a-dozen

Abdul Samad to Pooran, FOUR, smashed! Abhishek was at the receiving end a couple of overs back, it's Samad now. Touch fuller outside off, Pooran throws the kitchen sink and bludgeons it past the man at wide long-off, beating his dive near the fence
Abdul Samad to Pooran, SIX, woah! One of biggest of the night. Gets to the pitch of the ball and clubs it over wide long-on for six more. Carnage!
Abdul Samad to Pooran, SIX, fastest fifty of IPL 2020! A loopy delivery around off and the southpaw has tonked it over long-off for his sixth biggie of the night
Abdul Samad to Pooran, SIX, unstoppable! Slightly short ball on middle and leg, Pooran hacks it over deep mid-wicket for six more. Unbelievable hitting this!

Cottrell to Warner, FOUR, up and over! Haven't seen Warner be aggressive this early in this season but this shot perhaps shows a change in mindset. Slight fuller from Cottrell and it's lofted straight back over his head. Clean connection and gets the result

Cottrell to Warner, FOUR, educated edge if you want to call it that way but Warner gets another boundary. Hung back to the shorter length with an open bat face. Got it off the outer half, just wide of slip and races away to the third man fence

Mujeeb to Bairstow, FOUR, too full from Mujeeb, infact it ends up as a low full toss and Bairstow drives it elegantly through the covers. Probably looked for that in-swinging delivery but couldn't land it

Arshdeep Singh to Bairstow, 1 run, another full toss that Bairstow can't take full toll of, slams it straight down the ground but long-on gets across swiftly to keep the batsmen to just a single. 100-run stand is up!! These two just enjoy batting together, don't they?

Maxwell to Bairstow, FOUR, terrific effort from Mandeep. But the ball slips out and rolls into the rope. Flatter and outside off, Bairstow had the width and he slapped it to wide long-off, Mandeep ran across and put in a full length dive, got one hand to it but the ball did not stlick

Maxwell to Bairstow, SIX, wow! This is carnage of the highest level. Maxwell shouted "catch it" but there's no crowd allowed. This was a fraction short and Bairstow was quick to pick the length, rocked back and hammered the pull into the deep mid-wicket's second tier

Maxwell to Bairstow, SIX, and another.. This just keeps getting bad for Kings XI. Maxwell lands this right in the arc, Bairstow with this kind of hitting form is not going to miss out, he clears his front leg and goes straight, clearing the sightscreen comfortably

Shami to Bairstow, FOUR, this time the low full toss gets the treatment. Bairstow made a bit of room so that he could have a free swing of his arms, pumps it straight of mid-off and the ball rockets to the fence

Mujeeb to Warner, 1 run, fifty for Warner. Second of the season. He started aggressively today but has taken a step back once Bairstow went berserk. Looks like he will bat through the innings. Just a raise of the bat to celebrate the milestone. Mujeeb follows Warner and is tucked away through mid-wicket

Mujeeb to Bairstow, SIX, Bairstow is just toying with the bowling now. Bowlers are not sure where to bowl to him. Mujeeb goes wide outside off, Bairstow uses the long lever to thump it straight down the ground, all the way

Mujeeb to Bairstow, SIX, back to back sixes. The length was pulled back and Bairstow was waiting on the backfoot, pulls it in front of square and wide of the fielder at deep mid-wicket. He is closing in on his hundred..

Ravi Bishnoi to Warner, out Caught by Maxwell!! A wicket for Kings XI after almost 35 overs. Remember the Pollard-Pandya carnage, then Watson-Faf chase and now this. It is the young leggie who has broken this partnership. Warner had to go as Bairstow was playing for those three runs to get to his hundred. He takes on the googly and skies the slog sweep straight up, Maxwell settles under near long-on and pouches it comfortably. Warner c Maxwell b Ravi Bishnoi 52(40) [4s-5 6s-1]

Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, out Lbw!! Excellent review from Rahul. There was a run out and Samad was short, but he wanted the bigger fish. Challenged the LBW call and got it overturned. This was the slider which skids on, Bairstow is caught in the crease, beaten for pace as he misses the nudge to the on-side, struck on the back pad in front of leg-stump and ball-tracking had it smashing into the sticks. So, Bairstow falls three short of his hundred and young Bishnoi has sent back both openers in a space of four balls. Bairstow lbw b Ravi Bishnoi 97(55) [4s-7 6s-6]

Arshdeep Singh to Manish Pandey, out Caught&Bowled!! And another.. Kings XI are back in this. No wicket for 36-odd overs and now they have three in seven balls. The slower delivery that sticks in the wicket, Pandey is on the backfoot because of the shortish length, he closes the bat face early and the leading edge lobs back to the bowler. Arshdeep makes no mistake in his followthrough. Manish Pandey c and b Arshdeep Singh 1(2)

Ravi Bishnoi to Abdul Samad, FOUR, dropped! Pooran has put one down. Samad charges down, gets a bit too close to the flighted delivery and lofts it to long-off, Pooran runs to his left and goes with his hands over his head, never in a position to take it and what's more he allows it to roll into the rope

Ravi Bishnoi to Abdul Samad, out Caught by Arshdeep Singh!! Third for Bishnoi. What a turnaround by the youngster. He saw Samad shuffle across and pushed it through quicker, the pull is mistimed and Arshdeep stationed at deep square leg hangs on to a good catch. That ball was up for a long time and the pacer kept his calm to take it. SRH have now lost 4 wickets for 13 runs in 2.5 overs. Abdul Samad c Arshdeep Singh b Ravi Bishnoi 8(7) [4s-1]

Arshdeep Singh to Priyam Garg, out Caught by Pooran!! Pooran makes up for the drop catch and isn't he elated. Does a fist pump after completing the catch. SRH's innings has gone into a downward spiral. Garg decides he has to go from ball-one and heaves the slower delivery towards wide long-on, Pooran moves to his right and takes a well-judged catch. Priyam Garg c Pooran b Arshdeep Singh 0(1)

Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, wow! That's some shot. Just a chip from Sharma and the ball has cleared the rope. It was the slower delivery and Sharma was deceived for a moment there, checks his loft and manages to time it beautifully, goes all the way straight down the ground

Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR, banged in halfway down and Arshdeep does not have the pace to trouble the batsman, it sits up nicely for Sharma and he nails the pull in front of square, wide of long-on and though Pooran had just a few yards to cover, he was not able to stop that

Shami to Williamson, FOUR, that's a gift and Williamson is too good a player to miss out. Full toss outside off, Williamson does nothing fancy, just uses the pace on the ball and lofts it over extra cover. It was a safe shot with mid-off inside the ring

Shami to Williamson, SIX, woah! A one-handed six. The knuckle ball outside off, Williamson was completely deceived for pace as he looked to loft it straight down, the bottom hand comes off but the ball ends up over the rope

Shami to Abhishek Sharma, out Caught by Maxwell!! Another chip and this time Sharma hasn't timed it that well. It was a low full toss angled in from round the wicket, more power was needed but not sure even that would have helped, Maxwell runs in from deep mid-wicket and dives forward to take the catch. Abhishek Sharma c Maxwell b Shami 12(6) [4s-1 6s-1]

Shami to Warner, FOUR, doesn't miss out this time! Short again from Shami, this sits up nicely for Warner who crunches the pull over mid-wicket. Aerial but well over the infield and it races away to the fence

Shami to Williamson, 2 runs, nails the wide yorker outside off, Williamson drives it in front of square and wide of the fielder sweeping in the deep, Pooran races across and releases the ball quickly, just a brace

Cottrell to Bairstow, FOUR, poor ball, asking to be hit and Bairstow obliges. Not exactly a half-volley but plenty of width and it's sliced away over cover-point. Intentionally done by Bairstow and picks up a boundary

Cottrell to Bairstow, FOUR, ah, shot! Top stroke! This should get Bairstow going. One of his favourite strokes, stands up tall and punches this wide of the man at extra cover. Wasn't that bad a ball, just a super shot and from the look of things, this pitch looks a belter

Cottrell to Bairstow, FOUR, flies over a leaping short fine leg! 'Catch it!' was the call but the fielder had no chance at all. Another rubbish ball from Cottrell, short on leg stump and Bairstow just helps it on its way with the pull shot. Just used the pace and picked his spot to perfection

Shami to Bairstow, 3 runs, dropped! Great effort from KL at mid-off but these need to stick if KXIP are to make a comeback. Dived full-length to his right and also got his right hand to it but it didn't stick. Parried it all the way towards the deep before it was hauled back in. Bairstow is living dangerously here, stepped down for the flat-batted hit, didn't keep it down and would be happy that it didn't go to hand
Shami to Warner, FOUR, the carnage continues! And to be honest, Shami isn't helping his cause either by going shorter. It was pacy but Warner got hold of the pull, and belted it wide of mid-on
Shami to Warner, FOUR, and another! This is Warner at his riveting best. Makes a hint of room, gets the shorter length that he expects and slaps it over the infield at backward point

Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, SIX, kaboom! Bairstow finally times his charge down the track well, gets to the pitch of this and lofts dead straight down the ground. Long-on can't do much as it's well wider and flatter

Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, FOUR, how hard has he hit this! Bishnoi looks to go wider to keep this away from Bairstow but he reaches this and absolutely pummels this through the covers. No chance for sweeper cover

Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, SIX, 18 off the over! Bairstow is shifting gears and has found momentum on his side. Expects the lad to go short and he is sitting deep for that already, clobbers the pull over deep square leg

Mujeeb to Warner, SIX, someone shouted 'catch it!' from the KXIP team, maybe he was referring to whoever was there behind the sightscreen because this was always going to be a six. Mujeeb overcooks and it's slower too, Warner reaches it and goes through the line with a clean loft

Arshdeep Singh to Bairstow, 2 runs, hasn't timed it well but manages to get this very straight and so, it falls in no man's land. Slower and fuller, Bairstow looked for the loft but couldn't get the perfection connection. Gets a brace to get to fifty! It's been a typical free-flowing innings from JB, he'll be hungry for more though

Aaron to Dhawan, FOUR, slower ball on the pads and Dhawan puts it away with ease. Coming in at 116ks and it's right on the pads for Dhawan to unleash those whippy wrists and play the aerial flick over mid-wicket
Jofra Archer to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, 138ks just full enough for Prithvi Shaw to lay into a gorgeous check-drive, plays it on the rise and pierces the gap between cover and extra cover

Jofra Archer to Dhawan, out Caught by Jaiswal!! Catching practice for the teenager. Dhawan's poor run of form continues. Was fullish and in the area where Dhawan naturally fllicks/whips but with Jofra Archer there's always extra pace and skid off the surface. Dhawan played it slightly later than he would have liked and skews it off the inside half straight to mid-wicket. Dhawan c Jaiswal b Jofra Archer 5(4) [4s-1]
Tye to Hetmyer, SIX, hit-myer! Tye goes short, but this one isn't going to trouble the batsman. Hetmyer is quick to rock back as he pulls it over deep backward square leg for six runs

Rahul Tewatia to Stoinis, out Caught by Smith!! That's a soft dismissal, reckons KP on air. Was a wide ball outside off and Stoinis threw his hands at it. Miscues it towards cover-point as Smith takes an easy catch. If not with the bat, he'll do it with the ball. Rahul Tewatia, you beauty! Half of Delhi side back in the hut with more than 6 overs to go. Stoinis c Smith b Rahul Tewatia 39(30) [6s-4]

Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, SIX, too predictable. Kartik Tyagi sticks to his length that is on the shorter side. But the line is even worse as Hetmyer picks it up with ease and clears fine leg for half a dozen
Tye to Hetmyer, FOUR, short and punished! Hetmyer was waiting for it and slaps it towards long-on as the ball almost goes the distance

Tye to Hetmyer, SIX, this one has gone the distance! Goes full after bowling a short one, and the batsman reads him to perfection. Down on his knee as Hetmyer lofts it over deep extra cover for a maxmium
Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, SIX, exactly! This is what that overthrow has resulted in. A full toss on off and Hetmyer slams it over long-off as he manages to clear the man at long-off
Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, SIX, cruel game this! Kartik Tyagi bowls this one right into the slot on off and Hetmyer goes down on his knee and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for six more

Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Respite for Kartik Tyagi as he has managed to get rid of Shimron. He was looking for a hat-trick of sixes, but he slogs it straight to Tewatia near the boundary at wide long-on. Was a good catch as he grabbed it with a leap. Got a bit too greedy and has to pay the price for it. Hetmyer c Rahul Tewatia b Kartik Tyagi 45(24) [4s-1 6s-5]
Jofra Archer to Axar, 1 run, full toss outside off, Axar slices it towards the fielder at point

Jofra Archer to Axar, 1 run, has Archer damaged his finger there? This was a rocket throw by Smith from mid-off and the bowler seems to be in some pain. But it's his left hand, so no problem. Was a full ball that was drilled by Axar and he has managed to get a quick single
Jofra Archer to Harshal Patel, FOUR, pitched up by Jofra Archer and it has been lofted over extra cover by Harshal Patel to end the over
Tye to Axar, FOUR, Tye proving to be expensive in his first game of the season. Goes full on off and Axar makes the most out of it, smashes it right over the bowler's head for four runs
Tye to Axar, SIX, all smiles in the Delhi camp as the free-hit goes the distance. Touch full on off and it has been tonked right over the bowler's head by Axar
Tye to Axar, no ball, byes, FOUR, that's an awful delivery! A beamer that beats Axar's pull and also beats Buttler. Five bonus runs for Delhi, more importantly the next ball is a free-hit!
Tye to Axar, FOUR, smacked! Short ball by AJ and it has been slammed towards deep mid-wicket by Axar. Fifty up for Tye..

Tye to Axar, out Caught by Buttler!! Tye ends his spell with a wicket, but the damage has already been done. Fires a wide one outside off and Axar gets it off the cue end as he throws his hands at it. Good cameo by Patel. Axar c Buttler b Tye 17(8) [4s-2 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Harshal Patel, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Archer bags his third wicket! Harshal Patel looks to go big against the pacer and slogs it straight to the man at deep mid-wicket. Tewatia is everywhere in the field. A wicket, couple of catches. Good game for him so far. Harshal Patel c Rahul Tewatia b Jofra Archer 16(15) [4s-1]
Aaron to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, angling in and short enough for Shreyas Iyer to dismiss it off his sight with a carcking pull over mid-wicket

Aaron to Shreyas Iyer, no ball, FOUR, front foot no ball and it's safe to say that the game has just started. Batting game I meant. Shreyas Iyer backed away as he got width on the off-side and absolutely spanked the drive with full face past the diving left hand of backward point

Aaron to Prithvi Shaw, 2 runs, dropped! Prithvi Shaw takes on a pacy short ball and the top-edge carries all the way to the right of fine leg where Tyagi overruns and to make matters worse, he slips while letting the ball off his palm
Aaron to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, stand and deliver stuff! Prithvi Shaw waits for length and smokes it flat and straight back over the bowler's head with an air of arrogance

Kartik Tyagi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Kartik Tyagi continues to offer width and Shreyas Iyer doesn't miss out this time. Short and wide at 136ks, Iyer frees his arms and flays it over point with disdain
Jofra Archer to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, 141ks short ball slanting in wide of off, Prithvi Shaw rocks back and nails the pull over mid-wicket

Jofra Archer to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught&Bowled!! Prithvi Shaw looked all at sea against the short ball and it's a similar delivery that brings an end to his stay. Yet again, looks to unleash the pull but Jofra Archer's got the pace and bounce, complete miscue and it's hung in the air for an eternity. For a brief period, there was confusion regarding who's gonna go for the catch, but Archer calls for it and takes it clean near the mid-wicket pocket. Prithvi Shaw c and b Jofra Archer 19(10) [4s-2 6s-1]
Tye to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, just second ball into his spell and Tye bowls it at 124ks whilst giving Iyer the width he was waiting for, open bat face and crunched off the middle through covers
Tye to Pant, 1 run, juicy full toss outside off at 136ks, Pant looks to go hard but ends up slicing the drive off the outer half towards deep point

Tye to Shreyas Iyer, out Shreyas Iyer Run Out!! What a game young Yashaswi Jaiswal is having. He may not have starred with the bat yet, but he's done enough in this game already to make his presence felt in the side. Shane Warne is happy in the stands. Iyer pushed this towards extra cover and wanted a quick single, Pant was hesitant and sent him back after a momentary sprint. The DC skipper though was too far down the pitch and Jaiswal hit the stumps direct with a rifle-like throw. Brilliant work from the teenager. Shreyas Iyer run out (Jaiswal) 22(18) [4s-4]
Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, SIX, short and sits up at perfect height for Stoinis who powers the pull flat and hard over mid-wicket
Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, SIX, make that two in a row! Another short one and this one drifts into Stoinis' pads to launch another maximum into the mid-wicket stands
Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, SIX, Stoinis is making six-hitting look incredibly easy. Loopy delivery and he unleashes those muscular arms to club it flat over the extra cover fence

Rahul Tewatia to Stoinis, out Pant Run Out!! If there is one IPL game Pant never wants to revisit, this could be the one. He looked completely off today and his running explains everything. Stoinis knocked this towards mid-wicket and took a default sprint trying to sneak a single, Pant though was in a different planet. Doesn't even bat an eye at the field and just jogs blindly towards the batting end. The fielder at mid-wicket was sharp and he quickly threw it to the bowler who completed the formalities. Pant tried to get back, but he wasn't even in the frame. Pant run out ((sub)Vohra/Rahul Tewatia) 5(9)
Rahul Tewatia to Stoinis, SIX, that run out doesn't have any impact on Stoinis. Gets a juicy toss up in the zone and he hammers Rahul Tewatia clean and straight down the ground
Rabada to Buttler, FOUR, strays into the pad line, 147.8km/h of wasted gas, and that's tickled away with all the pace working against the bowler, for a boundary to fine leg
Rabada to Buttler, FOUR, banged in short and into the gut, but Buttler is quick enough to swivel into a shimmering pull to the backward square leg fence for four! Pretty picture, that...

Stoinis to Jaiswal, SIX, okay, he's catching up. Stoinis' no Nortje, and these 130ks are dibbly-dobblers for Jaiswal, who's clearing out his front leg and heaving it into those conical sheds at cow corner

Stoinis to Samson, out Caught by Hetmyer!! None of the lucky ground nonsense here. Samson wants to smoke it over long-on, and given his tryst with Sharjah, doesn't even look like keeping it down. Alas, it's a miscue, and there's only height on this without distance. Ends up at deep mid-wicket. Samson c Hetmyer b Stoinis 5(9)

Ashwin to Lomror, out Caught by Axar!! Well, well. This is getting rather tame. Ashwin loops it up and gets it fuller, Lomror - poor old Lomror - was only looking to push it away defensively to leg, but he's early, ending up with yet-another leading edge straight to short cover, who's there just for stuff like this. Lomror c Axar b Ashwin 1(2)

Ashwin to Jaiswal, FOUR, nails his sweep now .. yea, there's a thin line between confidence and desperation, and Jaiswal's still unsure where he stands, but he's taken this on full-blooded, going one-kneed and bisecting deep mid-wicket and deep square leg

Stoinis to Jaiswal, out Bowled!! Yea, yea, declare it, Stoinis' IPL. An off-spinner this, giving an impression that's it's a juicy leg-stump-line, but Jaiswal's undone by the lack of pace on this, going way too early with his flick, only to miss it big time and let the ball ricochet off his pads onto the off-stump. Okay he's 19, but it needs to be said, Jaiswal's made a mess here. Jaiswal b Stoinis 34(36) [4s-1 6s-2]
Stoinis to Tye, SIX, full pace feeding the slot -- and Tye's camping on the back foot for this precisely, with lovely high elbows on the bat swing to smoke it downtown

Axar to Tye, out Caught by Rabada!! Flat, short, angling in, cramping out room. Yep, you've read this before. This is bang in Axar Patel's territory, his mastery. Tye goes on the back foot, clears his front leg, swats across the line, and miscues it away into square leg somewhere. Rabada probably loses the ball, or maybe he's just late to pick it up, but never mind, he's moved quickly to his right, dived, stuck his hands out, and gotten it to stick. Tye c Rabada b Axar 6(6) [6s-1]
Rabada to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, this is the twist. THIS IS THE TWIST. Tewatia's cut loose, freeing up his hands and slicing this into the sightscreen straight down
Rabada to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, tummy-lined, around off, dabbed down to third man

Rabada to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! No, sorry, forget the twist. It's that same boring script. Archer looks to loft it through the line, but again, like the rest of his team, just doesn't get hold -- and with the bat-handle turning in his palms, long-off needn't do much. Jofra Archer c Shreyas Iyer b Rabada 2(4)
Nortje to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, just gets hold. Takes the slog off the front foot, with more height than he'd have liked, but then 77 meters is enough over here, at deep mid-wicket
Nortje to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, thick educated edge. Tewatia swishes a punch outside off, running it away really fine for third man to do anything with it

Harshal Patel to Shreyas Gopal, out Caught by Hetmyer!! The perfect slap. But what can you do when the catch is the mother of perfects? Who else but Hetmyer. Where else but deep sweeper. And what else but a forward diving take to intercept Gopal's flashy cut. It's clearly into his fingers, but when you've taken the decision to the third umpire, why not play around with a zillion replays, waste time, and then give it out. Yes. Shreyas Gopal c Hetmyer b Harshal Patel 2(3)
Harshal Patel to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, just brutally carved through the line. Goes after top-edge width outside off and just like that has managed to get it easily over deep point
Nortje to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, 141.8kph, a bit of a top-edge in this swivel-pull, but palming over off Rabada's jump at the deep square leg boundary

Rabada to Rahul Tewatia, out Bowled!! Chops on. 123kph. Back of a length. Angling across. Tewatia swings in a cut of sorts. Is early. And under-edges onto timber. And much like these stop-start sentences, Rajasthan have stopped before they started. Rahul Tewatia b Rabada 38(29) [4s-3 6s-2]

Rabada to Aaron, out Caught by Pant!!Sticky slower bouncer. Aaron attempts running this down to third man with his bat going upside-down, but ends up only getting a tickle ballooning up to the keeper. Pant's hobbling on his right leg as he walks across for the catch, but then smiles. Okay, stop worrying. Aaron c Pant b Rabada 1(2)

Ashwin to Buttler, out Caught by Dhawan! UH-OH! Terrific catch, and might I say, there might have been a bit of latent wrath in that angry swipe across the line! Absolutely spanks that, gets it off the inside half towards square leg where Dhawan is quick enough to hold onto a terrific catch! Ashwin gets Buttler! Buttler c Dhawan b Ashwin 13(8) [4s-2]
Rabada to Smith, SIX, non-chalance in that flick - a microsix, 62 meters, flicked away over a leaping Dhawan at deep backward square leg for six!

Rabada to Smith, FOUR, who'd've thought the world's best Test batsman would out-unorthodox a Maxi? Just paddle-pulls an express-pacer to fine leg, over short fine leg for four! Falls to his knees, avoiding the hit on the head, and gets a deflection on it over the in-field

Harshal Patel to Jaiswal, SIX, short ball, and Jaiswal was ready for that - just rocks back onto the backfoot and mows that over deep mid-wicket for six! Is this the activation energy this reaction needed?
Ashwin to Smith, FOUR, a rare rank half-tracker, and that's pulled away with all his might to wide long-on for four!
Ashwin to Jaiswal, 1 run, pushes this one hastily off the backfoot to mid-on for a quick single as Ashwin himself has to chase after it to prevent the single - but he doesn't manage to

Nortje to Smith, out Caught by Hetmyer! That's a fabulous low catch! Umpire review - soft signal is out. He's played another one of his effortless flicks, uppishly this time, and Hetmyer has been quick in runnign in from the cow corner boundary to pick up a fantastic low catch! The catch, in all honestly, looks good. Very little evidence to overturn the soft signal - and OUT it is! Smith c Hetmyer b Nortje 24(17) [4s-2 6s-1]
